translation: Basmala.
Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
interpretation: This verse praises and acknowledges Allah as the ultimate Lord and sustainer of all creations in the entire universe. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and expressing gratitude to Allah for His endless blessings and mercy upon all realms of existence.
orig: الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is recited at the beginning of most chapters in the Qur'an and it signifies the mercy and compassion of Allah, the Most Merciful. It serves as a reminder of Allah's attributes of mercy and grace, emphasizing His benevolence and kindness towards His creation.
orig: الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Owner of the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief that Allah is the ultimate possessor and sovereign of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing His authority and power over all of creation. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when all individuals will be held accountable for their actions, and Allah's ultimate justice and wisdom will prevail.
orig: مالك يوم الدين

translation: You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawheed (the Oneness of God) in Islam. It highlights the importance of worshipping Allah alone and seeking His help exclusively, acknowledging that all worship and reliance should be directed towards Him alone.
orig: إياك نعبد وإياك نستعين

translation: Guide us to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse is a plea to Allah to guide the believer to the right path, the path of righteousness and truth. It is a prayer for guidance in making the right choices and decisions in life, and for steadfastness in following the teachings of Islam.
orig: اهدنا الصراط المستقيم

translation: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked [Your] anger or of those who are astray.
interpretation: This verse is a prayer for guidance that Muslims recite multiple times a day in their prayers. It asks Allah to guide them on the path of those who have received His favor, and to keep them away from the paths of those who have angered Him or have gone astray. It underscores the importance of seeking divine guidance and avoiding behaviors or beliefs that are displeasing to Allah.
orig: صراط الذين أنعمت عليهم غير المغضوب عليهم ولا الضالين

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
interpretation: These letters are known as the disjointed letters (al-huruf al-muqatta'at) found at the beginning of certain chapters in the Qur'an. The exact meanings of these letters remain a mystery and scholars have proposed different interpretations over the centuries. Some believe that they are meant to draw the attention of the listeners to the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and to emphasize that the Qur'an is composed of the Arabic letters they are familiar with but arranged in a unique and inimitable way. Others suggest that they serve as a challenge to the Arabs at the time of revelation to bring a similar book if they doubt the divine origin of the Qur'an. Regardless of the exact meaning, these letters highlight the intricate and miraculous nature of the Qur'anic text.
orig: الم

translation: This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah -
interpretation: This verse highlights the certainty and clarity of the guidance provided in the Qur'an for those who are mindful of Allah's teachings and boundaries. It emphasizes the importance of following the instructions and advice contained within the Qur'an for those seeking guidance and righteousness.
orig: ذلك الكتاب لا ريب فيه هدى للمتقين

translation: Those who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the characteristics of the true believers who have faith in the unseen, are devoted to prayer, and are charitable in their spending. It highlights the importance of these acts of faith as essential components of a believer's life.
orig: الذين يؤمنون بالغيب ويقيمون الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And those who believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of belief in the revelations sent down to the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, as well as the previous scriptures, and having unwavering faith in the Hereafter. It highlights the strong conviction and certainty that believers should have in the unseen aspects of the faith.
orig: والذين يؤمنون بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك وبالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: They are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who are guided by Allah are the truly successful ones. It reminds believers that true success lies in following the guidance from Allah and living a righteous life according to His commandments.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the predetermined fate of those who choose to disbelieve in the message of Islam. It states that whether or not they are warned, their disbelief remains unchanged and they will not believe. It highlights the importance of individual free will in accepting or rejecting faith, and that guidance can only benefit those who are open to accepting it.
orig: إن الذين كفروا سواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse points to the consequences of persistent disbelief and rejection of truth, where the hearts, ears, and eyes of such individuals become veiled from perceiving guidance and truth. This sealing off signifies the hardening of their hearts and the closing of their minds to understanding. As a result of their disbelief and rejection, they are destined for a severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: ختم الله على قلوبهم وعلى سمعهم وعلى أبصارهم غشاوة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: And of the people are some who say, 'We believe in Allah and the Last Day,' but they are not believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity and true faith in Islam. It warns against mere verbal claims of faith without genuine belief and righteous actions. It serves as a reminder that true faith is reflected in one's deeds and intentions, not just in words.
orig: ومن الناس من يقول آمنا بالله وباليوم الآخر وما هم بمؤمنين

translation: They seek to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futile efforts of those who attempt to deceive Allah and the believers, making clear that their deception ultimately harms only themselves. It underscores the concept that deception is ultimately self-destructive, as it not only fails to affect Allah or the believers but also reflects a lack of awareness or understanding on the part of those who engage in such deceitful behavior.
orig: يخادعون الله والذين آمنوا وما يخدعون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: In their hearts is disease, so Allah has increased their disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they [habitually] used to lie.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of spiritual ailments existing within the hearts of those who habitually lie and deceive. Their dishonesty and denial of truth lead to an increase in their moral and spiritual sickness, resulting in a severe punishment inflicted by Allah as a consequence of their actions.
orig: في قلوبهم مرض فزادهم الله مرضا ولهم عذاب أليم بما كانوا يكذبون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Do not cause corruption on the earth,' they say, 'We are but reformers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceptive nature of those who claim to be working towards good while actually causing corruption. It serves as a warning against those who cloak their evil deeds with false justifications, emphasizing the importance of sincerity and integrity in one's actions.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم لا تفسدوا في الأرض قالوا إنما نحن مصلحون

translation: Indeed, they are the ones who cause corruption, but they perceive [it] not.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that those who spread corruption do so often unknowingly or with a lack of awareness of the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning that one should be mindful of their deeds and their potential impact on others, urging us to reflect on the consequences of our actions before engaging in them.
orig: ألا إنهم هم المفسدون ولكن لا يشعرون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Believe as the people have believed,' they say, 'Should we believe as the foolish have believed?' Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they know [it] not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who belittle the faith of others. It emphasizes that true ignorance lies in rejecting faith without knowledge or understanding. The verse warns against dismissing the beliefs of others simply because they differ from one's own, and encourages seeking knowledge and understanding before passing judgment.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا كما آمن الناس قالوا أنؤمن كما آمن السفهاء ألا إنهم هم السفهاء ولكن لا يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe'; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, 'Indeed, we are with you; we were only mocking.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of some individuals who claim to believe when in the company of believers but then reveal their true alliance with evil when they are in private. It warns against the deceit and duplicity of such people who pretend to be on the side of good but are actually aligned with darkness and mockery.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلوا إلى شياطينهم قالوا إنا معكم إنما نحن مستهزئون

translation: Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression while they wander blindly.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who persist in wrongdoing and defiance of God are essentially being misled and deluded further by God as a consequence of their own actions. It serves as a warning against arrogance and a reminder that the consequences of one's actions are ultimately in the hands of Allah.
orig: الله يستهزئ بهم ويمدهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of holding on to guidance and truth, and warns against those who choose to follow falsehood and ignorance. It highlights that those who willingly trade away guidance for error will ultimately find no benefit or success, and will remain lost without true guidance.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الضلالة بالهدى فما ربحت تجارتهم وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.
interpretation: This verse serves as an analogy to describe the state of those who initially had guidance and clarity in their lives but due to their own actions, arrogance, or ingratitude, they were deprived of this light and guidance by Allah. As a result, they were left in spiritual darkness, unable to perceive the truth or find their way back to the right path.
orig: مثلهم كمثل الذي استوقد نارا فلما أضاءت ما حوله ذهب الله بنورهم وتركهم في ظلمات لا يبصرون

translation: Deaf, dumb and blind, so they will not return [to the right path].
interpretation: This verse describes the spiritual state of those who refuse to listen, speak, or see the truth, implying that they are unable to comprehend and repent. It emphasizes the importance of understanding, reflection, and guidance in order to seek the right path in life.
orig: صم بكم عمي فهم لا يرجعون

translation: Or "[The example of] a rainstorm from the sky within which are darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers."
interpretation: This verse illustrates the behavior of disbelievers who are in denial of the signs of God's power and might. They react in fear and rejection when faced with natural phenomena and disasters, such as storms, instead of turning to God in reverence and submission. The disbelievers are depicted as covering their ears from the thunderclaps, fearing death, and failing to recognize God's authority over all things.
orig: أو كصيب من السماء فيه ظلمات ورعد وبرق يجعلون أصابعهم في آذانهم من الصواعق حذر الموت والله محيط بالكافرين

translation: It is as if lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse describes the condition of disbelievers who are spiritually blind. They are compared to people who are dazzled by lightning, then left in darkness, unable to see the right path. The verse emphasizes that Allah has power over everything, including taking away their hearing and sight if He willed. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ultimate control and authority over all creation, urging people to follow His guidance to avoid being consumed by darkness and ignorance.
orig: يكاد البرق يخطف أبصارهم كلما أضاء لهم مشوا فيه وإذا أظلم عليهم قاموا ولو شاء الله لذهب بسمعهم وأبصارهم إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse is a call to all of humanity to worship their Creator in order to attain righteousness. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and worshipping the one true God who created all of mankind, as a means to achieve piety and righteousness in one's actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها الناس اعبدوا ربكم الذي خلقكم والذين من قبلكم لعلكم تتقون

translation: He who made for you the earth a bed [spread out] and the sky a ceiling and sent down from the sky, rain and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not attribute to Allah equals while you know [that there is nothing similar to Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings and provisions that Allah has bestowed upon humanity by creating the earth as a place for us to dwell, the sky as a protective canopy, sending down rain for our sustenance, and providing us with fruits as provisions. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and appreciating these favors from Allah and warns against associating partners with Him, especially when we are fully aware of His unmatched power and uniqueness.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض فراشا والسماء بناء وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرج به من الثمرات رزقا لكم فلا تجعلوا لله أندادا وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to Our servant, then produce a chapter like it and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful.
interpretation: This verse challenges those who doubt the divine origin of the Qur'an to bring a chapter similar to its miraculous nature. It emphasizes the incomparable nature of the Qur'an and the inability of anyone to produce something like it. It also highlights the importance of sincerity and truthfulness in acknowledging the Quran's superiority.
orig: وإن كنتم في ريب مما نزلنا على عبدنا فأتوا بسورة من مثله وادعوا شهداءكم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: So if you do not and you will never do, then fear the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who reject faith and refuse to believe in the revelations of God. It emphasizes the consequences of disbelief and the existence of Hellfire, which is described as having people and stones as its fuel, illustrating the severity and intensity of the punishment awaiting those who choose to deny the truth.
orig: فإن لم تفعلوا ولن تفعلوا فاتقوا النار التي وقودها الناس والحجارة أعدت للكافرين

translation: And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with a provision of fruit therefrom, they will say, "This is what we were provided with before." And it is given to them in likeness. And they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the reward awaiting the believers who have faith in God and perform righteous deeds. They will be granted gardens in Paradise with rivers flowing beneath them. When they are provided with fruits in these gardens, they will recognize them as similar to what they have been given before, but elevated. Additionally, they will have purified spouses in Paradise and they will dwell there forever, enjoying eternal happiness and bliss.
orig: وبشر الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أن لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار كلما رزقوا منها من ثمرة رزقا قالوا هذا الذي رزقنا من قبل وأتوا به متشابها ولهم فيها أزواج مطهرة وهم فيها خالدون

translation: Indeed, Allah is not hesitant in presenting an example - that of a mosquito or what is smaller than it. And as for those who have believed, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What did Allah intend by this as an example?' He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads thereby only the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: Allah illustrates His wisdom through various examples, even if they seem insignificant like a mosquito. Those who believe understand the profound truth behind these examples, but those who disbelieve question and ridicule them, resulting in their further misguidance. Allah's examples guide the sincere believers and expose the rebellious ones to their own defiance and disobedience.
orig: إن الله لا يستحيي أن يضرب مثلا ما بعوضة فما فوقها فأما الذين آمنوا فيعلمون أنه الحق من ربهم وأما الذين كفروا فيقولون ماذا أراد الله بهذا مثلا يضل به كثيرا ويهدي به كثيرا وما يضل به إلا الفاسقين

translation: Those who break the covenant of Allah after its confirmation and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and cause corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.
interpretation: This verse describes the consequences for those who violate their covenant with Allah, who break the bonds that Allah has commanded to maintain, and who spread corruption on the earth. The verse warns that such individuals will face the curse of Allah and will ultimately dwell in a miserable state.
orig: الذين ينقضون عهد الله من بعد ميثاقه ويقطعون ما أمر الله به أن يوصل ويفسدون في الأرض أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: How can you disbelieve in Allah when you were lifeless and He brought you to life; then He will cause you to die, then He will bring you [back] to life, and then to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuous cycle of life and death decreed by Allah. It reminds us that we were once lifeless beings, then He granted us life and will cause us to die, only to bring us back to life again on the Day of Judgment. The verse serves as a reminder of the power and sovereignty of Allah over life and death, and the ultimate return of all souls to Him for judgment.
orig: كيف تكفرون بالله وكنتم أمواتا فأحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: He it is Who created for you all that is in the earth. Then He Istawa (rose over) towards the heaven and made them seven heavens and He is the All-Knower of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and knowledge of Allah in creating everything on the earth and then establishing the seven heavens. It shows the comprehensive knowledge and authority of Allah over all things.
orig: هو الذي خلق لكم ما في الأرض جميعا ثم استوى إلى السماء فسواهن سبع سماوات وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority.' They said, 'Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?' Allah said, 'Indeed, I know that which you do not know.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates how Allah announced His plan to create a vicegerent on earth. The angels expressed concern about the potential corruption and bloodshed this human authority might bring, but Allah assured them that He possesses knowledge beyond their understanding. It emphasizes the concept of Allah's wisdom in His actions, even when they may not be immediately clear to His creation.
orig: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني جاعل في الأرض خليفة قالوا أتجعل فيها من يفسد فيها ويسفك الدماء ونحن نسبح بحمدك ونقدس لك قال إني أعلم ما لا تعلمون

translation: And He taught Adam the names - all of them. Then He presented them to the angels and said, 'Inform Me of the names of these, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Allah taught Adam the names of all things. By doing so, He demonstrated Adam's superiority and knowledge over the angels. This highlights the unique status of human beings in creation due to the intellect and the ability to learn and understand, unlike angels who do not possess free will and can only obey. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of knowledge and learning in Islam.
orig: وعلم آدم الأسماء كلها ثم عرضهم على الملائكة فقال أنبئوني بأسماء هؤلاء إن كنتم صادقين

translation: They said, "Exalted are You! We have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Indeed, it is You who is the Knowing, the Wise."
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and acknowledgment of the limited knowledge of human beings in comparison to the knowledge of Allah. It serves as a reminder for believers to recognize Allah's infinite wisdom and knowledge, and to seek guidance and understanding from Him.
orig: قالوا سبحانك لا علم لنا إلا ما علمتنا إنك أنت العليم الحكيم

translation: He said, 'O Adam, inform them of their names.' And when he had informed them of their names, He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth? And I know what you reveal and what you have been concealing.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine knowledge and wisdom of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah's knowledge encompasses everything, including the unseen secrets of the heavens and the earth, as well as all that is hidden and known to mankind. It serves as a reminder of Allah's omniscience and authority over all things.
orig: قال يا آدم أنبئهم بأسمائهم فلما أنبأهم بأسمائهم قال ألم أقل لكم إني أعلم غيب السماوات والأرض وأعلم ما تبدون وما كنتم تكتمون

translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse describes the disobedience of Satan (Iblees) when he refused to prostrate to Adam as commanded by Allah. His refusal was rooted in his arrogance, which led to his disbelief and expulsion from the favor of Allah. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and disobedience, highlighting the importance of humility and submission to the divine commandments.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى واستكبر وكان من الكافرين

translation: And We said, 'O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an talks about the story of Adam and Eve in Paradise, where they were permitted to enjoy all the blessings of the Garden except for one forbidden tree. The verse emphasizes obedience to God's command as a way to avoid wrongdoing and disobedience. It highlights the importance of following divine instructions and the consequences of transgressing them.
orig: وقلنا يا آدم اسكن أنت وزوجك الجنة وكلا منها رغدا حيث شئتما ولا تقربا هذه الشجرة فتكونا من الظالمين

translation: So Satan made them slip out of it and removed them from that [condition] in which they had been. And We said, 'Go down, [all of you], as enemies to one another, and you will have upon the earth a place of settlement and provision for a time.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Adam and Eve being expelled from Paradise by Satan because of their disobedience. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of succumbing to temptation and straying from the path of obedience to God. The verse also highlights the concept of accountability and the transient nature of worldly possessions, emphasizing the importance of seeking repentance and guidance in order to secure eternal success.
orig: فأزلهما الشيطان عنها فأخرجهما مما كانا فيه وقلنا اهبطوا بعضكم لبعض عدو ولكم في الأرض مستقر ومتاع إلى حين

translation: So Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of repentance in Islam. It shows that Adam received certain words of repentance from God after committing a mistake, and upon repenting sincerely, God accepted his repentance. This verse emphasizes that Allah is always ready to accept the repentance of those who turn to Him sincerely, showing His endless mercy and compassion towards His servants.
orig: فتلقى آدم من ربه كلمات فتاب عليه إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: We said, "Go down from it, all of you. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither have [anything] to fear nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse from the Quran highlights the importance of following the guidance provided by Allah. It assures those who follow His guidance that they will be protected from fear and grief. It emphasizes the significance of adhering to the path of righteousness and following the guidance of Allah for a life free from fear and sorrow.
orig: قلنا اهبطوا منها جميعا فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن تبع هداي فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those will be the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and reject His guidance. It emphasizes that such individuals will be the inhabitants of Hell, where they will remain forever. This serves as a warning against rejecting the truth and turning away from the guidance of Allah.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and fulfill My covenant [upon you] that I will fulfill your covenant [from Me], and be afraid of [only] Me.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Children of Israel of the favors Allah has bestowed upon them, urging them to fulfill their covenant with Him as He will fulfill His with them. The verse emphasizes the importance of being conscious of Allah and maintaining a reverent fear of Him.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأوفوا بعهدي أوف بعهدكم وإياي فارهبون

translation: And believe in what I have sent down confirming that which is [already] with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it. And do not exchange My signs for a small price, and fear [only] Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the divine revelations that were sent down to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by confirming and accepting the previous scriptures. It also warns against being among the first ones to reject these revelations, as well as not to trade away the signs of Allah for temporary gains. The ultimate message is to have faith in Allah and fear Him alone, without compromising the integrity of the divine messages.
orig: وآمنوا بما أنزلت مصدقا لما معكم ولا تكونوا أول كافر به ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا وإياي فاتقون

translation: And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding truth and integrity by avoiding falsehood and dishonesty. It highlights the duty of conveying the truth openly and honestly, without distortion or concealment, especially when one is fully aware of the truth. It serves as a reminder to maintain sincerity and transparency in all affairs and to avoid deception or manipulation. Additionally, it encourages the believer to act with integrity and to be truthful in their words and actions.
orig: ولا تلبسوا الحق بالباطل وتكتموا الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in worship and obedience].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing regular prayer, giving to charity, and being humble and obedient in worship. It reminds believers to perform these acts of worship with sincerity and to be united with other worshippers in humility before God.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واركعوا مع الراكعين

translation: Do you order righteousness of the people and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to focus on self-improvement before advising or correcting others. It asks individuals to reflect on their own actions and behavior, rather than solely focusing on pointing out the flaws of others. By neglecting self-improvement and focusing on external factors, people may fail to reason and understand the true teachings of the scripture.
orig: أتأمرون الناس بالبر وتنسون أنفسكم وأنتم تتلون الكتاب أفلا تعقلون

translation: And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking assistance from Allah through patience and prayer. It highlights that these qualities are essential in facing challenges and difficulties. The verse also stresses that only those who are humble and submissive to Allah can truly comprehend the significance and power of patience and prayer in times of adversity.
orig: واستعينوا بالصبر والصلاة وإنها لكبيرة إلا على الخاشعين

translation: Those who think they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the inevitability of meeting with their Lord and returning to Him. It emphasizes the belief in the Day of Judgment and accountability before God. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of this world and the eternal nature of the Hereafter, urging believers to prepare for the meeting with their Lord by leading a righteous life and seeking His pleasure.
orig: الذين يظنون أنهم ملاقو ربهم وأنهم إليه راجعون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor with which I favored you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to the Children of Israel of the blessings and special favor bestowed upon them by Allah. It serves as a call to reflect on and appreciate the unique position they hold in Allah's sight, highlighting His grace and preference towards them compared to the rest of the world.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأني فضلتكم على العالمين

translation: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, and no compensation will be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when each soul will be accountable for its own deeds and there will be no one to intercede on behalf of another. It highlights the ultimate justice of God's judgment, where no amount of wealth, power, or influence will be able to change the outcome for an individual. It serves as a reminder to all to be mindful of their actions and strive to earn God's mercy and forgiveness in this life.
orig: واتقوا يوما لا تجزي نفس عن نفس شيئا ولا يقبل منها شفاعة ولا يؤخذ منها عدل ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And [recall] when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment, slaughtering your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the time when the Children of Israel were saved from the tyranny of Pharaoh, who imposed severe hardships on them. The verse highlights the great trials and tests that the believers faced at the hands of oppressors. It serves as a reminder that difficulties and trials in life are a test from God and a means to strengthen one's faith and resolve.
orig: وإذ نجيناكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب يذبحون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم

translation: And when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous event when Allah saved the Israelites by parting the sea for them, allowing them to escape from Pharaoh's army. It highlights Allah's power and mercy in delivering His believers from difficult situations and punishing the oppressors. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of wrongdoing and rejection of truth.
orig: وإذ فرقنا بكم البحر فأنجيناكم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وأنتم تنظرون

translation: And [recall] when We made an appointment with Moses for forty nights; then you took [for worship] the calf after him, while you were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) when he was called by Allah for forty nights. However, during his absence, the Israelites deviated from the straight path and began to worship a golden calf. The verse serves as a warning against disobeying Allah and indulging in idolatry, even in the absence of a religious leader or guidance.
orig: وإذ واعدنا موسى أربعين ليلة ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: Then We forgave you after that so that you might be grateful.
interpretation: This verse teaches us about the boundless mercy and forgiveness of Allah. Despite our shortcomings and sins, Allah is willing to forgive us if we repent sincerely. The purpose of this forgiveness is for us to show gratitude to Allah for His mercy and forgiveness, and to strive to lead a righteous life.
orig: ثم عفونا عنكم من بعد ذلك لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture and the criterion that perhaps you would be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gift of the Scripture and the criterion (the ability to distinguish between right and wrong) given to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) by Allah. The purpose of this gift was to guide the people towards the path of righteousness and enlightenment. It emphasizes the importance of divine guidance through the Scriptures to lead humanity towards the right path and away from darkness and confusion.
orig: وإذ آتينا موسى الكتاب والفرقان لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship], so repent to your Creator and kill yourselves. That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator.' Then He accepted your repentance; indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) addressing his people who had committed a grave sin by worshipping a calf. He guides them to repent sincerely to God, their Creator, and to symbolically kill their egos and wrongdoings. By doing so, they seek forgiveness and mercy from God. This verse teaches us about the importance of seeking repentance, acknowledging our wrongdoings, and striving to purify our souls from sins.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم إنكم ظلمتم أنفسكم باتخاذكم العجل فتوبوا إلى بارئكم فاقتلوا أنفسكم ذلكم خير لكم عند بارئكم فتاب عليكم إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And [recall] when you said, 'O Moses, we will never believe you unless we see Allah outright'; so the thunderbolt seized you while you were looking on.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of a time when the people of Moses demanded to physically see Allah in order to believe. The thunderbolt that struck them while they were looking on serves as a warning against the arrogance and audacity of demanding such a request, highlighting the importance of faith in the unseen and trust in the guidance of the prophets without always requiring explicit tangible evidence.
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نؤمن لك حتى نرى الله جهرة فأخذتكم الصاعقة وأنتم تنظرون

translation: Then We revived you after your death, so that you might be grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah, who has the ability to bring the dead back to life. The purpose of this revival is for humanity to show gratitude towards Allah for His blessings and to recognize His authority over life and death.
orig: ثم بعثناكم من بعد موتكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], 'Eat from the good things with which We have provided you.' And they wronged Us not - but they were [only] wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the story of the Israelites during their time in the wilderness. It speaks of how Allah provided them with sustenance in the form of manna and quails, despite their ingratitude and transgressions. The verse emphasizes that when humans behave unjustly or sin, it is not Allah who is wronged, but it is they who bring harm upon themselves by their actions.
orig: وظللنا عليكم الغمام وأنزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم وما ظلمونا ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And [mention] when We said, 'Enter this city and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance, and enter the gate bowing humbly and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens.' We will [then] forgive your sins for you, and We will increase the doers of good.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility, gratitude, and seeking forgiveness. It emphasizes the idea that by entering a place with humility, seeking forgiveness, and being grateful for the blessings and provision, one can attain forgiveness from Allah and be rewarded for their good deeds.
orig: وإذ قلنا ادخلوا هذه القرية فكلوا منها حيث شئتم رغدا وادخلوا الباب سجدا وقولوا حطة نغفر لكم خطاياكم وسنزيد المحسنين

translation: So We replaced those who were unjust with punishment, with a different saying than that which was told to them, and We sent down upon the unjust ones punishment from the sky because of their wrongdoing.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting how those who transgress and commit wrongdoing will face consequences for their actions. God may replace their blessings with punishment and send down retribution upon them as a result of their unjust behavior.
orig: فبدل الذين ظلموا قولا غير الذي قيل لهم فأنزلنا على الذين ظلموا رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people, so We said, 'Strike with your staff the stone.' And there gushed forth from it twelve springs, and every people knew its watering place. 'Eat and drink from the provision of Allah, and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.'
interpretation: This verse demonstrates the miraculous power of Allah in response to the supplication of Prophet Moses. It teaches the importance of relying on Allah for sustenance and gratefulness for His provisions. Moreover, it emphasizes the duty of humanity to maintain peace and order in the world by abstaining from corruption and wrongdoing.
orig: وإذ استسقى موسى لقومه فقلنا اضرب بعصاك الحجر فانفجرت منه اثنتا عشرة عينا قد علم كل أناس مشربهم كلوا واشربوا من رزق الله ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: And [recall] when you said, 'O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food. So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic and its lentils and its onions.' [Moses] said, 'Would you exchange what is better for what is less? Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked.' And they were covered with humiliation and poverty and returned with anger from Allah [upon them]. That was because they [repeatedly] disbelieved in the signs of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and were [habitually] transgressing.
interpretation: This verse conveys a story of the Children of Israel asking Prophet Moses for more variety in their food, despite having been provided with manna and quails from Allah. The verse highlights their lack of gratitude and patience, as well as their insistence on worldly desires. Prophet Moses warns them against seeking temporary pleasures over what Allah has provided, but they persist in their demands. The consequence of their ingratitude and disobedience was humiliation, poverty, and ultimately the wrath of Allah. This story serves as a lesson about the dangers of disobedience, ingratitude, and rejecting Allah's signs and messengers.
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نصبر على طعام واحد فادع لنا ربك يخرج لنا مما تنبت الأرض من بقلها وقثائها وفومها وعدسها وبصلها قال أتستبدلون الذي هو أدنى بالذي هو خير اهبطوا مصرا فإن لكم ما سألتم وضربت عليهم الذلة والمسكنة وباءوا بغضب من الله ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير الحق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed, those who are Jews, and the Christians and the Sabians - whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day and does righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true believers from various religious backgrounds who have faith in Allah, the Last Day, and perform righteous deeds will be rewarded by Allah. It highlights the inclusivity of Islam and reassures that those who believe and do good will be safe from fear and sorrow in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والنصارى والصابئين من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And [mention] when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], 'Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might become righteous.'
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of the covenant they have with Allah and the responsibilities that come with that covenant. By reflecting on the teachings and guidance in the Qur'an, believers can strengthen their faith and strive to improve themselves in order to attain righteousness.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واذكروا ما فيه لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then you turned away after that. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have been among the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of always being grateful for the grace and mercy of Allah. It serves as a reminder that it is only through the favor and mercy of Allah that we are saved from being among the losers, emphasizing the importance of clinging to faith and guidance to avoid being led astray.
orig: ثم توليتم من بعد ذلك فلولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته لكنتم من الخاسرين

translation: And you had already known about those who transgressed among you concerning the sabbath, and We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'
interpretation: This verse is a reference to a group of people who broke the Sabbath rule by going fishing on that day, and as a result, they were transformed into apes as a punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience to God's commandments and the importance of observing the sanctity of the Sabbath.
orig: ولقد علمتم الذين اعتدوا منكم في السبت فقلنا لهم كونوا قردة خاسئين

translation: So We made it a lesson for those before it and after it, and a reminder for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the purpose of the stories and lessons present in the Qur'an. It conveys that the events mentioned in the Qur'an are meant to serve as a reflection and warning for people who lived before its revelation, as well as those who would come after. It serves as a reminder and guidance for those who are conscious of God and strive to uphold righteousness in their lives.
orig: فجعلناها نكالا لما بين يديها وما خلفها وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his people, 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.' They said, 'Do you take us in ridicule?' He said, 'I seek refuge in Allah from being among the ignorant.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates a moment when Prophet Moses instructed his people to sacrifice a cow as commanded by Allah. However, his people responded with disbelief and mockery, questioning his seriousness. In response, Moses seeks refuge in Allah from being associated with the ignorant ones. This verse highlights the importance of obeying divine commands seriously and without doubt or mockery.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه إن الله يأمركم أن تذبحوا بقرة قالوا أتتخذنا هزوا قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجاهلين

translation: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is.' [Moses] said, 'He says, it is a cow which neither a fat one nor a lean one, but median in between, so do what you are commanded.'
interpretation: This verse comes from Surah Al-Baqarah in the Qur'an, where the Children of Israel asked Prophet Moses for a specific characteristic of the cow they were commanded to sacrifice. This verse illustrates that sometimes specific details are provided in the commands of God, which might seem unusual or unnecessary to us, but they are meant to test our obedience and adherence to His instructions. It teaches us the importance of following the commandments and guidance of Allah, even if we do not fully understand the reasons behind them.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا فارض ولا بكر عوان بين ذلك فافعلوا ما تؤمرون

translation: They said, 'Pray to your Lord for us that He may make clear to us what it is.' [Moses] said, 'He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers.'
interpretation: This verse is from Surah Al-Baqarah (2:69) in the Qur’an where the Children of Israel asked Prophet Moses to ask Allah to show them what kind of cow they should sacrifice. In response, Allah described the cow as yellow and distinct in color, a description that would be easily recognizable to them. This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to the commands of Allah and trusting in His wisdom and guidance.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما لونها قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة صفراء فاقع لونها تسر الناظرين

translation: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to show us what color it is.' [Moses] said, 'He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the yellow cow in the Qur'an. It highlights the importance of obeying the commands of Allah without unnecessary questioning or doubt. It also teaches a lesson about the value of faith and submission, even when the commands may seem unusual or difficult to understand.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي إن البقر تشابه علينا وإنا إن شاء الله لمهتدون

translation: He (Moses) said, 'Indeed, it says it is a cow neither trained to plough the earth nor to irrigate the field, one free from fault.' They said, 'Now you have come with the truth.' So they slaughtered her, though they almost did not do it.
interpretation: This verse recounts a situation where the people were given clear instructions regarding a cow to be sacrificed, but they hesitated and almost did not follow through. It serves as a lesson in obedience and the importance of carrying out instructions as they were given without hesitation or doubt.
orig: قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا ذلول تثير الأرض ولا تسقي الحرث مسلمة لا شية فيها قالوا الآن جئت بالحق فذبحوها وما كادوا يفعلون

translation: And when you have killed a soul, and then cast blame for it upon one another. But Allah brings out what you concealed.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of taking a life unjustly, emphasizing that Allah knows everything that is hidden and will bring it to light. It warns against trying to conceal acts of injustice, as ultimately nothing can be hidden from Allah.
orig: وإذ قتلتم نفسا فادارأتم فيها والله مخرج ما كنتم تكتمون

translation: So We said, 'Strike the slain man with part of it.' Thus Allah brings the dead to life, and He shows you His signs that you might reason.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power of Allah to bring the dead back to life and displays His signs to make people reflect and use their reasoning abilities. It serves as a reminder of the divine ability to show miracles and demonstrate the resurrection as a sign of Allah's supremacy and wisdom.
orig: فقلنا اضربوه ببعضها كذلك يحيي الله الموتى ويريكم آياته لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Then your hearts became hardened after that, so they are like stones or even harder. For indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth, and there are some of them that split open and water comes out, and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allah. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of spiritual hardness of the heart when one continuously turns away from the guidance and remembrance of Allah. The analogy of hearts becoming like stones or even harder signifies the loss of sensitivity to faith and righteousness. It warns against the consequences of neglecting the spiritual well-being and urges believers to remain conscious of Allah's presence and the accountability for their actions.
orig: ثم قست قلوبكم من بعد ذلك فهي كالحجارة أو أشد قسوة وإن من الحجارة لما يتفجر منه الأنهار وإن منها لما يشقق فيخرج منه الماء وإن منها لما يهبط من خشية الله وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Do you covet [the hope, O believers], that they would believe for you while a party of them used to hear the words of Allah and then distort it [or twist it] knowingly after they had understood it, while they were certain?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the hypocrisy of some people who were aware of the teachings of Allah and the truth of Islam, yet deliberately twisted or distorted those teachings for their own benefit or to mislead others, despite knowing the truth. It serves as a warning to be cautious of individuals who may manipulate or misinterpret religious teachings for their own personal gain.
orig: أفتطمعون أن يؤمنوا لكم وقد كان فريق منهم يسمعون كلام الله ثم يحرفونه من بعد ما عقلوه وهم يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe'; but when they are alone with one another, they say, 'Do you talk to them about what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue with you about it before your Lord?' Do you not reason?
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of some individuals who claim to believe in front of others but question and doubt their beliefs when alone. It serves as a reminder to be sincere in our faith and not to engage in two-faced behavior. It urges believers to reflect on their actions and think critically about the consequences of their behavior.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلا بعضهم إلى بعض قالوا أتحدثونهم بما فتح الله عليكم ليحاجوكم به عند ربكم أفلا تعقلون

translation: First of all, they know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah knows every aspect of one's being, including the secrets they keep hidden in their hearts as well as what they openly express. It serves as a reminder that nothing can be hidden from Allah, encouraging believers to be sincere in their actions and intentions, for Allah is aware of all that is concealed and all that is revealed.
orig: أولا يعلمون أن الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون

translation: And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Scripture except in wishful thinking, but they are only assuming.
interpretation: This verse highlights the presence of some individuals who are illiterate and lack knowledge of the scripture, but rely solely on their desires and assumptions. It serves as a reminder to seek true understanding and knowledge of the scripture rather than relying on baseless assumptions.
orig: ومنهم أميون لا يعلمون الكتاب إلا أماني وإن هم إلا يظنون

translation: Woe to those who write the scripture with their own hands, then say, “This is from Allah,” in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they have earned.
interpretation: This verse is warning against those who distort or fabricate scripture and attribute it falsely to Allah for personal gain. It condemns the act of manipulating religious texts for worldly benefits, emphasizing that those who engage in such deceit and corruption will face severe consequences for their actions.
orig: فويل للذين يكتبون الكتاب بأيديهم ثم يقولون هذا من عند الله ليشتروا به ثمنا قليلا فويل لهم مما كتبت أيديهم وويل لهم مما يكسبون

translation: And they say, "Never will the Fire touch us, except for [a few] numbered days." Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will never break His promise. Or do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"
interpretation: This verse challenges those who arrogantly believe that they will not face the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. It questions their certainty about their fate and warns about making claims without knowledge. It emphasizes the importance of keeping true to the promise made to Allah and reminds that Allah's promise is certain and unfailing.
orig: وقالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودة قل أتخذتم عند الله عهدا فلن يخلف الله عهده أم تقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that those who indulge in evil deeds and let their sins consume them will be the dwellers of the Fire for eternity. It emphasizes the consequences of one's actions and the importance of avoiding sinful behavior to avoid the punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: بلى من كسب سيئة وأحاطت به خطيئته فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds – they are the companions of Paradise, abiding therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward for those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds. It emphasizes that such individuals will be the dwellers of Paradise, where they will remain forever. It serves as a reminder of the importance of belief and righteous actions in securing a place in the eternal bliss of Paradise.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], "Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah." Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Children of Israel of the covenant they made with Allah to worship Him alone. They were also instructed to be good to their parents, relatives, orphans, and the needy, speak kindly to others, establish prayer, and give charity. However, most of them turned away from these teachings, only a few remained steadfast. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of fulfilling one's duties towards Allah and towards fellow human beings.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل لا تعبدون إلا الله وبالوالدين إحسانا وذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وقولوا للناس حسنا وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة ثم توليتم إلا قليلا منكم وأنتم معرضون

translation: And [mention] when We took your covenant, [saying], "Do not shed each other's blood or evict one another from your homes." Then you acknowledged [this] while you were witnessing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of upholding agreements and covenants. It emphasizes the sanctity of life and property, prohibiting actions such as murder and unjustly evicting others from their homes. The verse also underlines the significance of bearing witness to one's own commitments and responsibilities.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم لا تسفكون دماءكم ولا تخرجون أنفسكم من دياركم ثم أقررتم وأنتم تشهدون

translation: Then, it is you who are killing yourselves and evicting a group of your people from their homes, supporting one another against them in sin and transgression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was unlawful for you. Do you, then, believe in one part of the Scripture and reject the other? What is the compensation for those among you who do that, other than humiliation in this worldly life and punishment on the Day of Resurrection? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse condemns the hypocrisy and injustice of those who claim to believe in part of the scripture but disregard other parts, acting unjustly and harming others. It warns that those who engage in such behavior will face consequences, including humiliation in this life and punishment in the afterlife. It serves as a reminder that Allah is aware of all actions and intentions, and that faith must be lived consistently with justice and righteousness.
orig: ثم أنتم هؤلاء تقتلون أنفسكم وتخرجون فريقا منكم من ديارهم تظاهرون عليهم بالإثم والعدوان وإن يأتوكم أسارى تفادوهم وهو محرم عليكم إخراجهم أفتؤمنون ببعض الكتاب وتكفرون ببعض فما جزاء من يفعل ذلك منكم إلا خزي في الحياة الدنيا ويوم القيامة يردون إلى أشد العذاب وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Those are the ones who have exchanged the life of this world for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of prioritizing worldly pleasures over the eternal life in the Hereafter. Those who choose the temporary joys of this world at the expense of their spirituality or religious obligations will face a severe punishment in the afterlife, and they will find no support or assistance at that time.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة فلا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And certainly We gave Moses the Scripture and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of the reaction of some people when messengers of God come with teachings that challenge their desires and preconceived notions. The verse is a reminder that arrogance and denial towards messengers and their messages have been a recurring phenomenon throughout history. It emphasizes the importance of humility and openness to accept the truth, even if it conflicts with one's personal wishes and beliefs.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب وقفينا من بعده بالرسل وآتينا عيسى ابن مريم البينات وأيدناه بروح القدس أفكلما جاءكم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسكم استكبرتم ففريقا كذبتم وفريقا تقتلون

translation: And they say, "Our hearts are wrapped". Rather, Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and disbelief of certain individuals who claim that their hearts are veiled or covered, making them unable to understand and believe in the truth. However, the verse asserts that this veiling is not due to any inherent condition, but rather a consequence of their own rejection of faith. It emphasizes that their lack of belief is self-inflicted, and they are ultimately responsible for their disbelief despite the signs and evidence presented to them. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance, obstinacy, and reluctance to accept the truth.
orig: وقالوا قلوبنا غلف بل لعنهم الله بكفرهم فقليلا ما يؤمنون

translation: And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which was with them, while before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of accepting and believing in the revelations from Allah, even if they differ from one's previous beliefs. It warns against rejecting the truth out of arrogance or ignorance, as that will lead to being cursed by Allah. It highlights the significance of being open-minded, seeking knowledge, and having faith in Allah's guidance.
orig: ولما جاءهم كتاب من عند الله مصدق لما معهم وكانوا من قبل يستفتحون على الذين كفروا فلما جاءهم ما عرفوا كفروا به فلعنة الله على الكافرين

translation: How wretched is what they have sold their souls for - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed, grudging that Allah should send down of His favor on whom He wills of His servants. So they have drawn upon themselves wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes the severe consequences for those who knowingly reject the guidance and revelations of Allah, despite their own souls being at stake. It criticizes those who are envious and resentful of Allah's blessings being bestowed upon others, emphasizing the self-destructive nature of such actions. The verse warns that such individuals will face escalating punishment and humiliation in the Hereafter as a result of their disbelief and ingratitude.
orig: بئسما اشتروا به أنفسهم أن يكفروا بما أنزل الله بغيا أن ينزل الله من فضله على من يشاء من عباده فباءوا بغضب على غضب وللكافرين عذاب مهين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Believe in what Allah has revealed,' they say, 'We believe [only] in what was revealed to us.' And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, 'Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are [truly] believers?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of some people who claim to believe in only a part of the divine revelation they received, while rejecting or disregarding other parts that do not align with their desires or beliefs. It questions their selective faith and actions, pointing out that true belief entails accepting the entire truth from God and following it sincerely. The verse serves as a reminder about the importance of consistency and integrity in one's faith and actions.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا بما أنزل الله قالوا نؤمن بما أنزل علينا ويكفرون بما وراءه وهو الحق مصدقا لما معهم قل فلم تقتلون أنبياء الله من قبل إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, Moses came to you with clear proofs, then you took the calf [for worship] after that, while you were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights how Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) presented clear signs and miracles to the people, yet they resorted to worshipping a calf in his absence. The verse emphasizes the ingratitude, disobedience, and unjust behavior of the people towards Allah's commands despite being shown clear guidance.
orig: ولقد جاءكم موسى بالبينات ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: And [mention] when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], 'Take what We have given you with determination and listen.' They said [instead], 'We hear and disobey.' And their hearts absorbed [the worship of] the calf because of their disbelief. Say, 'How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the time when Allah made a covenant with the Children of Israel and raised Mount Sinai over them. Despite their initial agreement to follow Allah's commandments, they faltered and worshipped the golden calf, showing disobedience and disbelief. The verse highlights the importance of upholding faith and obedience to Allah's commands, condemning the actions driven by weak faith and disbelief. It emphasizes the need for sincere faith and submission to God's will for true believers.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واسمعوا قالوا سمعنا وعصينا وأشربوا في قلوبهم العجل بكفرهم قل بئسما يأمركم به إيمانكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Say, "If the home of the Hereafter with Allah is for you alone and not for anyone else, then wish for death, if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the concept of the afterlife and the idea that true believers should long for the rewards and blessings of the Hereafter, even to the point of wishing for death in order to attain it. It challenges the sincerity of one's faith by questioning whether they truly prioritize the eternal life with Allah over the worldly life.
orig: قل إن كانت لكم الدار الآخرة عند الله خالصة من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And they will never wish for it ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights that on the Day of Judgment, the wrongdoers will regret their actions and wish to undo the sins they committed in their lifetime. However, their regret will be of no avail as their fate will be determined by the deeds they have already performed. It serves as a reminder of the importance of living a righteous life and seeking forgiveness for our wrongdoings before it's too late.
orig: ولن يتمنوه أبدا بما قدمت أيديهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: And you will find them the keenest of people for life. And among them whoever would wish to be given life a thousand years but he will not be reprieved from the punishment by being given life. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the worldly attachment of some disbelievers who are so eager to cling to life that they may wish for a long lifespan, even a thousand years. However, their desire for a longer life will not save them from the consequences of their disbelief and wrongdoings. It serves as a reminder that ultimately it is Allah who determines the fate of individuals based on their deeds, regardless of their desires for a prolonged earthly existence.
orig: ولتجدنهم أحرص الناس على حياة ومن الذين أشركوا يود أحدهم لو يعمر ألف سنة وما هو بمزحزحه من العذاب أن يعمر والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is [none but] he who has brought the Qur'an down upon your heart, [O Muhammad], by permission of Allah, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who oppose the angel Gabriel are essentially opposing the message of the Qur'an itself. It reaffirms the belief that the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad by the permission of Allah, as a confirmation of the previous scriptures and as a source of guidance and glad tidings for the believers. It emphasizes the importance of believing in the revelations and the messengers of Allah.
orig: قل من كان عدوا لجبريل فإنه نزله على قلبك بإذن الله مصدقا لما بين يديه وهدى وبشرى للمؤمنين

translation: Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who oppose or show enmity towards Allah, His angels, His messengers, and even the archangels Gabriel and Michael, are considered as enemies of God. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of going against God and His divine guidance, and highlights the divine support and protection that believers receive in contrast to the fate of the disbelievers who set themselves against God.
orig: من كان عدوا لله وملائكته ورسله وجبريل وميكال فإن الله عدو للكافرين

translation: And We have certainly revealed to you clear verses and no one denies them except the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the signs and verses of the Qur'an are clear and evident, yet only those who persist in their disobedience and defiance deny them. It emphasizes the importance of being open to the guidance and wisdom found in the Qur'an, and warns against rejecting it out of arrogance and wrongdoing.
orig: ولقد أنزلنا إليك آيات بينات وما يكفر بها إلا الفاسقون

translation: And whenever they made a covenant, a party of them threw it away. But most of them do not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of some people to break their promises and betray their commitments. It emphasizes the lack of faith and integrity in many individuals, as they fail to uphold the agreements and covenants they make. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being truthful, reliable, and honoring one's obligations in all aspects of life.
orig: أوكلما عاهدوا عهدا نبذه فريق منهم بل أكثرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection and disregard shown by some people for the message of truth brought by the Messenger of Allah. Despite having knowledge of the scripture, they chose to ignore it and refused to accept the new revelation, showing a willful ignorance and negligence towards the guidance of Allah.
orig: ولما جاءهم رسول من عند الله مصدق لما معهم نبذ فريق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب كتاب الله وراء ظهورهم كأنهم لا يعلمون

translation: And they followed [instead] what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon. It was not Solomon who disbelieved, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, 'We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic].' And [yet] they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse warns against the practice of magic and sorcery, attributing its origins to the devils rather than to the prophets. It emphasizes that practicing magic is a form of disbelief and is used as a tool to cause harm. It also highlights that magic does not bring any benefit in the Hereafter and that those who engage in it are essentially selling their souls for something worthless.
orig: واتبعوا ما تتلو الشياطين على ملك سليمان وما كفر سليمان ولكن الشياطين كفروا يعلمون الناس السحر وما أنزل على الملكين ببابل هاروت وماروت وما يعلمان من أحد حتى يقولا إنما نحن فتنة فلا تكفر فيتعلمون منهما ما يفرقون به بين المرء وزوجه وما هم بضارين به من أحد إلا بإذن الله ويتعلمون ما يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ولقد علموا لمن اشتراه ما له في الآخرة من خلاق ولبئس ما شروا به أنفسهم لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And if only they had believed and feared Him, for a reward from Allah is better if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith and piety. It suggests that those who believe in God and have piety will be rewarded by Allah, and this reward is far better than anything they can imagine. The verse also highlights the importance of knowledge, indicating that if people truly understood the value of belief and piety, they would strive to attain them.
orig: ولو أنهم آمنوا واتقوا لمثوبة من عند الله خير لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: O you who have believed, do not say 'Ra'ina' but say 'Unthurna' and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to be careful with their words and not to use ambiguous phrases that can be misinterpreted. It teaches the importance of clear and respectful communication among believers, and to avoid any language that may carry disrespectful connotations. Additionally, it warns of the severe punishment awaiting the disbelievers in the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقولوا راعنا وقولوا انظرنا واسمعوا وللكافرين عذاب أليم

translation: Those who disbelieve from among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists do not wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights that disbelievers from the People of the Scripture and polytheists may not desire any goodness or blessings to be bestowed upon the believers by Allah. However, it is Allah who chooses to bestow His mercy upon whomever He wills, regardless of the disbelievers' thoughts or desires. Allah's mercy is vast, and His favor and generosity are boundless.
orig: ما يود الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب ولا المشركين أن ينزل عليكم من خير من ربكم والله يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: Whatever verse We abrogate or cause to be forgotten, We bring a better one or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah is All-Powerful over all things?
interpretation: This verse reminds us that God's wisdom and power are limitless. If any verse of the Qur'an is abrogated or forgotten, it is always replaced with something better or similar. It emphasizes the divine ability to maintain and improve upon the guidance provided in the Qur'an, highlighting the infinite wisdom and control of Allah over all creation.
orig: ما ننسخ من آية أو ننسها نأت بخير منها أو مثلها ألم تعلم أن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? And you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the absolute sovereignty of Allah over the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes the belief in tawhid (oneness of Allah) and highlights that there is no one besides Allah who can provide protection or assistance. It encourages believers to rely solely on Allah and seek help from Him alone, acknowledging His ultimate power and authority.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Do you want to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges disbelief for faith has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers that they should not question their Messenger in a challenging or doubting manner, as the people of Moses did with him. It also highlights the seriousness of exchanging faith for disbelief, emphasizing that such actions lead one astray from the right path and the truth.
orig: أم تريدون أن تسألوا رسولكم كما سئل موسى من قبل ومن يتبدل الكفر بالإيمان فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: And many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves [even] after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allah delivers His command. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the challenges faced by believers in the face of envy and opposition from some among the People of the Scripture. It advises the believers to forgive and overlook such behavior, remaining steadfast in their faith, and trusting that Allah will bring forth justice in His own time. It highlights the importance of patience and resilience in the face of adversity, knowing that ultimately, it is Allah who has total power and authority over all things.
orig: ود كثير من أهل الكتاب لو يردونكم من بعد إيمانكم كفارا حسدا من عند أنفسهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الحق فاعفوا واصفحوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing prayer and giving charity (zakat) while also stressing that any good deeds done for the sake of Allah will not go unrecognized. Allah, with His knowledge, sees all that we do and will reward us accordingly for our actions.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وما تقدموا لأنفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله إن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And they say, "None shall enter Paradise unless he be a Jew or a Christian." These are their own desires. Say, "Produce your proof if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the misconception held by some that only Jews or Christians will enter Paradise. However, it refutes this claim by challenging them to produce evidence to support their belief. The Qur'an emphasizes that true entry into Paradise is not restricted to any particular group, but is based on faith, righteousness, and submission to God's will.
orig: وقالوا لن يدخل الجنة إلا من كان هودا أو نصارى تلك أمانيهم قل هاتوا برهانكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Yes, whoever submits his face in Islam to Allah while being a doer of good will have his reward with his Lord. And there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true submission to Allah, coupled with righteous deeds, will be rewarded by Him. Those who sincerely submit to Islam and perform good actions will have nothing to fear or grieve about in the Hereafter. It highlights the importance of steadfast faith and virtuous deeds in attaining rewards and peace of heart in the sight of Allah.
orig: بلى من أسلم وجهه لله وهو محسن فله أجره عند ربه ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And the Jews say, 'The Christians are not [believers],' and the Christians say, 'The Jews are not [believers],' while they [all] recite the Scripture. Thus spoke those who do not know, like their words. But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights the disputes and differences between the Jewish and Christian communities as mentioned in their Scriptures. It conveys the message that on the Day of Judgment, Allah will be the ultimate judge and arbiter between them regarding their disagreements and disputes. It serves as a reminder that believers should strive for unity and understanding, leaving the judgment to Allah in the Hereafter.
orig: وقالت اليهود ليست النصارى على شيء وقالت النصارى ليست اليهود على شيء وهم يتلون الكتاب كذلك قال الذين لا يعلمون مثل قولهم فالله يحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون
