Those who renounce their faith and die as disbelievers will find their deeds in vain and will face eternal punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: يسألونك عن الشهر الحرام قتال فيه قل قتال فيه كبير وصد عن سبيل الله وكفر به والمسجد الحرام وإخراج أهله منه أكبر عند الله والفتنة أكبر من القتل ولا يزالون يقاتلونكم حتى يردوكم عن دينكم إن استطاعوا ومن يرتدد منكم عن دينه فيمت وهو كافر فأولئك حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - they expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward and status promised by Allah to those who believe in Him, migrate for their faith, and strive in His cause. They are hopeful for Allah's mercy and forgiveness, emphasizing Allah's attributes of forgiveness and mercy towards His devoted followers.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله أولئك يرجون رحمت الله والله غفور رحيم

translation: They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, 'In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit.' And they ask you what they should spend. Say, 'The excess [beyond needs].' Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.
interpretation: This verse highlights that while wine and gambling may have some benefits, the harms and sins associated with them far outweigh any advantages. Similarly, when it comes to spending, one should prioritize giving beyond one's basic needs. The verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the teachings of Allah to make informed and thoughtful decisions.
orig: يسألونك عن الخمر والميسر قل فيهما إثم كبير ومنافع للناس وإثمهما أكبر من نفعهما ويسألونك ماذا ينفقون قل العفو كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تتفكرون

translation: In this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about the orphans. Say, ‘Improvement for them is best.’ And if you associate with them, they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the amender. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of caring for orphans and treating them with kindness and justice. It highlights that those who help the orphans and seek to improve their situation will be rewarded by Allah. It also reminds believers that Allah has the knowledge to distinguish between those who cause corruption and those who bring about positive change. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of social responsibility and the reward for good deeds in the sight of Allah.
orig: في الدنيا والآخرة ويسألونك عن اليتامى قل إصلاح لهم خير وإن تخالطوهم فإخوانكم والله يعلم المفسد من المصلح ولو شاء الله لأعنتكم إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not marry polytheistic men [to your women] until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite [you] to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of marrying individuals who share the same faith in order to maintain harmony and unity within the family unit. It emphasizes the superiority of a believing spouse over a non-believer, irrespective of any worldly appeal the latter might have. The verse also serves as a reminder that those who follow the path of disbelief invite themselves to the Fire, while Allah calls to Paradise and forgiveness, making His guidance clear for people to reflect upon and remember.
orig: ولا تنكحوا المشركات حتى يؤمن ولأمة مؤمنة خير من مشركة ولو أعجبتكم ولا تنكحوا المشركين حتى يؤمنوا ولعبد مؤمن خير من مشرك ولو أعجبكم أولئك يدعون إلى النار والله يدعو إلى الجنة والمغفرة بإذنه ويبين آياته للناس لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: And they ask you about menstruation. Say, 'It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation. And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordained for you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the rules regarding menstruation and the need for purification before intimate contact with one's spouse. It emphasizes the importance of respecting the purity of women during their menstruation period and instructs believers to refrain from intimate relations during that time. The verse also highlights Allah's love for those who repent and strive for purity in their actions and intentions.
orig: ويسألونك عن المحيض قل هو أذى فاعتزلوا النساء في المحيض ولا تقربوهن حتى يطهرن فإذا تطهرن فأتوهن من حيث أمركم الله إن الله يحب التوابين ويحب المتطهرين

translation: Your women are a place of cultivation for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish and put forth [righteousness] for yourselves. And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the relationship between husband and wife as one of mutual care, support, and cultivation. It encourages treating one's spouse with kindness and respect, and reminds individuals to be aware of their actions and intentions as they will be held accountable by Allah. Believers are given glad tidings for their faith and righteous deeds.
orig: نساؤكم حرث لكم فأتوا حرثكم أنى شئتم وقدموا لأنفسكم واتقوا الله واعلموا أنكم ملاقوه وبشر المؤمنين

translation: And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing Allah and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that using oaths as an excuse to avoid doing good deeds, being righteous, or reconciling between people is not acceptable. It reminds believers that Allah is aware of everything they do and say, and thus they should be sincere in their actions and intentions. It serves as a reminder to prioritize genuine actions over empty promises or uses of oaths to justify wrongdoing.
orig: ولا تجعلوا الله عرضة لأيمانكم أن تبروا وتتقوا وتصلحوا بين الناس والله سميع عليم

translation: Allah does not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He imposes blame upon you for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity and honesty in one's words and intentions. It emphasizes that Allah is forgiving of unintentional mistakes or slips of the tongue in oaths, but He does hold people accountable for their true intentions and actions. It serves as a reminder that inner intentions and beliefs hold great weight in the sight of Allah, and that true repentance and sincerity in one's deeds are key aspects of faith.
orig: لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما كسبت قلوبكم والله غفور حليم

translation: Those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives must wait for four months; but if they reconcile - indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of reconciliation and forgiveness in relationships, specifically between spouses. It highlights that even in difficult times or disputes, it is essential to strive for reconciliation and forgiveness. The verse also serves as a reminder of Allah's forgiveness and mercy, encouraging believers to follow His example in their relationships with others.
orig: للذين يؤلون من نسائهم تربص أربعة أشهر فإن فاءوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And if they have decided on divorce, then indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if a couple has made the decision to divorce, Allah is fully aware of their intentions, actions, and the circumstances surrounding their decision. It serves as a reminder that even during times of conflict and separation, Allah is always listening to their prayers and is fully aware of their situation.
orig: وإن عزموا الطلاق فإن الله سميع عليم

translation: Divorced women remain in waiting for three periods, and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have more right to take them back in this [period] if they desire reconciliation. And due to the wives is similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the rights and responsibilities of divorced women and their ex-husbands during the waiting period ('iddah). It instructs divorced women to be honest about their pregnancy, provides guidance for reconciliation between the couple, and asserts the principle of fairness and balance in relationships between spouses, while also highlighting that men have a degree of responsibility over women. Ultimately, the verse conveys the wisdom and authority of Allah in the regulation of marital affairs.
orig: والمطلقات يتربصن بأنفسهن ثلاثة قروء ولا يحل لهن أن يكتمن ما خلق الله في أرحامهن إن كن يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر وبعولتهن أحق بردهن في ذلك إن أرادوا إصلاحا ولهن مثل الذي عليهن بالمعروف وللرجال عليهن درجة والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse addresses the rules regarding divorce in Islam. It allows for a husband to divorce his wife twice, after which he must either maintain a respectful and acceptable relationship with her or release her with kindness. It also emphasizes that the wife should not be forced to give back anything that was given to her by the husband during the marriage, unless both parties fear they will transgress the limits set by Allah. If transgression is feared, there should be no blame on either party if they agree to a form of compensation (ransom). The verse stresses the importance of respecting the boundaries set by Allah in matters of divorce, and warns against those who exceed these limits, as they are considered wrongdoers.
orig: الطلاق مرتان فإمساك بمعروف أو تسريح بإحسان ولا يحل لكم أن تأخذوا مما آتيتموهن شيئا إلا أن يخافا ألا يقيما حدود الله فإن خفتم ألا يقيما حدود الله فلا جناح عليهما فيما افتدت به تلك حدود الله فلا تعتدوها ومن يتعد حدود الله فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: So if he divorces her, she shall not be lawful to him thereafter until she has married another husband. Then if the latter divorces her, there shall be no sin on them both if they reunite, provided that they think they can keep within the bounds set by Allah. These are the bounds of Allah, He makes them clear to people who have knowledge.
interpretation: This verse addresses the procedure of divorce in Islam, highlighting the concept of giving a divorced woman the opportunity to marry someone else before potentially returning to her former husband. It emphasizes the significance of adhering to the limits and guidelines set by Allah in matters of marriage and divorce. It aims to bring about fairness and careful consideration in the process of divorce, ensuring that the rights and dignity of individuals are maintained as per Islamic teachings.
orig: فإن طلقها فلا تحل له من بعد حتى تنكح زوجا غيره فإن طلقها فلا جناح عليهما أن يتراجعا إن ظنا أن يقيما حدود الله وتلك حدود الله يبينها لقوم يعلمون

translation: And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of dealing with divorce in a just and honorable manner. It advises that when divorcing women, it should be done with fairness and kindness, without causing harm or transgressing against them. It warns against misusing the laws of divorce to oppress others, as that would be a grave injustice. Additionally, it reminds believers not to mock or take lightly the teachings of Allah, and to remember the blessings and guidance bestowed upon them through the Quran and wisdom. The verse concludes by emphasizing the importance of fearing Allah, being mindful that He is all-knowing and aware of all actions.
orig: وإذا طلقتم النساء فبلغن أجلهن فأمسكوهن بمعروف أو سرحوهن بمعروف ولا تمسكوهن ضرارا لتعتدوا ومن يفعل ذلك فقد ظلم نفسه ولا تتخذوا آيات الله هزوا واذكروا نعمت الله عليكم وما أنزل عليكم من الكتاب والحكمة يعظكم به واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of divorce in Islam, emphasizing the importance of treating divorced women with respect and fairness. It highlights the idea that divorce should be approached with a sense of responsibility and kindness towards the former spouse. The verse reminds believers to fear Allah and act with integrity when it comes to matters of marriage and divorce, as Allah is fully aware of all actions and intentions.
orig: وإذا طلقتم النساء فبلغن أجلهن فلا تعضلوهن أن ينكحن أزواجهن إذا تراضوا بينهم بالمعروف ذلك يوعظ به من كان منكم يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ذلكم أزكى لكم وأطهر والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Mothers may breastfeed their children for two complete years for whoever wishes to complete the nursing period. Upon the father is the mothers' provision and their clothing according to what is acceptable. No person is charged with more than his capacity. No mother should be harmed through her child, and no father through his child. And upon the [father's] heir is [a duty] like that. But if they both desire weaning through mutual consent from both of them and consultation, there is no sin upon them. And if you wish to have your children nursed by a substitute, there is no sin upon you as long as you give payment according to what is reasonable. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an addresses the period of breastfeeding and the related responsibilities between parents. It emphasizes the mutual rights and responsibilities concerning breastfeeding the child, ensuring fairness and compassion towards both the mother and the child. It invites parents to approach matters with mutual agreement and consultation, highlighting the importance of meeting obligations with justice and consideration. The verse underscores the concept of fairness, mutual consent, and the awareness that Allah sees and knows all actions.
orig: والوالدات يرضعن أولادهن حولين كاملين لمن أراد أن يتم الرضاعة وعلى المولود له رزقهن وكسوتهن بالمعروف لا تكلف نفس إلا وسعها لا تضار والدة بولدها ولا مولود له بولده وعلى الوارث مثل ذلك فإن أرادا فصالا عن تراض منهما وتشاور فلا جناح عليهما وإن أردتم أن تسترضعوا أولادكم فلا جناح عليكم إذا سلمتم ما آتيتم بالمعروف واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And those of you who die and leave wives behind, they shall wait for four months and ten days. And when they have reached the end of their waiting period, then there is no blame on you for what they do with themselves in a decent manner. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse addresses the waiting period (Iddah) for widows after the death of their husbands. During this time, the widows are expected to abstain from marrying again in order to ascertain if they are pregnant. After the waiting period elapses, they are free to choose their future course of action regarding marriage. This verse emphasizes the importance of dealing with widows and their affairs with kindness and understanding, and highlights Allah's knowledge of all actions.
orig: والذين يتوفون منكم ويذرون أزواجا يتربصن بأنفسهن أربعة أشهر وعشرا فإذا بلغن أجلهن فلا جناح عليكم فيما فعلن في أنفسهن بالمعروف والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: And there is no blame upon you for what you indirectly allude to in proposing to the women or for what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will have them in mind. But do not make a secret contract with them except in the recognized manner. And do not decide on marriage contract until the term prescribed reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is within yourselves, so beware of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse addresses the etiquette of proposing to women and contracting marriages. It emphasizes transparency and warns against secret contracts or hasty decisions regarding marriage. It instructs believers to be mindful that Allah knows their intentions and innermost thoughts, reminding them to be cautious and aware of their actions. Additionally, the verse reassures that Allah is Forgiving and Patient, highlighting His mercy and understanding towards human behavior.
orig: ولا جناح عليكم فيما عرضتم به من خطبة النساء أو أكننتم في أنفسكم علم الله أنكم ستذكرونهن ولكن لا تواعدوهن سرا إلا أن تقولوا قولا معروفا ولا تعزموا عقدة النكاح حتى يبلغ الكتاب أجله واعلموا أن الله يعلم ما في أنفسكم فاحذروه واعلموا أن الله غفور حليم

translation: There is no blame upon you if you divorce women you have not touched or specified for them an obligation. But give them [a gift of] compensation - the wealthy according to his capability and the poor according to his capability - a provision according to what is acceptable, a duty upon the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse tackles the topic of divorce in Islam, explaining the obligations of a Muslim when divorcing his wife. It emphasizes fairness and generosity towards the divorced women, urging that even if the couple has not been physically intimate, the woman should still be given a gift as a form of compensation. The verse stresses that the amount should be given based on the husband's financial situation, meaning the wealthy should give according to their means and the poor in accordance with their financial capabilities, always upholding the principles of fairness and goodness in treating others.
orig: لا جناح عليكم إن طلقتم النساء ما لم تمسوهن أو تفرضوا لهن فريضة ومتعوهن على الموسع قدره وعلى المقتر قدره متاعا بالمعروف حقا على المحسنين

translation: And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation, then [give] half of what you specified - unless they forego the right or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract foregoes it. And to forego it is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget graciousness between you. Indeed Allah, of whatever you do, is Seeing.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an addresses the issue of divorce before consummation of the marriage. It emphasizes fairness and kindness in the treatment of divorced women, highlighting that it is better to be generous in such situations. The verse teaches the importance of upholding righteousness, fairness, and kindness in all human relationships, emphasizing the importance of acting with integrity and considering the well-being of others even in times of difficulty.
orig: وإن طلقتموهن من قبل أن تمسوهن وقد فرضتم لهن فريضة فنصف ما فرضتم إلا أن يعفون أو يعفو الذي بيده عقدة النكاح وأن تعفوا أقرب للتقوى ولا تنسوا الفضل بينكم إن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: Maintain the prayers and the middle prayer, and stand before Allah, devoutly obedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing regular prayers and specifically mentions 'the middle prayer', which is understood to be the Asr prayer according to some interpretations. The verse encourages believers to be devout and obedient to Allah by performing their prayers with sincerity and focus. It serves as a reminder for Muslims to be consistent in their worship and to approach prayer as a means of strengthening their connection with Allah.
orig: حافظوا على الصلوات والصلاة الوسطى وقوموا لله قانتين

translation: So if you fear (an enemy), pray on foot or riding. But when you are secure, remember Allah in the manner He has taught you that which you did not previously know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and worshiping Allah in all circumstances, whether in times of fear or safety. It encourages believers to maintain their connection with Allah and follow His teachings, even in situations where they may be uncertain or fearful. The verse reminds us that obedience and remembrance of Allah are essential aspects of faith, regardless of the circumstances we find ourselves in.
orig: فإن خفتم فرجالا أو ركبانا فإذا أمنتم فاذكروا الله كما علمكم ما لم تكونوا تعلمون

translation: And those of you who die and leave wives behind – they should bequeath for their wives maintenance for a year without turning them out. But if they leave, there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable manner. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of providing maintenance for widows after the death of their husbands. It emphasizes the importance of husbands leaving behind provisions for their wives for a year after their passing, ensuring that they are taken care of during the mourning period without being forced to leave their homes. However, it also offers flexibility, stating that if the widows choose to leave during that time, it is acceptable and there is no blame on the heirs for what the widows do thereafter, as long as it is done in a gracious and honorable manner. Ultimately, the verse highlights the importance of kindness, understanding, and respect towards widows during their period of transition and bereavement.
orig: والذين يتوفون منكم ويذرون أزواجا وصية لأزواجهم متاعا إلى الحول غير إخراج فإن خرجن فلا جناح عليكم في ما فعلن في أنفسهن من معروف والله عزيز حكيم

translation: And for divorced women is a provision according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
interpretation: This verse addresses the provision given to divorced women, emphasizing that it should be provided according to known standards of fairness and kindness. It also highlights that it is a duty upon the righteous ones to fulfill these obligations with integrity and piety.
orig: وللمطلقات متاع بالمعروف حقا على المتقين

translation: Thus Allah makes clear His verses to you that perhaps you might understand
interpretation: Allah communicates His signs and revelations clearly for mankind to reflect on and comprehend, inviting them to contemplate on the signs of His existence, His mercy, wisdom, and power, in order for them to attain understanding and insight.
orig: كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Did you not see those who went out from their homes in thousands, fearing death? Then Allah said to them, 'Die.' And then He restored them to life. Indeed, Allah is gracious towards people, but most of the people do not show gratitude.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of Allah to grant life and the concept of resurrection. It serves as a reminder that Allah is merciful and favors humanity, yet many people fail to acknowledge His blessings and show gratitude. It also alludes to the inevitability of death and the resurrection, encouraging believers to reflect on the signs of Allah's mercy and be grateful for them.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين خرجوا من ديارهم وهم ألوف حذر الموت فقال لهم الله موتوا ثم أحياهم إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون

translation: And fight in the cause of Allah, and know that Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fighting in the cause of Allah with the awareness that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing. It serves as a reminder for believers to have faith and steadfastness in their struggles, knowing that Allah is aware of their intentions and actions.
orig: وقاتلوا في سبيل الله واعلموا أن الله سميع عليم

translation: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And it is Allah who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of giving in charity or doing good deeds for the sake of Allah. It encourages believers to be generous and help others, promising that whatever is given to Allah in the form of a good deed or charity will be multiplied many times over as a reward. It also reminds believers that everything belongs to Allah, and it is He who controls all provisions and grants abundance to whom He wills. Ultimately, all will return to Him and be held accountable for their actions.
orig: من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا فيضاعفه له أضعافا كثيرة والله يقبض ويبسط وإليه ترجعون

translation: Have you not considered the assembly of the Children of Israel after [the time of] Moses when they said to a prophet of theirs, 'Send to us a king, and we will fight in the way of Allah'? He said, 'Would you perhaps refrain from fighting if fighting was prescribed for you?' They said, 'And why should we not fight in the cause of Allah when we have been driven out of our homes and our children?' But when fighting was prescribed for them, they turned away, except for a few of them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse describes a situation among the Children of Israel where they asked for a king to lead them in battle for the sake of Allah. When they were asked if they would still fight if it was required of them, they confidently affirmed their readiness. However, when the time for battle actually came, most of them turned away, showing their lack of sincerity and commitment. The verse highlights the importance of staying true to one's promises and commitments, especially in matters concerning the service to Allah.
orig: ألم تر إلى الملإ من بني إسرائيل من بعد موسى إذ قالوا لنبي لهم ابعث لنا ملكا نقاتل في سبيل الله قال هل عسيتم إن كتب عليكم القتال ألا تقاتلوا قالوا وما لنا ألا نقاتل في سبيل الله وقد أخرجنا من ديارنا وأبنائنا فلما كتب عليهم القتال تولوا إلا قليلا منهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: And their prophet said to them, 'Indeed, Allah has sent forth Saul as a king for you.' They said, 'How can he have kingship over us while we are more deserving of kingship than him, and he has not been given an abundance of wealth?' He said, 'Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has increased him abundantly in knowledge and physique.' And Allah gives His sovereignty to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing, all-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Saul (Talut) being appointed as a king by Allah for the Children of Israel. Despite their initial objections based on worldly measures like wealth, the Prophet explains that Allah had selected Saul and endowed him with knowledge and strength. It reflects a lesson on how Allah's choices and blessings may not align with our preconceived notions of merit, emphasizing that sovereignty and power ultimately reside with Allah, who bestows them as He pleases, guided by His comprehensive knowledge and wisdom.
orig: وقال لهم نبيهم إن الله قد بعث لكم طالوت ملكا قالوا أنى يكون له الملك علينا ونحن أحق بالملك منه ولم يؤت سعة من المال قال إن الله اصطفاه عليكم وزاده بسطة في العلم والجسم والله يؤتي ملكه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: And their Prophet said to them, 'Indeed, the sign of his kingship is that the Ark will come to you in which is assurance from your Lord and a remnant of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron had left, carried by the angels. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.'
interpretation: This verse describes the Prophet informing the people that the arrival of the Ark would signify the confirmation of the king's legitimacy. The Ark mentioned would contain assurance and a remnant of the belongings of the family of Moses and Aaron, carried by angels. The Prophet emphasizes that this event is a sign for the believers to recognize and acknowledge the divine will and authority behind it.
orig: وقال لهم نبيهم إن آية ملكه أن يأتيكم التابوت فيه سكينة من ربكم وبقية مما ترك آل موسى وآل هارون تحمله الملائكة إن في ذلك لآية لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: So when Saul set out with the soldiers, he said, 'Indeed, Allah will be testing you with a river. So whoever drinks from it is not with me, but whoever does not taste it is indeed with me, except for one who takes [from it] in the hollow of his hand.' But they drank from it, except for a few of them. Then when he had crossed it along with those who believed with him, they said, 'There is no power for us today against Goliath and his soldiers.' But those who were certain that they would meet Allah said, 'How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the importance of faith, patience, and trust in Allah during times of crisis. It narrates an incident where a group faced a seemingly insurmountable challenge but ultimately emerged victorious due to their unwavering belief in Allah's support. It showcases that with Allah's permission, even a small group can triumph over a greatly superior force when they put their trust in Allah and demonstrate patience. The verse encourages believers to stay steadfast, rely on Allah, and maintain patience in the face of adversity, for victory comes to those who remain firm in their faith.
orig: فلما فصل طالوت بالجنود قال إن الله مبتليكم بنهر فمن شرب منه فليس مني ومن لم يطعمه فإنه مني إلا من اغترف غرفة بيده فشربوا منه إلا قليلا منهم فلما جاوزه هو والذين آمنوا معه قالوا لا طاقة لنا اليوم بجالوت وجنوده قال الذين يظنون أنهم ملاقو الله كم من فئة قليلة غلبت فئة كثيرة بإذن الله والله مع الصابرين

translation: And when they went forth to face Goliath and his soldiers, they prayed, 'Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.'
interpretation: This verse describes the prayer made by a group of believers as they faced a great challenge and sought strength, patience, resilience, and victory from Allah against those who opposed their faith. It teaches us the importance of turning to Allah in times of difficulty, seeking His help, and putting our trust in Him to overcome obstacles and enemies.
orig: ولما برزوا لجالوت وجنوده قالوا ربنا أفرغ علينا صبرا وثبت أقدامنا وانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: So they defeated them by permission of Allah, and Dawood killed Jalut, and Allah gave him the kingship and prophethood and taught him from that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted. But Allah is full of bounty to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that all victories come by the permission of Allah. It mentions the story of Dawood (David) defeating Jalut (Goliath) with the help of Allah, and receiving kingship and wisdom as a result. The verse also highlights the importance of maintaining balance on Earth by the intervention of Allah among people to prevent corruption. It signifies that despite the potential for chaos and corruption, Allah's grace and wisdom prevails over all creation.
orig: فهزموهم بإذن الله وقتل داوود جالوت وآتاه الله الملك والحكمة وعلمه مما يشاء ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لفسدت الأرض ولكن الله ذو فضل على العالمين

translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. And indeed, [O Muhammad], you are from the messengers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a validation of Prophet Muhammad's (peace be upon him) role as a messenger of Allah. It emphasizes the divine nature of the message being conveyed to him and highlights his truthfulness and integrity as a messenger. It reaffirms the importance of guidance from Allah and the prophethood of Muhammad (peace be upon him) in delivering this guidance to humanity.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق وإنك لمن المرسلين

translation: Those messengers - some of them We favored over others. Among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degrees of rank. And We gave Jesus, the Son of Mary, clear proofs, and We supported him with the Pure Spirit. If Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, and some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity among messengers and the varying levels of favor they received from Allah. It mentions the specific case of Jesus, who was given clear signs and supported by the Holy Spirit. The verse also addresses the differences and conflicts that arose among people despite receiving clear evidence and guidance. It emphasizes that Allah's will prevails over all things, and that people's choices and actions are ultimately determined by His decree.
orig: تلك الرسل فضلنا بعضهم على بعض منهم من كلم الله ورفع بعضهم درجات وآتينا عيسى ابن مريم البينات وأيدناه بروح القدس ولو شاء الله ما اقتتل الذين من بعدهم من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات ولكن اختلفوا فمنهم من آمن ومنهم من كفر ولو شاء الله ما اقتتلوا ولكن الله يفعل ما يريد

translation: O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before there comes a Day in which there is no exchange and no friendship and no intercession. And the disbelievers – they are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to spend from the provisions and blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them before a Day of Judgement arrives, where no worldly possessions or relationships will hold any value. It serves as a reminder to act with generosity and charity, and not be among the wrongdoers who reject the truth of Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أنفقوا مما رزقناكم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا بيع فيه ولا خلة ولا شفاعة والكافرون هم الظالمون

translation: Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah. It emphasizes His unique attributes including His eternal life, knowledge, and authority over all creation. It also points out that no one can intercede with Him except by His permission, demonstrating His ultimate control and wisdom. The verse serves as a reminder of the greatness and majesty of Allah, and the limitations of human understanding in comparison to His infinite knowledge and might.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو الحي القيوم لا تأخذه سنة ولا نوم له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض من ذا الذي يشفع عنده إلا بإذنه يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون بشيء من علمه إلا بما شاء وسع كرسيه السماوات والأرض ولا يئوده حفظهما وهو العلي العظيم

translation: There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that religion should not be forced upon anyone, as guidance and truth are clear and distinct from falsehood. It highlights the importance of rejecting false deities and believing in Allah, which is a secure foundation for the believers. It assures that holding onto faith in Allah is a firm and unwavering support, and that He is All-Hearing and All-Knowing of our actions and intentions.
orig: لا إكراه في الدين قد تبين الرشد من الغي فمن يكفر بالطاغوت ويؤمن بالله فقد استمسك بالعروة الوثقى لا انفصام لها والله سميع عليم

translation: Allah is the ally of those who believe. He brings them out from darkness into the light. But those who disbelieve – their allies are Taghut. They take them out of the light into darknesses. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that Allah is the protector and ally of the believers, guiding them from ignorance and darkness towards truth and enlightenment. On the other hand, those who reject faith have allies that lead them astray into darkness and disbelief. The verse warns that those who choose disbelief will face eternal punishment in the fire of Hell.
orig: الله ولي الذين آمنوا يخرجهم من الظلمات إلى النور والذين كفروا أولياؤهم الطاغوت يخرجونهم من النور إلى الظلمات أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: Have you not considered the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord [merely] because Allah had given him kingship? When Abraham said, 'My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death,' he said, 'I [too] give life and cause death.' Abraham said, 'Indeed, Allah brings the sun from the east, so bring it from the west.' Thus was the disbeliever overwhelmed [by astonishment], and Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse illustrates a conversation between Abraham and a disbeliever who claimed to have power over life and death due to the kingship he possessed. In response, Abraham attributed the power of life and death solely to Allah, showcasing his unwavering faith and belief in the power of the Almighty. The disbeliever was left bewildered when he was unable to bring the sun from the west as a sign of his supposed power, highlighting the undeniable authority and control of Allah over all things. The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and submitting to the ultimate power of Allah and the futility of arrogance and disbelief.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذي حاج إبراهيم في ربه أن آتاه الله الملك إذ قال إبراهيم ربي الذي يحيي ويميت قال أنا أحيي وأميت قال إبراهيم فإن الله يأتي بالشمس من المشرق فأت بها من المغرب فبهت الذي كفر والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Or [consider such an example] as the one who passed by a township which had fallen into ruin. He said, How will Allah bring this to life after its death? So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him. He said, How long have you remained [dead]? He said, [Perhaps] I have remained a day or part of a day. He said, Rather, you have remained one hundred years. Look at your food and your drink; it has not changed with time. And look at your donkey; and We will make you a sign for the people. And look at the bones [of this donkey] - how We raise them and then We cover them with flesh. When it became clear to him, he said, I know that Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse tells the story of a man who passed by a town that had been reduced to ruins and questioned how Allah could bring it back to life. Allah then caused the man to die for a hundred years and then resurrected him to show His power and ability to bring the dead back to life. The man, upon seeing the miraculous signs shown by Allah, acknowledged the omnipotence and capability of Allah over all things.
orig: أو كالذي مر على قرية وهي خاوية على عروشها قال أنى يحيي هذه الله بعد موتها فأماته الله مائة عام ثم بعثه قال كم لبثت قال لبثت يوما أو بعض يوم قال بل لبثت مائة عام فانظر إلى طعامك وشرابك لم يتسنه وانظر إلى حمارك ولنجعلك آية للناس وانظر إلى العظام كيف ننشزها ثم نكسوها لحما فلما تبين له قال أعلم أن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And [mention] when Abraham said, 'My Lord, show me how You give life to the dead.' [Allah] said, 'Have you not believed?' He said, 'Yes, but [I ask] only that my heart may be satisfied.' [Allah] said, 'Take four birds and commit them to yourself. Then [after slaughtering them] put on each hill a portion of them; then call them - they will come [flying] to you in haste. And know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.'
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) asks Allah to show him how He gives life to the dead. The act of having to sacrifice and then reassemble the birds symbolizes the power of Allah to give life from death. The verse emphasizes the strength of belief and the wisdom of Allah in demonstrating His capabilities.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب أرني كيف تحيي الموتى قال أولم تؤمن قال بلى ولكن ليطمئن قلبي قال فخذ أربعة من الطير فصرهن إليك ثم اجعل على كل جبل منهن جزءا ثم ادعهن يأتينك سعيا واعلم أن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed of grain that sprouts seven ears, in every ear there are a hundred grains; and Allah multiplies for whom He wills. And Allah is all-encompassing and knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of charity and spending in the way of Allah. Just as a single seed can grow into a plant bearing numerous fruits, the act of spending in the path of Allah is rewarded and multiplied manifold by Allah, far beyond what one could imagine. It emphasizes that Allah is generous and knowledgeable, rewarding those who give for His cause abundantly.
orig: مثل الذين ينفقون أموالهم في سبيل الله كمثل حبة أنبتت سبع سنابل في كل سنبلة مائة حبة والله يضاعف لمن يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah and then do not follow up what they have spent with reminders [of it] or [other] harm will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity and consistency in charitable actions. It emphasizes that those who give for the sake of Allah and do not seek recognition or harm from their charity will be rewarded by Allah. It also assures them that they will have no fear or grief in the Hereafter, indicating the blessings and protection granted to those who give selflessly.
orig: الذين ينفقون أموالهم في سبيل الله ثم لا يتبعون ما أنفقوا منا ولا أذى لهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: A kind word and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury. And Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of good manners and forgiveness over simply giving charity. It teaches that showing kindness and forgiveness towards others is more valuable and virtuous than giving charity if it comes with harm or hurtful behavior. Allah is described as self-sufficient and patient, emphasizing His attributes of generosity and mercy towards His creation.
orig: قول معروف ومغفرة خير من صدقة يتبعها أذى والله غني حليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders or injury as does one who spends his wealth [only to] be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a [large] smooth stone upon which is dust and is hit by a downpour that leaves it bare. They are unable [to keep] anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse admonishes the believers against nullifying the rewards of their acts of charity by following them with reminders or hurtful words. It criticizes those who give charity to show off to people rather than out of genuine belief in Allah and the Last Day. Such acts are equated to a rock covered with a thin layer of soil which is washed away by heavy rain, leaving the rock bare. This implies that hypocritical acts will bring no benefit or reward, as they are not done sincerely for the sake of Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تبطلوا صدقاتكم بالمن والأذى كالذي ينفق ماله رئاء الناس ولا يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر فمثله كمثل صفوان عليه تراب فأصابه وابل فتركه صلدا لا يقدرون على شيء مما كسبوا والله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: And the example of those who spend their wealth seeking the approval of Allah and firmness for their souls is like a garden on high ground which is hit by a downpour, so it brings forth its fruit twofold. And if it does not receive a downpour, then a drizzle is enough. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse compares the act of spending wealth in charity for the sake of pleasing Allah and strengthening one's faith to a garden that is well-irrigated and fruitful. Just as a garden on high ground benefits greatly from heavy rain by yielding abundant produce, those who spend their wealth sincerely for Allah's sake will be rewarded manifold by Him. Even if a garden on high ground only receives a light drizzle, it is still sufficient to maintain its growth. Similarly, Allah sees and appreciates the efforts and intentions behind every act of charity, whether small or large.
orig: ومثل الذين ينفقون أموالهم ابتغاء مرضات الله وتثبيتا من أنفسهم كمثل جنة بربوة أصابها وابل فآتت أكلها ضعفين فإن لم يصبها وابل فطل والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: Would any of you wish to have a garden with date-palms and vines, with rivers flowing beneath it, and all kinds of fruits therein, while he is afflicted with old age, with weak offspring, then a whirlwind containing fire smites it, so it is all burnt up? Thus Allah makes clear His revelations to you, so that you may reflect.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the impermanence and uncertainty of worldly blessings. Even if one is granted abundant wealth and resources, unforeseen calamities can destroy all that one has accumulated. It serves as a reminder to prioritize preparing for the eternal life in the hereafter rather than becoming attached to the fleeting pleasures and possessions of this world.
orig: أيود أحدكم أن تكون له جنة من نخيل وأعناب تجري من تحتها الأنهار له فيها من كل الثمرات وأصابه الكبر وله ذرية ضعفاء فأصابها إعصار فيه نار فاحترقت كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تتفكرون

translation: O you who have believed, spend from the good [things] which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim toward the defective therefrom to spend [from] while you would not take it [yourself] except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of giving charity from lawful and good earnings. It warns against giving from impure sources or seeking to donate from what is flawed or unlawful. It highlights the importance of sincerity in giving and reminds believers that Allah is self-sufficient and deserving of all praises.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أنفقوا من طيبات ما كسبتم ومما أخرجنا لكم من الأرض ولا تيمموا الخبيث منه تنفقون ولستم بآخذيه إلا أن تغمضوا فيه واعلموا أن الله غني حميد

translation: Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-encompassing and knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrast between the promises of Satan and the promises of Allah. Satan tries to instill fear and leads people towards immoral actions, while Allah assures forgiveness and blessings to those who turn to Him. It serves as a reminder that trusting in Allah's mercy and guidance is far more beneficial than following the temptations of Satan.
orig: الشيطان يعدكم الفقر ويأمركم بالفحشاء والله يعدكم مغفرة منه وفضلا والله واسع عليم

translation: He grants wisdom to whom He pleases, and whoever is granted wisdom is indeed given a great good. Yet none bear this in mind except men of understanding.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that Allah bestows wisdom upon whom He wills, and whoever is given wisdom has been bestowed with a great good. However, the ability to understand and appreciate this wisdom is limited to those who possess intelligence and insight.
orig: يؤتي الحكمة من يشاء ومن يؤت الحكمة فقد أوتي خيرا كثيرا وما يذكر إلا أولو الألباب

translation: And whatever you spend of expenditures or make of vows - indeed, Allah knows of it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of all the acts of charity or vows that people make. It serves as a reminder that no good deed, no matter how small, goes unnoticed by Allah. Additionally, it warns those who commit wrongdoing that they will have no supporters or helpers against the consequences of their actions.
orig: وما أنفقتم من نفقة أو نذرتم من نذر فإن الله يعلمه وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: If you disclose your charitable expenditures, they are good; but if you conceal them and give them to the poor, it is better for you, and He will remove from you some of your misdeeds. And Allah, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in acts of charity. While publicizing charitable acts can inspire others to do good deeds, giving in secret, solely for the sake of pleasing Allah, carries more reward. It highlights the significance of genuine intentions and humility in fulfilling obligations towards helping those in need. Ultimately, it stresses that Allah is fully aware of our actions and intentions, and rewards accordingly.
orig: إن تبدوا الصدقات فنعما هي وإن تخفوها وتؤتوها الفقراء فهو خير لكم ويكفر عنكم من سيئاتكم والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever good you spend is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever good you give for loan, It will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance ultimately comes from Allah, and it is not the Prophet Muhammad's responsibility to guide people's hearts. It also highlights the concept of selflessness in giving, stating that any good spent is ultimately for the self, as it is an investment in the Hereafter. Additionally, the verse confirms that any good done for the sake of Allah will be generously rewarded and repaid in full by Him, without injustice.
orig: ليس عليك هداهم ولكن الله يهدي من يشاء وما تنفقوا من خير فلأنفسكم وما تنفقون إلا ابتغاء وجه الله وما تنفقوا من خير يوف إليكم وأنتم لا تظلمون

translation: For the poor who have been restricted in the way of Allah, unable to move about in the land. The ignorant person thinks they are rich because of their modesty. You can recognize them by their features; they do not ask people persistently. And whatever you spend of good, indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humility and dignity of the poor who are dedicated to the path of Allah. Despite their poverty and limitations, they are perceived as rich due to their modesty and noble characteristics. They do not burden others with their needs, but carry themselves with grace. The verse also highlights that Allah is aware of the good deeds and charity that are given to help the poor, reinforcing the idea of sincerity and intention in charitable acts.
orig: للفقراء الذين أحصروا في سبيل الله لا يستطيعون ضربا في الأرض يحسبهم الجاهل أغنياء من التعفف تعرفهم بسيماهم لا يسألون الناس إلحافا وما تنفقوا من خير فإن الله به عليم

translation: Those who spend their wealth [in Allah 's way] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance and virtue of giving in charity for the sake of Allah. It encourages believers to be consistent in their acts of charity, whether in private or public, as both are rewarded by Allah. The verse also reassures believers that those who give for the sake of Allah will be protected from fear and grief, indicating the spiritual and emotional benefits of sincere charitable giving.
orig: الذين ينفقون أموالهم بالليل والنهار سرا وعلانية فلهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those who consume interest cannot stand [on the Day of Resurrection] except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, 'Trade is [just] like interest.' But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden interest. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair rests with Allah. But whoever returns to [dealing in interest or usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the prohibition of consuming interest or usury in Islam. It describes the fate of those who engage in such prohibited transactions, comparing their inability to stand on the Day of Resurrection to one who is being afflicted by Satan. The verse distinguishes between trade, which is permitted, and interest, which is forbidden, highlighting the underlying principles of Islamic finance. Those who heed the warning and refrain from dealing in interest will be forgiven for their past actions. However, those who persist in engaging in usury are warned of the severe punishment awaiting them in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder of the importance of adhering to the ethical and just financial practices prescribed by Islam.
orig: الذين يأكلون الربا لا يقومون إلا كما يقوم الذي يتخبطه الشيطان من المس ذلك بأنهم قالوا إنما البيع مثل الربا وأحل الله البيع وحرم الربا فمن جاءه موعظة من ربه فانتهى فله ما سلف وأمره إلى الله ومن عاد فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: Allah destroys interest and gives increase for charities. And Allah does not like every sinning disbeliever.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the prohibition of dealing in interest (riba) and encourages giving in charity. It highlights that Allah dislikes those who persist in sin and disbelief. The verse serves as a reminder to believers to avoid engaging in usury and to strive in acts of goodness and charity, as these are beloved to Allah.
orig: يمحق الله الربا ويربي الصدقات والله لا يحب كل كفار أثيم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds and established prayer and given zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith, good deeds, prayer, and charity (zakah). It reassures believers that their efforts will be rewarded by God and assures them that they need not fear or grieve, indicating the assurance of divine protection and peace for those who fulfill their religious duties earnestly.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة لهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.
interpretation: This verse is urging the believers to be conscious of Allah and to abstain from dealing with interest in their financial transactions. It emphasizes the importance of staying away from any form of usury in order to maintain the purity of their faith and fulfill their commitment to Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وذروا ما بقي من الربا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: But if you do not, then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.
interpretation: This verse warns that if people persist in wrongdoing and do not repent, they will face the consequences of their actions. However, if they choose to repent and turn back to Allah, they will be forgiven and allowed to keep what they have earned rightfully. The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning away from wrongful actions to avoid facing the consequences brought forth by their deeds.
orig: فإن لم تفعلوا فأذنوا بحرب من الله ورسوله وإن تبتم فلكم رءوس أموالكم لا تظلمون ولا تظلمون

translation: And if someone is in hardship, then [let there be] postponement until [a time of] ease. But if you give [from your wealth], it is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of patience during difficult times and encourages giving in charity even when one is facing financial hardships. The verse suggests that being patient and seeking future ease is better than rushing to fulfill one's desires and that giving in charity can bring blessings and ease. It teaches believers to trust in Allah's wisdom and to take actions that will ultimately bring them goodness and reward.
orig: وإن كان ذو عسرة فنظرة إلى ميسرة وأن تصدقوا خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgement when every individual will be held accountable for their deeds. It emphasizes the concept of divine justice - every person will be recompensed exactly for what they have done, with absolute fairness and without any injustice. This should instill in the believers a sense of God-consciousness and encourage them to reflect on their actions and intentions in this world.
orig: واتقوا يوما ترجعون فيه إلى الله ثم توفى كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it down. And let a scribe write between you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write and let the one who owes dictate, and let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who owes is of limited understanding or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men, then a man and two women from those whom you accept as witnesses, so that if one of them errs, the other can remind her. And let not the witnesses refuse when they are called upon. And do not be too weary to write it, whether it is small or large, for its specified term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate transaction which you conduct among yourselves, then there is no blame upon you if you do not write it. And take witnesses when you conclude a contract. Let no scribe be harmed or any witness. And if you do, indeed it is grave disobedience in you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding justice and transparency in financial dealings by requiring written documentation of debts for clarity and fairness. It stresses the significance of having witnesses to prevent disputes and ensure accountability. The directive promotes honesty, trustworthiness, and fear of Allah in financial transactions, highlighting the principles of integrity and reliability in business dealings. It also underscores the responsibility of those involved in financial agreements to act with fairness and integrity, reminding them of the importance of fulfilling their obligations and avoiding deception or negligence.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا تداينتم بدين إلى أجل مسمى فاكتبوه وليكتب بينكم كاتب بالعدل ولا يأب كاتب أن يكتب كما علمه الله فليكتب وليملل الذي عليه الحق وليتق الله ربه ولا يبخس منه شيئا فإن كان الذي عليه الحق سفيها أو ضعيفا أو لا يستطيع أن يمل هو فليملل وليه بالعدل واستشهدوا شهيدين من رجالكم فإن لم يكونا رجلين فرجل وامرأتان ممن ترضون من الشهداء أن تضل إحداهما فتذكر إحداهما الأخرى ولا يأب الشهداء إذا ما دعوا ولا تسأموا أن تكتبوه صغيرا أو كبيرا إلى أجله ذلكم أقسط عند الله وأقوم للشهادة وأدنى ألا ترتابوا إلا أن تكون تجارة حاضرة تديرونها بينكم فليس عليكم جناح ألا تكتبوها وأشهدوا إذا تبايعتم ولا يضار كاتب ولا شهيد وإن تفعلوا فإنه فسوق بكم واتقوا الله ويعلمكم الله والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, then a security deposit should be taken. And if one of you entrusts another, then let him who is entrusted deliver his trust (faithfully), and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it - his heart is indeed sinful. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honesty and justice in dealings between people, especially in situations where there may be a lack of formal documentation. It stresses the significance of fulfilling one's promises and trusts, and warns against concealing the truth or evidence, as doing so would be considered sinful. The verse encourages accountability, trustworthiness, and the fear of God in all actions.
orig: وإن كنتم على سفر ولم تجدوا كاتبا فرهان مقبوضة فإن أمن بعضكم بعضا فليؤد الذي اؤتمن أمانته وليتق الله ربه ولا تكتموا الشهادة ومن يكتمها فإنه آثم قلبه والله بما تعملون عليم

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. Then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omnipotence and omniscience of Allah. It explains that Allah is aware of everything, whether it is hidden within our hearts or openly expressed. Allah will judge each individual based on their intentions and actions, forgiving whom He pleases and punishing whom He pleases. It serves as a reminder that Allah has full power and authority over all things, showcasing His divine justice and mercy.
orig: لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإن تبدوا ما في أنفسكم أو تخفوه يحاسبكم به الله فيغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], 'We make no distinction between any of His messengers.' And they say, 'We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of belief in Allah, His angels, His books, and His messengers. It highlights the unity of acceptance of all messengers sent by Allah and the obedience and submission to His commandments. Believers ask for forgiveness and place their trust in Allah as the ultimate destination.
orig: آمن الرسول بما أنزل إليه من ربه والمؤمنون كل آمن بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله لا نفرق بين أحد من رسله وقالوا سمعنا وأطعنا غفرانك ربنا وإليك المصير

translation: Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that Allah does not burden them with trials and difficulties beyond their capacity to endure. It emphasizes the individual responsibility for one's actions and their consequences, both in this world and the Hereafter. The believers seek forgiveness and mercy from Allah, asking for His help and protection against the disbelievers.
orig: لا يكلف الله نفسا إلا وسعها لها ما كسبت وعليها ما اكتسبت ربنا لا تؤاخذنا إن نسينا أو أخطأنا ربنا ولا تحمل علينا إصرا كما حملته على الذين من قبلنا ربنا ولا تحملنا ما لا طاقة لنا به واعف عنا واغفر لنا وارحمنا أنت مولانا فانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: Alif Lam Mim
interpretation: This verse is known as one of the disconnected letters (Muqatta'at) of the Qur'an. These isolated letters appear at the beginning of certain chapters and their exact meanings are unknown. Muslims believe that these letters have a deeper, hidden meaning known only to Allah, and they serve as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and the inability of any human to produce something comparable.
orig: الم

translation: Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unique and supreme nature of Allah as the one true God, the source of all life and sustainer of the universe. It highlights His eternal existence and constant care for all that He has created, revealing His qualities of being ever-living and self-sufficient.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو الحي القيوم

translation: The Book was sent down to you in truth, confirming what was before it. And He sent down the Torah and the Gospel.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the belief that the Qur'an is a continuation and confirmation of the earlier scriptures revealed by God, such as the Torah and the Gospel. It emphasizes the unity and continuity of the message of monotheism and guidance from God throughout the various revelations to different prophets.
orig: نزل عليك الكتاب بالحق مصدقا لما بين يديه وأنزل التوراة والإنجيل

translation: A guidance for the people, and He sent down the Criterion. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is Exalted in Might, the Avenger.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an is a clear guidance for humanity and that it serves as a criterion to distinguish between right and wrong. It warns those who reject the signs of Allah that they will face a severe punishment. The verse also emphasizes that Allah is All-Powerful and Just, and He will take retribution against those who deny His signs.
orig: من قبل هدى للناس وأنزل الفرقان إن الذين كفروا بآيات الله لهم عذاب شديد والله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: Indeed, Allah is not unaware of anything in the earth or in the heaven.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah, the All-Knowing and All-Aware, is fully aware of everything that happens in the world, whether it is hidden on earth or in the heavens. It serves as a reminder of Allah's all-encompassing knowledge and presence, emphasizing that nothing is beyond His awareness and control.
orig: إن الله لا يخفى عليه شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء

translation: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating human beings in the wombs of their mothers. It asserts that Allah has complete control over the creation process and emphasizes His uniqueness as the only deity worthy of worship due to His ultimate authority and superior wisdom.
orig: هو الذي يصوركم في الأرحام كيف يشاء لا إله إلا هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He it is Who has sent down to thee the Book: In it are verses basic or fundamental (of established meaning); they are the foundation of the Book: others are allegorical. But those in whose hearts is perversity follow the part thereof that is allegorical, seeking discord, and searching for its hidden meanings, but no one knows its hidden meanings except Allah. And those who are firmly grounded in knowledge say: 'We believe in the Book; the whole of it is from our Lord:' and none will grasp the Message except men of understanding.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an contains verses that have clear meanings and are the foundation of the Book, as well as allegorical verses that require deeper reflection and understanding. Those with corrupt hearts may focus on the allegorical parts to create discord and confusion. However, only Allah knows the true meanings of these allegorical verses. Those who are deeply knowledgeable uphold their belief in the entire Book, acknowledging that its true interpretation is known only to Allah. This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding to grasp the true message of the Qur'an.
orig: هو الذي أنزل عليك الكتاب منه آيات محكمات هن أم الكتاب وأخر متشابهات فأما الذين في قلوبهم زيغ فيتبعون ما تشابه منه ابتغاء الفتنة وابتغاء تأويله وما يعلم تأويله إلا الله والراسخون في العلم يقولون آمنا به كل من عند ربنا وما يذكر إلا أولو الألباب

translation: Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him to keep our hearts steadfast on the right path after guiding us. It also acknowledges Allah as the Giver of Mercy and the Bestower of all blessings.
orig: ربنا لا تزغ قلوبنا بعد إذ هديتنا وهب لنا من لدنك رحمة إنك أنت الوهاب

translation: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the hereafter, reminding us that there will be a Day of Judgment where all people will be gathered. It reassures believers that Allah fulfills His promises and that there will be no doubt on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ربنا إنك جامع الناس ليوم لا ريب فيه إن الله لا يخلف الميعاد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - their wealth and their children will not avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that material possessions and offspring will not protect or benefit those who deny the truth and reject faith in Allah. It highlights the insignificance of worldly wealth and lineage in the face of divine judgment and punishment. Those who reject faith are ultimately destined to be fuel for the Fire in the hereafter.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا وأولئك هم وقود النار

translation: Like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them, they denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse describes how the disbelievers, like the people of Pharaoh and those who came before them, reject the signs of Allah and deny His existence. As a consequence of their sins and disbelief, Allah punished them. It serves as a warning that Allah's punishment is severe for those who persist in their denial of His signs and go against His commandments.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كذبوا بآياتنا فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم والله شديد العقاب

translation: Say to those who have disbelieved, you will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
interpretation: This verse is a declaration of the ultimate defeat of the disbelievers and their gathering in Hell. It conveys a warning of the severe consequences of rejecting faith and emphasizes the miserable fate that awaits those who choose to disbelieve in the truth.
orig: قل للذين كفروا ستغلبون وتحشرون إلى جهنم وبئس المهاد

translation: Indeed, there has been a sign for you in the two armies which met. One fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them to be twice their own number by the sight of the eye. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed, in that is a lesson for those of vision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that success does not solely depend on material or visible strength, but rather on the support and assistance of Allah. Even when it may seem that the disbelievers have a numerical advantage, Allah's support can lead to victory for those who are fighting in His cause. It serves as a reminder to believers that true insight and understanding come from recognizing the power and assistance of Allah in all matters, guiding their actions with faith and trust in Him.
orig: قد كان لكم آية في فئتين التقتا فئة تقاتل في سبيل الله وأخرى كافرة يرونهم مثليهم رأي العين والله يؤيد بنصره من يشاء إن في ذلك لعبرة لأولي الأبصار

translation: Beautiful for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of the worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights how humans are naturally inclined towards worldly desires like wealth, family, and possessions. While these are the pleasures of this temporary life on earth, the verse reminds believers that the ultimate and best reward lies with Allah in the Hereafter. It encourages believers to focus on spiritual growth and seeking proximity to Allah rather than being solely preoccupied with materialistic pursuits.
orig: زين للناس حب الشهوات من النساء والبنين والقناطير المقنطرة من الذهب والفضة والخيل المسومة والأنعام والحرث ذلك متاع الحياة الدنيا والله عنده حسن المآب

translation: Say, 'Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah.' And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of a greater reward in the hereafter for those who are mindful of God. It speaks of lush gardens, flowing rivers, eternal bliss, pure companionship, and the pleasure and approval of Allah. The verse serves as an encouragement for believers to maintain their piety and righteousness in order to attain the ultimate reward in the afterlife.
orig: قل أؤنبئكم بخير من ذلكم للذين اتقوا عند ربهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وأزواج مطهرة ورضوان من الله والله بصير بالعباد

translation: Those who say, 'Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and asking for protection from the punishment of Hell. It emphasizes the concept of faith and repentance as the believers humbly acknowledge their sins and seek Allah's mercy and guidance. It serves as a reminder for believers to constantly turn to Allah in repentance and seek His forgiveness to achieve spiritual growth and protection from the consequences of their sins.
orig: الذين يقولون ربنا إننا آمنا فاغفر لنا ذنوبنا وقنا عذاب النار

translation: The patient, the truthful, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.
interpretation: This verse describes the qualities of those who are righteous and sincere in their faith. They are patient in facing trials and tribulations, truthful in their words and actions, obedient to the commandments of Allah, generous in spending their wealth for righteousness, and seek forgiveness from Allah in the early hours of the morning. These qualities are essential for leading a pious and virtuous life according to the teachings of Islam.
orig: الصابرين والصادقين والقانتين والمنفقين والمستغفرين بالأسحار

translation: Allah bears witness that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and highlights His ultimate authority and wisdom. Allah, the angels, and those who possess knowledge all bear witness that there is no deity except Allah and that He governs the universe with justice. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's sovereignty, power, and wisdom in maintaining order and justice in the world.
orig: شهد الله أنه لا إله إلا هو والملائكة وأولو العلم قائما بالقسط لا إله إلا هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: Verily, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them out of jealous animosity among themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Islam is the true religion as decreed by Allah. It also highlights that previous communities who received divine scriptures deviated from the truth due to their own biases and disagreements. Those who reject the signs of Allah will be held accountable swiftly by Allah for their disbelief.
orig: إن الدين عند الله الإسلام وما اختلف الذين أوتوا الكتاب إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم ومن يكفر بآيات الله فإن الله سريع الحساب

translation: So if they argue with you, say, 'I have submitted myself to Allah and [so have] those who follow me.' And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, 'Have you submitted?' And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of submitting to Allah and following the guidance of the Quran. It instructs believers to invite others, including People of the Book and those who are unlearned, to submit to Islam. It also highlights that it is the responsibility of the believers to convey the message, but ultimately guidance comes from Allah alone, as He is the All-Seeing.
orig: فإن حاجوك فقل أسلمت وجهي لله ومن اتبعن وقل للذين أوتوا الكتاب والأميين أأسلمتم فإن أسلموا فقد اهتدوا وإن تولوا فإنما عليك البلاغ والله بصير بالعباد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice among the people - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns about severe consequences for those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah, kill prophets unjustly, and kill those who advocate for justice among the people. It serves as a reminder of the accountability people have towards their actions and the importance of upholding justice in society.
orig: إن الذين يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير حق ويقتلون الذين يأمرون بالقسط من الناس فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: Those are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who engage in actions that are not in accordance with the teachings of Islam will find their deeds in this world and the Hereafter to be of no benefit. Their actions will hold no value and they will be left without any supporters or helpers to aid them in their plight.
orig: أولئك الذين حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, calling to the Scripture of Allah that it should judge between them; then a party of them turns away, while they are refusing [to obey]?
