interpretation: This verse highlights the inconsistency and hypocrisy of some people who claim to follow the scripture from Allah but then turn away from its guidance when it does not align with their interests. It serves as a reminder to be sincere and consistent in following the teachings of Allah's scripture.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يدعون إلى كتاب الله ليحكم بينهم ثم يتولى فريق منهم وهم معرضون

translation: That is because they said, "The Fire will not touch us except for a few numbered days," and they were deluded in their religion by what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the false beliefs of some disbelievers who thought that they would only face punishment for a limited amount of time in the Hereafter. Their misguided understanding of religion led them to fabricate lies and deceive themselves into thinking they could escape the consequences of their actions.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودات وغرهم في دينهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: So how [will it be] when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgement when all people will be resurrected for recompense. On that day, every individual will receive full compensation for their deeds, whether good or bad, with perfect justice. The verse emphasizes the absolute fairness of Allah's judgement, ensuring that no one will be wronged in the least.
orig: فكيف إذا جمعناهم ليوم لا ريب فيه ووفيت كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say, 'O Allah, Possessor of sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate authority and power of Allah over all things. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate ruler and controls the sovereignty, honor, and status of all beings as He wills. It reminds believers of Allah's complete control and competence over all matters, conveying a sense of trust and submission to His divine will.
orig: قل اللهم مالك الملك تؤتي الملك من تشاء وتنزع الملك ممن تشاء وتعز من تشاء وتذل من تشاء بيدك الخير إنك على كل شيء قدير

translation: He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. And He gives provision to whom He wills without account.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and sovereignty of Allah over the universe. It emphasizes His ability to control time and life and death. Nothing is impossible for Him, and He can bring forth the living from the dead and vice versa. Additionally, the verse mentions that Allah provides sustenance to His creation without limit or calculation, showcasing His mercy and generosity.
orig: تولج الليل في النهار وتولج النهار في الليل وتخرج الحي من الميت وتخرج الميت من الحي وترزق من تشاء بغير حساب

translation: The believers should not take disbelievers as allies instead of believers. And whoever does that has no relationship with Allah except [when taking precaution against them] in prudence. And Allah warns you of Himself, and to Allah is the [final] destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of allegiance and loyalty among the believers, instructing them not to seek protection or alliance with disbelievers over fellow believers. The verse also acknowledges that there may be circumstances where precaution is needed when dealing with non-believers, as long as it does not compromise one's faith. Ultimately, it reminds the believers that their ultimate reliance and destination should be towards Allah alone.
orig: لا يتخذ المؤمنون الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين ومن يفعل ذلك فليس من الله في شيء إلا أن تتقوا منهم تقاة ويحذركم الله نفسه وإلى الله المصير

translation: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your hearts or reveal it, Allah knows it, and He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that nothing is hidden from Allah, as He knows all that is hidden in the hearts and is aware of everything in the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder that Allah's knowledge and power surpass all limitations, and believers should always be conscious of this fact in how they conduct themselves.
orig: قل إن تخفوا ما في صدوركم أو تبدوه يعلمه الله ويعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: On the Day when every soul will find presented whatever good it has done. And as for what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allah warns you of Himself, and Allah is Kind to [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an reminds believers of the Day of Judgment when every individual will witness the presentation of their deeds. Those who have performed good deeds will be pleased to see them, while those who have committed wrongdoings will deeply regret them and wish they were far separated from them. The verse emphasizes that Allah is compassionate towards His servants, warning them to be conscious of their actions and their consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: يوم تجد كل نفس ما عملت من خير محضرا وما عملت من سوء تود لو أن بينها وبينه أمدا بعيدا ويحذركم الله نفسه والله رءوف بالعباد

translation: Say, "If you love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a way to demonstrate our love for Allah. By following the Prophet's example, we draw closer to Allah, earn His love, and receive His forgiveness. It highlights the connection between loving Allah and obeying His commandments as shown through the Prophet's teachings.
orig: قل إن كنتم تحبون الله فاتبعوني يحببكم الله ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Say, 'Obey Allah and the Messenger.' But if they turn away, then indeed, Allah does not like the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying both Allah and His Messenger. It warns against turning away from their guidance as that is not pleasing to Allah. It highlights the significance of following the teachings of Islam and the consequences of disbelief.
orig: قل أطيعوا الله والرسول فإن تولوا فإن الله لا يحب الكافرين

translation: Certainly, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the special status that certain individuals and families hold in the eyes of Allah. It highlights how Allah has chosen Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of 'Imran above all the worlds, conveying the message that proximity to Allah is not based on worldly status, but rather on piety, righteousness, and devotion to Him.
orig: إن الله اصطفى آدم ونوحا وآل إبراهيم وآل عمران على العالمين

translation: Descendants, some of them from others. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the diversity and interconnected nature of human generations, as they are all descendants of one another. It highlights the omniscience and attentiveness of Allah, who is aware of every detail and connection among His creation.
orig: ذرية بعضها من بعض والله سميع عليم

translation: When the wife of Imran said, 'My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse from Surah Ali 'Imran (3:35) highlights the story of the mother of Maryam (Mary) making a vow to dedicate her unborn child to the service of Allah. This act of submission and devotion to Allah's will is a powerful example of faith and trust in Him. It demonstrates the importance of fulfilling promises made to Allah and the acceptance of one's destiny with gratitude and acknowledgment of Allah's attributes - His All-Hearing and All-Knowing nature.
orig: إذ قالت امرأت عمران رب إني نذرت لك ما في بطني محررا فتقبل مني إنك أنت السميع العليم

translation: So when she delivered her, she said, 'My Lord, I have delivered a female.' And Allah was most knowing of what she delivered, 'And the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah].'
interpretation: This verse describes the story of Mary's mother who, upon giving birth to Mary, acknowledges the uniqueness of a female child and seeks protection for her and her descendants from Satan's influence. The verse emphasizes the distinction between males and females, highlighting Mary's special status and the divine protection sought for her against evil forces. It reflects the belief in seeking refuge in Allah for protection against spiritual harm and guidance for righteousness.
orig: فلما وضعتها قالت رب إني وضعتها أنثى والله أعلم بما وضعت وليس الذكر كالأنثى وإني سميتها مريم وإني أعيذها بك وذريتها من الشيطان الرجيم

translation: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, 'O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?' She said, 'It is from Allah. Indeed, Allah provides for whom He wills without account.'
interpretation: This verse describes the acceptance and care of Mary by her Lord. It showcases Allah's blessing and provision for Mary through Zechariah and emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate provider, bestowing His gifts without limitation or measure. It highlights the concept of divine sustenance and how Allah provides for His creation according to His will.
orig: فتقبلها ربها بقبول حسن وأنبتها نباتا حسنا وكفلها زكريا كلما دخل عليها زكريا المحراب وجد عندها رزقا قال يا مريم أنى لك هذا قالت هو من عند الله إن الله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: There he called upon his Lord, saying, 'My Lord, grant me from You a good offspring. You are indeed the Hearer of supplication.'
interpretation: This verse describes Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) calling upon Allah to grant him righteous offspring. It signifies the importance of turning to Allah in prayer and seeking blessings from Him. The verse emphasizes the belief in Allah's ability to answer prayers and highlights Prophet Zakariya's faith in Allah's mercy and power.
orig: هنالك دعا زكريا ربه قال رب هب لي من لدنك ذرية طيبة إنك سميع الدعاء

translation: Then the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, 'Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when an angel announced to Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) about the birth of his son, John (peace be upon him). The angel describes John as a righteous and honorable person, confirming a word from Allah and destined to be a prophet. It highlights the importance of divine promises and the righteousness of prophets.
orig: فنادته الملائكة وهو قائم يصلي في المحراب أن الله يبشرك بيحيى مصدقا بكلمة من الله وسيدا وحصورا ونبيا من الصالحين

translation: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?" [The angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.'"
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) expressing his astonishment and disbelief at the news of having a son in his old age. The verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to create and bring about whatever He wills, even if it seems impossible or beyond human comprehension. It serves as a reminder of the limitless power of Allah and His ability to make the impossible possible.
orig: قال رب أنى يكون لي غلام وقد بلغني الكبر وامرأتي عاقر قال كذلك الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: He said, "My Lord, grant me a sign." [Allah] said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Zachariah (peace be upon him) where he asked for a sign from Allah. The sign given to him was to be unable to speak to people for three days except through gestures. The instruction to remember and glorify Allah frequently emphasizes the importance of remembrance and praise of the Lord, highlighting the significance of worship and devotion in strengthening one's faith.
orig: قال رب اجعل لي آية قال آيتك ألا تكلم الناس ثلاثة أيام إلا رمزا واذكر ربك كثيرا وسبح بالعشي والإبكار

translation: And [mention] when the angels said, 'O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the special status and honor given to Mary (Maryam in Arabic) by Allah. It signifies her purity, piety, and excellence among all the women of the worlds. Mary is revered as a symbol of devotion, faith, and humility in Islamic teachings.
orig: وإذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله اصطفاك وطهرك واصطفاك على نساء العالمين

translation: O Mary, submit to your Lord and prostrate and bow down with those who bow down.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is directing Mary, the mother of Jesus, to submit herself to the will of her Lord and to worship Him by engaging in prayer alongside other believers. It emphasizes the importance of humility, submission, and unity in worship, highlighting the equality of all individuals before God.
orig: يا مريم اقنتي لربك واسجدي واركعي مع الراكعين

translation: This is of the news of the unseen which We reveal unto you (O Muhammad). You were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be guardian of Mary, nor were you with them when they contended one with another.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the unseen ('ghayb') knowledge that is revealed to the Prophet Muhammad by Allah. It highlights that he was not physically present when the specific incidents occurred, such as when people debated who should be the guardian of Mary (mother of Jesus). This serves to affirm the divine origin of the Prophet's knowledge and to show that Allah has granted him insight into events that he did not witness.
orig: ذلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيه إليك وما كنت لديهم إذ يلقون أقلامهم أيهم يكفل مريم وما كنت لديهم إذ يختصمون

translation: When the angels said, 'O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].'
interpretation: This verse highlights the moment when the angels communicated to Mary about the birth of Jesus, the Christ, known as Isa ibn Maryam in Arabic. It emphasizes the special status of Jesus, both in this world and the hereafter, and how he will be among those close to Allah. It also signifies the divine blessing and honor that Mary received through this miraculous announcement.
orig: إذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله يبشرك بكلمة منه اسمه المسيح عيسى ابن مريم وجيها في الدنيا والآخرة ومن المقربين

translation: And [Jesus] will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miracle of Jesus speaking to people as an infant in the cradle, which is a sign of his special status and prophethood. It also highlights that Jesus will continue to spread the message of God even as he grows older and becomes a mature person. This verse also emphasizes Jesus' righteousness and piety, indicating his high status as a prophet and messenger of Allah.
orig: ويكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا ومن الصالحين

translation: She said, 'My Lord, how can I have a child when no man has touched me?' He said, 'Thus it will be; Allah creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the miraculous nature of Allah's power and capability to create as He wills. Mary, the mother of Jesus, questions how she can bear a child without any human intervention, to which the response highlights the divine authority of Allah, who simply commands creation into existence with the words 'Be,' and it happens. The verse signifies the limitless power of Allah over all things.
orig: قالت رب أنى يكون لي ولد ولم يمسسني بشر قال كذلك الله يخلق ما يشاء إذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And He will teach him the Book and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive knowledge and guidance that Allah provides to His chosen messengers. It signifies that Allah bestows upon His messengers not only the knowledge of the Qur'an but also the wisdom and teachings contained in earlier scriptures such as the Torah and the Gospel. This is a testament to the unity of the divine message sent to humanity through different prophets and scriptures.
orig: ويعلمه الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل

translation: And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord. I create for you from clay the likeness of a bird, then I breathe into it, and it becomes a bird by Allah's leave. And I heal the blind and the leper, and I bring the dead to life by Allah's leave. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Surely, in that is a sign for you if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miracles that Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) performed as a sign from Allah. It emphasizes his ability, granted by Allah, to create life from clay, heal the sick, and inform people of hidden knowledge. These miracles serve as evidence of his prophethood and a reminder to the believers to have faith in Allah's power.
orig: ورسولا إلى بني إسرائيل أني قد جئتكم بآية من ربكم أني أخلق لكم من الطين كهيئة الطير فأنفخ فيه فيكون طيرا بإذن الله وأبرئ الأكمه والأبرص وأحيي الموتى بإذن الله وأنبئكم بما تأكلون وما تدخرون في بيوتكم إن في ذلك لآية لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: and confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in confirming the previous scriptures, making permissible certain things that were previously prohibited, and bringing a miraculous sign from Allah. It emphasizes the importance of piety, fear of Allah, and obedience to the Prophet as essential aspects of faith and guidance.
orig: ومصدقا لما بين يدي من التوراة ولأحل لكم بعض الذي حرم عليكم وجئتكم بآية من ربكم فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the Lord of all beings and the importance of worshipping Him alone. It also highlights that following this guidance is the straight path that leads to righteousness and salvation in the sight of Allah.
orig: إن الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: When Jesus felt disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allah?" The disciples said," We are supporters for Allah. We have believed in Allah and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
interpretation: This verse describes a moment when Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) asked for supporters who were truly devoted to Allah. His disciples, known as the Hawariyyun, testified their belief in God and their commitment to submitting to Him. This highlights the importance of unwavering faith and dedication to Allah, emphasizing the concept of being a true supporter of God's cause.
orig: فلما أحس عيسى منهم الكفر قال من أنصاري إلى الله قال الحواريون نحن أنصار الله آمنا بالله واشهد بأنا مسلمون

translation: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger, so register us among the witnesses.
interpretation: This verse expresses the believers' plea to Allah to include them among those who bear witness to their faith and obedience to the teachings of the Prophet. It reflects the believers' desire to have their faith and actions recognized and recorded by Allah as a testimony to their commitment and sincerity.
orig: ربنا آمنا بما أنزلت واتبعنا الرسول فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And they planned, but Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah, emphasizing that no matter how much people may scheme and plot, ultimately, it is Allah's plan that will prevail. It serves as a reminder to believers to trust in Allah's ultimate wisdom and to have faith that His plans are always for the best.
orig: ومكروا ومكر الله والله خير الماكرين

translation: When Allah said, 'O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to Allah alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the special status of Jesus (peace be upon him) in Islam, as it indicates that he was not crucified but was instead raised up by Allah. It emphasizes that those who follow Jesus in the true monotheistic belief will be rewarded in the Hereafter, and that ultimately, all individuals will return to Allah for judgment. It underscores the idea of the ultimate justice and reconciliation that will take place on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى إني متوفيك ورافعك إلي ومطهرك من الذين كفروا وجاعل الذين اتبعوك فوق الذين كفروا إلى يوم القيامة ثم إلي مرجعكم فأحكم بينكم فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: As for those who disbelieve, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who choose to disbelieve in God. It conveys that those who reject faith will face a severe punishment not only in the life after death but also in this worldly life. It emphasizes the lack of supporters or helpers for those who reject the truth and deny the existence of God.
orig: فأما الذين كفروا فأعذبهم عذابا شديدا في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: But as for those who believe and do righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of justice and reward in Islam. It emphasizes that those who have faith in Allah and engage in good deeds will be rewarded by Him. It also warns against wrongdoing, indicating that Allah does not favor or support those who act unjustly or oppressively.
orig: وأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيوفيهم أجورهم والله لا يحب الظالمين

translation: We recite to you from the verses and the wise message.
interpretation: This verse highlights the aspect of divine guidance through the recitation of verses and wise messages. It emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the signs and wisdom contained in the Qur'an as a source of enlightenment and guidance for humanity.
orig: ذلك نتلوه عليك من الآيات والذكر الحكيم

translation: Indeed, the example of Jesus in the sight of Allah is like that of Adam. He created him from dust, then said to him, 'Be,' and he was.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and ability of Allah to create. It draws a parallel between the creation of Jesus and Adam, emphasizing that Allah, with His absolute power, can create beings in different ways as He wills. Just as Allah created Adam from dust and Jesus with a command 'Be,' it signifies the absolute sovereignty and omnipotence of Allah over all creation.
orig: إن مثل عيسى عند الله كمثل آدم خلقه من تراب ثم قال له كن فيكون

translation: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing the truth that comes from Allah, and it warns against doubt and uncertainty. Believers are encouraged to have faith in the truth revealed by Allah and to avoid being swayed by doubts or skepticism.
orig: الحق من ربك فلا تكن من الممترين

translation: So whoever disputes with you concerning him after [all] knowledge has come to you, say, 'Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes a method of resolving disputes through a form of challenge. It suggests that if someone persists in arguing or disbelieving after receiving clear knowledge or evidence, a final attempt at reaching the truth can be made by calling upon both parties to pray and call upon Allah's curse upon the one who lies. This is a way to seek divine intervention and guidance in discerning the truth from falsehood in a situation of dispute.
orig: فمن حاجك فيه من بعد ما جاءك من العلم فقل تعالوا ندع أبناءنا وأبناءكم ونساءنا ونساءكم وأنفسنا وأنفسكم ثم نبتهل فنجعل لعنت الله على الكاذبين

translation: Certainly, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except Allah. And indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the oneness of Allah and that He is the ultimate authority and source of wisdom and power. It reaffirms the truth of the stories and teachings in the Qur'an and highlights the attributes of Allah as the Almighty and the Wise.
orig: إن هذا لهو القصص الحق وما من إله إلا الله وإن الله لهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: So if they turn away, then indeed, Allah is Knowing of the corrupters.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah is aware and knowledgeable about those who cause corruption and mischief in the world. It serves as a warning to those who choose to turn away from the teachings of Islam and engage in wrongful and harmful actions, as they will ultimately be held accountable for their deeds by the All-Knowing Allah.
orig: فإن تولوا فإن الله عليم بالمفسدين

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the call for unity among the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) to acknowledge and worship the one true God, Allah, without associating partners with Him. It highlights the importance of monotheism and the rejection of polytheism. It conveys a message of respect, equity, and peaceful coexistence while asserting the principles of Islam. It also signifies the concept of submission to the will of Allah and invites others to embrace Islam despite any differences that may exist.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب تعالوا إلى كلمة سواء بيننا وبينكم ألا نعبد إلا الله ولا نشرك به شيئا ولا يتخذ بعضنا بعضا أربابا من دون الله فإن تولوا فقولوا اشهدوا بأنا مسلمون

translation: O People of the Book, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is questioning the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) about their debates regarding Prophet Abraham, even though the Torah and the Gospel were revealed after his time. It is calling on them to use their intellect and reasoning to understand that their arguments about Abraham are baseless, as the true message of the Torah and the Gospel came later.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تحاجون في إبراهيم وما أنزلت التوراة والإنجيل إلا من بعده أفلا تعقلون

translation: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows, while you know not.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not arguing about matters where we lack knowledge. It highlights the futility of debating over things we have no understanding of. It reminds believers that Allah is the All-Knowing, and it is essential to acknowledge our limited knowledge and understanding.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء حاججتم فيما لكم به علم فلم تحاجون فيما ليس لكم به علم والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a true Muslim, a Hanif. He was not of the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse highlights the monotheistic nature of the faith of Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him) who worshiped one God without associating any partners with Him. It stresses that true faith is not about labels or affiliations, but about the purity of belief and submission to the will of God. It emphasizes that Islam, submission to the will of God, is the essence of the faith of all the prophets, including Prophet Abraham, and that polytheism has no place in the monotheistic faith.
orig: ما كان إبراهيم يهوديا ولا نصرانيا ولكن كان حنيفا مسلما وما كان من المشركين

translation: Verily, the most rightful claimant to Ibrahim among the people are those who followed him, and this Prophet, and the believers. And Allah is the guardian of the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special position of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) among the people, emphasizing that those who truly follow his guidance, along with the believers and the Prophet Muhammad, are the closest to him. It underscores the importance of faith and righteous deeds in establishing a connection with the Prophets and Allah, who safeguards the believers and their interests.
orig: إن أولى الناس بإبراهيم للذين اتبعوه وهذا النبي والذين آمنوا والله ولي المؤمنين

translation: A faction of the People of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive it not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reality that some individuals, even from the People of the Scripture, may have ill intentions and wish to lead others astray. However, their efforts will ultimately only harm themselves, and they are oblivious to this consequence.
orig: ودت طائفة من أهل الكتاب لو يضلونكم وما يضلون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while you witness [to their truth]?
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and questions them about their disbelief in the signs and verses of Allah, especially when they are familiar with and bear witness to the truth of these signs. It highlights the importance of recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah and warns against denying them despite knowing their truth.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله وأنتم تشهدون

translation: O People of the Book, why do you mix truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know?
interpretation: This verse is directing a question to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians), asking them why they distort the truth by mixing it with falsehood and hide the truth even though they are aware of it. It serves as a reminder to always uphold truthfulness and integrity in one's actions and beliefs.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تلبسون الحق بالباطل وتكتمون الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And a faction of the people of the Scripture say [to each other], "Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will abandon [their religion]."
interpretation: This verse refers to a group among the People of the Book who adopt a deceptive approach of pretending to believe in the morning and rejecting it by the evening, in order to mislead the believers. It warns against hypocrisy and insincerity in matters of faith, emphasizing the importance of consistency and integrity in one's beliefs.
orig: وقالت طائفة من أهل الكتاب آمنوا بالذي أنزل على الذين آمنوا وجه النهار واكفروا آخره لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And do not believe except for those who follow your religion.' Say, 'Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allah. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?' Say, 'Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Wise.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance comes from Allah and that people should not restrict their belief only to those who follow their own religion. It also highlights the fact that all blessings and favors come from Allah alone, and He bestows them upon whomever He wills. The verse encourages openness to receiving knowledge and wisdom from different sources, as Allah's wisdom and knowledge are all-encompassing.
orig: ولا تؤمنوا إلا لمن تبع دينكم قل إن الهدى هدى الله أن يؤتى أحد مثل ما أوتيتم أو يحاجوكم عند ربكم قل إن الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: He grants His mercy to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights that it is Allah who bestows His mercy upon whomever He chooses. It emphasizes His unlimited grace and favor, as He is the One with immense and abundant generosity.
orig: يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a dinar, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, 'There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned.' And they speak untruth about Allah while they know [it].
interpretation: This verse is warning the People of the Scripture, referring to Jews and Christians, about their dishonest behavior in financial matters. It illustrates that some among them are trustworthy and will return entrusted wealth, regardless of the amount, while others will only honor their commitment if monitored closely. The reason for this dishonest behavior is their arrogance, as they believe they are superior and not accountable to non-believers. This behavior is hypocritical and deceitful, as they knowingly lie and deceive even though they have knowledge of the truth.
orig: ومن أهل الكتاب من إن تأمنه بقنطار يؤده إليك ومنهم من إن تأمنه بدينار لا يؤده إليك إلا ما دمت عليه قائما ذلك بأنهم قالوا ليس علينا في الأميين سبيل ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: Certainly, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears Allah - indeed, Allah loves those who are mindful of Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling promises and obligations, and being conscious and fearful of God. Those who fulfill their promises and are aware of God's presence are loved and favored by Him.
orig: بلى من أوفى بعهده واتقى فإن الله يحب المتقين

translation: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of breaking promises and betraying the trust of Allah. Those who are willing to compromise their faith and integrity for worldly gains will face severe consequences in the Hereafter. They will be deprived of Allah's mercy and forgiveness, and they will be excluded from His presence on the Day of Judgment. Such individuals will face a distressing punishment as a result of their actions.
orig: إن الذين يشترون بعهد الله وأيمانهم ثمنا قليلا أولئك لا خلاق لهم في الآخرة ولا يكلمهم الله ولا ينظر إليهم يوم القيامة ولا يزكيهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And indeed, among them is a group who twist their tongues with the Book so you may think it is from the Book, but it is not from the Book. And they say, "This is from Allah," but it is not from Allah. And they speak untruth about Allah while they know.
interpretation: This verse warns about certain people who manipulate or distort the scriptures in a way that misguides others. They falsely attribute their own words or concocted beliefs to the divine scripture, claiming it to be from Allah when it is not. They deceive others through lies about Allah even though they are aware of the sinfulness and falsehood of their claims.
orig: وإن منهم لفريقا يلوون ألسنتهم بالكتاب لتحسبوه من الكتاب وما هو من الكتاب ويقولون هو من عند الله وما هو من عند الله ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: It is not [befitting] for a human [prophet] that Allah should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, 'Be servants to me rather than Allah,' but [instead, he would say], 'Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is not appropriate for a Prophet to ask people to worship him instead of Allah. Rather, they should encourage people to be devoted servants of Allah and to acquire knowledge and understanding of the scriptures. Prophets are meant to guide people to be God-conscious and learned individuals.
orig: ما كان لبشر أن يؤتيه الله الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ثم يقول للناس كونوا عبادا لي من دون الله ولكن كونوا ربانيين بما كنتم تعلمون الكتاب وبما كنتم تدرسون

translation: And He does not command you to take the angels and the prophets as lords. Would He order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that Allah does not command them to worship angels or prophets as divine beings. It questions whether it would make any sense for Allah to command disbelief after they have already submitted to Him as Muslims. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining the pure monotheistic faith and not deviating into associating partners with Allah.
orig: ولا يأمركم أن تتخذوا الملائكة والنبيين أربابا أيأمركم بالكفر بعد إذ أنتم مسلمون

translation: And [mention] when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], 'Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a Messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him.' [Allah] said, 'Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?' They said, 'We have acknowledged it.' He said, 'Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the covenant and commitment made by the prophets to Allah. They were given the Scriptures and wisdom, and when a Messenger comes confirming what they already have, they are required to believe in him and support him. The importance of acknowledging and upholding this commitment is emphasized, and it calls for testifying to the truth and bearing witness to the unity of the Message. This verse signifies the unity of the messages brought by all the prophets in different times and places.
orig: وإذ أخذ الله ميثاق النبيين لما آتيتكم من كتاب وحكمة ثم جاءكم رسول مصدق لما معكم لتؤمنن به ولتنصرنه قال أأقررتم وأخذتم على ذلكم إصري قالوا أقررنا قال فاشهدوا وأنا معكم من الشاهدين

translation: So whoever turns away after this, then they are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse warns that those who turn away from the guidance of Allah after receiving it are considered disobedient and rebellious. It emphasizes the importance of following the teachings of Islam and staying on the right path.
orig: فمن تولى بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Do they seek other than the religion of Allah, while to Him submitted all creatures in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be returned?
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate submission of all creatures in the heavens and the earth to the religion of Allah, whether they do so willingly or unwillingly. It underscores the fact that all will ultimately return to Allah, emphasizing the ultimate authority and power of Allah over all creation.
orig: أفغير دين الله يبغون وله أسلم من في السماوات والأرض طوعا وكرها وإليه يرجعون

translation: Say, "We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants, and what was given to Moses and Jesus and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the oneness of Allah and the unity of the message received by various prophets throughout history. It teaches that Muslims should have faith in all the prophets mentioned, as they all came with the same core message of monotheism and submission to Allah. The verse highlights the importance of recognizing the interconnectedness and unity of the messages brought by the prophets, and stresses the principle of equality and respect for all prophets without making distinctions among them.
orig: قل آمنا بالله وما أنزل علينا وما أنزل على إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وما أوتي موسى وعيسى والنبيون من ربهم لا نفرق بين أحد منهم ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And whoever seeks a religion other than Islam, it will never be accepted of him, and in the Hereafter, he will be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exclusive acceptance of Islam as the true religion by God. It serves as a reminder that adherence to Islam is key to success in the Hereafter, and those who turn away from it will face loss and rejection.
orig: ومن يبتغ غير الإسلام دينا فلن يقبل منه وهو في الآخرة من الخاسرين

translation: How can Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear proofs had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that guidance from Allah is not bestowed upon those who deliberately reject faith after having once believed, especially when they have received clear evidence and signs. It emphasizes the importance of consistently upholding faith and righteousness, and warns against the consequences of straying from the path of belief and committing wrongdoing.
orig: كيف يهدي الله قوما كفروا بعد إيمانهم وشهدوا أن الرسول حق وجاءهم البينات والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those will have the curse of Allah and the angels and the people altogether.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe consequences for those who earn the wrath of Allah and His angels and the society as a whole. It serves as a warning to those who engage in activities that invite divine displeasure and social disapproval, reminding them of the repercussions of their actions.
orig: أولئك جزاؤهم أن عليهم لعنة الله والملائكة والناس أجمعين

translation: They will abide therein; [their punishment will not be lightened], and they will not be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse describes the eternal punishment that those who disbelieve and commit sins will face in the Hereafter. It emphasizes that their punishment will not be lessened, and they will not be granted any respite or relief from it. This serves as a warning to remind believers to stay on the right path and avoid committing sins that would lead to such a severe outcome.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينظرون

translation: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the merciful and forgiving nature of Allah towards those who sincerely repent for their wrongdoings and make amends for their mistakes. It serves as a reminder that no matter how grave the sin, as long as one sincerely repents and strives to rectify their actions, Allah is always ready to forgive and show mercy.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who have disbelieved after their belief and then increase in disbelief, their repentance will never be accepted, and they are the ones astray.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of persisting in disbelief after having once believed, stating that such individuals will not be forgiven even if they choose to repent later. It highlights the importance of steadfastness and warns against the dangers of increasing in disbelief after already being aware of the truth.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بعد إيمانهم ثم ازدادوا كفرا لن تقبل توبتهم وأولئك هم الضالون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - never would the ransom of the earth filled with gold be accepted from one of them if he would seek to ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no amount of material wealth or possessions can save a disbeliever from the consequences of their disbelief. It highlights the severity of the punishment for persistent disbelief, and conveys the idea that true belief and repentance can not be bought or bargained for. The verse serves as a warning against the futility of relying on worldly possessions to escape the consequences of one's actions in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وماتوا وهم كفار فلن يقبل من أحدهم ملء الأرض ذهبا ولو افتدى به أولئك لهم عذاب أليم وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: You will never attain righteousness until you spend from that which you love. And whatever you spend, indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of giving in charity for the sake of pleasing Allah. It indicates that true righteousness is not achieved simply by giving away things that are of little value to us, but rather by sacrificing and giving from the things that we love and value dearly. This act of giving from what is beloved reflects a deep sincerity in seeking the pleasure of Allah, and it is this selfless and sincere act of giving that is considered truly righteous in the sight of Allah.
orig: لن تنالوا البر حتى تنفقوا مما تحبون وما تنفقوا من شيء فإن الله به عليم

translation: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be truthful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of dietary restrictions and permissions within the Children of Israel before the revelation of the Torah. It points out that the Israelites had imposed certain restrictions on themselves regarding food consumption prior to the revelation of the Torah. The verse challenges those who claim knowledge and truthfulness to bring forth the Torah and recite it if they are truly being honest about their claims.
orig: كل الطعام كان حلا لبني إسرائيل إلا ما حرم إسرائيل على نفسه من قبل أن تنزل التوراة قل فأتوا بالتوراة فاتلوها إن كنتم صادقين

translation: So whoever invents a lie about Allah after that - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against falsely attributing lies to Allah after knowing the truth. It is a reminder that deliberately spreading falsehoods about Allah is a grave injustice and those who do so are considered unjust and sinful.
orig: فمن افترى على الله الكذب من بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, 'Allah has spoken the truth, so follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not among the polytheists.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the monotheistic religion of Abraham, who was a devout worshipper of Allah and did not associate partners with Him. It encourages Muslims to adhere to the true faith and avoid polytheism.
orig: قل صدق الله فاتبعوا ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Bakkah, blessed and a guidance for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance and sanctity of the Kaaba in Mecca, stating that it was the first house of worship established for humanity. It is described as blessed and serving as a guidance for all the worlds, emphasizing the importance of the Kaaba as a focal point for Muslims around the globe.
orig: إن أول بيت وضع للناس للذي ببكة مباركا وهدى للعالمين

translation: There are clear signs in it, including the standing place of Abraham. Whoever enters it shall be safe. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty owed to Allah by people who are able to undertake it. And whoever disbelieves — then Allah is Self-Sufficient, beyond need of any being.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the sacred place associated with Prophet Abraham within the vicinity of Kaaba. It emphasizes the sanctity and safety of the pilgrimage to the House of Allah, which is a mandatory act for those who have the means to perform it. The verse also underscores that Allah is not in need of anyone's worship or belief, as He is self-sufficient and transcends the needs of all beings.
orig: فيه آيات بينات مقام إبراهيم ومن دخله كان آمنا ولله على الناس حج البيت من استطاع إليه سبيلا ومن كفر فإن الله غني عن العالمين

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while Allah is witness over what you do?"
interpretation: This verse is calling on the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) to reflect on their rejection of the signs and verses of Allah. It reminds them that Allah is fully aware and is a witness to everything they do, including their disbelief. It serves as a warning for them to reconsider their actions and beliefs in light of the clear signs presented by Allah.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله والله شهيد على ما تعملون

translation: Say, 'O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of Allah those who believe, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the truth]? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) questioning their actions of preventing people who believe in Allah from following His path correctly. It highlights the hypocrisy of misleading others while claiming to be witnesses to the truth. The verse serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of their deeds, and they cannot deceive Him by their actions.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تصدون عن سبيل الله من آمن تبغونها عوجا وأنتم شهداء وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unbelievers.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against blindly following a group from among the People of the Book, as they may try to mislead or influence the believers. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining faith and not allowing others to lead one away from their beliefs.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تطيعوا فريقا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب يردوكم بعد إيمانكم كافرين

translation: And how can you disbelieve while to you are recited the verses of Allah and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allah has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the disbelief of those who reject the message of Allah despite having the Quran recited to them and having the Messenger of Allah among them. It highlights that holding firmly to Allah and seeking refuge in Him is the way to guidance on the straight path.
orig: وكيف تكفرون وأنتم تتلى عليكم آيات الله وفيكم رسوله ومن يعتصم بالله فقد هدي إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to maintain a conscious awareness and fear of Allah, and to ensure that their actions are in alignment with His commandments throughout their lives. It emphasizes the importance of constantly seeking to improve one's submission and devotion to Allah, so that when death comes, they are in a state of submission to Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله حق تقاته ولا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون

translation: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity among believers and cautions against division. It highlights how Allah's blessing can bring people who were once enemies together as brothers. The verse also serves as a reminder of the mercy of Allah in saving them from the brink of destruction. Ultimately, the verse invites believers to reflect on Allah's signs and guidance to maintain unity and gratitude.
orig: واعتصموا بحبل الله جميعا ولا تفرقوا واذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ كنتم أعداء فألف بين قلوبكم فأصبحتم بنعمته إخوانا وكنتم على شفا حفرة من النار فأنقذكم منها كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of promoting good deeds, encouraging righteousness, and discouraging evil. It highlights the role of believers in actively working towards establishing a community that upholds moral values and justice. Success is promised to those who fulfill these responsibilities with diligence and sincerity.
orig: ولتكن منكم أمة يدعون إلى الخير ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And do not be like those who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse admonishes believers against division and discord after receiving clear guidance and signs from Allah. It warns against falling into disputes and fragmentation, emphasizing the importance of unity among believers. Those who engage in such behavior are warned of a severe punishment awaiting them.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين تفرقوا واختلفوا من بعد ما جاءهم البينات وأولئك لهم عذاب عظيم

translation: On the Day when some faces will turn white and some faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], 'Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject.'
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment where people's deeds are manifested through the color of their faces. Those whose faces turn black symbolize the disbelievers who rejected faith after believing. They will face the consequences of their actions and disbelief. It serves as a warning to stay steadfast in faith and avoid disbelief to avoid the punishment.
orig: يوم تبيض وجوه وتسود وجوه فأما الذين اسودت وجوههم أكفرتم بعد إيمانكم فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: As for those whose faces have turned white, they [will be] in the mercy of Allah; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who will enter Paradise, where their faces will shine bright with happiness and joy. They will be enveloped in the endless mercy of Allah and will live there forever in eternal bliss.
orig: وأما الذين ابيضت وجوههم ففي رحمة الله هم فيها خالدون

translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. And Allah wants no injustice to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and asserts that its recitation is based on truth. It also highlights that Allah does not intend any form of injustice towards all of mankind. Therefore, the Qur'an is a source of guidance and justice, not oppression or wrongdoing.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق وما الله يريد ظلما للعالمين

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and to Allah all matters are returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of absolute ownership by Allah over everything in the heavens and the earth. It also highlights the belief in the ultimate return to Allah for all affairs and decisions. It serves as a reminder of the eternal power and authority of Allah over everything.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing up for righteousness and justice, enjoining good and forbidding evil, and believing in Allah. It also highlights that faith is not limited to a particular group; rather, it is based on one's actions and beliefs. The verse urges the People of the Scripture to embrace faith and righteousness, suggesting that it would lead to their betterment. However, it acknowledges that many among them choose disobedience over faith.
orig: كنتم خير أمة أخرجت للناس تأمرون بالمعروف وتنهون عن المنكر وتؤمنون بالله ولو آمن أهل الكتاب لكان خيرا لهم منهم المؤمنون وأكثرهم الفاسقون

translation: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs; then they will not be aided.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that the harm inflicted by disbelievers is temporary and limited, and even in the face of conflict, the enemies will eventually retreat and not receive any support or victory. It emphasizes the idea that ultimately, victory and support will come from Allah, and believers should remain steadfast and patient in facing challenges.
orig: لن يضروكم إلا أذى وإن يقاتلوكم يولوكم الأدبار ثم لا ينصرون

translation: Shame has been stamped upon them wherever they are found, except under a covenant from God and a covenant from the people. They incurred the wrath of God and were stamped with misery, because they persistently denied God's revelations and wrongfully killed the prophets. All this resulted from their disobedience and their persistent transgression.
interpretation: This verse talks about the consequences faced by those who persist in denying God's signs, killing the prophets, and transgressing boundaries. It highlights how shame and misery follow those who reject the truth and disobey God's commands. The verse serves as a warning against disbelief, disobedience, and injustice.
orig: ضربت عليهم الذلة أين ما ثقفوا إلا بحبل من الله وحبل من الناس وباءوا بغضب من الله وضربت عليهم المسكنة ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون الأنبياء بغير حق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: They are not all the same; among the People of the Book is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of Allah during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity among the People of the Book, emphasizing that not all of them are alike. It praises those among them who stand in devotion during the night, recite the verses of Allah, and prostrate in prayer, underscoring the importance of spiritual practice and dedication to worship regardless of one's background.
orig: ليسوا سواء من أهل الكتاب أمة قائمة يتلون آيات الله آناء الليل وهم يسجدون

translation: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and they hasten to good deeds. And those are among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse describes the characteristics of the righteous believers. They have faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment, they promote good deeds and discourage evil actions, and they are eager to engage in acts of kindness and charity. These qualities are what distinguish the righteous individuals who are on the path of goodness and virtue.
orig: يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويسارعون في الخيرات وأولئك من الصالحين

translation: And whatever good they do - never will it be denied them. And Allah is Knowing of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that any good deed they do will never be wasted or unrecognized by Allah. Even the smallest act of goodness will be acknowledged and rewarded by Him. It serves as a reminder that all actions, no matter how insignificant they may seem, are known to Allah, especially when done with sincerity and righteousness.
orig: وما يفعلوا من خير فلن يكفروه والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - their wealth and their children will not avail them at all against Allah, and it is they who are fuel for the Fire.
interpretation: This verse highlights that material possessions and offspring will not offer any form of protection or benefit to those who reject faith in Allah. It emphasizes that the ultimate consequence for those who disbelieve will be the punishment of Hellfire, where they will remain for eternity. In essence, faith in Allah and righteous actions are what truly matter and lead to ultimate success, while worldly attachments will not save one from the consequences of disbelief.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا وأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: The example of [this] expenditure in the worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the crops of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys them. And Allah has not wronged them, but they wronged themselves.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the concept of cause and effect, illustrating that the consequences of one's actions in this worldly life are directly related to their deeds. Just like a destructive wind that ruins the crops of unjust people, the negative outcomes individuals face are often a result of their own wrongdoing. It emphasizes personal responsibility and accountability for one's actions, indicating that Allah's justice is based on fairness and that individuals reap what they sow.
orig: مثل ما ينفقون في هذه الحياة الدنيا كمثل ريح فيها صر أصابت حرث قوم ظلموا أنفسهم فأهلكته وما ظلمهم الله ولكن أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you use reason.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to be cautious in choosing their closest companions and allies, urging them not to trust those who are not of their faith and community, for they may not have their best interests at heart. The verse warns that outward hostility is a sign of concealed animosity, highlighting the importance of being mindful of the intentions and attitudes of others. It also emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the signs and teachings provided, and to use reason and wisdom in social interactions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا بطانة من دونكم لا يألونكم خبالا ودوا ما عنتم قد بدت البغضاء من أفواههم وما تخفي صدورهم أكبر قد بينا لكم الآيات إن كنتم تعقلون

translation: Behold, you are the ones who love them while they do not love you, although you believe in the whole of the Scripture. And when they meet you, they say, 'We believe.' But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, 'Die in your rage.' Indeed, Allah knows the secrets of the hearts.
interpretation: This verse describes the hypocrites who pretend to be believers in front of the Muslims but harbor hatred and animosity towards them in their hearts. Allah exposes their true nature and advises the believers to not be deceived by their deceitful actions and words. The verse serves as a reminder to be sincere in faith and actions, as Allah knows the true intentions and feelings hidden in the hearts.
orig: ها أنتم أولاء تحبونهم ولا يحبونكم وتؤمنون بالكتاب كله وإذا لقوكم قالوا آمنا وإذا خلوا عضوا عليكم الأنامل من الغيظ قل موتوا بغيظكم إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: If a good befalls you, it grieves them, but if some evil overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if you remain patient and become God-conscious, their guile will do you no harm at all. Surely God encompasses all that they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reality that some people may become envious of the good fortune of others and take pleasure in their misfortune. However, the believers are encouraged to remain patient and mindful of God, for in doing so, they will be protected from the harm caused by the deceitful actions of such individuals. It emphasizes the importance of resilience, faith, and trust in God's protection in times of difficulty and adversity.
orig: إن تمسسكم حسنة تسؤهم وإن تصبكم سيئة يفرحوا بها وإن تصبروا وتتقوا لا يضركم كيدهم شيئا إن الله بما يعملون محيط

translation: And [remember] when you set out early from your family to post the believers at their station for the battle, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific incident in the Battle of Uhud where the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was setting up the positions of the believers in preparation for battle. The verse highlights the importance of strategic planning and proper positioning in warfare, reminding believers that Allah is aware of their actions and intentions. It serves as a lesson in the significance of careful preparation and placing trust in Allah's knowledge and wisdom.
orig: وإذ غدوت من أهلك تبوئ المؤمنين مقاعد للقتال والله سميع عليم

translation: When two groups among you were about to lose heart, but God was their protector. And in God should the believers place their trust.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that even in moments of difficulty and when facing challenges, they should place their trust in God. It emphasizes that God is the ultimate protector and source of strength, and that believers should remain steadfast in their faith, even when facing adversities.
orig: إذ همت طائفتان منكم أن تفشلا والله وليهما وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And Allah had certainly helped you at Badr when you were weak. So fear Allah that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers of the help and support they received from Allah during times of weakness and difficulty. It emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and being grateful to Him for His blessings and assistance, even in times of victory and success. The lesson is to remain humble, thankful, and conscious of Allah's presence in all situations.
orig: ولقد نصركم الله ببدر وأنتم أذلة فاتقوا الله لعلكم تشكرون

translation: When you said to the believers, 'Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine support and reinforcement for the believers. It emphasizes that the believers should find contentment and strength in the fact that Allah can send down thousands of angels to support them. It serves as a reminder of the unseen aid and protection that Allah provides to His faithful followers.
orig: إذ تقول للمؤمنين ألن يكفيكم أن يمدكم ربكم بثلاثة آلاف من الملائكة منزلين

translation: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allah and the enemy should come upon you [attacking] in rage, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction].
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that if they maintain patience and piety while facing adversity, Allah will provide them with divine help and protection. The mention of the five thousand angels with distinguishing marks serves as a reminder of the unseen support that Allah can provide to those who are steadfast in their faith.
orig: بلى إن تصبروا وتتقوا ويأتوكم من فورهم هذا يمددكم ربكم بخمسة آلاف من الملائكة مسومين

translation: And Allah made it not except as good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that any victory or success comes only from Allah, the Almighty and the Wise. It serves as a reminder to put our trust and reliance on Allah alone, as He is the ultimate source of all goodness and strength.
orig: وما جعله الله إلا بشرى لكم ولتطمئن قلوبكم به وما النصر إلا من عند الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: So that He may cut off a part of those who disbelieve, or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed
interpretation: This verse highlights that one of the reasons for the trials and difficulties faced by the disbelievers is to ultimately prevent their harmful actions or to humble them so that they realize their errors and turn back from their disbelief, feeling regretful and defeated.
orig: ليقطع طرفا من الذين كفروا أو يكبتهم فينقلبوا خائبين

translation: You have no authority over them, [O Muhammad], nor will You punish them; [but] they are wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he does not have the power to control people's hearts or force them to believe. It also serves as a warning to those who oppose the message of Islam, indicating that while the Prophet does not have the authority to punish them, their injustice and wrongdoing will have consequences in the sight of Allah.
orig: ليس لك من الأمر شيء أو يتوب عليهم أو يعذبهم فإنهم ظالمون

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute authority and sovereignty of Allah over all creation. It highlights that Allah has the power to forgive and show mercy to whomsoever He wills, and also to punish those whom He deems deserving of it. It serves as a reminder of the mercy and forgiveness that Allah extends to His creation, while also emphasizing His divine justice and wisdom in dealing with His servants.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allah that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an prohibits the consumption of usury, which is an unjust practice of gaining wealth through interest. Muslims are advised to fear Allah and avoid such unethical ways of acquiring money. By following these guidelines, believers may achieve success and prosperity in this life and the hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تأكلوا الربا أضعافا مضاعفة واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And fear the Fire prepared for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning and reminder to avoid the punishment of Hellfire that has been prepared for those who reject faith. It emphasizes the importance of fearing the consequences of disbelief and encourages people to adhere to the teachings of Islam to avoid such a fate.
orig: واتقوا النار التي أعدت للكافرين

translation: And obey Allah and the Messenger that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying both Allah and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in order to attain mercy from Allah. By following the guidance and instructions provided by Allah and His Messenger, one can hope to receive divine mercy and blessings in their lives.
orig: وأطيعوا الله والرسول لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and striving to do righteous deeds. It describes the reward for the righteous as a vast and beautiful garden, symbolizing paradise, which has been prepared for those who are mindful of Allah and lead a righteous life.
orig: وسارعوا إلى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها السماوات والأرض أعدت للمتقين

translation: Those who spend [in Allah's Cause] in prosperity and in adversity, who repress anger, and who pardon people. And Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the virtues of generosity, patience, forgiveness, and kindness. It encourages believers to engage in acts of charity, remain patient in times of ease and hardship, control their anger, and forgive others. By doing so, they demonstrate their faith and earn the love and pleasure of Allah.
orig: الذين ينفقون في السراء والضراء والكاظمين الغيظ والعافين عن الناس والله يحب المحسنين

translation: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression], remember Allah and seek forgiveness for their sins - and who can forgive sins except Allah? - and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah for any wrongdoing or sins committed. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate forgiver of sins, and encourages believers to repent sincerely without persisting in sinful behavior. It teaches believers to acknowledge their mistakes, remember Allah in difficult moments, seek forgiveness, and strive to avoid repeating their sins while being conscious of their actions.
orig: والذين إذا فعلوا فاحشة أو ظلموا أنفسهم ذكروا الله فاستغفروا لذنوبهم ومن يغفر الذنوب إلا الله ولم يصروا على ما فعلوا وهم يعلمون

translation: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally; and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward of the believers who are diligent in their deeds. They will be granted forgiveness from their Lord and will dwell in gardens with rivers flowing beneath, enjoying eternal bliss. It emphasizes the importance of good deeds and the ultimate reward that awaits those who strive to do good in this life.
orig: أولئك جزاؤهم مغفرة من ربهم وجنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ونعم أجر العاملين

translation: There have been examples before you. So travel through the earth and see what was the end of those who denied the truth.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to reflect on the consequences of those who rejected the truth in the past. By observing the fate of previous nations who denied the prophets, one can learn important lessons about the consequences of disbelief and the importance of following the guidance provided by Allah.
orig: قد خلت من قبلكم سنن فسيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: This is a statement for the people, and guidance and admonition for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse serves as a clear message and guidance for all people, providing instructions and lessons for those who are mindful and righteous in their beliefs and actions. It aims to offer direction and reminders for those who seek to adhere to the teachings of Islam and lead a righteous life.
orig: هذا بيان للناس وهدى وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And do not be weak nor grieve, for you will be superior if you are [true] believers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to feel weak or saddened by the challenges they face, as ultimate victory and superiority will be granted by God to those who have faith. It encourages perseverance, resilience, and trust in Allah in times of difficulty, reminding believers that their strength lies in their faith.
orig: ولا تهنوا ولا تحزنوا وأنتم الأعلون إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: If a wound should touch you - there has already touched the [opposing] people a wound similar to it. And these days [of varying conditions] We alternate among the people, so that Allah may make evident those who believe and [may] take to Himself from among you martyrs - and Allah does not like the wrongdoers -
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of trials and tests in life. It emphasizes that difficulties and hardships are common to all people, and that they serve a purpose in distinguishing the true believers from those who are unjust and do wrong. Trials are a means for Allah to identify those who remain steadfast in faith and may even elevate some to the status of martyrs. This verse reminds believers to have patience and perseverance in times of affliction, for Allah is aware of the true intentions and actions of all individuals.
orig: إن يمسسكم قرح فقد مس القوم قرح مثله وتلك الأيام نداولها بين الناس وليعلم الله الذين آمنوا ويتخذ منكم شهداء والله لا يحب الظالمين

translation: And that Allah may purify the believers [through trials] and destroy the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of trials and tests in the life of believers. It signifies that through these challenges, the faith and dedication of believers are further purified and strengthened. Conversely, those who persist in disbelief and rejection of the truth will face the consequences of their disbelief. Ultimately, it emphasizes the notion of divine decree and the distinction between believers and disbelievers in the sight of Allah.
orig: وليمحص الله الذين آمنوا ويمحق الكافرين

translation: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while Allah has not yet made evident those of you who strive [in His cause] and made evident the patient?
interpretation: Allah is reminding believers that entering Paradise is not merely a claim but a reward for those who strive sincerely in His cause and demonstrate patience in the face of challenges. True faith and dedication are known to Allah, and it is through consistent effort and perseverance that one can attain the ultimate reward of Paradise.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تدخلوا الجنة ولما يعلم الله الذين جاهدوا منكم ويعلم الصابرين

translation: And you were looking for death before you met it; so now you have seen it with your own eyes.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the human tendency to fear death and wish to avoid it, even though it is an inevitable part of life. It serves as a reminder that death is a reality that everyone will face, and that one should be prepared for it instead of wishing it away.
orig: ولقد كنتم تمنون الموت من قبل أن تلقوه فقد رأيتموه وأنتم تنظرون

translation: Muhammad is no more than a messenger. Messengers have passed away before him. If he dies or is killed, will you turn back on your heels? Anyone who turns back on his heels will do no harm to Allah. And Allah will reward the thankful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mortality of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and reminds the believers that messengers before him have also passed away. It reflects on the importance of steadfastness in faith, even in the face of hardship or loss. The verse conveys the message that turning away from the path of faith due to challenges or adversities will not harm Allah, as His will prevails. Instead, it encourages gratitude and patience in the face of difficulties, promising rewards for those who remain thankful and steadfast in their belief.
orig: وما محمد إلا رسول قد خلت من قبله الرسل أفإن مات أو قتل انقلبتم على أعقابكم ومن ينقلب على عقبيه فلن يضر الله شيئا وسيجزي الله الشاكرين
