translation: It is not given to any soul to die save by Allah's leave, at an appointed time. And if anyone desires the reward of this world, We shall grant it to him; and if anyone desires the reward of the hereafter, We shall grant it to him. We shall reward the thankful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in predestination and the power of Allah in determining the lifespan of every individual. It explains that death is a predetermined event that occurs by Allah's will at an appointed time. It also highlights that the rewards in both this world and the hereafter are granted by Allah based on one's intentions and actions. Those who are grateful and thankful are promised rewards from Allah.
orig: وما كان لنفس أن تموت إلا بإذن الله كتابا مؤجلا ومن يرد ثواب الدنيا نؤته منها ومن يرد ثواب الآخرة نؤته منها وسنجزي الشاكرين

translation: And how many a prophet [fought and] with him fought many religious scholars. But they never lost assurance due to what afflicted them in the cause of Allah, nor did they weaken or submit. And Allah loves the steadfast.
interpretation: This verse highlights the bravery, steadfastness, and resilience of the prophets and their followers in the face of challenges and opponents. It emphasizes the importance of unwavering faith and perseverance in the path of Allah, even in times of difficulty and conflict. The verse serves as a reminder that true believers remain strong and steadfast in their faith, never wavering or succumbing to fear or pressure, and such qualities are beloved to Allah.
orig: وكأين من نبي قاتل معه ربيون كثير فما وهنوا لما أصابهم في سبيل الله وما ضعفوا وما استكانوا والله يحب الصابرين

translation: And their words were not but that they said, "Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."
interpretation: This verse is highlighting a humble and sincere supplication to Allah, where believers are seeking forgiveness for their sins and asking for strength, guidance, steadfastness, and support against the disbelievers. It shows the deep trust and reliance on Allah's mercy and power in facing challenges and seeking success in both spiritual and worldly matters.
orig: وما كان قولهم إلا أن قالوا ربنا اغفر لنا ذنوبنا وإسرافنا في أمرنا وثبت أقدامنا وانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of reward and retribution in both this world and the Hereafter. It emphasizes that those who do good deeds will be rewarded by Allah in this life and the next. It also serves as a reminder that Allah loves those who perform acts of goodness and righteousness.
orig: فآتاهم الله ثواب الدنيا وحسن ثواب الآخرة والله يحب المحسنين

translation: O you who have believed, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will [then] become losers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the consequences of obeying the disbelievers instead of following the guidance of Allah. By doing so, they will be misled and ultimately face loss. The verse serves as a warning to stay steadfast on the path of faith and righteousness, even in the face of opposition or pressure from those who reject the truth.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تطيعوا الذين كفروا يردوكم على أعقابكم فتنقلبوا خاسرين

translation: But Allah is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that ultimately Allah is the true protector and supporter of believers. In times of need or difficulty, rather than relying on any other source of help, believers should place their trust in Allah as He is the best and most reliable source of support.
orig: بل الله مولاكم وهو خير الناصرين

translation: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve because they have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down authority. And their refuge will be the Fire, and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse illustrates that those who associate partners with Allah and disbelieve will have fear instilled in their hearts. Their ultimate destination will be the Fire (Hell), representing the severe punishment for such disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: سنلقي في قلوب الذين كفروا الرعب بما أشركوا بالله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا ومأواهم النار وبئس مثوى الظالمين

translation: And Allah had certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing them by His permission until [the time] when you lost courage and disputed about the matter [i.e., the disposition of the spoils] and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love. Among you are some who desire this world, and among you are some who desire the Hereafter. Then He turned you back from them so that He might test you. And He has already forgiven you, and Allah is the possessor of bounty for the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah had helped the believers in fulfilling His promise during a battle, but some of them lost their determination, fought over the spoils, and disobeyed Him. It shows that within the community there are those who are inclined towards the material world and those who prioritize the Hereafter. Through these challenges, Allah tests the believers and, despite their shortcomings, forgives them and demonstrates His mercy towards them.
orig: ولقد صدقكم الله وعده إذ تحسونهم بإذنه حتى إذا فشلتم وتنازعتم في الأمر وعصيتم من بعد ما أراكم ما تحبون منكم من يريد الدنيا ومنكم من يريد الآخرة ثم صرفكم عنهم ليبتليكم ولقد عفا عنكم والله ذو فضل على المؤمنين

translation: When you were climbing up and looking not towards anyone, while the Messenger was calling you from the rear. Allah rewarded you with distress on distress so that you would not grieve for what had escaped you or for what struck you. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of a specific incident that took place during a battle when the Messenger of Allah called the believers from the rear as they were climbing a high ground. The believers faced challenges and distress during this moment. The verse emphasizes that Allah allowed these difficulties to happen to test and strengthen the believers' resolve, and to remind them that Allah knows their actions. It serves as a reminder to believers to remain steadfast in faith and trust in Allah during times of hardship, knowing that everything happens by the will of Allah for a greater purpose.
orig: إذ تصعدون ولا تلوون على أحد والرسول يدعوكم في أخراكم فأثابكم غما بغم لكيلا تحزنوا على ما فاتكم ولا ما أصابكم والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Then, after the distress, He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness, overcoming a faction of you, while another faction worried about themselves, thinking of Allah other than the truth - the thought of ignorance. They say, 'Is there for us any part in the matter?' Say, 'Indeed, the matter belongs completely to Allah.' They conceal within themselves what they will not reveal to you. They say, 'If there was anything we could have done in the matter, we would not have been killed here.' Say, 'Even if you had been in your houses, those decreed to be killed would have come out to their death beds.' [It was] so that Allah might test what is in your breasts and purify what is in your hearts. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse discusses a period when security was granted after a time of distress, with some feeling at ease and some still anxious. It highlights the importance of submitting to Allah's will and understanding that all matters are in His hands. It also speaks about the testing of individuals' faith and intentions by God, revealing hidden thoughts and purifying hearts. The verse emphasizes trust in the divine plan and the inevitability of destiny.
orig: ثم أنزل عليكم من بعد الغم أمنة نعاسا يغشى طائفة منكم وطائفة قد أهمتهم أنفسهم يظنون بالله غير الحق ظن الجاهلية يقولون هل لنا من الأمر من شيء قل إن الأمر كله لله يخفون في أنفسهم ما لا يبدون لك يقولون لو كان لنا من الأمر شيء ما قتلنا هاهنا قل لو كنتم في بيوتكم لبرز الذين كتب عليهم القتل إلى مضاجعهم وليبتلي الله ما في صدوركم وليمحص ما في قلوبكم والله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day the two armies met, it was Satan who caused them to slip because of some [blame] they had earned. But Allah has already forgiven them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that when believers retreat from their duty in the face of adversity, it is often the work of Satan leading them astray due to their previous misdeeds. Despite this, Allah's mercy is vast, forgiving their shortcomings. It teaches us the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and the compassion He shows towards His servants.
orig: إن الذين تولوا منكم يوم التقى الجمعان إنما استزلهم الشيطان ببعض ما كسبوا ولقد عفا الله عنهم إن الله غفور حليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brothers when they traveled through the land or went out to fight, 'If they had been with us, they would not have died or have been killed.' So Allah makes that [misconception] a regret within their hearts. And it is Allah who gives life and causes death, and Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse illuminates the importance of belief and emphasizes the concept of destiny and predetermination in the eyes of Allah. It cautions believers against adopting the attitudes of the disbelievers who question the actions and fates of others. It reminds believers that life and death are in the control of Allah alone, and that everything is within His knowledge and plan. It serves as a reminder to have faith in the wisdom and justice of Allah's decree and to avoid questioning His will.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تكونوا كالذين كفروا وقالوا لإخوانهم إذا ضربوا في الأرض أو كانوا غزى لو كانوا عندنا ما ماتوا وما قتلوا ليجعل الله ذلك حسرة في قلوبهم والله يحيي ويميت والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And if you are killed in the cause of Allah or die - then forgiveness from Allah and mercy are better than whatever they accumulate.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that if they were to die in the path of Allah, whether in battle or due to other circumstances, they will be granted forgiveness and mercy by Allah. It emphasizes that these rewards from Allah are far superior to any material possessions or gains that others may amass in this worldly life.
orig: ولئن قتلتم في سبيل الله أو متم لمغفرة من الله ورحمة خير مما يجمعون

translation: And if you are killed or die in the cause of Allah, then forgiveness from Allah and mercy are better than whatever they accumulate.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that if someone dies or is killed while striving in the cause of Allah, they will be rewarded with forgiveness and mercy from Allah, which is far greater than any material wealth or possessions that they may have accumulated in this life.
orig: ولئن متم أو قتلتم لإلى الله تحشرون

translation: So by mercy from Allah, [O Muhammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of leniency, forgiveness, and consultation in dealing with others. It emphasizes the need for kindness and softness in communication, as harshness and rudeness can drive people away. The verse also encourages seeking forgiveness for others and relying on Allah's guidance after consulting with others. It teaches believers to trust in Allah's support and love those who rely on Him.
orig: فبما رحمة من الله لنت لهم ولو كنت فظا غليظ القلب لانفضوا من حولك فاعف عنهم واستغفر لهم وشاورهم في الأمر فإذا عزمت فتوكل على الله إن الله يحب المتوكلين

translation: If Allah helps you, none can overcome you; and if He forsakes you, who is there after Him that can help you? And in Allah let believers put their trust.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate reliance and trust in Allah's support and help. It highlights the notion that victory is granted by Allah alone, and if one is deserted by Allah, no other being can provide assistance or protect against defeat. Believers are called upon to place their complete trust in Allah in all aspects of their lives, knowing that He is the ultimate source of strength and support.
orig: إن ينصركم الله فلا غالب لكم وإن يخذلكم فمن ذا الذي ينصركم من بعده وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And it is not for a prophet to deceive [people]. And whoever deceives [others] will come with what he deceived on the Day of Resurrection. Then will every soul be [fully] compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honesty and truthfulness, especially for prophets and messengers of God. It warns against deceit and falsehood, stating that those who deceive will have to face the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. It also reaffirms the concept of individual accountability, highlighting that every person will be justly rewarded or punished based on their own deeds, without any injustice.
orig: وما كان لنبي أن يغل ومن يغلل يأت بما غل يوم القيامة ثم توفى كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Is one who follows the pleasure of Allah like one who has earned the anger of Allah and whose refuge is Hell? And wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking the pleasure and satisfaction of Allah. It highlights the stark contrast between those who strive to earn Allah's approval and those who earn His anger. It warns of the consequences of disobedience and sin, indicating that those who do not seek Allah's pleasure will have a terrible ending and will find themselves in Hellfire. The verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate consequences of our actions and the importance of living a life that is pleasing to Allah.
orig: أفمن اتبع رضوان الله كمن باء بسخط من الله ومأواه جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: They have varying degrees of rank with Allah, and Allah is All-Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights that individuals have different levels of status and honor in the sight of Allah based on their piety, faith, and deeds. It also emphasizes that Allah is fully aware and observant of everything they do, whether good or bad.
orig: هم درجات عند الله والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Indeed, Allah conferred a great favor upon the believers when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom, although they were before in clear error.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense blessing and favor bestowed upon the believers by Allah through the sending of a Messenger from among themselves. The Messenger recites the divine verses, purifies their souls, teaches them the scripture, and imparts wisdom. It illustrates the mercy and guidance of Allah towards those who were previously astray, leading them towards the straight path.
orig: لقد من الله على المؤمنين إذ بعث فيهم رسولا من أنفسهم يتلو عليهم آياته ويزكيهم ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة وإن كانوا من قبل لفي ضلال مبين

translation: When a calamity befalls you, even though you had inflicted twice as much, you say, 'How has this come about?' Say, 'It has come from your own selves.' Indeed, Allah is capable of all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to question why calamities or difficulties befall them, particularly when they may have played a role in causing similar harm to others. The verse serves as a reminder that whatever trials or challenges one faces, whether self-inflicted or from external sources, ultimately come from Allah's decree. It urges believers to reflect on their own actions, seek repentance, and place their trust in Allah's wisdom and power to overcome any adversity.
orig: أولما أصابتكم مصيبة قد أصبتم مثليها قلتم أنى هذا قل هو من عند أنفسكم إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And what struck you on the day the two armies met was by the permission of Allah, that He might make evident the believers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that all that befalls them, even in times of difficulty and conflict, is by the permission and will of Allah. The meeting of two armies on the battlefield is used as an example to illustrate how hardships can serve as a means to distinguish the true believers from others, as it tests their faith and loyalty to Allah.
orig: وما أصابكم يوم التقى الجمعان فبإذن الله وليعلم المؤمنين

translation: And so that those who are hypocrites at heart may know that they are told, 'Come forth, fight [on] Allah's path or defend [the community].' They say, 'If we knew how to fight, we would certainly follow you.' On that day, they are nearer to disbelief than to faith. They say with their mouths what is not in their hearts, but Allah knows fully well all that they hide.
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of hypocrites who outwardly proclaim faith but inwardly reject it. They hesitate to participate in the defense of the community or fight for the sake of Allah, despite claiming otherwise. Their lack of sincerity is emphasized as they speak lies with their tongues while concealing disbelief in their hearts. It serves as a reminder that true faith is not just in words but is reflected in one's actions and intentions, known only to Allah.
orig: وليعلم الذين نافقوا وقيل لهم تعالوا قاتلوا في سبيل الله أو ادفعوا قالوا لو نعلم قتالا لاتبعناكم هم للكفر يومئذ أقرب منهم للإيمان يقولون بأفواههم ما ليس في قلوبهم والله أعلم بما يكتمون

translation: Those who said about their brothers while they sat [themselves], 'If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed.' Say, 'Then prevent death from yourselves, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse challenges those who claim that if others had followed their opinions or actions, they would have been safe. It conveys the message that no one has the power to change the decree of Allah concerning matters like life and death. It reminds individuals that they have no control over the ultimate destiny, and they should focus on their own actions and relationship with Allah rather than blaming others for events they cannot alter.
orig: الذين قالوا لإخوانهم وقعدوا لو أطاعونا ما قتلوا قل فادرءوا عن أنفسكم الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And do not think of those who have been killed in the way of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that those who are martyred in the path of Allah are not truly dead, but are alive with their Lord and are being sustained by Him. Their sacrifice and commitment to the cause of Allah are honored and rewarded in the afterlife. This verse instills hope and comfort in the believers, emphasizing the eternal life and divine provision awaiting those who strive and make sacrifices in the name of Allah.
orig: ولا تحسبن الذين قتلوا في سبيل الله أمواتا بل أحياء عند ربهم يرزقون

translation: Rejoicing in what Allah has bestowed upon them of His bounty and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them who have not yet joined them – that there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse describes the believers who are filled with joy and gratitude for the blessings and favors that Allah has bestowed upon them. They are also given the glad tidings of the martyrs who will come after them, assuring them that they will have no fear or sadness. This verse conveys the message of reassurance and comfort to the believers, reminding them of the rewards and peace that await them in the afterlife.
orig: فرحين بما آتاهم الله من فضله ويستبشرون بالذين لم يلحقوا بهم من خلفهم ألا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: They rejoice in the favor and bounty from Allah, and that Allah does not allow the reward of the believers to be lost.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of recognizing and being grateful for the blessings and favor bestowed by Allah. It reassures the believers that Allah will not waste or overlook the rewards and good deeds of those who have faith and trust in Him. It serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in faith and keep doing good deeds, knowing that Allah values and rewards the efforts of the believers.
orig: يستبشرون بنعمة من الله وفضل وأن الله لا يضيع أجر المؤمنين

translation: Those who responded to Allah and the Messenger after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them and feared Allah is a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of responding to the call of Allah and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) even when facing difficulties or trials. It highlights that those who remain steadfast and continue to do good deeds while maintaining Taqwa (piety and consciousness of Allah) in challenging times will be rewarded greatly by Allah.
orig: الذين استجابوا لله والرسول من بعد ما أصابهم القرح للذين أحسنوا منهم واتقوا أجر عظيم

translation: Those to whom people said, 'Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them.' But it [merely] increased them in faith, and they said, 'Sufficient for us is Allah, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of reliance on Allah and trust in His plan. It teaches believers to not be overtaken by fear or anxiety due to the threats or intimidation by others, but rather to have faith that Allah is sufficient to take care of all matters and is indeed the best Guardian and Disposer of their affairs.
orig: الذين قال لهم الناس إن الناس قد جمعوا لكم فاخشوهم فزادهم إيمانا وقالوا حسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل

translation: So they returned with favor from Allah and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that when people turn towards the blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah, and follow His guidance, they are protected from harm and lead a path that encompasses the pleasure and approval of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and appreciating the gifts of Allah, and obeying His commandments to attain His favor and great bounty.
orig: فانقلبوا بنعمة من الله وفضل لم يمسسهم سوء واتبعوا رضوان الله والله ذو فضل عظيم

translation: Indeed, that is Satan frightening his supporters. So do not fear them, but fear Me, if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that the fear instilled by Satan and his followers is only temporary and deceptive. True believers should not fear the threats or intimidation of the disbelievers or the enemies of faith. Instead, they should fear Allah, strive to maintain their faith, and uphold their responsibilities as believers.
orig: إنما ذلكم الشيطان يخوف أولياءه فلا تخافوهم وخافون إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs entirely to Allah. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to be saddened by the actions of those who rush into disbelief and wrongdoings. It emphasizes that ultimately, all power belongs to Allah, who is All-Hearing and All-Knowing. It indicates that those who engage in such behaviors will not harm Allah in any way, and that Allah does not intend to grant them a share in the Hereafter and that they will face a severe punishment for their actions.
orig: ولا يحزنك الذين يسارعون في الكفر إنهم لن يضروا الله شيئا يريد الله ألا يجعل لهم حظا في الآخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: Indeed, those who exchange disbelief for faith will not harm Allah at all, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the futility of those who abandon faith for disbelief, as their actions do not harm Allah in any way. It emphasizes that their choice to reject faith will only result in a painful punishment for themselves in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين اشتروا الكفر بالإيمان لن يضروا الله شيئا ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And those who disbelieve should not think that [Our] grant [of respite] to them is good for themselves. We grant them respite only so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers against misinterpreting the time they are given to live their lives as a sign of favor or validation from Allah. Rather, this respite is temporary and serves to allow them to continue in their disbelief and sinful ways. The verse indicates that those who persist in disbelief and sin will ultimately face a severe punishment and humiliation in the Hereafter.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين كفروا أنما نملي لهم خير لأنفسهم إنما نملي لهم ليزدادوا إثما ولهم عذاب مهين

translation: God would not leave the believers in the state you are in until He separates the evil from the good. Nor would God reveal to you the unseen. But [instead], God chooses from His messengers whom He wills. So believe in God and His messengers; and if you believe and fear Him, then for you is a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that God will not keep the believers in a state of confusion or uncertainty. He will distinguish between those who are righteous and those who are not. It also explains that humans are not privy to the unseen world, and only God knows it. Furthermore, it highlights that God selects His messengers according to His will. The verse calls for belief in God and His messengers, promising a great reward for those who believe and maintain piety.
orig: ما كان الله ليذر المؤمنين على ما أنتم عليه حتى يميز الخبيث من الطيب وما كان الله ليطلعكم على الغيب ولكن الله يجتبي من رسله من يشاء فآمنوا بالله ورسله وإن تؤمنوا وتتقوا فلكم أجر عظيم

translation: And let not those who [greedily] withhold what Allah has given them of His bounty ever think that it is better for them. Rather, it is worse for them. They will be encircled by what they withheld on the Day of Resurrection. And to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. And Allah, of what you do, is Knowing.
interpretation: This verse cautions against greed and stinginess, reminding that withholding Allah's blessings is not a sign of prosperity, but rather a negative trait. It emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, those who withhold their wealth will face the consequences. It also reaffirms that Allah is the ultimate owner of all things, including the heavens and the earth, and He is fully aware of our actions.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين يبخلون بما آتاهم الله من فضله هو خيرا لهم بل هو شر لهم سيطوقون ما بخلوا به يوم القيامة ولله ميراث السماوات والأرض والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: Indeed, Allah has heard the statement of those [Jews] who said, 'Indeed, Allah is poor, while we are rich.' We will record what they said and [their] killing of the prophets without right and will say, 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and blasphemy of those who falsely claimed that Allah was in need while they considered themselves wealthy. It stresses that their disbelief and unjust actions, such as killing the prophets, will be duly recorded, and they will face the severe punishment of the Hellfire. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance, ingratitude, and falsehood.
orig: لقد سمع الله قول الذين قالوا إن الله فقير ونحن أغنياء سنكتب ما قالوا وقتلهم الأنبياء بغير حق ونقول ذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: That is because of what your hands have sent ahead [i.e., sin], and indeed Allah is not ever unjust to the servants.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that whatever hardships or difficulties a person faces in life is a consequence of their own actions and choices (sins) - referring to what their hands have sent ahead. It also reassures that Allah is never unjust to His servants, meaning that every individual will be held accountable for their deeds and Allah's justice is perfect and fair.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت أيديكم وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: Those who said, 'Allah has taken a promise from us that we shall not believe in a Messenger until he brings to us an offering which the fire consumes.' Say, 'Messengers have come to you before me with clear proofs and with what you mentioned. So why did you kill them, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse addresses those who refused to believe in a Messenger unless he brought a miraculous offering that the fire could consume. The verse reminds them of the messengers who came before with clear signs and messages, asking them why they rejected those messengers and even killed them if they were truly seeking the truth. It serves as a warning against setting unreasonable conditions for accepting the guidance of messengers and emphasizes the importance of recognizing and accepting the truth regardless of preconceived expectations.
orig: الذين قالوا إن الله عهد إلينا ألا نؤمن لرسول حتى يأتينا بقربان تأكله النار قل قد جاءكم رسل من قبلي بالبينات وبالذي قلتم فلم قتلتموهم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: So if they deny you, [O Muhammad], even so, the messengers before you were denied; they came with clear proofs, scriptures, and enlightening books.
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that if the people deny his message, he should take comfort in the fact that previous messengers also faced rejection despite bringing clear signs, inspired scriptures, and illuminating books. It serves as a reminder that denial and rejection are not uncommon for prophets, and that steadfastness in delivering the message is key despite the challenges they may face.
orig: فإن كذبوك فقد كذب رسل من قبلك جاءوا بالبينات والزبر والكتاب المنير

translation: Every soul will taste death, and you will only receive your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection. So he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has truly succeeded. The life of this world is nothing but an illusory enjoyment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitable reality of death for every living being. It further emphasizes that true success and ultimate rewards will only be granted in the Hereafter, on the Day of Judgment. Those who are saved from the punishment of Hell and granted entry into Paradise are the ones who have truly achieved success. The verse also highlights the transient and deceptive nature of worldly life, cautioning believers not to be deluded by its temporary attractions and distractions.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت وإنما توفون أجوركم يوم القيامة فمن زحزح عن النار وأدخل الجنة فقد فاز وما الحياة الدنيا إلا متاع الغرور

translation: You will surely be tested in your possessions and yourselves, and you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you and from those who associate others with Allah much abuse. But if you are patient and fear Allah - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of determination.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that trials and tests are inevitable in life, whether they be in the form of material wealth or personal struggles. Believers are encouraged to endure patiently through these challenges and maintain their piety. It also acknowledges that criticism and verbal attacks may come from those who do not share the same beliefs, but believers are advised to persevere with patience and fear of Allah. By doing so, they demonstrate their firm resolve and dedication to their faith.
orig: لتبلون في أموالكم وأنفسكم ولتسمعن من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم ومن الذين أشركوا أذى كثيرا وإن تصبروا وتتقوا فإن ذلك من عزم الأمور

translation: And [mention] when Allah took the covenant of those who were given the Scripture, [saying], 'You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it.' But they cast it behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. And wretched is that which they purchased.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of trustworthiness, honesty, and the importance of conveying knowledge and guidance to others. It warns against concealing or twisting knowledge for personal gain. It speaks of the betrayal of trust by some people of earlier scriptures in not fulfilling their duty to convey the truth to others, preferring worldly gains over their responsibility to teach. The verse serves as a lesson on sincerity and the consequences of betraying trust and abusing knowledge for selfish motives.
orig: وإذ أخذ الله ميثاق الذين أوتوا الكتاب لتبيننه للناس ولا تكتمونه فنبذوه وراء ظهورهم واشتروا به ثمنا قليلا فبئس ما يشترون

translation: Do not think those who rejoice for what they have done and love to be praised for what they did not do—think not they are in safety from the punishment. And for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against hypocrisy and insincerity. It cautions against feeling safe from the consequences of one's deeds if they are done for the wrong reasons, such as seeking praise and admiration from others for actions that were not genuinely performed. Such behavior is not acceptable in the sight of Allah, and hypocrites will face severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: لا تحسبن الذين يفرحون بما أتوا ويحبون أن يحمدوا بما لم يفعلوا فلا تحسبنهم بمفازة من العذاب ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty of Allah over the heavens and the earth, highlighting His power and control over all aspects of the universe. It serves as a reminder of the limitless authority and capabilities of Allah, reassuring believers of His omnipotence and the assurance that everything is within His control.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, are signs for those of understanding.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the magnificence and harmony in the creations of the heavens and the earth, as well as the cycle of night and day, point towards the signs of God's existence and power for those who are wise and reflect on these natural phenomena with understanding. It encourages believers to contemplate the wonders of the universe as a means to strengthen their faith and deepen their understanding of God's design and wisdom in the world.
orig: إن في خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف الليل والنهار لآيات لأولي الألباب

translation: Those who remember Allah while standing, sitting, and lying on their sides; and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth, saying, 'Our Lord, You did not create all this without purpose; glory be to You, so protect us from the torment of the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the importance of continuous remembrance of Allah in various states of being, which includes not only acts of worship but also contemplation on the signs of Allah in the creation of the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes the belief that everything in the universe has a purpose and is a testament to the greatness of the Creator. The verse urges believers to seek protection from the punishment of Hell through acknowledging the perfection and glory of Allah, and through sincere supplication for mercy.
orig: الذين يذكرون الله قياما وقعودا وعلى جنوبهم ويتفكرون في خلق السماوات والأرض ربنا ما خلقت هذا باطلا سبحانك فقنا عذاب النار

translation: Our Lord, whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability and justice in Islam. It emphasizes that those who are led astray and end up facing the consequences of their wrongdoing have no one to help or save them from their fate. It reminds believers of the importance of righteousness and obedience to avoid disgrace and punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: ربنا إنك من تدخل النار فقد أخزيته وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, 'Believe in your Lord', so we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse portrays believers seeking forgiveness and mercy from Allah after hearing the call to faith. They acknowledge their belief in Allah, ask for forgiveness for their sins, ask for purification from their misdeeds, and pray for a noble end among the righteous individuals.
orig: ربنا إننا سمعنا مناديا ينادي للإيمان أن آمنوا بربكم فآمنا ربنا فاغفر لنا ذنوبنا وكفر عنا سيئاتنا وتوفنا مع الأبرار

translation: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You never fail in [Your] promise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him to fulfill His promises that He made through His messengers. The believers are seeking assurance that they will not be humiliated on the Day of Judgment, and they acknowledge Allah's perfect faithfulness and reliability in keeping His word.
orig: ربنا وآتنا ما وعدتنا على رسلك ولا تخزنا يوم القيامة إنك لا تخلف الميعاد

translation: So their Lord answered them, 'Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another. So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed - I will surely remove from them their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from Allah, and Allah has with Him the best reward.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the divine promise that the efforts and sacrifices made in the cause of Allah will not be in vain. Allah reassures that He will not let the deeds of any believer, male or female, go to waste. Those who have endured hardships, persecution, or even death in the path of Allah will have their sins forgiven and will be rewarded with admission to paradise, where they will enjoy eternal bliss and blessings. This verse highlights the mercy, justice, and generosity of Allah towards those who demonstrate faith and obedience in His cause.
orig: فاستجاب لهم ربهم أني لا أضيع عمل عامل منكم من ذكر أو أنثى بعضكم من بعض فالذين هاجروا وأخرجوا من ديارهم وأوذوا في سبيلي وقاتلوا وقتلوا لأكفرن عنهم سيئاتهم ولأدخلنهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ثوابا من عند الله والله عنده حسن الثواب

translation: Let not the movement of the disbelievers throughout the land deceive you.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder not to be deceived or misled by the apparent success or power of disbelievers in society or within the world. It encourages believers to maintain their faith and trust in Allah, regardless of the circumstances or influence of others who reject the truth.
orig: لا يغرنك تقلب الذين كفروا في البلاد

translation: A brief enjoyment; then their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and the consequences of indulging in them at the expense of neglecting one's spiritual well-being. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of material enjoyment and the ultimate destination for those who turn away from the path of righteousness, emphasizing the importance of prioritizing the eternal life and preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: متاع قليل ثم مأواهم جهنم وبئس المهاد

translation: But for those who fear their Lord are gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, as hospitality from Allah. And that which is with Allah is best for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse describes the reward awaiting those who are mindful of their Lord and have piety in their hearts. They will be granted gardens with flowing rivers in Paradise, where they will dwell eternally as a gracious gift from Allah. The verse emphasizes that the ultimate reward and blessings come from Allah, and these are reserved for those who are righteous and obedient to Him.
orig: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها نزلا من عند الله وما عند الله خير للأبرار

translation: And there are certainly among the People of the Scripture those who believe in Allah and in what has been revealed to you and what was revealed to them, humbling themselves to Allah. They do not exchange the verses of Allah for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that among the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians), there are those who believe in Allah and the revelations sent to both Muslims and themselves. They are humble and sincere in their worship of Allah, not compromising their faith for worldly gains. Such individuals will be rewarded by Allah for their sincere belief and devotion. The verse emphasizes the importance of staying true to one's faith and not to compromise it for material gains, as Allah is just and quick in settling all accounts.
orig: وإن من أهل الكتاب لمن يؤمن بالله وما أنزل إليكم وما أنزل إليهم خاشعين لله لا يشترون بآيات الله ثمنا قليلا أولئك لهم أجرهم عند ربهم إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to have patience, endurance, and to remain steadfast in their faith. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of Allah and cultivating a sense of God-consciousness in order to attain success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اصبروا وصابروا ورابطوا واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allah, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allah is ever, over you, an Observer.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder for mankind to be conscious of their Lord, Allah. It emphasizes the unity of humanity, as all humans are created from a single soul, and from that soul, its mate was created. From these two individuals, countless men and women have been dispersed throughout the earth. It calls for fear of Allah, the One through whom people seek help and support, and also highlights the importance of maintaining family ties. The verse concludes by reminding that Allah is the ultimate watcher over every individual, aware of all their actions and deeds.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم الذي خلقكم من نفس واحدة وخلق منها زوجها وبث منهما رجالا كثيرا ونساء واتقوا الله الذي تساءلون به والأرحام إن الله كان عليكم رقيبا

translation: And give to the orphans their properties, and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is a great sin.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating orphans justly and protecting their rights. It instructs believers to safeguard the wealth and property of orphans, not to mix it with their own, and not to consume it unjustly. The verse warns against committing a grave sin by taking advantage of orphans and misappropriating their possessions.
orig: وآتوا اليتامى أموالهم ولا تتبدلوا الخبيث بالطيب ولا تأكلوا أموالهم إلى أموالكم إنه كان حوبا كبيرا

translation: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of justice and fairness in the treatment of orphan girls. It allows for polygamy as a solution to care for orphan girls, but only if the husband is able to treat them fairly and justly along with his other wives. If he fears he cannot do so, then he should marry only one or refrain from marrying at all. The verse stresses the significance of providing care and protection for the vulnerable, such as orphans, and highlights the value of justice and equity in all aspects of life.
orig: وإن خفتم ألا تقسطوا في اليتامى فانكحوا ما طاب لكم من النساء مثنى وثلاث ورباع فإن خفتم ألا تعدلوا فواحدة أو ما ملكت أيمانكم ذلك أدنى ألا تعولوا

translation: And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of giving women their bridal gifts willingly and graciously. It also permits women the right to give up part of their bridal gifts willingly, and in such cases, it is suggested that the husband accepts it with satisfaction and ease, highlighting the importance of kindness and understanding in relationships.
orig: وآتوا النساء صدقاتهن نحلة فإن طبن لكم عن شيء منه نفسا فكلوه هنيئا مريئا

translation: And do not give the foolish your property, which Allah has made a means of support for you, but provide for them and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating others with kindness and compassion, even if they may not be wise or intelligent. It instructs believers not to withhold help or support from those who may be considered foolish or lacking in understanding. Rather than disregarding them, believers are encouraged to provide for such individuals, show them care and respect, and communicate with them in a gentle and considerate manner. Overall, the verse teaches the value of empathy, generosity, and good manners towards all members of society, regardless of their intellectual abilities.
orig: ولا تؤتوا السفهاء أموالكم التي جعل الله لكم قياما وارزقوهم فيها واكسوهم وقولوا لهم قولا معروفا

translation: And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age; then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is reasonable. And when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of safeguarding the wealth and rights of orphans until they reach maturity. It instructs caretakers to responsibly manage the orphans' property, not exploit it, and release it when they are mature enough to manage it. It encourages fairness and accountability in dealing with others' assets, whether the caretaker is rich or poor, and reminds that Allah is the ultimate Judge over all matters.
orig: وابتلوا اليتامى حتى إذا بلغوا النكاح فإن آنستم منهم رشدا فادفعوا إليهم أموالهم ولا تأكلوها إسرافا وبدارا أن يكبروا ومن كان غنيا فليستعفف ومن كان فقيرا فليأكل بالمعروف فإذا دفعتم إليهم أموالهم فأشهدوا عليهم وكفى بالله حسيبا

translation: Men shall have a share in what parents and kinsfolk leave behind, and women shall have a share in what parents and kinsfolk leave behind, be it little or much - a determined share.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an addresses the distribution of inheritance, emphasizing that both men and women have a rightful share in the inheritance they receive from their parents and relatives, regardless of whether it is a small or large amount. It ensures an equitable and predetermined distribution of wealth among family members, promoting fairness and justice in society.
orig: للرجال نصيب مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون وللنساء نصيب مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون مما قل منه أو كثر نصيبا مفروضا

translation: And when [the] relatives and the orphans and the needy attend [the division of] the heritage, provide for them from it, and say to them a fair saying.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of taking care of relatives, orphans, and the needy when it comes to dividing inheritances. It highlights the value of treating them with kindness and fairness during this process, ensuring that they are provided for and not neglected.
orig: وإذا حضر القسمة أولو القربى واليتامى والمساكين فارزقوهم منه وقولوا لهم قولا معروفا

translation: And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.
interpretation: This verse is advising executors and guardians to be just and fair in their dealings, as if they were leaving behind vulnerable children who needed protection. They are encouraged to fear Allah and always speak the truth and act justly in all matters.
orig: وليخش الذين لو تركوا من خلفهم ذرية ضعافا خافوا عليهم فليتقوا الله وليقولوا قولا سديدا

translation: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire, and they will be burned in a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse is a severe warning against those who oppress and wrongfully take advantage of orphans by unlawfully consuming their wealth. It depicts such actions as not only a form of oppression but also as a means of self-destruction, as the wrongful gain accumulated from such acts will eventually lead them to the punishment of the Hellfire. The verse serves as a reminder of the gravity of exploiting those who are vulnerable and defenseless in society and warns of the severe consequences that await those who engage in such unjust behavior.
orig: إن الذين يأكلون أموال اليتامى ظلما إنما يأكلون في بطونهم نارا وسيصلون سعيرا

translation: Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: The verse lays down guidelines for inheritance distribution to family members after one's passing away. It specifies the share percentages allotted for sons and daughters, parents, and other relatives. The underlying message is the importance of fair and just distribution of inheritance as ordained by Allah, emphasizing the wisdom and knowledge of Allah in this matter.
orig: يوصيكم الله في أولادكم للذكر مثل حظ الأنثيين فإن كن نساء فوق اثنتين فلهن ثلثا ما ترك وإن كانت واحدة فلها النصف ولأبويه لكل واحد منهما السدس مما ترك إن كان له ولد فإن لم يكن له ولد وورثه أبواه فلأمه الثلث فإن كان له إخوة فلأمه السدس من بعد وصية يوصي بها أو دين آباؤكم وأبناؤكم لا تدرون أيهم أقرب لكم نفعا فريضة من الله إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for them is one fourth if you have no child. But if you have a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse provides guidelines on the distribution of inheritance among family members according to Islamic law. It outlines the shares that different relatives are entitled to receive from the deceased person's estate, taking into account the presence or absence of children, siblings, and other relatives. The verse emphasizes fairness and justness in the distribution of inheritance and highlights the importance of following the rules set by Allah in matters of inheritance. It reinforces the idea of respecting the rights of family members in matters of inheritance.
orig: ولكم نصف ما ترك أزواجكم إن لم يكن لهن ولد فإن كان لهن ولد فلكم الربع مما تركن من بعد وصية يوصين بها أو دين ولهن الربع مما تركتم إن لم يكن لكم ولد فإن كان لكم ولد فلهن الثمن مما تركتم من بعد وصية توصون بها أو دين وإن كان رجل يورث كلالة أو امرأة وله أخ أو أخت فلكل واحد منهما السدس فإن كانوا أكثر من ذلك فهم شركاء في الثلث من بعد وصية يوصى بها أو دين غير مضار وصية من الله والله عليم حليم

translation: These are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the rewards and blessings that come to those who obey Allah and His Messenger. It emphasizes that by following the boundaries and rules set by Allah, one will attain entry into paradise, where they will dwell eternally in gardens with flowing rivers. The verse conveys the message that true success lies in obedience to Allah and adherence to the teachings brought by His Messenger.
orig: تلك حدود الله ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against disobeying Allah and His Messenger and going beyond the limits set by Allah. It emphasizes the gravity of such actions by highlighting the consequence of entering the Fire and enduring a humiliating punishment for eternity. It serves as a reminder of the importance of obedience and staying within the boundaries prescribed by Allah.
orig: ومن يعص الله ورسوله ويتعد حدوده يدخله نارا خالدا فيها وله عذاب مهين

translation: And those who commit immorality from your women - then bring against them four witnesses from among you. And if they testify, confine the guilty women to houses until death takes them or Allah ordains for them another way.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the seriousness of allegations of immorality and the process that should be followed in dealing with such matters. It instructs that before any action is taken against a woman accused of immorality, four witnesses must testify to the act. If proven, the guilty women should be confined to their houses until a further decision is made by Allah or until death. This highlights the importance of not making false accusations and the necessity of establishing clear evidence before taking any punitive actions.
orig: واللاتي يأتين الفاحشة من نسائكم فاستشهدوا عليهن أربعة منكم فإن شهدوا فأمسكوهن في البيوت حتى يتوفاهن الموت أو يجعل الله لهن سبيلا

translation: And those who harm believing men and believing women for no fault of theirs have certainly burdened themselves with a slander and manifest sin.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning against harming innocent believers unjustly. It emphasizes the importance of avoiding harm towards others, especially towards fellow believers. It highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness and rectification if one has wronged someone, and ultimately calls for turning away from causing harm. The verse also highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah for those who repent and mend their ways.
orig: واللذان يأتيانها منكم فآذوهما فإن تابا وأصلحا فأعرضوا عنهما إن الله كان توابا رحيما

translation: Truly, repentance is only valid for those who do evil out of ignorance and then repent soon thereafter. These are the ones to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of repentance in Islam. It emphasizes that sincere repentance is accepted by Allah for those who commit wrongdoings out of ignorance and then swiftly turn to Him in repentance. The verse assures that Allah is forgiving and merciful towards those who sincerely seek His forgiveness, demonstrating His knowledge and wisdom in guiding His creation towards goodness.
orig: إنما التوبة على الله للذين يعملون السوء بجهالة ثم يتوبون من قريب فأولئك يتوب الله عليهم وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: But repentance is not [accepted] for those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, 'Indeed, I repent now'; nor [is repentance accepted] for those who die while they are disbelievers. For those, We have prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true repentance cannot be genuine if it is delayed until the time of death or if it is insincere. It warns against procrastination in seeking forgiveness and turning back to God. It also highlights that repentance is not accepted after death for those who die as disbelievers, and they will face severe consequences for their rejection of faith and persistent wrongdoing.
orig: وليست التوبة للذين يعملون السيئات حتى إذا حضر أحدهم الموت قال إني تبت الآن ولا الذين يموتون وهم كفار أولئك أعتدنا لهم عذابا أليما

translation: O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah makes therein much good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating women with kindness and fairness, especially in matters of inheritance. It warns against mistreating women or attempting to take away the wealth or rights they have been given, unless there is a clear reason for it. Ultimately, the verse reminds believers to deal with women in a just and respectful manner, and that even if one feels aversion towards them, there may still be goodness and blessings in the relationship.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا يحل لكم أن ترثوا النساء كرها ولا تعضلوهن لتذهبوا ببعض ما آتيتموهن إلا أن يأتين بفاحشة مبينة وعاشروهن بالمعروف فإن كرهتموهن فعسى أن تكرهوا شيئا ويجعل الله فيه خيرا كثيرا

translation: And if you wish to replace a wife in place of another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes justice and righteousness in dealing with multiple wives. It warns against the unjust practice of taking back gifts given to a wife upon replacing her with another. The verse condemns such behavior as an act of injustice and clear sin, reminding believers to treat all individuals, including their spouses, with fairness and dignity.
orig: وإن أردتم استبدال زوج مكان زوج وآتيتم إحداهن قنطارا فلا تأخذوا منه شيئا أتأخذونه بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: And how can you take it when one of you has already taken it, and they have taken a solemn covenant from you?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of honoring agreements and covenants made between people. It is admonishing those who break their promises and contracts, reminding them of the gravity of such actions. It serves as a warning against betrayal and emphasizes the need for sincerity and honesty in fulfilling commitments.
orig: وكيف تأخذونه وقد أفضى بعضكم إلى بعض وأخذن منكم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married, except what has already occurred. Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to Allah] and was evil as a way.
interpretation: This verse advises against marrying the wives of one's fathers, prohibiting it as it is considered an immoral act, detested by Allah, and a wrong path to take. The verse serves to emphasize the importance of maintaining ethical behavior and respecting the sanctity of marital relationships.
orig: ولا تنكحوا ما نكح آباؤكم من النساء إلا ما قد سلف إنه كان فاحشة ومقتا وساء سبيلا

translation: Forbidden to you [for marriage] are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal aunts, your maternal aunts, daughters of a brother, daughters of a sister, your mothers who breastfeed you, your sisters through breastfeeding, mothers of your wives, your step daughters in your guardianship from your wives whom you have entered but if you have not entered upon them there is no blame on you, and [also forbidden are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins, and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously, except for what has already occurred. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an outlines the women who are prohibited for men to marry, emphasizing on the close blood relations and those who have been part of their family in different ways. It also addresses the acceptable ways and considerations for marriage within these parameters. The verse highlights the importance of familial relationships and adherence to the guidelines prescribed by Allah when it comes to marriage.
orig: حرمت عليكم أمهاتكم وبناتكم وأخواتكم وعماتكم وخالاتكم وبنات الأخ وبنات الأخت وأمهاتكم اللاتي أرضعنكم وأخواتكم من الرضاعة وأمهات نسائكم وربائبكم اللاتي في حجوركم من نسائكم اللاتي دخلتم بهن فإن لم تكونوا دخلتم بهن فلا جناح عليكم وحلائل أبنائكم الذين من أصلابكم وأن تجمعوا بين الأختين إلا ما قد سلف إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And [also prohibited to you are] all married women except those your right hands possess. [This is] the decree of Allah upon you. And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these, [provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse. So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them, give them their due compensation as an obligation. And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the regulations concerning marriage and intimate relationships in Islam. It prohibits relationships with married women, except those who are enslaved (captives of war). It emphasizes seeking lawful marriages based on mutual consent, dignity, and respect, and stresses the importance of providing due compensation or dowry to women from the husband. It also allows flexibility for agreements beyond the obligatory compensation as long as both parties agree. The verse reminds believers that Allah is all-knowing and wise, acknowledging His guidance and wisdom in these matters.
orig: والمحصنات من النساء إلا ما ملكت أيمانكم كتاب الله عليكم وأحل لكم ما وراء ذلكم أن تبتغوا بأموالكم محصنين غير مسافحين فما استمتعتم به منهن فآتوهن أجورهن فريضة ولا جناح عليكم فيما تراضيتم به من بعد الفريضة إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women, then [they may marry] from the believing maidens whom your right hands possess. And Allah is most knowing about your faith. You [all] are of one another. So marry them with the permission of their people and give them their due compensation according to what is acceptable. [They should be] chaste, neither having illicit relations nor taking [secret] lovers. But if they should be modest, then for them is half the punishment [awarded to] free [women]. This [allowance] is for he who fears sin from among you. And to be patient is better for you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of marriage and permissible relationships. It highlights the importance of marriage and provides guidance for those who might not have the means to marry free, believing women, allowing them to marry from the believing maidens whom they possess. It emphasizes the importance of faith and chastity in relationships, and highlights the importance of seeking permission and offering fair compensation in marriage. It also encourages patience and warns against sinful behavior, with the reassurance that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: ومن لم يستطع منكم طولا أن ينكح المحصنات المؤمنات فمن ما ملكت أيمانكم من فتياتكم المؤمنات والله أعلم بإيمانكم بعضكم من بعض فانكحوهن بإذن أهلهن وآتوهن أجورهن بالمعروف محصنات غير مسافحات ولا متخذات أخدان فإذا أحصن فإن أتين بفاحشة فعليهن نصف ما على المحصنات من العذاب ذلك لمن خشي العنت منكم وأن تصبروا خير لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah wants to make clear to you and guide you to the ways of those before you and to accept your repentance. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah wants to guide and teach His followers the ways of the righteous people before them, in order to help them learn from their experiences and examples. It also highlights that Allah is aware of all actions and intentions, and He is Wisdom personified in His decisions and judgments.
orig: يريد الله ليبين لكم ويهديكم سنن الذين من قبلكم ويتوب عليكم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And Allah wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great deviation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrast between Allah's desire for His servants to repent and turn back to Him, and the desires of those who follow their own whims and passions, who wish to lead others astray. It serves as a reminder for believers to recognize the traps of their own desires and to strive to seek repentance and guidance from Allah.
orig: والله يريد أن يتوب عليكم ويريد الذين يتبعون الشهوات أن تميلوا ميلا عظيما

translation: Allah wants to lighten your burden, for man was created weak.
interpretation: This verse highlights the merciful nature of Allah, who is considerate of the weaknesses and limitations of humankind. It teaches us that Allah's laws and commandments are meant to ease our lives and guide us towards what is best for us, recognizing our frailties and showing compassion towards us.
orig: يريد الله أن يخفف عنكم وخلق الإنسان ضعيفا

translation: O you who have believed, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to be honest and just in their financial dealings, warning against consuming others' wealth unlawfully or engaging in corrupt practices. It emphasizes the importance of conducting business transactions with mutual consent and not to resort to unlawful means for financial gain. Moreover, it highlights the sanctity of life and prohibits killing one another. The verse underscores the mercy of Allah and the importance of upholding righteousness and fairness in all aspects of life.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تأكلوا أموالكم بينكم بالباطل إلا أن تكون تجارة عن تراض منكم ولا تقتلوا أنفسكم إن الله كان بكم رحيما

translation: And whoever does that in aggression and injustice, then We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who commit injustices and aggression will face punishment in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes that the punishment for such actions is severe but also serves as a reminder that for Allah, punishing such wrongdoers is not difficult or beyond His power.
orig: ومن يفعل ذلك عدوانا وظلما فسوف نصليه نارا وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden, We will remove from you your lesser sins and admit you to a noble entrance.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding major sins in Islam. By refraining from major sins, one can earn forgiveness for their minor sins and be rewarded with a place of honor in the afterlife. It serves as a reminder that by fulfilling our obligations and avoiding the most serious offenses, we can attain Allah's mercy and grace.
orig: إن تجتنبوا كبائر ما تنهون عنه نكفر عنكم سيئاتكم وندخلكم مدخلا كريما

translation: And do not wish for that by which Allah has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allah of his bounty. Indeed Allah is ever, of all things, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not coveting or desiring unjustly what others possess. Everyone, both men and women, has their own share of blessings and provisions given by Allah, which are based on their individual efforts and acts. It encourages believers to be content with their own share, to work hard for what they want, and to seek Allah's bounty through prayer and gratitude, as Allah is fully aware and knowledgeable of everything.
orig: ولا تتمنوا ما فضل الله به بعضكم على بعض للرجال نصيب مما اكتسبوا وللنساء نصيب مما اكتسبن واسألوا الله من فضله إن الله كان بكل شيء عليما

translation: And for all, We have made heirs to what the parents and close relatives have left, and to those whose oaths you have taken, so give them their share. Indeed, Allah is Witness over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of distributing inheritance fairly among the rightful heirs as outlined in Islamic law. It highlights the principles of justice, obligation, and accountability in managing the inheritance of the deceased. It reminds believers that Allah is always watchful and aware of all things, including the actions taken in the distribution of inheritance.
orig: ولكل جعلنا موالي مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون والذين عقدت أيمانكم فآتوهم نصيبهم إن الله كان على كل شيء شهيدا

translation: Men are in charge of women by [right of] what Allah has given one over the other and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth. So righteous women are devoutly obedient, guarding in [the husband's] absence what Allah would have them guard. But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance - [first] advise them; [then if they persist], forsake them in bed; and [finally], strike them. But if they obey you [once more], seek no means against them. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted and Grand.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of men being responsible and maintainers of women based on the authority and privileges bestowed upon them by Allah. It also outlines the expectation for women to be devoutly obedient and protective of their family's honor and secrets. In cases of disobedience or conflict, the verse instructs a gradual approach - starting with advice, then withdrawal of intimacy, and as a final resort, physical admonishment. However, the verse emphasizes that reconciliation and peace should be the ultimate goal, with no seeking of harm or oppression towards each other. The verse underscores that Allah is Supreme and All-Encompassing in His wisdom and judgment.
orig: الرجال قوامون على النساء بما فضل الله بعضهم على بعض وبما أنفقوا من أموالهم فالصالحات قانتات حافظات للغيب بما حفظ الله واللاتي تخافون نشوزهن فعظوهن واهجروهن في المضاجع واضربوهن فإن أطعنكم فلا تبغوا عليهن سبيلا إن الله كان عليا كبيرا

translation: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allah will cause it between them. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of resolving disputes and conflicts in a peaceful manner. It encourages mediation and arbitration, emphasizing the need for mutual willingness to reconcile. Ultimately, it emphasizes that Allah is aware of all matters and has the ability to bring about reconciliation when sincere efforts are made.
orig: وإن خفتم شقاق بينهما فابعثوا حكما من أهله وحكما من أهلها إن يريدا إصلاحا يوفق الله بينهما إن الله كان عليما خبيرا

translation: And worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler, and those whom your right hands possess. Indeed, Allah does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone without associating partners with Him, and showing kindness and compassion to parents, relatives, orphans, the needy, neighbors, companions, travelers, and those under your authority. It warns against arrogance and self-importance, as these traits are unwelcome in the sight of Allah.
orig: واعبدوا الله ولا تشركوا به شيئا وبالوالدين إحسانا وبذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين والجار ذي القربى والجار الجنب والصاحب بالجنب وابن السبيل وما ملكت أيمانكم إن الله لا يحب من كان مختالا فخورا

translation: Those who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy. We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who are stingy themselves and encourage others to be stingy as well, withholding the bounties that Allah has bestowed upon them. It highlights that Allah does not need anything from His creation and is worthy of all praise. The verse warns of a humiliating punishment for those who deny the blessings of Allah and fail to show gratitude through generosity.
orig: الذين يبخلون ويأمرون الناس بالبخل ويكتمون ما آتاهم الله من فضله وأعتدنا للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: And [there are] those who spend their wealth to be seen by the people and believe not in Allah nor in the Last Day. And he to whom Satan is a companion - then evil is he as a companion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in actions and intentions. It warns against those who perform good deeds merely for the sake of showing off to others, rather than seeking the pleasure and reward from Allah. It emphasizes the necessity of genuine belief in Allah and the Day of Judgment, as well as the dangers of being influenced or accompanied by Satan in one's actions and decisions.
orig: والذين ينفقون أموالهم رئاء الناس ولا يؤمنون بالله ولا باليوم الآخر ومن يكن الشيطان له قرينا فساء قرينا

translation: And what would be their plight if they believed in Allah and the Last Day, and spent out of what Allah has provided them? And Allah is ever Knower of them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Allah, belief in the Day of Judgment, and spending from the provisions given by Allah. It highlights that those who possess these qualities are under the care and knowledge of Allah. It encourages believers to have faith, do good deeds, and trust in Allah's knowledge and wisdom.
orig: وماذا عليهم لو آمنوا بالله واليوم الآخر وأنفقوا مما رزقهم الله وكان الله بهم عليما

translation: Indeed, Allah does not wrong anyone even by as much as an atom's weight. And if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute justice and fairness of Allah. It reassures believers that Allah will not overlook or disregard even the smallest good deed, and that He will multiply the rewards for those deeds. It serves as a reminder of Allah's generosity and mercy towards His creation, motivating believers to continue doing good and highlighting the promise of a great reward from Allah for their actions.
orig: إن الله لا يظلم مثقال ذرة وإن تك حسنة يضاعفها ويؤت من لدنه أجرا عظيما

translation: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness and bring you, [O Muhammad], against these [people] as a witness?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that on the Day of Judgment, each nation will have a witness and Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) will be a witness over his own nation. This highlights the fairness and justice of God's judgement, as every person and every community will be held accountable before God.
orig: فكيف إذا جئنا من كل أمة بشهيد وجئنا بك على هؤلاء شهيدا

translation: On that Day the unbelievers and the disobedient will wish that they could be levelled with the ground, but they will not be able to hide anything from Allah.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and the disobedient individuals will wish for the earth to swallow them up to escape the punishment, but they will not be able to escape the consequences of their actions or hide anything from Allah. It emphasizes that all deeds and intentions are known to Allah, and there is no escape from His judgment on that Day.
orig: يومئذ يود الذين كفروا وعصوا الرسول لو تسوى بهم الأرض ولا يكتمون الله حديثا

translation: O you who have believed, do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janabah, except those passing through [a place of worship], until you have washed [your whole body]. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of performing prayers in a state of physical and spiritual cleanliness. It outlines the conditions under which a person should not pray (while intoxicated or in a state of janabah) and provides alternatives if water for purification is not available. It also highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah, emphasizing that He understands and accommodates the circumstances of his believers.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقربوا الصلاة وأنتم سكارى حتى تعلموا ما تقولون ولا جنبا إلا عابري سبيل حتى تغتسلوا وإن كنتم مرضى أو على سفر أو جاء أحد منكم من الغائط أو لامستم النساء فلم تجدوا ماء فتيمموا صعيدا طيبا فامسحوا بوجوهكم وأيديكم إن الله كان عفوا غفورا

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, purchasing error [in exchange for it] and wishing you would lose the way?
interpretation: This verse warns against those who distort the teachings of the Scripture for personal gain and misguide others purposely. It highlights the consequences of deviating from the right path and the importance of staying steadfast in one's beliefs and actions.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يشترون الضلالة ويريدون أن تضلوا السبيل

translation: And Allah knows best who your enemies are; and Allah is sufficient as a Guardian, and Allah is sufficient as a Helper.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that Allah is aware of their enemies and is sufficient as their Guardian and Helper. It serves as a reminder to trust in Allah's protection and support in times of difficulty or conflict.
orig: والله أعلم بأعدائكم وكفى بالله وليا وكفى بالله نصيرا

translation: Among the Jews are those who distort words from their [proper] usages and say, 'We hear and disobey' and 'Hear but not be heard' and 'Observe us' twisting with their tongues and slandering the religion. But if they had said, 'We hear and obey' and 'Listen' and 'Look at us,' it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not except for a few.
interpretation: This verse describes a group among the Jews who deliberately distort the meanings of words and teachings, and they exhibit arrogance and disobedience towards God's commands.
