They manipulate their speech and actions to deflect from the true message. The verse emphasizes that if they had truly listened and obeyed, it would have been better for them. However, due to their rejection of faith and their wrongdoings, they are cursed by Allah and only a few among them remain believers.
orig: من الذين هادوا يحرفون الكلم عن مواضعه ويقولون سمعنا وعصينا واسمع غير مسمع وراعنا ليا بألسنتهم وطعنا في الدين ولو أنهم قالوا سمعنا وأطعنا واسمع وانظرنا لكان خيرا لهم وأقوم ولكن لعنهم الله بكفرهم فلا يؤمنون إلا قليلا

translation: O you who have been given the Scripture, believe in what We have sent down, confirming that which is with you, before We obliterate faces and turn them toward their backs or curse them as We cursed the sabbath-breakers. And ever is the decree of Allah accomplished.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder and a warning to the People of the Book (Christians and Jews) to believe in the Qur'an as it confirms the teachings that were sent to them previously. It warns them of the consequences of rejecting the message of the Qur'an, stating that those who persist in disbelief will face severe consequences just as those who disobeyed God's commandments in the past faced consequences. It emphasizes the ultimate authority and decree of Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين أوتوا الكتاب آمنوا بما نزلنا مصدقا لما معكم من قبل أن نطمس وجوها فنردها على أدبارها أو نلعنهم كما لعنا أصحاب السبت وكان أمر الله مفعولا

translation: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of associating partners with Allah (shirk) and declares that it is an unforgivable sin. However, it also highlights the vast mercy of Allah by mentioning that He forgives all other sins for those whom He wills. Associating partners with Allah is considered a grave sin as it goes against the concept of monotheism in Islam.
orig: إن الله لا يغفر أن يشرك به ويغفر ما دون ذلك لمن يشاء ومن يشرك بالله فقد افترى إثما عظيما

translation: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure? Rather, Allah purifies whom He wills, and injustice is not done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
interpretation: This verse reminds us that true purity and righteousness come from Allah and are not achieved merely by claiming it for oneself. Allah purifies and guides whomever He wills, and His decisions are always just. No injustice will be done to anyone, no matter how minuscule, as Allah's ultimate justice prevails.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يزكون أنفسهم بل الله يزكي من يشاء ولا يظلمون فتيلا

translation: See how they attribute falsehood to Allah, and that alone is a manifest sin.
interpretation: This verse highlights the grave sin of falsely attributing lies to Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of speaking truthfully about Allah and His attributes, and the severe consequences of spreading falsehood about Him. It emphasizes the need for sincerity and honesty in matters related to religion and the importance of avoiding misrepresentations about Allah.
orig: انظر كيف يفترون على الله الكذب وكفى به إثما مبينا

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, believing in superstition and false deities, and say about the disbelievers, 'These are better guided than the believers'?
interpretation: This verse highlights the issue of some people who have been given knowledge from the scripture but have deviated from the right path. They believe in superstition and false deities, and even go to the extent of considering disbelievers to be better guided than the believers. It reminds us that simply having knowledge is not enough if it is not accompanied by true faith and adherence to the teachings of the scripture.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يؤمنون بالجبت والطاغوت ويقولون للذين كفروا هؤلاء أهدى من الذين آمنوا سبيلا

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed; and he whom Allah curses - never will you find for him a helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of being cursed by Allah, indicating that those who incur the curse of Allah will never find any helper or support. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of going against the will of Allah and the importance of seeking His mercy and forgiveness.
orig: أولئك الذين لعنهم الله ومن يلعن الله فلن تجد له نصيرا

translation: Or have they a share of the dominion? Then [if that were so], they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if the disbelievers had any real share in governance and control, they would not even give the smallest amount to others. It highlights the selfishness and greed of those who prioritize their own power and wealth over the needs and rights of others.
orig: أم لهم نصيب من الملك فإذا لا يؤتون الناس نقيرا

translation: Or do they envy the people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.
interpretation: This verse presents the idea that envy towards others for the blessings appointed to them by Allah is futile. The verse mentions the generosity of Allah towards the family of Abraham, providing them with knowledge, wisdom, and a great kingdom. It reminds believers to be content with the bounties they have been granted and to avoid feelings of jealousy towards others.
orig: أم يحسدون الناس على ما آتاهم الله من فضله فقد آتينا آل إبراهيم الكتاب والحكمة وآتيناهم ملكا عظيما

translation: So, among them are those who believed in him, and among them are those who turned away from him. Sufficient is Hell as a blaze.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that people have different reactions to the message of the Qur'an - some believe in it and follow it, while others reject it. It also serves as a warning that Hellfire is a severe punishment awaiting those who consciously choose to turn away from the guidance of Allah.
orig: فمنهم من آمن به ومنهم من صد عنه وكفى بجهنم سعيرا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses - We will drive them into a Fire. Every time their skins are roasted through, We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severe punishment awaiting those who reject the signs and guidance of Allah. It describes how the disbelievers will face a continuous cycle of torment in Hell, with their skins being replaced so they can experience the pain repeatedly. It serves as a warning to those who refuse to believe in the power and wisdom of Allah.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بآياتنا سوف نصليهم نارا كلما نضجت جلودهم بدلناهم جلودا غيرها ليذوقوا العذاب إن الله كان عزيزا حكيما

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. For them therein are purified spouses, and We will admit them to deepening shade.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to the believers and righteous individuals of granting them entry into paradise where they will dwell eternally. They will enjoy the beauty of gardens with rivers flowing beneath, and will have pure and immaculate spouses as companions. Additionally, they will be bestowed with comforting shades that provide them relief and tranquility in the afterlife.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سندخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا لهم فيها أزواج مطهرة وندخلهم ظلا ظليلا

translation: Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people, to judge with justice. Excellent is that which Allah instructs you. Indeed, Allah is ever Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling trusts and being just in judgment. It reminds believers to be trustworthy in fulfilling their duties and to always uphold justice in their dealings with others. The verse serves as a guidance for believers to act with integrity and fairness, knowing that Allah is always aware of their actions and intentions.
orig: إن الله يأمركم أن تؤدوا الأمانات إلى أهلها وإذا حكمتم بين الناس أن تحكموا بالعدل إن الله نعما يعظكم به إن الله كان سميعا بصيرا

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah, His Messenger, and those in authority among the believers. It also advises resolving disagreements by referring them to Allah and His Messenger, highlighting the importance of faith in Allah and the Last Day. The verse underscores that following this guidance is the best course to take, leading to the best outcome.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول وأولي الأمر منكم فإن تنازعتم في شيء فردوه إلى الله والرسول إن كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ذلك خير وأحسن تأويلا

translation: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who claim to be believers but seek judgment from false deities ('Taghut') rather than Allah. They were commanded to reject such false authority, which is inspired by Satan to lead them astray. It emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance and judgment only from Allah and following His commands sincerely.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يزعمون أنهم آمنوا بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك يريدون أن يتحاكموا إلى الطاغوت وقد أمروا أن يكفروا به ويريد الشيطان أن يضلهم ضلالا بعيدا

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of hypocrites who show reluctance and aversion towards following the guidance sent down by Allah and following the teachings of the Messenger. The verse emphasizes the importance of embracing the divine message and not turning away from it due to hypocrisy or insincerity.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله وإلى الرسول رأيت المنافقين يصدون عنك صدودا

translation: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth and then they come to you swearing by Allah, 'We intended nothing but good conduct and reconciliation.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of those who, when faced with the consequences of their actions, try to justify themselves by swearing oaths, even though their deeds have already manifested their true intentions. It serves as a warning against deceitful behavior and reminds believers to be honest and sincere in their actions.
orig: فكيف إذا أصابتهم مصيبة بما قدمت أيديهم ثم جاءوك يحلفون بالله إن أردنا إلا إحسانا وتوفيقا

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah knows what is in their hearts, so turn away from them but admonish them and speak to them a word of appropriate justice.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is aware of what resides in people's hearts. It indicates that even if someone's outward actions may be deceitful, Allah knows their true intentions and beliefs. The instruction is to be just and fair in dealing with such individuals; to distance oneself if necessary, but also offer advice and guidance with wisdom and kindness.
orig: أولئك الذين يعلم الله ما في قلوبهم فأعرض عنهم وعظهم وقل لهم في أنفسهم قولا بليغا

translation: And We sent no messenger but that he should be obeyed by the permission of Allah. And if, when they wronged themselves, they had come to you, [O Muhammad], and asked forgiveness of Allah, and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found Allah Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying the messengers sent by Allah. It also highlights the concept of seeking forgiveness from Allah, showing that even in moments of wrongdoing, seeking repentance and asking for forgiveness can lead to Allah's mercy and forgiveness. The verse underscores the mercy and willingness of Allah to forgive those who sincerely seek His forgiveness through the guidance of the messengers.
orig: وما أرسلنا من رسول إلا ليطاع بإذن الله ولو أنهم إذ ظلموا أنفسهم جاءوك فاستغفروا الله واستغفر لهم الرسول لوجدوا الله توابا رحيما

translation: So by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of submitting to the teachings and judgments of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in matters of dispute among the believers. True faith requires not only accepting the Prophet's rulings but also feeling at peace with those decisions in the depths of one's heart. It signifies sincere acceptance and submission to the guidance of the Prophet as a crucial aspect of faith.
orig: فلا وربك لا يؤمنون حتى يحكموك فيما شجر بينهم ثم لا يجدوا في أنفسهم حرجا مما قضيت ويسلموا تسليما

translation: And if We had decreed upon them, 'Kill yourselves' or 'Leave your homes,' they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].
interpretation: This verse discusses obedience to Allah's commandments and the importance of following His guidance. It highlights that if people had truly followed and implemented the teachings and instructions given to them, it would have been more beneficial for them both in this world and the Hereafter. It emphasizes the significance of faith and adherence to divine guidance as a means of achieving spiritual and worldly success.
orig: ولو أنا كتبنا عليهم أن اقتلوا أنفسكم أو اخرجوا من دياركم ما فعلوه إلا قليل منهم ولو أنهم فعلوا ما يوعظون به لكان خيرا لهم وأشد تثبيتا

translation: And We will surely give them a great reward from Us.
interpretation: This verse indicates that believers will indeed receive a magnificent and significant reward from Allah for their faith, patience, and good deeds. It serves as an assurance and encouragement for the believers to remain steadfast and dedicated in their worship and obedience to Allah, knowing that their efforts will be generously compensated by Him.
orig: وإذا لآتيناهم من لدنا أجرا عظيما

translation: And We have guided them to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights God's guidance towards the right path for those who seek it. It emphasizes the importance of following the straight path in life, which leads to righteousness and closeness to God. It serves as a reminder that God is the ultimate guide for believers who sincerely strive for guidance.
orig: ولهديناهم صراطا مستقيما

translation: And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the high rank and companionship in the Hereafter for those who obey Allah and the Messenger. It highlights that those who follow the guidance of Allah and His Messenger will be in the company of the prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and the righteous. It signifies the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger to attain a lofty position in the sight of Allah.
orig: ومن يطع الله والرسول فأولئك مع الذين أنعم الله عليهم من النبيين والصديقين والشهداء والصالحين وحسن أولئك رفيقا

translation: That is the bounty from Allah, and it is enough that Allah is Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all blessings and favors come from Allah, and they are sufficient because Allah is All-Knowing. It reminds us to be grateful for the blessings we receive and to trust in Allah's infinite knowledge and wisdom.
orig: ذلك الفضل من الله وكفى بالله عليما

translation: O you who have believed, take your precautions and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is reminding the believers to be cautious and prepare themselves before going out for battle or any important task. It emphasizes the importance of planning, strategizing, and being ready whether one ventures out in groups or all together. It serves as a reminder for believers to be well-prepared in all their endeavors, both spiritually and practically.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا خذوا حذركم فانفروا ثبات أو انفروا جميعا

translation: And indeed, among you is he who lingers behind; and if disaster strikes you, he says, 'Allah has favored me in that I was not present with them as a martyr.'
interpretation: This verse points towards the attitude of some individuals who may avoid participation in battles or struggles, but when a calamity befalls their community, they may express gratitude for not being present with them. It highlights the hypocrisy and lack of commitment to the collective well-being of the community, as well as the selfishness of prioritizing personal safety over supporting and defending the group.
orig: وإن منكم لمن ليبطئن فإن أصابتكم مصيبة قال قد أنعم الله علي إذ لم أكن معهم شهيدا

translation: And if a favor from Allah comes to you, they would surely say, as if there had never been any love between you and them, 'Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have attained a great success.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how hypocrites show insincere behavior by pretending to be supportive and desiring to be on the side of the believers only when they witness blessings or success. It reminds believers to be cautious of fake alliances and to discern genuine companionship from those who only seek personal gain.
orig: ولئن أصابكم فضل من الله ليقولن كأن لم تكن بينكم وبينه مودة يا ليتني كنت معهم فأفوز فوزا عظيما

translation: So let those fight in the cause of Allah who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And he who fights in the cause of Allah and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of striving and fighting in the cause of Allah, particularly against injustice and oppression, even if it requires sacrificing worldly comforts. It highlights the idea of prioritizing the pursuit of the Hereafter over the temporary pleasures of this world. Those who engage in this struggle with sincerity, whether they are martyred or achieve success, are promised a great reward from Allah.
orig: فليقاتل في سبيل الله الذين يشرون الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة ومن يقاتل في سبيل الله فيقتل أو يغلب فسوف نؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allah and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, 'Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper'?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing up for justice and fighting against oppression in the way of Allah. It highlights the duty of believers to defend the oppressed, regardless of their gender or age. It also underscores the power of supplication and seeking divine assistance in times of hardship and oppression.
orig: وما لكم لا تقاتلون في سبيل الله والمستضعفين من الرجال والنساء والولدان الذين يقولون ربنا أخرجنا من هذه القرية الظالم أهلها واجعل لنا من لدنك وليا واجعل لنا من لدنك نصيرا

translation: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of Taghut (false deities). So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has been ever weak.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of spiritual warfare by highlighting the distinction between believers and disbelievers in their motivations for fighting. Believers are encouraged to fight for the sake of Allah against falsehood and injustice, while disbelievers fight in the name of false idols and desires. The verse warns against siding with the allies of Satan and reassures that the scheme of Satan is feeble in comparison to the strength and guidance provided by Allah for those who believe.
orig: الذين آمنوا يقاتلون في سبيل الله والذين كفروا يقاتلون في سبيل الطاغوت فقاتلوا أولياء الشيطان إن كيد الشيطان كان ضعيفا

translation: Have you not considered those who were told, 'Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah'? But then when fighting was ordained for them, at once a party of them feared men as they fear Allah or with [even] greater fear. They said, 'Our Lord, why have you decreed upon us fighting? If only you had postponed [it for] us for a short time.' Say, The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is better for he who fears Allah. And injustice will not be done to you, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
interpretation: This verse talks about a group of people who were initially instructed to restrain from fighting, establish prayer, and give charity, but when they were commanded to fight, some of them feared the humans more than they feared Allah. They questioned why they were being compelled to fight and wished for a delay. The verse emphasizes that the worldly pleasures are temporary, and the Hereafter is better for those who are conscious of God. It also reassures that no injustice will befall the believers, even as small as a thread inside a date seed.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين قيل لهم كفوا أيديكم وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فلما كتب عليهم القتال إذا فريق منهم يخشون الناس كخشية الله أو أشد خشية وقالوا ربنا لم كتبت علينا القتال لولا أخرتنا إلى أجل قريب قل متاع الدنيا قليل والآخرة خير لمن اتقى ولا تظلمون فتيلا

translation: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you should be within towers of lofty construction. But if good comes to them, they say, 'This is from Allah'; and if evil befalls them, they say, 'This is from you.' Say, 'All [things] are from Allah.' So what is [the matter] with those people that they can hardly understand any statement?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death and the reality that it will reach all individuals, regardless of their circumstances. It also criticizes the lack of understanding and awareness in those who attribute events to sources other than Allah, highlighting the need for people to recognize and acknowledge the power and control of Allah over all things.
orig: أينما تكونوا يدرككم الموت ولو كنتم في بروج مشيدة وإن تصبهم حسنة يقولوا هذه من عند الله وإن تصبهم سيئة يقولوا هذه من عندك قل كل من عند الله فمال هؤلاء القوم لا يكادون يفقهون حديثا

translation: Whatever good befalls you, it is from Allah, and whatever evil befalls you, it is from yourself. And We have sent you as a messenger to the people. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine decree and personal responsibility. It teaches us that all goodness comes from Allah, while any evil or hardship we face is a consequence of our own actions or choices. Additionally, the verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger of God to humanity, guiding them towards righteousness. Ultimately, it reminds us that Allah is the ultimate witness to all that we do.
orig: ما أصابك من حسنة فمن الله وما أصابك من سيئة فمن نفسك وأرسلناك للناس رسولا وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Whoever obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allah, but those who turn away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of the Messenger of Allah. It highlights that obeying the Messenger is equivalent to obeying Allah Himself. It also clarifies that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is not responsible for those who choose to turn away from his guidance and teachings, as his role is to deliver the message, not to compel belief or obedience.
orig: من يطع الرسول فقد أطاع الله ومن تولى فما أرسلناك عليهم حفيظا

translation: And they say, 'Obedience,' but when they leave you, a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say. But Allah records what they plan by night. So leave them alone and rely upon Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocritical behavior of some individuals who claim to obey the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) openly but conspire and plan against him in secret. It serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of people's intentions and actions, even those that are done in secret. The verse advises the Prophet to ignore such individuals and instead place his trust in Allah, as He is the best guardian of affairs and will ultimately manage and handle all matters in the best way.
orig: ويقولون طاعة فإذا برزوا من عندك بيت طائفة منهم غير الذي تقول والله يكتب ما يبيتون فأعرض عنهم وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: Will they not ponder upon the Qur'an? If it had been from other than Allah, they would surely have found therein much discrepancy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting upon the Qur'an and pondering its verses. It highlights the perfect coherence and harmony of the Qur'an, indicating that if it had been from sources other than Allah, there would be inconsistencies and contradictions present within it. Thus, this verse serves as evidence of the divine origin of the Qur'an.
orig: أفلا يتدبرون القرآن ولو كان من عند غير الله لوجدوا فيه اختلافا كثيرا

translation: And when there comes to them information about [public] security or fear, they spread it around. But if they had referred it back to the Messenger or to those of authority among them, then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of verifying information before spreading it, especially when it comes to matters of security or fear. Instead of impulsively spreading news, one should refer it back to the Messenger or those in authority to gain proper understanding. By doing so, those with sound judgment among them would be able to draw correct conclusions. The verse also reminds believers of the guidance and mercy of Allah, which protects them from falling into the traps and deceptions of Satan, only a few are able to resist such influences.
orig: وإذا جاءهم أمر من الأمن أو الخوف أذاعوا به ولو ردوه إلى الرسول وإلى أولي الأمر منهم لعلمه الذين يستنبطونه منهم ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته لاتبعتم الشيطان إلا قليلا

translation: Fight in the way of Allah; you are not held responsible except for yourself. And encourage the believers [to join you] that perhaps Allah will restrain the might of those who disbelieve. And Allah is greater in might and stronger in punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fighting in the cause of Allah but clarifies that each individual is only responsible for their own actions. It emphasizes the need to encourage and support other believers in their efforts, as unity can help weaken the strength of the disbelievers. Ultimately, it emphasizes the power and might of Allah, who is capable of restraining and punishing those who oppose Him.
orig: فقاتل في سبيل الله لا تكلف إلا نفسك وحرض المؤمنين عسى الله أن يكف بأس الذين كفروا والله أشد بأسا وأشد تنكيلا

translation: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a share in its benefits, and whoever intercedes for a bad cause will share in its burdens. And Allah is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle that anyone who intercedes or advocates for a good cause will be rewarded for their efforts, while those who support a bad cause will bear the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that our actions and intentions have consequences and that we should be mindful of the causes we support or advocate for, as everything is within the power and knowledge of Allah.
orig: من يشفع شفاعة حسنة يكن له نصيب منها ومن يشفع شفاعة سيئة يكن له كفل منها وكان الله على كل شيء مقيتا

translation: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, an Accountant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of responding to greetings in a better or at least equal manner. It teaches us the etiquette of kindness and respect in our interactions with others. By responding to a greeting in a better way, or at least equally, we promote peace, harmony, and good manners in society. It also reminds us that Allah is aware of all our actions and will hold us accountable for our behavior towards others.
orig: وإذا حييتم بتحية فحيوا بأحسن منها أو ردوها إن الله كان على كل شيء حسيبا

translation: There is no deity except Him, so He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. And who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the Oneness of Allah and the certainty of the Day of Resurrection. It also highlights the truthfulness and reliability of Allah's statements, reinforcing the importance of trust and belief in His words.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو ليجمعنكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه ومن أصدق من الله حديثا

translation: What is the matter with you [that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites, while Allah has made them fall back [into error and disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom Allah has sent astray? And he whom Allah sends astray - never will you find for him a way [of guidance].
interpretation: This verse addresses the situation where believers were divided into two factions regarding the hypocrites in their midst. The verse warns against trying to guide those whom Allah has purposely led astray due to their own wrongdoing. It emphasizes that those whom Allah decides to misguide will not find any way back to guidance, highlighting the ultimate power and wisdom of Allah in determining the paths of individuals.
orig: فما لكم في المنافقين فئتين والله أركسهم بما كسبوا أتريدون أن تهدوا من أضل الله ومن يضلل الله فلن تجد له سبيلا

translation: And they wish that you would disbelieve as they disbelieved so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of Allah. But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and do not take from among them any ally or helper.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against forming close alliances or friendships with the disbelievers who wish for the believers to abandon their faith. It advises not to trust them until they show signs of embracing Islam and making efforts to migrate for the sake of Allah. However, if they persist in enmity and turn away, the believers are instructed to deal with them firmly, as a measure of self-defense and protection of the Muslim community.
orig: ودوا لو تكفرون كما كفروا فتكونون سواء فلا تتخذوا منهم أولياء حتى يهاجروا في سبيل الله فإن تولوا فخذوهم واقتلوهم حيث وجدتموهم ولا تتخذوا منهم وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: Except for those who take refuge with a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty or those who come to you, their hearts strained at [the prospect of] fighting you or fighting their own people. And if Allah had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. So if they remove themselves from you and do not fight you and offer you peace, then Allah has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.
interpretation: This verse refers to scenarios where individuals or groups seek protection or come seeking peace. It highlights the importance of establishing peaceful relationships and honoring agreements, and it discourages unnecessary conflict. The verse emphasizes that if the opposing party offers peace and does not engage in fighting, there is no justification for initiating hostilities against them.
orig: إلا الذين يصلون إلى قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق أو جاءوكم حصرت صدورهم أن يقاتلوكم أو يقاتلوا قومهم ولو شاء الله لسلطهم عليكم فلقاتلوكم فإن اعتزلوكم فلم يقاتلوكم وألقوا إليكم السلم فما جعل الله لكم عليهم سبيلا

translation: You will find others who wish to be secure from you, and to be secure from their own people. Whenever they are made to revert to hostility, they fall headlong into it. So if they neither withdraw from you, nor offer you peace, nor restrain their hands, seize them and kill them wherever you come upon them. We have given you a clear authorization against them.
interpretation: This verse describes a situation where there are people who may pretend to be peaceful and seek security, but when instigated by others, they resort to hostility and violence. In such cases, if they do not cease hostilities, offer peace, or hold back their aggression, then the believers are given permission to defend themselves and fight back. It is a clear directive aimed at combating aggression and preserving the security and well-being of the community. This verse teaches the importance of self-defense and protecting oneself from those who engage in violence and hostility.
orig: ستجدون آخرين يريدون أن يأمنوكم ويأمنوا قومهم كل ما ردوا إلى الفتنة أركسوا فيها فإن لم يعتزلوكم ويلقوا إليكم السلم ويكفوا أيديهم فخذوهم واقتلوهم حيث ثقفتموهم وأولئكم جعلنا لكم عليهم سلطانا مبينا

translation: It is not for a believer to kill another believer except by mistake. And whoever kills a believer by mistake - his penalty is to free a believing slave and compensation [payable] to the deceased's family unless they give [up their right] as charity. But if the deceased was from a people at war with you and he was a believer, then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty, then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one], then [instead], fasting for two consecutive months, [seeking] acceptance from Allah. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the rulings for unintentional killing among believers. It emphasizes the sanctity of life and prescribes a specific form of expiation for the one who accidentally causes the death of another believer. The verse encourages the believer to seek forgiveness, make amends to the family of the deceased, or perform acts of charity as a means of atonement. It also highlights the importance of maintaining peace and honoring agreements, even during times of conflict.
orig: وما كان لمؤمن أن يقتل مؤمنا إلا خطأ ومن قتل مؤمنا خطأ فتحرير رقبة مؤمنة ودية مسلمة إلى أهله إلا أن يصدقوا فإن كان من قوم عدو لكم وهو مؤمن فتحرير رقبة مؤمنة وإن كان من قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق فدية مسلمة إلى أهله وتحرير رقبة مؤمنة فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين توبة من الله وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a severe warning to those who commit the grave sin of intentionally killing a believer. It emphasizes that such actions will be met with a severe punishment in the afterlife, with the individual spending eternity in Hell. The verse highlights the gravity of taking a life unjustly and the wrath of Allah towards those who commit such heinous acts.
orig: ومن يقتل مؤمنا متعمدا فجزاؤه جهنم خالدا فيها وغضب الله عليه ولعنه وأعد له عذابا عظيما

translation: O you who have believed, when you go forth in the cause of Allah, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace that you are not a believer, aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with Allah are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then Allah conferred His favor upon you, so investigate. Indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of caution and investigation when engaging in matters related to Allah's cause. It warns against hastily judging someone's faith based on superficial actions or appearances. The believers are advised to seek worldly gains with moderation and not compromise their faith for temporary worldly benefits. The verse reminds the believers of the blessings they have received from Allah and urges them to be vigilant in their actions, as Allah is fully aware of all they do.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا ضربتم في سبيل الله فتبينوا ولا تقولوا لمن ألقى إليكم السلام لست مؤمنا تبتغون عرض الحياة الدنيا فعند الله مغانم كثيرة كذلك كنتم من قبل فمن الله عليكم فتبينوا إن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: Those who remained behind from the believers are not equal to those who strove in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives. Allah has granted a higher status to those who strove with their wealth and lives compared to those who stayed behind. Although Allah has promised the best reward to all, Allah favored those who strove over those who remained behind with a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance and virtue of those who actively strive and make sacrifices in the path of Allah over those who sit idle. It highlights that there are different levels of faith and rewards based on individuals' actions and efforts. Those who engage in jihad (striving) with their wealth and lives are granted a higher status and greater reward from Allah compared to those who do not actively participate in such endeavors. The verse serves as a reminder of the significance of proactive engagement and personal sacrifice in furthering one's faith and earning blessings from Allah.
orig: لا يستوي القاعدون من المؤمنين غير أولي الضرر والمجاهدون في سبيل الله بأموالهم وأنفسهم فضل الله المجاهدين بأموالهم وأنفسهم على القاعدين درجة وكلا وعد الله الحسنى وفضل الله المجاهدين على القاعدين أجرا عظيما

translation: Degrees from Him and forgiveness and mercy. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all grades, forgiveness, and mercy come from Allah. It reminds us of Allah's infinite forgiveness and mercy, highlighting His attributes of being the Most Forgiving and the Most Merciful. It serves as a comforting reminder for believers that no matter their mistakes or shortcomings, Allah's mercy and forgiveness are always available for those who seek them sincerely.
orig: درجات منه ومغفرة ورحمة وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: Indeed, those whom the angels take [in death] while wronging themselves, [the angels] will say, 'In what [condition] were you?' They will say, 'We were oppressed in the land.' The angels will say, 'Was not the earth of Allah spacious [enough] for you to emigrate therein?' For those, their refuge is Hell - and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the accountability of individuals for their actions. Those who wrong themselves and live in oppression will have no excuse on the Day of Judgment for not making a positive change in their lives. The verse emphasizes that Allah's earth is vast and provides opportunities for individuals to seek a better life free from oppression. The consequence of ignoring these opportunities and living in wrongdoing is severe, leading to Hellfire as a destination.
orig: إن الذين توفاهم الملائكة ظالمي أنفسهم قالوا فيم كنتم قالوا كنا مستضعفين في الأرض قالوا ألم تكن أرض الله واسعة فتهاجروا فيها فأولئك مأواهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: Except for the weak among men, women and children who are unable to devise a plan nor are they guided to a way.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exception made for those who are weak among men, women, and children, emphasizing that they are unable to devise plans or find their own way. It teaches us to have compassion and provide support for those who are vulnerable and incapable.
orig: إلا المستضعفين من الرجال والنساء والولدان لا يستطيعون حيلة ولا يهتدون سبيلا

translation: So it may be that Allah will pardon them, for Allah is Ever-Pardoning, All-Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of Allah. It conveys the message that although we may fall into sin or error, Allah is always ready to forgive us if we repent sincerely. It serves as a reminder of Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness for those who turn to Him in repentance.
orig: فأولئك عسى الله أن يعفو عنهم وكان الله عفوا غفورا

translation: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allah will find on the earth many [alternative] dwelling places and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allah and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already become incumbent upon Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of migration for the sake of Allah, emphasizing the rewards and blessings that come with it. It assures those who migrate in the path of Allah of finding plenty of opportunities and provisions in this world. It also underscores the immense reward awaiting those who migrate for the sake of Allah and His Messenger, even if they were to pass away during their journey. It serves as a reminder of Allah's infinite forgiveness and mercy towards His believers.
orig: ومن يهاجر في سبيل الله يجد في الأرض مراغما كثيرا وسعة ومن يخرج من بيته مهاجرا إلى الله ورسوله ثم يدركه الموت فقد وقع أجره على الله وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: And when you travel throughout the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer, [especially] if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disbelievers are to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an allows for the shortening of prayers during travel out of concern for safety and security. It acknowledges the existence of clear enemies who may attempt to harm believers, and the permission for adjusting prayers under such circumstances reflects the mercy and practicality of Islamic principles.
orig: وإذا ضربتم في الأرض فليس عليكم جناح أن تقصروا من الصلاة إن خفتم أن يفتنكم الذين كفروا إن الكافرين كانوا لكم عدوا مبينا

translation: And when you are among them and lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand [in prayer] with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them be [in position] behind you and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed and let them pray with you, taking precaution and carrying their weapons. Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your weapons and your baggage so they could come upon you all at once. But there is no blame upon you, if you are troubled by rain or are ill, for putting down your arms, but take precaution. Indeed, Allah has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to be vigilant and prepared for any situation, including during times of prayer. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of one's surroundings and security, even in times of worship. The verse highlights the need to be cautious and ready to defend oneself, as well as the community, from any potential threats. It also serves as a reminder that the disbelievers may seek to take advantage of any moment of vulnerability, hence the importance of staying alert and taking necessary precautions. Ultimately, it underscores the importance of being prepared and maintaining security, even during acts of worship.
orig: وإذا كنت فيهم فأقمت لهم الصلاة فلتقم طائفة منهم معك وليأخذوا أسلحتهم فإذا سجدوا فليكونوا من ورائكم ولتأت طائفة أخرى لم يصلوا فليصلوا معك وليأخذوا حذرهم وأسلحتهم ود الذين كفروا لو تغفلون عن أسلحتكم وأمتعتكم فيميلون عليكم ميلة واحدة ولا جناح عليكم إن كان بكم أذى من مطر أو كنتم مرضى أن تضعوا أسلحتكم وخذوا حذركم إن الله أعد للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: So when you have finished the prayer, remember Allah standing, sitting, or lying on your sides. But when you feel secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and worshiping Allah not only during the formal prayers but also in all moments of one's life, whether standing, sitting, or even lying down. It indicates that prayer is obligatory and should be observed at specific times, and believers are encouraged to maintain their prayers regularly. The verse highlights the continuous connection and remembrance of Allah in the life of a believer, irrespective of the circumstances.
orig: فإذا قضيتم الصلاة فاذكروا الله قياما وقعودا وعلى جنوبكم فإذا اطمأننتم فأقيموا الصلاة إن الصلاة كانت على المؤمنين كتابا موقوتا

translation: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are suffering, but you expect from Allah that which they expect not. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of perseverance and steadfastness in facing challenges and enemies. It reminds believers that hardships are part of life, and just as they may suffer, their adversaries also face difficulties. The verse encourages believers to have faith in Allah, expecting assistance and outcomes that exceed worldly expectations because Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise.
orig: ولا تهنوا في ابتغاء القوم إن تكونوا تألمون فإنهم يألمون كما تألمون وترجون من الله ما لا يرجون وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book in truth so you may judge between the people by that which Allah has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the Book (Qur'an) when passing judgment or making decisions among people, as it is based on the truth. It also warns against siding with or supporting those who are deceitful or treacherous.
orig: إنا أنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق لتحكم بين الناس بما أراك الله ولا تكن للخائنين خصيما

translation: And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful, always ready to forgive His servants when they sincerely repent and seek His forgiveness. It serves as a reminder for believers to turn to Allah in repentance and seek His mercy and forgiveness for their sins.
orig: واستغفر الله إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, Allah does not love those who are treacherous and sinful.
interpretation: This verse advises against defending or supporting those who willingly deceive themselves or others. It highlights that Allah does not approve of those who are deceitful and sinful in their actions. The verse serves as a reminder to uphold honesty and righteousness in all aspects of one's conduct.
orig: ولا تجادل عن الذين يختانون أنفسهم إن الله لا يحب من كان خوانا أثيما

translation: They hide [their evil intentions] from the people, but they cannot hide [them] from Allah, and He is with them [in His knowledge] when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech. And ever is Allah, of what they do, encompassing.
interpretation: This verse highlights that no matter how hard people try to conceal their intentions and actions from others, they cannot hide anything from Allah. He is fully aware and knowledgeable about everything, even the secrets and actions people engage in when they think no one is watching. It serves as a reminder that accountability lies with Allah, who is all-knowing and all-seeing, and that all actions will be taken into account on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يستخفون من الناس ولا يستخفون من الله وهو معهم إذ يبيتون ما لا يرضى من القول وكان الله بما يعملون محيطا

translation: Here you are - those who argued about them in the worldly life - but who will argue with Allah for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will [then] be their representative?
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of arguing about matters in worldly life that are beyond our control or understanding. It emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, no one will be able to intercede or argue on behalf of others without Allah's permission. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority and justice of Allah on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء جادلتم عنهم في الحياة الدنيا فمن يجادل الله عنهم يوم القيامة أم من يكون عليهم وكيلا

translation: And whoever does evil or wrongs himself but afterwards seeks Allah's forgiveness will find Allah Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of seeking forgiveness from Allah after committing sins or wrongdoings. It highlights the boundless mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who sincerely repent and seek His forgiveness. No matter how grave the sin is, as long as one turns to Allah, He is always ready to forgive and show mercy to His repentant servants.
orig: ومن يعمل سوءا أو يظلم نفسه ثم يستغفر الله يجد الله غفورا رحيما

translation: And whoever earns sin - he only earns it against himself. And Allah is ever Knowing, Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes personal accountability for one's actions. It indicates that when a person commits a sin, they bear the responsibility for it solely upon themselves. It also reminds believers that Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise, emphasizing His justice and mercy in holding individuals accountable for their deeds.
orig: ومن يكسب إثما فإنما يكسبه على نفسه وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: And whoever earns a sin, only earns it against himself. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the individual responsibility for one's actions. It highlights that each person carries their own burden of sin, and no one can bear the burden of another. It also conveys the concept of divine justice, as Allah is aware of all deeds and his wisdom is inherent in the distribution of accountability and consequences for one’s actions.
orig: ومن يكسب خطيئة أو إثما ثم يرم به بريئا فقد احتمل بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, a group of them would have determined to mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they will not harm you at all. And Allah has revealed to you the Book and wisdom and has taught you that which you did not know. And ever has the favor of Allah upon you been great.
interpretation: This verse highlights the protection and guidance granted by Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It emphasizes that those who may wish to harm or mislead the Prophet would only harm themselves, as Allah's protection was over him. The verse also mentions Allah's gift of revelation and wisdom to the Prophet, indicating the immense favor and blessing bestowed upon him.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليك ورحمته لهمت طائفة منهم أن يضلوك وما يضلون إلا أنفسهم وما يضرونك من شيء وأنزل الله عليك الكتاب والحكمة وعلمك ما لم تكن تعلم وكان فضل الله عليك عظيما

translation: There is no good in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity, or kindness, or reconciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking Allah's pleasure, then We shall give him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of good deeds and intentions in Islam. It states that engaging in idle gossip and meaningless talk does not yield any benefit. Instead, the verse highlights that true goodness lies in actions such as giving to charity, showing kindness to others, and working towards reconciling conflicts among people. It stresses that performing such acts with the intention of pleasing Allah will result in a great reward from Him.
orig: لا خير في كثير من نجواهم إلا من أمر بصدقة أو معروف أو إصلاح بين الناس ومن يفعل ذلك ابتغاء مرضات الله فسوف نؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse warns against opposing or going against the teachings and guidance of the Messenger (Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him) after having received clear guidance. It emphasizes the importance of following the path of the believers and the Prophet, and warns of severe consequences for those who deviate from it. The verse indicates that such individuals will face consequences for their actions, ultimately leading them to Hell, highlighting the severity of deviating from the right path.
orig: ومن يشاقق الرسول من بعد ما تبين له الهدى ويتبع غير سبيل المؤمنين نوله ما تولى ونصله جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: Surely, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the seriousness of associating partners with Allah, known as shirk in Islam, which is considered the gravest sin. Allah does not forgive this sin if one dies in a state of believing in partners with Him. However, Allah can forgive all other sins if He wills. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining the purity of faith and monotheism in Islam, and the grave consequences of shirk.
orig: إن الله لا يغفر أن يشرك به ويغفر ما دون ذلك لمن يشاء ومن يشرك بالله فقد ضل ضلالا بعيدا

translation: They invoke none but females and indeed they invoke none but a rebellious Satan.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and wrongdoing of those who worship idols besides Allah, emphasizing that they worship only false entities and a rebellious Satan. It serves as a strong warning against polytheism and deviation from the path of monotheism.
orig: إن يدعون من دونه إلا إناثا وإن يدعون إلا شيطانا مريدا

translation: May Allah curse him, and he said, 'I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Satan rebelled against Allah and declared his intention to lead people astray by tempting them into disobedience. It serves as a cautionary tale, warning believers to be wary of the whispers and temptations of Satan that can lead them away from the path of righteousness.
orig: لعنه الله وقال لأتخذن من عبادك نصيبا مفروضا

translation: And I will lead them astray, and arouse in them [sinful] desires; and I will command them and they will slit the ears of cattle; and I will command them and they will change Allah's creation.' And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allah has certainly sustained a clear loss.
interpretation: This verse warns against following the path of Satan and diverting from the natural order created by Allah. It describes how Satan deceives and misleads people, encouraging them to alter the creation of Allah. The verse emphasizes the consequences of choosing Satan over Allah, highlighting the clear loss that follows such a choice.
orig: ولأضلنهم ولأمنينهم ولآمرنهم فليبتكن آذان الأنعام ولآمرنهم فليغيرن خلق الله ومن يتخذ الشيطان وليا من دون الله فقد خسر خسرانا مبينا

translation: He [Satan] promises them and stirs desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceptive nature of Satan, who entices people with false promises and stirs their desires. However, in reality, Satan's promises are nothing but delusions and falsehoods, leading people away from the path of righteousness and towards sin and temptation.
orig: يعدهم ويمنيهم وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا

translation: Their refuge is Hell, and they will not find from it an escape.
interpretation: This verse warns about the consequences of leading a life of disobedience and sin, emphasizing that those who choose to defy God's guidance will ultimately find themselves in Hell with no way out. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and the inevitability of facing the consequences of one's actions in the afterlife.
orig: أولئك مأواهم جهنم ولا يجدون عنها محيصا

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. [It is] the promise of Allah, [which is] truth, and who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reward that awaits the believers who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds. They will be granted entry into paradises filled with blessings, where rivers flow beneath them, and they will dwell there eternally. This is a promise from Allah, and His promises are true and trustworthy. It highlights the ultimate truthfulness and reliability of Allah's words and emphasizes the certainty of the reward He has promised to the righteous believers.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سندخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا وعد الله حقا ومن أصدق من الله قيلا

translation: It is not by your desires, nor by the desires of the People of the Scripture; whoever does evil, will be recompensed for it. And he will not find besides Allah a protector or a helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that one's actions and intentions alone are what count, not personal desires or the wishes of others. It highlights that those who commit wrongdoings will face consequences for their actions, and no one except Allah can give them protection or support. It reminds believers to rely on Allah alone and to always strive to do good deeds.
orig: ليس بأمانيكم ولا أماني أهل الكتاب من يعمل سوءا يجز به ولا يجد له من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that gender is not a factor in earning reward from Allah. It highlights the importance of faith and righteous actions, mentioning that those who do good deeds while believing will be granted entry into Paradise where they will not face any injustice, not even to the smallest degree.
orig: ومن يعمل من الصالحات من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فأولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون نقيرا

translation: Who is better in religion than one who submits his face to Allah while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth? And Allah took Abraham as a friend.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the best among the believers are those who submit themselves fully to Allah, do good deeds, follow the path of Prophet Abraham who was a true monotheist, and establish a close relationship with Allah. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity, good deeds, following the right path, and building a strong connection with the divine.
orig: ومن أحسن دينا ممن أسلم وجهه لله وهو محسن واتبع ملة إبراهيم حنيفا واتخذ الله إبراهيم خليلا

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and Allah is encompassing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omnipotence and all-encompassing nature of Allah, stating that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. It serves as a reminder that Allah's knowledge, power, and control extend over all things, highlighting His supreme authority and sovereignty over the universe.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكان الله بكل شيء محيطا

translation: And they request from you, [O Muhammad], a [legal] ruling concerning women. Say, 'Allah gives you a ruling about them and [about] what has been recited to you in the Book concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice.' And whatever good you do - indeed, Allah is ever Knowing of it.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that when they seek guidance regarding women orphans, they should rely on the rulings of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of just treatment of vulnerable groups such as orphan girls and oppressed children. It also highlights that all good deeds are known to Allah, encouraging believers to act with righteousness and justice in their dealings.
orig: ويستفتونك في النساء قل الله يفتيكم فيهن وما يتلى عليكم في الكتاب في يتامى النساء اللاتي لا تؤتونهن ما كتب لهن وترغبون أن تنكحوهن والمستضعفين من الولدان وأن تقوموا لليتامى بالقسط وما تفعلوا من خير فإن الله كان به عليما

translation: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them - and settlement is best. And present in [human] souls is stinginess. But if you do good and fear Allah - then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse addresses the delicate issue of marital conflicts, particularly when a wife fears mistreatment or neglect from her husband. It emphasizes the importance of resolving such conflicts amicably and highlights the virtue of reconciliation in Islam. It acknowledges the inherent human tendency towards selfishness but encourages the believers to strive for goodness and righteousness while being mindful of God, as He is fully aware of their actions and intentions.
orig: وإن امرأة خافت من بعلها نشوزا أو إعراضا فلا جناح عليهما أن يصلحا بينهما صلحا والصلح خير وأحضرت الأنفس الشح وإن تحسنوا وتتقوا فإن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: And you will never be able to be just between wives, even if you should strive to do so. So do not incline completely [toward one] and leave another hanging. And if you amend [your affairs] and fear Allah - then indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of fairness and justice in dealing with multiple wives. It acknowledges the difficulty of being completely fair in such relationships, but still encourages striving for justice and not favoring one over the other. It emphasizes the importance of reconciliation, righteousness, and God-consciousness, assuring that Allah is forgiving and merciful towards those who try to maintain fairness.
orig: ولن تستطيعوا أن تعدلوا بين النساء ولو حرصتم فلا تميلوا كل الميل فتذروها كالمعلقة وإن تصلحوا وتتقوا فإن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And if they separate, Allah will enrich each [of them] from His abundance. And ever is Allah Encompassing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if two spouses decide to separate, Allah will provide for each of them from His endless bounty. It reminds believers that Allah is All-Encompassing and Wise, and His decree is based on wisdom and knowledge beyond human comprehension.
orig: وإن يتفرقا يغن الله كلا من سعته وكان الله واسعا حكيما

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves to fear Allah. But if you disbelieve - then to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. It also reminds the people of the previous scriptures and the current believers to be conscious of Allah and fear Him. The verse asserts that even if some people choose to disbelieve, the dominion still ultimately belongs to Allah, who is self-sufficient and deserving of all praise.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ولقد وصينا الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم وإياكم أن اتقوا الله وإن تكفروا فإن لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكان الله غنيا حميدا

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing sovereignty and control of Allah over everything in the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder that all power and authority ultimately belong to Allah alone, and that He is fully capable of managing all matters. It encourages believers to rely on Him completely in all their affairs, knowing that He is the ultimate protector and caretaker.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: If He wills, He could do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And Allah is Most Capable of that.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that Allah has full control over all things. He can easily replace any individual or group of people with others if He wishes. It serves as a reminder of the power and authority of Allah, and the importance of having faith and submitting to His will.
orig: إن يشأ يذهبكم أيها الناس ويأت بآخرين وكان الله على ذلك قديرا

translation: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with Allah is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is Allah Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights that if someone seeks only material gains and rewards in this world, they will find them with God, yet those who seek rewards in both this world and the Hereafter will receive their rightful share. It emphasizes that Allah is all-hearing and all-seeing, aware of the intentions and actions of every individual.
orig: من كان يريد ثواب الدنيا فعند الله ثواب الدنيا والآخرة وكان الله سميعا بصيرا

translation: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for Allah, even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, Allah is more worthy of both. So follow not [personal] inclination, lest you not be just. And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it], then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding justice and fairness under all circumstances, even if it goes against one's own interests or the interests of loved ones. It teaches to be impartial and truthful in bearing witness for the sake of Allah, regardless of social status. The believers are reminded not to let personal desires lead them astray from doing what is right, as Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا قوامين بالقسط شهداء لله ولو على أنفسكم أو الوالدين والأقربين إن يكن غنيا أو فقيرا فالله أولى بهما فلا تتبعوا الهوى أن تعدلوا وإن تلووا أو تعرضوا فإن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: O you who have believed, believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger and the Scripture which He sent down before. And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Allah, His Messenger, the Qur'an, and the earlier scriptures revealed by Allah. It warns against the severe consequences of disbelief in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Day of Judgment, indicating that such disbelief leads one astray from the path of truth and guidance.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا آمنوا بالله ورسوله والكتاب الذي نزل على رسوله والكتاب الذي أنزل من قبل ومن يكفر بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله واليوم الآخر فقد ضل ضلالا بعيدا

translation: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, and then increased in disbelief - never will Allah forgive them nor will He guide them to a way.
interpretation: This verse describes the situation of those who waver in their faith, going back and forth between belief and disbelief. It emphasizes that if someone repeatedly rejects faith after having believed, and their disbelief only increases over time, then Allah will not forgive them or guide them to the right path. This verse serves as a warning against insincere or unstable faith.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا ثم كفروا ثم آمنوا ثم كفروا ثم ازدادوا كفرا لم يكن الله ليغفر لهم ولا ليهديهم سبيلا

translation: Give the hypocrites tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to the hypocrites, those who profess faith but do not sincerely believe or adhere to the teachings of Islam. It emphasizes that they will face a severe and painful punishment for their hypocrisy and deceit. It urges them to turn to Allah sincerely and avoid the consequences of their insincerity and falsehood.
orig: بشر المنافقين بأن لهم عذابا أليما

translation: Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of believers. Do they seek with them honor [through power]? But indeed, honor belongs to Allah entirely.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of loyalty and alliance among believers. It questions the motives of those who prioritize relationships with disbelievers over fellow believers, especially for seeking power or honor. The verse emphasizes that true honor and dignity come from Allah alone, and believers should prioritize their faith and allegiance to Him over any worldly gains or alliances.
orig: الذين يتخذون الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين أيبتغون عندهم العزة فإن العزة لله جميعا

translation: And it has already been revealed to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah [recited], they are denied [by them] and ridiculed; so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed, Allah will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers not to sit with those who mock or deny the signs of Allah, as being in their company may lead one to adopt similar blasphemous behavior. It emphasizes the importance of not engaging in discussions that belittle or ridicule matters of faith. Additionally, it warns of the eventual gathering of hypocrites and disbelievers in Hellfire as a consequence of their actions.
orig: وقد نزل عليكم في الكتاب أن إذا سمعتم آيات الله يكفر بها ويستهزأ بها فلا تقعدوا معهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره إنكم إذا مثلهم إن الله جامع المنافقين والكافرين في جهنم جميعا

translation: Those who wait in ambush for you. And if there is a victory from Allah, they say, 'Were we not with you?' But if the disbelievers have a share of it, they say to them, 'Did we not prevail over you and protect you from the believers?' So Allah will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection, and Allah will never give the disbelievers over the believers a way [to overcome them].
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of those who are hypocritical and deceitful. They try to take credit for the victories and successes of the believers while distancing themselves from any failures or setbacks. Ultimately, it asserts that Allah will be the ultimate judge of all actions and will not allow the disbelievers to overpower the believers. It reminds us of the importance of sincerity and integrity in our actions and the certainty that justice will prevail in the end.
orig: الذين يتربصون بكم فإن كان لكم فتح من الله قالوا ألم نكن معكم وإن كان للكافرين نصيب قالوا ألم نستحوذ عليكم ونمنعكم من المؤمنين فالله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة ولن يجعل الله للكافرين على المؤمنين سبيلا

translation: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive Allah, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing off to the people and not remembering Allah except a little.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the behavior of hypocrites who show devotion in their prayers as a mere pretense for the eyes of others, while lacking sincerity and true remembrance of Allah in their hearts. It highlights the importance of genuine devotion and intention in worship, rather than seeking validation or praise from people. It serves as a reminder to cultivate a sincere connection with Allah in all our actions and intentions.
orig: إن المنافقين يخادعون الله وهو خادعهم وإذا قاموا إلى الصلاة قاموا كسالى يراءون الناس ولا يذكرون الله إلا قليلا

translation: Wavering between them, [belonging] neither to the one group nor the other. And he whom Allah leaves astray - never will you find for him a way.
interpretation: This verse speaks about those who are indecisive and wavering between different paths or beliefs, without committing to any. It warns that those who are led astray by Allah will find it difficult to find guidance and a way back to the right path.
orig: مذبذبين بين ذلك لا إلى هؤلاء ولا إلى هؤلاء ومن يضلل الله فلن تجد له سبيلا

translation: O you who have believed, do not take disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allah against yourselves a clear case?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of loyalty to fellow believers and warns against forming alliances with disbelievers who may act against the interest of the Muslim community. It serves as a reminder of the significance of unity among believers and the potential consequences of aligning with those who do not share the same faith and values.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين أتريدون أن تجعلوا لله عليكم سلطانا مبينا

translation: Verily, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire; and you will find no helper for them.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the severe punishment that awaits hypocrites in the Hereafter. Hypocrisy, which involves professing faith outwardly while concealing disbelief or ill intentions internally, is condemned in Islam. The verse warns that hypocrites will face the most severe punishment in Hell, highlighting the gravity of their actions and the absence of any support or advocate for them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن المنافقين في الدرك الأسفل من النار ولن تجد لهم نصيرا

translation: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to Allah, and are sincere in their religion for Allah, for those will be with the believers. And Allah is going to give the believers a great reward.
interpretation: This verse talks about the qualities of true believers and highlights the importance of sincere repentance, self-improvement, devotion to Allah, and dedication to faith. Those who possess these qualities will be rewarded by being in the company of other believers and receiving a tremendous reward from Allah. It emphasizes the significance of inner transformation and true devotion to God.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا وأصلحوا واعتصموا بالله وأخلصوا دينهم لله فأولئك مع المؤمنين وسوف يؤت الله المؤمنين أجرا عظيما

translation: What does God gain by punishing you if you are grateful and believe? God is Appreciative and Knowledgeable.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that God does not benefit from punishing people; rather, He appreciates and rewards those who are grateful and believe in Him. It emphasizes the importance of gratitude and faith, while also highlighting God's attributes of appreciation and knowledge.
orig: ما يفعل الله بعذابكم إن شكرتم وآمنتم وكان الله شاكرا عليما

translation: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of not publicly speaking about or spreading harm, except for those who have been wronged and seek justice. It serves as a reminder of the value of restraint and the importance of seeking justice through appropriate channels, rather than resorting to spreading negativity and gossip. Additionally, it highlights that Allah is always aware of what is said and done, and He hears all things and knows the intentions behind our actions.
orig: لا يحب الله الجهر بالسوء من القول إلا من ظلم وكان الله سميعا عليما

translation: Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. Then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is aware of all that is hidden and all that is revealed within ourselves. It serves as a reminder that Allah is all-forgiving and has the power to forgive whoever He wishes and to hold accountable those who deserve punishment. It teaches us the importance of sincerity and righteous deeds, as well as the reassurance that ultimately, Allah's justice prevails.
orig: إن تبدوا خيرا أو تخفوه أو تعفوا عن سوء فإن الله كان عفوا قديرا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, 'We believe in some and disbelieve in others,' and wish to adopt a way in between -
interpretation: This verse warns against those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers, who try to create division between Allah and His messengers by believing in some and denying others. It emphasizes that such attempts at division and compromise are not acceptable in faith.
orig: إن الذين يكفرون بالله ورسله ويريدون أن يفرقوا بين الله ورسله ويقولون نؤمن ببعض ونكفر ببعض ويريدون أن يتخذوا بين ذلك سبيلا

translation: Those indeed are the disbelievers and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who persist in disbelief are truly categorized as disbelievers. The reference to a 'humiliating punishment' serves as a stern warning about the consequences of rejecting faith and the displeasure of God. It reminds believers of the importance of faith and obedience to avoid facing such a disgraceful fate in the Hereafter.
orig: أولئك هم الكافرون حقا وأعتدنا للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to them He will give their rewards. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of belief in Allah and His messengers without making distinctions between them. It highlights the unity of the message brought by all messengers and promises rewards for those who believe sincerely. The verse also reminds believers of Allah's forgiveness and mercy, encouraging them to follow the path of faith and unity.
orig: والذين آمنوا بالله ورسله ولم يفرقوا بين أحد منهم أولئك سوف يؤتيهم أجورهم وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The People of the Book ask you to bring down a Book to them from heaven, but they had asked Moses for something even greater: they said, 'Show us God in plain view,' and so the thunderbolt struck them for their wickedness. Then they took the calf for worship, after all the clear signs that had come to them, but We pardoned that and gave Moses clear authority.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the inconsistency and ingratitude of the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who, despite seeking a miraculous proof from God, had previously witnessed great miracles through the prophet Moses, yet still turned to idol worship. It serves as a reminder that clear evidence and signs from God are not always enough for some people to stay on the right path, as they can easily be swayed by their desires and whims. The verse also emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of God, as He pardoned the previous transgressions of the People of the Book and bestowed Moses with evident authority.
orig: يسألك أهل الكتاب أن تنزل عليهم كتابا من السماء فقد سألوا موسى أكبر من ذلك فقالوا أرنا الله جهرة فأخذتهم الصاعقة بظلمهم ثم اتخذوا العجل من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات فعفونا عن ذلك وآتينا موسى سلطانا مبينا
