translation: And We raised above them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, 'Enter the gate bowing humbly', and We said to them, 'Do not transgress on the Sabbath', and We took from them a solemn covenant.
interpretation: This verse talks about the covenant made with the Children of Israel, reminding them of their obligations and agreements with Allah. By mentioning how they were commanded to enter the gate humbly and not transgress the rules set for the Sabbath, the verse serves as a reminder of the importance of following divine commands and staying true to one's promises.
orig: ورفعنا فوقهم الطور بميثاقهم وقلنا لهم ادخلوا الباب سجدا وقلنا لهم لا تعدوا في السبت وأخذنا منهم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: So for their breaking the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allah and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, 'Our hearts are wrapped'. Rather, Allah has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not except for a few.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of the actions of those who break their covenant with Allah, reject His signs, unjustly kill the prophets, and claim that their hearts are sealed. It emphasizes that such individuals have been deprived of belief due to their own disbelief. Overall, the verse underscores the importance of upholding one's covenant with Allah, recognizing His signs, and avoiding disbelief and unjust actions.
orig: فبما نقضهم ميثاقهم وكفرهم بآيات الله وقتلهم الأنبياء بغير حق وقولهم قلوبنا غلف بل طبع الله عليها بكفرهم فلا يؤمنون إلا قليلا

translation: And [for] their disbelief and their saying about Mary a great slander,
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe accusation and slander made by some disbelievers against Mary, the mother of Jesus. The Qur'an condemns such false accusations and emphasizes the importance of being truthful and just in one's speech and actions.
orig: وبكفرهم وقولهم على مريم بهتانا عظيما

translation: And their saying, 'Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of Allah.' And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but another was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumptions. And they did not kill him, for certain.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the misconceptions surrounding the crucifixion of Jesus. It clarifies that Jesus was not killed nor crucified, but instead, it appeared so to certain people. Those who argue about this are only following assumptions and possess no certainty about what truly happened. The verse emphasizes that Jesus was not killed in the way people believe, and what actually transpired is known only to Allah.
orig: وقولهم إنا قتلنا المسيح عيسى ابن مريم رسول الله وما قتلوه وما صلبوه ولكن شبه لهم وإن الذين اختلفوا فيه لفي شك منه ما لهم به من علم إلا اتباع الظن وما قتلوه يقينا

translation: But Allah raised him up to Himself. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the situation of Prophet Isa (Jesus) in which Allah elevated him to Himself. It serves as a reminder of the power and wisdom of Allah, demonstrating that He is capable of all things and that His plans are always wise and just.
orig: بل رفعه الله إليه وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in Jesus before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection, he will be against them a witness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every person from the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) will eventually come to believe in the truth of Jesus before they die. It refers to a recognition of the prophethood or message of Jesus, suggesting that the truth of his message will become clear to them. On the Day of Resurrection, this belief will be a witness either in favor of or against them, based on their acceptance or rejection of it.
orig: وإن من أهل الكتاب إلا ليؤمنن به قبل موته ويوم القيامة يكون عليهم شهيدا

translation: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of breaking covenants and turning away from the path of God. It talks about how those who deviate from the right path are cursed and have their hearts hardened. They also manipulate the teachings and forget the reminders given to them. The verse indicates the prevalence of deceit among those who stray, except for a few who remain on the right path.
orig: فبظلم من الذين هادوا حرمنا عليهم طيبات أحلت لهم وبصدهم عن سبيل الله كثيرا

translation: And their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the prohibition of usury (riba) and unjust consumption of people's wealth. It serves as a reminder of the severe consequences awaiting those who engage in such unethical practices. The verse conveys the message that indulging in usury and unlawfully taking others' wealth are serious offenses that will result in a painful punishment for the disbelievers.
orig: وأخذهم الربا وقد نهوا عنه وأكلهم أموال الناس بالباطل وأعتدنا للكافرين منهم عذابا أليما

translation: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer [especially] the ones who give zakah, and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those, We will give them a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of firm faith and knowledge. It highlights the characteristics of the believers who not only believe in the revelations sent to Prophet Muhammad but also in the previous scriptures, establish prayer, give charity, believe in Allah, and believe in the Day of Judgment. Such individuals can expect a great reward from Allah for their steadfastness and devotion.
orig: لكن الراسخون في العلم منهم والمؤمنون يؤمنون بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك والمقيمين الصلاة والمؤتون الزكاة والمؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر أولئك سنؤتيهم أجرا عظيما

translation: Indeed, We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that just as Allah revealed His messages to various prophets throughout history, including Noah, Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and others, so too has He revealed guidance to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights the continuity and consistency of the message of monotheism and righteousness brought by these prophets over time, culminating in the final revelation to Prophet Muhammad.
orig: إنا أوحينا إليك كما أوحينا إلى نوح والنبيين من بعده وأوحينا إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وعيسى وأيوب ويونس وهارون وسليمان وآتينا داوود زبورا

translation: And [We sent] messengers We have mentioned to you before, and messengers We have not mentioned to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity of messengers and prophets that were sent by Allah throughout history. Some were mentioned in the Qur'an, while others are not explicitly named. It also emphasizes the special relationship between Allah and Prophet Moses, whom Allah communicated with directly. The verse serves as a reminder of the multitude of messengers sent by Allah and the different ways in which they were chosen to convey His message to humanity.
orig: ورسلا قد قصصناهم عليك من قبل ورسلا لم نقصصهم عليك وكلم الله موسى تكليما

translation: We sent messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom behind sending messengers to deliver glad tidings and warnings to mankind. By sending messengers, Allah removes any justification for people to claim ignorance of the truth after the messengers have delivered the message. It emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah in ensuring that His message reaches humanity through various messengers, preventing anyone from having an excuse for rejecting the truth.
orig: رسلا مبشرين ومنذرين لئلا يكون للناس على الله حجة بعد الرسل وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: But Allah bears witness to what He has revealed to you; He has revealed it with His knowledge. And the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin and authenticity of the Qur'an. It asserts that Allah testifies to the truth of what has been revealed to the Prophet Muhammad through His infinite knowledge. The angels also bear witness to the truth of the message. Ultimately, Allah is sufficient as a witness to the legitimacy and accuracy of His revelations, ensuring that the Qur'an is a timeless and reliable source of guidance for humanity.
orig: لكن الله يشهد بما أنزل إليك أنزله بعلمه والملائكة يشهدون وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe consequences of disbelief and obstructing others from the path of Allah. It emphasizes that those who engage in such actions are severely misguided and have deviated far from the right path. The verse serves as a warning against disbelief and obstruction of the path of righteousness, reminding believers to stay steadfast on the right path and to beware of actions that lead to misguidance.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله قد ضلوا ضلالا بعيدا

translation: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and committed wrong - Allah will not forgive them nor guide them to a way.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who persist in disbelief and wrongdoing without repentance will not be forgiven by Allah nor will He guide them to the right path. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and living a life of injustice.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وظلموا لم يكن الله ليغفر لهم ولا ليهديهم طريقا

translation: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that for Allah is [always] easy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of rejecting faith and following the path of wrongdoing, which leads to Hell. The reference to Hell as a place of eternal dwelling emphasizes the severity of the punishment for those who persist in their disbelief. It also emphasizes the omnipotence and ease with which Allah can hold people accountable for their actions and decisions.
orig: إلا طريق جهنم خالدين فيها أبدا وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: O mankind, there has come to you a Messenger with the truth from your Lord, so believe, it is better for you. But if you disbelieve, then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the Messenger sent by Allah, as it is for the benefit of mankind. However, it also warns that denying the truth will not harm Allah in any way, as His knowledge and wisdom encompass everything in the heavens and the earth.
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم الرسول بالحق من ربكم فآمنوا خيرا لكم وإن تكفروا فإن لله ما في السماوات والأرض وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: O People of the Scripture, do not exaggerate in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul ​included from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist – it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse advises the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) not to go to extremes in their religion and to speak only the truth about Allah. It confirms that Jesus, as the Messiah, was a messenger of Allah, His word directed to Mary, and a soul from Him. The verse emphasizes the belief in one God, warning against the notion of the Trinity. Allah is exalted above having a son, and He is the sole controller of everything in the heavens and on earth, fully capable of managing all affairs.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لا تغلوا في دينكم ولا تقولوا على الله إلا الحق إنما المسيح عيسى ابن مريم رسول الله وكلمته ألقاها إلى مريم وروح منه فآمنوا بالله ورسله ولا تقولوا ثلاثة انتهوا خيرا لكم إنما الله إله واحد سبحانه أن يكون له ولد له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: The Messiah will not disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor will the angels who are near to Him. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humility and obedience required from all creatures, including Jesus (the Messiah) and the closest angels to Allah. It warns against arrogance and refusal to worship Allah, as those who display such behavior will be gathered together and held accountable by Allah.
orig: لن يستنكف المسيح أن يكون عبدا لله ولا الملائكة المقربون ومن يستنكف عن عبادته ويستكبر فسيحشرهم إليه جميعا

translation: So, as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who were disdainful and arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith and good deeds. It describes how Allah rewards the believers with blessings and extra favors from His mercy. On the other hand, those who are arrogant and reject faith are warned of a painful punishment and will have no one besides Allah to protect or assist them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the ultimate justice that will be meted out by Allah.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيوفيهم أجورهم ويزيدهم من فضله وأما الذين استنكفوا واستكبروا فيعذبهم عذابا أليما ولا يجدون لهم من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah has provided humanity with clear evidence and guidance through the Qur'an, which serves as a source of enlightenment for people. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and following this divine guidance for one's own benefit and guidance in life.
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم برهان من ربكم وأنزلنا إليكم نورا مبينا

translation: As for those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him, He will admit them to mercy from Him and favor, and guide them to Him on a straight path.
interpretation: This verse describes the rewards and blessings bestowed by Allah upon those who have faith in Him and adhere steadfastly to their belief. It emphasizes that those who believe in Allah and cling to Him with sincerity will be shown mercy by Him, granted His favor, and guided towards the right path leading to Him. It serves as an encouragement for believers to remain steadfast in their faith and trust in Allah's guidance.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا بالله واعتصموا به فسيدخلهم في رحمة منه وفضل ويهديهم إليه صراطا مستقيما

translation: They ask you for a legal ruling. Say: 'Allah gives you a ruling concerning those who have neither parents nor direct heirs.' If a man dies childless but has a sister, she will receive half of the inheritance; he inherits from her if she has no children. If there are two sisters, they will inherit two-thirds of the deceased's estate; if there are siblings, men and women, the male will have the share of two females. Allah clarifies to you, lest you go astray, and Allah has knowledge of everything.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of inheritance in Islam, outlining the distribution of assets when someone dies without direct heirs. It provides a clear and fair division of inheritance to ensure the rights of siblings, both male and female, are protected. The verse emphasizes the importance of clarity in inheritance laws to prevent confusion or disputes, and highlights that Allah's wisdom and knowledge encompass all aspects of life, including legal rulings.
orig: يستفتونك قل الله يفتيكم في الكلالة إن امرؤ هلك ليس له ولد وله أخت فلها نصف ما ترك وهو يرثها إن لم يكن لها ولد فإن كانتا اثنتين فلهما الثلثان مما ترك وإن كانوا إخوة رجالا ونساء فللذكر مثل حظ الأنثيين يبين الله لكم أن تضلوا والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: O you who have believed, fulfill [all] contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - hunting not being permitted while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling agreements and contracts. It allows the consumption of grazing livestock animals for food, other than those prohibited in the Qur'an. It also reminds believers not to hunt these animals while in a state of ihram during pilgrimage. Ultimately, the verse highlights that Allah's commands and decrees are based on His wisdom and will.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أوفوا بالعقود أحلت لكم بهيمة الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم غير محلي الصيد وأنتم حرم إن الله يحكم ما يريد

translation: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or [the sanctity of] the sacred month or [neglect the marking of] the sacrificial animals or [violates the safety of] the garlands or [those who flock to] the sacred house seeking bounty from their Lord and [His] approval. But when you come out of ihram [during pilgrimage], [then] hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And help one another in righteousness and piety, but do not help one another in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the sanctity of certain rituals and places in Islam, such as the sacred months, sacrificial animals, garlands, and the sacred house (Kaaba in Mecca). It warns against allowing animosity or hatred from others to lead to transgressions. Believers are encouraged to support each other in righteousness and piety, and to avoid assisting in sinful or aggressive actions. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain a balance between devotion to God and relationships with others, and to always act in accordance with righteousness and piety while being mindful of Allah's severe punishment for wrongdoings.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تحلوا شعائر الله ولا الشهر الحرام ولا الهدي ولا القلائد ولا آمين البيت الحرام يبتغون فضلا من ربهم ورضوانا وإذا حللتم فاصطادوا ولا يجرمنكم شنآن قوم أن صدوكم عن المسجد الحرام أن تعتدوا وتعاونوا على البر والتقوى ولا تعاونوا على الإثم والعدوان واتقوا الله إن الله شديد العقاب

translation: Forbidden to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, and [those animals] killed by strangling, or by a violent blow, or by a headlong fall, or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you [are able to] slaughter [before its death], and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and [prohibited is] that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disbelieve have despaired of [defeating] your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse outlines certain prohibitions in Islam such as consuming dead animals, blood, pork, and meat dedicated to entities other than Allah, as well as animals killed in forbidden ways. It also emphasizes not turning to unlawful practices for obtaining decisions or guidance. The verse signifies the completion and perfection of the religion of Islam by Allah, highlighting the importance of adhering to its teachings even in the face of challenges. It also shows the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those compelled by extreme circumstances.
orig: حرمت عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل لغير الله به والمنخنقة والموقوذة والمتردية والنطيحة وما أكل السبع إلا ما ذكيتم وما ذبح على النصب وأن تستقسموا بالأزلام ذلكم فسق اليوم يئس الذين كفروا من دينكم فلا تخشوهم واخشون اليوم أكملت لكم دينكم وأتممت عليكم نعمتي ورضيت لكم الإسلام دينا فمن اضطر في مخمصة غير متجانف لإثم فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what has been made lawful for them. Say, 'Lawful for you are good foods and [game caught by] what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as Allah has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of Allah upon it, and fear Allah.' Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of consuming lawful and good foods that have been obtained through permissible means, such as hunting animals trained for the purpose. The verse also urges believers to remember and mention the name of Allah upon their food, signifying gratitude and invoking the blessings of Allah. Additionally, the verse highlights the necessity of being conscious of Allah and following His guidance, as He is swift in holding people accountable for their actions.
orig: يسألونك ماذا أحل لهم قل أحل لكم الطيبات وما علمتم من الجوارح مكلبين تعلمونهن مما علمكم الله فكلوا مما أمسكن عليكم واذكروا اسم الله عليه واتقوا الله إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: This day [all] good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And [lawful in marriage are] chaste women from among the believers and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of lawful and pure sustenance in Islam. It declares that all that is good and pure in terms of food is permissible for the believers. It also allows for marriage with chaste women from among the believers as well as from the People of the Book, with the condition to honor them and not engage in illicit behavior. The verse issues a warning that denying faith renders one's deeds futile and will result in being among the losers in the afterlife.
orig: اليوم أحل لكم الطيبات وطعام الذين أوتوا الكتاب حل لكم وطعامكم حل لهم والمحصنات من المؤمنات والمحصنات من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم إذا آتيتموهن أجورهن محصنين غير مسافحين ولا متخذي أخدان ومن يكفر بالإيمان فقد حبط عمله وهو في الآخرة من الخاسرين

translation: O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of cleanliness in Islam, particularly before the act of prayer. It outlines the requirements for ablution (wudu) before prayer and provides guidelines on what to do if water is unavailable for purification. The underlying message is about the significance of spiritual purification and the ease with which one can fulfill these rituals in various circumstances to maintain purity of heart and body in preparation for prayer.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا قمتم إلى الصلاة فاغسلوا وجوهكم وأيديكم إلى المرافق وامسحوا برءوسكم وأرجلكم إلى الكعبين وإن كنتم جنبا فاطهروا وإن كنتم مرضى أو على سفر أو جاء أحد منكم من الغائط أو لامستم النساء فلم تجدوا ماء فتيمموا صعيدا طيبا فامسحوا بوجوهكم وأيديكم منه ما يريد الله ليجعل عليكم من حرج ولكن يريد ليطهركم وليتم نعمته عليكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, 'We hear and we obey'; and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to reflect upon the blessings of Allah and the covenant they made with Him. It emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah's commandments and being conscious of Him. It also highlights that Allah knows the innermost thoughts and intentions of people.
orig: واذكروا نعمة الله عليكم وميثاقه الذي واثقكم به إذ قلتم سمعنا وأطعنا واتقوا الله إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding justice and fairness in all situations, even if it means going against the biases or dislikes towards certain individuals or communities. It instructs believers to stand firmly for justice and not be swayed by personal prejudices or societal pressure. By being just, one is closer to righteousness and piety. The verse serves as a reminder to fear Allah and to act with integrity and fairness, with the understanding that Allah is aware of all actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا قوامين لله شهداء بالقسط ولا يجرمنكم شنآن قوم على ألا تعدلوا اعدلوا هو أقرب للتقوى واتقوا الله إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds [that] for them is forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of forgiveness and a great reward that Allah has made for those who have faith in Him and follow it with righteous deeds. It serves as an encouragement for believers to continue doing good deeds and have faith, reassuring them of the ultimate reward of forgiveness and a great recompense from Allah.
orig: وعد الله الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة وأجر عظيم

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse conveys that those who choose to disbelieve in the signs and revelations of Allah will be among the inhabitants of the Hellfire. It emphasizes the consequences of rejecting the truth and turning away from the guidance of Allah, indicating a stern warning against disbelief and denial.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to reflect upon the blessings and favors of Allah upon them, specifically in times of potential harm or danger. It emphasizes the need to have trust and reliance on Allah in all circumstances, for He is the ultimate protector and supporter of the believers. The believers are encouraged to have piety and fear of Allah, and to put their trust in Him alone.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ هم قوم أن يبسطوا إليكم أيديهم فكف أيديهم عنكم واتقوا الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And indeed Allah took the covenant from the Children of Israel and We appointed twelve leaders among them. And Allah said, 'I am with you if you establish prayer, give zakah, believe in My messengers, support them, and lend Allah a good loan. I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever of you disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant Allah made with the Children of Israel and the conditions He set for them. It emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's duties towards Allah, such as prayer, charity, belief in the messengers, supporting them, and extending good loans for the sake of Allah. It assures the believers of Allah's forgiveness and promises them entry into paradise. However, those who turn to disbelief after being given such guidance have indeed deviated from the right path.
orig: ولقد أخذ الله ميثاق بني إسرائيل وبعثنا منهم اثني عشر نقيبا وقال الله إني معكم لئن أقمتم الصلاة وآتيتم الزكاة وآمنتم برسلي وعزرتموهم وأقرضتم الله قرضا حسنا لأكفرن عنكم سيئاتكم ولأدخلنكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار فمن كفر بعد ذلك منكم فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: So, for breaking their covenant, We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook [their misdeeds]. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse points out the consequences of breaking a covenant with Allah, as seen through the example of past communities who faced hardships due to their disobedience. Their hearts have become hardened, leading them to stray from the true meanings of words and teachings. Despite the deception and betrayal, it advises forgiveness and patience, reminding that Allah appreciates those who do good even in the face of adversity.
orig: فبما نقضهم ميثاقهم لعناهم وجعلنا قلوبهم قاسية يحرفون الكلم عن مواضعه ونسوا حظا مما ذكروا به ولا تزال تطلع على خائنة منهم إلا قليلا منهم فاعف عنهم واصفح إن الله يحب المحسنين

translation: And among those who say, 'We are Christians,' We took their covenant. But they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We caused among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah is going to inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse is pointing out that some among the Christians broke their covenant with Allah by forgetting or neglecting parts of their teachings and obligations. As a consequence, Allah allowed animosity and hatred to arise among them. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of their actions and will hold them accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ومن الذين قالوا إنا نصارى أخذنا ميثاقهم فنسوا حظا مما ذكروا به فأغرينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة وسوف ينبئهم الله بما كانوا يصنعون

translation: O People of the Book, Our Messenger has come to you, making clear to you much of what you used to hide of the Book and he overlooks much. There has come to you from Allah a light and a clear Book.
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Book (Jews and Christians), informing them that a messenger from Allah has come to them to clarify the truths that were concealed within their own scriptures. The verse highlights that this messenger, Prophet Muhammad, not only illuminates these concealed truths but also forgives many of their past errors. It emphasizes the guidance, enlightenment, and clarity that have been granted to them through the Quran, revealed by Allah as a source of light and clear guidance for all mankind.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم كثيرا مما كنتم تخفون من الكتاب ويعفو عن كثير قد جاءكم من الله نور وكتاب مبين

translation: By it, Allah guides those who follow His approval to the ways of peace and brings them out from darknesses into the light, by His permission, and guides them to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the guidance and mercy of Allah towards those who seek His approval and guidance. It emphasizes that following the path of righteousness and seeking Allah's pleasure leads to peace, enlightenment, and being guided towards the straight path. It signifies the power and generosity of Allah in guiding His creation towards goodness and away from darkness and misguidance.
orig: يهدي به الله من اتبع رضوانه سبل السلام ويخرجهم من الظلمات إلى النور بإذنه ويهديهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve have said, 'Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary,' Say, 'Then who could prevent Allah at all if He intended to destroy the Messiah, the son of Mary, his mother, and everyone on the earth? To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. He creates whatever He wills, and Allah is competent over all things.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the falsehood of those who claim that Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary. It emphasizes that Allah has complete power over all creation, including the ability to destroy the Messiah, his mother, and all beings on earth if He so wills. It asserts that Allah's sovereignty encompasses everything in the heavens and the earth, and His authority is absolute to create as He pleases. The verse underscores the omnipotence and control of Allah over all affairs.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم قل فمن يملك من الله شيئا إن أراد أن يهلك المسيح ابن مريم وأمه ومن في الأرض جميعا ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما يخلق ما يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And [both] the Jews and the Christians say, 'We are the children of Allah and His beloved.' Say, 'Then why does He punish you for your sins?' Rather, you are but human beings from among those He has created. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and to Him is the [final] destination.
interpretation: This verse addresses the claims of Jews and Christians who regard themselves as the chosen children of God. The verse challenges this belief by questioning why, if they are so beloved and special, would they be punished for their sins. It reminds them that they are only human like everyone else, and that forgiveness and punishment are in the hands of Allah alone. The verse also emphasizes the ultimate authority and control of Allah over everything in existence, highlighting that all matters ultimately lead back to Him.
orig: وقالت اليهود والنصارى نحن أبناء الله وأحباؤه قل فلم يعذبكم بذنوبكم بل أنتم بشر ممن خلق يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وإليه المصير

translation: O People of the Book! Our Messenger has come to you, making clear to you much of what you have been concealing of the Scriptures, and pardoning much. A light has now come to you from Allah, and a clear Book.
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Book, referring to the Jews and the Christians, informing them that a Messenger has come with revelations that clarify and confirm what they have concealed or altered in their scriptures. It emphasizes the importance of accepting the message brought by the Messenger, as he serves as both a bearer of good news and a warner. The verse highlights the power and knowledge of Allah over all things, affirming the authority and significance of the message delivered by the Messenger.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم على فترة من الرسل أن تقولوا ما جاءنا من بشير ولا نذير فقد جاءكم بشير ونذير والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors and gave you what He had not given anyone among the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the blessings and favors that Allah bestows upon His people. It highlights how Allah has chosen certain individuals, such as prophets, to guide and lead communities. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the unique blessings and opportunities that Allah has granted, which set believers apart from the rest of the world.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ جعل فيكم أنبياء وجعلكم ملوكا وآتاكم ما لم يؤت أحدا من العالمين

translation: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back [from fighting in Allah's cause] for then you will be returned as losers.
interpretation: This verse is a call to the believers to enter and conquer the Holy Land (Jerusalem) as it has been designated for them by Allah. It serves as a reminder to remain steadfast in their faith and not to retreat in the face of challenges or enemies, as doing so would result in defeat and loss. The verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's mission and staying committed to the path set by Allah without fear or hesitation.
orig: يا قوم ادخلوا الأرض المقدسة التي كتب الله لكم ولا ترتدوا على أدباركم فتنقلبوا خاسرين

translation: They said, 'O Moses, indeed within it is a people of tyrannical strength, and indeed, we will never enter it until they leave it. But if they leave it, then we will enter.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a lack of faith and resolve on the part of some of the Israelites who doubted the ability to conquer a land due to the strength of its inhabitants. It serves as a lesson on the importance of trust in God's guidance and the necessity of perseverance in the face of challenges.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إن فيها قوما جبارين وإنا لن ندخلها حتى يخرجوا منها فإن يخرجوا منها فإنا داخلون

translation: Two men among those who feared [to disbelieve] upon whom Allah had bestowed favor said, 'Enter upon them through the gate, for when you have entered it, you will be predominant. And upon Allah rely, if you should be believers.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an teaches us the importance of having trust in Allah and relying on Him, especially in times of difficulty or challenges. The two men mentioned in the verse encourage believers to take confident action while also putting their trust in Allah's support and guidance. By having faith and reliance on Allah, believers can overcome obstacles and emerge victorious in their endeavors.
orig: قال رجلان من الذين يخافون أنعم الله عليهما ادخلوا عليهم الباب فإذا دخلتموه فإنكم غالبون وعلى الله فتوكلوا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said, 'O Moses, indeed we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are within it; so go, you and your Lord, and fight. Indeed, we are remaining right here.'
interpretation: In this verse, the disbelievers are telling Prophet Moses that they will not enter the land that has been forbidden to them as long as its inhabitants are there. They challenge Moses to go with his Lord and fight them while they watch from the sidelines. This shows their arrogance and stubbornness in refusing to follow the guidance given to them.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إنا لن ندخلها أبدا ما داموا فيها فاذهب أنت وربك فقاتلا إنا هاهنا قاعدون

translation: He said, 'My Lord, indeed I do not possess except myself and my brother, so part us from the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse showcases the devotion and concern of Prophet Moses towards his people. He is seeking protection from God against being associated or grouped with those who are openly disobedient to God. It highlights the importance of surrounding oneself with righteous and ethical individuals, and the need to distance oneself from those who openly transgress the boundaries set by God.
orig: قال رب إني لا أملك إلا نفسي وأخي فافرق بيننا وبين القوم الفاسقين

translation: He said, 'Indeed, it is forbidden to them for forty years; they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a period of trial or punishment, during which a group of people were forbidden from entering a certain land for forty years. It serves as a reminder to accept divine decree and not be saddened by the actions of those who openly disobey God's commands.
orig: قال فإنها محرمة عليهم أربعين سنة يتيهون في الأرض فلا تأس على القوم الفاسقين

translation: Recite to them in truth the story of the two sons of Adam. When they both offered a sacrifice [to Allah], and it was accepted from one of them and not accepted from the other. [One] said, 'I will surely kill you.' [The other] said, 'Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of the sons of Adam, Cain and Abel, and how one's sacrifice was accepted by Allah while the other's was not. It highlights the importance of piety and righteousness in being accepted by Allah, and the consequences of envy and aggression towards those who are favored by Allah.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ ابني آدم بالحق إذ قربا قربانا فتقبل من أحدهما ولم يتقبل من الآخر قال لأقتلنك قال إنما يتقبل الله من المتقين

translation: If you extend your hand to kill me, I will not extend my hand to kill you, for I fear Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse speaks to the importance of avoiding retaliation and responding with patience and forgiveness, even when faced with aggression or harm. It emphasizes the fear of Allah and the recognition of His ultimate authority and judgment over all creation. It teaches us to overcome our ego and anger, and instead respond with mercy and consciousness of Allah's presence in our interactions.
orig: لئن بسطت إلي يدك لتقتلني ما أنا بباسط يدي إليك لأقتلك إني أخاف الله رب العالمين

translation: I wish that you should bear the penalty of both the sin and the crime without any helper from me, and that you will be in the companionship of the Fire. That is the recompense of the wrong-doers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that those who commit sins and wrongdoings will bear the consequences and punishment for their actions, without any support or intercession. It emphasizes the justice and accountability in the Hereafter, where wrongdoers will face the punishment of Hellfire as a retribution for their unjust actions.
orig: إني أريد أن تبوء بإثمي وإثمك فتكون من أصحاب النار وذلك جزاء الظالمين

translation: So his soul permitted him to kill his brother; he killed him and became one of the losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Cain and Abel, where Cain's jealousy and arrogance led him to commit the heinous act of murdering his brother. The verse emphasizes that giving in to negative impulses and acting on them can lead to ruin and loss. It serves as a warning against succumbing to base desires and urges that may lead to destructive outcomes.
orig: فطوعت له نفسه قتل أخيه فقتله فأصبح من الخاسرين

translation: So Allah sent a crow searching in the ground to show him how to hide the disgrace of his brother. He said, 'O woe to me! Have I failed to be like this crow and hide the disgrace of my brother?' And he became of the regretful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates the story of two sons of Adam, Cain and Abel. When Cain killed Abel out of jealousy, he didn't know what to do with his brother's body. So Allah sent a crow that scratched the ground to show Cain how to bury his brother's body. This made Cain realize his mistake and regret his actions. The verse teaches us about regret, remorse, and the consequences of jealousy and sin.
orig: فبعث الله غرابا يبحث في الأرض ليريه كيف يواري سوءة أخيه قال يا ويلتا أعجزت أن أكون مثل هذا الغراب فأواري سوءة أخي فأصبح من النادمين

translation: Because of that, We decreed upon the Children of Israel that whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely. And whoever saves one - it is as if he had saved mankind entirely. And our messengers had certainly come to them with clear proofs. Then indeed many of them, [even] after that, throughout the land, were transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the sanctity of life and emphasizes the gravity of taking a life unjustly. It conveys the message that the killing of one innocent person is akin to the killing of all humanity, whereas saving one person is like saving all of humanity. The verse also serves as a reminder of the responsibility placed upon the Children of Israel to uphold justice and righteousness, as well as the consequences faced by those who choose to transgress after receiving clear guidance from divine messengers.
orig: من أجل ذلك كتبنا على بني إسرائيل أنه من قتل نفسا بغير نفس أو فساد في الأرض فكأنما قتل الناس جميعا ومن أحياها فكأنما أحيا الناس جميعا ولقد جاءتهم رسلنا بالبينات ثم إن كثيرا منهم بعد ذلك في الأرض لمسرفون

translation: Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes the severe punishment for those who actively oppose and fight against Allah and His Messenger, and work to spread corruption and mischief in the land. It outlines that their penalty may involve being killed, crucified, having their hands and feet cut off from opposite sides, or being exiled from the land. This stern punishment serves as a deterrent and is followed by disgrace in this world and a severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: إنما جزاء الذين يحاربون الله ورسوله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا أن يقتلوا أو يصلبوا أو تقطع أيديهم وأرجلهم من خلاف أو ينفوا من الأرض ذلك لهم خزي في الدنيا ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: Except for those who repent before you apprehend them. So know that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who repent sincerely before facing the consequences of their wrongdoings. It emphasizes the importance of repentance and turning back to Allah before it is too late, as He is always ready to forgive those who seek His forgiveness with true remorse and a resolve to change for the better.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من قبل أن تقدروا عليهم فاعلموا أن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining righteousness and seeking closeness to Allah through acts of worship and dedication. It encourages believers to put in effort and struggle in the path of Allah, indicating that success comes from sincere dedication to Him. By fearing Allah, seeking closeness to Him, and striving in His cause, believers can attain prosperity and achievement in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وابتغوا إليه الوسيلة وجاهدوا في سبيله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - if they should have all that is in the earth and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the punishment of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that on the Day of Resurrection, disbelievers will not be able to ransom themselves from the punishment of Allah even if they were to possess all the riches of the world. Their disbelief and rejection of the truth will lead to a severe punishment, showing the severity of denying faith and the consequences that follow.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لو أن لهم ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه ليفتدوا به من عذاب يوم القيامة ما تقبل منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: They want to get out of the Fire, but they are not to emerge from it. For them is a lasting punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes the regret of the disbelievers and sinners who wish to escape the punishment of Hell, but once they are in it, there is no escape. It emphasizes that they will face a never-ending punishment due to their defiance of God and their rejection of truth and righteousness.
orig: يريدون أن يخرجوا من النار وما هم بخارجين منها ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: And [as for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands in recompense for what they committed as a deterrent [punishment] from Allah. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse addresses the punishment for theft in Islam, which involves cutting off the hand of the thief as a deterrent and recompense for their actions. The severity of this punishment reflects the importance of preserving property rights and deterring crimes that may harm society. It emphasizes that the implementation of this punishment is a divine decree from Allah, who is All-Powerful and Wise in His commandments.
orig: والسارق والسارقة فاقطعوا أيديهما جزاء بما كسبا نكالا من الله والله عزيز حكيم

translation: So whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, indeed, Allah will turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of repentance and making amends for one's wrongdoings. It offers hope and reassurance that if one sincerely repents and strives to rectify their actions, Allah is ready to forgive. It conveys the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who seek His guidance and forgiveness.
orig: فمن تاب من بعد ظلمه وأصلح فإن الله يتوب عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate sovereignty of Allah over the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that Allah has the power to punish those who deserve it and forgive those who seek His forgiveness. It serves as a reminder of Allah's complete control and ability to do as He wills, and it instills a sense of humility and awe towards His authority.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يعذب من يشاء ويغفر لمن يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O Messenger, let not those grieve you who hasten into disbelief of those who say, 'We believe' with their mouths, but their hearts believe not; and of the Jews who listen eagerly to lies, listening for others who have not come to you. They distort words beyond their [proper] usages, saying, 'If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware.' But he for whom Allah intends fitnah - never will you possess [power to do] for him a thing against Allah. Those are the ones for whom Allah does not intend to purify their hearts. For them in this world is disgrace, and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad not to be saddened by those who hasten into disbelief, including those who outwardly claim to be believers but are not sincere in their hearts, and those from the Jewish community who are eager to listen to falsehood and deceptive statements in order to spread them. The verse warns that those who are truly meant to be tested by Allah will face their trials, and no one has the power to save them against Allah's will. Those who refuse purification of their hearts are destined for disgrace in this world and a severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الرسول لا يحزنك الذين يسارعون في الكفر من الذين قالوا آمنا بأفواههم ولم تؤمن قلوبهم ومن الذين هادوا سماعون للكذب سماعون لقوم آخرين لم يأتوك يحرفون الكلم من بعد مواضعه يقولون إن أوتيتم هذا فخذوه وإن لم تؤتوه فاحذروا ومن يرد الله فتنته فلن تملك له من الله شيئا أولئك الذين لم يرد الله أن يطهر قلوبهم لهم في الدنيا خزي ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: They listen to falsehood, devour what is forbidden. If they come to you, judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them, they will not harm you at all. And if you judge, judge with justice. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of justice and honesty. It highlights how some people may indulge in falsehood and forbidden actions, but as a believer, one must strive to uphold justice when faced with such situations. Even if one chooses to avoid dealing with dishonest individuals, they should not fear any harm. True believers are encouraged to judge with fairness and integrity, as justice is beloved by Allah.
orig: سماعون للكذب أكالون للسحت فإن جاءوك فاحكم بينهم أو أعرض عنهم وإن تعرض عنهم فلن يضروك شيئا وإن حكمت فاحكم بينهم بالقسط إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: And how do they make you a judge while they have the Torah, in which is the judgment of Allah? Then they turn away, after that; but those are not [in fact] believers.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the contradiction of those who claim adherence to the Torah, which contains the laws and judgments of Allah, while at the same time turning away from its guidance and not abiding by its teachings. It emphasizes that true belief is not reflected merely in claiming faith but in truly following and upholding the divine laws and commandments.
orig: وكيف يحكمونك وعندهم التوراة فيها حكم الله ثم يتولون من بعد ذلك وما أولئك بالمؤمنين

translation: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted [to Allah] judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars, by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed, then it is those who are the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance and significance of the Torah as a source of guidance and light sent down by Allah. It emphasizes that the prophets, rabbis, and scholars were entrusted to judge by the teachings of the Torah. The verse warns against exchanging the divine verses for worldly gains and calls for reverence and adherence to Allah's revealed knowledge. It also condemns those who choose not to abide by Allah's revelations, labeling them as disbelievers.
orig: إنا أنزلنا التوراة فيها هدى ونور يحكم بها النبيون الذين أسلموا للذين هادوا والربانيون والأحبار بما استحفظوا من كتاب الله وكانوا عليه شهداء فلا تخشوا الناس واخشون ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الكافرون

translation: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever gives [up his right as] charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of Qisas, the law of equivalent retaliation, in cases of intentional harm or injury. It emphasizes the idea of justice and balance in retribution. However, it also highlights the importance of forgiveness and charity, stating that giving up one's right for retribution can serve as an act of atonement. The verse condemns those who do not uphold the laws and guidance set by Allah as they are considered unjust.
orig: وكتبنا عليهم فيها أن النفس بالنفس والعين بالعين والأنف بالأنف والأذن بالأذن والسن بالسن والجروح قصاص فمن تصدق به فهو كفارة له ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming that which came before him in the Torah, and We gave him the Gospel, in which was guidance and light and confirming that which preceded it of the Torah as guidance and instruction for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuity and unity of the message from Allah throughout different Prophets. It highlights the role of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) as a confirmation of the previous scriptures and the giver of the Gospel, which was meant to provide guidance, illumination, and to reinforce the teachings of the Torah. The verse underscores that all Prophets came with a consistent message of guidance and warnings for the God-conscious individuals, encouraging righteousness and piety.
orig: وقفينا على آثارهم بعيسى ابن مريم مصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وآتيناه الإنجيل فيه هدى ونور ومصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وهدى وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the divine guidance revealed in the Gospel. It instructs the followers of the Gospel to judge their matters based on the teachings and commandments of Allah. Those who fail to do so are considered to be disobedient and defiant in their actions.
orig: وليحكم أهل الإنجيل بما أنزل الله فيه ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: And We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming that which preceded it of the Scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their inclinations away from what has come to you of the truth. To each of you We prescribed a law and a method. Had Allah willed, He would have made you one nation [united in religion], but [He intended] to test you in what He has given you; so race to [all that is] good. To Allah is your return all together, and He will [then] inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine revelation of the Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a confirmation of the previous Scriptures and a criterion of truth. It instructs the Prophet to judge in accordance with what has been revealed by Allah in the Qur'an and not to be swayed by the desires and inclinations of others. The verse also highlights the diversity in laws and paths prescribed to different communities by Allah, with the reminder that unity in religion was within Allah's power but that diversity exists as a test for humankind. The emphasis is on doing good deeds and racing towards righteousness, while underscoring that ultimately, all will return to Allah and He will clarify the differences that existed among people.
orig: وأنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق مصدقا لما بين يديه من الكتاب ومهيمنا عليه فاحكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم عما جاءك من الحق لكل جعلنا منكم شرعة ومنهاجا ولو شاء الله لجعلكم أمة واحدة ولكن ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم فاستبقوا الخيرات إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And judge between them by what Allah has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations and beware lest they tempt you away from some of what Allah has revealed to you. And if they turn away - then know that Allah only intends to afflict them with some of their sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the guidance of Allah in making judgments and decisions, rather than following human desires or inclinations. It also serves as a warning against being influenced or tempted by others to deviate from the teachings of Allah. If people choose to reject the guidance given by Allah, they will face the consequences of their actions. The verse highlights the prevalence of disobedience among people and the need to stay steadfast in upholding the divine commandments.
orig: وأن احكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم واحذرهم أن يفتنوك عن بعض ما أنزل الله إليك فإن تولوا فاعلم أنما يريد الله أن يصيبهم ببعض ذنوبهم وإن كثيرا من الناس لفاسقون

translation: But do they desire a judgment of ignorance? But who is better than Allah in judgment for a people who are certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse questions those who seek to follow the judgment of the days of ignorance before Islam, highlighting the superiority of Allah's judgment. It emphasizes that Allah's rulings are the best for those who have firm faith and certainty in Him.
orig: أفحكم الجاهلية يبغون ومن أحسن من الله حكما لقوم يوقنون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers not to form close alliances or friendships with those who hold beliefs and values contradictory to Islam, such as the Jews and Christians. It emphasizes the importance of being cautious about the relationships we build and highlights the idea of loyalty and unity among the believers. By warning against taking disbelievers as close allies, the verse underscores the significance of preserving one's faith and not aligning oneself with those who may lead them away from the path of righteousness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا اليهود والنصارى أولياء بعضهم أولياء بعض ومن يتولهم منكم فإنه منهم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: So you see those in whose hearts is disease hastening into [association with] them, saying, 'We are afraid a misfortune may strike us.' But perhaps Allah will bring conquest or a decision from Him, and they will become, over what they have been concealing within themselves, regretful.
interpretation: This verse describes those who harbor doubt and hypocrisy in their hearts. They express fear that some calamity may befall them due to their actions but continue to indulge in sinful behavior. The verse suggests that even though they may escape immediate consequences, Allah may bring about a revelation or decree that will lead them to remorse and regret for their hidden intentions and deeds.
orig: فترى الذين في قلوبهم مرض يسارعون فيهم يقولون نخشى أن تصيبنا دائرة فعسى الله أن يأتي بالفتح أو أمر من عنده فيصبحوا على ما أسروا في أنفسهم نادمين

translation: And those who have believed say, 'Are these the ones who swore by Allah their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?' Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceitfulness of the hypocrites who claim to support the believers but actually work against them. Despite their strong oaths and claims of allegiance, their true intentions are revealed through their actions, rendering their deeds meaningless and leading them to ultimate loss in front of Allah.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا أهؤلاء الذين أقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم إنهم لمعكم حبطت أعمالهم فأصبحوا خاسرين

translation: O you who have believed, whoever of you should revert from his religion - Allah will bring forth [in place of them] a people He will love and who will love Him [who are] humble toward the believers, powerful against the disbelievers; they strive in the cause of Allah and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the seriousness of apostasy and highlights the concept of replacement in faith. It conveys that individuals who abandon or change their faith will be replaced by others whom Allah loves and who remain steadfast in their belief, loyal to fellow believers, strong against disbelievers, and committed to striving in the path of Allah without fear of criticism. The verse also points out that the favor and selection of individuals is solely in the hands of Allah, who is all-encompassing and all-knowing.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا من يرتد منكم عن دينه فسوف يأتي الله بقوم يحبهم ويحبونه أذلة على المؤمنين أعزة على الكافرين يجاهدون في سبيل الله ولا يخافون لومة لائم ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: Indeed, your ally is [only] Allah and His Messenger and those who have believed - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they bow [in worship].
interpretation: This verse highlights the criteria for being considered an ally of Allah and His Messenger. It emphasizes that true believers are those who not only have faith but also fulfill their religious duties, such as establishing prayers and giving charity (zakah). By doing so sincerely and humbly ('bowing'), individuals can strengthen their relationship with Allah and His Messenger.
orig: إنما وليكم الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم راكعون

translation: And whoever takes Allah, His Messenger, and those who have believed as allies - indeed, the party of Allah will be the predominant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being steadfast in faith and aligning oneself with Allah, His Messenger, and the believers. It assures that those who stand by Allah, His Messenger, and the believers will ultimately prevail. The verse encourages believers to remain firm in their faith and trust in Allah's support and victory.
orig: ومن يتول الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا فإن حزب الله هم الغالبون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those who have taken your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you and the disbelievers. And fear Allah, if you should [truly] be believers.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against forming close relationships with those who mock or make fun of their religion, whether they are from previous communities who were given scriptures or from those who do not believe. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining one's faith and being cautious of the company kept, advising to fear Allah and uphold faith sincerely.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا الذين اتخذوا دينكم هزوا ولعبا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم والكفار أولياء واتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And when you call to prayer, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of taking the call to prayer seriously and reverently. It criticizes those who mock or make fun of the prayer call, emphasizing that such behavior stems from their lack of understanding and wisdom. The verse serves as a reminder to approach matters of worship with sincerity and respect.
orig: وإذا ناديتم إلى الصلاة اتخذوها هزوا ولعبا ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعقلون

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except [for the fact] that we have believed in Allah and what was revealed to us and what was revealed before and because most of you are defiantly disobedient?"
interpretation: This verse is calling out to the People of the Scripture, referring to the Jews and Christians, questioning their animosity towards the Muslims. The verse points out that the core reason for this resentment is the Muslims' belief in Allah and the revelations given to them, alongside the disobedient behavior of many among the People of the Scripture. The verse highlights the importance of faith and understanding as a basis for relations among different religious communities.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب هل تنقمون منا إلا أن آمنا بالله وما أنزل إلينا وما أنزل من قبل وأن أكثركم فاسقون

translation: Say, 'Shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that as penalty from Allah? [It is that of] those whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry and made of them apes and pigs and slaves of Taghut. Those are worse in position and further astray from the sound way.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the severe punishment that those who have earned the anger and curse of Allah will face. They are compared to apes, pigs, and slaves of Taghut (false deities). This verse serves as a warning about the consequences of straying from the righteous path and the gravity of incurring Allah's wrath.
orig: قل هل أنبئكم بشر من ذلك مثوبة عند الله من لعنه الله وغضب عليه وجعل منهم القردة والخنازير وعبد الطاغوت أولئك شر مكانا وأضل عن سواء السبيل

translation: And when they come to you, they say, 'We believe,' while they have entered with disbelief [in their hearts], and they have certainly left with it. And Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of hypocrisy, where individuals may outwardly claim to be believers but conceal disbelief in their hearts. Allah, being All-Knowing, is fully aware of the truth that is hidden within one's heart, emphasizing the importance of sincerity and genuine faith in Islam.
orig: وإذا جاءوكم قالوا آمنا وقد دخلوا بالكفر وهم قد خرجوا به والله أعلم بما كانوا يكتمون

translation: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and the devouring of [what is] unlawful. How wretched is what they have been doing!
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the tendency of some people to rush into committing sins, transgressions, and consuming forbidden things. It emphasizes the destructive nature of such actions and condemns the behavior of those who engage in them.
orig: وترى كثيرا منهم يسارعون في الإثم والعدوان وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يعملون

translation: If it were not that the religious scholars and the priests prohibit them from indulging in sinful speech and consuming unlawful earnings, indeed, their deeds would be forlorn.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of religious scholars and leaders in guiding people away from sin and unethical practices. It highlights the role of these spiritual guides in maintaining the moral fabric of society and preventing people from engaging in wrongful acts. Without their guidance, people may be more inclined to commit sins and engage in immoral behavior.
orig: لولا ينهاهم الربانيون والأحبار عن قولهم الإثم وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يصنعون

translation: And the Jews say, 'The hand of Allah is chained.' Chained are their hands, and cursed are they for what they say. Rather, both His hands are extended; He spends however He wills. And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. And We have cast among them animosity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. Every time they kindled the fire of war, Allah extinguished it. And they strive throughout the land [causing] corruption. And Allah does not like corrupters.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the Jews who claimed that Allah's hands are tied, implying His inability to act or help. The verse refutes this claim by asserting that Allah's power and capability are limitless and that He can do as He pleases. The verse also highlights that the rejection and hostility shown by some of the Jews towards the message revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) will only lead to their increase in disobedience and disbelief. Despite their efforts to incite wars and spread corruption, Allah will ultimately thwart their plans and does not support those who cause corruption and mischief.
orig: وقالت اليهود يد الله مغلولة غلت أيديهم ولعنوا بما قالوا بل يداه مبسوطتان ينفق كيف يشاء وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا وألقينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة كلما أوقدوا نارا للحرب أطفأها الله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا والله لا يحب المفسدين

translation: And if only the People of the Scripture had believed and feared Allah, We would have removed from them their misdeeds and admitted them to gardens of pleasure.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of belief and piety before Allah. If the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) truly believed in Allah and were conscious of Him, He would forgive their sins and reward them with eternal paradise. The verse emphasizes that true faith and righteousness are the foundations for salvation and ultimate happiness in the Hereafter.
orig: ولو أن أهل الكتاب آمنوا واتقوا لكفرنا عنهم سيئاتهم ولأدخلناهم جنات النعيم

translation: And if only they upheld [the law of] the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed [provision] from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them are a moderate community, but many of them - evil is that which they do.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of following the divine revelations that came before the Qur'an, such as the Torah and the Gospel. It suggests that if the people adhered to these scriptures and the guidance from their Lord, they would have sustenance and blessings abundantly. It also highlights the presence of a righteous and balanced community among the followers of these scriptures, but acknowledges that many of them have strayed from the righteous path and engaged in wrongful deeds.
orig: ولو أنهم أقاموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليهم من ربهم لأكلوا من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم منهم أمة مقتصدة وكثير منهم ساء ما يعملون

translation: O Messenger, announce everything that has been revealed to you from your Lord. If you do not do so, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to convey all the revelations from Allah to the people, emphasizing the importance of delivering the entire message without omitting anything. It reassures the Prophet of Allah's protection and guidance, warning that those who reject the message will not be guided by Allah.
orig: يا أيها الرسول بلغ ما أنزل إليك من ربك وإن لم تفعل فما بلغت رسالته والله يعصمك من الناس إن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, you are [standing] on nothing until you uphold the Law of the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord." And that which has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in transgression and disbelief. So do not grieve over the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and emphasizes the importance of upholding the teachings of the Torah and the Gospel. It also highlights the divine revelation that has come to them from their Lord. The verse warns that some of them may deviate from the right path and increase in transgression and disbelief. The instruction is to not be saddened by the disbelief of these individuals, as it is a reminder to the believers to remain steadfast in their faith and adherence to the guidance given by Allah.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لستم على شيء حتى تقيموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليكم من ربكم وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا فلا تأس على القوم الكافرين

translation: Indeed, those who have believed, the Jews, the Sabians, and the Christians - whoever believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that anyone, regardless of their religious background, who believes in Allah, the Last Day, and does good deeds will receive their reward from Allah. It highlights the inclusivity of Islam and how righteousness is not limited to a specific group of people, but is open to all who believe in Him and do good deeds.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئون والنصارى من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: We did indeed make a covenant with the Children of Israel and sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a group of them they belied, and a group they killed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the response of the Children of Israel to the messengers sent to them by God. It reveals that despite the covenant they had with God, some among them chose to reject the message brought by the messengers, and others even went to the extreme of killing some of the messengers. This serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience, even when faced with clear signs and messages from God.
orig: لقد أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل وأرسلنا إليهم رسلا كلما جاءهم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسهم فريقا كذبوا وفريقا يقتلون

translation: And they thought there would be no [resulting] punishment, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allah turned to them in forgiveness; yet many of them became blind and deaf again. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of people's denial of God's signs and warnings. Some may initially repent and seek forgiveness, but ultimately revert to their heedlessness and disbelief. The verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of all that humans do, including their innermost intentions and actions.
orig: وحسبوا ألا تكون فتنة فعموا وصموا ثم تاب الله عليهم ثم عموا وصموا كثير منهم والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve have said, 'Allah is the Messiah, son of Maryam.' The Messiah said, 'O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' Verily, whosoever sets up partners with Allah, then Allah has forbidden Paradise for him, and the Fire will be his abode. And for the wrongdoers, there are no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the oneness of Allah and condemns the belief that Allah can have offspring or be part of a Trinity. It highlights that even Prophet Isa (Jesus), upon him be peace, emphasized the worship of Allah alone. Associating partners with Allah is considered a grave sin that leads to exclusion from Paradise and residence in Hell. It also conveys the message that wrongdoers will have no one to assist or protect them in the Hereafter.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم وقال المسيح يا بني إسرائيل اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم إنه من يشرك بالله فقد حرم الله عليه الجنة ومأواه النار وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: Those who say that Allah is the third of three are certainly disbelievers. There is no god but one God. If they do not desist from what they say, a painful punishment will surely befall those of them who disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and refutes the belief in the Trinity, stating that Allah is the only true deity. It warns those who associate partners with Allah of a severe punishment if they do not stop their disbelief and return to the belief in the oneness of Allah.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله ثالث ثلاثة وما من إله إلا إله واحد وإن لم ينتهوا عما يقولون ليمسن الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: Will they not repent to Allah and seek His forgiveness? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of repentance and seeking forgiveness from Allah. It emphasizes that no matter what mistakes or sins a person has committed, they can always turn to Allah in repentance and seek His forgiveness, as Allah is ready to forgive and show mercy to those who sincerely seek His pardon.
orig: أفلا يتوبون إلى الله ويستغفرونه والله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messiah, son of Mary, was no more than a messenger; many were the messengers that passed away before him. His mother was a woman of truth. They both had to eat their [daily] food. See how Allah does make His signs clear to them; yet see in what ways they are deluded away from the truth!
interpretation: This verse highlights the status of Jesus, who is recognized as a messenger of God, just like many other messengers who came before him. It also emphasizes the humanity of Jesus and his mother, Mary, by mentioning their need to eat food.
