The verse challenges the misconceptions and delusions of those who deny the signs and truths that God presents to them through his messengers.
orig: ما المسيح ابن مريم إلا رسول قد خلت من قبله الرسل وأمه صديقة كانا يأكلان الطعام انظر كيف نبين لهم الآيات ثم انظر أنى يؤفكون

translation: Say, "Do you worship besides Allah that which holds for you no [power of] harm or benefit while it is Allah who is the Hearing, the Knowing?"
interpretation: This verse questions why people would worship other than Allah, who has complete control over harm and benefit, unlike any other entity. It highlights that Allah is the All-Hearing and All-Knowing, urging the believers to place their trust and worship solely in Him.
orig: قل أتعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لكم ضرا ولا نفعا والله هو السميع العليم

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do not exceed limits in your religion beyond the truth and do not follow the inclinations of a people who had gone astray before and misled many and have strayed from the soundness of the way."
interpretation: This verse advises the People of the Scripture, which includes Jews and Christians, to adhere to the true teachings of their religion and not to exaggerate or go beyond what is genuine. It warns against blindly following the misguided beliefs or practices of those who deviated from the right path in the past, emphasizing the importance of staying on the correct and balanced path of faith.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لا تغلوا في دينكم غير الحق ولا تتبعوا أهواء قوم قد ضلوا من قبل وأضلوا كثيرا وضلوا عن سواء السبيل

translation: Those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel were cursed by the tongue of David and of Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and transgressed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of disobedience and transgression in the context of the Children of Israel. It emphasizes that those who disbelieved were cursed by prophets like David and Jesus due to their defiance against what they were commanded, indicating that disobedience leads to being deprived of blessings and being subjected to divine punishment.
orig: لعن الذين كفروا من بني إسرائيل على لسان داوود وعيسى ابن مريم ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: They used not to prevent one another from the evil they committed. How vile was that which they used to do!
interpretation: This verse highlights the wrongdoing of people who not only commit evil themselves but also fail to stop others from committing evil. It condemns the lack of moral responsibility and initiative in preventing or speaking out against wrong actions. It serves as a reminder of the importance of discouraging and actively working against evil deeds in society.
orig: كانوا لا يتناهون عن منكر فعلوه لبئس ما كانوا يفعلون

translation: You see many of them taking the disbelievers as their allies. How wretched is that which they have put forth for themselves, that Allah is angry with them, and in the punishment they will abide eternally.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of believers befriending disbelievers and prioritizing their relationships over their faith. It warns of the negative outcomes that await those who choose to align themselves with the enemies of belief, emphasizing the eternal punishment awaiting them in the Hereafter due to their choices. The verse serves as a reminder to prioritize one's faith and not compromise it for worldly allegiances.
orig: ترى كثيرا منهم يتولون الذين كفروا لبئس ما قدمت لهم أنفسهم أن سخط الله عليهم وفي العذاب هم خالدون

translation: And if they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and in what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights that true belief in Allah, the Prophet, and the revealed scriptures should prevent people from forming alliances with those who oppose the teachings of Islam. It also emphasizes the importance of not following the ways of those who openly disobey God.
orig: ولو كانوا يؤمنون بالله والنبي وما أنزل إليه ما اتخذوهم أولياء ولكن كثيرا منهم فاسقون

translation: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers [to be] the Jews and those who associate others with Allah; and you will find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say, 'We are Christians.' That is because among them are priests and monks, and because they are not arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity of relationships between different faith communities. It mentions that some of the Jews and polytheists may show animosity towards the believers (Muslims), while on the other hand, it acknowledges that some Christians may exhibit affection towards the believers. The reason given for the latter is their humility and the presence of priests and monks among them. It emphasizes the importance of humility and kindness in fostering positive interfaith relations.
orig: لتجدن أشد الناس عداوة للذين آمنوا اليهود والذين أشركوا ولتجدن أقربهم مودة للذين آمنوا الذين قالوا إنا نصارى ذلك بأن منهم قسيسين ورهبانا وأنهم لا يستكبرون

translation: And when they hear what has been sent down to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth. They say, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the emotional and spiritual impact that the Quran had on the early believers. It signifies the profound recognition of truth and faith that lead them to display deep emotion, humility, and a desire to be counted amongst the faithful witnesses. The verse emphasizes the importance of true belief and the readiness to bear witness to one's faith.
orig: وإذا سمعوا ما أنزل إلى الرسول ترى أعينهم تفيض من الدمع مما عرفوا من الحق يقولون ربنا آمنا فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And why should we not believe in Allah and in what has come to us of the truth? And we aspire that our Lord will admit us [to Paradise] with the righteous people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in Allah and following the truth that has been revealed. It highlights the aspiration of believers to be admitted to Paradise among the righteous people, showing the ultimate goal and desire of the faithful to be in the company of the pious and virtuous in the Hereafter.
orig: وما لنا لا نؤمن بالله وما جاءنا من الحق ونطمع أن يدخلنا ربنا مع القوم الصالحين

translation: So Allah rewarded them for what they said with gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the reward that Allah gives to those who do good deeds and speak righteously. It promises them gardens in Paradise with flowing rivers where they will dwell forever, emphasizing that this eternal bliss is the compensation for their righteous actions.
orig: فأثابهم الله بما قالوا جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: And those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those will be the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of disbelief and denial of the signs of Allah. It serves as a warning to those who reject the truth and ignore the signs of Allah's existence and power. The verse highlights that those who choose to disbelieve will face the punishment of Hellfire in the Hereafter, emphasizing the importance of faith and belief in the signs of Allah.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to not forbid themselves from consuming the lawful things that Allah has permitted for them. It also warns against transgressing the boundaries set by Allah, as He does not approve of those who exceed the limits and commit wrongful actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تحرموا طيبات ما أحل الله لكم ولا تعتدوا إن الله لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to consume only that which is permissible (halal) and pure (tayyib) from the sustenance provided by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of being conscious of Allah and adhering to His commandments, especially in matters related to what we consume. By being mindful of the source of our sustenance and following Allah's guidelines, believers demonstrate their faith and obedience to Him.
orig: وكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله الذي أنتم به مؤمنون

translation: Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your [own] families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find [or afford it] - then a fast of three days [is required]. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of honoring one's commitments and oaths, emphasizing that keeping one's word is a serious matter. It outlines the expiation required for breaking oaths, which includes feeding the needy, clothing them, or freeing a slave, or fasting for three days if one is unable to fulfill the other options. The verse also reminds believers to be careful with their promises and to show gratitude for Allah's guidance.
orig: لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما عقدتم الأيمان فكفارته إطعام عشرة مساكين من أوسط ما تطعمون أهليكم أو كسوتهم أو تحرير رقبة فمن لم يجد فصيام ثلاثة أيام ذلك كفارة أيمانكم إذا حلفتم واحفظوا أيمانكم كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تشكرون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allah], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an advises believers to stay away from intoxicants, gambling, idol worship, and divination as these are impure and from Satan's influence. By avoiding these actions, believers strive for success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما الخمر والميسر والأنصاب والأزلام رجس من عمل الشيطان فاجتنبوه لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Indeed, Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of Allah and from prayer. So will you not desist?
interpretation: This verse highlights the insidious tactics of Satan to sow discord among people by promoting animosity and hatred through indulgence in intoxicants and gambling. These vices distract individuals from remembering Allah and performing prayers, thus leading them away from righteousness. The verse serves as a reminder to stay vigilant against temptations and to prioritize spirituality and unity over worldly desires fanned by Satan.
orig: إنما يريد الشيطان أن يوقع بينكم العداوة والبغضاء في الخمر والميسر ويصدكم عن ذكر الله وعن الصلاة فهل أنتم منتهون

translation: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and following the teachings of the Messenger, may peace be upon him. It warns the believers of the consequences of turning away from the guidance provided by Allah and His Messenger. It also underscores that the Messenger's duty is only to convey the message clearly, and the ultimate decision lies with the individuals themselves.
orig: وأطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول واحذروا فإن توليتم فاعلموا أنما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين

translation: There is no blame upon those who believe and do righteous deeds for what they have eaten [in the past] if they [now] fear Allah and believe and do righteous deeds, and then fear Allah and believe, and then fear Allah and do good; and Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of continuous improvement and repentance in the life of a believer. It highlights that if one has sinned in the past but sincerely repents, fears Allah, believes, and does good deeds, they will not be held accountable for their previous sins. It also shows that Allah appreciates and loves those who strive to do good and improve themselves spiritually.
orig: ليس على الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جناح فيما طعموا إذا ما اتقوا وآمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ثم اتقوا وآمنوا ثم اتقوا وأحسنوا والله يحب المحسنين

translation: O you who have believed, Allah will surely test you through some game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that Allah may make evident those who fear Him unseen. And whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers that they will be tested by Allah through various means, including the lawful hunting of animals. The purpose of this test is to distinguish those who truly fear Allah even when they are not being watched. Those who exceed the limits set by Allah will face severe consequences.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ليبلونكم الله بشيء من الصيد تناله أيديكم ورماحكم ليعلم الله من يخافه بالغيب فمن اعتدى بعد ذلك فله عذاب أليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of ihram. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two just men among you as an offering [to Allah] delivered to the Ka'bah, or an expiation: the feeding of needy people or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his deed. Allah has pardoned what is past, but whoever returns [to violation], then Allah will take retribution from him. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
interpretation: This verse highlights the sanctity of life and the prohibition of killing game while in the state of ihram (the state of ritual consecration during Hajj or Umrah). It sets out the consequences for intentionally violating this prohibition and emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and making restitution. It serves as a reminder of the responsibility Muslims have towards all living creatures and the importance of respecting the sanctity of life.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقتلوا الصيد وأنتم حرم ومن قتله منكم متعمدا فجزاء مثل ما قتل من النعم يحكم به ذوا عدل منكم هديا بالغ الكعبة أو كفارة طعام مساكين أو عدل ذلك صياما ليذوق وبال أمره عفا الله عما سلف ومن عاد فينتقم الله منه والله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: He has made lawful for you the game of the sea and its food, a provision for you and for the travelers, but forbidden to you is the game of the land as long as you are in the state of ihram. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is a reminder of the lawful and unlawful acts related to hunting animals while in the state of ihram during the pilgrimage. It allows the consumption of seafood and its game as a provision for sustenance, but prohibits hunting land animals during this sacred period. The verse emphasizes the importance of being mindful of Allah's commands and being aware of the boundaries set by Him, as one day all will be gathered before Allah for judgment.
orig: أحل لكم صيد البحر وطعامه متاعا لكم وللسيارة وحرم عليكم صيد البر ما دمتم حرما واتقوا الله الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: Allah has made the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, standing for the people, and [has sanctified] the sacred month and the sacrificial animals and the garlands [by which they are identified]. That is so you may know that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and that Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the significance of the Ka'bah, the sacred month, and the rituals associated with Hajj as symbols of unity, reverence, and obedience to Allah. It highlights the omniscience of Allah, His knowledge extending over all realms, and serves as a reminder for believers to be conscious of Allah's wisdom and authority over everything.
orig: جعل الله الكعبة البيت الحرام قياما للناس والشهر الحرام والهدي والقلائد ذلك لتعلموا أن الله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وأن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Know that Allah is severe in punishment and that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse informs us of two key aspects of Allah's nature: His severity in punishment for those who commit wrongdoings and His boundless forgiveness and mercy for those who seek His forgiveness. It serves as a reminder for believers to stay on the right path and seek forgiveness from Allah, as well as to never lose hope in His mercy.
orig: اعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب وأن الله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messenger's duty is only to convey the message; and Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the primary responsibility of the Messenger (Prophet Muhammad) which is to deliver the message of Islam to the people. It also reassures that Allah is fully aware of everything that is apparent to us and everything that we hide within ourselves, indicating the omniscience and knowledge of God.
orig: ما على الرسول إلا البلاغ والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

translation: Say, 'Not equal are the evil and the good, although the abundance of evil might impress you. So fear Allah, O you of understanding, that you may be successful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the distinction between good and evil, asserting that they are not equal. Even if evil might seem abundant or attractive, believers are reminded to fear Allah and to use their understanding and intelligence to discern between right and wrong. By choosing the path of righteousness and obedience to Allah, success in this life and the Hereafter is promised.
orig: قل لا يستوي الخبيث والطيب ولو أعجبك كثرة الخبيث فاتقوا الله يا أولي الألباب لعلكم تفلحون

translation: O you who have believed, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Qur'an is being revealed, they will be shown to you. Allah has pardoned that which has passed; and Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse advises the believers not to ask about intricate, difficult matters unless absolutely necessary, as being too curious about unclear matters may lead to unnecessary distress. However, if there is a genuine need to seek clarification and knowledge, it is better to ask when the Qur'an is being revealed, as that is when guidance and answers are provided. The verse reassures that Allah is Forgiving and Patient, willing to forgive previous mistakes or misunderstandings. It highlights the importance of being patient and trusting in Allah's mercy and wisdom.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تسألوا عن أشياء إن تبد لكم تسؤكم وإن تسألوا عنها حين ينزل القرآن تبد لكم عفا الله عنها والله غفور حليم

translation: Indeed, a people before you asked for this concept and then they turned disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of ingratitude and disbelief in previous nations who had been given similar blessings and guidance. It serves as a reminder that seeking knowledge without humility and gratitude can lead to rejection of truth.
orig: قد سألها قوم من قبلكم ثم أصبحوا بها كافرين

translation: Allah has not appointed any Bahirah or Sa'ibah or Wasilah or Ham prohibited; but those who disbelieve fabricate lies against Allah, and most of them do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has not made certain animals or aspects of nature inherently sacred or forbidden, but it is the disbelievers who fabricate falsehoods about Allah. The verse highlights the lack of reason and understanding in those who deny the truth and attribute falsehood to Allah.
orig: ما جعل الله من بحيرة ولا سائبة ولا وصيلة ولا حام ولكن الذين كفروا يفترون على الله الكذب وأكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the attitude of hypocrisy where some individuals claim to follow the faith but in reality turn away from the teachings of Allah and His Messenger. They use the excuse that they are following the ways of their ancestors, even though their ancestors may have been misguided. The verse highlights the importance of following the true guidance of Allah and the Messenger rather than blindly adhering to traditions that may lead one astray.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله وإلى الرسول قالوا حسبنا ما وجدنا عليه آباءنا أولو كان آباؤهم لا يعلمون شيئا ولا يهتدون

translation: O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. To Allah is your return all together; then He will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to take responsibility for their own actions and decisions. It reassures them that those who are misguided will not affect them once they have found guidance. It emphasizes that all individuals will ultimately return to Allah, who will then inform them of their deeds. The verse serves as a call to self-reflection and accountability, encouraging believers to stay on the right path and seek guidance from Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا عليكم أنفسكم لا يضركم من ضل إذا اهتديتم إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, when death approaches one of you, if you leave a will, take as witnesses two just men from among you or two others from outside if you are traveling through the land and the disaster of death befalls you. Detain them after the prayer. And if you doubt, then let them swear by Allah that, 'We will not exchange our oath for a price, even if he should be a near relative, and we will not conceal the testimony of Allah, for then indeed we would be of the sinful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having witnesses when making a will or testament, especially in cases of imminent death. The witnesses should be just and trustworthy individuals. They are to be called upon to give their testimony after the deceased's prayer, and they must swear by Allah that they will not conceal the truth or exchange their testimony for any price or personal gain. This directive is meant to ensure the fair distribution of wealth and the protection of the rights of all involved parties.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا شهادة بينكم إذا حضر أحدكم الموت حين الوصية اثنان ذوا عدل منكم أو آخران من غيركم إن أنتم ضربتم في الأرض فأصابتكم مصيبة الموت تحبسونهما من بعد الصلاة فيقسمان بالله إن ارتبتم لا نشتري به ثمنا ولو كان ذا قربى ولا نكتم شهادة الله إنا إذا لمن الآثمين

translation: So if it is found that both hold guilt, then two others shall stand in their place from among those who have a claim against them, and they shall swear by Allah, 'Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed. Indeed, then we would be of the unjust.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of justice in resolving conflicts. When two parties are in dispute and both are found guilty, two others should come forward as witnesses to give their testimony, making an oath by Allah to uphold the truth. This process ensures fairness and prevents any injustice from taking place.
orig: فإن عثر على أنهما استحقا إثما فآخران يقومان مقامهما من الذين استحق عليهم الأوليان فيقسمان بالله لشهادتنا أحق من شهادتهما وما اعتدينا إنا إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: That is more suitable that they should give testimony according to its [true] objective, or [at least] fear that [other] oaths will be asked of them. And fear Allah and listen; and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of giving truthful testimony when bearing witness, or at the very least, ensuring that one's oaths are made sincerely. It reminds believers to be conscious of Allah, heed His commands, and refrain from deceit and disobedience. The verse also serves as a warning against the consequences of acting sinfully and losing guidance.
orig: ذلك أدنى أن يأتوا بالشهادة على وجهها أو يخافوا أن ترد أيمان بعد أيمانهم واتقوا الله واسمعوا والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: On the Day when Allah will gather the messengers and say, 'What was the response you received?' They will say, 'We have no knowledge. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.'
interpretation: This verse depicts a scene on the Day of Judgment where Allah will gather all the messengers and question them about the responses they received from their people. The messengers will humbly acknowledge their lack of knowledge about the ultimate outcomes of their efforts, recognizing that Allah alone has complete knowledge of the unseen and all hidden matters.
orig: يوم يجمع الله الرسل فيقول ماذا أجبتم قالوا لا علم لنا إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: When Allah said, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother when I supported you with the Pure Spirit and you spoke to the people in the cradle and in maturity. And when I taught you writing, wisdom, the Torah, and the Gospel. And when you designed from clay [what was] like the form of a bird with My permission, and then you breathed into it, and it became a bird with My permission. And you healed the blind and the leper with My permission, and you brought forth the dead with My permission. And [remember] when I restrained the Children of Israel from [killing] you when you came to them with clear proofs, and those who disbelieved among them said, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights some of the miracles and favors bestowed upon Jesus, the son of Mary, by Allah. It describes how Jesus was supported by the Holy Spirit, given knowledge and wisdom, and performed various miracles such as bringing the dead back to life, healing the blind and the leper, and creating a bird from clay. Despite these clear signs, some disbelievers attributed his miracles to magic, demonstrating the importance of faith and belief in recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم اذكر نعمتي عليك وعلى والدتك إذ أيدتك بروح القدس تكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا وإذ علمتك الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل وإذ تخلق من الطين كهيئة الطير بإذني فتنفخ فيها فتكون طيرا بإذني وتبرئ الأكمه والأبرص بإذني وإذ تخرج الموتى بإذني وإذ كففت بني إسرائيل عنك إذ جئتهم بالبينات فقال الذين كفروا منهم إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And [remember] when I inspired the disciples, 'Believe in Me and in My Messenger,' they said, 'We have believed; so bear witness that indeed we are Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disciples of Prophet Isa (Jesus), upon whom be peace, affirming their belief in Allah and His Messenger. They declared their faith and submission to the teachings of Islam, which emphasizes surrendering to the will of Allah. It highlights the importance of faith in both Allah and His messengers as a fundamental aspect of being a Muslim.
orig: وإذ أوحيت إلى الحواريين أن آمنوا بي وبرسولي قالوا آمنا واشهد بأننا مسلمون

translation: When the disciples said, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, can your Lord send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven?' [Jesus] said, 'Fear Allah, if you should be believers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a moment when the disciples of Jesus (peace be upon him) asked for a miraculous sign to demonstrate his mission. Jesus redirected their focus back to the importance of faith and piety, emphasizing that true belief requires fear and reverence towards Allah. It serves as a reminder that miracles alone are not the foundation of faith; rather, it is the internal spiritual connection and devotion to God that holds greater significance.
orig: إذ قال الحواريون يا عيسى ابن مريم هل يستطيع ربك أن ينزل علينا مائدة من السماء قال اتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said, 'We wish to eat from it and satisfy our hearts, and know that you have told us the truth and be among the witnesses.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the response of the Children of Israel when Moses and his people asked them to sacrifice a cow. It reflects human nature's tendency to doubt and inquire further even when guidance is clear. The verse shows the importance of faith, trust, and verification in one's beliefs, as well as the desire for certainty and clarity before complying with instructions.
orig: قالوا نريد أن نأكل منها وتطمئن قلوبنا ونعلم أن قد صدقتنا ونكون عليها من الشاهدين

translation: Jesus, the son of Mary, said, 'O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a table [spread with food] from the heaven to be for us a festival for the first of us and the last of us and a sign from You. And provide for us, You are the best of providers.'
interpretation: This verse recounts a prayer by Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) where he appeals to Allah to send down a divine banquet from the heavens as a celebration for his followers, a miraculous sign of Allah's power. The prayer also expresses trust in Allah as the ultimate provider and sustainer.
orig: قال عيسى ابن مريم اللهم ربنا أنزل علينا مائدة من السماء تكون لنا عيدا لأولنا وآخرنا وآية منك وارزقنا وأنت خير الرازقين

translation: Allah said, 'Indeed, I will send it down upon you, but whoever disbelieves after that from among you - then indeed will I punish him with a punishment by which I have not punished anyone among the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of the punishment for those who reject the truth after it has been revealed to them. It serves as a warning that disbelief or turning away from the guidance after having known it will lead to a punishment of a unique and severe nature from Allah, surpassing any punishment inflicted on earlier communities.
orig: قال الله إني منزلها عليكم فمن يكفر بعد منكم فإني أعذبه عذابا لا أعذبه أحدا من العالمين

translation: And when Allah said, 'O Jesus, Son of Mary, did you say to the people, 'Take me and my mother as deities besides Allah?' He said, 'Exalted are You! It was not for me to say that to which I have no right. If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself, and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, it is You who is Knower of the unseen.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates a dialogue between Allah and Jesus, emphasizing the monotheism of Islam. Jesus refutes the false belief of being worshipped alongside Allah and asserts that only Allah has the ultimate knowledge of unseen matters. It highlights the importance of staying true to the oneness of God and acknowledging His supreme knowledge and authority.
orig: وإذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم أأنت قلت للناس اتخذوني وأمي إلهين من دون الله قال سبحانك ما يكون لي أن أقول ما ليس لي بحق إن كنت قلته فقد علمته تعلم ما في نفسي ولا أعلم ما في نفسك إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: I said not to them except what You commanded me - to worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I remained among them; but when You took me up, You were the Observer over them, and You are, over all things, Witness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble submission of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) to the commandments and guidance from Allah. He clarifies that he only conveyed the message that Allah commanded him to, which was to call people to worship Allah, the Lord of all. It also reflects the concept of divine oversight and Allah's continuous observation over His creation, even after the physical departure of Prophets.
orig: ما قلت لهم إلا ما أمرتني به أن اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم وكنت عليهم شهيدا ما دمت فيهم فلما توفيتني كنت أنت الرقيب عليهم وأنت على كل شيء شهيد

translation: If You punish them, indeed they are Your servants, but if You forgive them, indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah in dealing with His servants. It reminds believers that they are ultimately under the authority and control of Allah. It highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah, urging believers to seek His forgiveness and highlighting His ultimate wisdom in all matters.
orig: إن تعذبهم فإنهم عبادك وإن تغفر لهم فإنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: Allah will say, 'This is the Day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness.' For them are gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when those who were truthful in their faith and deeds will benefit from their sincerity. They will be rewarded with eternal gardens in Paradise, where they will dwell forever. Allah's pleasure with them and their satisfaction with Allah will be the ultimate success and achievement for them.
orig: قال الله هذا يوم ينفع الصادقين صدقهم لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is in them, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all dominion and sovereignty belong to Allah alone. He is the All-Powerful and All-Capable, with authority over everything in the heavens and the earth. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's supreme power and control over all creation, highlighting His ability to do as He wills and His competence in managing every aspect of the universe.
orig: لله ملك السماوات والأرض وما فيهن وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: All praise is due to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Yet those who disbelieve equate others with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and majesty of Allah as the Creator of the universe, who has control over both darkness and light. It emphasizes that despite clear signs of His existence and Oneness, there are those who reject the truth and associate partners with Allah. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing and acknowledging the oneness of Allah and not falling into disbelief or associating others with Him.
orig: الحمد لله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وجعل الظلمات والنور ثم الذين كفروا بربهم يعدلون

translation: He it is who created you from clay, and then decreed a term (of life), and a term (is fixed) with Him. Yet you doubt.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah in creating human beings from clay, determining their lifespan, and setting a fixed time for their existence. It reminds us of the divine plan and the certainty of appointed time for every individual, urging us to have faith in Allah's ultimate wisdom and not to doubt His decree.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من طين ثم قضى أجلا وأجل مسمى عنده ثم أنتم تمترون

translation: And He is Allah in the heavens and on the earth. He knows your secret and what you make public, and He knows what you earn.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipresence and omniscience of Allah, emphasizing that He is aware of everything that happens in the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder that Allah knows our hidden thoughts and intentions as well as our public actions, and He is fully aware of everything we do and earn. This verse encourages believers to be conscious of Allah's constant watch and accountability, urging them to strive for sincere intentions and righteous deeds in all aspects of their lives.
orig: وهو الله في السماوات وفي الأرض يعلم سركم وجهركم ويعلم ما تكسبون

translation: And they do not come to them of any of the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the heedlessness of those who ignore and turn away from the signs of Allah that are presented to them. It serves as a reminder that some people, despite being shown clear signs and guidance from their Lord, choose to ignore them out of arrogance or ignorance.
orig: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين

translation: They have indeed denied the truth when it has come to them. So they will soon come to know the consequences of what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of denying the truth and mocking the beliefs sent by Allah. It warns that those who choose to ignore or belittle the messages of truth will eventually face the outcomes of their actions and be shown the reality they chose to ignore.
orig: فقد كذبوا بالحق لما جاءهم فسوف يأتيهم أنباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Have they not seen how many generations before them We destroyed, whom We had established in the land as We have not established you, and We sent rain from the sky upon them in abundance, and We made rivers flow beneath them. Then We destroyed them for their sins and produced after them a generation of others.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the accountability for one's actions. It highlights the fate of past generations who were destroyed due to their sins, emphasizing the importance of faithfulness and righteousness. Furthermore, it draws attention to the cycle of creation and destruction, showcasing Allah's power to establish and remove civilizations based on their actions.
orig: ألم يروا كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من قرن مكناهم في الأرض ما لم نمكن لكم وأرسلنا السماء عليهم مدرارا وجعلنا الأنهار تجري من تحتهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: And if We had sent down to you a book inscribed on pages and they touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would still have said, 'This is nothing but manifest magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the disbelief and stubbornness of those who refuse to believe, suggesting that no matter how clear the signs and revelations may be, some people will always find excuses to deny the truth. It illustrates how faithless individuals would resort to rejecting clear evidence by attributing it to magic or tricks, rather than accepting the message and guidance provided in the Book.
orig: ولو نزلنا عليك كتابا في قرطاس فلمسوه بأيديهم لقال الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And they say: 'Why was not an angel sent down to him?' If We did send down an angel the matter would be settled at once, and no respite would be granted them.
interpretation: This verse addresses the disbelievers who questioned why a human messenger was sent instead of an angel. The verse asserts that if an angel was sent, the decree would be immediately established with no opportunity for people to repent or change their ways. It highlights the wisdom behind sending human messengers, allowing time and opportunity for people to reflect, repent, and make choices in their lives.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه ملك ولو أنزلنا ملكا لقضي الأمر ثم لا ينظرون

translation: And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that Allah has the power to create or make someone any form He wills. Even if Allah had chosen to send prophets in the form of angels, He could have made them appear as humans to maintain the natural order. It further emphasizes that Allah has complete control over all things, including the ability to conceal or reveal His signs as He deems fit.
orig: ولو جعلناه ملكا لجعلناه رجلا وللبسنا عليهم ما يلبسون

translation: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequence of mocking and ridiculing the messengers of God. It warns that those who mock or belittle the messengers of God will eventually face the consequences of their actions. It highlights the importance of showing respect to the messengers and their message, as disregarding or mocking them can lead to dire consequences.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say, "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those who denied."
interpretation: This verse is a call to reflection on the consequences faced by those who deny the message of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of contemplating the outcomes of disbelief and disobedience, and emphasizes the inevitability of facing accountability for one's actions.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض ثم انظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: Say, 'To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth?' Say, 'To Allah.' He has decreed upon Himself mercy. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the comprehensive ownership of everything in the heavens and the earth by Allah. It highlights that Allah has ordained mercy upon Himself and that He will gather all people on the Day of Judgment, a day that is certain to come. Those who deny this truth and fail to believe will ultimately bring loss upon themselves.
orig: قل لمن ما في السماوات والأرض قل لله كتب على نفسه الرحمة ليجمعنكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the night and the day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything, whether it is in the darkness of night or the brightness of day, ultimately belongs to Allah. It highlights the all-encompassing knowledge and awareness of Allah, who hears everything and knows everything. It serves as a reminder of Allah's complete authority and presence over all aspects of existence.
orig: وله ما سكن في الليل والنهار وهو السميع العليم

translation: Say, 'Should I take other than Allah as a protector, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?' Say, 'Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allah] and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism and the importance of solely relying on Allah as the ultimate protector and sustainer. It also stresses the significance of being the first to submit to Allah's commands and to steer clear of associating partners with Him in worship.
orig: قل أغير الله أتخذ وليا فاطر السماوات والأرض وهو يطعم ولا يطعم قل إني أمرت أن أكون أول من أسلم ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: Say, "Indeed, I fear if I should disobey my Lord the punishment of a tremendous Day."
interpretation: This verse highlights the fear and reverence a believer should have towards disobeying Allah and the consequences of facing punishment on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of one's actions and seeking forgiveness to avoid the severe punishment that may follow in the afterlife.
orig: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Whoever is saved from the fire and admitted to Paradise has already attained success.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that success is achieved by being saved from the punishment and being admitted to Paradise. It points out that the ultimate success lies in being spared from the Hellfire and entering Paradise in the Hereafter.
orig: من يصرف عنه يومئذ فقد رحمه وذلك الفوز المبين

translation: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the absolute power and control of Allah over all things. It teaches that all hardships and blessings come from Allah, and that only He has the ability to remove hardships or bestow goodness. Therefore, it encourages believers to rely on Allah in times of difficulty and acknowledge His ultimate authority over all things.
orig: وإن يمسسك الله بضر فلا كاشف له إلا هو وإن يمسسك بخير فهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights two important attributes of Allah: His power and wisdom. The verse emphasizes that Allah is dominant over His creation, having complete control and power over His servants. At the same time, it reminds us that Allah is wise and knowledgeable, perfectly aware of everything. This serves as a reminder for believers to submit to Allah's decree and trust in His wisdom, knowing that He is all-wise and all-knowing.
orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: Say, "What is the greatest testimony?" Say, "Allah is witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with Allah there are other deities?" Say, "I will not testify." Say, "Indeed, He is but one God, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and the rejection of associating partners with Him. It highlights the significance of the Qur'an as a means of guidance and a warning to humanity. The verse questions the validity of testifying to the presence of other deities besides Allah, asserting the belief in the Oneness of God and distancing oneself from polytheism.
orig: قل أي شيء أكبر شهادة قل الله شهيد بيني وبينكم وأوحي إلي هذا القرآن لأنذركم به ومن بلغ أئنكم لتشهدون أن مع الله آلهة أخرى قل لا أشهد قل إنما هو إله واحد وإنني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceals the truth while they know [it].
interpretation: This verse points out that some of those who were given the Scripture recognize and acknowledge the truth of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the Qur'an like they know their own children, but out of arrogance or denial, they choose to reject and hide the truth from others even though they are fully aware of it.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعرفونه كما يعرفون أبناءهم الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents lies about Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of inventing lies about Allah or denying His revelations. It underscores the concept that injustice and falsehood will never lead to success or prosperity, emphasizing that those who engage in such wrongful acts will ultimately face consequences and will not achieve true success in this life or the Hereafter.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And [mention] the Day We will gather them all, then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, 'Where are your partners that you used to claim?'
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the Day of Judgment when all people will be gathered together before Allah. On that day, those who associated others with Allah will be asked about the partners they used to worship and claim to be equal to Allah. It serves as a warning against associating partners with Allah and emphasizes the oneness of Allah, highlighting the importance of sincere monotheism in Islam.
orig: ويوم نحشرهم جميعا ثم نقول للذين أشركوا أين شركاؤكم الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: Then their faith could not avail them when they saw Our punishment. [This is] the established way of Allah which has occurred among His servants. And the disbelievers will then be lost.
interpretation: This verse highlights that when disbelievers see the punishment of Allah, their faith will not benefit them. It emphasizes the consequences of rejecting the truth and worshipping other than Allah, stressing that the disbelievers will ultimately face loss and regret for their actions.
orig: ثم لم تكن فتنتهم إلا أن قالوا والله ربنا ما كنا مشركين

translation: See how they have lied against themselves. And lost from them is what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of falsehood and deception. Those who spread lies and fabrications ultimately deceive themselves and lose the truth that they have distorted. It serves as a warning against falsehood and emphasizes the importance of honesty and integrity.
orig: انظر كيف كذبوا على أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have set veils upon their hearts, so they understand it not, and deafness in their ears. If they see every one of the signs, they will not believe in them; to the point that when they come to you to argue with you, those who disbelieve say, 'This is not but legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates that there are some individuals who may listen to the Qur'anic message, but due to the veils on their hearts and the deafness in their ears, they are unable to comprehend its true meaning and significance. Even when presented with clear signs and verses, they choose not to believe. Their disbelief leads them to argue against the truth, dismissing it as mere tales and stories of the past, failing to recognize the wisdom and guidance contained within the Qur'an.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإن يروا كل آية لا يؤمنوا بها حتى إذا جاءوك يجادلونك يقول الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.
interpretation: This verse speaks about those who reject and oppose the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and prevent others from following him. However, in doing so, they are only harming themselves and leading themselves towards destruction, even though they are not aware of the consequences of their actions.
orig: وهم ينهون عنه وينأون عنه وإن يهلكون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And [mention] when they will be made to stand over the Fire, they will say, 'Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord but be among the believers.'
interpretation: This verse depicts a scene where the disbelievers, upon witnessing the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter, regret their disbelief and disobedience. They express a desire to return to life on earth so that they can believe in the signs of their Lord and be among the believers. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and obedience to the signs of Allah in this life before it is too late.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على النار فقالوا يا ليتنا نرد ولا نكذب بآيات ربنا ونكون من المؤمنين

translation: But what they used to hide has [now] become apparent to them. And if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden. And indeed, they are liars.
interpretation: This verse highlights how the truth eventually reveals itself, even if people try to conceal it. It warns that people may continue in their wrongdoing if given another chance, despite knowing it is prohibited. It serves as a reminder that deceit does not go unnoticed, and that falsehood will eventually be exposed.
orig: بل بدا لهم ما كانوا يخفون من قبل ولو ردوا لعادوا لما نهوا عنه وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: And they say, 'There is not but our worldly life; we die and we live, and nothing destroys us except time.' But they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.
interpretation: This verse highlights the materialistic mindset of some individuals who believe that life is limited to the worldly pleasures and pursuits. They are dismissive of the concept of the afterlife and resurrection, thinking that they will neither be held accountable nor receive any consequences for their actions. The verse refutes this false assumption and emphasizes that such individuals lack true knowledge and understanding of the reality of the life after death.
orig: وقالوا إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: And [mention] when they are made to stand before their Lord. He will say, 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He will say, 'Then taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve.'
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where individuals come before their Lord after death. When confronted with the truth, they acknowledge it, but it is too late. Their disbelief and rejection of the truth in the worldly life lead them to face the consequences of their actions in the form of punishment.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على ربهم قال أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Indeed, those who deny the meeting with Allah will have lost. When the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, 'Oh, how we regret that we neglected it,' and they will bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret of those who denied the concept of meeting with Allah and the Day of Resurrection. When the Hour suddenly approaches them, they will deeply regret their denial and the burden of their sins will be heavy upon them. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and negligence towards the ultimate meeting with Allah and the accountability for one's actions.
orig: قد خسر الذين كذبوا بلقاء الله حتى إذا جاءتهم الساعة بغتة قالوا يا حسرتنا على ما فرطنا فيها وهم يحملون أوزارهم على ظهورهم ألا ساء ما يزرون

translation: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah. Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary nature of worldly life, which is filled with distractions and amusements. It contrasts this with the eternal bliss and rewards of the Hereafter for those who are mindful of God and act righteously. The verse encourages reflection and contemplation on the true purpose of life and the importance of prioritizing actions that will benefit one in the Hereafter.
orig: وما الحياة الدنيا إلا لعب ولهو وللدار الآخرة خير للذين يتقون أفلا تعقلون

translation: We know that it grieves you what they say. But they do not lie to you. It is the evildoers who reject the revelations of Allah.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that despite the hurtful words of the disbelievers, they are not lying to him when they reject the message of Allah. It is the wrongdoers and those who deny the signs of Allah who are truly in error. The verse serves as a comforting reassurance to the Prophet, affirming that he is on the right path and that it is the disbelievers who are misguided.
orig: قد نعلم إنه ليحزنك الذي يقولون فإنهم لا يكذبونك ولكن الظالمين بآيات الله يجحدون

translation: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of Allah. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of denial and persecution that prophets before Muhammad (peace be upon him) faced. It emphasizes the importance of patience and perseverance in the face of rejection and harm, knowing that ultimately, Allah's victory will prevail. The verse also underscores the divine protection over the message of Allah, emphasizing that His words are unchangeable. It serves as a reminder to the Prophet Muhammad and to all believers of the struggles faced by previous prophets and the reassurance that the truth will always prevail in the end.
orig: ولقد كذبت رسل من قبلك فصبروا على ما كذبوا وأوذوا حتى أتاهم نصرنا ولا مبدل لكلمات الله ولقد جاءك من نبإ المرسلين

translation: And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you can seek a tunnel into the earth, or a stairway into the sky, to bring them a sign... but if Allah had willed, He would have gathered them upon guidance. So never be among the ignorant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Prophets should persist in conveying the message of guidance to their people, even when they face rejection and opposition. The verse illustrates that even if one were to perform a miraculous act like creating a tunnel in the earth or a ladder to the heavens, the guidance would only be effective if Allah wills it. It reminds the Prophet and believers not to be deterred by the ignorance or disbelief of others, but to remain steadfast in delivering the message entrusted to them, leaving the ultimate guidance in the hands of Allah.
orig: وإن كان كبر عليك إعراضهم فإن استطعت أن تبتغي نفقا في الأرض أو سلما في السماء فتأتيهم بآية ولو شاء الله لجمعهم على الهدى فلا تكونن من الجاهلين

translation: Surely, it is only those who listen that respond. As for the dead, Allah will raise them up, then to Him they will be returned.
interpretation: This verse teaches us that only those who are truly attentive and receptive will respond to the message of God. Just as the dead will be resurrected by Allah, they will eventually return to Him, being accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being mindful and responsive to the guidance and commands of God during our lives.
orig: إنما يستجيب الذين يسمعون والموتى يبعثهم الله ثم إليه يرجعون

translation: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'Indeed, Allah is able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the disbelief of some people who demand to see extraordinary signs from Allah in order to believe. The response emphasizes that Allah has the power to send down signs, but many fail to recognize or understand the signs that are already present in the world around them. It serves as a reminder to reflect on the signs of Allah's existence and power that are evident in nature and in one's own life.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل عليه آية من ربه قل إن الله قادر على أن ينزل آية ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all creatures, whether animals or birds, are communities just like human beings, created by Allah with a purpose. It highlights the meticulous nature of Allah's decrees and that everything is accounted for in His Register. Eventually, all beings will be gathered before their Lord for judgment, reinforcing the concept of accountability and the Day of Resurrection.
orig: وما من دابة في الأرض ولا طائر يطير بجناحيه إلا أمم أمثالكم ما فرطنا في الكتاب من شيء ثم إلى ربهم يحشرون

translation: And those who deny Our signs are deaf and dumb, in darkness. Allah lets go astray whoever He wills and guides whoever He wills onto a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who reject the signs of Allah are spiritually blind and deaf, living in ignorance and darkness. Allah allows those who disobey Him to go astray while guiding those whom He pleases onto the right path. This serves as a reminder of the consequences that come with rejecting the signs and guidance provided by Allah.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا صم وبكم في الظلمات من يشإ الله يضلله ومن يشأ يجعله على صراط مستقيم

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if punishment from Allah should come to you or the Hour come to you, would you call upon any other than Allah, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers about their reliance on false gods and idols. It challenges them to consider who they would turn to in times of ultimate distress and whether their idols would be able to save them from the punishment of Allah or the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of sincerely turning to Allah alone for help, guidance, and salvation.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله أو أتتكم الساعة أغير الله تدعون إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But it is to Him that you call and He removes that which you call to Him for, if He wills, and you forget what you associate [with Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of Allah. It emphasizes that only Allah should be worshipped and called upon, as He has the ability to respond to those calls and remove difficulties. It also warns against associating partners with Allah, as doing so leads to forgetfulness and misguidance.
orig: بل إياه تدعون فيكشف ما تدعون إليه إن شاء وتنسون ما تشركون

translation: And We have certainly sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad], and We seized them with hardship and adversity that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
interpretation: This verse highlights that throughout history, messengers were sent to different nations to convey the message of Allah. Sometimes, when the people did not heed the message, they were afflicted with hardship and difficulties to remind them of their dependence on Allah and to encourage them to turn back to Him in humility and submission.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا إلى أمم من قبلك فأخذناهم بالبأساء والضراء لعلهم يتضرعون

translation: So why did they not, when Our punishment came to them, humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and repentance when faced with hardship or punishment from Allah. It points out that instead of turning to Allah in humility, some people let their hearts harden and become influenced by Satan, who makes their wrongful actions seem attractive to them. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance, stubbornness, and being misled by Satan.
orig: فلولا إذ جاءهم بأسنا تضرعوا ولكن قست قلوبهم وزين لهم الشيطان ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And when they forgot that about which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning not to become heedless of the reminders and guidance provided by Allah. It reminds us that sometimes when people become overly consumed with worldly pleasures and forget the teachings of Allah, they may be tested suddenly and find themselves in a state of despair. It teaches the importance of being grateful, staying mindful of Allah's guidance, and not letting material possessions or worldly pleasures lead us away from the path of righteousness.
orig: فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به فتحنا عليهم أبواب كل شيء حتى إذا فرحوا بما أوتوا أخذناهم بغتة فإذا هم مبلسون

translation: So the people who did wrong were cut off. All praises be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that ultimately, those who engage in wrongdoing will face the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that God is the ultimate judge and will ultimately bring justice to those who have been wronged. The praise of Allah at the end of the verse is a recognition of His sovereignty and power over all creation.
orig: فقطع دابر القوم الذين ظلموا والحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'Have you considered: if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allah could bring them [back] to you?' Look how we diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah, stating that if He were to take away someone's senses and seal their hearts, no other deity could restore them. The verse reminds people of Allah's ultimate control and serves as a warning to those who turn away from His signs despite witnessing His power and miracles.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أخذ الله سمعكم وأبصاركم وختم على قلوبكم من إله غير الله يأتيكم به انظر كيف نصرف الآيات ثم هم يصدفون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if the punishment of Allah should come to you suddenly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the punishment of Allah can come suddenly or gradually. It emphasizes that ultimately it is the wrongdoers who will face destruction as a consequence of their unjust actions.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله بغتة أو جهرة هل يهلك إلا القوم الظالمون

translation: And We do not send the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and corrects himself - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual role of messengers as conveyors of good news and warners. It serves as a reminder that believing in the message and acting righteously will lead to a state of peace and contentment, free from fear and sorrow. It highlights the importance of faith and good deeds in attaining tranquility in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: وما نرسل المرسلين إلا مبشرين ومنذرين فمن آمن وأصلح فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who deny Our signs - the punishment will touch them for their defiant disobedience.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny the signs and revelations of Allah will face punishment as a consequence of their persistent disobedience and defiance. It serves as a warning against rejecting the clear signs of truth and committing acts of transgression.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا يمسهم العذاب بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me.' Say, 'Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the point that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is a human messenger of Allah and does not possess divine knowledge or powers. He is simply conveying the divine revelations he receives. The questioning of whether the blind and the seeing are equal is meant to provoke reflection on the differences in perception and understanding, encouraging people to contemplate and recognize the wisdom of Allah in the distinctions He has created.
orig: قل لا أقول لكم عندي خزائن الله ولا أعلم الغيب ولا أقول لكم إني ملك إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي قل هل يستوي الأعمى والبصير أفلا تتفكرون

translation: And warn with it those who fear that they will be gathered to their Lord - for them besides Him there is no protector nor intercessor - that they might become righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of warning those who fear standing before their Lord without any protector or intercessor. It encourages people to be conscious of their actions and strive to be righteous, as no one will be able to help them on the Day of Judgment except Allah.
orig: وأنذر به الذين يخافون أن يحشروا إلى ربهم ليس لهم من دونه ولي ولا شفيع لعلهم يتقون

translation: And do not send away those who call upon their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything concerning them of their account, and not upon them is anything concerning you of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to prevent or push away those who worship and invoke their Lord at all times. It emphasizes that believers should not intervene or obstruct others' acts of worship, as it is a personal and direct relationship between them and God. By doing so, one would be acting unjustly and interfering in matters beyond their control.
orig: ولا تطرد الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ما عليك من حسابهم من شيء وما من حسابك عليهم من شيء فتطردهم فتكون من الظالمين

translation: And thus We have tried some of them by means of others that they might say, 'Are these the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor among us?' Is not Allah most knowing of the grateful?
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah puts people through trials and tests that involve interactions with others to distinguish the grateful from the ungrateful. It serves as a reminder that gratitude and recognition of Allah's favors should be an essential part of a believer's attitude, as Allah is fully aware and cognizant of those who are truly thankful.
orig: وكذلك فتنا بعضهم ببعض ليقولوا أهؤلاء من الله عليهم من بيننا أليس الله بأعلم بالشاكرين

translation: And when those who believe in Our verses come to you, say, "Peace be upon you. Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy: that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who have faith and make mistakes out of ignorance but sincerely repent and strive to correct themselves. It shows that Allah is always ready to forgive and show mercy to those who turn to Him in repentance.
orig: وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم كتب ربكم على نفسه الرحمة أنه من عمل منكم سوءا بجهالة ثم تاب من بعده وأصلح فأنه غفور رحيم

translation: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the detailed explanations and signs in the Qur'an serve to make clear the way and path of those who commit crimes or act unjustly. By reflecting on these signs, one can discern the truth from falsehood and recognize the consequences of wrongful actions.
orig: وكذلك نفصل الآيات ولتستبين سبيل المجرمين

translation: Say, ‘I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah.’ Say, ‘I do not follow your desires; if I did, I would go astray and not be of the rightly guided.’
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of steadfastness in one's faith and the rejection of following the desires of others over the commandments of Allah. It highlights the importance of staying on the path of righteousness and guidance, even if it means going against the wishes of those who try to lead one astray. It serves as a reminder to prioritize seeking Allah's pleasure and guidance above all else.
orig: قل إني نهيت أن أعبد الذين تدعون من دون الله قل لا أتبع أهواءكم قد ضللت إذا وما أنا من المهتدين

translation: Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have that for which you are impatient. The decision is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders."
interpretation: This verse reminds us to trust in the clarity and truthfulness of the message given by Allah. It emphasizes patience in the face of denial and opposition, as the final judgment belongs to Allah alone. It reassures that Allah will ultimately reveal the truth and that His judgment is the best and most just.
orig: قل إني على بينة من ربي وكذبتم به ما عندي ما تستعجلون به إن الحكم إلا لله يقص الحق وهو خير الفاصلين

translation: Say, 'If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you.' And Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights that if the believers had the power they wished for to hasten the Day of Judgment and the consequences for the disbelievers, then the matter would have been readily closed between the believers and the disbelievers. However, only Allah has the ultimate knowledge and authority over all, including those who commit injustices. It reminds believers to trust in the wisdom and timing of Allah's plan, even when faced with impatience or concerns about injustice.
orig: قل لو أن عندي ما تستعجلون به لقضي الأمر بيني وبينكم والله أعلم بالظالمين

translation: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it; and no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing knowledge and control of Allah over everything in the universe. It highlights that Allah alone possesses knowledge of the unseen, and nothing escapes His awareness - from the smallest details like a leaf falling or a grain of soil, to all that exists on land and sea. The verse underscores the extent of Allah's knowledge and power, as everything is recorded in a clear record kept by Him.
orig: وعنده مفاتح الغيب لا يعلمها إلا هو ويعلم ما في البر والبحر وما تسقط من ورقة إلا يعلمها ولا حبة في ظلمات الأرض ولا رطب ولا يابس إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: It is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return, and then He will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute control and knowledge of Allah over His creation. It describes how He takes our souls during the night and is aware of our actions during the day. He then resurrects us according to a predetermined term, and ultimately, our return is to Him. It serves as a reminder of accountability and the assurance that every action will be accounted for by Allah.
orig: وهو الذي يتوفاكم بالليل ويعلم ما جرحتم بالنهار ثم يبعثكم فيه ليقضى أجل مسمى ثم إليه مرجعكم ثم ينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He sends over you guardian angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him and they do not fail [in their duties].
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah is the ultimate authority over His creation and He appoints guardian angels to protect and watch over individuals. When the time of death approaches, the angels assigned to take the souls of the deceased fulfill their duty meticulously and without any lapse.
orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده ويرسل عليكم حفظة حتى إذا جاء أحدكم الموت توفته رسلنا وهم لا يفرطون

translation: Then they will be returned to Allah, their true Master. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of reckoners.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate return of all individuals to Allah, who is the true and rightful Master of all creations. It highlights that all judgement ultimately belongs to Allah, and He is swift in taking account of our deeds, holding everyone accountable for their actions.
orig: ثم ردوا إلى الله مولاهم الحق ألا له الحكم وهو أسرع الحاسبين

translation: Say, 'Who rescues you from the darkness of the land and the sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [with humility] and privately, 'If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the grateful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in Allah's power and mercy. It highlights how in times of hardship and darkness, when people turn to Allah with humility and sincerity, seeking His help and protection, they should do so with the intention of gratitude. The verse reminds believers to be thankful and appreciative to Allah for His blessings and favors, especially when He saves them from difficulties and challenges.
orig: قل من ينجيكم من ظلمات البر والبحر تدعونه تضرعا وخفية لئن أنجانا من هذه لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: Say, "Allah will save you from it and from every distress, then you [still] associate others with Him."
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that it is Allah alone who has the power to save them from distress and difficulties. It warns against associating partners with Allah (shirk), emphasizing the importance of turning to Him alone for help and guidance in times of trouble.
orig: قل الله ينجيكم منها ومن كل كرب ثم أنتم تشركون

translation: Say, "He is [the one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another." Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power of Allah to inflict punishment upon people in various ways if they deviate from the right path. It highlights that Allah can send down afflictions from above or below, or cause divisions among people, as a means to make them understand and reflect. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ultimate authority and the importance of staying united and faithful to avoid such consequences.
orig: قل هو القادر على أن يبعث عليكم عذابا من فوقكم أو من تحت أرجلكم أو يلبسكم شيعا ويذيق بعضكم بأس بعض انظر كيف نصرف الآيات لعلهم يفقهون

translation: And your people have denied it while it is the truth. Say, 'I am not responsible for you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection of the truth by certain individuals despite its clear validity. The Prophet is instructed to convey the message of truth without bearing the burden of those who choose to deny it. It emphasizes personal responsibility and the inability to force others to accept the truth.
orig: وكذب به قومك وهو الحق قل لست عليكم بوكيل

translation: For every event is a finality; and soon you will come to know.
interpretation: This verse signifies that every occurrence, every news, every message has a conclusion and an ultimate outcome. It serves as a reminder that events in life unfold with a purpose, and eventually their true meaning and consequences will become apparent. It encourages patience and reflection, as well as an understanding that all things will be manifested and revealed in due time.
orig: لكل نبإ مستقر وسوف تعلمون

translation: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse advises believers to avoid engaging with those who ridicule or mock the signs of Allah and to turn away from such conversations. It also warns against sitting with unjust people who may lead one astray, emphasizing the importance of surrounding oneself with those who remind one of Allah and righteousness.
orig: وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره وإما ينسينك الشيطان فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين

translation: And there is nothing upon those who are mindful [of God] concerning their account, but [there is] a reminder that perhaps they will be mindful.
interpretation: This verse assures those who are conscious of God that they will not be burdened with more than they can bear regarding their accountability. It serves as a reminder to urge them to increase in their mindfulness of God, illustrating the mercy and fairness of God's judgment towards those who strive to attain piety and righteousness.
orig: وما على الذين يتقون من حسابهم من شيء ولكن ذكرى لعلهم يتقون

translation: And leave those who have taken their religion as amusement and diversion and been deluded by the worldly life. But remind with it, lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than Allah no protector nor intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
