interpretation: This verse warns against those who treat their religion as a mere amusement, becoming distracted by the worldly pleasures and forgetting their true purpose in life. It emphasizes that each individual is responsible for their own actions and their consequences, and no one can intercede on their behalf before Allah. Those who persist in disbelief and wrongdoing will face a severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: وذر الذين اتخذوا دينهم لعبا ولهوا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وذكر به أن تبسل نفس بما كسبت ليس لها من دون الله ولي ولا شفيع وإن تعدل كل عدل لا يؤخذ منها أولئك الذين أبسلوا بما كسبوا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us? - [we would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us.'" Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of calling upon beings other than Allah who cannot bring any benefit or harm. It warns against turning away from the guidance of Allah after having been shown the right path. It presents the analogy of one who is confused and misled by the temptations of evil forces, and highlights the importance of following the true guidance of Allah and submitting to Him as the Lord of all creation.
orig: قل أندعو من دون الله ما لا ينفعنا ولا يضرنا ونرد على أعقابنا بعد إذ هدانا الله كالذي استهوته الشياطين في الأرض حيران له أصحاب يدعونه إلى الهدى ائتنا قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى وأمرنا لنسلم لرب العالمين

translation: And establish prayer and fear Him. And it is to Him that you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing the prayer and being conscious and fearful of God. It reminds believers of the ultimate truth that they will all be gathered to Him in the Hereafter, highlighting the significance of maintaining a strong connection with God through prayer and piety.
orig: وأن أقيموا الصلاة واتقوه وهو الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in truth. And the day He says, 'Be,' and it is. His word is the truth. And His is the dominion on the Day the Horn is blown. Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah as the creator of the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes the fact that when Allah decrees something, it instantly becomes reality. It also mentions the Day of Judgment when the horn will be blown, signifying the end of the world. Allah is portrayed as the all-knowing, wise, and well-acquainted with all that is hidden and seen.
orig: وهو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق ويوم يقول كن فيكون قوله الحق وله الملك يوم ينفخ في الصور عالم الغيب والشهادة وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: And [mention] when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people in manifest error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the conversation between Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his father, Azar, where Ibrahim questions the wisdom of worshiping idols as gods. Ibrahim demonstrates his firm belief in the oneness of God and expresses concern for his father and their community for being in clear misguidance by worshiping false deities. The verse emphasizes the rejection of idol worship and the importance of recognizing and following the truth.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه آزر أتتخذ أصناما آلهة إني أراك وقومك في ضلال مبين

translation: And thus did We show Ibrahim the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah demonstrated to Ibrahim the vastness and magnificence of creation to strengthen his belief and certainty in Him. It shows that through witnessing the signs of Allah's power and creation, one can increase their faith and become firm and steadfast believers.
orig: وكذلك نري إبراهيم ملكوت السماوات والأرض وليكون من الموقنين

translation: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set, he said, 'I do not like those that set.'
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) pondering over the different heavenly bodies as potential lords or objects of worship. Initially mistaking a star as his Lord, he later rejects it upon its setting, as he realizes that Allah, the Creator of all things, does not set or disappear. The verse demonstrates the importance of recognizing the oneness and eternal nature of Allah, the one true God.
orig: فلما جن عليه الليل رأى كوكبا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لا أحب الآفلين

translation: When he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set, he said, 'Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the misguided nature of idolatry and the importance of seeking guidance from the true source of knowledge and guidance, which is Allah. It shows that it is easy to be misled by our limited perceptions and that true guidance comes only from Allah.
orig: فلما رأى القمر بازغا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لئن لم يهدني ربي لأكونن من القوم الضالين

translation: So when he saw the sun rising, he said, 'This is my Lord; this is greater.' But when it set, he said, 'O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.'
interpretation: This verse talks about the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) reflecting on the sun as a possible deity, but then realizing the error in the worship of material entities and declaring his monotheistic belief in the one true God. It emphasizes the importance of rejecting polytheism and falsehood, and embracing the worship of the One Almighty God.
orig: فلما رأى الشمس بازغة قال هذا ربي هذا أكبر فلما أفلت قال يا قوم إني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Verily, I have turned my face towards Him Who has created the heavens and the earth, sincerely, and I am not of the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse expresses the devotion and sincerity of the speaker towards the Creator of the heavens and the earth, affirming absolute monotheism and rejecting polytheism. It conveys a strong proclamation of one's faith and commitment to worshiping Allah alone, without associating partners with Him.
orig: إني وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السماوات والأرض حنيفا وما أنا من المشركين

translation: And he argued with his people, [saying], 'Do you argue with me about Allah while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him, [and] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker is confident in his faith and belief in Allah, to the point where he fearlessly challenges his people to argue with him about their beliefs. He emphasizes that his trust in Allah is unwavering, and he is not swayed by the false idols others worship. The speaker acknowledges the all-encompassing knowledge and power of Allah, questioning why his people do not reflect on these truths.
orig: وحاجه قومه قال أتحاجوني في الله وقد هدان ولا أخاف ما تشركون به إلا أن يشاء ربي شيئا وسع ربي كل شيء علما أفلا تتذكرون

translation: And how could I fear what you have associated, while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the sense of justice and logic, questioning how one can fear the false gods they associate with Allah when they do not even fear that they are associating partners with Allah without any proof or authority. The verse challenges the believers to consider who truly deserves security and safety, emphasizing the importance of avoiding shirk (associating partners with Allah) and following the true path of monotheism.
orig: وكيف أخاف ما أشركتم ولا تخافون أنكم أشركتم بالله ما لم ينزل به عليكم سلطانا فأي الفريقين أحق بالأمن إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: Those who believed and did not mix their belief with injustice - they will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining sincerity and integrity in one's faith, without mixing it with wrongdoing or injustice. Those who believe in God with purity of heart and do not engage in unjust behavior will find security and guidance in their lives, both in this world and the hereafter.
orig: الذين آمنوا ولم يلبسوا إيمانهم بظلم أولئك لهم الأمن وهم مهتدون

translation: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah provided Ibrahim (Abraham) with convincing evidence to present to his people as a means of guidance. It also emphasizes that Allah has the authority to elevate the status of whomsoever He chooses, reaffirming His ultimate wisdom and knowledge in all matters.
orig: وتلك حجتنا آتيناها إبراهيم على قومه نرفع درجات من نشاء إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and each We guided. And Noah We guided before, and from his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes how God bestows guidance and blessings upon the prophets and their descendants who follow their righteous path. It highlights the continuity of prophethood and guidance from one generation to the next, with a promise of reward for those who do good deeds and follow the path of righteousness.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب كلا هدينا ونوحا هدينا من قبل ومن ذريته داوود وسليمان وأيوب ويوسف وموسى وهارون وكذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: And [mention] Zechariah, John, Jesus, and Elijah - all [of them] were of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse lists some of the prophets and messengers of Allah, highlighting their righteousness and piety. It emphasizes that individuals such as Zechariah, John, Jesus, and Elijah were all among the righteous servants of God, chosen to deliver His guidance and uphold the highest moral standards.
orig: وزكريا ويحيى وعيسى وإلياس كل من الصالحين

translation: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Prophets Ishmael, Elisha, Jonah, and Lot were chosen and favored by Allah over all the people of the world. It teaches us that these Prophets were special in the sight of Allah and were blessed with unique qualities and missions.
orig: وإسماعيل واليسع ويونس ولوطا وكلا فضلنا على العالمين

translation: And among their fathers and their descendants and their brothers, We chose them and We guided them to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special selection and guidance given by Allah to certain individuals among their ancestors, offspring, and close relatives. It emphasizes that being guided to the straight path is a divine blessing and those chosen by Allah are given the opportunity to follow this righteous path.
orig: ومن آبائهم وذرياتهم وإخوانهم واجتبيناهم وهديناهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: This is the guidance of Allah; He guides with it whom He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Him, then what they used to do would have been of no avail to them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true guidance only comes from Allah, and He bestows it upon those whom He chooses among His servants. It also warns against associating partners with Allah, as doing so nullifies the good deeds of the individuals. The verse highlights the importance of sincere monotheism in order for one's actions to be accepted and beneficial.
orig: ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء من عباده ولو أشركوا لحبط عنهم ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Those to whom We gave the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood. If these [people] disbelieve in it, We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the revelation of the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood is a great trust from Allah. If those who were granted such knowledge and guidance choose to reject it, then Allah can easily transfer this responsibility to others who will not deny it. It serves as a reminder that the rejection of the truth does not diminish its value and can be given to others who will uphold its teachings.
orig: أولئك الذين آتيناهم الكتاب والحكم والنبوة فإن يكفر بها هؤلاء فقد وكلنا بها قوما ليسوا بها بكافرين

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so from their guidance take an example. Say, 'I do not ask you for it any payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance comes from Allah, and those who are guided should be followed as examples. The reminder of the Qur'an is not meant to be a source of profit or payment for the Prophet or for those who follow his teachings; it is a guidance and a reminder for all people.
orig: أولئك الذين هدى الله فبهداهم اقتده قل لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إن هو إلا ذكرى للعالمين

translation: And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal when they said, 'Allah did not reveal to a human being anything.' Say, 'Who revealed the Scripture which Moses brought as light and guidance to the people? You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers.' Say, 'Allah [revealed it].' Then leave them in their discourse, amusing themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and arrogance of those who deny the divine revelation sent to prophets like Moses. The disbelievers belittle the scriptures and the wisdom contained within them, even though they themselves have been taught and guided by these scriptures. The verse urges believers to leave such ignorant arguments and activities of the disbelievers, as they amuse themselves in their falsehood and ignorance.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره إذ قالوا ما أنزل الله على بشر من شيء قل من أنزل الكتاب الذي جاء به موسى نورا وهدى للناس تجعلونه قراطيس تبدونها وتخفون كثيرا وعلمتم ما لم تعلموا أنتم ولا آباؤكم قل الله ثم ذرهم في خوضهم يلعبون

translation: And this is a blessed Book that We have revealed, confirming what is before it, so that you may warn the Mother of Cities and whoeever surrounds it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are diligent in their prayers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the Qur'an as a blessed and confirming Book from Allah. It highlights the responsibility of the believers to convey its message and warnings to others, especially the people of the main city (Mecca) and its surroundings. It also emphasizes the link between belief in the Hereafter and belief in the Qur'an, and stresses the importance of regular prayer and maintaining the connection with Allah.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك مصدق الذي بين يديه ولتنذر أم القرى ومن حولها والذين يؤمنون بالآخرة يؤمنون به وهم على صلاتهم يحافظون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or says, 'It has been inspired to me,' while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, 'I will reveal [something] like what Allah revealed.' And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], 'Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth, and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of falsely attributing lies to Allah or falsely claiming to receive divine revelations. It emphasizes that those who engage in such deceit will face a humiliating punishment in the Hereafter. The verse warns against arrogance towards the signs of Allah and the importance of speaking the truth when discussing divine matters.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو قال أوحي إلي ولم يوح إليه شيء ومن قال سأنزل مثل ما أنزل الله ولو ترى إذ الظالمون في غمرات الموت والملائكة باسطو أيديهم أخرجوا أنفسكم اليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تقولون على الله غير الحق وكنتم عن آياته تستكبرون

translation: And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your ‘intercessors’ whom you claimed to be partners with Allah for you. Indeed, the ties between you have been cut off, and what you used to claim has led you astray from you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the individual accountability of humans before God. It highlights that on the Day of Judgment, people will come before God alone, without any intermediaries or partners. The verse also rebukes the false belief in intercessors or partners with God, emphasizing that such beliefs lead people astray from the truth and the reality of their own actions and responsibilities. Ultimately, it serves as a reminder of the importance of sincere devotion to God and the need for each individual to take responsibility for their own deeds and actions.
orig: ولقد جئتمونا فرادى كما خلقناكم أول مرة وتركتم ما خولناكم وراء ظهوركم وما نرى معكم شفعاءكم الذين زعمتم أنهم فيكم شركاء لقد تقطع بينكم وضل عنكم ما كنتم تزعمون

translation: Indeed, Allah is the Cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allah; so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and ability of Allah in controlling all aspects of life and death. It emphasizes the concept of resurrection and the continuous cycle of life and death as a manifestation of Allah's greatness and wisdom. The rhetorical question at the end challenges believers to reflect on how they can be led astray when such clear signs of Allah's power are present.
orig: إن الله فالق الحب والنوى يخرج الحي من الميت ومخرج الميت من الحي ذلكم الله فأنى تؤفكون

translation: He is the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the precision and intricacy in the creation of the universe, where the alternation of night and day, the movement of the sun and moon are all part of a well-calculated system set by the Almighty, All-Knowing God. The verse emphasizes the orderly nature of the universe and the wisdom of the Creator in designing such a harmonious system.
orig: فالق الإصباح وجعل الليل سكنا والشمس والقمر حسبانا ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: And it is He who made for you the stars, that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and the sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of stars as guiding lights provided by Allah to help navigate through the darkness of the land and sea. It serves as a reminder of Allah's wisdom and mercy in providing signs for those who seek knowledge and understanding.
orig: وهو الذي جعل لكم النجوم لتهتدوا بها في ظلمات البر والبحر قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: And it is He who created you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of human unity and equality, emphasizing that despite the diversity among people, all human beings share a common origin. It also underscores the importance of reflection and understanding of the signs of God's existence and wisdom as a means to develop spiritual insight and consciousness.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأكم من نفس واحدة فمستقر ومستودع قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يفقهون

translation: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and blessings of Allah by describing how He sends down rain that sustains and brings forth a variety of plants and fruits from the earth. It draws attention to the signs of His existence and greatness in the different types of vegetation and fruits that are created, emphasizing that these signs are meant for those who believe in Him.
orig: وهو الذي أنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به نبات كل شيء فأخرجنا منه خضرا نخرج منه حبا متراكبا ومن النخل من طلعها قنوان دانية وجنات من أعناب والزيتون والرمان مشتبها وغير متشابه انظروا إلى ثمره إذا أثمر وينعه إن في ذلكم لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And they assign to Allah a share of the jinn though He created them, and they falsely attribute to Him sons and daughters without knowledge. Exalted is He and high above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the false beliefs and practices of some people who associate partners with Allah, attributing children or offspring to Him without any basis or knowledge. It emphasizes that Allah is far above and beyond what they ascribe to Him, and His divine essence cannot be limited or defined by human understanding or imagination.
orig: وجعلوا لله شركاء الجن وخلقهم وخرقوا له بنين وبنات بغير علم سبحانه وتعالى عما يصفون

translation: Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He has no consort? He created all things and He has knowledge of all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique and matchless nature of Allah's attributes. It emphasizes that Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, cannot have a son or offspring because He has no equal or partner. It asserts His supreme power as the Creator of all things and His comprehensive knowledge of everything. The verse denounces the idea of Allah having offspring, reinforcing the concept of monotheism and the oneness of Allah in Islam.
orig: بديع السماوات والأرض أنى يكون له ولد ولم تكن له صاحبة وخلق كل شيء وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the Creator and the one worthy of worship. It highlights the fact that everything in existence is created by Allah, and therefore, He alone deserves to be worshipped. Additionally, it reminds believers that Allah is the ultimate caretaker and manager of all affairs.
orig: ذلكم الله ربكم لا إله إلا هو خالق كل شيء فاعبدوه وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the incomprehensibility of Allah's essence to human perception, while highlighting His complete knowledge and awareness of everything. It affirms Allah's subtlety and depth of understanding, showing His intricate and detailed knowledge of all things.
orig: لا تدركه الأبصار وهو يدرك الأبصار وهو اللطيف الخبير

translation: There have come to you Enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see does so for the good of his own soul, and whoever blinds himself does so to its harm. And I am not a keeper over you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of personal responsibility and accountability. It states that the signs and guidance have come from God, and it is up to each individual to either benefit or harm themselves by receiving or ignoring these signs. It also reassures that God is not responsible for a person's choices or actions.
orig: قد جاءكم بصائر من ربكم فمن أبصر فلنفسه ومن عمي فعليها وما أنا عليكم بحفيظ

translation: And so We explain the verses, so that they may say, 'You have studied,' and to make it clear to a people who know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is revealed in a way that its meanings are clear and explained clearly. It also highlights that the signs and verses are there for people to understand and reflect upon, so that they may acknowledge the wisdom and depth of the message, and realize that it comes from a source of knowledge and understanding.
orig: وكذلك نصرف الآيات وليقولوا درست ولنبينه لقوم يعلمون

translation: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to adhere to the guidance and revelations from Allah and to worship Him alone without associating any partners with Him. It also highlights the importance of avoiding association or collaboration with those who practice polytheism or associate partners with Allah.
orig: اتبع ما أوحي إليك من ربك لا إله إلا هو وأعرض عن المشركين

translation: And if Allah had willed, they would not have associated [anything] and We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, and you are not over them a manager.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of free will and accountability in Islam. It highlights that if Allah had wanted, He could have guided everyone to believe in Him alone without associating partners with Him. It also clarifies that the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was to deliver the message, not to force people into belief or manage their affairs. Ultimately, every individual is responsible for their own choices and actions, as they will be accountable before Allah for their beliefs and deeds.
orig: ولو شاء الله ما أشركوا وما جعلناك عليهم حفيظا وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allah, lest they insult Allah in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have adorned for every nation their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the beliefs and deities of others, warning against insulting them in ignorance as this may lead them to insult Allah in return. It teaches that people of every nation will be judged based on their deeds, and they will be held accountable for their actions on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولا تسبوا الذين يدعون من دون الله فيسبوا الله عدوا بغير علم كذلك زينا لكل أمة عملهم ثم إلى ربهم مرجعهم فينبئهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, "The signs are only with Allah." And what will make you perceive that even if a sign came, they would not believe?
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and fickleness of disbelievers who claim they would believe in God's signs if shown, yet fail to recognize the signs already present in the world. It emphasizes that true belief is a matter of the heart and understanding, not just of witnessing miracles.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن جاءتهم آية ليؤمنن بها قل إنما الآيات عند الله وما يشعركم أنها إذا جاءت لا يؤمنون

translation: And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes just as they refused to believe in it the first time. And We will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the truth and turning away from faith. It speaks about how those who persist in disbelief and wrongdoing will find their hearts and vision veiled from the truth, leaving them lost in their misguided ways. It serves as a warning against the arrogance and heedlessness that leads individuals to reject faith and be deprived of guidance.
orig: ونقلب أفئدتهم وأبصارهم كما لم يؤمنوا به أول مرة ونذرهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And even if We were to send the angels to them, and the dead were to speak to them, and We were to gather before them all things, they would still not believe unless Allah wills. But most of them are ignorant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine will and predestination, highlighting that belief and faith ultimately come from Allah. It underscores that even if extraordinary signs were shown to some people, they would still choose not to believe due to their ignorance and lack of understanding. It serves as a reminder that guidance and faith are gifts from Allah, and it is through His will that individuals come to believe in Him.
orig: ولو أننا نزلنا إليهم الملائكة وكلمهم الموتى وحشرنا عليهم كل شيء قبلا ما كانوا ليؤمنوا إلا أن يشاء الله ولكن أكثرهم يجهلون

translation: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
interpretation: This verse highlights that every prophet faces enemies, including devils from among humans and jinn, who spread delusional and deceptive speech. It illustrates that if God willed, these enemies would not have been able to harm the prophets. The message is to trust in God's plan and wisdom, and ignore the false accusations and plots of adversaries.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا شياطين الإنس والجن يوحي بعضهم إلى بعض زخرف القول غرورا ولو شاء ربك ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And so the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter will incline towards it, and they will be pleased with it and will commit what they are committing.
interpretation: This verse describes how the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are inclined towards worldly desires and pleasures, allowing them to commit actions that are not in line with the teachings of Islam. It serves as a reminder to believers to remain steadfast in their faith and avoid being influenced by those who do not believe in the Hereafter.
orig: ولتصغى إليه أفئدة الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وليرضوه وليقترفوا ما هم مقترفون

translation: Do I seek other than God as a source of law, when it is He who has revealed to you the Book fully detailed? Those to whom We gave the Book know it is sent down from your Lord with truth, so do not be among the doubters.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that the Quran is a comprehensive and detailed guide sent down by Allah. The people who were given previous scriptures also acknowledge the truth of the Quran. The message is to have firm faith in the Quran and not to doubt its divine origin and guidance.
orig: أفغير الله أبتغي حكما وهو الذي أنزل إليكم الكتاب مفصلا والذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعلمون أنه منزل من ربك بالحق فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate truth and justice that come from fulfilling the word of Allah. It highlights the certainty and unchangeability of Allah's decree, establishing His authority as the All-Hearing and All-Knowing. It serves as a reminder of the power and knowledge of Allah, signaling that His promises will always come to fruition.
orig: وتمت كلمت ربك صدقا وعدلا لا مبدل لكلماته وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that blindly following the majority without proper guidance and adherence to the path of Allah can lead to deviating from the true faith. It highlights the importance of seeking knowledge, understanding the teachings of Islam, and not being swayed by mere assumptions or the misguided ways of the majority who may not be on the right path.
orig: وإن تطع أكثر من في الأرض يضلوك عن سبيل الله إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is the All-Knowing, aware of those who deviate from the path of righteousness as well as those who are rightly guided. It signifies the importance of staying on the right path and seeking guidance from Him.
orig: إن ربك هو أعلم من يضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: So consume of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of eating halal (lawful) food on which the name of Allah has been invoked. It stresses the significance of being mindful of what we consume, and the importance of having faith in the signs of Allah.
orig: فكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه إن كنتم بآياته مؤمنين

translation: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled? And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of consuming only Halal food upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, as He has clearly outlined what is forbidden. It warns against following one's whims and desires blindly without knowledge, as many are led astray in this manner. Ultimately, it emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of those who transgress His commands.
orig: وما لكم ألا تأكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه وقد فصل لكم ما حرم عليكم إلا ما اضطررتم إليه وإن كثيرا ليضلون بأهوائهم بغير علم إن ربك هو أعلم بالمعتدين

translation: And leave what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn sin will be recompensed for what they used to commit.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to avoid engaging in sins whether openly or secretly, as both will be accounted for. It serves as a warning that every action, whether large or small, is seen by Allah and will be recompensed accordingly. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity and being conscious of one's deeds at all times.
orig: وذروا ظاهر الإثم وباطنه إن الذين يكسبون الإثم سيجزون بما كانوا يقترفون

translation: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].
interpretation: This verse warns against consuming food on which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, emphasizing the importance of remembering and invoking Allah's name before eating. It also cautions against following the inspiration of devils or their allies, as it may lead to associating partners with Allah, which is considered a grave sin in Islam.
orig: ولا تأكلوا مما لم يذكر اسم الله عليه وإنه لفسق وإن الشياطين ليوحون إلى أوليائهم ليجادلوكم وإن أطعتموهم إنكم لمشركون

translation: Is he who was dead and We have raised him to life, and set for him a light wherein he walks among men, as one whose likeness is in utter darkness whence he cannot emerge? Thus what they used to do seems fair to the unbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the contrast between the believers and the disbelievers, highlighting the profound difference in their spiritual states. The believers are like those who were dead but were revived and guided by the light of faith, enabling them to navigate through the challenges of life. In contrast, the disbelievers are like those lost in darkness, unable to find their way out due to their rejection of faith. The actions and deeds of the disbelievers are presented as delusional and misguided, as they are blinded by their own disbelief.
orig: أومن كان ميتا فأحييناه وجعلنا له نورا يمشي به في الناس كمن مثله في الظلمات ليس بخارج منها كذلك زين للكافرين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And thus We have placed within every city the greatest of its criminals to conspire therein. But they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice and how wrongdoing individuals within communities are left to plot against each other with their own malicious intentions. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, their actions only harm themselves and they are oblivious to this consequence.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا في كل قرية أكابر مجرميها ليمكروا فيها وما يمكرون إلا بأنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And when there came to them a sign, they said, 'We will never believe until we are given like that which was given to the messengers of Allah.' Allah is most knowing of where He places His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allah and severe punishment for what they used to plot.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and disbelief of some people who refuse to accept a sign from Allah as a proof of His existence and power. They demand equivalent miracles to those received by the earlier messengers before they would believe, showing an attitude of arrogance and ingratitude. However, Allah's wisdom transcends human expectations, and He knows best where to bestow His guidance and signs. The punishment for those who persist in arrogance and wickedness is severe and will be in accordance with their deeds.
orig: وإذا جاءتهم آية قالوا لن نؤمن حتى نؤتى مثل ما أوتي رسل الله الله أعلم حيث يجعل رسالته سيصيب الذين أجرموا صغار عند الله وعذاب شديد بما كانوا يمكرون

translation: So, whoever Allah wants to guide - He expands his breast to [contain] Islam; and whoever He wants to misguide - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does Allah place defilement upon those who do not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of guidance and misguidance by Allah. It explains that when Allah intends to guide someone, He makes their heart open and accepting of Islam, while for those whom He intends to lead astray, He makes their hearts closed and constricted, causing difficulty and confusion. The analogy of climbing into the sky signifies the struggle and confusion faced by those who are misguided. It emphasizes that disbelief leads to impurity and defilement in the eyes of Allah.
orig: فمن يرد الله أن يهديه يشرح صدره للإسلام ومن يرد أن يضله يجعل صدره ضيقا حرجا كأنما يصعد في السماء كذلك يجعل الله الرجس على الذين لا يؤمنون

translation: And this is a straight path to your Lord. We have detailed the signs for those who remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the straight path, which refers to the righteous path of Islam that leads to Allah. The term 'straight path' symbolizes a way of life that is free from deviation and leads to spiritual growth and closeness to Allah. The verse also highlights the importance of reflecting on the signs of Allah as a means of remembrance and guidance for the believers.
orig: وهذا صراط ربك مستقيما قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يذكرون

translation: For them will be the Home of Peace with their Lord. And He will be their protecting friend because of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse describes the promised reward for the believers in the afterlife, where they will reside in the Home of Peace, which is a tranquil and secure place in the presence of their Lord. It emphasizes that God is their protecting friend who safeguards and supports them due to their righteous deeds and actions in the world.
orig: لهم دار السلام عند ربهم وهو وليهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day He will gather them all; [and He will say], 'O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind.' And their allies among mankind will say, 'Our Lord, some of us made use of others, and we have [now] reached our term, which You appointed for us.' He [Allah] will say, 'The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except for what Allah wills. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Resurrection when all beings will be gathered together, including jinn and humans. Those who led others astray will acknowledge their wrongdoing and that they have reached the appointed time determined by Allah. They will be told that their abode will be the Fire, unless Allah wills otherwise, as He is the Wise and All-Knowing.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم جميعا يا معشر الجن قد استكثرتم من الإنس وقال أولياؤهم من الإنس ربنا استمتع بعضنا ببعض وبلغنا أجلنا الذي أجلت لنا قال النار مثواكم خالدين فيها إلا ما شاء الله إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And thus We make some wrongdoers allies of others for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of retribution and accountability. Wrongdoers are made allies of each other based on their actions and their deeds. It serves as a reminder that individuals will be grouped based on their deeds, and that their actions will have consequences.
orig: وكذلك نولي بعض الظالمين بعضا بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?' They will say, 'We bear witness against ourselves'; and the worldly life deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability on the Day of Judgment. It mentions how the messengers of Allah came to both jinn and mankind with clear signs and warnings, but many individuals allowed worldly desires and distractions to lead them astray, causing them to reject the truth. On the Day of Judgment, they will have no excuse as they bear witness against themselves, acknowledging their disbelief despite being presented with the truth.
orig: يا معشر الجن والإنس ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يقصون عليكم آياتي وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا شهدنا على أنفسنا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وشهدوا على أنفسهم أنهم كانوا كافرين

translation: That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities unjustly while their people were unaware.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the justice of Allah, stating that He does not destroy cities without just cause while the people within them are heedless or unaware of the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder of the fairness and wisdom in Allah's decisions, as destruction is not brought upon the inhabitants of a city unless they have knowingly and deliberately transgressed against His commands.
orig: ذلك أن لم يكن ربك مهلك القرى بظلم وأهلها غافلون

translation: And for all there are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability in Islam. It teaches that everyone will be rewarded or punished based on their deeds and intentions. It reminds believers that Allah is fully aware of all their actions and intentions, and nothing goes unnoticed or unaccounted for. This serves as a reminder to be mindful of one's actions and to strive to do good deeds in order to earn Allah's pleasure and rewards.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وما ربك بغافل عما يعملون

translation: And your Lord is the Free of need, full of mercy. If He wills, He can do away with you and give succession after you to whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and sovereignty of Allah, who is self-sufficient and merciful. It emphasizes that Allah has the authority to replace one group of people with another if He wills, just as He created different nations and generations. It also serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of this life and the importance of remaining humble and obedient before the will of Allah.
orig: وربك الغني ذو الرحمة إن يشأ يذهبكم ويستخلف من بعدكم ما يشاء كما أنشأكم من ذرية قوم آخرين

translation: Indeed, what you are promised is coming, and you will not cause failure [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the promises of Allah are true and will come to pass, and no one can prevent or thwart His will. It serves as a warning to those who may doubt or challenge the divine promises, emphasizing the inevitability and certainty of Allah's decree.
orig: إن ما توعدون لآت وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; [for] indeed, I am working. And you are going to know to whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring punishment." Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that everyone is responsible for their own actions. Prophets are instructed to convey the message while emphasizing that they are accountable for their deeds. The verse warns about the consequences that await those who are unjust and disobedient. It serves as a call to righteousness, urging people to reflect on their deeds and their consequences, and emphasizes that ultimately, wrongdoing will not lead to success.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون من تكون له عاقبة الدار إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And they assign to Allah a portion of the crops and livestock He has created, declaring, 'This is for Allah,' according to their claims, 'and this is for our idols.' However, what is designated for their idols does not reach Allah, while what is set aside for Allah reaches their idols. Evil is the judgment they make!
interpretation: This verse highlights the folly of those who assign a portion of the provisions given by Allah to idols or other deities. It criticizes those who divide the sustenance provided by Allah between Him and false gods, illustrating that the portion designated for idols will never reach Allah, but the portion designated for Allah will be taken by their false gods. The verse condemns such actions as misguided and erroneous judgments.
orig: وجعلوا لله مما ذرأ من الحرث والأنعام نصيبا فقالوا هذا لله بزعمهم وهذا لشركائنا فما كان لشركائهم فلا يصل إلى الله وما كان لله فهو يصل إلى شركائهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And thus, to many of the polytheists, their partners have been made to seem pleasing in the killing of their children in order to bring about their destruction and to cover them with confusion in their religion. And if Allah had willed, they would not have done so. So leave them and what they invent.
interpretation: This verse talks about the delusion and deception of the polytheists who used to associate partners with Allah. It highlights how some of them justified the killing of their own children as sacrifices to these false deities, believing it would bring them closer to their gods. This act was manipulated by evil forces to mislead and confuse them in their religion. The verse emphasizes that Allah does not approve of such actions and instructs believers to leave these misguided individuals to their ways and not be swayed by their fabrications.
orig: وكذلك زين لكثير من المشركين قتل أولادهم شركاؤهم ليردوهم وليلبسوا عليهم دينهم ولو شاء الله ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And they say, 'These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat them except whom we wish,' by their claim, and there are animals forbidden from being used for work or as sacrificial animals. And animals they do not mention the name of Allah upon as an invention about Him. He will punish them for what they were fabricating.'
interpretation: This verse speaks about the arrogance and false beliefs of those who declared certain animals and crops as forbidden without any true basis. They claimed the authority to decide who could benefit from them, even though all sustenance is ultimately provided by Allah. Their false practices of forbidding certain animals for labor or sacrifice, and not mentioning Allah's name upon them, are condemned as baseless and invented. The verse warns that those who indulge in such fabrications and misrepresentations of Allah's commandments will face divine retribution for their deception.
orig: وقالوا هذه أنعام وحرث حجر لا يطعمها إلا من نشاء بزعمهم وأنعام حرمت ظهورها وأنعام لا يذكرون اسم الله عليها افتراء عليه سيجزيهم بما كانوا يفترون

translation: And they say, "What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein." He will punish them for their description. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and injustice of certain individuals who assign specific portions of the livestock to males and prohibit them for females, and in case the offspring is dead, they believe it is for all to share. This behavior is condemned as unfair and misguided, and they are warned of punishment for their wrongful beliefs and actions. Ultimately, Allah is Wise and Knowledgeable, and He will hold everyone accountable for their deeds.
orig: وقالوا ما في بطون هذه الأنعام خالصة لذكورنا ومحرم على أزواجنا وإن يكن ميتة فهم فيه شركاء سيجزيهم وصفهم إنه حكيم عليم

translation: Those who have lost their children foolishly without knowledge and have forbidden what Allah has provided for them, inventing falsehood about Allah. They have indeed gone astray and were not guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of those who unjustly kill their own children out of ignorance and prevent themselves from receiving the sustenance provided by Allah. It condemns the act of attributing false claims to Allah and warns that such actions lead people astray from the right path, showing their lack of guidance.
orig: قد خسر الذين قتلوا أولادهم سفها بغير علم وحرموا ما رزقهم الله افتراء على الله قد ضلوا وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: And it is He who produces gardens trellised and untrellised, and date palms, and crops of different shape and taste (its fruits and its seeds) and olives, and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in taste). Eat of their fruit when they ripen, but pay due (rights) on the day of their harvest, and waste not by extravagance. Verily, He likes not Al-Musrifun (those who waste by extravagance).
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity and abundance of blessings in nature created by Allah, and it encourages moderation and gratitude in consuming these blessings. People are urged to not waste resources and to acknowledge the rights and dues of others. The verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude, moderation, and responsible use of the bounties provided by Allah.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأ جنات معروشات وغير معروشات والنخل والزرع مختلفا أكله والزيتون والرمان متشابها وغير متشابه كلوا من ثمره إذا أثمر وآتوا حقه يوم حصاده ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين

translation: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens] and those [too] small. Eat of what Allah has provided for you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being grateful for the provisions Allah has given through the blessings of livestock, which provide sustenance for humans. It also warns against following the temptations and deception of Satan, emphasizing that he is a clear enemy leading humanity astray from the path of righteousness.
orig: ومن الأنعام حمولة وفرشا كلوا مما رزقكم الله ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: Eight pairs of sheep - two [male] and of goats two [male]. Say, 'Has He forbidden the males or the females or that which the wombs of the females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the Quraish tribe who used to hold certain rituals involving sacrificing animals. The verse questions the logic behind their selective prohibitions on certain genders of animals for sacrifice, implying that such restrictions lack rational basis. It challenges the Quraish to provide a valid reason for their practices and urges them to seek knowledge and truth in their beliefs and actions.
orig: ثمانية أزواج من الضأن اثنين ومن المعز اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين نبئوني بعلم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And of the camels [two], and of the cattle [two]. Say, 'Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when Allah charged you with this? Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah to mislead the people without knowledge? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the people that Allah has made certain animals forbidden for consumption, questioning whether it is the males, the females, or the offspring within the wombs of the females that are prohibited. It highlights the severity of lying about Allah and spreading falsehood, emphasizing that those who engage in such behavior are among the most unjust, as they mislead others without any true knowledge. It warns against unjust actions and falsehood, stating that Allah does not guide those who commit wrongdoing.
orig: ومن الإبل اثنين ومن البقر اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين أم كنتم شهداء إذ وصاكم الله بهذا فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا ليضل الناس بغير علم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the permissible and impermissible foods in Islam. It prohibits the consumption of dead animals, blood, swine, and animals sacrificed in the name of anyone other than Allah. However, in cases of necessity where one has no other choice but to consume these forbidden items, there is allowance given without blame. This verse emphasizes Allah's compassion and understanding towards His creation, particularly in times of difficulty or constraint. It showcases the balance between adhering to Islamic dietary laws and the flexibility allowed under specific circumstances.
orig: قل لا أجد في ما أوحي إلي محرما على طاعم يطعمه إلا أن يكون ميتة أو دما مسفوحا أو لحم خنزير فإنه رجس أو فسقا أهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فإن ربك غفور رحيم

translation: And We have forbidden to the Jews such animals with claws, and from the cattle and sheep We forbade to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or entrails or what is joined with bone. [This was] an imposition [on them] for their disobedience. And indeed, We are truthful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the specific dietary restrictions placed upon the Jews by God. It mentions the prohibition of certain animals with claws, as well as the restriction on consuming the fat of cattle and sheep unless it is attached to specific parts of the animals. The verse also emphasizes that these restrictions were a consequence of the disobedience of the Jews. Overall, the verse emphasizes the importance of following God's guidance and restrictions as a form of obedience and loyalty to Him.
orig: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا كل ذي ظفر ومن البقر والغنم حرمنا عليهم شحومهما إلا ما حملت ظهورهما أو الحوايا أو ما اختلط بعظم ذلك جزيناهم ببغيهم وإنا لصادقون

translation: So if they deny you, say, 'Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy, but His punishment cannot be averted from the guilty people.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that despite the mercy of Allah, His punishment is also just and cannot be avoided by those who persist in their wrongdoing and reject the truth. It serves as a warning to those who defy Allah's commands and stray from the righteous path.
orig: فإن كذبوك فقل ربكم ذو رحمة واسعة ولا يرد بأسه عن القوم المجرمين

translation: Those who associated others with Allah will say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything.' Likewise did those before deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, 'Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the disbelievers who associate partners with Allah and their false claims that they would not have done so if Allah had not willed it. The verse asserts that such denial and false claims are in line with the behavior of previous disbelievers who denied until they faced the consequences of their actions. The verse challenges them to produce any knowledge to support their claims, highlighting the emptiness of their arguments based on mere assumptions and falsehoods.
orig: سيقول الذين أشركوا لو شاء الله ما أشركنا ولا آباؤنا ولا حرمنا من شيء كذلك كذب الذين من قبلهم حتى ذاقوا بأسنا قل هل عندكم من علم فتخرجوه لنا إن تتبعون إلا الظن وإن أنتم إلا تخرصون

translation: Say, "To Allah belongs the [right of] argument entirely. If He had willed, He would have guided you all."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate authority and wisdom of Allah. It conveys that Allah has the full right to argue and judge, and if He desired, He could have guided everyone to the right path. It highlights the concept of Divine guidance and the importance of submitting to the will of Allah.
orig: قل فلله الحجة البالغة فلو شاء لهداكم أجمعين

translation: Say, "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the commandments of Allah, which include not associating partners with Him, being good to parents, avoiding immorality, and not unjustly taking a life. It also stresses the use of reason in understanding and obeying these laws.
orig: قل هلم شهداءكم الذين يشهدون أن الله حرم هذا فإن شهدوا فلا تشهد معهم ولا تتبع أهواء الذين كذبوا بآياتنا والذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وهم بربهم يعدلون

translation: Say, "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the prohibitions set by Allah. It instructs believers not to associate partners with Him, to show kindness and respect to parents, to not commit infanticide for fear of poverty, to avoid all forms of immorality, and to not take a life unjustly. The verse aims to guide people towards understanding the importance of following these prohibitions in order to attain wisdom and righteousness.
orig: قل تعالوا أتل ما حرم ربكم عليكم ألا تشركوا به شيئا وبالوالدين إحسانا ولا تقتلوا أولادكم من إملاق نحن نرزقكم وإياهم ولا تقربوا الفواحش ما ظهر منها وما بطن ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تعقلون

translation: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in a way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned. And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result. And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned. And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of justice and fairness in all dealings, especially with vulnerable individuals like orphans. It instructs believers to fulfill their commitments and be just in measurement and weighing, both in material and metaphorical senses. Additionally, it warns against arrogance, ignorance, and heedlessness towards the Signs of God in nature and within ourselves.
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا الكيل والميزان بالقسط لا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها وإذا قلتم فاعدلوا ولو كان ذا قربى وبعهد الله أوفوا ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تذكرون

translation: And this is my path, straight; so follow it and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way. This has He instructed you that you may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the straight path laid out by Allah and not deviating onto other misguided paths. By following the guidance of Allah and staying on the right path, one can attain righteousness and piety. It serves as a reminder to stay steadfast and committed to the teachings of Islam, avoiding paths that lead astray from the truth and righteousness.
orig: وأن هذا صراطي مستقيما فاتبعوه ولا تتبعوا السبل فتفرق بكم عن سبيله ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then We gave Moses the Book, complete for the one who did good, and explaining all things, and as a guidance and a mercy, so that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the guidance provided by the Book of Allah to Moses (peace be upon him) which is complete and detailed, serving as a source of guidance and mercy for those who do good. It emphasizes the purpose of the Book to lead people towards belief in the meeting with their Lord, urging faith and righteousness.
orig: ثم آتينا موسى الكتاب تماما على الذي أحسن وتفصيلا لكل شيء وهدى ورحمة لعلهم بلقاء ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, so that you may warn the Mother of Cities and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are maintaining their prayers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance from the Qur'an, which is described as blessed and confirming previous scriptures. It encourages believers to follow the teachings of the Qur'an and to be mindful of their actions, with the hope of receiving mercy and blessings from Allah. The verse also highlights the significance of faith in the Hereafter, attributing belief in the Qur'an as a reflection of one's belief in the afterlife.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك فاتبعوه واتقوا لعلكم ترحمون

translation: That you should not say, "The Book was only revealed to two groups before us, and we were indeed unaware of their reading."
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers not to dismiss or ignore the teachings of the Quran by claiming that it was revealed only to previous generations and not relevant to them. It emphasizes the importance of studying and reflecting on the teachings of the Quran, regardless of who it was revealed to in the past.
orig: أن تقولوا إنما أنزل الكتاب على طائفتين من قبلنا وإن كنا عن دراستهم لغافلين

translation: Or do you say, 'If only the Book had been revealed to us, we would have been more guided than they?' So there has come to you a clear evidence from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the signs of Allah and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our signs with the worst of punishment, because of their turning away.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the guidance from Allah is clear and accessible to all through the revelations in the Quran. It condemns those who deny and turn away from the signs of Allah, indicating that they will face severe punishment for their rejection. The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and following the guidance provided by Allah to avoid being among the unjust and facing severe consequences.
orig: أو تقولوا لو أنا أنزل علينا الكتاب لكنا أهدى منهم فقد جاءكم بينة من ربكم وهدى ورحمة فمن أظلم ممن كذب بآيات الله وصدف عنها سنجزي الذين يصدفون عن آياتنا سوء العذاب بما كانوا يصدفون

translation: Do they await but that the angels should come to them, or thy Lord should come, or there should come some of the signs of thy Lord? The day that some of the signs of thy Lord do come, no good will it do to a soul to believe in them then if it believed not before nor earned righteousness through its faith. Say: 'Wait ye, we too are waiting.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincere belief and righteousness prior to witnessing the signs of Allah. It highlights that true faith and good deeds should be established before the evidences and signs of Allah's existence are presented. It invites people to develop their faith in anticipation of the coming of these signs, as simply witnessing them without a foundation of genuine belief will not benefit the soul.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن تأتيهم الملائكة أو يأتي ربك أو يأتي بعض آيات ربك يوم يأتي بعض آيات ربك لا ينفع نفسا إيمانها لم تكن آمنت من قبل أو كسبت في إيمانها خيرا قل انتظروا إنا منتظرون

translation: Indeed, those who have divided their religion and become sects - you, [O Muhammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to Allah; then He will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of maintaining unity in the religion and avoiding divisions and sects. It serves as a reminder that Allah alone holds the authority to judge and guide individuals based on their actions and beliefs, emphasizing the importance of striving for unity and adherence to the principles of Islam.
orig: إن الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا لست منهم في شيء إنما أمرهم إلى الله ثم ينبئهم بما كانوا يفعلون

translation: Whoever brings a good deed will have ten times the like thereof to his credit, and whoever brings an evil deed, won't be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of recompense in Islam, stating that those who perform good deeds will be rewarded generously by Allah, with even more good being added to their records. On the other hand, those who commit evil deeds will only be recompensed with the equivalent thereof, illustrating divine justice. It also emphasizes that no one will be wronged or treated unjustly by Allah, as He is the epitome of fairness and justice.
orig: من جاء بالحسنة فله عشر أمثالها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion - the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associate others with Allah."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the guidance from Allah to follow the path of monotheism and truth, as was practiced by the Prophet Abraham. It highlights the importance of staying away from associating partners with Allah, as true guidance leads to the straight path of righteousness and monotheism.
orig: قل إنني هداني ربي إلى صراط مستقيم دينا قيما ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Say, "Indeed, my prayer, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of dedicating every aspect of one's life to Allah. It highlights the importance of worshiping Allah not only through formal acts of worship like prayer and sacrifice, but also in the way one lives their entire life, even in the moment of death. It serves as a reminder to maintain a constant awareness of Allah's presence and to align all actions and intentions with His will.
orig: قل إن صلاتي ونسكي ومحياي ومماتي لله رب العالمين

translation: He has no partner. And I have been commanded, and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism (Tawheed) by stating that Allah has no partner. It also highlights the importance of submitting to Allah's command, with the speaker claiming to be the first among the believers who have fully submitted to the will of Allah (Muslims). It serves as a reminder of the fundamental principle of Islam, which is the belief in the oneness of Allah and the act of submission to His commandments.
orig: لا شريك له وبذلك أمرت وأنا أول المسلمين

translation: Say, 'Should I seek a lord other than Allah while He is the Lord of all things?' And every soul earns only [blame] upon itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exclusive worship and submission to Allah as the one true Lord. It highlights the individual responsibility of each person for their actions and decisions, indicating that each soul will be accountable only for its own deeds. Additionally, it reminds us that in the end, all of us will return to Allah who will then clarify the disputes and differences that occurred among people during their lives.
orig: قل أغير الله أبغي ربا وهو رب كل شيء ولا تكسب كل نفس إلا عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] to test you through what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty, but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine wisdom and the test of life. It emphasizes that God has appointed humans as successors on earth and has given different ranks to different individuals. This variation in status is a means of testing them with what they have been granted. It reminds believers that even though God is swift in punishment for wrongdoing, He is also Forgiving and Merciful to those who repent and seek His forgiveness.
orig: وهو الذي جعلكم خلائف الأرض ورفع بعضكم فوق بعض درجات ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم إن ربك سريع العقاب وإنه لغفور رحيم

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
interpretation: This verse is known as the disjointed letters (Huroof Al-Muqatta'at), and its specific meaning is known only to Allah. Muslims believe that these disjointed letters are a mystery from the knowledge of Allah and serve as a proof of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an. They signify the miraculous and unique nature of the Qur'an, challenging people to bring something similar to it if they doubt its divine origin.
orig: المص

translation: This is a Book which We have revealed to you that you may bring mankind out of the darkness into the light, by the permission of their Lord, to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Book (Qur'an) as a source of guidance and enlightenment. It emphasizes that the Qur'an was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad to serve as a means of warning and a reminder for the believers. The verse conveys the importance of embracing the teachings of the Qur'an in order to guide people towards righteousness, faith, and the straight path to God. It signifies the transformative power of the Qur'an in illuminating hearts and leading believers towards the path of God's pleasure and commendation.
orig: كتاب أنزل إليك فلا يكن في صدرك حرج منه لتنذر به وذكرى للمؤمنين

translation: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and do not follow anything besides it as protectors. Little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance and teachings that have been sent down by Allah, and not to turn to others for leadership or guidance. It serves as a reminder that true guidance comes from Allah alone, and that human beings often forget this essential truth. It encourages the believers to stay steadfast on the path set by Allah and not to be led astray by worldly distractions or false teachings.
orig: اتبعوا ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم ولا تتبعوا من دونه أولياء قليلا ما تذكرون

translation: And how many a city We have destroyed, and Our punishment came to it at night or while they were sleeping at noon.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah in destroying nations that transgress His laws and commit injustices. It serves as a warning to people to reflect on the consequences of their actions and to be aware that punishment can come at any time, unexpectedly. It highlights the importance of being conscious of one's deeds and always striving to be on the path of righteousness, as Allah's punishment can descend suddenly upon those who deviate from His guidance.
orig: وكم من قرية أهلكناها فجاءها بأسنا بياتا أو هم قائلون

translation: So their declaration when Our punishment came to them was only that they said, 'Indeed, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how some individuals only recognize their wrongdoings and seek forgiveness when they are faced with the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that it is essential to repent and seek forgiveness throughout life, not just when faced with adversity.
orig: فما كان دعواهم إذ جاءهم بأسنا إلا أن قالوا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: So we will surely ask those to whom [a message] was sent, and we will surely ask the messengers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the accountability of all those who have received a message and all the messengers sent by God. It indicates that everyone will be questioned about their actions and how they fulfilled their responsibilities. This highlights the importance of spreading and upholding the message of God with sincerity and obedience.
orig: فلنسألن الذين أرسل إليهم ولنسألن المرسلين

translation: So We will relate to them, knowledge, and We were not absent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that God will reveal His knowledge and guidance to humanity continuously, and there is nothing hidden from Him. It highlights God's presence and involvement in guiding and educating His creation, reassuring believers of His continuous care and knowledge.
orig: فلنقصن عليهم بعلم وما كنا غائبين

translation: And the weighing on that Day will be the true weighing. So those whose scales are heavy, it is they who will be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the Day of Judgment when every individual's deeds will be weighed. Those whose good deeds outweigh the bad will be successful and rewarded in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder that a person's actions in this world determine their fate in the afterlife, encouraging believers to strive for righteousness and piety.
orig: والوزن يومئذ الحق فمن ثقلت موازينه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of good deeds in the eyes of Allah. Those whose scales of deeds are light on the Day of Judgment are those who have brought harm upon themselves by disregarding and oppressing the signs of Allah. It serves as a reminder that our deeds and actions in this world hold weight in the Hereafter, and the consequences of neglecting righteousness will be severe and eternal.
orig: ومن خفت موازينه فأولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم بما كانوا بآياتنا يظلمون

translation: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings and provisions that Allah has granted humanity by providing them with sustenance and means of livelihood on the Earth. Despite these gifts, it is evident that many people show ingratitude and fail to appreciate the blessings they have been given.
orig: ولقد مكناكم في الأرض وجعلنا لكم فيها معايش قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And We have certainly created you, then fashioned you, then told the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblis; he was not of those who prostrated.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of humility and obedience to God's commands. It narrates the event of when God created Adam and commanded the angels to prostrate to him, as a sign of respect and honor. This prostration was not an act of worship towards Adam, but a gesture to acknowledge God's command and the elevated status of Adam. However, Iblis (Satan) refused to prostrate out of arrogance and disobedience, which led to his downfall. The verse conveys the importance of humility, compliance with God's orders, and the consequences of arrogance and defiance.
orig: ولقد خلقناكم ثم صورناكم ثم قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس لم يكن من الساجدين

translation: He said, 'What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?' He said, 'I am better than him, You created me from fire and created him from clay.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an reflects the story of the creation of Adam and Iblis (Satan). Iblis, out of his arrogance and pride, refused to prostrate to Adam as commanded by Allah, citing his superiority based on his creation from fire. This verse serves as a reminder of the dangers of arrogance and disobedience towards Allah's commands.
orig: قال ما منعك ألا تسجد إذ أمرتك قال أنا خير منه خلقتني من نار وخلقته من طين

translation: He said, 'Descend from it, for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased.'
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to Iblis (Satan) after he refused to prostrate to Adam. It signifies that arrogance has no place in the presence of Allah, and those who are arrogant will be debased and humiliated. The verse serves as a lesson on the importance of humility and submission to the will of Allah.
orig: قال فاهبط منها فما يكون لك أن تتكبر فيها فاخرج إنك من الصاغرين

translation: He said, 'Look at me; see to which day they will be raised.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a statement made by a disbeliever who challenges the concept of resurrection and the Day of Judgment. The disbeliever asks for a sign or proof of this event to be shown to him, questioning the inevitability of the Day when all will be resurrected and held accountable for their deeds. This serves as a reminder for believers to have faith in the unseen and the importance of preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: قال أنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, you are among the observers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific event, where one of the people present is being identified as an observer. The implication is that this individual has been observed closely or is being watched meaningfully. This can indicate that their actions, intentions, or qualities are being perceived or scrutinized with significance.
orig: قال إنك من المنظرين

translation: He (Satan) said, 'Because You have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path.'
interpretation: This verse showcases Satan’s vow to mislead and tempt humanity away from the path of righteousness. It highlights the cunning and persistent nature of Satan's attempts to lead people astray and deceive them from following the straight path of God. It serves as a reminder to be cautious of falling into the traps set by those who seek to deviate us from the right path.
