translation: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and they came upon a people devoted to their idols. They said, 'O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods.' He said, 'Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of the Children of Israel and how they encountered a group of people who were deeply attached to their idols. The Israelites, influenced by the practices of these people, asked Prophet Moses to create a god for them as the idolaters had. Prophet Moses rebuked them for their ignorance, emphasizing the folly of associating partners with Allah and the importance of holding steadfast to monotheism.
orig: وجاوزنا ببني إسرائيل البحر فأتوا على قوم يعكفون على أصنام لهم قالوا يا موسى اجعل لنا إلها كما لهم آلهة قال إنكم قوم تجهلون

translation: Indeed, these [disbelievers] are disbelievers in that which they are in, and they are false in what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the state of those who disbelieve in the truth despite being aware of it. It emphasizes that their disbelief is a rejection of the reality they are in, and their actions are based on falsehood and deception. The verse warns against the consequence of denying the truth and following falsehood.
orig: إن هؤلاء متبر ما هم فيه وباطل ما كانوا يعملون

translation: He said, 'Should I seek other than Allah for God while He has favored you over the worlds?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of monotheism and the absurdity of seeking other gods besides Allah. It emphasizes that Allah's favor and grace are unparalleled and sufficient, making reliance on anyone or anything else unnecessary.
orig: قال أغير الله أبغيكم إلها وهو فضلكم على العالمين

translation: And [recall] when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment; they were killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of when they were saved from the oppressive and tyrannical rule of Pharaoh, who subjected them to severe hardship by killing their sons and sparing their women. The verse emphasizes that such trials and tribulations are tests from God, designed to prove the faith and patience of His servants.
orig: وإذ أنجيناكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب يقتلون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم

translation: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights, and completed them with ten more, so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, 'Take my place among my people, do right, and do not follow the way of the corrupt.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and his brother Aaron, where Moses is called by Allah to stay for forty nights for a special appointment. It serves as a reminder for believers to fulfill their responsibilities, to entrust tasks to trusted individuals in their absence, and to always uphold righteousness and avoid the ways of the corrupt.
orig: وواعدنا موسى ثلاثين ليلة وأتممناها بعشر فتم ميقات ربه أربعين ليلة وقال موسى لأخيه هارون اخلفني في قومي وأصلح ولا تتبع سبيل المفسدين

translation: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."
interpretation: This verse depicts the deep desire of Prophet Moses to witness the Divine presence of Allah. However, due to the limitations of human sight, it is impossible for mortal beings to directly perceive Allah in this life. The incident with the mountain symbolizes the overwhelming power and glory of Allah such that even the mountain could not withstand His presence. Moses' awe and submission upon regaining consciousness convey the profound realization of Allah's magnificence and the humility of true faith.
orig: ولما جاء موسى لميقاتنا وكلمه ربه قال رب أرني أنظر إليك قال لن تراني ولكن انظر إلى الجبل فإن استقر مكانه فسوف تراني فلما تجلى ربه للجبل جعله دكا وخر موسى صعقا فلما أفاق قال سبحانك تبت إليك وأنا أول المؤمنين

translation: He said, "O Moses, indeed I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."
interpretation: In this verse, Allah is addressing Prophet Moses, informing him of his special selection for the mission of delivering His messages and proclaiming His words. Allah instructs Moses to accept the gifts and revelations given to him and to show gratitude for them. This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and appreciation for the blessings and responsibilities entrusted to individuals by Allah.
orig: قال يا موسى إني اصطفيتك على الناس برسالاتي وبكلامي فخذ ما آتيتك وكن من الشاكرين

translation: And We inscribed for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], 'Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient.'
interpretation: This verse refers to how the message was given to Moses (peace be upon him) on tablets containing guidance and detailed explanations for everything. The instruction to 'take them with determination' emphasizes the importance of adhering firmly to the teachings. The command to order people to take the best of it indicates the significance of following the guidance in the best possible way. Additionally, the verse warns about the consequences of disobedience by showing 'the home of the defiantly disobedient', highlighting the importance of following the guidance to avoid such a fate.
orig: وكتبنا له في الألواح من كل شيء موعظة وتفصيلا لكل شيء فخذها بقوة وأمر قومك يأخذوا بأحسنها سأريكم دار الفاسقين

translation: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and even if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting how those who are arrogant and unjust on the earth will be deprived of understanding and guidance from Allah, even if they are presented with clear signs and proofs of His existence and power. It emphasizes that arrogance, denial, and heedlessness towards the signs of Allah lead people astray, causing them to choose the path of error over the path of righteousness.
orig: سأصرف عن آياتي الذين يتكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق وإن يروا كل آية لا يؤمنوا بها وإن يروا سبيل الرشد لا يتخذوه سبيلا وإن يروا سبيل الغي يتخذوه سبيلا ذلك بأنهم كذبوا بآياتنا وكانوا عنها غافلين

translation: And those who have denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they to be recompensed except for what they used to do?
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of denying the signs of Allah and the belief in the Hereafter. It conveys the message that the actions of those who reject the signs of Allah and the idea of being accountable in the Hereafter will be in vain and they will only be rewarded based on their disbelief and actions in this world.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا ولقاء الآخرة حبطت أعمالهم هل يجزون إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an condemns the act of idol worship. It reflects on a time when some of the followers of Prophet Moses fell into the sin of idolatry by creating an idol (a calf) for worship. The verse highlights the absurdity of worshipping something that cannot speak or guide, emphasizing the foolishness of turning away from the truth and following false gods. The verse serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in faith and avoid falling into the trap of worshipping anything besides the One true God.
orig: واتخذ قوم موسى من بعده من حليهم عجلا جسدا له خوار ألم يروا أنه لا يكلمهم ولا يهديهم سبيلا اتخذوه وكانوا ظالمين

translation: And when they fell in the hands of (their enemies) and saw that they had indeed gone astray, they said: 'If our Lord does not have mercy on us and forgive us, we will surely be losers.'
interpretation: This verse depicts the moment of defeat and realization of the wrong path taken by a group of people. They acknowledge their mistakes and turn to Allah seeking His mercy and forgiveness, understanding that without His guidance and forgiveness they will be at loss. It emphasizes the importance of seeking repentance and forgiveness from Allah, and the hope for His mercy even after making errors or straying from the right path.
orig: ولما سقط في أيديهم ورأوا أنهم قد ضلوا قالوا لئن لم يرحمنا ربنا ويغفر لنا لنكونن من الخاسرين

translation: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, 'How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the command of your Lord?' And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, 'O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me. So let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse portrays the emotional turmoil experienced by Prophet Moses upon his return to his people after receiving the divine commandments. Feeling disappointed by his people's actions and betrayals, Moses expresses his frustration and anger. Despite being chosen by God as a leader, he finds his people weak and willing to oppress and even kill him. His declaration reflects his struggle in dealing with the difficulties and challenges presented by his own community, calling for protection against enemies and distance from the wrongdoers.
orig: ولما رجع موسى إلى قومه غضبان أسفا قال بئسما خلفتموني من بعدي أعجلتم أمر ربكم وألقى الألواح وأخذ برأس أخيه يجره إليه قال ابن أم إن القوم استضعفوني وكادوا يقتلونني فلا تشمت بي الأعداء ولا تجعلني مع القوم الظالمين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse demonstrates the humility and supplication of Prophet Moses, seeking forgiveness not just for himself but also for his brother, Aaron. It highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah, recognizing His mercy and compassion as the most merciful of all those who show mercy.
orig: قال رب اغفر لي ولأخي وأدخلنا في رحمتك وأنت أرحم الراحمين

translation: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will certainly receive anger from their Lord and humiliation in this worldly life; and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
interpretation: This verse warns about the consequences for those who worship false gods or idols. They will face the anger of Allah and experience humiliation in this life. It serves as a reminder that those who engage in deception and falsehood will face the consequences of their actions in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين اتخذوا العجل سينالهم غضب من ربهم وذلة في الحياة الدنيا وكذلك نجزي المفترين

translation: And those who have done evil deeds and then repented after them and believed, indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who repent sincerely after committing sins. It shows that no matter how grave the sin, if a person truly repents and believes in Allah, they can be forgiven as Allah is the Most Merciful and Most Forgiving.
orig: والذين عملوا السيئات ثم تابوا من بعدها وآمنوا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets, and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of controlling one's anger, as Moses did when he calmed down. It also emphasizes that the commandments and teachings given by Allah are a source of guidance and mercy for those who have awareness and fear of their Lord, indicating that adherence to these teachings leads to righteousness and protection from harm.
orig: ولما سكت عن موسى الغضب أخذ الألواح وفي نسختها هدى ورحمة للذين هم لربهم يرهبون

translation: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, 'My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the story of Prophet Moses choosing seventy men to come with him for an appointment with Allah. When an earthquake strikes, Moses pleads to Allah to spare them, indicating his concern for their well-being despite their errors. The verse highlights the concept of divine trials and tests, where Allah has the power to guide whom He wills and send astray whom He wills. It also emphasizes seeking forgiveness, mercy, and acknowledging Allah as the ultimate forgiver.
orig: واختار موسى قومه سبعين رجلا لميقاتنا فلما أخذتهم الرجفة قال رب لو شئت أهلكتهم من قبل وإياي أتهلكنا بما فعل السفهاء منا إن هي إلا فتنتك تضل بها من تشاء وتهدي من تشاء أنت ولينا فاغفر لنا وارحمنا وأنت خير الغافرين

translation: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the mercy and justice of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah's mercy encompasses everything, and He decrees goodness both in this world and in the Hereafter. It also highlights the importance of piety, obedience to Allah's commands, giving charity, and belief in His signs. The verse reflects the concept of divine decree and the rewards for the righteous believers who demonstrate their faith through their actions.
orig: واكتب لنا في هذه الدنيا حسنة وفي الآخرة إنا هدنا إليك قال عذابي أصيب به من أشاء ورحمتي وسعت كل شيء فسأكتبها للذين يتقون ويؤتون الزكاة والذين هم بآياتنا يؤمنون

translation: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered Prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the characteristics and behaviors of true believers who follow the Messenger of Allah, who is described as the unlettered Prophet. These believers are those who adhere to what is right, avoid what is wrong, enjoy what is good, and forbid what is evil. They are relieved of their burdens and previous restrictions. True success is promised to those who believe, honor, support, and follow the guidance brought by the Messenger, as it leads them to righteousness and prosperity in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: الذين يتبعون الرسول النبي الأمي الذي يجدونه مكتوبا عندهم في التوراة والإنجيل يأمرهم بالمعروف وينهاهم عن المنكر ويحل لهم الطيبات ويحرم عليهم الخبائث ويضع عنهم إصرهم والأغلال التي كانت عليهم فالذين آمنوا به وعزروه ونصروه واتبعوا النور الذي أنزل معه أولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Say, "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role and mission of the Messenger of Allah, specifying that he is sent to all of mankind by the One who has dominion over the heavens and the earth. It calls for belief in Allah, the Messenger, and following his guidance for the attainment of guidance and righteousness.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إني رسول الله إليكم جميعا الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض لا إله إلا هو يحيي ويميت فآمنوا بالله ورسوله النبي الأمي الذي يؤمن بالله وكلماته واتبعوه لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of guidance through truth and the establishment of justice in the community. It emphasizes the duty of believers to lead others towards righteousness by upholding truth and justice, following the example set by the community of Moses.
orig: ومن قوم موسى أمة يهدون بالحق وبه يعدلون

translation: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, 'Strike with your staff the stone,' and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], 'Eat from the good things with which We have provided you.' And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse talks about the miraculous incidents that occurred with the tribe of Israel during their journey through the desert under Moses' guidance. It mentions how Allah provided for them in extraordinary ways, such as producing water from a rock, shading them with clouds, and sending them manna and quails for food. Despite all these blessings, the verse highlights that the people did not wrong Allah, but rather wronged themselves through their actions. It emphasizes the importance of gratitude and obedience to Allah's provisions.
orig: وقطعناهم اثنتي عشرة أسباطا أمما وأوحينا إلى موسى إذ استسقاه قومه أن اضرب بعصاك الحجر فانبجست منه اثنتا عشرة عينا قد علم كل أناس مشربهم وظللنا عليهم الغمام وأنزلنا عليهم المن والسلوى كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم وما ظلمونا ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility, obedience to God's command, and seeking forgiveness in order to receive mercy and blessings. It encourages believers to be grateful for the provisions and blessings granted to them, to supplicate sincerely for forgiveness, and to enter places of worship with humility and devotion. By doing so, Allah promises to forgive their sins and increase their rewards for their good deeds.
orig: وإذ قيل لهم اسكنوا هذه القرية وكلوا منها حيث شئتم وقولوا حطة وادخلوا الباب سجدا نغفر لكم خطيئاتكم سنزيد المحسنين

translation: So We punished those who were unjust among them, and We caused them to taste a severe punishment because they were defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that those who commit injustice and wrongdoings will face consequences for their actions. The punishment they receive is a result of their own actions and disobedience to Allah's commands. It serves as a warning for people to be mindful of their behavior and to stay away from wrongdoing and oppression.
orig: فبدل الذين ظلموا منهم قولا غير الذي قيل لهم فأرسلنا عليهم رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يظلمون

translation: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in the [matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse mentions the story of a town by the sea whose people were tested with the observance of the Sabbath. The townspeople were prohibited from fishing on the Sabbath but were tempted to disobey. This trial was a test of their obedience and piety, and because of their defiance and disobedience, they were ultimately punished.
orig: واسألهم عن القرية التي كانت حاضرة البحر إذ يعدون في السبت إذ تأتيهم حيتانهم يوم سبتهم شرعا ويوم لا يسبتون لا تأتيهم كذلك نبلوهم بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And when a community among them said, 'Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?' they [the advisors] said, 'To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of advising and warning others, even if they are facing severe punishment or destruction from Allah. The act of advising serves as a means of seeking absolution from God and can potentially lead people to develop piety and fear of Him. It demonstrates the mercy and hope for guidance even in difficult circumstances.
orig: وإذ قالت أمة منهم لم تعظون قوما الله مهلكهم أو معذبهم عذابا شديدا قالوا معذرة إلى ربكم ولعلهم يتقون

translation: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and adhering to the teachings and reminders provided in the Qur'an. It highlights the consequences of forgetting and turning away from these reminders, indicating that righteous individuals who forbid evil will be saved, while those who engage in wrongdoing and disobedience will face a severe punishment as a result of their persistent defiance.
orig: فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به أنجينا الذين ينهون عن السوء وأخذنا الذين ظلموا بعذاب بئيس بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: So when they disregarded that about which they had been forbidden, We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of people who were disobedient to God's commandments and indulged in immoral behavior despite being warned against it. As a consequence of their actions, they were transformed into apes as a symbol of degradation and dishonor. The verse serves as a warning against the consequences of disobedience and the importance of following divine guidance.
orig: فلما عتوا عن ما نهوا عنه قلنا لهم كونوا قردة خاسئين

translation: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse demonstrates the balance of qualities possessed by Allah. While He is swift in punishment for those who transgress His limits and commit wrong, He is also described as Forgiving and Merciful, ready to forgive those who repent and seek His mercy. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience as well as the endless mercy and forgiveness of Allah for those who seek it.
orig: وإذ تأذن ربك ليبعثن عليهم إلى يوم القيامة من يسومهم سوء العذاب إن ربك لسريع العقاب وإنه لغفور رحيم

translation: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad [times] that perhaps they would return [to obedience].
interpretation: This verse highlights how people were divided into different nations with varying levels of righteousness. They were tested with both blessings and hardships to see if they would turn back to God in obedience. It serves as a reminder that trials in life are meant to bring people closer to God and encourage them to repent and seek righteousness.
orig: وقطعناهم في الأرض أمما منهم الصالحون ومنهم دون ذلك وبلوناهم بالحسنات والسيئات لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Then a posterity succeeded them who inherited the Book, taking the goods of this lower life, and saying, 'It will be forgiven us.' And if similar goods come to them again, they will take them. Has a pledge not been taken from them, in the Book, not to tell lies against Allah, and have they not studied that which is within it? The Home of the Hereafter is better for those who are God-conscious. Will you not use your reason?
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of some who came after the previous generations of believers, who were given the responsibility of the Book (Scripture). Instead of upholding the teachings of the Book and striving for the Hereafter, they become consumed with worldly possessions, all the while hoping for forgiveness regardless of their actions. They neglect the deeper meaning of the teachings and obligations outlined in the Scripture and fail to grasp the importance of being truthful in their beliefs and actions. The verse serves as a reminder that the Hereafter holds greater value for those who sincerely fear and are conscious of God, urging people to reflect and use their intellect to understand this important message.
orig: فخلف من بعدهم خلف ورثوا الكتاب يأخذون عرض هذا الأدنى ويقولون سيغفر لنا وإن يأتهم عرض مثله يأخذوه ألم يؤخذ عليهم ميثاق الكتاب أن لا يقولوا على الله إلا الحق ودرسوا ما فيه والدار الآخرة خير للذين يتقون أفلا تعقلون

translation: And those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the promise of Allah to preserve and reward those who hold fast to the teachings of the Qur'an and establish regular prayers. It assures believers that their efforts in upholding the message of the Book and performing acts of righteousness will not go unnoticed, for Allah does not neglect the reward of those who strive to improve themselves and the society around them.
orig: والذين يمسكون بالكتاب وأقاموا الصلاة إنا لا نضيع أجر المصلحين

translation: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allah said], 'Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might become righteous.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates an incident where the Children of Israel asked Prophet Musa (Moses) to show them Allah directly, and as a response to their demand, Allah caused the mountain to be raised over them. The scene was so awe-inspiring that they feared the mountain would fall on them. The message behind this incident is to emphasize the importance of obedience to Allah's commands and to remember the teachings and signs that have been given for the purpose of attaining righteousness and piety.
orig: وإذ نتقنا الجبل فوقهم كأنه ظلة وظنوا أنه واقع بهم خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واذكروا ما فيه لعلكم تتقون

translation: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], 'Am I not your Lord?' They said, 'Yes, we have testified.' [This] - lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, 'Indeed, we were of this unaware.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the pre-existence of every human soul before being born into this world. It signifies a covenant made by every individual with their Creator before their earthly existence, acknowledging their belief in Him. It serves as a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, no one will have an excuse for rejecting the truth as they had acknowledged it before their earthly life began.
orig: وإذ أخذ ربك من بني آدم من ظهورهم ذريتهم وأشهدهم على أنفسهم ألست بربكم قالوا بلى شهدنا أن تقولوا يوم القيامة إنا كنا عن هذا غافلين

translation: Or do you say that our ancestors associated others [with Allah] before, and we were descendants after them? So will You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?
interpretation: This verse questions the idea that just because one's ancestors practiced associating partners with Allah, their descendants should face punishment for their actions. It highlights the importance of personal accountability and the fact that individuals will be accountable for their own deeds and beliefs, regardless of the actions of their ancestors.
orig: أو تقولوا إنما أشرك آباؤنا من قبل وكنا ذرية من بعدهم أفتهلكنا بما فعل المبطلون

translation: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become manifest.
interpretation: This verse explains that the signs and verses in the Quran are detailed and clear for people to reflect upon. By reflecting on these signs, one can come to understand the truth and guidance within the Quran. It also warns that the ultimate fate of those who persist in wrongdoing will be made clear and they will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: وكذلك نفصل الآيات ولعلهم يرجعون

translation: Recite to them the news of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he detached himself from them, so Satan pursued him, and he became one of the misguided.
interpretation: This verse highlights a key process where a person is given clear signs and guidance from Allah, but then due to his own actions, he separates himself from that guidance. As a result, Shaytan (Satan) takes advantage of this separation, leading the person astray and causing him to become lost and misguided.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ الذي آتيناه آياتنا فانسلخ منها فأتبعه الشيطان فكان من الغاوين

translation: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the consequences of neglecting the guidance and signs of Allah and following one's desires instead. Just like a dog that pants whether you chase it or leave it be, those who deny the signs of Allah will find themselves restless and unsatisfied. The verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the stories and lessons from the Qur'an to attain understanding and guidance.
orig: ولو شئنا لرفعناه بها ولكنه أخلد إلى الأرض واتبع هواه فمثله كمثل الكلب إن تحمل عليه يلهث أو تتركه يلهث ذلك مثل القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فاقصص القصص لعلهم يتفكرون

translation: Evil is the example of the people who denied Our signs and wronged themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of denying the signs of Allah and committing wrongdoing. It serves as a warning against rejecting the truth and oppressing oneself by straying from the path of righteousness and denying the clear signs and guidance provided by Allah.
orig: ساء مثلا القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا وأنفسهم كانوا يظلمون

translation: Whomever Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but whomever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of guidance in Islam. It emphasizes that true guidance comes from Allah. Those who are guided by Allah are on the right path, while those who are led astray from the path of righteousness will ultimately suffer loss. It serves as a reminder for believers to seek guidance from Allah and to follow His guidance in order to attain success and avoid failure.
orig: من يهد الله فهو المهتدي ومن يضلل فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. They are like livestock; rather, they are [even] more astray. It is they who are the heedless.
interpretation: This verse describes a group of people who are spiritually blind, deaf, and ignorant. Despite having the faculties of hearing, seeing, and understanding, they do not utilize them in the right way, and as a result, they are compared to cattle. Their heedlessness towards the signs and guidance of Allah leads them astray and keeps them away from the path of righteousness and truth.
orig: ولقد ذرأنا لجهنم كثيرا من الجن والإنس لهم قلوب لا يفقهون بها ولهم أعين لا يبصرون بها ولهم آذان لا يسمعون بها أولئك كالأنعام بل هم أضل أولئك هم الغافلون

translation: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of invoking Allah by His beautiful names and attributes. It warns against those who deviate from the true meanings and interpretations of His names. Those who misinterpret the names of Allah will face consequences for their actions.
orig: ولله الأسماء الحسنى فادعوه بها وذروا الذين يلحدون في أسمائه سيجزون ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of guidance and establishing justice in society. It emphasizes the role of certain communities or individuals who are tasked with guiding others towards truth and justice. It emphasizes the responsibility of these individuals to lead by example and ensure fairness and righteousness in their dealings.
orig: وممن خلقنا أمة يهدون بالحق وبه يعدلون

translation: And those who have denied Our signs, We will gradually lead them from where they do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who deny the signs of Allah and His guidance will be led astray without even realizing it. It serves as a warning that disbelief can lead to further misguidance and deviation from the right path, ultimately leading to a state of ignorance and loss.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون

translation: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fact that Allah's plan is steady and strong, and that He provides time for individuals to reflect on their actions before they face the consequences. It serves as a reminder that Allah's decree is unwavering and His justice is just, and that individuals should take heed of their deeds and strive to follow the right path.
orig: وأملي لهم إن كيدي متين

translation: Do they not reflect within themselves? Allah created the heavens and the earth and everything between them in truth and for an appointed term. Yet many people deny that they will meet their Lord.
interpretation: This verse is reminding the disbelievers to ponder and reflect on the signs of Allah's existence and power within themselves and in the world around them. It emphasizes the truth of the creation of heavens and earth by Allah and the importance of recognizing one's purpose in life and the accountability towards meeting your Lord in the Hereafter. It serves as a warning to those who deny the existence of Allah and the Day of Judgment.
orig: أولم يتفكروا ما بصاحبهم من جنة إن هو إلا نذير مبين

translation: Have they not looked at the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that God has created, and that perhaps their time is near? So in what statement after this will they believe?
interpretation: This verse is inviting people to reflect upon the signs of God's creation in the heavens and the earth, and consider the transient nature of life, as one's own death may be approaching. It challenges them to think deeply about what could possibly convince them to believe after witnessing such clear signs of God's existence and power.
orig: أولم ينظروا في ملكوت السماوات والأرض وما خلق الله من شيء وأن عسى أن يكون قد اقترب أجلهم فبأي حديث بعده يؤمنون

translation: Whoever Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse explains that those who deviate from the path of righteousness after Allah has guided them will not find any guidance. They will be left to wander in their disobedience and arrogance, unable to see the truth clearly due to their own wrongdoings.
orig: من يضلل الله فلا هادي له ويذرهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: They ask you about the Hour, when will it be? Say: 'Its knowledge is only with my Lord, none but He can reveal its time. Heavy is its burden through the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except suddenly.' They ask you as though you are well acquainted with it. Say: 'Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most people do not know.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the timing of the final Hour and Day of Judgment is known only to Allah. It highlights the mysterious nature and immense weight of this event, warning that it will come suddenly and unexpectedly. The passage serves to remind believers that despite their curiosity about the Hour, only Allah has the knowledge of its timing, and that most people are unaware of the true reality and significance of this Day.
orig: يسألونك عن الساعة أيان مرساها قل إنما علمها عند ربي لا يجليها لوقتها إلا هو ثقلت في السماوات والأرض لا تأتيكم إلا بغتة يسألونك كأنك حفي عنها قل إنما علمها عند الله ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Say, "I have no power to benefit myself or harm myself, except what Allah wills. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am only a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of relying on the will of Allah in all matters. It emphasizes that ultimate power lies with Allah, and humans have limited control over their own fate. Even if one had knowledge of the unseen, they couldn't alter their destiny without Allah's will. The verse also points out that the role of believers is to warn others of the consequences of their actions and to give them hope and good news based on their faith.
orig: قل لا أملك لنفسي نفعا ولا ضرا إلا ما شاء الله ولو كنت أعلم الغيب لاستكثرت من الخير وما مسني السوء إن أنا إلا نذير وبشير لقوم يؤمنون

translation: He it is Who created you from a single soul and made from it its mate, that he may find comfort in her. And when he covered her, she carried a light burden, and she passed by with it. But when it became heavy, they called upon Allah, their Lord, 'If You give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the origin of mankind from a single soul, emphasizing the unity and interconnectedness of humanity. It also touches upon the process of creation, development, and challenges faced in conceiving a child. The verse underscores the importance of gratitude and calling upon Allah in times of need, acknowledging His role as the Creator and Sustainer of all life.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من نفس واحدة وجعل منها زوجها ليسكن إليها فلما تغشاها حملت حملا خفيفا فمرت به فلما أثقلت دعوا الله ربهما لئن آتيتنا صالحا لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: So when he gave them good tidings, they ascribed partners to Him in what He had given them. But exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ingratitude and disbelief of those who, despite receiving blessings from Allah, associate partners with Him and attribute those blessings to others besides Him. The verse reminds us of the importance of recognizing and being grateful to Allah as the ultimate source of all blessings, and that attributing partners to Him is a grave sin. It serves as a warning against the act of shirk (associating partners with Allah) and encourages believers to maintain pure monotheism in their faith and actions.
orig: فلما آتاهما صالحا جعلا له شركاء فيما آتاهما فتعالى الله عما يشركون

translation: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are themselves created?
interpretation: This verse questions the logic of associating partners with Allah, who is the ultimate Creator, when those partners themselves have no creative power and are created beings. It emphasizes the absurdity of attributing divine attributes to anything besides Allah.
orig: أيشركون ما لا يخلق شيئا وهم يخلقون

translation: And they will not be able to help themselves, nor can they be helped.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate powerlessness of those who are worshipped besides Allah. It shows that neither these false deities nor their followers can offer any real help or support when faced with challenges or difficulties. It highlights the importance of putting faith and reliance solely on Allah, the All-Powerful and All-Sustaining.
orig: ولا يستطيعون لهم نصرا ولا أنفسهم ينصرون

translation: And if you call them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same to you whether you call them or you are silent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that even if you invite others to follow the path of guidance and righteousness, not everyone will heed your call. Despite this, the responsibility lies in calling them to goodness, whether they choose to follow or not is up to them. The verse reminds us of the importance of persisting in spreading goodness and not being disheartened by the response of others.
orig: وإن تدعوهم إلى الهدى لا يتبعوكم سواء عليكم أدعوتموهم أم أنتم صامتون

translation: Indeed, those whom you invoke other than Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything or anyone other than Allah. It highlights that those who are worshipped besides Allah are incapable of responding to the prayers and calls of their worshippers. The verse challenges those who associate partners with Allah to call upon them and see if they can truly respond, emphasizing the uniqueness and power of Allah as the only One worthy of worship.
orig: إن الذين تدعون من دون الله عباد أمثالكم فادعوهم فليستجيبوا لكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they hear? Say: Call your (so-called) partners (of Allah) and then plot against me, spare me not.
interpretation: This verse questions the credibility of false gods or partners associated with Allah by asking whether they have abilities such as walking, holding, seeing, or hearing. It emphasizes the futility of worshiping gods that lack power and challenges people to consider the true nature of their beliefs before plotting against the messenger of Allah.
orig: ألهم أرجل يمشون بها أم لهم أيد يبطشون بها أم لهم أعين يبصرون بها أم لهم آذان يسمعون بها قل ادعوا شركاءكم ثم كيدون فلا تنظرون

translation: Verily, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is the Guardian of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief that Allah is the ultimate protector and guardian of the righteous. It highlights the importance of relying on Allah and seeking His guidance and protection, especially for those who strive to do good and lead a righteous life.
orig: إن وليي الله الذي نزل الكتاب وهو يتولى الصالحين

translation: And those you invoke other than Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that besides Allah, no one else has the power to truly help or support anyone. It emphasizes the importance of relying on Allah alone for assistance and protection as all other beings are powerless in comparison.
orig: والذين تدعون من دونه لا يستطيعون نصركم ولا أنفسهم ينصرون

translation: And if you call them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of spiritual blindness, where even when individuals are presented with guidance and truth, they fail to actually perceive or understand it. They may physically see the messenger calling them towards the right path, but their hearts and minds remain closed off to accepting the guidance being offered.
orig: وإن تدعوهم إلى الهدى لا يسمعوا وتراهم ينظرون إليك وهم لا يبصرون

translation: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of forgiveness, promoting goodness, and avoiding ignorant people. It encourages believers to adopt a forgiving and kind attitude, promote righteousness, and stay away from ignorance and negativity.
orig: خذ العفو وأمر بالعرف وأعرض عن الجاهلين

translation: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse teaches that when one encounters whispers or evil suggestions from Satan, they should seek protection and refuge in Allah, who is All-Hearing and All-Knowing. By turning to Allah for help, believers can shield themselves from the whispers of Satan and find strength in their faith.
orig: وإما ينزغنك من الشيطان نزغ فاستعذ بالله إنه سميع عليم

translation: Indeed, those who fear when touched by an impulse from the devil and remember [Allah]; then indeed they are enlightened.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of God-consciousness and remembrance of Allah in protecting oneself from the whispers and temptations of Satan. Those who are mindful of Allah and seek His protection are able to see the truth clearly and are guided to the right path.
orig: إن الذين اتقوا إذا مسهم طائف من الشيطان تذكروا فإذا هم مبصرون

translation: And their brethren increase them in error, then they do not stop short.
interpretation: This verse warns about how some people, even their own brothers, may lead them astray and increase them in error. It emphasizes that they will not cease in their wrongdoing, showcasing the dangers of following those who misguide others on the wrong path.
orig: وإخوانهم يمدونهم في الغي ثم لا يقصرون

translation: And when you do not bring them a sign, they say, 'Why have you not contrived it?' Say, 'I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection and questioning faced by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by those who demanded miracles as proof of his prophethood. The verse emphasizes that the Qur'an itself is a powerful sign and a source of guidance and mercy from Allah for those who believe. It shows that true faith is based on accepting the message of the Qur'an and following the guidance revealed by Allah, rather than relying on worldly miracles or demands for extraordinary signs.
orig: وإذا لم تأتهم بآية قالوا لولا اجتبيتها قل إنما أتبع ما يوحى إلي من ربي هذا بصائر من ربكم وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of attentively listening to the Qur'an when it is being recited. By actively listening, one can hope to attain mercy and compassion from Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers to give their full attention to the recitation of the Qur'an in order to benefit from its teachings and guidance.
orig: وإذا قرئ القرآن فاستمعوا له وأنصتوا لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And mention your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering Allah sincerely and humbly, without the need for public displays. It instructs believers to maintain a constant awareness of Allah during all times, particularly in the morning and evening. The verse also warns against negligence and encourages a consciousness of Allah in one's innermost self.
orig: واذكر ربك في نفسك تضرعا وخيفة ودون الجهر من القول بالغدو والآصال ولا تكن من الغافلين

translation: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and devotion of the righteous believers towards their Lord. It emphasizes that those close to God are free from arrogance, fully engaged in worship, glorifying Him, and expressing their submission through prostration. It serves as a reminder of the importance of sincerity and humility in one's worship and devotion to God.
orig: إن الذين عند ربك لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ويسبحونه وله يسجدون

translation: They ask you about the spoils of war. Say: "The spoils of war belong to Allah and the Messenger, so fear Allah, reconcile between yourselves, and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you are believers."
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of distributing the spoils of war, emphasizing that the spoils belong to Allah and His Messenger. It instructs believers to fear Allah, reconcile conflicts among themselves, and obey Allah and the Prophet Muhammad. The verse highlights the importance of unity, justice, and obedience in the context of war and conflicts.
orig: يسألونك عن الأنفال قل الأنفال لله والرسول فاتقوا الله وأصلحوا ذات بينكم وأطيعوا الله ورسوله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, feel a fear in their hearts and when His verses are recited to them, it increases their faith; and upon their Lord they rely.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the qualities of true believers. It describes how a genuine believer is someone whose heart trembles in awe and fear when they remember Allah, and whose faith is strengthened by reciting the verses of the Qur'an. They put their trust in Allah, relying solely on Him. This verse highlights the importance of having a deep and sincere connection with Allah through remembrance, faith, and reliance on Him.
orig: إنما المؤمنون الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم وإذا تليت عليهم آياته زادتهم إيمانا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: Those who establish prayer and from what We have provided them, they spend.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of two core principles in Islam: establishing prayer and giving in charity. It emphasizes that true believers are those who not only perform their prayers regularly but also are generous in giving from what they have been provided by Allah. This serves as a reminder to Muslims to be steadfast in their prayers and to share their wealth with those in need, as acts of worship and righteousness.
orig: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: Those are the true believers. They will have high ranks with their Lord, along with forgiveness and generous provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities and rewards of true believers. It emphasizes that true believers will be honored with high spiritual ranks in the sight of their Lord, along with forgiveness for their shortcomings and abundant provision as a gracious gift. It serves as a reminder of the blessings that await those who sincerely believe and strive to uphold their faith.
orig: أولئك هم المؤمنون حقا لهم درجات عند ربهم ومغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: Just as your Lord brought you out of your home in truth, while indeed, a party among the believers were unwilling.
interpretation: This verse is reminding the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of how Allah had supported him and brought him out of his home during difficult times, referring to the migration from Makkah to Madinah. It also acknowledges that even among the believers, there were some who were hesitant or reluctant to support his mission. The verse serves as a reminder of the challenges faced in spreading the message of Islam and the importance of remaining steadfast despite opposition.
orig: كما أخرجك ربك من بيتك بالحق وإن فريقا من المؤمنين لكارهون

translation: They argue with you concerning the truth after it has become clear as though they are being herded toward death while they are looking on.
interpretation: This verse describes the stubbornness and opposition of some people to the truth even when it is clear to them. It compares their resistance to following the truth to being led towards death while they are fully aware of the impending consequence. It highlights the irrationality and futility of denying the truth when it is evident.
orig: يجادلونك في الحق بعدما تبين كأنما يساقون إلى الموت وهم ينظرون

translation: And [remember] when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is reminding believers of a past event where Allah promised them victory over one of the two groups in battle. Even though they preferred the weaker group to fight, Allah's plan was to establish truth and defeat the disbelievers. The verse highlights that victory ultimately comes from Allah's will and wisdom, not just relying on physical strength or numbers.
orig: وإذ يعدكم الله إحدى الطائفتين أنها لكم وتودون أن غير ذات الشوكة تكون لكم ويريد الله أن يحق الحق بكلماته ويقطع دابر الكافرين

translation: So that the truth may be confirmed and falsehood negated, even if the criminals dislike it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate victory of truth over falsehood, even if wrongdoers may detest it. It teaches us that no matter how much resistance or objection the truth faces from those who commit crimes and engage in wrongdoing, eventually truth will prevail and falsehood will be exposed and invalidated.
orig: ليحق الحق ويبطل الباطل ولو كره المجرمون

translation: When you sought help from your Lord, He answered you: 'I am sending you reinforcement of a thousand angels in succession.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of seeking help from Allah in times of need and the readiness of divine assistance. It emphasizes that Allah responds to the pleas of His servants and provides support beyond human capabilities, indicating the power and mercy of God.
orig: إذ تستغيثون ربكم فاستجاب لكم أني ممدكم بألف من الملائكة مردفين

translation: And Allah has not made it except as good tidings and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Quran was revealed to bring glad tidings and peace to the hearts of humanity. It reminds believers that true victory can only come from Allah, highlighting His supreme power and wisdom. Therefore, it encourages reliance on Allah for success and assures that His wisdom surpasses all.
orig: وما جعله الله إلا بشرى ولتطمئن به قلوبكم وما النصر إلا من عند الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: When He caused drowsiness to overcome you as a security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky water by which to purify you and remove from you the uncleanliness of Satan and to make steadfast your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of trust in Allah's protection. It signifies that Allah alone provides a sense of security and purity through physical and spiritual means. The rain mentioned here is not just a physical purifier but also a spiritual cleanser that removes the impurities caused by the whispers of Satan. The verse serves as a reminder to trust in Allah's support, which helps to strengthen hearts and keep believers steadfast on the right path.
orig: إذ يغشيكم النعاس أمنة منه وينزل عليكم من السماء ماء ليطهركم به ويذهب عنكم رجز الشيطان وليربط على قلوبكم ويثبت به الأقدام

translation: When your Lord inspired to the angels, 'I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip.'
interpretation: This verse describes a situation where God commands the angels to give strength to the believers and strike fear into the hearts of the disbelievers. It emphasizes the concept of divine protection for the believers and warnings for those who reject faith. The verse also alludes to the consequences for those who oppose the message of God.
orig: إذ يوحي ربك إلى الملائكة أني معكم فثبتوا الذين آمنوا سألقي في قلوب الذين كفروا الرعب فاضربوا فوق الأعناق واضربوا منهم كل بنان

translation: This is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of opposing Allah and His Messenger. It serves as a reminder that going against the teachings and guidance of Allah and His Messenger will result in severe punishment. It emphasizes the importance of obedience and submission to the divine commandments, as well as the need to avoid actions that would lead to opposing the authority of Allah and His Messenger.
orig: ذلك بأنهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاقق الله ورسوله فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: So taste [punishment] and indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning and a reminder of the consequences for those who reject faith and deviate from the path of righteousness. It emphasizes the concept of accountability for one's deeds and the eventual punishment that awaits those who choose denial and disbelief. The verse highlights the seriousness of rejecting the truth and the grave consequences that follow such actions, ultimately stressing the importance of faith and obedience to Allah.
orig: ذلكم فذوقوه وأن للكافرين عذاب النار

translation: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
interpretation: This verse advises the believers to stand firm in the face of adversaries and not retreat when confronted by those who reject the message of Islam. It emphasizes the importance of courage and steadfastness in defending one's faith and principles, even in challenging situations.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا لقيتم الذين كفروا زحفا فلا تولوهم الأدبار

translation: And whoever turns away from them on that day - unless he is swerving [as if] to [face] a different foe or joining [another] group - has certainly returned with anger [upon him] from Allah, and his refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an warns that those who withdraw or turn away from the battle on the day of fighting, except those who do so for tactical reasons or to regroup with their fellow believers, will face the anger of Allah and their destination will be Hell, which is a terrible abode. The verse emphasizes the importance of commitment to the cause with complete sincerity and determination.
orig: ومن يولهم يومئذ دبره إلا متحرفا لقتال أو متحيزا إلى فئة فقد باء بغضب من الله ومأواه جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: So you did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not [the handful of dust], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw it that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse conveys that ultimate power and control lie with Allah, even in situations where it may seem otherwise. It emphasizes that every trial believers face is a test from Allah to strengthen their faith. It reassures believers that Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions, and that His wisdom transcends human comprehension.
orig: فلم تقتلوهم ولكن الله قتلهم وما رميت إذ رميت ولكن الله رمى وليبلي المؤمنين منه بلاء حسنا إن الله سميع عليم

translation: That is so; and that Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the schemes and plots of the disbelievers will ultimately fail as Allah will render them ineffective. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ultimate power and the eventual failure of those who oppose Him.
orig: ذلكم وأن الله موهن كيد الكافرين

translation: If you ask for victory, victory has already come to you; and if you desist, it is better for you. But if you return [to hostility], We will return, and your forces will not avail you at all, however numerous they may be. And that God is with the believers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that true victory comes from Allah, and seeking His guidance and support is essential. It also emphasizes that if one turns away from hostility, it is for their own benefit. Even if a person's forces and numbers increase, without Allah's support, they will not succeed. It ultimately reassures the believers that Allah is with them and will guide and protect them as long as they remain steadfast in faith.
orig: إن تستفتحوا فقد جاءكم الفتح وإن تنتهوا فهو خير لكم وإن تعودوا نعد ولن تغني عنكم فئتكم شيئا ولو كثرت وأن الله مع المؤمنين

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn away from him while you hear [his message].
interpretation: This verse is addressing the believers, instructing them to obey Allah and His Messenger without turning away from them, especially when receiving their guidance and teachings. It emphasizes the importance of attentiveness and obedience to the divine commandments, reminding the believers to actively engage with the messages and not ignore them.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله ورسوله ولا تولوا عنه وأنتم تسمعون

translation: And do not be like those who say, 'We have heard,' while they do not hear.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to be sincere and attentive when listening to divine guidance. Merely claiming to have heard and understood without truly internalizing and following the teachings is futile. It warns against hypocrisy and emphasizes the importance of truly listening and comprehending the message of God.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين قالوا سمعنا وهم لا يسمعون

translation: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the importance of reason and understanding. It illustrates that those who do not use their intellect, reason, and understanding are considered the worst among all living creatures by Allah. The deaf and dumb mentioned here are not those with physical disabilities, but rather those who deprive themselves of understanding and fail to contemplate the signs and guidance of Allah. It emphasizes the significance of using one's intellect to comprehend and follow the teachings of the Qur'an.
orig: إن شر الدواب عند الله الصم البكم الذين لا يعقلون

translation: And if Allah had known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
interpretation: This verse highlights that if Allah had seen any potential for goodness or faith in certain disbelievers, He would have guided them and made them hear the truth. However, it is emphasized that even if they were to hear it, their disbelief and rejection would remain unchanged due to their stubbornness and deliberate aversion from the truth.
orig: ولو علم الله فيهم خيرا لأسمعهم ولو أسمعهم لتولوا وهم معرضون

translation: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to respond to the call of Allah and His Messenger, as it brings life to their hearts and souls. It also reminds them that Allah is aware of what is in the hearts of people, and ultimately, all will be gathered before Him for accountability and judgment.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا استجيبوا لله وللرسول إذا دعاكم لما يحييكم واعلموا أن الله يحول بين المرء وقلبه وأنه إليه تحشرون

translation: And fear the trial which affects not in particular (only) those of you who do wrong; and know that Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against the consequences of a trial or punishment that may not discriminate between those who are wrongdoers and those who are not. It serves as a reminder that one should be mindful of their actions as God's punishment can be severe and all-encompassing.
orig: واتقوا فتنة لا تصيبن الذين ظلموا منكم خاصة واعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب

translation: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you, but He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things that you might be grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights a reminder of the past hardships and vulnerabilities faced by the early believers. It emphasizes how Allah protected them, granted them victory, and provided sustenance in abundance. The underlying message is to be grateful for the blessings, support, and protection provided by Allah, especially during times of difficulty and scarcity.
orig: واذكروا إذ أنتم قليل مستضعفون في الأرض تخافون أن يتخطفكم الناس فآواكم وأيدكم بنصره ورزقكم من الطيبات لعلكم تشكرون

translation: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers not to betray the trust placed upon them by Allah, His Messenger, and others. It emphasizes the importance of being truthful and faithful in all matters, whether they are personal responsibilities or obligations towards God and His Messenger. It serves as a reminder that one should always uphold their commitments and responsibilities, especially when entrusted with something valuable.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تخونوا الله والرسول وتخونوا أماناتكم وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And know that your possessions and your children are but a trial, and that Allah has with Him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that their wealth and children are a test from Allah. They can be a means of distraction from the path of righteousness if one becomes overly attached to them. The true reward lies with Allah and is far greater than any worldly possession or relationship. It serves as a reminder to prioritize the hereafter over the temporary pleasures of this world.
orig: واعلموا أنما أموالكم وأولادكم فتنة وأن الله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse addresses the believers, encouraging them to maintain a conscious awareness of Allah, which will lead to the ability to distinguish between right and wrong, good and evil. By fearing Allah and being mindful of Him, a believer can gain clarity and insight in their decisions and actions. The verse also highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah, emphasizing that by being conscious of Him, believers can have their sins erased and be granted His grace and blessings. It serves as a reminder of the importance of piety and mindfulness in the life of a believer, as it leads to spiritual growth, purification of the self, and divine mercy.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تتقوا الله يجعل لكم فرقانا ويكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويغفر لكم والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: And [remember] when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that despite the plots and schemes of the disbelievers against the believers, ultimately, it is Allah's plan that will prevail. It conveys the concept of divine protection and guidance, reassuring believers that Allah's plans are superior to any human plots. It also emphasizes the importance of trust and reliance on Allah in the face of adversity.
orig: وإذ يمكر بك الذين كفروا ليثبتوك أو يقتلوك أو يخرجوك ويمكرون ويمكر الله والله خير الماكرين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, 'We have heard. If we willed, we could say something like this. This is nothing but legends of the former people.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of some individuals when they are presented with the signs and verses of the Qur'an. They dismiss these profound revelations as mere myths and tales of the past, showing their arrogance and disregard for the truth. It serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and openness to divine guidance.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا قالوا قد سمعنا لو نشاء لقلنا مثل هذا إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: And when they said, 'O Allah, if this is the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a moment of disbelief and arrogance from a group of people, demanding a sign from Allah to prove the truth of the message they were being presented. This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and the importance of seeking guidance with an open heart and mind.
orig: وإذ قالوا اللهم إن كان هذا هو الحق من عندك فأمطر علينا حجارة من السماء أو ائتنا بعذاب أليم

translation: And Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them. And Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
interpretation: This verse reassures and emphasizes that Allah would not punish a community while a prophet is among them, guiding and warning them. It also emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah, as His mercy and forgiveness are readily available to those who repent and seek His pardon.
orig: وما كان الله ليعذبهم وأنت فيهم وما كان الله معذبهم وهم يستغفرون

translation: And why should Allah not punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al-Haram and they were not its guardians? Its guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who obstruct others from the sacred mosque, despite not being its true guardians. It emphasizes that the true custodians of sacred places are the righteous individuals who uphold piety. The verse points out the ignorance of many who act in ways that defy righteousness and understanding of the sacred. It serves as a reminder that righteous and pious individuals are the ones truly protecting sacred places, not those who create obstacles and hinder access to them.
orig: وما لهم ألا يعذبهم الله وهم يصدون عن المسجد الحرام وما كانوا أولياءه إن أولياؤه إلا المتقون ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And their prayer at the House (of Allah) was nothing but whistling and clapping. So taste the punishment because of what you used to disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the hypocrites who would perform their prayers at the Kaaba in Makkah with insincerity and in a disrespectful manner, through whistling and clapping, without true devotion or faith. The verse warns them of the consequences of their disbelief and insincerity, reminding them that their actions will lead to punishment in the hereafter.
orig: وما كان صلاتهم عند البيت إلا مكاء وتصدية فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it, then it will be for them a [source of] regret, and then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse describes the actions of those who disbelieve in Allah, stating that they spend their wealth to hinder others from following the path of Allah. However, their efforts will ultimately be in vain, and they will regret their actions as they will not succeed in their efforts. Ultimately, those who disbelieve will face the consequences of their disbelief and wrongdoing, being gathered in Hell as a result.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينفقون أموالهم ليصدوا عن سبيل الله فسينفقونها ثم تكون عليهم حسرة ثم يغلبون والذين كفروا إلى جهنم يحشرون

translation: Allah will distinguish the evil from the good, and place the evil on one another, and heap them all together, and cast them into Hell. Those are the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice, where Allah will separate the wicked from the righteous, and the evildoers will be grouped together and punished in Hell. It emphasizes that ultimately, those who choose to do wrong and disobey Allah will be the ultimate losers.
orig: ليميز الله الخبيث من الطيب ويجعل الخبيث بعضه على بعض فيركمه جميعا فيجعله في جهنم أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say to those who have disbelieved, if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them; but if they return, then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that forgiveness is always available for those who sincerely repent and turn away from disbelief and wrongdoing. It emphasizes the importance of taking heed of the consequences of not heeding the warnings and examples of those who have come before us. It serves as a call to reflect on the patterns of behavior that lead to destruction and to make the conscious choice to change for the better.
orig: قل للذين كفروا إن ينتهوا يغفر لهم ما قد سلف وإن يعودوا فقد مضت سنت الأولين

translation: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease - then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to fight against those who pose a threat to the religion of Islam and to establish the supremacy of the religion of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of eliminating corruption and ensuring that the worship and allegiance are solely for Allah. However, it also reminds that if the enemies cease their hostility and aggression, then it is advised to stop the fight, as Allah is aware of all actions and intentions.
orig: وقاتلوهم حتى لا تكون فتنة ويكون الدين كله لله فإن انتهوا فإن الله بما يعملون بصير

translation: And if they turn away, then know that Allah is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that even if people turn away from them, they should remember that Allah is their ultimate protector and supporter. Allah is described as the best protector and the best helper, emphasizing the importance of relying on Him in times of need and difficulty.
orig: وإن تولوا فاعلموا أن الله مولاكم نعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for Allah is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have believed in Allah and in that which We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And Allah, over all things, is competent.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers about the distribution of war booty and emphasizes the importance of fulfilling the rights of various categories of people, including Allah, the Messenger, relatives, orphans, the needy, and travelers. It serves as a reminder to uphold justice and fairness in the distribution of wealth and resources, showing that those who believe in Allah and follow His guidance will be guided to act with righteousness and compassion towards those in need.
orig: واعلموا أنما غنمتم من شيء فأن لله خمسه وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل إن كنتم آمنتم بالله وما أنزلنا على عبدنا يوم الفرقان يوم التقى الجمعان والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: When you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, while the caravan was below you. And if you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the divine destiny and decree of Allah. It highlights the concept that Allah's plans are perfect and that everything that occurs is according to His will. Those who perish in disbelief do so with clear evidence or proof, and those who live in faith also have clear evidence or signs to guide them. It reminds believers that Allah is all-hearing and all-knowing, overseeing all affairs with wisdom and precision.
orig: إذ أنتم بالعدوة الدنيا وهم بالعدوة القصوى والركب أسفل منكم ولو تواعدتم لاختلفتم في الميعاد ولكن ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا ليهلك من هلك عن بينة ويحيى من حي عن بينة وإن الله لسميع عليم

translation: When Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you (believers) would surely have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter (of the prophethood). But Allah saved (you). Verily, He is the Knower of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's wisdom and mercy in revealing truths gradually to the believers in a way that they can handle. It also emphasizes how Allah protects the believers from unnecessary disputes and challenges that may arise if too much was revealed at once. The verse reminds believers of Allah's deep knowledge of their innermost feelings and thoughts, and the importance of trust and patience in accepting His guidance.
orig: إذ يريكهم الله في منامك قليلا ولو أراكهم كثيرا لفشلتم ولتنازعتم في الأمر ولكن الله سلم إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And [remember] when they showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and they made you appear few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah are [all] matters returned.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of how the believers were made to appear weak and insignificant in the eyes of their enemies, but in reality, it was part of Allah's plan to accomplish His decree. It emphasizes the ultimate authority and control of Allah over all matters, highlighting the importance of placing trust in Him and relying on His divine plan.
orig: وإذ يريكموهم إذ التقيتم في أعينكم قليلا ويقللكم في أعينهم ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, when you encounter a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to remain steadfast and remember Allah frequently when faced with challenges or adversaries. By staying strong in faith and continuously remembering and relying on Allah, they will find success and triumph over difficulties.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا لقيتم فئة فاثبتوا واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage and [then] your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, and the avoidance of disputes among believers which can lead to failure and weakness. It urges believers to be patient in facing challenges, reminding them that Allah is with those who persevere and remain steadfast in their faith.
orig: وأطيعوا الله ورسوله ولا تنازعوا فتفشلوا وتذهب ريحكم واصبروا إن الله مع الصابرين

translation: And do not be like those who came forth from their homes insolently and to be seen by people and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And Allah is encompassing of what they do.
