interpretation: This verse advises against arrogance, showing off, and misleading people from the path of Allah. It warns against seeking worldly recognition at the expense of sincerity and humble devotion to God. The verse serves as a reminder to remain sincere in intentions and actions, as Allah is fully aware of all that we do.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين خرجوا من ديارهم بطرا ورئاء الناس ويصدون عن سبيل الله والله بما يعملون محيط

translation: And [mention] when Satan made their deeds pleasing to them and said, 'No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector.' But when the two armies sighted each other, he turned on his heels and said, 'Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed, I fear Allah. And Allah is severe in penalty.'
interpretation: This verse describes how Satan can deceive people by making their actions seem pleasant and promising them protection and victory. However, when a situation arises that reveals the truth, Satan distances himself from them and acknowledges his fear and submission to Allah, reminding us that Allah's punishment is severe for those who fall into his traps.
orig: وإذ زين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم وقال لا غالب لكم اليوم من الناس وإني جار لكم فلما تراءت الفئتان نكص على عقبيه وقال إني بريء منكم إني أرى ما لا ترون إني أخاف الله والله شديد العقاب

translation: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease said, 'Their religion has deluded these [believers].' But whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the criticism and mockery that hypocrites and disbelievers direct towards believers, claiming that their faith is based on delusion. However, the verse emphasizes that those who put their trust in Allah will find that Allah is powerful and wise, capable of guiding and protecting them despite the doubts and criticism of others.
orig: إذ يقول المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض غر هؤلاء دينهم ومن يتوكل على الله فإن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: And if you could but see when the disbelievers are brought before the angels, striking their faces and their backs and [saying], 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.'
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in the Hereafter where the disbelievers will face a severe punishment and agony in the form of physical and spiritual torment. The disbelievers will be struck by the angels and will be made to taste the excruciating punishment of the Hellfire. It serves as a warning and a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and going against the guidance of Allah.
orig: ولو ترى إذ يتوفى الذين كفروا الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: This is because of what your hands have sent ahead, and Allah is not ever unjust to the servants.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that the consequences one faces are a result of their own actions. Allah emphasizes that He is never unjust to His servants and that everyone will be held accountable for their deeds. It serves as a warning to be mindful of one's actions as they will ultimately affect one's own fate.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت أيديكم وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: Like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them, they disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the consequences of rejecting the signs and messages of Allah. Those who disbelieved in the past faced severe punishment from Allah due to their sins. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of believing in Allah's signs and the severity of the punishment for those who choose to reject them.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كفروا بآيات الله فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم إن الله قوي شديد العقاب

translation: That is because Allah would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that Allah's favors and blessings are conditional upon the response and actions of people. If people choose to disobey Allah or turn away from His guidance, they risk losing His blessings. Allah will not withdraw His blessings arbitrarily but will do so only in response to the actions and choices that people make. It highlights the importance of individuals taking responsibility for their own actions and striving to maintain a connection with Allah in order to continue receiving His blessings.
orig: ذلك بأن الله لم يك مغيرا نعمة أنعمها على قوم حتى يغيروا ما بأنفسهم وأن الله سميع عليم

translation: Like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them, they rejected the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh - and all of them were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of rejecting the signs of Allah and persisting in wrongdoing, using the fate of Pharaoh and his people as an example. It serves as a reminder of the inevitable punishment faced by those who choose to deny the truth and engage in oppression and injustice.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كذبوا بآيات ربهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وكل كانوا ظالمين

translation: Verily, the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are those who disbelieve; they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the seriousness of disbelief in the eyes of Allah. It points out that those who reject faith are likened to the worst of creatures. It serves as a warning to disbelievers about the consequences of their denial and emphasizes the importance of belief as a core aspect of faith.
orig: إن شر الدواب عند الله الذين كفروا فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who break their covenant with Allah by going against His commandments, spreading corruption, and causing division. The verse warns that those who do so will face the consequences of their actions and will be cursed with a miserable abode in the afterlife.
orig: الذين عاهدت منهم ثم ينقضون عهدهم في كل مرة وهم لا يتقون

translation: So, when you meet those who disbelieve in battle, strike their necks until you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then bind them in chains. And either confer favour afterwards or demand ransom until the war lays down its burdens. That is the command. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them, but He ordered armed struggle to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allah - never will He waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the conduct during battle and the rules of engagement. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining discipline and control during warfare while also allowing for the possibility of mercy or ransom towards the enemy combatants. The verse underscores the gravity of war and the need to act with justice and in accordance with the command of Allah. It also highlights the concept of martyrdom and the eternal value of those who sacrifice their lives in defense of Islam.
orig: فإما تثقفنهم في الحرب فشرد بهم من خلفهم لعلهم يذكرون

translation: And if you fear treachery from a people, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like the treacherous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honesty and integrity in agreements and treaties. It advises that if one fears betrayal or treachery from the other party in a covenant, it is better to renounce the agreement in a fair and just manner rather than persist under false pretenses. It highlights that betrayal is frowned upon by Allah, and it is crucial to uphold trustworthiness and sincerity in all dealings and relationships.
orig: وإما تخافن من قوم خيانة فانبذ إليهم على سواء إن الله لا يحب الخائنين

translation: And let not those who disbelieve think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to the disbelievers, cautioning them against thinking that they will be able to avoid the consequences of their disbelief. It emphasizes that their disbelief will not lead them to succeed in escaping or thwarting the ultimate decree of Allah. The verse conveys the message that ultimately, no one can escape the consequences of their actions, and that the disbelievers will face the consequences of their denial and rejection of faith.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين كفروا سبقوا إنهم لا يعجزون

translation: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse talks about preparing for defense and protection against enemies with the resources and means available, including military power if necessary. It emphasizes the need to be strong and proactive in defending against those who stand against the message of Allah and pose a threat. The verse also reassures that any expenditure made in the path of Allah will be duly rewarded by Allah without any injustice.
orig: وأعدوا لهم ما استطعتم من قوة ومن رباط الخيل ترهبون به عدو الله وعدوكم وآخرين من دونهم لا تعلمونهم الله يعلمهم وما تنفقوا من شيء في سبيل الله يوف إليكم وأنتم لا تظلمون

translation: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it and rely upon Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of pursuing peace and reconciliation. Muslims are encouraged to accept and embrace peace when it is offered, and to place their trust in Allah. It highlights that Allah is all-hearing and all-knowing, and believers should have faith that He will guide them towards the right path in matters of peace and reconciliation.
orig: وإن جنحوا للسلم فاجنح لها وتوكل على الله إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, then indeed, Allah is your protector. It is He who supported you with His help and with the believers.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that if anyone tries to deceive or harm them, Allah is their protector and supporter. It reminds them that God's help is always present, and He strengthens them with the support of fellow believers.
orig: وإن يريدوا أن يخدعوك فإن حسبك الله هو الذي أيدك بنصره وبالمؤمنين

translation: And if you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have brought their hearts together; but Allah brought them together. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and wisdom of Allah in unifying hearts. It highlights that no matter what resources one may have, true cohesion and unity among people can only be achieved through Allah's will and guidance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of relying on Allah to foster harmony and understanding among individuals.
orig: وألف بين قلوبهم لو أنفقت ما في الأرض جميعا ما ألفت بين قلوبهم ولكن الله ألف بينهم إنه عزيز حكيم

translation: O Prophet, Sufficient for you is Allah and [for] whoever follows you of the believers.
interpretation: This verse is a reassurance and support from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad, informing him that Allah's help is enough for him in facing any challenges or enemies. It also highlights the importance of following the Prophet for the believers, emphasizing that those who follow him faithfully will always have Allah's support and protection.
orig: يا أيها النبي حسبك الله ومن اتبعك من المؤمنين

translation: O Prophet, urge the believers to fight. If there are among you twenty [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disbelieved because they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to be steadfast and courageous in times of conflict or battle. It highlights the importance of quality over quantity, suggesting that a small group of steadfast believers can overcome a much larger group of disbelievers. The emphasis is on the strength of faith and determination, rather than sheer numbers. It serves as a reminder to the believers that victory is achievable through perseverance, faith, and strategic planning, regardless of the odds.
orig: يا أيها النبي حرض المؤمنين على القتال إن يكن منكم عشرون صابرون يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم مائة يغلبوا ألفا من الذين كفروا بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: Now Allah has lightened your burden, for He knows that there is weakness in you. So if there are one hundred of you who are patient, they will overcome two hundred; and if there are one thousand of you, they will overcome two thousand by Allah's leave. And Allah is with the patient.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that Allah is aware of their weaknesses and has lightened their burden. It emphasizes the importance of patience and perseverance in facing challenges, as even a small group with patience can overcome a larger force. The verse reminds believers that success comes with Allah's permission, and He is always with those who are patient and steadfast in their faith.
orig: الآن خفف الله عنكم وعلم أن فيكم ضعفا فإن يكن منكم مائة صابرة يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم ألف يغلبوا ألفين بإذن الله والله مع الصابرين

translation: It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [on Allah's enemies] in the land. Some Muslims desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires for you the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the principle that prophets should not keep captives of war unless it is necessary to establish justice and peace. It also warns against worldly desires that may distract from the ultimate goal of seeking the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the wisdom and power of Allah in guiding the believers.
orig: ما كان لنبي أن يكون له أسرى حتى يثخن في الأرض تريدون عرض الدنيا والله يريد الآخرة والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Had it not been for a decree from Allah that preceded, surely there would have touched you for what you took a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine decree and destiny. It conveys the idea that everything happens according to the will of Allah, and that any punishment or hardship faced by individuals is a result of their own actions. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of accountability and the belief in God's ultimate judgment and justice.
orig: لولا كتاب من الله سبق لمسكم فيما أخذتم عذاب عظيم

translation: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of consuming halal (lawful) and wholesome food, and reminds believers to be conscious of Allah while doing so. It highlights the significance of mentioning the name of Allah before consuming any sustenance, as a way of acknowledging His blessings and showing gratitude. By being mindful of Allah in matters as basic as eating, believers show their faith and devotion, recognizing that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: فكلوا مما غنمتم حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O Prophet, say to those who are in your hands as captives: 'If Allah knows any good in your hearts, He will give you something better than what has been taken from you, and He will forgive you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet and the believers to treat prisoners of war with kindness and mercy. It emphasizes that Allah knows the true intentions of people's hearts and rewards them accordingly. It encourages compassion towards captives and highlights Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لمن في أيديكم من الأسرى إن يعلم الله في قلوبكم خيرا يؤتكم خيرا مما أخذ منكم ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, then verily, Allah is All-Sufficient for you. He it is Who has supported you with His help and with the believers.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that if others intend to deceive or betray them, then they are ultimately betraying Allah before betraying them. It signifies that Allah is all-knowing and wise, and He will always support the believers in times of deceit and betrayal.
orig: وإن يريدوا خيانتك فقد خانوا الله من قبل فأمكن منهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought with their wealth and lives in the cause of Allah, and those who gave shelter and helped - they are allies of one another. But those who believed and did not emigrate - for you is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. And if they seek help of you for the religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity and mutual support among believers. It highlights the bond between those who actively strive and sacrifice in the way of Allah, and those who offer help and support to fellow believers. It also stresses that true allegiance is to those who share in the struggles of faith and righteousness. The verse reminds that assistance in matters of faith is a duty among believers, but warns that this help should not extend to those with whom there is a mutual agreement or treaty of peace, and that Allah is watching over all actions and intentions.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك بعضهم أولياء بعض والذين آمنوا ولم يهاجروا ما لكم من ولايتهم من شيء حتى يهاجروا وإن استنصروكم في الدين فعليكم النصر إلا على قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And those who disbelieve are allies of one another. If you do not do so, there will be fitnah on earth and great corruption.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that those who disbelieve in the truth of Allah and His message tend to ally with each other, forming a bond in opposition to the believers. The verse warns against disunity among the believers, emphasizing the importance of standing together in faith and righteousness. It also cautions that if the believers do not unite and uphold their faith, it could lead to chaos, disorder, and corruption on earth.
orig: والذين كفروا بعضهم أولياء بعض إلا تفعلوه تكن فتنة في الأرض وفساد كبير

translation: And those who have believed and emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - it is they who are the believers, truly. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities and actions of true believers in Islam. It emphasizes the importance of faith, migration for the sake of Allah, striving in His cause, providing shelter, and supporting others in need. True believers are promised forgiveness from Allah and abundant provisions as a reward for their sincere faith and good deeds.
orig: والذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك هم المؤمنون حقا لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who believe thereafter and emigrate and strive with you - they are of you. But those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity and brotherhood among believers. It highlights that those who believe, emigrate for the sake of their faith, and strive in the way of Allah alongside the community are considered as part of that community. It also underscores the importance of maintaining strong family ties and supporting one another. Ultimately, it reminds that Allah is aware and knowledgeable of all aspects of life and relationships.
orig: والذين آمنوا من بعد وهاجروا وجاهدوا معكم فأولئك منكم وأولو الأرحام بعضهم أولى ببعض في كتاب الله إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: An exemption from Allah and His Messenger to those of the polytheists with whom you made a treaty.
interpretation: This verse speaks about maintaining treaties and agreements with non-Muslims, even idolaters, as long as they do not breach the agreements. It emphasizes the importance of honoring and upholding agreements and treaties, even with those who may not share the same beliefs. This is a reminder of the importance of trust and reliability in relationships, as breaking agreements is seen as a serious matter in Islam.
orig: براءة من الله ورسوله إلى الذين عاهدتم من المشركين

translation: So travel freely for four months throughout the land. But know that you cannot escape Allah and that Allah will humiliate the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority of Allah over all affairs. It emphasizes that, despite the freedom to travel and move about in the world, one cannot truly elude Allah's decree and judgment. The verse warns the disbelievers of the consequences of their actions, making it clear that eventually, all will be held accountable for their beliefs and deeds.
orig: فسيحوا في الأرض أربعة أشهر واعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وأن الله مخزي الكافرين

translation: And [it shall be an announcement] from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage that Allah is free from [all obligations to] the polytheists, and [so is] His Messenger. So if you repent, that is best for you; but if you turn away - then know that you will not cause failure to Allah. And give tidings to those who disbelieve of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage, a declaration will be made by Allah and His Messenger declaring Allah's disassociation from the polytheists and their beliefs. It encourages repentance as the best course of action, but even if people turn away from this call, they should know that they cannot hinder Allah's will. It also warns the disbelievers of a severe punishment awaiting them.
orig: وأذان من الله ورسوله إلى الناس يوم الحج الأكبر أن الله بريء من المشركين ورسوله فإن تبتم فهو خير لكم وإن توليتم فاعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وبشر الذين كفروا بعذاب أليم

translation: Except for those who have made a treaty with you among the polytheists and then have not been deficient toward you in anything or supported anyone against you; so complete for them their treaty until their term [has ended]. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling treaties and agreements made with others, even those who may not share the same beliefs. It emphasizes the value of keeping one's word and respecting agreements until their proper conclusion. The verse also emphasizes Allah's love for those who are conscious of Him and act righteously in their interactions with others.
orig: إلا الذين عاهدتم من المشركين ثم لم ينقصوكم شيئا ولم يظاهروا عليكم أحدا فأتموا إليهم عهدهم إلى مدتهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: So when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the rules of engagement during times of conflict for Muslims. It instructs to fight against those who are actively opposing the Muslim community, but also allows for forgiveness and mercy for those who repent, establish prayer, and give charity.
orig: فإذا انسلخ الأشهر الحرم فاقتلوا المشركين حيث وجدتموهم وخذوهم واحصروهم واقعدوا لهم كل مرصد فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فخلوا سبيلهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing kindness and providing protection to those who seek refuge, even if they are polytheists, in order for them to hear the message of Allah. It promotes treating others with compassion and guiding them towards safety, even if they hold different beliefs, as they may come to understand the truth.
orig: وإن أحد من المشركين استجارك فأجره حتى يسمع كلام الله ثم أبلغه مأمنه ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعلمون

translation: How can there be a covenant with the polytheists by Allah and His Messenger except for those with whom you made a covenant near the sacred Mosque? So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding agreements and covenants made with others, particularly in the sacred and respected places like the sacred Mosque. It highlights the value of integrity and righteousness in honoring commitments, with a reminder that God loves those who are mindful and conscious of Him in their actions.
orig: كيف يكون للمشركين عهد عند الله وعند رسوله إلا الذين عاهدتم عند المسجد الحرام فما استقاموا لكم فاستقيموا لهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: And if they come to you, they do not observe any loyalty to you, either in respect to kinship or treaty. They please you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse warns against hypocritical behavior, where people may claim loyalty or friendship outwardly, but their true intentions and feelings are opposite. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity and integrity in relationships, urging believers to be cautious of those who may betray trust or harbor ill intentions, even if they pretend otherwise.
orig: كيف وإن يظهروا عليكم لا يرقبوا فيكم إلا ولا ذمة يرضونكم بأفواههم وتأبى قلوبهم وأكثرهم فاسقون

translation: They exchange the verses of Allah for a small price and divert [people] from His way. Indeed, it is evil that they are doing.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who distort the teachings of Allah for the sake of worldly gain and lead others astray from the right path. It criticizes the act of putting a monetary value on divine guidance and emphasizes the evil nature of such actions.
orig: اشتروا بآيات الله ثمنا قليلا فصدوا عن سبيله إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: They do not observe toward a believer any oath or treaty. Those are the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling promises and treating believers with trust and honesty. It condemns those who do not honor their commitments and transgress against others, emphasizing the significance of integrity and keeping one's word in the Islamic faith.
orig: لا يرقبون في مؤمن إلا ولا ذمة وأولئك هم المعتدون

translation: But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincere repentance, establishing prayers, and giving zakah for fostering brotherhood in faith. It emphasizes that true brotherhood in religion is based on these actions, and it also underscores the importance of understanding and reflecting on the verses of the Qur'an for those who seek knowledge.
orig: فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فإخوانكم في الدين ونفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: And if they break their oaths after their treaty and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, they have no faith, so that they will desist.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to defend themselves if their treaties are violated and their religion is attacked. It highlights the importance of standing against those who promote disbelief and falsehood, reminding believers to resist such attacks to uphold the truth and faith.
orig: وإن نكثوا أيمانهم من بعد عهدهم وطعنوا في دينكم فقاتلوا أئمة الكفر إنهم لا أيمان لهم لعلهم ينتهون

translation: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] believers.
interpretation: This verse is urging believers to stand up and defend themselves when they are faced with aggression and violence from those who have betrayed their oaths and seek to harm the Messenger of God. It emphasizes the importance of fearing God more than fearing the enemies, reminding believers that true faith requires them to place their trust and fear in Allah above all else.
orig: ألا تقاتلون قوما نكثوا أيمانهم وهموا بإخراج الرسول وهم بدءوكم أول مرة أتخشونهم فالله أحق أن تخشوه إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and heal the breasts of a believing people.
interpretation: This verse is a call to fight against those who pose a threat to the believers and the message of Islam. It indicates that victory will be granted to the believers, as Allah will provide them with strength and support. The healing of the breasts of the believers suggests that through this struggle, the believers will find solace and comfort, reinforcing their faith and resolve.
orig: قاتلوهم يعذبهم الله بأيديكم ويخزهم وينصركم عليهم ويشف صدور قوم مؤمنين

translation: And [Allah] repels anger from their hearts. And Allah gives guidance to whom He wills. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah has the power to remove anger and ill feelings from the hearts of believers, guiding them towards righteousness and forgiveness. It emphasizes Allah's sovereignty in guiding whom He wills, based on His knowledge and wisdom.
orig: ويذهب غيظ قلوبهم ويتوب الله على من يشاء والله عليم حكيم

translation: Do you think that you will be left alone, while Allah has not yet known those among you who strive hard and do not take anyone other than Allah, His Messenger, and the believers as intimate friends? And Allah is Aware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions. It warns against forming close relationships with those who oppose Allah, His Messenger, and the believers. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of Allah and choosing righteous companionship.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تتركوا ولما يعلم الله الذين جاهدوا منكم ولم يتخذوا من دون الله ولا رسوله ولا المؤمنين وليجة والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah [while] witnessing against themselves with disbelief. [For] those, their deeds have become worthless, and in the Fire they will abide eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sanctity of mosques and the importance of sincere worship. It warns against those who maintain mosques outwardly but harbor disbelief in their hearts. Such actions are futile and will not be accepted by Allah. The verse serves as a reminder that true worship requires sincerity and faith, and hypocritical behavior will not be rewarded.
orig: ما كان للمشركين أن يعمروا مساجد الله شاهدين على أنفسهم بالكفر أولئك حبطت أعمالهم وفي النار هم خالدون

translation: The mosques of Allah shall be maintained only by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, establish prayer, and give zakah, and fear none but Allah. It is they who are expected to be among the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the maintenance of mosques is the responsibility of those who have true faith in Allah and the Last Day, and practice their faith through establishing prayer, giving zakah (charity), and having a deep reverence for Allah alone. It highlights that such individuals are expected to be guided on the right path, as their actions reflect their faith and dedication to God.
orig: إنما يعمر مساجد الله من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وأقام الصلاة وآتى الزكاة ولم يخش إلا الله فعسى أولئك أن يكونوا من المهتدين

translation: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrims and the maintenance of al-Masjid al-Haram equal to those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and strive in the cause of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and integrity in faith and actions. It highlights that certain good deeds, such as providing water for pilgrims and maintaining a sacred mosque, do not carry the same weight in the sight of Allah as acts of true faith, belief in the Last Day, and striving in the path of Allah. It reminds believers that genuine faith and efforts for the sake of Allah hold superior value, and that Allah does not guide those who act unjustly and insincerely.
orig: أجعلتم سقاية الحاج وعمارة المسجد الحرام كمن آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وجاهد في سبيل الله لا يستوون عند الله والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those who believed and emigrated and strove in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah. And it is those who are the attainers of success.
interpretation: This verse highlights the superior status of those who believe in Allah, migrate for His sake, and strive for His cause with their wealth and lives. Such individuals are considered of higher rank and are deemed successful in the eyes of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of faith, sacrifice, and dedication in the path of Allah as key components of achieving success and earning His favor.
orig: الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله بأموالهم وأنفسهم أعظم درجة عند الله وأولئك هم الفائزون

translation: Their Lord gives them glad tidings of mercy from Him, and approval, and of gardens where lasting pleasure will be theirs.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that those who believe and do righteous deeds will be rewarded by their Lord with His mercy and pleasure, as well as being granted entry into eternal gardens where they will experience everlasting joy and delight. It serves as an encouragement for believers to stay steadfast in their faith and deeds, in anticipation of the ultimate reward that awaits them in the afterlife.
orig: يبشرهم ربهم برحمة منه ورضوان وجنات لهم فيها نعيم مقيم

translation: Living therein forever, surely Allah has a great reward with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of eternal life in Paradise as a reward from Allah for the believers. It emphasizes the infinite nature of the blessings awaiting those who adhere to faith and righteousness, symbolizing the incomparable and immense reward that Allah has prepared for the righteous ones in the afterlife.
orig: خالدين فيها أبدا إن الله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever does so among you - then it is they who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against taking their fathers or brothers as allies if they have chosen disbelief over belief, indicating that one's loyalty should not compromise their faith. It emphasizes the importance of standing firm in one's belief even if it means severing ties with close relatives who go against the teachings of Islam.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا آباءكم وإخوانكم أولياء إن استحبوا الكفر على الإيمان ومن يتولهم منكم فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that one's love for material possessions, family, and wealth should not surpass their love for Allah, His Messenger, and the duty of striving in the way of Allah. It urges believers to prioritize their faith and devotion above all worldly attachments, emphasizing the importance of remaining steadfast and patient in facing life's challenges and temptations. It highlights the significance of prioritizing the love and obedience towards Allah and His guidance over all other worldly distractions and interests.
orig: قل إن كان آباؤكم وأبناؤكم وإخوانكم وأزواجكم وعشيرتكم وأموال اقترفتموها وتجارة تخشون كسادها ومساكن ترضونها أحب إليكم من الله ورسوله وجهاد في سبيله فتربصوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: Indeed, Allah has given you victory on many battlefields. And on the day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you at all, and the earth was confining for you with its vastness; then you turned back, fleeing.
interpretation: This verse from the Quran serves as a reminder that victory comes from Allah alone, not from numbers or material possessions. It highlights the importance of true faith and humility, as even with great numbers, success is not guaranteed without the help and support of Allah. It also warns against arrogance and overconfidence, as they can lead to defeat despite outward appearances of strength.
orig: لقد نصركم الله في مواطن كثيرة ويوم حنين إذ أعجبتكم كثرتكم فلم تغن عنكم شيئا وضاقت عليكم الأرض بما رحبت ثم وليتم مدبرين

translation: Then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and sent down armies [of angels] that you did not see and punished those who disbelieved. And that is the recompense of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah sent down tranquility upon His Messenger (Prophet Muhammad) and the believers, and also sent down unseen armies of angels to support them. At the same time, Allah punished the disbelievers for their rejection of the truth. The verse emphasizes that disbelief leads to punishment, highlighting the consequences of denying the truth and the support and protection Allah provides to the believers.
orig: ثم أنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وأنزل جنودا لم تروها وعذب الذين كفروا وذلك جزاء الكافرين

translation: Then Allah turns in forgiveness to whom He wills; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the infinite mercy and forgiveness of Allah. It emphasizes that regardless of our past mistakes and sins, Allah is always ready to accept our repentance and forgive us if we sincerely turn to Him. It also signifies that no sin is too great for Allah to forgive if one sincerely seeks His forgiveness. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's boundless mercy and the importance of repentance in seeking His forgiveness and guidance.
orig: ثم يتوب الله من بعد ذلك على من يشاء والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this, their [final] year. And if you fear privation, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers, informing them that the polytheists are impure and should not be allowed to approach the sacred mosque after the specified year. It also reassures the believers that if they fear poverty or suffering as a result of implementing this prohibition, Allah will provide for them from His endless bounty according to His wisdom. The verse highlights the importance of upholding purity and boundaries, as well as trusting in Allah's wisdom and provision.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما المشركون نجس فلا يقربوا المسجد الحرام بعد عامهم هذا وإن خفتم عيلة فسوف يغنيكم الله من فضله إن شاء إن الله عليم حكيم

translation: Fight those who do not believe in Allah or in the Last Day and do not consider unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have made unlawful and who do not adopt the religion of truth from those who were given the Scripture - [fight] until they give the jizyah willingly while they are humbled.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to stand against those who oppose God's commands, do not believe in the teachings of Islam, and continue in their disbelief. It emphasizes the importance of defending the principles of Islam and seeking justice, even in the face of adversity.
orig: قاتلوا الذين لا يؤمنون بالله ولا باليوم الآخر ولا يحرمون ما حرم الله ورسوله ولا يدينون دين الحق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب حتى يعطوا الجزية عن يد وهم صاغرون

translation: And the Jews say, 'Ezra is the son of Allah,' and the Christians say, 'The Messiah is the son of Allah.' That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved [before them]. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse highlights the grave error of the Jews and Christians in ascribing sons to Allah, which echoes the falsehood of those who rejected faith in the past. It condemns the act of attributing offspring to the Divine based on mere words without any foundation. The verse serves as a warning against such grave deviations from the true monotheistic belief in Allah.
orig: وقالت اليهود عزير ابن الله وقالت النصارى المسيح ابن الله ذلك قولهم بأفواههم يضاهئون قول الذين كفروا من قبل قاتلهم الله أنى يؤفكون

translation: They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides Allah, and [also] the Messiah, the son of Mary. And they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse is warning against the practice of some people who elevate their scholars, monks, and even Jesus, the son of Mary, to the status of lords besides Allah. The verse emphasizes the oneness of God, stating that the true command is to worship only one God and that there is no deity but Him. It condemns the act of associating partners with God and asserts the absolute uniqueness and supremacy of Allah over all else.
orig: اتخذوا أحبارهم ورهبانهم أربابا من دون الله والمسيح ابن مريم وما أمروا إلا ليعبدوا إلها واحدا لا إله إلا هو سبحانه عما يشركون

translation: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futile attempts of disbelievers to diminish the guidance and truth of Allah with their words and actions. However, it emphasizes that Allah's light of guidance and truth can never be extinguished by the disbelievers' efforts. It indicates that Allah's light will prevail and shine even brighter despite the opposition and hatred of those who reject faith.
orig: يريدون أن يطفئوا نور الله بأفواههم ويأبى الله إلا أن يتم نوره ولو كره الكافرون

translation: He it is Who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all religion, however much the idolaters may be averse.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate triumph of the guidance and the religion of truth brought by the Messenger of Allah, even in the face of resistance from idolaters and those who oppose it. It signifies the certainty of the truth prevailing and spreading, regardless of the opposition it faces.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed many of the scholars and monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to those who use their religious positions to exploit others and accumulate wealth unjustly, and do not spend their riches in the way of Allah. It condemns the scholars and monks who deceive people for personal gain, and the hoarding of wealth without using it for good deeds. The verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in one's faith and actions, and reminds believers of the consequences of such wrongful behavior.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن كثيرا من الأحبار والرهبان ليأكلون أموال الناس بالباطل ويصدون عن سبيل الله والذين يكنزون الذهب والفضة ولا ينفقونها في سبيل الله فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: The day they are exposed to the Fire of Hell, with their faces, sides, and backs striking it, 'This is what you hoarded for yourselves, so taste what you used to hoard.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who accumulate wealth and material possessions in this world. It illustrates that on the Day of Judgment, the accumulated wealth will be of no benefit and will be turned into a source of punishment. It emphasizes that material possessions should not be accumulated at the expense of neglecting one's spiritual well-being or the rights of others. The verse urges individuals to consider their actions and intentions in this world, reminding them that hoarding material wealth will be of no avail in the Hereafter, and that reckoning for their deeds will come on that Day.
orig: يوم يحمى عليها في نار جهنم فتكوى بها جباههم وجنوبهم وظهورهم هذا ما كنزتم لأنفسكم فذوقوا ما كنتم تكنزون

translation: Indeed, the number of months with Allah is twelve [lunar] months in the register of Allah [from] the day He created the heavens and the earth; of these, four are sacred. That is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the disbelievers collectively as they fight against you collectively. And know that Allah is with the righteous [who fear Him].
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the sanctity of the twelve lunar months, with four of them being especially revered. It also enjoins believers to fight against those who oppose them and to be mindful not to wrong themselves during any time, but particularly during the sacred months. Additionally, the verse reassures that Allah is with those who are righteous and God-fearing, indicating divine support for those who uphold the correct faith and act justly.
orig: إن عدة الشهور عند الله اثنا عشر شهرا في كتاب الله يوم خلق السماوات والأرض منها أربعة حرم ذلك الدين القيم فلا تظلموا فيهن أنفسكم وقاتلوا المشركين كافة كما يقاتلونكم كافة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: The evil ones only increase in disbelief Allah will allow those who disbelieved to go astray due to their misdeeds. They allow it one year and forbid it another year that they may make up for the number of months which Allah has forbidden. Thus they make lawful what Allah has forbidden. Their evil deeds seem pleasing to them. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse warns against the practice of manipulating religious laws to suit one's desires. It highlights the hypocrisy of those who deliberately twist the rules set by Allah in order to justify their transgressions. Such actions only lead to further disbelief and misguidance. The verse underscores the danger of deviating from the straight path and the consequences of altering divine laws for personal gains or indulgences.
orig: إنما النسيء زيادة في الكفر يضل به الذين كفروا يحلونه عاما ويحرمونه عاما ليواطئوا عدة ما حرم الله فيحلوا ما حرم الله زين لهم سوء أعمالهم والله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that, when you are told to go forth in the cause of Allah, you adhere heavily to the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But what is the enjoyment of worldly life compared to the Hereafter except a [very] little.
interpretation: This verse admonishes believers who are hesitant or lazy to respond to the call to strive and sacrifice in the path of Allah. It questions their attachment to this temporary worldly life over the eternal Hereafter. The verse emphasizes that the pleasures and luxuries of this world are fleeting and insignificant when compared to the rewards and blessings that await in the Hereafter, urging believers to prioritize their efforts and investments for the afterlife rather than being overly attached to the material aspects of this world.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ما لكم إذا قيل لكم انفروا في سبيل الله اثاقلتم إلى الأرض أرضيتم بالحياة الدنيا من الآخرة فما متاع الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا قليل

translation: But if you do not go forth, He will punish you with a painful punishment and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. And Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's duties and responsibilities. It serves as a reminder that if one neglects their obligations, they will face consequences in the form of punishment. The verse also highlights the concept of divine power and control, indicating that Allah has the ability to replace those who fail to fulfill their duties with others who are more deserving, without Allah being at a loss in any way. It conveys the message that Allah is all-powerful and has the ultimate authority over all things.
orig: إلا تنفروا يعذبكم عذابا أليما ويستبدل قوما غيركم ولا تضروه شيئا والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: If you do not aid him [Muhammad] - Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, 'Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us.' And Allah sent down his tranquility upon him and supported him with angels you did not see and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah - that is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse describes a moment during the early days of Islam when the Prophet Muhammad and his companion were sought by the disbelievers of Makkah and had to hide in a cave. Despite the dire situation, the Prophet maintained unwavering faith and trust in Allah, assuring his companion that Allah's help was with them. Allah supported the Prophet with unseen forces and granted him tranquility. The verse highlights that the word of disbelievers will be deemed insignificant compared to the word of Allah, Who holds ultimate power and wisdom.
orig: إلا تنصروه فقد نصره الله إذ أخرجه الذين كفروا ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن إن الله معنا فأنزل الله سكينته عليه وأيده بجنود لم تروها وجعل كلمة الذين كفروا السفلى وكلمة الله هي العليا والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Go forth, whether light or heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of Allah. That is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of putting effort and striving in the way of Allah, regardless of whether the task is easy or difficult, whether the sacrifice is small or great. It encourages believers to expend their wealth and engage in personal sacrifices for the sake of Allah. The verse reminds the reader that such dedication and commitment to the cause of Allah is ultimately beneficial for their own spiritual growth and well-being.
orig: انفروا خفافا وثقالا وجاهدوا بأموالكم وأنفسكم في سبيل الله ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: If it had been a near adventure and a short journey, they would have followed you, but the distance seemed too far to them. And yet they will swear by Allah, 'If we were able, we would have gone forth with you.' They destroy their souls, and Allah knows they are surely lying.
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where some people express a desire to join a cause or a journey, but when they are faced with actual challenges or obstacles, they make excuses and back out. Despite claiming that they would have participated if the circumstances were different, their reluctance exposes their insincerity and lack of true commitment. The verse warns against making false promises and emphasizes the importance of honesty and integrity in one's words and actions.
orig: لو كان عرضا قريبا وسفرا قاصدا لاتبعوك ولكن بعدت عليهم الشقة وسيحلفون بالله لو استطعنا لخرجنا معكم يهلكون أنفسهم والله يعلم إنهم لكاذبون

translation: Allah has pardoned you; [prophet], why did you give them permission [to stay behind] before it was clear to you who was telling the truth and who were the liars?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of discernment and wisdom in decision-making. It teaches that sometimes it is necessary to withhold judgment and permission until the truth becomes apparent, distinguishing between the sincere believers and the deceitful hypocrites.
orig: عفا الله عنك لم أذنت لهم حتى يتبين لك الذين صدقوا وتعلم الكاذبين

translation: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day would not ask your permission to be excused from striving with their wealth and their lives. And Allah is Knowing of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the commitment of true believers to sacrifice their wealth and lives in the way of Allah and for the betterment of the community. It indicates that those who have sincere faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment will not seek permission to engage in acts of charity, struggle, or striving for the sake of Allah. It also highlights that Allah is aware of the actions and intentions of those who are righteous and pious in their beliefs and deeds.
orig: لا يستأذنك الذين يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Those who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day seek permission from you. Their hearts are in doubt, so they are hesitant in their doubt.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who do not have faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment may come to seek permission from you in matters of uncertainty, as their hearts are filled with doubt and hesitation. It emphasizes the concept of faith and the impact it can have on a person's decisions and actions.
orig: إنما يستأذنك الذين لا يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر وارتابت قلوبهم فهم في ريبهم يترددون

translation: And if they had intended to go forth, they would have prepared for it [some] preparation. But Allah disliked their being sent, so He kept them back, and they were told, 'Remain [behind] with those who remain.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates how Allah's will prevails over human intentions. Even if people plan to engage in something, if Allah does not will it, their efforts will be thwarted. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, everything is subject to Allah's decree and He has full control over the outcome of our plans and actions.
orig: ولو أرادوا الخروج لأعدوا له عدة ولكن كره الله انبعاثهم فثبطهم وقيل اقعدوا مع القاعدين

translation: If they had gone forth with you, they would not have increased you except in confusion, and they would have been active amongst you, seeking to cause fitnah. And among you are listeners to them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against hypocrites who claim to be with the believers but would only bring confusion and corruption if they were to join them. It emphasizes the importance of being cautious of those who seek to create division and turmoil within the community of believers. The verse also reminds that Allah is fully aware of the actions of the wrongdoers.
orig: لو خرجوا فيكم ما زادوكم إلا خبالا ولأوضعوا خلالكم يبغونكم الفتنة وفيكم سماعون لهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: They had sought to stir up sedition before, and upset matters for you, until the Truth arrived, and the decree of Allah became manifest, while they were averse.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that some people have always sought to create chaos and confusion, but eventually, the truth prevails and the divine decree of Allah becomes clear, even if those who oppose it resist and reject it.
orig: لقد ابتغوا الفتنة من قبل وقلبوا لك الأمور حتى جاء الحق وظهر أمر الله وهم كارهون

translation: And among them are those who say, 'Grant me permission [to sit at home] and do not put me to trial.' Unquestionably, into trial they have fallen. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of some individuals who seek to avoid any challenges or difficulties in life, preferring to stay away from any form of trial or struggle. However, the verse warns that trials are inevitable and those who try to escape them will ultimately find themselves facing various tests. Furthermore, the verse emphasizes that Hell will be the fate of those who reject faith and refuse to face the challenges and trials placed before them.
orig: ومنهم من يقول ائذن لي ولا تفتني ألا في الفتنة سقطوا وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: If a good befalls you, it grieves them, but if some misfortune overtakes you, they rejoice at it. But if you remain patient and become Al-Muttaqun (the pious - see V.2:2), not the least harm will their cunning do to you. Surely, Allah surrounds all that they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights how there are people who may feel envious or unhappy when good things happen to you but rejoice when misfortune strikes. However, the verse emphasizes that remaining patient, conscious of Allah, and practicing piety will protect you from any harm or schemes they may plot against you. It reminds us that Allah is aware of all that transpires, and ultimately, faith, patience, and righteousness will prevail.
orig: إن تصبك حسنة تسؤهم وإن تصبك مصيبة يقولوا قد أخذنا أمرنا من قبل ويتولوا وهم فرحون

translation: Say, 'Nothing will ever happen to us except what Allah has decreed for us. He is our protector.' And in Allah let the believers put their trust.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Qadr (divine destiny) in Islam, stating that nothing will happen to us except what Allah has already written for us. It encourages believers to place their trust in Allah, recognizing Him as their ultimate protector. This verse serves as a reminder for believers to accept their fate and put their complete faith in Allah's wisdom and plan.
orig: قل لن يصيبنا إلا ما كتب الله لنا هو مولانا وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: Say, 'Do you await for us except one of the best two things while we await for you that Allah will afflict you with punishment from Himself or at our hands? So wait; indeed, we are waiting with you.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that God's judgment is absolute and just. It warns those who are waiting for the believers' downfall that the believers are also waiting, and ultimately, it is God who decides what will happen. It highlights the believers' trust in Allah's plans and serves as a reminder that His justice will prevail in the end.
orig: قل هل تربصون بنا إلا إحدى الحسنيين ونحن نتربص بكم أن يصيبكم الله بعذاب من عنده أو بأيدينا فتربصوا إنا معكم متربصون

translation: Say, 'Spend willingly or unwillingly; it will not be accepted from you, for indeed you have been a defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and intention in acts of worship and charity. Merely going through the motions without true faith and willingness will not be accepted by Allah. It serves as a reminder to be sincere in our actions and to repent for past disobedience.
orig: قل أنفقوا طوعا أو كرها لن يتقبل منكم إنكم كنتم قوما فاسقين

translation: And nothing prevents their expenditures from being accepted from them except that they have disbelieved in Allah and in His Messenger and that they come not to prayer except while they are lazy and that they do not spend except while they are unwilling.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in acts of charity and worship. It emphasizes that the sincerity of one's belief in Allah and His Messenger is crucial for one's charitable acts and prayers to be accepted. It also underscores the significance of performing prayers diligently and without laziness, as well as spending in charity willingly and without reluctance.
orig: وما منعهم أن تقبل منهم نفقاتهم إلا أنهم كفروا بالله وبرسوله ولا يأتون الصلاة إلا وهم كسالى ولا ينفقون إلا وهم كارهون

translation: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in worldly life and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder not to be deceived or impressed by the wealth or children of disbelievers, as these are not signs of true success or favor from Allah. The verse highlights that sometimes Allah allows disbelievers to enjoy temporary worldly pleasures as part of their punishment, and ultimately their souls will depart while they are still in a state of disbelief.
orig: فلا تعجبك أموالهم ولا أولادهم إنما يريد الله ليعذبهم بها في الحياة الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And they swear by Allah that they are from among you while they are not from among you; but they are a people who are dividing.
interpretation: This verse warns against hypocrites who claim to be part of a community of believers but in reality, they do not truly belong there. They may swear oaths to deceive others, but their actions will reveal their true nature. This serves as a reminder to be cautious of false claims of loyalty and to be aware of those who seek to cause division and strife within the community.
orig: ويحلفون بالله إنهم لمنكم وما هم منكم ولكنهم قوم يفرقون

translation: If they could find a refuge or a cave or a place to enter, they would turn thereto in swift fleeing.
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where people in distress or facing danger would seek any available refuge, cave, or entrance in order to escape quickly. It highlights the instinct and urgency of seeking safety and protection during times of difficulty or fear.
orig: لو يجدون ملجأ أو مغارات أو مدخلا لولوا إليه وهم يجمحون

translation: And among them are those who abuse you concerning the [distribution of] charities. If they are given from them, they approve; but if they are not given from them, at once they become angry.
interpretation: This verse talks about certain hypocrites who would mock and criticize the distribution of charity. They only show approval when they themselves benefit from it, but become angry when they do not receive any. The verse highlights the importance of sincerity and goodwill in giving charity, and condemns those who engage in such hypocritical behavior.
orig: ومنهم من يلمزك في الصدقات فإن أعطوا منها رضوا وإن لم يعطوا منها إذا هم يسخطون

translation: And if only they had been satisfied with what Allah and His Messenger gave them and said, "Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and [so will] His Messenger; indeed, we are desirous toward Allah,"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes contentment with what Allah and His Messenger provide, having trust in Allah's provisions and knowing that there will always be more blessings coming from Allah and His Messenger. It encourages believers to have faith in God's wisdom and to look towards Him with hope and desire for His bounty.
orig: ولو أنهم رضوا ما آتاهم الله ورسوله وقالوا حسبنا الله سيؤتينا الله من فضله ورسوله إنا إلى الله راغبون

translation: Indeed, [prescribed] charities are for the poor and the needy, and those employed to administer the funds, for those whose hearts have been recently reconciled [to truth], for [the freeing of] slaves and debtors, for those in the cause of Allah and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation [imposed] by Allah. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the categories of people to whom charity (sadaqah) should be given. It emphasizes the significance of helping the poor, the needy, those who work to distribute the charity, those whose hearts are to be reconciled to the truth, slaves seeking liberation, debtors in need of help, those striving in the cause of Allah, and travelers in need of assistance. Giving charity is described as a duty decreed by Allah, who is All-Knowing and Wise.
orig: إنما الصدقات للفقراء والمساكين والعاملين عليها والمؤلفة قلوبهم وفي الرقاب والغارمين وفي سبيل الله وابن السبيل فريضة من الله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among them are those who harm the Prophet and say, 'He is an ear.' Say, 'An ear of goodness for you. He believes in Allah and believes for the believers and is a mercy to those who believe among you.' But those who harm the Messenger of Allah will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of respecting and believing in the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It condemns those who harm the Prophet and emphasize that he is a source of goodness, belief, and mercy for the believers. It warns of a severe punishment for those who intentionally harm the Messenger of Allah.
orig: ومنهم الذين يؤذون النبي ويقولون هو أذن قل أذن خير لكم يؤمن بالله ويؤمن للمؤمنين ورحمة للذين آمنوا منكم والذين يؤذون رسول الله لهم عذاب أليم

translation: They swear by Allah to you [Muslims] to please you, but it is more fitting that they should please Allah and His Messenger, if they are [truly] believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that some people may try to win favor and approval by making false oaths and promises, but true believers should prioritize seeking the pleasure and satisfaction of Allah and following the guidance of His Messenger above all else. It encourages sincerity and genuine faith in one's actions and intentions, rather than seeking validation from others.
orig: يحلفون بالله لكم ليرضوكم والله ورسوله أحق أن يرضوه إن كانوا مؤمنين

translation: Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - that for him is the fire of Hell, wherein he will abide eternally? That is the great disgrace.
interpretation: This verse serves as a strong warning against opposing Allah and His Messenger. It emphasizes that those who go against them will face the severe punishment of Hellfire, where they will remain forever. The mention of 'great disgrace' highlights the severity of this consequence and urges believers to adhere to the teachings of Islam to avoid such a fate.
orig: ألم يعلموا أنه من يحادد الله ورسوله فأن له نار جهنم خالدا فيها ذلك الخزي العظيم

translation: The hypocrites are warned that a chapter will be revealed concerning what is in their hearts. Say, "Mock [as you wish]; indeed, Allah will expose that which you fear."
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the hypocrites who pretend to believe but conceal disbelief in their hearts. It reminds them that Allah knows the truth of what they conceal and that no amount of mockery or deception can change that.
orig: يحذر المنافقون أن تنزل عليهم سورة تنبئهم بما في قلوبهم قل استهزئوا إن الله مخرج ما تحذرون

translation: And if you ask them, they will surely say, 'We were only conversing and playing.' Say, 'Is it Allah and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?'
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people dismiss the significance and seriousness of Allah's signs and messages by taking them lightly or mocking them. It serves as a reminder to consider the weight and importance of the teachings of the Qur'an and the guidance of the Prophet Muhammad, and to not ridicule or disrespect them.
orig: ولئن سألتهم ليقولن إنما كنا نخوض ونلعب قل أبالله وآياته ورسوله كنتم تستهزئون

translation: Do not make excuses; you have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon a faction of you, We will punish another faction because they were criminals.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who have abandoned their faith after initially believing. It emphasizes the severity of such an action and the consequences that come with it. It also highlights that individuals will be held accountable for their choices and actions, and that no excuses or justifications will suffice in front of the ultimate judgment of God.
orig: لا تعتذروا قد كفرتم بعد إيمانكم إن نعف عن طائفة منكم نعذب طائفة بأنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and close their hands. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them accordingly. Indeed, the hypocrites are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse describes the hypocrites who outwardly claim to be believers but inwardly conceal disbelief. They are described as being united in wrongdoing and corrupt behavior, promoting evil and discouraging good deeds. Their lack of commitment to good deeds and remembrance of Allah leads to their own forgetfulness and abandonment by Allah. The verse serves as a reminder of the dangers of hypocrisy and the importance of sincerity and faith in all actions.
orig: المنافقون والمنافقات بعضهم من بعض يأمرون بالمنكر وينهون عن المعروف ويقبضون أيديهم نسوا الله فنسيهم إن المنافقين هم الفاسقون

translation: Allah has promised the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the disbelievers the fire of Hell, wherein they will abide eternally. It is sufficient for them. And Allah has cursed them, and for them is an enduring punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the severe punishment that awaits the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell. It emphasizes the eternity of their punishment and the fact that their fate is solely in the punishment of Hellfire, which is a consequence of their rejection of the truth and their deceitful actions. The verse serves as a stern warning against hypocrisy and disbelief, reminding the believers of the consequences of such grave sins.
orig: وعد الله المنافقين والمنافقات والكفار نار جهنم خالدين فيها هي حسبهم ولعنهم الله ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: Like those before you; they were mightier than you in power and had more wealth and children. They enjoyed their share, so you have enjoyed your share as those before you enjoyed their share. And you indulged [in idle talk] as they indulged. It is they whose deeds have become worthless in this world and in the Hereafter, and it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the historical pattern of past nations who were blessed with power, wealth, and many descendants but indulged in worldly pleasures, neglecting their responsibilities towards God. They failed to understand the purpose of life and the consequences of their actions, resulting in their deeds being in vain in both this world and in the Hereafter. The lesson is a warning against repeating the mistakes of those who came before and serves as a reminder to prioritize righteous actions and intentions over fleeting worldly pleasures.
orig: كالذين من قبلكم كانوا أشد منكم قوة وأكثر أموالا وأولادا فاستمتعوا بخلاقهم فاستمتعتم بخلاقكم كما استمتع الذين من قبلكم بخلاقهم وخضتم كالذي خاضوا أولئك حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Has the news not reached them of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Midian and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And it was not Allah who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.
interpretation: This verse reminds the people that the stories of their predecessors who rejected the messengers of God and were punished for their wrongdoing should serve as a lesson for them. The messengers brought clear signs and warnings, but the people chose to oppress and reject the truth, bringing the subsequent punishment upon themselves. It emphasizes that it is not Allah who wrongs anyone but rather individuals wrong themselves by going against what is right and just.
orig: ألم يأتهم نبأ الذين من قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود وقوم إبراهيم وأصحاب مدين والمؤتفكات أتتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, establish prayer, give charity, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of unity and cooperation among the believers, both men and women. They are meant to support and guide each other towards righteousness, including promoting goodness and deterring evil, upholding the acts of worship such as prayer and charity, and obeying the teachings of Allah and His Messenger. By doing so, they earn the mercy and blessings of Allah, for He is the All-Powerful and All-Wise.
orig: والمؤمنون والمؤمنات بعضهم أولياء بعض يأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة ويطيعون الله ورسوله أولئك سيرحمهم الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence; and approval from Allah is greater. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse describes the promise of Paradise from Allah to the believing men and women. It emphasizes the eternal nature of Paradise, with flowing rivers and pleasant dwellings. The mention of Allah's approval being greater signifies that achieving the reward of Paradise is the ultimate success and the highest achievement for believers.
orig: وعد الله المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ومساكن طيبة في جنات عدن ورضوان من الله أكبر ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad, instructing him to confront and actively resist both the non-believers and those who profess belief but are hypocritical in their actions. The directive to be 'harsh upon them' is a call for firmness in dealing with those who oppose or feign faith. The verse emphasizes that ultimately, the destination for such individuals is Hell, emphasizing the severe consequences of their actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم ومأواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: They swear by Allah that they did not say [anything against the Prophet] while they had said the word of disbelief and disbelieved after their [pretense of] Islam and had determined [what they were unable to obtain]. And they were not resentful except [for the fact] that Allah and His Messenger had enriched them of His bounty. So if they repent, it is better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And there will not be for them on earth any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of a group of people who professed faith but then turned away from it and engaged in acts of disbelief. They sought material gain and status but harbored resentment when it did not materialize. The verse warns that if they repent sincerely, it will be better for them, but if they persist in their hypocrisy, they will face severe punishment in this life and the Hereafter, with no protector or helper to shield them from the consequences of their actions.
orig: يحلفون بالله ما قالوا ولقد قالوا كلمة الكفر وكفروا بعد إسلامهم وهموا بما لم ينالوا وما نقموا إلا أن أغناهم الله ورسوله من فضله فإن يتوبوا يك خيرا لهم وإن يتولوا يعذبهم الله عذابا أليما في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم في الأرض من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And among them are those who made a covenant with Allah, 'If He gives us out of His bounty, we will surely spend and be among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling promises and commitments made to Allah. It highlights the concept of gratitude and righteousness, indicating that those who are blessed with Allah's favors should show gratitude through acts of charity and righteousness.
orig: ومنهم من عاهد الله لئن آتانا من فضله لنصدقن ولنكونن من الصالحين

translation: So when He gave them from His bounty, they were stingy with it and turned away while they were refusing.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the unfortunate behavior of those who, upon receiving blessings from Allah, become stingy and ungrateful, turning away from the source of their blessings. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the blessings we receive and to not let them lead us to arrogance or greed.
orig: فلما آتاهم من فضله بخلوا به وتولوا وهم معرضون

translation: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their hearts until the Day they will meet Him - because they failed Allah in what they promised Him and because they habitually lied.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who fail to fulfill their promises to God and persist in falsehood may be afflicted with hypocrisy in their hearts as a consequence. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of deceiving oneself and others, and the importance of truthfulness and fulfilling commitments.
orig: فأعقبهم نفاقا في قلوبهم إلى يوم يلقونه بما أخلفوا الله ما وعدوه وبما كانوا يكذبون

translation: Do they not know that Allah knows their secrets and their private conversations, and that Allah is the knower of the unseen?
interpretation: This verse highlights the all-encompassing knowledge of Allah, emphasizing that He is aware of all that is hidden, including the secrets and private discussions of individuals. It serves as a reminder that nothing escapes the knowledge of Allah and that He is the knower of the unseen, which encourages believers to be mindful of their actions and intentions at all times.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله يعلم سرهم ونجواهم وأن الله علام الغيوب

translation: Those who ridicule the contributors among the believers concerning [their] charities and [also] those who find nothing [to spend] except their effort, so they ridicule them - Allah will ridicule them, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who mock or belittle those who contribute to charity, and those who are only able to give a small amount but are sincere in their efforts. The verse highlights that Allah will respond to the mockery by mocking them in return, and warns of a severe punishment for their actions. It emphasizes the importance of respecting and appreciating all acts of kindness and charity, regardless of their size or form.
orig: الذين يلمزون المطوعين من المؤمنين في الصدقات والذين لا يجدون إلا جهدهم فيسخرون منهم سخر الله منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them, even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, Allah will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that forgiveness is not granted to those who persist in disbelief and disobedience towards Allah and His Messenger. It highlights the importance of sincere repentance and submission to Allah's guidance, as forgiveness is not guaranteed simply through a superficial act of seeking forgiveness. It serves as a reminder that true repentance involves a change in attitude and behavior, and those who persist in defiance and sinfulness will not receive Allah's mercy and guidance.
orig: استغفر لهم أو لا تستغفر لهم إن تستغفر لهم سبعين مرة فلن يغفر الله لهم ذلك بأنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: The complacent among the believers are procrastinating without legitimate excuse, and they dislike to strive with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah, and say: 'Do not go forth in the heat.' Say: 'The Fire of Hell is more intense in heat,' if only they could understand.
