interpretation: This verse warns against the attitude of complacency and laziness among the believers who hesitate to strive and make sacrifices in the path of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of being active and dedicated in one's faith, and the seriousness of failing to fulfill this duty. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of neglecting one's responsibilities and the severity of the punishment awaiting those who do not comprehend the gravity of their actions.
orig: فرح المخلفون بمقعدهم خلاف رسول الله وكرهوا أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله وقالوا لا تنفروا في الحر قل نار جهنم أشد حرا لو كانوا يفقهون

translation: So let them laugh a little and weep much as a recompense for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse points to the consequences of one's actions in this life and the next. It suggests that those who indulge in worldly pleasures and wrongdoing may enjoy temporary joy and laughter in this world but will ultimately face sorrow and regret in the Hereafter as a result of their sins and misdeeds.
orig: فليضحكوا قليلا وليبكوا كثيرا جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: So if Allah should bring you back to a group of them and they ask your permission to go out [to battle], then say, 'You will not go out with me, ever, and you will never fight with me an enemy. Indeed, you were satisfied with sitting [at home] the first time, so sit [now] with those who stay behind.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of commitment and loyalty in times of hardship and struggle. It advises not to allow those who were hesitant or unwilling to participate in the initial struggle to join in the future when the commitment is more challenging. It emphasizes the need to stay steadfast and determined, not letting those who previously showed reluctance or lack of dedication affect the current fight for a righteous cause.
orig: فإن رجعك الله إلى طائفة منهم فاستأذنوك للخروج فقل لن تخرجوا معي أبدا ولن تقاتلوا معي عدوا إنكم رضيتم بالقعود أول مرة فاقعدوا مع الخالفين

translation: And never pray [the funeral prayer] for any of them who has died, nor stand at his grave. Indeed, they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers that those who have chosen to reject the truth of Islam and have passed away in a state of defiance and disobedience to Allah should not be prayed for or honored after their death. It emphasizes the gravity of disbelief and the consequences of persisting in disobedience towards Allah and His Messenger.
orig: ولا تصل على أحد منهم مات أبدا ولا تقم على قبره إنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله وماتوا وهم فاسقون

translation: And let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse warns against being impressed or envious of the wealth and children of disbelievers, as these are not a measure of success in the eyes of Allah. Rather, the wealth and children of such individuals may be a means through which they are tested and ultimately punished in this world. It serves as a reminder not to be misled by material possessions, but to focus on faith and righteous deeds as true measures of success.
orig: ولا تعجبك أموالهم وأولادهم إنما يريد الله أن يعذبهم بها في الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And when a surah [chapter] was revealed [enjoining them] to believe in Allah and to strive with His Messenger, those of wealth among them asked your permission [to stay back] and said, 'Leave us to be with those who sit [at home].'
interpretation: This verse is pointing to a situation where some individuals, specifically those who were affluent, sought exemption from joining the struggle in the way of God and preferred to stay behind with those who did not actively participate. The verse underscores the importance of wholeheartedly believing in God and actively supporting His Messenger, rather than seeking comfort and safety while neglecting one's duty to strive for the cause of righteousness.
orig: وإذا أنزلت سورة أن آمنوا بالله وجاهدوا مع رسوله استأذنك أولو الطول منهم وقالوا ذرنا نكن مع القاعدين

translation: They are content to be with those who stay behind, and a seal has been set upon their hearts so they understand not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the condition of some people who are satisfied with staying behind, away from engaging in Jihad (striving in the way of Allah), and as a result, their hearts have been sealed preventing them from understanding the truth and the importance of their actions. It serves as a warning about the dangers of neglecting one's duty and falling into complacency.
orig: رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون

translation: But the messenger and those who believed with him strove with their wealth and their lives. Those will have the good things, and it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sacrifice and struggle for the cause of faith. It emphasizes that true success lies in dedicating both wealth and personal efforts in the service of God's message. The believers who wholeheartedly commit themselves to striving for righteousness and faith are promised the ultimate reward and success, both in this life and in the Hereafter.
orig: لكن الرسول والذين آمنوا معه جاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم وأولئك لهم الخيرات وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Allah has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of paradise that Allah has prepared for the believers, where they will dwell forever in blissful surroundings with flowing rivers. It signifies the ultimate success and reward for those who follow the path of righteousness and faith.
orig: أعد الله لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And those Bedouins who were excused came to seek permission [to remain], and those who lied to Allah and His Messenger sat [at home]. There will strike those who disbelieved among them a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that those who are sincere and earnest will always find a way to seek the truth and permission to be part of a righteous cause, while those who intentionally lie and reject the guidance from Allah and His Messenger will face severe consequences and suffer a painful punishment for their disbelief.
orig: وجاء المعذرون من الأعراب ليؤذن لهم وقعد الذين كذبوا الله ورسوله سيصيب الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: There is no blame upon the weak or upon the ill or upon those who do not find anything to spend [in the cause of Allah] if they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger. There is no cause for blame upon the doers of good. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the compassion and understanding of Allah towards His servants, emphasizing that he does not burden the weak, the sick, or those who are financially constrained to contribute in the way of Allah if they are sincere in their intentions. It also reiterates that those who do good deeds will not be held accountable. Ultimately, this verse portrays Allah as Forgiving and Merciful, acknowledging the varying capabilities and situations of individuals.
orig: ليس على الضعفاء ولا على المرضى ولا على الذين لا يجدون ما ينفقون حرج إذا نصحوا لله ورسوله ما على المحسنين من سبيل والله غفور رحيم

translation: Nor on those who, when they came to you for you to provide them with mounts, you said, "I cannot find anything for you to ride on." They turned back while their eyes overflowed with tears out of grief that they could not find anything to spend.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of empathy and compassion towards those in need. It criticizes those who turn away those seeking help, even if they have valid reasons, and emphasizes the emotional turmoil the needy may experience when denied assistance. The verse teaches us to be mindful of the feelings and struggles of others, and encourages us to be generous and charitable towards those less fortunate.
orig: ولا على الذين إذا ما أتوك لتحملهم قلت لا أجد ما أحملكم عليه تولوا وأعينهم تفيض من الدمع حزنا ألا يجدوا ما ينفقون

translation: The way [of blame] is only against those who ask permission of you while they are rich. They are satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and Allah has set a seal upon their hearts so they do not know.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the hypocrisy of certain individuals who seek the permission of the Prophet (peace be upon him) to stay behind from participating in Jihad, even though they are capable of doing so. These individuals are content with remaining behind with those who are inactive and disloyal. Allah has sealed their hearts due to their ignorance and lack of understanding.
orig: إنما السبيل على الذين يستأذنونك وهم أغنياء رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع الله على قلوبهم فهم لا يعلمون

translation: They will apologize to you when you return to them. Say, 'Do not apologize; we will never believe you. For Allah has informed us of your news. And Allah will observe your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse warns against the hypocrites who seek apologies when confronted with their deceitful actions. It emphasizes that true believers should not accept insincere apologies and exposes the reality of the hypocrites who claim to believe but their deeds betray them. It serves as a reminder that Allah and His Messenger are aware of all actions, seen and unseen, and that true accountability lies in the knowledge and judgment of Allah.
orig: يعتذرون إليكم إذا رجعتم إليهم قل لا تعتذروا لن نؤمن لكم قد نبأنا الله من أخباركم وسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله ثم تردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: They will surely swear by Allah to you when you return to them that you would leave them alone. So leave them alone; indeed, they are impure, and their refuge is Hell as reward for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse warns against those hypocrites who will swear by Allah to gain the trust of the believers, but in reality, they are impure in their intentions and actions. The verse encourages the believers to stay away from such deceitful individuals and not be deceived by their false oaths. The ultimate punishment for their hypocrisy and deception will be Hellfire, as their deceitful actions will earn them a severe recompense.
orig: سيحلفون بالله لكم إذا انقلبتم إليهم لتعرضوا عنهم فأعرضوا عنهم إنهم رجس ومأواهم جهنم جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: They swear to you that you may be pleased with them. But if you should be pleased with them - indeed, Allah is not pleased with the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of some individuals who try to win the approval of others through false oaths and insincere actions. The verse warns that even if people succeed in gaining the approval of others, it is ultimately Allah's approval that truly matters. Allah does not approve of those who are defiantly disobedient and engage in sinful behavior.
orig: يحلفون لكم لترضوا عنهم فإن ترضوا عنهم فإن الله لا يرضى عن القوم الفاسقين

translation: The Bedouins are stronger in disbelief and hypocrisy and more likely not to know the limits of what Allah has revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the characteristics of the Bedouins at the time of the Prophet Muhammad, mentioning that they tended to have stronger disbelief and hypocrisy compared to others, and were less likely to understand and follow the guidelines set by Allah through His revelations. It serves as a reminder that knowledge and adherence to the teachings of Allah are important, and that Allah, being All-Knowing and Wise, is aware of all actions and intentions.
orig: الأعراب أشد كفرا ونفاقا وأجدر ألا يعلموا حدود ما أنزل الله على رسوله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among the Bedouins are some who consider what they spend as a fine and await for misfortunes to befall you. Upon them will be the evil turn of misfortune. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of some Bedouins who show off their material possessions by making a big show of giving charity, while in reality, they do so grudgingly or for the sake of appearances. They are also depicted as waiting for any misfortune or calamity to strike the believers. The verse warns against such insincere acts and malicious intentions, reminding us that Allah is fully aware of our intentions, actions, and thoughts, and that ultimately, true intentions and deeds will be recognized and rewarded accordingly.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يتخذ ما ينفق مغرما ويتربص بكم الدوائر عليهم دائرة السوء والله سميع عليم

translation: And among the bedouins are some who believe in Allah and the Last Day and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah and of [obtaining] invocations of the Messenger. Unquestionably, it is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His mercy. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that belief in Allah and the Last Day, along with acts of spending for the sake of Allah and seeking the blessings of the Messenger, can bring believers closer to Allah. It highlights the importance of sincere faith and good deeds, indicating that such actions will lead to Allah's mercy and forgiveness, as He is the Most Merciful and Forgiving.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ويتخذ ما ينفق قربات عند الله وصلوات الرسول ألا إنها قربة لهم سيدخلهم الله في رحمته إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And the first forerunners [in the faith] among the Muhajireen and the Ansar and those who followed them with good conduct - Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an praises the earliest believers who migrated for the sake of Allah (Muhajireen) and the supporters who aided them (Ansar), as well as those who followed them in righteousness. It highlights how Allah is pleased with them, they are content with Allah, and they have been promised eternal paradise with flowing rivers. The verse emphasizes that this eternal reward is the ultimate achievement and a great success for those who sincerely believe and act righteously.
orig: والسابقون الأولون من المهاجرين والأنصار والذين اتبعوهم بإحسان رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه وأعد لهم جنات تجري تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And among those around you of the Bedouins are hypocrites, and [also] from the people of Madinah. They have become accustomed to hypocrisy. You, [O Muhammad], do not know them, [but] We know them. We will punish them twice [in this world]; then they will be returned to a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns about the presence of hypocrites among the people, whether they are Bedouins or from the city of Madinah. It highlights that the nature of these hypocrites is such that they are accustomed to their falsehood and deceit. Despite the fact that the Prophet Muhammad may not be aware of who they are, Allah has full knowledge of their true intentions and actions. The verse also indicates that these hypocrites will face punishment twice, once in this world and then again in the Hereafter, where they will face severe consequences for their actions.
orig: وممن حولكم من الأعراب منافقون ومن أهل المدينة مردوا على النفاق لا تعلمهم نحن نعلمهم سنعذبهم مرتين ثم يردون إلى عذاب عظيم

translation: And [there are] others who have acknowledged their sins. They had mixed a righteous deed with another that was bad. Perhaps Allah will turn to them in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of repentance and forgiveness in Islam. It indicates that some individuals may have a combination of good and bad deeds, but if they acknowledge their sins, repent, and strive for righteousness, Allah, who is indeed Forgiving and Merciful, may forgive them. It emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and the hope for redemption through sincere repentance.
orig: وآخرون اعترفوا بذنوبهم خلطوا عملا صالحا وآخر سيئا عسى الله أن يتوب عليهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Take from their wealth a charity to purify them and cause them to grow, and pray for them. Indeed, your prayer is a source of tranquility for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of giving charity to purify oneself and others, and invoking blessings upon others through prayer. It highlights the spiritual benefits of giving charity and praying for the well-being of others, as both actions bring tranquility and spiritual growth. It also reminds us that Allah is always attentive and knowledgeable of our actions and intentions.
orig: خذ من أموالهم صدقة تطهرهم وتزكيهم بها وصل عليهم إن صلاتك سكن لهم والله سميع عليم

translation: Do they not know that it is Allah who accepts repentance from His servants and receives charities and that it is Allah who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful?
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards His servants. It reminds us that Allah readily accepts repentance from His servants and appreciates acts of charity. It serves as a reassurance that no matter the sins committed, Allah is always willing to pardon and grant His mercy to those who seek forgiveness and show kindness to others.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله هو يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويأخذ الصدقات وأن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And say, 'Do [as you will], for Allah will see your deeds, and [so, will] His Messenger and the believers. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that all their actions are observed by Allah, His Messenger, and the believers. It emphasizes the concept of accountability, as on the Day of Judgment, all deeds, whether done in secret or in public, will be exposed and judged by Allah. It serves as a reminder for people to be mindful and sincere in their actions, as they will ultimately be answerable for them.
orig: وقل اعملوا فسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله والمؤمنون وستردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And [there are] others awaiting the command of Allah - whether He will punish them or whether He will forgive them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate authority and wisdom of Allah in determining the fate of individuals. Some people are left to await the decree of Allah regarding their punishment or forgiveness, and it is only He who knows and decides, based on His infinite knowledge and wisdom.
orig: وآخرون مرجون لأمر الله إما يعذبهم وإما يتوب عليهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And [there are] those [hypocrites] who have taken a mosque as a site of harm and disbelief and division among the believers and as a station for whoever had warred against Allah and His Messenger before. And they will surely swear, "We intended only the best." And Allah testifies that indeed they are liars.
interpretation: This verse condemns the hypocrites who had corrupted a mosque by using it as a base for spreading harm, disbelief, and division among the believers. They claimed they had good intentions, but in reality, they were lying. This verse serves as a warning against hypocrisy and deceitful actions in sacred places.
orig: والذين اتخذوا مسجدا ضرارا وكفرا وتفريقا بين المؤمنين وإرصادا لمن حارب الله ورسوله من قبل وليحلفن إن أردنا إلا الحسنى والله يشهد إنهم لكاذبون

translation: Never stand [for prayer] within it – a mosque founded on righteousness from the first day is more worthy for you to stand in. Within it are men who love to purify themselves; and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honoring and performing prayers in a mosque that is founded upon righteousness and piety. It highlights the significance of being in the company of those who strive for purity and cleanliness in both their physical and spiritual aspects, as these characteristics are beloved to Allah. It encourages believers to seek spiritual purification and to surround themselves with individuals who share the same aspiration, emphasizing the value of inner cleanliness and mindfulness in worship.
orig: لا تقم فيه أبدا لمسجد أسس على التقوى من أول يوم أحق أن تقوم فيه فيه رجال يحبون أن يتطهروا والله يحب المطهرين

translation: Is it then he, who laid the foundation of his building on piety to Allah and His Good Pleasure, better, or he who laid the foundation of his building on the brink of a crumbling, overhanging precipice so that it toppled down with him into the fire of Hell, and Allah guides not the wrongdoing people?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of building one's actions and life on piety and righteousness as opposed to building them on shaky, unstable ground. The metaphor of building on a crumbling precipice symbolizes actions based on corruption and wrongdoing, which ultimately lead to destruction and punishment. It emphasizes the necessity of following the path of piety, as Allah does not guide those who engage in wrongdoing and injustice.
orig: أفمن أسس بنيانه على تقوى من الله ورضوان خير أم من أسس بنيانه على شفا جرف هار فانهار به في نار جهنم والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Their building which they have built will not cease to be a cause of skepticism in their hearts until [their] hearts are cut into pieces. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to those whose faith is weak and who harbor doubts and suspicions within their hearts. It reminds believers that a shaky foundation built upon skepticism will never bring them peace or satisfaction, and that only by firmly establishing their faith can they find true contentment. It highlights the importance of sincere belief and trust in God, who is All-Knowing and Wise.
orig: لا يزال بنيانهم الذي بنوا ريبة في قلوبهم إلا أن تقطع قلوبهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties [in exchange] for that they will have Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah, so they kill and are killed. [It is] a true promise [binding] upon Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is truer to his covenant than Allah? So rejoice in your transaction which you have contracted. And it is that which is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of sacrifice and commitment in the path of Allah. It highlights the idea that believers give their lives and wealth in return for the promise of Paradise. Through their dedication and struggles in the cause of Allah, believers are assured of a great reward. The verse also emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's covenant with Allah, prompting believers to rejoice in their commitment to Him. Overall, this verse serves as a reminder of the significant spiritual transaction that takes place between believers and Allah.
orig: إن الله اشترى من المؤمنين أنفسهم وأموالهم بأن لهم الجنة يقاتلون في سبيل الله فيقتلون ويقتلون وعدا عليه حقا في التوراة والإنجيل والقرآن ومن أوفى بعهده من الله فاستبشروا ببيعكم الذي بايعتم به وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers [of Allah], the travelers [for His cause], the bowing, the prostrating, the enjoining of what is right, the forbidding of what is wrong, and the guardians of the limits [set by] Allah. And give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an mentions the qualities and characteristics of the believers. It praises those who repent, worship, praise Allah, strive in His cause, perform acts of obedience like bowing and prostrating in prayers, enjoins what is good, forbids what is wrong, and observe the limits set by Allah. The verse encourages and gives glad tidings to the believers who exhibit these qualities and encourages others to strive towards embodying these characteristics.
orig: التائبون العابدون الحامدون السائحون الراكعون الساجدون الآمرون بالمعروف والناهون عن المنكر والحافظون لحدود الله وبشر المؤمنين

translation: It is not for the Prophet and those who have believed to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they were relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that believers are not allowed to seek forgiveness for disbelievers, even if they are close relatives, once it has become clear that they have chosen to reject the truth and are destined for Hellfire. It teaches believers the importance of staying faithful to their beliefs and not interceding on behalf of those who have consciously chosen to reject the faith.
orig: ما كان للنبي والذين آمنوا أن يستغفروا للمشركين ولو كانوا أولي قربى من بعد ما تبين لهم أنهم أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And Ibrahim's seeking forgiveness for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he disassociated himself from him. Indeed was Ibrahim compassionate and patient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of standing by truth and righteousness, even if it means distancing oneself from close family members who are enemies of God. It emphasizes the necessity of prioritizing one's faith and loyalty to Allah over any familial ties, as demonstrated by Prophet Ibrahim's righteous decision to disassociate himself from his father when he realized his father's enmity towards Allah.
orig: وما كان استغفار إبراهيم لأبيه إلا عن موعدة وعدها إياه فلما تبين له أنه عدو لله تبرأ منه إن إبراهيم لأواه حليم

translation: And Allah would not let a people stray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that once Allah has guided a group of people, He will not let them go astray unless they actively choose to deviate from the guidance. Allah clarifies to them what they should be cautious of, as His knowledge encompasses all things and He is aware of what is beneficial and harmful for His servants.
orig: وما كان الله ليضل قوما بعد إذ هداهم حتى يبين لهم ما يتقون إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Surely, Allah has the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and gives death. And you have no protector or helper besides Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute authority and power of Allah over all things. It highlights that He is the sole giver and taker of life, and that no one and nothing can provide protection or aid except Him. It serves as a reminder of the importance of relying on Allah for all matters and acknowledging His supreme dominion.
orig: إن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يحيي ويميت وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Indeed, Allah has turned in mercy to the Prophet, the Emigrants, and the Helpers who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the hearts of a party of them were about to deviate. Then He turned in mercy to them. Surely, He is Kind and Merciful to them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards the Prophet Muhammad, the Emigrants (those who migrated with him to Madinah), and the Helpers (residents of Madinah who supported him). It emphasizes how even when some among them were faltering in faith or facing difficulties, Allah showed them mercy and forgiveness. The verse conveys the idea of Allah's compassion and understanding towards His servants, especially during times of hardship and moments of weakness.
orig: لقد تاب الله على النبي والمهاجرين والأنصار الذين اتبعوه في ساعة العسرة من بعد ما كاد يزيغ قلوب فريق منهم ثم تاب عليهم إنه بهم رءوف رحيم

translation: And [He also forgave] the three who were left behind [from the battle of Tabuk] and felt constricted until the earth closed in on them in spite of its vastness, and their souls constricted within them, and they thought that there was no refuge from Allah except in Him. Then Allah turned in mercy to them so that they might repent. Indeed, Allah is the Accepter of Repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of the three companions who stayed behind during the battle of Tabuk, feeling remorse and distress as they believed they had no escape from Allah's judgment besides turning back to Him. It highlights Allah's mercy and acceptance of their repentance, teaching us that no matter the gravity of one's mistake, sincere repentance is always met with forgiveness and compassion from Allah.
orig: وعلى الثلاثة الذين خلفوا حتى إذا ضاقت عليهم الأرض بما رحبت وضاقت عليهم أنفسهم وظنوا أن لا ملجأ من الله إلا إليه ثم تاب عليهم ليتوبوا إن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with those who are true.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to be conscious of Allah and to surround themselves with truthful and trustworthy people. It reminds us of the importance of being in the company of those who are sincere and honest, as their integrity and righteousness can have a positive influence on our character and actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وكونوا مع الصادقين

translation: It is not for the people of Medina and those surrounding them of the Bedouins to remain behind the Messenger of Allah, or to prefer themselves over him. That is because they are not afflicted by thirst, fatigue, or hunger in the cause of Allah, and they do not tread any ground that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they attain from an enemy any gain, but that it is written for them as a righteous deed. Indeed, Allah does not allow the reward of the good-doers to be lost.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of supporting and following the Messenger of Allah without hesitation or delay. Those who are truly committed to the cause of Allah will not let any obstacles hinder them from fulfilling their duty. Their sincerity and perseverance, even in the face of adversity, will not go unrewarded by Allah.
orig: ما كان لأهل المدينة ومن حولهم من الأعراب أن يتخلفوا عن رسول الله ولا يرغبوا بأنفسهم عن نفسه ذلك بأنهم لا يصيبهم ظمأ ولا نصب ولا مخمصة في سبيل الله ولا يطئون موطئا يغيظ الكفار ولا ينالون من عدو نيلا إلا كتب لهم به عمل صالح إن الله لا يضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: And they do not spend any spending, small or large, nor do they cross a valley but that it is registered for them that Allah may reward them for the best of what they were doing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and consistency in one's actions for the sake of Allah. It highlights that all deeds, whether big or small, are recorded and will be rewarded accordingly by Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers that every action, no matter how insignificant it may seem, is significant in the eyes of Allah and will contribute to their overall reward in the Hereafter.
orig: ولا ينفقون نفقة صغيرة ولا كبيرة ولا يقطعون واديا إلا كتب لهم ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And it is not for the believers to go forth [to battle] all at once. For there should separate from every division of them a group [remaining] to obtain understanding in the religion and warn their people when they return to them that they might be cautious.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of knowledge and understanding in the religion (deen) among the believers. It highlights the need for a group of people to remain behind in order to deepen their knowledge of the faith and educate others. By doing so, they can significantly contribute to the guidance and awareness of the community, ensuring that they remain steadfast and cautious in their faith.
orig: وما كان المؤمنون لينفروا كافة فلولا نفر من كل فرقة منهم طائفة ليتفقهوا في الدين ولينذروا قومهم إذا رجعوا إليهم لعلهم يحذرون

translation: O you who have believed, fight those who are near to you among the disbelievers and let them find in you harshness. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to stand firm against the disbelievers who are close to them and to show strength in facing them. It serves as a reminder that Allah is always on the side of those who are righteous and pious in their actions and beliefs.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا قاتلوا الذين يلونكم من الكفار وليجدوا فيكم غلظة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: And when a surah is revealed, some of them say, 'Which of you has this increased in faith?' As for those who believe, it has increased them in faith, and they rejoice.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the impact of the revelation of the Qur'an on the believers. It highlights that the believers' faith is increased when they receive guidance and teachings from the Qur'an. The verse suggests that true believers are those who find their faith strengthened and are filled with joy upon receiving the message of the Qur'an.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة فمنهم من يقول أيكم زادته هذه إيمانا فأما الذين آمنوا فزادتهم إيمانا وهم يستبشرون

translation: But as for those in whose hearts is disease, it has [only] increased them in evil [in addition] to their evil. And they will have died while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the state of those whose hearts are diseased with disbelief and immorality. The disease in their hearts makes them more inclined towards evil and disbelief, and ultimately, they meet their end in a state of disbelief. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining a pure and sound heart, free from diseases such as hypocrisy and disbelief.
orig: وأما الذين في قلوبهم مرض فزادتهم رجسا إلى رجسهم وماتوا وهم كافرون

translation: First they believe that they will be fought against, and then they will be tried; but they will not stumble. They will keep trying to overthrow you, but they will not succeed, and all their plots will be in vain.
interpretation: This verse could be understood as highlighting the resilience and determination of those who oppose the believers. Despite their repeated attempts to undermine and defeat the believers, they will ultimately fail in their efforts. It serves as an encouragement for believers to remain steadfast and trust in the ultimate victory promised by Allah.
orig: أولا يرون أنهم يفتنون في كل عام مرة أو مرتين ثم لا يتوبون ولا هم يذكرون

translation: And when a surah is revealed, some of them look at each other, [as if to say], 'Does anyone see you?' and then they turn away. Allah has turned their hearts because they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the hypocrites who do not sincerely engage with the Qur'an when it is recited. They are depicted as looking around to see if anyone notices them listening to the revelation, and when they see no one watching, they turn away and do not reflect on the message. Their lack of understanding and insincerity cause Allah to turn their hearts away from the truth.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة نظر بعضهم إلى بعض هل يراكم من أحد ثم انصرفوا صرف الله قلوبهم بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the believers is kind and merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of the Messenger of Allah and his deep care and concern for his people. It emphasizes his close connection to the believers, his kindness, and mercy towards them. The verse serves as a reminder of the Prophet's compassion and his dedication to guiding and supporting the believers.
orig: لقد جاءكم رسول من أنفسكم عزيز عليه ما عنتم حريص عليكم بالمؤمنين رءوف رحيم

translation: So if they turn away, say, "Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne."
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to trust in Allah and rely on Him alone, especially in times of difficulty or when faced with rejection from others. It emphasizes the importance of having faith that Allah is sufficient to handle any situation and that He is the ultimate source of support and guidance, being the Lord of the Great Throne.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل حسبي الله لا إله إلا هو عليه توكلت وهو رب العرش العظيم

translation: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: This verse introduces a new chapter of the Qur'an, emphasizing the divine wisdom and guidance contained within the Book. The mention of Alif, Lam, Ra is a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'anic Arabic language and a sign of the Quran's inimitability. It serves as a prelude to the wisdom and guidance that will follow in the subsequent verses, inviting the reader to reflect on the profound messages within the scriptures.
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: Is it a wonder for the people that We revealed to a man from among them, 'Warn the people and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord'? [But] the disbelievers say, 'Indeed, this is an obvious magician.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the reaction of the disbelievers to a Prophet who was sent to warn and deliver glad tidings to the people. Despite the Prophet's clear signs and guidance, the disbelievers reject his message and accuse him of being a magician, refusing to believe in the truth he brings. The verse highlights the clash between faith and disbelief, as well as the challenges faced by Prophets in conveying the message of God amidst skepticism and opposition.
orig: أكان للناس عجبا أن أوحينا إلى رجل منهم أن أنذر الناس وبشر الذين آمنوا أن لهم قدم صدق عند ربهم قال الكافرون إن هذا لساحر مبين

translation: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] chasing it rapidly; and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah as the creator of the heavens and the earth in six days, and then establishing Himself above the Throne. It highlights the governance of Allah over the universe, controlling the alternation of night and day, and the celestial bodies like the sun, moon, and stars. The verse calls for the recognition of Allah's sovereignty and the significance of worshipping Him alone, reminding believers to reflect on His signs and wisdom in creation.
orig: إن ربكم الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش يدبر الأمر ما من شفيع إلا من بعد إذنه ذلكم الله ربكم فاعبدوه أفلا تذكرون

translation: To Him is your return, all of you. [It is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. Indeed, He begins the [process of] creation and then repeats it that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds, in justice. But those who disbelieved will have a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of resurrection and accountability in the hereafter. It highlights that all individuals will ultimately return to Allah, who will fulfill His promise of true justice by rewarding the believers who have performed good deeds and punishing the disbelievers accordingly. The imagery of a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment is used to emphasize the severity of the consequences for those who reject faith.
orig: إليه مرجعكم جميعا وعد الله حقا إنه يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات بالقسط والذين كفروا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: He it is who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light and determined for it phases that you may know the number of years and the account. Allah has not created this except in truth. He details the signs for a people who know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the sun and the moon as sources of light with precise functions and determinable phases. It emphasizes that these creations were made with purpose and accuracy, to signify the passing of time and to serve as a means for people to reflect and learn about the Creator's signs and wisdom. The verse also implies that deep understanding and knowledge are required to fully appreciate the signs and messages of Allah in the universe.
orig: هو الذي جعل الشمس ضياء والقمر نورا وقدره منازل لتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب ما خلق الله ذلك إلا بالحق يفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: Indeed, in the alternation of night and day and in what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the signs of Allah's existence and power that are evident in the natural world around us. The alternation of night and day, along with the magnificent creation of the heavens and the earth, serve as reminders and proofs for those who are conscious of God's presence and have fear of Him. It encourages reflection upon these signs and the recognition of the greatness and wisdom of the Creator.
orig: إن في اختلاف الليل والنهار وما خلق الله في السماوات والأرض لآيات لقوم يتقون

translation: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the worldly life and feel secure therein and those who are heedless of Our signs -
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of those who prioritize worldly pleasures over the remembrance of God and the Hereafter. It warns against becoming complacent with the temporal pleasures of this life and neglecting the signs and guidance from God. It serves as a reminder to stay vigilant and focused on the ultimate meeting with God and the accountability in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ورضوا بالحياة الدنيا واطمأنوا بها والذين هم عن آياتنا غافلون

translation: Their refuge is the Fire because of what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse is a warning that those who commit sinful acts and earn evil deeds will find their ultimate destination to be the Fire (Hell). It serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the accountability for their deeds in the hereafter.
orig: أولئك مأواهم النار بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds, their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in the gardens of pleasure.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the close relationship between faith, good deeds, and guidance from God. Those who believe in God and perform good deeds will find themselves guided by Him towards what is best for them. As a reward for their faith and righteous actions, they will be granted eternal bliss in Paradise, depicted as gardens with flowing rivers - symbolizing peace, abundance, and happiness.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات يهديهم ربهم بإيمانهم تجري من تحتهم الأنهار في جنات النعيم

translation: Their call therein will be, "Exalted are You, O Allah," and their greeting therein will be, "Peace." And the last of their call will be, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds!"
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the believers in Paradise, where their invocation will be to praise and glorify Allah. Their interactions will be filled with peace and tranquility, and all their expressions will be dedicated to praising Allah, the Lord of all existence.
orig: دعواهم فيها سبحانك اللهم وتحيتهم فيها سلام وآخر دعواهم أن الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: And if Allah were to hasten for the people the evil [they invoke] as He hastens for them the good, their term would have been resolved for them. But We leave those who do not expect the meeting with Us, in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah's wisdom and justice dictate that He does not hasten the punishment for those who commit evil deeds, as He does with rewarding the good deeds. It highlights that while Allah could punish wrongdoers swiftly, He gives them respite, allowing them time to repent, reform, and turn back to Him. It serves as a reminder that those who persist in wrongdoing and arrogance will ultimately face the consequences of their actions, either in this world or in the Hereafter.
orig: ولو يعجل الله للناس الشر استعجالهم بالخير لقضي إليهم أجلهم فنذر الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And when harm touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing. But when We remove from him his affliction, he continues [in disobedience] as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people turn to God in times of difficulty, seeking His help and relief. However, once the hardship is removed, they go back to their old ways and forget their supplications to God. The verse points out the ingratitude and insincerity of those who only remember God when they are in need, but neglect their relationship with Him once their troubles are resolved.
orig: وإذا مس الإنسان الضر دعانا لجنبه أو قاعدا أو قائما فلما كشفنا عنه ضره مر كأن لم يدعنا إلى ضر مسه كذلك زين للمسرفين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who transgress and commit wrong deeds by mentioning those previous generations that were destroyed due to their wrongdoing despite being warned by their messengers with clear signs. The verse serves as a reminder that disbelieving in the signs of God and persisting in wrongdoing will lead to punishment.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا القرون من قبلكم لما ظلموا وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وما كانوا ليؤمنوا كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: Then We made you successors in the land after them so that We may observe how you will do.
interpretation: This verse highlights that succeeding generations are placed on earth to carry out their duties and responsibilities. It serves as a reminder that our actions are being monitored and assessed. It encourages self-awareness and accountability in our behaviors, emphasizing the importance of righteous conduct and good deeds as a means to fulfill one's purpose in life.
orig: ثم جعلناكم خلائف في الأرض من بعدهم لننظر كيف تعملون

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not hope for Our meeting say, 'Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed, I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the steadfastness of the Prophets in delivering the message of Allah. It highlights Prophet Muhammad's commitment to conveying the Qur'anic revelations as they were revealed to him, without alteration, despite the disbelievers' demands for changes or substitutes. The verse also conveys the fear of the consequences of disobeying Allah, acknowledging the Day of Judgment and the accountability for one's actions.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ائت بقرآن غير هذا أو بدله قل ما يكون لي أن أبدله من تلقاء نفسي إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Say, 'If Allah had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you, for I had remained among you a lifetime before it. Then will you not reason?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine will and destiny. It emphasizes that everything happens according to Allah's will, and the Quran is brought to the people by His decree. It also questions the lack of understanding or contemplation among the people, urging them to reflect on these matters more deeply.
orig: قل لو شاء الله ما تلوته عليكم ولا أدراكم به فقد لبثت فيكم عمرا من قبله أفلا تعقلون

translation: So who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe injustice and wrongdoing committed by those who fabricate lies about Allah or reject His divine signs and revelations. It serves as a reminder that those who engage in such sinful acts will not achieve success or salvation, emphasizing the importance of seeking truth and righteousness in faith and actions.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح المجرمون

translation: And they worship besides Allah that which neither harms them nor benefits them, and they say, 'These are our intercessors with Allah.' Say, 'Do you inform Allah of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?' Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of shirk (associating partners with Allah) and warns against worshipping anything besides Allah. It questions the belief in intercessors with Allah and emphasizes that Allah is all-knowing and does not need intermediaries. The verse aims to emphasize the oneness of Allah and to caution against practices that undermine His divine attributes.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ويقولون هؤلاء شفعاؤنا عند الله قل أتنبئون الله بما لا يعلم في السماوات ولا في الأرض سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And mankind was not but one community [united in religion], but [then] they differed. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them [immediately] in what they differed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of human unity and the origin of mankind as one community. Despite this unity, people have diverged in their beliefs and actions. The verse also emphasizes the importance of divine guidance, hinting that differences among people could have been resolved instantly by God's word if not for His wisdom in allowing free will and the eventual judgment based on individuals' actions.
orig: وما كان الناس إلا أمة واحدة فاختلفوا ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم فيما فيه يختلفون

translation: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' So say, 'The unseen is only for Allah [to administer], so wait; indeed, I am with you among the waiters.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that the knowledge of the unseen is solely with Allah, and it is not for human beings to demand signs or proofs beyond what has been revealed through the Prophets. It encourages patience and trust in Allah's wisdom, assuring that the fulfillment of promises will come in due time.
orig: ويقولون لولا أنزل عليه آية من ربه فقل إنما الغيب لله فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: And when We let the people taste mercy after hardship has touched them, at once they scheme against Our verses. Say, "Allah is swifter in strategy." Indeed, Our messengers record that which you scheme.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reality that people often tend to forget about Allah and become ungrateful when they are relieved from hardship and bestowed with blessings. Despite Allah's mercy and favors, some individuals still plot against the signs of Allah. However, the verse warns that Allah's plan and retribution are infallible and superior to any human manipulation. It highlights the accountability that humans have towards Allah's watchful messengers who record their actions and intentions, urging them to be mindful of their schemes and to have faith in Allah's ultimate plan.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة من بعد ضراء مستهم إذا لهم مكر في آياتنا قل الله أسرع مكرا إن رسلنا يكتبون ما تمكرون

translation: He it is who enables you to travel on land and sea until, when you are on ships and they sail with them by a good wind and they rejoice therein. There comes a strong wind, and the waves come to them from everywhere and they assume that they are surrounded, supplicating Allah, sincere to Him in religion, "If You should save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful."
interpretation: This verse speaks to the transient and unpredictable nature of life, likening the journey of humans through life to sailing on the sea. It highlights that moments of ease and joy can quickly turn into difficulty and distress, causing individuals to turn to God in sincere supplication. The verse emphasizes gratitude and humility, showcasing the importance of acknowledging God's role in guiding one through life's trials and being thankful for His assistance.
orig: هو الذي يسيركم في البر والبحر حتى إذا كنتم في الفلك وجرين بهم بريح طيبة وفرحوا بها جاءتها ريح عاصف وجاءهم الموج من كل مكان وظنوا أنهم أحيط بهم دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين لئن أنجيتنا من هذه لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: So when We saved them, they went unrestrainedly into wrongdoing in the land. O mankind, your wrongdoing is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of wrongdoing and the accountability of one's actions. It warns against indulging in wrongful deeds thinking they won't have any repercussions. The verse reminds people that their actions have consequences both in this life and the hereafter, and that they will be held accountable for their deeds when they return to God.
orig: فلما أنجاهم إذا هم يبغون في الأرض بغير الحق يا أيها الناس إنما بغيكم على أنفسكم متاع الحياة الدنيا ثم إلينا مرجعكم فننبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - [those] from which men and livestock eat - until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an serves as a reminder of the temporary and fleeting nature of worldly life. Just as rain falls from the sky and causes plants to grow, sustaining both humans and animals, life on earth flourishes and people may feel a sense of ownership and control over it. However, just as swiftly as rain brings life to the earth, Allah's command can come at any moment, bringing an end to this worldly life. The verse stresses the impermanence of material wealth and possessions, emphasizing the importance of reflecting on the signs of Allah and preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: إنما مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء أنزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض مما يأكل الناس والأنعام حتى إذا أخذت الأرض زخرفها وازينت وظن أهلها أنهم قادرون عليها أتاها أمرنا ليلا أو نهارا فجعلناها حصيدا كأن لم تغن بالأمس كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And Allah invites to the Home of Peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights that it is Allah who calls people to the abode of peace, which refers to Paradise, and He guides those whom He chooses to the straight path of righteousness and faith. It emphasizes the divine guidance and mercy that leads believers to the path of truth and salvation.
orig: والله يدعو إلى دار السلام ويهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: For those who have done good is the best and more. And no darkness will cover their faces, nor humiliation. Those are companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that those who perform good deeds will receive rewards not only equal to their actions, but even more than they deserve. They will not face any darkness or humiliation, but rather will be honored and rewarded in Paradise where they will live forever.
orig: للذين أحسنوا الحسنى وزيادة ولا يرهق وجوههم قتر ولا ذلة أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: And those who earn evil deeds - the recompense of an evil deed is its equivalent, and humiliation will cover them. They will have from Allah no protector. It will be as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night, darkened. They are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability and consequences in Islam. It highlights that those who commit wrongful deeds will face a just retribution equivalent to their actions. Additionally, it conveys the idea that those who persist in wrongdoing will feel a deep sense of humiliation and abandonment, as they will have no protector or support from Allah. The imagery of their faces being enveloped in darkness portrays the severe punishment and eternal residence in Hell that awaits them as a result of their actions.
orig: والذين كسبوا السيئات جزاء سيئة بمثلها وترهقهم ذلة ما لهم من الله من عاصم كأنما أغشيت وجوههم قطعا من الليل مظلما أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: And [mention] the Day We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, '[Remain in] your place, you and your 'partners.' 'Then We will separate them, and their 'partners' will say, 'You did not used to worship us.'
interpretation: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment when all people will be gathered together. The disbelievers will be separated from their false gods and idols, and these idols will disown the worship they received from their followers. It highlights the futility of associating partners with Allah and serves as a warning against idolatry.
orig: ويوم نحشرهم جميعا ثم نقول للذين أشركوا مكانكم أنتم وشركاؤكم فزيلنا بينهم وقال شركاؤهم ما كنتم إيانا تعبدون

translation: And Allah is sufficient as a witness between us and you, indeed we were unaware of your worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah is aware and sufficient as a witness to what is in the hearts and actions of people. It emphasizes that even if someone is unaware of the worship of others, Allah is fully knowledgeable of all things. This serves as a reminder that sincerity in worship is crucial as Allah is the ultimate judge and witness to all our deeds.
orig: فكفى بالله شهيدا بيننا وبينكم إن كنا عن عبادتكم لغافلين

translation: There, every soul will be put to trial for what it did previously, and they will be brought back to Allah, their true Lord, and will lose sight of the falsehood they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that on the Day of Judgment, everyone will be held accountable for their actions, and all deeds, good and bad, will be brought forth. It emphasizes the ultimate return to Allah where truth will prevail, and all falsehood and fabrications will be discarded. It serves as a reminder to be mindful of our actions and to always strive for truth and righteousness.
orig: هنالك تبلو كل نفس ما أسلفت وردوا إلى الله مولاهم الحق وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Say, 'Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who controls hearing and sight and who brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and who arranges [every] matter?' They will say, 'Allah.' So say, 'Then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse challenges the disbelievers to reflect upon the signs of Allah's existence and power in the creation of the heavens and the earth, in the control of all aspects of life and death, and in the organization of all matters. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and fearing Allah as the ultimate provider and controller of all things.
orig: قل من يرزقكم من السماء والأرض أمن يملك السمع والأبصار ومن يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ومن يدبر الأمر فسيقولون الله فقل أفلا تتقون

translation: So, that is Allah, your Lord, the Truth. So after the Truth, what is there except error? How then are you turned away?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute truth and reality of Allah as the Lord. It then questions the logic of turning away from the truth, indicating that any deviation from the path of truth ultimately leads to error and misguidance. It serves as a reminder to believers to stay steadfast on the path of truth and not be misled by falsehood.
orig: فذلكم الله ربكم الحق فماذا بعد الحق إلا الضلال فأنى تصرفون

translation: Thus has the Word of your Lord come into effect against those who disbelieved that they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who persist in disbelief will continue to do so, as it is in accordance with the decree of God. Their rejection of faith is a consequence of their own wrongdoing and rebellion against the truth, and it is a confirmation that their hearts are closed to belief.
orig: كذلك حقت كلمت ربك على الذين فسقوا أنهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Say, 'Is there any of your partners who begins creation and then repeats it?' Say, 'Allah begins creation and then repeats it. So how are you deluded?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that only Allah has the power to create and recreate. It challenges those who associate partners with Allah to contemplate how illogical it is to attribute the power of creation to anyone other than the One who initiates and repeats it. It serves as a reminder of the uniqueness and greatness of Allah's creative power, and warns against the folly of ascribing His abilities to others.
orig: قل هل من شركائكم من يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده قل الله يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده فأنى تؤفكون

translation: Say, 'Can any of your partners guide [others] to the truth?' Say, 'God guides [to the truth]. So is He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed, or he who does not guide unless he is guided? Then what is [wrong] with you - how do you judge?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate guidance that comes from God alone. It questions the logic of following anyone other than God when He is the one who guides to the truth. It challenges the polytheistic beliefs present at the time and calls for a reevaluation of who deserves true devotion and obedience.
orig: قل هل من شركائكم من يهدي إلى الحق قل الله يهدي للحق أفمن يهدي إلى الحق أحق أن يتبع أمن لا يهدي إلا أن يهدى فما لكم كيف تحكمون

translation: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights how many people follow their own assumptions and conjectures rather than seeking and following the truth. It emphasizes that mere assumptions do not change the reality of the truth. Allah is fully aware and knowledgeable of all that people do, and their actions will be judged accordingly.
orig: وما يتبع أكثرهم إلا ظنا إن الظن لا يغني من الحق شيئا إن الله عليم بما يفعلون

translation: And this Qur'an is not such as could ever be produced by other than Allah, but it is a confirmation of what was before it and an explanation of the Scripture, without a doubt from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and highlights its unique nature as a revelation from Allah. It confirms the previous scriptures and serves as an explanation and guidance for mankind. The verse asserts the authenticity and reliability of the Qur'an as the words of the Lord of all creation.
orig: وما كان هذا القرآن أن يفترى من دون الله ولكن تصديق الذي بين يديه وتفصيل الكتاب لا ريب فيه من رب العالمين

translation: Or do they say, 'He has forged it'? Say, 'Bring then a chapter like it and call upon whoever you can besides Allah if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse challenges those who doubt the authenticity of the Qur'an to produce even a chapter that matches its eloquence and guidance, highlighting the miraculous nature of the Qur'an as a divine revelation. It emphasizes the profound challenge posed by the Qur'an, suggesting that its unmatched beauty and wisdom could not have simply come from a human being, inviting all to reflect on its divine origin and truth.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل فأتوا بسورة مثله وادعوا من استطعتم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But they have denied that of which they have no knowledge and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. But observe the end of the evildoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ignorance and arrogance of those who deny the truth without understanding it fully. It warns about the consequences of denying the signs of Allah and the ultimate fate of those who oppress and act unjustly.
orig: بل كذبوا بما لم يحيطوا بعلمه ولما يأتهم تأويله كذلك كذب الذين من قبلهم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة الظالمين

translation: And among them are those who believe in it, and among them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity in people's reactions to the message of the Qur'an. Some believe in it and follow its teachings, while others reject it. Ultimately, it is God who knows best the intentions and actions of those who spread corruption and mischief.
orig: ومنهم من يؤمن به ومنهم من لا يؤمن به وربك أعلم بالمفسدين

translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], then say, 'For me are my deeds, and for you are your deeds. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do.'
interpretation: This verse teaches us about personal responsibility and accountability. Each individual is accountable for their own actions. The Prophet Muhammad is instructed to maintain his righteousness in the face of rejection or denial and to remind the deniers that everyone is accountable for their own deeds. It emphasizes the principle of individual accountability and absolves the Prophet Muhammad from the actions of those who reject him.
orig: وإن كذبوك فقل لي عملي ولكم عملكم أنتم بريئون مما أعمل وأنا بريء مما تعملون

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but can you make the deaf hear, even though they will not understand?
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that not everyone who hears the message of the Quran will truly understand and heed its guidance. Just like it is impossible for the deaf to hear unless granted the ability by Allah, some people's hearts and minds are closed to the message of the Quran, regardless of how clearly it is delivered. It serves as a reminder that guidance ultimately comes from Allah, and only those who are open to it will truly benefit from the teachings of the Quran.
orig: ومنهم من يستمعون إليك أفأنت تسمع الصم ولو كانوا لا يعقلون

translation: And among them are those who look toward you. But can you guide the blind even though they do not see?
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness of some disbelievers who, despite witnessing the signs of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his guidance, still refuse to believe. It emphasizes the inability to guide those who are spiritually blind and unwilling to see the truth, no matter how clear it may be.
orig: ومنهم من ينظر إليك أفأنت تهدي العمي ولو كانوا لا يبصرون

translation: Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who wrong themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate justice of Allah, asserting that He does not wrong anyone and is fair in His dealings with His creation. It emphasizes that any perceived injustice or wrongdoing is a result of people's own actions and choices, rather than any flaw or injustice on the part of Allah.
orig: إن الله لا يظلم الناس شيئا ولكن الناس أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and] they will recognize each other. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allah and were not guided.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when people will be resurrected, and it will seem to them as if their worldly life was just a moment. At that time, those who disbelieved in meeting Allah and strayed from the path of guidance will realize their loss and the consequences of their denial.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم كأن لم يلبثوا إلا ساعة من النهار يتعارفون بينهم قد خسر الذين كذبوا بلقاء الله وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the responsibility of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is to convey the message of Islam to the people, whether they believe or not. The final judgment and accountability for their actions rest with Allah. The Prophet's duty is to deliver the message, and it is up to the individuals to accept or reject it, with their actions being witnessed by Allah.
orig: وإما نرينك بعض الذي نعدهم أو نتوفينك فإلينا مرجعهم ثم الله شهيد على ما يفعلون

translation: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine justice and the fairness of Allah's judgment. It highlights that every nation is sent a messenger to guide them and when the messenger arrives, the people will be judged with fairness and justice according to their deeds, and no injustice will be done to them. It serves as a reminder that Allah's judgment is based on justice and equity.
orig: ولكل أمة رسول فإذا جاء رسولهم قضي بينهم بالقسط وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse reflects the skepticism and doubt of disbelievers regarding the fulfillment of the promise of resurrection and accountability in the Hereafter. They challenge the believers by questioning the timing of this event, seeking to undermine the certainty of the truth revealed by Allah. It highlights the importance of faith and patience in trusting and waiting for the promise of Allah to be fulfilled, regardless of the doubts and mockery of the disbelievers.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "I possess not for myself any harm or benefit except what Allah should will. For every nation is a [specified] term. When their time has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it]."
interpretation: This verse conveys that ultimately Allah is the ultimate controller of everything, including harm and benefit. It stresses the concept of predestination and the idea that every nation has a predetermined term set by Allah. Once their time is up, they cannot delay or hasten it even for a moment.
orig: قل لا أملك لنفسي ضرا ولا نفعا إلا ما شاء الله لكل أمة أجل إذا جاء أجلهم فلا يستأخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if His punishment should come to you by night or by day, for which aspect of it would the criminals be impatient?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of the punishment for those who persist in wrongdoing, questioning the rush of the sinners and wrongdoers to face the consequences. It serves as a reminder that no one can escape the consequences of their actions, and the punishment of Allah can come at any time, causing reflection on the arrogance and impatience of those who commit wrongs.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أتاكم عذابه بياتا أو نهارا ماذا يستعجل منه المجرمون

translation: Then is it, when it has actually occurred, you will believe in it? Now? And you were [once] for it impatient?
interpretation: This verse questions the sincerity of those who only believe when they witness the fulfillment of a prophecy or a warning. It criticizes the lack of faith or patience in believing without the need for visible proof or events. It encourages believers to reflect on their level of faith and readiness to accept the truth even before it manifests physically.
orig: أثم إذا ما وقع آمنتم به آلآن وقد كنتم به تستعجلون

translation: Then it will be said to those who have wronged, 'Taste the punishment of eternity. Are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine justice, stating that those who commit wrongdoing will face eternal punishment as a consequence of their actions. It serves as a warning that people will be held accountable for their deeds and will receive a just recompense based on their own actions.
orig: ثم قيل للذين ظلموا ذوقوا عذاب الخلد هل تجزون إلا بما كنتم تكسبون

translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], 'Is it true?' Say, 'Yes, by my Lord. And you will not evade [punishment].'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the truth and the inevitability of accountability for one's actions. It conveys the idea that denying the truth or trying to avoid responsibility will not change the reality of the situation. As believers, we are called to acknowledge the truth and accept the consequences of our choices, as accountability lies ultimately with Allah.
orig: ويستنبئونك أحق هو قل إي وربي إنه لحق وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: And if every soul that wronged had everything on earth, it would offer it to ransom itself. And they will confide regret when they see the punishment; and the judgement will be passed between them equitably, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate futility of seeking to avoid accountability for wrongdoing by offering material possessions. Ultimately, on the Day of Judgement, each individual will bear the consequences of their actions. No one will be treated unfairly, as Allah's justice will prevail, and every person will be judged in a just and equitable manner, without any injustice.
orig: ولو أن لكل نفس ظلمت ما في الأرض لافتدت به وأسروا الندامة لما رأوا العذاب وقضي بينهم بالقسط وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, the promise of Allah is true, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing ownership of Allah over everything in the heavens and the earth. It also highlights the certainty of Allah's promise, indicating that it will never be in vain. However, despite the truth of Allah's promise, it mentions that many people are unaware or ignorant of this fact, which serves as a reminder to believers to have faith and trust in Allah's promises even when they may not fully understand them.
orig: ألا إن لله ما في السماوات والأرض ألا إن وعد الله حق ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and control of Allah over life and death. It serves as a reminder to believers that all life and death are in the hands of Allah, and that ultimately all will return to Him for judgment and accountability.
orig: هو يحيي ويميت وإليه ترجعون

translation: O mankind, there has come to you instruction from your Lord and healing for what is in the breasts and guidance and mercy for the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal message of the Qur'an, addressing all of mankind. It serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is not only a book of guidance but also a source of healing for the spiritual unease that resides in the hearts of people. It provides guidance and a path to true mercy for those who believe and follow its teachings.
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءتكم موعظة من ربكم وشفاء لما في الصدور وهدى ورحمة للمؤمنين

translation: Say, 'In the bounty of Allah and in His mercy - in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate.'
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to attribute all good things to the grace and mercy of Allah, and to find joy and contentment in His blessings rather than in the material possessions and wealth they accumulate in this world. It emphasizes the spiritual and eternal value of Allah's blessings over temporary worldly gains.
orig: قل بفضل الله وبرحمته فبذلك فليفرحوا هو خير مما يجمعون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered what Allah has sent down to you of provision of which you have made [some] lawful and [some] unlawful?' Say, 'Has Allah permitted you [to do so], or do you invent [something] about Allah?'
interpretation: This verse questions the people who have arbitrarily declared certain things as lawful or unlawful without any divine authority. It challenges them to consider whether it is Allah who has given them permission to do so, or if they are fabricating lies about Allah. It serves as a reminder to adhere to the laws and guidelines set by Allah rather than making their own judgments.
orig: قل أرأيتم ما أنزل الله لكم من رزق فجعلتم منه حراما وحلالا قل آلله أذن لكم أم على الله تفترون

translation: And what will be the supposition of those who invent falsehood about Allah on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of them are not grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of lying about Allah and inventing falsehood about Him. It warns of the consequences that those who spread lies about Allah will face on the Day of Judgment. Despite Allah's abundant blessings and favors upon people, many fail to recognize these and show gratitude. The verse serves as a reminder to be truthful about Allah and to appreciate His countless blessings in order to avoid His displeasure.
orig: وما ظن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب يوم القيامة إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثرهم لا يشكرون

translation: And you are not engaged in any matter, nor do you recite any portion of the Qur'an or do any deed, but We are witness over you when you are engrossed in it. And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every action, every word recited from the Qur'an, and every deed that is done is known to Allah. Nothing is hidden from Him, not even an atom's weight of good or evil. It serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of our actions and nothing escapes His knowledge, implying the importance of being mindful of our deeds and intentions as we are accountable for all our actions.
orig: وما تكون في شأن وما تتلو منه من قرآن ولا تعملون من عمل إلا كنا عليكم شهودا إذ تفيضون فيه وما يعزب عن ربك من مثقال ذرة في الأرض ولا في السماء ولا أصغر من ذلك ولا أكبر إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: Indeed, the allies of Allah will have no fear nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that those who are close to Allah, who have faith and righteousness, will have protection and comfort. They will not be overwhelmed by fear or sadness, as Allah is their protector and source of solace.
orig: ألا إن أولياء الله لا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those who believed and were fearing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have faith in Allah and who are mindful of Him. They are conscious of their actions and strive to lead a righteous life, fearing the consequences of their deeds. This fear acts as a motivation for them to adhere to the teachings of Islam and follow the path of righteousness.
orig: الذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون
