translation: They have good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. There is no changing the words of Allah. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who believe in Allah and follow His guidance will be rewarded with blessings and good news in both this life and the Hereafter. It emphasizes the permanence and unchanging nature of Allah's decrees and promises. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate success and felicity that awaits those who remain steadfast in their faith and deeds.
orig: لهم البشرى في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة لا تبديل لكلمات الله ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, all honor belongs to Allah. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) not to be saddened by the words of the disbelievers and to remember that all honor and power belongs to Allah alone. It emphasizes that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, aware of everything that is said and done.
orig: ولا يحزنك قولهم إن العزة لله جميعا هو السميع العليم

translation: Indeed, to Allah belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And those who invoke other than Allah do not [actually] follow [His] 'partners.' They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of monotheism in Islam, emphasizing that all in the heavens and the earth belong to Allah alone. It also criticizes those who associate partners with Allah, stating that such beliefs are based on mere assumptions without any basis, and that those who do so are in fact in error and falsehood.
orig: ألا إن لله من في السماوات ومن في الأرض وما يتبع الذين يدعون من دون الله شركاء إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: It is He who made the night for you to rest therein and the day giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and mercy of Allah in creating the cycle of night and day, providing opportunities for rest and productivity. It emphasizes that these natural phenomena are filled with signs pointing to the existence and power of Allah for those who are willing to reflect and listen to his guidance.
orig: هو الذي جعل لكم الليل لتسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يسمعون

translation: They say, "Allah has taken a son." Exalted is He! He is the [one] Free of need. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this [claim]. Do you say about Allah that which you do not know?
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the greatness of Allah and the absurdity of attributing a son to Him when He is self-sufficient and the owner of everything in the heavens and the earth. It questions the people who make such claims about Allah without any evidence or knowledge, highlighting the importance of speaking only about Him based on what we truly know and understand.
orig: قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا سبحانه هو الغني له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض إن عندكم من سلطان بهذا أتقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Say, "Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who attribute lies to Allah will not achieve prosperity or success. It serves as a warning against spreading falsehoods or lies about Allah, as doing so goes against the beliefs and teachings of Islam.
orig: قل إن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون

translation: A provision in the worldly life, then to Us is their return, then We will make them taste the severe punishment because they used to disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary nature of worldly pleasures and the ultimate return to Allah. It warns of a severe punishment for those who persist in disbelief despite the signs and guidance provided by Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers to stay steadfast in faith and avoid falling into disbelief.
orig: متاع في الدنيا ثم إلينا مرجعهم ثم نذيقهم العذاب الشديد بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: And recite to them the news of Noah when he said to his people, 'O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you - then upon Allah, I have relied. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Let not your plan be in doubt for you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an speaks about Prophet Noah addressing his people, reminding them of their rejection of his message and devotion to false gods. He asserts his trust in Allah, urging them to carry out their plan against him if they wish. Through this story, the concept of reliance on Allah and standing firm in the face of opposition is emphasized.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ نوح إذ قال لقومه يا قوم إن كان كبر عليكم مقامي وتذكيري بآيات الله فعلى الله توكلت فأجمعوا أمركم وشركاءكم ثم لا يكن أمركم عليكم غمة ثم اقضوا إلي ولا تنظرون

translation: So if you turn away, I have not asked you for any payment. My reward is only from Allah, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Prophets are not seeking any material reward from people for delivering the message of Allah. Their ultimate reward lies with Allah alone, and they have been ordained to submit to Him completely. It highlights the purity of intention and sincerity in conveying the message of Islam, free from any worldly motives.
orig: فإن توليتم فما سألتكم من أجر إن أجري إلا على الله وأمرت أن أكون من المسلمين

translation: So they denied him; but We saved him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. So observe the end of those who were warned.
interpretation: The verse narrates the story of Prophet Nuh (Noah) and how those who rejected his message were drowned in punishment by God while Nuh and his followers were saved in the Ark. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the signs of God and rejecting the warnings of the prophets.
orig: فكذبوه فنجيناه ومن معه في الفلك وجعلناهم خلائف وأغرقنا الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين

translation: Then We sent messengers after him to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal the hearts of the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse discusses the response of some people to the messengers sent to them by God, where despite being presented with clear evidence and signs by these messengers, they chose not to believe. Their hearts were sealed due to their persistent rejection and transgression. The verse highlights the consequences of denying the truth and the hardening of hearts that can result from continued defiance against divine guidance.
orig: ثم بعثنا من بعده رسلا إلى قومهم فجاءوهم بالبينات فما كانوا ليؤمنوا بما كذبوا به من قبل كذلك نطبع على قلوب المعتدين

translation: Then We sent Moses and Aaron, after them, to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly. They were criminal people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of the prophets Moses and Aaron being sent to the Pharaoh and his people with divine signs to guide them towards righteousness. However, despite witnessing clear signs of the truth, the Pharaoh and his chiefs rejected the message out of arrogance and disobedience, illustrating their wrongful and criminal behavior.
orig: ثم بعثنا من بعدهم موسى وهارون إلى فرعون وملئه بآياتنا فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما مجرمين

translation: So when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'This is clearly magic.'
interpretation: This verse captures the reaction of certain disbelievers who, upon being presented with undeniable truth and guidance from Allah, dismiss it as mere magic in order to justify their rejection of the message. It serves as a reminder of how some individuals may choose ignorance and disbelief despite clear evidence, opting to discredit the truth rather than accept it.
orig: فلما جاءهم الحق من عندنا قالوا إن هذا لسحر مبين

translation: Moses said, 'Do you say to the truth when it has come to you, 'Is this magic?' And magicians will never succeed.'
interpretation: This verse showcases Prophet Moses confronting the people who dismissed the truth by wrongly attributing it to magic. It teaches us the importance of recognizing and accepting the truth, as denying it due to pride or arrogance will not lead to success in this world or the Hereafter.
orig: قال موسى أتقولون للحق لما جاءكم أسحر هذا ولا يفلح الساحرون

translation: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers practicing and so that you two may have greatness in the land? We are not believers in you."
interpretation: This verse reflects the response of a group of people who rejected the message of the prophets, questioning their motives and expressing reluctance to abandon the traditions of their forefathers. They rejected the idea of changing their ways and following a different path, showing pride in their current position and refusing to accept the truth. The verse serves as a reminder of the challenge of inviting people to embrace new beliefs and practices, especially when they are deeply rooted in old traditions.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لتلفتنا عما وجدنا عليه آباءنا وتكون لكما الكبرياء في الأرض وما نحن لكما بمؤمنين

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'Bring to me every learned magician.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh's arrogance and disbelief in God's power. Despite witnessing the miracles of Prophet Moses, Pharaoh challenges him by summoning all the skilled magicians to compete with Moses' miracles. It symbolizes the human tendency to rely on worldly knowledge and power, even in the face of clear signs of divine truth and guidance.
orig: وقال فرعون ائتوني بكل ساحر عليم

translation: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you have to throw."
interpretation: This verse describes a moment in the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) where he was confronted by the magicians of Pharaoh. Despite facing immense pressure and challenge, Prophet Moses remained steadfast in his faith and courage. The verse showcases his confidence in the power of Allah and his willingness to confront and defeat the false practices of the magicians, trusting in Allah's guidance and support.
orig: فلما جاء السحرة قال لهم موسى ألقوا ما أنتم ملقون

translation: So when they threw, Moses said, 'What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allah will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allah does not amend the work of corrupters.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitable defeat and nullification of falsehood and deceit, even if it appears impressive or powerful initially. It highlights the principle that the deceptive actions of wrongdoers will eventually be exposed, and that Allah does not support or bring success to those who engage in corruption and mischief.
orig: فلما ألقوا قال موسى ما جئتم به السحر إن الله سيبطله إن الله لا يصلح عمل المفسدين

translation: And Allah will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the truth will prevail in the end, regardless of the disbelief and resistance of wrongdoers. It emphasizes the certainty and power of Allah's words in upholding justice and exposing falsehood, even if those who are engaged in sin and injustice despise it. Ultimately, the truth stands firm and will not be shaken by the objections or rejection of those who go against it.
orig: ويحق الله الحق بكلماته ولو كره المجرمون

translation: But none believed in Moses except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their establishment that he would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and how only a few youths from his own people believed in him due to their fear of Pharaoh and his power to persecute them. Despite Pharaoh's arrogance and oppression, the youth stood firm in their faith. The verse serves as a lesson in faith, courage, and steadfastness in times of adversity and tyranny.
orig: فما آمن لموسى إلا ذرية من قومه على خوف من فرعون وملئهم أن يفتنهم وإن فرعون لعال في الأرض وإنه لمن المسرفين

translation: And Moses said, 'O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then rely upon Him, if you are Muslims.'
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Moses is advising his people to have true faith in Allah and to completely trust in Him. He is emphasizing the importance of placing one's trust and reliance on Allah as a form of submission and obedience to Him, showing that true belief is manifested through complete reliance and dependence on the Creator.
orig: وقال موسى يا قوم إن كنتم آمنتم بالله فعليه توكلوا إن كنتم مسلمين

translation: So they said, "Upon Allah do we rely. Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of relying solely on Allah and seeking His protection from becoming victims of trials and tests at the hands of unjust oppressors. It teaches believers to have faith in Allah's wisdom and protection against the harm that may be inflicted upon them by oppressive or wrongdoers.
orig: فقالوا على الله توكلنا ربنا لا تجعلنا فتنة للقوم الظالمين

translation: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah seeking His mercy and guidance to protect the believers from the harm and disbelief of the disbelieving people. It emphasizes the dependence of believers on Allah's mercy for their salvation and protection from those who reject the truth.
orig: ونجنا برحمتك من القوم الكافرين

translation: And We inspired Moses and his brother, saying: 'Appoint houses for your people in Egypt and make your houses a direction for prayer, and establish regular prayer, and give glad tidings to the believers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the instruction given to Prophet Moses and his brother to establish places of residence for their people in Egypt and to make these residences a place for prayer. It emphasizes the importance of establishing regular prayer and delivering good news to the believers. The verse highlights the significance of establishing a connection with God through prayer and providing encouragement to the believers.
orig: وأوحينا إلى موسى وأخيه أن تبوآ لقومكما بمصر بيوتا واجعلوا بيوتكم قبلة وأقيموا الصلاة وبشر المؤمنين

translation: And Moses said, 'Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the plea of Prophet Moses to God regarding Pharaoh and his people who were leading others astray from the path of God due to their wealth and influence. Prophet Moses prays for their wealth to be destroyed and for their hearts to be hardened as a consequence of their disbelief and oppression, showing that material possessions and arrogance can hinder people from recognizing and submitting to the truth.
orig: وقال موسى ربنا إنك آتيت فرعون وملأه زينة وأموالا في الحياة الدنيا ربنا ليضلوا عن سبيلك ربنا اطمس على أموالهم واشدد على قلوبهم فلا يؤمنوا حتى يروا العذاب الأليم

translation: He said, "Your supplication has indeed been answered. But whoever disobeys will be in Hellfire and will have no helpers."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of staying on the right path and not following those who are ignorant or misguided. It warns against disobedience, as it can lead one to the Hellfire with no one to assist or help them. It serves as a reminder to be steadfast in faith and actions guided by knowledge and righteousness.
orig: قال قد أجيبت دعوتكما فاستقيما ولا تتبعان سبيل الذين لا يعلمون

translation: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, 'I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the dramatic moment when Pharaoh, the tyrannical oppressor of the Children of Israel, faced with his imminent death by drowning, finally realizes the truth and declares his faith in the One true God. It serves as a reminder that even the most hardened hearts can soften and turn to God in their final moments, emphasizing the significance of sincere belief and submission to God's will.
orig: وجاوزنا ببني إسرائيل البحر فأتبعهم فرعون وجنوده بغيا وعدوا حتى إذا أدركه الغرق قال آمنت أنه لا إله إلا الذي آمنت به بنو إسرائيل وأنا من المسلمين

translation: Now you have disobeyed before and were of the corrupters.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and corruption. It serves as a reminder that past wrongdoings can lead to further disobedience if not rectified. It underscores the importance of accountability and the need for repentance to prevent falling into a cycle of corruption.
orig: آلآن وقد عصيت قبل وكنت من المفسدين

translation: So today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reflecting on the signs of God and learning from the past, as individuals are meant to be a sign for those who come after them. It emphasizes the idea that many people are heedless and oblivious to the signs and lessons that Allah has placed in their lives, and thus it calls for reflection, awareness, and consciousness of one's surroundings and experiences.
orig: فاليوم ننجيك ببدنك لتكون لمن خلفك آية وإن كثيرا من الناس عن آياتنا لغافلون

translation: And We certainly settled the Children of Israel in a secure settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until knowledge came to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights how the Children of Israel were provided with good provisions and settled in a secure place. They only started to differ among themselves when they deviated from the knowledge that was given to them. On the Day of Judgment, Allah will be the ultimate judge of their disputes and disagreements.
orig: ولقد بوأنا بني إسرائيل مبوأ صدق ورزقناهم من الطيبات فما اختلفوا حتى جاءهم العلم إن ربك يقضي بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: So if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be one of those who doubt.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and clarification when in doubt. It encourages asking the people of knowledge and scriptures for guidance and understanding. It reassures the reader that the truth has come from the Lord, and it advises against being among those who let doubt cloud their faith.
orig: فإن كنت في شك مما أنزلنا إليك فاسأل الذين يقرءون الكتاب من قبلك لقد جاءك الحق من ربك فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And do not be among those who deny the signs of Allah or [among] those who are of the losers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers to not fall into the category of those who deny the signs and revelations of Allah. It warns against rejecting the truth and turning a blind eye to the manifestations of Allah's presence and guidance. By following the signs and remaining steadfast in faith, believers can safeguard themselves from being among the losers who miss out on the rewards and blessings promised by Allah.
orig: ولا تكونن من الذين كذبوا بآيات الله فتكون من الخاسرين

translation: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your Lord has come into effect will not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights that some people, despite being shown clear signs and evidence from their Lord, still refuse to believe. It emphasizes the concept of free will and individual choice in accepting faith, even when presented with undeniable truths. It serves as a reminder of the importance of open-mindedness, sincerity, and humility in recognizing and accepting the truth when it is presented to us.
orig: إن الذين حقت عليهم كلمت ربك لا يؤمنون

translation: And even if every sign came to them, until they see the painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the unfortunate reality of some individuals who may continue to reject the signs of the divine and remain heedless until they face the severe consequences of their actions. It emphasizes the importance of reflection and turning to the truth before it is too late, as denying the signs of God can lead to facing a painful punishment.
orig: ولو جاءتهم كل آية حتى يروا العذاب الأليم

translation: And had it not been that a community believed and profited by its belief, there would certainly have overtaken it a visitation from Us of intense chastisement that which they used to make fun of,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance and impact of belief in Allah. It emphasizes that the faith of a community can protect them from severe punishment. It also serves as a reminder that disbelief and mockery can lead to punishment in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: فلولا كانت قرية آمنت فنفعها إيمانها إلا قوم يونس لما آمنوا كشفنا عنهم عذاب الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ومتعناهم إلى حين

translation: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity among human beings and the fact that differences in beliefs will always exist. It emphasizes that true faith and belief should come from within each individual, and cannot be forcibly imposed on them. It also serves as a reminder that acceptance of others' differing beliefs is important, as it is ultimately up to each person to choose their faith and path in life.
orig: ولو شاء ربك لآمن من في الأرض كلهم جميعا أفأنت تكره الناس حتى يكونوا مؤمنين

translation: And it is not for a soul to believe except by permission of Allah. And He will place defilement upon those who do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that faith and belief is a matter decreed by Allah, and it cannot be achieved without His permission. It also points out that those who lack understanding and do not use rational thinking will be led astray and faced with spiritual impurity.
orig: وما كان لنفس أن تؤمن إلا بإذن الله ويجعل الرجس على الذين لا يعقلون

translation: Say, "Look at what is in the heavens and the earth." But signs and warners do not avail a people who do not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reflection and contemplation on the signs of Allah's creation in the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that even with clear signs and warnings, those who choose not to believe will not benefit from them. Belief and faith are essential to truly understand and appreciate the signs of Allah.
orig: قل انظروا ماذا في السماوات والأرض وما تغني الآيات والنذر عن قوم لا يؤمنون

translation: So do they await except the way of life of those who passed before? Say, "Then await; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that the challenges and trials they face are not unique, as those who came before them also faced similar tests. It encourages patience and perseverance, assuring that God is with those who patiently await His decree. It emphasizes the concept of faith in divine timing and the promise of support from God during times of difficulty.
orig: فهل ينتظرون إلا مثل أيام الذين خلوا من قبلهم قل فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: Then We save Our messengers and those who believe. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us to save the believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is part of Allah's promise and duty to save and protect His messengers and the believers who have faith in Him. It highlights the divine protection extended to those who follow and believe in the messengers, reinforcing the concept of divine support and deliverance for the faithful.
orig: ثم ننجي رسلنا والذين آمنوا كذلك حقا علينا ننج المؤمنين

translation: Say, O mankind, if you are in doubt as to my religion, then (know that) I do not worship those you worship besides Allah, but I worship Allah who will cause you to die. And I have been commanded to be among the believers.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of true monotheistic faith and devotion to Allah. It teaches that even in times of doubt or questioning from others, one must firmly maintain their faith in Allah alone. The verse highlights the ultimate power of Allah in causing life and death, and asserts the believer's commitment to following the path of faith and righteousness despite any uncertainties or pressures from society.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في شك من ديني فلا أعبد الذين تعبدون من دون الله ولكن أعبد الله الذي يتوفاكم وأمرت أن أكون من المؤمنين

translation: And incline toward the religion in uprightness and do not be among those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of adhering to the true religion with sincerity and steadfastness, without associating anyone or anything with Allah. It serves as a reminder to stay committed to the principles of monotheism and to avoid falling into the trap of polytheism or associating partners with Allah.
orig: وأن أقم وجهك للدين حنيفا ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to worship or invoke anything other than Allah, for nothing has the power to benefit or harm except Him. Associating partners with Allah in worship is a grave injustice and a form of wrongdoing.
orig: ولا تدع من دون الله ما لا ينفعك ولا يضرك فإن فعلت فإنك إذا من الظالمين

translation: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He intends for you good, then there is no one who can repel His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine decree and the ultimate control that Allah has over all matters. It teaches us that if hardships come upon us, only Allah can remove them, and if blessings come our way, no one can prevent them. It also highlights that every situation is decreed by Allah according to His wisdom and will, and that His mercy and forgiveness are always available to His servants.
orig: وإن يمسسك الله بضر فلا كاشف له إلا هو وإن يردك بخير فلا راد لفضله يصيب به من يشاء من عباده وهو الغفور الرحيم

translation: Say, 'O mankind, the truth has come to you from your Lord. So whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the individual responsibility that each person holds for their own guidance or misguidance. It conveys the message that guidance ultimately benefits the individual themselves, while straying leads them to loss. It also highlights that the role of the Prophet is not to control or manage people's choices, but to deliver the message of truth for them to reflect upon and choose their path accordingly.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم الحق من ربكم فمن اهتدى فإنما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها وما أنا عليكم بوكيل

translation: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah judges, and He is the best of judges.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to adhere to the guidance revealed by Allah and to remain patient in following His commandments. It reassures them that Allah's judgment is always just and that ultimate justice will be served by Him. It encourages patience and trust in Allah's wisdom and decisions.
orig: واتبع ما يوحى إليك واصبر حتى يحكم الله وهو خير الحاكمين

translation: Alif Lam Ra. This is a Book whose verses have been perfected and then presented in detail from One who is Wise and Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an is a perfectly structured and detailed Book, revealed by the All-Wise and All-Knowing Creator. It highlights the deep wisdom and knowledge behind every verse of the Qur'an, underscoring the importance of reflecting on its messages and guidance.
orig: الر كتاب أحكمت آياته ثم فصلت من لدن حكيم خبير

translation: Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshiping only Allah. It serves as a reminder that there is only one true God worthy of worship. The speaker, likely a prophet, declares that they are a warner, cautioning the people about the consequences of not following the guidance, and a bringer of good news, promising rewards for those who adhere to the teachings of Islam.
orig: ألا تعبدوا إلا الله إنني لكم منه نذير وبشير

translation: And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will provide you with good provisions for a specified term and will give every doer of favor his favor. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and turning back to Him in repentance. It promises that Allah will grant believers good provisions and blessings for a set time, rewarding those who do good deeds. However, a warning is issued that if one turns away from seeking forgiveness and repentance, there is a fear of facing severe punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وأن استغفروا ربكم ثم توبوا إليه يمتعكم متاعا حسنا إلى أجل مسمى ويؤت كل ذي فضل فضله وإن تولوا فإني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم كبير

translation: To Allah is your return, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the ultimate return to Allah after death, emphasizing His complete power and control over all things. It serves as a reminder of accountability to Him for our actions and that ultimately, He has complete authority and control over everything.
orig: إلى الله مرجعكم وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: Verily, they fold up their breasts that they may hide from Him. Verily, when they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Indeed, He is Knowing of that which is within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse highlights that even though people may try to conceal their innermost thoughts and feelings from others, nothing can be hidden from Allah. He is fully aware of what is hidden in their hearts and what is apparent. It serves as a reminder of the all-encompassing knowledge and understanding that Allah has about His creation, emphasizing the importance of sincerity and honesty in one's actions and intentions.
orig: ألا إنهم يثنون صدورهم ليستخفوا منه ألا حين يستغشون ثيابهم يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief that all provision, sustenance, and knowledge of every creature's whereabouts are solely in the hands of Allah. It highlights the concept of divine providence and emphasizes that everything is predestined and recorded by Allah in a clear and detailed manner.
orig: وما من دابة في الأرض إلا على الله رزقها ويعلم مستقرها ومستودعها كل في كتاب مبين

translation: And He it is who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne was upon the water - that He might try you, as to which of you is best in deeds. But if you were to say to them, 'You will be resurrected after death,' those who disbelieve will surely say, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's power and ability to create the heavens and the earth in six days. It also highlights the purpose of the creation, which is to test humanity and determine who among them performs the best deeds. The verse also acknowledges that disbelievers will reject the notion of resurrection after death and attribute it to mere magic, refusing to acknowledge the truth of the afterlife and the consequences of their deeds.
orig: وهو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام وكان عرشه على الماء ليبلوكم أيكم أحسن عملا ولئن قلت إنكم مبعوثون من بعد الموت ليقولن الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And if We defer the punishment from them for a specified term, they will surely say, 'What detains it?' Unquestionably, a day will come when it will not be averted from them, and it will envelop them, the things they used to ridicule will encompass them.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the dismissive attitude of disbelievers towards the warning of punishment from Allah. They mock the concept of punishment being deferred, believing it will never come. However, this verse serves as a reminder that the Day of Judgment will inevitably come, and the disbelievers will face the consequences of their mockery and disbelief.
orig: ولئن أخرنا عنهم العذاب إلى أمة معدودة ليقولن ما يحبسه ألا يوم يأتيهم ليس مصروفا عنهم وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And if We let man taste mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human tendency to become despondent and ungrateful when blessings are taken away. It serves as a reminder to be thankful and patient, acknowledging that any mercy or blessings come from Allah and can be taken away by His will.
orig: ولئن أذقنا الإنسان منا رحمة ثم نزعناها منه إنه ليئوس كفور

translation: But if We let him taste favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, 'Bad times have left me.' Indeed, he is exultant and boastful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fickle nature of human beings, as people tend to forget their trials and hardships once they have been relieved of them and become prosperous. It serves as a reminder to remain humble and grateful to God in times of ease, without arrogance or boastfulness.
orig: ولئن أذقناه نعماء بعد ضراء مسته ليقولن ذهب السيئات عني إنه لفرح فخور

translation: Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds; those will have forgiveness and great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and righteous deeds in the face of challenges and difficulties. It assures believers that those who remain steadfast in their faith, practice patience, and perform good deeds will be rewarded with forgiveness from Allah and a great reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إلا الذين صبروا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك لهم مغفرة وأجر كبير

translation: Perhaps you would risk your life over their denial if they do not believe in this message, out of sorrow.
interpretation: This verse reflects upon the struggle of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in conveying the message of Islam to the disbelievers of Makkah. It suggests that the Prophet may feel sad and distressed by the rejection of his message, but he is reminded that his role is to deliver the warning, and that ultimately, Allah is the Guardian and Protector of all things.
orig: فلعلك تارك بعض ما يوحى إليك وضائق به صدرك أن يقولوا لولا أنزل عليه كنز أو جاء معه ملك إنما أنت نذير والله على كل شيء وكيل

translation: Or do they say, 'He has invented it?' Say, 'Then bring ten surahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse challenges those who accuse the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of fabricating the Qur'an to produce even ten chapters like it if they believe it to be a human creation. By issuing this challenge, the Qur'an affirms its divine origin and unparalleled eloquence, highlighting the impossibility of replicating its unique style and content.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل فأتوا بعشر سور مثله مفتريات وادعوا من استطعتم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: So if they do not respond to you, then know that it has been revealed with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no deity except Him. Then, are you Muslims?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is revealed with the knowledge of Allah and asserts the Oneness of God. It challenges the non-believers to consider the truth of Islam and asks them whether they are willing to submit to Allah and become Muslims.
orig: فإلم يستجيبوا لكم فاعلموا أنما أنزل بعلم الله وأن لا إله إلا هو فهل أنتم مسلمون

translation: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and therein they will not be deprived.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who prioritize worldly pleasures over spiritual fulfillment will receive their recompense accordingly in this life, but deny themselves the greater rewards of the Hereafter. It warns against becoming so engrossed in material gains that one neglects their spiritual obligations and the ultimate purpose of existence.
orig: من كان يريد الحياة الدنيا وزينتها نوف إليهم أعمالهم فيها وهم فيها لا يبخسون

translation: Those are the ones for whom there is not but the Fire in the Hereafter; and lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of those who reject faith and do not believe in the Hereafter. Their actions in this world are futile and devoid of value in the Hereafter, leading to their ultimate destination being the Hellfire.
orig: أولئك الذين ليس لهم في الآخرة إلا النار وحبط ما صنعوا فيها وباطل ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Is he then who has with him clear proof from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it, and before it there was the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy? They believe in it. And whoever of the factions disbelieves in it, the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.
interpretation: This verse speaks about those who have clear proof from their Lord and follow the guidance of the previous scriptures, including the Book of Moses. Those who believe in this guidance will find mercy and guidance. However, those who disbelieve in it will face the punishment of Hellfire. The verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the truth revealed by God, but it also acknowledges that many people fail to have faith in it.
orig: أفمن كان على بينة من ربه ويتلوه شاهد منه ومن قبله كتاب موسى إماما ورحمة أولئك يؤمنون به ومن يكفر به من الأحزاب فالنار موعده فلا تك في مرية منه إنه الحق من ربك ولكن أكثر الناس لا يؤمنون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, 'These are the ones who lied against their Lord.' Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of inventing lies about Allah, which is considered a great injustice. Those who do so will be brought before their Lord on the Day of Judgment, and the witnesses will testify against them. It emphasizes that the curse of Allah is upon those who commit such heinous acts of falsehood and oppression.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أولئك يعرضون على ربهم ويقول الأشهاد هؤلاء الذين كذبوا على ربهم ألا لعنة الله على الظالمين

translation: Those who hinder others from the Path of Allah and seek to make it crooked, and they are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the wrongdoing of those who not only turn away from the path of Allah themselves but also actively obstruct others from following it. They not only deviate themselves but try to lead others astray, denying and disbelieving in the concept of the Hereafter and the consequences of their actions. It warns against such behavior and highlights the importance of staying steadfast in faith and avoiding misleading others.
orig: الذين يصدون عن سبيل الله ويبغونها عوجا وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون

translation: They were not causing failure [to Allah] on earth, and there was not for them besides Allah any protectors. They were [themselves] the ones in loss.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who oppose Allah and His guidance will ultimately fail and suffer loss, as they have no power or authority on earth and no protectors besides Allah to save them from the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning to those who choose to reject or go against the teachings of Allah.
orig: أولئك لم يكونوا معجزين في الأرض وما كان لهم من دون الله من أولياء يضاعف لهم العذاب ما كانوا يستطيعون السمع وما كانوا يبصرون

translation: Those are the ones who have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences of those who have gone astray and lost their way due to their fabricated beliefs and false practices. It emphasizes that by deviating from the truth, individuals are essentially causing harm to themselves, leading to further loss and misguided actions.
orig: أولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Surely, they are the losers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny the truth and commit wrongdoing will ultimately be the losers in the Hereafter. It serves as a warning against leading a life that goes against the teachings of Islam and reminds believers to strive for righteousness and piety in order to secure success in the Hereafter.
orig: لا جرم أنهم في الآخرة هم الأخسرون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbly submitted to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true believers who have faith, perform good deeds, and humble themselves before God will be rewarded with eternal residence in Paradise. It highlights the importance of faith, good deeds, and submission to God as essential components for attaining everlasting bliss in the afterlife.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وأخبتوا إلى ربهم أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: The example of the two groups is like the blind and the deaf and the seeing and the hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the difference between two groups of people: those who are blind and deaf to the message of Allah and those who can see and hear and thus understand and follow His guidance. It emphasizes the importance of utilizing one's faculties of seeing and hearing to comprehend the truth and not equating those who are receptive to guidance with those who are negligent and heedless.
orig: مثل الفريقين كالأعمى والأصم والبصير والسميع هل يستويان مثلا أفلا تذكرون

translation: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], 'Indeed, I am to you a clear warner,'
interpretation: This verse highlights the mission of Prophet Noah (peace be upon him) who was sent by Allah to warn his people about the consequences of their disbelief and to guide them towards the right path. It emphasizes the role of prophets as warners and guides sent by Allah to guide humanity towards righteousness.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه إني لكم نذير مبين

translation: That you worship none but Allah. Verily, I fear for you the torment of a painful Day.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshiping only Allah and warns against associating any partners with Him. The speaker expresses concern for the believers, warning them about the severe punishment awaiting those who deviate from the path of monotheism and righteousness.
orig: أن لا تعبدوا إلا الله إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم أليم

translation: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, 'We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we see you not having any merit over us; rather, we think you are liars.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the rejection and disbelief shown by the elite and disbelievers from the Prophet's community towards his message. They belittle the Prophet by comparing him to an ordinary human, questioning his followers' credibility, and rejecting any superiority or merit. Their arrogant denial is rooted in their refusal to acknowledge the truth of the Prophet's words and to accept his message.
orig: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما نراك إلا بشرا مثلنا وما نراك اتبعك إلا الذين هم أراذلنا بادي الرأي وما نرى لكم علينا من فضل بل نظنكم كاذبين

translation: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a mercy from Him, who would protect me from Allah if I disobeyed Him? So you have no wish to harm me.'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker is conveying to his people that if he is guided by clear evidence from his Lord and has received mercy from Him, then it is Allah who protects him. The speaker is highlighting the importance of following divine guidance and the consequences of going against it. It emphasizes the idea that true protection and safety come from obedience to Allah and His guidance, and disobedience only harms oneself.
orig: قال يا قوم أرأيتم إن كنت على بينة من ربي وآتاني رحمة من عنده فعميت عليكم أنلزمكموها وأنتم لها كارهون

translation: And O my people, I ask you not for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humility and sincerity of the speaker who is not seeking material gain or payment from the people for conveying the message. The speaker's reward is only from Allah, emphasizing the importance of sincerity in spreading the message of faith. It also expresses the frustration of the speaker at the ignorance of the people who fail to recognize the truth, despite the clear signs and evidence.
orig: ويا قوم لا أسألكم عليه مالا إن أجري إلا على الله وما أنا بطارد الذين آمنوا إنهم ملاقو ربهم ولكني أراكم قوما تجهلون

translation: And O my people, who will support me against Allah if I should drive them away? Then will you not be reminded?
interpretation: This verse is a call from a Prophet to his people, asking them who will support him against Allah if he were to reject them. It serves as a reminder of the power and authority of Allah, highlighting the futility of opposing or going against His will.
orig: ويا قوم من ينصرني من الله إن طردتهم أفلا تذكرون

translation: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories of Allah, nor [that] I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Prophet Muhammad's limited knowledge and authority. It makes clear that he does not possess the treasures of Allah or knowledge of the unseen. By stating that he only follows the revelation given to him, the verse also highlights the importance of adhering to divine guidance. The rhetorical question at the end invites reflection on the stark difference between those who are blind to the truth and those who can see it, urging people to think deeply about the message being conveyed.
orig: ولا أقول لكم عندي خزائن الله ولا أعلم الغيب ولا أقول إني ملك ولا أقول للذين تزدري أعينكم لن يؤتيهم الله خيرا الله أعلم بما في أنفسهم إني إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: They said, 'O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an depicts the people responding to the Prophet Noah's warnings by challenging him to bring the punishment he promised upon them if he truly believed in what he was preaching. It reflects the arrogance and disbelief of those who rejected the message of the prophets and demanded immediate proof of the impending punishment.
orig: قالوا يا نوح قد جادلتنا فأكثرت جدالنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said, 'It will come to you only if Allah wills it; you cannot prevent it.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate control and power of Allah over all things. It teaches that nothing can happen without the will of Allah, and no one can stop what He has decreed. It reminds believers to submit to the divine will and trust in Allah's wisdom and plan.
orig: قال إنما يأتيكم به الله إن شاء وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: And my advice will not benefit you - although I wish to advise you - If Allah should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that even the best advice will not benefit those whom Allah has willed to stray. It highlights the ultimate power of Allah as the Lord who guides and misguides. It reminds believers that all affairs ultimately return to Allah, underscoring the importance of relying on His guidance and submitting to His will.
orig: ولا ينفعكم نصحي إن أردت أن أنصح لكم إن كان الله يريد أن يغويكم هو ربكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: Or do they say, 'He has fabricated it?' Say, 'If I have fabricated it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what you commit.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the authenticity and truthfulness of the Qur'an. It highlights that if the Prophet Muhammad had fabricated the Qur'an, he would bear the consequences of his actions. By asserting his innocence of such accusations, the verse solidifies the belief that the Qur'an is a divine revelation and not a product of human invention.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل إن افتريته فعلي إجرامي وأنا بريء مما تجرمون

translation: And it was revealed to Noah that no one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not grieve over what they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the message given to the prophet Noah, peace be upon him, that only those who had already believed among his people will truly embrace faith. It signifies that guidance and faith are ultimately in the hands of Allah, and that prophets are not responsible for the disbelief of their people. It teaches us to be patient and steadfast in delivering the message of truth, even in the face of rejection or opposition.
orig: وأوحي إلى نوح أنه لن يؤمن من قومك إلا من قد آمن فلا تبتئس بما كانوا يفعلون

translation: And construct the ship under Our observation and as We instruct. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is a part of the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) and his people. Here, Allah commands Prophet Noah to build the ark under His guidance and not to plead on behalf of the wrongdoers who are destined to be drowned in the upcoming flood. The verse emphasizes the importance of following Allah's guidance and accepting His decree, even when it involves the punishment of the wrongdoers.
orig: واصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا إنهم مغرقون

translation: And he made the ship. And every time that a company [of believers] passed by him, they derided him. He said, 'If you deride us, then indeed we will deride you just as you deride [us].'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of a prophet named Nuh (Noah) who was commanded by Allah to build a ship. Despite being mocked and ridiculed by his people, Nuh remained steadfast in his faith and warned them of the consequences of their disbelief. The verse highlights the theme of patience and perseverance in the face of adversity, and serves as a reminder that believers may face challenges and ridicule in upholding their faith, but they should remain steadfast and trust in Allah's guidance.
orig: ويصنع الفلك وكلما مر عليه ملأ من قومه سخروا منه قال إن تسخروا منا فإنا نسخر منكم كما تسخرون

translation: You will soon know upon whom descends humiliation and who dwells in a lasting punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the readers that those who face humiliation and enduring punishment are clear signs of Allah's justice. It conveys the message that wrongdoers will inevitably face consequences for their actions, illustrating the concept of divine retribution and the importance of leading a righteous life to avoid such punishments.
orig: فسوف تعلمون من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم

translation: So when Our command came, and the oven overflowed, We said, 'Load onto it a pair of every kind, together with your family, except those against whom the decree has already been passed. And do not engage in argument with Me, concerning those who have done wrong; they will be drowned.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Noah, peace be upon him, and the command to bring onto the ark pairs of every kind of creature along with his family to survive the flood. It emphasizes the importance of following the command of Allah without questioning it, and highlights the consequences of disbelief and disobedience.
orig: حتى إذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور قلنا احمل فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول ومن آمن وما آمن معه إلا قليل

translation: And he said, "Embark therein; in the Name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of putting trust in Allah before undertaking any journey or endeavor. It reminds believers to begin their journeys with the name of Allah, acknowledging His guidance and mercy. It emphasizes the concept of reliance on Allah's forgiveness and mercy throughout the journey, seeking His protection and blessings in all aspects of life.
orig: وقال اركبوا فيها بسم الله مجراها ومرساها إن ربي لغفور رحيم

translation: And it was said, 'O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain].' And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, 'Away with the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse describes the event of the great flood in the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh in Arabic). It highlights the miraculous nature of the event where the floodwaters receded and the ship carrying Prophet Noah and his followers came to rest on Mount Judiyy. It also emphasizes the consequences of wrongdoing as the disbelievers faced punishment for their sins.
orig: وهي تجري بهم في موج كالجبال ونادى نوح ابنه وكان في معزل يا بني اركب معنا ولا تكن مع الكافرين

translation: He said, 'I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water.' [Nuh] said, 'There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy.' And the waves came between them, so he was among the drowned.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an narrates a moment during the story of Prophet Nuh (Noah) when his disbelieving son, in fear of the flood, sought refuge in a mountain. Prophet Nuh explained to him that no physical protection could save him from the decree of Allah except for those upon whom Allah bestows His mercy. The event unfolded as the waves rose and separated them, leading to the son's unfortunate fate of drowning due to his disbelief and refusal to seek the guidance and mercy of Allah.
orig: قال سآوي إلى جبل يعصمني من الماء قال لا عاصم اليوم من أمر الله إلا من رحم وحال بينهما الموج فكان من المغرقين

translation: And it was said, 'O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain].' And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on [Mount] Judiyy. And it was said, 'Away with the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse describes a momentous event from the story of Prophet Noah's Ark, where after the floods recede, the ship comes to rest on a mountain. It signifies the end of a trial, the fulfillment of a divine decree, and the punishment of the wrongdoers.
orig: وقيل يا أرض ابلعي ماءك ويا سماء أقلعي وغيض الماء وقضي الأمر واستوت على الجودي وقيل بعدا للقوم الظالمين

translation: And Noah called upon his Lord and said, 'My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most Just of judges.'
interpretation: Noah is calling upon Allah in this verse, expressing his concern for his son who was amongst the disbelievers. He is acknowledging that his son is from his family, yet he still trusts in the promise of Allah and recognizes Allah's ultimate justice and wisdom. This verse teaches us about the importance of faith and trusting in Allah's decree, even when it involves loved ones who may be misguided.
orig: ونادى نوح ربه فقال رب إن ابني من أهلي وإن وعدك الحق وأنت أحكم الحاكمين

translation: He said, 'O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant.'
interpretation: In this verse, Allah is advising Prophet Noah (Nuh) not to seek information about matters that he does not have knowledge of. The verse shows us the importance of not speaking about things without proper understanding or knowledge. It serves as a reminder for believers to seek knowledge and understanding before making judgments or asking questions about things beyond their comprehension.
orig: قال يا نوح إنه ليس من أهلك إنه عمل غير صالح فلا تسألن ما ليس لك به علم إني أعظك أن تكون من الجاهلين

translation: He said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking You that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy on me, I will be among the losers."
interpretation: This verse reflects the humility and supplication of a person who is aware of their limitations and seeks protection from seeking knowledge beyond their capacity. The person acknowledges their dependence on Allah for forgiveness and mercy to avoid being among the losers in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: قال رب إني أعوذ بك أن أسألك ما ليس لي به علم وإلا تغفر لي وترحمني أكن من الخاسرين

translation: It was said, 'O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations to whom We shall grant enjoyment  [now] will then be afflicted by a painful punishment from Us.'
interpretation: This verse from Surah Hud describes how after the flood, Prophet Noah and those with him were granted safety and blessings from Allah, while other nations who were granted temporary enjoyment are warned of a painful punishment awaiting them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the importance of returning to righteousness to avoid punishment.
orig: قيل يا نوح اهبط بسلام منا وبركات عليك وعلى أمم ممن معك وأمم سنمتعهم ثم يمسهم منا عذاب أليم

translation: These are the tidings of the unseen which We reveal unto thee. Thou thyself knewest it not, nor did thy folk know it before this. So be patient; surely the (good) end is for those who are mindful of Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of unknown knowledge that is revealed by Allah to His chosen messengers. It highlights the importance of patience in facing challenges and difficulties, as the ultimate outcome will be in favor of those who are conscious of Allah and strive to lead a righteous life.
orig: تلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيها إليك ما كنت تعلمها أنت ولا قومك من قبل هذا فاصبر إن العاقبة للمتقين

translation: And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].
interpretation: This verse is reminding the people of 'Aad through the message of the Prophet Hud to devote themselves to the worship of Allah alone, emphasizing the oneness and uniqueness of Allah as the only true deity. It also warns them against following false beliefs and practices, inviting them to abandon their fabrications and embrace the truth of monotheism.
orig: وإلى عاد أخاهم هودا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره إن أنتم إلا مفترون

translation: O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the selflessness and sincerity of the Prophets, as they convey the message of Allah without seeking any material gain or reward from the people. It reminds the people to reflect on the simplicity and purity of the Prophets' mission, calling them to use their intellect and reason to recognize the truth of the message being delivered.
orig: يا قوم لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إن أجري إلا على الذي فطرني أفلا تعقلون

translation: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah and repenting sincerely in order to receive His mercy and blessings. It highlights the concept that seeking forgiveness and repentance lead to increased strength and blessings from Allah, while turning away from Him and persisting in wrongdoing will only lead to harm and loss.
orig: ويا قوم استغفروا ربكم ثم توبوا إليه يرسل السماء عليكم مدرارا ويزدكم قوة إلى قوتكم ولا تتولوا مجرمين

translation: They said, 'O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not leaving our gods on your say-so; nor are we believers in you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and disbelief of the people addressed by the Prophet Hud. They refused to believe in the message brought by Prophet Hud, rejecting his call for monotheism and arguing that they will not abandon their idols and will not believe in him without clear evidence. This verse serves as a reminder of the challenges faced by prophets in conveying the message of tawheed (monotheism) to their people, and the resistance often encountered in the face of truth.
orig: قالوا يا هود ما جئتنا ببينة وما نحن بتاركي آلهتنا عن قولك وما نحن لك بمؤمنين

translation: "We will only say that perhaps our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "Indeed, I call Allah to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with Allah"
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) when he challenges his people's beliefs in multiple gods. His people accused him of being possessed by evil for rejecting their gods, but Ibrahim firmly denies this and proclaims his innocence from associating any partners with Allah. The verse emphasizes the unwavering faith of Ibrahim in the oneness of Allah, despite facing opposition and persecution from his own community.
orig: إن نقول إلا اعتراك بعض آلهتنا بسوء قال إني أشهد الله واشهدوا أني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Apart from Him, [how many] schemings have you made! But you look on.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of attempting to scheme or plot against Allah, as He is the ultimate planner and nothing can occur without His will. It serves as a reminder that ultimately Allah is in control of all affairs, and no matter how much humans may plan, it is ultimately Allah's plan that will prevail.
orig: من دونه فكيدوني جميعا ثم لا تنظرون

translation: Indeed, I have relied upon Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a path that is straight.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the importance of placing our trust and reliance on Allah, our Lord. It emphasizes that Allah has complete control over every living creature, holding them by their forelocks. The mention of Allah being on a straight path highlights His guidance and justice, serving as a reminder to trust in His wisdom and follow His guidance for the ultimate success and righteousness.
orig: إني توكلت على الله ربي وربكم ما من دابة إلا هو آخذ بناصيتها إن ربي على صراط مستقيم

translation: If they turn away, then I have conveyed to you that with which I was sent to you; and my Lord will bring other people in your place, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed, my Lord is Guardian over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the responsibility of the Prophet to convey the message of Islam to the people, regardless of whether they accept it or not. It reassures the Prophet that if his people reject the message, Allah will replace them with others who will fulfill their duties. It also highlights the ultimate control and protection that Allah has over all things, reminding believers of His absolute power and knowledge.
orig: فإن تولوا فقد أبلغتكم ما أرسلت به إليكم ويستخلف ربي قوما غيركم ولا تضرونه شيئا إن ربي على كل شيء حفيظ

translation: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah shows mercy to His believers and saves them from severe punishment when they obey His command and stay steadfast in their faith. It serves as a reminder of the importance of following God's guidance and believing in Him, as well as the reward and protection that come with righteousness.
orig: ولما جاء أمرنا نجينا هودا والذين آمنوا معه برحمة منا ونجيناهم من عذاب غليظ

translation: And [remember] 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.
interpretation: This verse mentions the people of 'Aad who denied the signs of Allah, disobeyed His messengers, and chose to follow the commands of their oppressive and stubborn leaders. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the guidance from Allah and blindly following unjust rulers.
orig: وتلك عاد جحدوا بآيات ربهم وعصوا رسله واتبعوا أمر كل جبار عنيد

translation: And they pursued [sinners] in this world a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, Ad denied their Lord; then, away with Ad, the people of Hud.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who persist in wrongdoing and reject the guidance from their Lord. It mentions the people of 'Ad who disbelieved in their Lord and faced destruction. The verse serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when the wrongdoers will face their ultimate fate for their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: وأتبعوا في هذه الدنيا لعنة ويوم القيامة ألا إن عادا كفروا ربهم ألا بعدا لعاد قوم هود

translation: And to the Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive.'
interpretation: This verse discusses the message of the prophet Salih to the Thamud tribe, calling them to worship Allah alone as there is no deity worthy of worship except Him. It highlights that Allah created them from the earth, provided for them, and they should seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. The verse emphasizes the closeness and responsiveness of Allah to those who seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.
orig: وإلى ثمود أخاهم صالحا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره هو أنشأكم من الأرض واستعمركم فيها فاستغفروه ثم توبوا إليه إن ربي قريب مجيب

translation: They said, 'O Salih, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers have worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the resistance and doubts faced by the Prophet Salih from his people when calling them to worship the One true God rather than the idols worshipped by their forefathers. It showcases the struggle faced by prophets in convincing their communities to abandon false beliefs and traditions in favor of faith in the One God.
orig: قالوا يا صالح قد كنت فينا مرجوا قبل هذا أتنهانا أن نعبد ما يعبد آباؤنا وإننا لفي شك مما تدعونا إليه مريب

translation: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a mercy from Him, who would protect me from Allah if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss."
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker is appealing to his people, questioning them about the consequences of not following a clear message from God and the mercy that has been bestowed upon him. He emphasizes that if he were to go against God's commands, no one could protect him from Allah, and his people would only cause him harm rather than benefit. This verse highlights the importance of staying on the right path and the consequences of deviating from it.
orig: قال يا قوم أرأيتم إن كنت على بينة من ربي وآتاني منه رحمة فمن ينصرني من الله إن عصيته فما تزيدونني غير تخسير

translation: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah - [she is] a sign for you. So let her feed [where] in Allah's land and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of respecting the signs and manifestations of Allah. It illustrates how mistreating or harming a divine sign can lead to severe consequences and punishment. It serves as a reminder to be mindful of our actions and to treat all creations with reverence and respect.
orig: ويا قوم هذه ناقة الله لكم آية فذروها تأكل في أرض الله ولا تمسوها بسوء فيأخذكم عذاب قريب

translation: Then they rejected him and said, 'Enjoy yourselves in your dwelling for three days; that is a promise not to be denied.'
interpretation: This verse describes the response of the people of Prophet Hud when he warned them of the consequences of rejecting the message of God. Despite the warning, they arrogantly rejected him and challenged him to bring forth the punishment. In their hubris, they issued a taunting promise that they would enjoy their lives for three days before facing any repercussions. However, the verse ultimately indicates that this promise was due to be fulfilled and could not be denied, highlighting the certainty of divine punishment for those who persist in their rejection of truth and righteousness.
orig: فعقروها فقال تمتعوا في داركم ثلاثة أيام ذلك وعد غير مكذوب

translation: So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him by mercy from Us. And [We saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, your Lord - He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights how Allah saved the prophet Saleh and his followers when His command for their salvation was issued. They were saved by Allah's mercy, both from the calamity that befell the disbelievers and from the disgrace of the Day of Judgment. The verse emphasizes the power and might of Allah, indicating that He has the ultimate control and authority to save those who believe in Him.
orig: فلما جاء أمرنا نجينا صالحا والذين آمنوا معه برحمة منا ومن خزي يومئذ إن ربك هو القوي العزيز

translation: And those who have wronged will be seized by a shout, and they will be lying in their homes in [complete] silence.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment where the wrongdoers will be seized by a shout, referring to the terrifying sound of the trumpet blown by the Angel Israfil heralding the end of the world. The wrongdoers will then find themselves motionless in their homes, symbolizing their state of helplessness and despair as they face the consequences of their actions.
orig: وأخذ الذين ظلموا الصيحة فأصبحوا في ديارهم جاثمين

translation: They lived therein as if they had never flourished therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequence of denying and rejecting one's Lord. It highlights the ingratitude and disbelief of the Thamud people towards their Lord despite the blessings bestowed upon them. The verse emphasizes that such denial and arrogance led to the downfall and destruction of the Thamud. It teaches us the importance of acknowledging and being grateful to our Creator, as disbelief and ingratitude can lead to severe consequences.
orig: كأن لم يغنوا فيها ألا إن ثمود كفروا ربهم ألا بعدا لثمود

translation: And Our messengers came to Abraham with good tidings; they said, 'Peace.' He answered, 'Peace,' and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.
interpretation: This verse tells the story of how angels came to Prophet Abraham with good news, greeted him with peace, and Abraham responded in kind. He then hastened to present them with a roasted calf as a gesture of hospitality and kindness. The verse emphasizes the importance of showing kindness and generosity to guests and reinforces the value of peace in interactions between people.
orig: ولقد جاءت رسلنا إبراهيم بالبشرى قالوا سلاما قال سلام فما لبث أن جاء بعجل حنيذ

translation: So when he saw their hands not reaching towards the meal, he felt uneasy about them and feared them. The angels said, 'Do not fear, we have been sent to the people of Lot.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels sent to the people of Lot in the Qur'an, where Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) greeted them with a meal. The people did not reach for the food, which made Prophet Ibrahim uneasy as he sensed they were not ordinary visitors. The verse highlights the supernatural nature of the angels and the reassurance they gave to Prophet Ibrahim. It teaches us about the importance of recognizing signs from Allah and the need to have faith and trust in His messengers and guidance.
orig: فلما رأى أيديهم لا تصل إليه نكرهم وأوجس منهم خيفة قالوا لا تخف إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم لوط

translation: And his wife was standing, and she laughed. So We gave her good tidings of Isaac, and after Isaac, Jacob.
interpretation: This verse narrates the incident where Sarah, the wife of Prophet Ibrahim, laughed upon hearing the news of her bearing a child in her old age. The verse highlights the miraculous nature of the birth of Prophet Isaac (Ishaq) and Prophet Jacob (Ya'qub) through the divine intervention and grace of Allah, despite biological impossibilities. It illustrates how Allah's decree can overcome any limitations or norms that humans perceive in the natural order.
orig: وامرأته قائمة فضحكت فبشرناها بإسحاق ومن وراء إسحاق يعقوب

translation: She said, 'Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!'
interpretation: This verse reflects the astonishment and disbelief of Prophet Ibrahim's wife when she learned she was going to have a child despite her old age. It highlights the miraculous nature of Allah's ability to grant blessings and fulfill His promises, even in situations that seem impossible from a human perspective.
orig: قالت يا ويلتى أألد وأنا عجوز وهذا بعلي شيخا إن هذا لشيء عجيب

translation: They said, 'Are you amazed at the decree of Allah's mercy and His blessings upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine decree of Allah's mercy and blessings upon the household of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights the honor and praise that Allah bestows upon them, underscoring their elevated status and sanctity in Islam.
orig: قالوا أتعجبين من أمر الله رحمت الله وبركاته عليكم أهل البيت إنه حميد مجيد

translation: So when the fear went away from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.
interpretation: This verse describes a turning point for Prophet Abraham when he received the good news of a son (Ishmael) and the removal of fear from his heart. This allowed him to engage in a debate with Allah about the fate of the people of Lot, showing his concern for their well-being and compassion as a messenger of God.
orig: فلما ذهب عن إبراهيم الروع وجاءته البشرى يجادلنا في قوم لوط

translation: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and frequently returning [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse praises Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him) by highlighting his qualities of patience, devotion, and constant turning back to Allah. It serves as a reminder for believers to emulate these qualities in their own lives by being patient in facing hardships, seeking forgiveness from Allah, and continuously returning to Him for guidance and support.
orig: إن إبراهيم لحليم أواه منيب

translation: O Ibrahim, disregard this. The command of your Lord has come. Indeed, they are to receive a punishment that cannot be repelled.
interpretation: This verse is addressed to Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him), advising him to ignore the actions of disbelievers as the decree of Allah has been finalized. The disbelievers will face a punishment that is unavoidable and cannot be averted. This serves as a reminder of the certainty of the consequences of disbelief and the ultimate justice of Allah.
orig: يا إبراهيم أعرض عن هذا إنه قد جاء أمر ربك وإنهم آتيهم عذاب غير مردود

translation: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt powerless [to protect] them. And he said, 'This is a distressing day.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Prophet Lot (Lut) and the struggles he faced when he tried to convey the message of monotheism to his people who engaged in immoral behavior. Lot felt distressed and overwhelmed by the challenge of guiding his people towards righteousness, as they persisted in their sinful ways. The verse highlights the difficulty and emotional burden that prophets may face in fulfilling their mission of spreading the message of God's guidance.
orig: ولما جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقال هذا يوم عصيب

translation: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, 'O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?'
interpretation: This verse presents a scene where the prophet Lot's people had deviated from the right path and were engaged in sinful acts. Lot tried to guide them back to righteousness by offering his daughters as a permissible alternative to the evil deeds they were pursuing. This act was a demonstration of his concern for their well-being and his attempt to protect them from sin. Additionally, by highlighting the importance of hospitality and moral conduct towards guests, the verse emphasizes the need for righteousness and rational thinking among the people.
orig: وجاءه قومه يهرعون إليه ومن قبل كانوا يعملون السيئات قال يا قوم هؤلاء بناتي هن أطهر لكم فاتقوا الله ولا تخزون في ضيفي أليس منكم رجل رشيد

translation: They said, 'You know that we have no right to your daughters, and indeed, you know what we want.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a situation where a group of people approached a prophet with bad intentions, seeking to marry his daughters for the wrong reasons. The verse highlights the prophet's awareness of their true intentions. It serves as a reminder that God knows the secrets and intentions of all individuals and that one should be cautious of people who approach with deceptive motives.
orig: قالوا لقد علمت ما لنا في بناتك من حق وإنك لتعلم ما نريد
