translation: Praise be to Allah who has granted me, despite my old age, Isma'il and Ishaq. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an expresses gratitude to Allah for granting the prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) the sons Isma'il (Ishmael) and Ishaq (Isaac) even in his old age. It emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah in answering prayers and acknowledges that Allah is indeed the Hearer of all supplications. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of gratitude, trust in Allah's timing, and the certainty that Allah is attentive to all prayers.
orig: الحمد لله الذي وهب لي على الكبر إسماعيل وإسحاق إن ربي لسميع الدعاء

translation: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
interpretation: This verse reflects a beautiful supplication seeking Allah's guidance to be steadfast in prayer and asking for the continuity of righteous actions and supplication not just for oneself but also for future generations. It highlights the importance of prayer as a means of connection with Allah and the desire for one's offspring to also be guided on the right path and maintain the practice of prayer.
orig: رب اجعلني مقيم الصلاة ومن ذريتي ربنا وتقبل دعاء

translation: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day the account is established.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for forgiveness for oneself, one's parents, and all the believers on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the understanding that ultimate accountability will take place in the hereafter, encouraging believers to seek forgiveness and mercy from Allah, not only for themselves but for their loved ones and the community of believers as a whole.
orig: ربنا اغفر لي ولوالدي وللمؤمنين يوم يقوم الحساب

translation: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].
interpretation: This verse reassures that no act of injustice or wrongdoing goes unnoticed by Allah, even if the wrongdoers may feel they are escaping accountability. The delay in punishment is a test and a display of Allah's mercy, giving the wrongdoers time to repent and return to the right path. Ultimately, there will come a Day of Judgment where every action will be laid bare, and justice will be served, causing the wrongdoers to face the consequences of their deeds.
orig: ولا تحسبن الله غافلا عما يعمل الظالمون إنما يؤخرهم ليوم تشخص فيه الأبصار

translation: Rushing, with heads raised aloft, their gaze returning not towards them and their hearts void.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene of the disbelievers in the hereafter, overwhelmed and in a state of panic, their heads upright in despair and their hearts empty of faith and tranquility. They are filled with regret for turning away from the Truth, yet they are unable to change their fate as they ignored the signs and guidance given to them during their worldly life.
orig: مهطعين مقنعي رءوسهم لا يرتد إليهم طرفهم وأفئدتهم هواء

translation: And warn the people of the Day when the punishment comes to them and those who have wronged will say, 'Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers!' Did you not swear before that you would not have a reverse?
interpretation: This verse highlights how on the Day of Judgment, those who have been unjust to themselves will beg for more time to rectify their deeds, claiming they will then adhere to righteousness. The verse emphasizes the futility of such pleas after witnessing the reality of their false promises and oaths made in the world.
orig: وأنذر الناس يوم يأتيهم العذاب فيقول الذين ظلموا ربنا أخرنا إلى أجل قريب نجب دعوتك ونتبع الرسل أولم تكونوا أقسمتم من قبل ما لكم من زوال

translation: And you have taken up residence in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it has become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented examples for you.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences of the wrongdoing and sins committed by those before us. By observing history and reflecting on the fate of those who transgressed, we are meant to learn lessons and guidance from their stories. The verse suggests that understanding the past can serve as a reminder and guidance for the present and future, showcasing the importance of reflecting on historical events and learning from them.
orig: وسكنتم في مساكن الذين ظلموا أنفسهم وتبين لكم كيف فعلنا بهم وضربنا لكم الأمثال

translation: And they plotted their plot, and with Allah is their plot, though their plot was such that the mountains should pass away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of the plots and schemes of those who go against the will of Allah. No matter how intricate or strong their plans may be, they ultimately hold no power or permanence in comparison to the divine decree. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority and supremacy of Allah over all things.
orig: وقد مكروا مكرهم وعند الله مكرهم وإن كان مكرهم لتزول منه الجبال

translation: So do not think Allah to fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to doubt or lose faith in Allah's promise to His messengers. It emphasizes that Allah is powerful and just, and will ultimately hold all accountable for their actions, ensuring that justice is served.
orig: فلا تحسبن الله مخلف وعده رسله إن الله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: On the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come forth before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment, when the current world as we know it will be replaced by a new earth and heavens. All beings, including humans, will be resurrected and gathered before Allah on that day. This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah as the One who is supreme and dominant over all creation.
orig: يوم تبدل الأرض غير الأرض والسماوات وبرزوا لله الواحد القهار

translation: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in chains,
interpretation: On that Day, the wrongdoers will be bound and chained, symbolizing their captivity and confinement as a consequence of their unjust actions in the world.
orig: وترى المجرمين يومئذ مقرنين في الأصفاد

translation: Their garments of pitch and fire will cover their faces.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the disbelievers in the Hereafter, where they will be enveloped in garments made of pitch and fire, symbolizing the punishment and agony they will face as a consequence of their rejection of faith and disobedience to God. The intense imagery here underscores the severity of the consequences of disbelief and serves as a warning to those who fail to heed the guidance and mercy of God.
orig: سرابيلهم من قطران وتغشى وجوههم النار

translation: So that Allah may reward every soul for what it has earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of individual accountability in Islam. It conveys the idea that every soul will be recompensed based on its own deeds and actions. It serves as a reminder of the swift accountability by Allah, indicating that the judgment and reward for one's deeds will not be delayed. It also underscores the importance of being conscious of one's actions and intentions, as they will determine the consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: ليجزي الله كل نفس ما كسبت إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: This is a message for mankind, that they may be warned with it, and so that they may know that He is the One God, and so that people of understanding may remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing the oneness of God and spreading the message to warn and educate humanity. It calls on people of understanding to reflect and remember the truth about the one God.
orig: هذا بلاغ للناس ولينذروا به وليعلموا أنما هو إله واحد وليذكر أولو الألباب

translation: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting that the Qur'an contains clear signs and verses that guide and enlighten those who reflect upon them. The mention of 'Alif, Lam, Ra' at the beginning of the verse is a literary device known as 'al-huroof al-muqatta'at', and its exact meaning remains a mystery. However, it serves to draw attention to the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and its divine origin.
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب وقرآن مبين

translation: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that those who reject faith may one day regret their decision and wish they had embraced Islam. It serves as a reminder that choosing faith and submitting to God can lead to a fulfilling and purposeful life, and that rejecting belief may ultimately result in regret.
orig: ربما يود الذين كفروا لو كانوا مسلمين

translation: Leave them to eat and enjoy themselves and let false hope beguile them; they will soon come to know.
interpretation: This verse warns against being deceived by the temporary pleasures and distractions of this world. It advises to let those who ignore the truth and indulge in selfish desires continue on their path, as ultimately they will realize the consequences of their actions and understand the truth.
orig: ذرهم يأكلوا ويتمتعوا ويلههم الأمل فسوف يعلمون

translation: And We did not destroy any city except that it had a known decree.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every community that has been destroyed in the past was not done so arbitrarily, but rather it was based on a known and just decree from Allah. It highlights the divine justice in the destruction of cities in the past, linking their fate to their own actions and choices.
orig: وما أهلكنا من قرية إلا ولها كتاب معلوم

translation: No nation can advance its term nor can they delay it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of destiny and predestination in Islam. It reminds believers that no nation or group of people can alter the appointed time of their existence or any event in their timeline. It illustrates the absolute power and control of Allah over time and events, reinforcing the idea that everything is under His command and decree.
orig: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون

translation: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad."
interpretation: This verse reflects the reaction of the disbelievers towards the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) when he conveyed the message of Islam to them. They accused him of being insane due to their refusal to accept the truth, even though his message was a clear guidance from Allah. The verse highlights the challenges faced by prophets in conveying their messages and the intense opposition they encountered from those who chose to reject the truth.
orig: وقالوا يا أيها الذي نزل عليه الذكر إنك لمجنون

translation: If you do not bring us the angels, then, if you should be among the truthful.
interpretation: This verse highlights a demand for proof and evidence. It implies that if one claims something extraordinary, they should be able to provide convincing evidence to support their claim. It emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and integrity in making statements and the requirement for evidence to validate extraordinary claims.
orig: لو ما تأتينا بالملائكة إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: We do not send down the angels except with truth, and they would not be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the angels are only sent down with the truth from Allah and that there is no delay or procrastination in carrying out His commands. It highlights the precision and decisiveness of Allah's actions, ensuring that everything occurs according to His divine plan without any room for doubt or delay.
orig: ما ننزل الملائكة إلا بالحق وما كانوا إذا منظرين

translation: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that God is the ultimate protector of the Qur'an, ensuring its preservation from any distortions or corruptions. It conveys the divine assurance that the message of the Qur'an will remain intact and protected throughout time, serving as a guide for humanity.
orig: إنا نحن نزلنا الذكر وإنا له لحافظون

translation: And We have certainly sent messengers before you among the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the concept of Messengers being sent to different nations is not new, as messengers were sent to the people who came before, emphasizing the continuity of the message of guidance throughout time. It serves as a reminder of the universal nature of prophethood and the importance of following the guidance brought by these messengers for the betterment of humanity.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك في شيع الأولين

translation: And there does not come to them any messenger except that they ridicule him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the response of some disbelievers to the messengers of Allah. Despite the messengers bringing them guidance and warning them of the consequences of their actions, the disbelievers mock and ridicule them. It shows the painful reality of how some people choose to reject the truth and mock the messengers of God.
orig: وما يأتيهم من رسول إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Thus do We seal the hearts of the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse illustrates how the hearts of those who persist in sin and transgression are sealed, making them unable to see the truth or guidance. It emphasizes the consequences of one's actions and warns against the hardening of the heart due to continuous disobedience.
orig: كذلك نسلكه في قلوب المجرمين

translation: They do not believe in it, even though the ways of the ancients have passed away.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that there are people who do not believe in the message of the Qur'an, despite the fact that similar events and consequences have occurred in the past to those who rejected the truth. It serves as a reminder that disbelief and rejection of guidance has been a recurring theme throughout history.
orig: لا يؤمنون به وقد خلت سنة الأولين

translation: And if We opened upon them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,
interpretation: This verse reflects on the stubbornness and disbelief of those who reject the message of God. Even if clear signs were to appear to them from the heavens, they would still choose to turn away and not heed the guidance. It highlights the free will that humans possess and the consequences of their choices.
orig: ولو فتحنا عليهم بابا من السماء فظلوا فيه يعرجون

translation: They said, 'Indeed, we are but in a state of confusion, rather we are a bewitched people.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the disbelief of a group of people who were presented with the truth but chose to deny it by attributing their confusion to sorcery and magic. It serves as a reminder of how individuals may choose to remain blind to the clear signs and evidence of the truth due to their own arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: لقالوا إنما سكرت أبصارنا بل نحن قوم مسحورون

translation: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars for those who observe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the beauty and order in the heavens created by Allah. It emphasizes that the stars in the sky serve as signs for those who reflect and ponder upon the universe and its intricate design, leading them to acknowledge the existence and greatness of the Creator.
orig: ولقد جعلنا في السماء بروجا وزيناها للناظرين

translation: And We protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah],
interpretation: This verse speaks about Allah's protection over the Qur'an from the influence of the rejected devil, ensuring that it remains free from corruption and distortion. It highlights the purity and preservation of the Qur'an as a divine and unaltered guidance for humanity.
orig: وحفظناها من كل شيطان رجيم

translation: Except for one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, clear documentation.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an refers to those who try to eavesdrop on the secrets of the heavens but are met with a flaming comet that chases them away, serving as a clear warning and protection of divine knowledge from those who seek to undermine or exploit it.
orig: إلا من استرق السمع فأتبعه شهاب مبين

translation: And the earth We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the earth with a perfect balance and order. It emphasizes the harmony and balance in the universe, with mountains acting as firm anchors and a variety of well-proportioned vegetation growing in a precise manner. It serves as a reminder of the intricate design and careful planning of the Creator in shaping the world for the benefit of all living beings.
orig: والأرض مددناها وألقينا فيها رواسي وأنبتنا فيها من كل شيء موزون

translation: And We have made for you therein means of livelihood and for those for whom you are not providers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that Allah has provided means of sustenance for all creatures, even for those whom you are not responsible for providing. It emphasizes the concept of Allah's vast and inclusive provision, ensuring that everyone has a means of livelihood, regardless of their circumstances.
orig: وجعلنا لكم فيها معايش ومن لستم له برازقين

translation: And there is nothing but that We have its treasures with Us, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine knowledge and control over all things. It emphasizes that everything is within Allah's knowledge and under His control. Nothing happens except by His will and in a predetermined measure. It reminds believers of the power and wisdom of Allah in managing the universe according to His divine plan.
orig: وإن من شيء إلا عندنا خزائنه وما ننزله إلا بقدر معلوم

translation: And We have sent the winds to fertilize, and We sent down water from the sky, and We gave you to drink from it. And you are not the ones to retain its stores.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah in providing sustenance to His creations. It emphasizes that it is Allah who sends down winds, rain, and water to nourish the land and provide for all living beings. It serves as a reminder of the dependence of humanity on Allah's provisions and that ultimately, it is He who controls the resources and sustains life on earth.
orig: وأرسلنا الرياح لواقح فأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأسقيناكموه وما أنتم له بخازنين

translation: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritors.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah, who is the ultimate giver and taker of life. It reminds us that everything in the universe belongs to Allah, and He is the ultimate Inheritor of all things. It also serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of this worldly life, and the certainty of death as a part of the divine plan.
orig: وإنا لنحن نحيي ونميت ونحن الوارثون

translation: And We certainly know those of you who have gone before and We certainly know those who will come later.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omniscience of Allah, stating that He is fully aware of all individuals who have existed before and those who will come in the future. It emphasizes that Allah's knowledge encompasses all of time and space, underscoring His ability to perfectly recognize and understand all aspects of creation.
orig: ولقد علمنا المستقدمين منكم ولقد علمنا المستأخرين

translation: And indeed, your Lord will gather them. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the ultimate gathering by God on the Day of Judgment. It highlights God's wisdom and knowledge in orchestrating such a gathering, where all will be brought before Him for accountability and judgment. It serves as a reminder of the power and sovereignty of God and the certainty of the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإن ربك هو يحشرهم إنه حكيم عليم

translation: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
interpretation: This verse highlights the origin of mankind from clay, emphasizing the humble beginnings of human beings. It serves as a reminder of the miraculous creation of humans and the importance of humility and gratitude towards the Creator.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: And We have certainly created the jinn before from scorching fire.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the jinn were created by Allah from a smokeless flame, differentiating them from humans who were created from clay. It emphasizes the power and creativity of Allah in creating different forms of beings from various elements, showcasing His infinite capabilities.
orig: والجان خلقناه من قبل من نار السموم

translation: And [mention] when your Lord said to the angels, 'Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay. So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the creation of human beings and the special status given to them by Allah. It signifies the honor and dignity bestowed upon humans by Allah through the act of creating them from clay and breathing His own spirit into them. Human beings are thus considered a unique creation with a special connection to Allah, deserving respect and submission.
orig: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the process of the creation of human beings by Allah. It emphasizes the unique status and honor bestowed upon humans through the breathing of Allah's spirit into them. The act of prostration symbolizes reverence, submission, and worship to the Creator for this special gift of life and soul.
orig: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين

translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,
interpretation: This verse describes the scene where all the angels humble themselves and prostrate before Allah in complete submission and obedience. It emphasizes the unity and devotion of the angels in carrying out the commands of Allah, highlighting their unwavering loyalty and reverence towards their Creator.
orig: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون

translation: Except for Iblis, he refused to be among the prostrators.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the defiance and arrogance of Iblis (Satan) when he refused to prostrate to Adam as commanded by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and disobedience, as well as the importance of humility and submission to the will of Allah.
orig: إلا إبليس أبى أن يكون مع الساجدين

translation: He said, 'O Iblis, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?'
interpretation: This verse refers to a dialogue between Allah and Iblis (Satan) when Iblis refused to prostrate to Adam as commanded by Allah. The verse highlights Iblis' arrogance and disobedience towards Allah's command, leading to his expulsion from Paradise. It serves as a warning against pride and disobedience, emphasizing the importance of humbling oneself before Allah.
orig: قال يا إبليس ما لك ألا تكون مع الساجدين

translation: He said, 'I was not meant to prostrate to a human, whom You created from clay, from an altered black mud.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the refusal of Satan to prostrate to Adam out of arrogance and pride, considering himself superior due to his creation from fire. It highlights that arrogance blinds one to the truth and leads to disobedience to Allah's commands.
orig: قال لم أكن لأسجد لبشر خلقته من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: He said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when God commanded Satan to be expelled from Paradise. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and arrogance. It teaches us that pride and defiance towards God lead to expulsion from grace and mercy, hence emphasizing the importance of humility and obedience in Islam.
orig: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم

translation: And upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: This verse highlights the seriousness of one's actions and the consequences of wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder that those who engage in evil or unjust behavior will face the consequences of their actions, continuing to bear the curse until the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the accountability that every individual holds for their deeds and the justice that will prevail on the Day of Recompense.
orig: وإن عليك اللعنة إلى يوم الدين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.'
interpretation: In this verse, a person is seeking a delay until the Day of Resurrection. It shows a moment of realization and concern about the consequences of their actions, and a desire for more time to make amends before facing the ultimate accountability before God.
orig: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, you are among the ones who have been awaited.'
interpretation: This verse speaks about a moment of realization and acknowledgment, where someone acknowledges that the person they are speaking to is among those long-awaited or anticipated. It conveys a sense of recognition and importance, indicating the significance of the person being addressed.
orig: قال فإنك من المنظرين

translation: Until the time of the known Day.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of a fixed appointed time for the Day of Judgment, highlighting the belief in the resurrection and accountability before Allah. It serves as a reminder for believers to always be conscious of their actions, as they will be answerable on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم

translation: Said, 'My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all.'
interpretation: This verse describes Shaytan (Satan) admitting his intentions to misguide and lead astray the people on earth. It emphasizes the cunning nature of Shaytan and his determination to sow corruption by making sin seem appealing to humanity. The verse serves as a reminder of the constant battle between good and evil, encouraging believers to be cautious of Shaytan's temptations and to seek refuge in Allah's protection.
orig: قال رب بما أغويتني لأزينن لهم في الأرض ولأغوينهم أجمعين

translation: Except Your chosen servants among them.
interpretation: This verse implies that there are individuals among the people who are sincere and devoted to Allah. These are the chosen servants of Allah, who are loyal and faithful in their worship and obedience. It serves as a reminder that while many may stray or deviate from the righteous path, there are always those who remain steadfast and sincere in their faith.
orig: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين

translation: He said: 'This is a straight path for me.'
interpretation: This verse signifies the importance of adhering to a path of righteousness and guidance, emphasizing the need for clarity and steadfastness in one's faith and actions. It serves as a reminder to stay on the right path, following the straight path towards God's pleasure and salvation.
orig: قال هذا صراط علي مستقيم

translation: Indeed, My servants - there is for you over them no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no human being has authority or power over others except with the guidance and permission from God. It reminds us that ultimately, God is the only true authority and He is in control of all affairs. Therefore, we should seek guidance and follow the way of God to stay on the right path.
orig: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان إلا من اتبعك من الغاوين

translation: And Hell will surely be their appointed place, all gathered together.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers and wrongdoers who will be gathered in Hell, as it is the predetermined destination for those who reject faith and commit sins. It emphasizes the certainty and inevitability of accountability and punishment for their deeds in the Hereafter.
orig: وإن جهنم لموعدهم أجمعين

translation: It has seven gates; for each gate is of them a portion designated.
interpretation: This verse is describing the seven gates of Hell, each gate designated for a specific group of sinners. The verse emphasizes the structured and organized nature of Hell, where each individual will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: لها سبعة أبواب لكل باب منهم جزء مقسوم

translation: Verily, the righteous will be in gardens and rivers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward of the righteous believers in the afterlife, where they will reside in paradisiacal gardens with flowing rivers. It serves as an encouragement for believers to strive for righteousness and piety in their actions and intentions, promising them a beautiful and tranquil abode in the Hereafter.
orig: إن المتقين في جنات وعيون

translation: Enter it in security, [entering] in peace.
interpretation: This verse is describing the believers' entry into Jannah (Paradise) where they will be welcomed with peace and security. It conveys the assurance and tranquility that believers will experience upon entering Paradise after a life of faith and good deeds.
orig: ادخلوها بسلام آمنين

translation: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers on thrones facing each other.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea of forgiveness and reconciliation. It signifies that through the mercy and guidance of Allah, animosities in people's hearts will be replaced with love and brotherhood. It highlights the transformative power of forgiveness in bringing people together in unity and harmony.
orig: ونزعنا ما في صدورهم من غل إخوانا على سرر متقابلين

translation: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they be removed.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of believers in paradise, where they will be free from any hardships or troubles and will remain there forever without being expelled or removed from it.
orig: لا يمسهم فيها نصب وما هم منها بمخرجين

translation: Inform My servants that I am the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to all believers that Allah is the Most Forgiving and the Most Merciful. It reassures us that no matter how many times we may have erred or sinned, Allah's forgiveness and mercy are always available to those who repent sincerely. It emphasizes the compassionate and forgiving nature of Allah, inviting us to seek His forgiveness and mercy with hope and humility.
orig: نبئ عبادي أني أنا الغفور الرحيم

translation: And that My punishment is the painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity and intensity of the punishment that comes from turning away from Allah and disobeying His commandments. It serves as a warning to those who choose to follow a path of disobedience, reminding them of the grave consequences of their actions.
orig: وأن عذابي هو العذاب الأليم

translation: and inform them about the guests of Abraham.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event when Abraham received guests, who were actually angels in disguise, and how he welcomed them with generosity and kindness. The verse highlights the importance of showing hospitality towards others and the rewards of being hospitable as demonstrated by Prophet Abraham.
orig: ونبئهم عن ضيف إبراهيم

translation: When they entered upon him and said, 'Peace.' [Joseph] said, 'Indeed, we are fearful.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when Joseph's brothers came to see him. In response to their greetings of peace, Joseph expressed his fear of their intentions due to their past betrayal and mistreatment towards him.
orig: إذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلاما قال إنا منكم وجلون

translation: They said, 'Do not be afraid; we bring you good news of a knowledgeable boy.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels reassuring Mary, the mother of Jesus, about the birth of her son, Jesus. The angels are comforting her and informing her of the miraculous birth of a great prophet who will be knowledgeable and wise.
orig: قالوا لا توجل إنا نبشرك بغلام عليم

translation: He said, 'Did you give me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?'
interpretation: This verse is questioning the nature of the good news that was given to the elderly man, implying a sense of disbelief or wonder at the unexpected nature of the news. It serves as a reminder that Allah's blessings and messages can come at any time and in any circumstances, even when one might least expect it.
orig: قال أبشرتموني على أن مسني الكبر فبم تبشرون

translation: They said, 'We bring you good tidings in all truth, so do not be among the despairing.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to be hopeful and to trust in the mercy and promises of Allah. It warns against falling into despair or losing faith, emphasizing the importance of maintaining positivity and optimism even in difficult circumstances.
orig: قالوا بشرناك بالحق فلا تكن من القانطين

translation: He said: And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those who are astray?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that despairing of the mercy of Allah is a characteristic of those who are misguided or astray. It serves as a reminder that believers should always have hope in the infinite mercy of Allah, regardless of their circumstances.
orig: قال ومن يقنط من رحمة ربه إلا الضالون

translation: He said, 'What then is your business, O messengers?'
interpretation: In this verse, the question posed by the person addressed to the messengers indicates curiosity and a desire to know the purpose behind their visit. It reflects a sense of readiness to listen and engage with the message that the messengers have to deliver, suggesting a willingness to understand and potentially accept the truth.
orig: قال فما خطبكم أيها المرسلون

translation: They said, 'Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates how prophets and messengers were often sent to people who were engaged in wrongdoing and sin. It highlights the important role of the prophets in guiding and advising people, even those who may be considered sinful or unjust. It serves as a reminder that it is necessary to share the message of truth and righteousness with all people, regardless of their actions.
orig: قالوا إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم مجرمين

translation: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all
interpretation: This verse refers to the family of the Prophet Lot (PBUH) and how they were saved from the destruction that befell their people due to their sins. It shows that God's mercy extends even to the families of the Prophets, indicating His compassion and forgiveness towards those who follow His guidance.
orig: إلا آل لوط إنا لمنجوهم أجمعين

translation: Except for his wife; We have decreed that she is of those who remain behind.
interpretation: This verse refers to the wife of the Prophet Noah (peace be upon him), and how she was not among the believers who accepted his message and boarded the Ark. The verse reminds us that even close family members may choose not to follow the truth, and that ultimately, faith is a personal choice and responsibility.
orig: إلا امرأته قدرنا إنها لمن الغابرين

translation: So when Our messengers came to Lot's family,
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrival of the angels sent by Allah to the family of Prophet Lot. It signifies an event in which divine messengers were sent to warn and guide the people, emphasizing the importance of listening to and following the guidance of Allah's chosen messengers.
orig: فلما جاء آل لوط المرسلون

translation: He said, 'You are indeed a people unknown.'
interpretation: In this verse, the response acknowledges the messengers as a people unrecognized or unknown. This can signify the disbelief, rejection, or lack of acknowledgment of the message brought by the messengers. It highlights the challenge faced by the messengers in their mission to convey the truth to their people who refuse to recognize their status or their message.
orig: قال إنكم قوم منكرون

translation: They will say, "Indeed, we have come to you with that about which they were disputing."
interpretation: In this verse, the disbelievers are portrayed as being confident that they have brought a resolution to the arguments and disagreements they had with the believers. However, their claims are ultimately false and futile in the face of the truth.
orig: قالوا بل جئناك بما كانوا فيه يمترون

translation: And We have brought you the truth, and indeed, We are truthful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine nature of the truth revealed by God and reassures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that the message he conveys is indeed the truth. It demonstrates God's unwavering support for His messengers and serves as a reminder of the importance of conveying the message with honesty and sincerity.
orig: وأتيناك بالحق وإنا لصادقون

translation: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow in their rear, and let not anyone among you look back, but go on to where you are commanded.
interpretation: This verse instructs Prophet Noah to embark on the Ark with his family at night, ensuring no one looks back as they proceed forward as commanded by Allah. The verse symbolizes the importance of steadfastness, patience, and obedience in fulfilling the divine command, even if it involves leaving behind what is familiar or entering into the unknown.
orig: فأسر بأهلك بقطع من الليل واتبع أدبارهم ولا يلتفت منكم أحد وامضوا حيث تؤمرون

translation: And We decreed for him this matter: that the last remnants of those [sinners] would be cut off by early morning.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has decreed the ultimate end for the disbelievers and wrongdoers, meaning that eventually they will face a complete and final defeat or punishment. It highlights the certainty and inevitability of God's decree and the ultimate justice that will prevail.
orig: وقضينا إليه ذلك الأمر أن دابر هؤلاء مقطوع مصبحين

translation: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where the people of the city are filled with joy and happiness. It signifies a moment of celebration or good news that leads to a sense of delight and contentment among the inhabitants of the city.
orig: وجاء أهل المدينة يستبشرون

translation: He said, "Indeed, they are my guests, so do not embarrass me."
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of hospitality in Islam. It emphasizes the concept of treating guests with kindness and respect, and not causing them embarrassment or harm. It serves as a reminder to uphold the values of generosity and good manners when hosting guests, reflecting the teachings of compassion and consideration found in the Qur'an.
orig: قال إن هؤلاء ضيفي فلا تفضحون

translation: And fear Allah and do not be humiliated.
interpretation: This verse is advising believers to maintain God-consciousness and righteousness in their actions, and to not succumb to actions or behaviors that would bring shame or humiliation upon themselves. By being mindful of Allah and following His guidance, believers can uphold their dignity and protect themselves from humiliation in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: واتقوا الله ولا تخزون

translation: They said, 'Did we not forbid you from [protecting] the worlds?'
interpretation: This verse depicts a conversation where the disbelievers express their astonishment at the believers for attempting to guide and protect not just themselves but all of humanity. The disbelievers are questioning why the believers are concerned with the well-being and guidance of all beings, implying that they should only worry about themselves. The verse serves to highlight the noble and inclusive mission of the believers beyond their own interests and the narrow-mindedness of those who fail to see the broader responsibility towards all of creation.
orig: قالوا أولم ننهك عن العالمين

translation: He said, 'These are my daughters, if you would be doers (of lawful marriage).'
interpretation: In this verse, the story of Prophet Lut when he offered his daughters for marriage to the people of Sodom is highlighted. The interpretation of this verse emphasizes the importance of upholding lawful relationships and the rejection of immoral and sinful behavior.
orig: قال هؤلاء بناتي إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: By your life, indeed, they were in their intoxication, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse refers to a state of heedlessness and blindness that people fall into when they are consumed by their desires and ignore the truth. It serves as a reminder to avoid being deluded by temporary pleasures and distractions, as they can lead one astray from the right path.
orig: لعمرك إنهم لفي سكرتهم يعمهون

translation: So the blast seized them at sunrise,
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment brought upon the people of the Pharaoh as a sudden and unexpected blast that overtook them at sunrise. It serves as a reminder of the power and justice of God, who can bring about swift consequences for those who transgress His limits.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة مشرقين

translation: So We made the highest part (the top) of it the lowest, and We rained upon them stones of hard clay.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment inflicted upon the people of a town mentioned in the context of the Qur'an. The town's location, which was once elevated and exalted, was overturned and brought low by God as a consequence of their disobedience and sins. Additionally, they were struck with a rain of hard clay stones as a divine punishment. The verse underscores the power of God's retribution upon those who defy His commands and deviate from the right path.
orig: فجعلنا عاليها سافلها وأمطرنا عليهم حجارة من سجيل

translation: Indeed, in that are signs for those who reflect.
interpretation: This verse highlights that within the signs and revelations of the Qur'an, there are profound lessons and insights for those who ponder and reflect upon them. It emphasizes the importance of contemplating the verses of the Qur'an to derive deeper meanings and guidance from them.
orig: إن في ذلك لآيات للمتوسمين

translation: And indeed, it is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the straightness and clarity of the path of righteousness and truth that Allah has set for humanity. It serves as a reminder for believers to stay on this path and not be led astray by temptations or distractions.
orig: وإنها لبسبيل مقيم

translation: Verily, in that there is a sign for the believers.
interpretation: This verse is indicating that for those who believe, there are signs and proofs in the world around them that point towards the existence and the greatness of Allah. The believers are encouraged to reflect on these signs as a means of strengthening their faith and understanding of their Creator.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين

translation: And indeed, the companions of the thicket were also wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of the thicket who rejected the message of their prophet and persisted in their wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder that even those who witness signs of God's existence and power can choose to disobey and commit wrong deeds.
orig: وإن كان أصحاب الأيكة لظالمين

translation: So We punished them. Indeed, both [cities] are on a clear road.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that was inflicted upon the people of a particular city for their disobedience and transgressions. It emphasizes that the punishment was deserved and serves as a clear lesson for others to reflect upon.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم وإنهما لبإمام مبين

translation: And indeed, the companions of the thicket denied the messengers
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of the people of the thicket who rejected and denied the messengers sent to guide them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the messages of truth and the importance of accepting and following the guidance sent by Allah.
orig: ولقد كذب أصحاب الحجر المرسلين

translation: And We gave them Our signs, but they turned away from them.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people, despite being presented with the signs and proofs of Allah's existence and power, choose to ignore or reject them. It serves as a reminder that guidance is ultimately in the hands of individuals, and those who turn away from the signs of Allah do so out of their own free will.
orig: وآتيناهم آياتنا فكانوا عنها معرضين

translation: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.
interpretation: This verse highlights the skill and power that some people had in shaping the mountains to build secure and stable homes. It serves as a lesson on human ingenuity and capability to create safe living spaces even in challenging terrains.
orig: وكانوا ينحتون من الجبال بيوتا آمنين

translation: So the Blast seized them at sunrise,
interpretation: This verse describes how the people of Pharaoh were overtaken by a catastrophic event, interpreted here as a blast or a scream, which struck them in the early hours of the day. It signifies the sudden and unexpected nature of divine punishment, highlighting the power and swiftness of God's decree against those who transgress and disobey.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة مصبحين

translation: So their earnings did not avail them at all.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the wealth and material gains that people accumulate in the world will not be of any benefit to them in the hereafter, if they have been engaged in wrongdoing or have strayed away from the righteous path. It serves as a reminder that true success and worth are not measured by worldly possessions, but by one's actions and faith.
orig: فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything between them in play. We created them for a true purpose, but most of them do not know. Indeed, the Hour is coming - so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the creation of the heavens and the earth was not a frivolous act, but done with a profound purpose. Despite this, many people remain unaware of this truth. It also serves as a reminder that the Day of Judgment is inevitable, and encourages believers to forgive others generously in anticipation of that Day.
orig: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وإن الساعة لآتية فاصفح الصفح الجميل

translation: Indeed, your Lord is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the attributes of Allah as the Creator and the All-Knowing. It reminds believers of the power and knowledge of Allah, highlighting His authority over all creation and His awareness of everything, which instills a sense of awe and respect towards Him.
orig: إن ربك هو الخلاق العليم

translation: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance and significance of the Qur'an as a divine revelation that was granted to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It mentions the seven often repeated verses (Al-Fatiha) and the entire Qur'an as being great and highly revered. It emphasizes the uniqueness of the Qur'an as a guidance and source of knowledge for the believers.
orig: ولقد آتيناك سبعا من المثاني والقرآن العظيم

translation: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers.
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to envy or become sorrowful over the blessings and enjoyments granted to others. Instead, believers are urged to show humility and kindness towards fellow believers, demonstrating the importance of mutual respect and compassion within the community.
orig: لا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم ولا تحزن عليهم واخفض جناحك للمؤمنين

translation: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner."
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) declaring himself as the clear and evident warner to the people. It emphasizes his role in delivering the message of Islam and warning the people about the consequences of their actions. Through this declaration, the Prophet asserts his responsibility in guiding the people towards the right path and calling them to righteousness.
orig: وقل إني أنا النذير المبين

translation: We have sent it down upon the disputers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an being revealed by Allah to address and guide those who engage in disputes and disagreements, emphasizing the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance from the Qur'an to resolve conflicts and differences among people.
orig: كما أنزلنا على المقتسمين

translation: Those who made the Qur'an into fragments.
interpretation: This verse refers to people who distort the message of the Qur'an by taking select parts of it out of context or by separating it from its holistic teachings. It warns against cherry-picking verses to suit one's desires or agenda, rather than understanding its guidance as a complete and interconnected whole.
orig: الذين جعلوا القرآن عضين

translation: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability in front of God. It serves as a reminder that all individuals will be questioned and held accountable for their actions and deeds in front of God on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فوربك لنسألنهم أجمعين

translation: concerning what they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the accountability of individuals for their actions on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that every individual will be judged based on their deeds and actions in this world. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being mindful and responsible for one's actions, as they will eventually determine one's fate in the afterlife.
orig: عما كانوا يعملون

translation: So proclaim openly that which you have been commanded, and turn away from the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to openly proclaim and convey the message they have been commanded to deliver, which is the message of monotheism and faith in Allah. At the same time, believers are advised to distance themselves from those who associate partners with Allah or engage in polytheistic practices, as such beliefs are contrary to the teachings of Islam.
orig: فاصدع بما تؤمر وأعرض عن المشركين

translation: Verily, We are sufficient for you against the mockers.
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah assures His support to the Prophet Muhammad against those who mock or ridicule him. It conveys the message that Allah will protect His messengers and believers from the harm and mockery of others, providing them with strength and solace in the face of adversity.
orig: إنا كفيناك المستهزئين

translation: Those who make another deity with Allah will soon come to know.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah and emphasizes that those who do so will eventually realize the error of their ways and understand the true oneness and uniqueness of Allah as the only deity worthy of worship.
orig: الذين يجعلون مع الله إلها آخر فسوف يعلمون

translation: And We certainly know that your chest tightens at what they say,
interpretation: Allah acknowledges the distress you feel from the hurtful words and accusations of the disbelievers. It is a reminder that even the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) faced difficulties and criticism, and this verse offers comfort by emphasizing that Allah is aware and understanding of the challenges faced by His chosen messengers.
orig: ولقد نعلم أنك يضيق صدرك بما يقولون

translation: So exalt [ Allah ] with praise of your Lord and be among the prostrators.
interpretation: This verse is encouraging believers to glorify and praise Allah and to engage in prostrations as an act of worship. Prostrating before Allah is a physical manifestation of humility, submission, and devotion, and it serves as a reminder of the believers' dependence on and obedience to their Creator.
orig: فسبح بحمد ربك وكن من الساجدين

translation: And worship your Lord until certainty comes to you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of continuously worshipping and obeying Allah until one's last breath, never losing faith or devotion. It teaches believers to persevere in their worship, seeking certainty in their faith and ultimately aiming for the reward and closeness to Allah that comes with unwavering devotion.
orig: واعبد ربك حتى يأتيك اليقين

translation: The command of Allah has come, so do not hasten it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse reminds us not to rush the decree of Allah, as His timing is perfect and His wisdom is beyond our comprehension. It also emphasizes the importance of believing in the oneness of Allah and avoiding associating partners with Him. We should trust in Allah's plan and have faith in His ultimate wisdom and justice.
orig: أتى أمر الله فلا تستعجلوه سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.
interpretation: This verse refers to the descent of the angels and the Spirit by the permission of Allah, who decrees and ordains all matters. The angels descend to carry out various tasks as commanded by Allah, and the Spirit - believed to be Gabriel - also comes down in accordance with Allah's will. This highlights the divine control over every aspect of creation and serves as a reminder for the believers to worship Allah alone and to be conscious of Him.
orig: ينزل الملائكة بالروح من أمره على من يشاء من عباده أن أنذروا أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاتقون

translation: He has created the heavens and the earth in truth. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the true and absolute creation of the heavens and the earth by Allah. It highlights His uniqueness and superiority over any partners or associates that people may attribute to Him. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power and sovereignty as the ultimate Creator.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق تعالى عما يشركون

translation: Man was created from a drop of fluid, yet he becomes an open contender.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble origin of human beings, emphasizing that they were created from a small and insignificant drop of fluid. However, despite this humble beginning, humans often boast and argue, becoming openly confrontational and competitive. It serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and gratitude in the face of human tendencies towards arrogance and conflict.
orig: خلق الإنسان من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين

translation: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the various benefits and provisions that Allah has provided through the creation of livestock for humankind. It highlights how these animals serve as a source of warmth, multiple advantages, and sustenance for humans through their consumption. It reminds believers of the blessings and provisions of Allah and encourages gratitude for His mercy and care.
orig: والأنعام خلقها لكم فيها دفء ومنافع ومنها تأكلون

translation: And in them (i.e., the ships) you have beauty when you bring them in, and when you send them forth.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the beauty and grace of ships as they arrive at the shore and as they set sail. It conveys the idea that ships bring a sense of elegance and majesty both when they are docked in the harbor and when they are out at sea, symbolizing the power and allure of the sea and the maritime activities of the people.
orig: ولكم فيها جمال حين تريحون وحين تسرحون

translation: And bear with patience what they say, and depart from them in a good manner.
interpretation: This verse advises believers to remain patient and composed in the face of adversity and ignorant remarks from others. It encourages responding to negativity or harm with kindness and grace, showcasing good manners even in challenging situations. The verse underscores the importance of showing patience and restraint in dealing with difficult people, highlighting the virtues of forgiveness and understanding in the face of hostility or ignorance.
orig: وتحمل أثقالكم إلى بلد لم تكونوا بالغيه إلا بشق الأنفس إن ربكم لرءوف رحيم

translation: And [He created] the horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah as He has created animals like horses, mules, and donkeys for mankind to use for transportation and other needs. It also emphasizes that Allah's creations are vast and beyond human knowledge, reminding believers of the power and wisdom of Allah in His creations.
orig: والخيل والبغال والحمير لتركبوها وزينة ويخلق ما لا تعلمون

translation: And Allah's is the direction of the way, and among them are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.
interpretation: This verse highlights that it is Allah who ultimately guides people on the right path. While some may deviate from the straight path, it is within Allah's power to guide all of humanity if He so wills. It emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and being steadfast in following the right path.
orig: وعلى الله قصد السبيل ومنها جائر ولو شاء لهداكم أجمعين

translation: He is the one who sent down rain from the sky; from it you drink and from it plants on which you graze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the provision of water by Allah through rain, which is not only essential for human consumption but also sustains vegetation for animals to graze on. It emphasizes the concept of sustenance provided by Allah for all living beings on earth.
orig: هو الذي أنزل من السماء ماء لكم منه شراب ومنه شجر فيه تسيمون

translation: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and all kinds of fruits. Surely, there is a sign in this for people who reflect.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the bounties and blessings of Allah by mentioning the various types of fruits that He causes to grow for humans. It emphasizes that these fruits are signs for us to reflect on Allah's power and generosity, prompting us to ponder over His creation and be grateful for the sustenance He provides.
orig: ينبت لكم به الزرع والزيتون والنخيل والأعناب ومن كل الثمرات إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يتفكرون

translation: He has subjected to you the night and day, the sun and the moon, and the stars are in subjection by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and control of Allah over the universe, as He has subjected the night, day, sun, moon, and stars to serve humanity and obey His command. The verse emphasizes that these natural phenomena are signs for those who reflect and contemplate on the signs of Allah's existence and power.
orig: وسخر لكم الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر والنجوم مسخرات بأمره إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And He has created for you from the earth different colors. Indeed, in that is a sign for a people who remember.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity and beauty in the creation of different colors on earth as a sign for people to reflect upon the greatness and creativity of Allah. It encourages believers to contemplate the beauty around them and be reminded of the power and wisdom of Allah in creating such diversity.
orig: وما ذرأ لكم في الأرض مختلفا ألوانه إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يذكرون

translation: And He it is who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to take out from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the variety of blessings bestowed upon humans by God, including the ability to benefit from the sea by consuming its nutritious food and extracting ornaments from its depths. It emphasizes the signs of God's power and generosity, such as ships sailing on the sea. The verse encourages gratitude towards God for His countless blessings.
orig: وهو الذي سخر البحر لتأكلوا منه لحما طريا وتستخرجوا منه حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك مواخر فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the intricate design and purposeful creation of mountains, rivers, and roads on Earth by Allah. Mountains are described as anchors that prevent the earth from shaking and shifting. Rivers and roads are provided as means of guidance for humanity. The verse emphasizes the signs of Allah's wisdom and mercy in nature, urging people to reflect on them and be guided towards righteousness.
orig: وألقى في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بكم وأنهارا وسبلا لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And by the stars they are [also] guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the guidance and signs that are present in the stars, indicating their importance as a means of navigation and orientation for people. The stars serve as a celestial guide that aids in guiding individuals in the darkness, representing the intricate and precise system of creation by Allah.
orig: وعلامات وبالنجم هم يهتدون

translation: Is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the disbelief of those who deny the power of Allah to create. It emphasizes the difference between the Creator, who has the power to bring everything into existence, and the creation itself. The verse challenges people to reflect on the signs of creation and consider the greatness of the Creator.
orig: أفمن يخلق كمن لا يخلق أفلا تذكرون

translation: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of gratitude and appreciation towards the endless bounties and blessings bestowed upon individuals by Allah. It emphasizes that no matter how much we try, we cannot fully count or comprehend the numerous blessings and favors that Allah has granted us. It is a reminder to be grateful and to recognize the generosity and forgiveness of Allah, as He bestows His mercy upon His creation despite their shortcomings and sins.
orig: وإن تعدوا نعمة الله لا تحصوها إن الله لغفور رحيم

translation: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah is All-Knowing of everything, whether it is hidden or made public. It serves as a reminder that we can never hide anything from Allah, and that sincerity and honesty are important values in the sight of Allah.
orig: والله يعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون

translation: And those they invoke besides Allah create nothing, while they [themselves] are created.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the powerlessness and futility of those who worship deities other than Allah. It highlights the fact that these false gods have no ability to create anything, as they themselves are created beings. It serves as a reminder that true power and creation belong only to Allah, the Supreme Creator.
orig: والذين يدعون من دون الله لا يخلقون شيئا وهم يخلقون

translation: Dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.
interpretation: This verse is pointing out that those who reject faith and remain spiritually dead will not be aware of when they will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the transience of life and the importance of understanding the consequences of one's actions in the Hereafter.
orig: أموات غير أحياء وما يشعرون أيان يبعثون

translation: Your deity is one deity. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are in denial, and they are arrogant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism by stating that there is only one true deity. It also highlights the attitude of those who do not believe in the Hereafter, describing them as having hearts filled with denial and arrogance. The verse underscores the importance of faith in the afterlife and warns against the negative qualities associated with disbelief in it.
orig: إلهكم إله واحد فالذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة قلوبهم منكرة وهم مستكبرون

translation: Indeed, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah has complete knowledge of everything, whether it be hidden or made public by individuals. It emphasizes that arrogance is detested by Allah, and thus encourages humility and modesty in the believers.
orig: لا جرم أن الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون إنه لا يحب المستكبرين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'What has your Lord sent down?' They say, 'Legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the message of Allah. They dismiss the Quran as mere myths and stories, showing their refusal to accept the truth and guidance that has been revealed to them. It serves as a reminder that some people will choose to remain ignorant and reject the teachings of Allah, despite the clear signs and proofs provided to them.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم ماذا أنزل ربكم قالوا أساطير الأولين

translation: They will bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and also some of the burdens of those whom they mislead without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of personal responsibility and accountability on the Day of Judgment. It highlights that individuals will carry the weight of their own sins, as well as the burden of influencing others to go astray without knowledge or guidance. It serves as a warning against leading others astray and highlights the severity of such actions.
orig: ليحملوا أوزارهم كاملة يوم القيامة ومن أوزار الذين يضلونهم بغير علم ألا ساء ما يزرون

translation: Indeed, those before them had plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning from Allah about the consequences of deceit and evil plotting. It illustrates that those who plan harm or mischief will ultimately face the consequences of their actions, even if they think they are safe and secure. The verse emphasizes the notion that Allah's justice is all-encompassing and that one cannot escape the consequences of their deeds, no matter how well they think they have schemed their plans.
orig: قد مكر الذين من قبلهم فأتى الله بنيانهم من القواعد فخر عليهم السقف من فوقهم وأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' concerning whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace this Day and evil are upon the disbelievers."
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Resurrection when disbelievers will be humiliated by Allah as they will be asked about the partners they associated with Him. Those who were given knowledge will acknowledge the disgrace and evil that falls upon the disbelievers on that day.
orig: ثم يوم القيامة يخزيهم ويقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تشاقون فيهم قال الذين أوتوا العلم إن الخزي اليوم والسوء على الكافرين

translation: Those whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [the angels] will say, 'In what [condition] were you?' They will say, 'We were oppressed in the land.' The angels will say, 'Was not the earth of Allah spacious [enough] for you to emigrate therein?' For those, their refuge is Hell - and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who wrong themselves and fail to adhere to the guidance and commands of Allah. The angels will question them about their actions, and those who have oppressed themselves by straying from the right path will face the punishment of Hell. It serves as a reminder of the importance of living in accordance with the teachings of Islam and the need to avoid wrongdoing and oppression.
orig: الذين تتوفاهم الملائكة ظالمي أنفسهم فألقوا السلم ما كنا نعمل من سوء بلى إن الله عليم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: So enter the gates of Hell, to abide eternally therein. Indeed, how evil is the abode of the proud.
interpretation: This verse warns those who are arrogant and proud of their actions and status, that they will face the consequences of their pride in the afterlife by entering Hell and dwelling there forever. It emphasizes the severity and unpleasantness of the destination for those who are arrogant and refuse to humble themselves before Allah.
orig: فادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فلبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: And it is said to those who feared Allah, 'What has your Lord sent down?' They will say, 'Good.' For those who do good in this world is good, and the home of the Hereafter is even better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the rewards and blessings for those who fear Allah and strive to do good deeds in this world. It highlights that the good deeds done in this life will be rewarded with goodness here and in the Hereafter, where the rewards will be even greater. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of righteousness and the ultimate reward for piety and good actions.
orig: وقيل للذين اتقوا ماذا أنزل ربكم قالوا خيرا للذين أحسنوا في هذه الدنيا حسنة ولدار الآخرة خير ولنعم دار المتقين

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever they please. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous.
interpretation: This verse describes the reward of the righteous believers in the Hereafter. They will be granted entry into gardens of eternal bliss, with flowing rivers beneath them, and they will have whatever they desire. It signifies the ultimate reward and fulfillment for those who were mindful of God and lived a righteous life in this world.
orig: جنات عدن يدخلونها تجري من تحتها الأنهار لهم فيها ما يشاءون كذلك يجزي الله المتقين

translation: Those whom the angels take in death [while] good and pure - [the angels] will say, 'Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse describes the peaceful and honourable transition of the righteous believers from this world to the next. The angels will greet them with blessings and admission to Paradise, as a reward for the good deeds they performed in their lives on Earth.
orig: الذين تتوفاهم الملائكة طيبين يقولون سلام عليكم ادخلوا الجنة بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Do they await but that the angels should come to them or there come the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the disbelievers' denial of the truth and refusal to follow guidance will not delay the consequences of their actions. It emphasizes that Allah is just and does not wrong anyone, rather it is the individuals who wrong themselves through their actions. It warns that just as those who came before faced the consequences of their disbelief, the same fate awaits those who continue on the path of denial and disobedience.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن تأتيهم الملائكة أو يأتي أمر ربك كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم وما ظلمهم الله ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice, indicating that the consequences of one's actions will eventually catch up with them. It warns against mocking or belittling the signs of God or the guidance provided, as such attitudes can lead to detrimental outcomes for individuals or communities.
orig: فأصابهم سيئات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything apart from Him, neither we nor our forefathers, nor would we have forbidden anything without Him." Likewise did those before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?
interpretation: This verse addresses those who associate partners with Allah and claim that they only worship them because Allah willed it. The verse highlights the erroneous reasoning of such individuals and their disregard for accountability. It emphasizes that the messengers' role is simply to convey the clear message, and ultimately, everyone will be accountable for their beliefs and actions.
orig: وقال الذين أشركوا لو شاء الله ما عبدنا من دونه من شيء نحن ولا آباؤنا ولا حرمنا من دونه من شيء كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم فهل على الرسل إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], 'Worship Allah and avoid Taghut.' And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So travel through the land and observe how was the end of the deniers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal message of sending messengers to every nation, guiding them to worship Allah and avoid false deities. It points out that some people accept guidance while others reject it, leading to their own misguidance. The verse encourages reflection on the consequences faced by those who deny the truth, urging people to travel and witness the outcome of those who deny the message brought by the messengers.
orig: ولقد بعثنا في كل أمة رسولا أن اعبدوا الله واجتنبوا الطاغوت فمنهم من هدى الله ومنهم من حقت عليه الضلالة فسيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: If you strive for their guidance, [O Muhammad] - indeed Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that guidance ultimately comes from Allah alone. No matter how hard someone may try to guide those who have gone astray, it is ultimately up to Allah to grant them guidance. It also emphasizes the reality that those who have chosen to be astray will find themselves without any support from others in their misguided path.
orig: إن تحرص على هداهم فإن الله لا يهدي من يضل وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that Allah will not raise up him who dies. Yes, indeed, it is a binding promise upon Him, but most of mankind do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and disbelief of many people regarding the promise of resurrection after death. Despite swearing vehemently that Allah will not resurrect those who die, the truth is that it is a decree and promise from Allah, and He is bound by His promise. However, due to their lack of knowledge or faith, most people fail to comprehend this fundamental concept of resurrection as ordained by Allah.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لا يبعث الله من يموت بلى وعدا عليه حقا ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: To make clear to them what they differ about and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.
interpretation: This verse serves to clarify the differences among people and to expose the falsehood of those who have disbelieved. It emphasizes the importance of clarity and truthfulness in matters of belief.
orig: ليبين لهم الذي يختلفون فيه وليعلم الذين كفروا أنهم كانوا كاذبين

translation: Our command is only one word, when We intend a thing, We only say to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah. It illustrates that when Allah wills something to happen, all He has to do is command it by saying 'Be,' and it comes into existence immediately. It emphasizes how effortlessly Allah brings about the creation and manifestation of things in the universe through His mere command.
orig: إنما قولنا لشيء إذا أردناه أن نقول له كن فيكون

translation: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah after they had been wronged, We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to those who migrate for His sake after facing injustice. It reassures them that they will be provided with a good life in this world as well as an even greater reward in the Hereafter. The verse reminds believers to have faith in Allah's justice and to trust in His ultimate rewards for their patience and perseverance in the face of challenges.
orig: والذين هاجروا في الله من بعد ما ظلموا لنبوئنهم في الدنيا حسنة ولأجر الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Those who are patient, and rely upon their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of patience and trust in Allah. It emphasizes the importance of enduring difficulties with patience and relying on Allah for support and guidance. It serves as a reminder that true believers should remain steadfast in their faith and trust in Allah, especially during challenging times, as their ultimate reliance should be on Allah alone.
orig: الذين صبروا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the messengers sent by Allah before Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) were also human beings who received revelations from Allah. It encourages seeking knowledge and guidance from those who possess knowledge of the scriptures if one is in doubt or lacks understanding.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: With clear proofs, scriptures, and We have revealed to you the message, that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of clear evidence and divine scriptures in guiding people towards the truth. It highlights the role of the Qur'an in clarifying for humanity the revelation sent to them, inviting them to reflect upon its message and guidance.
orig: بالبينات والزبر وأنزلنا إليك الذكر لتبين للناس ما نزل إليهم ولعلهم يتفكرون

translation: Then do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that no one should feel secure in their wrongdoing, thinking that they will not be held accountable by Allah.
