It emphasizes that Allah has the power to bring about punishment on people who engage in evil deeds, even if they are not aware of it. It warns against complacency and encourages self-reflection and repentance.
orig: أفأمن الذين مكروا السيئات أن يخسف الله بهم الأرض أو يأتيهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: Or He could cause them to be lost in their [tumult] so they would not find a way.
interpretation: This verse discusses one of the ways in which God could deal with those who disobey Him - by letting them wander aimlessly in their confusion and disarray, unable to find their way out. It serves as a reminder of God's ultimate authority and control over all matters, including guiding or misguiding individuals based on their actions.
orig: أو يأخذهم في تقلبهم فما هم بمعجزين

translation: Or that He may imprison them for their fear. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and kindness of Allah towards His creation. It reassures believers that even if they feel fear or anxiety, Allah's mercy surpasses all, and He is compassionate towards their concerns. It also serves as a reminder that Allah's justice is always coupled with His mercy.
orig: أو يأخذهم على تخوف فإن ربكم لرءوف رحيم

translation: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah while they are humble.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the natural state of submission to Allah that everything in creation adheres to, even their shadows. It emphasizes the innate state of humility and obedience that exists in the entire universe to the Creator, emphasizing the concept of universal submission to the Almighty.
orig: أولم يروا إلى ما خلق الله من شيء يتفيأ ظلاله عن اليمين والشمائل سجدا لله وهم داخرون

translation: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal submission to Allah, emphasizing that everything in the heavens and the earth bows down to Allah willingly, including animals and angels. It underscores the concept of humility and the absence of arrogance in the creatures of Allah, as they recognize and obey their Creator without pride.
orig: ولله يسجد ما في السماوات وما في الأرض من دابة والملائكة وهم لا يستكبرون

translation: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having a respectful fear and awe of Allah. It implies that true believers are conscious of Allah's presence and authority over them, and they strive to follow His commands obediently. It highlights the combination of love, fear, and obedience that should define the relationship between a believer and their Creator.
orig: يخافون ربهم من فوقهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون

translation: And Allah said, 'Do not take two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of God and prohibits associating partners with Him. It highlights the importance of having sincere belief in the oneness of God and the necessity to fear and worship Him alone without associating any partners with Him.
orig: وقال الله لا تتخذوا إلهين اثنين إنما هو إله واحد فإياي فارهبون

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawhid (the oneness of Allah) and the ultimate sovereignty of Allah over all that exists. It reminds believers to worship Allah alone and to have fear and reverence only for Him, as He is the one who created everything and is worthy of worship and devotion.
orig: وله ما في السماوات والأرض وله الدين واصبا أفغير الله تتقون

translation: And whatever blessing you have is from Allah. Then, when harm touches you, unto Him you cry aloud for help.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of gratitude and reliance on Allah. It teaches that all blessings we receive are from Allah, so we should be grateful for them. At the same time, when facing hardship or distress, we should turn to Allah for help and seek refuge in Him, recognizing that He is the ultimate source of ease and relief.
orig: وما بكم من نعمة فمن الله ثم إذا مسكم الضر فإليه تجأرون

translation: Then when We remove the affliction from you, a group of you [who are unjust] associate others with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights an unfortunate behavior among some people, where they turn to associating partners with Allah, particularly during times of ease and comfort, forgetting His mercy and grace when hardship is lifted. It serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in faith and gratitude, regardless of one's circumstances.
orig: ثم إذا كشف الضر عنكم إذا فريق منكم بربهم يشركون

translation: They may deny what We have bestowed upon them and may enjoy themselves [for a while], but soon they will know.
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the signs and blessings of Allah that they may enjoy the worldly pleasures for a limited time but eventually they will come to realize the truth and face the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

translation: And they assign to Allah that of which they have no knowledge. And there will be for them no helpers. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the severe warning against attributing false statements to Allah, claiming knowledge of things that one has no knowledge about, or associating beliefs or practices with Him that are not rooted in truth. It emphasizes that every individual will be held accountable for their actions, beliefs, and inventions, and that there is no escape from facing the consequences of such false attributions.
orig: ويجعلون لما لا يعلمون نصيبا مما رزقناهم تالله لتسألن عما كنتم تفترون

translation: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the false belief of some people who attribute daughters to God, when God is far above having any offspring or partners. It emphasizes that God is free from the attributes that humans assign to Him according to their desires or misconceptions.
orig: ويجعلون لله البنات سبحانه ولهم ما يشتهون

translation: And when one of them is given the glad tidings of [the birth of] a female, his face darkens, and he suppresses grief.
interpretation: This verse describes the reaction of certain individuals at the news of the birth of a female child, a reaction marked by disappointment and sadness, leading to a darkening of the face. The verse conveys the mindset of a society where the birth of a daughter was considered a source of shame and dishonor, contrasting it with the joy and pride that should be felt at the blessing of having a child, regardless of gender.
orig: وإذا بشر أحدهم بالأنثى ظل وجهه مسودا وهو كظيم

translation: He hides from the people because of the evil of that whereof he has been informed. Shall he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Surely, evil is what they decide.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the dilemma of a person who receives bad news or a piece of information that might bring shame or trouble upon them. It presents the internal struggle of whether to conceal the information and bear the humiliation or try to bury it and keep it hidden. The verse condemns the act of concealing the truth or making wrongful decisions in such circumstances.
orig: يتوارى من القوم من سوء ما بشر به أيمسكه على هون أم يدسه في التراب ألا ساء ما يحكمون

translation: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who deny or disbelieve in the Hereafter are likened to evil because they fail to acknowledge the ultimate justice and accountability in the afterlife. The verse also emphasizes that Allah is incomparable and possesses the highest attributes beyond any human comparison. His power and wisdom are unmatched, and He is the All-Mighty and the All-Wise.
orig: للذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة مثل السوء ولله المثل الأعلى وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].
interpretation: This verse indicates that if Allah were to hold people accountable for their wrongdoings immediately, none would be spared due to their sins. However, Allah, in His mercy, delays their punishment until a designated time. Once the appointed time arrives, no one can postpone it or hasten it. This verse serves as a reminder of the inevitable accountability each individual will face for their actions, emphasizing the justice of Allah's decree.
orig: ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بظلمهم ما ترك عليها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم إلى أجل مسمى فإذا جاء أجلهم لا يستأخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون

translation: And they assign to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongue[s] assert the lie that for them is the best. Unquestionably, for them is the Fire, and they will be therein neglected.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of those who falsely attribute qualities and beliefs to Allah that are not pleasing to Him. Additionally, it points out how they deceitfully claim that they hold the best beliefs and practices, while in reality, they are deserving of punishment in the Fire for their falsehoods and arrogance.
orig: ويجعلون لله ما يكرهون وتصف ألسنتهم الكذب أن لهم الحسنى لا جرم أن لهم النار وأنهم مفرطون

translation: By Allah, We certainly sent [prophets] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds seem pleasing to them. So he is their patron today, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights that throughout history, messengers have been sent to various nations before the listener's time. However, Satan has deceived many individuals in those nations, making their wrongful actions and sins appear attractive and acceptable to them. As a result, they followed Satan and his temptations, and now, they are under his influence and authority, leading to facing severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: تالله لقد أرسلنا إلى أمم من قبلك فزين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم فهو وليهم اليوم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except to make clear to them those matters in which they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the purpose of the revelation of the Qur'an which is to clarify matters of dispute among people and to provide guidance and mercy to those who believe. The Qur'an serves as a source of guidance and a means to resolve differences, offering a path to faith and understanding for those who accept its teachings.
orig: وما أنزلنا عليك الكتاب إلا لتبين لهم الذي اختلفوا فيه وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who sends down rain to revive the dead earth, symbolizing the continuous cycle of life and death. It serves as a clear sign for those who reflect and listen attentively to the signs of Allah's existence and power.
orig: والله أنزل من السماء ماء فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يسمعون

translation: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, between excretion and blood, pure milk, palatable to drinkers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessing of the provision of pure and nourishing milk that comes from the livestock as a sign of Allah's mercy and wisdom in creating sustenance for humans. It emphasizes the importance of reflecting on these natural processes and recognizing the signs of God's creation as a lesson for humanity.
orig: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة نسقيكم مما في بطونه من بين فرث ودم لبنا خالصا سائغا للشاربين

translation: And of the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines from which you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights how from the date palms and grapes, people produce permissible and beneficial items like food and drink, as well as impermissible substances like alcohol. It serves as a reminder for those who use their intellect to differentiate between what is beneficial and harmful for them, encouraging them to seek that which is good for their well-being and to avoid what may lead to harm or moral corruption.
orig: ومن ثمرات النخيل والأعناب تتخذون منه سكرا ورزقا حسنا إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يعقلون

translation: And your Lord inspired to the bee, 'Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of observation and learning from the world around us. Allah uses the bee, a humble creature, as an example to teach humans lessons. In this case, the bee is directed to build its hives in various natural structures, showcasing the intricate wisdom and design in the natural world. It serves as a reminder for us to reflect upon the creations of Allah and to recognize the purpose and wisdom behind every living being and their actions.
orig: وأوحى ربك إلى النحل أن اتخذي من الجبال بيوتا ومن الشجر ومما يعرشون

translation: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]. There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed, in that is a sign for people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of diversity in the fruits that we consume and the different benefits that they offer. It also highlights the miraculous nature of the creation of these fruits, as they provide healing properties for humans. The verse encourages reflection on the signs of Allah present in the variety and benefits of fruits, urging people to ponder over the wisdom and mercy of their Creator.
orig: ثم كلي من كل الثمرات فاسلكي سبل ربك ذللا يخرج من بطونها شراب مختلف ألوانه فيه شفاء للناس إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in the creation and fate of humans. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate creator who gives life and causes death. It also points out that some people may reach a stage in old age where they become weak and lose their knowledge. This serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of life and the importance of seeking knowledge before it is too late.
orig: والله خلقكم ثم يتوفاكم ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكي لا يعلم بعد علم شيئا إن الله عليم قدير

translation: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of unequal distribution of provision among people by Allah's decree. It points out that those who have been granted more wealth or provisions should not use this as a means to oppress or mistreat others who have less. The verse questions whether people who deny the blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah through their actions are justified in doing so.
orig: والله فضل بعضكم على بعض في الرزق فما الذين فضلوا برادي رزقهم على ما ملكت أيمانهم فهم فيه سواء أفبنعمة الله يجحدون

translation: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then is it in the falsehood that they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah upon mankind by providing them with spouses, children, grandchildren, and sustenance. It questions the choice of some people who believe in falsehood and reject the favors bestowed upon them by Allah.
orig: والله جعل لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا وجعل لكم من أزواجكم بنين وحفدة ورزقكم من الطيبات أفبالباطل يؤمنون وبنعمت الله هم يكفرون

translation: And they worship besides Allah that which possesses no power for them of provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are not capable.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who worship entities besides Allah that have no power to provide sustenance from the heavens and the earth, highlighting the futility and weakness of such beliefs. It emphasizes the importance of worshiping the One true God, who has power over all things.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لهم رزقا من السماوات والأرض شيئا ولا يستطيعون

translation: So do not attribute likenesses to Allah. Verily, Allah knows, and you do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and incomparability of Allah, warning against likening Him to any of His creations. It reminds believers that Allah's knowledge and wisdom surpass human understanding, thus urging them to avoid forming any misleading comparisons or attributing human qualities to the Divine Being.
orig: فلا تضربوا لله الأمثال إن الله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Allah presents an example of a slave owned by another, who has no power over anything, and one whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an provides a parable about two individuals: one who is a slave with no possessions or power, and the other who has been blessed with wealth and spends from it generously. The verse questions whether these two individuals are equal, emphasizing the gratitude due to Allah for His blessings. It highlights the importance of recognizing and utilizing the blessings one has been given to benefit oneself and others, rather than displaying ingratitude and ignorance.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا عبدا مملوكا لا يقدر على شيء ومن رزقناه منا رزقا حسنا فهو ينفق منه سرا وجهرا هل يستوون الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And Allah presents an example: a man restricted within constraints, unable to do [anything], while he whom We have provided from Us good provisions is free to spend, and he spends [in the way of Allah]. Is he equal to one who stands in the way of justice and follows the straight path?
interpretation: This verse is a comparison between two individuals - one who is limited in ability and resources but remains steadfast in faith and trust in Allah, and another who has been granted abundant wealth and freedom to spend, especially in charitable deeds. The verse questions whether those who strive for justice and righteousness can be considered equal to those who are complacent or misuse their blessings. It highlights the value of using one's provisions and capabilities in a manner that aligns with the path of righteousness and justice.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا رجلين أحدهما أبكم لا يقدر على شيء وهو كل على مولاه أينما يوجهه لا يأت بخير هل يستوي هو ومن يأمر بالعدل وهو على صراط مستقيم

translation: To Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that only Allah has knowledge of the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth, and the Day of Judgment will come suddenly, in the blink of an eye or even quicker. It highlights the omnipotence of Allah, emphasizing His absolute control over all things.
orig: ولله غيب السماوات والأرض وما أمر الساعة إلا كلمح البصر أو هو أقرب إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And Allah has brought you out from the wombs of your mothers while you know nothing, and He has given you hearing, sight, and hearts that you might give thanks.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous process of human creation and the blessings bestowed upon humanity by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of gratitude by reminding us of our humble beginnings and the gifts of hearing, sight, and understanding given to us by Allah. Therefore, we should be grateful for these blessings and acknowledge the greatness of our Creator.
orig: والله أخرجكم من بطون أمهاتكم لا تعلمون شيئا وجعل لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة لعلكم تشكرون

translation: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse points to the incredible signs of Allah's power and control in the natural world. Just as birds soar effortlessly through the sky by the will of Allah, everything in the universe is under His command. It serves as a reminder for those who have faith in Allah's existence and authority.
orig: ألم يروا إلى الطير مسخرات في جو السماء ما يمسكهن إلا الله إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on the day of travel and on the day of encampment; and from their wool, fur, and hair furnishings and goods for a while.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah has provided different materials from animals, such as hides, wool, fur, and hair, for humans to use in making tents and other items for their comfort and convenience during travel and stay. It emphasizes the bounties and provisions given by Allah for human benefit and survival.
orig: والله جعل لكم من بيوتكم سكنا وجعل لكم من جلود الأنعام بيوتا تستخفونها يوم ظعنكم ويوم إقامتكم ومن أصوافها وأوبارها وأشعارها أثاثا ومتاعا إلى حين

translation: And Allah has made for you from that which He has created shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the various blessings and provisions that Allah has provided for humans, such as shadows for comfort, mountains for safety, and garments for protection from different elements. The verse emphasizes that these are all ways in which Allah completes His favor upon us, and it encourages believers to be grateful and submit to His will.
orig: والله جعل لكم مما خلق ظلالا وجعل لكم من الجبال أكنانا وجعل لكم سرابيل تقيكم الحر وسرابيل تقيكم بأسكم كذلك يتم نعمته عليكم لعلكم تسلمون

translation: So if they turn away, then it is only upon you to clearly convey the message.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of conveying the message of the Qur'an clearly and comprehensively. It reminds the reader that their duty is to deliver the message faithfully, regardless of how others may respond or whether they choose to accept it or not.
orig: فإن تولوا فإنما عليك البلاغ المبين

translation: They recognize the favor of Allah and then deny it; and most of them are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and disbelief of some people who acknowledge the blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah but still deny them. It signifies the unfortunate reality that many are unappreciative of the numerous blessings they enjoy, leading them to disbelief.
orig: يعرفون نعمت الله ثم ينكرونها وأكثرهم الكافرون

translation: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness, then it will not be permitted for those who disbelieved, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability on the Day of Judgment, where witnesses will be brought forth from each community to testify. It highlights the fact that on that day, there will be no opportunity for those who disbelieved to defend themselves or make excuses for their actions. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate justice and judgment that awaits all individuals.
orig: ويوم نبعث من كل أمة شهيدا ثم لا يؤذن للذين كفروا ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: And when those who have wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of the wrongdoers who will face the full weight of their actions without any alleviation or escape. It serves as a warning that the punishment for injustice and wrongdoing will be inevitable and unrelenting.
orig: وإذا رأى الذين ظلموا العذاب فلا يخفف عنهم ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And when those who associated others with Allah see their 'partners,' they will say, 'Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You.' But they will throw at them the statement, 'Indeed, you are liars.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the false beliefs of those who associate partners with Allah. On the Day of Judgment, these individuals will deny their idols and false gods, realizing the falsehood of their worship and those whom they attributed divinity to. The verse serves as a warning against polytheism and the consequences of attributing partners to Allah.
orig: وإذا رأى الذين أشركوا شركاءهم قالوا ربنا هؤلاء شركاؤنا الذين كنا ندعو من دونك فألقوا إليهم القول إنكم لكاذبون

translation: And they will be presented before Allah that Day in submission, and what they used to invent will fail them.
interpretation: On that Day of Judgment, all people will be brought before Allah in submission, acknowledging His ultimate authority and power. Any falsehoods or fabrications that they relied on in the worldly life will be of no avail to them in the face of divine truth and justice.
orig: وألقوا إلى الله يومئذ السلم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment because they used to spread corruption.
interpretation: This verse warns of the consequences for those who reject faith and hinder others from following the path of Allah. Such individuals will face a double punishment as a result of their corruption and misguidance. It serves as a reminder of the accountability before Allah for their actions and the severity of the punishment for those who actively oppose His guidance.
orig: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله زدناهم عذابا فوق العذاب بما كانوا يفسدون

translation: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over these [people]. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when every nation will have a witness from within itself. Prophet Muhammad will be a witness over his people, showing that he conveyed the message of Allah to them. The Qur'an is sent as a clear guide and mercy, providing good news to those who submit to Allah and follow His guidance.
orig: ويوم نبعث في كل أمة شهيدا عليهم من أنفسهم وجئنا بك شهيدا على هؤلاء ونزلنا عليك الكتاب تبيانا لكل شيء وهدى ورحمة وبشرى للمسلمين

translation: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding justice, righteousness, kindness towards relatives, and prohibits indecency, immorality, and oppression. Allah advises and urges believers to adhere to these principles in order to be reminded and guided towards a virtuous way of life.
orig: إن الله يأمر بالعدل والإحسان وإيتاء ذي القربى وينهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر والبغي يعظكم لعلكم تذكرون

translation: Fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the importance of keeping their promises and upholding their commitments, especially those made in the name of Allah. It emphasizes the seriousness of oath-taking and the need to honor these agreements. The verse serves as a reminder that Allah is always watching and aware of our actions, so it is crucial to be honest and truthful in all dealings.
orig: وأوفوا بعهد الله إذا عاهدتم ولا تنقضوا الأيمان بعد توكيدها وقد جعلتم الله عليكم كفيلا إن الله يعلم ما تفعلون

translation: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.
interpretation: This verse warns against breaking oaths and treaties deceitfully or unjustly to gain unfair advantage over others. It emphasizes that differences in wealth or status between communities should not lead one to deceive or betray others. Allah tests people through such situations, and on the Day of Judgment, all disputes and disagreements will be clarified and judged by Him.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالتي نقضت غزلها من بعد قوة أنكاثا تتخذون أيمانكم دخلا بينكم أن تكون أمة هي أربى من أمة إنما يبلوكم الله به وليبينن لكم يوم القيامة ما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the power of Allah to make all people follow one religion if He so willed, but He has allowed for differences in belief and guidance. It highlights that guidance ultimately comes from Allah, who leads whom He wills astray and guides whom He wills. The verse also reminds that every individual will be held accountable for their actions and beliefs on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولو شاء الله لجعلكم أمة واحدة ولكن يضل من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء ولتسألن عما كنتم تعملون

translation: And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing of wrongdoing and making peace between people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to use their oaths as an excuse to avoid doing what is right and just, and not to undermine efforts towards reconciliation and peace between people. It cautions against deceit and straying from the path of righteousness, reminding that there will be severe punishment for those who do wrong.
orig: ولا تتخذوا أيمانكم دخلا بينكم فتزل قدم بعد ثبوتها وتذوقوا السوء بما صددتم عن سبيل الله ولكم عذاب عظيم

translation: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you knew.
interpretation: This verse admonishes believers against compromising their commitment to Allah for worldly gains or temporary pleasures. It emphasizes the importance of honoring one's covenant with Allah and choosing His guidance over material benefits. The verse encourages believers to prioritize their faith and trust in Allah's wisdom and provisions rather than succumbing to the temptations of this world.
orig: ولا تشتروا بعهد الله ثمنا قليلا إنما عند الله هو خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: What is with you will be exhausted, but what is with Allah is enduring. And We will surely reward those who were patient according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the possessions and blessings of this world are temporary and will eventually come to an end. On the other hand, the rewards and blessings that await in the hereafter, with Allah, are everlasting and enduring. It emphasizes the importance of patience and steadfastness in facing hardships and challenges in life, promising that the rewards for such patience will be bestowed by Allah and will be far greater than one can imagine, based on their righteous deeds.
orig: ما عندكم ينفد وما عند الله باق ولنجزين الذين صبروا أجرهم بأحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will give them their reward according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights that whoever, whether male or female, engages in righteous actions while being a believer, will be granted a good and satisfying life in this world and will be rewarded in the Hereafter based on the excellence of their deeds. It emphasizes the importance of faith and good deeds, promising a positive and fulfilling life for those who follow this path.
orig: من عمل صالحا من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فلنحيينه حياة طيبة ولنجزينهم أجرهم بأحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: So when you recite the Qur'an, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking protection from Satan when reciting the Qur'an. By seeking refuge in Allah, one acknowledges their reliance on God's protection from the whispers and distractions of Satan during the time of engaging with the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder to remain focused on the message of the Qur'an and to seek divine help in maintaining purity and sincerity in one's engagement with the sacred text.
orig: فإذا قرأت القرآن فاستعذ بالله من الشيطان الرجيم

translation: He has no authority over those who believe and trust in their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of God over His servants. It emphasizes that for those who believe in God and rely on Him, no one and nothing has power or control over them. By trusting in God and having faith, believers are protected from any harm or influence that others may try to exert over them.
orig: إنه ليس له سلطان على الذين آمنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through Him associate others with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah's authority is only over those who choose to follow and obey Him, and those who commit shirk (associating partners with Allah). It emphasizes the concept of ultimate sovereignty and power resting with Allah and those who accept His oneness.
orig: إنما سلطانه على الذين يتولونه والذين هم به مشركون

translation: And when We substitute a verse in place of another verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, 'You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies].' But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the resistance faced by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from the disbelievers when they accuse him of fabricating the verses of the Qur'an. It emphasizes the ignorance of the disbelievers regarding the profound nature of the Qur'anic revelations and their lack of understanding about the divine wisdom behind the changes in the revelations.
orig: وإذا بدلنا آية مكان آية والله أعلم بما ينزل قالوا إنما أنت مفتر بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings for the Muslims."
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an was revealed by the Holy Spirit from Allah to strengthen the faith of the believers, giving them guidance and glad tidings. It reminds Muslims that the message of the Qur'an is a source of support and encouragement for those who have faith and surrender themselves to Allah.
orig: قل نزله روح القدس من ربك بالحق ليثبت الذين آمنوا وهدى وبشرى للمسلمين

translation: And We certainly know that they say, 'It is only a human being who teaches him.' The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this is a clear Arabic tongue.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an acknowledges that disbelievers at the time of the Prophet Muhammad claimed that he was only being taught by a human being, referring to the Prophet as having a foreign tongue. However, the Qur'an reassures that the revelation is in clear Arabic, implying that the language of the message is simple and understandable, regardless of the allegations made against the Prophet.
orig: ولقد نعلم أنهم يقولون إنما يعلمه بشر لسان الذي يلحدون إليه أعجمي وهذا لسان عربي مبين

translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the signs of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of belief in the signs and revelations of Allah. It warns that those who reject these signs will not be guided by Allah and will face a severe punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and the significance of faith in Allah's signs.
orig: إن الذين لا يؤمنون بآيات الله لا يهديهم الله ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Those who do not believe in the signs of Allah are the ones who invent falsehood, and it is they who are the liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny or fail to believe in the clear signs and revelations of Allah are the ones who resort to spreading lies and fabrications. It highlights the importance of faith and belief in the divine signs as a foundation for truthfulness and honesty.
orig: إنما يفتري الكذب الذين لا يؤمنون بآيات الله وأولئك هم الكاذبون

translation: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief, except for one who is forced [to renounce his faith] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who willingly open their hearts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the significance of sincere faith and warns against deliberate disbelief after having known the truth. It highlights that those who reject faith willingly will face divine anger and severe punishment, whereas those who are compelled to renounce their faith while their hearts remain steadfast in belief are granted mercy and understanding by Allah.
orig: من كفر بالله من بعد إيمانه إلا من أكره وقلبه مطمئن بالإيمان ولكن من شرح بالكفر صدرا فعليهم غضب من الله ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reason why some people do not believe in the afterlife and fail to follow the guidance of Allah. It points out that their love for the material world and their lack of faith prevent them from recognizing the truth and seeking guidance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of prioritizing faith and the Hereafter over temporary worldly gains.
orig: ذلك بأنهم استحبوا الحياة الدنيا على الآخرة وأن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: Those are the ones upon whose hearts, hearing, and vision Allah has set a seal, and it is those who are heedless.
interpretation: This verse refers to those whose hearts have been sealed by Allah due to their persistent denial of the truth, their refusal to listen to guidance, and their blindness to the signs of Allah. They are described as heedless because they are oblivious to the guidance and warnings that are presented to them, leading them further away from the path of righteousness.
orig: أولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم وسمعهم وأبصارهم وأولئك هم الغافلون

translation: Certainly, they are the losers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate loss of those who reject the truth and disobey Allah. It serves as a warning that those who do not believe in the Hereafter and fail to follow the teachings of Islam will face severe consequences in the afterlife. It highlights the importance of faith and good deeds in securing success and salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: لا جرم أنهم في الآخرة هم الخاسرون

translation: Then indeed, your Lord, to those who emigrated after they were compelled [to leave] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward and mercy of Allah for those who were forced to migrate for their faith and then fought and endured hardships patiently. It assures believers that even after their trials, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards them, emphasizing the importance of perseverance and trust in Allah's mercy.
orig: ثم إن ربك للذين هاجروا من بعد ما فتنوا ثم جاهدوا وصبروا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when each individual will be held accountable for their deeds. It highlights the concept of personal responsibility and justice, stressing that no one will be treated unjustly by God in the recompense for their actions.
orig: يوم تأتي كل نفس تجادل عن نفسها وتوفى كل نفس ما عملت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provisions coming to it in abundance from every quarter. But it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.
interpretation: This verse is illustrating a city that was blessed with safety and prosperity, with abundance of provisions coming to it from all directions. Despite these blessings, the people of the city were ungrateful and denied the favors of Allah. As a consequence of their ingratitude and wrongdoing, Allah punished them by making them experience hunger and fear; thus, emphasizing the importance of gratitude and obedience to Allah's commands.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا قرية كانت آمنة مطمئنة يأتيها رزقها رغدا من كل مكان فكفرت بأنعم الله فأذاقها الله لباس الجوع والخوف بما كانوا يصنعون

translation: And there came to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so the punishment seized them while they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights how the people who denied and rejected the Messenger sent to them faced punishment due to their wrongdoing and rejection of the truth. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the prophets and going against the message they bring.
orig: ولقد جاءهم رسول منهم فكذبوه فأخذهم العذاب وهم ظالمون

translation: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of consuming only what is halal (lawful) and pure, and to show gratitude for the sustenance provided by Allah. It serves as a reminder to be mindful of what we consume and to be grateful for the blessings bestowed upon us.
orig: فكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واشكروا نعمت الله إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: Forbidden to you (for food) are: dead meat, blood, the flesh of swine, and that on which hath been invoked the name of other than Allah; that which hath been killed by strangling, or by a violent blow, or by a headlong fall, or by being gored to death; that which hath been partly eaten by a wild animal; unless ye are able to slaughter it (in due form); that which is sacrificed on stone (altars); (forbidden) also is the division (of meat) by raffling with arrows: that is impiety. This day have those who reject faith given up all hope of your religion: yet fear them not but fear Me. This day have I perfected your religion for you, completed My favor upon you, and have chosen for you Islam as your religion. But if any is forced by hunger, with no inclination to transgression, Allah is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse outlines the food restrictions for Muslims, specifying what they are forbidden to eat. It also emphasizes the importance of obeying these restrictions by detailing the consequences for non-compliance. The core message is that Allah has provided clear guidance on what is permissible and what is not, and that followers should adhere to these regulations with sincerity and fear of God. The verse also conveys Allah's mercy and forgiveness for those who may be in situations of extreme necessity and are compelled to consume forbidden food as a result.
orig: إنما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, 'This is lawful and this is unlawful,' to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the prohibition of attributing false statements to Allah and making up lies about what is permissible (halal) and what is forbidden (haram). It warns that those who fabricate falsehood about Allah will not find success. Therefore, it stresses the importance of speaking the truth and not falsely assigning things to Allah.
orig: ولا تقولوا لما تصف ألسنتكم الكذب هذا حلال وهذا حرام لتفتروا على الله الكذب إن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون

translation: They will have a brief enjoyment, and painful torment awaits them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who choose to indulge in wrongdoings and sins. It serves as a reminder that the enjoyment of this world is temporary, and the true consequences of one's actions will be felt in the Hereafter.
orig: متاع قليل ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And to those who are Jews, We have forbidden that which We have related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse points out that the restrictions placed on the Jews were not due to any wrongdoing from Allah, but rather a consequence of the actions of the Jews themselves. It emphasizes personal accountability and highlights the concept of reaping what one sows, implying that transgressions committed by individuals are a result of their own misdeeds.
orig: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا ما قصصنا عليك من قبل وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: Then indeed, your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who unknowingly commit wrong deeds, but then sincerely repent and strive to correct themselves. It emphasizes the importance of seeking repentance and making amends as a means of attaining Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: ثم إن ربك للذين عملوا السوء بجهالة ثم تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exceptional character of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham), describing him as a model of submission and devotion to Allah. Ibrahim's unwavering belief in the oneness of God and his rejection of idolatry set him apart as a true monotheist. The verse emphasizes Ibrahim's righteousness, his commitment to the truth, and his firm stand against polytheism. It serves as a reminder to believers to follow Ibrahim's example of faith, piety, and steadfastness in the worship of Allah alone.
orig: إن إبراهيم كان أمة قانتا لله حنيفا ولم يك من المشركين

translation: Being grateful for His favours, He chose him and guided him to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of gratitude for the blessings that God bestows upon us. It mentions how God chose and guided someone to the right path because of their gratitude. It teaches us that being grateful leads to further blessings and guidance from God towards the right way of living.
orig: شاكرا لأنعمه اجتباه وهداه إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of reward and recompense in the eyes of Allah. It reassures that those who do good deeds in this world will be rewarded not only in the worldly life but also in the Hereafter, where they will be among the righteous and receive blessings from Allah.
orig: وآتيناه في الدنيا حسنة وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: Then We revealed to you to follow the religion of Abraham, a man of pure faith, and he was not among the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the monotheistic faith of Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him). It highlights the concept of Hanif, which in this context refers to being upright in devotion and maintaining a pure faith. By following the path of Abraham, believers are encouraged to stay away from idolatry and polytheism.
orig: ثم أوحينا إليك أن اتبع ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: The Sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Sabbath was prescribed for the people who disputed its observance. It also serves as a reflection on the Day of Judgment, where all differences and disputes will be settled by Allah. It highlights the divine judgment and the ultimate resolution of disputes that will take place on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: إنما جعل السبت على الذين اختلفوا فيه وإن ربك ليحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of inviting others to the path of God in a gentle and wise manner, using good advice and arguments. It highlights the significance of conducting discussions and debates in the best possible manner, with respect and wisdom. Ultimately, it reminds believers that God is fully aware of those who have gone astray and those who have found the right guidance.
orig: ادع إلى سبيل ربك بالحكمة والموعظة الحسنة وجادلهم بالتي هي أحسن إن ربك هو أعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.
interpretation: This verse teaches fairness and justice in dealing with those who have wronged us. It emphasizes the concept of 'an eye for an eye' in seeking retribution for harm done, but also encourages patience and forgiveness as a superior quality for those who are able to uphold it. The message is to balance justice and mercy, and to strive for patience when faced with challenges or injustices.
orig: وإن عاقبتم فعاقبوا بمثل ما عوقبتم به ولئن صبرتم لهو خير للصابرين

translation: And be patient, for your patience is but by Allah. And do not grieve over them, and do not be in distress because of what they conspire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and reliance on Allah in the face of difficulties. It reminds believers that true patience comes from having faith in Allah. It also advises against being saddened by the behavior of disbelievers and warns against feeling constricted by their schemes, encouraging believers to trust in Allah's plan and remain steadfast.
orig: واصبر وما صبرك إلا بالله ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تك في ضيق مما يمكرون

translation: Verily, Allah is with those who are righteous and those who are good-doers.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah's support and guidance are with those who are righteous and who perform good deeds. It emphasizes the importance of piety and good conduct in earning Allah's closeness and aid.
orig: إن الله مع الذين اتقوا والذين هم محسنون

translation: Glory be to Him Who made His servant to go on a night from the Sacred Mosque to the remote mosque of which We have blessed the precincts, so that We may show to him some of Our signs. Surely He is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous journey of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) known as Isra and Miraj, where he was taken from the Sacred Mosque in Mecca to the Farthest Mosque in Jerusalem and was shown signs and wonders of Allah's power and glory. It highlights the magnificence and omnipotence of Allah's abilities, showcasing His control over all things and His ability to reveal His miraculous signs to the believers.
orig: سبحان الذي أسرى بعبده ليلا من المسجد الحرام إلى المسجد الأقصى الذي باركنا حوله لنريه من آياتنا إنه هو السميع البصير

translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as a Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of following the guidance provided in the scripture given to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) as a means of guidance for the Children of Israel. It serves as a reminder to the believers not to take anyone or anything besides Allah as a trusted guardian or guide in their affairs, emphasizing the oneness and sovereignty of Allah in all matters.
orig: وآتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلناه هدى لبني إسرائيل ألا تتخذوا من دوني وكيلا

translation: A posterity who shall be carried in the Ark with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.
interpretation: This verse mentions the descendants of Noah who were chosen to be saved in the Ark along with him. They are praised for being grateful servants of God. The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and servitude to God, and serves as a reminder of the reward for being thankful and obedient to Him.
orig: ذرية من حملنا مع نوح إنه كان عبدا شكورا

translation: And We decreed for the Children of Israel in the Scripture that indeed, you would do mischief on the earth twice and you will become tyrants and extremely arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights a warning given to the Children of Israel in the scripture that they would cause corruption and mischief on the earth not once, but twice, leading to them becoming oppressive and arrogant. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of deviating from righteousness and the importance of following the guidelines and teachings laid down for maintaining peace and justice.
orig: وقضينا إلى بني إسرائيل في الكتاب لتفسدن في الأرض مرتين ولتعلن علوا كبيرا

translation: So when the first of the two promises came, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the promises made in the Qur'an will come to pass, and when the first of these promises from Allah is fulfilled, it will be accompanied by events that are meant to serve as reminders of His power and authority. In this context, the verse talks about the punishment that befalls those who have strayed from the path of righteousness, and how they will face consequences for their actions. It also highlights the importance of being mindful of our deeds and staying on the right path in order to avoid such calamities.
orig: فإذا جاء وعد أولاهما بعثنا عليكم عبادا لنا أولي بأس شديد فجاسوا خلال الديار وكان وعدا مفعولا

translation: Then We reversed the direction of the enemy to you, and We gave you increase in wealth and children and made you greater in manpower.
interpretation: This verse highlights the constant care and favor from Allah towards His believers. It illustrates how Allah can turn the situation of the believers from difficulty to ease, providing them with sustenance, wealth, offspring, and strength as a sign of His mercy and blessings towards them.
orig: ثم رددنا لكم الكرة عليهم وأمددناكم بأموال وبنين وجعلناكم أكثر نفيرا

translation: If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves. Then when the final promise comes, [We will send your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the temple in Jerusalem as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of personal responsibility. It suggests that the consequences of one's actions ultimately affect themselves. Those who do good will benefit themselves, and those who do evil will harm themselves. Furthermore, it highlights the eventual accountability in the hereafter, where the wrongdoers will face the consequences of their actions and be humiliated. It serves as a reminder of the importance of accountability, both in this life and the hereafter.
orig: إن أحسنتم أحسنتم لأنفسكم وإن أسأتم فلها فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة ليسوءوا وجوهكم وليدخلوا المسجد كما دخلوه أول مرة وليتبروا ما علوا تتبيرا

translation: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you, and if you return [to disobedience], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed.
interpretation: This verse reflects the concept of mercy and punishment in Islam. It emphasizes that the mercy of God is always available to those who seek it, and that He is willing to forgive those who repent and turn back to Him. However, it also warns that if one persistently engages in disobedience, then punishment will follow. The mention of Hell as a prison-bed for the disbelievers serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and disobedience to God.
orig: عسى ربكم أن يرحمكم وإن عدتم عدنا وجعلنا جهنم للكافرين حصيرا

translation: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the guidance provided by the Qur'an towards what is right and beneficial. It brings glad tidings to the believers who perform good deeds, promising them a vast reward for their efforts. It encourages believers to adhere to righteousness and emphasizes the importance of living a life dedicated to good deeds as a means to attain a great reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إن هذا القرآن يهدي للتي هي أقوم ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا كبيرا

translation: And for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny or do not believe in the afterlife will face severe punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and the importance of faith in the Hereafter.
orig: وأن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة أعتدنا لهم عذابا أليما

translation: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hastiness of human nature in making supplications, as people often pray earnestly for their desires to be fulfilled without fully realizing the consequences, whether it be for good or for ill. It reminds believers of the importance of patience and reflection in their prayers and actions, cautioning against haste and impulsiveness.
orig: ويدع الإنسان بالشر دعاءه بالخير وكان الإنسان عجولا

translation: And We made the night and the day two signs, then We obliterated the sign of the night and made the sign of the day a source of light that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the alternation of night and day as signs from Allah. The day is a clear sign, providing light that allows us to seek sustenance and blessings from Allah, as well as enabling us to count time and measure our days and years. It is a reminder of the precision and order in Allah's creation, and serves as a means for us to plan and organize our lives.
orig: وجعلنا الليل والنهار آيتين فمحونا آية الليل وجعلنا آية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب وكل شيء فصلناه تفصيلا

translation: And every human being We have fastened his fate to his neck, and We will produce for him, on the Day of Resurrection, a record which he will encounter spread open.
interpretation: This verse signifies that every individual is responsible for their own actions and choices. The mention of the record being produced on the Day of Resurrection demonstrates that every person will be held accountable for their deeds, as their fate will be revealed and presented before them. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being conscious of one's actions and the consequences they may face in the Hereafter.
orig: وكل إنسان ألزمناه طائره في عنقه ونخرج له يوم القيامة كتابا يلقاه منشورا

translation: Read your book. It is enough that you take yourself to account today.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of self-reflection and self-accountability. It reminds individuals to assess their own actions, deeds, and intentions without relying on others to judge them. It encourages self-awareness, introspection, and responsibility for one's own choices and behaviors. Ultimately, it serves as a reminder that each individual will be held accountable for their actions in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: اقرأ كتابك كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا

translation: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the individual responsibility of guidance and the consequences of misguidance. It teaches that each person is accountable for their own actions and decisions. It also highlights the importance of messengers in delivering the message of guidance before any punishment is inflicted.
orig: من اهتدى فإنما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى وما كنا معذبين حتى نبعث رسولا

translation: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word (of punishment) comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with (complete) destruction.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that when Allah decides to destroy a disobedient city, He first commands its affluent people to follow the right path, but they choose to disobey and commit sins. Consequently, the punishment decreed by Allah is executed upon the city, leading to its complete destruction.
orig: وإذا أردنا أن نهلك قرية أمرنا مترفيها ففسقوا فيها فحق عليها القول فدمرناها تدميرا

translation: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of disobedience and sin, highlighting the destruction of past generations due to their wrongdoing. It portrays Allah as being fully aware and observant of the sins committed by His servants, serving as a warning to the current and future generations to be mindful of their actions and seek repentance to avoid similar fates.
orig: وكم أهلكنا من القرون من بعد نوح وكفى بربك بذنوب عباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: Whoever desires [worldly] immediate gains - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to seek immediate gratification in this worldly life at the expense of the Hereafter. Those who prioritize worldly gains may be granted their desires quickly in this life, but they will ultimately face the consequence of Hell in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of focusing on the eternal life and not being swayed by temporary desires and pleasures.
orig: من كان يريد العاجلة عجلنا له فيها ما نشاء لمن نريد ثم جعلنا له جهنم يصلاها مذموما مدحورا

translation: And whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it as he ought to strive while he is a believer, it is those whose strive shall be appreciated.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of striving for the Hereafter while being a believer. It highlights that sincere efforts made for the sake of the Hereafter will be recognized and rewarded by Allah. It encourages believers to prioritize their actions and efforts towards achieving success in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن أراد الآخرة وسعى لها سعيها وهو مؤمن فأولئك كان سعيهم مشكورا

translation: No! We provide [livelihood] for these and those from the provision of your Lord. And the provision of your Lord is not restricted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that sustenance and provision come from Allah alone, and He provides for all creatures without any limitations. It reminds us to trust in Allah's infinite wisdom and generosity in providing for all beings according to His divine wisdom and decree.
orig: كلا نمد هؤلاء وهؤلاء من عطاء ربك وما كان عطاء ربك محظورا

translation: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.
interpretation: This verse highlights the variation in blessings and provisions that Allah bestows upon His creations in this world. It reminds us that worldly wealth and status are not definitive measures of success. The true worth and reward will be determined in the Hereafter, where the differences in people's ranks and blessings will be more significant and just.
orig: انظر كيف فضلنا بعضهم على بعض وللآخرة أكبر درجات وأكبر تفضيلا

translation: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and disgraced.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah, as doing so will lead to being condemned and humiliated on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining the oneness of Allah in belief and worship.
orig: لا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتقعد مذموما مخذولا

translation: And your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him, and that you be kind to your parents. Whether one or both of them attain old age in your lifetime, do not say to them a word of contempt, nor repel them, but address them in terms of honor.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and being kind and respectful to one's parents. It teaches Muslims to treat their parents with kindness and respect, even as they age and require care. Muslims are advised not to utter even a word of disrespect to their parents and to always speak to them with kindness and honor, regardless of the situation.
orig: وقضى ربك ألا تعبدوا إلا إياه وبالوالدين إحسانا إما يبلغن عندك الكبر أحدهما أو كلاهما فلا تقل لهما أف ولا تنهرهما وقل لهما قولا كريما

translation: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, 'My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up when I was small.'
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to treat their parents with respect, humility, and mercy, and to pray for God's mercy upon them just as they cared for the believer when they were young. It emphasizes the importance of honoring and caring for parents throughout their lives.
orig: واخفض لهما جناح الذل من الرحمة وقل رب ارحمهما كما ربياني صغيرا

translation: Your Lord knows best what is in your inner selves. If you are righteous, then indeed He is Forgiving to those who turn to Him frequently.
interpretation: This verse reflects the concept that Allah knows the true intentions and feelings of individuals. It emphasizes the importance of genuine righteousness and repentance, as Allah is Merciful and Forgiving towards those who sincerely seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.
orig: ربكم أعلم بما في نفوسكم إن تكونوا صالحين فإنه كان للأوابين غفورا

translation: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of fulfilling the rights of relatives, the poor, and travelers. It encourages believers to be mindful of their spending and to avoid extravagance and wastefulness.
orig: وآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ولا تبذر تبذيرا

translation: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the moral failing of extravagance and wastefulness, equating those who are extravagant with the devil and portraying them as ungrateful to Allah. It serves as a reminder to be moderate and grateful for the sustenance provided by Allah, rather than squandering resources.
orig: إن المبذرين كانوا إخوان الشياطين وكان الشيطان لربه كفورا

translation: And if you [must] turn away from the disbelievers, seeking the mercy of your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
interpretation: This verse advises believers on how to respond to disbelievers with kindness and gentleness, even when turning away from them. It emphasizes the importance of seeking mercy from Allah and speaking in a gentle and reasonable manner, maintaining one's dignity and composure even in the face of adversity.
orig: وإما تعرضن عنهم ابتغاء رحمة من ربك ترجوها فقل لهم قولا ميسورا

translation: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.
interpretation: This verse is reminding believers not to be extravagant nor miserly in their spending. It cautions against both excessive spending ('extend it completely') and extreme stinginess ('make your hand [as] chained to your neck'), as both can lead to criticism, reproach, and financial difficulties. It advises finding a balance in spending and not being careless with wealth.
orig: ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة إلى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط فتقعد ملوما محسورا

translation: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is always, regarding His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that sustenance and provision come from Allah alone, and He distributes it according to His will. Allah is aware of the needs and circumstances of His servants and is knowledgeable about all aspects of their lives.
orig: إن ربك يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is a great sin.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the killing of children out of fear of poverty, stating that provision comes from Allah for both the children and the parents. It emphasizes that taking the life of a child is a grave sin, emphasizing the sanctity of life and the importance of trusting in Allah's provision.
orig: ولا تقتلوا أولادكم خشية إملاق نحن نرزقهم وإياكم إن قتلهم كان خطئا كبيرا

translation: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.
interpretation: This verse prohibits engaging in any form of unlawful sexual relations, emphasizing the immorality and evil of such actions. It serves as a reminder to avoid not only the act itself but also any actions that may lead to it, highlighting the importance of upholding modesty and purity in behavior.
orig: ولا تقربوا الزنا إنه كان فاحشة وساء سبيلا

translation: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority; but let him not exceed limits in the matter of taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sanctity of human life and prohibits killing except in cases of justice. It also highlights the concept of seeking justice for those who have been wrongfully killed, ensuring that their heirs have the legal authority to seek retribution within the limits of the law. The verse underscores the importance of upholding justice and avoiding transgression in matters of taking life, with the reassurance that the just cause will be supported and upheld.
orig: ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ومن قتل مظلوما فقد جعلنا لوليه سلطانا فلا يسرف في القتل إنه كان منصورا

translation: And do not approach the property of the orphan, except in a way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating the property of orphans with care and fairness. It advises not to approach or use the wealth of orphans unless it is in the best and most appropriate manner, preserving and growing it until they are old enough to manage it themselves. Furthermore, it stresses the significance of fulfilling promises and commitments, reminding believers that they will be held accountable for their commitments and agreements in the sight of Allah.
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا بالعهد إن العهد كان مسئولا

translation: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fairness and justice in all dealings, including in measurements and transactions. It highlights the importance of being honest and just in all aspects of life, as this leads to better outcomes and results in this world and the hereafter.
orig: وأوفوا الكيل إذا كلتم وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم ذلك خير وأحسن تأويلا

translation: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not speaking about matters that one does not have knowledge of. It reminds believers that they will be held accountable for their words and actions, highlighting the significance of using their faculties of hearing, sight, and understanding wisely and responsibly.
orig: ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم إن السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل أولئك كان عنه مسئولا

translation: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
interpretation: This verse advises against arrogance and pride. It reminds us of our limitations as human beings in the grand scheme of creation. It serves as a caution against being boastful and thinking too highly of oneself, as ultimately we are insignificant compared to the vastness and power of the natural world created by Allah.
orig: ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إنك لن تخرق الأرض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولا

translation: All this is indeed evil, hateful in the sight of your Lord.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that evil deeds are detestable and displeasing to Allah. It serves as a warning against engaging in sinful and harmful actions, emphasizing the importance of following the teachings of the Qur'an and striving for righteousness in the eyes of God.
orig: كل ذلك كان سيئه عند ربك مكروها

translation: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the wisdom revealed by Allah and not associating any partners with Him. The warning against associating others with Allah serves as a reminder of the severe consequences one might face if they engage in polytheism or idol worship, highlighting the significance of monotheism in Islam.
orig: ذلك مما أوحى إليك ربك من الحكمة ولا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتلقى في جهنم ملوما مدحورا

translation: So, has your Lord preferred males for you and taken females from among the angels? Indeed, you are saying a dreadful thing.
interpretation: This verse challenges the pre-Islamic belief of assigning daughters to God while preferring sons for themselves. It highlights the absurdity of such beliefs and the disrespect it shows towards Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of attributing the right qualities and characteristics to Allah, free from human-like desires and biases.
orig: أفأصفاكم ربكم بالبنين واتخذ من الملائكة إناثا إنكم لتقولون قولا عظيما

translation: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that the people may be reminded, but it does not increase them except in aversion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the variety of guidance, reminders, and lessons in the Qur'an, designed to help people reflect and be reminded of their purpose in life. However, for those who turn away from the message, their aversion only hardens, leading them further away from the truth and guidance.
orig: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القرآن ليذكروا وما يزيدهم إلا نفورا

translation: Say, 'If there were in [the heavens and earth] gods besides Allah, as they say, these [gods] would have sought a way to the Owner of the Throne.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of Tawhid, the Oneness of Allah. It dismisses the claim of polytheists who suggest the existence of multiple gods by challenging them to explain why those supposed gods do not assert their authority over Allah, the ultimate Creator and Sustainer. The verse emphasizes that Allah alone possesses absolute power and control over all creation.
orig: قل لو كان معه آلهة كما يقولون إذا لابتغوا إلى ذي العرش سبيلا

translation: Exalted is He and high above what they say with great sublimity.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the greatness and exalted nature of Allah, beyond what people may say or think about Him. It denotes the transcendent and majestic nature of Allah, who is far above any imperfections or limitations that humans might attribute to Him. It serves as a reminder of the infinite superiority and perfection of Allah over all else.
orig: سبحانه وتعالى عما يقولون علوا كبيرا

translation: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [ Allah ] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all of creation, including the heavens, the earth, and everything in them, glorify and praise Allah constantly. The verse suggests that everything in the universe is in a state of worship and praise towards Allah in ways that are beyond human comprehension. It reminds us that even if we may not fully grasp how all things praise Allah, we should still acknowledge and appreciate the magnificence of this universal praise. Additionally, it highlights the attributes of Allah as the Most Forbearing and the Most Forgiving.
orig: تسبح له السماوات السبع والأرض ومن فيهن وإن من شيء إلا يسبح بحمده ولكن لا تفقهون تسبيحهم إنه كان حليما غفورا

translation: And when you recite the Quran, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an unseen barrier.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power of the Qur'an to create a separation between those who believe in the Hereafter and those who do not. It signifies the spiritual and ideological barrier that is established through the divine guidance and wisdom of the Qur'an, distinguishing the believers from the disbelievers.
orig: وإذا قرأت القرآن جعلنا بينك وبين الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة حجابا مستورا
