translation: And We have placed coverings over their hearts, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some individuals have hardened their hearts to the message of the Qur'an, making them resistant to understanding and accepting it. Their rejection is symbolized by their aversion to hearing about Allah and His teachings. It emphasizes the importance of approaching the Qur'an with an open heart and mind to truly comprehend its message.
orig: وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإذا ذكرت ربك في القرآن وحده ولوا على أدبارهم نفورا

translation: We know best what they say when they listen to you, and when they conspire in private, when the wrongdoers say, 'You are only following a man who is bewitched.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that Allah is fully aware of the thoughts and intentions of people, even when they speak in secret. The verse also exposes the baseless accusations made by the wrongdoers who try to discredit the Prophet Muhammad by claiming he is under a magic spell, showing the desperation and tactics of those who reject the message of Islam.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يستمعون به إذ يستمعون إليك وإذ هم نجوى إذ يقول الظالمون إن تتبعون إلا رجلا مسحورا

translation: See how they strike for you parables; they have gone astray, and cannot find a way.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting how disbelievers may try to discredit the Prophet by mocking and creating false representations of him. Despite their efforts, they have deviated from the right path and are unable to find the truth or guidance. It serves as a reminder of the futility of those who oppose the message of Islam and try to undermine it through falsehoods.
orig: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الأمثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا

translation: And they say, 'When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected in a new creation?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the doubt some people have about the concept of resurrection and life after death. The disbelievers questioned whether it was possible to be resurrected anew after turning into mere bones and dust. The verse serves to remind believers of the power of Allah to recreate and resurrect them, emphasizing the certainty of life after death.
orig: وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Say, 'Be stones or iron'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is a command to the disbelievers who are stubborn and refuse to accept the message of the Prophet. It is emphasizing that no matter how rigid or unyielding they are in their disbelief, it will not hinder the truth or affect the ultimate victory of Islam. The comparison to stones or iron is meant to highlight the futility of their resistance against the divine truth.
orig: قل كونوا حجارة أو حديدا

translation: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." So they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and greatness of Allah as the Creator, who has the ability to bring forth any creation, including that which is great within the hearts of people. The questioning of when resurrection will happen underscores the uncertainty of human existence and the need for faith and patience in the promise of the Hereafter.
orig: أو خلقا مما يكبر في صدوركم فسيقولون من يعيدنا قل الذي فطركم أول مرة فسينغضون إليك رءوسهم ويقولون متى هو قل عسى أن يكون قريبا

translation: The day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the power and authority of Allah, describing a scene where on the Day of Judgment, all beings will be called by Him and they will respond in praise and recognition of His greatness. It indicates that on that day, people will realize how short their worldly life was and how insignificant it was compared to the eternal life that follows.
orig: يوم يدعوكم فتستجيبون بحمده وتظنون إن لبثتم إلا قليلا

translation: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed, Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of speaking kindly and using gentle words. It also warns against the whisperings and divisive tactics of Satan, who aims to sow discord among people. It reminds us to be aware of Satan's enmity towards mankind and to strive for unity and goodness in our interactions.
orig: وقل لعبادي يقولوا التي هي أحسن إن الشيطان ينزغ بينهم إن الشيطان كان للإنسان عدوا مبينا

translation: Your Lord knows you well. If He wills, He will have mercy on you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you as a guardian over them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-knowing nature of God, who knows His creation intimately. It acknowledges the power of God to either show mercy or deliver punishment, depending on His will. It also reminds Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that his role is to convey the message of God to the people, but not to control their actions or decisions.
orig: ربكم أعلم بكم إن يشأ يرحمكم أو إن يشأ يعذبكم وما أرسلناك عليهم وكيلا

translation: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have favored some prophets over others, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has knowledge of all that is in the heavens and the earth, and that He has chosen and favored some prophets over others. It also specifically mentions that Prophet David (Dawood) was given the book of Psalms (Zabur). This serves as a reminder of the divine wisdom in Allah's distribution of knowledge and blessings among His prophets.
orig: وربك أعلم بمن في السماوات والأرض ولقد فضلنا بعض النبيين على بعض وآتينا داوود زبورا

translation: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of invoking only Allah in times of need and seeking help directly from Him. It highlights the reality that those false deities people worship have no power to protect or assist them in times of distress or to ease their difficulties. It serves as a reminder of the importance of placing trust in Allah alone and not in anything or anyone else.
orig: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دونه فلا يملكون كشف الضر عنكم ولا تحويلا

translation: Those they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who seek closeness to Allah by calling upon intermediaries or intercessors, hoping for Allah's mercy and fearing His punishment. It highlights the importance of seeking a direct relationship with Allah, acknowledging His mercy, and being mindful of His punishment.
orig: أولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون إلى ربهم الوسيلة أيهم أقرب ويرجون رحمته ويخافون عذابه إن عذاب ربك كان محذورا

translation: And there is no community but We shall destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe torment. That is written in the Book (of decrees).
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate authority and power of Allah over all communities. It serves as a warning that those who deviate from the path of righteousness and commit evil deeds will face the consequences either in this world or in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of accountability for one's actions and the divine justice that will be served on the Day of Resurrection. The verse reminds believers to uphold righteousness and seek forgiveness to avoid facing severe punishment.
orig: وإن من قرية إلا نحن مهلكوها قبل يوم القيامة أو معذبوها عذابا شديدا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا

translation: And nothing has prevented Us from sending [this message] with signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the reason signs and miracles were sent by God in the past was to guide people and warn them of the consequences of their actions. However, many people in the past, like the people of Thamud, rejected and harmed these signs, leading to their own downfall. The verse highlights the importance of recognizing and following the signs of God as a means of guidance and reminder.
orig: وما منعنا أن نرسل بالآيات إلا أن كذب بها الأولون وآتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها وما نرسل بالآيات إلا تخويفا

translation: And [remember] when We said to you, 'Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people.' And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the cursed tree mentioned in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
interpretation: This verse is reminding that Allah's knowledge and power are all-encompassing. The references to the sight shown to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) being a trial for people and the cursed tree mentioned in the Qur'an highlight that tests and warnings are given to guide people towards righteousness. However, some individuals only respond to these warnings and trials with increased disobedience and transgression.
orig: وإذ قلنا لك إن ربك أحاط بالناس وما جعلنا الرؤيا التي أريناك إلا فتنة للناس والشجرة الملعونة في القرآن ونخوفهم فما يزيدهم إلا طغيانا كبيرا

translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He said, 'Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?'
interpretation: This verse narrates the incident when God commanded the angels to prostrate to Adam out of respect and honor for him being the pinnacle of creation. While the angels obeyed God's command and prostrated, Iblis (Satan) refused, displaying his arrogance and disbelief. Iblis refused not due to his origin being different but due to his pride and refusal to submit to God's will.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس قال أأسجد لمن خلقت طينا

translation: He (Satan) said, 'Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You respite me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely seize and mislead his descendants, except a few.'
interpretation: In this verse, Satan expresses his resentment towards Adam, whom Allah honored above him. He vows to mislead Adam's descendants if he is given respite until the Day of Resurrection, showing his enmity and determination to lead astray as many of humanity as possible.
orig: قال أرأيتك هذا الذي كرمت علي لئن أخرتن إلى يوم القيامة لأحتنكن ذريته إلا قليلا

translation: He will say, "Go away, along with any of them that follow you! Your reward is Hell, a fitting recompense."
interpretation: This verse is a warning indicating that those who lead others astray will bear the responsibility for their followers as well. It highlights the severe punishment awaiting those who misguide others, stating that Hell is the appropriate recompense for such actions.
orig: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فإن جهنم جزاؤكم جزاء موفورا

translation: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing how Satan tries to deceive and mislead people by luring them with material wealth, power, and false promises. It warns against falling for the temptations and false assurances of Satan, as they are nothing but deceit and illusions.
orig: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك وأجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم في الأموال والأولاد وعدهم وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا

translation: Indeed, My servants - you have no authority over them, and sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that no one has control or authority over the true servants of God except God Himself. It emphasizes the ultimate power and sovereignty of God over His creation, reassuring believers that they are under His protection and guidance. It serves as a reminder to trust in God's plan and to rely on Him in all matters.
orig: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان وكفى بربك وكيلا

translation: Your Lord is the one who propels the ships for you through the sea, so that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever Merciful towards you.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who facilitates the movement of ships on the sea for the benefit of mankind. It emphasizes the importance of seeking Allah's blessings and provisions, as well as His continuous mercy and compassion towards his creation.
orig: ربكم الذي يزجي لكم الفلك في البحر لتبتغوا من فضله إنه كان بكم رحيما

translation: And when distress touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He saves you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights how people may call upon various entities in times of distress, yet it is ultimately Allah who rescues them. However, once they are saved and reach safety, they often forget Him and turn away, showing ingratitude. It serves as a reminder to maintain faith and gratitude towards Allah in both times of adversity and ease.
orig: وإذا مسكم الضر في البحر ضل من تدعون إلا إياه فلما نجاكم إلى البر أعرضتم وكان الإنسان كفورا

translation: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that no one is immune to the power and might of Allah. It warns against becoming complacent and heedless of His immense ability to bring about sudden and unexpected changes in the world that could lead to destruction or disaster. It emphasizes the importance of always being conscious of Allah's power and remaining humble and devout in the face of potential calamities.
orig: أفأمنتم أن يخسف بكم جانب البر أو يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا

translation: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it another time and then send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment. It warns against feeling secure or complacent in this world, as one may face trials and tribulations in the afterlife for disbelief or wrongdoing. The imagery of a hurricane of wind drowning the disbelievers highlights the severity of the consequences of rejecting faith and serves as a call to reflect on one's actions and beliefs before it is too late.
orig: أم أمنتم أن يعيدكم فيه تارة أخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا

translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the special status and honor given to human beings by Allah. It mentions how humans are provided with sustenance and are given preference over many other creations. It highlights the responsibility and blessings bestowed upon humans by their Creator, urging them to be grateful and recognize their elevated status among all of Allah's creations.
orig: ولقد كرمنا بني آدم وحملناهم في البر والبحر ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا

translation: On the Day We will call every people with their imam. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the Day of Judgment, where every individual will be presented with their deeds. Those who receive a record of their good deeds in their right hand will be filled with joy and gratitude, as they will be rewarded without the slightest injustice. This verse emphasizes the absolute justice of Allah on that Day, where every individual will receive their due without any unfairness or mistreatment.
orig: يوم ندعو كل أناس بإمامهم فمن أوتي كتابه بيمينه فأولئك يقرءون كتابهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا

translation: And whoever is blind in this [world] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance in this world, as it will have consequences in the Hereafter. It highlights that those who are spiritually blind in this life, who fail to see the signs of God and follow His guidance, will remain blind in the Hereafter, deprived of the light and truth that leads to salvation. Such individuals will be led further astray and away from the right path in the afterlife due to their own choices in this world.
orig: ومن كان في هذه أعمى فهو في الآخرة أعمى وأضل سبيلا

translation: And they almost tempted you away from what We revealed to you in order to fabricate something else in Our name. And then they would have made you a close friend.
interpretation: This verse warns the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of those who may try to lead him away from the revelations he received from Allah, so as to make him fabricate teachings other than what Allah had commanded. The verse highlights the importance of staying steadfast in faith and not succumbing to false influences or temptations that lead one away from the truth.
orig: وإن كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذي أوحينا إليك لتفتري علينا غيره وإذا لاتخذوك خليلا

translation: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) remained resolute and dedicated to delivering the message of Islam, despite the challenges and opposition he faced. It signifies the importance of divine support in maintaining steadfastness in the face of adversity.
orig: ولولا أن ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن إليهم شيئا قليلا

translation: Then We would have made you taste double punishment in life and double punishment after death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that those who reject God's guidance and assistance will face the consequences of their actions both in this life and in the hereafter. It warns that turning away from God's guidance can lead to experiencing hardship and punishment both in this world and in the afterlife, ultimately highlighting the importance of seeking assistance and guidance from Allah.
orig: إذا لأذقناك ضعف الحياة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا

translation: And they had almost tempted you away from the land to expel you from it. But then, they would not have stayed [there] after you, except for a little.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the constant struggle and opposition that prophets face from those who reject their message. It suggests that the disbelievers may try to drive away or remove the prophet from his land, but in reality, their influence and dominance would only be temporary. This verse conveys the idea that ultimately, the truth and the message of the prophet will prevail, and the disbelievers will not have lasting success in their attempts to thwart the divine message.
orig: وإن كادوا ليستفزونك من الأرض ليخرجوك منها وإذا لا يلبثون خلافك إلا قليلا

translation: A tradition with those of Our messengers whom We sent before you. And you will not find any alteration in Our tradition.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consistency in the message brought by the messengers of Allah throughout history. It assures believers that the core message of monotheism and moral values remains unchanged and immutable, regardless of the different times and peoples to whom it was revealed. It encourages the believers to trust in the continuity and integrity of the divine message.
orig: سنة من قد أرسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا

translation: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing the prayer at specific times during the day, from the decline of the sun until nightfall, and specifically highlighting the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn. It serves as a reminder to believers to maintain their connection with Allah through prayer and recitation of the Qur'an, especially during these special times.
orig: أقم الصلاة لدلوك الشمس إلى غسق الليل وقرآن الفجر إن قرآن الفجر كان مشهودا

translation: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of the night prayer (Tahajjud) as an optional act of worship that one can perform in the latter part of the night. The verse suggests that by engaging in this night prayer, one may attain a high and honored position in the Hereafter, as a reward from Allah. It indicates the importance of striving for excellence in worship and seeking nearness to Allah through voluntary acts of devotion and dedication.
orig: ومن الليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى أن يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا

translation: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking help and guidance from Allah in every aspect of life. It is a supplication asking for Allah's assistance in navigating through life with honesty and integrity, seeking success in all endeavors, and seeking His support and protection against any challenges that may arise.
orig: وقل رب أدخلني مدخل صدق وأخرجني مخرج صدق واجعل لي من لدنك سلطانا نصيرا

translation: And say, "The truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed, falsehood is ever bound to depart."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the triumph of truth over falsehood. It signifies that falsehood is inherently fragile and transient, destined to perish, while truth prevails and endures. It reminds believers to remain steadfast in the face of falsehood, as the truth will ultimately prevail and falsehood will be easily defeated.
orig: وقل جاء الحق وزهق الباطل إن الباطل كان زهوقا

translation: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an serves as a source of healing and mercy for those who believe in it. It is meant to guide and comfort the believers, providing spiritual nourishment and solutions to their problems. However, for those who persist in wrongdoing and refuse to follow its guidance, the Qur'an serves as a reminder of their loss and misguidance.
orig: وننزل من القرآن ما هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا

translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the behavior of humans when they experience blessings and hardships. It highlights how people tend to neglect Allah's gifts and turn away from Him during times of ease but turn to Him desperately seeking His help and mercy during times of distress. It serves as a reminder to be grateful during times of prosperity and to seek guidance and protection from Allah during times of adversity.
orig: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه وإذا مسه الشر كان يئوسا

translation: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."
interpretation: This verse reminds us that everyone has their own way of living, believing, and acting. Allah, our Lord, knows best who is truly guided and on the right path, so we should trust in His wisdom and guidance.
orig: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلا

translation: And they ask you about the soul. Say, 'The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And you have not been given of knowledge except a little.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the limited knowledge that humans possess compared to the vast knowledge and wisdom of Allah. It emphasizes that the nature and essence of the soul are among the hidden matters that only Allah fully understands. It serves as a reminder of the importance of trusting in the wisdom and knowledge of Allah, even when faced with questions that may be beyond human comprehension.
orig: ويسألونك عن الروح قل الروح من أمر ربي وما أوتيتم من العلم إلا قليلا

translation: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah, stating that if He wished, He could erase or abolish the revelations given to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). This highlights the ultimate control and sovereignty of Allah over His creations, emphasizing the need for submission and reliance on Him alone.
orig: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي أوحينا إليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا

translation: Except as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has been great.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that any blessings or mercy one receives is solely due to the mercy and favor of Allah. It serves as a reminder to show gratitude for the abundance of blessings that come as a result of Allah's immense favor upon an individual.
orig: إلا رحمة من ربك إن فضله كان عليك كبيرا

translation: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and challenges humanity and jinn to come together to produce something similar to it, but they are unable to do so. It highlights the unique and incomparable eloquence, depth, and guidance found in the Qur'an, and how it stands as a divine revelation that cannot be replicated by any creation.
orig: قل لئن اجتمعت الإنس والجن على أن يأتوا بمثل هذا القرآن لا يأتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا

translation: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But most of the people refuse [anything] except disbelief.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an contains various examples and lessons for people to reflect upon and learn from. However, many people stubbornly refuse to accept these teachings and instead choose to disbelieve. It emphasizes the importance of being open-minded and willing to accept guidance from the Qur'an.
orig: ولقد صرفنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا

translation: And they say, 'We will never believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness of disbelievers who demand unreasonable proofs before they believe in the message. It serves as a reminder that faith is not built solely on miracles or extraordinary signs, but on sincerity and belief in the unseen.
orig: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الأرض ينبوعا

translation: Or [you may choose] to have a garden of date-palms and grapes, and cause rivers to gush forth within it in overflowing abundance,
interpretation: This verse presents a beautiful image of one of the rewards in paradise that awaits the believers - a garden filled with date-palms and grapes, with rivers flowing abundantly through it. It is a depiction of the lushness and splendor of the paradise promised to those who follow the path of righteousness.
orig: أو تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الأنهار خلالها تفجيرا

translation: Or the heaven will fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]
interpretation: This verse from the Quran presents a rhetorical challenge to the disbelievers, questioning whether they expect the sky to fall in pieces upon them as they claim, or whether they anticipate Allah and the angels to come before them. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority and power of Allah, and highlights the disbelief and arrogance of those who challenge the signs of Allah.
orig: أو تسقط السماء كما زعمت علينا كسفا أو تأتي بالله والملائكة قبيلا

translation: Either you have a house adorned with gold or you ascend into the sky, and [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a written authority we may read.' Say, 'Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the obstinate nature of the disbelievers who demand extraordinary signs and miracles as proof of the Prophet's authenticity, even suggesting impossible feats like ascending into the heavens. The response emphasizes that the Prophet Muhammad is only a human messenger, and his purpose is to convey the message of Allah, not to perform miracles to satisfy the whims of those who refuse to believe.
orig: أو يكون لك بيت من زخرف أو ترقى في السماء ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتابا نقرؤه قل سبحان ربي هل كنت إلا بشرا رسولا

translation: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, 'Has Allah sent a human as a messenger?'
interpretation: This verse highlights a common obstacle faced by people when it comes to accepting guidance from Allah. It points out that sometimes individuals struggle to believe in a message of guidance because they perceive messengers of Allah as merely human beings, questioning the choice of a human being as a messenger of God. The verse serves as a reminder to focus on the message itself regardless of the messenger delivering it, emphasizing the importance of recognizing and accepting divine guidance when it is presented.
orig: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى إلا أن قالوا أبعث الله بشرا رسولا

translation: Say, if there were angels on earth walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as a messenger.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the point that if angels were to walk securely on earth, they too would be in need of guidance and support from a higher authority. It highlights the ultimate authority of Allah and the necessity of guidance and messengers for all beings, even angels.
orig: قل لو كان في الأرض ملائكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السماء ملكا رسولا

translation: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed, He is ever Aware and Seer of His servants."
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate knowledge and awareness of Allah, who is sufficient as a witness in all matters. It emphasizes that nothing is hidden from Him and that He comprehends everything about His servants. Therefore, believers should be conscious of their actions, knowing that Allah is fully aware of all that they do.
orig: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides, We increase them in blazing fire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine guidance and misguidance. It highlights that only Allah can guide people to the right path, and those who are led astray by Him will find no protectors besides Allah. It describes the fate of those who are misguided, being gathered on the Day of Resurrection in a state of blindness, deafness, and speechlessness, and their destiny is Hell where they will face an increasing torment. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and staying on the right path to avoid the punishment of Hellfire.
orig: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم أولياء من دونه ونحشرهم يوم القيامة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما مأواهم جهنم كلما خبت زدناهم سعيرا

translation: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, 'When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected in a new creation?'
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment awaiting those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and question the concept of resurrection. It highlights the significance of faith in the afterlife and the accountability for one's deeds.
orig: ذلك جزاؤهم بأنهم كفروا بآياتنا وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is [the one] able to create the like of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse except disbelief.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to create anything He wills. It serves as a reminder that just as Allah has created the heavens and the earth, He is fully capable of creating human beings and all other creatures. The verse also warns the wrongdoers (the disbelievers) who reject the signs of Allah, that their denial will lead to nothing but ingratitude and disbelief, despite the clear evidence of His existence and power.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض قادر على أن يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم أجلا لا ريب فيه فأبى الظالمون إلا كفورا

translation: Say, 'If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending.' And ever has man been stingy.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the nature of human beings to sometimes hesitate to give charity or spend in the way of Allah due to fear of poverty or loss. It serves as a reminder that true generosity and trust in Allah's provision should overcome the attachment to material possessions.
orig: قل لو أنتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي إذا لأمسكتم خشية الإنفاق وكان الإنسان قتورا

translation: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them, and Pharaoh said to him, 'Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic.'
interpretation: This verse describes the confrontation between Prophet Moses and Pharaoh, where Pharaoh dismisses Moses's signs of God's power as mere magic. The verse showcases the persistent arrogance and disbelief of Pharaoh towards the signs and messages of God, despite their clear and miraculous nature. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and stubbornness in the face of undeniable truth and guidance.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى تسع آيات بينات فاسأل بني إسرائيل إذ جاءهم فقال له فرعون إني لأظنك يا موسى مسحورا

translation: He said, 'I know what you do not know; it is Allah who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. He alone is the All-Seeing. And indeed, I think you, Pharaoh, are a ruined man.'
interpretation: This verse speaks to the arrogance and delusion of Pharaoh when faced with the Truth. The Pharaoh, in his pride and disbelief, failed to recognize the true power and authority lies with Allah. The verse highlights that knowledge and insight ultimately come from Allah, and Pharaoh's false sense of power will lead to his downfall and ruin.
orig: قال لقد علمت ما أنزل هؤلاء إلا رب السماوات والأرض بصائر وإني لأظنك يا فرعون مثبورا

translation: So he wanted to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of Pharaoh (Fir'awn) who wanted to oppress and harm the followers of Prophet Musa (Moses) and drive them out of their land. However, as a consequence of his arrogance and transgressions, Allah punished Pharaoh by drowning him and his army in the sea during the time of Prophet Moses, showcasing the ultimate power and justice of Allah over those who oppose His guidance and tyrannize His servants.
orig: فأراد أن يستفزهم من الأرض فأغرقناه ومن معه جميعا

translation: And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel, 'Dwell securely in the land of promise.' And when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass, We shall bring you all, as a motley crowd.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the temporary nature of worldly life and possessions, encouraging the Children of Israel to live in the land peacefully while emphasizing that the true promise and gathering will be in the Hereafter. It reminds them that the final abode and gathering will be in the Hereafter where all will be brought together despite their diverse backgrounds and statuses.
orig: وقلنا من بعده لبني إسرائيل اسكنوا الأرض فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا

translation: And with the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has come down. And We have not sent you [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine origin and truth of the Qur'an, emphasizing the importance of its message. It also reassures Prophet Muhammad of his role as a messenger, tasked with conveying glad tidings of reward for the believers and warning of the consequences for those who reject the message.
orig: وبالحق أنزلناه وبالحق نزل وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا

translation: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gradual revelation of the Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), emphasizing the importance of reciting it to the people over time. It also shows the meticulous planning of Allah in revealing the Qur'an in stages, suited to the specific needs and circumstances of the community at that time.
orig: وقرآنا فرقناه لتقرأه على الناس على مكث ونزلناه تنزيلا

translation: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, fall upon their faces in prostration,"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of knowledge in recognizing the truth of the Quran. Those who possess knowledge and understanding of the message of the Quran are deeply affected by its recitation, acknowledging the truth and submitting themselves in prostration. It highlights the power and impact of true knowledge in opening hearts and guiding individuals towards faith and humility.
orig: قل آمنوا به أو لا تؤمنوا إن الذين أوتوا العلم من قبله إذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للأذقان سجدا

translation: And they say, 'Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the believers acknowledging the fulfillment of Allah's promise and expressing their gratitude and glorification for Him. It emphasizes the certainty and reliability of the promises made by Allah and the significance of recognizing His power and faithfulness.
orig: ويقولون سبحان ربنا إن كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا

translation: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of true believers who turn to their Lord in humility and submission, so overwhelmed with reverence and awe that they fall down in prostration and weep. This behavior reflects their deep connection with Allah, their recognition of His greatness, and their sincere repentance and supplication. The more they reflect on the magnificence of Allah and His blessings, the more humble and reverent they become.
orig: ويخرون للأذقان يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا

translation: Say, 'Call upon Allah, or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names.' And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] silently but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that one can call upon Allah using any of His beautiful names and attributes, and that a balance should be maintained in the way prayers are recited - not too loud nor too silent, but in a moderate tone. It serves as a reminder to maintain a balanced and moderate approach in worship and communication with the Divine.
orig: قل ادعوا الله أو ادعوا الرحمن أيا ما تدعوا فله الأسماء الحسنى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا

translation: And say: Praise be to Allah, Who has not taken unto Himself a son, and Who has no partner in the Sovereignty, nor has He any protecting friend through dependence. And magnify Him with all magnificence.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness and uniqueness of Allah, highlighting that He has no offspring or partners, and that He is not in need of any protectors or allies. It instructs believers to praise and glorify Allah, recognizing His unmatched sovereignty and magnificence.
orig: وقل الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك ولم يكن له ولي من الذل وكبره تكبيرا

translation: All praise is due to Allah, who has sent down to His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.
interpretation: This verse praises Allah for sending down His Book (the Qur'an) to His servant (Prophet Muhammad) without any error or deviation. It emphasizes the perfection and guidance found in the Qur'an, highlighting that it is a clear and straight path without any crookedness or distortion, serving as a source of guidance for believers.
orig: الحمد لله الذي أنزل على عبده الكتاب ولم يجعل له عوجا

translation: To warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual function of the Qur'an: as a warning of severe consequences for those who deviate from the righteous path, and as a promise of glad tidings to the believers who perform good deeds, assuring them of a beautiful reward awaiting them in the Hereafter.
orig: قيما لينذر بأسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا حسنا

translation: They will abide therein forever.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who will remain in Hell eternally as a punishment for their rejection of God and His guidance. It signifies the severity and permanence of the punishment for those who consciously choose to reject the truth and live a life of disobedience to God.
orig: ماكثين فيه أبدا

translation: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of warning those who associate partners with Allah or claim that Allah has offspring. Such beliefs are considered major sins in Islam as they contradict the oneness of Allah and His uniqueness as the supreme and ultimate creator of everything, with no need for offspring or partners.
orig: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا

translation: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their forefathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance of those who speak falsehood about matters they have no knowledge of, following the falsehood of their forefathers. It condemns the act of spreading lies as a serious offense, emphasizing the importance of speaking the truth and seeking knowledge before making claims.
orig: ما لهم به من علم ولا لآبائهم كبرت كلمة تخرج من أفواههم إن يقولون إلا كذبا

translation: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
interpretation: This verse reflects the deep concern and grief Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) felt for the disbelievers who rejected the message of Islam. It shows the Prophet's intense desire for their guidance and belief, to the extent that it weighs heavily on his heart. It serves as a reminder of the Prophet's compassion and dedication to guiding people towards the truth.
orig: فلعلك باخع نفسك على آثارهم إن لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث أسفا

translation: Indeed, We have made whatever is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the material world being a form of adornment and a test for human beings. It emphasizes that the true measure of a person's worth is in their deeds and actions, encouraging individuals to strive for excellence and righteousness in their conduct despite the distractions and attractions of the worldly possessions around them.
orig: إنا جعلنا ما على الأرض زينة لها لنبلوهم أيهم أحسن عملا

translation: And We will make what is upon it [into] a barren ground.
interpretation: This verse indicates that everything will come to an end and be transformed into a barren land. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of worldly possessions and the fleeting nature of life, encouraging believers to focus on the eternal and prepare for the Hereafter.
orig: وإنا لجاعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا

translation: Or do you think that the companions of the cave and the inscription were among Our signs a wonder?
interpretation: This verse questions the mindset of people who are surprised by the story of the sleepers of the cave and the inscription, reminding them that the signs of Allah's power and mercy are numerous and can be seen in various miraculous events.
orig: أم حسبت أن أصحاب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من آياتنا عجبا

translation: When the young men sought refuge in the cave, they said, 'Our Lord, grant us mercy from Yourself, and guide us rightly in our affairs.'
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of the young men who sought refuge in a cave to preserve their faith. With deep faith and reliance on Allah, they ask Him for His mercy and guidance in their affairs. The verse highlights the significance of seeking Allah's assistance and guidance in times of difficulty and uncertainty.
orig: إذ أوى الفتية إلى الكهف فقالوا ربنا آتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من أمرنا رشدا

translation: So We sealed upon their ears in the cave for a number of years.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the sleepers of the cave who slept for many years while being protected and preserved by Allah. It symbolizes the concept of divine protection and miraculous occurrences that can happen to those who have faith and are devoted to God.
orig: فضربنا على آذانهم في الكهف سنين عددا

translation: Then We sent them to ascertain which of the two groups could better calculate the period of time for which they had stayed.
interpretation: This verse highlights a test that was given to a group of people to see who among them could better estimate or calculate the amount of time they had spent in a particular situation. It signifies the importance of knowledge, precision, and intelligence in making judgments and decisions.
orig: ثم بعثناهم لنعلم أي الحزبين أحصى لما لبثوا أمدا

translation: We relate to you their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
interpretation: This verse talks about the story of the believing youths who held firmly to their faith in Allah despite facing challenges and persecution. It is a reminder that belief in Allah can bring about increased guidance and strength in times of difficulty.
orig: نحن نقص عليك نبأهم بالحق إنهم فتية آمنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى

translation: And We will firmly establish their hearts when they stood up and said, 'Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken in error then.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the unwavering conviction of the believers when they affirm that there is no God but Allah. It emphasizes the importance of staying steadfast in faith and rejecting the worship of anything or anyone else besides the one true God. The verse shows the believers' recognition of the grave error and disbelief in associating partners with Allah, reflecting their commitment to sincere monotheism.
orig: وربطنا على قلوبهم إذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السماوات والأرض لن ندعو من دونه إلها لقد قلنا إذا شططا

translation: These are our people who have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of associating partners with Allah, which is considered a great injustice. It questions the logic of worshiping other deities besides Allah when those deities cannot bring forth any clear evidence or authority. The verse emphasizes the seriousness of falsely attributing lies to Allah, implying that such actions are among the gravest injustices one can commit.
orig: هؤلاء قومنا اتخذوا من دونه آلهة لولا يأتون عليهم بسلطان بين فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا

translation: And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave; your Lord will spread out His mercy for you and will make your affair easy for you.
interpretation: This verse speaks about seeking refuge in Allah when faced with adversity or when surrounded by disbelief and idolatry. By withdrawing from such negative influences and turning to Allah, He will shower His mercy upon you and make your situation easier for you to handle. It highlights the importance of seeking solace and guidance from Allah in times of trouble.
orig: وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا الله فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من أمركم مرفقا

translation: And you would have thought them awake while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have run away from them in flight and been filled with fear of them.
interpretation: This verse describes the story of the People of the Cave, who sought refuge in a cave away from persecution and were granted a miraculous sleep that lasted for many years. The verse emphasizes the power and control of Allah over all things, including time, as He protected the believers during their time of need. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to guide those who seek His guidance and to lead astray those who choose to reject it.
orig: وترى الشمس إذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين وإذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم في فجوة منه ذلك من آيات الله من يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا

translation: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turn them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with overwhelming terror.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and control of Allah over His creation, as He is able to manipulate circumstances to serve His purpose. It also highlights the concept of 'unseen' forces at work, as there are deeper layers to reality that may not be immediately apparent to people. The verse urges reflection on the unseen aspects of existence and the consequences of disbelief or disobedience to God's guidance.
orig: وتحسبهم أيقاظا وهم رقود ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال وكلبهم باسط ذراعيه بالوصيد لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا

translation: And thus We raised them that they might question one another. A speaker among them said, 'How long have you remained here?' They said, 'We have remained a day or part of a day.' They said, 'Your Lord is most knowledgeable about how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him look for the food that is purest and bring you provision from it. And let him be cautious and let no one be aware of you.'
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of a group of youths who were asleep in a cave for a long period of time. When they woke up, they were uncertain about how long they had been asleep. They decided to send one of them with money to buy food from the city without drawing attention to themselves. The verse illustrates the trust and reliance on God's knowledge and guidance in their actions, showing the importance of wisdom and cautiousness in dealing with worldly matters.
orig: وكذلك بعثناهم ليتساءلوا بينهم قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم قالوا ربكم أعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا أحدكم بورقكم هذه إلى المدينة فلينظر أيها أزكى طعاما فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم أحدا

translation: If they should come upon you, they would stone you or force you to return to their religion. And you will never succeed, then, ever.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to the believers to be cautious of external threats and pressures that may lead them away from their faith. It highlights the importance of remaining steadfast in one's beliefs, even in the face of adversity, and not succumbing to the attempts of others to deter them from their religion. The verse emphasizes that true success lies in staying committed to one's faith and not compromising one's beliefs under any circumstances.
orig: إنهم إن يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم أو يعيدوكم في ملتهم ولن تفلحوا إذا أبدا

translation: And thus We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, 'Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them.' Said those who prevailed in the matter, 'We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of the people of the cave and how they were discovered centuries later as a sign and reminder of the truth of Allah's promise and the certainty of the coming of the Hour of Judgment. It also portrays the disputes among people regarding their story, reflecting human tendencies towards doubt and differing opinions. Ultimately, it showcases the power and authority of Allah by demonstrating that those who have faith and righteousness eventually prevail and establish a place of worship over the site of the people of the cave.
orig: وكذلك أعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا أن وعد الله حق وأن الساعة لا ريب فيها إذ يتنازعون بينهم أمرهم فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنيانا ربهم أعلم بهم قال الذين غلبوا على أمرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا

translation: They say, "There were three of them, their dog being the fourth," and they say, "There were five of them, with their dog as the sixth." As they conjecture, and they say, "There were seven of them, their dog being the eighth." Say, "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators]."
interpretation: This verse sheds light on the story of the People of the Cave and emphasizes that certain matters are known only to Allah. It warns against indulging in unnecessary debates and speculations about obscure details that are beyond human comprehension. It stresses the importance of acknowledging the limits of human knowledge and avoiding fruitless disputes over matters that are not essential to our faith.
orig: سيقولون ثلاثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم قل ربي أعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم إلا قليل فلا تمار فيهم إلا مراء ظاهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم أحدا

translation: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow".
interpretation: This verse reminds us not to procrastinate or delay doing good deeds or fulfilling our responsibilities. It serves as a reminder that we should live in the present moment and not assume that we have tomorrow to do what is required of us. It encourages promptness and diligence in fulfilling our obligations and striving towards righteousness.
orig: ولا تقولن لشيء إني فاعل ذلك غدا

translation: Except [when Allah wills]. And remember your Lord when you forget and say, 'Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering Allah even when we forget, and trusting in His guidance. It encourages humility and seeking guidance from Allah when we are unsure, showing faith in His wisdom to lead us to the right path.
orig: إلا أن يشاء الله واذكر ربك إذا نسيت وقل عسى أن يهدين ربي لأقرب من هذا رشدا

translation: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years, and exceeded by nine.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the People of the Cave who sought refuge in a cave to preserve their faith. Allah granted them a long sleep that lasted three hundred years, protecting them from persecution and allowing their faith to remain intact. By mentioning 'exceeded by nine,' it signifies that their resurrection after this period was not exactly 300 years, but slightly more, emphasizing the miraculous nature of their story.
orig: ولبثوا في كهفهم ثلاث مائة سنين وازدادوا تسعا

translation: Say, "Allah knows best how long they stayed. To Him belongs the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth. How well He sees and hears! They have no protector besides Him, and He makes no one share in His rule."
interpretation: Allah is omniscient and all-knowing about the duration of their stay on earth. The unseen realms of the heavens and the earth are under His exclusive knowledge and control. His awareness, vision, and hearing are perfect. No one can protect them except Him, and His sovereignty is absolute without any partners.
orig: قل الله أعلم بما لبثوا له غيب السماوات والأرض أبصر به وأسمع ما لهم من دونه من ولي ولا يشرك في حكمه أحدا

translation: And recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changing His words, and you will never find in other than Him a refuge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reciting and reflecting on the Qur'an as it is the direct revelation from Allah. It also highlights the immutability of Allah's words, indicating that the guidance provided in the Qur'an is unalterable. The verse further asserts that there is no true refuge or protection to be found outside of Allah, emphasizing the absolute need for reliance on Him.
orig: واتل ما أوحي إليك من كتاب ربك لا مبدل لكلماته ولن تجد من دونه ملتحدا

translation: And be patient, [O Muhammad], with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.
interpretation: This verse teaches the importance of patience and perseverance in the face of those who are devoted to their worship of Allah, seeking His pleasure day and night. It emphasizes that worldly distractions should not divert one's attention from the sincere believers who are focused on spiritual growth. Additionally, it warns against following those who have been led astray from the remembrance of Allah due to their own desires and neglect, indicating the importance of adhering to the right path and avoiding sinful influences.
orig: واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ولا تعد عيناك عنهم تريد زينة الحياة الدنيا ولا تطع من أغفلنا قلبه عن ذكرنا واتبع هواه وكان أمره فرطا

translation: Say, "The truth is from your Lord." So whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve. Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds their faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of free will in matters of belief and disbelief. It highlights that each person has the choice to believe in the truth from their Lord or to disbelieve. The verse also describes the severe punishment awaiting the wrongdoers in the afterlife, indicating that they will be surrounded by fire and provided with a tormenting drink. It serves as a warning to those who engage in wrongdoing and reject the truth.
orig: وقل الحق من ربكم فمن شاء فليؤمن ومن شاء فليكفر إنا أعتدنا للظالمين نارا أحاط بهم سرادقها وإن يستغيثوا يغاثوا بماء كالمهل يشوي الوجوه بئس الشراب وساءت مرتفقا

translation: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - indeed, We do not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine promise of rewarding those who believe in God and perform good deeds. It assures believers that their efforts will not be in vain and that every good deed will be recognized and rewarded by Allah. It serves as a source of motivation for believers to continue doing good and highlights the mercy and justice of Allah in rewarding faith and righteousness.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات إنا لا نضيع أجر من أحسن عملا

translation: For them will be Gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and goodly is the resting-place.
interpretation: This verse describes the rewards and blessings that await the believers in paradise. It details the luxurious and beautiful environment of Jannah (Paradise), such as flowing rivers, golden bracelets, green garments made of fine silk and brocade, and comfortable couches. It emphasizes the greatness of the reward reserved for the righteous and the beauty of the place of rest in the afterlife.
orig: أولئك لهم جنات عدن تجري من تحتهم الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ويلبسون ثيابا خضرا من سندس وإستبرق متكئين فيها على الأرائك نعم الثواب وحسنت مرتفقا

translation: And present to them an example: two men. We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.
interpretation: This verse is presenting a parable that highlights the concept of gratitude and the varying responses of individuals when bestowed with blessings from Allah. The two men in the example symbolize different types of people: one who is grateful and appreciative of the blessings of Allah, while the other is ungrateful and arrogant. The blessings bestowed upon them represent the different provisions and favors that Allah grants to people. The parable serves as a reminder to appreciate and be thankful for the blessings we have been given, as gratitude is a sign of faith and humility.
orig: واضرب لهم مثلا رجلين جعلنا لأحدهما جنتين من أعناب وحففناهما بنخل وجعلنا بينهما زرعا

translation: Both gardens produced its food and did not wrong them in anything. And We caused a river to gush forth in their midst.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the divine justice and blessings bestowed upon believers. It emphasizes that the gardens provided abundant sustenance without depriving the believers of anything, highlighting God's fairness and generosity. The mention of the river flowing through the gardens symbolizes the continuous blessings and prosperity provided by God to those who follow His guidance.
orig: كلتا الجنتين آتت أكلها ولم تظلم منه شيئا وفجرنا خلالهما نهرا

translation: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, 'I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates a moment of arrogance and pride in material possessions and worldly status. The man boasting about his wealth and power to his companion is a reminder of the dangers of arrogance and how material possessions can blind a person from the true source of blessings and purpose in life.
orig: وكان له ثمر فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره أنا أكثر منك مالا وأعز نفرا

translation: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, 'I do not think that this will perish ever.'
interpretation: This verse depicts a person who is arrogant and unjust, thinking that his wealth and success will never come to an end. It serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and gratitude, and the transient nature of worldly possessions. It warns against pride and the belief in one's own self-sufficiency, emphasizing the impermanence of material wealth and the ultimate accountability before God.
orig: ودخل جنته وهو ظالم لنفسه قال ما أظن أن تبيد هذه أبدا

translation: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be returned to my Lord, indeed, I will find with Him better than it as a return.
interpretation: This verse highlights the certainty of the Day of Judgment and the belief in the Hereafter. It conveys the message that believers should have faith in the promise of a better return to their Lord, even if they may doubt the occurrence of the Hour. It encourages believers to trust in Allah's wisdom and mercy, assuring them that their ultimate return to Him will be far better than anything in this worldly life.
orig: وما أظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رددت إلى ربي لأجدن خيرا منها منقلبا

translation: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, 'Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then proportioned you as a man?'
interpretation: This verse questions the arrogance and ingratitude of individuals who deny the existence of the Creator even though they were created from simple substances like dust and a sperm-drop. It highlights how Allah, the Creator, has carefully and precisely fashioned human beings.
orig: قال له صاحبه وهو يحاوره أكفرت بالذي خلقك من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم سواك رجلا

translation: But He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the monotheistic belief in the oneness of Allah and the rejection of associating partners with Him. The speaker declares that Allah is their only Lord, and they do not ascribe any partners to Him. It serves as a reminder of the importance of pure monotheism in the Islamic faith.
orig: لكنا هو الله ربي ولا أشرك بربي أحدا

translation: And why did you not, when you entered your garden, say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah'? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of acknowledging Allah's will and power in all aspects of life. It teaches humility and gratitude by reminding believers that all outcomes are ultimately determined by Allah. It also highlights that material wealth and worldly possessions should not be the measure of one's success or piety in the eyes of Allah.
orig: ولولا إذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شاء الله لا قوة إلا بالله إن ترن أنا أقل منك مالا وولدا

translation: Perhaps my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground.
interpretation: This verse portrays the story of a man who boasted about his garden and was warned by his companion not to be ungrateful to God, for God has the power to replace his garden with something even better. The verse teaches the lesson of humility, gratitude, and the transient nature of worldly possessions, reminding us to be thankful for what we have and not boast about it, as it can easily be taken away by God's will.
orig: فعسى ربي أن يؤتين خيرا من جنتك ويرسل عليها حسبانا من السماء فتصبح صعيدا زلقا

translation: Or [lest] it become like a mirage - so you would be unable to find it.
interpretation: This verse is warning against the fleeting nature of material possessions and the temporary nature of worldly pleasures. Just like a mirage in the desert that disappears when you get closer, the pursuit of material wealth and worldly desires can be deceptive and ultimately unfulfilling. It serves as a reminder to prioritize seeking the eternal rewards of the Hereafter over the temporary pleasures of this world.
orig: أو يصبح ماؤها غورا فلن تستطيع له طلبا

translation: And wealth will be surrounded by him in the morning and he will be turning his hands all about over what he had spent therein while it will be bare on thrones. And he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of material attachment and the regret that may come with associating partners with Allah. It highlights the transient nature of worldly possessions and the realization that true contentment lies in devotion to the one true God.
orig: وأحيط بثمره فأصبح يقلب كفيه على ما أنفق فيها وهي خاوية على عروشها ويقول يا ليتني لم أشرك بربي أحدا

translation: And he will not have company to help him other than Allah, nor will he be helped.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and support being only from Allah. It highlights that no one can truly help or support a person if Allah does not will it. It serves as a reminder of the importance of relying on Allah alone for assistance and guidance.
orig: ولم تكن له فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان منتصرا

translation: There is the authority for Allah, the Truth. He is the Best for reward and the Best for the final end.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate authority of Allah and highlights that turning to Him for guidance and obedience leads to the best rewards in this life and the Hereafter. It signifies that submitting to the will of Allah not only brings about the best outcomes in this world but also guarantees ultimate success and goodness in the afterlife.
orig: هنالك الولاية لله الحق هو خير ثوابا وخير عقبا

translation: And present to them an example of the life of this world: [it is] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, competent.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an offers a metaphorical comparison of the transient nature of worldly life to rain that descends from the sky. Just like rain that nourishes the earth and causes plants to grow, this world is a place where humans experience growth and opportunities. However, eventually, everything in this world, like the dry remnants scattered by the wind, will come to an end. The verse reminds believers that the power and control lie with Allah, who is capable of determining the fate of all things.
orig: واضرب لهم مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء أنزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض فأصبح هشيما تذروه الرياح وكان الله على كل شيء مقتدرا

translation: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the temporary nature of wealth and children in this worldly life, highlighting that they are merely adornments and not the ultimate goal of a believer. It encourages believers to focus on performing good deeds that have a lasting impact and are pleasing to the Lord, as they hold a greater reward and hope for the future.
orig: المال والبنون زينة الحياة الدنيا والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير أملا

translation: And [mention] the Day We will procession the mountains and you will see the earth prominent and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when all creatures will be brought before Allah, and even the mountains will be in motion. On this day, no one will be left out or ignored, and every soul will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: ويوم نسير الجبال وترى الأرض بارزة وحشرناهم فلم نغادر منهم أحدا

translation: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], 'You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a time when all beings will be gathered in front of Allah for judgment in an orderly manner. It mentions how humans will be brought back to life after death just as they were originally created, and how some people had doubted or denied the concept of a resurrection and accountability in the Hereafter.
orig: وعرضوا على ربك صفا لقد جئتمونا كما خلقناكم أول مرة بل زعمتم ألن نجعل لكم موعدا

translation: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, 'Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?' And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the deeds of all individuals will be presented before them. The wrongdoers will be filled with fear and regret upon seeing their actions written down comprehensively in the Book of Deeds. They will acknowledge the accuracy and justness of the record, realizing that nothing they did, no matter how small or significant, has been overlooked. The verse ends with a reassurance that on that Day, no one will be treated unjustly by their Lord.
orig: ووضع الكتاب فترى المجرمين مشفقين مما فيه ويقولون يا ويلتنا مال هذا الكتاب لا يغادر صغيرة ولا كبيرة إلا أحصاها ووجدوا ما عملوا حاضرا ولا يظلم ربك أحدا

translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the moment when God commanded the angels to prostrate to Adam, and they all obeyed except for Iblis (Satan), who refused due to his arrogance. The verse warns against taking Satan and his followers as allies or protectors instead of God, as they are enemies to humanity. It highlights the consequences of siding with wrongdoers and straying from the path of righteousness.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس كان من الجن ففسق عن أمر ربه أفتتخذونه وذريته أولياء من دوني وهم لكم عدو بئس للظالمين بدلا

translation: I did not create them, the heavens and the earth, nor their own selves, and I was not one to take misleaders as helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that Allah is the Creator of all things, including the heavens, the earth, and the people themselves. It emphasizes that Allah does not need any assistance or support from those who lead others astray, as He is the ultimate source of creation and guidance.
orig: ما أشهدتهم خلق السماوات والأرض ولا خلق أنفسهم وما كنت متخذ المضلين عضدا

translation: And [mention] the Day when He will say, "Call those 'partners' of Mine whom you claimed." So they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them, and We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the Day of Judgment, where those who worshipped false deities alongside Allah will be called upon to summon those deities they associated with Him. However, these false deities will be powerless and unresponsive. Allah will set a barrier between them and their worshippers, illustrating the futility of associating partners with Him and emphasizing the unity and ultimate power of Allah.
orig: ويوم يقول نادوا شركائي الذين زعمتم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وجعلنا بينهم موبقا

translation: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.
interpretation: This verse describes how the criminals will see the punishment of the Fire in the Hereafter and will realize that they are destined to enter it, with no way of escape. It emphasizes the certainty and inevitability of divine justice for those who persist in wrongdoing and reject the guidance of God.
orig: ورأى المجرمون النار فظنوا أنهم مواقعوها ولم يجدوا عنها مصرفا

translation: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example, but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive nature of the Qur'an, which contains various examples and teachings for the guidance of humanity. However, despite the clarity of the messages, human beings have shown a tendency towards disputes and disagreements, often failing to heed the guidance provided to them.
orig: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القرآن للناس من كل مثل وكان الإنسان أكثر شيء جدلا

translation: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that nothing should prevent people from believing in Allah and seeking forgiveness when guidance is presented to them. However, sometimes people are deterred due to the fear of facing the consequences endured by those who came before them. The verse emphasizes the importance of not allowing past experiences or the fear of punishment to hinder one's faith and repentance.
orig: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى ويستغفروا ربهم إلا أن تأتيهم سنة الأولين أو يأتيهم العذاب قبلا

translation: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of messengers sent by Allah, who are tasked with delivering glad tidings to the believers and warning the disbelievers. It also mentions the behavior of those who reject the message, resorting to falsehood in their arguments and mocking the warnings and signs of Allah. The verse emphasizes the significance of messengers in conveying the truth and the consequences faced by those who deny it.
orig: وما نرسل المرسلين إلا مبشرين ومنذرين ويجادل الذين كفروا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق واتخذوا آياتي وما أنذروا هزوا

translation: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and deafness in their ears. And if you invite them to guidance, they will never be guided, then - ever.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unjustness of those who turn away from the signs and reminders of their Lord, forgetting the actions they have committed. It describes a state of spiritual blindness and deafness that prevents them from understanding and following the guidance. It emphasizes that even if they are called towards the right path, they will persist in their misguided ways.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن ذكر بآيات ربه فأعرض عنها ونسي ما قدمت يداه إنا جعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإن تدعهم إلى الهدى فلن يهتدوا إذا أبدا

translation: And your Lord is the Forgiving, the Possessor of Mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. But for them is an appointed time from which they will find no refuge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of Allah, highlighting that if He were to immediately punish people for their sins, no one would be spared. The verse reassures that Allah has appointed a time for judgment, and no one will escape from His justice.
orig: وربك الغفور ذو الرحمة لو يؤاخذهم بما كسبوا لعجل لهم العذاب بل لهم موعد لن يجدوا من دونه موئلا
