translation: And those towns - We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We made an appointed time for their destruction.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the destruction of communities in the past was a consequence of their wrongdoing and injustice. It serves as a warning that those who transgress and harm others will face consequences for their actions, and that there is a predetermined time for accountability and judgement for their deeds.
orig: وتلك القرى أهلكناهم لما ظلموا وجعلنا لمهلكهم موعدا

translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, 'I will not give up [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the determination and resolve of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) as he sets out on a challenging journey with unwavering faith and perseverance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of steadfastness and dedication in the pursuit of achieving noble goals, even in the face of great obstacles and uncertainties.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لفتاه لا أبرح حتى أبلغ مجمع البحرين أو أمضي حقبا

translation: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey."
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an tells the story of Prophet Moses and his companion when they reached a certain point and Moses realized they had forgotten their fish, which they were to eat. It highlights that human forgetfulness is a natural trait but also a reminder of our vulnerability and dependence on Allah. The verse invites reflection on the importance of seeking sustenance and help from God, even in moments of forgetfulness or distress.
orig: فلما بلغا مجمع بينهما نسيا حوتهما فاتخذ سبيله في البحر سربا

translation: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, 'Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Moses and his servant on a journey. It highlights the human aspect of the Prophet, showing his fatigue and hunger after a long journey. Despite being a prophet, he faced challenges and discomforts just like any other human being. The verse emphasizes the physical and emotional toll of travel, reminding believers that prophets were also tested in different ways.
orig: فلما جاوزا قال لفتاه آتنا غداءنا لقد لقينا من سفرنا هذا نصبا

translation: He said, 'Have you seen when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) when he became impatient and left his people before he was commanded to do so. As a consequence, he was swallowed by a fish. Here, Prophet Yunus expresses his regret for forgetting the fish which was actually a sign from God. The verse reminds us of the importance of patience and trust in God's plan, even when facing difficult situations.
orig: قال أرأيت إذ أوينا إلى الصخرة فإني نسيت الحوت وما أنسانيه إلا الشيطان أن أذكره واتخذ سبيله في البحر عجبا

translation: He said, 'Such is that which we have been seeking.' So they turned back, retracing their footsteps.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the signs and lessons of the past. It highlights the idea that sometimes the answer or the truth we seek may be found by revisiting and reflecting on what is already known. It encourages us to look back at the stories and experiences of those before us to gain wisdom and guidance for our own lives.
orig: قال ذلك ما كنا نبغ فارتدا على آثارهما قصصا

translation: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.
interpretation: This verse talks about a servant of Allah who was bestowed with Allah's mercy and was granted a specific knowledge from Allah. It highlights the importance of divine favor and knowledge in the life of a believer, emphasizing the significance of seeking knowledge as a means of attaining closeness to Allah.
orig: فوجدا عبدا من عبادنا آتيناه رحمة من عندنا وعلمناه من لدنا علما

translation: Moses said to him, 'May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me some of the knowledge that you have been taught?'
interpretation: This verse portrays Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) seeking knowledge and guidance from a wise man, demonstrating humility and eagerness to learn. It emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance from those who are more knowledgeable, signifying the value of humility in the pursuit of wisdom.
orig: قال له موسى هل أتبعك على أن تعلمن مما علمت رشدا

translation: He said, 'You will never be able to be patient with me.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a situation where one person doubts the patience of another in the face of a difficult or challenging circumstance. It conveys a message about human limitations and the different levels of patience individuals may possess in dealing with trials or hardships.
orig: قال إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا

translation: And how will you endure [with patience] what you have not encompassed in knowledge?
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to have patience and endurance in the face of the unknown and the unseen. It teaches that it is natural to face challenges and uncertainties in life, but true faith and trust in Allah requires patience in the face of such situations, and to accept that not everything can be fully comprehended or understood by human knowledge alone.
orig: وكيف تصبر على ما لم تحط به خبرا

translation: He said, 'You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order.'
interpretation: This verse reflects Prophet Ibrahim's words of commitment and obedience to Allah's command. It shows his strong faith, trust, and submission to the will of Allah, even under difficult circumstances. It serves as a reminder of the importance of patience, obedience, and trust in facing challenges as a believer.
orig: قال ستجدني إن شاء الله صابرا ولا أعصي لك أمرا

translation: He said, 'If you should follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is highlighting the importance of following guidance without questioning or doubting it. It teaches that trust and obedience to the guidance provided by the Prophet (peace be upon him) is essential, and that one should refrain from asking unnecessary questions that may lead to doubt or confusion. It emphasizes the need for faith and patience in following the teachings without constantly seeking clarification on every detail.
orig: قال فإن اتبعتني فلا تسألني عن شيء حتى أحدث لك منه ذكرا

translation: So they set out, and when they embarked on the ship, he made a hole in it. Moses said, 'Have you made a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done something grievous.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a story where Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) was accompanied by a wise man on a journey. The wise man seemingly caused damage to a ship, prompting Moses to question his actions. The interpretation can be understood as a lesson in trust in divine wisdom, as what seemed like a destructive act by the wise man turned out to be guided by a higher purpose unperceived by Moses at that moment.
orig: فانطلقا حتى إذا ركبا في السفينة خرقها قال أخرقتها لتغرق أهلها لقد جئت شيئا إمرا

translation: He said, 'Did I not say to you that with me you would never have patience?'
interpretation: This verse reflects a moment of frustration or impatience, where one party expresses disbelief or disappointment in the other's inability to remain patient or steadfast in a difficult situation. It serves as a reminder of the challenges of maintaining patience, particularly in the face of adversity or hardship.
orig: قال ألم أقل إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا

translation: He said, 'Do not hold me accountable for what I forgot, and do not burden me with difficulty in my matter.'
interpretation: This verse portrays the humility and repentance of a person asking for forgiveness for their forgetfulness and seeking ease in their affairs. It teaches us to acknowledge our mistakes, seek forgiveness, and pray for relief from hardships, showing reliance on Allah's mercy and compassion.
orig: قال لا تؤاخذني بما نسيت ولا ترهقني من أمري عسرا

translation: So they set out, until when they met a boy, he killed him. [Moses] said, 'Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly come to a grave thing.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates the story of Prophet Moses encountering a righteous boy who was unjustly killed by the companion he was traveling with. Moses' reaction reflects his distress and condemnation of the murder of an innocent soul. The verse emphasizes the sanctity of life and the severity of committing such a grave sin. It serves as a reminder of the importance of upholding justice and respecting the sanctity of all lives.
orig: فانطلقا حتى إذا لقيا غلاما فقتله قال أقتلت نفسا زكية بغير نفس لقد جئت شيئا نكرا

translation: He said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
interpretation: This verse showcases a moment when Prophet Musa (Moses) expresses his frustration at his companion for not being able to endure a difficult situation as he had foreseen. It highlights the importance of patience in facing challenges and tests in life, reminding believers of the necessity to persevere and trust in Allah's plan despite hardships.
orig: قال ألم أقل لك إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا

translation: He said, 'If I ask you about anything after this, do not keep me in your company. You have received more than enough excuses from me.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of setting boundaries in relationships. It teaches that it is important to acknowledge when someone needs space or time alone, and to respect their request for privacy or solitude. It serves as a reminder that sometimes it is necessary to give others space, even if it may be difficult or inconvenient for us.
orig: قال إن سألتك عن شيء بعدها فلا تصاحبني قد بلغت من لدني عذرا

translation: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidhr restored it. [Moses] said, 'If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment.'
interpretation: This verse describes a story from the Qur'an where Moses and al-Khidhr encountered a town whose people refused to offer them hospitality. Al-Khidhr then repaired a wall in the town despite not receiving any material compensation for his good deed. The verse teaches about the importance of kindness and doing good deeds without expecting anything in return, and that true generosity comes from the heart without a desire for reward.
orig: فانطلقا حتى إذا أتيا أهل قرية استطعما أهلها فأبوا أن يضيفوهما فوجدا فيها جدارا يريد أن ينقض فأقامه قال لو شئت لاتخذت عليه أجرا

translation: He said, "This is the parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where two individuals have reached a point of parting ways. One of them is expressing his intent to reveal the interpretation of a matter to the other, acknowledging that the other may not have had the patience to wait for the knowledge or understanding beforehand. It can serve as a reminder of the importance of patience in seeking knowledge and understanding, and how sometimes parting ways can lead to new revelations and clarity.
orig: قال هذا فراق بيني وبينك سأنبئك بتأويل ما لم تستطع عليه صبرا

translation: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So, I intended to make it defective. And there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an recounts a story about a ship owned by poor individuals that was intentionally damaged by someone. The ship and its owners represent vulnerability and poverty. The verse highlights the unfairness of the situation, where a powerful king unjustly seizes ships belonging to others. It serves as a reminder of the importance of justice and compassion towards those who are less fortunate, as well as a warning against those who misuse their power to oppress others.
orig: أما السفينة فكانت لمساكين يعملون في البحر فأردت أن أعيبها وكان وراءهم ملك يأخذ كل سفينة غصبا

translation: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of protecting the faith and well-being of believers, even if it involves taking drastic measures to prevent harm or corruption from infiltrating the community. It also serves as a reminder of the responsibility parents have towards their children in guiding them towards righteousness and protecting them from negative influences.
orig: وأما الغلام فكان أبواه مؤمنين فخشينا أن يرهقهما طغيانا وكفرا

translation: So We intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates the concept that when Allah takes something away from a person, He replaces it with something better and more beneficial. It emphasizes the mercy and wisdom of Allah in His dealings with His creation, reassuring believers that hardships are often opportunities for growth and betterment.
orig: فأردنا أن يبدلهما ربهما خيرا منه زكاة وأقرب رحما

translation: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and beneath it was a treasure for them, and their father was righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.
interpretation: This verse speaks about a wall that belonged to two orphan boys containing a hidden treasure, and their father was a righteous man. It was God's plan that the boys would grow to maturity and retrieve the treasure as a mercy from Him. The verse emphasizes that everything that transpired was based on God's will and divine plan, beyond human control or understanding.
orig: وأما الجدار فكان لغلامين يتيمين في المدينة وكان تحته كنز لهما وكان أبوهما صالحا فأراد ربك أن يبلغا أشدهما ويستخرجا كنزهما رحمة من ربك وما فعلته عن أمري ذلك تأويل ما لم تسطع عليه صبرا

translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, 'I will recite to you about him a report.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific story regarding a figure named Dhul-Qarnayn mentioned in the Qur'an. The interpretation revolves around the story of Dhul-Qarnayn and the lessons that can be derived from it, such as dedication to faith, righteousness, and the importance of using power and influence for good purposes.
orig: ويسألونك عن ذي القرنين قل سأتلو عليكم منه ذكرا

translation: Indeed, We gave him power on the earth and granted him means to everything.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the immense power and authority bestowed upon a particular individual by God on Earth, providing them with the means to access and control everything they need. It serves as a reminder of God's unique ability to elevate and empower whom He chooses, reinforcing His role as the ultimate bestower of blessings and capabilities.
orig: إنا مكنا له في الأرض وآتيناه من كل شيء سببا

translation: So follow a way
interpretation: This verse is encouraging believers to follow a path or a way towards righteousness and obedience to Allah. It emphasizes the importance of following the guidance provided in the Qur'an and the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in order to maintain a steadfast and righteous life.
orig: فأتبع سببا

translation: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of black muddy (or hot) water. Near it he found a people. Allah said, 'O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish them or else you adopt among them behavior of kindness.'
interpretation: This verse narrates a story about Dhul-Qarnayn, a figure mentioned in the Qur'an who was given great power and knowledge by Allah. In this specific incident, when Dhul-Qarnayn reached a certain place, he witnessed a unique natural phenomenon that seemed unusual and perhaps even perplexing. The essence of this story lies in the guidance and advice that Allah granted Dhul-Qarnayn regarding how to deal with the people he encountered - he was given the choice to either punish them for their deeds or to treat them with kindness and respect. This episode serves as a reminder that even when facing challenging situations or unfamiliar circumstances, it is crucial to act with wisdom, justice, and compassion, guided by the principles of morality and righteousness.
orig: حتى إذا بلغ مغرب الشمس وجدها تغرب في عين حمئة ووجد عندها قوما قلنا يا ذا القرنين إما أن تعذب وإما أن تتخذ فيهم حسنا

translation: As for those who do wrong, We will punish them, then they will be returned to their Lord, and He will punish them with a terrible punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability and justice in Islam. It conveys that those who commit injustice will face punishment for their actions. It serves as a warning to wrongdoers to remind them that ultimately they will be held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. The verse reflects the belief in divine justice, emphasizing that no act of oppression or wrongdoing will go unpunished, as God will ensure justice is served in the end.
orig: قال أما من ظلم فسوف نعذبه ثم يرد إلى ربه فيعذبه عذابا نكرا

translation: But as for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them is the best reward, and we will speak to them of our command in ease.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of reward for those who believe in God and act virtuously. It assures the believers of a great reward from God and promises to guide them in matters with ease.
orig: وأما من آمن وعمل صالحا فله جزاء الحسنى وسنقول له من أمرنا يسرا

translation: Then followed a way
interpretation: This verse signifies the importance of following a clear path or way in life. It emphasizes the significance of guidance and direction, suggesting that believers should follow a specified course towards righteousness and truth, rather than wandering aimlessly without a purpose.
orig: ثم أتبع سببا

translation: Until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
interpretation: This verse describes the story of Dhul-Qarnayn who traveled to the west and then to the east of the Earth. When he reached the easternmost point, he found a group of people who were not protected from the sun's intense heat physically or metaphorically. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's power and control over all things, highlighting the importance of seeking protection and guidance from Him alone.
orig: حتى إذا بلغ مطلع الشمس وجدها تطلع على قوم لم نجعل لهم من دونها سترا

translation: And thus, We have encompassed all that he has in knowledge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the comprehensive knowledge and awareness that Allah possesses. It highlights the fact that Allah is all-knowing and fully aware of everything, including all that a person has or does.
orig: كذلك وقد أحطنا بما لديه خبرا

translation: Then he pursued a way
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who continued to follow a certain path or course of action. It can be understood as a reminder to stay steadfast and committed to a chosen path or goal, regardless of obstacles or distractions.
orig: ثم أتبع سببا

translation: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of black muddy (or hot) water. Near it he found a people. We said, “O Khidr, you have done an unusual thing.
interpretation: This verse (Qur'an 18:86) tells the story of Prophet Musa (Moses) and Khidr. Khidr's action of making a hole in the ship they were on might have seemed strange and harmful to Musa, but it was part of a greater plan and wisdom known to Khidr. It teaches us that sometimes we may not understand the wisdom behind an action, but we should trust that there is a higher purpose beyond our immediate understanding.
orig: حتى إذا بلغ بين السدين وجد من دونهما قوما لا يكادون يفقهون قولا

translation: They said, 'O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?'
interpretation: In this verse, people are seeking help from Dhul-Qarnayn, acknowledging the mischief caused by Gog and Magog on earth. They propose setting up a barrier as a means of protection. This verse highlights the importance of seeking solutions to prevent corruption and chaos in society.
orig: قالوا يا ذا القرنين إن يأجوج ومأجوج مفسدون في الأرض فهل نجعل لك خرجا على أن تجعل بيننا وبينهم سدا

translation: He said, 'That in which my Lord has established me is better, so help me with strength; I will make between you and them a barrier.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the story of a righteous man, who, when faced with a situation where he felt threatened by those around him, relied on the strength and support from Allah to protect himself. It teaches us the importance of trust in Allah and seeking His assistance when faced with challenges, as well as the idea of setting boundaries to protect oneself from harm.
orig: قال ما مكني فيه ربي خير فأعينوني بقوة أجعل بينكم وبينهم ردما

translation: Bring me pieces of iron. Until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]". Until, when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."
interpretation: This verse illustrates the story of Prophet Solomon (Sulaiman) from the Qur'an where he was able to control and manipulate natural elements under the will of Allah. It showcases his knowledge and command over different elements, as well as his ability to use them for accomplishing great tasks and achieving supernatural feats. It serves as a reminder of the power and miracles that Allah granted to His prophets, and the importance of using knowledge and resources in obedience to Allah's commands.
orig: آتوني زبر الحديد حتى إذا ساوى بين الصدفين قال انفخوا حتى إذا جعله نارا قال آتوني أفرغ عليه قطرا

translation: So they were unable to produce it and were confounded.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inability of the disbelievers to produce anything like the Qur'an, which is a linguistic and literary miracle. Despite their efforts to discredit or challenge the Qur'an, they failed miserably and were left bewildered and confounded by its unmatched eloquence and power.
orig: فما اسطاعوا أن يظهروه وما استطاعوا له نقبا

translation: He (Moses) said, 'This is a mercy from my Lord, but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true.'
interpretation: This verse is referring to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) expressing gratitude for the mercy from Allah in the form of the staff that turned into a serpent. Moses acknowledges it as a blessing from his Lord. However, he also points out that when the promised punishment or event from his Lord occurs, it will happen without exception, emphasizing the certainty and truthfulness of Allah's promises. The verse highlights the concept of trust in Allah's plans and the fulfillment of His promises.
orig: قال هذا رحمة من ربي فإذا جاء وعد ربي جعله دكاء وكان وعد ربي حقا

translation: And We caused some of them to surge against others on the Day of Resurrection, and the Horn will be blown, then We will gather them all together.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Resurrection when the Trumpet will be blown, causing a tumultuous gathering of all creatures, where each will be in a state of confusion and distress, ultimately being gathered before their Lord for judgement.
orig: وتركنا بعضهم يومئذ يموج في بعض ونفخ في الصور فجمعناهم جمعا

translation: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Hell will be presented vividly to the unbelievers as a reality, a place of punishment and retribution for those who rejected faith and disobeyed Allah's commandments.
orig: وعرضنا جهنم يومئذ للكافرين عرضا

translation: Those whose eyes had been within a cover from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people who are heedless and neglectful of remembering Allah. Their hearts and minds are veiled from the remembrance of Allah, and they are unable to truly hear and understand the guidance and wisdom in the words of Allah. It highlights the importance of actively engaging in the remembrance of Allah to avoid falling into spiritual negligence and ignorance.
orig: الذين كانت أعينهم في غطاء عن ذكري وكانوا لا يستطيعون سمعا

translation: Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants as protectors instead of Me? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of disbelievers seeking protection or guidance from anyone or anything other than Allah. It highlights the ultimate consequence of disbelief, which is severe punishment in Hell. It serves as a warning and a reminder that true guidance and protection can only come from Allah, and associating partners with Him is a grave mistake that will lead to eternal suffering in the Hereafter.
orig: أفحسب الذين كفروا أن يتخذوا عبادي من دوني أولياء إنا أعتدنا جهنم للكافرين نزلا

translation: Say, "Shall we inform you of the greatest losers in respect to [their] deeds?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the concept of loss and highlighting those whose actions will lead to ultimate failure and loss. It serves as a reminder to reflect on one's deeds and ensure they are aligned with what is beneficial in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: قل هل ننبئكم بالأخسرين أعمالا

translation: Those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the consequences of being misguided in one's pursuits in this worldly life. It highlights the misguided efforts of those who think they are doing good but in reality are lost and misguided. It serves as a warning against being deluded by false perceptions of success and goodness in this world, and instead advises focus on righteousness and true success in the eyes of Allah.
orig: الذين ضل سعيهم في الحياة الدنيا وهم يحسبون أنهم يحسنون صنعا

translation: Those are the ones who have disbelieved in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any weight.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him. Their deeds will hold no value, and they will have no standing on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of faith and belief in recognizing and honoring the signs of Allah during one's lifetime.
orig: أولئك الذين كفروا بآيات ربهم ولقائه فحبطت أعمالهم فلا نقيم لهم يوم القيامة وزنا

translation: That is their recompense, Hell, for having denied the truth and taken My messages and My messengers in mockery.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of those who disbelieve and mock the signs and messengers of Allah. It emphasizes that Hell is the retribution for such actions, serving as a warning to those who reject the truth and do not take the guidance provided by Allah seriously.
orig: ذلك جزاؤهم جهنم بما كفروا واتخذوا آياتي ورسلي هزوا

translation: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the close connection between belief in God and the practice of good deeds. It indicates that those who sincerely believe in God and demonstrate this belief through their actions will be rewarded with the highest level of paradise, known as Jannat al-Firdous. The verse serves as a reminder that faith and deeds go hand in hand, and that true faith is reflected in one's conduct and behavior.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات كانت لهم جنات الفردوس نزلا

translation: Abiding therein eternally, they will not desire from it any transfer.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the inhabitants of paradise, who will remain there forever without any desire to leave. It signifies the perfect contentment and satisfaction that they will experience in paradise, with no wish for change or relocation.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يبغون عنها حولا

translation: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the infinite nature of Allah's words and knowledge, asserting that even if all the seas were turned into ink to write His words, they would run out before His knowledge and wisdom. It signifies the boundless nature of Allah's wisdom and the impossibility of fully comprehending His greatness.
orig: قل لو كان البحر مدادا لكلمات ربي لنفد البحر قبل أن تنفد كلمات ربي ولو جئنا بمثله مددا

translation: Say, "I am only a human like you, to whom it has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the equality of all human beings and the oneness of God. It encourages people to do good deeds and worship God alone without associating partners with Him. It highlights the importance of faith and righteous actions in preparing for the meeting with God in the Hereafter.
orig: قل إنما أنا بشر مثلكم يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فمن كان يرجو لقاء ربه فليعمل عملا صالحا ولا يشرك بعبادة ربه أحدا

translation: Kaf Ha Ya 'Ayn Sad
interpretation: This verse is from the Quran and is known as a combination of isolated (Muqatta'at) letters. These letters are believed to have a mysterious and hidden meaning known only to Allah. Scholars have different interpretations regarding these letters, but the exact meaning is known only to Allah.
orig: كهيعص

translation: Mention, [O Muhammad], the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah.
interpretation: This verse encourages the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to remember and highlight the mercy of Allah towards His servant Zechariah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of acknowledging and reflecting upon the mercy and blessings of Allah upon His servants.
orig: ذكر رحمت ربك عبده زكريا

translation: When his Lord called out to him in a secluded voice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special and intimate relationship between a person and their Lord. It signifies the personal and private nature of communication between an individual and the divine. It exemplifies how Allah calls upon His servants in a gentle and subtle manner, emphasizing the closeness and individual attention that each believer receives from their Creator.
orig: إذ نادى ربه نداء خفيا

translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy."
interpretation: This verse reflects the words of Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) as he supplicated to Allah despite facing challenges. It shows his humility, faith, and reliance on Allah, as he acknowledges his physical weakness and old age, yet remains steadfast in his devotion and prayer.
orig: قال رب إني وهن العظم مني واشتعل الرأس شيبا ولم أكن بدعائك رب شقيا

translation: And I fear my kinsmen after me, and my wife is barren. So give me from Yourself an heir,
interpretation: This verse is from the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) praying to Allah for a righteous heir, as his fear of his kinsmen and his wife's infertility made him pray for a righteous successor from Allah.
orig: وإني خفت الموالي من ورائي وكانت امرأتي عاقرا فهب لي من لدنك وليا

translation: He will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleased.
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Yahya (John the Baptist) and how he will inherit the knowledge and wisdom from his predecessors (including Prophet Zakariya) and bring joy to his Lord. It reminds us of the concept of passing down knowledge and blessings through generations, as well as the importance of seeking the pleasure of Allah in all our actions.
orig: يرثني ويرث من آل يعقوب واجعله رب رضيا

translation: O Zachariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an conveys the story of the good news given to the Prophet Zakariya (Zachariah) of the birth of his son Yahya (John). It emphasizes the uniqueness of the name 'Yahya,' indicating that this name has not been given to anyone before. The verse highlights the special nature of this child and serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to bring about miracles and fulfill His promises.
orig: يا زكريا إنا نبشرك بغلام اسمه يحيى لم نجعل له من قبل سميا

translation: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Zakariya expresses his astonishment and disbelief at the news of having a son in his old age, considering the barrenness of his wife and his advanced age. It shows his vulnerability and human nature, questioning the possibility of such a miracle. However, this verse also demonstrates that Allah's power transcends the limitations of human understanding, and He can bring about miracles even in the most unlikely situations.
orig: قال رب أنى يكون لي غلام وكانت امرأتي عاقرا وقد بلغت من الكبر عتيا

translation: He said, "Thus it shall be; your Lord said: 'It is easy for Me, and indeed I created you before, when you were nothing.'"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ease of Allah's ability to create and bring things into existence. It highlights the fact that Allah created human beings even when they were nothing, demonstrating His supreme power and authority as the Creator.
orig: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين وقد خلقتك من قبل ولم تك شيئا

translation: He said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture."
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of Prophet Zachariah (peace be upon him) asking Allah for a sign, and the sign was that he would be unable to speak to people for three days except through gestures. This incident serves as a reminder that signs from Allah are not always grand miracles but can be simple things that serve as clear messages for believers.
orig: قال رب اجعل لي آية قال آيتك ألا تكلم الناس ثلاث ليال سويا

translation: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of remembering and glorifying Allah at all times, specifically in the morning and evening. It is a reminder for believers to engage in regular acts of worship and remembrance throughout the day.
orig: فخرج على قومه من المحراب فأوحى إليهم أن سبحوا بكرة وعشيا

translation: O John, take the Book with determination.' And We gave him wisdom while [he was still] a child.
interpretation: This verse is addressing John the Baptist, instructing him to hold firmly to the Book and emphasizing that he was granted wisdom even in his young age. It signifies the importance of steadfastness in faith and the divine wisdom granted by Allah to His chosen messengers from a very young age.
orig: يا يحيى خذ الكتاب بقوة وآتيناه الحكم صبيا

translation: and kindness from Us and purity, and he was righteous.
interpretation: This verse describes a person who is characterized by kindness, purity, and righteousness, which are qualities that are bestowed by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of showing compassion and righteousness in one's actions and behavior towards others as a way to attain closeness to Allah.
orig: وحنانا من لدنا وزكاة وكان تقيا

translation: And be good to [one's] parents, and do not be disobedient to them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating one's parents with kindness and respect, and not rebelling against them. It is a reminder to honor and care for one's parents, regardless of their behavior, as a way to maintain family harmony and fulfill one's duty towards them.
orig: وبرا بوالديه ولم يكن جبارا عصيا

translation: And peace be upon him on the day he was born, and on the day he dies, and on the day he is raised alive.
interpretation: This verse expresses the prayer for peace and blessings upon a specific individual, indicating the significant moments of his life: his birth, his death, and the day he will be resurrected. It emphasizes the importance of invoking peace and blessings upon this individual at key moments in his life journey.
orig: وسلام عليه يوم ولد ويوم يموت ويوم يبعث حيا

translation: And mention in the Book, Mary, when she withdrew from her family to an eastern place.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Mary in the Qur'an when she secluded herself in a remote eastern location. It highlights Mary's piety, dedication to worship, and her submission to God's will. Mary's seclusion symbolizes her devotion and seeking closeness to Allah through worship.
orig: واذكر في الكتاب مريم إذ انتبذت من أهلها مكانا شرقيا

translation: So she took a barrier from them. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Maryam (Mary) in the Qur'an when she withdrew from her people and was approached by the Angel Jibreel (Gabriel). The verse highlights the miraculous encounter between Maryam and the angel, who appeared to her in the form of a handsome man. It showcases the divine intervention and the extraordinary nature of the event.
orig: فاتخذت من دونهم حجابا فأرسلنا إليها روحنا فتمثل لها بشرا سويا

translation: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."
interpretation: This verse depicts a woman seeking protection in Allah from a Pharaoh who was seen as oppressive and unjust. It serves as a reminder of the power of turning to Allah for refuge in times of difficulty and seeking protection from those who may harm us, highlighting the importance of piety and fearing Allah above all else.
orig: قالت إني أعوذ بالرحمن منك إن كنت تقيا

translation: He said, "I am only a messenger of your Lord to [announce] to you [the gift of] a pure boy."
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and the glad tidings he received of a righteous son, Isma'il (Ishmael). The verse highlights the role of the prophets as messengers delivering divine messages and miracles, in this case, the birth of a noble and pious son as a gift from God. It also signifies the importance of having trust in God's plan and obeying His commands.
orig: قال إنما أنا رسول ربك لأهب لك غلاما زكيا

translation: She said, 'How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?'
interpretation: This verse refers to Mary, the mother of Jesus (peace be upon him), expressing her astonishment at the news of her conceiving a child despite not being touched by a man. It highlights the miraculous nature of the birth of Jesus, which was a sign of God's power and ability to create without the usual means of conception.
orig: قالت أنى يكون لي غلام ولم يمسسني بشر ولم أك بغيا

translation: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and [We will make it] a sign for the people and a mercy from Us.' And it is a matter [already] decreed."
interpretation: This verse portrays the ease with which Allah can manifest His power and make miraculous events occur. It emphasizes that everything is within Allah's authority and that His decrees will always come to pass. The verse also highlights that the miracles and signs sent by Allah serve as a mercy to humanity, guiding them and reminding them of His existence and power.
orig: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين ولنجعله آية للناس ورحمة منا وكان أمرا مقضيا

translation: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
interpretation: This verse describes the moment when Maryam (Mary) conceived Prophet Isa (Jesus) by the will of Allah, and then withdrew to a remote place to give birth to him. The verse emphasizes the miraculous nature of Isa's birth and highlights Maryam's piety and devotion.
orig: فحملته فانتبذت به مكانا قصيا

translation: So the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, 'Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Maryam (Mary) as she was in labor pains and sought solace by a palm tree. In her moment of distress, she expressed a wish to have died before this difficult situation arose, suggesting a preference for a state of oblivion over facing the challenges ahead. It shows the human side of Maryam, a revered figure in Islam, as someone who faced moments of vulnerability and wished for relief from the burdens of life.
orig: فأجاءها المخاض إلى جذع النخلة قالت يا ليتني مت قبل هذا وكنت نسيا منسيا

translation: So he called her from below her, 'Do not grieve; indeed, your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an assures us that Allah is always near and ready to provide comfort and solutions to our worries and difficulties. Just as He provided water to Hagar in the desert, He is always there to ease our hardships and guide us through challenges. It teaches us to trust in Allah's plan and to have faith that He will alleviate our sorrows and struggles.
orig: فناداها من تحتها ألا تحزني قد جعل ربك تحتك سريا

translation: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
interpretation: This verse signifies the miraculous event where Allah instructed Maryam (Mary) to shake the trunk of a palm tree which resulted in fresh dates falling down to her. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power to provide sustenance in unexpected ways, emphasizing the importance of faith and trust in His divine wisdom and provision.
orig: وهزي إليك بجذع النخلة تساقط عليك رطبا جنيا

translation: So eat and drink and be consoled. And if you see any human being, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful a vow, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's vows and commitments made to Allah. It shows the significance of keeping promises and shows the dedication and obedience of believers towards their Creator, even in challenging situations.
orig: فكلي واشربي وقري عينا فإما ترين من البشر أحدا فقولي إني نذرت للرحمن صوما فلن أكلم اليوم إنسيا

translation: So she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, 'O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.'
interpretation: This verse mentions the astonishment of Mary's people when she brought baby Jesus to them. They were puzzled by this miraculous event and viewed it as something beyond their understanding or expectations. The verse highlights the uniqueness and extraordinary nature of the birth of Jesus, indicating the divine intervention and power at play in this miraculous event.
orig: فأتت به قومها تحمله قالوا يا مريم لقد جئت شيئا فريا

translation: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is addressing Mary, the mother of Jesus, and emphasizing her honorable lineage and character. It highlights that her ancestry was noble and her parents were virtuous, countering any doubts or accusations against her purity and righteousness. This serves to exalt Maryam and assert her innocence and purity in the face of any slander or misinformation that may have been spread.
orig: يا أخت هارون ما كان أبوك امرأ سوء وما كانت أمك بغيا

translation: So she pointed to him. They said, 'How can we speak to someone who is in the cradle, a child?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous birth of Prophet Jesus (Isa) and how he spoke as an infant in the cradle, which was a sign of his prophethood. It highlights the power and ability of Allah to make extraordinary things happen, showcasing the unique nature of Prophet Jesus and his mission as a messenger of God.
orig: فأشارت إليه قالوا كيف نكلم من كان في المهد صبيا

translation: He said, 'Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.'
interpretation: This verse signifies Prophet Jesus (Isa) declaring his servitude to Allah, acknowledging the divine revelation he received in the form of the Scripture (Gospel), and acknowledging his prophethood. It emphasizes the humility, obedience, and submission of Prophet Jesus to the will of Allah.
orig: قال إني عبد الله آتاني الكتاب وجعلني نبيا

translation: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being grateful for the blessings bestowed upon us by God, such as being made blessed regardless of our location. It also emphasizes the duty of performing prayers and giving to charity (zakah) as acts of worship for as long as we live, illustrating the perpetual nature of these obligations in Islam.
orig: وجعلني مباركا أين ما كنت وأوصاني بالصلاة والزكاة ما دمت حيا

translation: And He has made me dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the importance of being kind and dutiful to one's parents. It emphasizes the virtue of showing respect and care towards one's mother, avoiding arrogance and cruelty. It highlights the significance of humility and compassion in one's behavior, especially towards one's family.
orig: وبرا بوالدتي ولم يجعلني جبارا شقيا

translation: And peace be upon me the day I was born and the day I die and the day I am raised alive.
interpretation: This verse is spoken by Prophet Jesus (Isa) in the Qur'an, affirming that peace and blessings were upon him at the key stages of his life - his birth, his death, and his resurrection. It portrays a profound acceptance and submission to God's plan, acknowledging the stages of life as part of a divine decree with peace and tranquility. It exemplifies a sense of trust and reliance on God's wisdom and ultimate plan for every individual's life journey.
orig: والسلام علي يوم ولدت ويوم أموت ويوم أبعث حيا

translation: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
interpretation: This verse is acknowledging Jesus (peace be upon him) as the son of Mary and is emphasizing his identity as the word of truth. It highlights the disagreement and confusion that exist among people regarding the truth about Jesus. The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing the truth and the status of Jesus as a respected prophet in Islam.
orig: ذلك عيسى ابن مريم قول الحق الذي فيه يمترون

translation: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the oneness of Allah and rejects the idea of Him having a son. It highlights the absolute power of Allah over all creation, as all He needs to do is command something to 'Be' and it comes into existence. It underlines the uniqueness of Allah's power and authority in the act of creation.
orig: ما كان لله أن يتخذ من ولد سبحانه إذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and calls for the worship of Him alone. It serves as a reminder that the straight path to righteousness and guidance is through sincere devotion to Allah, acknowledging His exclusive divinity and following His commandments.
orig: وإن الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: So the groups differed [among themselves]; and woe to those who disbelieve from a scene of a great Day.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divisions and disagreements among people, leading to different groups with varying beliefs and ideologies. It warns those who deny the truth and disbelieve, that they will face severe consequences on the Day of Judgment, where their disbelief will be apparent and they will regret it.
orig: فاختلف الأحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين كفروا من مشهد يوم عظيم

translation: I will make them hear and see on the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, everyone will hear and see clearly the truth and justice of their deeds. However, in the present world, those who persist in wrongdoing are clearly misguided and veiled from the truth.
orig: أسمع بهم وأبصر يوم يأتوننا لكن الظالمون اليوم في ضلال مبين

translation: And warn them of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be decided; yet they are heedless and they do not believe.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment, a day of regret and sorrow for those who were heedless and disbelieving in this life. It emphasizes the importance of warning others about the consequences of their actions and the reality of the Day when all matters will be settled. It highlights the importance of faith and belief in preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: وأنذرهم يوم الحسرة إذ قضي الأمر وهم في غفلة وهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the ultimate power and sovereignty of Allah. It indicates that everything in this world belongs to Allah and that humans will eventually return to Him. It serves as a reminder of the transience of worldly possessions and the inevitability of being held accountable in the Hereafter.
orig: إنا نحن نرث الأرض ومن عليها وإلينا يرجعون

translation: And mention in the Book, Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
interpretation: This verse highlights the character of Prophet Abraham, emphasizing his truthfulness and his status as a prophet. It serves as a reminder of his righteous and exemplary life, urging believers to reflect on his conduct and follow his example in their own lives.
orig: واذكر في الكتاب إبراهيم إنه كان صديقا نبيا

translation: When he said to his father, 'O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you in anything?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of worshipping idols or objects that are incapable of hearing or seeing, emphasizing the importance of worshipping the one true God who is all-knowing and all-seeing. It teaches us the importance of seeking a meaningful connection with our Creator who alone can benefit us and respond to our prayers.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه يا أبت لم تعبد ما لا يسمع ولا يبصر ولا يغني عنك شيئا

translation: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking and following knowledge. It emphasizes that sometimes knowledge may come to others before it reaches us, and in such cases, it is essential to be open-minded and willing to learn from those who have acquired knowledge. It also teaches us the value of guidance and the importance of staying on the right path, indicating that those who possess knowledge have a responsibility to guide and help others find the correct way.
orig: يا أبت إني قد جاءني من العلم ما لم يأتك فاتبعني أهدك صراطا سويا

translation: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.
interpretation: This verse is advising and warning against worshipping Satan, emphasizing that Satan is disobedient to the Most Merciful (referring to Allah). It serves as a reminder to avoid following Satan's ways and to adhere to the path of righteousness and obedience to Allah.
orig: يا أبت لا تعبد الشيطان إن الشيطان كان للرحمن عصيا

translation: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concern of Prophet Ibrahim towards his father's well-being and his fear of the punishment that may befall him due to his disbelief. It demonstrates the emphasis on the importance of maintaining a strong connection with God and avoiding actions that could lead one astray and make them an ally of Satan.
orig: يا أبت إني أخاف أن يمسك عذاب من الرحمن فتكون للشيطان وليا

translation: He said, 'Do you forsake my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time.'
interpretation: This verse narrates a conversation where a disbeliever threatens Abraham with harm if he does not abandon his belief in one God. It reflects the challenges faced by prophets and believers who are steadfast in their faith despite threats and pressure from those who worship false gods.
orig: قال أراغب أنت عن آلهتي يا إبراهيم لئن لم تنته لأرجمنك واهجرني مليا

translation: He said, 'Peace be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.'
interpretation: This verse is from the story of Prophet Nuh (Noah) in the Qur'an when he speaks to his son who was disbelieving. Prophet Nuh expresses his love and concern for his son by invoking Allah's forgiveness for him. It shows the deep compassion and care that prophets have for their loved ones, even when they are faced with disobedience and rejection.
orig: قال سلام عليك سأستغفر لك ربي إنه كان بي حفيا

translation: And I leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and I invoke my Lord. I hope that I will not be unhappy in calling upon my Lord.
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) is expressing his detachment from the false idols that the disbelievers worship and his commitment to sincerely calling upon Allah alone. He hopes and prays that his calls to Allah will not lead him to any suffering or despair, emphasizing the importance of true faith and devotion to the one true God.
orig: وأعتزلكم وما تدعون من دون الله وأدعو ربي عسى ألا أكون بدعاء ربي شقيا

translation: So when he had withdrawn from them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and each of them We made a prophet.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) when he distanced himself from his people and the false gods they worshipped, focusing solely on the worship of Allah. As a reward for his steadfastness and devotion, Allah granted him Prophets Isaac and Jacob as descendants, both of whom were blessed with prophethood. This emphasizes the importance of monotheism and the reward of staying true to faith in Allah.
orig: فلما اعتزلهم وما يعبدون من دون الله وهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب وكلا جعلنا نبيا

translation: And We granted them out of Our mercy, and We gave them a truthful and elevated tongue.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah bestows His mercy upon certain individuals, granting them the gift of speaking truthfully and eloquently. It emphasizes the importance of using speech responsibly, honestly, and with integrity, reflecting the elevated status of those who are endowed with such a gift by Allah.
orig: ووهبنا لهم من رحمتنا وجعلنا لهم لسان صدق عليا

translation: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the special status of Prophet Moses in the Quran, highlighting his sincerity, his role as a messenger of God, and his position as a prophet. It serves as a reminder of the importance of Prophet Moses in the history of Islam and as a figure of guidance and leadership for believers.
orig: واذكر في الكتاب موسى إنه كان مخلصا وكان رسولا نبيا

translation: And We called to him from the right side of the mount, and brought him near in communication.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Moses (Musa) when he was called by Allah from the right side of the mount (Sinai) and Allah communicated with him in a close and intimate manner. It signifies the special and unique relationship that Allah had with Prophet Moses, as well as highlighting the importance of direct communication between the prophet and Allah in conveying the divine message.
orig: وناديناه من جانب الطور الأيمن وقربناه نجيا

translation: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the mercy of Allah towards Prophet Moses by granting him his brother Aaron as a prophet. It shows that Allah's mercy extends to providing support and help to his chosen servants, and in this case, by appointing Aaron as a prophet to assist Moses in fulfilling his mission.
orig: ووهبنا له من رحمتنا أخاه هارون نبيا

translation: And mention in the Book, Isma'il. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mention of Prophet Isma'il in the Qur'an, praising his honesty and faithfulness to his promises. It emphasizes his role as a messenger and a prophet, indicating his high status and the importance of following his example in fulfilling commitments and conveying the message of God with integrity.
orig: واذكر في الكتاب إسماعيل إنه كان صادق الوعد وكان رسولا نبيا

translation: And he used to enjoin on his family the Salat (prayer) and the Zakat, and his Lord was pleased with him.
interpretation: This verse praises a righteous individual who not only performed his religious duties of prayer and charity (Salat and Zakat) but also encouraged his family to do the same. The phrase 'and his Lord was pleased with him' signifies the approval and favor of Allah due to the person's piety and actions, emphasizing the importance of fulfilling religious obligations and influencing others to do the same.
orig: وكان يأمر أهله بالصلاة والزكاة وكان عند ربه مرضيا

translation: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the prophet Idrees (Enoch) and highlights his esteemed status as a man of truth and a prophet. It emphasizes the importance of mentioning and remembering the righteous and truthful figures from the past, such as Idrees, to draw inspiration and lessons from their lives.
orig: واذكر في الكتاب إدريس إنه كان صديقا نبيا

translation: And We raised him to a high station.
interpretation: This verse refers to the elevation of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) to a high and noble status in the sight of Allah. It signifies the honor and special position granted to Prophet Jesus by Allah, highlighting his exalted rank and elevated status among the prophets.
orig: ورفعناه مكانا عليا

translation: Those are the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.
interpretation: This verse describes the believers who are blessed by Allah, mentioning prophets from the lineage of Adam, those who were saved with Noah, descendants of Abraham and Israel, as well as other individuals whom Allah guided and chose. It highlights their devotion and humility, as upon hearing the verses of Allah being recited, they immediately fall into prostration out of recognition of His greatness and weep in awe and gratitude.
orig: أولئك الذين أنعم الله عليهم من النبيين من ذرية آدم وممن حملنا مع نوح ومن ذرية إبراهيم وإسرائيل وممن هدينا واجتبينا إذا تتلى عليهم آيات الرحمن خروا سجدا وبكيا

translation: Then, there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued their desires; so they will meet destruction,
interpretation: This verse is a warning against those who neglect their prayers and instead follow their worldly desires. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining one's connection with God through prayer and staying away from temptations and sinful acts. The verse serves as a reminder that neglecting prayer and indulging in base desires will ultimately lead to ruin and downfall.
orig: فخلف من بعدهم خلف أضاعوا الصلاة واتبعوا الشهوات فسوف يلقون غيا

translation: Except for those who repent, believe, and do good; for them will enter the Garden and they will not be wronged in the least.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincere repentance, firm belief, and righteous actions for attaining entry into Paradise. Those who sincerely repent for their sins, have faith in Allah, and consistently perform good deeds without committing any oppression or wrong will be granted entry into Paradise where they will be justly rewarded without any injustice.
orig: إلا من تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا فأولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون شيئا

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the promise of eternal gardens in paradise that the Most Merciful (Allah) has assured to His righteous servants. The phrase 'Inna wadahu ma'atiya' emphasizes the certainty of this promise being fulfilled, indicating that Allah's promises are always realized.
orig: جنات عدن التي وعد الرحمن عباده بالغيب إنه كان وعده مأتيا

translation: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood. [Only] a [greeting of] peace, and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.
interpretation: This verse describes the peaceful and harmonious atmosphere of Paradise where inhabitants will not hear any negative or false speech. Instead, they will only experience peace and contentment, with their sustenance provided for them abundantly throughout the day.
orig: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا إلا سلاما ولهم رزقهم فيها بكرة وعشيا

translation: That is Paradise which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward of Paradise that Allah promises to those who are righteous and God-fearing. It emphasizes that the ultimate inheritance and reward for the righteous believers is Paradise, where they will attain eternal bliss and proximity to Allah.
orig: تلك الجنة التي نورث من عبادنا من كان تقيا

translation: And We do not descend except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us and what is between those. And your Lord is never forgetful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence and omniscience of Allah, emphasizing that every action or decree is done by His command and knowledge. It also assures believers that Allah's control and oversight extend to all aspects of existence, past, present, and future, reiterating that He never neglects or forgets anything.
orig: وما نتنزل إلا بأمر ربك له ما بين أيدينا وما خلفنا وما بين ذلك وما كان ربك نسيا

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them; so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know any equal to Him?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute and unique sovereignty of Allah over all creation. It calls for worship and patience in obeying Him, while highlighting His unmatched and incomparable status. It underscores the importance of acknowledging Allah's unmatched power and authority, urging believers to dedicate themselves to His worship with perseverance and belief in His unparalleled greatness.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما فاعبده واصطبر لعبادته هل تعلم له سميا

translation: And man says, 'When I have died, will I surely be brought forth alive?'
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelief of some individuals who doubt the concept of resurrection after death. It emphasizes the inevitability and certainty of life after death, and serves as a reminder of the ultimate return to God for accountability and judgement.
orig: ويقول الإنسان أإذا ما مت لسوف أخرج حيا

translation: Man needs to remember that We created him before when he was nothing.
interpretation: This verse reminds humans of their humble origin and emphasizes the power and ability of Allah in creating them from nothing. It serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and gratitude towards the Creator for bringing them into existence.
orig: أولا يذكر الإنسان أنا خلقناه من قبل ولم يك شيئا

translation: Indeed, [O Muhammad], your Lord knows that you will gather them together. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse reassures Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that Allah knows that he will gather people on the Day of Judgment, and Allah is all-wise and all-knowing. This verse serves as a comfort and support to the Prophet during his mission.
orig: فوربك لنحشرنهم والشياطين ثم لنحضرنهم حول جهنم جثيا

translation: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were most obstinate in disbelief.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, God will separate the believers from the disbelievers, and those who were most stubborn and persistent in their rejection of truth and faith will face consequences for their actions.
orig: ثم لننزعن من كل شيعة أيهم أشد على الرحمن عتيا

translation: Then it is We who know best those who are most worthy of burning in it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is ultimately Allah who possesses the knowledge and wisdom to determine who deserves punishment in Hellfire, based on His perfect understanding of each individual's actions and intentions.
orig: ثم لنحن أعلم بالذين هم أولى بها صليا

translation: And there is none among you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the certainty of death for every individual, emphasizing that everyone will inevitably face death as decreed by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of life on Earth and the ultimate accountability before Allah for all deeds and actions.
orig: وإن منكم إلا واردها كان على ربك حتما مقضيا

translation: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, those who were righteous and God-fearing will be saved and rewarded, while the wrongdoers and those who were unjust will be left to face the consequences of their actions. The mention of leaving the wrongdoers 'on their knees' signifies their defeat, humiliation, and submission before the ultimate justice of Allah.
orig: ثم ننجي الذين اتقوا ونذر الظالمين فيها جثيا

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them clearly, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Which of the two groups is best in position and best in association?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of the disbelievers when they hear the clear signs and verses of the Qur'an. Instead of reflecting on the message and guidance offered, they question the status and superiority between believers and disbelievers. The verse points to the importance of true faith and righteousness as the ultimate criteria for goodness, rather than worldly considerations like social status or power.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أي الفريقين خير مقاما وأحسن نديا

translation: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were better in possessions and outward appearance?
interpretation: This verse highlights the inevitability of the destruction of generations who were wealthy and had luxurious possessions but failed to heed the message of the prophets. It serves as a reminder that material wealth and outward beauty do not guarantee success or protection from divine punishment if one strays from the path of righteousness.
orig: وكم أهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم أحسن أثاثا ورئيا

translation: Say, "Whoever is in error, let the Most Merciful extend for him a period." until, when they see that which they are promised - either the punishment or the Hour, they will come to know who is in the worst position and weaker in soldiers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine mercy and patience, even towards those who may be misguided. It warns that eventually all will witness the consequences of their actions and beliefs, realizing the severity of their situation. It highlights the importance of reflecting on one's choices and recognizing the ultimate power of God.
orig: قل من كان في الضلالة فليمدد له الرحمن مدا حتى إذا رأوا ما يوعدون إما العذاب وإما الساعة فسيعلمون من هو شر مكانا وأضعف جندا

translation: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that those who are already guided by Allah will be further increased in guidance. It emphasizes the importance of continuous good deeds that have a lasting impact, as they are more favorable in terms of rewards from Allah and provide a better outcome in the Hereafter.
orig: ويزيد الله الذين اهتدوا هدى والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير مردا

translation: Have you seen he who has disbelieved in Our signs and said, 'I will surely be given wealth and children'?
interpretation: This verse questions and highlights the attitude of those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and confidently expect to be given wealth and children as a result of their disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the arrogance and misguided beliefs of the disbelievers who fail to recognize Allah's true power and authority.
orig: أفرأيت الذي كفر بآياتنا وقال لأوتين مالا وولدا

translation: Has he [Muhammad ﷺ] been made acquainted with the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Merciful?
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ has been given knowledge of the unseen by Allah, or if he has made a special covenant with Allah that grants him this knowledge. It highlights the unique and elevated status of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ in being a recipient of divine revelation, and it challenges the disbelievers to ponder and reflect on the extraordinary nature of his message.
orig: أطلع الغيب أم اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا

translation: No! We shall record what he says, and We shall extend for him from the punishment extensively.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that every word and action of a person will be recorded and accounted for on the Day of Judgement. It emphasizes that there is no escape from the consequences of one's deeds, and the punishment may be extended extensively based on the individual's actions.
orig: كلا سنكتب ما يقول ونمد له من العذاب مدا

translation: And [then] we inherit it [from him].
interpretation: This verse signifies the inevitability of death and the passing of wealth and possessions from one generation to another. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of our worldly belongings and the importance of preparing for the everlasting life in the Hereafter.
orig: ونرثه ما يقول ويأتينا فردا

translation: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.
interpretation: This verse highlights the people who have taken false deities besides Allah in order to seek honor, power, or status from them. It warns against associating partners with Allah and seeking qualities that only belong to Him from others than Him.
orig: واتخذوا من دون الله آلهة ليكونوا لهم عزا

translation: No! They will deny their worship, and they will be against them adversaries.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and denial of the disbelievers towards their worship of Allah. It signifies that they will reject and deny their acts of worship and that their own deeds will stand as evidence against them on the Day of Judgment, serving as adversaries that will testify to their disbelief and ingratitude.
orig: كلا سيكفرون بعبادتهم ويكونون عليهم ضدا

translation: Have you not seen that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them with [constant] incitement?
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the existence of evil forces, represented by the devils, who constantly try to misguide and incite those who deny the truth. It serves as a warning about the influence of negative forces in leading people astray from the right path and emphasizes the need for believers to stay steadfast in their faith and seek protection from such evil influences through seeking refuge in Allah and maintaining a strong connection with Him.
orig: ألم تر أنا أرسلنا الشياطين على الكافرين تؤزهم أزا

translation: So be patient over them. We are counting for them a limited number.
interpretation: This verse advises patience toward those who oppose or disbelieve in the message of the Qur'an. It reassures that their fate and consequences are already predetermined by Allah, and believers are urged to be steadfast and patient in delivering the message, leaving the ultimate judgment to Allah.
orig: فلا تعجل عليهم إنما نعد لهم عدا

translation: On the Day we will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation,
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, the pious and righteous individuals will be gathered in front of the Most Merciful One, in a dignified and honored manner, showing their devotion and loyalty to Him.
orig: يوم نحشر المتقين إلى الرحمن وفدا

translation: And We will drive the criminals to Hell, as weary cattle are herded.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the consequences that the wrongdoers and criminals will face in the afterlife, being driven to Hell in a humiliating manner. This serves as a reminder for believers to be mindful of their actions and to avoid committing sins that may lead them to such a fate.
orig: ونسوق المجرمين إلى جهنم وردا

translation: They will not possess [the power of] intercession except for one who has taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the power of intercession on the Day of Judgment belongs only to those who have a covenant with Allah, indicating that intercession is not a right that can be claimed or possessed by anyone. It highlights the importance of having a strong relationship with Allah and upholding one's promises and commitments in order to be worthy of any form of intercession.
orig: لا يملكون الشفاعة إلا من اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا

translation: And they say: 'The Most Merciful has begotten a son.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the incorrect belief held by some people that Allah, the Most Merciful, has a son. The interpretation here emphasizes the unfounded nature of this claim, asserting that Allah is free from such humanly attributes as offspring, since He is beyond the limitations of creation and neither begets nor is begotten.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا

translation: You have come with a thing that is astounding.
interpretation: This verse expresses the astonishment and disbelief of the disbelievers in the Quraysh tribe upon hearing the message of the Quran. They cannot comprehend or accept the teachings brought to them by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), considering it something strange and beyond belief.
orig: لقد جئتم شيئا إدا

translation: The heavens almost break apart from above them, and the angels exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is Allah who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse describes the immense power and majesty of Allah, emphasizing His ability to cause cataclysmic events such as the breaking of the heavens and the shaking of the earth. It also highlights the role of the angels in exalting Allah and seeking forgiveness for the people on earth, underscoring Allah's mercy and forgiveness towards His creations.
orig: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن منه وتنشق الأرض وتخر الجبال هدا

translation: That they attribute offspring to the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is condemning the belief held by some that Allah, the Most Merciful, has offspring or children. It reaffirms the oneness of Allah and rejects any notion of Him having offspring, as He is beyond human attributes such as procreation or family relations.
orig: أن دعوا للرحمن ولدا

translation: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the oneness of God and refutes the notion of God having offspring. It teaches that God, in His grandeur and mercy, is far beyond the need for a child or offspring, as such a notion would contradict His perfect essence and uniqueness.
orig: وما ينبغي للرحمن أن يتخذ ولدا

translation: Indeed, there is no one in the heavens and the earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
interpretation: This verse reflects the concept of ultimate submission to the will of Allah, emphasizing that every being in the heavens and the earth will eventually return to Allah and serve Him. It highlights the universal truth that every creature, willingly or unwillingly, is a servant of the Most Merciful and will ultimately submit to Him.
orig: إن كل من في السماوات والأرض إلا آتي الرحمن عبدا

translation: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the meticulous knowledge and awareness that Allah has over His creation. It shows that Allah has complete knowledge of each individual and has counted them all precisely, highlighting His infinite wisdom and power.
orig: لقد أحصاهم وعدهم عدا

translation: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everyone will appear before Allah individually on the Day of Judgement, regardless of their status, wealth, or power in the worldly life. It highlights the ultimate accountability and justice that will be served in the Hereafter, where each person will be answerable for their own deeds and faith.
orig: وكلهم آتيه يوم القيامة فردا

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds, the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that sincere belief in Allah and righteous actions will lead to receiving His love and affection. It serves as a reminder that faith and good deeds go hand in hand, and those who combine them will be blessed with the mercy and love of Allah.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سيجعل لهم الرحمن ودا

translation: So indeed, We have made it easy in your language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ease with which the Qur'an was revealed in the Arabic language to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in order to deliver glad tidings to the righteous individuals and to caution those who reject and oppose the message. It emphasizes the dual purpose of the Qur'an - to guide the believers and warn the disbelievers.
