orig: فإنما يسرناه بلسانك لتبشر به المتقين وتنذر به قوما لدا

translation: And many a generation We destroyed before them; Can you see a single one of them, or hear from them even a whisper?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences that previous generations faced due to their disobedience to God. It questions whether any trace of those past nations remains, highlighting the importance of reflecting on history as a lesson for the present and future generations. It serves as a reminder of the importance of heeding the warnings from the destruction of past nations to avoid a similar fate.
orig: وكم أهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هل تحس منهم من أحد أو تسمع لهم ركزا

translation: طه
interpretation: This is the chapter name, which is called Surah Taha. It is the 20th chapter of the Qur'an. The chapter starts with the Arabic letters طه which are a mystery and their exact meaning is known only to Allah. Some scholars believe these letters were used to capture the attention of the listener, while others believe they are cryptic reminders of Allah's power and knowledge. Regardless of the interpretation, these letters serve as a powerful reminder of the divine origin of the Qur'an.
orig: طه

translation: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an was not revealed to cause distress or hardship upon the Prophet Muhammad or the believers. It reassures the believers that the Qur'an is intended as guidance and mercy, not as a source of suffering or difficulty.
orig: ما أنزلنا عليك القرآن لتشقى

translation: This is a reminder for those who fear (Allah).
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder for those who have fear and awe of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of being conscious of Allah's presence and being mindful of His teachings and guidance. Those who fear Allah are reminded through this verse to reflect on their actions and strive to live a righteous life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: إلا تذكرة لمن يخشى

translation: A revelation from He who created the earth and the highest heavens,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an is a revelation from the Creator of the heavens and the earth. It highlights the divine origin and authority of the Qur'an as a guidance for mankind, coming from the One who created the entire universe.
orig: تنزيلا ممن خلق الأرض والسماوات العلى

translation: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.
interpretation: This verse highlights the supreme power and authority of Allah, stating that He is above His throne in a manner befitting His majesty. It emphasizes the transcendence and sovereignty of Allah over all creation, while also invoking His attribute of mercy by mentioning 'The Most Merciful'. This verse reminds believers of the greatness and exalted status of God, reinforcing the concept of His ultimate control and dominance over everything in the universe.
orig: الرحمن على العرش استوى

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is under the soil.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute ownership and control of Allah over everything in the universe, whether visible or hidden. It highlights the comprehensive power and authority of Allah over all creation, indicating that every single thing ultimately belongs to Him and is under His dominion.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وما بينهما وما تحت الثرى

translation: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah knows all secrets and hidden things, even if they are not expressed verbally. It reminds believers that they should be mindful that Allah is aware of everything, whether it is said out loud or kept hidden in one's heart.
orig: وإن تجهر بالقول فإنه يعلم السر وأخفى

translation: Allah! There is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.
interpretation: This verse affirms the oneness of Allah and emphasizes that He is the only deity worthy of worship. It also highlights the beautiful names and attributes of Allah, indicating His perfection and greatness.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو له الأسماء الحسنى

translation: Has the story of Moses reached you?
interpretation: This verse serves as a rhetorical question drawing attention to the importance of reflecting on the story of Prophet Moses, emphasizing the significance of learning from the lessons and wisdom found in his life and experiences. It urges the listener or reader to ponder upon the teachings and messages conveyed through the narrative of Moses, as a means to learn, gain guidance, and deepen their faith.
orig: وهل أتاك حديث موسى

translation: When he saw a fire and said to his family, 'Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) when he saw a fire and informed his family to wait while he approached it. The verse demonstrates Prophet Ibrahim's loyalty to his faith and his trust in Allah's guidance, as he was willing to face the fire with the hope of finding guidance or a means to bring light to his family. It serves as a lesson on faith, trust, and perseverance even in the face of challenges and uncertainties.
orig: إذ رأى نارا فقال لأهله امكثوا إني آنست نارا لعلي آتيكم منها بقبس أو أجد على النار هدى

translation: So when he came to it, he was called, 'O Moses!'
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Moses was called by Allah when he approached the burning bush. It signifies the divine guidance and communication with the Prophet Moses, showing that Allah was aware of his presence and was about to entrust him with a great responsibility. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being attentive to Allah's call and being prepared to receive His commands.
orig: فلما أتاها نودي يا موسى

translation: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when God spoke to Prophet Moses in the sacred valley of Tuwa. By asking Moses to remove his sandals, God was indicating the sacredness of the place and reminding Moses to show humility and respect in the presence of the Divine. It serves as a reminder that when we are in a place of spiritual significance or in the presence of God, we should approach with reverence and humility.
orig: إني أنا ربك فاخلع نعليك إنك بالواد المقدس طوى

translation: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the special selection of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by Allah to receive and convey His revelations. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to and obeying these divine revelations as they are guidance for humanity.
orig: وأنا اخترتك فاستمع لما يوحى

translation: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and His right to be worshipped alone. It directs believers to worship Him diligently and to establish prayer as a means to remember Him. Through this act of worship, believers can strengthen their connection with Allah and maintain His remembrance in their hearts and lives.
orig: إنني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدني وأقم الصلاة لذكري

translation: The Hour is coming; I almost hide it so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the certainty of the Day of Judgment, stating that it is surely coming, and Allah has knowledge of its exact timing. The verse also highlights the importance of individuals striving towards righteous deeds in order to be rewarded or punished accordingly in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الساعة آتية أكاد أخفيها لتجزى كل نفس بما تسعى

translation: So let not one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, lest you perish.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the believers not to let those who do not believe in the Qur'an and follow their own desires distract them from the guidance of the Qur'an. It emphasizes the importance of staying steadfast in faith and not being swayed by the opinions or desires of those who do not believe in the message of the Qur'an.
orig: فلا يصدنك عنها من لا يؤمن بها واتبع هواه فتردى

translation: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?
interpretation: This verse is a question posed to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) by Allah. It highlights the significance of paying attention to the signs and blessings from Allah. It serves as a reminder to recognize and appreciate the favors and gifts Allah bestows upon His servants, as well as a call to reflect on the responsibilities and missions assigned to them.
orig: وما تلك بيمينك يا موسى

translation: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and have in it other uses.""
interpretation: This verse describes a conversation where Prophet Musa (Moses) is asked about the staff he carries. He explains that it serves multiple practical purposes for him, such as support, gathering food for his sheep, and possibly other utilities. This interaction signifies the resourcefulness and wisdom of Prophet Musa in utilizing the simple staff for various needs in his daily life.
orig: قال هي عصاي أتوكأ عليها وأهش بها على غنمي ولي فيها مآرب أخرى

translation: He said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Allah instructed Prophet Moses to throw down his staff, which then transformed into a serpent. This event showcases the power and miracles of Allah, as well as the obedience and trust Moses had in following Allah's commands.
orig: قال ألقها يا موسى

translation: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event where Prophet Musa (Moses) was given a sign by God to throw down his staff which then transformed into a snake. It shows the power and miracles that God bestows upon his chosen prophets, and the importance of faith and trust in following God's commands.
orig: فألقاها فإذا هي حية تسعى

translation: He said, 'Take it and do not fear. We will return it to its former condition.'
interpretation: This verse showcases the story of Prophet Job being reassured by God that his health will be restored after enduring hardship. It teaches us about trusting in God's plan, having patience, and that trials and difficulties are temporary, with better times ahead for those who remain steadfast in faith.
orig: قال خذها ولا تخف سنعيدها سيرتها الأولى

translation: And [then] draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
interpretation: This verse is a part of the story of Prophet Musa (Moses) when he was given a miraculous sign by Allah to demonstrate His power. It signifies the importance of trusting in Allah's guidance and provisions, as well as the belief in miracles as signs of divine intervention.
orig: واضمم يدك إلى جناحك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء آية أخرى

translation: We will show you our great signs.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah will show His signs and wonders to humanity as a means to guide and teach them about His greatness and power. It is a reminder of the evidence of His existence and the importance of reflecting on His signs.
orig: لنريك من آياتنا الكبرى

translation: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
interpretation: This verse is a command to Prophet Moses to go to Pharaoh, the tyrannical ruler who had arrogantly transgressed the bounds set by God. It emphasizes the defiance and injustice of Pharaoh, highlighting the necessity of confronting such oppressive powers.
orig: اذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى

translation: Said Moses, 'My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]'
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) is asking Allah to ease his task, remove his doubts, and fill his heart with conviction and determination. It shows the human need for spiritual strength and support from the Almighty when facing challenges and responsibilities.
orig: قال رب اشرح لي صدري

translation: And make my task easy for me.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah to make the speaker's affairs easy for them. It is a request for guidance, help, and facilitation in carrying out responsibilities and navigating challenges.
orig: ويسر لي أمري

translation: And ease my task for me;
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for assistance in making speech clear and removing any difficulties in communication. The speaker is seeking help in expressing themselves effectively and removing any obstacles that may hinder their ability to communicate clearly.
orig: واحلل عقدة من لساني

translation: They understand my words.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of deeply understanding the words of Allah. It encourages believers to contemplate, ponder, and reflect on the teachings of the Qur'an in order to gain wisdom and guidance in life.
orig: يفقهوا قولي

translation: And appoint for me a minister from my family.
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) asking Allah for support and assistance in spreading the message of Islam, requesting for a companion who can aid him in his mission. It teaches us the value of seeking help from our loved ones and allies in times of need, emphasizing the importance of having strong and supportive relationships within our families.
orig: واجعل لي وزيرا من أهلي

translation: Haroon is my brother.
interpretation: This verse indicates a statement made by Prophet Musa (Moses) that Haroon (Aaron) is his brother. It emphasizes the importance of familial relationships and the bond between these two prophets in their mission.
orig: هارون أخي

translation: Strengthen my back.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for strength and support to endure hardships and challenges. The metaphorical use of 'strengthen my back' implies seeking assistance and resilience to bear the burdens and difficulties of life with patience and steadfastness.
orig: اشدد به أزري

translation: And associate others with Me in my command.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah in His command, indicating the importance of following and obeying Allah's guidance without taking others as partners in matters of decision-making or authority.
orig: وأشركه في أمري

translation: So that we may exalt You abundantly.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the purpose of praising and glorifying Allah – to show gratitude and exalt Him abundantly. It emphasizes the importance of consistently praising Allah through words and actions as a way of acknowledging His greatness and expressing our devotion to Him.
orig: كي نسبحك كثيرا

translation: And We mention you much.
interpretation: This verse signifies the importance of constant remembrance of Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers that they should always keep Allah in their thoughts and continuously remember Him through various forms of worship and mindfulness. The repeated mention of Allah serves to strengthen the believer's faith, mindfulness, and connection to the Divine.
orig: ونذكرك كثيرا

translation: Indeed, You are Seeing of us.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the fact that Allah is All-Seeing and All-Aware of everything that we do. It serves as a reminder to believers that they are constantly under the observation of Allah, and that He knows all of their deeds, intentions, and innermost thoughts. This verse highlights the concept of Allah's omniscience and omnipresence, encouraging believers to be mindful of their actions as they are accountable to Him.
orig: إنك كنت بنا بصيرا

translation: He said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses."
interpretation: This verse illustrates the response of Allah to the request of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him). It signifies that Allah grants the supplications of His servants when they turn to Him in earnest prayer and need. It is a reminder of Allah's readiness to respond to the prayers of the believers and the importance of turning to Him with sincerity and trust.
orig: قال قد أوتيت سؤلك يا موسى

translation: And We have bestowed favor upon you once again.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah bestowing His favor upon the person being addressed a second time. It emphasizes the continuous blessings and mercy of Allah towards His creation, highlighting His generosity and grace.
orig: ولقد مننا عليك مرة أخرى

translation: When We revealed to your mother what was revealed,
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Allah revealed His guidance to the mother of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) to protect and care for her child. It highlights the divine intervention and protection provided by Allah for His chosen prophets right from their birth.
orig: إذ أوحينا إلى أمك ما يوحى

translation: Put him into a chest and throw it into the river; the river will cast him upon the bank, and there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I endued thee with love from Me, that thou mightest be reared under Mine eye.
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Moses (Musa) being placed in a chest and thrown into the river, where he is found and taken in by Pharaoh's family. Allah bestows love upon Moses, allowing him to be raised under divine protection and guidance.
orig: أن اقذفيه في التابوت فاقذفيه في اليم فليلقه اليم بالساحل يأخذه عدو لي وعدو له وألقيت عليك محبة مني ولتصنع على عيني

translation: When your sister walked and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from the distress and tested you with various trials. Then you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and highlights some significant events in his life. It speaks about moments of trial, redemption, and testing of faith. It illustrates how Allah guides and protects His chosen messengers and how everything occurs according to a divine plan and decree.
orig: إذ تمشي أختك فتقول هل أدلكم على من يكفله فرجعناك إلى أمك كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن وقتلت نفسا فنجيناك من الغم وفتناك فتونا فلبثت سنين في أهل مدين ثم جئت على قدر يا موسى

translation: And I have chosen you for Myself.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah choosing certain individuals for specific tasks and responsibilities. It shows Allah's favor and selection of a person for a specific purpose or role, emphasizing the importance and significance of the chosen individual.
orig: واصطنعتك لنفسي

translation: Go, you and your brother, with My signs, and do not neglect My remembrance.
interpretation: This verse is a direct command from Allah to Prophet Moses and his brother Aaron, instructing them to go to Pharaoh together with the signs and miracles bestowed upon them by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of not forgetting or neglecting the remembrance of Allah while carrying out their mission. The verse serves as a reminder that even in the face of challenges and struggles, believers should remain steadfast in their faith and always remember Allah.
orig: اذهب أنت وأخوك بآياتي ولا تنيا في ذكري

translation: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
interpretation: This verse is directing Prophet Moses and Prophet Aaron to go to Pharaoh, the ruler who has arrogantly exceeded the limits set by Allah. It demonstrates that even the most powerful and oppressive individuals are not beyond accountability and guidance from Allah's chosen messengers.
orig: اذهبا إلى فرعون إنه طغى

translation: So speak to him a gentle word that perhaps he may be reminded or fear (Allah).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of communicating with others in a gentle and kind manner, even in times of disagreement or conflict. By choosing gentle words, there is a higher chance of the other person being reminded of the truth or feeling a sense of awe and reverence towards Allah. It highlights the power of softness and compassion in guiding others towards righteousness and wisdom.
orig: فقولا له قولا لينا لعله يتذكر أو يخشى

translation: They said, 'Our Lord, indeed we fear that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress.'
interpretation: In this verse, the two men are expressing their fear and concern to Allah, acknowledging their own weaknesses and seeking His protection from any hastened punishment or oppression. It highlights the importance of seeking refuge in Allah in times of fear and distress.
orig: قالا ربنا إننا نخاف أن يفرط علينا أو أن يطغى

translation: He said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see."
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that Allah is always present with them, listening to their prayers and observing their actions. It conveys the message of divine protection and comfort, reminding us that Allah is aware of everything happening in our lives. Therefore, believers should find solace in knowing that Allah is always watching over them and hearing their concerns.
orig: قال لا تخافا إنني معكما أسمع وأرى

translation: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not harm them. We have certainly come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon whoever follows guidance.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of conveying the message of Allah with peace and wisdom. The messengers are instructed to approach Pharaoh and request the release of the Children of Israel without causing harm. It highlights the principle of calling others to the truth in a gentle and respectful manner, even when faced with opposition or hostility. The verse also indicates that those who accept guidance and follow the right path will be blessed with peace and tranquility.
orig: فأتياه فقولا إنا رسولا ربك فأرسل معنا بني إسرائيل ولا تعذبهم قد جئناك بآية من ربك والسلام على من اتبع الهدى

translation: Verily, We have revealed to us that the punishment is for him who denies and turns away.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny the truth and turn away from the guidance will face punishment. It conveys the message that there are consequences for rejecting the truth and choosing to ignore it.
orig: إنا قد أوحي إلينا أن العذاب على من كذب وتولى

translation: He said, 'So who is your Lord, O Moses?'
interpretation: This verse poses a question asked by Allah to Moses, illustrating that Allah is the Supreme and Ultimate authority. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and acknowledging the oneness and greatness of Allah as the Lord and Creator.
orig: قال فمن ربكما يا موسى

translation: Our Lord is He Who gave everything its creation, then guided it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the concept of Tawheed (the Oneness of Allah) and reinforces the idea that Allah is the sustainer and guide of all creation. It emphasizes that everything in existence is created by Allah and that He provides guidance and direction to all His creations.
orig: قال ربنا الذي أعطى كل شيء خلقه ثم هدى

translation: He said, 'So what is the matter with the former generations?'
interpretation: In this verse, it is questioning the fate and consequences of the past generations. The question is asked to reflect on the lessons that can be learned from the outcomes of those who came before us, and to consider the impact of their actions on their present situation.
orig: قال فما بال القرون الأولى

translation: He said, 'Its knowledge is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah, in His infinite knowledge and perfect memory, is aware of all things. Nothing is hidden from Him, and He never forgets. This reminds believers to trust in Allah's wisdom and knowledge, knowing that He is always in control and aware of every detail.
orig: قال علمها عند ربي في كتاب لا يضل ربي ولا ينسى

translation: Who made for you the earth a bed and made for you in it roads so that you may find your way and sent down from the sky rain, and by it We bring forth various kinds of vegetation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings and provisions from Allah, who has made the earth a place of comfort and convenience for human beings, with roads for easy travel, sustenance, and bounty in the form of rain that brings forth a diverse array of vegetation for sustenance and beauty.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض مهدا وسلك لكم فيها سبلا وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به أزواجا من نبات شتى

translation: Eat and pasture your livestock; indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of taking care of one's livestock and using them as a source of sustenance. The verse highlights that through observing the process of feeding and caring for animals, one can reflect on the signs of Allah's wisdom and intelligence in the natural world. It encourages believers to appreciate the bounties of Allah and use them wisely for their benefit.
orig: كلوا وارعوا أنعامكم إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

translation: From the earth We created you, and into it We shall return you, and from it We shall bring you out once again.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that human life originates from the earth, and ultimately, everyone shall return to it after death. It signifies the cycle of life and death ordained by God, emphasizing the idea that all human beings are created from the same source and are equal in their return to the earth in death. Additionally, it serves as a reminder of the resurrection on the Day of Judgment, where all will be brought forth from the earth once again.
orig: منها خلقناكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة أخرى

translation: And We had certainly shown him all Our signs, but he denied and refused.
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who was presented with clear signs and proofs of Allah's existence and power, but he still chose to reject them and stubbornly refused to believe. It highlights the importance of recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah in order to attain guidance and faith.
orig: ولقد أريناه آياتنا كلها فكذب وأبى

translation: He said, "Have you come to us to turn us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
interpretation: This verse portrays the reaction of the sorcerers in Pharaoh's court to the miracles performed by Prophet Moses. They were bewildered by the power and truth of his message, but due to their pride and arrogance, they attributed his miracles to mere magic. It illustrates how sometimes arrogance and disbelief can blind individuals from recognizing the signs of truth and guidance.
orig: قال أجئتنا لتخرجنا من أرضنا بسحرك يا موسى

translation: So we will bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, not to be missed - neither we nor you - in a place designated.
interpretation: This verse recounts a challenge presented by sorcerers to Prophet Musa (Moses) to match their magic. However, it also serves as a reminder that Allah's power and might are unmatched, and attempts by sorcerers or others to challenge the divine authority inevitably fall short. It teaches us the futility of turning to magic or other false means for power or control, when true strength and guidance come only from Allah.
orig: فلنأتينك بسحر مثله فاجعل بيننا وبينك موعدا لا نخلفه نحن ولا أنت مكانا سوى

translation: He will say, 'Your appointment is on the day of [great] festival, and the people will be gathered for judgement.'
interpretation: This verse is a reference to the Day of Judgment, where all people will be gathered for their final accountability and judgement. It signifies the importance of being prepared for the afterlife and emphasizes the inevitable nature of this day.
orig: قال موعدكم يوم الزينة وأن يحشر الناس ضحى

translation: So Pharaoh turned away, gathered his plan, and then came.
interpretation: This verse describes the actions of Pharaoh who, after rejecting the truth, plotted against the believers. Despite being warned and shown signs, he remained arrogant and defiant. The verse serves as a reminder that those who oppose the truth may gather their plans and schemes, but ultimately they will face consequences for their actions before God.
orig: فتولى فرعون فجمع كيده ثم أتى

translation: Moses said to them: 'Woe to you! Do not invent falsehoods about God, or He will destroy you with a punishment. Whoever invents falsehood will surely fail.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning against falsely attributing lies to God or spreading false information about Him. It emphasizes that those who fabricate lies about God will face severe consequences and ultimately fail in their endeavors.
orig: قال لهم موسى ويلكم لا تفتروا على الله كذبا فيسحتكم بعذاب وقد خاب من افترى

translation: So they disputed among themselves their case and concealed their secret counsel.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of arrogance and disputes among people, which lead to concealing their true intentions and dealings. It serves as a warning against allowing disagreements to escalate into hidden intrigues and secret plotting, emphasizing the importance of resolving conflicts openly and constructively.
orig: فتنازعوا أمرهم بينهم وأسروا النجوى

translation: They said, 'These are indeed two magicians who intend to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most cherished way of life.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a situation where the magicians of Pharaoh accused Prophet Moses and Prophet Aaron of using magic to deceive the people. The interpretation can be seen as a warning against falsehood, manipulation, and deception used by the oppressors to maintain their power and control. It also emphasizes the importance of holding onto one's faith and beliefs in the face of challenges and false accusations.
orig: قالوا إن هذان لساحران يريدان أن يخرجاكم من أرضكم بسحرهما ويذهبا بطريقتكم المثلى

translation: So conspire your plot and then come in full force. And he who has succeeded today will indeed prosper.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message of perseverance and unity in the face of challenges. It encourages believers to plan and strategize together before taking decisive action. The mention of success and prosperity serves as a motivator, emphasizing the rewards of determination and coordination in achieving their goals.
orig: فأجمعوا كيدكم ثم ائتوا صفا وقد أفلح اليوم من استعلى

translation: They said, 'O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) was challenged by the sorcerers of Pharaoh. They asked him to either throw his staff first or allow them to go first. Prophet Moses was being tested by them, but he remained steadfast in his faith and trust in Allah, who eventually manifested His power through the miracles performed by Prophet Moses.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إما أن تلقي وإما أن نكون أول من ألقى

translation: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].
interpretation: This verse describes a moment when magicians were called upon to challenge the miracles of Prophet Moses. The magicians threw down their ropes and staffs, which appeared to be moving like snakes to them due to their illusions. This event highlights how deception and trickery can create illusions that seem real, but they are ultimately exposed by the power of truth and faith.
orig: قال بل ألقوا فإذا حبالهم وعصيهم يخيل إليه من سحرهم أنها تسعى

translation: So Moses felt fear within himself.
interpretation: This verse describes a moment when Prophet Moses felt fear within himself. It highlights the human aspect of the prophets, showing that even the most revered and righteous individuals may experience feelings of fear and uncertainty. It emphasizes that feeling fear is a normal part of the human experience, and even prophets may go through moments of doubt or anxiety. Despite his fear, Moses continued to fulfill his duty and trust in Allah, setting an example for believers to face their fears with strength and faith.
orig: فأوجس في نفسه خيفة موسى

translation: We said, 'Do not fear; indeed, you are the highest.'
interpretation: This verse reassures and encourages the recipient not to fear, as they are elevated and protected by Allah. It conveys the message that with faith and trust in Allah, one should not feel intimidated or fearful, as Allah's support and protection are always present for the believers.
orig: قلنا لا تخف إنك أنت الأعلى

translation: And throw that which is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is only the scheme of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is emphasizing the power and authority of Allah over all magic and illusions. It teaches that the tricks and deceptions of magicians will never prevail against the truth and might of Allah. The verse serves as a reminder that reliance on Allah's power and guidance is superior to relying on worldly illusions and deceitful practices.
orig: وألق ما في يمينك تلقف ما صنعوا إنما صنعوا كيد ساحر ولا يفلح الساحر حيث أتى

translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, 'We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the moment when the magicians who were summoned by Pharaoh to challenge Prophet Moses, upon witnessing the miracle performed by Moses, believed in the Lord of Moses and Aaron, despite their previous disbelief. It teaches us that belief can manifest even in the most unexpected places and in the hearts of those who are perceived as opponents.
orig: فألقي السحرة سجدا قالوا آمنا برب هارون وموسى

translation: He said, 'Have you believed him before I gave you permission? Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring.'
interpretation: This verse discusses a situation where a tyrant threatened to punish magicians who had believed in God before seeking his permission. The tyrant threatens severe physical punishment, showing his arrogance and determination to maintain control and suppress any belief that contradicts his authority. The verse highlights the unjust and oppressive nature of those who use power to suppress faith and truth, emphasizing the consequences of going against oppressive rulers and the importance of remaining steadfast in one's beliefs despite the threats and intimidation.
orig: قال آمنتم له قبل أن آذن لكم إنه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ولأصلبنكم في جذوع النخل ولتعلمن أينا أشد عذابا وأبقى

translation: They said, 'We will never give preference to you over what has come to us of clear proofs and over He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. Indeed, you only decree for us this worldly life.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a conversation where some people refuse to be guided by the Messenger of Allah, insisting on not prioritizing his guidance despite clear signs and the fact that it is from the Creator. The verse serves as a reminder that humans are often focused on worldly matters and fail to see the greater purpose and guidance provided by Allah through His messengers.
orig: قالوا لن نؤثرك على ما جاءنا من البينات والذي فطرنا فاقض ما أنت قاض إنما تقضي هذه الحياة الدنيا

translation: We have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring.
interpretation: This verse expresses the belief in Allah's forgiveness and the faith that He is better and more enduring than anything else. It also highlights the idea that believers seek Allah's forgiveness for their sins and acknowledge that He is superior to any magic or wrongdoings that may have influenced them.
orig: إنا آمنا بربنا ليغفر لنا خطايانا وما أكرهتنا عليه من السحر والله خير وأبقى

translation: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of leading a sinful life and approaching one's Lord in a state of wrongdoing. It highlights the eternal punishment of Hell for those who have committed grave sins and emphasizes the everlasting nature of the punishment in Hellfire, where there is neither death nor life as humans know it.
orig: إنه من يأت ربه مجرما فإن له جهنم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى

translation: And whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith and good deeds in Islam. It states that those who come on the Day of Judgement as believers who have performed righteous actions will be granted the highest ranks and positions in the sight of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the significance of combining faith with righteous actions in order to attain the highest levels of reward in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن يأته مؤمنا قد عمل الصالحات فأولئك لهم الدرجات العلى

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will abide therein forever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves.
interpretation: This verse describes the gardens of paradise, where the righteous will dwell eternally. It highlights that those who purify themselves through their actions and intentions will be rewarded with this eternal bliss in the afterlife. It emphasizes the significance of spiritual purification as a means to attain the ultimate reward of paradise.
orig: جنات عدن تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء من تزكى

translation: And We inspired to Moses, "Take away My servants by night, indeed you will be pursued." Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers
interpretation: This verse refers to the command given to Prophet Moses by Allah to lead the Children of Israel out of Egypt. Despite the seemingly impossible task of going through the sea, it signifies trust in Allah's plan and the importance of relying on Him, as He guided Moses and protected him and his people from Pharaoh's pursuit. It teaches us the lesson of faith, courage, and obedience to the divine commandments.
orig: ولقد أوحينا إلى موسى أن أسر بعبادي فاضرب لهم طريقا في البحر يبسا لا تخاف دركا ولا تخشى

translation: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them.
interpretation: This verse describes the pursuit by Pharaoh and his army of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and the Children of Israel. As they reached the sea, Allah caused the sea to split for Prophet Moses and his followers to cross safely, but when Pharaoh and his army followed, the sea closed upon them, drowning the pursuing soldiers. The verse shows Allah's power and protection towards His obedient followers while also demonstrating the consequences of defiance and arrogance against His chosen messengers.
orig: فأتبعهم فرعون بجنوده فغشيهم من اليم ما غشيهم

translation: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].
interpretation: This verse highlights the misguided leadership of Pharaoh, who led his people astray from the right path without providing them with any guidance. It serves as a lesson about the consequences of tyrannical leadership and the importance of following true guidance.
orig: وأضل فرعون قومه وما هدى

translation: O Children of Israel, we have saved you from your enemy and made an appointment with you on the right side of the Mount, and sent down to you manna and quails.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes Allah's protection and provision for the Children of Israel. It highlights the divine intervention in saving them from their enemies, fulfilling promises made to them, and providing sustenance in the form of manna and quails. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and grace towards His believers.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل قد أنجيناكم من عدوكم وواعدناكم جانب الطور الأيمن ونزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى

translation: Eat from the good things We have provided for you and do not transgress therein, lest My wrath should descend upon you. And whoever incurs My wrath has fallen down into ruin.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder for believers to consume only what is lawful and pure from the sustenance that God has provided. It warns against exceeding the limits and indulging in forbidden things as doing so may invoke divine punishment and destruction upon the wrongdoers.
orig: كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم ولا تطغوا فيه فيحل عليكم غضبي ومن يحلل عليه غضبي فقد هوى

translation: And indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver to whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the infinite mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who sincerely repent for their wrongdoings, believe in Him, perform good deeds, and continue on the path of righteousness and guidance. It emphasizes the importance of repentance, faith, and good actions as a means to receive Allah's forgiveness and guidance.
orig: وإني لغفار لمن تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا ثم اهتدى

translation: What has made you so quick to leave your people, O Moses?
interpretation: This verse is questioning Prophet Moses about why he has seemingly rushed to leave his people. It conveys the idea that leadership requires patience, dedication, and a sense of responsibility towards the community. It serves as a reminder to leaders to be mindful of their duties and the impact of their actions on those they are responsible for.
orig: وما أعجلك عن قومك يا موسى

translation: He said, 'They are close upon my track, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased.'
interpretation: This verse describes a Prophetic figure seeking refuge and guidance from God in a moment of urgency and danger, showing his complete reliance on God's mercy and protection. It highlights the concept of seeking God's pleasure and approval above all else, even in the face of imminent challenges.
orig: قال هم أولاء على أثري وعجلت إليك رب لترضى

translation: He (Moses) said, "We have certainly tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray."
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment where Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) is informing about a trial that had happened to his people after he departed, and how they were led astray by a person known as the Samiri. The verse highlights the importance of remaining steadfast in faith and knowledge even in the absence of the Prophet's physical presence, as there may be individuals who seek to mislead others.
orig: قال فإنا قد فتنا قومك من بعدك وأضلهم السامري

translation: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, 'O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you? Or did you wish that wrath would descend upon you from your Lord? So you broke your promise [with Him].'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Moses returning to his people feeling angry and saddened. He questions them about breaking their promise with God despite the good promises made to them. He warns them of the consequences of their actions and reminds them of their covenant with God. The verse highlights the importance of fulfilling promises made to God and the consequences of betraying that trust.
orig: فرجع موسى إلى قومه غضبان أسفا قال يا قوم ألم يعدكم ربكم وعدا حسنا أفطال عليكم العهد أم أردتم أن يحل عليكم غضب من ربكم فأخلفتم موعدي

translation: They said, 'We did not break our promise to you by our own will. But we were made to carry the burdens of the people's ornaments, then we threw them into the fire, and thus did the Samiri throw [the calf].'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the people's excuse for their idol worship. They tried to justify their actions by blaming the Samiri for misleading them into worshipping the calf. It serves as a warning against blindly following others without questioning or thinking critically about one's actions.
orig: قالوا ما أخلفنا موعدك بملكنا ولكنا حملنا أوزارا من زينة القوم فقذفناها فكذلك ألقى السامري

translation: So he extracted for them a statue of a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, 'This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot.'
interpretation: This verse discusses the story of the Israelites worshipping a calf made of gold while Prophet Moses was away on Mount Sinai. It highlights the human tendency to seek physical representations of the divine, and the ease with which people can be led astray from the true worship of God. It also reflects the concept of forgetfulness and ingratitude towards the divine guidance provided by God and His prophets.
orig: فأخرج لهم عجلا جسدا له خوار فقالوا هذا إلهكم وإله موسى فنسي

translation: Do they not see that it does not return a word to them and that it has no power to do harm to them or bring them benefit?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the inability of false deities and idols to respond or have any influence on their worshippers. It challenges the believers to reflect on the powerlessness of these false objects of worship and the futility of expecting any help or harm from them.
orig: أفلا يرون ألا يرجع إليهم قولا ولا يملك لهم ضرا ولا نفعا

translation: And indeed, Aaron had already told them before, 'O my people, you are only being tested by it. And indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order.'
interpretation: In this verse, Aaron reminds his people that the challenges they are facing are a test from Allah, the Most Merciful. He urges them to follow his guidance and obey his commands, emphasizing the importance of faith, patience, and obedience in times of trials and tribulations.
orig: ولقد قال لهم هارون من قبل يا قوم إنما فتنتم به وإن ربكم الرحمن فاتبعوني وأطيعوا أمري

translation: They said, 'We will never cease being devoted to him until Moses returns to us.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the steadfast determination of a group of people to wait for Moses' return. It highlights their loyalty and commitment to him, emphasizing their strong belief in his leadership and guidance. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of patience and loyalty in relationships, as well as the faith in the eventual return of what is awaited.
orig: قالوا لن نبرح عليه عاكفين حتى يرجع إلينا موسى

translation: He (Moses) said, O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray?
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Moses is questioning Prophet Aaron about his actions when he saw the people going astray. This highlights the importance of taking action to guide others on the right path when they are straying from it.
orig: قال يا هارون ما منعك إذ رأيتهم ضلوا

translation: Will you not follow me? Have I forbidden you a clear command?
interpretation: This verse portrays a rhetorical question posed to individuals who are being urged to follow the clear instructions and commands laid out by Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience and submission to the divine will, highlighting the necessity of following the guidance provided by Allah without hesitation or resistance.
orig: ألا تتبعن أفعصيت أمري

translation: He said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.'
interpretation: This verse narrates a scene where Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) is being approached by his brother, Aaron (Harun), who reminds Moses not to seize him by his beard or head out of fear of causing division among the Children of Israel. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of unity and harmony among believers and the wisdom in avoiding actions that could potentially lead to discord.
orig: قال يا ابن أم لا تأخذ بلحيتي ولا برأسي إني خشيت أن تقول فرقت بين بني إسرائيل ولم ترقب قولي

translation: He [Moses] said, 'What is your case, O Samiri?'
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when Prophet Moses questioned Samiri about his actions. Moses sought to understand the reasons behind Samiri's deviation and wrongdoing. It teaches us the importance of seeking clarification and addressing questionable behavior in a respectful manner in order to uphold justice and righteousness.
orig: قال فما خطبك يا سامري

translation: He said, 'I perceived what they did not perceive, so I seized a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me.'
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where a man from the community of the prophet Musa (Moses) witnessed a unique event that no one else saw. Instead of accepting the miraculous event as a sign from God, he chose to doubt it and act against his better judgement. The man's soul tempted him to reject the truth despite the clear evidence presented to him, leading to his own downfall.
orig: قال بصرت بما لم يبصروا به فقبضت قبضة من أثر الرسول فنبذتها وكذلك سولت لي نفسي

translation: He (Pharaoh) said, 'Go! Indeed, for you in life is that you will say, 'Do not touch.' And indeed, you have an appointment which you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to whom you have been devoted. We will surely burn it, and then blow it into the sea with a blast.'
interpretation: This verse describes Pharaoh's arrogant command to Prophet Musa (Moses) and the subsequent conversation. Pharaoh boasts about his power and threatens Prophet Musa. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance, disbelief, and false idols. It highlights the eventual downfall of those who oppose the truth and rely on material power or false deities.
orig: قال فاذهب فإن لك في الحياة أن تقول لا مساس وإن لك موعدا لن تخلفه وانظر إلى إلهك الذي ظلت عليه عاكفا لنحرقنه ثم لننسفنه في اليم نسفا

translation: Your deity is only Allah, there is no deity except Him. He has encompassed all things in knowledge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the only deity worthy of worship, acknowledging His exclusive divine essence. It highlights the comprehensive knowledge of Allah, indicating His encompassing awareness and understanding of all things. It serves as a reminder of the supreme power and omniscience of Allah, and underscores His unique position as the ultimate source of wisdom and guidance.
orig: إنما إلهكم الله الذي لا إله إلا هو وسع كل شيء علما

translation: Thus We relate to you [O Muhammad] some information of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us a message.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is being informed about past events as a means of guidance and learning. It signifies that the stories of the past are being shared with him so that he may understand and convey the message of Islam effectively.
orig: كذلك نقص عليك من أنباء ما قد سبق وقد آتيناك من لدنا ذكرا

translation: Whoever turns away from it, [it is] he who will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who turn away from the teachings of the Qur'an will carry the weight of their actions and choices on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a warning against neglecting or ignoring the guidance provided in the Qur'an, as there will be consequences in the Hereafter for those who choose to do so.
orig: من أعرض عنه فإنه يحمل يوم القيامة وزرا

translation: Abiding therein eternally. It is an evil place to stay and a terrible abode.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of those who will dwell in Hellfire forever. It emphasizes the everlasting nature of their punishment and highlights the extreme discomfort, suffering, and regret they will face on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a warning and reminder of the severe consequences of straying from the path of righteousness and rejecting the guidance of Allah.
orig: خالدين فيه وساء لهم يوم القيامة حملا

translation: On the Day the Horn is blown and We will gather the criminals, that Day will be blue [i.e. the faces of the criminals will be blue].
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the Horn is blown to signal the end of the world. The term 'blue' used here symbolizes fear and distress, indicating the state of the criminals who will be gathered and held accountable before God for their actions.
orig: يوم ينفخ في الصور ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا

translation: They talk quietly among themselves: 'You have only tarried for ten days.'
interpretation: This verse describes how a group of disbelievers discuss amongst themselves, mistakenly thinking that Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) had only stayed among them for ten days, underestimating his mission and the inevitable consequences of rejecting his message. The verse serves as a reminder that people often underestimate the significance and impact of events and individuals, showing the ignorance and arrogance of those who refuse to acknowledge the truth.
orig: يتخافتون بينهم إن لبثتم إلا عشرا

translation: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah knows everything that people say, and the Prophet is not responsible for compelling them to follow guidance. The best way to guide people is through reminding them with the Qur'an, especially those who fear the consequences of their actions.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يقولون إذ يقول أمثلهم طريقة إن لبثتم إلا يوما

translation: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, 'My Lord will blow them away with a blast.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and control of Allah over all creation, including the mountains which are viewed as strong and stable. It teaches us to recognize the greatness of Allah's might and His ability to destroy and reshape even the most seemingly unshakable things in the universe. It serves as a reminder for believers to have faith in Allah's power and to never underestimate His capabilities.
orig: ويسألونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربي نسفا

translation: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
interpretation: This verse suggests that sometimes it is better to leave people who are indulging in confusion or disbelief in their state for a period of time, allowing them to reflect and potentially come to a realization on their own. It highlights the wisdom in patience and allowing individuals the time and space to find their way to the truth.
orig: فيذرها قاعا صفصفا

translation: There is not therein a crookedness or a deviation.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the perfection and flawlessness of whatever is being talked about. It conveys the idea that the subject is straight, true, and free from any imperfections or deviations.
orig: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا أمتا

translation: On that Day, they will follow the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be humbled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when all beings will follow the Caller (the angel who calls people to account), without any deviation from the path towards judgment. It portrays a scene of humility and submission before the Most Merciful (God), where all voices are subdued, and only whispers can be heard. The verse emphasizes the inevitability of facing judgment and the ultimate authority of God over all creation.
orig: يومئذ يتبعون الداعي لا عوج له وخشعت الأصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع إلا همسا

translation: On that Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that on the Day of Judgment, no one will be able to intercede on behalf of another except with the permission and approval of Allah. It highlights the absolute authority and justice of Allah, as He is the ultimate decision-maker on that Day.
orig: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفاعة إلا من أذن له الرحمن ورضي له قولا

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not encompass Him in knowledge.
interpretation: This verse highlights the all-encompassing knowledge of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah knows everything about His creation, both past and future, while they do not have the capacity to fully comprehend His knowledge. It serves as a reminder of the vastness and perfection of Allah's knowledge compared to the limited knowledge of human beings.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما

translation: And faces shall be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of all existence, and whoever bears injustice will have failed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when every individual will stand before Allah, the Ever-Living and Sustainer of all existence. It points out that those who have committed injustice and wrongdoing will face humiliation and failure on that day. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and justice that will prevail in the hereafter.
orig: وعنت الوجوه للحي القيوم وقد خاب من حمل ظلما

translation: And whoever does righteous deeds, while being a believer, shall have no fear of injustice or deprivation.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the connection between faith and good deeds. It assures believers that if they engage in righteous actions with genuine faith, they should not fear any form of injustice or harm in this world or the Hereafter. It serves as a source of comfort and encouragement for those who strive to do good deeds while holding steadfast to their faith.
orig: ومن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما

translation: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid sin or it would cause them remembrance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine wisdom in revealing the Quran in the Arabic language, making it clearer and more accessible to the Arab audience. By diversifying the warnings and reminders within the Quran, there is a hope that people will be conscious of their actions, avoid sin, and be reminded of their purpose in life through the guidance of the Quran.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون أو يحدث لهم ذكرا

translation: So high above all is Allah, the True Sovereign. And do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and reflection when reciting the Qur'an, not rushing through it but contemplating its meanings and revelations thoroughly. The verse also underscores the significance of seeking knowledge and continuously asking Allah to increase one's knowledge, highlighting the value of continuous learning and growth in one's understanding of the faith.
orig: فتعالى الله الملك الحق ولا تعجل بالقرآن من قبل أن يقضى إليك وحيه وقل رب زدني علما

translation: And We had already taken a covenant from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the forgetfulness and human nature of Adam, the first man. It serves as a reminder to believers of the importance of steadfastness and determination in fulfilling their covenants with God, as forgetting or neglecting them can lead one astray. The verse emphasizes the need for resilience and commitment in upholding one's promises and responsibilities.
orig: ولقد عهدنا إلى آدم من قبل فنسي ولم نجد له عزما

translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate to Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He refused.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the story of the creation of Adam and the command given to the angels to prostrate to him. It reflects the arrogance and disobedience of Iblis (Satan), who defied the command of Allah due to his pride and refusal to bow down to someone he deemed inferior. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and disobedience, and the importance of humility and submission to the will of Allah.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى

translation: So We said, 'O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let them not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is emphasizing the importance of obedience to Allah's commandments and the potential consequences of disobedience. It highlights the story of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, where Satan is referred to as the clear enemy of mankind. It serves as a reminder that following Allah's guidance leads to blessings and happiness, while disobedience can lead to negative consequences and suffering.
orig: فقلنا يا آدم إن هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى

translation: You will not be hungry in it nor will you be unclothed.
interpretation: This verse assures believers about the provision and care they will receive in the afterlife. It emphasizes that in the Hereafter, people will not suffer from hunger or lack of clothing, indicating the abundance and satisfaction that awaits the believers in the afterlife.
orig: إن لك ألا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى

translation: And that you will not be thirsty therein nor will you be hot.
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings and comforts of Paradise, where the inhabitants will not experience thirst or extreme heat. It signifies the perfect state of tranquility and satisfaction in the afterlife for the righteous believers.
orig: وأنك لا تظمأ فيها ولا تضحى

translation: Then Satan whispered to him, saying, 'O Adam! Shall I lead you to the Tree of Eternity and a kingdom that never decays?'
interpretation: This verse depicts the story of Satan trying to deceive Adam by enticing him with the promise of eternal life and a never-fading kingdom. It serves as a warning against the temptations and deceptions of the devil, urging believers to be vigilant and steadfast in their faith to resist such temptations.
orig: فوسوس إليه الشيطان قال يا آدم هل أدلك على شجرة الخلد وملك لا يبلى

translation: So they ate from it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the story of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, and how they were tempted to eat from the forbidden tree. Their disobedience towards Allah led to them becoming aware of their nakedness and covering themselves with leaves. This incident highlights human tendency to give in to temptation and disobeying divine command, leading to the consequences of sin and vulnerabilities.
orig: فأكلا منها فبدت لهما سوآتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وعصى آدم ربه فغوى

translation: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Yunus (Jonah), who was swallowed by a whale after leaving his people without permission from Allah. Despite his mistake, Allah chose him, forgave him, and showed him the right path. It teaches us that no matter how far we may have strayed, if we sincerely repent and seek guidance, Allah is always ready to forgive and guide us back to the straight path.
orig: ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى

translation: He said, 'Get out of it, despised and expelled. Whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray nor suffer.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the consequences of disobedience to God's command. It speaks about the expulsion of mankind from paradise due to disobedience, but also offers hope and guidance to those who choose to follow the path set by God. By following God's guidance, one can be assured of not going astray and finding true peace and happiness in life.
orig: قال اهبطا منها جميعا بعضكم لبعض عدو فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن اتبع هداي فلا يضل ولا يشقى

translation: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and being mindful of Allah. Those who turn away from His remembrance will lead a constricted and unsatisfactory life in this world. Ultimately, on the Day of Resurrection, they will be gathered blind, symbolizing their spiritual blindness and inability to see the truth due to their heedlessness in this life.
orig: ومن أعرض عن ذكري فإن له معيشة ضنكا ونحشره يوم القيامة أعمى

translation: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"
interpretation: This verse represents a situation where a person, after being resurrected on the Day of Judgment, questions why they have been resurrected blind when they had the ability to see in the worldly life. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and questioning before Allah for the actions and choices made in the earthly life.
orig: قال رب لم حشرتني أعمى وقد كنت بصيرا

translation: He will say, 'Thus did Our signs come to you, but you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of how people may receive signs and guidance from Allah, but due to negligence or distractions, they forget them. Just as they forgot the signs in the worldly life, in the Hereafter they will be neglected and forgotten due to their own forgetfulness and disobedience.
orig: قال كذلك أتتك آياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى

translation: And thus do We recompense those who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of their Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the consequences for those who are extravagant and do not believe in the signs of their Lord. It warns that the punishment in the Hereafter will be severe and everlasting, serving as a reminder to avoid transgression and disbelief.
orig: وكذلك نجزي من أسرف ولم يؤمن بآيات ربه ولعذاب الآخرة أشد وأبقى

translation: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after the former generations that, had We willed, We could have struck them for their sins and set a seal upon their hearts so they could not hear?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the people who came after the past generations, warning them of the consequences of their sins that caused the destruction of previous nations. It highlights that the signs of Allah are evident in the rise and fall of nations, urging people to reflect on these lessons and amend their ways.
orig: أفلم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

translation: And if it were not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been necessary [to specify the time of punishment as] an appointed term.
interpretation: This verse indicates that there is a predetermined time for every event and every decree in the divine plan. If it were not for the precise word and decree from Allah, everything would have happened haphazardly. It emphasizes the idea of divine wisdom and control over the universe.
orig: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما وأجل مسمى

translation: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience, gratitude, and remembrance of Allah throughout different times of the day and night. It encourages believers to maintain a strong connection with Allah by praising Him and seeking His pleasure, which leads to contentment and satisfaction in life.
orig: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ومن آناء الليل فسبح وأطراف النهار لعلك ترضى

translation: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to be envious of the temporary pleasures and material possessions enjoyed by others in this worldly life. These are merely tests from Allah to see the faith and gratitude of individuals. The sustenance provided by Allah is superior and everlasting, emphasizing the importance of patience and gratitude in facing worldly trials and tests.
orig: ولا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم زهرة الحياة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ورزق ربك خير وأبقى

translation: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prayer and patience in fulfilling this duty. It reassures believers that Allah is the ultimate provider and that the ultimate reward and success belong to those who maintain righteousness and piety.
orig: وأمر أهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها لا نسألك رزقا نحن نرزقك والعاقبة للتقوى

translation: And they say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, the unseen belongs to Allah; so wait, indeed I am with you among those who wait."
interpretation: This verse addresses the disbelievers who demanded a miraculous sign from the Prophet Muhammad to prove his prophethood. The response given is that the knowledge of the unseen rests with Allah alone, and it is He who decides when and how to manifest signs. The believers are advised to have patience and trust in Allah's wisdom, as the fulfillment of His promise is certain, and the Prophet is also waiting along with them for the signs to be shown.
orig: وقالوا لولا يأتينا بآية من ربه أولم تأتهم بينة ما في الصحف الأولى

translation: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before this revelation, they would have said, 'Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the merciful nature of Allah, who sends messengers before punishment to give people the opportunity to receive guidance and turn to Him. It emphasizes the importance of following the teachings and signs of Allah to avoid humiliation and disgrace in the Hereafter.
orig: ولو أنا أهلكناهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا أرسلت إلينا رسولا فنتبع آياتك من قبل أن نذل ونخزى

translation: Say, "Everyone is waiting, so wait; you will come to know who are the companions of the sound path and who is rightly guided."
interpretation: This verse is reminding believers to be patient and steadfast in their faith, as everyone will eventually be judged based on their actions and beliefs. It encourages believers to be vigilant and persevere on the right path, as those who are truly guided will eventually be distinguished from those who are not.
orig: قل كل متربص فتربصوا فستعلمون من أصحاب الصراط السوي ومن اهتدى

translation: The Judgment has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
interpretation: This verse warns that the Day of Judgment is approaching for all people, yet many are oblivious and turn away from this reality. It serves as a reminder to be vigilant and mindful of the consequences of one's actions, as ultimately everyone will be held accountable for their deeds before Allah.
orig: اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون

translation: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are playing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the heedlessness and lack of seriousness of some individuals when it comes to receiving and reflecting upon the messages and reminders from their Lord. It criticizes those who pay superficial attention to the guidance and revelations of Allah, treating them as mere entertainment or amusement rather than engaging with them seriously and sincerely. It serves as a reminder to believers to approach the teachings of the Qur'an with attentiveness, respect, and a desire for guidance rather than trivializing or neglecting them.
orig: ما يأتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث إلا استمعوه وهم يلعبون

translation: Their hearts are distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], 'Is this [Prophet] except a human like yourselves? So would you approach magic while you are aware?'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder from Allah about how the disbelievers refused to believe in the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) due to their arrogance and ignorance. They questioned his humanity, accusing him of using magic to deceive people. The verse emphasizes that the Prophet was indeed a human being and warns against falling into disbelief due to arrogance and lack of understanding.
orig: لاهية قلوبهم وأسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا إلا بشر مثلكم أفتأتون السحر وأنتم تبصرون

translation: My Lord knows what is said in the heavens and the earth. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence and omniscience of Allah. It emphasizes that He knows all that is said and done in the heavens and the earth, showcasing His supreme ability to hear and know everything. It reminds us of Allah's divine attributes and His infinite knowledge and awareness of all things.
orig: قال ربي يعلم القول في السماء والأرض وهو السميع العليم

translation: Rather, they say, 'He has invented it.' Rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles].'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the response of disbelievers to the message of the Qur'an, in which they claim it to be the product of the Prophet Muhammad's imagination or poetry. The challenge put forth here is for the Prophet to produce a miraculous sign similar to the ones brought by previous Messengers as evidence of his prophethood. It illustrates the stubbornness and skepticism of those who refused to acknowledge the truth of the message.
orig: بل قالوا أضغاث أحلام بل افتراه بل هو شاعر فليأتنا بآية كما أرسل الأولون

translation: I did not believe before them any city that We destroyed. Will they then believe?
interpretation: This verse highlights the reality that previous nations and cities which rejected the message of their messengers were ultimately destroyed as a consequence of their disbelief. The rhetorical question posed in the verse challenges the current disbelievers to reflect on this pattern of destruction and take heed by believing before facing a similar fate.
orig: ما آمنت قبلهم من قرية أهلكناها أفهم يؤمنون

translation: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all previous prophets were human beings to whom Allah revealed His message. It encourages seeking knowledge and guidance from people of knowledge if one is uncertain or lacking understanding.
orig: وما أرسلنا قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And We did not make them bodies that do not eat food, nor were they immortal.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human condition of being dependent on sustenance, such as food, for survival. It emphasizes the concept of mortality and the fact that humans are not immortal beings. It serves as a reminder of our limitations as humans and our reliance on Allah for our basic needs and our ultimate destiny.
orig: وما جعلناهم جسدا لا يأكلون الطعام وما كانوا خالدين

translation: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed, and We destroyed the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of God fulfilling His promises to His believers and saving them from harm or danger. It also emphasizes that God has the power to destroy those who exceed the limits and engage in transgression against Him.
orig: ثم صدقناهم الوعد فأنجيناهم ومن نشاء وأهلكنا المسرفين

translation: We have sent down to you a Book containing your message. Do you not understand?
interpretation: This verse is calling on people to reflect and ponder upon the Book revealed to them, which contains guidance and reminders for them. It emphasizes the importance of using one's intellect to understand the message and guidance provided in the Qur'an.
orig: لقد أنزلنا إليكم كتابا فيه ذكركم أفلا تعقلون

translation: And how many a city have We destroyed that was unjust, and We produced after it another people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the recurring pattern of destruction and re-creation of nations in history as a result of their tyranny and oppression. It serves as a reminder that unjust societies will face consequences for their actions, and new generations will rise to take their place. It also emphasizes the concept of divine justice and the importance of upholding righteousness and fairness in societies.
orig: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وأنشأنا بعدها قوما آخرين

translation: So when they tasted Our punishment, immediately they fled from it.
interpretation: This verse describes the response of certain people to the punishment inflicted by Allah. When they experienced the consequences of their actions or disbelief, they tried to escape from it. It signifies the realization of the consequences of wrongdoing and the instinctual reaction to avoid suffering.
orig: فلما أحسوا بأسنا إذا هم منها يركضون

translation: Do not walk proudly on the earth; indeed, you will never tear the earth apart and will never reach the mountains in height.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to walk arrogantly on the earth, thinking themselves better than others. It teaches humility and modesty, urging people to avoid arrogance and instead seek knowledge and guidance from their dwellings and surroundings.
orig: لا تركضوا وارجعوا إلى ما أترفتم فيه ومساكنكم لعلكم تسألون

translation: They will say, 'Woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the moment of realization and regret of the wrongdoers on the Day of Judgment when they acknowledge their injustices and sins. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing one's faults and seeking forgiveness before it's too late.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: So their declaration persisted until We made them (as) reaped (field), extinguished.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences of the persistent disbelief and rejection of the truth by the disbelievers. It describes how their stubbornness in denial ultimately led to their destruction and loss of vitality, like a harvested field left in desolation. It serves as a warning against the consequences of consistently rejecting the messages of guidance and truth.
orig: فما زالت تلك دعواهم حتى جعلناهم حصيدا خامدين

translation: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and whatever is between them aimlessly.
