interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the divine purpose behind the creation of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between. It serves as a reminder that all of creation is meticulously designed by Allah with wisdom and purpose, and not without a reason or in vain.
orig: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: If We willed, We could have made it [a means for derision], but We do not intend to do so.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and will of Allah, stating that if He had wished, He could have made the Qur'an a source of jest and mockery. However, the verse emphasizes that this is not the intention of Allah, as the Qur'an is a serious and sacred scripture meant for guidance and reflection, not for amusement or ridicule.
orig: لو أردنا أن نتخذ لهوا لاتخذناه من لدنا إن كنا فاعلين

translation: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the truth always prevails over falsehood. It shows that falsehood is inherently weak and will eventually be destroyed by the truth. It serves as a reminder that those who persist in falsehood will face consequences for their actions.
orig: بل نقذف بالحق على الباطل فيدمغه فإذا هو زاهق ولكم الويل مما تصفون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universality of Allah's dominion over all that exists in the heavens and the earth. It also highlights that those who are close to Allah do not let arrogance hinder them from worshiping Him, and they do not grow weary of fulfilling their duties towards Him. It serves as a reminder for believers to maintain humility and dedication in their worship of Allah.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون

translation: They glorify Him night and day without slackening.
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuous praise and glorification of God by the believers, indicating their unwavering devotion and dedication to Him, as they constantly remember and praise Him throughout the day and night without any cessation.
orig: يسبحون الليل والنهار لا يفترون

translation: Have they taken gods from the earth who can raise the dead?
interpretation: This verse questions the logic and wisdom of those who worship idols made from earthly materials. The rhetorical question posed suggests that how can these idols, which are themselves created and lifeless, have the power to bring the dead back to life? It highlights the absurdity of worshiping false gods who have no power or authority, especially when compared to the might and authority of the one true God.
orig: أم اتخذوا آلهة من الأرض هم ينشرون

translation: If there were therein gods besides Allah, then verily both would have been in a state of ruin. So glorified is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, above what they attribute to Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and rejects the concept of multiple gods. It highlights the perfection and uniqueness of Allah, stating that if there were other gods besides Him, then the whole system of the heavens and the earth would have been chaotic and ruined. It serves as a reminder that Allah is far above any likeness or partners that people may ascribe to Him.
orig: لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا فسبحان الله رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the supreme authority and wisdom of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is not accountable to anyone for His actions, as He is the creator and sustainer of the universe. However, all human beings will be questioned and held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith, accountability, and submission to the will of Allah.
orig: لا يسأل عما يفعل وهم يسألون

translation: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
interpretation: This verse is questioning the practice of taking other gods besides Allah and challenges those who do so to provide evidence or proof for their beliefs. It also highlights that the Qur'an is a reminder for the people of the past and present. The verse emphasizes that many people are unaware of the truth and choose to turn away from it.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دونه آلهة قل هاتوا برهانكم هذا ذكر من معي وذكر من قبلي بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق فهم معرضون

translation: And We did not send before you (O Muhammad) any messenger except that We revealed to him that there is no deity except Me, so worship Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the monotheistic message that all messengers of God have preached throughout history. It affirms the belief in the oneness of God and the obligation of worshipping Him alone. This verse reminds us of the consistency in the message brought by all the prophets and messengers sent by God, guiding humanity towards the worship and obedience of the One true God.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول إلا نوحي إليه أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدون

translation: And they say: 'The Most Merciful has taken a son.' Exalted is He! Rather, they are servants honored.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the oneness and uniqueness of Allah, rejecting the notion that He could have a son. It also highlights the high status of His righteous servants who are honored and near to Him.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا سبحانه بل عباد مكرمون

translation: They do not precede Him in speech and [they] act by His command.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate authority and power of Allah. It signifies that no one can speak before Him as they have no knowledge of the unseen, and all actions are carried out only by His command. It highlights the supremacy and control of Allah over all things.
orig: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بأمره يعملون

translation: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. And His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse describes the vast knowledge and power of Allah, stating that He knows everything that is before and after us. Nothing can intercede on behalf of others except by Allah's permission. The mention of His Kursi, or Throne, indicates His authority and sovereignty over the heavens and the earth. Despite His immense control and knowledge, taking care of the universe does not exhaust Him. Ultimately, it emphasizes the incomparable greatness and majesty of Allah.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون إلا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون

translation: And whoever says, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him," that one We reward with Hell. Thus do We reward the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against the sin of associating partners with Allah, claiming divinity besides Him. It emphasizes that such a belief will lead to punishment in Hell, as it is a form of injustice and wrongdoing in the sight of Allah. The verse highlights the importance of maintaining pure monotheism and not attributing divine powers to anyone or anything besides Allah.
orig: ومن يقل منهم إني إله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم كذلك نجزي الظالمين

translation: Do those who disbelieve not see that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an calls upon the disbelievers to reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth as a single entity that was then separated. It emphasizes the role of water as a source of life for all living things and questions why those who witness such miraculous creations do not believe in the power and wisdom of Allah.
orig: أولم ير الذين كفروا أن السماوات والأرض كانتا رتقا ففتقناهما وجعلنا من الماء كل شيء حي أفلا يؤمنون

translation: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and purpose behind the creation of mountains and valleys on Earth. Mountains are described as firmly set to provide stability to the land, and valleys are formed as pathways, facilitating navigation and guidance for people. It emphasizes the harmonious design of nature, serving both practical and spiritual purposes, inviting reflection on the signs of God's creation.
orig: وجعلنا في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We have made the heaven a roof well guarded. Yet they turn away from its signs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the perfection of the heavens created by Allah, which serve as a protected and guarded structure above us. Despite the clear signs and wonders of the heavens, many people choose to ignore or turn away from reflecting upon them, thereby missing out on the opportunity to recognize the power and majesty of Allah.
orig: وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا وهم عن آياتها معرضون

translation: He it is Who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon, all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its orbit.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah as the Creator of the universe and all that it contains. It highlights the orderly motion and harmony of the celestial bodies, such as the sun and the moon, moving in precise orbits as a sign of Allah's perfect design and control over creation.
orig: وهو الذي خلق الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر كل في فلك يسبحون

translation: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mortality of humans. It reminds us that no human being before the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was granted eternal life on earth. Therefore, if the Prophet were to die, would those who came before him be eternal? The verse highlights the transient nature of life on this earth and serves as a reminder that all humans are bound to die and return to their Creator.
orig: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد أفإن مت فهم الخالدون

translation: Every soul will taste death, and We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that death is an inevitable reality that every soul will experience. God tests people with both adversity and prosperity as a means of trial in this worldly life. Ultimately, all individuals will return to God and be held accountable for their deeds in the Hereafter.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة وإلينا ترجعون

translation: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], 'Is this the one who mentions your gods?' while they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mockery and ridicule faced by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from the disbelievers when he preached about the Oneness of Allah and the message of Islam. It shows the contrast between their disrespectful attitude towards the Prophet and their rejection of the message of mercy and compassion brought by Islam.
orig: وإذا رآك الذين كفروا إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي يذكر آلهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كافرون

translation: Man was created of haste. Soon I will show you My signs, so do not be impatient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that human beings are created with a tendency towards impatience and haste. It advises believers to be patient and trust in the signs and guidance that Allah will reveal in due time. It serves as a reminder to have faith in the divine plan and timing, rather than rushing and being impatient for immediate results.
orig: خلق الإنسان من عجل سأريكم آياتي فلا تستعجلون

translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the attitude of the disbelievers who question the fulfillment of the promise of the Day of Judgment. They mockingly ask when this promise will be fulfilled, challenging the truth and inevitability of the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the accountability that awaits all individuals and the importance of faith in the unseen as decreed by Allah.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: If only those who disbelieved knew when they will not avert the Fire from their faces nor from their backs, and they will not be aided.
interpretation: This verse conveys that if those who reject faith were aware of the future consequences awaiting them, where they will be unable to escape the punishment of Hell from any side and no one will come to their aid, they might reconsider their disbelief and choose to believe in God and righteousness.
orig: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون

translation: But it [i.e., the Hour] will come upon them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be given respite.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the suddenness and unpredictability of the coming of the Hour (the Day of Judgment). It emphasizes that when the Hour arrives, people will be shocked and unable to defend themselves against it or delay it. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being prepared for the Hereafter and the accountability that comes with it.
orig: بل تأتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that there were messengers before the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) who were mocked and ridiculed by their people. However, those who laughed at and scorned the messengers eventually faced the consequences of their mockery. It serves as a warning to those who ridicule the messengers of Allah, as their actions may lead to their own downfall and punishment.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say, 'Who shields you from the night and the day from the All-Merciful?' Yet they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and ignorance of those who fail to recognize the protection and sustenance provided to them by Allah, the Most Merciful, throughout the day and night. It emphasizes how some people, despite being constantly surrounded by the signs and blessings of their Lord, choose to turn away from remembering Him and acknowledging His presence in their lives.
orig: قل من يكلؤكم بالليل والنهار من الرحمن بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون

translation: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable even to help themselves, nor are they accompanied by Us.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the futility of associating partners with Allah or relying on other deities besides Him. It emphasizes that these false gods have no power to defend, help, or support anyone, as ultimate power and protection belong solely to Allah. It serves as a reminder to monotheism and the exclusive worship of Allah.
orig: أم لهم آلهة تمنعهم من دوننا لا يستطيعون نصر أنفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون

translation: Rather, We gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers until the period grew long for them. Do they not see that We are advancing in the land, reducing it from its borders? But it is they who will overcome.
interpretation: This verse discusses the arrogance and heedlessness of the disbelievers who were enjoying the bounties of this world and feeling secure despite their wrongdoings. The verse points to the fact that despite their arrogance, Allah is the one who has ultimate power and control over all things, and they will eventually be overcome by the will of Allah.
orig: بل متعنا هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى طال عليهم العمر أفلا يرون أنا نأتي الأرض ننقصها من أطرافها أفهم الغالبون

translation: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of revelation in warning people about the consequences of their actions. The deaf mentioned here are not just those who have trouble hearing physically, but also those who choose not to listen or pay attention to the warnings being delivered to them. It highlights the importance of not ignoring the messages of guidance and warning brought by divine revelation.
orig: قل إنما أنذركم بالوحي ولا يسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ما ينذرون

translation: If a mere whiff of the punishment of your Lord were to touch them, they would surely cry, 'Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that even the slightest taste of God's punishment would lead the wrongdoers to acknowledge their transgressions and regret their past actions. It illustrates the concept of divine justice and serves as a reminder of the consequences of wrongdoing.
orig: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of justice and accountability in Islam. It emphasizes that on the Day of Resurrection, every individual's deeds, no matter how small, will be taken into account. The scales of justice will accurately weigh each person's good and bad actions, ensuring that no one is treated unjustly. This serves as a reminder of the ultimate fairness and accountability in the sight of Allah.
orig: ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا وإن كان مثقال حبة من خردل أتينا بها وكفى بنا حاسبين

translation: And We had certainly given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special gifts bestowed upon Prophet Moses (Musa) and his brother Aaron (Harun) by God. They were given the 'criterion' which helped them distinguish between truth and falsehood, 'a light' which guided them on the right path, and 'a reminder' to serve as guidance for those who seek righteousness. It emphasizes the importance of God's guidance for those who fear Him and strive to lead a righteous life.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى وهارون الفرقان وضياء وذكرا للمتقين

translation: Those who fear their Lord unseen, and they are fearful of the Hour.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have a deep reverence and fear of Allah, even though they cannot physically see Him. They are constantly aware and mindful of the Day of Judgment, which motivates them to maintain their piety and righteousness in this life. The verse emphasizes the importance of having a strong faith and awareness of the unseen reality, as well as a sense of accountability for one's actions.
orig: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون

translation: And this is a blessed message which We have revealed. Will you then deny it?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an is a blessed revelation from Allah, and it questions the audience if they will deny or reject this divine message. It invites the readers to reflect on the significance and beauty of the message and to consider their response to it.
orig: وهذا ذكر مبارك أنزلناه أفأنتم له منكرون

translation: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah had blessed Ibrahim (Abraham) with sound judgment and knowledge before the events mentioned in this verse took place. It emphasizes Allah's knowledge of Ibrahim's character and abilities, recognizing his wisdom and understanding.
orig: ولقد آتينا إبراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What are these statues to which you are devoted?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) questioning his father and his people about their devotion to statues. Ibrahim's questioning serves as a call to reflect on the false worship of idols and to turn towards the worship of the one true God.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التي أنتم لها عاكفون

translation: They said, 'We found our fathers worshippers of them.'
interpretation: This verse denotes a conversation where some people justify their actions by mentioning that their forefathers were also involved in the same practices. The Quran often highlights how blindly following traditions or customs without questioning their validity is not a valid justification for one's actions.
orig: قالوا وجدنا آباءنا لها عابدين

translation: He will say, 'You were indeed in manifest error, you and your forefathers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Judgment when individuals will be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder that following the wrong path, whether it be inherited from ancestors or chosen by oneself, will be futile in the end. It emphasizes the importance of seeking the true guidance and avoiding deviation from the right path.
orig: قال لقد كنتم أنتم وآباؤكم في ضلال مبين

translation: They said, 'Have you come to us with the truth, or are you of those who jest?'
interpretation: This verse reflects a common reaction of disbelief and mockery towards the message of truth. People often question the sincerity and seriousness of the messenger, doubting whether the message being conveyed is genuine. It underscores the importance of discerning the truth and the need to approach it with an open mind, rather than dismissing it out of hand.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا بالحق أم أنت من اللاعبين

translation: He said, 'Rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of the witnesses.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah) by affirming that Allah is the Lord of all of creation, the heavens, and the earth. It highlights the attribute of Allah as the Creator of everything and that He is a Witness to all that happens. The verse also implies the importance of acknowledging and recognizing Allah's lordship over the universe.
orig: قال بل ربكم رب السماوات والأرض الذي فطرهن وأنا على ذلكم من الشاهدين

translation: By Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and determination of Allah in confronting and defeating the false idols that people worship instead of Him. It serves as a warning to those who deviate from the path of monotheism, indicating that ultimately all false beliefs and idols will be rendered powerless and exposed by the will of Allah.
orig: وتالله لأكيدن أصنامكم بعد أن تولوا مدبرين

translation: So He made them like stubble, except for a few, and [thus] they will return [to Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and might of Allah, depicting how He can reduce individuals to nothingness except for those who hold firm to their faith and devotion. It serves as a reminder that ultimately all beings will return to Him, emphasizing the importance of staying steadfast in faith and obedience.
orig: فجعلهم جذاذا إلا كبيرا لهم لعلهم إليه يرجعون

translation: They said, 'Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of people who find their idols or gods being harmed or destroyed. It reveals how they automatically place blame on others without evidence or proper consideration. It symbolizes the blind devotion people have towards objects or beliefs, leading them to act unjustly and hastily in defense of those beliefs.
orig: قالوا من فعل هذا بآلهتنا إنه لمن الظالمين

translation: They said, 'We heard a young man mention them; he is called Abraham.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and how the people were discussing him. It highlights the reaction of the people upon hearing Ibrahim mention their idols and his journey towards monotheism. It shows how he stood out among the people and gained their attention because of his devotion to Tawhid (monotheism).
orig: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له إبراهيم

translation: They said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."
interpretation: This verse highlights the desire of some individuals to publicly present evidence in order to convince others. It indicates the importance of providing clear and tangible proof to establish the truth and seek witnesses to support one's case. Additionally, it serves as a reminder of the significance of seeking verification and ensuring transparency in matters of conflict or dispute.
orig: قالوا فأتوا به على أعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون

translation: They said, 'Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?'
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when Prophet Abraham destroyed the idols worshipped by his people. The people then questioned him about his actions, and their question reflects their shock and disbelief at his act of defying their gods. Abraham's action symbolizes the rejection of false idols and the importance of worshipping only the One true God.
orig: قالوا أأنت فعلت هذا بآلهتنا يا إبراهيم

translation: He said, 'Rather, their chief has done this; so ask them if they should [be able to] speak.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the inability of the idols to speak or defend themselves despite being worshipped by people as gods. It's emphasizing the absurdity and futility of idol worship, as these idols are mere creations of human hands and hold no power or divinity.
orig: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فاسألوهم إن كانوا ينطقون

translation: So they returned to themselves and said, 'Indeed, you are the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse describes a situation in which people, after reflecting on their actions, come to realize that they themselves are the ones committing wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder for self-reflection and accountability, urging individuals to acknowledge their own faults and mistakes before attributing blame to others.
orig: فرجعوا إلى أنفسهم فقالوا إنكم أنتم الظالمون

translation: Then they will be thrown on their faces into it (the Hellfire), they and the evildoers.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene of Judgment Day when the disbelievers and wrongdoers will be thrown face-first into the Hellfire. It signifies the severe punishment awaiting those who rejected faith and committed wrongdoing in their lives. The vivid imagery serves as a warning to those who deviate from righteousness and disobey the commandments of Allah.
orig: ثم نكسوا على رءوسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلاء ينطقون

translation: He said, 'Do you worship besides Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of worshiping anything besides Allah. It questions the rationale behind placing trust and devotion in entities that have no power to benefit or harm individuals. It emphasizes the importance of directing one's worship and faith solely towards Allah, who is the ultimate source of benefit and protection.
orig: قال أفتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيئا ولا يضركم

translation: Woe to you, and to what you worship besides Allah! Have you no sense?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder and a warning to those who worship things or beings other than Allah. It questions their lack of reason and understanding, highlighting the futility of worshiping false deities. It calls upon the believers to reflect on the illogical nature of associating partners with Allah and to turn back to the true worship of the One God.
orig: أف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله أفلا تعقلون

translation: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where a group of people were debating about what to do with a believer. The disbelievers suggested burning the believer as a way to punish him for his faith, while also challenging the believer's gods to come to his rescue if they truly existed. This verse serves to highlight the cruelty and ignorance of those who reject the message of God and resort to violence in order to maintain their false beliefs.
orig: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا آلهتكم إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: We said, 'O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham.'
interpretation: This verse recounts the moment when God commanded the fire to be cool and peaceful for the Prophet Abraham. It speaks to the power and mercy of God, who can even alter the nature of the elements to protect those who are devoted to Him.
orig: قلنا يا نار كوني بردا وسلاما على إبراهيم

translation: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine power of Allah over any plans made by individuals or groups. It signifies that even when people plot against the believers, Allah will turn their schemes against them and make them the ultimate losers, displaying His supreme control and justice over all affairs.
orig: وأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأخسرين

translation: And We saved him and Lot to the land which We have blessed for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his nephew Prophet Lut (Lot) and how they were saved from the destruction of their people by being taken to a blessed land. It showcases Allah's mercy and protection towards His righteous servants, as well as the importance of seeking refuge in Him during times of hardship.
orig: ونجيناه ولوطا إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها للعالمين

translation: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob as a gift, and each We made righteous.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the blessings granted by Allah to Prophet Abraham, peace be upon him, in the form of his sons Isaac and Jacob. The mention of making each of them righteous signifies the importance of piety and good deeds in the lineage of the Prophets of God.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب نافلة وكلا جعلنا صالحين

translation: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah. And they were worshippers of Us.
interpretation: This verse speaks about how God appointed certain individuals as leaders to guide others in following His commandments. These leaders were inspired to perform good deeds, establish regular prayers, give to charity, and were devoted worshippers of God. The verse emphasizes the importance of leadership roles in guiding people towards righteousness and the significance of performing good deeds, praying, and giving to those in need as acts of worship.
orig: وجعلناهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا وأوحينا إليهم فعل الخيرات وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة وكانوا لنا عابدين

translation: And We gave Lot judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the town that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, disobedient.
interpretation: This verse mentions the story of Prophet Lot (Lut) in which he was granted wisdom and knowledge from Allah. Additionally, Lot was saved from the wicked and depraved town where people were committing sin and evil deeds. The people of the town were described as sinful and disobedient, reflecting the consequences of their actions and the mercy shown towards Prophet Lot.
orig: ولوطا آتيناه حكما وعلما ونجيناه من القرية التي كانت تعمل الخبائث إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فاسقين

translation: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine mercy and how it envelops and encompasses the righteous believers. Through their piety and good deeds, they are granted Allah's mercy, which serves as a shield and a source of protection for them.
orig: وأدخلناه في رحمتنا إنه من الصالحين

translation: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders. So We saved him and his family from the great distress.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) calling out to Allah in distress, and Allah responding by saving him and his family from a great calamity. It shows that Allah is always ready to respond to the sincere calls of those in need, emphasizing His mercy and ability to deliver His servants from hardships.
orig: ونوحا إذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We supported him against the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a [people of] evil, so We drowned them all.
interpretation: This verse refers to a Prophet who was supported by Allah against a people who rejected the signs of Allah and engaged in evil deeds. As a consequence of their disbelief and transgressions, Allah caused them to drown in a punishment for their collective wrongdoing.
orig: ونصرناه من القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: And [We] gave understanding to David and Solomon, and they said, 'All praise is [due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and understanding granted by Allah to the prophets David and Solomon. It emphasizes gratitude to Allah for His blessings and acknowledges the responsibility of upholding justice and ruling with integrity. It teaches us to acknowledge and appreciate the favors bestowed upon us by Allah, and to use the wisdom and understanding granted to us to serve Him and His creation with humility and gratitude.
orig: وداوود وسليمان إذ يحكمان في الحرث إذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين

translation: So We made Solomon understand it, and to each [of them] We gave judgment and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and the birds. And We were doing [that].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes how Allah granted Prophet Solomon (peace be upon him) the understanding of the language of birds and endowed all prophets with wisdom and knowledge. The mountains and birds were made to glorify Allah alongside Prophet David. It highlights the power and greatness of Allah and His ability to make all creation submit to His will and praise Him.
orig: ففهمناها سليمان وكلا آتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فاعلين

translation: And We taught him the art of making garments for you to protect you from your [mutual] violence. So will you be grateful?
interpretation: This verse highlights the benevolence and wisdom of Allah in providing knowledge and skills to Prophet Adam to make garments for his offspring. The act of dressing is not merely for aesthetics but serves a practical purpose of protection and modesty. It reminds humans to appreciate the blessings and provisions of Allah and to express gratitude for the gifts and wisdom bestowed upon them.
orig: وعلمناه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من بأسكم فهل أنتم شاكرون

translation: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority granted to Prophet Solomon (peace be upon him) by Allah, where even the wind obeyed his command. It emphasizes that all aspects of nature are under the control of Allah, who knows everything and has blessed certain lands.
orig: ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجري بأمره إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها وكنا بكل شيء عالمين

translation: And among the devils are those who dive for him and do deeds other than that, and We are their guardians.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that there are devils who work in hidden ways to mislead people, engaging in secretive and deceptive actions. However, despite their efforts, God is the ultimate protector and guardian over all His creation, including guarding the believers from the mischief of these devils.
orig: ومن الشياطين من يغوصون له ويعملون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حافظين

translation: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Job (Ayyub in Arabic), who turned to Allah in a moment of great hardship and suffering. Despite his suffering, Job acknowledged Allah's mercy and compassion. The verse emphasizes the concept of seeking comfort and solace in Allah during times of adversity, acknowledging His ultimate mercy and compassion.
orig: وأيوب إذ نادى ربه أني مسني الضر وأنت أرحم الراحمين

translation: So We responded to him, and We removed what afflicted him of harm, and We gave him back his family, and a like number with them, as a mercy from Us, and a reminder for the worshippers.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the concept of divine mercy and response to the prayers of the righteous. It shows that Allah listens to the supplications of His servants, relieves them of their troubles, restores their losses, and bestows His blessings upon them as a sign of His mercy and a reminder for those who worship Him devotedly.
orig: فاستجبنا له فكشفنا ما به من ضر وآتيناه أهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة من عندنا وذكرى للعابدين

translation: And Ishmael and Enoch and Ezekiel; all were of the patient.
interpretation: This verse mentions the prophets Ishmael, Enoch, and Ezekiel, highlighting their quality of patience. It serves as a reminder to believers of the importance of being patient in facing difficulties and challenges in life, as demonstrated by the prophets who showed great perseverance in their faith.
orig: وإسماعيل وإدريس وذا الكفل كل من الصابرين

translation: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate mercy and kindness of Allah towards the righteous believers. It emphasizes that those who are righteous will be granted admission into the mercy and blessings of Allah, as a reward for their good deeds and piety.
orig: وأدخلناهم في رحمتنا إنهم من الصالحين

translation: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, 'There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Prophet Yunus (Jonah) who, out of frustration, left his people before receiving permission from Allah. He was swallowed by a large fish and stayed within it until he realized his mistake and sought forgiveness. The verse highlights the concept of repentance, humility, and the mercy of Allah towards those who turn to Him in sincere repentance, even after committing mistakes.
orig: وذا النون إذ ذهب مغاضبا فظن أن لن نقدر عليه فنادى في الظلمات أن لا إله إلا أنت سبحانك إني كنت من الظالمين

translation: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah responds to the prayers of His servants and saves them from hardship and difficulties. It is a reminder that Allah always aids and protects the believers who put their trust in Him.
orig: فاستجبنا له ونجيناه من الغم وكذلك ننجي المؤمنين

translation: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
interpretation: This verse refers to the prophet Zechariah (peace be upon him) praying to Allah not to leave him without any descendants, asking for a righteous heir. It highlights his trust in Allah as the best of all inheritors who provides for His creation and ensures the continuation of His legacy.
orig: وزكريا إذ نادى ربه رب لا تذرني فردا وأنت خير الوارثين

translation: So We answered him, We granted him Yahya, and We cured for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.
interpretation: This verse talks about Allah's response to Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) when he prayed for a son. In response to his supplication, Allah granted him Yahya (John) and cured his wife from her infertility. The verse highlights the virtues of Prophet Zakariya and his family, as they were dedicated to performing good deeds, prayed to Allah with hope and fear, and were submissive to the will of Allah. It teaches us the importance of patience, trust in Allah's timing, and the power of sincere supplication.
orig: فاستجبنا له ووهبنا له يحيى وأصلحنا له زوجه إنهم كانوا يسارعون في الخيرات ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا وكانوا لنا خاشعين

translation: And [We have placed Maryam] who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] from Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special status of Maryam (Mary) in Islam, emphasizing her purity and chastity. It mentions the miraculous conception of Prophet Isa (Jesus) by the will of Allah without a father, making him a significant sign for all people. It also serves as a reminder of the power and ability of Allah to bring forth miracles as signs of His existence and greatness.
orig: والتي أحصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيها من روحنا وجعلناها وابنها آية للعالمين

translation: Indeed, this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of the Muslim community and highlights the concept of Tawhid (monotheism) by emphasizing that there is only one true religion ordained by God. It serves as a reminder that all believers, regardless of their backgrounds, are part of the same community and share a common faith in worshiping the one true God.
orig: إن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاعبدون

translation: And they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that ultimately all matters will return to Allah. It reminds believers that despite the divisions and disputes among people, all will be held accountable before Allah in the end. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when everyone will stand before Allah and be judged for their deeds.
orig: وتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم كل إلينا راجعون

translation: So whoever does righteous deeds while believing, there will be no denial of his effort, and indeed We are recording it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith along with actions. It assures believers that their efforts in doing good deeds will not be in vain, as every good deed they do is being recorded and will not be denied. It serves as a motivation for believers to continue striving for righteousness, knowing that their actions are being acknowledged and preserved by Allah.
orig: فمن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا كفران لسعيه وإنا له كاتبون

translation: And it is forbidden upon a [destroyed] village which We have destroyed that they [the people of that village] should return [to it].
interpretation: This verse reflects that once a community has been destroyed by God due to their disobedience and sins, it is forbidden for them to return to that place. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from God's guidance and the importance of following His laws and commandments to avoid facing a similar fate.
orig: وحرام على قرية أهلكناها أنهم لا يرجعون

translation: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an speaks about the prophecy of Gog and Magog being released upon the earth. Gog and Magog are considered as two corrupt and destructive tribes that will emerge near the end of times, causing chaos and corruption. The verse signifies the inevitability of this event and the need for believers to remain steadfast in their faith and seek protection from such trials.
orig: حتى إذا فتحت يأجوج ومأجوج وهم من كل حدب ينسلون

translation: And the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], 'O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this. Rather, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment and the accountability of those who rejected the truth. It portrays the moment when disbelievers will realize their neglect and wrongdoing, expressing regret for their denial of the signs and warnings sent by Allah.
orig: واقترب الوعد الحق فإذا هي شاخصة أبصار الذين كفروا يا ويلنا قد كنا في غفلة من هذا بل كنا ظالمين

translation: Indeed, you and what you worship other than Allah are the fuel of Hell. You will be coming to [enter it].
interpretation: This verse serves as a stark reminder of the consequences of associating partners with Allah or worshipping any other entity alongside Him. It highlights that those who engage in such actions will be the fuel for Hellfire, emphasizing the severity of such disbelief and deviation from the true path. Essentially, it underscores the importance of maintaining the purity of faith and worshipping Allah alone to avoid such a dire outcome in the Hereafter.
orig: إنكم وما تعبدون من دون الله حصب جهنم أنتم لها واردون

translation: If these had been gods, they would not have come to it. But, all of them will abide therein.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that false gods or deities do not have the power to save themselves, let alone their worshippers. If these idols were truly divine, they would not be subject to destruction or perishability. The verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping false gods and underlines the necessity of turning to the one true God, who is eternal and all-powerful.
orig: لو كان هؤلاء آلهة ما وردوها وكل فيها خالدون

translation: They will have therein a [roaring] exhale and they therein will not hear.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment of the disbelievers in the Hereafter, emphasizing the intense suffering and torment they will face. The term 'roaring exhale' symbolizes the harsh, agonizing sounds and cries they will make in Hell, while the phrase 'they therein will not hear' indicates their inability to escape or be relieved from this punishment or to hear any mercy or calls for help.
orig: لهم فيها زفير وهم فيها لا يسمعون

translation: Indeed, those who have been given preference by Us in the good [things] are indeed far removed from it.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who have been given blessings and favors from Allah are the ones who distance themselves from arrogance and ingratitude. It serves as a reminder that those who have been favored should show humility and gratitude, rather than becoming conceited or ungrateful for the blessings bestowed upon them.
orig: إن الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى أولئك عنها مبعدون

translation: They will not hear its sound while they are, in which their souls desired eternity.
interpretation: This verse refers to the inhabitants of Paradise who will not hear any harmful words or sounds, and will have eternal bliss and contentment in accordance with their own desires.
orig: لا يسمعون حسيسها وهم في ما اشتهت أنفسهم خالدون

translation: The Great Terror will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them, [saying], 'This is your Day which you have been promised.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the state of the believers on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that those who are righteous and faithful will remain steadfast and untroubled by the fear and terror of the Day of Judgment. Instead, they will be honored and welcomed by the angels, realizing that this Day they are experiencing is the day they were promised in their earthly life for their deeds and faith.
orig: لا يحزنهم الفزع الأكبر وتتلقاهم الملائكة هذا يومكم الذي كنتم توعدون

translation: On the Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and ability of Allah to recreate the world and resurrect all beings on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the certainty and inevitability of this event, reminding believers that just as Allah created the universe in the beginning, He will recreate it again as part of His promise and decree as the All-Powerful and All-Knowing.
orig: يوم نطوي السماء كطي السجل للكتب كما بدأنا أول خلق نعيده وعدا علينا إنا كنا فاعلين

translation: And We have written in the Psalms after the reminder that My righteous servants will inherit the earth.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise from Allah that the righteous servants will inherit the earth. It signifies that those who believe in Allah and follow His teachings will eventually prevail and inherit the blessings of the earth. It serves as a reminder that despite the challenges and trials faced by the believers, the ultimate victory and reward belong to those who remain steadfast in faith and righteousness.
orig: ولقد كتبنا في الزبور من بعد الذكر أن الأرض يرثها عبادي الصالحون

translation: Verily, in this is a message for a people who worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the message contained in the Qur'an is clear and serves as a reminder for those who are devoted to worshipping Allah. It emphasizes the importance of reflecting on and following the guidance provided in the scripture for those who sincerely worship and seek closeness to their Creator.
orig: إن في هذا لبلاغا لقوم عابدين

translation: And We have not sent you (O Muhammad) except as a mercy to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a source of mercy for all the worlds. As a messenger of Allah, his teachings and actions embody compassion, kindness, and mercy not only for Muslims but for all of humanity. This verse emphasizes the universal nature of Prophet Muhammad's mission and the importance of mercy in Islam.
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا رحمة للعالمين

translation: Say, "It has been revealed to me that your God is but one God. So will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism in Islam, stating unequivocally that there is only one God. It challenges the listeners to embrace this belief and submit themselves fully to the one true God. The verse implies that true faith involves submission and obedience to God's will, highlighting the importance of being a Muslim in the sense of being in a state of submission and surrender to God.
orig: قل إنما يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فهل أنتم مسلمون

translation: So if they turn away, say, 'I have warned you all alike; I do not know whether near or far is what you are promised.
interpretation: This verse signifies that even if people turn away from the message being delivered to them, the responsibility of the messenger is to convey it clearly. The messenger is not aware of the unseen and cannot predict whether the consequences of their actions will happen soon or in the distant future. The focus is on the duty of delivering the message rather than determining the outcomes.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل آذنتكم على سواء وإن أدري أقريب أم بعيد ما توعدون

translation: He knows the secret and what is hidden.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah has complete knowledge of everything, whether it is spoken out loud or kept hidden in one's heart. It emphasizes the all-encompassing knowledge and awareness of Allah, who knows everything even before it is expressed or concealed.
orig: إنه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون

translation: And I know not but that this might be a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the difficulties and trials in life may be tests of faith from Allah, allowing us to prove our devotion to Him. While these tests may cause hardship, they are also a means of purification and growth, ultimately leading to rewards and blessings in this life and the hereafter.
orig: وإن أدري لعله فتنة لكم ومتاع إلى حين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, judge with truth. Our Lord is the Most Merciful, He whose help is sought against that which you attribute.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking justice and judgment based on truth. It emphasizes the mercy and assistance of Allah, encouraging believers to rely on Him for support and guidance in difficult situations where false accusations or wrongful attributions may occur.
orig: قال رب احكم بالحق وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون

translation: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to all of humanity to be conscious of their Lord and to fear Him. It warns about the immense and terrifying event of the Day of Judgment, signaling the power and severity of the consequences that will follow.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم إن زلزلة الساعة شيء عظيم

translation: On the Day when you see it, every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the severity and magnitude of that Day. It illustrates that on that Day, people will be so overwhelmed and preoccupied with the fear and events of Judgment Day that even the most natural and nurturing instincts, like a mother caring for her child or a pregnant woman protecting her pregnancy, will be forsaken. The vivid imagery of people appearing intoxicated, while they are not actually drunk, portrays the extreme confusion and distress that will encompass humanity. Ultimately, the verse serves as a reminder of the impending Day of Judgment and the absolute power and severity of Allah's punishment for those who do not follow His guidance.
orig: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما أرضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكارى وما هم بسكارى ولكن عذاب الله شديد

translation: And among the people are those who argue about Allah without knowledge and follow every rebellious devil.
interpretation: This verse warns against those who engage in disputes about Allah and His religion without knowledge or understanding. It condemns blindly following the whispers of devils and urges people to seek knowledge and understanding before engaging in discussions about religious matters.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطان مريد

translation: It is decreed upon him who takes him as an ally that indeed, he will lead him astray and guide him to the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability and warns about the consequences of following the wrong path or choosing the wrong allies. It serves as a reminder that ultimately each individual is responsible for their choices and actions, and they will bear the consequences of those decisions. It highlights the importance of making wise and righteous choices in life.
orig: كتب عليه أنه من تولاه فأنه يضله ويهديه إلى عذاب السعير

translation: O mankind, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then We develop you that you may reach your maturity. And among you is he who is taken in death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.
interpretation: This verse serves to remind mankind of the miraculous process of creation, from being created from dust and then developing through different stages in the womb until birth. It emphasizes the power of God over life and death, and the cycle of growth and rejuvenation as evidenced in the earth responding to rain by bringing forth vegetation of various kinds. It highlights the wisdom of Allah in creating life and the reminder of the afterlife, urging people to reflect on their purpose and destiny.
orig: يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في ريب من البعث فإنا خلقناكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ونقر في الأرحام ما نشاء إلى أجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيئا وترى الأرض هامدة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت وأنبتت من كل زوج بهيج

translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah, stating that He is the ultimate truth, capable of bringing the dead back to life, and possessing full authority over all things. It highlights the belief in the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah, the One who controls all aspects of existence and is capable of performing miracles such as resurrecting the dead.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأنه يحيي الموتى وأنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And the Hour is coming without any doubt, and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of the Day of Judgment and resurrection after death. It serves as a reminder of the certainty of the Hereafter and the accountability that all individuals will face for their actions in this world. It encourages believers to lead a righteous life in preparation for the impending Day of Judgment.
orig: وأن الساعة آتية لا ريب فيها وأن الله يبعث من في القبور

translation: And among the people are those who argue about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who engage in arguments about Allah without knowledge, guidance, or a clear divine scripture. It highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance before discussing matters related to Allah and His religion to avoid misunderstanding or misrepresenting the teachings of Islam.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير

translation: Whoever turns his back [on Allah], for him there will be disgrace in this world and We shall make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of burning.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who turn away from the path of Allah. It highlights the consequences of such actions, indicating that those who choose to disobey Allah will face humiliation in this world and will be subjected to severe punishment in the Hereafter. The mention of 'the punishment of burning' emphasizes the intensity and severity of the consequences for those who deviate from the righteous path.
orig: ثاني عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله له في الدنيا خزي ونذيقه يوم القيامة عذاب الحريق

translation: That is because of what your hands have sent ahead; and Allah is not ever unjust to the servants.
interpretation: This verse implies that the consequences individuals face are often a result of their own actions and choices. It serves as a reminder that Allah is fair and just, and that He does not wrong His servants. Therefore, individuals should be mindful of their deeds and strive to do good, as they are accountable for their actions.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: And among the people are those who worship Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by a trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost this world and the Hereafter. That is the manifest loss.
interpretation: This verse describes a group of people who worship Allah but their faith and devotion are not steadfast. Their faith fluctuates based on their circumstances. When things are going well, they may feel secure and content, but when faced with challenges and trials, they become unsteady and turn away from their faith. Such wavering and insincere devotion leads to their ultimate loss in this world and the Hereafter. The verse highlights the importance of remaining steadfast in faith and devotion under all circumstances, as inconsistency in faith can lead to significant losses.
orig: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف فإن أصابه خير اطمأن به وإن أصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والآخرة ذلك هو الخسران المبين

translation: He calls upon besides Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is the extreme deviation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of invoking or worshiping anything other than Allah, as it neither brings harm nor benefit to the individual. It emphasizes that such actions lead to severe deviation from the right path and serve as a clear warning against associating partners with Allah.
orig: يدعو من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ذلك هو الضلال البعيد

translation: He calls upon one who is more likely to harm him than to benefit him. What a wretched protector and what a wretched companion!
interpretation: This verse warns against seeking help from those who are more likely to harm rather than benefit us. It highlights the importance of choosing our allies and protectors wisely, as relying on the wrong people can lead to negative consequences. It serves as a reminder to surround ourselves with supportive and trustworthy individuals who genuinely have our best interests at heart.
orig: يدعو لمن ضره أقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds will be rewarded with paradise, where rivers flow beneath lush gardens. It also underscores the concept that Allah's will prevails above all, and He can do as He pleases.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار إن الله يفعل ما يريد

translation: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the sky, then cut [it], and see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the futility of trying to oppose or go against the will of Allah. It emphasizes that no matter how strong someone's resolve may be, it is ultimately subject to the power and decree of Allah. Therefore, one should not rebel against or challenge God's will, as it will only lead to frustration and anger.
orig: من كان يظن أن لن ينصره الله في الدنيا والآخرة فليمدد بسبب إلى السماء ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ

translation: And thus We have sent it down as clear verses. And indeed, Allah guides whom He wills.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an contains clear and unambiguous signs from Allah. It also stresses that Allah alone has the power to guide whomever He chooses to the right path. This highlights the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and trusting in His wisdom and guidance.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه آيات بينات وأن الله يهدي من يريد

translation: Indeed, those who have believed [in Prophet Muhammad] and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated others with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allah is, over all things, Witness.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, Allah will be the ultimate judge among different religious communities. It highlights the belief in a final Day of Reckoning when all will be judged based on their faith and deeds. The verse underscores the ultimate authority and omniscience of Allah as the Witness over all things, indicating that everyone will be held accountable according to their actions and beliefs.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئين والنصارى والمجوس والذين أشركوا إن الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة إن الله على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universal submission and glorification of Allah by all of creation, both animate and inanimate. It highlights the importance of recognizing Allah's supreme authority and power over all aspects of the universe. The verse also warns that those who are arrogant or disobedient will be deserving of punishment while those who are humble and obedient will receive honor and reward from Allah. It ultimately reminds believers that Allah has full control over all things and can decree whatever He wishes.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يسجد له من في السماوات ومن في الأرض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس وكثير حق عليه العذاب ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم إن الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: These two adversaries have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where two opposing groups are in dispute concerning their Lord. The disbelievers will face a severe punishment in the form of garments made of fire and boiling water poured over their heads. The verse highlights the consequences of disbelief and the severe punishment that awaits those who reject the truth.
orig: هذان خصمان اختصموا في ربهم فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق رءوسهم الحميم

translation: He will melt the contents of their bellies and their skins.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of the punishment that wrongdoers will face in the Hereafter. It describes a terrifying scenario where everything inside their bodies, and even their skins, will melt. This serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobeying Allah and the importance of repentance and righteous deeds.
orig: يصهر به ما في بطونهم والجلود

translation: And for them are shackles of iron.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment in the Hereafter for those who have committed wrong deeds and transgressed the boundaries set by Allah. The imagery of 'shackles of iron' signifies the captivity and confinement of the wrongdoers, emphasizing the consequences of their actions and the justice of their punishment.
orig: ولهم مقامع من حديد

translation: Every time they want to come out of it from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!'
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment awaiting those who defy God and persist in wrongdoing. It illustrates the cycle of punishment wherein the wrongdoers will keep trying to escape the torment but will be forced back to it, in a continuous and agonizing cycle, highlighting the severity and inevitability of punishment for those who disobey God.
orig: كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها من غم أعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
interpretation: This verse describes the reward that awaits those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds. It promises them entry into paradise, where they will enjoy a luxurious and beautiful environment with flowing rivers and attire made of silk, adorned with gold and pearls. It serves as encouragement for believers to remain steadfast in their faith and continue to do good deeds in anticipation of the ultimate reward in the hereafter.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

translation: And guide them to the best of speech and guide them to the path of the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of using kind and beneficial speech when guiding people. It instructs to lead others towards the path that is praised by Allah, implying that our words and guidance should be filled with goodness, kindness, and positivity, ultimately directing them towards righteousness and earning Allah's approval.
orig: وهدوا إلى الطيب من القول وهدوا إلى صراط الحميد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert others from the path of Allah and from al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse talks about the severe punishment awaiting those who disbelieve in Allah and deny His path, as well as those who try to hinder people from visiting and worshiping at al-Masjid al-Haram, the sacred mosque. It emphasizes that the punishment for those who engage in acts of deviation or wrongdoing within the sacred premises will be severe and agonizing.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذي جعلناه للناس سواء العاكف فيه والباد ومن يرد فيه بإلحاد بظلم نذقه من عذاب أليم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], 'Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.
interpretation: This verse recalls the moment when Allah appointed the location of the Kaaba to the Prophet Abraham and instructed him to keep it pure and free from any associations with Allah. The verse highlights the sanctity of the Kaaba and emphasizes the importance of maintaining its purity for those who visit it for circumambulation, prayer, and prostration.
orig: وإذ بوأنا لإبراهيم مكان البيت أن لا تشرك بي شيئا وطهر بيتي للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود

translation: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of announcing and calling people to perform the pilgrimage (Hajj). It emphasizes that people will come to perform Hajj from various distant places, regardless of the means of transportation they use. The verse serves as a reminder of the universal nature of Hajj and how people from different backgrounds and regions come together for this significant act of worship.
orig: وأذن في الناس بالحج يأتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر يأتين من كل فج عميق

translation: So they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah during specified days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the unfortunate poor.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering Allah's name and expressing gratitude for the provisions He has given by sacrificing animals during specific days. It also encourages sharing the blessings by feeding the poor and needy as an act of charity and kindness.
orig: ليشهدوا منافع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله في أيام معلومات على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فكلوا منها وأطعموا البائس الفقير

translation: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the Ancient House.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to cleanse themselves from any impurities, fulfill their promises and obligations, and perform the ritual of Tawaf (circumambulation) around the Kaaba, which is a symbolic act of devotion and unity towards Allah.
orig: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق

translation: And whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of respecting the sacred laws and boundaries set by Allah. It reminds believers to honor and abide by these ordinances, as doing so is beneficial for them in the eyes of their Lord. The verse also allows the consumption of permissible livestock for food, but warns against consuming anything that is forbidden. It advises believers to stay away from impurity associated with idol worship and to refrain from spreading falsehoods.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمات الله فهو خير له عند ربه وأحلت لكم الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم فاجتنبوا الرجس من الأوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور

translation: Purely inclined to Allah, not associating anything with Him. And whoever associates anything with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of pure monotheism (Tawheed) and warns against associating partners with Allah (shirk). Those who commit shirk are likened to someone who falls from the sky and is snatched away by birds or is carried off by the wind into a distant place, highlighting the gravity and consequences of associating partners with Allah.
orig: حنفاء لله غير مشركين به ومن يشرك بالله فكأنما خر من السماء فتخطفه الطير أو تهوي به الريح في مكان سحيق

translation: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of showing reverence and respect for the signs and symbols of Allah. By doing so, it reflects the piety and righteousness that resides in the hearts of the believers. Honoring these symbols is considered a manifestation of one's faith and devotion to Allah.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم شعائر الله فإنها من تقوى القلوب

translation: For you therein are [the benefits of] beauty for a limited period, then continues for an appointed time to the ancient home.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the temporary nature of earthly beauty and pleasures, highlighting that they are only beneficial for a limited time. It directs the believers to focus on the eternal and lasting rewards in the afterlife, represented by the 'ancient home' which is a metaphor for paradise. It encourages prioritizing the spiritual over the material and transient aspects of life.
orig: لكم فيها منافع إلى أجل مسمى ثم محلها إلى البيت العتيق

translation: And for every nation We have made a rite (of sacrifice) that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord].
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity of nations and the different ways in which people remember and worship Allah. The act of sacrifice is mentioned as a way for people to remember and thank Allah for the provisions given to them. It emphasizes the oneness of God and calls for all to submit to Him. The verse also encourages bringing glad tidings to those who are humble and submit themselves to Allah.
orig: ولكل أمة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فإلهكم إله واحد فله أسلموا وبشر المخبتين

translation: Who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are filled with awe, and those who endure whatever befalls them with patience, and establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them.
interpretation: This verse describes the characteristics of the righteous believers. They are those who have deep reverence and humility towards Allah, such that their hearts are moved when His name is mentioned. They are patient in the face of adversity and trials, steadfast in performing their prayers, and generous in giving from the wealth that Allah has bestowed upon them. This verse emphasizes the importance of faith, patience, prayer, and charity in the life of a believer.
orig: الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصابرين على ما أصابهم والمقيمي الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And for you in the livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of livestock as a creation of Allah that has been made useful for humans in many ways. By providing us with food and sustenance, livestock serves as a practical and beneficial resource from which we derive various benefits. It emphasizes the importance of gratitude and recognition of Allah's blessings through the consumption and utilization of these animals.
orig: والبدن جعلناها لكم من شعائر الله لكم فيها خير فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف فإذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها وأطعموا القانع والمعتر كذلك سخرناها لكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: It is not their flesh nor their blood that reaches Allah, but it is your piety that reaches Him. Thus He has subjected them to you, that you may glorify Allah for His guidance to you. And give good news to the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the significance of sacrifice during rituals like Eid al-Adha is not in the meat or blood itself, but in the sincerity and piety with which it is offered. It is a reminder that the essence of any religious act lies in the intention and devotion behind it, rather than the physical act alone. The verse encourages believers to reflect on the purpose and meaning of their religious practices and to strive for righteousness and sincerity in their worship.
orig: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هداكم وبشر المحسنين

translation: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like every treacherous ingrate.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is the protector and defender of those who have faith. It also highlights that Allah does not favor those who are treacherous and ungrateful, as treachery and ingratitude are qualities that are not in line with the teachings and values of Islam.
orig: إن الله يدافع عن الذين آمنوا إن الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور

translation: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.
interpretation: This verse highlights that permission to defend oneself in battle has been granted to those who have been wronged. It reassures believers that Allah is capable of granting victory to those who are fighting in self-defense.
orig: أذن للذين يقاتلون بأنهم ظلموا وإن الله على نصرهم لقدير

translation: Those who have been evicted from their homes unjustly only because they said, 'Our Lord is Allah.' And if Allah had not repelled the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse highlights the injustice faced by those who are persecuted and driven out of their homes simply for believing in and professing the oneness of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of freedom of religion and the protection of places of worship. The verse also assures that Allah will aid and support those who stand up for Him. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power and might, encouraging believers to remain steadfast in their faith in the face of adversity.
