orig: الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم بغير حق إلا أن يقولوا ربنا الله ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صوامع وبيع وصلوات ومساجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ولينصرن الله من ينصره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Those who, if We give them power in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of all matters.
interpretation: This verse highlights the responsibility of those who are given authority and power to establish justice and righteousness on the earth. They are expected to uphold the principles of prayer, charity, enjoining good, and forbidding evil. It emphasizes that the ultimate outcome and judgment of all matters belong to Allah, underscoring the importance of adhering to His commands and principles in all aspects of life.
orig: الذين إن مكناهم في الأرض أقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأمروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ولله عاقبة الأمور

translation: And if they deny you, so did nations before them deny. The people of Noah, and 'Aad, and Thamud.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that if his people deny him, he should not be disheartened because previous prophets also faced denial and rejection from their communities. By mentioning the people of Noah, 'Aad, and Thamud, it serves as a reassurance that facing rejection is a common experience for messengers of God, and it emphasizes the importance of patience, perseverance, and faith in delivering the message of Islam despite opposition.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود

translation: And [the tribe of] Ibrahim and the tribe of Lut
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the people of Lut (Lot) who were prophets sent by God. It highlights the contrast between the righteous followers of the prophets and the disobedient and sinful people who faced the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder of the importance of adhering to the guidance of the prophets and the consequences of deviating from the path of righteousness.
orig: وقوم إبراهيم وقوم لوط

translation: And the people of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them. And how [terrible] was My reproach!
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an reflects on the past nations and their rejection of the messengers sent by Allah. The people of Madyan, like many others, rejected the message brought by Prophet Moses, and they were granted respite to continue in their disbelief before facing the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the truth and the severe punishment awaiting those who persist in disbelief despite being warned by messengers.
orig: وأصحاب مدين وكذب موسى فأمليت للكافرين ثم أخذتهم فكيف كان نكير

translation: And how many a village have We destroyed while it was unjust, so it has become desolate upon its walls, and it was uninhabited. And how many a well was abandoned and a lofty palace.
interpretation: This verse points to the consequences of injustice and wrongdoing, illustrating that many civilizations and communities have perished due to their own oppression and wrongdoing. It serves as a stark reminder of the importance of justice and righteousness in societies, as injustice ultimately leads to destruction and abandonment.
orig: فكأين من قرية أهلكناها وهي ظالمة فهي خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد

translation: Have they not traveled through the land, and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? Indeed, it is not the eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes reflection on the signs of Allah through observation and contemplation. It highlights that the true blindness is not in the physical eyes but in the hearts that fail to see and comprehend the profound truths and guidance evident in the world around them. It calls for deep introspection and understanding beyond mere physical sight.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها أو آذان يسمعون بها فإنها لا تعمى الأبصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور

translation: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And never will Allah fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that some people may rush for the punishment of the wrongdoers, but God will fulfill His promise in His own timing. Time for God is not perceived the same way as it is for humans, as a day in His reckoning can be equivalent to a thousand years in human calculations. Therefore, believers are reminded to have patience and trust in God's perfect timing and justice.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده وإن يوما عند ربك كألف سنة مما تعدون

translation: And how many a city have We given respite while it was unjust. Then We seized it, and to Us is the destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of warnings given by Allah to unjust cities or communities, granting them respite before eventually holding them accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate return to Allah for judgment, emphasizing divine justice and warning against persisting in wrongdoing.
orig: وكأين من قرية أمليت لها وهي ظالمة ثم أخذتها وإلي المصير

translation: Say, "O mankind, indeed I am to you a clear warner."
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is a clear warning to humanity. It emphasizes the Prophet's role as a warner, alerting people to the consequences of their actions and calling them to the path of righteousness.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إنما أنا لكم نذير مبين

translation: So those who believe and do good deeds will have forgiveness and a generous provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith and righteous deeds in Islam. It emphasizes that those who believe in God and perform good deeds will be granted forgiveness for their sins and will be provided with generous blessings and sustenance. It serves as a reminder for Muslims to have faith in God's mercy and grace, and to actively engage in actions that are pleasing to God in order to attain His forgiveness and bountiful rewards.
orig: فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our verses to cause failure - those will be companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse warns about those who actively oppose and try to undermine the miracles and signs of Allah. Such individuals, through their disbelief and disobedience, are destined to be in Hellfire as a consequence of their actions.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And We sent not before you [as messengers] any but men to whom We revealed from among the people of the towns. Have they not traveled through the earth and seen what was the end of those before them? And verily, the abode of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah. Do you not then understand?
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that all the messengers and prophets sent by Allah before the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) were human beings. It also emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the lessons from the past civilizations and prophets' experiences. The verse calls on people to ponder over the consequences of their actions, reminding them that the ultimate reward lies in the Hereafter for those who are conscious of Allah. It serves as a reminder for people to understand the signs of Allah and to learn from the stories of the past messengers.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبي إلا إذا تمنى ألقى الشيطان في أمنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقي الشيطان ثم يحكم الله آياته والله عليم حكيم

translation: In order that He may make what Satan throws in as a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease and whose hearts are hardened. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that Satan tries to plant doubts and temptations in the hearts of those with weak faith or hardened hearts. It serves as a warning to be cautious of the whispers of Satan and to seek protection from his temptations. The verse also points out that those who persist in wrongdoing are far from the path of righteousness and are engulfed in severe discord.
orig: ليجعل ما يلقي الشيطان فتنة للذين في قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم وإن الظالمين لفي شقاق بعيد

translation: And so those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of knowledge and understanding in recognizing the truth of the message from God. It emphasizes that those who truly possess knowledge will believe in the truth revealed by God and will submit to it wholeheartedly. Additionally, it confirms that God guides those who believe to the straight path, indicating that true believers will be directed towards righteousness and guidance in their lives.
orig: وليعلم الذين أوتوا العلم أنه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم وإن الله لهاد الذين آمنوا إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And those who disbelieve will continue to be in doubt about it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.
interpretation: This verse highlights how the disbelievers will persist in their doubts and denial of the truth until the Day of Judgment arrives suddenly upon them or they face the punishment of a barren Day, emphasizing the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: ولا يزال الذين كفروا في مرية منه حتى تأتيهم الساعة بغتة أو يأتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم

translation: The dominion that Day will be the true dominion belonging to Allah; He will judge between them. So those who believed and did good deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate sovereignty and judgment of Allah on the Day of Judgment. It highlights that true dominion and authority belong to Allah alone, and He will make a just judgment between people. Those who have faith in Allah and perform righteous deeds will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise as a result.
orig: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في جنات النعيم

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those will be the companions of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject the signs of Allah and choose to disbelieve will face a humiliating punishment in Hellfire. It serves as a warning to those who refuse to acknowledge the truth and guidance offered by Allah, highlighting the serious consequences of disbelief.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا فأولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reward and provision from Allah for those who leave their homes in the path of Allah, whether they are killed or die in this journey. It highlights the ultimate care, sustenance, and bestowing of blessings by Allah, acknowledging that He is the superior provider.
orig: والذين هاجروا في سبيل الله ثم قتلوا أو ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا وإن الله لهو خير الرازقين

translation: He will admit them to a place with which they will be pleased, and indeed Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse assures believers that Allah will grant them entry into Paradise, where they will find complete satisfaction and contentment. It emphasizes Allah's deep knowledge and patience, conveying the idea that He understands His creation and deals with them gently and patiently. It serves as a source of hope and encouragement for believers to persevere in their faith and good deeds, knowing that their ultimate reward will be a place of eternal happiness and fulfillment in the Hereafter.
orig: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه وإن الله لعليم حليم

translation: That [is so]. And he who has responded to injustice with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of justice in Islam. It encourages believers to respond to aggression with fairness and not exceed the limits in retaliation. It also reassures that Allah will support those who uphold justice and stand against tyranny, even if it means enduring hardships. The verse highlights the qualities of forgiveness and mercy that are intrinsic to Allah's nature.
orig: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغي عليه لينصرنه الله إن الله لعفو غفور

translation: That is because Allah merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night, and because Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the seamless way in which Allah transitions between night and day, symbolizing His power and control over the universe. It also emphasizes Allah's attributes of being all-hearing and all-seeing, signifying His continuous presence and awareness of all that occurs.
orig: ذلك بأن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وأن الله سميع بصير

translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and what they call upon other than Him is falsehood. And verily, Allah is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness and supremacy of Allah. It highlights that Allah is the ultimate truth, and all else that is worshipped besides Him is falsehood. Allah is described as the Most High and the Most Great, signifying His unmatched power and glory.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه هو الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير

translation: Have you not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Kind and All-Aware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous power and mercy of Allah in sending down water from the sky, which makes the earth fertile and green. It serves as a reminder of Allah's kindness and His all-encompassing knowledge of His creation.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فتصبح الأرض مخضرة إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth. Truly, Allah is the Rich, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. It emphasizes His absolute ownership and control over all things. By describing Allah as 'the Rich' and 'the Praiseworthy,' the verse highlights His self-sufficiency and perfection, encouraging believers to rely on Him and praise Him for His boundless blessings and attributes.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإن الله لهو الغني الحميد

translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which sail through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and control that Allah has over the universe. It emphasizes the signs of Allah's unique authority in the functioning of the earth, the movement of ships at sea, and the suspension of the sky. It reminds believers of Allah's mercy and kindness towards humanity, showcasing His benevolence and protection over creation.
orig: ألم تر أن الله سخر لكم ما في الأرض والفلك تجري في البحر بأمره ويمسك السماء أن تقع على الأرض إلا بإذنه إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم

translation: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and then will again give life to you. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of Allah in giving life and causing death, emphasizing that He is the ultimate source of life. It also points out the ungratefulness of humanity despite being granted life and blessings by Allah. It serves as a reminder to be thankful and appreciative of the gifts and opportunities given to us by our Creator.
orig: وهو الذي أحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم إن الإنسان لكفور

translation: To every community We have appointed ways of worship which they observe; so do not let them draw you into disputes concerning this matter. Call them to the Way of your Lord with wisdom and good teaching, and argue with them in the most courteous manner, for your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is rightly guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that each community has its own way of worship, and believers should not engage in unnecessary disputes with others about their different practices. Instead, Muslims are encouraged to invite others to the path of God with wisdom, kindness, and good manners, avoiding confrontations and arguments. The verse reminds believers to focus on promoting guidance and righteousness, leaving the judgment of people's beliefs to God, who knows the truth about their faith.
orig: لكل أمة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه فلا ينازعنك في الأمر وادع إلى ربك إنك لعلى هدى مستقيم

translation: And if they argue with you, say, 'Allah is most knowing of what you do.'
interpretation: This verse advises believers on how to respond when faced with arguments or disputes from others. It emphasizes the notion that Allah is fully aware of our actions and intentions. Thus, instead of engaging in unnecessary disputes, it is better to remind oneself and others of Allah's all-knowing nature and leave the judgment to Him.
orig: وإن جادلوك فقل الله أعلم بما تعملون

translation: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate divine judgment that will take place on the Day of Resurrection, where Allah, the Supreme Judge, will resolve all disputes and disagreements that existed among people during their worldly life. It serves as a reminder that ultimately all matters will be brought to justice and accountability in the Hereafter, and emphasizes the importance of seeking truth, justice, and righteousness in this life.
orig: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive knowledge of Allah, emphasizing that He knows everything that is in the heavens and the earth. The verse also points out that all of this information is recorded in a divine Book, indicating the meticulous recording and preservation of all deeds and actions. Moreover, it serves as a reassurance that despite the vastness of Allah's knowledge and the meticulous recording of it all, it is easy for Him to manage and account for everything, underscoring His supreme power and control over all things.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله يعلم ما في السماء والأرض إن ذلك في كتاب إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down any sultan (proof) and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will be no helper for the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of worshiping false deities or idols besides Allah without any evidence or knowledge. It emphasizes the futility of such actions and warns that those who engage in wrongful worship will have no support or aid in the Hereafter.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وما ليس لهم به علم وما للظالمين من نصير

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, 'Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that?' [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of disbelievers when the Qur'anic verses are recited to them. Despite the clarity and truth in the verses, they exhibit disapproval and almost resort to violence. The verse warns of the severe consequences awaiting those who choose to deny these revelations, as they will ultimately face the punishment of the Fire in the Hereafter, emphasizing the grave outcome of disbelief.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات تعرف في وجوه الذين كفروا المنكر يكادون يسطون بالذين يتلون عليهم آياتنا قل أفأنبئكم بشر من ذلكم النار وعدها الله الذين كفروا وبئس المصير

translation: O mankind, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from it. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.
interpretation: This verse presents a clear example to illustrate the weakness and futility of worshipping false gods or idols. It emphasizes that those false deities have no power or ability to create even a simple insect like a fly, let alone help or protect their followers. The verse highlights the inadequacy and ineffectiveness of worshipping anything other than Allah, emphasizing the futility of turning to such entities for help or guidance as they lack the inherent capability to provide assistance.
orig: يا أيها الناس ضرب مثل فاستمعوا له إن الذين تدعون من دون الله لن يخلقوا ذبابا ولو اجتمعوا له وإن يسلبهم الذباب شيئا لا يستنقذوه منه ضعف الطالب والمطلوب

translation: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that human beings cannot fully comprehend the greatness of Allah and His power. No matter how much we try to assess or appreciate His attributes, our understanding will always fall short of the true magnitude of His essence. Allah is beyond our limited perceptions and definitions, infinitely powerful and mighty beyond measure.
orig: ما قدروا الله حق قدره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Allah chooses messengers from the angels and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine selection and guidance. It emphasizes that messengers are chosen both from among the angels and from among the people by Allah Himself. The verse ends by reminding us of Allah's perfect attributes of Hearing and Seeing, indicating that He is aware of all things and has full knowledge of what is best for His creation.
orig: الله يصطفي من الملائكة رسلا ومن الناس إن الله سميع بصير

translation: He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and to Allah all matters are returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omniscience and omnipotence of Allah. It reminds us that Allah knows everything that has happened, is happening, and will happen, as well as what is in our hearts and minds. It also reassures believers that all matters are ultimately in the control of Allah and that we will all return to Him for judgment and accountability.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is calling upon the believers to humble themselves before Allah, the Lord of the worlds. It emphasizes the importance of performing the acts of bowing (ruku') and prostrating (sujood) in prayer as forms of worship. The verse also encourages believers to engage in acts of goodness and righteousness in order to attain success in this life and the hereafter. By obeying Allah's commands, showing devotion through prayer, and performing righteous deeds, believers are promised success and prosperity.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اركعوا واسجدوا واعبدوا ربكم وافعلوا الخير لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of striving (jihad) in the way of Allah as a duty that Allah has assigned to the believers. It highlights the ease of the religion of Islam and the continuity of the monotheistic message from the time of Prophet Abraham. It also stresses the importance of establishing prayer, giving charity (zakah), and holding firmly to Allah. Finally, it reminds the believers that Allah is their ultimate protector and helper, and they should place their trust in Him.
orig: وجاهدوا في الله حق جهاده هو اجتباكم وما جعل عليكم في الدين من حرج ملة أبيكم إبراهيم هو سماكم المسلمين من قبل وفي هذا ليكون الرسول شهيدا عليكم وتكونوا شهداء على الناس فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واعتصموا بالله هو مولاكم فنعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: Indeed, the believers have succeeded.
interpretation: This verse declares the success and prosperity of the believers in the sight of Allah. It signifies that true success is attained through faith and obedience to God. Believers who uphold the principles of Islam are assured of eventual success and reward in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: قد أفلح المؤمنون

translation: Those who are humbly submissive in their prayers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who perform their prayers with reverence, humility, and focus. It highlights the importance of sincerity and devotion in the act of praying, emphasizing the need for believers to approach their prayers with a sense of awe and humility towards Allah.
orig: الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون

translation: And those who turn away from ill speech
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding useless talk, gossip, and foul language. It encourages believers to speak with wisdom and kindness, and to abstain from engaging in conversations that do not bring benefit or that may harm others. It promotes the idea of using language in a constructive and positive manner, reflecting the values of patience and self-control.
orig: والذين هم عن اللغو معرضون

translation: And those who are active in giving Zakah.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who are diligent and consistent in fulfilling the obligation of Zakah, which is the charity tax prescribed in Islam. It emphasizes the importance of contributing to the welfare of the community by giving Zakah regularly and sincerely. It is a reminder to believers to fulfill their financial obligations towards those in need and to maintain a sense of social responsibility.
orig: والذين هم للزكاة فاعلون

translation: And they who guard their private parts,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of self-control and chastity in Islam. It highlights the significance of protecting one's modesty and maintaining purity in one's actions and intentions. By guarding one's private parts, a person demonstrates control over their desires and maintains a sense of honor and respect in their interactions with others.
orig: والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون

translation: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an delineates the permissible boundaries regarding intimate relations, specifying that one is allowed to be physically affectionate only with one's spouse or with those whom they rightfully possess. It emphasizes that when engaging in such relationships within these parameters, no blame shall be placed upon them.
orig: إلا على أزواجهم أو ما ملكت أيمانهم فإنهم غير ملومين

translation: So whoever seeks beyond that, then it is those who are the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of following the teachings and boundaries set by Allah. Those who seek to go beyond these limits are considered transgressors. It serves as a reminder to stay within the boundaries prescribed by Islam and not to exceed them in seeking understanding or enlightenment.
orig: فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فأولئك هم العادون

translation: And those who are faithfully true to their trusts and covenants;
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling one's responsibilities and keeping one's promises and trusts. It emphasizes the qualities of honesty, loyalty, and integrity in fulfilling agreements and commitments. Being true to one's word and loyal in fulfilling duties is a characteristic that is highly praised in Islam and is seen as a sign of strong moral character and trustworthiness.
orig: والذين هم لأماناتهم وعهدهم راعون

translation: And those who guard their prayers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of safeguarding and preserving one's prayers. It implies the significance of being consistent and attentive in fulfilling the acts of worship and fulfilling the duties of prayers as a way of maintaining a strong connection with Allah.
orig: والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون

translation: Those are the inheritors.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are deserving of inheriting the blessings and rewards promised by Allah. It signifies that those who follow the guidance of Allah and strive to please Him will receive the ultimate inheritance of Paradise in the Hereafter.
orig: أولئك هم الوارثون

translation: Those who inherit Paradise will abide in it eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who are granted entry into Paradise will reside there forever, enjoying its pleasures and bounties without any end. It highlights the everlasting nature of the rewards reserved for the believers who fulfill their duties and follow the teachings of Allah.
orig: الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون

translation: And We have certainly created man from an extract of clay.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humble origin of human beings, highlighting that they were created from simple material, clay. It serves as a reminder of the undeniable connection between humans and the earth, calling for humility and gratitude towards their Creator.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من سلالة من طين

translation: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous process of human creation and development within the womb, emphasizing the stages of embryonic development. It is a reminder of the power and intricacy of Allah's creation and a testament to His ability to bring life into existence from the most humble beginnings.
orig: ثم جعلناه نطفة في قرار مكين

translation: Then We made the drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.
interpretation: This verse describes the stages of human creation in the womb, emphasizing the miraculous process of development from a drop of fluid to a fully formed human being. It highlights the power and perfection of Allah's creation, emphasizing His role as the best of creators.
orig: ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة فخلقنا العلقة مضغة فخلقنا المضغة عظاما فكسونا العظام لحما ثم أنشأناه خلقا آخر فتبارك الله أحسن الخالقين

translation: Then indeed you, after that, are going to die.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the inevitable reality of death. It emphasizes that every soul will taste death, stressing the transient nature of life in this world. The purpose is to urge believers to remember the transient nature of their worldly lives and to focus on preparing for the eternal life to come.
orig: ثم إنكم بعد ذلك لميتون

translation: Then indeed, you will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the certainty of resurrection on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a warning that all individuals will be brought back to life and held accountable for their deeds, emphasizing the concept of accountability and justice in the afterlife.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة تبعثون

translation: And We have certainly created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of the creation unaware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense power and knowledge of Allah, stating that He has created seven layered heavens above us, showing His supreme ability to create and govern the universe. The verse emphasizes that nothing in His creation goes unnoticed or unaccounted for, underlining the meticulous care and attention Allah gives to His creation.
orig: ولقد خلقنا فوقكم سبع طرائق وما كنا عن الخلق غافلين

translation: And We have sent down from the sky water in measure and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are able to take it away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and control of Allah over the water cycle on the Earth. It emphasizes that Allah sends down water from the sky in measured quantities, which nourishes the earth and sustains life. The verse reminds believers that just as Allah sends down water, He also has the power to take it away if He wills. It serves as a reminder of Allah's control over nature and the importance of gratitude and careful stewardship of resources that sustain life.
orig: وأنزلنا من السماء ماء بقدر فأسكناه في الأرض وإنا على ذهاب به لقادرون

translation: So We caused to grow on it [i.e., the earth] gardens of palm trees and grapevines for you; there you have many fruits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah has created the earth with its diverse vegetation, providing an abundance of fruits like dates and grapes for human beings to enjoy. It highlights Allah's bountiful provisions and blessings for His creation.
orig: فأنشأنا لكم به جنات من نخيل وأعناب لكم فيها فواكه كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And [there] is a tree that grows in Mount Sinai which produces oil and seasoning for those who eat.
interpretation: This verse describes a tree in Mount Sinai that provides oil and seasoning for the people. It can be understood as a manifestation of Allah's provision and mercy towards His creatures, providing sustenance and blessings in different forms, even in the barren land of Mount Sinai.
orig: وشجرة تخرج من طور سيناء تنبت بالدهن وصبغ للآكلين

translation: And indeed for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings and benefits that Allah has provided us through livestock. It emphasizes the provision of sustenance and nourishment that comes from these animals, pointing towards the wisdom and mercy of Allah in creating such animals for the benefit of humankind.
orig: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة نسقيكم مما في بطونها ولكم فيها منافع كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And upon it and upon ships you are carried.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the earth as a stable ground and the seas as a means of transportation. It highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the earth as a place where people can live and ships as vehicles for travel and commerce. It serves as a reminder of the blessings and marvels of creation that Allah has provided for humankind.
orig: وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون

translation: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse highlights Prophet Noah's mission to call his people to worship Allah alone and to remind them of the importance of fearing Him. It serves as a reminder for believers to worship and fear Allah with sincerity and devotion, as He is the only true deity worthy of worship.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, 'This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if God had willed, He could have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and disbelief of the disbelievers who mocked the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as being just a human being like themselves. They questioned why God would choose a human as a messenger instead of angels. Their refusal to believe in the Prophet was driven by their pride and a desire to maintain their position of authority, even though they knew deep down that messengers had been sent to past generations.
orig: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يريد أن يتفضل عليكم ولو شاء الله لأنزل ملائكة ما سمعنا بهذا في آبائنا الأولين

translation: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so keep a watch on him for a while.
interpretation: This verse is indicating that the disbelievers dismissed the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as just a man affected by madness. They were advised to wait and watch his actions for a while before making judgments. The verse highlights the importance of patience and observation in understanding the truth.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل به جنة فتربصوا به حتى حين

translation: He said, "My Lord, support me against the falsifiers."
interpretation: This verse reflects Prophet Noah's plea to God for help and support against those who disbelieved in him and rejected his message. It teaches us the importance of seeking assistance from God in times of trouble and when facing opposition or falsehood.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: So We inspired him: 'Construct the ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration. Then when Our command comes and the oven overflows, lead onto it two of every pair, and your family—except those against whom the word has already been passed—and those who have believed. But do not converse with Me concerning the wrongdoers; they are surely to be drowned.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an speaks about the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) and the construction of the ark. It emphasizes the importance of following divine guidance and acting upon it without hesitation. It also highlights the idea of divine protection for the believers while acknowledging the impending punishment for the wrongdoers who rejected the message of God.
orig: فأوحينا إليه أن اصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا فإذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور فاسلك فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول منهم ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا إنهم مغرقون

translation: So when you have boarded the ship and those with you, you should say, 'All praise is due to Allah who saved us from the unjust people.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of expressing gratitude to Allah upon being saved from difficulties and trials. It teaches us to acknowledge and be thankful for Allah's protection and blessings in times of crisis or danger. It reminds us to always remember and praise Allah for His mercy and guidance.
orig: فإذا استويت أنت ومن معك على الفلك فقل الحمد لله الذي نجانا من القوم الظالمين

translation: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit. And grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."
interpretation: This verse is a supplication from Prophet Musa (Moses) in the Qur'an, where he is asking Allah to grant him a blessed entry and exit from any situation or place, and to provide him with divine support and authority. It teaches us to seek guidance and assistance from Allah in every aspect of our lives, acknowledging Him as the ultimate source of all strength and blessings.
orig: وقل رب أنزلني منزلا مباركا وأنت خير المنزلين

translation: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever putting [believers] to the test.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the signs of God's existence and power are present all around us, and that part of the human experience involves being tested by God. The trials and challenges we face are a test of our faith and dedication to God, and through perseverance and trust in Him, we can strengthen our faith and character.
orig: إن في ذلك لآيات وإن كنا لمبتلين

translation: Then We raised up after them another generation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuous cycle of generations on earth, emphasizing the transient nature of life and the inevitability of succession. It serves as a reminder that each generation has its responsibilities and will eventually be replaced by the next, reflecting the divine order and decay of life in this world.
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: So We sent among them a messenger from their own, saying, 'Worship Allah, you have no deity other than Him. Will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and striving to attain Taqwa, which is the consciousness of God's presence in every aspect of life. By following the teachings of the messenger sent by Allah, people are reminded to fear God and avoid associating any partners with Him in worship. The call to worship Allah alone encapsulates the fundamental principle of Tawheed (monotheism) in Islam.
orig: فأرسلنا فيهم رسولا منهم أن اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, 'This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.'
interpretation: This verse portrays the arrogance and disbelief of the disbelieving leaders in their rejection of the Prophet, claiming that he is merely a human like them despite his message and guidance. It reflects how worldly comfort and luxury can blind individuals to the truth and lead them to belittle divine messages.
orig: وقال الملأ من قومه الذين كفروا وكذبوا بلقاء الآخرة وأترفناهم في الحياة الدنيا ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يأكل مما تأكلون منه ويشرب مما تشربون

translation: And if you obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you will then be losers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that blind obedience to fallible human beings, without critical thinking or consideration of the truth, can lead to loss and misguidance. It warns against following leaders simply because they are similar to us in worldly matters, emphasizing the importance of following the guidance of Allah and His messenger instead of blindly following flawed human beings.
orig: ولئن أطعتم بشرا مثلكم إنكم إذا لخاسرون

translation: Does He promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones, you will be brought forth?
interpretation: This verse questions the arrogant disbelievers who deny the concept of resurrection and life after death. It highlights the power and ability of Allah to bring back the dead to life, despite their state of decay and disintegration after death.
orig: أيعدكم أنكم إذا متم وكنتم ترابا وعظاما أنكم مخرجون

translation: Never! Never! When what you are promised will happen.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the certainty of the promises of Allah. It conveys the idea that what Allah promises will certainly come to pass, without a doubt. It serves as a reminder of the inevitability and power of Allah's will and the importance of trusting in His promises.
orig: هيهات هيهات لما توعدون

translation: It is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and we will not be resurrected.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the transient nature of worldly life and the inevitability of death. It emphasizes that life and death are all part of this temporary world, and it asserts that there will be no resurrection or afterlife. The verse serves as a reminder of the fleeting nature of earthly existence and encourages reflection on the deeper meaning and purpose of life beyond the material world.
orig: إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah, and we are not believers in him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of discerning the truth from falsehood when it comes to the messages attributed to Allah. It emphasizes that those who falsely attribute lies to Allah are mere humans and should not be believed without evidence. It reminds believers to verify the authenticity of claims and not blindly trust any individual who claims to speak on behalf of Allah.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل افترى على الله كذبا وما نحن له بمؤمنين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, support me because they have denied me.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a powerful example of Prophet Lut's plea to God for support and help against those who denied and rejected him. It teaches us the importance of turning to God in times of difficulty and seeking His assistance when faced with opposition or rejection from others.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: He said, 'In a little while they will surely regret.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of feeling regret for one's actions if they are not guided by faith and righteousness. It serves as a reminder that the consequences of our choices will eventually catch up with us, urging us to act with mindfulness and piety in order to avoid future regrets.
orig: قال عما قليل ليصبحن نادمين

translation: So the shriek took them at truth, and We made them as rubbish. Away with the wrongdoing people!
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment that befell those who rejected the truth. The shriek mentioned can be understood as the punishment or calamity that descended upon them in reality. By turning them into rubbish, it signifies their worthlessness and insignificance in the sight of God. The verse emphasizes the consequences that await the wrongdoers and those who oppose the truth, emphasizing the justice of God's actions in dealing with the unjust.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة بالحق فجعلناهم غثاء فبعدا للقوم الظالمين

translation: Then We raised up after them generations.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of successive generations created by Allah. It suggests the continual cycle of life, where one generation succeeds another, each with its own unique characteristics and challenges. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of life and the importance of leaving a positive legacy for future generations.
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرونا آخرين

translation: No nation can advance its term, nor can they delay it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of predestination in Islam, stating that no community or nation can bring forward or delay the appointed time of their existence. It serves as a reminder that everything is within the control and knowledge of Allah, and that all events occur according to His divine plan and timing.
orig: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون

translation: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Whenever there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him; so We made some of them follow others and made them narrations.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of disbelief and rejection of messengers by their respective communities in history. Despite the messengers being sent as guides and warners, many people rejected them and even opposed them. Thus, their stories and experiences were meant to serve as lessons for those who do not believe, emphasizing the consequences of denying the truth and rejecting divine guidance.
orig: ثم أرسلنا رسلنا تترى كل ما جاء أمة رسولها كذبوه فأتبعنا بعضهم بعضا وجعلناهم أحاديث فبعدا لقوم لا يؤمنون

translation: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority.
interpretation: This verse refers to the sending of the Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and his brother Aaron (peace be upon him) with Allah's signs and clear authority. It highlights the special role and mission that these two prophets had, as well as the undeniable evidence and miracles that they were given to establish their authenticity and guidance for the people.
orig: ثم أرسلنا موسى وأخاه هارون بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh and his establishment they were arrogant, and they were haughty people.
interpretation: This verse talks about the arrogance and pride of Pharaoh and his followers. Despite being warned by a messenger from God, they refused to submit and were characterized by their excessive pride and arrogance. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and the importance of humility in the face of divine guidance.
orig: إلى فرعون وملئه فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما عالين

translation: They said, 'Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the skepticism and disbelief of some people towards the messengers of God, questioning their authenticity and authority based on their human nature and the fact that their followers were considered inferior by societal standards. It serves as a reminder to look beyond superficial judgments and prejudices, and focus on the message and truth being conveyed by the messengers.
orig: فقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا وقومهما لنا عابدون

translation: So they denied them, and they became of those who were destroyed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequence of denying the prophets sent by God. Those who reject the truth brought by the messengers of God are ultimately doomed and face destruction in various forms, whether it be spiritual, physical, or moral ruin.
orig: فكذبوهما فكانوا من المهلكين

translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special favor bestowed upon Prophet Moses with the revelation of the Scriptures. The purpose of giving the Scripture to Moses was to guide his people towards the right path and lead them to righteousness. It signifies the importance of divine guidance through revelation for the guidance of humanity.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water springs.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the special status of Mary and her son, Jesus (peace be upon them both), as they were both chosen by Allah as a sign for humanity. They were provided with protection and sustenance in a high and fruitful place, emphasizing Allah's care and provision for His chosen ones.
orig: وجعلنا ابن مريم وأمه آية وآويناهما إلى ربوة ذات قرار ومعين

translation: O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I am Knowing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse is a guidance to the messengers of Allah, instructing them to consume good and lawful food and to perform righteous deeds. It emphasizes that Allah is aware of all their actions, serving as a reminder to maintain purity both in physical sustenance and in their actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها الرسل كلوا من الطيبات واعملوا صالحا إني بما تعملون عليم

translation: And indeed, this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of the believers under one religion and one Lord. It calls for the believers to maintain piety and consciousness (taqwa) towards Allah, recognizing His authority and adhering to the principles of the faith.
orig: وإن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاتقون

translation: So they split their affair between them into sects, [yet] each faction, in what it has, is rejoicing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the division and fragmentation among people into different sects and groups, each believing themselves to be right and feeling a sense of pleasure in their own beliefs. The Qur'an warns against such fragmentation and emphasizes the importance of unity and following the path of truth.
orig: فتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم زبرا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: So leave them in their confusion for a time.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to be patient and not overly concerned with the rejection and ignorance of those who oppose the message of Islam. It is a reminder to trust in Allah's plan and timing, and to continue striving for the truth despite the obstacles and challenges faced from disbelievers.
orig: فذرهم في غمرتهم حتى حين

translation: Do they think that what We provide them with of wealth and children
interpretation: This verse questions if people think that material wealth and having children are the ultimate blessings from God. It challenges the notion that worldly possessions are the measure of one's success or worth in the eyes of God, emphasizing the importance of spiritual virtues and obedience to Him over material possessions.
orig: أيحسبون أنما نمدهم به من مال وبنين

translation: We urge on them only for good. But they do not perceive it.
interpretation: This verse highlights how God encourages and facilitates the path towards good deeds for individuals, even though they may not have the awareness or perception to recognize these opportunities. It emphasizes that despite the support and nudges from God towards goodness, some individuals may remain unaware or unresponsive to these prompts.
orig: نسارع لهم في الخيرات بل لا يشعرون

translation: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having awe and fear of Allah, even when one is alone and unseen. It highlights that those who have this quality will be blessed with forgiveness for their shortcomings and sins, and will be rewarded abundantly in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون

translation: And those who believe in the signs of their Lord,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of having faith in the signs and revelations from Allah. Believers are those who recognize and have faith in the signs of Allah's existence, His power, His mercy, and His guidance. It emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the signs of Allah in creation and in the Quran, and having firm faith in them.
orig: والذين هم بآيات ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And [they are] those who do not associate anything with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism (Tawheed) in Islam, highlighting the importance of worshipping and believing in the oneness of Allah without associating partners with Him. It serves as a reminder to maintain sincerity and devotion in one's worship solely to Allah, without attributing any partners or intermediaries in acts of worship.
orig: والذين هم بربهم لا يشركون

translation: And those who give what they give while their hearts are trembling because they will be returning to their Lord
interpretation: This verse describes the believers who give charity with humility and sincerity, feeling a sense of awe and fear of Allah in their hearts. They are mindful that they will eventually return to their Lord and be held accountable for their deeds. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity and humility in acts of charity, as well as the awareness of being answerable to Allah for their actions.
orig: والذين يؤتون ما آتوا وقلوبهم وجلة أنهم إلى ربهم راجعون

translation: Those are the ones who hasten to good deeds, and they are foremost in them.
interpretation: This verse praises those who eagerly and actively pursue good deeds and virtues, showing dedication and commitment to righteousness. It emphasizes the importance of being proactive and enthusiastic in performing acts of goodness and kindness, striving to be at the forefront of such actions.
orig: أولئك يسارعون في الخيرات وهم لها سابقون

translation: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of fairness and justice in Islam. It reassures believers that Allah does not burden anyone beyond their capability, and He has a record that accurately depicts truth and justice. The verse also highlights that no one will be treated unjustly by Allah.
orig: ولا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها ولدينا كتاب ينطق بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Nay! But their hearts are in a covered over (from understanding) of this (Qur'an), and they have deeds besides that (which they are doing), which they are doing.
interpretation: This verse implies that some people fail to comprehend the message of the Qur'an because their hearts are veiled and distracted by other pursuits and actions. Despite receiving guidance, they are preoccupied with their worldly affairs and fail to heed the teachings of the Qur'an.
orig: بل قلوبهم في غمرة من هذا ولهم أعمال من دون ذلك هم لها عاملون

translation: Until, when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people, when they are faced with difficulties and punishment after their life of luxury and comfort, will immediately turn to Allah seeking assistance and help. It serves as a reminder that true faith and reliance on Allah should not only come to light in times of ease, but also during hardships and trials.
orig: حتى إذا أخذنا مترفيهم بالعذاب إذا هم يجأرون

translation: Do not be arrogant today, for indeed, you are not superior over us.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder against arrogance and pride. It highlights the transient nature of worldly power and status, emphasizing that no one is inherently superior to others. It urges humility and warns against attitudes of superiority or entitlement.
orig: لا تجأروا اليوم إنكم منا لا تنصرون

translation: My verses used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels
interpretation: This verse points out that despite the signs and revelations from Allah being made clear to the people, they chose to turn away and ignore them. It emphasizes the ungratefulness and disobedience of the disbelievers who disregarded the guidance offered to them.
orig: قد كانت آياتي تتلى عليكم فكنتم على أعقابكم تنكصون

translation: You are walking proudly in Saamara
interpretation: This verse may be understood as a warning against arrogance and pride. It emphasizes that those who act with arrogance and haughtiness in their actions and attitudes will ultimately be left abandoned and isolated. It serves as a reminder for believers to remain humble and avoid the pitfalls of arrogance.
orig: مستكبرين به سامرا تهجرون

translation: Have they not considered the word, or has there come to them that which did not come to their forefathers?
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the disbelievers have pondered upon the teachings and messages brought to them by the prophets, or if they are rejecting them without any valid reason, despite similar messages being brought to their forefathers before.
orig: أفلم يدبروا القول أم جاءهم ما لم يأت آباءهم الأولين

translation: Or have they not recognized their Messenger, and so they are rejecting him?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers truly recognize and understand the Messenger that has been sent to them, implying that their denial and rejection of him may stem from a lack of understanding about his true message and purpose.
orig: أم لم يعرفوا رسولهم فهم له منكرون

translation: Or do they say: 'He has invented it?' Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so perhaps they will be guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is not an invention of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), but rather the ultimate truth from Allah. It highlights that the Prophet Muhammad's mission is to convey this truth and warn those who have not received guidance before. The rejection of the truth by many is acknowledged, but the hope remains that some may be guided through this message.
orig: أم يقولون به جنة بل جاءهم بالحق وأكثرهم للحق كارهون

translation: And if the truth had been in accordance with their desires, the heavens and the earth and everyone in them would have surely been corrupted. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they turn away from their message.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if people were to follow their own desires rather than the truth, then it would lead to corruption in the heavens, the earth, and everything within them. However, despite their inclinations, Allah has sent reminders and guidance to them. Yet, many still choose to turn away from these reminders and disregard the message brought to them.
orig: ولو اتبع الحق أهواءهم لفسدت السماوات والأرض ومن فيهن بل أتيناهم بذكرهم فهم عن ذكرهم معرضون

translation: Do you ask of them a payment, so they are burdened with debt? But the bounty of your Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the difference between the worldly concept of seeking payment in return for favors and the divine bounty bestowed by Allah. It emphasizes that the provision and sustenance provided by Allah are far superior to any material wealth that can be obtained from people. It reminds believers to trust in Allah as the ultimate provider and to not burden others with unnecessary expectations or obligations.
orig: أم تسألهم خرجا فخراج ربك خير وهو خير الرازقين

translation: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in calling people to the straight path of Islam. It emphasizes his mission to guide humanity towards righteousness, truth, and obedience to Allah. The verse underscores the importance of following the guidance of the Prophet and adhering to the teachings of Islam in order to attain salvation and success in both this world and the Hereafter.
orig: وإنك لتدعوهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of denying the existence of the Hereafter. It emphasizes that those who do not believe in the afterlife are straying from the righteous path set by Allah. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of faith in the Hereafter and the accountability of one's deeds in the afterlife.
orig: وإن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة عن الصراط لناكبون

translation: And if We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is upon them, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that sometimes people continue in their wrongdoing and transgression even after experiencing mercy and relief from distress. It serves as a reminder of the importance of reflecting on one's actions and changing one's behavior, rather than persisting in arrogance and blindness to one's own faults.
orig: ولو رحمناهم وكشفنا ما بهم من ضر للجوا في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And We have already seized them with punishment, but they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor did they supplicate earnestly.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the consequences of the arrogance and lack of humility shown by those who were punished by God. Despite facing hardships, they did not turn to their Lord in humility or seek His help through sincere supplication. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and seeking God's help in times of difficulty.
orig: ولقد أخذناهم بالعذاب فما استكانوا لربهم وما يتضرعون

translation: Until, when We open upon them a door of severe punishment, suddenly they will be in despair therein.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power and authority of Allah. It conveys that when Allah decides to inflict severe punishment upon those who have strayed from the right path, they will be filled with despair and helplessness. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from the guidance and mercy of Allah, and urges believers to seek His forgiveness and guidance to avoid falling into such a state of despair.
orig: حتى إذا فتحنا عليهم بابا ذا عذاب شديد إذا هم فيه مبلسون

translation: And He it is who created for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah upon us by creating our hearing, vision, and hearts. It emphasizes that despite these gifts, humans often fail to show gratitude towards Allah for these abilities.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأ لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And it is He who has created you from the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of Allah, the creator of all things. It emphasizes that human beings have been created from the earth by the divine will of Allah and that they will all be resurrected and gathered before Him for accountability and judgment in the Hereafter.
orig: وهو الذي ذرأكم في الأرض وإليه تحشرون

translation: He is the one who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and control of Allah over life and death, as well as the alternation of the night and day. It serves as a reminder for people to reflect on these natural phenomena and to use their intellect to recognize the signs of Allah's existence and greatness.
orig: وهو الذي يحيي ويميت وله اختلاف الليل والنهار أفلا تعقلون

translation: Rather, they say [then about the Prophet], 'He is but a [human] like yourselves.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how disbelievers rejected Prophet Muhammad by comparing him to others, claiming he was just a human being like themselves and not a messenger of God. The verse emphasizes the refusal of the disbelievers to acknowledge the Prophet's true status and message.
orig: بل قالوا مثل ما قال الأولون

translation: They say, 'When we have been lost within the earth and become [mere] dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?'
interpretation: This verse addresses the skepticism of non-believers regarding the concept of resurrection. It highlights their doubts about being brought back to life after they have turned into dust and bones. The verse serves as a reminder of the power of Allah and His ability to resurrect mankind on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the inevitability and reality of resurrection.
orig: قالوا أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون

translation: We and our forefathers were promised this before. This is nothing but legends of the ancient.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers are dismissing the message of the Quran as mere myths and legends that have been passed down through generations. It highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who refuse to accept the truth, despite the fact that the message has been promised and foretold by previous prophets and messengers. The verse serves as a reminder that denial of the truth out of arrogance and ignorance is a recurring theme throughout history.
orig: لقد وعدنا نحن وآباؤنا هذا من قبل إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: Say, "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is on it, if you should know?"
interpretation: This verse challenges mankind to reflect on the ownership and sovereignty of the Earth and everything on it. It emphasizes that true knowledge and understanding come from recognizing the ultimate ownership of the universe and acknowledging the Creator's power and control over all that exists.
orig: قل لمن الأرض ومن فيها إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not remember?'
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of the importance of turning to Allah for guidance and remembrance. It highlights the need for reflection and remembrance of Allah's teachings and signs in order to stay on the straight path, and to not be heedless or forgetful of Him. It serves as a call to consciousness and a reminder to always keep Allah in mind in all aspects of life.
orig: سيقولون لله قل أفلا تذكرون

translation: Say, 'Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the greatness, power, and authority of Allah by asking the rhetorical question about who holds ultimate sovereignty over the heavens and the magnificent Throne. It prompts reflection on the supreme position and control of Allah over the entire universe, encouraging believers to acknowledge and submit to His unmatched dominion.
orig: قل من رب السماوات السبع ورب العرش العظيم

translation: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: In this verse, there is a dialogue mentioned where people say that they fear Allah, and the response challenges them to truly have a sense of awe and fear for Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of true and sincere piety and fear of Allah in one's actions and intentions.
orig: سيقولون لله قل أفلا تتقون

translation: Say, 'Who has the power over all things, while they protect and none are protectors against Him, if you know?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of tawheed (the oneness of Allah) by emphasizing Allah's ultimate power and sovereignty over all things. It asserts that no one has power or authority over Him, and no one can offer protection against His will. It challenges people to reflect on the majesty and supremacy of Allah and to acknowledge His unique authority and control over all creation.
orig: قل من بيده ملكوت كل شيء وهو يجير ولا يجار عليه إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: They will say: 'To Allah.' Say: 'Then how are you deluded?'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the ultimate authority and power of Allah, highlighting the absurdity of turning to anything else for guidance or worship. It challenges those who associate partners with Allah or worship other beings to reflect on the irrationality of their beliefs. It urges believers to trust in Allah alone and not fall into delusion by following false deities or worldly temptations.
orig: سيقولون لله قل فأنى تسحرون

translation: But We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that despite the truth being presented to them, the disbelievers continue to deny it and persist in their falsehood. It highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who knowingly reject the truth, even when it is clearly evident to them.
orig: بل أتيناهم بالحق وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and refutes the notion of Him having any offspring or partners. It highlights the absurdity of polytheism, stating that if there were multiple gods, each one would try to assert dominance over the others. The verse aims to exalt Allah and clarify that He is free from the shortcomings and weaknesses attributed to Him by those who associate partners with Him.
orig: ما اتخذ الله من ولد وما كان معه من إله إذا لذهب كل إله بما خلق ولعلا بعضهم على بعض سبحان الله عما يصفون

translation: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above whatever they associate [with Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the attribute of Allah as the Knower of all that is hidden and all that is evident in the world. It emphasizes the concept of Tawhid, the oneness of Allah, and His uniqueness in being above any partners or associates. It draws attention to the incomparable knowledge and position of Allah as the Supreme Being.
orig: عالم الغيب والشهادة فتعالى عما يشركون

translation: Say, "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,
interpretation: This verse is a call to God, asking Him to reveal or show the truth of what the disbelievers are promising or threatening. It shows a believer seeking confirmation from God, indicating a deep trust in Him and reliance on His guidance and justice.
orig: قل رب إما تريني ما يوعدون

translation: My Lord, do not place me among the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse reflects a supplication made to Allah by the speaker to protect them from being counted among the unjust and oppressors. It signifies a plea for guidance and righteousness, seeking refuge from being associated with those who commit wrongdoing and transgressions.
orig: رب فلا تجعلني في القوم الظالمين

translation: And indeed, we are able to show you the [punishment] We have promised them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has the ability to fulfill His promises, whether in terms of reward or punishment. It serves as a reminder of the power and authority of Allah, emphasizing the certainty of His promise to show the consequences of the actions of individuals or communities.
orig: وإنا على أن نريك ما نعدهم لقادرون

translation: Repel [evil] with that which is better; We are more knowing of what they describe.
interpretation: This verse advises responding to evil with kindness and good actions. It implies that reacting positively to negative actions can lead to better outcomes and is more effective in resolving conflicts. It also highlights that Allah is fully aware of what people say and do, and thus ultimately knows the truth about all matters.
orig: ادفع بالتي هي أحسن السيئة نحن أعلم بما يصفون

translation: And say, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils.'
interpretation: This verse teaches believers to seek protection and refuge in Allah from the whispers and temptations of the devil. By reciting this supplication, a person acknowledges their vulnerability to the influence of evil forces and expresses their reliance on Allah for protection against such negative influences.
orig: وقل رب أعوذ بك من همزات الشياطين

translation: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me.
interpretation: This verse is a prayer seeking protection from the harmful intentions and presence of others. It shows a deep sense of reliance on God to guard against any harm or negative influences that may come from those around us.
orig: وأعوذ بك رب أن يحضرون

translation: Until, when death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord, send me back'
interpretation: This verse highlights the reality of human nature that when faced with death, people may wish for a second chance to go back to the world and amend their ways. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of this life and the importance of preparing for the Hereafter while one still has the opportunity.
orig: حتى إذا جاء أحدهم الموت قال رب ارجعون

translation: Perhaps I may do good in that which I have left behind.' No! It is but a word that he speaks; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uncertainty of the human soul concerning their actions and deeds after they pass away. It serves as a reminder that when someone leaves this world, they cannot go back to rectify or improve their actions. It conveys the message that one should strive to do good deeds during their lifetime, as the opportunity to do so is limited to their earthly existence before the Day of Resurrection.
orig: لعلي أعمل صالحا فيما تركت كلا إنها كلمة هو قائلها ومن ورائهم برزخ إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: So when the Horn is blown, no relationships among them will avail them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the Trumpet will be blown, signaling the end of the world. At that moment, all family ties and relationships will cease to matter, and each person will be solely concerned about their own fate. People will be solely focused on themselves and their deeds, without any concern for others or familial ties.
orig: فإذا نفخ في الصور فلا أنساب بينهم يومئذ ولا يتساءلون

translation: So whoever's scales are heavy - it is they who will be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of good deeds and righteous actions. It suggests that those whose good deeds outweigh their bad deeds on the Day of Judgment will be the ones who attain true success and salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: فمن ثقلت موازينه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves in Hell, abiding eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of leading a righteous and just life. On the Day of Judgment, the good deeds and sins of each individual will be weighed on the scales. Those whose good deeds outweigh their sins will be successful and rewarded, while those whose scales are light due to their lack of good deeds will suffer in Hell for eternity. It serves as a reminder to believers to strive for righteousness and to be mindful of their actions, knowing that these will determine their ultimate fate.
orig: ومن خفت موازينه فأولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم في جهنم خالدون

translation: Faces will be humbled to the Fire, distressed therein, their abode burnt faces.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment where those who have denied or disobeyed Allah will have their faces touched by the Fire, indicating a state of deep distress and humiliation. The mention of faces being burnt underscores the severity and intensity of the punishment for those who reject the truth and follow the wrong path.
orig: تلفح وجوههم النار وهم فيها كالحون

translation: Were not My verses recited to you, but you used to deny them?
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the signs and verses of Allah are readily available and presented to us, yet despite the clear evidence, some people choose to reject and deny them. It highlights the importance of reflection and acceptance of the signs of Allah in our lives.
orig: ألم تكن آياتي تتلى عليكم فكنتم بها تكذبون

translation: They will say, "Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, so we confess our sins. Is there any way out of this?"
interpretation: This verse reflects the reaction of people on the Day of Judgment when they realize the consequences of their actions. They acknowledge their wrongdoings and seek a way out from the punishment they are facing. It serves as a reminder of the importance of seeking forgiveness and repentance before it's too late.
orig: قالوا ربنا غلبت علينا شقوتنا وكنا قوما ضالين

translation: Our Lord, take us out of it, and if we should return [to evil], then indeed we would be wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse reflects humility and repentance before God. The believers are acknowledging their mistakes and shortcomings, seeking refuge in God's mercy and forgiveness. It teaches us to always be humble and repentant before God, and to seek His guidance and forgiveness when we realize our wrongdoings.
orig: ربنا أخرجنا منها فإن عدنا فإنا ظالمون

translation: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me."
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will be told to remain in a state of humiliation in Hell and will be forbidden from speaking with Allah. It signifies the severe punishment and disregard for those who rejected the truth and turned away from righteousness during their life on earth.
orig: قال اخسئوا فيها ولا تكلمون

translation: Indeed, there was a group among My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness and mercy from Allah by acknowledging one's faith and humbly asking for His pardon.
