It illustrates the notion that Allah is the ultimate source of mercy and forgiveness, emphasizing the believers' deep trust and reliance on His benevolence and compassion.
orig: إنه كان فريق من عبادي يقولون ربنا آمنا فاغفر لنا وارحمنا وأنت خير الراحمين

translation: So you took them in derision. [mockingly], until they caused you to forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of mocking and making fun of the signs and messages of Allah. It highlights how ridiculing the truth can lead to forgetting the remembrance of Allah and cause one to be deprived of guidance. It warns against arrogance and disrespect towards the divine message.
orig: فاتخذتموهم سخريا حتى أنسوكم ذكري وكنتم منهم تضحكون

translation: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and endurance in the face of trials and challenges. Allah promises that those who remain steadfast and patient will be rewarded and ultimately find success. It serves as a reminder to believers to persevere in difficult times and have faith in the divine promise of reward for patience.
orig: إني جزيتهم اليوم بما صبروا أنهم هم الفائزون

translation: He will say, "How long did you remain on the earth in number of years?"
interpretation: This verse refers to a scene on the Day of Judgment where people will be asked about the duration of their stay on earth. It emphasizes the fleeting nature of life and serves as a reminder for individuals to reflect on how they spent their time in this world, and to be mindful of being held accountable for their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: قال كم لبثتم في الأرض عدد سنين

translation: They will say, 'We stayed a day or part of a day; ask those who count.'
interpretation: In this verse, people who are questioned about their stay on earth will express that they perceive their worldly life as brief, either a day or part of a day, emphasizing its transient nature. This response reflects the fleeting nature of life in the worldly realm and highlights the importance of seeking guidance and knowledge from those who have a deeper understanding of the passage of time and the reality of life.
orig: قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم فاسأل العادين

translation: He will say, "You stayed only a little - if only you had known."
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they realize that the lifespan they had on earth was actually very short compared to eternity. They wish they had utilized that short time to seek knowledge and guidance, which would have led them to faith and righteousness.
orig: قال إن لبثتم إلا قليلا لو أنكم كنتم تعلمون

translation: Do you think that We created you aimlessly and that you will not be returned to Us?
interpretation: This verse questions the purpose of human creation, emphasizing that humans are not created without purpose or in vain. It reminds us of the importance of reflecting on our existence and the fact that we will ultimately return to God, highlighting the accountability and responsibility that come with our creation.
orig: أفحسبتم أنما خلقناكم عبثا وأنكم إلينا لا ترجعون

translation: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. There is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and majesty of Allah as the one true King and Lord of the magnificent Throne. It reminds believers of the supreme power and authority of Allah above all else.
orig: فتعالى الله الملك الحق لا إله إلا هو رب العرش الكريم

translation: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism and warns against associating partners with Allah. It speaks against the act of worshiping or calling upon other deities without evidence or justification. It highlights that ultimately each individual will be accountable to Allah for their beliefs and actions, and it stresses that those who reject the truth and choose to disbelieve will not attain success.
orig: ومن يدع مع الله إلها آخر لا برهان له به فإنما حسابه عند ربه إنه لا يفلح الكافرون

translation: And say, 'My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and mercy from Allah, acknowledging His ultimate authority and supreme mercy. It serves as a reminder to always turn to Allah for forgiveness and mercy, recognizing that His mercy surpasses all others.
orig: وقل رب اغفر وارحم وأنت خير الراحمين

translation: We have revealed it as an Arabic Qur'an and have commanded that you should learn and recite it. We have made it clear with vivid signs, so that you may take heed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the Qur'an, reciting it, and understanding its clear signs. It reminds believers to engage with the Qur'an, ponder its meanings, and derive guidance from its teachings. By doing so, one can attain knowledge, wisdom, and spiritual growth.
orig: سورة أنزلناها وفرضناها وأنزلنا فيها آيات بينات لعلكم تذكرون

translation: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion of Allah, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the punishment for unmarried individuals who engage in sexual intercourse outside of marriage. The severity of the punishment serves as a deterrent and a reminder to uphold the sanctity of marriage and protect social norms. It also emphasizes the importance of adhering to the laws and commands of Allah, reminding believers to prioritize faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment above personal inclinations or emotions.
orig: الزانية والزاني فاجلدوا كل واحد منهما مائة جلدة ولا تأخذكم بهما رأفة في دين الله إن كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر وليشهد عذابهما طائفة من المؤمنين

translation: The adulterer does not marry except an adulteress or polytheist, and the adulteress none marries her except an adulterer or a polytheist. And that has been made unlawful for the believers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an prohibits believers from marrying those who commit adultery or associate partners with Allah. It emphasizes the importance of upholding moral values and remaining faithful in relationships. It is a reminder to believers to seek partners who share their beliefs and values to maintain a harmonious and faithful relationship.
orig: الزاني لا ينكح إلا زانية أو مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها إلا زان أو مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين

translation: And those who accuse chaste women and do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever. And those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse addresses the severe punishment for those who falsely accuse chaste women of immoral behavior without producing the required witnesses. It emphasizes the importance of evidence in Islamic law and warns against making false accusations that can ruin the reputation of innocent individuals. The punishment of flogging and the rejection of their testimony serve as deterrents to such malicious behavior, highlighting the value Islam places on justice, honesty, and protecting the honor and integrity of others.
orig: والذين يرمون المحصنات ثم لم يأتوا بأربعة شهداء فاجلدوهم ثمانين جلدة ولا تقبلوا لهم شهادة أبدا وأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Except for those who repent afterward and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of repentance and redemption in Islam. It emphasizes that no matter what sins a person may have committed in the past, sincere repentance and efforts to rectify one's behavior can lead to forgiveness from Allah. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and willingness to forgive those who sincerely seek His forgiveness and make amends for their actions.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the testimony of one of them [should be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the serious issue of falsely accusing one's spouse of adultery. It establishes a rigorous standard of evidence required for such accusations, emphasizing that making such claims without proper witnesses is a grave offense. It promotes truthfulness and sincerity in testimony, highlighting the importance of honesty and integrity in matters of justice and personal relationships.
orig: والذين يرمون أزواجهم ولم يكن لهم شهداء إلا أنفسهم فشهادة أحدهم أربع شهادات بالله إنه لمن الصادقين

translation: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allah be upon him if he should be among the liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of lying and the consequences of being dishonest. It serves as a warning that those who intentionally deceive and lie will incur the curse of Allah upon them, highlighting the importance of truthfulness and honesty in one's actions and speech.
orig: والخامسة أن لعنت الله عليه إن كان من الكاذبين

translation: And the punishment will be averted from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the liars.
interpretation: This verse refers to the procedure to deal with accusations of adultery in Islam. If a woman is accused of adultery but denies it, she can avoid punishment by giving four oaths swearing by Allah that the accuser is lying. This procedure safeguards the reputation and dignity of the accused, ensuring that innocent individuals are not wrongly punished based solely on accusations.
orig: ويدرأ عنها العذاب أن تشهد أربع شهادات بالله إنه لمن الكاذبين

translation: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allah upon her if he was among the truthful.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the seriousness of the situation by mentioning the oath of Allah upon her. It highlights the gravity of the matter, stating that if the person was indeed among the truthful, then the wrath of Allah will be upon her. It serves as a warning and a reminder of the consequences of dishonesty and betrayal.
orig: والخامسة أن غضب الله عليها إن كان من الصادقين

translation: And had it not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, and because Allah is Accepting of repentance and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of Allah's favor and mercy upon believers. It highlights Allah's attributes of being Accepting of repentance and Wise, reminding the believers to seek repentance and guidance from Him due to His infinite mercy and wisdom.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله تواب حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather, it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an teaches us not to believe false accusations and rumors spread by a certain group of people. It reassures us that such falsehoods will ultimately benefit the believers by exposing the sinful actions of those who spread them. Each individual involved will face the consequences of their actions, and those who are more actively involved in spreading lies and deception will face severe punishment. The verse emphasizes the importance of not rushing to judgment based on false information and highlights the principle of accountability and justice in Islam.
orig: إن الذين جاءوا بالإفك عصبة منكم لا تحسبوه شرا لكم بل هو خير لكم لكل امرئ منهم ما اكتسب من الإثم والذي تولى كبره منهم له عذاب عظيم

translation: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of themselves and say, 'This is an obvious falsehood'?
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to have a positive opinion of themselves and others, and to not quickly believe in false accusations or rumors. It highlights the importance of having faith and trust in the righteousness of fellow believers, and not rushing to judgment based on unfounded claims. It encourages a mindset of goodness, fairness, and skepticism toward information that may harm others.
orig: لولا إذ سمعتموه ظن المؤمنون والمؤمنات بأنفسهم خيرا وقالوا هذا إفك مبين

translation: And why did they not produce four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then those [we will consider] as liars in the sight of Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of producing witnesses when making a claim. In cases where no witnesses can be produced, the credibility of the claim is questioned. It serves as a reminder of the significance of evidence and accountability in establishing truth and justice.
orig: لولا جاءوا عليه بأربعة شهداء فإذ لم يأتوا بالشهداء فأولئك عند الله هم الكاذبون

translation: And had it not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved, with great punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of Allah's favor and mercy upon the believers in this world and the Hereafter. If it were not for Allah's grace, people would face severe punishment for their wrongdoings. It serves as a reminder of the significance of Allah's mercy and blessings, and also highlights the consequences of disobedience to Allah's guidance.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته في الدنيا والآخرة لمسكم في ما أفضتم فيه عذاب عظيم

translation: When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allah, tremendous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of speaking only what is true and verified, cautioning against spreading rumors and speaking without knowledge. It serves as a reminder that even seemingly small or insignificant words can have great consequences in the eyes of Allah.
orig: إذ تلقونه بألسنتكم وتقولون بأفواهكم ما ليس لكم به علم وتحسبونه هينا وهو عند الله عظيم

translation: And had you not, when you heard it, said, 'It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, this is a great slander.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of verifying information before spreading it and the necessity to refrain from engaging in gossip or spreading false accusations. It emphasizes the need to uphold one's integrity by refraining from participating in discussions or rumors that are not based on truth, in order to maintain honor and dignity. The verse encourages believers to be cautious in their speech and actions, preventing them from falling into sin by speaking without knowledge or spreading falsehoods.
orig: ولولا إذ سمعتموه قلتم ما يكون لنا أن نتكلم بهذا سبحانك هذا بهتان عظيم

translation: Allah cautions you never to repeat the like of it, if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers to avoid repeating past mistakes or sins. It emphasizes the importance of learning from one's errors and striving to improve oneself continuously. By heeding this caution, believers can demonstrate their faith and commitment to righteousness.
orig: يعظكم الله أن تعودوا لمثله أبدا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah provides clear signs and revelations to humankind, showing His infinite knowledge and wisdom. It emphasizes that Allah's guidance is comprehensive and profound, designed with wisdom beyond human comprehension.
orig: ويبين الله لكم الآيات والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who love that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows, while you do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe punishment awaiting those who take pleasure in spreading immorality or indecency among the believers. It serves as a warning that such actions will result in not only worldly consequences but also in the Hereafter. It reminds believers that Allah is aware of all things, even if humans are unaware of the full consequences of their actions.
orig: إن الذين يحبون أن تشيع الفاحشة في الذين آمنوا لهم عذاب أليم في الدنيا والآخرة والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And had it not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, and because Allah is Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of gratitude towards Allah for His grace and mercy upon the believers. It reminds us that all blessings and mercy we receive are from Allah, who is Kind and Merciful towards His creation.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله رءوف رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever. But Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers to be cautious and not to follow the path of Satan. By doing so, one can end up engaging in immoral and wrongful actions. The verse highlights the concept of divine purification, emphasizing that it is only through the favor and mercy of Allah that purity is attainable. It also conveys the message that Allah has the power to purify whomever He wills, and that His knowledge and awareness encompass everything.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان ومن يتبع خطوات الشيطان فإنه يأمر بالفحشاء والمنكر ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم من أحد أبدا ولكن الله يزكي من يشاء والله سميع عليم

translation: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of generosity, forgiveness, and kindness. Those who are privileged and have the means are encouraged to help their relatives, the needy, and the migrants in the way of Allah. It reminds believers that by showing kindness and forgiveness towards others, they are more likely to receive forgiveness from Allah, who is Merciful and Forgiving.
orig: ولا يأتل أولو الفضل منكم والسعة أن يؤتوا أولي القربى والمساكين والمهاجرين في سبيل الله وليعفوا وليصفحوا ألا تحبون أن يغفر الله لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who falsely accuse chaste women who may be unaware (of their situation) and are believers, are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe condemnation and punishment for those who wrongfully accuse innocent and believing women of immorality without evidence. Such actions are condemned in both the present life and the Hereafter, emphasizing the gravity and harm of false accusations, especially against those who are righteous and unaware of such accusations against them.
orig: إن الذين يرمون المحصنات الغافلات المؤمنات لعنوا في الدنيا والآخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: On the Day when their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them regarding what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when people's own body parts will testify against them about their deeds and actions in the worldly life. It highlights the concept of accountability and the absolute justice of Allah, where every individual will be held responsible for their actions, as even their own limbs will testify against them.
orig: يوم تشهد عليهم ألسنتهم وأيديهم وأرجلهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: On that Day God will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is God Who is the manifest Truth.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, God will fulfill their obligations and repay them according to their deeds, and they will realize and acknowledge that only God is the absolute and clear Truth.
orig: يومئذ يوفيهم الله دينهم الحق ويعلمون أن الله هو الحق المبين

translation: Evil statements are for evil people (or evil women) and evil people for evil statements. And good statements are for good people (or good women) and good people for good statements. Those are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of reciprocity in the Quran, stating that good and evil tend to be aligned. It teaches that those who engage in evil actions or speech will receive the same in return, while those who strive for goodness will be rewarded with good in turn. The verse also assures believers that they will be absolved of false accusations and promises forgiveness and bountiful provisions from God for their righteousness.
orig: الخبيثات للخبيثين والخبيثون للخبيثات والطيبات للطيبين والطيبون للطيبات أولئك مبرءون مما يقولون لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking permission before entering someone else's home and greeting its inhabitants. It promotes respect for others' privacy and sets a standard for good manners and etiquette in social interactions. By following these guidelines, believers are reminded to be considerate and mindful of others' space and feelings.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها ذلكم خير لكم لعلكم تذكرون

translation: So if you do not find anyone there, do not enter it until permission has been given to you. And if it is said to you, 'Go back,' then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking permission before entering someone's private space. It is a reminder to respect boundaries and privacy. It also teaches a lesson in obedience and humility, by advising that when asked to leave, one should comply willingly, as doing so is better for the individual's own moral character. Ultimately, it highlights that Allah is aware of all our actions and intentions.
orig: فإن لم تجدوا فيها أحدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم وإن قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا هو أزكى لكم والله بما تعملون عليم

translation: There is no blame upon you for entering houses that are not inhabited, in which there is something of benefit to you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is permissible to enter uninhabited houses if there is some benefit for you. It also serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of everything you reveal and everything you keep hidden, highlighting the importance of sincerity and honesty in all actions.
orig: ليس عليكم جناح أن تدخلوا بيوتا غير مسكونة فيها متاع لكم والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

translation: Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty; that will make for greater purity for them; And Allah is well acquainted with all that they do.
interpretation: This verse is advising male believers to lower their gaze and guard their modesty as a means of maintaining purity. It emphasizes the importance of self-control and modest behavior, as God is aware of all actions and intentions. By following these guidelines, believers can attain a higher level of righteousness and purity in the sight of Allah.
orig: قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من أبصارهم ويحفظوا فروجهم ذلك أزكى لهم إن الله خبير بما يصنعون

translation: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
interpretation: This verse instructs believing women to lower their gaze, guard their chastity, and not display their beauty except what is apparent, such as the face and hands. They are also advised to cover their chests with a portion of their garments, except in front of certain individuals such as their husbands, fathers, sons, and other close relatives. The verse emphasizes modesty and privacy in interactions and attire, highlighting the importance of repentance and adherence to God's commandments for success.
orig: وقل للمؤمنات يغضضن من أبصارهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا ما ظهر منها وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا لبعولتهن أو آبائهن أو آباء بعولتهن أو أبنائهن أو أبناء بعولتهن أو إخوانهن أو بني إخوانهن أو بني أخواتهن أو نسائهن أو ما ملكت أيمانهن أو التابعين غير أولي الإربة من الرجال أو الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورات النساء ولا يضربن بأرجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن وتوبوا إلى الله جميعا أيه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Marry those among you who are single, and the virtuous ones among your male and female slaves. If they are in poverty, Allah will enrich them out of His grace: Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of marriage in Islam, encouraging believers to marry those who are single and virtuous, including male and female slaves. It also reassures that if the individuals to be married are in need or come from humble backgrounds, Allah, out of His grace and generosity, will provide for them. The verse highlights Allah's encompassing mercy and knowledge, indicating that He is aware of all circumstances and capable of enriching those in need.
orig: وأنكحوا الأيامى منكم والصالحين من عبادكم وإمائكم إن يكونوا فقراء يغنهم الله من فضله والله واسع عليم

translation: And let those who find not the means for marriage keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them of His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among those whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, seeking [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse advises those who cannot afford to marry to preserve their chastity until they are able to marry. It also acknowledges the practice of entering into a contract for the eventual freedom of those under one's authority, urging kindness and fairness in such agreements. The verse strongly prohibits forcing slave girls into prostitution, emphasizing the importance of respecting their desire for chastity. It reassures that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful to those who may have committed such wrongs under compulsion.
orig: وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله والذين يبتغون الكتاب مما ملكت أيمانكم فكاتبوهم إن علمتم فيهم خيرا وآتوهم من مال الله الذي آتاكم ولا تكرهوا فتياتكم على البغاء إن أردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحياة الدنيا ومن يكرههن فإن الله من بعد إكراههن غفور رحيم

translation: And We have certainly revealed to you clear evidences and examples of those who passed before you and an admonition for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an contains clear signs, examples from past nations, and lessons for those who are pious and strive to be righteous. It is a reminder for believers of the consequences of actions and the importance of following the guidance provided in the Qur'an.
orig: ولقد أنزلنا إليكم آيات مبينات ومثلا من الذين خلوا من قبلكم وموعظة للمتقين

translation: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse describes Allah as the Light of the heavens and the earth, using the imagery of a lamp within a niche. The light of Allah is pure and illuminating, symbolized by a blessed olive tree. The verse emphasizes the guidance and enlightenment that Allah provides, and how His light can guide those whom He chooses. This verse serves as a metaphor for the illumination and guidance that comes from following the path of Allah.
orig: الله نور السماوات والأرض مثل نوره كمشكاة فيها مصباح المصباح في زجاجة الزجاجة كأنها كوكب دري يوقد من شجرة مباركة زيتونة لا شرقية ولا غربية يكاد زيتها يضيء ولو لم تمسسه نار نور على نور يهدي الله لنوره من يشاء ويضرب الله الأمثال للناس والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: In houses which Allah has permitted to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of establishing houses and spaces where the name of Allah is remembered and exalted regularly. It emphasizes the significance of dedicating time in the mornings and evenings to praise and glorify Allah in these designated places. It serves as a reminder to create environments that are conducive to the remembrance and worship of Allah.
orig: في بيوت أذن الله أن ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والآصال

translation: Men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about.
interpretation: This verse describes the characteristics of righteous men who prioritize their devotion to Allah above worldly distractions like trade and business. They are diligent in remembering Allah, establishing prayers, and fulfilling their obligations by giving charity. These men have an awareness and fear of the Day of Judgment, when everything will be turned upside down and hearts and eyes will be filled with fear and uncertainty. It emphasizes the importance of staying focused on spiritual matters and preparing for the Hereafter despite the distractions of this world.
orig: رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة يخافون يوما تتقلب فيه القلوب والأبصار

translation: May Allah reward them with the best of what they have done and give them more from His bounty. And Allah provides for whom He wills without account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine justice and mercy. It assures believers that Allah will reward them for their good deeds, not only with what they deserve but with even more blessings. It further highlights that Allah's provisions are limitless and abundant, and He bestows His favors upon whomever He wills without measure. This serves as a reminder for Muslims to have faith in Allah's fairness and trust in His will, knowing that whatever they do for the sake of pleasing Him will be generously rewarded.
orig: ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: And those who disbelieve - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due. And Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fate of those who disbelieve in God and fail to do good deeds. Their actions are likened to a mirage in the desert, which seems promising from afar but is ultimately empty and deceiving. In the same way, their misguided deeds will not benefit them on the Day of Judgment. God is always aware of their actions and will hold them accountable promptly and justly. This serves as a reminder of the transient nature of worldly temptations and the importance of sincere faith and good deeds.
orig: والذين كفروا أعمالهم كسراب بقيعة يحسبه الظمآن ماء حتى إذا جاءه لم يجده شيئا ووجد الله عنده فوفاه حسابه والله سريع الحساب

translation: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of those who stray from the path of righteousness and truth, likening them to darkness within a deep, tumultuous sea. The layers of darkness, waves, and clouds symbolize confusion, lack of guidance, and obstacles that obstruct clarity and truth. Those who have not been granted light from Allah are left in spiritual darkness and are unable to see the path to enlightenment and guidance.
orig: أو كظلمات في بحر لجي يغشاه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ظلمات بعضها فوق بعض إذا أخرج يده لم يكد يراها ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور

translation: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he who Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing submission to Allah in the universe. Everything in existence, from the beings on earth to the celestial bodies, consciously or unconsciously, follows the divine system set by Allah. Moreover, the verse reminds that those who engage in disobedience or reject faith will face consequences for their choices, and ultimately, Allah's will prevails in all matters.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يسبح له من في السماوات والأرض والطير صافات كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه والله عليم بما يفعلون

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the final destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty and ownership of Allah over everything in the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder that all authority, power, and control ultimately belong to Allah alone. Additionally, the statement 'and to Allah is the final destination' highlights the belief in the Hereafter, where all beings will return to Allah for accountability and judgment. It reinforces the idea of submission to Allah's will and the importance of recognizing that our ultimate destiny lies in returning to Him.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وإلى الله المصير

translation: Have you not considered that Allah drives clouds, then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it? And He sends down from the sky mountains [of clouds] wherein is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away the eyesight.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the power and control of Allah over nature, particularly emphasizing how Allah orchestrates the formation of clouds, rain, and hail, and directs them according to His will. It highlights the precision and intricacy with which Allah manages the weather patterns and phenomena, showcasing His absolute sovereignty over the elements and His ability to bestow blessings or inflict trials through them.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يزجي سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله وينزل من السماء من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشاء ويصرفه عن من يشاء يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالأبصار

translation: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuous cycles and alternation in the natural phenomena of night and day as signs of the power and wisdom of Allah. It serves as a reminder for people who possess insight to reflect upon the signs of Allah's creation and appreciate His greatness.
orig: يقلب الله الليل والنهار إن في ذلك لعبرة لأولي الأبصار

translation: And Allah has created every living creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that move on two legs, and of them are those that move on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the diversity in creation and the power of Allah over all living creatures. It highlights how Allah has created different animals with different modes of mobility, some crawling, some walking on two legs, and some on four. It serves as a reminder of the infinite power and capability of Allah in creating and controlling all things in the universe.
orig: والله خلق كل دابة من ماء فمنهم من يمشي على بطنه ومنهم من يمشي على رجلين ومنهم من يمشي على أربع يخلق الله ما يشاء إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: We have sent down clear verses. Allah guides whom He wills to the straight path.
interpretation: Allah has revealed clear signs and guidance to humanity through the Qur'an. It is Allah's will to guide those whom He chooses to the straight path, leading them towards righteousness and truth.
orig: لقد أنزلنا آيات مبينات والله يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And they say, 'We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger and we obey.' Then a party of them turns away after that, and those are not believers.
interpretation: This verse condemns the behavior of those who claim to believe in Allah and follow the teachings of the Prophet, but then turn away and abandon their faith. It serves as a reminder that true belief requires consistent actions and faithfulness to one's principles.
orig: ويقولون آمنا بالله وبالرسول وأطعنا ثم يتولى فريق منهم من بعد ذلك وما أولئك بالمؤمنين

translation: And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of submitting to the authority of Allah and His Messenger when disputes arise among believers. It warns against turning away from the decision made by Allah and His Messenger, emphasizing the need for obedience and adherence to the guidance provided by Islam in resolving conflicts and disagreements.
orig: وإذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم إذا فريق منهم معرضون

translation: And if they had been given the right, they would have come to him humbly.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of humility in accepting the truth. It suggests that when people are truly seeking the truth and if the truth is presented to them, they would accept it with humility and submission. It underlines the idea that arrogance and stubbornness are obstacles to recognizing and accepting the truth.
orig: وإن يكن لهم الحق يأتوا إليه مذعنين

translation: Is there disease in their hearts or have they doubts or fear lest Allah and His Messenger should wrong them in judgment? Nay, it is they themselves who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse questions the motives of those who oppose the message of Allah and His Messenger. It suggests that their resistance may come from a place of inner sickness, doubt, or fear of being judged unfairly. Ultimately, it emphasizes that those who reject the truth of Allah and His Messenger are the ones who are unjust and wrongdoers.
orig: أفي قلوبهم مرض أم ارتابوا أم يخافون أن يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله بل أولئك هم الظالمون

translation: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, 'We hear and we obey.' And those are the successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith and obedience when seeking judgment from Allah and His Messenger. True believers respond with humility and acceptance of God's decree, and through their submission, they earn success and blessings in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: إنما كان قول المؤمنين إذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم أن يقولوا سمعنا وأطعنا وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, fears Allah, and has taqwa (consciousness of Allah), then they are the successful ones.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger, being conscious of Allah and having taqwa. Those who follow these principles are the ones who will truly succeed both in this life and in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فأولئك هم الفائزون

translation: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you should command them, they would go forth. Say, 'Do not swear; [such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do.'
interpretation: This verse admonishes those who make exaggerated oaths or swear by Allah insincerely, claiming they would obey if commanded, when in reality they have no intention to do so. The verse emphasizes that genuine obedience is what matters, not hollow oaths. It serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of our intentions and actions, and sincerity and genuine obedience are what is valued by Him.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن أمرتهم ليخرجن قل لا تقسموا طاعة معروفة إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Say, 'Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away, then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying both Allah and His Messenger. It explains that the Prophet's duty is to deliver the message clearly, and it is the responsibility of the individual to choose whether to obey or not. Obedience to the Messenger will lead to guidance, while turning away will only bring consequences upon oneself.
orig: قل أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول فإن تولوا فإنما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم وإن تطيعوه تهتدوا وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: Allah has promised those of you who have believed and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the promise of Allah to the believers who do good deeds, that they will be granted authority on the earth, that their religion will be preserved and established, and that they will be given security after fear. The verse also emphasizes the importance of worshiping Allah alone and avoiding associating partners with Him. However, it warns that those who disbelieve afterwards are considered defiantly disobedient.
orig: وعد الله الذين آمنوا منكم وعملوا الصالحات ليستخلفنهم في الأرض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذي ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم أمنا يعبدونني لا يشركون بي شيئا ومن كفر بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of establishing regular prayer, giving in charity (zakah), and obeying the teachings of the Messenger (Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him). By adhering to these practices, one can attain the mercy and blessings of Allah. The verse highlights the interconnectedness of worship, charity, and following the guidance of the Messenger as a means to attain Allah's mercy and compassion.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون

translation: Do not think that those who disbelieve have escaped in the land. Their refuge is the Fire, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that ultimate justice will prevail, even if it seems that disbelievers are successful in this worldly life. The verse emphasizes that those who reject faith will face the consequences of their choices, and their ultimate fate will be the Fire, highlighting the severe punishment awaiting them in the afterlife.
orig: لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين في الأرض ومأواهم النار ولبئس المصير

translation: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the believers, instructing them on the etiquette of seeking permission before entering private spaces, specifically in households where there are individuals who have not yet reached puberty. The verse outlines three specific times when seeking permission is necessary: before the dawn prayer, during the midday rest period, and after the night prayer. Outside of these times, there is no blame on either party for moving freely amongst each other. The verse emphasizes the importance of respecting boundaries, privacy, and modesty, while also highlighting Allah's wisdom and knowledge in detailing such guidelines.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ليستأذنكم الذين ملكت أيمانكم والذين لم يبلغوا الحلم منكم ثلاث مرات من قبل صلاة الفجر وحين تضعون ثيابكم من الظهيرة ومن بعد صلاة العشاء ثلاث عورات لكم ليس عليكم ولا عليهم جناح بعدهن طوافون عليكم بعضكم على بعض كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات والله عليم حكيم

translation: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask for permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse addresses the importance of seeking permission before entering private spaces, specifically mentioning the significance of this practice when children reach the age of puberty. It emphasizes the value of following established norms and etiquettes in society, implying that these principles are part of the guidance provided by Allah to ensure respect, privacy, and order in the community.
orig: وإذا بلغ الأطفال منكم الحلم فليستأذنوا كما استأذن الذين من قبلهم كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته والله عليم حكيم

translation: And the women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of modesty for women, particularly for those who are no longer of childbearing age and have no interest in marriage. They are not required to display adornment in public, and it is better for them to maintain their modesty. Allah recognizes and appreciates their intention to be modest, as He is All-Hearing and All-Knowing.
orig: والقواعد من النساء اللاتي لا يرجون نكاحا فليس عليهن جناح أن يضعن ثيابهن غير متبرجات بزينة وأن يستعففن خير لهن والله سميع عليم

translation: There is no blame upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame upon the sick nor upon yourselves if you eat from your houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your father's brothers, or the houses of your father's sisters, or the houses of your mother's brothers, or the houses of your mother's sisters, or from the houses of whose keys you possess, or from the house of your friend. There is no sin upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon yourselves - greetings from Allah, blessed and good. Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might understand.
interpretation: This verse addresses the permissibility of eating from the homes of relatives and close friends without any blame or sin. It emphasizes the importance of greeting one another with peace and blessings when entering houses, reminding believers of the etiquettes of social interactions and expressing the blessings and clarity of divine guidance in these matters.
orig: ليس على الأعمى حرج ولا على الأعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ولا على أنفسكم أن تأكلوا من بيوتكم أو بيوت آبائكم أو بيوت أمهاتكم أو بيوت إخوانكم أو بيوت أخواتكم أو بيوت أعمامكم أو بيوت عماتكم أو بيوت أخوالكم أو بيوت خالاتكم أو ما ملكتم مفاتحه أو صديقكم ليس عليكم جناح أن تأكلوا جميعا أو أشتاتا فإذا دخلتم بيوتا فسلموا على أنفسكم تحية من عند الله مباركة طيبة كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Indeed, the believers are only those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allah. It is those who are the truthful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true believers are those who have complete faith in Allah and His Messenger, and they are willing to make sacrifices in the way of Allah without hesitation. They are sincere in their beliefs and actions, showing dedication and loyalty to the teachings of Islam.
orig: إنما المؤمنون الذين آمنوا بالله ورسوله وإذا كانوا معه على أمر جامع لم يذهبوا حتى يستأذنوه إن الذين يستأذنونك أولئك الذين يؤمنون بالله ورسوله فإذا استأذنوك لبعض شأنهم فأذن لمن شئت منهم واستغفر لهم الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Do not make the calling of the Messenger among you as the call of one of you to another. Allah knows those of you who slip away surreptitiously. So let those who oppose His command beware, lest a trial strike them or they suffer a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse cautions against treating the Messenger's (Prophet Muhammad's) call as ordinary conversation among yourselves. It emphasizes the importance of following the guidance and commands of the Prophet and warns those who oppose his teachings that they may face trials or punishment if they persist in their defiance. It serves as a reminder of the need to take the guidance of the Prophet seriously and to avoid straying from his teachings.
orig: لا تجعلوا دعاء الرسول بينكم كدعاء بعضكم بعضا قد يعلم الله الذين يتسللون منكم لواذا فليحذر الذين يخالفون عن أمره أن تصيبهم فتنة أو يصيبهم عذاب أليم

translation: Surely, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows well what you are engaged in. And on the Day they are returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah, highlighting His knowledge and awareness of all our actions. On the Day of Judgment, we will be held accountable for our deeds, as Allah is All-Knowing and fully aware of everything.
orig: ألا إن لله ما في السماوات والأرض قد يعلم ما أنتم عليه ويوم يرجعون إليه فينبئهم بما عملوا والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -
interpretation: This verse praises Allah, the Most Exalted, for revealing the Qur'an as a criterion for his servant, Prophet Muhammad, as a warner to all the worlds. It emphasizes the importance of the Qur'an as a guide and a warning for all of humanity.
orig: تبارك الذي نزل الفرقان على عبده ليكون للعالمين نذيرا

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He has begotten no offspring nor does He have a partner in His dominion. He has created everything and has ordained it in due measure.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and sovereignty of Allah over the heavens and the earth, emphasizing that He has no progeny and no equal in His rule. Allah is the creator of all things and has decreed their existence and purpose in a just and precise manner. It serves as a reminder of the uniqueness and absolute authority of Allah in the universe.
orig: الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض ولم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك وخلق كل شيء فقدره تقديرا

translation: And they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit, and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of worshipping false gods created by humans who have no power to create anything themselves, nor have the ability to harm or benefit anyone. These false gods do not have control over life or death, and they cannot resurrect people. The verse emphasizes the incomparable power and authority of Allah as the only Creator and the ultimate source of control over life and death.
orig: واتخذوا من دونه آلهة لا يخلقون شيئا وهم يخلقون ولا يملكون لأنفسهم ضرا ولا نفعا ولا يملكون موتا ولا حياة ولا نشورا

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'This is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it.' But they have committed an injustice and a lie.
interpretation: This verse addresses the response of the disbelievers to the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights their denial of the truth and their accusations that the Prophet was fabricating the Qur'an with the help of others. The verse emphasizes the unjust and false nature of their claims, highlighting their refusal to accept the divine origins of the Qur'an and their rejection of the guidance it offers.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا إفك افتراه وأعانه عليه قوم آخرون فقد جاءوا ظلما وزورا

translation: And they say: 'Legends of the ancients, which he has had written down, and they are dictated to him morning and evening.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the baseless accusations made by the disbelievers about the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) claiming that he is merely reciting fables and stories from the past that were written down for him. The verse dismisses these claims and asserts that the Qur'an is a divine revelation, and not tales of the ancients.
orig: وقالوا أساطير الأولين اكتتبها فهي تملى عليه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: Say, "He has sent it down, who knows the secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a divine revelation from Allah, who knows all the hidden and apparent matters in the heavens and the earth. It highlights Allah's attributes of forgiveness and mercy, showing that despite His complete knowledge and power, He is always ready to forgive His creation.
orig: قل أنزله الذي يعلم السر في السماوات والأرض إنه كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And they say, 'What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the lack of understanding among some people regarding the nature of the Prophet Muhammad. They were questioning why a special angel was not sent down to him instead of living a human life like eating food and walking in the markets. This highlights a common misconception that prophets should be beyond human needs and actions, whereas in reality, they were chosen by Allah to be amongst their people, leading by example and delivering guidance in ways that are relatable to humanity.
orig: وقالوا مال هذا الرسول يأكل الطعام ويمشي في الأسواق لولا أنزل إليه ملك فيكون معه نذيرا

translation: Or [it may be] that he be given a treasure, or that he have a garden from which he may eat.' And the wrongdoers say, 'You follow not but a man bewitched.'
interpretation: This verse discusses the response of the disbelievers to the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights their refusal to believe in the Prophet's message, attributing his abilities to magic or sorcery rather than acknowledging the truth of his guidance. The verse emphasizes the arrogant denial and stubbornness of those who choose to reject the signs and teachings of Allah.
orig: أو يلقى إليه كنز أو تكون له جنة يأكل منها وقال الظالمون إن تتبعون إلا رجلا مسحورا

translation: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot find a way.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people may try to mislead or confuse others by presenting false comparisons or arguments that lead them astray. However, despite their efforts, those who are misguided will not find the right path or guidance.
orig: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الأمثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا

translation: Blessed is He who, if He wills, will give you something better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow and will give you palaces.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the abundant blessings and rewards that God can bestow upon His followers in the afterlife. It serves as a reminder that whatever goodness we may experience in this life is just a glimpse of what awaits the believers in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the infinite mercy and generosity of God towards those who strive to please Him.
orig: تبارك الذي إن شاء جعل لك خيرا من ذلك جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ويجعل لك قصورا

translation: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelievers who reject the concept of the Day of Judgment. It highlights that those who deny the Day of Judgment will face severe consequences and punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: بل كذبوا بالساعة وأعتدنا لمن كذب بالساعة سعيرا

translation: When they are thrown into a place from a far-off place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where disbelievers are being thrown into Hell from a distant place, and they hear the violent and terrifying sounds of Hell as they approach their punishment. It serves as a warning and a reminder of the consequences of denying the truth and disobeying God's commandments.
orig: إذا رأتهم من مكان بعيد سمعوا لها تغيظا وزفيرا

translation: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will call there for destruction.
interpretation: This verse describes the situation of the disbelievers in the afterlife when they are cast into the Hellfire. They will be confined in a narrow space, bound in chains, and they will call out for destruction, realizing the severity of their punishment. It serves as a warning of the consequences of rejecting faith and the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإذا ألقوا منها مكانا ضيقا مقرنين دعوا هنالك ثبورا

translation: Do not invoke today [as time is distinct] for one [unchastised] but invoke it for much [chastisement].
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to be complacent and to realize that there will be consequences for their actions in the Hereafter. It serves as a warning that individuals will not be treated as a homogenous group on the Day of Judgment; rather, each person's deeds will be weighed individually in determining their fate. Therefore, it urges believers to strive to do good deeds abundantly to avoid punishment and seek Allah's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: لا تدعوا اليوم ثبورا واحدا وادعوا ثبورا كثيرا

translation: Say, 'Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be their reward and destination.'
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question comparing the worldly life to the eternal paradise in the Hereafter. It highlights the superior nature of the eternal bliss and reward that awaits the righteous believers as opposed to the fleeting pleasures of this world. It emphasizes the importance of striving for righteousness and piety in order to attain the ultimate reward of entering paradise, which is described as a place of eternal happiness and fulfillment.
orig: قل أذلك خير أم جنة الخلد التي وعد المتقون كانت لهم جزاء ومصيرا

translation: For them therein is all that they wish for, while abiding eternally. It is a promise binding upon your Lord that must be fulfilled.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that in Paradise, believers will have all that they wish for and will remain there eternally. It also reminds us that this promise of reward and eternal bliss in the Hereafter is a commitment from Allah, the Lord, which He will surely fulfill. This serves to inspire hope and encouragement for believers to strive for good deeds and righteousness in their lives.
orig: لهم فيها ما يشاءون خالدين كان على ربك وعدا مسئولا

translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, 'Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?'
interpretation: This verse highlights a scene on the Day of Judgment when people will be gathered with what they worshipped besides Allah. It questions whether those false deities misled the people or if the people themselves willingly went astray from the guidance provided to them. It serves as a reminder of personal responsibility and accountability for one's beliefs and actions.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم وما يعبدون من دون الله فيقول أأنتم أضللتم عبادي هؤلاء أم هم ضلوا السبيل

translation: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a ruined people."
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and ingratitude of those who choose to turn away from the guidance of Allah and instead rely on worldly comforts and luxuries. It emphasizes that the true allegiance and reliance should only be to Allah, and that forgetting His message leads to ruin and loss.
orig: قالوا سبحانك ما كان ينبغي لنا أن نتخذ من دونك من أولياء ولكن متعتهم وآباءهم حتى نسوا الذكر وكانوا قوما بورا

translation: They have denied what you say, so you cannot avert [punishment] or help [anyone]. And whoever among you does wrong, We will make him taste a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who reject the Prophet and do wrong. It emphasizes that the deniers cannot escape punishment or assistance and that those who commit wrongdoing will face severe consequences. It conveys the idea that unjust actions will ultimately be met with divine justice.
orig: فقد كذبوكم بما تقولون فما تستطيعون صرفا ولا نصرا ومن يظلم منكم نذقه عذابا كبيرا

translation: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah; then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse reflects on the messengers of Allah who were sent before Muhammad, mentioning that they were all human beings who lived among communities. It urges people to reflect on the consequences faced by those who came before them and to consider the Hereafter as the ultimate goal for those who have a reverence for Allah and His guidance. The verse is a call for reflection and contemplation on the signs of Allah's presence and the importance of following His path.
orig: وما أرسلنا قبلك من المرسلين إلا إنهم ليأكلون الطعام ويمشون في الأسواق وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة أتصبرون وكان ربك بصيرا

translation: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, 'Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?' Indeed, they have become arrogant within themselves and become excessively proud.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the attitude of those who do not believe in the meeting with Allah or in the Day of Judgment. They question why they cannot see the angels or witness their Lord, displaying arrogance and excessive pride. The verse emphasizes the importance of humbleness, belief, and submission to Allah, rather than arrogance and pride.
orig: وقال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا لولا أنزل علينا الملائكة أو نرى ربنا لقد استكبروا في أنفسهم وعتوا عتوا كبيرا

translation: The day they see the angels, there will be no good tidings on that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, 'A protective shield.'
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the criminals will have no hope of receiving any good news or relief. The angels will declare a protective barrier, indicating that the wrongdoers will be held accountable for their deeds and prevented from escaping the consequences of their sins.
orig: يوم يرون الملائكة لا بشرى يومئذ للمجرمين ويقولون حجرا محجورا

translation: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment where Allah will evaluate and render as worthless the deeds of those who disbelieved and disobeyed Him. Their actions will be scattered like dust, having no value or worth in the sight of Allah. It serves as a warning to remind believers to be mindful of their actions and intentions, for they will be held accountable on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: وقدمنا إلى ما عملوا من عمل فجعلناه هباء منثورا

translation: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are in a better settlement and better resting place.
interpretation: On that Day, the people of Paradise will find themselves in a place that is much more comfortable and peaceful than anything they have experienced before. This verse highlights the ultimate reward and bliss that awaits the righteous believers in the Hereafter, emphasizing the contrast between the hardships of the earthly life and the everlasting tranquility of Paradise.
orig: أصحاب الجنة يومئذ خير مستقرا وأحسن مقيلا

translation: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from the Day of Judgment when the sky will split open, filled with thick clouds, and the angels will descend in a gradual and continuous manner. It depicts the awe-inspiring power of God and the inevitable arrival of the Day of Resurrection when all will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: ويوم تشقق السماء بالغمام ونزل الملائكة تنزيلا

translation: The sovereignty that Day is the true sovereignty belonging to the Most Merciful. And it will be a difficult Day for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, ultimate sovereignty will belong to Allah, the Most Merciful. It emphasizes that the Day of Judgment will be challenging and difficult for those who rejected faith and denied the truth.
orig: الملك يومئذ الحق للرحمن وكان يوما على الكافرين عسيرا

translation: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, 'Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the wrongdoers will regret their actions and wish they had followed the path shown by the Messenger (Prophet Muhammad). It emphasizes the importance of adhering to the guidance of the Prophet and living a righteous life to avoid remorse and regret in the Hereafter.
orig: ويوم يعض الظالم على يديه يقول يا ليتني اتخذت مع الرسول سبيلا

translation: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
interpretation: This verse expresses regret and sorrow over a choice that was made in selecting a friend. It serves as a reminder to choose companions wisely, as they can have a significant impact on one's life and spiritual well-being. It teaches the importance of surrounding oneself with good and righteous company to avoid potential harm or negative influences.
orig: يا ويلتى ليتني لم أتخذ فلانا خليلا

translation: He led me astray from the Reminder after it had come to me. And Satan always deserts man.
interpretation: This verse highlights the influence of Satan on humans, how he leads them astray from the reminder or guidance when it has reached them. It serves as a warning about the deceptive tactics of Satan and how easily humans can be led away from the right path if they do not remain vigilant and conscious of their beliefs and actions.
orig: لقد أضلني عن الذكر بعد إذ جاءني وكان الشيطان للإنسان خذولا

translation: And the Messenger has said, 'O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the Prophet's concern about his people neglecting the Quran, not giving it the attention and respect it deserves. It highlights the importance of valuing, studying, and implementing the teachings of the Quran in one's life.
orig: وقال الرسول يا رب إن قومي اتخذوا هذا القرآن مهجورا

translation: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes how every prophet faced opposition from those who were intent on committing crimes and spreading corruption, represented by the devils from mankind and jinn. Despite this enmity, believers are reminded that ultimately it is God who guides and protects them, and no harm can come to them without His permission. The verse encourages believers to be steadfast in their faith and to disregard any falsehood or deception spread by the enemies of truth.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا من المجرمين وكفى بربك هاديا ونصيرا

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?' Thus, [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.
interpretation: This verse addresses the disbelievers who question why the Qur'an was not revealed all at once. The slow and gradual revelation of the Qur'an was a deliberate choice by Allah to strengthen the heart of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the believers over time. This gradual revelation also allowed for better understanding, contemplation, and implementation of the teachings of the Qur'an. The method of revealing the Qur'an showcases the wisdom and mercy of Allah in guiding and nurturing the believers.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لولا نزل عليه القرآن جملة واحدة كذلك لنثبت به فؤادك ورتلناه ترتيلا

translation: And they do not bring to you a similitude except that We bring you the truth and the best interpretation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the uniqueness of the truths presented in the Qur'an. It asserts that whenever someone challenges or brings about a comparison, the Qur'an will always prevail with the truth and the most excellent explanation. Therefore, the Qur'an stands as the ultimate source of guidance and wisdom, unmatched in its clarity and profundity.
orig: ولا يأتونك بمثل إلا جئناك بالحق وأحسن تفسيرا

translation: Those who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in place and farthest astray.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of those who will be gathered on their faces and taken to Hell. It emphasizes that such individuals are in the worst place and farthest away from the right path. The imagery used here serves as a warning about the consequences of deviating from the straight path and disobeying God's commandments.
orig: الذين يحشرون على وجوههم إلى جهنم أولئك شر مكانا وأضل سبيلا

translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as a minister.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the special appointment of Aaron (Harun) as a minister to support his brother Moses (Musa) in spreading the message of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of partnership, cooperation, and support in carrying out the duties of prophethood and leadership. The relationship between Moses and Aaron serves as an example of how having a companion and ally can strengthen and aid in fulfilling one's mission.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلنا معه أخاه هارون وزيرا

translation: So We said, 'Go to the people who have denied Our signs.' Then We destroyed them completely.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences that befell the people who rejected the signs and revelations of Allah. It emphasizes the severity of their denial and the ultimate destruction that they faced as a result of their disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the importance of acknowledging and accepting the signs and guidance of Allah, and the consequences of rejecting them.
orig: فقلنا اذهبا إلى القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فدمرناهم تدميرا

translation: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah when they denied the messengers and drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) and his people who rejected the messages brought by the messengers of Allah. As a consequence of their disbelief and wrongdoing, they were drowned in a great flood. This serves as a lesson and a sign for humanity that denying the truth and acting unjustly will lead to a severe punishment.
orig: وقوم نوح لما كذبوا الرسل أغرقناهم وجعلناهم للناس آية وأعتدنا للظالمين عذابا أليما

translation: And [mention] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an mentions the nations of 'Aad and Thamud, as well as the companions of the well (Ashab al-Rass), referring to past nations that were destroyed due to their disbelief and transgression. By mentioning these nations, the Qur'an serves as a reminder for people to reflect on the consequences of rejecting the guidance of Allah and living in disobedience. It conveys a message about the importance of faith, humility, and obedience to the teachings of Islam to avoid facing similar destruction.
orig: وعادا وثمود وأصحاب الرس وقرونا بين ذلك كثيرا

translation: And We have certainly presented every kind of example in this Qur'an to people. But man has ever been, most of anything, prone to dispute.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that various examples and parables have been given in the Qur'an to help people understand its message. The verse also highlights the tendency of humans to argue and dispute even when clear examples are provided to them, pointing to the importance of reflection and sincerity in understanding and following the guidance of the Qur'an.
orig: وكلا ضربنا له الأمثال وكلا تبرنا تتبيرا

translation: And they had already come upon the town which was showered with a harmful rain. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting a past event where a town was punished with a destructive rain, yet the people of that town did not take heed of the punishment as a reminder of the forthcoming Day of Resurrection. It serves as a warning to the disbelievers, reminding them to reflect on the signs of God's punishment and to expect accountability in the Hereafter.
orig: ولقد أتوا على القرية التي أمطرت مطر السوء أفلم يكونوا يرونها بل كانوا لا يرجون نشورا

translation: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], 'Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?'
interpretation: This verse describes how some people mocked the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) when they saw him, doubting that he could be a messenger of Allah. It highlights the resistance and disbelief faced by the Prophet in his mission, while also emphasizing the powerful message he brought despite the mockery and ridicule.
orig: وإذا رأوك إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي بعث الله رسولا

translation: Indeed, he almost led us astray from our gods if we had not been patient and steadfast in their worship. But they will know, when they see the punishment, who is further astray from the right path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and steadfastness in one's faith, especially in times of difficulty or temptation. It emphasizes that those who stay devoted to their beliefs despite challenges will ultimately see the truth and the error of their ways. It serves as a reminder that adherence to one's faith will reveal the righteous path and expose those who are led astray.
orig: إن كاد ليضلنا عن آلهتنا لولا أن صبرنا عليها وسوف يعلمون حين يرون العذاب من أضل سبيلا

translation: Have you seen the one who has taken as his god his [own] desire? Then would you be responsible for him?
interpretation: This verse questions the wisdom of prioritizing one's own desires and whims above all else, as it implies worshipping one's own desires as a god. The verse serves as a reminder to reflect on whether submitting to one's whims and desires is a worthy or responsible way to live, suggesting that it is not a path that leads to righteousness or guidance.
orig: أرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه أفأنت تكون عليه وكيلا

translation: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are not but like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and heedlessness of many people who do not use their hearing and intellect to comprehend the truth. The metaphor of comparing them to livestock emphasizes their lack of knowledge and guidance, implying that they are wandering aimlessly in the wrong path despite possessing the faculties of hearing and understanding. It serves as a reminder to appreciate and utilize the gifts of hearing and intellect in seeking guidance and truth.
orig: أم تحسب أن أكثرهم يسمعون أو يعقلون إن هم إلا كالأنعام بل هم أضل سبيلا

translation: Have you not considered how your Lord extends the shadow? And if He willed, He could have made it stationary. Then We made the sun for it an indication.
interpretation: This verse highlights the intricate design and precision in the natural world created by Allah. It draws attention to the movement of shadows and the sun, indicating the power and wisdom of Allah in His creation. It serves as a reminder for humans to reflect upon the signs of Allah's existence and greatness in the world around them.
orig: ألم تر إلى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا

translation: Then We took him back to Us as a slight withdrawal.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the return of a person to Allah, indicating the concept of death and the transition of the soul back to its Creator. The phrase 'a slight withdrawal' implies a gentle and easy return to Allah, highlighting the peaceful nature of death for believers who will be reunited with their Lord.
orig: ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا

translation: He it is Who made the night a covering for you, and sleep a rest, and made the day a rising.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine wisdom in the alternation of night and day.
