It signifies the mercy of Allah in providing rest and rejuvenation through sleep during the night, and the opportunity for activity and productivity during the day. It serves as a reminder of the balance and order in the universe that Allah has created for the benefit and sustenance of humankind.
orig: وهو الذي جعل لكم الليل لباسا والنوم سباتا وجعل النهار نشورا

translation: He it is who sends the winds as heralds of good tidings before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's mercy and power in the creation of the natural elements like wind and rain. The wind is described as bringing good news of rainfall, which is pure and beneficial for all living beings. It emphasizes the cycle of mercy and sustenance created by Allah for the benefit of humanity and all of creation.
orig: وهو الذي أرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته وأنزلنا من السماء ماء طهورا

translation: We shall revive a dead land and give to drink thereof many of the cattle and men that We had created.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the power and magnificence of Allah, as it mentions the ability to revive a dead land and provide sustenance for both animals and humans. It serves as a reminder of Allah's capability to bring life to barren places and offer sustenance to all living creatures, emphasizing His role as the ultimate provider and sustainer.
orig: لنحيي به بلدة ميتا ونسقيه مما خلقنا أنعاما وأناسي كثيرا

translation: And We have certainly distributed it (the Qur'an) among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an has been revealed and distributed among people as a means of reminding them of the truth and guiding them towards righteousness. However, many people choose to reject the message out of arrogance and ingratitude, displaying disbelief and denial despite the reminders and guidance provided to them.
orig: ولقد صرفناه بينهم ليذكروا فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا

translation: And if We willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and wisdom of Allah, who sends warners to different communities to guide them towards the right path. It implies that Allah has the power to send messengers to every nation as a form of guidance and that His ultimate will is for humanity to be guided and follow the right path.
orig: ولو شئنا لبعثنا في كل قرية نذيرا

translation: So do not obey the disbelievers, but strive against them with the Qur'an a great jihad.
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to follow the ways or commands of disbelievers. Instead, they are encouraged to engage in a great struggle against those who reject the truth, using the teachings of the Qur'an as their weapon. It emphasizes the importance of standing firm in one's faith and resisting the influence of those who oppose or reject it.
orig: فلا تطع الكافرين وجاهدهم به جهادا كبيرا

translation: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating and controlling the natural phenomena on Earth. It describes how Allah has created two different types of seas that meet but do not mix, each with its own distinct characteristics. This separation is maintained by a barrier that Allah has put in place. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to create diverse and interconnected systems in nature, as well as a metaphor for the balance and order that exists in the universe.
orig: وهو الذي مرج البحرين هذا عذب فرات وهذا ملح أجاج وجعل بينهما برزخا وحجرا محجورا

translation: He it is Who has created man from water, then has He made him of a drop (of) water, and He made it kinship and marriage. And your Lord is All-Powerful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous nature of human creation, emphasizing how Allah created mankind from water and then established relationships and connections among them through kinship and marriage. The verse also underscores the all-encompassing power of Allah, who has the ability to create and shape human beings as He wills.
orig: وهو الذي خلق من الماء بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا وكان ربك قديرا

translation: And they worship other than Allah that which neither benefits them nor harms them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of worshipping anything other than Allah, emphasizing that such acts hold no benefit nor harm for the individual. It also underscores the role of disbelievers who end up unknowingly aiding Satan in his mission against Allah. The verse serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in the worship of Allah and not to deviate towards false idols or beliefs.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعهم ولا يضرهم وكان الكافر على ربه ظهيرا

translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: This verse is addressing Prophet Muhammad, stating that his mission is to deliver glad tidings to those who believe and follow the guidance, as well as to warn those who reject the message and continue in wrongdoing. It emphasizes the dual role of the Prophet as a bearer of good news to the believers and a warner to those who are heedless or defiant.
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا

translation: Say, 'I do not ask of you for it any payment, only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sincerity and selflessness of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in delivering the message of Islam. It highlights that the Prophet does not seek any material gain or reward from the people for conveying the message of Allah. Rather, his sole purpose is to guide humanity towards the path that leads to Allah, leaving it up to individuals to choose whether or not to follow this path. The verse underscores the importance of sincerity and intention in delivering the message of Islam, and the ultimate goal of leading people towards their Lord.
orig: قل ما أسألكم عليه من أجر إلا من شاء أن يتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا

translation: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of relying on Allah, the Ever-Living, who is eternal and does not die. It emphasizes praising Allah and acknowledging His greatness and mercy. The verse reassures believers that Allah is fully aware of their sins and shortcomings, yet He is sufficient in His knowledge and forgiveness. It encourages believers to trust in Allah's infinite mercy and seek His forgiveness with sincerity.
orig: وتوكل على الحي الذي لا يموت وسبح بحمده وكفى به بذنوب عباده خبيرا

translation: Who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days; then He established Himself above the Throne. The Most Merciful. So ask about Him one well informed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah as the Creator of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between in just six days. After creating the universe, Allah established Himself above the Throne, demonstrating His sovereignty. Believers are encouraged to seek knowledge about Allah from those who are well-informed and knowledgeable about Him, emphasizing the importance of understanding and deepening one's connection with the Divine.
orig: الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وما بينهما في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش الرحمن فاسأل به خبيرا

translation: And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer] to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we bow to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and disbelief of some people who refuse to bow in prayer to the Most Merciful, questioning the command and showing defiance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of humility and submission to Allah's commands without hesitation or questioning.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اسجدوا للرحمن قالوا وما الرحمن أنسجد لما تأمرنا وزادهم نفورا

translation: Blessed is He who has placed constellations in the sky and placed therein a burning lamp and luminous moon.
interpretation: This verse highlights the beauty and wonder of the universe, praising Allah for the creation of the stars, the sun, and the moon in the sky. It emphasizes the power and creativity of Allah in shaping the cosmos and providing light and guidance for humanity.
orig: تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا

translation: And it is He who made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine wisdom behind the alternation of night and day, serving as a reminder for those who seek to remember Allah and be grateful for His blessings. The day and night cycle allows for reflection, remembrance, and appreciation of Allah's countless favors upon His creation.
orig: وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن أراد أن يذكر أو أراد شكورا

translation: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of the true servants of Allah, who are characterized by humility, patience, and peace. They maintain composure and respond with words of peace even when faced with ignorance or hostility. It emphasizes the importance of exhibiting good manners and avoiding unnecessary conflict in interactions with others.
orig: وعباد الرحمن الذين يمشون على الأرض هونا وإذا خاطبهم الجاهلون قالوا سلاما

translation: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]
interpretation: This verse describes the act of worship where believers dedicate a portion of their night to pray to their Lord by prostrating and standing in prayer. It highlights the importance of engaging in night prayer as a means to strengthen faith, seek closeness to Allah, and seek forgiveness and guidance.
orig: والذين يبيتون لربهم سجدا وقياما

translation: And those who say, 'Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering'
interpretation: This verse highlights the supplication of believers seeking protection from the punishment of Hell. It emphasizes the intense fear believers have of the torment of Hellfire and their reliance on seeking refuge with Allah from it. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience to Allah and the importance of seeking His mercy and protection.
orig: والذين يقولون ربنا اصرف عنا عذاب جهنم إن عذابها كان غراما

translation: Verily, it is an evil abode and resting place.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the negativity and evilness of the abode and resting place being referred to. It is a warning and a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the importance of choosing a righteous path that leads to a good destination.
orig: إنها ساءت مستقرا ومقاما

translation: And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly, but hold a medium (way) between those (extremes).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of moderation in spending. It instructs believers to avoid both extravagance and stinginess when giving in charity or spending on themselves. It encourages a balanced and moderate approach to wealth, where resources are utilized wisely and justly, without wastefulness or miserliness.
orig: والذين إذا أنفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما

translation: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of monotheism, respect for human life, and moral purity. It prohibits associating partners with Allah, taking innocent lives, and engaging in immoral acts. The verse warns of consequences for those who engage in such sinful behaviors, highlighting the significance of upholding these values in the eyes of Allah.
orig: والذين لا يدعون مع الله إلها آخر ولا يقتلون النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ولا يزنون ومن يفعل ذلك يلق أثاما

translation: The punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated,
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of those who persist in their wrongdoing and arrogance. It speaks of the doubling of punishment in the Hereafter for those who have been warned and still continue in their disrespectful ways. They will endure humiliation and disgrace for eternity as a result of their actions.
orig: يضاعف له العذاب يوم القيامة ويخلد فيه مهانا

translation: Except for those who repent, believe, and do righteous work; for them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good ones. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of repentance, faith, and good deeds leading to forgiveness and mercy from Allah. It highlights the transformative power of sincere repentance, belief in Allah, and righteous actions, as they are able to erase one's past wrongdoings and replace them with good deeds. It serves as a reminder that Allah is constantly forgiving and merciful towards those who sincerely seek His guidance and forgiveness.
orig: إلا من تاب وآمن وعمل عملا صالحا فأولئك يبدل الله سيئاتهم حسنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: And whoever repents and does righteousness truly turns to Allah in repentance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of repentance and good deeds in the eyes of Allah. It emphasizes that when a person sincerely repents for their sins and follows it up with righteous actions, they are indeed turning back to Allah in repentance. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and forgiveness for those who seek it sincerely and strive to improve themselves through good deeds.
orig: ومن تاب وعمل صالحا فإنه يتوب إلى الله متابا

translation: And those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and integrity in one's speech and actions. It encourages believers to avoid participating in spreading falsehood or engaging in idle gossip. Instead, they are advised to maintain their dignity and integrity by refraining from such behavior.
orig: والذين لا يشهدون الزور وإذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما

translation: And those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being attentive and receptive when reminded of the signs and verses of Allah. Believers should not turn a deaf ear or a blind eye to these reminders but rather strive to understand and reflect upon them with an open heart and mind.
orig: والذين إذا ذكروا بآيات ربهم لم يخروا عليها صما وعميانا

translation: And those who say, 'Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the supplication of believers to seek righteous spouses and offspring who bring comfort and joy to their lives. It also emphasizes the aspiration to become role models for the righteous, serving as leaders and guides for those who fear God and strive to be pious.
orig: والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من أزواجنا وذرياتنا قرة أعين واجعلنا للمتقين إماما

translation: They will be awarded the Chamber for their patience, and they will be greeted therein with a greeting of peace and security.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the reward that the believers will receive in the Hereafter for their patience and perseverance in facing the trials of life. They will be granted entry into a special abode where they will be greeted with peace and security, symbolizing the ultimate peace and tranquility that awaits them in Paradise.
orig: أولئك يجزون الغرفة بما صبروا ويلقون فيها تحية وسلاما

translation: Eternally they will abide therein. It is a good settlement and residence.
interpretation: This verse describes Paradise as a place where the inhabitants will dwell forever. It emphasizes that Paradise is a beautiful and ideal place to reside, highlighting the permanence and tranquility of the abode promised to the believers as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: خالدين فيها حسنت مستقرا ومقاما

translation: Say, "My Lord cares not for you were it not for your invocation, but you have denied, so it will be inevitable."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prayer and supplication to Allah. It conveys that Allah's response to human needs and concerns is contingent upon their prayers and invocation. The verse warns those who deny the importance of prayer that they will face the consequences of their denial, highlighting the significance of seeking guidance and help from Allah through sincere supplication.
orig: قل ما يعبأ بكم ربي لولا دعاؤكم فقد كذبتم فسوف يكون لزاما

translation: طسم
interpretation: This is a group of disjointed Arabic letters that appear at the beginning of certain chapters in the Qur'an. The exact meaning or significance of these letters is known only to Allah. These letters serve as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and the inability of human beings to produce something similar.
orig: طسم

translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an as a clear and evident Book, full of signs and guidance for those who reflect and ponder upon its verses. It emphasizes the clarity and guidance contained within the Qur'an, inviting believers to deeply contemplate its teachings.
orig: تلك آيات الكتاب المبين

translation: Perhaps you would kill yourself with grief that they are not believers.
interpretation: This verse reflects the Prophet Muhammad's (peace be upon him) deep concern for the guidance and faith of his people. It shows his emotional struggle and his desire for all people to embrace and believe in the message of Islam. It also emphasizes the importance of faith and the Prophet's sincere care for the well-being and guidance of his community.
orig: لعلك باخع نفسك ألا يكونوا مؤمنين

translation: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign, so their necks would remain humbled to it.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that if God desired, He could send down a clear sign from the sky to prove His existence and power, causing people to submit themselves to Him in humility and awe. It highlights the power and authority of God to manifest His signs as He wills, and the importance of recognizing and submitting to His ultimate authority.
orig: إن نشأ ننزل عليهم من السماء آية فظلت أعناقهم لها خاضعين

translation: And no mention of the Most Merciful comes to them as a new revelation, but they turn away from it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unfortunate reality that some people, despite hearing reminders and teachings about Allah's mercy and guidance, choose to disregard and ignore them. It serves as a warning against rejecting or turning away from the messages of mercy and guidance that come from Allah.
orig: وما يأتيهم من ذكر من الرحمن محدث إلا كانوا عنه معرضين

translation: So they denied him, and they will be brought the news of what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of rejecting the message of the Prophet. Those who mock and deny the truth will eventually face the consequences of their disbelief. Ultimately, they will be confronted with the reality that they used to mock, and their mockery will be turned against them as a reminder of their wrongdoings.
orig: فقد كذبوا فسيأتيهم أنباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Have they not seen how much We have caused to grow in the land of every noble pair?
interpretation: This verse highlights the abundance and diversity of plants and vegetation on Earth as a sign of Allah's power and creativity. It serves as a reminder for humans to reflect on the natural world around them and recognize the beauty and blessings that Allah has provided.
orig: أولم يروا إلى الأرض كم أنبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم

translation: Verily, in that there is a sign; yet most of them are not believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that despite the clear signs and evidence provided by Allah, most people still choose not to believe. It highlights the importance of faith and belief in recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah around us.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes two key attributes of Allah - His Might and His Mercy. It is a reminder that Allah possesses ultimate power and strength, yet He is also infinitely compassionate and merciful towards His creation. This combination of qualities assures believers that Allah has the ability to grant help and victory, while also showing kindness and forgiveness to His servants.
orig: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], 'Go to the wrongdoing people -
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when God called upon the Prophet Moses to go to the tyrannical and oppressive people of Pharaoh, urging him to deliver God's message of truth and justice to them despite their wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder of the responsibility of believers to confront injustice and spread righteousness, even in the face of adversity.
orig: وإذ نادى ربك موسى أن ائت القوم الظالمين

translation: The people of Pharaoh have they no fear?
interpretation: This verse questions the lack of fear and accountability in the people of Pharaoh despite their arrogance and oppression. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of defying God's commandments and the importance of having piety and fear of God in one's heart.
orig: قوم فرعون ألا يتقون

translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me."
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Musa (Moses) expresses his fear to Allah that the people may reject or disbelieve him. It shows the human aspect of the prophets, seeking reassurance and guidance from Allah even when facing difficulties or challenges in conveying His message.
orig: قال رب إني أخاف أن يكذبون

translation: And my chest tightens, and my tongue does not express well; so send for Aaron.
interpretation: This verse expresses the feeling of inadequacy and difficulty in speech that the Prophet Moses felt when faced with a daunting task. It teaches us that even the most esteemed individuals can face moments of insecurity and struggle with communication. Seeking help and support from others, like Moses turning to his brother Aaron for assistance, is a valuable lesson in overcoming challenges by collaborating and relying on the strengths of those around us.
orig: ويضيق صدري ولا ينطلق لساني فأرسل إلى هارون

translation: And they have upon us a sin, so we fear that they will kill us.
interpretation: This verse reflects the words of Prophet Moses as he expressed fear that the Pharaoh and his people would kill him and his followers due to the sins they had committed. It shows the human emotion of fear and vulnerability in the face of oppression and injustice.
orig: ولهم علي ذنب فأخاف أن يقتلون

translation: He said, 'No! So you both go with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine presence and support for the messengers of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is always aware of their situation and is attentive to their needs. This assurance serves as a reminder that believers are never alone in their struggles and endeavors, as Allah is ever watchful and close to those who strive in His cause.
orig: قال كلا فاذهبا بآياتنا إنا معكم مستمعون

translation: So go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are messengers from the Lord of the worlds,'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the concept of prophethood and the duty of messengers to deliver the message of God to the people, including even the most powerful and arrogant individuals like Pharaoh. It emphasizes the importance of conveying the truth and guidance to all people, regardless of their status or worldly power.
orig: فأتيا فرعون فقولا إنا رسول رب العالمين

translation: to send with us the Children of Israel
interpretation: This verse refers to a request made to send the Children of Israel along with a group. It may signify the importance of having the Children of Israel accompany the group for protection, guidance, or another specific purpose.
orig: أن أرسل معنا بني إسرائيل

translation: Did We not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed among us for years of your life?
interpretation: This verse reflects a rhetorical question posed to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) about his upbringing and his long stay among his people to remind him of Allah's continuous care and protection. It emphasizes the role of upbringing and the years spent in a community as part of the divine plan and a foundation for prophethood.
orig: قال ألم نربك فينا وليدا ولبثت فينا من عمرك سنين

translation: And you did the deed that you did, and you are among the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of one's actions and behaviors. It serves as a reminder that individuals will be held accountable for their deeds, and those who engage in disbelief or denial will face the consequences of their choices.
orig: وفعلت فعلتك التي فعلت وأنت من الكافرين

translation: He said, 'I did it when I was of those who are astray.'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker confesses to a mistake or wrongdoing that they committed in the past while they were lost or misguided. The verse reflects the humility and repentance of the individual for their past actions, acknowledging their previous state of being lost and showing sincerity in seeking forgiveness and redemption.
orig: قال فعلتها إذا وأنا من الضالين

translation: So I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord gave me wisdom and appointed me as [one of] the messengers.
interpretation: This verse is referring to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and how he fled from his people in fear. However, Allah granted him wisdom and chose him as one of the messengers to deliver His message to the people. It shows that even in moments of fear and hesitation, Allah guides and empowers His chosen messengers to fulfill their missions.
orig: ففررت منكم لما خفتكم فوهب لي ربي حكما وجعلني من المرسلين

translation: And that is a favor bestowed upon you that you are worshiping the Children of Israel.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of recognizing the blessing Allah has granted by guiding the Children of Israel to follow the right path of worship. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the guidance that has been bestowed upon you by Allah.
orig: وتلك نعمة تمنها علي أن عبدت بني إسرائيل

translation: Pharaoh said, 'And what is the Lord of the worlds?'
interpretation: This verse highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and disbelief in God despite witnessing the signs and miracles presented to him by Prophet Musa (Moses). It serves as a reminder of the consequences of pride and rejection of the truth, as well as the blind ignorance of those who refuse to recognize the existence and sovereignty of the Creator of all worlds.
orig: قال فرعون وما رب العالمين

translation: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you have certainty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah as the Creator of the heavens and the earth and everything in between. It challenges the believers to have certainty in their faith and in the existence of Allah, encouraging them to strengthen their belief and trust in Him.
orig: قال رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إن كنتم موقنين

translation: He said to those around him, 'Will you not listen?'
interpretation: This verse conveys a message of admonition and a call to heed the words being spoken. It serves as a reminder to the audience to pay attention, reflect, and take heed of the message being delivered, emphasizing the importance of listening attentively to the teachings and guidance being imparted.
orig: قال لمن حوله ألا تستمعون

translation: Your Lord is the Lord of your forefathers of old.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuity of the relationship between individuals and their Lord through generations. It reminds believers that their Lord is the same as the Lord of their forefathers, highlighting the unity and consistency of the divine message throughout history. It encourages a sense of connection and responsibility towards the legacy of faith passed down by ancestors.
orig: قال ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: He said, 'Indeed, your messenger who has been sent to you is a madman.'
interpretation: This verse shows the response of the disbelievers who accused the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of being mad. It illustrates the challenges and opposition the Prophet faced in delivering the message of Islam, highlighting the resilience and steadfastness required in the face of adversity.
orig: قال إن رسولكم الذي أرسل إليكم لمجنون

translation: The Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity but He, so take Him as Disposer of your affairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the oneness of Allah as the Lord of all directions and the importance of trusting Him to manage our affairs. It emphasizes the concept of Tawakkul, or reliance on Allah, and reminds believers to place their trust in Him completely.
orig: قال رب المشرق والمغرب وما بينهما إن كنتم تعقلون

translation: He said, 'If you take a deity other than me, I will surely place you among the imprisoned.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of monotheism in Islam and the severe consequences of associating partners with Allah. It serves as a warning against polytheism and emphasizes the belief in the oneness of God. The verse also underscores the importance of staying true to one's faith and not deviating from the path of monotheism.
orig: قال لئن اتخذت إلها غيري لأجعلنك من المسجونين

translation: He said, "Even if I brought you something clear?"
interpretation: This verse shows a confident statement made by a messenger in response to those who doubted his message or asked for a clear sign. It reflects the idea that the truth of the message itself should be evident and compelling, without always requiring miraculous signs for validation.
orig: قال أولو جئتك بشيء مبين

translation: He said, 'Then bring it if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse reflects a challenge presented by Prophet Musa (Moses) as a response to the magicians who claimed to have magical abilities. It signifies that truth will always prevail and that those who make claims must provide evidence to support their assertions.
orig: قال فأت به إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: So he threw his staff and thereupon it was a clear serpent.
interpretation: This verse describes Prophet Moses performing a miracle by turning his staff into a clear serpent. It serves as a demonstration of the power and authority of God, emphasizing that He can manifest His signs through His chosen messengers.
orig: فألقى عصاه فإذا هي ثعبان مبين

translation: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miracle performed by Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) when his hand turned white as a sign from Allah. It signifies the power and miracles that Allah bestowed upon His Prophets to establish their truthfulness and strengthen the faith of the believers.
orig: ونزع يده فإذا هي بيضاء للناظرين

translation: He said to the chiefs around him, 'This is indeed a learned magician.'
interpretation: This verse depicts a moment where the chiefs of the disbelievers, upon witnessing a miracle or sign from Allah, resort to dismissing it as mere magic in an attempt to undermine the Prophet's message. It highlights the tendency of some people to deny the truth by attributing it to superficial or deceptive means, despite witnessing clear signs of divine power and wisdom.
orig: قال للملإ حوله إن هذا لساحر عليم

translation: He wants to drive you out from your land with his magic. What do you advise?
interpretation: This verse discusses the situation where Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) was faced with the challenge of Pharaoh using magic to try and drive Moses and his followers from their land. It reflects the theme of remaining steadfast in the face of trials and trusting in Allah's plan, seeking counsel, and ultimately relying on faith and patience to overcome hardships.
orig: يريد أن يخرجكم من أرضكم بسحره فماذا تأمرون

translation: They said, 'Postpone him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the conversation among the people regarding Prophet Moses and his brother Aaron. The people suggested that they should delay or expel them from the city and send gatherers to collect information about them. It demonstrates the resistance and opposition faced by the prophets in spreading the message of God among people.
orig: قالوا أرجه وأخاه وابعث في المدائن حاشرين

translation: They present to you every skillful magician.
interpretation: This verse reveals the attempts of disbelievers to challenge the truth by using deceptive means, such as magic and sorcery. However, despite their efforts, the truth and light of faith will always prevail over falsehood and deceit.
orig: يأتوك بكل سحار عليم

translation: So the magicians were assembled for a specific time on a known day.
interpretation: This verse describes the gathering of the magicians as they were summoned to face Moses. It highlights the organized and predetermined nature of the confrontation, emphasizing that the magicians were gathered at an appointed time and on a known day. This verse reinforces the concept of divine planning and control over events, even in situations where people may rely on their own skills or powers.
orig: فجمع السحرة لميقات يوم معلوم

translation: And it will be said to the people, 'Are you gathered?'
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, a question will be posed to humanity, asking whether they are prepared for their gathering to face their deeds and be held accountable for their actions in front of Allah.
orig: وقيل للناس هل أنتم مجتمعون

translation: Perhaps we can follow the magicians if they are the predominant ones.
interpretation: This verse comes from Surah Ash-Shu'ara (Chapter 26), it emphasizes the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject the truth despite witnessing miracles. The verse refers to the magicians in the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) who initially challenged him but later embraced faith after witnessing the miracles of Allah. The message is to reflect on the consequences of blindly following those who are arrogant and deceptive, instead of seeking the truth and submitting to the guidance of Allah.
orig: لعلنا نتبع السحرة إن كانوا هم الغالبين

translation: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, 'Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?'
interpretation: This verse depicts the moment when the magicians confronted Pharaoh with their belief and asked for a reward if they emerge victorious. It shows their courage and trust in Allah despite the consequences they might face.
orig: فلما جاء السحرة قالوا لفرعون أئن لنا لأجرا إن كنا نحن الغالبين

translation: He said, 'Yes, and indeed, you will [then be] of those near [to me].'
interpretation: This verse refers to a conversation where a person affirms that those who fulfill certain criteria will be among those nearest to Allah. The interpretation here is that the verse highlights the concept of closeness and proximity to Allah, indicating that certain actions or qualities can bring individuals closer to Him spiritually and emotionally.
orig: قال نعم وإنكم إذا لمن المقربين

translation: Moses said to them, 'Throw whatever you will throw.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the unwavering faith and confidence of Prophet Moses in the face of adversity. Despite the challenges presented to him by the disbelievers, he remains steadfast in his trust in Allah's power and control over all things. It serves as a reminder that true believers should face trials with courage, knowing that their faith will guide them through any hardships.
orig: قال لهم موسى ألقوا ما أنتم ملقون

translation: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, 'By Pharaoh's might, indeed we are the predominant.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Moses (Musa) confronting Pharaoh's magicians. Pharaoh's sorcerers initially challenged Prophet Moses to a magical duel. However, when Prophet Moses' staff miraculously transformed into a serpent and devoured their illusions, they recognized the truth and submitted to God's power. This verse illustrates the arrogance and false pride of Pharaoh and his followers, and the eventual defeat of those who reject the truth and choose to oppose the divine.
orig: فألقوا حبالهم وعصيهم وقالوا بعزة فرعون إنا لنحن الغالبون

translation: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was swallowing up what they falsified.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous event where Prophet Moses threw his staff, and it transformed into a serpent and devoured the false magic of the sorcerers of Pharaoh. It illustrates the power and superiority of God's miracles over the deceptive tricks of humans, highlighting the ultimate authority and supremacy of God.
orig: فألقى موسى عصاه فإذا هي تلقف ما يأفكون

translation: So the magicians fell down prostrating.
interpretation: This verse describes the moment when the magicians who were challenged by Prophet Musa (Moses) with his miracles chose to believe in the truth they witnessed and submitted themselves to Allah, acknowledging His power and greatness. Their act of prostrating symbolizes their surrender and acceptance of the oneness of God, despite their profession in magic. It serves as a reminder that even those deeply immersed in misconceptions can recognize the truth and embrace it when it is presented in its clarity and undeniable form.
orig: فألقي السحرة ساجدين

translation: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the statement of those who believe in the existence and lordship of the Creator of the universe. It highlights the fundamental aspect of faith in acknowledging and accepting the supreme authority of Allah over all of creation, emphasizing the concept of monotheism and submission to the one true God.
orig: قالوا آمنا برب العالمين

translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of acknowledging and recognizing the Lordship and authority of Allah over all His creations. It specifically mentions the names of two prominent prophets, Moses and Aaron, to emphasize that even great figures in history are ultimately under the sovereignty and power of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the significance of humility and submission before the ultimate authority of God.
orig: رب موسى وهارون

translation: He (Pharaoh) said, 'You believed in him before I gave you permission. He must be your chief, the one who taught you magic. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. Then you will surely know which of us can inflict a more severe and lasting punishment.'
interpretation: This verse depicts Pharaoh's threat to those who had believed in Prophet Moses before obtaining his permission. Pharaoh accuses Moses of teaching magic, but in his arrogance and tyranny, Pharaoh pronounces a severe punishment for those who believed. It shows the cruelty and oppression of Pharaoh towards those who opposed his rule and tyranny. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance, tyranny, and persecution, and as a reminder of the consequences faced by those who choose to oppress others.
orig: قال آمنتم له قبل أن آذن لكم إنه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلسوف تعلمون لأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ولأصلبنكم أجمعين

translation: They said, 'There is no harm; indeed, we are to our Lord returning.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the unwavering belief of the believers in the ultimate return to God. Despite facing difficulties or challenges, they remain steadfast in their faith and trust that they will ultimately return to their Lord, seeking comfort in the knowledge that their ultimate destination is with God.
orig: قالوا لا ضير إنا إلى ربنا منقلبون

translation: Indeed, we hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers.
interpretation: This verse reflects the sincere hope and aspiration of the believers for Allah's forgiveness of their sins. It highlights the acknowledgment of one's sins and the desire for repentance, emphasizing the importance of seeking forgiveness as an essential manifestation of faith.
orig: إنا نطمع أن يغفر لنا ربنا خطايانا أن كنا أول المؤمنين

translation: And We inspired Moses, 'Travel by night with My servants, indeed you shall be pursued.'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Allah instructed Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) to lead the Children of Israel in their exodus from Egypt, emphasizing the importance of traveling by night to avoid being caught by Pharaoh's army. The verse showcases the divine guidance and protection provided to Prophet Moses and his followers in their time of need.
orig: وأوحينا إلى موسى أن أسر بعبادي إنكم متبعون

translation: So Pharaoh sent in the cities gatherers
interpretation: This verse describes how Pharaoh sent out gatherers to various cities. The interpretation could be the misuse of power and authority by Pharaoh to monitor and control the people living in these cities out of fear or a desire for control.
orig: فأرسل فرعون في المدائن حاشرين

translation: Verily, these are a small band,
interpretation: This verse describes a small group of people, emphasizing their insignificance or lack of power. It may also imply that the group is weak or not influential.
orig: إن هؤلاء لشرذمة قليلون

translation: And indeed, they are toward Us, displeased.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that some people are resentful or displeased with Allah, despite His endless blessings and mercy upon them. It serves as a reminder for believers to reflect on their attitude towards their Creator and to strive to maintain gratitude and contentment in all circumstances.
orig: وإنهم لنا لغائظون

translation: And indeed, we are all guarding.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every single person is being watched over and protected. It serves as a reminder that Allah is aware of all our actions and is constantly safeguarding us, highlighting His boundless mercy and care for His creation.
orig: وإنا لجميع حاذرون

translation: So We removed them from gardens and springs,
interpretation: This verse refers to a historical event where a group of people were expelled from a place of abundance and blessings due to their disobedience and disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the consequence of ingratitude and rebellion against God's guidance.
orig: فأخرجناهم من جنات وعيون

translation: And treasures, and a generous position.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the valuable and honorable position that awaits the righteous believers in the hereafter. It signifies the rewards and blessings that God has prepared for those who obey His commands and strive to live a pious life. The 'treasures' mentioned can be interpreted as the abundant rewards in paradise, while the 'generous position' refers to the high status and honor granted by God to the believers as a result of their faith and good deeds.
orig: وكنوز ومقام كريم

translation: Thus We gave it as inheritance to the Children of Israel.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah granted the land mentioned in the context as an inheritance to the Children of Israel. It highlights the concept of divine providence and the fulfillment of promises made by Allah to His chosen people.
orig: كذلك وأورثناها بني إسرائيل

translation: So follow them devotedly.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance and examples set by the prophets who came before, and to do so diligently and earnestly. It encourages believers to learn from the teachings and way of life of the prophets in order to attain closeness to God and lead a righteous life.
orig: فأتبعوهم مشرقين

translation: When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, 'Indeed, we are to be overtaken!'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting a moment of fear and uncertainty among the companions of Moses when they saw their enemies approaching. It serves as a reminder of how even the most faithful believers can sometimes doubt and fear, but also sets the stage for the miraculous events that follow, demonstrating that ultimately victory lies with Allah.
orig: فلما تراءى الجمعان قال أصحاب موسى إنا لمدركون

translation: He said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
interpretation: This verse highlights the unwavering trust and reliance on Allah shown by the believing soul facing challenges. It signifies the believer's firm belief that Allah, the Guide and Protector, will provide guidance and support in times of difficulty and uncertainty. It serves as a reminder to trust in Allah's plan and seek His guidance in all matters.
orig: قال كلا إن معي ربي سيهدين

translation: So We inspired Moses, 'Strike the sea with your staff.' And it split in two, each part like a towering cliff.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous event where Prophet Moses was instructed by Allah to strike the sea with his staff, causing it to split into two parts. This divine intervention showcases the power and authority of Allah and was a demonstration of His ability to make the impossible possible through His chosen messengers.
orig: فأوحينا إلى موسى أن اضرب بعصاك البحر فانفلق فكان كل فرق كالطود العظيم

translation: And close to Us there will also be the others.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the closeness of all beings to Allah. It conveys the idea that ultimately, all individuals will return to Allah and be accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder that despite the differences in status and rank in this world, all souls are equal in the sight of Allah, and will stand before Him for judgement.
orig: وأزلفنا ثم الآخرين

translation: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
interpretation: This verse refers to the protection and deliverance of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and his followers from the threats posed by Pharaoh and his army. It showcases the mercy and power of Allah in safeguarding His righteous servants from harm and granting them salvation.
orig: وأنجينا موسى ومن معه أجمعين

translation: Then We drowned the others.
interpretation: This verse refers to a time when Allah caused the drowning of disbelievers or wrongdoers as a form of punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the importance of following the teachings of Allah to avoid similar fate.
orig: ثم أغرقنا الآخرين

translation: Indeed, in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that despite the signs and evidence provided by Allah, most people still choose not to believe. It highlights the reality that belief is not merely a result of clear signs but is ultimately a matter of individual choice and disposition. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of having faith and belief in the face of disbelief and ignorance.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, your Lord is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual nature of Allah's attributes as the Almighty and the Merciful. It reminds us that Allah possesses all power and might, yet He is also full of mercy and compassion. This balance encourages believers to have faith in both His strength and His benevolence, seeking His help and guidance always.
orig: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Recite to them the news of Abraham
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to convey the story of the Prophet Abraham to others. It highlights the importance of learning from the lives of the prophets and drawing lessons from their experiences to strengthen faith and guide one's own actions.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ إبراهيم

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What do you worship?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the questioning of the beliefs and practices of society. It emphasizes the importance of critically examining the faith and traditions passed down by one's ancestors, and the need to seek a deeper understanding of the true essence of worship and spirituality.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما تعبدون

translation: They said, 'We worship idols and will continue to devote ourselves to them.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and ignorance of some people who continue to worship false idols despite being advised against it. It serves as a reminder of the dangers of blindly following traditions or practices that are not based on sound reasoning or divine guidance.
orig: قالوا نعبد أصناما فنظل لها عاكفين

translation: He said, "Do they hear you when you call?"
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the idols that people worship are able to hear their prayers. It emphasizes the futility of worshiping beings or objects that are incapable of listening or responding to prayers, highlighting the importance of directing worship towards the One true God who can truly hear and respond to His servants.
orig: قال هل يسمعونكم إذ تدعون

translation: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm you?
interpretation: This verse questions the believers about the true nature of the idols they worship besides Allah. It challenges them to reflect on whether these idols have any power to truly benefit or harm them. The verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping false gods who are powerless to impact human affairs, highlighting the importance of true faith in Allah as the only source of benefit and protection.
orig: أو ينفعونكم أو يضرون

translation: They say, 'But we found our fathers doing so.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the objection of some individuals who defend their wrong actions by mentioning that their forefathers used to do the same. The message here is to emphasize personal accountability regardless of tradition or familial practices, and to remind people to follow what is right and just, rather than blindly imitating the actions of their ancestors.
orig: قالوا بل وجدنا آباءنا كذلك يفعلون

translation: He will say, "Have you considered what you used to worship?
interpretation: In this verse, Allah is drawing attention to the false gods and objects of worship that people used to devote themselves to in the worldly life. It serves as a reminder for Muslims to reflect on the futility of worshipping anything or anyone other than Allah, who is the only true deity worthy of worship.
orig: قال أفرأيتم ما كنتم تعبدون

translation: You and your ancient forefathers.
interpretation: This verse reminds us to reflect on the history and legacy of our ancestors. It emphasizes the connection between us and our forefathers, highlighting the importance of understanding and appreciating our roots and the path that has led us to where we are today.
orig: أنتم وآباؤكم الأقدمون

translation: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad's (peace be upon him) deep conviction and trust in God. It emphasizes that all opponents of the Prophet are indeed his enemies, except for the ultimate authority and protector, the Lord of all creation. It serves as a reminder of the unwavering faith and reliance on the mercy and support of God even in the face of opposition.
orig: فإنهم عدو لي إلا رب العالمين

translation: He who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the belief in Allah as the creator and guide of all human beings. It highlights the concept of divine guidance and the realization that it is Allah who has created us and leads us through life, providing us with the guidance we seek.
orig: الذي خلقني فهو يهدين

translation: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the believer's acknowledgment that all sustenance, including food and drink, comes from Allah. It encourages gratitude for the provisions provided by Allah and serves as a reminder of His continuous care and mercy towards His creation.
orig: والذي هو يطعمني ويسقين

translation: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the healing power of Allah. It serves as a reminder that even in times of illness and hardship, one should turn to Allah for healing and strength, acknowledging that He is the ultimate source of cure and well-being.
orig: وإذا مرضت فهو يشفين

translation: Who will cause me to die and then bring me to life.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and control of Allah over life and death. It serves as a reminder of the resurrection after death and the belief in the Hereafter. It conveys the idea that Allah is the ultimate authority over life and death, and that He has the power to bring the dead back to life on the Day of Judgment.
orig: والذي يميتني ثم يحيين

translation: And He, whose forgiveness I seek, may forgive my sins on the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: This verse expresses humility and hope in seeking forgiveness from Allah for one's sins on the Day of Judgment. It reflects the believer's acknowledgement of their mistakes and their reliance on the mercy and forgiveness of Allah.
orig: والذي أطمع أن يغفر لي خطيئتي يوم الدين

translation: My Lord, grant me wisdom and join me with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for wisdom and to be among the righteous. It reflects the believer's desire to seek guidance, knowledge, and companionship with those who are on the right path. It emphasizes the importance of seeking wisdom and being in the company of good and virtuous people.
orig: رب هب لي حكما وألحقني بالصالحين

translation: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for a lasting legacy of truthfulness and integrity that will be remembered and respected by future generations. It highlights the importance of maintaining a good reputation and leaving behind a positive impact that outlives an individual's lifetime.
orig: واجعل لي لسان صدق في الآخرين

translation: And make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.
interpretation: The speaker is asking Allah to include them among the inheritors of Paradise, a place of eternal happiness and contentment. This verse reflects the longing for a reward in the afterlife and the aspiration for a place among the blessed inhabitants of Paradise.
orig: واجعلني من ورثة جنة النعيم

translation: And forgive my father. Indeed, he was of those who gone astray.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication made by Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) to seek forgiveness for his father who was not on the right guidance. It shows the compassion and mercy Ibrahim had for his father despite his father's disbelief and deviation from the right path. It teaches us the importance of not giving up on our loved ones and always praying for their guidance and forgiveness.
orig: واغفر لأبي إنه كان من الضالين

translation: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him not to subject the speaker to disgrace or humiliation on the Day of Judgement when all people will be resurrected and brought before Allah for judgment. It emphasizes the importance of seeking protection from shame and humiliation in the Hereafter.
orig: ولا تخزني يوم يبعثون

translation: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when neither wealth nor offspring will provide any benefit to anyone. On that day, only one's faith and good deeds will hold value, stressing the temporary nature of worldly possessions and the ultimate importance of one's spiritual state.
orig: يوم لا ينفع مال ولا بنون

translation: Except those who come to Allah with a sound heart.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity and purity of heart in one's relationship with Allah. It signifies that those who approach Allah with a genuine and pure heart, free from any form of impurity or dishonesty, will find acceptance and closeness to Him. It highlights the significance of inner purity and sincerity as key elements in worship and devotion to Allah.
orig: إلا من أتى الله بقلب سليم

translation: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an indicates that Paradise, the ultimate reward and abode of peace and bliss, will be brought close to those who are righteous and God-conscious. It signifies the proximity and nearness of Paradise to the pious believers, emphasizing the special status and closeness to God that the righteous will enjoy in the Hereafter.
orig: وأزلفت الجنة للمتقين

translation: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who deviate from the path of righteousness and choose to indulge in sin and wrongdoing. It conveys the idea that Hellfire awaits those individuals who persist in their deviation and refuse to seek repentance and guidance. The mention of Hellfire serves as a reminder of the consequences of straying from the right path and highlights the importance of staying on the straight and righteous path as outlined in the Qur'an.
orig: وبرزت الجحيم للغاوين

translation: And it will be said, "Where is that which you used to worship
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, people will be questioned about the objects of worship they followed in their worldly life. This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping false gods or idols and highlights the necessity of true worship of Allah alone.
orig: وقيل لهم أين ما كنتم تعبدون

translation: Is it other than Allah that you seek help from to grant you victory, or save you?
interpretation: This verse questions the wisdom of seeking help or victory from any other entity besides Allah. It highlights the ultimate power and control that Allah has over all matters, emphasizing that seeking help or victory from anyone else is futile and meaningless. It reminds believers to place their trust, reliance, and prayers solely in Allah, the One who has the power to grant victory and salvation.
orig: من دون الله هل ينصرونكم أو ينتصرون

translation: So they will be thrown into it (the Fire), they and the deviators,
interpretation: This verse highlights the fate of those who have strayed from the true path and remained in ignorance. They will be cast into the Fire along with others who have gone astray, emphasizing the consequences of rejecting faith and living a life deviated from the teachings of Islam.
orig: فكبكبوا فيها هم والغاوون

translation: And the soldiers of Satan, all together.
interpretation: This verse refers to the followers and supporters of Satan who work collectively against the believers to lead them astray from the path of righteousness. It serves as a reminder of the ongoing battle between good and evil, and the need for believers to be aware of the temptations and obstacles that may come their way.
orig: وجنود إبليس أجمعون

translation: They will argue with one another therein.
interpretation: This verse refers to a scene in the afterlife, where the disbelievers will engage in disputes and arguments among themselves in Hell. It highlights the state of chaos and misery they will face due to their rejection of faith and disobedience to God.
orig: قالوا وهم فيها يختصمون

translation: By Allah, indeed we were clearly astray.
interpretation: This verse highlights a moment of realization and acknowledgment of one's past mistakes and misguidance. The speaker is admitting that they were clearly lost and misguided before acknowledging the truth. It emphasizes the importance of humility and self-awareness in seeking guidance and returning to the right path.
orig: تالله إن كنا لفي ضلال مبين

translation: When We have made you perfect and complete.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah who has created humans and has perfected them. It reminds us of the power and wisdom of Allah in creating and guiding humanity on the right path. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the blessings and capabilities given to us by our Creator.
orig: إذ نسويكم برب العالمين

translation: And none have led us astray except the criminals.
interpretation: This verse highlights the acknowledgment of the believers that they have not gone astray by following the path of faith and righteousness, and that it is only the wrongdoers and criminals who lead themselves astray from the straight path set by God. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of deviating from the teachings of Islam and the importance of staying on the right path.
orig: وما أضلنا إلا المجرمون

translation: So we have none to intercede for us,
interpretation: This verse reflects the helpless state of individuals on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that no one will be able to intercede on behalf of another except by the permission of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the absolute authority and justice of Allah, where everyone will be accountable for their own deeds without any intermediaries.
orig: فما لنا من شافعين

translation: And not a devoted friend.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, close friends will not benefit or protect each other. Each person will be solely responsible for their own deeds and will not have the support of even their closest friends.
orig: ولا صديق حميم

translation: If we had a turn [at worldly life] we would be among the believers.
interpretation: This verse is expressing a hypothetical situation where the speaker is implying that if they were to have another chance or opportunity, they would choose to be among the believers. It indicates the regret or longing for being counted among the believers and emphasizes the value and importance of faith.
orig: فلو أن لنا كرة فنكون من المؤمنين

translation: Indeed, in that are signs, yet most of them are not believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that there are clear signs of Allah's existence and power in the world around us, but many people choose not to believe despite these signs. It highlights the importance of reflecting on these signs and having faith in Allah.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, your Lord is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual nature of Allah as the Almighty and the Merciful. It serves as a reminder to believers of His power and strength, while also highlighting His compassion and mercy towards His creation. The combination of these attributes is a source of solace and hope for believers, knowing that no matter what challenges they face, Allah is both powerful enough to help them and merciful enough to forgive them.
orig: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: The people of Noah denied the messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection and denial of the messengers by the people of Noah. It showcases the recurring theme in the Qur'an of prophets facing disbelief and opposition from their people despite being sent with guidance and warnings from God.
orig: كذبت قوم نوح المرسلين

translation: When their brother Noah said to them, 'Will you not fear Allah?'
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Noah (peace be upon him) advising his people to fear Allah, to be righteous and to follow the guidance. It serves as a reminder for believers to always be conscious of Allah and to strive to live a pious life.
orig: إذ قال لهم أخوهم نوح ألا تتقون

translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad's declaration of being a trustworthy and reliable messenger of Allah to the people. It emphasizes the importance of trustworthiness in delivering the message of Islam and signifies the Prophet's integrity and honesty in conveying the divine message to humanity.
orig: إني لكم رسول أمين

translation: So fear Allah and obey me.
interpretation: This verse is a command for believers to be conscious of Allah's presence and to obey the teachings and guidance of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It emphasizes the importance of piety, obedience to Allah, and following the guidance of the Prophet as essential for a successful and righteous life.
orig: فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Prophets do not seek any worldly reward for spreading the message of God. Their only reward comes from Allah, the Lord of all creation. It serves as a reminder that sincerity and dedication to serving God should be the main motivation for spreading His message, rather than seeking material benefits or recognition from people.
orig: وما أسألكم عليه من أجر إن أجري إلا على رب العالمين

translation: So fear Allah and obey.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and obeying His commands. It serves as a reminder to believers to be conscious of Allah in their actions and to submit to His guidance. By fearing Allah, one can attain righteousness and avoid wrongdoing, leading to a life that is pleasing to Him.
orig: فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: They said, 'Shall we believe for you while the lowest [people] follow us?'
interpretation: This verse depicts a scenario where some arrogant individuals express disbelief in the message of the Prophet, questioning the authenticity and worth of those who follow him. It highlights the arrogance and superiority complex of certain individuals who belittle others based on social status or perceived worth.
orig: قالوا أنؤمن لك واتبعك الأرذلون

translation: He said, 'And I do not know what they used to do.'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker conveys his lack of knowledge about the actions of others. It emphasizes the limitation of human knowledge and the importance of acknowledging our own limitations in understanding the actions and intentions of others.
orig: قال وما علمي بما كانوا يعملون

translation: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you could perceive.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief that ultimate judgment and accountability for all actions lies solely with God. It reminds believers that even if they are not able to perceive or comprehend the justice of God's judgment in this world, they should trust in the wisdom and fairness of His decree. It serves as a call for patience, faith, and reliance on God's ultimate justice.
orig: إن حسابهم إلا على ربي لو تشعرون

translation: And I am not one to expel the believers.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that the Messenger (peace be upon him) would never forcibly remove or expel those who believe in Allah. It emphasizes the principle of tolerance, inclusivity, and acceptance of believers, regardless of their circumstances or flaws.
orig: وما أنا بطارد المؤمنين

translation: Indeed, I am only a clear warner.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Prophet Muhammad as a clear warner sent by Allah to guide people towards the right path. It highlights the Prophet's duty to convey a message of warning and guidance to humanity, reminding them of their responsibilities and the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder to people to heed the warnings and teachings of the Prophet and to follow the path of righteousness.
orig: إن أنا إلا نذير مبين

translation: They said, 'If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be among the stoned.'
interpretation: This verse portrays the rejection and threats that Prophet Noah faced from his people. They warned him that if he did not stop preaching his message, he would face the punishment of being stoned. It shows the challenges and resistance that prophets often encountered while conveying the message of God to their communities.
orig: قالوا لئن لم تنته يا نوح لتكونن من المرجومين

translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me."
interpretation: This verse reflects the Prophet Hud's plea to his Lord, acknowledging that his people have rejected his message. It serves as a reminder of the challenges prophets faced in conveying the message of God, even when met with denial and disbelief from those they were sent to guide.
orig: قال رب إن قومي كذبون

translation: So decree between me and them with truth, and save me and those with me of the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking God's judgment and intervention in resolving disputes and conflicts. It illustrates the belief in divine justice and the plea for protection and deliverance for the believers who are facing challenges and opposition. It emphasizes the trust in God's ability to bring about justice and provide salvation to the faithful followers.
orig: فافتح بيني وبينهم فتحا ونجني ومن معي من المؤمنين

translation: So We saved him and those with him in a laden ship.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Nuh (Noah) and how Allah saved him and those who believed in him by guiding them to build and board the Ark, which protected them from the great flood. It highlights the importance of having faith and obedience to Allah in times of trial and calamity.
orig: فأنجيناه ومن معه في الفلك المشحون

translation: Then We drowned the others.
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment inflicted by Allah upon a group of people who had rejected the guidance and continued their wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the importance of following the right path to avoid such a fate.
orig: ثم أغرقنا بعد الباقين

translation: Indeed, in that there is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
interpretation: This verse implies that despite the signs and proofs of the existence of God and the truth of His message, the majority of people choose not to believe. It highlights the importance of faith and belief in accepting these signs.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, your Lord is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual qualities of Allah as the Almighty and the Merciful. It reminds us that while Allah possesses ultimate power and authority, He also constantly bestows His mercy and compassion upon His creation. This serves as a reminder of the balance between Allah's attributes of justice and forgiveness, power and compassion.
orig: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: The people of 'Aad denied the messengers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the tribe of 'Aad, who rejected and disbelieved in the messengers sent by Allah to guide them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying and opposing the truth brought by the messengers, which led to the destruction of 'Aad as a punishment for their disbelief.
orig: كذبت عاد المرسلين

translation: When their brother Hud said to them: Will you not fear Allah?
interpretation: This verse highlights the message of Prophet Hud (peace be upon him) to his people, calling upon them to be mindful of their duty to Allah and to fear Him. It emphasizes the importance of piety and consciousness of God in one's actions and behavior.
orig: إذ قال لهم أخوهم هود ألا تتقون

translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
interpretation: This verse expresses Prophet Muhammad's declaration to the people that he is a trustworthy messenger of God. It emphasizes his integrity, honesty, and reliability in delivering the message of Islam to the people. This declaration serves as a reminder to trust and believe in the message he is delivering, as it comes from God and is meant for the guidance and benefit of humanity.
orig: إني لكم رسول أمين

translation: So fear Allah and obey [Him].
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to have fear of Allah and to obey His commandments. It emphasizes the importance of being conscious of God in all aspects of life and following His guidance obediently.
orig: فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pure intentions of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in conveying the message of Islam to the people. It emphasizes that his mission is solely for the sake of Allah and the guidance of humanity, without seeking any personal gain or reward from the people. It serves as a reminder for believers to perform their duties sincerely and seek the pleasure and reward only from Allah, the Lord of all worlds.
orig: وما أسألكم عليه من أجر إن أجري إلا على رب العالمين

translation: Do you build on every height a sign, playing?
interpretation: This verse challenges the people who construct lofty and extravagant structures as mere displays of wealth and power, without any sincere purpose or devotion to God. It criticizes the frivolous and arrogant attitude of those who engage in such construction projects without reflecting on the moral and spiritual implications of their actions.
orig: أتبنون بكل ريع آية تعبثون

translation: And you take [for worship] Sawaan (gods) to [hopefully] remain eternal.
interpretation: This verse highlights the misguided practice of some people who worship false gods in the hopes of attaining eternal life or immortality. It warns against the futility of placing one's faith in powerless idols and emphasizes the importance of worshiping the One true God, who alone holds the power of eternity.
orig: وتتخذون مصانع لعلكم تخلدون

translation: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of restraint and justice in times of confrontation or conflict. It warns against using excessive force or aggression when dealing with others, reminding believers to always uphold fairness and righteousness, even in moments of power or dominance.
orig: وإذا بطشتم بطشتم جبارين

translation: So fear Allah and obey [Him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and being mindful of His presence at all times. It reminds believers to have piety, fear Allah's judgment, and follow His commands as a way of seeking His pleasure and guidance in life.
orig: فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: And fear the One who has provided you with what you know.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to be mindful and fearful of Allah, the Provider of knowledge and blessings. It emphasizes gratitude and awareness of the Source of all knowledge and gifts, urging believers to use their knowledge in a way that pleases Allah.
orig: واتقوا الذي أمدكم بما تعلمون

translation: I will provide for you with wealth and children.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to provide sustenance in the form of wealth and offspring to His believers. It signifies the generosity and blessings of Allah towards His creation, ensuring that they are provided for and their needs are met.
orig: أمدكم بأنعام وبنين

translation: And gardens and springs.
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings and rewards that await the believers in paradise, highlighting the beauty, tranquility, and abundance of the gardens and springs that will be granted to them by Allah as a form of eternal bliss and happiness.
orig: وجنات وعيون

translation: I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
interpretation: This verse expresses the concern and fear of the speaker for the people, warning them about the imminent punishment that awaits on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the severity and magnitude of the punishment that will befall the wrongdoers on that Day.
orig: إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: They say, "[It is] all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors."
interpretation: This verse captures a scene where disbelievers arrogantly dismiss the advice and warnings from the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as inconsequential to them. They show indifference to the message being conveyed to them, highlighting their obstinacy and lack of interest in guidance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being receptive to advice and the consequences of rejecting it.
orig: قالوا سواء علينا أوعظت أم لم تكن من الواعظين

translation: Indeed, this is only the creation of the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that the creation of mankind and the world is not something new or unique, but rather a continuation of a pattern that has been observed in the creation of previous generations. It serves as a reminder of the cyclical nature of creation and existence, emphasizing the consistency and order in Allah's design throughout history.
orig: إن هذا إلا خلق الأولين

translation: And we are not ones to be punished.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that they will not be punished unjustly by Allah. It signifies Allah's mercy and fairness in dealing with His servants, emphasizing that He will not punish them without cause or beyond what they deserve.
orig: وما نحن بمعذبين

translation: So they denied him, and We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of the disbelievers denying the prophet and the message he brought. It serves as a reminder that those who reject the truth and persist in disbelief are subject to destruction, despite the signs that are presented to them. It emphasizes the importance of belief in recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah.
orig: فكذبوه فأهلكناهم إن في ذلك لآية وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, your Lord is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the dual qualities of Allah as the Exalted in Might, showing His power and authority, and at the same time as the Merciful, showcasing His compassion and kindness towards His creation. It serves as a reminder of the balance between Allah's might and mercy in His dealings with humanity.
orig: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Thamud denied the messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and disbelief of the people of Thamud towards the messengers who were sent to guide them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the message of God and the messengers He sends with guidance and warnings.
orig: كذبت ثمود المرسلين

translation: When their brother Salih said to them, 'Will you not fear Allah?'
interpretation: Salih, a messenger sent by Allah, urged his people to fear Allah and follow His commandments. This verse emphasizes the importance of having taqwa (God-consciousness) and reverence for Allah in all aspects of life.
orig: إذ قال لهم أخوهم صالح ألا تتقون

translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
