orig: وإن تكذبوا فقد كذب أمم من قبلكم وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: Do they not see how Allah initiates the creation, then reproduces it? That is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the power and ability of Allah to create and recreate everything in the universe. It emphasizes the concept of resurrection and the afterlife, highlighting that for Allah, the process of creation and recreation is effortless and simple. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when all creation will be resurrected and held accountable for their deeds.
orig: أولم يروا كيف يبدئ الله الخلق ثم يعيده إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: Say, 'Travel through the land and observe how He began creation. Then Allah will produce the final creation. Indeed Allah, over all things, is competent.'
interpretation: This verse encourages reflection and contemplation on the signs of creation in the world around us. By observing the universe and reflecting on the beginning of creation, one can gain a deeper understanding of Allah's power and ability to bring about the final creation in the Hereafter. It emphasizes Allah's omnipotence and control over all things, reminding believers of His capability to bring about the end of this world and the beginning of the next.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف بدأ الخلق ثم الله ينشئ النشأة الآخرة إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute authority of God over his creation. It highlights that God has the power to punish or show mercy to whomever He chooses. It serves as a reminder of the final return to God, where all individuals will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: يعذب من يشاء ويرحم من يشاء وإليه تقلبون

translation: And you are not [powerful] in the land or in the heaven. And besides Allah you have neither any protector nor any helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and authority of Allah over all creation. It highlights that no one can defy or challenge Allah's will, and that without Him, no one has the ability to protect or assist anyone. It serves as a reminder for humankind of their humble position in relation to the divine power of Allah.
orig: وما أنتم بمعجزين في الأرض ولا في السماء وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject the signs of Allah and deny the concept of meeting Him in the Hereafter will be deprived of Allah's mercy and will face a severe punishment. It warns against disbelief and calls for faith in Allah's signs and the ultimate meeting with Him.
orig: والذين كفروا بآيات الله ولقائه أولئك يئسوا من رحمتي وأولئك لهم عذاب أليم

translation: So the answer of his people was only that they said, 'Kill him or burn him,' but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) when his people threatened to kill him by burning. Despite the threat, Allah protected and saved him from the fire as a sign for those who believe in Him, emphasizing the concept of divine protection and miracles for the believers.
orig: فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا اقتلوه أو حرقوه فأنجاه الله من النار إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And they have said, 'You have only taken [for yourselves] idols besides Allah as a bond of love among you in worldly life.' But then on the Day of Resurrection, they will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers.'
interpretation: This verse warns about the consequences of idolatry and false bonds based on idol worship. In the worldly life, people may form relationships and alliances based on false deities, but on the Day of Resurrection, all such ties will be severed. Each person will deny and curse the other, and their ultimate abode will be the Fire, with no supporters or helpers. It emphasizes the futility of putting faith in idols and warns about the severe consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: وقال إنما اتخذتم من دون الله أوثانا مودة بينكم في الحياة الدنيا ثم يوم القيامة يكفر بعضكم ببعض ويلعن بعضكم بعضا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: So Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, 'Indeed, I will emigrate for the sake of my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.'
interpretation: This verse portrays Prophet Lot's belief in Prophet Abraham's message and his decision to emigrate for the sake of worshipping Allah alone. It reflects the importance of faith, obedience, and sacrifice in the path of righteousness, highlighting the wisdom and power of Allah in guiding His servants.
orig: فآمن له لوط وقال إني مهاجر إلى ربي إنه هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob and placed prophethood and the Scripture in his descendants. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is among the righteous in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings bestowed upon Prophet Abraham (Ibrahim), mentioning his righteous offspring Isaac and Jacob (Ishaq and Ya'qub). It emphasizes that prophethood and divine scriptures were passed down in his lineage. In addition to the rewards granted to him in this world, the verse assures believers that he will be among the righteous in the Hereafter. It underlines the eternal significance of his faith and deeds, setting an example for others to follow.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب وجعلنا في ذريته النبوة والكتاب وآتيناه أجره في الدنيا وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, 'Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Lot (peace be upon him) and his people, who were engaged in immoral acts that were unprecedented in the world. It serves as a warning against deviating from the path of righteousness and engaging in sinful behavior that goes against the norms of society and the teachings of Allah.
orig: ولوطا إذ قال لقومه إنكم لتأتون الفاحشة ما سبقكم بها من أحد من العالمين

translation: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly.' But the answer of his people was not except that they said, 'Expel them from your city. Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an condemns the act of approaching men with desire instead of women, highlighting the ignorance and wrongdoing of such behavior. It depicts a situation where people are engaging in immoral actions and when confronted, instead of repenting, they reject the truth and demand punishment, showing their refusal to acknowledge their wrongdoings. It serves as a reminder to stay away from acts that go against the natural order and teachings of Islam, emphasizing the importance of purity and righteousness.
orig: أئنكم لتأتون الرجال وتقطعون السبيل وتأتون في ناديكم المنكر فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا ائتنا بعذاب الله إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said, "My Lord, support me against the corrupting people."
interpretation: This verse shows the Prophet Nuh (Noah) seeking help and assistance from Allah against the wrongdoers and corrupt individuals. It highlights the importance of seeking aid from Allah in times of difficulty and oppression, as well as the Prophet's unwavering trust in Allah's support and guidance.
orig: قال رب انصرني على القوم المفسدين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of this city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."
interpretation: This verse talks about when the angels visited Prophet Abraham with the news of the destruction of the people of a city due to their wrongdoing and disbelief. It highlights the concept of divine punishment for those who engage in oppression and transgression against the teachings of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of wrongdoing and the importance of staying on the path of righteousness to avoid such destruction.
orig: ولما جاءت رسلنا إبراهيم بالبشرى قالوا إنا مهلكو أهل هذه القرية إن أهلها كانوا ظالمين

translation: He said, "Indeed, in it is Lot." They said, "We are most knowing of who is in it; we will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."
interpretation: In this verse, the angels mention the presence of Lot in the city they are discussing. They express their intention to save Lot and his family from the impending punishment, except for his wife who will be left behind. This verse speaks to the divine knowledge of the angels and the specific response to the situation at hand, highlighting the concept of divine justice and mercy.
orig: قال إن فيها لوطا قالوا نحن أعلم بمن فيها لننجينه وأهله إلا امرأته كانت من الغابرين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt powerless to protect them. They said, 'Do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is to be among those who stay behind.'
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of Prophet Lot (Lut) and his interaction with the angels sent by God. It emphasizes the protection and guidance offered by the angels to Prophet Lot in a time of distress and fear. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's protection for the righteous, even in the face of adversity. It also highlights the importance of faith and trust in God's plan, as Prophet Lot was reassured by the angels not to fear or grieve as they offered salvation to him and his family except for his wife, who chose to be among the disbelievers.
orig: ولما أن جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقالوا لا تخف ولا تحزن إنا منجوك وأهلك إلا امرأتك كانت من الغابرين

translation: We will certainly send down upon the people of this town punishment from the sky because they have been defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning of the consequences of disobedience and defiance towards God. It emphasizes that wrongdoing and disobedience lead to punishment and that divine retribution can come in various forms. The verse highlights the importance of following the guidance of God to avoid facing His wrath and punishment.
orig: إنا منزلون على أهل هذه القرية رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And We have certainly left of it a sign clear for a people who use reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights that within the Qur'an, there are clear signs and proofs for those who possess reason and intellect to reflect upon and comprehend. It emphasizes the importance of using one's intellect and reasoning to grasp the messages and wisdom contained in the Qur'an.
orig: ولقد تركنا منها آية بينة لقوم يعقلون

translation: And to the people of Madyan We sent their brother Shu'aib. He said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. And do not diminish from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an talks about the Prophets' mission to guide their people to worship Allah alone and uphold justice. In this instance, Prophet Shu'aib is instructing the people of Madyan to worship Allah, to be mindful of the Day of Judgment, and to avoid corruption and injustice on earth. The verse emphasizes the importance of monotheism, ethical behavior, and accountability in the sight of Allah.
orig: وإلى مدين أخاهم شعيبا فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله وارجوا اليوم الآخر ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: So they denied him, and the earthquake seized them, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the consequences faced by a people who rejected the message of a prophet. The earthquake mentioned symbolizes a punishment that seized those who denied the truth. The image of them becoming lifeless in their own homes serves as a stark reminder of the outcome of denying the prophets and their messages.
orig: فكذبوه فأخذتهم الرجفة فأصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين

translation: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with insight.
interpretation: This verse highlights the destruction of the nations of 'Aad and Thamud due to their disobedience and deviation from the right path, even though they were given clear signs. It emphasizes how Satan beautified their wrongful actions to lead them astray despite their ability to perceive the truth.
orig: وعادا وثمود وقد تبين لكم من مساكنهم وزين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل وكانوا مستبصرين

translation: And Qarun (Korah), Pharaoh, and Haman; and certainly, Moses came to them with clear proofs, but they were arrogant in the land, and they were not among those who would succeed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mention of Qarun (Korah), Pharaoh, and Haman as examples of arrogant and oppressive individuals in history. Despite receiving clear signs and proofs from Prophet Moses, they chose to be arrogant and oppressive, leading to their downfall and failure. The verse serves as a reminder that no matter how powerful or wealthy a person may be, true success lies in humility and righteousness, not arrogance and oppression.
orig: وقارون وفرعون وهامان ولقد جاءهم موسى بالبينات فاستكبروا في الأرض وما كانوا سابقين

translation: So We took each one for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast, and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah did not wrong them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability and divine justice. It states that each individual is held responsible for their own sins and actions. The different forms of punishment mentioned in the verse, such as being struck by stones, blasted, swallowed by the earth, or drowned, are manifestations of the consequences of their own wrongdoing. It emphasizes that it is not Allah who wrongs them but rather they wrong themselves by their sinful behavior.
orig: فكلا أخذنا بذنبه فمنهم من أرسلنا عليه حاصبا ومنهم من أخذته الصيحة ومنهم من خسفنا به الأرض ومنهم من أغرقنا وما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse draws a comparison between those who take false deities besides Allah as protectors or allies, and the spider that builds its fragile home. It emphasizes that relying on anything or anyone other than Allah for protection and support is as weak and vulnerable as the home of a spider. The verse encourages believers to place their trust and reliance solely on Allah, as He is the ultimate protector and source of strength.
orig: مثل الذين اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء كمثل العنكبوت اتخذت بيتا وإن أوهن البيوت لبيت العنكبوت لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, Allah knows whatever they call upon besides Him; and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omniscience of Allah, stating that He is aware of whatever is invoked or worshipped besides Him. It also showcases His attributes of ultimate power and wisdom, highlighting that He is the Almighty and the All-Wise.
orig: إن الله يعلم ما يدعون من دونه من شيء وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of knowledge and understanding in interpreting the examples and parables given in the Qur'an. It highlights the idea that only those who possess true knowledge and wisdom can truly comprehend the deeper meanings and lessons conveyed in these examples.
orig: وتلك الأمثال نضربها للناس وما يعقلها إلا العالمون

translation: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the creation of the heavens and the earth by Allah as a manifestation of His power and truth. It serves as a reminder and a sign for the believers of His existence, His greatness, and His ability to create everything in truth and perfection.
orig: خلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين

translation: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book, and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reciting and following the teachings of the Qur'an, and establishing regular prayers. It highlights that prayer serves as a deterrent against immoral and wrongful actions, and that remembering Allah is of utmost importance. The verse further reminds that Allah is knowledgeable of all our actions, encouraging believers to stay mindful of their deeds.
orig: اتل ما أوحي إليك من الكتاب وأقم الصلاة إن الصلاة تنهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر ولذكر الله أكبر والله يعلم ما تصنعون

translation: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, 'We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him.'
interpretation: This verse advises the believers on how to engage with the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) in a respectful and wise manner. It encourages dialogue based on goodness and kindness, except with those who wrong others. It emphasizes the shared belief in one God for all, sending a message of unity and peaceful coexistence. The believers are reminded to maintain their faith and submission to God amidst diversity and differing beliefs.
orig: ولا تجادلوا أهل الكتاب إلا بالتي هي أحسن إلا الذين ظلموا منهم وقولوا آمنا بالذي أنزل إلينا وأنزل إليكم وإلهنا وإلهكم واحد ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And thus We have revealed to you the Book, and those to whom We have given the Book believe in it. And among these are those who believe in it. And none reject Our signs except the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of belief in the revelations sent by Allah. It emphasizes that those who have been given the Book (previous scriptures) should believe in the Qur'an as well. Those who deny the signs and messages of Allah are considered disbelievers. The verse reinforces the concept of faith in Allah's revelations and the consequences of rejection of the signs of Allah.
orig: وكذلك أنزلنا إليك الكتاب فالذين آتيناهم الكتاب يؤمنون به ومن هؤلاء من يؤمن به وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الكافرون

translation: And you had not recited before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was unlettered and had not received any formal education or training in reading or writing. The Quran is considered a miraculous revelation from Allah, as it was recited to the Prophet Muhammad who then conveyed it to the people. The verse dismisses any claim that the Prophet Muhammad could have authored the Quran himself, emphasizing its divine origin and refuting the accusations of those who doubted his prophethood.
orig: وما كنت تتلو من قبله من كتاب ولا تخطه بيمينك إذا لارتاب المبطلون

translation: Rather, it is clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our signs except the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the signs and revelations of Allah are clear and evident to those who possess knowledge and understanding. It highlights that those who deny or reject these signs are ultimately the wrongdoers, implying that disbelief or refusal to acknowledge the truth is an act of injustice.
orig: بل هو آيات بينات في صدور الذين أوتوا العلم وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الظالمون

translation: And they say, "Why has no sign been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, the signs are only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the fact that the signs and miracles are in the hands of Allah alone, and it is not up to humans to question or demand them. The role of the Prophet mentioned here is that of a Warner, delivering the message clearly and effectively, regardless of whether or not miraculous signs accompany it.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه آيات من ربه قل إنما الآيات عند الله وإنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and a reminder for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance and sufficiency of the Qur'an as a guidance and reminder for those who believe. It highlights that the Book is a source of mercy and a reminder for those who have faith in Allah. It serves as a clear sign for those who are willing to reflect and be guided by its teachings.
orig: أولم يكفهم أنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب يتلى عليهم إن في ذلك لرحمة وذكرى لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, "Sufficient is Allah between me and you as Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allah - it is those who are the losers."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's omniscience and oversight, highlighting that He is well aware of everything in the heavens and the earth. It warns against disbelief in Allah and believing in falsehood, underscoring that those who do so will face loss and be deprived of guidance and success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: قل كفى بالله بيني وبينكم شهيدا يعلم ما في السماوات والأرض والذين آمنوا بالباطل وكفروا بالله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.
interpretation: This verse points out the impatience of disbelievers who demand immediate punishment upon the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his followers. However, the verse emphasizes that if not for the appointed time designated by Allah, the punishment would have already befallen them. The verse serves as a reminder that the punishment of Allah is certain and will come suddenly and unexpectedly for those who are heedless.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولولا أجل مسمى لجاءهم العذاب وليأتينهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the impatience of the disbelievers for the punishment to come upon the believers. It serves as a reminder that Hell is a reality that awaits those who reject faith, and its torment will surround and engulf those who persist in disbelief.
orig: يستعجلونك بالعذاب وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: On the Day when the punishment will cover them from above them and from below their feet, and it is said, 'Taste [the result of] what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene of the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and sinners will face the consequences of their actions. The punishment will envelop them entirely, leaving them with no escape, and they will be made to taste the results of their deeds. It serves as a warning of accountability and retribution for one's actions in the Hereafter.
orig: يوم يغشاهم العذاب من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم ويقول ذوقوا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: O My servants who have believed, indeed, My earth is spacious, so worship Me alone.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers that Allah's earth is vast and accommodating, emphasizing that there are abundant opportunities and resources available for the worship of Allah. It conveys the message that no matter where one may be, they can always turn to Allah in worship and seek His guidance and blessings. The verse encourages believers to dedicate their worship solely to Allah, highlighting the importance of sincere devotion and servitude to the Creator.
orig: يا عبادي الذين آمنوا إن أرضي واسعة فإياي فاعبدون

translation: Every soul will taste death, and to Us you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the undeniable reality of death that every living soul will experience. It reminds us that death is a universal truth that no one can escape. The phrase 'to Us you will be returned' serves as a reminder that ultimately all beings will return to Allah for accountability and judgement after they pass away.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ثم إلينا ترجعون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will surely cause them to dwell in lofty chambers of Paradise beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith and good deeds in Islam. It promises a beautiful and eternal reward in paradise for those who believe in God and live a righteous life. The imagery of lofty chambers in paradise with rivers flowing beneath symbolizes the abundance and tranquility that awaits the believers as a reward for their efforts in this worldly life. This verse serves as an encouragement for Muslims to stay steadfast in their faith and continue doing good deeds despite any challenges they may face, as the ultimate reward for the righteous is with Allah in the hereafter.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنبوئنهم من الجنة غرفا تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها نعم أجر العاملين

translation: Those who are patient and rely upon their Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and trust in Allah. It suggests that those who persevere through difficulties and hardships with patience and place their trust in Allah will find strength and guidance to navigate through life's challenges. By relying on Allah, one can find peace and comfort in knowing that He is always there to support and protect them.
orig: الذين صبروا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision! Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of sustenance and provision in Islam. It serves as a reminder that just as Allah provides for all creatures, He will also provide for mankind. It emphasizes that sustenance and provision come from Allah, who is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, and that we should trust in His divine wisdom and plan for us.
orig: وكأين من دابة لا تحمل رزقها الله يرزقها وإياكم وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon, they will surely say, 'Allah.' Then how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the undeniable signs of Allah's creation and power in the heavens and the earth, as well as the clear submission of celestial bodies like the sun and the moon to His will. It questions how people can be deluded and turn away from the truth when the evidence of Allah's existence and greatness is so apparent in the world around them.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض وسخر الشمس والقمر ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: Allah expands provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the concept of sustenance and provision being in the hands of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah has full control over the sustenance He provides to His servants, expanding it for some and restricting it for others. It is a reminder of the ultimate knowledge and wisdom of Allah in determining the sustenance and provisions for each individual.
orig: الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And if you asked them, 'Who sent down rainwater from the sky, and revived the earth with it after its death?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise belongs to Allah.' But most of them do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the ingratitude and lack of understanding of many people towards the signs of God's existence and power. It emphasizes that if they were asked about the life-giving rain and its role in reviving the dead earth, they would attribute it to Allah. However, despite this acknowledgment, many fail to reflect on or comprehend the wisdom and power of Allah behind such miracles, showing their heedlessness and lack of thought.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من نزل من السماء ماء فأحيا به الأرض من بعد موتها ليقولن الله قل الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And this worldly life is not but amusement and diversion. But the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah, if only they knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary nature of this worldly life, describing it as mere play and amusement. It reminds believers that the real and eternal life is in the Hereafter, reserved for those who fear and obey Allah. The verse implies that if people truly understood the reality of the Hereafter, they would prioritize their actions and focus on preparing for the eternal life to come.
orig: وما هذه الحياة الدنيا إلا لهو ولعب وإن الدار الآخرة لهي الحيوان لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: So when they boarded the ship, they called upon Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivered them to the land, at once they associated others with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human tendency to turn to Allah in times of distress and difficulty, showing sincerity in faith, but once they are saved from the trial and reach safety, they return to associating partners with Allah or committing acts of disbelief. It serves as a reminder to maintain faith and devotion to Allah consistently, not just in times of need.
orig: فإذا ركبوا في الفلك دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين فلما نجاهم إلى البر إذا هم يشركون

translation: So let them disbelieve in what We have given them, and enjoy themselves; soon they will know.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the temporary enjoyment and indulgence of those who choose to disbelieve in the signs and blessings given by Allah. It warns that eventually they will come to know the consequences of their disbelief and actions.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم وليتمتعوا فسوف يعلمون

translation: Do they not see that We have made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of people not recognizing the sanctity and safety of Makkah, despite the clear signs of God's protection and blessings. It criticizes those who believe in falsehoods and fail to acknowledge God's grace and favors upon them, reflecting the importance of gratitude and faith in recognizing the blessings of Allah.
orig: أولم يروا أنا جعلنا حرما آمنا ويتخطف الناس من حولهم أفبالباطل يؤمنون وبنعمة الله يكفرون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of the sin of falsely attributing lies to Allah or rejecting the truth when it is presented to someone. It serves as a reminder that those who engage in such actions are among the most unjust individuals. The verse also emphasizes the consequences of such behavior, indicating that Hell is the fitting abode for those who persist in disbelief and dishonesty.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بالحق لما جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of striving and putting effort in the way of Allah. It assures that those who sincerely work hard for the sake of Allah will be guided towards His ways. It serves as a reminder of Allah's support for those who perform good deeds and work towards righteousness.
orig: والذين جاهدوا فينا لنهدينهم سبلنا وإن الله لمع المحسنين

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim
interpretation: These are known as separate letters (Muqatta'at) in the Qur'an whose meanings are known only to Allah. They are believed to be a part of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an, challenging the disbelievers to produce something similar.
orig: الم

translation: The Romans have been defeated,
interpretation: This verse refers to the defeat of the Romans in a battle, which was seen as a significant event at the time. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of power and the unpredictability of human affairs. It also conveys the message that victory ultimately belongs to God and that believers should have faith and patience in difficult times.
orig: غلبت الروم

translation: On the lowest level of the earth and they will be surpassed yet.
interpretation: This verse could be referring to the situation of certain people who are at a low point or disadvantaged position, but it assures that despite this temporary state, they will eventually overcome their difficulties and emerge victorious. It serves as a message of hope and reassurance that even in times of hardship, there is always the potential for improvement and success.
orig: في أدنى الأرض وهم من بعد غلبهم سيغلبون

translation: In a few years. To Allah belongs the command before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all matters are ultimately under the control of Allah, both in the past and the future. The believers are reminded to have faith in Allah's will and to have patience, as ultimately there will be joy and victory for them in the Hereafter.
orig: في بضع سنين لله الأمر من قبل ومن بعد ويومئذ يفرح المؤمنون

translation: With the help of Allah. He helps whom He wills, and He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that victory and support come from Allah alone, and He bestows it upon whom He chooses. It highlights Allah's ultimate power and mercy, asserting that He is the source of strength and compassion in the universe.
orig: بنصر الله ينصر من يشاء وهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Allah does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reliability and certainty of Allah's promises. Regardless of the circumstances, Allah's promises will always be fulfilled. However, it points out that many people are unaware or ignorant of this fact, highlighting the importance of having faith in Allah's promises and trusting in His wisdom.
orig: وعد الله لا يخلف الله وعده ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the shortsightedness of those who are solely focused on the material aspects of this worldly life, neglecting the importance of the Hereafter. It emphasizes that true knowledge goes beyond the visible world and includes understanding and preparation for the eternal life in the Hereafter.
orig: يعلمون ظاهرا من الحياة الدنيا وهم عن الآخرة هم غافلون

translation: Have they not contemplated within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except in truth and for a specified term. But indeed, many among the people deny the meeting with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of reflection and contemplation on the signs of Allah's creation within oneself. It emphasizes that the creation of the heavens and the earth, and everything in between, is done in truth and with a set purpose and timeframe. However, despite these clear signs, many people still deny the reality of meeting with their Lord and the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: أولم يتفكروا في أنفسهم ما خلق الله السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى وإن كثيرا من الناس بلقاء ربهم لكافرون

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and seen the end of those before them? They were greater in strength than them, and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would not have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reflecting upon the consequences faced by previous nations who were stronger and more prosperous but ultimately faced destruction due to their own wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder that receiving clear guidance from messengers and Prophets is a sign of Allah's mercy, and the downfall of a community is often due to their own injustices and transgressions.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا أشد منهم قوة وأثاروا الأرض وعمروها أكثر مما عمروها وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: Then the outcome for those who did evil was that they denied the signs of Allah and used to ridicule them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences that befall those who commit wrongdoing, which is ultimately their denial of the signs and revelations of Allah. By mocking and ridiculing the signs of Allah, they not only reject the truth but also demonstrate arrogance and disrespect towards the guidance and wisdom provided by Allah. Such individuals face the consequences of their actions in the form of disbelief and denial of the truth.
orig: ثم كان عاقبة الذين أساءوا السوأى أن كذبوا بآيات الله وكانوا بها يستهزئون

translation: Allah begins the creation and then repeats it, then to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the oneness and power of Allah in the creation and resurrection. It highlights that all creation begins with Allah, who has the ability to recreate it, and ultimately, all beings will return to Him for judgment.
orig: الله يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And on the Day the Hour will be established, the criminals will be in despair.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Judgment when the Hour will be established, signaling the end of the world. At this moment, the wrongdoers and criminals will be filled with regret and desperation for their deeds, realizing the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning to those who engage in sinful conduct, urging them to turn to repentance and righteousness before facing the accountability of their actions on that Day.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يبلس المجرمون

translation: And they will have no intercessors from those they associated with Allah, and they will be disbelievers in their partners.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who associate partners with Allah will not have anyone to intercede on their behalf on the Day of Judgment. It highlights the severity of associating partners with Allah and underscores the disbelief of those who commit such an act. The verse serves as a warning against shirk (associating partners with Allah) and stresses the importance of maintaining the oneness of Allah in faith and worship.
orig: ولم يكن لهم من شركائهم شفعاء وكانوا بشركائهم كافرين

translation: And [mention] the Day the Hour will be established, on that Day they will be separated.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the Hour will be established, and people will be separated based on their deeds and beliefs. It emphasizes the inevitability of a Day when everyone will be held accountable for their actions, leading to the ultimate division of the righteous from the evildoers.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يتفرقون

translation: As for those who believe and do good deeds, they will be in a Garden, delighted.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the promise of a blissful abode in Paradise for those who believe in Allah and perform righteous deeds. It emphasizes the ultimate reward and joy awaiting the believers in the afterlife, where they will dwell in a garden of delight and eternal happiness as a result of their faith and good actions in the world.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فهم في روضة يحبرون

translation: And as for those who disbelieve and deny Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, they are the ones in the punishment, prepared.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fate of those who reject the signs of Allah and deny the reality of the Hereafter. They are warned that they will face punishment for their disbelief and denial. The verse reminds believers of the consequences of rejecting the truth and serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in faith and righteousness.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا ولقاء الآخرة فأولئك في العذاب محضرون

translation: So exalted is Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to glorify and praise Allah both in the evening and in the morning. It emphasizes the importance of acknowledging and recognizing the greatness of Allah at all times of the day, showing gratitude for His blessings and seeking His guidance and protection throughout each day.
orig: فسبحان الله حين تمسون وحين تصبحون

translation: And to Him belongs [all] praise in the heavens and the earth, and [exalted is He] at night and when you are at noon.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that all praise and gratitude belong to Allah in all circumstances, whether in the heavens or on earth, during the night or day. It highlights the constant presence and greatness of Allah, calling on believers to acknowledge His glory and beauty at all times.
orig: وله الحمد في السماوات والأرض وعشيا وحين تظهرون

translation: He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living and gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. And thus will you be brought out.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the power and ability of Allah to bring forth life and death, and the concept of resurrection. It highlights the cycle of life and death in nature as a reminder of the resurrection that all humans will go through. It emphasizes the belief in the Day of Judgment and the ultimate resurrection of all beings.
orig: يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ويحيي الأرض بعد موتها وكذلك تخرجون

translation: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].
interpretation: This verse highlights the miraculous nature of human creation, emphasizing that we were created from humble origins (dust) and then endowed with life and consciousness by Allah. Moreover, it reminds us of the transient nature of human life as we move through the world, serving as a reflection on the temporary nature of existence and the power of Allah over creation.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلقكم من تراب ثم إذا أنتم بشر تنتشرون

translation: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the signs of Allah's creation, which is the creation of spouses from among yourselves. The verse emphasizes the purpose of marriage to find tranquility in one's spouse and that Allah has placed between spouses affection and mercy. It calls on people to reflect on the wisdom and signs of Allah in this creation, encouraging contemplation and understanding.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلق لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا لتسكنوا إليها وجعل بينكم مودة ورحمة إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's existence and power through the creation of the heavens and the earth, as well as the diversity in languages and colors among people. It signifies that these differences are intended to be appreciated and recognized as divine signs for those who possess knowledge and understanding.
orig: ومن آياته خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف ألسنتكم وألوانكم إن في ذلك لآيات للعالمين

translation: And of His signs is [the fact] that He shows you the lightning [causing] fear and hope, and He sends down rain from the sky by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for people who listen.
interpretation: This verse highlights the different signs of Allah's power and mercy, such as the lightning that instills both fear and hope in people, and the life-giving rain that revives the barren earth. It serves as a reminder for those who are attentive and receptive to these manifestations of divine grace and power.
orig: ومن آياته منامكم بالليل والنهار وابتغاؤكم من فضله إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يسمعون

translation: And of His signs is that He shows you the lightning, [causing] fear and aspiration, and He sends down rain from the sky, by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's power and mercy in the natural phenomenon of lightning and rain. Lightning is a source of both fear and hope, reminding us of the power and majesty of Allah. Rain, on the other hand, brings life to the earth after it appears barren, illustrating the cycle of life and death. These natural signs point to the existence of a greater purpose and the wisdom of Allah for those who reflect and use their intellect.
orig: ومن آياته يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينزل من السماء ماء فيحيي به الأرض بعد موتها إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And among His signs is that the heavens and the earth stand by His command. Then when He calls you by a single call from the earth, behold, you will come forth.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's power and control over the universe, emphasizing that just as He commands the heavens and the earth in existence, He will also resurrect and call humans back to life on the Day of Judgment with a single call. It serves as a reminder of Allah's supreme authority and the inevitability of being brought back to Him for accountability and judgment.
orig: ومن آياته أن تقوم السماء والأرض بأمره ثم إذا دعاكم دعوة من الأرض إذا أنتم تخرجون

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawhid, the Oneness of God's dominion over all of creation. It serves as a reminder that everything in the universe, whether in the heavens or the earth, belongs to Allah and is submissive to His will. It highlights the ultimate authority and power of God over all things, indicating the comprehensive obedience of all aspects of the universe to His divine command.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض كل له قانتون

translation: He is the One who originates the creation, then repeats it, and it is easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attributes in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating and recreating everything in existence. It emphasizes that the act of creation is effortless for Him, and He holds the supreme qualities in the universe. It serves as a reminder of Allah's sovereignty, might, and wisdom in His creations, and that He is capable of recreating everything with ease.
orig: وهو الذي يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده وهو أهون عليه وله المثل الأعلى في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He sets forth for you a parable from yourselves: Do you have partners among those whom your right hands possess (i.e. slaves) to share as equals in the wealth We have provided for you? Do you fear them as you fear one another? Thus do We make clear the signs to people who use their intellect.
interpretation: This verse serves as a parable that questions the absurdity of considering one's slaves or possessions as equal partners in the blessings and wealth provided by Allah. It highlights the illogical nature of fearing slaves while also fearing other human beings, emphasizing the importance of using intellect to comprehend the signs and wisdom of Allah in such matters.
orig: ضرب لكم مثلا من أنفسكم هل لكم من ما ملكت أيمانكم من شركاء في ما رزقناكم فأنتم فيه سواء تخافونهم كخيفتكم أنفسكم كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: But those who have gone astray follow their own desires without knowledge. Who can guide those whom Allah has led astray? They will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse warns against following one's own desires without knowledge, as it leads to misguidance. It emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and following His teachings, as those who stray from the right path by following their whims will be left without any support or helpers.
orig: بل اتبع الذين ظلموا أهواءهم بغير علم فمن يهدي من أضل الله وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the fitrah of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in Allah's creation. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the true religion and the natural inclination (fitrah) towards monotheism that Allah has instilled in all people. It highlights the unchanging nature of Allah's creation and the correctness of the religion of Islam. Despite this, many people remain unaware and deviate from the path of truth.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين حنيفا فطرت الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Turn to Him in repentance, and fear Him, and establish prayer, and do not be among the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of repentance, piety, prayer, and avoiding associating partners with Allah. It encourages believers to constantly turn back to Allah, have a sense of awe and reverence for Him, fulfill their prayers, and maintain monotheism in their worship. By following these principles, believers can strengthen their connection with Allah and deepen their faith.
orig: منيبين إليه واتقوه وأقيموا الصلاة ولا تكونوا من المشركين

translation: Among those who have divided their religion and become sects, each faction rejoicing in what it has.
interpretation: This verse highlights the danger of division within the Muslim community, emphasizing that those who split into factions and sects, each holding on staunchly to their own beliefs, are a cause for division and conflict among the believers. It serves as a reminder to Muslims to strive for unity and to not fall into the trap of dividing themselves into sects that lead to discord and disunity.
orig: من الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, a party of them associate others with their Lord,
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of some people to call upon God only in times of hardship, seeking His help and turning towards Him in repentance. However, when God grants them His mercy and alleviates their suffering, some of them turn back to associating partners with Him, forgetting His true and singular importance in their lives.
orig: وإذا مس الناس ضر دعوا ربهم منيبين إليه ثم إذا أذاقهم منه رحمة إذا فريق منهم بربهم يشركون

translation: So they may disbelieve in what We have given them, then enjoy yourselves, but you are going to know.
interpretation: This verse warns those who choose to be ungrateful for the blessings given to them by God, indicating that they may temporarily enjoy their worldly pleasures but will eventually come to realize the consequences of their disbelief and ingratitude.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

translation: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they associate with Him?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers have been provided with a clear proof or authority that validates their belief in associating partners with Allah. The verse challenges the illogical and baseless beliefs of the polytheists, emphasizing the importance of guidance from Allah and warning against following false beliefs and practices.
orig: أم أنزلنا عليهم سلطانا فهو يتكلم بما كانوا به يشركون

translation: When We let people taste mercy, they rejoice in it, but if evil befalls them as a result of their own deeds, they become utterly despondent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of human beings towards gratitude and despair. It shows that people are quick to celebrate and be joyful when they receive blessings and mercy from God. However, when faced with hardships or difficulties as consequences of their own actions, they despair and lose hope. It reminds us of the importance of being grateful during times of ease and remaining patient during times of hardship.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة فرحوا بها وإن تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت أيديهم إذا هم يقنطون

translation: Do they not see that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that Allah is the Provider and sustainer of all sustenance. He gives to whom He wills and withholds from whom He wills. It is a sign for those who have faith in Allah's wisdom and decree, and a reminder to trust in His perfect plan and to be content with whatever provision He bestows upon us.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah, and it is they who will be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling the rights of close relatives, the needy, and travelers. It highlights the significance of assisting those in need and honoring family bonds, stating that doing so is pleasing to Allah. The verse concludes by indicating that those who strive to seek the pleasure of Allah through such actions will be successful in this world and the hereafter.
orig: فآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ذلك خير للذين يريدون وجه الله وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whatever you give in usury to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the prohibition of engaging in usury and highlights the importance of giving zakah with the intention of seeking the pleasure of Allah. It indicates that while engaging in usury brings no increase or blessing from Allah, giving in charity (zakah) for His sake multiplies and amplifies the rewards.
orig: وما آتيتم من ربا ليربو في أموال الناس فلا يربو عند الله وما آتيتم من زكاة تريدون وجه الله فأولئك هم المضعفون

translation: It is Allah who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will bring you back to life. Is there any of your 'partners' who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exclusive power and authority of Allah as the creator and sustainer of life. It challenges the concept of partners or associates with Allah, highlighting that none of these supposed partners have the ability to create, provide, give life, or cause death, as only Allah holds such authority. It serves as a reminder of the oneness of Allah and the futility of assigning any partners to Him.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم ثم رزقكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم هل من شركائكم من يفعل من ذلكم من شيء سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of cause and effect, suggesting that corruption and trials present in the world are a result of people's actions and choices. It serves as a reminder that the consequences of our deeds will eventually catch up with us, and the purpose of these trials is to lead people back to the right path through reflection and repentance.
orig: ظهر الفساد في البر والبحر بما كسبت أيدي الناس ليذيقهم بعض الذي عملوا لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Say, "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were polytheists."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the consequences of the actions of past nations who engaged in polytheism. It serves as a reminder to learn from history and to understand that associating partners with Allah has severe consequences. By studying the lessons of the past and acknowledging the fate of those who strayed from the path of monotheism, believers are urged to stay steadfast in their faith and avoid falling into the same mistakes.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبل كان أكثرهم مشركين

translation: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the Fitrah of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the true religion decreed by Allah and staying committed to the innate nature (Fitrah) upon which all humans are created. It reminds believers to remain steadfast in their faith and practices, despite any external challenges or pressures, as the true path ordained by Allah does not change. The verse also indicates that many people are unaware or misguided about this true religion.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين القيم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا مرد له من الله يومئذ يصدعون

translation: Whoever disbelieves, upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are preparing for themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes personal responsibility and accountability. It states that those who choose to reject faith will bear the consequences of their disbelief. Conversely, those who engage in righteous deeds are actually benefiting themselves, as their actions will be in their favor in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder that individuals have the power to shape their own destinies through their choices and actions.
orig: من كفر فعليه كفره ومن عمل صالحا فلأنفسهم يمهدون

translation: So that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah rewards those who have faith and perform good deeds. God's rewards are given out of His grace and generosity. It also points out that Allah does not favor the disbelievers, as they reject the truth and deny His existence despite His clear signs.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات من فضله إنه لا يحب الكافرين

translation: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command and that you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.
interpretation: This verse points out the signs of Allah's existence and power. Through the example of sending winds, it teaches that Allah's creations serve multiple purposes, including bringing blessings, allowing humans to experience His mercy, facilitating sea travel under His control, providing opportunities for seeking His bounties, and ultimately encouraging believers to be thankful for His blessings.
orig: ومن آياته أن يرسل الرياح مبشرات وليذيقكم من رحمته ولتجري الفلك بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We certainly sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they brought them clear proofs. Then We took retribution from those who committed crimes. And incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the recurring pattern of messengers being sent to various communities with clear signs and guidance, but the disbelievers often face consequences for their wrongdoing. The verse emphasizes that it is the Divine responsibility to protect and support the believers who adhere to the message delivered by the messengers.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك رسلا إلى قومهم فجاءوهم بالبينات فانتقمنا من الذين أجرموا وكان حقا علينا نصر المؤمنين

translation: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and control of Allah over all aspects of nature. The wind is described as a means through which Allah rejuvenates the earth, bringing life to barren lands. It serves as a reminder of the awe-inspiring ability of Allah to bring about life from what was once lifeless. The verse emphasizes the concept of resurrection and the divine ability to recreate and revive life, symbolizing hope and renewal.
orig: الله الذي يرسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فيبسطه في السماء كيف يشاء ويجعله كسفا فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله فإذا أصاب به من يشاء من عباده إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: And indeed, before this [Qur'an], they were in despair.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the disbelievers were in a state of misguidance and hopelessness before the Qur'an was revealed to them. It emphasizes the transformative power of the Qur'an in bringing guidance and clarity to those who were previously lost.
orig: وإن كانوا من قبل أن ينزل عليهم من قبله لمبلسين

translation: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah by highlighting the way He brings life back to the earth after it has become lifeless, as a reflection of the greater resurrection of the dead. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to revive not just the earth, but also to bring back the dead to life, showcasing His complete control and power over all things.
orig: فانظر إلى آثار رحمت الله كيف يحيي الأرض بعد موتها إن ذلك لمحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And if We had sent a wind and they saw it turned yellow, they would still have remained in disbelief thereafter.
interpretation: This verse indicates that even if people were to witness clear signs of God's might and power, such as a wind turning yellow which would be a highly unusual and remarkable event, some would still persist in their disbelief. It highlights the stubbornness and disbelief of those who refuse to accept the truth despite being presented with clear evidence and signs of God's existence and power.
orig: ولئن أرسلنا ريحا فرأوه مصفرا لظلوا من بعده يكفرون

translation: Indeed, you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs,
interpretation: This verse reminds that we cannot make those who are spiritually dead or heedless hear the truth, just as we cannot guide those who have turned away from the path of righteousness. It emphasizes the limitations of human beings in guiding others, and highlights the importance of sincere intentions and turning towards the right path to attain guidance.
orig: فإنك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ولوا مدبرين

translation: And you are not a guide for the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses, so they are Muslims.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the guidance of people ultimately comes from Allah. Even if someone tries to guide the misguided, it is only effective for those who are willing to believe in the signs and revelations of Allah. It emphasizes that true guidance and submission come from within, and efforts to guide those who are spiritually blind will only be successful with the will and permission of Allah.
orig: وما أنت بهاد العمي عن ضلالتهم إن تسمع إلا من يؤمن بآياتنا فهم مسلمون

translation: It is Allah who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.
interpretation: This verse teaches us about the cycle of life that humans go through, starting from weakness in infancy, gaining strength in youth, and eventually returning to weakness and old age. It reminds us that Allah has power over all stages of life, and He can create and shape existence as He wishes, being fully aware and capable of all things.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم من ضعف ثم جعل من بعد ضعف قوة ثم جعل من بعد قوة ضعفا وشيبة يخلق ما يشاء وهو العليم القدير

translation: And on the Day when the Hour will be established, the criminals will swear that they had remained [in the world] but an hour. Thus they were deluded.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, the wrongdoers will falsely swear that their lives on earth felt like just a short while, despite the reality of their wrongful actions. This verse highlights the delusion and denial that the disbelievers will be engulfed in on the Day of Resurrection, realizing too late the consequences of their actions.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يقسم المجرمون ما لبثوا غير ساعة كذلك كانوا يؤفكون

translation: And those who were given knowledge and faith will say, 'You remained in accordance with the decree of Allah until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of knowledge and faith. It indicates that those who possess knowledge and faith will acknowledge on the Day of Resurrection that everything was decreed by Allah and that they were unaware of the truth during their worldly life. It highlights the significance of seeking knowledge and embracing faith to gain understanding and guidance.
orig: وقال الذين أوتوا العلم والإيمان لقد لبثتم في كتاب الله إلى يوم البعث فهذا يوم البعث ولكنكم كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: On that Day, excuses will not benefit the wrongdoers, nor will they be asked to make amends.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Judgment when the wrongdoers will not be able to use their excuses to escape accountability for their actions. It emphasizes that no amount of justification or pleading will help them on that day, and they will not be given the opportunity to rectify their wrongdoings.
orig: فيومئذ لا ينفع الذين ظلموا معذرتهم ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, 'You are but falsifiers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an contains various examples and lessons for humanity. It warns that even in the face of clear signs or miracles, disbelievers will reject the truth and accuse the believers of deception. It emphasizes the importance of faith and understanding over mere display of miracles.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل ولئن جئتهم بآية ليقولن الذين كفروا إن أنتم إلا مبطلون

translation: Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of those who do not know.
interpretation: This verse refers to how Allah seals the hearts of those who remain ignorant, closed off to knowledge and guidance. It emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding to prevent having one's heart sealed in ignorance.
orig: كذلك يطبع الله على قلوب الذين لا يعلمون

translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let not those who have no certainty [in faith] dishearten you.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to be patient and steadfast in facing challenges and struggles, assuring them that the promises of Allah are true and will be fulfilled. It also advises not to be influenced or disheartened by those who lack faith or certainty, emphasizing the importance of maintaining one's own belief and conviction.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق ولا يستخفنك الذين لا يوقنون

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
interpretation: These are known as the disjointed letters (al-huruf al-muqatta'at) found at the beginning of certain chapters in the Qur'an. Their exact meaning and interpretation remain unknown, but they serve as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and a challenge to humanity to produce something similar to it.
orig: الم

translation: Those are the verses of the wise Book.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a wise and insightful book, filled with divine guidance and knowledge. It encourages believers to reflect upon its verses and teachings to gain wisdom and understanding.
orig: تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: Guidance and mercy for the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights that guidance and mercy are bestowed upon those who choose to do good deeds. It serves as a reminder that goodness leads to divine rewards in the form of guidance and mercy from Allah.
orig: هدى ورحمة للمحسنين

translation: Those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in the Hereafter for those who establish prayers and give to charity. It highlights the strong belief and certainty these individuals have in the afterlife, which motivates them to perform good deeds and fulfill their religious obligations.
orig: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم بالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: They are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who are guided by their Lord are the ones who will attain true success. It highlights the importance of being on the right path and following divine guidance in order to achieve success in this life and the hereafter.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against those who engage in idle talk and falsehood, leading others astray from the path of Allah without knowledge or wisdom. Such individuals will face a dishonorable punishment for their actions.
orig: ومن الناس من يشتري لهو الحديث ليضل عن سبيل الله بغير علم ويتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of those who arrogantly reject the signs of Allah when they are recited to them. They deliberately turn away from the guidance and truth, acting as if they are deaf to the message. As a consequence of their arrogance and heedlessness, they are warned of a severe punishment awaiting them.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليه آياتنا ولى مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها كأن في أذنيه وقرا فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens of pleasure.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds will be rewarded with eternal happiness and delight in paradise. It serves as a reminder that true belief should be accompanied by righteous actions, and that the ultimate reward for such believers is a blissful life in the gardens of paradise.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم جنات النعيم

translation: Living therein forever, the promise of Allah is truth; and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the eternal nature of the promised reward from Allah for the believers. It assures that the promise of paradise is true and will be fulfilled. It also highlights the power and wisdom of Allah, emphasizing His authority and knowledge in giving this promise.
orig: خالدين فيها وعد الله حقا وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.
interpretation: This verse reflects the grandeur and wisdom of Allah's creation. It asserts the flawless design of the universe and emphasizes the balance and stability it provides for the inhabitants of the earth. The reference to mountains being like pegs holding the earth steady implies the divine planning and purpose behind every element of creation. The verse also highlights the abundance and diversity of life on earth, all of which is sustained by Allah's provision of rain that makes every kind of plant flourish. Ultimately, it is a reminder of Allah's power, wisdom, and mercy evident in His creation.
orig: خلق السماوات بغير عمد ترونها وألقى في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بكم وبث فيها من كل دابة وأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأنبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم

translation: This is the creation of Allah, so show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.
interpretation: This verse highlights the undeniable evidence of the creation of Allah, inviting those who associate partners with Him to produce something similar. However, it also emphasizes that the disbelievers who reject these signs and persist in wrongdoing are clearly misguided and lost.
orig: هذا خلق الله فأروني ماذا خلق الذين من دونه بل الظالمون في ضلال مبين

translation: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], 'Be grateful to Allah.' And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of gratitude and thankfulness to Allah. It emphasizes that being grateful benefits oneself, as it leads to the recognition and appreciation of Allah's blessings. On the other hand, ingratitude is described as a form of denial of Allah's favors, and it is emphasized that Allah is self-sufficient and praiseworthy regardless of whether people are grateful or not.
orig: ولقد آتينا لقمان الحكمة أن اشكر لله ومن يشكر فإنما يشكر لنفسه ومن كفر فإن الله غني حميد

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Luqman said to his son while he was instructing him, 'O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allah. Indeed, association [with him] is great injustice.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the advice of Luqman to his son, emphasizing the importance of monotheism and warning against associating partners with Allah. The interpretation of this verse underscores the significance of maintaining pure faith and the great injustice of committing shirk (associating partners with Allah), which is considered a grave sin in Islam.
orig: وإذ قال لقمان لابنه وهو يعظه يا بني لا تشرك بالله إن الشرك لظلم عظيم

translation: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing kindness and gratitude towards one's parents. It highlights the sacrifices parents make for their children, from the mother's carrying and nursing the child, despite the challenges and weaknesses she faces, to the period of weaning just after birth, usually lasting two years. The directive to be grateful to both the creator (Allah) and one's parents emphasizes the significance of honoring and respecting one's parents as a fundamental aspect of moral and spiritual responsibility in Islam.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه حملته أمه وهنا على وهن وفصاله في عامين أن اشكر لي ولوالديك إلي المصير

translation: And if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to follow anyone who tries to make them associate partners with Allah without knowledge. Instead, they are instructed to treat such people kindly in this world but to stand firm in their belief and follow the path of repentance towards Allah. Ultimately, everyone will return to Allah, where they will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وإن جاهداك على أن تشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما وصاحبهما في الدنيا معروفا واتبع سبيل من أناب إلي ثم إلي مرجعكم فأنبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O my son, if it should be [that] there is the weight of a mustard seed and it should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that nothing is hidden from Allah, not even the weight of a mustard seed, no matter where it is located. It emphasizes the omnipotence of Allah and His knowledge of all things, reminding us that He is aware of even the smallest details and is capable of bringing all things to light. This serves as a reminder for believers to be mindful of their actions and intentions as nothing will escape the knowledge and judgment of Allah.
orig: يا بني إنها إن تك مثقال حبة من خردل فتكن في صخرة أو في السماوات أو في الأرض يأت بها الله إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an advises believers to uphold the pillars of their faith, maintain prayer, promote good deeds, prevent immoral behavior, and face hardships with patience and perseverance. It emphasizes the importance of steadfastness and resilience in the face of challenges, as these are crucial aspects of leading a righteous and fulfilling life.
orig: يا بني أقم الصلاة وأمر بالمعروف وانه عن المنكر واصبر على ما أصابك إن ذلك من عزم الأمور

translation: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an reminds believers to avoid arrogance, pride, and self-importance. It teaches humility in interactions with others and in one's demeanor. Allah does not favor those who are arrogant and boastful, emphasizing the importance of humility and modesty in the eyes of God.
orig: ولا تصعر خدك للناس ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إن الله لا يحب كل مختال فخور

translation: And lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the braying of donkeys.
