translation: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it, what descends from the sky and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights the all-encompassing knowledge and mercy of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of everything that happens on earth and in the heavens. He knows all that enters and exits the earth, and everything that comes down from the sky and goes up to it. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's infinite knowledge, mercy, and forgiveness towards His creation.
orig: يعلم ما يلج في الأرض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو الرحيم الغفور

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'The Hour will not come to us.' Say, 'Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you.' Allah is the Knower of the unseen. Not an atom's weight in the heavens or on the earth is hidden from Him, nor is there anything smaller or larger than that except that it is in a clear register.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Day of Judgment will indeed come, despite the disbelief of some individuals. It asserts that Allah has knowledge of all things, including the unseen, and nothing, not even the smallest particle or the greatest entity, is hidden from Him. Everything is meticulously recorded in a clear and comprehensive record.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لا تأتينا الساعة قل بلى وربي لتأتينكم عالم الغيب لا يعزب عنه مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الأرض ولا أصغر من ذلك ولا أكبر إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: So that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds; for them is forgiveness and noble provision.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the reward for those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds is forgiveness from their sins and generous provisions from Allah. It serves as a reminder that one's actions and faith will be rewarded by Allah in this life and the hereafter.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our verses [to cause] failure - those will be companions of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse warns against those who attempt to challenge or defeat the signs and teachings of Allah. It emphasizes that those who oppose or try to invalidate the divine signs will face severe punishment and torment in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: And those who have been given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of knowledge and understanding in recognizing the truth of the message revealed by Allah to the Prophet Muhammad. Those who possess true knowledge acknowledge the authenticity of the revelations sent by Allah and recognize that it leads them to the path of the Most Exalted and Most Praiseworthy. It emphasizes the significance of seeking knowledge and using it to guide oneself towards righteousness and devotion.
orig: ويرى الذين أوتوا العلم الذي أنزل إليك من ربك هو الحق ويهدي إلى صراط العزيز الحميد

translation: And those who disbelieve say, "Shall we point out to you a man who will inform you, when you have been totally torn apart in complete disintegration, that indeed you are [fully] in a new creation?"
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and denial of the disbelievers who question the concept of resurrection and a new creation after disintegration. It emphasizes the power of Allah to recreate humans after they have turned to dust, as a sign of His greatness and ability to bring about life after death.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا هل ندلكم على رجل ينبئكم إذا مزقتم كل ممزق إنكم لفي خلق جديد

translation: Does he who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it comes to him – is Hell not the abode for the disbelievers?
interpretation: This verse questions the intentions of those who lie about Allah or deny the truth that has been revealed to them. It highlights that those who do not believe in the afterlife will ultimately face punishment and will be severely misguided.
orig: أفترى على الله كذبا أم به جنة بل الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة في العذاب والضلال البعيد

translation: Have they not looked at what is before them and behind them of the sky and the earth? If We will, We can cause the earth to swallow them, or make pieces of the sky fall upon them. Surely in this is a sign for every repentant servant.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the power and control that Allah has over all things. It illustrates the signs of Allah's might and ability to bring calamity upon those who disobey Him. It serves as a warning to the disbelievers, urging them to repent and turn back to Allah before they face swift and severe punishment from Him. The verse emphasizes on the importance of repentance and submission to Allah for every individual who seeks guidance and forgiveness.
orig: أفلم يروا إلى ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم من السماء والأرض إن نشأ نخسف بهم الأرض أو نسقط عليهم كسفا من السماء إن في ذلك لآية لكل عبد منيب

translation: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], 'O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well].' And We made pliable for him iron,
interpretation: This verse describes the special favors bestowed upon Prophet David (Dawood) by Allah, including the ability to glorify Allah with the mountains and birds, as well as the knowledge and control over iron, indicating his strength and capabilities granted by Allah.
orig: ولقد آتينا داوود منا فضلا يا جبال أوبي معه والطير وألنا له الحديد

translation: And work, [O Muhammad], steadfastly, and your Lord will provide for you a goodly provision, and do righteous deeds. Indeed, I am seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to Prophet Muhammad to remain steadfast and dedicated in his work, as Allah will provide for him abundantly. It emphasizes the importance of doing good deeds consistently, as Allah is aware and observant of all actions. The verse serves as a reassurance and motivation for believers to persist in their efforts and trust in Allah's provision and guidance.
orig: أن اعمل سابغات وقدر في السرد واعملوا صالحا إني بما تعملون بصير

translation: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And of the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights some of the unique abilities and blessings granted to Prophet Solomon by Allah, such as mastery over the wind and control over the jinn. It signifies the immense power and authority given to the prophets by Allah, and at the same time warns those who disobey or deviate from Allah's commands of the consequences they will face in the Hereafter.
orig: ولسليمان الريح غدوها شهر ورواحها شهر وأسلنا له عين القطر ومن الجن من يعمل بين يديه بإذن ربه ومن يزغ منهم عن أمرنا نذقه من عذاب السعير

translation: They make for him what he wills of sanctuaries and statues, vessels, plates like the troughs of water and kitchens and drums that will not rust. Work, O family of David, in gratitude. And few of My servants are grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes how God provides the family of David with an abundance of resources and blessings which are utilized to create sanctuaries, statues, vessels, and other items. It urges the family of David to be grateful for these blessings and to work diligently in thanks to God. The verse highlights the importance of gratitude and dedication to God's service in utilizing the blessings bestowed upon them.
orig: يعملون له ما يشاء من محاريب وتماثيل وجفان كالجواب وقدور راسيات اعملوا آل داوود شكرا وقليل من عبادي الشكور

translation: And when We decreed for him [Solomon] death, nothing indicated to them his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the story of Prophet Solomon's death in the Qur'an, highlighting the concept of the unseen (ghaib) and the limited knowledge and perception that humans and jinn possess. It shows that even the jinn, who have abilities beyond humans, cannot predict or know the unseen completely. Thus, it serves as a reminder of the limitations of human and jinn knowledge and the importance of submitting to the divine decree.
orig: فلما قضينا عليه الموت ما دلهم على موته إلا دابة الأرض تأكل منسأته فلما خر تبينت الجن أن لو كانوا يعلمون الغيب ما لبثوا في العذاب المهين

translation: Indeed, there was a sign for the people of Sheba in their dwelling place: two gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], 'Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord.'
interpretation: This verse talks about the people of Sheba and their bountiful lands. They were blessed with fertile gardens on both sides, and they were urged to be grateful to Allah for providing them with sustenance. The verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude and the blessings that come from being thankful to Allah, who is forgiving and generous towards His creations.
orig: لقد كان لسبإ في مسكنهم آية جنتان عن يمين وشمال كلوا من رزق ربكم واشكروا له بلدة طيبة ورب غفور

translation: So they denied him, and We sent upon them the flood of 'Arim, and We changed them with their two [gardens into gardens producing bitter fruit, tamarisks, and some lote trees.]
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment inflicted upon a group of people who denied a prophet. They were struck with a devastating flood, which destroyed their gardens and wealth, transforming their once fertile gardens into ones that bore bitter fruits and few trees. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the message of prophets and the importance of heeding their warnings.
orig: فأعرضوا فأرسلنا عليهم سيل العرم وبدلناهم بجنتيهم جنتين ذواتي أكل خمط وأثل وشيء من سدر قليل

translation: That is their recompense for their disbelief, and how terrible is such a recompense. And do We let them go on in their arrogance, only to increase in sin. But will We ever reward anyone for anything but what they have done?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences of disbelief - that those who disbelieve will indeed be recompensed for their disbelief. It also questions the logic of rewarding anyone for anything other than what they have done. The verse serves as a reflection on the divine justice and the accountability of individuals for their actions.
orig: ذلك جزيناهم بما كفروا وهل نجازي إلا الكفور

translation: And We have placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], 'Travel between them by night or day in safety.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concepts of divine blessing, guidance, and safety provided by Allah to travelers between the cities He has chosen. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power and wisdom in facilitating safe and easy travel between these cities, emphasizing the importance of safety and security in one's journey.
orig: وجعلنا بينهم وبين القرى التي باركنا فيها قرى ظاهرة وقدرنا فيها السير سيروا فيها ليالي وأياما آمنين

translation: And they say, 'Our Lord, hasten for us our due share before the Day of Account.' But bear in mind that they will have been distanced from their due share on that Day by their own earnings. So We have turned them into mere tales and scattered them in all directions. Verily in this are Signs for everyone who is steadfast and grateful.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the consequences and fate that individuals bring upon themselves by their actions. It explains that those who seek to hasten their share of reward or punishment hasten only their own downfall. Their impatience leads to their dispersion and obliteration. The verse emphasizes the lesson that patience and gratitude in obedience to God's decree is key, as it leads to reflection upon the signs of God and a steadfast nature.
orig: فقالوا ربنا باعد بين أسفارنا وظلموا أنفسهم فجعلناهم أحاديث ومزقناهم كل ممزق إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: And indeed, Iblees had already confirmed his assumption about them, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Iblees (Satan) was certain of the weakness of human nature and deliberately led many astray. However, there were some believers who resisted his temptation and did not follow him. It emphasizes the importance of faith and resilience in the face of evil.
orig: ولقد صدق عليهم إبليس ظنه فاتبعوه إلا فريقا من المؤمنين

translation: And he has no authority over them, except [We must know] who believes in the Hereafter from one who is in doubt thereof. And your Lord is, over all things, Guardian.
interpretation: This verse highlights that no one has the ultimate authority over people's beliefs and faith in the Hereafter. It is a test from Allah to distinguish between those who believe firmly in the Hereafter and those who are in doubt. This test is under the watchful protection of Allah, who guards and knows all things.
orig: وما كان له عليهم من سلطان إلا لنعلم من يؤمن بالآخرة ممن هو منها في شك وربك على كل شيء حفيظ

translation: Say, "Invoke those you claim [as gods] besides Allah." They do not possess an atom's weight in the heavens or the earth, nor do they have any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and independence of Allah, stating that the false deities people worship besides Him have no share in His dominion or control over any aspect of the universe. It highlights the futility of associating partners with Allah and speaks to the fact that no one is equivalent to or comparable to Him in any way.
orig: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دون الله لا يملكون مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الأرض وما لهم فيهما من شرك وما له منهم من ظهير

translation: And intercession does not benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [But when fear is removed from their hearts,] they will say, 'What has your Lord said?' They will say, 'The truth.' And He is the Most High, the Grand.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no one can intercede on behalf of others with Allah except by His permission. When fear is removed from people's hearts after the Day of Judgment, they will inquire about what their Lord has decided. At that time, the truth will be revealed, and Allah's sovereignty, grandeur, and authority will be fully acknowledged.
orig: ولا تنفع الشفاعة عنده إلا لمن أذن له حتى إذا فزع عن قلوبهم قالوا ماذا قال ربكم قالوا الحق وهو العلي الكبير

translation: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah." And indeed, either we or you are upon guidance or in clear error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah who provides sustenance for all beings from the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder that guidance and misguidance are determined by Allah, and that we are all either following the right path or in clear error based on our adherence to His guidance.
orig: قل من يرزقكم من السماوات والأرض قل الله وإنا أو إياكم لعلى هدى أو في ضلال مبين

translation: Say, 'Do not ask about what we have committed, and do not ask about what you have done.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not to delve into the sins of others and focus on their own actions and deeds. It emphasizes personal accountability and encourages individuals to be more concerned with their own conduct and seeking forgiveness for their own wrongdoings, rather than being preoccupied with the faults of others.
orig: قل لا تسألون عما أجرمنا ولا نسأل عما تعملون

translation: Say, 'Our Lord will bring us together, then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Knowing Judge.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of a final judgement by God, where all people will be brought together and justice will be served. It reminds believers that God is the ultimate judge, all-knowing and wise, and His judgement will be based on truth and fairness.
orig: قل يجمع بيننا ربنا ثم يفتح بيننا بالحق وهو الفتاح العليم

translation: Say, 'Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No, rather, He is Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and rejects the concept of associating partners with Him. It asserts that Allah is the Almighty and the All-Wise, highlighting His unique and unparalleled attributes.
orig: قل أروني الذين ألحقتم به شركاء كلا بل هو الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner to all people, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the dual role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a bearer of glad tidings for those who follow the guidance and a warner for those who choose to ignore it. Despite this clear message and guidance, many people remain ignorant or heedless of the truth brought by the Prophet, thus missing out on the opportunity to benefit from his message.
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا كافة للناس بشيرا ونذيرا ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
interpretation: This verse highlights the questioning and skepticism of disbelievers regarding the Day of Judgment and the fulfillment of the promises made by Allah. The disbelievers challenge the believers to prove the truth of the promise of the Day of Judgment, questioning its timing and occurrence. It shows the arrogance and ignorance of those who deny the reality of the Hereafter. The verse serves as a reminder to have faith in the promises of Allah and trust in His decree.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "The appointment is on a day which you cannot delay nor advance by an hour."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment and the fact that it will come at its appointed time, which cannot be delayed or hastened by anyone. It serves as a reminder that every individual will be held accountable for their deeds on that Day, so they should prepare for it by leading a righteous life and seeking forgiveness for their sins.
orig: قل لكم ميعاد يوم لا تستأخرون عنه ساعة ولا تستقدمون

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'We will not believe in this Qur'an nor in that which came before it.' But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting one another. Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, 'If not for you, we would have been believers.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the disbelief of those who reject the Qur'an and the earlier scriptures. It describes a scene on the Day of Judgment where the wrongdoers will dispute among themselves. The oppressed will blame the arrogant for their disbelief, pointing out that if it weren't for the influence of the arrogant, they would have been believers. This emphasizes the impact of negative influences and the accountability of individuals in the sight of God.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لن نؤمن بهذا القرآن ولا بالذي بين يديه ولو ترى إذ الظالمون موقوفون عند ربهم يرجع بعضهم إلى بعض القول يقول الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا لولا أنتم لكنا مؤمنين

translation: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."
interpretation: This verse highlights the conversation between those who were arrogant and those who were oppressed on the Day of Judgment. The arrogant will deny any responsibility for leading the oppressed astray, blaming them for their own wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder that everyone will be held accountable for their own actions, regardless of the influence of others.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا للذين استضعفوا أنحن صددناكم عن الهدى بعد إذ جاءكم بل كنتم مجرمين

translation: And those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allah and attribute to Him equals." But they will [only] see the regret when they see the punishment. And We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
interpretation: This verse highlights the accountability individuals will face for their actions. The arrogant will blame the oppressed for their own wrongdoing, but ultimately it is their own actions that will lead to regret and punishment. It emphasizes that disbelievers will bear the consequences of their deeds, and they will be recompensed accordingly.
orig: وقال الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا بل مكر الليل والنهار إذ تأمروننا أن نكفر بالله ونجعل له أندادا وأسروا الندامة لما رأوا العذاب وجعلنا الأغلال في أعناق الذين كفروا هل يجزون إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, 'Indeed, we are disbelievers in what you have been sent with.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the unfortunate reality that often the wealthy and powerful individuals in society are quick to reject and oppose the warnings and messages sent by the prophets, out of arrogance, ignorance, or self-interest. The verse emphasizes the importance of humility, open-mindedness, and sincerity in accepting the messages of guidance and warning sent by Allah through His messengers.
orig: وما أرسلنا في قرية من نذير إلا قال مترفوها إنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: And they say, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."
interpretation: This verse reveals the arrogance and false sense of security of the disbelievers who boast about their wealth and children believing that these worldly possessions provide them with immunity from punishment in the Hereafter. However, the verse highlights that true success and protection lie in faith and obedience to Allah, not in material wealth or offspring.
orig: وقالوا نحن أكثر أموالا وأولادا وما نحن بمعذبين

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief that sustenance and provision are in the hands of Allah, who provides for whom He wills according to His wisdom and knowledge. It serves as a reminder that humans may not always understand the reasons behind who receives abundance or scarcity, and that ultimately, it is Allah who decrees all matters of sustenance.
orig: قل إن ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And your wealth and your children are not but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the transient nature of worldly possessions and the importance of sincere belief and righteous deeds as a means of drawing near to God. Material wealth and children should not distract believers from the path of righteousness and faith. Instead, true closeness to Allah is achieved through genuine faith and good deeds, which will be rewarded manifold by Him. Those who believe and act righteously will find peace and security in the chambers of paradise.
orig: وما أموالكم ولا أولادكم بالتي تقربكم عندنا زلفى إلا من آمن وعمل صالحا فأولئك لهم جزاء الضعف بما عملوا وهم في الغرفات آمنون

translation: And those who strive against Our signs [to cause] failure - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].
interpretation: This verse warns about those who work against the signs and revelations of Allah, trying to undermine or distort them. It indicates that those who actively resist and oppose the truth will face severe punishment as a consequence of their actions.
orig: والذين يسعون في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك في العذاب محضرون

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's control over sustenance, stating that He provides abundantly for whom He wills and restricts for others. It emphasizes that any expenditure made in the way of Allah will be rewarded and compensated by Him, as He is the ultimate provider and sustainer.
orig: قل إن ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له وما أنفقتم من شيء فهو يخلفه وهو خير الرازقين

translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when all humans will be gathered and questioned about their beliefs and actions. On that day, those who worshipped others besides Allah will be asked if they were truly worth worshipping, highlighting the futility of worshipping false gods or beings. It serves as a reminder to worship only Allah, the one true God, and to not associate partners with Him.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم جميعا ثم يقول للملائكة أهؤلاء إياكم كانوا يعبدون

translation: They say: 'Glory be to You! You are our Guardian besides them; rather they were worshipping the jinn, most of them were believers in them.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the misunderstanding and deviation of the disbelievers who worshipped beings other than Allah, particularly the jinn. It emphasizes the folly of such misplaced worship and reminds believers of the importance of recognizing Allah as their true Guardian and Protector.
orig: قالوا سبحانك أنت ولينا من دونهم بل كانوا يعبدون الجن أكثرهم بهم مؤمنون

translation: So today none of you has power to benefit or harm another, and We will say to those who did wrong, 'Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of individual accountability on the Day of Judgment. It highlights that on that day, no one will be able to intercede or help another, and each person will be held responsible for their own actions. The warning to those who wronged others to taste the punishment of the Fire serves as a reminder that denial of the truth and injustices will have severe consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: فاليوم لا يملك بعضكم لبعض نفعا ولا ضرا ونقول للذين ظلموا ذوقوا عذاب النار التي كنتم بها تكذبون

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, 'This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping.' And they say, 'This is not except a false concoction.' And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection and denial faced by Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) when he recited the clear signs and verses of the Qur'an to the disbelievers. Despite the clarity and truthfulness of the message, they accused him of being a mere man trying to deceive people and turn them away from the traditions of their forefathers. They accused the Qur'an of being a fabricated lie or plain sorcery, refusing to accept the truth presented to them. This verse serves as a reminder of the common tactics of denial and opposition faced by messengers of God throughout history when delivering His message to the people.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قالوا ما هذا إلا رجل يريد أن يصدكم عما كان يعبد آباؤكم وقالوا ما هذا إلا إفك مفترى وقال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And We did not give them any scriptures which they could study, nor did We send to them before you, [O Muhammad], any warner.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the disbelievers mentioned in the Qur'an did not receive any scriptures to study and learn from, nor were they warned by any messenger before the Prophet Muhammad. It stresses the unique role of Prophet Muhammad as a warner and a bringer of the Qur'anic message to those who had not received guidance before.
orig: وما آتيناهم من كتب يدرسونها وما أرسلنا إليهم قبلك من نذير

translation: And those before them denied, and they did not reach a tenth of what We had given them. But they denied My messengers, so how was My reproach?
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of disbelief among previous nations who denied the messages of their respective messengers, even though they were not given even a fraction of the blessings and proofs that these messengers brought. The verse poses a rhetorical question questioning the consequences of denying the messengers sent by Allah, indicating that the punishment for rejecting the truth brought by the messengers is severe.
orig: وكذب الذين من قبلهم وما بلغوا معشار ما آتيناهم فكذبوا رسلي فكيف كان نكير

translation: Say, 'I advise you of one thing - that you stand for Allah, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought.' There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of contemplating and reflecting upon the message of Allah individually and collectively. It assures that the messenger is not a madman as claimed by some, but a warner delivering a message of impending severe punishment should the people persist in their disobedience.
orig: قل إنما أعظكم بواحدة أن تقوموا لله مثنى وفرادى ثم تتفكروا ما بصاحبكم من جنة إن هو إلا نذير لكم بين يدي عذاب شديد

translation: Say, "I do not ask you for it [the Qur'an] any payment, only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the message of the Qur'an is not to be spread for the sake of material gain or reward in this world. It highlights the purity of intention in sharing the message and encourages people to seek the path to God sincerely, without worldly intentions. The ultimate accountability for the message and its acceptance lies with God, who is the witness to all things.
orig: قل ما سألتكم من أجر فهو لكم إن أجري إلا على الله وهو على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth, Knower of the unseen."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and knowledge of Allah, highlighting that He reveals the truth and has complete awareness of all that is hidden or unseen. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to unveil the realities beyond human perception and knowledge.
orig: قل إن ربي يقذف بالحق علام الغيوب

translation: Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the truth is inevitable and will prevail over falsehood. It asserts that the truth is clear and evident, while falsehood cannot establish anything substantial or revive any falsehood that has been vanquished by the truth. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate triumph of truth and the futility of falsehood.
orig: قل جاء الحق وما يبدئ الباطل وما يعيد

translation: Say, "If I should stray, I stray only to my own detriment; but if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is All-Hearing, Ever Near."
interpretation: This verse teaches us about personal responsibility and guidance. It emphasizes that if one goes astray, it is to their own detriment, but if one is guided, it is by the divine revelations from God. It highlights the importance of seeking guidance from God and acknowledges His presence and nearness to us, always listening to our prayers and calls for help.
orig: قل إن ضللت فإنما أضل على نفسي وإن اهتديت فبما يوحي إلي ربي إنه سميع قريب

translation: And if you could but see when they will be terrified but there will be no escape, and they will be seized from a nearby place.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene when those who disbelieved will be overcome by terror and fear, and they will not find any way to escape the consequences of their actions. They will be seized and punished swiftly, even from a place that is seemingly close by, reflecting the swift and inevitable nature of Divine retribution.
orig: ولو ترى إذ فزعوا فلا فوت وأخذوا من مكان قريب

translation: And they say, 'We have believed in it, but how can we be sure of its truth from a distant place?'
interpretation: This verse points to a common tendency among some people to claim belief in the message of the Qur'an, yet seek further tangible proof or signs from a distant place before fully committing to faith. It highlights the importance of sincere belief and trust in the unseen, rather than relying solely on physical evidence or distant signs.
orig: وقالوا آمنا به وأنى لهم التناوش من مكان بعيد

translation: And they have indeed disbelieved in it before and throw out conjectures about the unseen from a far place.
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of those who disbelieve in the Qur'an, rejecting it without proper evidence and resorting to baseless speculations about the unseen. It serves as a reminder of the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding the truth with sincerity, rather than blindly denying it out of ignorance and prejudice.
orig: وقد كفروا به من قبل ويقذفون بالغيب من مكان بعيد

translation: And barriers will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in perplexing doubt.
interpretation: This verse reflects the consequences of disbelief and rejection of the truth. Those who persist in their denial will have their desires blocked off from them as a form of punishment. The reference to the past highlights that this is not a new punishment but a recurring consequence for those who choose to remain in doubt and denial of the truth. It serves as a warning to reflect upon the consequences of disbelief and to seek guidance before being consumed by doubt and uncertainty.
orig: وحيل بينهم وبين ما يشتهون كما فعل بأشياعهم من قبل إنهم كانوا في شك مريب

translation: Praise be to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who made the angels messengers with wings—two or three or four. He adds to creation as He wills. Surely Allah has power over everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights the infinite power and creative ability of Allah, who is the creator of the heavens and the earth. The reference to angels with varying numbers of wings indicates the diverse ways in which Allah has created and equipped His creations. It emphasizes that Allah has complete control over everything and can increase and diversify His creation as He wills, demonstrating His limitless capabilities.
orig: الحمد لله فاطر السماوات والأرض جاعل الملائكة رسلا أولي أجنحة مثنى وثلاث ورباع يزيد في الخلق ما يشاء إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Whatever Allah grants to people of mercy, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can release it thereafter. He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the complete control and authority of Allah over all matters, including the granting and withholding of mercy. It highlights the power and wisdom of Allah, indicating that His decisions are final and cannot be altered. It reminds believers to trust in the wisdom and divine plan of Allah, even when they may not understand His decisions.
orig: ما يفتح الله للناس من رحمة فلا ممسك لها وما يمسك فلا مرسل له من بعده وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the sky and the earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to all of humanity to reflect on the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them. It questions the absurdity of turning to anyone other than Allah as the ultimate provider of sustenance from the heavens and the earth. The verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and challenges the logic of looking elsewhere for provisions when it is He alone who provides for all. It serves as a call to abandon delusions and recognize the omnipotence and sole sovereignty of Allah in providing for His creation.
orig: يا أيها الناس اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم هل من خالق غير الله يرزقكم من السماء والأرض لا إله إلا هو فأنى تؤفكون

translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], so have denied [the messengers] before you. And to Allah are all matters returned.
interpretation: This verse reminds Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that if people reject his message, they are following a pattern seen throughout history of messengers being rejected by their people. It reassures Prophet Muhammad that ultimately, all matters will be returned to Allah for judgement and accountability.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت رسل من قبلك وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the promises made by Allah are true and will be fulfilled. It cautions against being fooled or misled by the temporary attractions and distractions of worldly life, and warns against being deceived by Satan's influence to lose sight of the reality of Allah and His promises.
orig: يا أيها الناس إن وعد الله حق فلا تغرنكم الحياة الدنيا ولا يغرنكم بالله الغرور

translation: Surely, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the enmity of Satan towards humans and advises believers to consider him as an enemy. Satan seeks to mislead people and lead them astray from the path of righteousness, ultimately aiming for them to become inhabitants of Hellfire. It serves as a warning to be cautious and aware of the deceptive tactics of Satan, urging believers to seek refuge in Allah and resist the temptations and whispers of the devil.
orig: إن الشيطان لكم عدو فاتخذوه عدوا إنما يدعو حزبه ليكونوا من أصحاب السعير

translation: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, but those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the contrast between the consequences of disbelief and belief in Islam. It highlights the concept that those who reject faith will face severe punishment, while those who have faith and engage in good deeds will be granted forgiveness and a great reward by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and righteousness in the eyes of God, and the promise of divine mercy and rewards for those who uphold their faith and act with goodness.
orig: الذين كفروا لهم عذاب شديد والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة وأجر كبير

translation: Is he whose evil deed is made fairseeming to him so that he thinks it is good, any different from him who knows that it is evil? God leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish out of regret for them; God is aware of all that they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of understanding the difference between good and evil deeds. It warns that some individuals may be misled into thinking that their evil actions are actually good, while others are fully aware of the evil they commit. It reminds believers that it is ultimately God who guides or leads astray individuals according to His will. The believers are advised not to get so disheartened over those who are led astray, as God is fully aware of all their actions and intentions.
orig: أفمن زين له سوء عمله فرآه حسنا فإن الله يضل من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء فلا تذهب نفسك عليهم حسرات إن الله عليم بما يصنعون

translation: And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who has control over all aspects of nature. It emphasizes the cycle of life and death, showing how Allah can bring life back to a barren land. It serves as a reminder of the resurrection and the ultimate power of Allah to bring about life after death.
orig: والله الذي أرسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فسقناه إلى بلد ميت فأحيينا به الأرض بعد موتها كذلك النشور

translation: Whoever desires honor - then to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those will perish.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true honor and dignity come from Allah alone. Good speech and righteous actions are elevated to Allah, indicating that sincerity and good deeds are what bring real honor. On the other hand, those who plot evil will face severe punishment, and their schemes will ultimately fail and be destroyed.
orig: من كان يريد العزة فلله العزة جميعا إليه يصعد الكلم الطيب والعمل الصالح يرفعه والذين يمكرون السيئات لهم عذاب شديد ومكر أولئك هو يبور

translation: And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no long-aged person reaches old age, nor is a diminution being made to his lifespan, but it is in a decree. That is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the magnificent creation of human beings by Allah, describing the stages from creation to birth. It emphasizes that everything related to human life, such as conception, birth, and lifespan, occurs by the will and knowledge of Allah. The verse affirms the divine decree and control that Allah has over every aspect of human existence, portraying the ease with which He orchestrates these processes.
orig: والله خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم جعلكم أزواجا وما تحمل من أنثى ولا تضع إلا بعلمه وما يعمر من معمر ولا ينقص من عمره إلا في كتاب إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: And the two seas are not alike: one is fresh, sweet, pleasant to drink, and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from both of them you eat tender meat and extract ornaments to wear, and you see ships plowing through them so that you may seek His bounty, and be grateful.
interpretation: This verse alludes to the different qualities of two seas and how they are not alike just as how blessings and trials are not alike. It highlights the diversity in Allah's creation and His wisdom in providing sustenance and resources for human benefit. The verse emphasizes seeking Allah's bounty through His creations, recognizing His greatness, and being grateful for His provisions.
orig: وما يستوي البحران هذا عذب فرات سائغ شرابه وهذا ملح أجاج ومن كل تأكلون لحما طريا وتستخرجون حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك فيه مواخر لتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the dominion. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the control and power of Allah over all aspects of creation, emphasizing His ability to seamlessly transition between night and day and to set a specific course for the sun and the moon. It serves as a reminder of Allah's sovereignty and the insignificance of any false deities or idols that people may worship in comparison to His supreme authority.
orig: يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لأجل مسمى ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك والذين تدعون من دونه ما يملكون من قطمير

translation: If you call them, they will not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they will deny your association. And none can inform you like the One Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of calling upon false gods or idols, as they are deaf to prayers and powerless to respond. It warns against associating partners with Allah, as on the Day of Judgment, those who worshipped other than Allah will disown their former beliefs. Only Allah, who is All-Knowing and Aware of all things, can provide true guidance and knowledge.
orig: إن تدعوهم لا يسمعوا دعاءكم ولو سمعوا ما استجابوا لكم ويوم القيامة يكفرون بشرككم ولا ينبئك مثل خبير

translation: O mankind, you are the ones in need of Allah, while Allah is Free of need, Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse reminds mankind of their inherent reliance on Allah for everything, as He is the self-sufficient and praiseworthy. It emphasizes the importance of acknowledging our dependence on Allah and turning to Him for assistance and guidance, recognizing His greatness and perfection.
orig: يا أيها الناس أنتم الفقراء إلى الله والله هو الغني الحميد

translation: If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and authority of Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah has the ability to remove humans and create a new creation if He so wills, showing His ultimate control over all aspects of existence.
orig: إن يشأ يذهبكم ويأت بخلق جديد

translation: And that is not difficult for Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that nothing is too difficult for Allah, as He possesses all power and might. It reassures believers that no matter how challenging a situation may seem, Allah has the ability to overcome it and bring about a solution. It encourages trust in Allah's wisdom and capability to handle any matter.
orig: وما ذلك على الله بعزيز

translation: And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allah is the [final] destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of personal accountability and individual responsibility in Islam. Each person is responsible for their own actions and will not bear the burdens of others on the Day of Judgment. It also highlights the importance of warning and advising those who fear Allah and establish prayer, and encourages self-purification for one's own benefit. Ultimately, the verse reminds believers that the final destination is with Allah, and it is towards Him that all actions and intentions should be directed.
orig: ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى وإن تدع مثقلة إلى حملها لا يحمل منه شيء ولو كان ذا قربى إنما تنذر الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وأقاموا الصلاة ومن تزكى فإنما يتزكى لنفسه وإلى الله المصير

translation: Not equal are the blind and the seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of knowledge, awareness, and understanding. It emphasizes that those who possess insight and understanding are not equal to those who are ignorant or lack understanding. It serves as a reminder to value intellect and enlightenment over ignorance and blindness, whether it be intellectual, spiritual, or moral.
orig: وما يستوي الأعمى والبصير

translation: And neither darkness nor light.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and control of Allah over all aspects of creation; darkness and light are both under His command and nothing can exist or occur beyond His will. It serves as a reminder of Allah's omnipotence and sovereignty over all things.
orig: ولا الظلمات ولا النور

translation: Neither the coolness nor the heat.
interpretation: This verse describes the ultimate comfort and peace that Allah provides to the believers by protecting them from any harm or discomfort, whether it be physical, emotional, or spiritual. It signifies that Allah's mercy encompasses all aspects of a believer's life, shielding them from any extreme conditions or hardships, and providing them with ease and tranquility in all circumstances.
orig: ولا الظل ولا الحرور

translation: Nor are the living equal to the dead. Indeed, Allah makes hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stark difference between the living and the dead, emphasizing that Allah has the power to make hear whomever He chooses, while humans have no control over those who are deceased. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority and power of Allah over all creation.
orig: وما يستوي الأحياء ولا الأموات إن الله يسمع من يشاء وما أنت بمسمع من في القبور

translation: You are only a warner.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a warner to the people. He was sent to warn them of the consequences of their actions and to remind them of God's commandments. It serves as a message that the Prophet's duty was to convey the message of God's guidance and warn the people of the Day of Judgment, rather than forcing them to believe.
orig: إن أنت إلا نذير

translation: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there is no nation but that there has passed within it a warner.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mission of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger sent by Allah to convey the truth to humanity. He is sent to deliver good news to those who believe and follow the guidance but also to warn those who reject the message. It highlights the universal nature of prophethood, mentioning that in every nation there were warners sent by Allah to guide the people towards righteousness. This serves as a reminder of the continuity of divine guidance throughout history and the responsibility of all communities to heed the warnings and follow the guidance provided by the messengers.
orig: إنا أرسلناك بالحق بشيرا ونذيرا وإن من أمة إلا خلا فيها نذير

translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], so did those before them deny. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of rejection faced by the prophets throughout history. Just as the disbelievers deny the message brought by Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), so did the nations before them deny the messengers sent to them with clear evidences, divine scriptures, and enlightenment. It serves as a reminder that the response of disbelief and denial to the Prophets' messages is not new, and it highlights the importance of accepting the guidance brought by the messengers of God.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذب الذين من قبلهم جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وبالزبر وبالكتاب المنير

translation: Then those who disbelieved will be taken to Hell, and it will be said, 'How terrible a settlement!'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the severe punishment awaiting them in Hell, emphasizing the dreadful consequences of their rejection of faith and disobedience to God. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and righteous deeds to avoid the torment of Hell in the hereafter.
orig: ثم أخذت الذين كفروا فكيف كان نكير

translation: Have you not considered that Allah sent down water from the sky and produced thereby fruits of varied colors, and among the mountains are white and red stripes, and diverse in color, and [some] extremely black.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the diversity and beauty of Allah's creation. It highlights how through the provision of water, Allah brings forth a variety of fruits in different colors, and how the mountains also exhibit diversity in their colors and formations. The verse emphasizes the magnificence and creativity of Allah in His creation, urging us to reflect on His power and wisdom.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به ثمرات مختلفا ألوانها ومن الجبال جدد بيض وحمر مختلف ألوانها وغرابيب سود

translation: And among the people, animals, and livestock are varied colors likewise. Only those of His servants who have knowledge fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the diversity in creation, highlighting the variety of colors and forms among people, animals, and livestock as a sign of Allah's creative power. It also underscores the importance of knowledge and understanding in cultivating a true fear of Allah, suggesting that those with knowledge are more likely to be conscious of Allah's grandeur and attributes. And ultimately reminds us that Allah is Mighty and Forgiving, encompassing both power and mercy.
orig: ومن الناس والدواب والأنعام مختلف ألوانه كذلك إنما يخشى الله من عباده العلماء إن الله عزيز غفور

translation: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and openly, [can] hope for a transaction [with Allah] that will never perish.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reciting the Qur'an, establishing regular prayer, and giving charity generously and sincerely. It highlights that those who engage in these acts of worship and righteousness can expect a reward from Allah that will be everlasting and beneficial, symbolizing a spiritual 'transaction' that will bring eternal blessings and rewards.
orig: إن الذين يتلون كتاب الله وأقاموا الصلاة وأنفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية يرجون تجارة لن تبور

translation: So that He may fully reward them for their deeds and give them more out of His bounty. Indeed, He is all-forgiving, appreciative.
interpretation: This verse expresses that Allah will reward His servants for their good deeds and will bless them with even more from His bounty. It emphasizes Allah's qualities of forgiveness and appreciation towards His believers.
orig: ليوفيهم أجورهم ويزيدهم من فضله إنه غفور شكور

translation: And what We have revealed to you of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed, Allah, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin and truth of the Qur'an, stating that it confirms the messages of the previous scriptures. It highlights that Allah is well aware and observant of His servants, their actions, and intentions.
orig: والذي أوحينا إليك من الكتاب هو الحق مصدقا لما بين يديه إن الله بعباده لخبير بصير

translation: Then We gave the Scripture as inheritance to those We have chosen from Our servants. Some of them wrong themselves, some follow a middle course, and some are foremost in good deeds, by Allah’s will. That is the greatest bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Scripture is given as an inheritance to those chosen by Allah from among His servants. It recognizes that among the recipients, there are those who may commit wrongs, some who maintain moderation, and others who excel in performing good deeds with the guidance and permission of Allah. Thus, it emphasizes the importance of striving to excel in good deeds and attributes any success in doing so as being by the will and grace of Allah, underscoring His immense favor upon His servants.
orig: ثم أورثنا الكتاب الذين اصطفينا من عبادنا فمنهم ظالم لنفسه ومنهم مقتصد ومنهم سابق بالخيرات بإذن الله ذلك هو الفضل الكبير

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
interpretation: This verse describes the Paradise promised to the believers. It portrays a picture of a beautiful and luxurious afterlife filled with everlasting bliss and comfort. The mention of gardens, gold, pearls, and silk signifies the abundance and extravagance that await the righteous in the Hereafter. It symbolizes the rewards and pleasures that Allah has prepared for those who adhere to faith and righteousness in this life.
orig: جنات عدن يدخلونها يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

translation: And they will say, 'Praise to Allah, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -
interpretation: This verse is a reminder for believers to express gratitude towards Allah for alleviating their sorrows and difficulties. It highlights the importance of acknowledging Allah's mercy and favors upon His servants. The verse emphasizes Allah's attributes of forgiveness and gratitude towards His creation, encouraging believers to have faith in His continuous blessings and to always be thankful.
orig: وقالوا الحمد لله الذي أذهب عنا الحزن إن ربنا لغفور شكور

translation: The One who has made lawful to you the Sacred House, and the sacrificial animals, their garlands, and those who flock to the Sacred House in seasons of peace. As they vie with one another in loving service.Most certainly this is in order that one may know that Allah knows all that is in the heavens and the earth, and that Allah has full knowledge of all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings and provisions bestowed upon the believers by Allah, including allowing access to the Sacred House (Kaaba) for worship and the performance of religious duties without fear or hindrance. It emphasizes the importance of knowing that Allah has full knowledge of everything in the heavens and the earth, and encourages believers to engage in acts of devotion and service with sincerity and diligence.
orig: الذي أحلنا دار المقامة من فضله لا يمسنا فيها نصب ولا يمسنا فيها لغوب

translation: And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment awaiting those who disbelieve in the hereafter. It highlights the severity of the punishment, emphasizing that death will not come to them as a relief from the torment of Hell, and that their suffering will not be eased. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of ingratitude and disbelief in Allah's message.
orig: والذين كفروا لهم نار جهنم لا يقضى عليهم فيموتوا ولا يخفف عنهم من عذابها كذلك نجزي كل كفور

translation: And they will scream therein, "Our Lord, bring us out; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" Did We not grant you a life long enough for whoever would be reminded therein to be reminded, and there came to you the Warner? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights a scene from the Day of Judgment where the disbelievers and wrongdoers, upon facing the consequences of their deeds, will desperately plead to be given another chance to do good deeds. However, at that point, it will be too late, as they had been given more than enough time and warnings in the worldly life to make the right choices. The verse serves as a reminder that it is crucial for individuals to heed the warnings and reminders provided to them in this world, and to actively seek forgiveness and righteousness before it is too late.
orig: وهم يصطرخون فيها ربنا أخرجنا نعمل صالحا غير الذي كنا نعمل أولم نعمركم ما يتذكر فيه من تذكر وجاءكم النذير فذوقوا فما للظالمين من نصير

translation: Verily, Allah knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the profound knowledge and awareness of Allah, as He is fully aware of all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth, as well as the innermost thoughts and feelings of people. It serves as a reminder of Allah's all-encompassing knowledge and wisdom.
orig: إن الله عالم غيب السماوات والأرض إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah who has appointed human beings as successors on earth. It warns that those who reject faith will bear the consequences of their unbelief. The disbelief of the disbelievers only leads to their own detriment and does not increase their status in the sight of Allah, rather it only deepens their hatred and loss.
orig: هو الذي جعلكم خلائف في الأرض فمن كفر فعليه كفره ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم عند ربهم إلا مقتا ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم إلا خسارا

translation: Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth, or do they have partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a scripture so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? No, [the fact is that], the wrongdoers do promise each other nothing but delusion."
interpretation: This verse questions the belief in idols and false gods, asking for proof of their power or authority. It points out the falsehood in worshiping anything other than Allah and emphasizes that such practices are merely delusions created by wrongdoers.
orig: قل أرأيتم شركاءكم الذين تدعون من دون الله أروني ماذا خلقوا من الأرض أم لهم شرك في السماوات أم آتيناهم كتابا فهم على بينت منه بل إن يعد الظالمون بعضهم بعضا إلا غرورا

translation: Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power of Allah in maintaining the order of the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that if Allah were to release His hold on them, there would be no one capable of sustaining their existence. The attributes of Allah mentioned in this verse, 'Halim' (Forbearing) and 'Ghafur' (Forgiving), indicate His patience and mercy towards His creation despite their shortcomings and sins.
orig: إن الله يمسك السماوات والأرض أن تزولا ولئن زالتا إن أمسكهما من أحد من بعده إنه كان حليما غفورا

translation: And they swore by Allah their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than any of the other nations. But when a warner did come to them, it only increased their aversion,
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of certain people who claim that they would be more receptive to guidance if a warner were to come to them. However, when the warner does come, instead of accepting the guidance, they reject it further out of pride and disbelief.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن جاءهم نذير ليكونن أهدى من إحدى الأمم فلما جاءهم نذير ما زادهم إلا نفورا

translation: Out of arrogance on earth and plotting evil. But the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration.
interpretation: This verse warns against arrogance and evil plotting, emphasizing that such schemes only harm those who initiate them. It questions whether people are waiting for anything other than the consequences faced by those before them who followed a similar path. The verse reaffirms that the way of Allah remains constant and unchanging, indicating that His laws and justice are unwavering and immutable.
orig: استكبارا في الأرض ومكر السيئ ولا يحيق المكر السيئ إلا بأهله فهل ينظرون إلا سنت الأولين فلن تجد لسنت الله تبديلا ولن تجد لسنت الله تحويلا

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength, and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidences. And Allah would not have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to reflect on the lessons from history by observing the outcomes of those who came before them. It emphasizes that despite the might and progress of previous nations, they were still subject to the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that Allah, the All-Knowing and All-Powerful, does not wrong anyone, but it is individuals who wrong themselves through their actions and decisions.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم وكانوا أشد منهم قوة وما كان الله ليعجزه من شيء في السماوات ولا في الأرض إنه كان عليما قديرا

translation: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy and wisdom of Allah in giving people time and delaying their accountability for their deeds until a specified time. It indicates that Allah knows all that His servants do and is well aware of their actions. It reminds believers that they should be mindful of their deeds as they are accountable for them in front of Allah.
orig: ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بما كسبوا ما ترك على ظهرها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم إلى أجل مسمى فإذا جاء أجلهم فإن الله كان بعباده بصيرا

translation: Yasin.
interpretation: This verse is the beginning of Surah Yasin in the Qur'an. The chapter is named after the Arabic letters 'Yasin'. This chapter is often recited for its numerous blessings and rewards, and it serves as a reminder of the importance of faith, guidance, and the message brought by the prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It is a chapter that emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the signs of Allah, the inevitability of death and resurrection, and the truth of the Quranic message.
orig: يس

translation: And the Wise Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an as being full of wisdom and knowledge. It emphasizes that the Qur'an is not just a book of stories or regulations, but it is a source of profound wisdom and guidance for humanity. Believers are encouraged to reflect on the wisdom and guidance contained in the Qur'an to benefit from its teachings.
orig: والقرآن الحكيم

translation: Indeed, you are of the messengers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is among the messengers sent by Allah. It emphasizes his noble and elevated status as a messenger of God, chosen to convey the message of Islam to humanity. It reinforces the importance of following the guidance brought by the messengers and the significance of their role in delivering the divine message to mankind.
orig: إنك لمن المرسلين

translation: on a straight path
interpretation: This verse refers to the belief that Allah guides those who follow His teachings and stay on the right path. It emphasizes the importance of remaining steadfast and righteous in one's faith and actions, leading to the ultimate goal of attaining Allah's pleasure and paradise in the afterlife.
orig: على صراط مستقيم

translation: The revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an is a divine revelation sent down by Allah, who is Exalted in Might and Merciful. It emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah, highlighting these qualities as essential aspects of His nature. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's sovereignty and compassion, setting the tone for the reader to approach the Qur'an with reverence and humility.
orig: تنزيل العزيز الرحيم

translation: So that you may warn a people whose ancestors were not warned, so they are unaware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of warning people who have not received guidance before. It emphasizes the need to communicate the message clearly to those who may be unaware or heedless of it. It serves as a reminder of the duty to convey the message of truth to others, irrespective of their past knowledge or beliefs.
orig: لتنذر قوما ما أنذر آباؤهم فهم غافلون

translation: The word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the truth has been revealed to most people, but they still choose not to believe. It highlights the concept that belief is a choice and despite being presented with evidence or truth, some individuals may still choose to reject it.
orig: لقد حق القول على أكثرهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Verily, We have set upon their necks shackles reaching their chins so that their heads are raised up.
interpretation: This verse describes the arrogance and pride of some individuals who are burdened with the weight of their sins and wrongdoings, depicted as heavy shackles on their necks that prevent them from humbling themselves. Despite the burden, they remain stubborn and arrogant, lifting their heads high in defiance instead of repenting and seeking forgiveness.
orig: إنا جعلنا في أعناقهم أغلالا فهي إلى الأذقان فهم مقمحون

translation: And We placed before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
interpretation: This verse describes a situation where some individuals are spiritually blinded and unable to see the truth, as barriers have been placed in front and behind them, preventing them from discerning the reality. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from the guidance of Allah and emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and insight to avoid falling into blindness and ignorance.
orig: وجعلنا من بين أيديهم سدا ومن خلفهم سدا فأغشيناهم فهم لا يبصرون

translation: And whether you warn them or you do not warn them, they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that guidance ultimately comes from Allah, and no matter how much a messenger may warn or preach to the disbelievers, it is up to Allah to open their hearts to faith. It serves as a reminder to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that his duty is to deliver the message, but he cannot force people to believe, as belief is a matter of the heart and is ultimately in Allah's control.
orig: وسواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: You only warn those who follow the message and fear the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that warnings and reminders are effective only for those who follow the guidance of the Qur'an and have piety towards Allah, even when they are not seen by others. To such individuals, the believer should convey the good news of forgiveness and a generous reward from Allah.
orig: إنما تنذر من اتبع الذكر وخشي الرحمن بالغيب فبشره بمغفرة وأجر كريم

translation: Verily, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah as the one who grants life and brings death. It also highlights the concept of Allah inheriting all that people leave behind, indicating His ultimate ownership and control over everything. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's supreme power and dominion over all creation.
orig: إنا نحن نحيي الموتى ونكتب ما قدموا وآثارهم وكل شيء أحصيناه في إمام مبين

translation: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to them.
interpretation: This verse is calling for reflection on the fate of previous communities who rejected the messengers sent by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the truth and the importance of heeding the message brought by the messengers of Allah.
orig: واضرب لهم مثلا أصحاب القرية إذ جاءها المرسلون

translation: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, 'Indeed, we are messengers to you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of resilience in the face of opposition and rejection. Even when the messengers were denied by the people, Allah reinforced them and they remained steadfast in their mission to convey the message. It signifies the importance of perseverance and determination in the face of adversity and the ultimate trust in Allah's support.
orig: إذ أرسلنا إليهم اثنين فكذبوهما فعززنا بثالث فقالوا إنا إليكم مرسلون

translation: They said, 'You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the response of disbelievers to the Prophets, denying their message and claiming that they are human like themselves and that God has not revealed anything to them. The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who reject the truth and refuse to acknowledge the signs of God.
orig: قالوا ما أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا وما أنزل الرحمن من شيء إن أنتم إلا تكذبون

translation: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,"
interpretation: This verse reflects the response of the messengers sent by Allah to the disbelievers. It conveys their acknowledgment that Allah, their Lord, is aware of their mission and purpose as messengers. It highlights the prophets' unwavering commitment to delivering the message despite facing rejection and opposition from the people they were sent to.
orig: قالوا ربنا يعلم إنا إليكم لمرسلون

translation: And upon us is not but clear notification.
interpretation: This verse refers to the duty of conveying the message clearly and openly. It emphasizes the obligation to proclaim the message of Islam in a lucid and understandable manner, without hiding or distorting it. The responsibility lies in delivering the message clearly, while the acceptance or rejection of it is up to the individual. It highlights the importance of communication and dissemination of knowledge with clarity and transparency.
orig: وما علينا إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: They said, 'We consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will touch you, from us, a painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the resistance faced by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from the disbelievers of his time. The rejection and hostility towards the message he was delivering led to threats of physical harm and punishment. It serves as a reminder of the challenges faced by the Prophet and his followers in spreading the message of Islam, and the resilience needed in the face of opposition.
orig: قالوا إنا تطيرنا بكم لئن لم تنتهوا لنرجمنكم وليمسنكم منا عذاب أليم

translation: They said, 'Your omen is with you. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people.'
interpretation: In this verse, the disbelievers mockingly comment on the presence of the Prophet Muhammad's companions with him as if their presence would bring bad luck or misfortune. The disbelievers refuse to believe and argue that the companions being with the Prophet will not bring any benefit or guidance because they themselves are extravagant and transgress the boundaries set by Allah. This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers who are unwilling to accept the truth even when presented with clear signs and guidance.
orig: قالوا طائركم معكم أئن ذكرتم بل أنتم قوم مسرفون

translation: And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, 'O my people, follow the messengers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of a man who hurried to deliver a message to his people, urging them to follow the messengers sent by God. It emphasizes the importance of listening to the guidance brought by the messengers and the urgency in conveying the message to others.
orig: وجاء من أقصى المدينة رجل يسعى قال يا قوم اتبعوا المرسلين

translation: Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes following and taking guidance from those who do not seek any material gain or reward from their guidance. It highlights the importance of seeking guidance from those who are sincere and selfless in their teaching, as they are more likely to lead one towards the right path. It promotes the idea of following those who sincerely seek to help others without any ulterior motives.
orig: اتبعوا من لا يسألكم أجرا وهم مهتدون

translation: And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
interpretation: This verse highlights the natural inclination towards worshipping the Creator and the ultimate return to Him. It questions the logic of not worshipping Allah, the one who created us and to whom all of us will eventually return for judgment. It serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing and appreciating the Creator and worshipping Him alone.
orig: وما لي لا أعبد الذي فطرني وإليه ترجعون

translation: Do they take for worship gods besides Him? If they had power to help them, the beneficent would indeed be in difficulty for the help-seekers. Verily, you align nothing that can save them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of seeking help or protection from any other gods besides the one true God. It highlights that even if people worship other deities, those deities hold no power to save or intercede on behalf of their worshippers. The verse serves as a reminder to rely solely on Allah for help and protection as He is the ultimate source of aid.
orig: أأتخذ من دونه آلهة إن يردن الرحمن بضر لا تغن عني شفاعتهم شيئا ولا ينقذون

translation: Verily, I am in clear error.
interpretation: This verse expresses a sentiment of self-awareness and admission of one's own error and misguidance. It serves as a reminder for self-reflection and seeking guidance to rectify one's path towards the right way.
orig: إني إذا لفي ضلال مبين

translation: Surely, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having faith in one's Lord and encourages people to listen attentively to the message being conveyed. It underscores the significance of faith as the foundation for receiving guidance and wisdom.
orig: إني آمنت بربكم فاسمعون

translation: It will be said, 'Enter Paradise.' He will say, 'I wish my people could know'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret of a person who entered Paradise realizing that they wish their people had known the way to attain Paradise as well. It emphasizes the feeling of empathy and care for others' well-being, even after attaining personal success or salvation.
orig: قيل ادخل الجنة قال يا ليت قومي يعلمون

translation: With what my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honored ones.
interpretation: This verse expresses gratitude to God for His forgiveness and for the honor He has bestowed upon the speaker. It emphasizes the importance of acknowledging God's mercy and blessings, as well as recognizing one's elevated status as a result of God's grace.
orig: بما غفر لي ربي وجعلني من المكرمين

translation: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that after a prophet's time, no armies or soldiers will be sent down from heaven to aid or support the people. It highlights the principle that divine help and guidance come through following the teachings and guidance provided by the prophets and their scriptures. It also serves as a reminder that people are responsible for their own actions and should not rely on miraculous interventions from heaven.
orig: وما أنزلنا على قومه من بعده من جند من السماء وما كنا منزلين

translation: If there were to be but one blast, lo, they will all be brought before Us.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of the Day of Judgment, where all of humanity will be resurrected and brought before Allah for their deeds and actions in this world. It highlights the power and authority of Allah in determining the fate of all beings.
orig: إن كانت إلا صيحة واحدة فإذا هم خامدون
