translation: What a sorrow is upon the servants! There does not come to them a messenger but they mock him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unfortunate behavior of some people who mock and ridicule the messengers sent by Allah to guide them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the message brought by the messengers and the importance of showing respect and sincerity towards the divine guidance.
orig: يا حسرة على العباد ما يأتيهم من رسول إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Have they not seen how many generations We have destroyed before them? Surely, they will never return to them.
interpretation: This verse is reminding the disbelievers of the past nations who were destroyed due to their disobedience and rebellion against Allah. It serves as a warning that those who reject the truth and continue on a path of wrongdoing will face a similar fate, and there will be no turning back or escape for them once the punishment is decreed.
orig: ألم يروا كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون أنهم إليهم لا يرجعون

translation: And indeed, all [of us] will be brought present.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every human being will ultimately be presented before Allah for judgment. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Resurrection when everyone will be held accountable for their deeds and actions, highlighting the importance of leading a conscientious and righteous life.
orig: وإن كل لما جميع لدينا محضرون

translation: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of Allah to bring life to dead land, allowing crops to grow and sustain life. It is a reminder of the Creator's ability to transform what seems lifeless into a source of sustenance, and it serves as a sign of His great power and mercy.
orig: وآية لهم الأرض الميتة أحييناها وأخرجنا منها حبا فمنه يأكلون

translation: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs,
interpretation: This verse describes the abundant blessings and provisions that Allah has provided in the earth for mankind, including gardens of palm trees and grapevines, which are sources of sustenance and beauty. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and generosity in creating a world that is rich in resources and delights for humans to enjoy.
orig: وجعلنا فيها جنات من نخيل وأعناب وفجرنا فيها من العيون

translation: So let them eat of His fruit and give thanks to Him for what He has created.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the act of gratitude towards God for the provisions He has created for humans to consume. It highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings and sustenance provided by God, encouraging believers to be grateful and express thanks for the many gifts they have been given.
orig: ليأكلوا من ثمره وما عملته أيديهم أفلا يشكرون

translation: Glory be to Him Who has created all the pairs of that which the earth produces, as well as themselves, and other things of which they have no knowledge.
interpretation: This verse praises and glorifies Allah, the Creator, who has designed and created all things in pairs - such as plants, animals, and humans. It emphasizes the complexity and diversity in creation and acknowledges that there are aspects of creation and the wisdom behind it that human knowledge cannot fully comprehend.
orig: سبحان الذي خلق الأزواج كلها مما تنبت الأرض ومن أنفسهم ومما لا يعلمون

translation: And a sign for them is the night. We remove from it [the light of] the day, so they are [left] in darkness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the alternation of night and day as a sign of Allah's power and wisdom. It shows how the cycle of day and night is a manifestation of God's control over the universe, his ability to bring light and darkness, and a reminder of the transient nature of life. It signifies that just as day follows night, and night follows day, our lives also have periods of ease and hardship, with the darkness of difficulty eventually leading to the light of ease.
orig: وآية لهم الليل نسلخ منه النهار فإذا هم مظلمون

translation: And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the precise and orderly nature of the universe, with the sun moving in a designated path towards its appointed place. It reflects the power and wisdom of Allah, who has full knowledge and control over all things in the universe.
orig: والشمس تجري لمستقر لها ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: And We have appointed the moon in its phases until it returns like an old date stalk.
interpretation: Allah, in His infinite wisdom and power, has set the moon in its stages and orbits, and it continues to follow these precise patterns established by Him. Just as a date stalk returns to its old form after being old and withered, the moon also follows a cycle that repeats itself. This cycle is a reminder of the magnificence of Allah's creation and His control over the universe.
orig: والقمر قدرناه منازل حتى عاد كالعرجون القديم

translation: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outrun the day. All float in an orbit.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the perfect order and design in the universe, highlighting the set course and balance established by Allah. The verse points to the laws of nature and the harmony in the celestial bodies' movements, indicating that everything in the universe is following a precise and predetermined path set by the Creator.
orig: لا الشمس ينبغي لها أن تدرك القمر ولا الليل سابق النهار وكل في فلك يسبحون

translation: And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden ship.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the great mercy and power of Allah by highlighting the example of how He saved the offspring of Noah and other believers during the great flood by carrying them in the laden ship. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to protect and guide those who believe in Him, even in the face of immense challenges and peril.
orig: وآية لهم أنا حملنا ذريتهم في الفلك المشحون

translation: And We created for them from the likes of it that on which they ride.
interpretation: This verse refers to how Allah has created animals and other means of transportation for humans to ride on. It highlights the mercy and blessings of Allah by providing humans with various resources and means of travel.
orig: وخلقنا لهم من مثله ما يركبون

translation: And if We will, We can drown them; then there will be no one to respond to their cry for help, nor will they be saved.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the absolute power and authority of Allah, stating that if He wanted, He could cause destruction and no one would be able to prevent it or save themselves. It serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing and submitting to the will of Allah, as He holds total control over all matters.
orig: وإن نشأ نغرقهم فلا صريخ لهم ولا هم ينقذون

translation: Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.
interpretation: This verse highlights that all blessings and provisions are ultimately from Allah out of His mercy and intention for a specific period of time. It serves as a reminder for believers to be grateful for the blessings they receive, as they are a result of Allah's mercy and generosity towards His creation.
orig: إلا رحمة منا ومتاعا إلى حين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Fear what is before you and what is behind you that you may receive mercy.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being mindful of the consequences of our actions and being conscious of Allah's presence at all times. It serves as a reminder to be cautious of our past deeds and to be mindful of our future actions in order to seek Allah's mercy and blessings.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتقوا ما بين أيديكم وما خلفكم لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And they do not come to them any of the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it.
interpretation: This verse talks about the disbelievers who turn away from the signs and evidences of Allah that are presented to them. Despite the signs of Allah being evident and clear, they choose to ignore them and reject the truth. It highlights the importance of being receptive to the signs of Allah and not turning away from them.
orig: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Spend of that with which Allah has provided you,' those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Should we feed those whom, if Allah willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of the disbelievers towards providing for others. They question the necessity of sharing their provisions with those in need, indicating a lack of understanding of the concept of charity and relying solely on Allah's will. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of giving charity as a means of fulfilling one's duty towards those less fortunate, regardless of personal opinions or doubts.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم أنفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أنطعم من لو يشاء الله أطعمه إن أنتم إلا في ضلال مبين

translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mockingly ask when the promised Day of Judgment will come. The disbelievers question the truth behind the promise of resurrection and judgment, showing their doubt and arrogance. The verse serves as a reminder to have faith and patience in the fulfillment of God's promises.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: They await but one blast which will seize them while they dispute.
interpretation: This verse highlights the sudden and inevitable nature of death and the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes that despite their disputes and arguments in this world, all people will eventually face the reality of death and be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of life and the importance of preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: ما ينظرون إلا صيحة واحدة تأخذهم وهم يخصمون

translation: So they will not be able to make a will, nor will they return to their people.
interpretation: This verse indicates the ultimate powerlessness and isolation of disbelievers in the Hereafter. They will not have the ability to make any bequests or return to their families, emphasizing their state of despair and lack of support in the afterlife due to their rejection of faith.
orig: فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا إلى أهلهم يرجعون

translation: And the Horn will be blown; and behold, they will rush out of their graves towards their Lord.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the trumpet will be blown, signifying the end of the world and the resurrection of all people. At that moment, all human beings will come out of their graves swiftly, heading towards their Lord for accountability and judgment. It signifies the certainty of resurrection and the Day of Reckoning when everyone will be brought back to life to face the consequences of their deeds.
orig: ونفخ في الصور فإذا هم من الأجداث إلى ربهم ينسلون

translation: They will say, 'O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping-place?' This is what the Most Merciful had promised and the messengers spoke truth!
interpretation: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will express regret and dismay at being resurrected from their graves. It highlights the certainty of the promise of resurrection made by Allah, the Most Merciful, and reaffirms the truthfulness of the message brought by the messengers sent by Allah.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا من بعثنا من مرقدنا هذا ما وعد الرحمن وصدق المرسلون

translation: If there should be only one blast, then when they see it coming from a far place, they will begin to dispute among themselves.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the Day of Judgment, highlighting that when the final Hour approaches, all disputes will cease, and everyone will be gathered before Allah for judgment. It serves as a reminder of the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection and the accountability that awaits every individual for their deeds in this world.
orig: إن كانت إلا صيحة واحدة فإذا هم جميع لدينا محضرون

translation: So today, no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, every individual will be judged fairly and their deeds will be accounted for accurately. There will be no injustice done to anyone, as every person will be recompensed based on their own actions and intentions in this world. It highlights the belief in divine justice and accountability in the afterlife, emphasizing the importance of leading a righteous life and being aware of one's actions.
orig: فاليوم لا تظلم نفس شيئا ولا تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: Indeed, the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the state of the people of Paradise on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing their joyful and content state as they are engaged in delightful activities. It depicts a picture of ultimate happiness and satisfaction in the afterlife for those who have been rewarded with entry into Paradise.
orig: إن أصحاب الجنة اليوم في شغل فاكهون

translation: They and their spouses will be in shade, reclining on adorned couches.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in Paradise where the believers and their spouses will enjoy a peaceful and luxurious life, reclining in the shade and comfort of beautifully decorated couches. It symbolizes the ultimate reward and tranquility awaiting the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: هم وأزواجهم في ظلال على الأرائك متكئون

translation: They will have fruits therein, and they will have whatever they call for.
interpretation: In Paradise, believers will be rewarded with fruits and everything they desire and ask for. This verse highlights the unlimited and fulfilling rewards awaiting those who believe and obey God's commandments.
orig: لهم فيها فاكهة ولهم ما يدعون

translation: Peace, a word from a Merciful Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that peace is a gift and a blessing that comes from the Most Merciful God. It serves as a reminder that tranquility and harmony are characteristics of God's mercy, and believers should strive to embody peace in their lives and interactions with others.
orig: سلام قولا من رب رحيم

translation: And today you are distinguished, [O disbelievers]!
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that a day will come where the disbelievers will be clearly distinguished and separated from the believers based on their deeds and beliefs. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when everyone will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وامتازوا اليوم أيها المجرمون

translation: Have I not made a covenant with you, O children of Adam, that you should not worship Satan? Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse reminds the children of Adam of the covenant made with them by Allah, emphasizing the prohibition of worshiping Satan. It serves as a warning that Satan is a visible and open enemy to humanity, constantly trying to lead them astray from the path of righteousness and obedience to Allah. By abstaining from worshiping Satan and adhering to the teachings of Islam, one can protect themselves from his deception and harm.
orig: ألم أعهد إليكم يا بني آدم أن لا تعبدوا الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: And that you worship Me, this is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the importance of worshiping only Allah. It emphasizes that worshiping Allah is the straight path that leads to righteousness and guidance. The verse stresses the fundamental principle of monotheism and the exclusive devotion to Allah, which serves as a guidance for believers in their lives.
orig: وأن اعبدوني هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: And We have certainly misled many among you. So, did you not use your reason?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder for believers to reflect upon their actions and decisions, urging them to use their intellect and reasoning. It highlights the importance of critical thinking and making sound judgments in order to avoid being led astray.
orig: ولقد أضل منكم جبلا كثيرا أفلم تكونوا تعقلون

translation: This is Hell which you were promised.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to people about the consequences of their actions, warning them of the reality of Hell that they were informed about. It emphasizes the accountability of individuals for their deeds and the importance of striving towards righteousness to avoid punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: هذه جهنم التي كنتم توعدون

translation: Perform it (prayer) today, with what you used to disbelieve in.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prayer regardless of past behavior or beliefs. It reminds believers that they should not let their previous shortcomings or lack of faith prevent them from fulfilling their religious obligations. It serves as a call to action, urging believers to engage in prayer sincerely and wholeheartedly, regardless of their past mistakes or doubts.
orig: اصلوها اليوم بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Today, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that on the Day of Judgment, various body parts of individuals will bear witness about their deeds, as their mouths, hands, and feet will speak and testify against them, revealing the truth of their actions and intentions. It serves as a reminder of the accountability everyone will face for their deeds in the afterlife.
orig: اليوم نختم على أفواههم وتكلمنا أيديهم وتشهد أرجلهم بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, so they would race to [find] the path, but how could they see?
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of guidance and insight. It explains that Allah has the power to remove the ability to perceive guidance from those who reject it. Even if a clear path is presented to them, they would not be able to see it due to their blindness to the truth. It emphasizes that true vision and perception come from accepting guidance with humility and understanding, and rejecting guidance can lead one to spiritual blindness and ignorance.
orig: ولو نشاء لطمسنا على أعينهم فاستبقوا الصراط فأنى يبصرون

translation: And if We willed, We could have deformed them in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah, stating that if He wished, He could alter the physical appearance or abilities of people, preventing them from moving forward or returning. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate control that Allah has over all aspects of creation, highlighting His ability to enforce His will as He sees fit.
orig: ولو نشاء لمسخناهم على مكانتهم فما استطاعوا مضيا ولا يرجعون

translation: And Him Who created you the first time shall you be brought back.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the power and wisdom of Allah, the One who created them in the first place and will bring them back to life after death for accountability. It serves as a call for reflection on the signs of Allah's existence and the importance of rational thinking and understanding His intricate design in creation.
orig: ومن نعمره ننكسه في الخلق أفلا يعقلون

translation: And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it suitable for him. This is not but a reminder and a clear Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is not a product of poetry or human invention, rather it is a divine reminder and a clear scripture sent down by Allah. It highlights the unique and miraculous nature of the Qur'an as a guidance for mankind.
orig: وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له إن هو إلا ذكر وقرآن مبين

translation: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Quran as a means of warning and admonition for those who are alive and as a justification for holding the disbelievers accountable for their denial of the truth. It highlights the importance of reflecting on the teachings of the Quran and using it as a guide for moral and spiritual conduct.
orig: لينذر من كان حيا ويحق القول على الكافرين

translation: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?
interpretation: This verse highlights the evidence of God's existence and power through the creation of grazing livestock, which serve as sustenance and benefit for humans. It emphasizes the notion of ownership as a reminder that all creatures are ultimately under the control and provision of Allah, and should be treated with care and gratitude.
orig: أولم يروا أنا خلقنا لهم مما عملت أيدينا أنعاما فهم لها مالكون

translation: And We have subjected it to them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
interpretation: This verse is pointing out how Allah has made certain animals submissive and useful to mankind for riding and as a source of food. It highlights the concept of animals being provided for human use as a sign of divine mercy and provision.
orig: وذللناها لهم فمنها ركوبهم ومنها يأكلون

translation: And they have therein benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an points to the luxuries and blessings that God has provided to humans in this world. It questions why people would not be grateful for the numerous benefits and provisions they have been bestowed with, urging them to reflect on and appreciate the countless favors of God.
orig: ولهم فيها منافع ومشارب أفلا يشكرون

translation: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they might be helped.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wrongful act of associating partners with Allah by worshiping other gods in hopes of receiving help or support. It emphasizes the concept of Tawheed (Islamic monotheism) and warns against shirk (associating partners with Allah), which is considered a major sin in Islam.
orig: واتخذوا من دون الله آلهة لعلهم ينصرون

translation: They will not be able to help them, and they will be for them soldiers brought [to account].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who people may seek for help in times of difficulty or need, will ultimately not be able to provide any assistance. Only Allah holds power and control over all matters, and all individuals, no matter their status or strength, will be held accountable by Him.
orig: لا يستطيعون نصرهم وهم لهم جند محضرون

translation: So do not let their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers not to be saddened or affected by the negative words or actions of others. Allah assures that He knows everything - what people try to hide and what they openly reveal. It serves as a comforting reminder that Allah sees all and knows all, and ultimately it is His judgment that matters.
orig: فلا يحزنك قولهم إنا نعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون

translation: Does man not see that We created him from a drop? Yet behold, he is an open adversary!
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and ingratitude of mankind towards their Creator. It serves as a reminder that human beings are created from a humble origin, a mere drop of fluid, and despite this, they often show enmity and defiance towards God. It calls for reflection on our own existence and the miraculous creation that we are, urging us to show humility and gratitude instead of being adversarial towards the divine.
orig: أولم ير الإنسان أنا خلقناه من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين

translation: And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, 'Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance of those who deny the resurrection and mock the idea of life after death. It emphasizes how easy it is for Allah to bring the dead back to life, just as He brought them into existence in the first place. It serves as a reminder of the power and capability of Allah in resurrecting the dead, and as a warning to those who doubt His ability to do so.
orig: وضرب لنا مثلا ونسي خلقه قال من يحيي العظام وهي رميم

translation: Say, 'He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of resurrection and emphasizes the belief in the power of Allah to bring back to life after death. It also emphasizes Allah's knowledge and mastery over all of creation.
orig: قل يحييها الذي أنشأها أول مرة وهو بكل خلق عليم

translation: He who made for you from the green trees, fire, and then from it you ignite.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the power and capability of Allah in creating fire from green trees. It emphasizes the contrast and wonder of how something as peaceful as a green tree can transform into a force as powerful and potentially destructive as fire. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to bring forth both life-sustaining and destructive elements from the same source, showcasing His ultimate control over all things.
orig: الذي جعل لكم من الشجر الأخضر نارا فإذا أنتم منه توقدون

translation: Is not He (God) Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yes, indeed! for He is the Creator, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and knowledge of God, emphasizing that if He created the vast heavens and the earth, then surely He is capable of creating the like of them. It serves as a reminder of God's unmatched abilities as the Creator and the All-Knowing, instilling awe and reverence for His magnificence.
orig: أوليس الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بقادر على أن يخلق مثلهم بلى وهو الخلاق العليم

translation: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute power and authority of Allah, indicating that His command is immediate and effective. When He wills something to come into existence, He simply says 'Be,' and it comes into being. This verse emphasizes the miraculous and instantaneous creation by the mere will of Allah.
orig: إنما أمره إذا أراد شيئا أن يقول له كن فيكون

translation: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute and complete authority of Allah over all creation. It emphasizes that every aspect of the universe is under His control. The verse also serves as a reminder of the ultimate truth that all beings will return to Allah in the Hereafter, where they will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: فسبحان الذي بيده ملكوت كل شيء وإليه ترجعون

translation: By those [angels] lined up in rows,
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels standing in perfect and organized rows, ready to carry out the commands of Allah. It emphasizes the precision, order, and unity among the angels as they fulfill their duties in the cosmic realm.
orig: والصافات صفا

translation: So the drivers driving.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the severe punishment that awaits the wrongdoers, who will be driven forcefully and mercilessly towards their ultimate destination. The imagery conveys the idea that there will be no escape from the consequences of their actions.
orig: فالزاجرات زجرا

translation: So let the one who wills remember it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the freedom of choice given to every individual to remember the teachings of the Qur'an. It highlights the importance of personal responsibility in seeking and retaining knowledge, encouraging individuals to actively engage with the scripture and reflect upon its guidance.
orig: فالتاليات ذكرا

translation: Verily, your God is One.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the oneness and uniqueness of God. It serves as a reminder to believers that there is only one true God who is worthy of worship and that He is indivisible, without partners or associates.
orig: إن إلهكم لواحد

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them; Lord of the easts.
interpretation: This verse highlights the supreme power and authority of Allah as the Lord and Creator of the entire universe. It emphasizes that Allah is not only the Lord of the heavens and the earth but also of everything in between and every direction, symbolizing His omnipotence and dominion over all creation.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما ورب المشارق

translation: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars.
interpretation: This verse highlights the beauty and magnificence of the stars in the nearest heaven. It serves as a reminder of the wonders of creation and the power of Allah to decorate the skies with heavenly bodies, providing light and guidance in the darkness of the night.
orig: إنا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب

translation: And [We have appointed] guards to protect him from every devil driven away.
interpretation: This verse mentions that Allah has assigned guards to protect us from every rebellious devil. It highlights the concept of spiritual protection and guidance provided by Allah to believers, shielding them from evil influences and negative forces.
orig: وحفظا من كل شيطان مارد

translation: They cannot listen to the highest assembly and they are pelted from every side,
interpretation: This verse describes those who have turned away from the guidance of Allah and the teachings of the Qur'an. They are deprived of the ability to receive guidance from the highest assembly of angels and are surrounded by negative influences and temptations from all directions, leading them further away from the path of truth and righteousness.
orig: لا يسمعون إلى الملإ الأعلى ويقذفون من كل جانب

translation: And for them is a punishment in the Hereafter, and indeed, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that those who turn away from the guidance and teachings of Allah will face punishment in the Hereafter. The verse serves as a warning to believers and non-believers alike, reminding them of the consequences of their actions in the afterlife. It highlights the severity of the punishment awaiting those who reject the truth and choose to disobey Allah, in comparison to any difficulties or trials they may face in this life.
orig: دحورا ولهم عذاب واصب

translation: Except for those [poets] who snatch away [people's words] but then are pursued by a piercing flame.
interpretation: This verse is describing the fate of poets who deceive others with their words and lies. They may try to snatch away the attention and admiration of people with their eloquence, but they will ultimately be pursued by a piercing flame, suggesting a punishment for their deceit and manipulation.
orig: إلا من خطف الخطفة فأتبعه شهاب ثاقب

translation: So ask them, [O Muhammad], are they a stronger or more difficult creation or those [others] We have created? Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the power of Allah in creating humans from humble materials like clay, and it challenges the disbelievers to ponder over their own creation and the creations of other beings to realize the truth and wisdom in the creation of mankind.
orig: فاستفتهم أهم أشد خلقا أم من خلقنا إنا خلقناهم من طين لازب

translation: Nay, they are amazed that a warner has come to them, and the disbelievers mock at the idea.
interpretation: This verse addresses the reaction of the disbelievers to the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Despite receiving warnings and guidance, they are astonished and mock the Prophet, showing their arrogance and refusal to accept the truth. The verse highlights the disbelief and ignorance of those who reject the message of Islam.
orig: بل عجبت ويسخرون

translation: And when they are mentioned, they do not remember.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the state of the disbelievers who, despite being reminded of the truth, do not reflect upon it or remember it. It serves as a warning about the consequences of heedlessness and forgetfulness when it comes to matters of faith and guidance.
orig: وإذا ذكروا لا يذكرون

translation: And when they see a sign, they ridicule it
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people react to the signs and miracles of Allah with mockery and ridicule instead of reflecting upon them with humility and faith. It emphasizes the importance of approaching the signs of Allah with sincerity and openness, rather than with arrogance and disbelief.
orig: وإذا رأوا آية يستسخرون

translation: And they said, 'This is nothing but clear magic.'
interpretation: The disbelievers claimed that the signs brought by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) were mere magic and illusions rather than the miraculous revelations from Allah. This shows their refusal to acknowledge the truth and their attempt to discredit the Prophet's message.
orig: وقالوا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: When we have died and have become dust and bones, shall we [truly] be resurrected?
interpretation: This verse reflects on the human nature of questioning the concept of resurrection after death. It highlights the disbelief or skepticism of some people regarding the idea of being brought back to life after they have died and decomposed. The verse challenges the audience to ponder over the possibility and significance of resurrection and the life after death, emphasizing the power and will of Allah to resurrect all human beings for accountability and judgment in the Hereafter.
orig: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون

translation: Our forefathers
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of our ancestral lineage and the importance of reflecting on the lives and experiences of our predecessors. It encourages us to learn from the wisdom and mistakes of those who came before us, as a way to guide our own actions and decisions in the present.
orig: أوآباؤنا الأولون

translation: Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] powerless."
interpretation: This verse can be understood as a reminder of the inevitability of accountability and judgment. It suggests that ultimately, the truth will prevail and those who deny it will be left powerless and defeated.
orig: قل نعم وأنتم داخرون

translation: So, there is but one shout, and behold, they will all be brought before Us!
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Judgment when all created beings will be resurrected and gathered before Allah for accountability. It emphasizes the power of Allah's command, such that with a single shout, all will be brought back to life for the ultimate judgment.
orig: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة فإذا هم ينظرون

translation: And they say, 'O woe to us! This is the Day of Judgement.'
interpretation: This verse captures the moment of regret and realization when those who denied the truth will be confronted with the Day of Judgement. It conveys the intense fear and sorrow felt by individuals who neglected their faith and good deeds, facing the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: وقالوا يا ويلنا هذا يوم الدين

translation: This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inevitability of the Day of Judgement, emphasizing that it is the day when the truth will be revealed and when those who denied the existence of such a day will have to face the consequences of their denial. It serves as a reminder of the importance of belief in the Day of Judgement and the accountability of all individuals for their actions.
orig: هذا يوم الفصل الذي كنتم به تكذبون

translation: Gather those who have wronged, together with their companions and what they used to worship,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment where the wrongdoers will be gathered with their partners in wrongdoing and the false gods they worshipped. It highlights the accountability of individuals for their actions and beliefs, with a warning of the consequences for those who transgress and associate partners with Allah.
orig: احشروا الذين ظلموا وأزواجهم وما كانوا يعبدون

translation: Guide them to the path of Hellfire instead of Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the seriousness of misguided individuals who have turned away from following Allah's guidance. It serves as a warning that those who deviate from the right path will be led astray towards the path of Hellfire if they choose to follow anything or anyone other than Allah.
orig: من دون الله فاهدوهم إلى صراط الجحيم

translation: Stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that individuals who have committed wrongdoing or transgressions will be held accountable and questioned for their actions in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of one's deeds as each person will be answerable for their choices and behavior.
orig: وقفوهم إنهم مسئولون

translation: Why do you not help one another?
interpretation: This verse calls upon believers to support and assist one another. It emphasizes the importance of unity, cooperation, and solidarity among the believers. By helping and supporting each other, the community can become stronger and more cohesive, fulfilling the principles of brotherhood and compassion outlined in the Qur'an.
orig: ما لكم لا تناصرون

translation: Nay, but they, on that Day, will be surrendering.
interpretation: This verse highlights the eventual surrender of disbelievers to the truth and the inevitability of acknowledging the reality of the Day of Judgment. Despite their denial and defiance now, they will come to a point where they will have to submit to the truth and face the consequences of their actions.
orig: بل هم اليوم مستسلمون

translation: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when people will be brought together and will turn to one another asking and questioning about their deeds and actions in the worldly life. It signifies the sense of accountability and judgment that will prevail among individuals on that momentous day.
orig: وأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون

translation: They (the disbelievers) will say: 'Certainly you (believers) used to come to us from the right,'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will express their astonishment to the believers, acknowledging that the warnings and guidance the believers offered to them were indeed true. It highlights the regret of the disbelievers for not following the guidance and truth that the believers presented to them during their earthly life.
orig: قالوا إنكم كنتم تأتوننا عن اليمين

translation: They said, "No, we were not believers."
interpretation: The disbelievers denied their faith and rejected the truth, refusing to acknowledge their lack of belief despite clear signs and evidence. This highlights their arrogance and stubbornness in the face of guidance.
orig: قالوا بل لم تكونوا مؤمنين

translation: And we had no authority over you, but you were a transgressing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the messengers have no authority to force people to believe; rather, it is up to individuals to choose whether to follow the guidance or not. The verse also highlights the wrongful behavior of the disbelievers, indicating that they were unjustly oppressive and transgressed the bounds set by Allah.
orig: وما كان لنا عليكم من سلطان بل كنتم قوما طاغين

translation: And the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the commands and warnings of our Lord are true and will come to pass. It serves as a reminder that we will face consequences for our actions and that we should be mindful of our deeds and strive to do good.
orig: فحق علينا قول ربنا إنا لذائقون

translation: So We tempted you; for We were tempted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the trials and temptations faced by humans are a test from Allah. It serves as a reminder that one should be steadfast in faith during times of difficulty, knowing that Allah is aware of the challenges faced and will guide those who turn to Him for help.
orig: فأغويناكم إنا كنا غاوين

translation: So on that Day, they will all share in the punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of collective accountability and shared consequences. It serves as a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, those who have engaged in wrongdoing will not be able to escape the consequences of their actions, and they will all bear the burden of the punishment together.
orig: فإنهم يومئذ في العذاب مشتركون

translation: Indeed, thus do We deal with the criminals.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the inevitable justice of Allah towards those who commit crimes and transgress against His commandments. It highlights that ultimately, wrongdoers will face the consequences of their actions and will face divine justice. It serves as a reminder of the accountability that everyone holds for their deeds, and the reassurance that there will be justice in the end.
orig: إنا كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين

translation: Indeed, when it was said to them, 'There is no deity except Allah,' they were arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of some people who, when invited to believe in the Oneness of God, become arrogant and refuse to submit to the truth. It serves as a reminder to stay humble and open-minded when receiving guidance towards the path of righteousness.
orig: إنهم كانوا إذا قيل لهم لا إله إلا الله يستكبرون

translation: And they say, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of some disbelievers who rejected the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and questioned whether they should abandon their idols for the message brought by what they considered a mad poet. It showcases the stubbornness and disbelief of those who were resistant to accepting the truth of Islam.
orig: ويقولون أئنا لتاركو آلهتنا لشاعر مجنون

translation: Nay, he has come with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) came with the truth as a confirmation of the previous messengers and their message. It highlights the importance of believing in the Prophet Muhammad and his message, as well as honoring and acknowledging the truth brought by all the messengers of God.
orig: بل جاء بالحق وصدق المرسلين

translation: Indeed, you will surely taste the painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that those who engage in wrongdoing will face the consequences of their actions and will experience the severe and painful punishment for their deeds in the Hereafter. It reminds believers to be mindful of their actions and to strive to avoid actions that lead to displeasure of Allah and eternal punishment.
orig: إنكم لذائقو العذاب الأليم

translation: And you are not recompensed except for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, each individual will be held accountable only for their own deeds. It emphasizes the importance of personal responsibility and the concept of divine justice based on one's actions in this world.
orig: وما تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: Except for the chosen servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the special status and protection granted by Allah to His devoted and sincere servants. It implies that those who are sincere in their faith and obedience to Allah will be exempt from any harm or punishment. It is a reminder of the importance of sincerity and loyalty in one's worship to reap the rewards and blessings promised by Allah.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: For them is a known provision.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every person's sustenance is known and provided by Allah. It reassures believers that they will receive what has been decreed for them and encourages trust and reliance on Allah's provision.
orig: أولئك لهم رزق معلوم

translation: Fruits, they will be honoured.
interpretation: This verse alludes to the rewards and blessings that await the believers in paradise. It signifies that in the afterlife, the righteous will be granted high status and respect, with the mention of fruits symbolizing abundance and delight in paradise.
orig: فواكه وهم مكرمون

translation: in the gardens of pleasure
interpretation: This verse alludes to the concept of Paradise in Islam, describing it as a place of eternal bliss and joy. It signifies a state of ultimate happiness and contentment that believers aspire to attain in the afterlife as a reward for their faith and good deeds in this world.
orig: في جنات النعيم

translation: on couches, face to face.
interpretation: This verse describes the rewarding scene in Paradise where the believers will recline on couches facing one another. It signifies a state of relaxation, comfort, and companionship, reflecting the ultimate bliss and peace that awaits the dwellers of Paradise.
orig: على سرر متقابلين

translation: A cup [of wine] shall be passed round for them from a clear-flowing fountain,
interpretation: This verse describes a beautiful scene in Paradise where the inhabitants will be served a special drink from a pure and abundant source. It signifies the abundance of blessings and pleasures that the believers will enjoy in the afterlife as a reward for their faith and good deeds in this world.
orig: يطاف عليهم بكأس من معين

translation: White, delicious to the drinkers.
interpretation: This verse refers to a description of the drinks in paradise as being white and enjoyable to those who consume them. It symbolizes the theme of reward and pleasure that awaits the believers in the afterlife according to Islamic teachings.
orig: بيضاء لذة للشاربين

translation: There is no ghoul in it nor do they (angels) suffer weariness therefrom.
interpretation: This verse describes the pure and serene nature of Paradise, where there is no fear of harm or exhaustion. The mention of 'ghoul' implies any form of evil or danger, emphasizing the peace and tranquility that exist in Paradise. Additionally, it highlights the everlasting vigor and energy of the inhabitants of Paradise, suggesting a state of eternal bliss and contentment.
orig: لا فيها غول ولا هم عنها ينزفون

translation: And with them are maidens of modest glance, untouched before them by man or jinn.
interpretation: This verse refers to the inhabitants of Paradise, who are described as having beautiful, pure and modest companions. These companions are untouched by any man or jinn, symbolizing the purity and exclusivity of the bond between them and the inhabitants of Paradise.
orig: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف عين

translation: as if they are hidden eggs
interpretation: This verse compares women waiting to give birth to hidden eggs, implying a sense of anticipation and protection. It depicts a state of readiness and potential for new life, highlighting the preciousness and delicate nature of pregnancy.
orig: كأنهن بيض مكنون

translation: So they approached one another, questioning.
interpretation: This verse refers to a scene where the disbelievers in the Quraysh would turn to one another, asking questions and expressing doubts about the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the message of Islam. It highlights their confusion, skepticism, and lack of certainty in the face of the clear signs and revelations of Allah.
orig: فأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون

translation: A speaker among them said, 'Indeed, I had a companion [to guide me].'
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability and the influence of companions on a person's actions and beliefs. The speaker acknowledges having a companion who played a role in shaping their behavior and choices. It reminds us to reflect on the company we keep and how it can impact our moral and spiritual development.
orig: قال قائل منهم إني كان لي قرين

translation: He says, 'Are you indeed of the believers?'
interpretation: This verse is questioning the belief of a certain individual, prompting them to reflect on whether they truly have faith. It serves as a reminder for believers to assess the depth of their conviction and commitment to their faith.
orig: يقول أإنك لمن المصدقين

translation: When we are dead and have become dust (decomposed), shall we ( be raised to a new creation)?
interpretation: This verse questions the concept of resurrection after death. It makes individuals reflect on the reality of life after death and the inevitability of facing judgment for one's deeds in this world.
orig: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمدينون

translation: He said, 'Do you wish to look?'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker is inviting the audience to reflect and ponder on the signs of Allah's creation. It suggests a call to observe the world with a deeper understanding and awareness, encouraging a deeper contemplation of the beauty and complexity of the universe as a means of recognizing the greatness and existence of Allah.
orig: قال هل أنتم مطلعون

translation: So he looked and saw him in the midst of the Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where the disbeliever sees the consequences of his actions and finds himself in Hell. It serves as a warning to remind people of the repercussions of their deeds and the importance of following the right path in life.
orig: فاطلع فرآه في سواء الجحيم

translation: He said, "By Allah, you will certainly be led astray."
interpretation: This verse reflects a moment of strong conviction or warning, with the speaker swearing by Allah. It conveys a sense of urgency and certainty in the belief that the listener is on a path that will lead them astray or into error.
orig: قال تالله إن كدت لتردين

translation: And if it were not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought [to account].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of recognizing the blessings and favors from Allah. It emphasizes that all achievements and protection from consequences come from the mercy and goodness of Allah. It serves as a reminder to be grateful and not take blessings for granted.
orig: ولولا نعمة ربي لكنت من المحضرين

translation: Are we not to die?
interpretation: In this verse, the question is raised about the inevitability of death. It reminds us of the fleeting nature of life and serves as a reminder of the mortality that all humans share. It prompts reflection on the afterlife and the ultimate purpose of our existence in this world.
orig: أفما نحن بميتين

translation: Except our first death and we will not be punished.
interpretation: This verse suggests that after the first death, which is a natural part of life, there will be no further punishment. It emphasizes the belief in the afterlife and the concept of facing consequences for our actions after death rather than during our lifetime.
orig: إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمعذبين

translation: Verily, this is the supreme success.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate victory and success that comes from following the teachings and guidance of Allah. It signifies that true success lies in righteousness, faith, and living a life in accordance with the teachings of Islam. It serves as a reminder that the ultimate reward and success are found in obeying Allah and His commandments.
orig: إن هذا لهو الفوز العظيم

translation: Let the workers work in the same way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of working diligently and consistently. It encourages individuals to actively engage in productive actions and tasks, highlighting the value of effort and hard work in achieving success and fulfilling one's responsibilities.
orig: لمثل هذا فليعمل العاملون

translation: Is this a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?
interpretation: Allah is questioning whether the destination of the disbelievers in Hell, symbolized by the tree of zaqqum, is better than a comfortable and pleasant accommodation. It emphasizes the severity and punishment awaiting those who reject faith and commit evil deeds.
orig: أذلك خير نزلا أم شجرة الزقوم

translation: Verily, We have made it (the Qur'an) a trial for the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a test or trial for those who are unjust or engage in wrongdoing. The teachings and guidance in the Qur'an are meant to distinguish between those who follow the right path and those who deviate from it. It serves as a criterion to discern the sincerity and righteousness of individuals, separating the oppressors from the righteous believers.
orig: إنا جعلناها فتنة للظالمين

translation: It is a tree that springs from the bottom of Hell.
interpretation: This verse is describing a tree that grows at the root of Hell. The imagery of a tree growing in the depths of Hell is likely used to emphasize the concept of punishment and suffering in the afterlife for those who commit evil deeds in this world.
orig: إنها شجرة تخرج في أصل الجحيم

translation: He emerged as if he were the horns of the devils.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where a formidable and fearsome individual appears, the comparison to the horns of devils emphasizing his intimidating and monstrous presence. It serves as a reminder that power and authority should be wielded with wisdom and justice, as the misuse of strength can lead to devastation and chaos.
orig: طلعها كأنه رءوس الشياطين

translation: Indeed, they will eat from it and fill their bellies with it.
interpretation: This verse highlights a warning about those who indulge excessively in worldly pleasures and material possessions, symbolized here by food. It serves as a reminder to moderate one's desires and not be consumed by temporary desires at the expense of spiritual growth and righteousness.
orig: فإنهم لآكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون

translation: Then indeed, they will have to taste from it a boiling drink and a filthy wound,
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment awaiting those who have committed sins and wronged themselves. They will be made to drink boiling water, symbolizing intense suffering and torment, along with a festering wound that will add to their agony. It signifies the severe consequences of their actions and serves as a warning against wrongdoing.
orig: ثم إن لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم

translation: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning about the consequences of wrongdoing and the rejection of faith. It speaks about those who turn away from the truth and engage in sinful actions, proclaiming that their ultimate destination will be the Hellfire. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and the eventual return to face the consequences of one's deeds in the afterlife.
orig: ثم إن مرجعهم لإلى الجحيم

translation: Indeed, they found their fathers astray.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that some people follow the misguided ways of their forefathers without questioning or seeking the truth. It serves as a reminder for individuals to think critically and not blindly adhere to traditions or beliefs solely based on inheritance or cultural practices.
orig: إنهم ألفوا آباءهم ضالين

translation: So they will be rushing in their footsteps.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fact that there will come a time when people will hasten to follow the ways and actions of those who came before them. It serves as a reminder to be mindful of the paths we choose to follow, as they may have consequences that others will also be influenced by.
orig: فهم على آثارهم يهرعون

translation: And most of the former peoples went astray before them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of many past communities to stray from the right path. It serves as a warning to the current community to learn from the mistakes of their predecessors and to be vigilant in following the guidance provided to them in order to avoid the same fate of going astray.
orig: ولقد ضل قبلهم أكثر الأولين

translation: And We certainly sent warners into them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that throughout history, God has sent warners to different nations to remind them about His guidance and warn them of the consequences of their actions. It underscores the mercy and justice of God in continuously providing guidance to humanity through messengers and warners.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا فيهم منذرين

translation: So observe how was the end of those who were warned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the consequences faced by those who did not heed the warnings they received. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of ignoring guidance and advice, and encourages believers to learn from the mistakes of others in order to avoid similar outcomes.
orig: فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين

translation: Except the chosen servants of Allah
interpretation: This verse highlights a group of people who are the sincere devotees of Allah, implying that they are the ones who will be saved or exempted from certain consequences. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity and devotion in one's worship and servitude to Allah, suggesting that only those with pure intentions and genuine dedication will be ultimately favored by Allah.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: And Noah had certainly called Us, and We are the best of responders.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of prayer and supplication in Islam. It emphasizes that Prophet Noah (peace be upon him) called upon Allah, and Allah responded to his prayers. It signifies that Allah is always ready to respond to the sincere supplications of His servants. This verse serves as a reminder for believers to turn to Allah in times of need, knowing that He is the best of responders.
orig: ولقد نادانا نوح فلنعم المجيبون

translation: And We saved him and his family from the great distress.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) and how Allah saved him and his family from the great flood that wiped out the disbelievers. It serves as a reminder that Allah is the ultimate protector and savior of those who believe in Him and follow His commands, even in the face of immense challenges and trials.
orig: ونجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth].
interpretation: This verse is highlighting how Allah granted Prophet Noah's descendants the honor of being the ones who survived and remained on earth after the great flood. It signifies the continuation of his progeny and the establishment of a new generation post the purification of the earth through the flood.
orig: وجعلنا ذريته هم الباقين

translation: And We left for him [fame] among later generations.
interpretation: This verse talks about Prophet Nuh (Noah) and how Allah granted him fame and remembrance among later generations, emphasizing the idea that the good deeds and righteousness of the believers will be remembered and honored by future generations, serving as a source of inspiration and guidance.
orig: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Noah among the worlds.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication for peace upon the Prophet Noah, peace be upon him, in all the worlds. It signifies a wish for tranquility and harmony for Prophet Noah, who is respected and remembered for his perseverance in delivering the message of God despite facing considerable challenges and disbelief from his people.
orig: سلام على نوح في العالمين

translation: Indeed, thus do We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah rewards those who excel in goodness. It serves as a reminder that good deeds are recognized and compensated by Allah, and encourages believers to continue performing acts of kindness and righteousness.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, he is one of our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse highlights the esteemed status of the believer in the eyes of Allah. Believers are honored servants of God, distinguished by their faith and devotion. The verse emphasizes the importance of faith and indicates that being a believer is a source of pride and distinction.
orig: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: Then We drowned the others.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment inflicted by God on disbelievers during the time of Prophet Noah, where those who rejected the message of God were drowned in a great flood as a consequence of their disobedience and rejection of truth. It serves as a reminder of God's power and justice, as well as a warning to those who persist in their disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: ثم أغرقنا الآخرين

translation: And indeed, among his followers was Abraham.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that Prophet Abraham (Ibrahim) was among the followers of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights the unity of the message of monotheism carried by the prophets, from Abraham to Muhammad, emphasizing the continuity and interconnectedness of their missions.
orig: وإن من شيعته لإبراهيم

translation: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart,
interpretation: This verse refers to the state of the believers who approach their Lord with a pure and sincere heart free from any form of shirk or hypocrisy. It emphasizes the importance of having a clean and sincere heart in connecting with Allah, as sincerity and purity of heart are essential in gaining closeness to Him.
orig: إذ جاء ربه بقلب سليم

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What do you worship?'
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when a prophet questioned his own father and people about their beliefs and practices. It serves as a reminder for believers to question and reflect on the beliefs and actions of themselves and their communities, encouraging critical thinking and self-assessment in matters of faith.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ماذا تعبدون

translation: Do you worship falsehood instead of Allah?
interpretation: This verse questions the belief in false gods or deities besides Allah, emphasizing the futility and falsehood of such worship. It serves as a reminder to stay on the path of true monotheism and to reject any form of polytheism or idolatry.
orig: أئفكا آلهة دون الله تريدون

translation: So, what is your assumption about the Lord of the worlds?
interpretation: This verse challenges the reader to reflect on their beliefs about the Creator of the universe. It prompts individuals to ponder over the greatness and magnificence of Allah, who is the Lord of all creation, and to question their understanding and perception of His existence and attributes.
orig: فما ظنكم برب العالمين

translation: So look at the stars
interpretation: This verse invites us to contemplate the beauty and complexity of the universe, urging us to reflect on the signs of Allah's creation in the celestial bodies. It emphasizes the importance of pondering over the creation of Allah as a means to strengthen our faith and awe in His power and wisdom.
orig: فنظر نظرة في النجوم

translation: So he said, 'Indeed, I am ill.'
interpretation: This verse indicates a moment of vulnerability and honesty when the person acknowledges their own physical weakness or illness. It teaches us the importance of acknowledging our limitations and seeking help when needed, both physically and spiritually. It reminds us that it is okay to admit when we are in need of support and care.
orig: فقال إني سقيم

translation: So turn away from him who turns his back upon Our Remembrance and desires nothing but the present life.
interpretation: This verse warns against following those who turn away from the teachings of Allah and are only focused on worldly desires. It advises believers to avoid such individuals and instead turn towards the remembrance of Allah and the guidance He provides.
orig: فتولوا عنه مدبرين

translation: went to their gods and said, 'Do you not eat?'
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where someone is questioning the logic behind worshiping idols that do not have the ability to eat or partake in any human activities. It highlights the absurdity of idol worship, emphasizing the superiority of Allah who is not in need of food or sustenance.
orig: فراغ إلى آلهتهم فقال ألا تأكلون

translation: What is [wrong] with you, that you do not speak?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is questioning why someone would remain silent when they should be speaking up. It encourages communication, expressing thoughts, and standing up for what is right. It may also imply the importance of using one's voice and speaking out against injustice or falsehood.
orig: ما لكم لا تنطقون

translation: So strike [them] upon the necks
interpretation: This verse is a call to action against the enemies of Islam. It symbolizes the firm and strong stance that believers should take in defending their faith and values against those who oppose or harm them. It serves as a reminder of the necessity of standing up for justice and protecting oneself from harm and oppression.
orig: فراغ عليهم ضربا باليمين

translation: So they will approach Him in a group.
interpretation: This verse describes how people will be brought before Allah collectively on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that all individuals, regardless of their status or background, will have to face their deeds and be judged together before Allah.
orig: فأقبلوا إليه يزفون

translation: He said, 'Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
interpretation: This verse highlights the absurdity of worshipping idols which are created by human hands. It serves as a reminder to focus on the worship of the One true God who is the Creator of everything, rather than worshiping objects made by humans.
orig: قال أتعبدون ما تنحتون

translation: And Allah has created you and what you do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief that Allah is the creator of all humans and everything they do. It emphasizes the concept of divine creation and serves as a reminder that everything that occurs is ultimately under the will and power of Allah.
orig: والله خلقكم وما تعملون

translation: They said, "Build for him a structure and throw him into the burning fire."
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where a group of people decided to harm someone by building a structure to harm and then throwing the person into a burning fire. It warns against the cruelty and injustice that can arise when people plot harm against others.
orig: قالوا ابنوا له بنيانا فألقوه في الجحيم

translation: So they planned a plan, and We made them the lowest.
interpretation: This verse refers to the plotting and planning of the disbelievers against the believers. Despite their schemes, Allah declares that He will ultimately bring them low and make them face the consequences of their actions, displaying His supreme power and authority over all things.
orig: فأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأسفلين

translation: And he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the submission and reliance on Allah. It shows the unwavering faith of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) as he resolves to follow the command of his Lord, trusting that Allah will guide him on the right path. It emphasizes the importance of trusting in Allah's guidance and surrendering to His will in all aspects of life.
orig: وقال إني ذاهب إلى ربي سيهدين

translation: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse reflects a supplication made by Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) in the Qur'an, where he is asking Allah to grant him a righteous child. It shows Ibrahim's deep desire to have a righteous offspring who would continue his legacy and spread goodness in the world. This verse teaches us the importance of making supplications to Allah for good and righteous outcomes in our lives.
orig: رب هب لي من الصالحين

translation: So We gave him the good news of a forbearing boy.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Abraham (Ibrahim) receiving the good news of a forbearing and patient son, who was none other than Prophet Ishmael (Isma'il). It teaches us about the rewards of patience and the fulfillment of divine promises.
orig: فبشرناه بغلام حليم

translation: When he reached the age to work with him, he said, 'My son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice you. See what you think.' He said, 'Father, do as you are commanded. Allah willing, you will find me patient.'
interpretation: This verse tells the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his son Isma'il (Ishmael), where Ibrahim receives a command in a dream to sacrifice his son. Both Ibrahim and Isma'il show complete submission and obedience to Allah's will, demonstrating the qualities of faith, patience, and trust in the divine plan.
orig: فلما بلغ معه السعي قال يا بني إني أرى في المنام أني أذبحك فانظر ماذا ترى قال يا أبت افعل ما تؤمر ستجدني إن شاء الله من الصابرين

translation: So when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his son Isma'il (Ishmael) both submitted to the will of Allah, and Ibrahim laid his son down to fulfill the command of Allah. It highlights the utmost obedience and submission to the divine command, even in the most difficult and testing situations.
orig: فلما أسلما وتله للجبين

translation: And We called out to him, 'O Abraham,'
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Allah called Prophet Abraham by his name. It shows the intimacy and direct communication between Allah and His chosen prophets. It signifies the special status and close relationship that Prophet Abraham had with his Lord.
orig: وناديناه أن يا إبراهيم

translation: The vision has been fulfilled. Indeed, we are thus rewarding the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling promises and rewards those who do good deeds. It serves as a reminder that God is just and will reward those who strive to do good in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: قد صدقت الرؤيا إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, this is a clear affliction.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the trials and tribulations we face in life are a test from God, and they serve as a clear indication of His wisdom and power. These afflictions can be seen as opportunities for growth, learning, and strengthening one's faith.
orig: إن هذا لهو البلاء المبين

translation: And we ransomed him with a great sacrifice.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Prophet Ibrahim and his willingness to sacrifice his son Isma'il as an act of obedience to God's command. It showcases the importance of submission to God's will and the concept of sacrifice in achieving closeness to Him. The verse highlights the ultimate reward and mercy of God in accepting Ibrahim's devotion and providing a ram as a substitute for the sacrifice, emphasizing the significance of faith, trust, and obedience in the face of difficult trials.
orig: وفديناه بذبح عظيم

translation: And We have left him a good reputation among later generations.
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Noah, peace be upon him, and how Allah preserved his reputation and mentioned him in a good light among the later generations as a reminder of his righteousness, patience, and the mission he carried out to guide his people.
orig: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Ibrahim.
interpretation: This verse conveys a greeting of peace upon the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) in the Qur'an. It signifies a message of peace, blessings, and goodwill towards one of the prominent prophets in Islam. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of honoring and respecting the prophets and their roles in conveying the message of monotheism and submission to the will of Allah.
orig: سلام على إبراهيم

translation: Thus do We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah rewards those who do good deeds. It serves as a reminder that the ultimate judgment and reward lies with Allah, and those who consistently strive to do good will be rewarded accordingly in the sight of Allah.
orig: كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, he is one of our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special status of the believer among the servants of Allah. It emphasizes the significance of faith and its role in defining a person's identity and relationship with their Creator. Belief in Allah and submission to His will are fundamental qualities that elevate a person's status and bring them closer to Allah.
orig: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a prophet among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights a moment where Allah gave Ibrahim the good news of having a son named Isaac, who would grow up to become a prophet known for his righteousness. It underscores the importance of receiving glad tidings and the significance of prophethood within the lineage of Ibrahim.
orig: وبشرناه بإسحاق نبيا من الصالحين

translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is one who is righteous and another who clearly wrongs himself.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity that can exist among the descendants of the prophets. While some choose righteousness and goodness, others may choose to wrong themselves by straying from the right path. It serves as a reminder of the importance of individual choices and the consequences they have in determining a person's spiritual path.
orig: وباركنا عليه وعلى إسحاق ومن ذريتهما محسن وظالم لنفسه مبين

translation: And We certainly favored Moses and Aaron.
interpretation: This verse highlights the special favor and blessing from Allah upon the prophets Moses and Aaron. It emphasizes the importance of their roles in conveying Allah's message and guidance to their people. It serves as a reminder of the honor and favor bestowed upon these prophets by Allah, which in turn highlights the significance of following their teachings and guidance.
orig: ولقد مننا على موسى وهارون

translation: And We saved them both and their people from the great distress.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and protection towards Prophet Lut and his family from the severe torment that befell the people of Sodom. It emphasizes that Allah can deliver His righteous servants from immense hardships and tribulations, granting them salvation and relief amidst adversities.
orig: ونجيناهما وقومهما من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We supported them, so they were the victors.
interpretation: This verse speaks of Allah's help and support for His righteous servants, leading them to victory. It is a reminder that with faith, perseverance, and reliance on Allah, success and triumph will be granted to those who truly believe and have trust in their Creator.
orig: ونصرناهم فكانوا هم الغالبين

translation: And We gave them the Clear Scripture.
interpretation: This verse refers to the divine revelation (the Qur'an) given to Prophets Musa (Moses) and Harun (Aaron). It emphasizes the clarity and guidance provided by the scripture revealed to them, highlighting the importance of following divine guidance for success in this life and the hereafter.
orig: وآتيناهما الكتاب المستبين

translation: And We guided the two of them to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse refers to the guidance given by Allah to Adam and Eve towards the straight path, a path that is righteous, clear, and free from deviation. It emphasizes the importance of following the correct way of life as shown by Allah, avoiding falsehood and leading a life in accordance with His guidance.
orig: وهديناهما الصراط المستقيم

translation: And We left for them among later generations
interpretation: This verse indicates that the consequences of one's actions can extend beyond their immediate lifetime and impact future generations as well. It serves as a reminder of the interconnectedness of all people and the importance of considering the long-term effects of our deeds.
orig: وتركنا عليهما في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.
interpretation: This verse is a greeting of peace towards the prophets Moses and Aaron. It signifies respect and honor for these two legendary figures who played key roles in spreading the message of Allah. It also serves as a reminder for believers to reflect upon the stories of these prophets and to strive to embody the good qualities they exemplified in their lives.
orig: سلام على موسى وهارون

translation: Indeed, [O Muhammad], this is how We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine reward for those who perform good deeds. It reassures that Allah will indeed reward those who act with goodness, kindness, and righteousness in their conduct and intentions. This serves as a motivation and encouragement for believers to continue to engage in acts of kindness and righteousness, knowing that their efforts will not go unrewarded.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Verily, they are [not] but our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those being referred to are indeed among the servants of Allah who have belief in Him. It highlights the importance of faith in distinguishing believers from non-believers.
orig: إنهما من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: And indeed, Elias was one of the messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Elias (Elisha) as one of the Messengers of God, emphasizing his role and status as a chosen messenger to guide his people towards the path of righteousness and belief in one God.
orig: وإن إلياس لمن المرسلين

translation: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allah?"
interpretation: This verse highlights a call to piety and consciousness of Allah. The speaker is urging their people to be mindful of their actions, to fear Allah and act in accordance with His guidance. The emphasis on taqwa (fear of Allah) serves as a reminder to lead a life that is righteous, just, and in obedience to Allah's commandments.
orig: إذ قال لقومه ألا تتقون

translation: Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators?
interpretation: This verse questions the practice of worshipping false gods like Ba'l, while neglecting and forgetting the true Creator, Allah, who is the best of creators. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and worshipping the one true God instead of turning towards idols or other false deities.
orig: أتدعون بعلا وتذرون أحسن الخالقين

translation: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers, the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the oneness of Allah as the Lord of all, including the present generation and their forefathers. It highlights the continuity of faith across generations and the reminder of the ultimate authority and power of Allah over all existence, from the past to the present.
orig: الله ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: So they denied him, and they will be brought [for punishment].
