interpretation: This verse is questioning whether those who have received the evidence and signs of punishment are equal to those who are guided towards belief and righteousness. It questions whether it is possible to save someone who is already destined for punishment in the Fire. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting guidance and the importance of seeking salvation from the torment of the Fire through faith and righteous deeds.
orig: أفمن حق عليه كلمة العذاب أفأنت تنقذ من في النار

translation: But those who fear their Lord will have chambers above them, chambers built upon chambers, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in His promise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the rewards that those who fear and obey their Lord will receive in the Hereafter. The chambers mentioned symbolize the high status and luxurious dwellings that will be granted to the righteous believers in Paradise. The flowing rivers signify the abundance and blessings that will be bestowed upon them. The verse reassures believers that the promise of Allah is true and that He will fulfill His promise of rewarding the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم غرف من فوقها غرف مبنية تجري من تحتها الأنهار وعد الله لا يخلف الله الميعاد

translation: Have you not seen that Allah sent down water from the sky and threaded it as springs in the earth? Then He brings forth with it crops of different colors and thereafter they wither and you see them turning yellow, then He makes them into worthless chaff. Indeed, in this is a reminder for those of understanding.
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine process of sending down water from the sky to bring forth vegetation on earth. It underscores the cycle of life and death in nature, where crops grow, wither, and eventually turn into chaff. The verse invites reflection on the patterns of creation and serves as a reminder for people of intellect to recognize the signs of Allah's power and wisdom in the world around them.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فسلكه ينابيع في الأرض ثم يخرج به زرعا مختلفا ألوانه ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يجعله حطاما إن في ذلك لذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: Then is one whose breast Allah has expanded to [accept] Islam and he is upon a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah. Those are in manifest error.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the contrast between those who have willingly embraced Islam and have a deep sense of conviction and guidance from Allah, and those whose hearts are hardened and closed off to the remembrance of Allah. It warns of the severe consequences for those who persist in disbelief and negligence towards the signs and reminders of Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of having an open heart and a willingness to accept the truth of Islam in order to avoid clear misguidance.
orig: أفمن شرح الله صدره للإسلام فهو على نور من ربه فويل للقاسية قلوبهم من ذكر الله أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Allah has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound effect that the Qur'an has on the hearts of believers. It describes how the hearts of those who fear Allah are moved and humbled by the remembrance of their Lord when they recite the Qur'an. The verse emphasizes the power of guidance from Allah, indicating that only those whom Allah wills to guide will be guided by the Qur'an. Conversely, those whom Allah chooses not to guide will remain astray, as no one can guide them except Allah Himself.
orig: الله نزل أحسن الحديث كتابا متشابها مثاني تقشعر منه جلود الذين يخشون ربهم ثم تلين جلودهم وقلوبهم إلى ذكر الله ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: Is he who will confront with his face the evil of the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, 'Taste what you used to earn.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the accountability of individuals for their actions on the Day of Judgment. It conveys that those who commit wrongdoing and evil in this world will have to face the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of righteousness and piety in this life to avoid suffering in the afterlife.
orig: أفمن يتقي بوجهه سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وقيل للظالمين ذوقوا ما كنتم تكسبون

translation: Those before them also denied the truth, and so the punishment came at them from directions they did not perceive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who deny the truth and reject the message of God. It serves as a reminder that the punishment for disbelief can come suddenly and unexpectedly from directions that those who commit wrongdoings do not anticipate or realize. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing the signs and messages of God and turning towards the right path before it's too late.
orig: كذب الذين من قبلهم فأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: So Allah will taste them the disgrace in the worldly life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that sometimes people may face hardships and disgrace in this worldly life as a result of their actions. However, the true and more severe punishment awaits them in the Hereafter if they only knew. It serves as a reminder that one should strive to avoid sins and seek forgiveness to avoid the greater punishment that may come in the afterlife.
orig: فأذاقهم الله الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And We have certainly presented every kind of example in this Qur'an to the people, that they may remember.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an contains various examples and stories to serve as reminders for people. These examples are meant to help individuals reflect on their lives, learn from the past, and ultimately remember Allah's teachings and guidance.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: A Quran in Arabic, without any crookedness, that they may fear Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the clarity and straightness of the Qur'an in its Arabic language, highlighting its purity and precision as a guidance for people to develop piety and awareness of Allah. The straightness of the Qur'an reflects the purity of its message and the straightforward path it lays out for those who seek guidance.
orig: قرآنا عربيا غير ذي عوج لعلهم يتقون

translation: Allah presents an example: a man shared partners differing with one another, and a man belonging exclusively to one man. Are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the stark difference between those who associate partners with Allah and those who worship Him alone. It points out that the man who believes in the Oneness of Allah is on a higher spiritual level than one who is involved in polytheism. The verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and praising the uniqueness and greatness of Allah, as many people are unaware of this distinction.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا رجلا فيه شركاء متشاكسون ورجلا سلما لرجل هل يستويان مثلا الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Verily, you will die, and verily, they will die as well.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the inevitability of death for all individuals. It emphasizes the equalizing nature of death, as it is a fate that every living being will face regardless of their status, wealth, or power. In essence, the verse calls for humility and a realization of the transient nature of life on this earth, urging individuals to reflect on their deeds and prepare for the ultimate journey towards the afterlife.
orig: إنك ميت وإنهم ميتون

translation: Then indeed, you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that on the Day of Judgment, every individual will have to stand before their Lord and justify their actions. The word 'تختصمون' implies that there will be arguments and disputes as people try to defend their deeds and face accountability for their choices in the worldly life. This serves as a reminder that all our actions are being recorded and will be brought forth for judgment on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة عند ربكم تختصمون

translation: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allah and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe injustice and wrongdoing of those who deny the truth and lie about Allah despite being presented with clear evidence. It questions the wisdom of such actions and suggests that a grave punishment in Hell awaits those who persist in disbelief and falsehood.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن كذب على الله وكذب بالصدق إذ جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And he who brought the truth and confirmed it - those are the righteous.
interpretation: This verse praises those who not only speak the truth but also act upon it. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity and honesty, indicating that those who uphold truth are the ones who exhibit true piety and righteousness.
orig: والذي جاء بالصدق وصدق به أولئك هم المتقون

translation: They will have whatever they wish with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward reserved for those who do good deeds. It emphasizes that those who perform good actions will be rewarded abundantly by Allah, receiving whatever they desire in the presence of their Lord as a token of appreciation for their righteousness and piety.
orig: لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: So Allah will pardon them for the worst of what they did and reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards His servants. It indicates that Allah may forgive the sins and mistakes of individuals and reward them based on their good deeds. It serves as a reminder of Allah's compassion and fair judgement, encouraging believers to strive for righteousness and seek forgiveness for their wrongdoings.
orig: ليكفر الله عنهم أسوأ الذي عملوا ويجزيهم أجرهم بأحسن الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: Is Allah not sufficient for His Servant? And [yet], they threaten you with those other than Him. And whoever Allah leaves to stray - for him there is no guide.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's ultimate power and authority. It emphasizes that Allah alone is sufficient to protect His servants, despite any threats or intimidation from others. It also warns that those who are led astray by Allah will not find any guidance or assistance elsewhere.
orig: أليس الله بكاف عبده ويخوفونك بالذين من دونه ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And he whom Allah guides, for him there will be no misleader. Is not Allah Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of guidance from Allah. It reassures believers that those who are guided by Allah will not be led astray or misguided. It also highlights Allah's power and authority, reminding us that He is the Mighty and the Just, capable of rewarding the righteous and punishing the wrongdoers.
orig: ومن يهد الله فما له من مضل أليس الله بعزيز ذي انتقام

translation: And if you ask them, 'Who has created the heavens and the earth?' they will surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Have you then considered what you invoke besides Allah? If Allah intended me harm, could they remove His harm? Or if He intended me mercy, could they withhold His mercy?' Say, 'Sufficient for me is Allah; upon Him rely the [wise] reliers.'
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah. Even if people may profess belief in Allah as the Creator of the heavens and the earth, it questions their allegiance to other entities they invoke. The verse challenges the polytheists of Mecca to reflect on the powerlessness of their idols and their inability to protect or harm anyone without Allah's will. It emphasizes the importance of relying solely on Allah, as He is the ultimate protector and source of mercy.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله قل أفرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله إن أرادني الله بضر هل هن كاشفات ضره أو أرادني برحمة هل هن ممسكات رحمته قل حسبي الله عليه يتوكل المتوكلون

translation: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; [for] indeed, I am working. And you are going to know."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of individuals fulfilling their responsibilities and duties according to their position and capabilities. It conveys the message that everyone should focus on their own tasks and not worry about the actions of others, as each person will be held accountable for their own deeds. The verse also suggests that through sincere effort and determination, the truth and reality of situations will eventually become clear to all.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون

translation: Whosoever comes to Him (Allah) (believing in Him,) he shall be humiliated, and for him is a lasting punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who reject or disbelieve in Allah will face humiliation and a severe, lasting punishment. It serves as a warning to those who defy the beliefs and laws set by Allah, emphasizing the consequences of such actions.
orig: من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم

translation: Verily, We have revealed to you the Book for mankind in truth. So whoever is guided, it is for his own soul; and whoever goes astray, he goes astray only to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an was revealed by Allah for the guidance of mankind. It highlights the concept of personal responsibility, stating that those who are guided benefit themselves, whereas those who go astray harm only themselves. It also reminds the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he is not responsible for forcing people to follow guidance, as everyone has free will to choose their own path.
orig: إنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب للناس بالحق فمن اهتدى فلنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an explains that Allah is the one who takes the souls of individuals at the time of their death, as well as during their sleep for those who are meant to continue living. It highlights the power and control that Allah has over life and death, emphasizing the signs of His existence and wisdom for those who reflect and ponder on the deeper meanings of life and mortality.
orig: الله يتوفى الأنفس حين موتها والتي لم تمت في منامها فيمسك التي قضى عليها الموت ويرسل الأخرى إلى أجل مسمى إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Do they take for intercessors others besides Allah? Say: 'Even if they have power over nothing and have no intelligence?'
interpretation: This verse questions the practice of taking intermediaries besides Allah and emphasizes that those intermediaries have no power or intelligence. It reminds believers to rely solely on Allah and not seek help or intercession from others.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دون الله شفعاء قل أولو كانوا لا يملكون شيئا ولا يعقلون

translation: Say, "To Allah belongs [the right of] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism and reminds us of the ultimate authority and power of Allah. It highlights that all intercession belongs solely to Allah, and He alone has control over the heavens and the earth. The verse concludes by emphasizing that all human beings will ultimately return to Allah, highlighting the belief in the Day of Judgment and accountability for our deeds.
orig: قل لله الشفاعة جميعا له ملك السماوات والأرض ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion; but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of those who do not believe in the Hereafter when the mention of Allah is made in contrast to the mention of false deities. It highlights how the disbelievers feel discomfort and aversion when reminded of the worship of the One true God, while they find joy and happiness in the worship of false gods. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of sincere belief in Allah and the consequences of disbelief in the Hereafter.
orig: وإذا ذكر الله وحده اشمأزت قلوب الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وإذا ذكر الذين من دونه إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: Say, "O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between Your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness and power of Allah by describing Him as the Creator of the heavens and the earth, and the Knower of all that is hidden and all that is seen. It serves as a reminder that Allah is the ultimate judge who will resolve the disputes and differences between His servants. It emphasizes the importance of submission to Him as the final arbiter of all matters.
orig: قل اللهم فاطر السماوات والأرض عالم الغيب والشهادة أنت تحكم بين عبادك في ما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: And if those who have wronged had all that is in the earth and the like of it with it, they would surely ransom themselves thereby from the evil of the torment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allah that which they had not taken into account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no amount of wealth or possessions in this world will be able to save the wrongdoers from the punishment they deserve on the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a warning to those who oppress others or do wrong, reminding them that they will be held accountable for their actions in the hereafter, where material wealth will hold no value and only righteousness and obedience to Allah will matter.
orig: ولو أن للذين ظلموا ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به من سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وبدا لهم من الله ما لم يكونوا يحتسبون

translation: And the evil consequences of what they earned appeared to them, and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice as it portrays the consequences of one's actions coming back to them. It serves as a reminder that individuals will eventually face the repercussions of their deeds, even if they used to mock or disregard the idea of accountability. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of one's actions and the impact they may have, as everything will be brought to light eventually.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما كسبوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: So when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, 'I have only been given this because of [my] knowledge.' Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of humans to turn to God only in times of adversity and to credit their successes solely to their own knowledge and efforts. However, the verse reminds us that all blessings and trials come from God, and that they are tests to see how we use those blessings and trials in our lives. It serves as a reminder to acknowledge and thank God in both times of hardship and prosperity, recognizing that everything ultimately comes from Him.
orig: فإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعانا ثم إذا خولناه نعمة منا قال إنما أوتيته على علم بل هي فتنة ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Those before them had already said it, but they gained no benefit from what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of the people before who received similar warnings but still did not heed the message and consequently did not benefit from their actions. It serves as a reminder for the listeners to reflect on the consequences of their choices and the importance of learning from history to avoid repeating the same mistakes.
orig: قد قالها الذين من قبلهم فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: So they will be touched by what they have earned. And those who have wronged among these will be afflicted by what they have earned. And they are not unjustly treated.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice. It emphasizes that people will face the consequences of their actions, whether good or bad. Those who have wronged others will face the repercussions of their deeds, and ultimately, no one will be treated unjustly by Allah.
orig: فأصابهم سيئات ما كسبوا والذين ظلموا من هؤلاء سيصيبهم سيئات ما كسبوا وما هم بمعجزين

translation: Do they not know that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fact that Allah is the ultimate provider and sustainer. He chooses to bless some with abundance and others with scarcity according to His divine wisdom. The signs of His existence and power are evident in the way He distributes sustenance, and those who truly believe in Him will recognize this and trust in His decree.
orig: أولم يعلموا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder from Allah to His servants who may have committed sins and wronged themselves to never lose hope in His mercy. No matter how great the sins may be, Allah is always ready to forgive and His mercy is vast. It highlights the infinite forgiveness and compassion of Allah towards those who sincerely seek His forgiveness and strive to repent.
orig: قل يا عبادي الذين أسرفوا على أنفسهم لا تقنطوا من رحمة الله إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعا إنه هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: And turn in repentance and submit to your Lord before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning back to God before the punishment for disobedience reaches us. It is a reminder to repent and submit to God's will, as delaying this could lead to a state where help or escape from the consequences of our actions might not be available.
orig: وأنيبوا إلى ربكم وأسلموا له من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب ثم لا تنصرون

translation: And follow the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the best guidance and teachings from Allah before punishment befalls people unexpectedly. It urges believers to follow the righteous path and act accordingly, as one may not always be cognizant of the impending consequences of their actions.
orig: واتبعوا أحسن ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب بغتة وأنتم لا تشعرون

translation: lest a soul should say, 'Oh [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allah and that I was indeed among the mockers.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning against neglecting one's duties towards Allah and falling into mockery or disbelief. It emphasizes the importance of taking one's relationship with Allah seriously and avoiding actions or words that may lead to regret and loss in the Hereafter.
orig: أن تقول نفس يا حسرتا على ما فرطت في جنب الله وإن كنت لمن الساخرين

translation: Or say, 'If only Allah had guided me, I would have been among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that some people may blame their lack of righteousness on the guidance or lack thereof from Allah, when in reality, true guidance comes from following the teachings of Allah and striving to be among the righteous through one's own efforts and commitment to faith.
orig: أو تقول لو أن الله هداني لكنت من المتقين

translation: Or [lest] you say, 'If only I had a chance, so I could be among the doers of good.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who may seek to delay their repentance or good deeds until they are faced with punishment or calamity. It reminds us of the fleeting nature of life and the importance of seizing the opportunity to do good and seek forgiveness without delay.
orig: أو تقول حين ترى العذاب لو أن لي كرة فأكون من المحسنين

translation: Nay, but My signs have come to you, so you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the rejection of the signs and revelations from Allah by certain individuals. It highlights how some people, despite being shown clear signs of the truth, chose to deny them out of arrogance and disbelief. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the truth and failing to humble oneself before the guidance of Allah.
orig: بلى قد جاءتك آياتي فكذبت بها واستكبرت وكنت من الكافرين

translation: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about Allah - their faces will be blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Resurrection when the disbelievers will face the consequences of their lies about Allah. Their blackened faces symbolize their shame and guilt. The verse questions whether Hell is not a fitting abode for those who are arrogant and refuse to submit to the truth. It serves as a warning against pride and disbelief.
orig: ويوم القيامة ترى الذين كذبوا على الله وجوههم مسودة أليس في جهنم مثوى للمتكبرين

translation: And Allah will save those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that Allah will protect those who are mindful of Him and live a righteous life. They will be saved from harm and sorrow, as their faith in Allah will grant them peace and security in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: وينجي الله الذين اتقوا بمفازتهم لا يمسهم السوء ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah as the Creator and disposer of all things. It highlights the belief in Allah's absolute control over everything in the universe, serving as a reminder of His omnipotence and sovereignty. It inspires submission and trust in Allah's plan and decree, reassuring believers that He is in charge of their affairs and will take care of them.
orig: الله خالق كل شيء وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah - it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and control of Allah over the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that those who reject the signs of Allah and disbelieve are at loss and will ultimately face consequences for their disbelief.
orig: له مقاليد السماوات والأرض والذين كفروا بآيات الله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say, 'Do you order me to worship other than Allah, O ignorant ones?'
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to those who worship beings other than Allah, emphasizing the absurdity and ignorance of such actions. It highlights the importance of worshipping only Allah, the One True God, and condemns the worship of false idols or deities.
orig: قل أفغير الله تأمروني أعبد أيها الجاهلون

translation: And it was revealed to you and to those before you that if you associate [anything] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining sincerity and pure monotheism in worship. It warns against associating partners with Allah, as it nullifies one's good deeds and leads to ultimate loss. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain the purity of faith and to avoid any form of shirk (associating partners with Allah), as it is considered a grave sin in Islam.
orig: ولقد أوحي إليك وإلى الذين من قبلك لئن أشركت ليحبطن عملك ولتكونن من الخاسرين

translation: But rather, worship Allah and be among the grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and being grateful to Him. It reminds us that true worship involves both actions and attitudes, including gratitude for the blessings we receive from Allah. By being grateful, we demonstrate our acknowledgment of Allah's countless favors upon us and strengthen our faith and connection with Him.
orig: بل الله فاعبد وكن من الشاكرين

translation: And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal, while the Earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the incomprehensible greatness and power of Allah. It emphasizes that on the Day of Resurrection, all of creation will be under His control, and the heavens and the earth will be completely submissive to Him. It also condemns the act of associating partners with Allah, asserting that He is above such associations and is worthy of the highest praise and reverence.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره والأرض جميعا قبضته يوم القيامة والسماوات مطويات بيمينه سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Resurrection when the trumpet will be blown, causing all creatures in the heavens and the earth to die except those whom Allah wills. Then the trumpet will be blown a second time, and all will be resurrected, standing and awaiting their judgment. It emphasizes the absolute power and control of Allah over all creation and the certainty of the Day of Judgment.
orig: ونفخ في الصور فصعق من في السماوات ومن في الأرض إلا من شاء الله ثم نفخ فيه أخرى فإذا هم قيام ينظرون

translation: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and judgment will be made between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the earth will be illuminated with the light of Allah's presence. The Book of Deeds will be brought forth, and everyone, including the prophets and the witnesses, will be held accountable for their actions. Judgment will be passed with perfect justice, and no one will be wronged on that Day.
orig: وأشرقت الأرض بنور ربها ووضع الكتاب وجيء بالنبيين والشهداء وقضي بينهم بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and He is the best Knower of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice and accountability. It emphasizes that every individual will be rewarded or punished according to their actions and deeds. It serves as a reminder that one should always be conscious of their actions as they are being closely observed and recorded by Allah, who knows everything that we do.
orig: ووفيت كل نفس ما عملت وهو أعلم بما يفعلون

translation: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers."
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where the disbelievers are being driven towards Hell in groups. As they arrive at Hell, its gates will be opened, and the keepers will remind them that messengers had come to them during their life, reciting the verses of the Lord and warning them of the consequences of their disbelief. The disbelievers will acknowledge this, but it will be too late as the punishment has now become a reality for them. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of heeding the warnings and messages brought by messengers and not rejecting them, as the consequences of disbelief are severe.
orig: وسيق الذين كفروا إلى جهنم زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها فتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يتلون عليكم آيات ربكم وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا بلى ولكن حقت كلمة العذاب على الكافرين

translation: It will be said, 'Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein.' And how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe punishment awaiting those who are arrogant and refuse to submit to God's will. The arrogant will be condemned to Hell for eternity, emphasizing the negative consequences of pride and self-importance.
orig: قيل ادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: And those who feared their Lord will be led to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it, and its gates are opened, and its keepers will say to them, 'Peace be upon you, well have you fared. Enter it abiding eternally.'
interpretation: This verse describes the believers who have been conscious of their Lord and followed His commandments. As they enter Paradise in groups, they are greeted with peace and welcome by the keepers of Paradise. They are then granted entry to dwell in Paradise eternally, as a reward for their piety and faithfulness.
orig: وسيق الذين اتقوا ربهم إلى الجنة زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها وفتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها سلام عليكم طبتم فادخلوها خالدين

translation: And they will say, 'Praise to Allah, who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us inherit the earth, so we may settle in Paradise wherever we will.' And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the gratitude and praise of believers towards Allah for fulfilling His promise to them and granting them Paradise on earth. It highlights the reward reserved for those who do good deeds and follow the path of righteousness.
orig: وقالوا الحمد لله الذي صدقنا وعده وأورثنا الأرض نتبوأ من الجنة حيث نشاء فنعم أجر العاملين

translation: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne giving praise to their Lord. And judgement will be made between them in truth. And it will be said, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds!"
interpretation: This verse depicts the scene where the angels are seen glorifying and praising their Lord, and justice will be served among them by Allah in the most truthful manner. The verse emphasizes the unity of the angels in their devotion and submission to Allah, the ultimate Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds.
orig: وترى الملائكة حافين من حول العرش يسبحون بحمد ربهم وقضي بينهم بالحق وقيل الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Ha, Meem.
interpretation: This combination of letters (Ha, Meem) is known as a disjointed or isolated letters (Muqatta'at) in the Qur'an. The exact meaning of these letters is known only to Allah. It is believed to be one of the mysteries of the Qur'an, serving as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'anic text and encouraging believers to reflect on its deeper meanings and seek guidance from it.
orig: حم

translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an is a divine revelation from Allah, emphasizing His might and knowledge. It signifies the importance, power, and wisdom behind the words of the Qur'an, emphasizing that it is not a human creation but a guidance from the All-Powerful and All-Knowing Creator.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز العليم

translation: He is the Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, the Severe in punishment, the Bestower (of favours). There is no god but He: to Him is the final destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights some of the attributes of Allah, including His forgiveness of sins, acceptance of repentance, and severity in punishment. It emphasizes the belief in the oneness of Allah and the acknowledgment that all affairs ultimately return to Him.
orig: غافر الذنب وقابل التوب شديد العقاب ذي الطول لا إله إلا هو إليه المصير

translation: No one disputes concerning the verses of Allah except those who disbelieve, so let not their ability to move about through the land impress you.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who disbelieve are the ones who question and dispute the signs and verses of Allah. The verse advises believers not to be deceived by the apparent freedom and success of the disbelievers in the world, as their movement and activities in the land should not be a source of admiration or confusion for the believers. It reminds believers to remain steadfast in their faith and trust in Allah's wisdom and ultimate judgement.
orig: ما يجادل في آيات الله إلا الذين كفروا فلا يغررك تقلبهم في البلاد

translation: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, as did the confederates after them. Every nation schemed against their messenger to seize him, and argued falsely, aiming thereby to refute the truth. But then I seized them. How terrible was My retribution!
interpretation: This verse highlights that many nations in the past, including the people of Noah, rejected the truth brought by their messengers and instead conspired against them. They used false arguments to discredit the truth, but ultimately faced a severe punishment from God. It serves as a warning against denying the truth and conspiring against messengers of God.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح والأحزاب من بعدهم وهمت كل أمة برسولهم ليأخذوه وجادلوا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق فأخذتهم فكيف كان عقاب

translation: And thus will the word of your Lord have been justified upon those who disbelieved that they are the companions of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse establishes that those who disbelieve are destined to be in the Fire as a consequence of their rejection of the truth. It highlights the divine justice that will be served upon those who consciously choose to turn away from faith and righteousness.
orig: وكذلك حقت كلمت ربك على الذين كفروا أنهم أصحاب النار

translation: Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], 'Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the noble task of the angels who glorify and praise Allah, believing in Him and seeking forgiveness for the believers. It emphasizes the all-encompassing mercy and knowledge of Allah, urging believers to sincerely repent and follow the path of righteousness to be spared from the punishment of Hellfire.
orig: الذين يحملون العرش ومن حوله يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويؤمنون به ويستغفرون للذين آمنوا ربنا وسعت كل شيء رحمة وعلما فاغفر للذين تابوا واتبعوا سبيلك وقهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: Our Lord, and admit them to the gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to God, asking Him to admit the believers into Paradise, along with their righteous ancestors, spouses, and descendants. It acknowledges God's might and wisdom in fulfilling His promises and rewarding the righteous.
orig: ربنا وأدخلهم جنات عدن التي وعدتهم ومن صلح من آبائهم وأزواجهم وذرياتهم إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: And shield them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You shield from the evil consequences [of his deeds] on that Day - You have had mercy upon him. And that is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Lord's mercy and forgiveness towards those who sincerely repent for their sins and strive to avoid evil deeds. It highlights the importance of seeking protection from the consequences of wrongdoing by turning back to God in repentance. The verse conveys the idea that true success and salvation lie in receiving God's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: وقهم السيئات ومن تق السيئات يومئذ فقد رحمته وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve are invoking [Allah] beside whom there is no deity but He. They are calling upon a deity who is greater in hostility than your "own" [God]. The disbelievers are invoking faith while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of the disbelievers who call upon false deities and reject the true faith when they themselves are in need of guidance and faith. It emphasizes the futility of turning to anything other than Allah, the One true God, for help and guidance.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينادون لمقت الله أكبر من مقتكم أنفسكم إذ تدعون إلى الإيمان فتكفرون

translation: They will say, 'Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So, is there any way to get out of this predicament?'
interpretation: This verse speaks about the acknowledgment of one's sins and shortcomings before God, acknowledging His power to give life and cause death. It emphasizes the desperation of those who realize their mistakes and seek a way out of their predicament. It highlights the importance of repentance and seeking forgiveness from Allah, as He is the only one who can grant forgiveness and guide individuals towards the right path.
orig: قالوا ربنا أمتنا اثنتين وأحييتنا اثنتين فاعترفنا بذنوبنا فهل إلى خروج من سبيل

translation: That is because when Allah alone is invoked, you disbelieve; but if others are associated with Him, you believe. So the judgment is with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse highlights the hypocrisy of some individuals who only believe in God when their desires are not fulfilled, but when they associate partners with God and worship them alongside Allah, they believe they will gain what they desire. The verse emphasizes that true belief and judgment belong solely to Allah, the Supreme and Great, and that associating partners with Him is considered a form of disbelief.
orig: ذلكم بأنه إذا دعي الله وحده كفرتم وإن يشرك به تؤمنوا فالحكم لله العلي الكبير

translation: He is the one who shows you His signs and sends down provision for you from the sky. But none remember except those who turn back [to Him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is the one who provides for His creations and shows them His signs. However, only those who genuinely repent and turn back to Him are those who truly remember and appreciate His blessings.
orig: هو الذي يريكم آياته وينزل لكم من السماء رزقا وما يتذكر إلا من ينيب

translation: So invoke Allah, being sincere to Him in religion, even if the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerity in worship and calling upon Allah. It encourages believers to maintain their faith and devotion to Allah despite any opposition or dislike from disbelievers. It highlights the need for steadfastness in faith and commitment to Allah's commands, emphasizing that pleasing Allah should be the ultimate goal in one's worship, without being influenced by the opinions or objections of others.
orig: فادعوا الله مخلصين له الدين ولو كره الكافرون

translation: He is the Exalted in Might, the Owner of the Throne; He sends the inspiration by His command to whom He wills of His servants to warn [them] of the Day of Meeting.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah, who sends guidance and inspiration to his servants as He wills, in order to warn them about the Day of Meeting, when they shall be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: رفيع الدرجات ذو العرش يلقي الروح من أمره على من يشاء من عباده لينذر يوم التلاق

translation: The Day when they will emerge, nothing concerning them will be concealed from Allah. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, when all people will be brought forth, nothing about them will be hidden from Allah. On that day, all power and authority will belong solely to Allah, the One who is Supreme and All-Powerful.
orig: يوم هم بارزون لا يخفى على الله منهم شيء لمن الملك اليوم لله الواحد القهار

translation: On the Day every soul will be compensated for what it earned. No injustice today. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse conveys the concept of accountability and justice in Islam. It emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, every individual will be rewarded or punished based on their actions in this world. It assures that on that day, there will be no injustice, as Allah is quick and accurate in His judgement. This serves as a reminder for believers to be mindful of their deeds and to strive for righteousness.
orig: اليوم تجزى كل نفس بما كسبت لا ظلم اليوم إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: And warn them of the Day of Distress when hearts are at the throats, filled with anguish. For the wrongdoers, there will be no devoted friend nor any intercessor to be obeyed.
interpretation: This verse serves as a powerful reminder of the Day of Judgment when individuals will be filled with fear and regret. It emphasizes that no wrongdoer will have a close friend or intermediary to help them in that time of need. The verse underscores the importance of leading a righteous life and seeking forgiveness, as no one else will be able to assist on that fearful Day.
orig: وأنذرهم يوم الآزفة إذ القلوب لدى الحناجر كاظمين ما للظالمين من حميم ولا شفيع يطاع

translation: He knows the treachery of the eyes and what the breasts conceal.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah knows not only the apparent actions that may deceive others but also the secret thoughts and intentions that people harbor in their hearts. It serves as a reminder that nothing is hidden from Allah, and He is fully aware of everything, both the seen and the unseen. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity in our actions and intentions, as Allah knows the true state of our hearts.
orig: يعلم خائنة الأعين وما تخفي الصدور

translation: And Allah judges with truth, while those they invoke besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, Allah - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate authority and justice of Allah. It highlights that only Allah can truly judge with fairness and righteousness, while those whom people invoke besides Him have no power to judge at all. It reaffirms the attributes of Allah as the All-Hearing and All-Seeing, underscoring His complete knowledge and awareness of all things.
orig: والله يقضي بالحق والذين يدعون من دونه لا يقضون بشيء إن الله هو السميع البصير

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but Allah seized them for their sins. And they had not from Allah any protector.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reflecting on the consequences faced by those who came before us. It serves as a reminder that regardless of their strength and impact on the earth, they were eventually punished by Allah for their sins. This serves as a lesson for us to be mindful of our actions and to seek guidance from Allah as our ultimate protector.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين كانوا من قبلهم كانوا هم أشد منهم قوة وآثارا في الأرض فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم وما كان لهم من الله من واق

translation: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allah seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.
interpretation: This verse illustrates that the disbelievers were punished by Allah not because they were not provided with clear evidence or guidance, but because they rejected the messengers and the signs they brought. It emphasizes the power and severity of Allah's punishment for those who persist in disbelief despite receiving clear guidance.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كانت تأتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فكفروا فأخذهم الله إنه قوي شديد العقاب

translation: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) was sent by Allah with clear signs and undeniable authority to guide his people. It highlights the prophethood of Moses and the miraculous signs he was given to prove the authenticity of his message.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun, but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."
interpretation: This verse refers to the response of Pharaoh, Haman, and Qarun claiming that the Messenger was merely a magician and a liar. It highlights the disbelief and arrogance of these individuals despite the clear signs and miracles presented by the Messenger. It serves as a reminder of the rejection and denial faced by the Prophets throughout history from those who chose to oppose the truth and distort reality for their own benefit.
orig: إلى فرعون وهامان وقارون فقالوا ساحر كذاب

translation: So when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive.' But the plan of the disbelievers is only in error.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reaction of the disbelievers to the truth that was revealed to them, showing their cruel intentions to harm the believers and their families. It also underscores that the schemes of the disbelievers are rooted in misguided actions and falsehood.
orig: فلما جاءهم بالحق من عندنا قالوا اقتلوا أبناء الذين آمنوا معه واستحيوا نساءهم وما كيد الكافرين إلا في ضلال

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'Leave me to kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land.'
interpretation: This verse reflects Pharaoh's tyrannical nature and his fear of Moses causing a shift in faith among his people. It also shows his concern that Moses might bring chaos and corruption to society. Despite Pharaoh's arrogance and cruelty, it highlights the struggle between good and evil, righteousness and oppression, and the power of faith in the face of tyranny.
orig: وقال فرعون ذروني أقتل موسى وليدع ربه إني أخاف أن يبدل دينكم أو أن يظهر في الأرض الفساد

translation: And Moses said, 'Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account.'
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Moses seeks protection from Allah from the harm and mischief of those who are arrogant and do not believe in the Day of Judgment. It highlights the importance of seeking refuge in Allah from those who are proud and deny the accountability of their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: وقال موسى إني عذت بربي وربكم من كل متكبر لا يؤمن بيوم الحساب

translation: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, 'Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is Allah' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of a believer from the family of Pharaoh who expressed his faith in Allah despite the oppressive regime he was surrounded by. He questions the unjust killing of a man who simply believes in Allah and presents evidence from God. The believer warns against committing injustice by killing him, as if he is truthful, consequences will follow those who deny the truth. It emphasizes the importance of justice, warning against transgression and falsehood, as Allah does not guide those who intentionally engage in such behavior.
orig: وقال رجل مؤمن من آل فرعون يكتم إيمانه أتقتلون رجلا أن يقول ربي الله وقد جاءكم بالبينات من ربكم وإن يك كاذبا فعليه كذبه وإن يك صادقا يصبكم بعض الذي يعدكم إن الله لا يهدي من هو مسرف كذاب

translation: O my people, sovereignty today is yours, dominant in the land. But who will help us from the punishment of Allah if it comes to us?' Pharaoh said, 'I show you only what I see, and I guide you only to the right path.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the arrogance of Pharaoh, as he claims to be the ultimate authority and guide for his people. Despite his earthly power, Pharaoh's false pride blinds him to the true guidance from Allah. It serves as a warning against arrogance and a reminder that true guidance comes from following the path of righteousness.
orig: يا قوم لكم الملك اليوم ظاهرين في الأرض فمن ينصرنا من بأس الله إن جاءنا قال فرعون ما أريكم إلا ما أرى وما أهديكم إلا سبيل الرشاد

translation: And the believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "O my people, indeed, I fear for you a fate like the day of the companies - [a day of battle like that of] the people of the well."
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of a believing man from Pharaoh's family who kept his faith hidden. Despite his fear of the consequences, he courageously warns his people of the impending punishment, drawing parallels to the past calamities suffered by those who rejected the truth. The verse emphasizes the importance of speaking out against injustice and warning others of the consequences of their actions, even at personal risk.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم إني أخاف عليكم مثل يوم الأحزاب

translation: The likeness of the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them. And Allah intends no injustice for [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the repetition of patterns in the behavior and consequences of past nations such as the people of Noah, 'Aad, and Thamud. It serves as a reminder that Allah does not deal unjustly with His servants, and that the fate of those nations is a lesson for the people to reflect upon and take heed.
orig: مثل دأب قوم نوح وعاد وثمود والذين من بعدهم وما الله يريد ظلما للعباد

translation: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling.
interpretation: This verse highlights Prophet Hud's concern for his people, warning them of the impending Day of Judgment and the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that every individual will be held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ويا قوم إني أخاف عليكم يوم التناد

translation: On the Day when you turn away, fleeing without looking back, there shall be no protection for you from Allah. And whomever Allah lets go astray will have no guide.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from the guidance of Allah. It highlights that on the Day of Judgment, those who choose to ignore the path of righteousness and flee from their responsibilities will find no safety or protection from Allah. It also emphasizes that those who are misguided by Allah will have no one to guide them back to the right path. The verse stresses the importance of staying true to the teachings of Islam and seeking guidance from Allah to avoid being lost and astray.
orig: يوم تولون مدبرين ما لكم من الله من عاصم ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And Joseph had already come to you with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of what he brought to you until when he died, you said, 'Never will Allah send a messenger after him.' Thus does Allah leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of people to doubt the messengers of Allah even when they come with clear evidence and signs. It serves as a warning against rejecting the message of the prophets due to skepticism and disbelief. Those who deny the messengers and indulge in transgression will ultimately be led astray by their disbelief and arrogance.
orig: ولقد جاءكم يوسف من قبل بالبينات فما زلتم في شك مما جاءكم به حتى إذا هلك قلتم لن يبعث الله من بعده رسولا كذلك يضل الله من هو مسرف مرتاب

translation: Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without any authority having come to them - there is in their hearts nothing but arrogance, which they will never attain. So seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the arrogance and pride of those who argue and dispute about the signs and revelations of Allah without any valid reasoning or evidence. Their hearts are filled with pride, which prevents them from reaching true understanding and guidance. The verse advises seeking refuge in Allah from such arrogance and emphasizes that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing, aware of everything including the intentions and actions of those who challenge His signs without justification.
orig: الذين يجادلون في آيات الله بغير سلطان أتاهم كبر مقتا عند الله وعند الذين آمنوا كذلك يطبع الله على كل قلب متكبر جبار

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'O Haman, construct for me a tower that I might reach the ways -
interpretation: Pharaoh, in his arrogance, commands Haman to build a tower so he can reach and challenge the ways or paths leading to the heavens, showing his delusion and desire to assert his power even over what is beyond human reach.
orig: وقال فرعون يا هامان ابن لي صرحا لعلي أبلغ الأسباب

translation: The example of the heaven is like that of the earth when it is clear. But I consider him a liar, and thus he made the evil of his deed pleasing to Pharaoh, and he was averted from the way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not but in ruin.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the arrogance and disbelief of Pharaoh in the face of the signs of God. Despite the clear signs of God's existence and power, Pharaoh chose to deny the truth and lead his people astray. His evil deeds were made to seem appealing to him and he was swayed from the right path. In the end, all the schemes and plans of Pharaoh only led to his own downfall and ruin.
orig: أسباب السماوات فأطلع إلى إله موسى وإني لأظنه كاذبا وكذلك زين لفرعون سوء عمله وصد عن السبيل وما كيد فرعون إلا في تباب

translation: And the one who had believed said, 'O my people, follow me, I will guide you to the way of right conduct.'
interpretation: The believer in this verse is calling out to his people to follow him in the path of righteousness and guidance. It signifies the responsibility of those who have faith to lead others towards the right path and promote virtuous behavior among their community.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم اتبعون أهدكم سبيل الرشاد

translation: O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the life of this world is fleeting and temporary, filled with material enjoyments that are short-lived. The true and lasting abode is the Hereafter, where our deeds and actions in this life will determine our eternal dwellings. It encourages believers to prioritize their actions and decisions based on the values and principles that will lead to success and contentment in the Hereafter, rather than being solely focused on the temporary pleasures of this world.
orig: يا قوم إنما هذه الحياة الدنيا متاع وإن الآخرة هي دار القرار

translation: Whoever does an evil deed will not be recompensed but the like thereof; and whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - those will enter Paradise, being given provision therein without account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of divine justice and reward. It states that those who perform evil deeds will be punished accordingly, while those who do righteous deeds, regardless of gender, and believe in God will be granted entry into Paradise. The provision and blessings given to them in Paradise will be unlimited and without any measure or account, denoting the immense mercy and grace of Allah toward the believers.
orig: من عمل سيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها ومن عمل صالحا من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فأولئك يدخلون الجنة يرزقون فيها بغير حساب

translation: And O my people, what is my duty if I invite you to salvation but you invite me to the Fire?
interpretation: This verse highlights the struggle of prophets who invite their people to goodness, righteousness, and salvation, but their people persist in rejecting the message and choosing the path of ignorance and evil. It conveys the idea of the difficulty faced by messengers in trying to guide their communities towards the right path, and the rejection and opposition they face in return. It serves as a reminder of the importance of heeding the call towards salvation and righteousness, and the consequences of persisting in disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: ويا قوم ما لي أدعوكم إلى النجاة وتدعونني إلى النار

translation: You invite me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stark difference between the invitation of the disbelievers to abandon faith in Allah and commit shirk, while Prophet Ibrahim (AS) invites them to acknowledge and worship the All-Powerful, the Ever-Forgiving. It teaches us the importance of calling people towards faith in God, who is All-Powerful and Most Merciful, rather than falling into ignorance and disbelief.
orig: تدعونني لأكفر بالله وأشرك به ما ليس لي به علم وأنا أدعوكم إلى العزيز الغفار

translation: No doubt you are calling me to something to which there is no call in this world or in the Hereafter; and our return is to Allah; and the transgressors will be the companions of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the true call of Allah and not being misled by false calls or desires that lead to transgression. It highlights the certainty of returning to Allah in the Hereafter, where accountability for one's actions will be held. Those who transgress and deviate from the right path will face the consequences of their actions by being among the inhabitants of the Hellfire.
orig: لا جرم أنما تدعونني إليه ليس له دعوة في الدنيا ولا في الآخرة وأن مردنا إلى الله وأن المسرفين هم أصحاب النار

translation: So you will remember what I tell you. And I entrust my affair to Allah. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of trusting in Allah and entrusting one's affairs to Him. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, Allah is aware of all matters and has full knowledge of His servants. The verse emphasizes the significance of turning to Allah for guidance and relying on Him in all aspects of life.
orig: فستذكرون ما أقول لكم وأفوض أمري إلى الله إن الله بصير بالعباد

translation: Allah protected him from the evils of what they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and protection provided by Allah to those who have faith. It demonstrates that no matter what difficulties one may face or the schemes plotted against them, if they remain steadfast in their belief and trust in Allah, they will be safeguarded. Moreover, it also emphasizes that those who act unjustly and transgress the limits, like the people of Pharaoh, will face severe consequences and punishment ultimately.
orig: فوقاه الله سيئات ما مكروا وحاق بآل فرعون سوء العذاب

translation: The Fire, they are exposed to it morning and evening. And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], 'Admit the family of Pharaoh into the severest punishment.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the inevitable punishment that awaits those who reject the truth and transgress against God. The family of Pharaoh, known for their tyranny and arrogance, is specifically mentioned here as an example of those who will face severe punishment. It serves as a reminder that no one, regardless of their status or power, is above accountability on the Day of Judgment.
orig: النار يعرضون عليها غدوا وعشيا ويوم تقوم الساعة أدخلوا آل فرعون أشد العذاب

translation: And [mention] when they will argue in Hellfire, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, 'Indeed, we were your followers, so are you able to avert from us any [part] of the Fire?'
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in the afterlife where those who followed the arrogant will blame them for their situation in hellfire. The weak, who were misled by the arrogant in the worldly life, will seek to hold the arrogant accountable for their fate in Hell, questioning if they can protect them from any portion of the punishment.
orig: وإذ يتحاجون في النار فيقول الضعفاء للذين استكبروا إنا كنا لكم تبعا فهل أنتم مغنون عنا نصيبا من النار

translation: Those who were arrogant will say, 'Indeed, we are all in it. Indeed, Allah has passed judgment upon the servants.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the fate of those who displayed arrogance and pride. They will come to acknowledge their wrongdoing and the judgment of Allah upon them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and emphasizes the importance of humility in the eyes of Allah.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا إنا كل فيها إن الله قد حكم بين العباد

translation: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, 'Call upon your Lord to lighten for us the punishment for a day.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the desperation of those who are in Hell, seeking any relief from the torment they are facing. Despite their disbelief and disobedience in the world, they now acknowledge the power of God and seek His mercy even for a brief respite from the punishment. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate authority and mercy of Allah, even in the face of severe consequences for one's actions.
orig: وقال الذين في النار لخزنة جهنم ادعوا ربكم يخفف عنا يوما من العذاب

translation: They will say, "Have there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply, "Then supplicate [yourselves]," but the supplication of the disbelievers is not except in error.
interpretation: In this verse, it is highlighted how disbelievers, when confronted with the truth and the evidence brought by messengers, fail to recognize the signs and resort to misguided supplication. Their lack of faith and rejection of the truth lead them astray in their prayers and requests, as they are far from the guidance and light of faith. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and accepting divine signs and guidance in order for supplications to be meaningful and accepted.
orig: قالوا أولم تك تأتيكم رسلكم بالبينات قالوا بلى قالوا فادعوا وما دعاء الكافرين إلا في ضلال

translation: Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who have believed during the life of this world and on the Day the witnesses will stand,
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the promise of Allah to support and aid His messengers and those who have faith in Him during their worldly life. It also refers to the Day of Judgment when all will stand witness to their actions and beliefs.
orig: إنا لننصر رسلنا والذين آمنوا في الحياة الدنيا ويوم يقوم الأشهاد

translation: On a Day when the excuses of the wrongdoers will not benefit them, and they will have the curse, and they will have the worst home.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment when the wrongdoers will not be able to offer any excuses for their actions. They will be cursed and will dwell in a place of ultimate suffering and regret. It serves as a warning for individuals to strive to live righteously and refrain from wrongdoing to avoid facing such consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: يوم لا ينفع الظالمين معذرتهم ولهم اللعنة ولهم سوء الدار

translation: And We certainly gave Moses the guidance and We made the Children of Israel inherit the Book
interpretation: This verse highlights how God granted guidance to Prophet Moses and entrusted the Children of Israel with the divine scripture, emphasizing the importance of guidance and knowledge in their spiritual journey.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الهدى وأورثنا بني إسرائيل الكتاب

translation: A guidance and a reminder for those of understanding.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is meant to guide and remind those who possess intellect and understanding. It indicates that the Qur'an is not only a book of guidance but also a source of wisdom and reminders for those who reflect and ponder on its teachings.
orig: هدى وذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: So be patient, indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience, as the promises of Allah are true and will come to fruition. It also encourages seeking forgiveness for one's sins and praises the act of glorifying and exalting Allah, both in the evening and in the morning. Overall, the verse serves as a reminder to have faith, patience, seek forgiveness, and engage in the remembrance of Allah regularly.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق واستغفر لذنبك وسبح بحمد ربك بالعشي والإبكار

translation: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without any authority having come to them - there is not within their breasts except pride, [the extent of] which they cannot reach. So seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance of those who engage in arguments about the signs of Allah without any sound evidence or knowledge. Their hearts are filled with pride, and they overestimate their own abilities. The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking refuge in Allah from such arrogance and ignorance, reminding us that Allah is the All-Hearing and All-Seeing, aware of everything we do and think.
orig: إن الذين يجادلون في آيات الله بغير سلطان أتاهم إن في صدورهم إلا كبر ما هم ببالغيه فاستعذ بالله إنه هو السميع البصير

translation: The creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the greatness and complexity of the universe compared to human beings. It emphasizes that the creation of the heavens and the earth is a remarkable and awe-inspiring feat that surpasses the creation of mankind. Despite this, many people are unaware and fail to recognize the magnificence of the universe and the power of the Creator.
orig: لخلق السماوات والأرض أكبر من خلق الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And not equal are the blind and the seeing, nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that there is a stark difference between those who can see and those who are blind, as well as between those who believe in God and do good deeds and those who do evil. It serves as a reminder for people to reflect on these distinctions and not to overlook the importance of faith and righteous actions in guiding their lives.
orig: وما يستوي الأعمى والبصير والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ولا المسيء قليلا ما تتذكرون

translation: Indeed, the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - but most of the people do not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment (the Hour) and the fact that it will surely come to pass, although many people fail to truly believe in it. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and belief in the unseen, including belief in the Hereafter and accountability on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن الساعة لآتية لا ريب فيها ولكن أكثر الناس لا يؤمنون

translation: And your Lord has said, 'Call upon Me; I will respond to you.' Indeed, those who are too proud to worship Me will enter Hell, abased.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of calling upon Allah in sincere worship and humility. It highlights the consequences of arrogance and pride, stating that those who turn away from worshipping Allah with humility will face punishment in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder to seek Allah's help and guidance with sincerity and humility.
orig: وقال ربكم ادعوني أستجب لكم إن الذين يستكبرون عن عبادتي سيدخلون جهنم داخرين

translation: It is Allah who made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day giving sight. Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people are not grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the bounties of Allah upon mankind, including the alternation of night and day which serve different purposes and provide for different needs. It emphasizes that despite these blessings, many people fail to show gratitude for them. The verse reminds us to appreciate the gifts and provisions that Allah has bestowed upon us, and to be mindful of our actions and expressions of thankfulness.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الليل لتسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون

translation: That is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the creator of all things and questions why people would turn away from Him to worship false deities. It serves as a reminder of the importance of believing in and worshipping the one true God, Allah.
orig: ذلكم الله ربكم خالق كل شيء لا إله إلا هو فأنى تؤفكون

translation: Thus do those who deny the signs of Allah deceive themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who deny the signs of Allah only deceive themselves. Denying or ignoring the signs and revelations of Allah ultimately leads them astray and hinders them from the truth and guidance provided by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and accepting the signs of Allah as a means of staying on the right path and gaining spiritual enlightenment.
orig: كذلك يؤفك الذين كانوا بآيات الله يجحدون

translation: It is Allah who made for you the earth a place of settlement and the sky a canopy, and formed you and perfected your forms and provided you with good things. That is Allah, your Lord, so blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and majesty of Allah as the Creator of the earth and sky, the Designer of human form, and the Provider of sustenance. It serves as a reminder of Allah's blessings and encourages gratitude and recognition of Allah's sovereignty over all existence.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الأرض قرارا والسماء بناء وصوركم فأحسن صوركم ورزقكم من الطيبات ذلكم الله ربكم فتبارك الله رب العالمين

translation: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, [being] sincere to Him in religion. Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of monotheism, stating that there is no one worthy of worship except Allah, the Ever-Living. It urges believers to call upon Him sincerely and with devotion. The verse concludes with praise for Allah as the Lord of all existence, highlighting His infinite power and control over the entire universe.
orig: هو الحي لا إله إلا هو فادعوه مخلصين له الدين الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah.' Say, 'I will not follow your desires, for then I would go astray and I would not be among the rightly guided.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of staying steadfast in the worship of Allah alone, even in the face of pressure or temptation to follow others' desires or worship other deities. It emphasizes the need to adhere to the clear guidance from Allah and submit to Him, the Lord of all the worlds.
orig: قل إني نهيت أن أعبد الذين تدعون من دون الله لما جاءني البينات من ربي وأمرت أن أسلم لرب العالمين

translation: He it is Who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clot; then He brings you forth as infants; then that you may reach your full strength; and then that you may become old men - though some among you die before - and that you may reach an appointed term, and that you may understand.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the stages of human creation and the ultimate purpose of our existence. It emphasizes the gradual process of human development, from being created from dust to reaching old age. The verse highlights the inevitability of death and the importance of reaching an appointed term in life. It encourages us to reflect on the purpose of our existence and to use our intellect to understand the signs of Allah in our journey from creation to old age.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم يخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ثم لتكونوا شيوخا ومنكم من يتوفى من قبل ولتبلغوا أجلا مسمى ولعلكم تعقلون

translation: He is the one who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and control of Allah over all creation. It highlights His ability to bring life and death and His authority to simply command something to exist, and it exists. It establishes the concept of Allah's divine decree and the immediate realization of His command, illustrating His unmatched sovereignty and omnipotence.
orig: هو الذي يحيي ويميت فإذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: Have you not seen those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah - how they are averted?
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of people who engage in arguments and disputes about the signs and revelations of Allah. It questions why they are so intent on turning away from these signs and choosing to dispute them rather than reflect on their profound meaning and guidance. The verse serves as a reminder to focus on understanding and benefiting from Allah's signs rather than engaging in futile arguments and distractions.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يجادلون في آيات الله أنى يصرفون

translation: Those who reject the Book and that with which We sent Our messengers will soon know.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who deny the truth of the scriptures and the messages sent by Allah through His prophets will eventually come to realize the error of their ways. It serves as a warning to those who reject the guidance and teachings provided in the Quran and through the messengers of Allah. Ultimately, the truth will become apparent to them, and they will understand the consequences of their rejection.
orig: الذين كذبوا بالكتاب وبما أرسلنا به رسلنا فسوف يعلمون

translation: When the collars are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of accountability and reckoning on the Day of Judgment, where the disbelievers and wrongdoers will face the consequences of their actions.
