The image of collars and chains conveys the idea of being bound and restrained, illustrating the helplessness and submission of those who opposed God's guidance. The act of being dragged further emphasizes the humiliation and punishment awaiting those who rejected the truth and rebelled against their Creator.
orig: إذ الأغلال في أعناقهم والسلاسل يسحبون

translation: In boiling water, then in the Fire they will be burned.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment that awaits those who have disobeyed Allah and committed sins. It illustrates a vivid depiction of the intense torment and agony that the wrongdoers will face in the Hereafter. It serves as a warning to remind believers to stay on the right path and avoid actions that could lead them to such a fate.
orig: في الحميم ثم في النار يسجرون

translation: Then it will be said to them, 'Where are those you used to associate with Allah?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the Day of Judgment when those who associated partners with Allah will be questioned about the entities they worshiped alongside Allah. It emphasizes the folly and futility of polytheism and idol worship, and serves as a reminder of the importance of worshipping Allah alone without any partners.
orig: ثم قيل لهم أين ما كنتم تشركون

translation: Those whom they invoke besides Allah have misled them; rather, they were calling on nothing before. Thus Allah sends astray the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of the disbelievers' invocation of beings other than Allah, emphasizing that those false entities cannot guide or help them as they were not invoked before. It serves as a reminder that true guidance and support can only come from Allah, and those who persist in disbelief will remain misguided.
orig: من دون الله قالوا ضلوا عنا بل لم نكن ندعو من قبل شيئا كذلك يضل الله الكافرين

translation: That is because you used to exult on earth in other than the truth, and that you used to be very happy.
interpretation: This verse highlights that one of the reasons for people's suffering and pain is their rejoicing in falsehood and indulging in worldly pleasures excessively. It serves as a reminder to prioritize truth and righteousness over temporary joy and amusement in order to attain lasting contentment and success.
orig: ذلكم بما كنتم تفرحون في الأرض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تمرحون

translation: Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein. How wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
interpretation: This verse is a stark warning to those who are arrogant and proud. It warns them of the severe consequences of their pride and arrogance in the Hereafter, where they will be sent to Hell and will dwell there forever. The verse highlights the negative outcome and punishment reserved for those who display arrogance and pride, emphasizing the importance of humility and modesty in the eyes of God.
orig: ادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And whether We show you some of what We promise them or We take you in death, to Us is their return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and trust in Allah's promise. It reminds believers that whatever Allah has promised is true and will come to pass, whether they witness it in this world or in the life after death. It reassures that ultimately, all beings will return to Allah, and He will fulfill His promise.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق فإما نرينك بعض الذي نعدهم أو نتوفينك فإلينا يرجعون

translation: And We have certainly sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for a messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, it will be concluded in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that messengers were sent before the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), some of whose stories are mentioned in the Quran, while others are not. It reminds that every sign or verse brought by a messenger is by the permission of Allah, and when the command of Allah is decreed, it will be fulfilled with truth. Those who deny the truth will ultimately face loss and failure.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا رسلا من قبلك منهم من قصصنا عليك ومنهم من لم نقصص عليك وما كان لرسول أن يأتي بآية إلا بإذن الله فإذا جاء أمر الله قضي بالحق وخسر هنالك المبطلون

translation: It is Allah who made for you the grazing animals, that you may ride on some of them and eat from others.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah in creating animals such as cattle, camels, and other livestock, which serve multiple purposes for humankind. Some animals are meant for transportation and labor, while others are a source of sustenance through their meat and milk. It reminds believers of the wisdom and care in Allah's creation, providing for both our physical needs and convenience in various ways.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الأنعام لتركبوا منها ومنها تأكلون

translation: And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts; and upon them and upon ships you are carried.
interpretation: This verse describes the various benefits and provisions derived from the Earth, encouraging believers to reflect on the sustenance and necessities provided by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of utilizing these resources responsibly and with gratitude, as well as recognizing the miraculous transportation systems created for human ease and mobility.
orig: ولكم فيها منافع ولتبلغوا عليها حاجة في صدوركم وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون

translation: And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of Allah do you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to reflect upon the signs of Allah in the world around us. It challenges us to consider which of Allah's signs are we denying, and encourages us to ponder over the evidence of His existence and power in nature and in our lives.
orig: ويريكم آياته فأي آيات الله تنكرون

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power and in impression on the land, but Allah seized them for their sins. And they had not from Allah any protector.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of reflecting on the consequences faced by previous nations who were even more powerful and left significant imprints on the earth but were still punished by Allah due to their sins. It serves as a reminder that worldly power and strength cannot protect one from the consequences of their actions if they go against the commands of Allah.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا أكثر منهم وأشد قوة وآثارا في الأرض فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: So when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in what knowledge they had, and what they used to mock befell them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of those who mock the messengers of God and reject the signs they bring. When the truth is eventually revealed to them through clear proofs, they are no longer able to deny it. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and disbelief.
orig: فلما جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فرحوا بما عندهم من العلم وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: So when they saw Our punishment, they said, 'We believe in Allah alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people may only turn to Allah and disbelieve in their previous polytheistic beliefs when faced with a calamity or punishment. It serves as a reminder that true faith should not be a mere reaction to adversity, but a consistent belief in the Oneness of Allah, free from associating any partners with Him.
orig: فلما رأوا بأسنا قالوا آمنا بالله وحده وكفرنا بما كنا به مشركين

translation: So their faith did not benefit them when they saw Our punishment. [It was] the established precedent of Allah which had occurred among His servants, and the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].
interpretation: This verse speaks about the consequence of the disbelievers' lack of faith and the futility of their belief when they witnessed the punishment from Allah. It emphasizes that true faith should be reflected in actions and those who failed to believe faced loss and destruction.
orig: فلم يك ينفعهم إيمانهم لما رأوا بأسنا سنت الله التي قد خلت في عباده وخسر هنالك الكافرون

translation: Ha-Mim.
interpretation: This verse is the beginning of Surah Ghafir (The Forgiver) in the Qur'an. The meaning of 'Ha-Mim' is known only to Allah, but these letters, which are referred to as 'Muqatta'at,' serve as a mysterious and miraculous aspect of the Qur'an and are a sign of the divine origin of the Qur'an. Believers recite and ponder over these letters in awe and reverence, acknowledging that only Allah truly knows their full significance.
orig: حم

translation: A revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an is a divine revelation from Allah, who is described as the Most Merciful and the Most Compassionate. It emphasizes the loving and caring nature of Allah, as well as His eternal mercy and compassion towards all of creation.
orig: تنزيل من الرحمن الرحيم

translation: A Book whose verses have been detailed, an Arabic Qur'an for people who know
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the clarity and detail of the Qur'an, highlighting that its verses are clear and easy to understand. It also emphasizes that the Qur'an is in Arabic to ensure its accessibility to the people who understand the language. The verse suggests that the knowledge and understanding of the Qur'an are accessible to those who seek it with sincerity and comprehension.
orig: كتاب فصلت آياته قرآنا عربيا لقوم يعلمون

translation: as a bringer of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as someone who brings good news to the believers and warns the disbelievers but acknowledges that most people turn away from his message and do not listen to it.
orig: بشيرا ونذيرا فأعرض أكثرهم فهم لا يسمعون

translation: And they say, "Our hearts are covered against what you call us to, and there is a heaviness in our ears, and a barrier between us and you. So act; indeed, we are acting."
interpretation: This verse addresses the stubbornness and resistance of some individuals to the message of the Qur'an. Despite being called to guidance and truth, they claim that their hearts are closed and their ears are heavy to accept it. They perceive a barrier separating themselves from the believers and the message. The verse emphasizes that regardless of their objections and excuses, actions will speak louder, suggesting that it is essential to keep striving for good deeds and righteousness regardless of the disbelief of others.
orig: وقالوا قلوبنا في أكنة مما تدعونا إليه وفي آذاننا وقر ومن بيننا وبينك حجاب فاعمل إننا عاملون

translation: Say, "I am only a human like you, [but] it is revealed to me that your god is one God; so take a straight course to Him and seek His forgiveness." And woe to the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humanity of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his role as a messenger. It highlights the importance of sincerely worshipping and seeking forgiveness from the one true God. The verse also warns against polytheism, showing the severe consequences for those who associate partners with God.
orig: قل إنما أنا بشر مثلكم يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فاستقيموا إليه واستغفروه وويل للمشركين

translation: Those who do not give the zakah, and in the Hereafter they are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of giving zakah (obligatory alms) as a symbol of charity and compassion towards others. It also serves as a reminder that neglecting this duty may reflect a lack of faith in the Hereafter and could lead one towards disbelief.
orig: الذين لا يؤتون الزكاة وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have a reward uninterrupted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of reward in the afterlife for those who believe in Allah and perform good deeds. It highlights that the reward for such individuals will be continuous and without end, illustrating the infinite mercy and grace of Allah for those who faithfully follow His guidance.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم أجر غير ممنون

translation: Say, 'Do you indeed disbelieve in He who created the earth in two days and attribute to Him equals? That is the Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the disbelief of those who refuse to acknowledge the power and uniqueness of the Creator, who created the earth in a short period of time. It emphasizes the absurdity of assigning partners or equals to this Supreme Being, who is the Lord of all existence and creation.
orig: قل أئنكم لتكفرون بالذي خلق الأرض في يومين وتجعلون له أندادا ذلك رب العالمين

translation: And [Allah] placed therein firmly set mountains over its surface and blessed it and apportioned therein its sustenance in four days without distinction - for [the information] of those who ask.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the Earth and everything within it. It speaks of how Allah has placed mountains on the Earth, blessed it with provisions, and arranged its sustenance in a perfect manner within a short period of time. The verse emphasizes the ease with which Allah can create and provide for His creation, demonstrating His might and mercy.
orig: وجعل فيها رواسي من فوقها وبارك فيها وقدر فيها أقواتها في أربعة أيام سواء للسائلين

translation: Then He directed Himself to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come [into being], willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We have come willingly."
interpretation: This verse describes the creation of the heavens and the earth, emphasizing how everything in the universe submits to the command of Allah willingly. It highlights the ultimate power and authority of Allah over all creation, emphasizing that every element of the universe is obedient to His will.
orig: ثم استوى إلى السماء وهي دخان فقال لها وللأرض ائتيا طوعا أو كرها قالتا أتينا طائعين

translation: So He completed them as seven heavens in two days, and He inspired in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps and as protection. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse describes the creation of the heavens in two days and the assigning of specific commands to each heaven. It also mentions the adornment of the nearest heaven with stars as a form of beauty and protection. The verse emphasizes the power and knowledge of Allah in the precise planning and organization of the universe.
orig: فقضاهن سبع سماوات في يومين وأوحى في كل سماء أمرها وزينا السماء الدنيا بمصابيح وحفظا ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: So if they turn away, then say, 'I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] 'Aad and Thamud.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who reject the message of the Quran should be warned of the consequences similar to the destruction that befell the ancient tribes of 'Aad and Thamud. It serves as a reminder that refusal to heed the message of guidance can lead to catastrophic consequences.
orig: فإن أعرضوا فقل أنذرتكم صاعقة مثل صاعقة عاد وثمود

translation: When the messengers came to them from among themselves, before them and behind them, [saying], 'Do not worship except Allah,' they said, 'If our Lord had willed, He would have sent down the angels, so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of some people when messengers are sent to them, reminding them to worship only Allah. Instead of accepting the message and submitting to the truth, they mockingly question why angels were not sent down instead, thus rejecting the message and demonstrating disbelief and ingratitude.
orig: إذ جاءتهم الرسل من بين أيديهم ومن خلفهم ألا تعبدوا إلا الله قالوا لو شاء ربنا لأنزل ملائكة فإنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: As for 'Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, 'Who is greater than us in strength?' Do they not see that Allah who created them is greater than them in strength? But they were rejecting Our signs.
interpretation: This verse addresses the arrogance of the people of 'Aad, who boasted about their strength without acknowledging the power and supremacy of Allah. They denied the signs of Allah, thinking they were superior, but failed to realize that Allah, who created them, is the ultimate source of power and strength. The verse serves as a reminder that all power and strength come from Allah, and one should not be arrogant or deny His signs.
orig: فأما عاد فاستكبروا في الأرض بغير الحق وقالوا من أشد منا قوة أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلقهم هو أشد منهم قوة وكانوا بآياتنا يجحدون

translation: So We sent upon them a furious wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgraceful, and they will not be helped.
interpretation: In this verse, Allah describes sending a destructive wind upon a group of people as a punishment for their wrongdoing. The wind brought disgrace and destruction upon them in their worldly life, but the punishment awaiting them in the Hereafter is even more severe. This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the importance of seeking Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: فأرسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا في أيام نحسات لنذيقهم عذاب الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الآخرة أخزى وهم لا ينصرون

translation: As for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the people of Thamud who were sent guidance but chose to replace it with blindness, meaning they rejected the truth and chose to remain ignorant. As a consequence of their actions, they faced a severe punishment as a result of their arrogance and their wrongdoings.
orig: وأما ثمود فهديناهم فاستحبوا العمى على الهدى فأخذتهم صاعقة العذاب الهون بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to save and protect those who believe in Him and show piety and consciousness in their actions. It emphasizes the importance of faith and the fear of Allah as a means of achieving salvation and deliverance from hardships.
orig: ونجينا الذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون

translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, 'Did you [mislead] these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?'
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when the enemies of Allah will be gathered and questioned about their worship of false deities. It highlights the accountability of individuals for their actions, emphasizing that they cannot blame anyone else for their misguidance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of worshipping Allah alone and following His guidance.
orig: ويوم يحشر أعداء الله إلى النار فهم يوزعون

translation: Until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, every individual's own body will bear witness against them regarding their actions in their worldly life. It conveys the idea that one's senses and faculties will testify the truth of their deeds, leaving no room for denial or escape from accountability.
orig: حتى إذا ما جاءوها شهد عليهم سمعهم وأبصارهم وجلودهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they will say to their skins, 'Why have you testified against us?' They will say, 'We were made to speak by Allah, who has made everything speak. And He is the One who created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.'
interpretation: This verse describes a scene on the Day of Judgment where people will question their own bodies about the testimony they are giving. The bodies will explain that they were made to speak by Allah, who has power over all things and is the creator of all. This highlights the ultimate authority and control of Allah over every aspect of our existence, reinforcing the belief in the ultimate return to Him for accountability.
orig: وقالوا لجلودهم لم شهدتم علينا قالوا أنطقنا الله الذي أنطق كل شيء وهو خلقكم أول مرة وإليه ترجعون

translation: And you were not covering yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that Allah does not know much of what you do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the impossibility of hiding our actions from Allah, as He has knowledge of everything we do, even if we try to conceal it. It serves as a reminder that we are accountable for our deeds, both the apparent and the hidden, in front of Allah's ultimate knowledge and justice.
orig: وما كنتم تستترون أن يشهد عليكم سمعكم ولا أبصاركم ولا جلودكم ولكن ظننتم أن الله لا يعلم كثيرا مما تعملون

translation: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of having false assumptions or beliefs about God. It warns that incorrect assumptions about God can lead to ruin and loss. It emphasizes the importance of having a true and correct understanding of God to avoid negative outcomes in life.
orig: وذلكم ظنكم الذي ظننتم بربكم أرداكم فأصبحتم من الخاسرين

translation: So if they endure, the Fire is the residence for them, and if they seek forgiveness, they will not be forgiven.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of one's actions in the afterlife. If individuals remain patient and steadfast in the face of trials and tribulations, they will find themselves in the punishment of the Fire. However, if they repent and seek forgiveness from Allah, they will not find forgiveness. It emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning to Allah for mercy and guidance.
orig: فإن يصبروا فالنار مثوى لهم وإن يستعتبوا فما هم من المعتبين

translation: And We have appointed for them companions who made [evil] attractive to them. And it was decreed for them that the word [i.e., doom] had proved true among nations of jinn and men that have passed away before them. Indeed they were losers.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting that disbelievers are often misled by companions who make evil actions appear attractive to them, leading them astray. The verse also talks about the inevitability of the consequences faced by nations in the past, jinn and humans, who faced similar consequences due to their disbelief and wrongdoing. It serves as a reminder that those who reject the truth and indulge in evil deeds will ultimately face loss and ruin.
orig: وقيضنا لهم قرناء فزينوا لهم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم وحق عليهم القول في أمم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والإنس إنهم كانوا خاسرين

translation: And those who disbelieve say, 'Do not listen to this Qur'an and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the opposition faced by the disbelievers towards the Qur'an. They are advised against listening to it and are encouraged to make noise during its recitation in the hope of suppressing its message. The verse depicts the disbelievers' attempts to silence the Qur'an out of fear that its truth and guidance may lead others away from their beliefs.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لا تسمعوا لهذا القرآن والغوا فيه لعلكم تغلبون

translation: So We will surely taste the disbelievers a severe punishment and will surely repay them the worst of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine justice, indicating that those who disbelieve will face severe consequences for their actions. It serves as a reminder that all deeds, good or bad, will be accounted for and repaid accordingly in the afterlife.
orig: فلنذيقن الذين كفروا عذابا شديدا ولنجزينهم أسوأ الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah: the Fire. For them therein is the abode of eternity as recompense for what they, of Our signs, were rejecting.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences faced by those who reject and oppose the signs and teachings of Allah. It portrays the punishment for the enemies of Allah as the Fire, indicating a severe retribution awaiting those who deny the truth and turn away from the guidance provided by Allah. The concept of 'abode of eternity' emphasizes the everlasting nature of this punishment, underscoring the gravity of denying the truth and turning a blind eye to the signs of God.
orig: ذلك جزاء أعداء الله النار لهم فيها دار الخلد جزاء بما كانوا بآياتنا يجحدون

translation: And those who disbelieve will say, 'Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and mankind, so we may put them under our feet that they will be among the lowest.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the arrogance and vengefulness of the disbelievers towards those who they believe misled them, both from among the jinn and mankind. It shows their desire for those individuals to be humiliated and debased. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and the misguided attempts of individuals to seek retribution against others in the afterlife.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا ربنا أرنا اللذين أضلانا من الجن والإنس نجعلهما تحت أقدامنا ليكونا من الأسفلين

translation: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is Allah' and then remain steadfast - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], 'Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of firm faith in Allah and steadfastness in one's belief. It assures believers that their commitment to God will be recognized by the angels who will offer them comfort and assurance, reminding them of the eternal reward awaiting them in Paradise. It serves as a reminder to believers to remain steadfast in their faith even in challenging times, as their dedication will be rewarded in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا تتنزل عليهم الملائكة ألا تخافوا ولا تحزنوا وأبشروا بالجنة التي كنتم توعدون

translation: We are your allies in this world and in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of believers having Allah as their ally both in this world and in the Hereafter. It highlights the idea that the rewards and provisions are not limited to the material possessions of this world but also extend to fulfilling the desires and requests of the believers in the Hereafter based on their faith and good deeds.
orig: نحن أولياؤكم في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة ولكم فيها ما تشتهي أنفسكم ولكم فيها ما تدعون

translation: Sent down by the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an is a divine revelation sent down by Allah, who is the Most Forgiving and the Most Merciful. It emphasizes the compassionate and forgiving nature of Allah in communicating His guidance to humanity through the Qur'an.
orig: نزلا من غفور رحيم

translation: And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allah and does righteousness and says, 'Indeed, I am of the Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of speaking in a kind and gentle manner when calling others to the path of Allah. It emphasizes the significance of combining words with actions, as well as declaring oneself as a Muslim with sincerity and humility.
orig: ومن أحسن قولا ممن دعا إلى الله وعمل صالحا وقال إنني من المسلمين

translation: And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.
interpretation: This verse teaches us that good and evil are not equal. It advises believers to respond to evil with goodness and kindness. By doing so, even those who were enemies can become close friends. The verse emphasizes the importance of responding to negativity with positivity and maintaining good conduct even in the face of adversity.
orig: ولا تستوي الحسنة ولا السيئة ادفع بالتي هي أحسن فإذا الذي بينك وبينه عداوة كأنه ولي حميم

translation: But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].
interpretation: This verse from the Quran highlights that only those who are patient and have a significant share of good fortune will attain success. It emphasizes the importance of patience and perseverance when facing challenges or striving for success in life. It serves as a reminder to trust in the wisdom of God's plan and to remain steadfast in faith during difficult times, as success comes to those who endure with patience and have a portion of good fortune bestowed upon them by God.
orig: وما يلقاها إلا الذين صبروا وما يلقاها إلا ذو حظ عظيم

translation: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes seeking protection and refuge in Allah when one is afflicted with evil whispers or temptations from Satan. It reminds believers that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, and turning to Him for help and seeking His guidance is the best way to combat such negative influences.
orig: وإما ينزغنك من الشيطان نزغ فاستعذ بالله إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: And of His signs are the night and day, and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon; but prostrate to Allah, who created them, if it is truly Him that you worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's creation, such as the night, day, sun, and moon, emphasizing that they should not be worshipped. Rather, worship is to be directed solely towards Allah, the Creator of these celestial bodies. The verse stresses the importance of sincere monotheistic worship, reminding believers to direct all acts of worship and reverence exclusively to Allah.
orig: ومن آياته الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر لا تسجدوا للشمس ولا للقمر واسجدوا لله الذي خلقهن إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: So if they are arrogant, those who are near your Lord exalt Him by night and by day, and they do not become weary.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that those closest to Allah are constantly glorifying and praising Him, day and night, without ever tiring. It serves as a reminder that humility and constant worship of Allah are praised virtues, contrasting with the arrogance of those who refuse to humble themselves before their Creator.
orig: فإن استكبروا فالذين عند ربك يسبحون له بالليل والنهار وهم لا يسأمون

translation: And among His signs is that you see the earth still, but when We send down water upon it, it stirs and grows. Indeed, He who gives it life is the giver of life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the signs of Allah's power and ability to bring life and growth to the earth. It demonstrates how the earth, seemingly lifeless at times, comes to life with the mercy and blessings of water from Allah. It is a reminder of Allah's capability to resurrect and give life after death, indicating His absolute power and control over all things.
orig: ومن آياته أنك ترى الأرض خاشعة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت إن الذي أحياها لمحيي الموتى إنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: Indeed, those who commit injustices against Our verses will not be hidden from Us. So, is one who is cast into the Fire better or one who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who distort or reject the signs of Allah will not escape accountability. It poses a rhetorical question comparing the fate of those who face punishment in the Hereafter with those who are granted security on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the importance of righteous deeds. The verse ends with a reminder that Allah is All-Seeing and Aware of everything we do.
orig: إن الذين يلحدون في آياتنا لا يخفون علينا أفمن يلقى في النار خير أم من يأتي آمنا يوم القيامة اعملوا ما شئتم إنه بما تعملون بصير

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message when it came to them, and indeed, it is a mighty Book.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the rejection of the message of the Qur'an by those who disbelieve, despite its powerful and authoritative nature. It serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is a strong and significant scripture that deserves recognition and acceptance.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بالذكر لما جاءهم وإنه لكتاب عزيز

translation: Falsehood cannot approach it from in front or from behind. [It is] a revelation from a [God who is] Wise and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the purity and divine origin of the Qur'an, stating that it is immune to falsehood or corruption. It highlights that the message of the Qur'an is revealed by a Source that is infinitely wise and worthy of all praise, underscoring the divine nature and guidance that the Qur'an provides to humanity.
orig: لا يأتيه الباطل من بين يديه ولا من خلفه تنزيل من حكيم حميد

translation: You are not told except what was said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your Lord is possessor of forgiveness and possessor of painful penalty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consistency in the message given to all messengers throughout history, emphasizing that prophets before Muhammad received similar guidance. The verse also serves as a reminder that while God is forgiving to those who seek His forgiveness, He also possesses the power to inflict a severe punishment on those who deserve it.
orig: ما يقال لك إلا ما قد قيل للرسل من قبلك إن ربك لذو مغفرة وذو عقاب أليم

translation: And if We had made it a non-Arabic Qur'an, they would have said, 'Why are its verses not explained in detail? Is it [in a language] other than Arabic?' Say, 'It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure.' And those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the fact that the Quran, being in Arabic, might evoke skepticism from non-believers who might question why it is not in a different language. The response is that the Quran is meant to serve as guidance and healing for those who believe, and for those who do not believe, their inability to comprehend it is due to their spiritual deafness and blindness. The verse emphasizes that faith and openness are essential for truly understanding the message of the Quran.
orig: ولو جعلناه قرآنا أعجميا لقالوا لولا فصلت آياته أأعجمي وعربي قل هو للذين آمنوا هدى وشفاء والذين لا يؤمنون في آذانهم وقر وهو عليهم عمى أولئك ينادون من مكان بعيد

translation: And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning it, in doubt, disquieting.
interpretation: This verse highlights the disputes and disagreements that arose among the people regarding the scripture given to Prophet Moses. It emphasizes that divine intervention is necessary to resolve such disputes. It also points out the doubt and confusion that some people faced regarding the scripture, highlighting the importance of seeking clarity and understanding in matters of faith.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب فاختلف فيه ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم وإنهم لفي شك منه مريب

translation: Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does so] against it. And your Lord is not ever unjust to the servants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of personal accountability and individual responsibility. It highlights that the consequences of one's actions, whether good or bad, ultimately impact the individual themselves. It also reassures that God is just and fair, not treating His servants with injustice.
orig: من عمل صالحا فلنفسه ومن أساء فعليها وما ربك بظلام للعبيد

translation: To Him [alone] is attributed the knowledge of the Hour. And no fruits emerge from their coverings, nor does any female conceive or give birth except with His knowledge. And on the Day He will call to them, 'Where are My partners?' They will say, 'We announce to You that none of us can testify.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah alone possesses the knowledge of the Day of Judgment. It also highlights that nothing happens without His knowledge and will, whether it is the growth of fruits, the reproduction of living beings, or the actions and statements of individuals. The verse warns against associating partners with Allah, as on the Day of Judgment, even those who were falsely worshiped as partners with Allah will deny any association with such actions.
orig: إليه يرد علم الساعة وما تخرج من ثمرات من أكمامها وما تحمل من أنثى ولا تضع إلا بعلمه ويوم يناديهم أين شركائي قالوا آذناك ما منا من شهيد

translation: And that which they used to invoke before will fail them, and they will know that they have no place of refuge.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences of people's misguided beliefs and false worship. It emphasizes that the false deities whom they used to call upon will not be of any help to them, and they will realize that they have no escape or shelter from the consequences of their actions.
orig: وضل عنهم ما كانوا يدعون من قبل وظنوا ما لهم من محيص

translation: Man does not weary of asking for good, but if touched by evil, he despairs and loses hope.
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of human beings to constantly seek goodness and blessings, never growing tired of asking for it from Allah. However, when faced with adversity or touched by evil, humans may easily fall into despair and lose hope, forgetting that Allah is the ultimate source of all solutions and mercy.
orig: لا يسأم الإنسان من دعاء الخير وإن مسه الشر فيئوس قنوط

translation: And if We let him taste mercy from Us after an adversity which has touched him, he will surely say, 'This is mine, and I do not think the Hour will occur; and [even] if I am returned to my Lord, indeed, for me there will be with Him the best.' But We will surely inform those who disbelieved about what they did, and We will surely make them taste a massive punishment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that some people, when afflicted with difficulties, may turn to disbelief but if they are then shown mercy, they may claim it as their own and believe that the Day of Judgment will not come upon them. Ultimately, however, all actions will be accounted for, and those who disbelieved will face a severe punishment for their deeds.
orig: ولئن أذقناه رحمة منا من بعد ضراء مسته ليقولن هذا لي وما أظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رجعت إلى ربي إن لي عنده للحسنى فلننبئن الذين كفروا بما عملوا ولنذيقنهم من عذاب غليظ

translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of human beings when they encounter different situations in life. It points out that when people are blessed with favors and prosperity, they tend to become arrogant and distant from their Creator. However, when faced with hardship and adversity, they turn in sincere supplication and prayer, seeking relief and help from Allah. The verse serves as a reminder for humans to remain humble and grateful during times of ease and to turn to Allah in times of need.
orig: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه وإذا مسه الشر فذو دعاء عريض

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if it is from Allah and you disbelieve in it, who is more astray than one in extreme dissension?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of disbelief in the message sent by Allah. It questions the wisdom of those who reject divine guidance, emphasizing that they are in a state of severe deviation and distance from the truth.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن كان من عند الله ثم كفرتم به من أضل ممن هو في شقاق بعيد

translation: We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient concerning your Lord that He is, over all things, a Witness?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that signs of Allah's existence and power are present in the universe and also within ourselves. These signs are meant to lead people to recognize the truth of Islam and the existence of Allah. Allah's presence and authority are everywhere, and nothing escapes His witness. The message conveys the idea that evidence of Allah's existence and power is abundant in the world and within ourselves, leaving us with no excuse for denial or ignorance.
orig: سنريهم آياتنا في الآفاق وفي أنفسهم حتى يتبين لهم أنه الحق أولم يكف بربك أنه على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Surely, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Surely, He encompasses all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the doubt and uncertainty that some people have regarding meeting with their Lord. It emphasizes that despite their doubts, God's knowledge and encompassing power extends over all things. The verse serves as a reminder of God’s all-encompassing presence and knowledge, urging believers to have faith and trust in Him. It also serves as a warning to those who doubt the concept of meeting their Lord, reassuring them that God is all-encompassing and omnipotent.
orig: ألا إنهم في مرية من لقاء ربهم ألا إنه بكل شيء محيط

translation: Ha, Meem.
interpretation: This verse is a part of the Quranic text known as 'huroof al-muqatta'at' - the disjointed or abbreviated letters. These letters appear at the beginning of some chapters in the Quran and their specific meanings are known only to Allah. They are a mystery that highlights the miraculous nature of the Quran and serves as a challenge to humanity, emphasizing the Quran's divine origins and the inability of humans to produce something similar. Muslims are encouraged to reflect on these letters and contemplate the depth and miraculous nature of the Quran.
orig: حم

translation: Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah, highlighting that He is unique and indivisible. It affirms the monotheistic belief in Islam, declaring that Allah is the only One worthy of worship and there is none like Him.
orig: عسق

translation: Thus it is revealed to you and to those before you by Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the revelations sent to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) are in line with the divine guidance given to the prophets before him. It highlights the consistency of the message throughout history and asserts the power and wisdom of Allah in His decrees and guidance.
orig: كذلك يوحي إليك وإلى الذين من قبلك الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the vastness of Allah's ownership and dominion over all that exists in the heavens and the earth. It highlights His supremacy and greatness, indicating that He is high above all in power, knowledge, and majesty. It serves as a reminder for believers to acknowledge and submit to the all-encompassing authority of Allah in all aspects of their lives.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العلي العظيم

translation: The heavens almost break apart from above them, while the angels exalt with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, Allah is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the intense magnificence of the heavens and the devoted worship of the angels towards Allah. It emphasizes the continuous cycle of praise and forgiveness that exists within the celestial realm and extends to the inhabitants of the earth. The verse reinforces the idea that Allah is infinitely forgiving and merciful towards His creations, highlighting His boundless compassion and mercy.
orig: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن من فوقهن والملائكة يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويستغفرون لمن في الأرض ألا إن الله هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: And those who take protectors besides Him, [say], 'We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allah in position.' Indeed, Allah will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allah does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.
interpretation: This verse warns against taking any partners or protectors besides Allah and emphasizes that those who do so will not find their intercessors will succeed on their behalf. Instead, all will be judged by Allah according to their true intentions and actions. The verse also stresses that Allah does not guide the ones who deliberately and persistently reject the truth and lie about it.
orig: والذين اتخذوا من دونه أولياء الله حفيظ عليهم وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: Thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn the mother of cities (Mecca) and those around it and warn of the Day of Gathering, about which there is no doubt: a party will be in Paradise, and a party in the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the primary purpose of the Qur'an, which is to serve as a guidance to warn and educate people about the truth. It emphasizes the importance of conveying the message to the people of Mecca and those around them, reminding them of the day of judgment which is inevitable. The verse also indicates that people will be divided into two groups on that Day - those who will be in Paradise due to their faith and good deeds, and those who will be in Hellfire due to their disbelief and sins.
orig: وكذلك أوحينا إليك قرآنا عربيا لتنذر أم القرى ومن حولها وتنذر يوم الجمع لا ريب فيه فريق في الجنة وفريق في السعير

translation: And if Allah had willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills into His mercy. But the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of free will and the individual responsibility of each person in choosing their faith. It highlights that Allah could have made all people follow a single religion if He wished, but He allows each person to choose their path. The verse also highlights that the wrongdoers, who go against Allah's guidance and commit injustices, will not find any protection or support in their wrongdoing.
orig: ولو شاء الله لجعلهم أمة واحدة ولكن يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمون ما لهم من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Or have they taken allies besides Him? But Allah is the ally, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and questions the wisdom of people who take others as allies besides Him. It also highlights the power of Allah as the one who gives life to the dead and His ultimate authority over all things. It serves as a reminder to believers to place their complete trust and loyalty in Allah alone.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دونه أولياء فالله هو الولي وهو يحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And in whatever you disagree, the judgement thereof is with Allah. That is Allah, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking Allah's judgment and guidance in all matters of disagreement. It encourages believers to trust in Allah, rely on Him completely, and return to Him for help and guidance in times of uncertainty or conflict.
orig: وما اختلفتم فيه من شيء فحكمه إلى الله ذلكم الله ربي عليه توكلت وإليه أنيب

translation: Originator of the heavens and the earth. He made for you from yourselves mates, and for the cattle mates; by this means He multiplies you. There is nothing whatever like Him. And He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the creative power of Allah in establishing the system of pairs in creation, from humans to cattle, as a means of reproduction and multiplication. It emphasizes the uniqueness and incomparability of Allah, stating that nothing resembles Him in any way. Furthermore, it attributes to Him the attributes of All-Hearing and All-Seeing, emphasizing His all-encompassing knowledge and awareness.
orig: فاطر السماوات والأرض جعل لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا ومن الأنعام أزواجا يذرؤكم فيه ليس كمثله شيء وهو السميع البصير

translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He provides abundantly for whoever He wills and restricts. Indeed, He is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of Allah over the heavens and the earth, emphasizing that all sustenance and provisions come from Him. It underscores that Allah has full knowledge and control over everything, including the abundance or scarcity of resources, and that His wisdom in providing sustenance is based on His complete knowledge and understanding of His creation.
orig: له مقاليد السماوات والأرض يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إنه بكل شيء عليم

translation: He has ordained for you from the religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuity and unity of the message of monotheism throughout different prophets and scriptures. It highlights the importance of following the guidance of Allah, practicing it consistently, and not allowing divisions to occur within the community of believers. The verse also indicates that it is Allah who selects and guides those who truly turn towards Him, regardless of their background or faith.
orig: شرع لكم من الدين ما وصى به نوحا والذي أوحينا إليك وما وصينا به إبراهيم وموسى وعيسى أن أقيموا الدين ولا تتفرقوا فيه كبر على المشركين ما تدعوهم إليه الله يجتبي إليه من يشاء ويهدي إليه من ينيب

translation: And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are in doubt concerning it, suspicious.
interpretation: This verse highlights that disagreements and divisions arose among people after the knowledge was given to them due to envy and pride. It emphasizes that there is a divine plan and decree that postpones judgment until an appointed time. It also mentions that even those who inherited previous scriptures after them are uncertain and have doubts due to their own suspicions and interpretations.
orig: وما تفرقوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك إلى أجل مسمى لقضي بينهم وإن الذين أورثوا الكتاب من بعدهم لفي شك منه مريب

translation: So call and stand firm as you are ordered, and do not follow their desires. And say, 'I have believed in what Allah has revealed of the Book, and I have been commanded to do justice between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. There is no argument between us and you. Allah will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remaining steadfast in faith and following the guidance of Allah, even in the face of opposition. It encourages believers to uphold justice and not be swayed by the desires of others. It also highlights the unity of believers under the Lordship of Allah, emphasizing that everyone will be accountable for their own actions. Ultimately, the verse emphasizes the belief in the oneness of God and the final return to Him.
orig: فلذلك فادع واستقم كما أمرت ولا تتبع أهواءهم وقل آمنت بما أنزل الله من كتاب وأمرت لأعدل بينكم الله ربنا وربكم لنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم لا حجة بيننا وبينكم الله يجمع بيننا وإليه المصير

translation: And those who argue concerning Allah after it has been responded to - their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against arguing or disputing about matters concerning Allah after the truth has been made clear. It highlights that such arguments hold no weight with Allah, lead to His displeasure, and result in severe punishment. The verse emphasizes the importance of accepting and submitting to the truth once it has been clarified, and warns against persisting in baseless arguments and disputes.
orig: والذين يحاجون في الله من بعد ما استجيب له حجتهم داحضة عند ربهم وعليهم غضب ولهم عذاب شديد

translation: It is Allah who has sent down the Book in truth and [has also sent down] the Balance. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah who revealed the Qur'an with truth and sent down the scales of justice. It also questions humanity's awareness of the proximity of the Hour, reminding us to be prepared for the Day of Judgment which could come suddenly and unexpectedly.
orig: الله الذي أنزل الكتاب بالحق والميزان وما يدريك لعل الساعة قريب

translation: Those who disbelieve in it seek to hasten it, while those who believe are fearful of it, and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are in extreme error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes a contrast between those who believe in the concept of the Hour (the Day of Judgment) and approach it with fear and certainty as truth, and those who disbelieve in it and try to rush its coming. It highlights that those who deny or argue about the Day of Judgment are profoundly misguided and distant from the truth.
orig: يستعجل بها الذين لا يؤمنون بها والذين آمنوا مشفقون منها ويعلمون أنها الحق ألا إن الذين يمارون في الساعة لفي ضلال بعيد

translation: Allah is Gentle with His servants; He provides for whom He wills. And He is the Strong, the Mighty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the delicate and compassionate nature of Allah towards his servants. It emphasizes that Allah provides sustenance to whomever He chooses, highlighting His power and strength. It serves as a reminder that Allah's mercy and generosity are limitless, and He is capable of providing for all His creations with His might and power.
orig: الله لطيف بعباده يرزق من يشاء وهو القوي العزيز

translation: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of focusing on the eternal rewards of the Hereafter rather than solely chasing the material gains of this world. It conveys that those who prioritize their faith and good deeds will be rewarded abundantly in the Hereafter, while those who prioritize worldly pursuits and neglect their spiritual development may gain in this life but will have no share in the Hereafter.
orig: من كان يريد حرث الآخرة نزد له في حرثه ومن كان يريد حرث الدنيا نؤته منها وما له في الآخرة من نصيب

translation: Is it that they have partners [in worship] who have ordained for them a religion which Allah has not allowed? But had it not been for a decisive word [from Allah], judgment would have been passed between them. And indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who associate partners with Allah by following religions and laws not ordained by Him will face severe consequences. It highlights the importance of adhering to the clear guidance and rulings of Allah, as deviating from it will lead to inevitable judgment and punishment for the wrongdoers.
orig: أم لهم شركاء شرعوا لهم من الدين ما لم يأذن به الله ولولا كلمة الفصل لقضي بينهم وإن الظالمين لهم عذاب أليم

translation: You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, while it will surely befall them. But those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in lush regions of the gardens [in Paradise]; they will have whatever they wish in the presence of their Lord. That is the great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stark contrast in the fate of the wrongdoers and the believers who perform good deeds. The wrongdoers will be apprehensive and fearful of the consequences of their actions, while the believers who do good deeds will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will have everything they desire, in the presence of their Lord. It emphasizes the great mercy and favor bestowed upon the believers by their Lord.
orig: ترى الظالمين مشفقين مما كسبوا وهو واقع بهم والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في روضات الجنات لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ذلك هو الفضل الكبير

translation: That is what Allah gives good news to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, "I do not ask you for it [the message] any payment, except for love of [my] relatives." And whoever commits a good deed - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Appreciative.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of belief in Allah and doing good deeds. It highlights that believers should seek the reward for their good actions solely from Allah, except for showing love and kindness to relatives. Allah promises to increase the reward for those who do good deeds. The verse also mentions Allah's attributes of forgiveness and gratitude, reminding believers of His mercy and kindness.
orig: ذلك الذي يبشر الله عباده الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات قل لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إلا المودة في القربى ومن يقترف حسنة نزد له فيها حسنا إن الله غفور شكور

translation: Or do they say, 'He has invented it?' Say, 'If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] against Allah at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse warns against accusing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of fabricating the Qur'an. The verse asserts that the Prophet's heart is pure from deception, as God can expose falsehood and verify the truth. It emphasizes that God knows the intentions of all hearts and will protect His prophets. Additionally, it highlights God's attributes of forgiveness and mercy towards those who repent.
orig: أم يقولون افترى على الله كذبا فإن يشإ الله يختم على قلبك ويمح الله الباطل ويحق الحق بكلماته إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons misdeeds and knows what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards His servants. It highlights the importance of repentance and seeking forgiveness for one's sins, as Allah is ready to accept the repentance of those who turn to Him sincerely. It also reminds us that Allah is aware of all our actions, both good and bad, motivating us to strive for righteousness and seek forgiveness for our wrongdoings.
orig: وهو الذي يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويعفو عن السيئات ويعلم ما تفعلون

translation: And He responds to those who have believed and done righteous deeds and increases [for] them from His bounty. But the disbelievers will have a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice and reward. It emphasizes that Allah responds to the believers who combine faith with good deeds by increasing His blessings upon them. On the other hand, it warns the disbelievers of a severe punishment, underscoring the importance of faith and righteous actions as the path to receiving Allah's grace.
orig: ويستجيب الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ويزيدهم من فضله والكافرون لهم عذاب شديد

translation: And if Allah had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount He wills. Indeed He is concerning His servants Acquainted and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom of Allah in distributing sustenance among His servants. If Allah had given unlimited wealth to everyone, people would have become arrogant and oppressive. However, Allah, in His infinite knowledge, bestows provision upon His creation as He sees fit, in a manner that is ultimately beneficial for them. It reminds believers to be content with what they have and to trust in Allah's perfect wisdom and fairness in providing for them.
orig: ولو بسط الله الرزق لعباده لبغوا في الأرض ولكن ينزل بقدر ما يشاء إنه بعباده خبير بصير

translation: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah, as He sends rain to revive the earth after a period of drought, giving hope and sustenance to His creation. It highlights that Allah is the ultimate Protector, always there to support and help those in need, and that He is deserving of all praise and gratitude for His endless blessings.
orig: وهو الذي ينزل الغيث من بعد ما قنطوا وينشر رحمته وهو الولي الحميد

translation: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the living creatures that He has dispersed throughout them, and He is competent to gather them whenever He wills.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the signs of Allah's existence and power, which is His ability to create the vast heavens and the earth, as well as all the diverse living beings within them. It emphasizes that Allah has full control over His creation and can gather them all together whenever He intends to do so, showcasing His ultimate power and authority as the Creator.
orig: ومن آياته خلق السماوات والأرض وما بث فيهما من دابة وهو على جمعهم إذا يشاء قدير

translation: And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of personal responsibility and accountability in Islam. It teaches that calamities and hardships that befall individuals are often consequences of their own actions. However, it also highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah, who forgives many sins and hardships that humans may encounter.
orig: وما أصابكم من مصيبة فبما كسبت أيديكم ويعفو عن كثير

translation: And you are not ones who can frustrate God upon the earth, and you do not have besides God any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that no one has the power to thwart or resist God's will on earth. It emphasizes that all beings are ultimately dependent on God alone, and no one else can provide protection or assistance besides Him. It reminds believers of the ultimate sovereignty and power of God over all creation, urging them to place their trust and reliance solely on Him.
orig: وما أنتم بمعجزين في الأرض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And of His signs are the ships in the sea like landmarks.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the signs of Allah's existence and power, which is the ships sailing in the vast expanse of the sea. Just as landmarks guide travelers on land, ships serve as indicators of movement, trade, and exploration on the sea. This sign encourages reflection on Allah's creation and the marvels of the natural world, inviting believers to contemplate His greatness and wisdom.
orig: ومن آياته الجوار في البحر كالأعلام

translation: If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed, in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of Allah to control the wind and keep ships steady on its surface. It emphasizes that this control and power are signs for those who are patient during trials and thankful for the blessings bestowed upon them.
orig: إن يشأ يسكن الريح فيظللن رواكد على ظهره إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: Or that He might destroy them for what they have earned; but He pardons much.
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah has the power to punish people for their sins, yet out of His mercy and forgiveness, He often pardons many sins. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ultimate justice and His boundless mercy towards His creation.
orig: أو يوبقهن بما كسبوا ويعف عن كثير

translation: And those who dispute concerning Our signs will know that for them there is no place of escape.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who argue and dispute about the signs of Allah will eventually realize that there is no escape from the truth and the consequences of their actions. It highlights the futility of rejecting the clear signs and messages from Allah, as ultimately they will be held accountable for their disbelief and arguments.
orig: ويعلم الذين يجادلون في آياتنا ما لهم من محيص

translation: So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] the enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely.
interpretation: This verse highlights the temporary nature of worldly possessions and pleasures, emphasizing that true worth lies in what is with Allah, which is better and everlasting. Believers are urged to put their trust in Allah, as He is the ultimate provider of what is good and enduring.
orig: فما أوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وما عند الله خير وأبقى للذين آمنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive.
interpretation: This verse highlights the characteristics of the righteous individuals who not only steer clear of major sins and indecencies but also demonstrate forgiveness and control over their anger. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining good behavior and attitude even in moments of anger, showing the exceptional moral conduct expected from a believer.
orig: والذين يجتنبون كبائر الإثم والفواحش وإذا ما غضبوا هم يغفرون

translation: And those who have responded to their Lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believers responding to their Lord, establishing prayer, making decisions through consultation, and spending from the provisions given to them by Allah. It highlights the values of worship, community, mutual consultation, and generosity in the path of Allah.
orig: والذين استجابوا لربهم وأقاموا الصلاة وأمرهم شورى بينهم ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And those who, when injustice happens to them, defend themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing up against injustice and unfair treatment. It encourages believers to seek justice and defend themselves when faced with oppression or wrongdoing, rather than accepting or submitting to it passively. It highlights the concept of standing up for one's rights and fighting against tyranny and injustice in a just manner.
orig: والذين إذا أصابهم البغي هم ينتصرون

translation: And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from Allah. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of reciprocity in Islam, which is that the punishment for a wrongdoing should be in proportion to the offense committed. However, forgiveness and reconciliation are highly encouraged and those who choose to forgive instead of seeking retribution will be rewarded by Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah does not favor those who oppress and commit injustice.
orig: وجزاء سيئة سيئة مثلها فمن عفا وأصلح فأجره على الله إنه لا يحب الظالمين

translation: And those who avenge themselves when wronged will not be blamed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who seek justice and defend themselves after being wronged are not to be blamed for their actions. It highlights the importance of standing up against injustice and defending one's rights within the bounds of fairness and reason.
orig: ولمن انتصر بعد ظلمه فأولئك ما عليهم من سبيل

translation: The way is only against those who wrong the people and go about in the land corrupting it. Those are the ones for whom there is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the idea that the path of righteousness is not for those who oppress others and spread corruption in the land unjustly. It warns that those who engage in such behavior will face severe consequences and a painful punishment. It serves as a reminder of the importance of treating others with justice and avoiding actions that harm society as a whole.
orig: إنما السبيل على الذين يظلمون الناس ويبغون في الأرض بغير الحق أولئك لهم عذاب أليم

translation: And for whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and forgiveness. It teaches that those who possess these qualities exhibit great strength and determination. It emphasizes the significance of maintaining patience in challenging situations and the power of forgiveness in achieving resolution and peace.
orig: ولمن صبر وغفر إن ذلك لمن عزم الأمور

translation: And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no guide. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, 'Is there any way back?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who are led astray by Allah will have no one to guide them thereafter. It also portrays the scene of the wrongdoers regretting and seeking a way back when faced with the consequences of their actions, highlighting the importance of reflecting on one's deeds before it is too late.
orig: ومن يضلل الله فما له من ولي من بعده وترى الظالمين لما رأوا العذاب يقولون هل إلى مرد من سبيل

translation: And you see them being exposed to it humbled from humiliation, looking from [the place of] a concealed position. And those who have believed say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who have lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment where the true losers are described as those who have led themselves and their families astray from the right path. It illustrates the consequences of wrongdoing and the punishment that awaits the wrongdoers in the Hereafter. Believers are shown to be aware of the ultimate loss that results from straying from the path of righteousness and the importance of staying steadfast in faith to avoid such a fate.
orig: وتراهم يعرضون عليها خاشعين من الذل ينظرون من طرف خفي وقال الذين آمنوا إن الخاسرين الذين خسروا أنفسهم وأهليهم يوم القيامة ألا إن الظالمين في عذاب مقيم

translation: And they will have no protectors to help them other than Allah. And whoever Allah leaves astray - for him there is no way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no one can help or protect someone against Allah's decree except Allah Himself. Those who are led astray by Allah will have no way to find guidance or be saved, showcasing the ultimate power and control that Allah holds over His creation.
orig: وما كان لهم من أولياء ينصرونهم من دون الله ومن يضلل الله فما له من سبيل

translation: Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. For you there will be no refuge that day, nor for you will there be any denial.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the urgency of responding to the call of Allah and following His guidance before the Day of Judgment arrives. It warns that on that Day, no one will be able to escape from the decree of Allah, and there will be no refuge or denial available to anyone. Hence, it encourages believers to take heed, seek forgiveness, and submit to their Lord before it is too late.
orig: استجيبوا لربكم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا مرد له من الله ما لكم من ملجإ يومئذ وما لكم من نكير

translation: So if they turn away, then We have not sent you as a guardian over them; your duty is only to deliver the message. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but if any harm afflicts them for what their hands have already done, then indeed, man is ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of a messenger, stating that it is not their responsibility to control or force people into belief, but rather to deliver the message to them. It also points out the nature of mankind, mentioning that they often rejoice in the mercy of God but fail to show gratitude when faced with difficulties or consequences of their own actions.
orig: فإن أعرضوا فما أرسلناك عليهم حفيظا إن عليك إلا البلاغ وإنا إذا أذقنا الإنسان منا رحمة فرح بها وإن تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت أيديهم فإن الإنسان كفور

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.
interpretation: This verse highlights that all creation and sovereignty belong to Allah alone. He has the power to create whatever He wills, as well as to determine the gender and characteristics of His creations. This verse emphasizes Allah's complete control and authority over all aspects of life and creation.
orig: لله ملك السماوات والأرض يخلق ما يشاء يهب لمن يشاء إناثا ويهب لمن يشاء الذكور

translation: Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah in creating different beings with different abilities and roles. It highlights that Allah has full knowledge and control over all aspects of creation, including determining the gender of offspring and deciding their ability to reproduce. It serves as a reminder of the sovereignty and wisdom of Allah in His divine plan.
orig: أو يزوجهم ذكرانا وإناثا ويجعل من يشاء عقيما إنه عليم قدير

translation: And it is not for a human [prophet] that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah communicates with His messengers either through direct revelation, from behind a veil, or by sending an angel to convey His message. It emphasizes that the words from Allah are divinely inspired and in accordance with His wisdom. It highlights the exceptional status and unique communication channels established by Allah for His messengers.
orig: وما كان لبشر أن يكلمه الله إلا وحيا أو من وراء حجاب أو يرسل رسولا فيوحي بإذنه ما يشاء إنه علي حكيم

translation: And thus We have revealed to you a soul from Our command. You did not know what is the Book or what is faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Muhammad], you guide to a straight path -
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an explains how Allah has bestowed guidance upon the Prophet Muhammad by sending down revelation and wisdom through the Angel Gabriel (Jibreel). The Prophet did not know the details of the Book (Qur'an) or the concept of faith before receiving the revelation. Through the guidance of Allah, the Prophet Muhammad was made a source of light and illumination for humanity. The verse emphasizes that the guidance comes from Allah and that the Prophet is a means to lead people to the straight path of righteousness and truth.
orig: وكذلك أوحينا إليك روحا من أمرنا ما كنت تدري ما الكتاب ولا الإيمان ولكن جعلناه نورا نهدي به من نشاء من عبادنا وإنك لتهدي إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: Allah's is the path, a path that leads to Him, encompassing all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah do all matters return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all matters, affairs, and destinies eventually lead back to Allah. It highlights the ultimate authority and control of Allah over everything in the heavens and the earth. Therefore, it serves as a reminder of the absolute sovereignty and divine power of Allah, and the inevitability of returning to Him for judgment and accountability.
orig: صراط الله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ألا إلى الله تصير الأمور

translation: Ha, Meem
interpretation: This verse is part of the unique sets of letters that appear at the beginning of certain chapters in the Quran. The exact meaning or significance of these letters is known only to Allah. It is considered one of the mysteries of the Quran that shows the miraculous nature of the book and challenges people to contemplate its wisdom and guidance.
orig: حم

translation: And the clear Book.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an as the clear and manifest book that provides guidance and clarity to those who seek it. It emphasizes the Qur'an's role as a source of knowledge and wisdom that is accessible and understandable to all people.
orig: والكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Qur'an being revealed in the Arabic language, which was the language of the people to whom the Prophet Muhammad was sent. The primary purpose of revealing the Qur'an in Arabic was to facilitate understanding and comprehension for the people. It emphasizes the importance of using a language that is clear and accessible to deliver the message of guidance effectively.
orig: إنا جعلناه قرآنا عربيا لعلكم تعقلون

translation: And indeed, it is, in the Mother of the Book with Us, exalted and full of wisdom.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges the Quran as the Mother of the Book, the original source of divine knowledge. It highlights the Quran's exalted status and profound wisdom, emphasizing the importance of seeking guidance and understanding from it.
orig: وإنه في أم الكتاب لدينا لعلي حكيم

translation: Should we just ignore you because you are a transgressing people?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the message and guidance should be taken away from the people who persist in wrongdoing and transgression. It serves as a reminder that if one chooses to stray from the right path and continues to act in defiance of what is right and just, they risk losing the blessings of guidance and knowledge.
orig: أفنضرب عنكم الذكر صفحا أن كنتم قوما مسرفين

translation: And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuity of prophethood throughout history, indicating that Allah has sent many prophets before, not just to one particular nation or time period. It serves as a reminder of the divine guidance that has been sent to various communities over time, highlighting the importance of following the teachings of these prophets.
orig: وكم أرسلنا من نبي في الأولين
