translation: And there did not come to them any prophet except that they used to ridicule him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unfortunate reality that throughout history, many people rejected and mocked the prophets sent by God to guide them. It emphasizes the resilience and patience needed by prophets in the face of such ridicule and disbelief, as well as the importance of having faith and belief in the message of the prophets despite opposition and mockery.
orig: وما يأتيهم من نبي إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: So We destroyed those who were stronger than these in violence. And the example of the former peoples has preceded.
interpretation: This verse highlights that God destroyed nations that had exhibited greater arrogance and wrongdoing than the current disbelievers, emphasizing that the fate of the past nations serves as a clear warning and lesson for the present people.
orig: فأهلكنا أشد منهم بطشا ومضى مثل الأولين

translation: And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will surely say, "They were created by the Exalted in Might, the All-Knowing."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the supreme power and knowledge of Allah as the creator of the heavens and the earth. It reminds believers to recognize and acknowledge the greatness and wisdom of Allah as the ultimate creator of all existence.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن خلقهن العزيز العليم

translation: That made for you the earth a bed and made for you upon it roads that you might be guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and mercy of Allah in creating the Earth as a place of comfort and ease for mankind, with well-structured paths and roads to facilitate guidance and movement. It signifies the divine provision of resources and guidance that is essential for humans to navigate through their lives and journeys on Earth, both physically and spiritually.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض مهدا وجعل لكم فيها سبلا لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth -
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who sends down rain in just the right amount to revive barren lands, showing His ability to bring life to what was once dead. It serves as a reminder of the resurrection of humans on the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the idea of renewal and transformation in accordance with divine will.
orig: والذي نزل من السماء ماء بقدر فأنشرنا به بلدة ميتا كذلك تخرجون

translation: And it is He who created all pairs and made for you [mankind] ships and animals you ride.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah, who has created everything in pairs. It also mentions how Allah has provided mankind with ships and animals that they can ride, showing His mercy and provision for human needs.
orig: والذي خلق الأزواج كلها وجعل لكم من الفلك والأنعام ما تركبون

translation: So that you may settle yourselves upon their backs, remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled and say, 'Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes reflecting on the blessings of Allah and acknowledging His uniqueness and power in allowing humans to use and benefit from the animals and resources around them. It encourages gratitude and recognition of Allah's favors by acknowledging that humanity's power and authority over creation are due to His will and grace.
orig: لتستووا على ظهوره ثم تذكروا نعمة ربكم إذا استويتم عليه وتقولوا سبحان الذي سخر لنا هذا وما كنا له مقرنين

translation: And indeed, to Our Lord we will surely return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of our eventual return to Allah after death. It reminds us that no matter what we do in this worldly life, we will ultimately be held accountable in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of this life and the importance of preparing for the afterlife through righteous actions and seeking forgiveness.
orig: وإنا إلى ربنا لمنقلبون

translation: And they assign to Allah a share of the servants. Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude of people who associate partners with Allah or attribute a portion of His power to others. It emphasizes that human beings are prone to ingratitude despite the clear signs of Allah's presence and favors upon them.
orig: وجعلوا له من عباده جزءا إن الإنسان لكفور مبين

translation: Do you take for yourselves males from what He creates and choose for Him daughters?
interpretation: This verse questions the mindset of those who ascribe daughters to God while preferring sons for themselves. It challenges the cultural preference of sons over daughters and reminds that God, the Creator, does not have offspring in the way humans do. It serves as a reminder not to make unwarranted assumptions about God's will or attributes based on personal biases or societal norms.
orig: أم اتخذ مما يخلق بنات وأصفاكم بالبنين

translation: And when one of them is given good tidings of that which he attributes to the Most Merciful in comparison, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance of those who reject the message of God. When they are presented with examples and signs from the Most Merciful, instead of being humbled and receptive, they react with darkness on their faces and arrogance in their hearts. They refuse to accept the truth and suppress their emotions out of stubbornness and pride.
orig: وإذا بشر أحدهم بما ضرب للرحمن مثلا ظل وجهه مسودا وهو كظيم

translation: Or is the one brought up in ornaments while in the midst of a dispute, clearly not?
interpretation: This verse questions whether a person who has been raised in luxury and seems to be in disagreement and confusion can truly see things clearly and understand the reality of the situation. It highlights the idea that material wealth and distractions can cloud one's judgment and lead to confusion and discord.
orig: أومن ينشأ في الحلية وهو في الخصام غير مبين

translation: And they have made the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse highlights the foolishness of those who associate partners with Allah by claiming that the angels are female beings, contrary to their nature as servants of the Most Merciful. It questions their claims by asking if they have witnessed the creation of the angels or have any legitimate basis for their beliefs. Ultimately, it emphasizes that the true nature of the angels, their testimony, and their questioning will all be in accordance with the divine decree of Allah.
orig: وجعلوا الملائكة الذين هم عباد الرحمن إناثا أشهدوا خلقهم ستكتب شهادتهم ويسألون

translation: And they say: 'If the All-Merciful had so willed, we would not have worshipped them.' They have no knowledge of that; they are only guessing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the misconception of some people that they worship idols because it is the will of Allah. It refutes this flawed belief by asserting that they have no knowledge of what they are asserting, and they are merely making baseless assumptions.
orig: وقالوا لو شاء الرحمن ما عبدناهم ما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Or did We give them a Scripture before this to which they are holding fast?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the people were given a previous scripture which they were adhering to. It challenges the audience to reflect on the guidance that was sent to them before and whether they are truly holding firm onto it.
orig: أم آتيناهم كتابا من قبله فهم به مستمسكون

translation: But they say, 'Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided.'
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the mindset of some individuals who believe that following the religion of their forefathers automatically guarantees their guidance. The verse challenges this assumption and emphasizes the importance of personal reflection and seeking guidance based on the truth, rather than blindly following tradition or ancestry.
orig: بل قالوا إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مهتدون

translation: And likewise, We sent not a warner before you [O Muhammad] to any township, but the luxurious ones among them said: 'We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we will indeed follow in their footsteps.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the common response of people to the messengers sent by God throughout history. It shows how some individuals, especially those who are affluent and comfortable, tend to follow blind traditions and resist the guidance of the prophets. It emphasizes the importance of thinking critically and independently, rather than simply adhering to the ways of one's ancestors without reflection or consideration.
orig: وكذلك ما أرسلنا من قبلك في قرية من نذير إلا قال مترفوها إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مقتدون

translation: He said, 'What if I brought you that which is better than what you have found your forefathers following?' They replied, 'Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a powerful moment in which Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) offered the Qur'anic guidance as a superior alternative to the beliefs and practices inherited from their forefathers. The response from the disbelievers demonstrates their stubborn commitment to tradition and resistance to accepting the message brought by the Prophet, despite its superior guidance and truth.
orig: قال أولو جئتكم بأهدى مما وجدتم عليه آباءكم قالوا إنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: So We took retribution from them, and see how was the end of the deniers.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the divine justice and retribution. It emphasizes that those who persist in denying the truth and opposing God's guidance will ultimately face the consequences of their actions. The verse serves as a warning to remind people of the inevitable consequences of their deeds and the importance of believing in God's message.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: And [mention] when Abraham said to his father and his people, 'Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Abraham declaring his innocence from the false idols that his father and his people were worshipping. It signifies the importance of having firm faith in Allah and rejecting any form of false worship or association of partners with Him.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه وقومه إنني براء مما تعبدون

translation: Except for He who created me, and indeed, He will guide me.
interpretation: This verse highlights an acknowledgment of the divine Creator and the belief in His guidance. It signifies the trust and reliance on Allah for guidance in one's journey in life. It emphasizes the belief that God, who created us, will also provide the necessary guidance and support to navigate through the challenges and uncertainties of life.
orig: إلا الذي فطرني فإنه سيهدين

translation: And made it a word remaining in his descendants that perhaps they would return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the message of the Qur'an is meant to endure through generations, serving as a reminder and guidance for people to reflect upon and return to righteousness and God. It highlights the perpetual relevance of the Qur'an and the invitation for individuals to constantly return to the path of God.
orig: وجعلها كلمة باقية في عقبه لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Rather, they enjoyed their worldly life and the enjoyment of their fathers until there came to them the truth and a clear Messenger.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who are too indulged in worldly pleasures to the extent that they ignore the truth when it is presented to them by a clear messenger. It highlights the importance of not being consumed by worldly desires and distractions, but instead remaining open and attentive to receiving guidance and understanding the truth.
orig: بل متعت هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى جاءهم الحق ورسول مبين

translation: And when the truth came to them, they said, 'This is magic, and indeed we are disbelievers in it.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the response of the disbelievers when presented with the truth. They immediately dismiss it as magic due to their stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the truth. It showcases the ignorance and arrogance of those who choose to deny the clear signs and guidance from Allah, even when it is presented to them.
orig: ولما جاءهم الحق قالوا هذا سحر وإنا به كافرون

translation: And they say, 'Why was this Qur'an not revealed to a great man from [one of] the two cities?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and skepticism of some disbelievers who questioned why the Qur'an was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), a man from Mecca, rather than to a great leader from a powerful city. The verse emphasizes that the message of the Qur'an transcends the stature or background of the one receiving it, as the greatness of the message itself lies in its divinely inspired guidance and wisdom.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل هذا القرآن على رجل من القريتين عظيم

translation: Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees, that some may make use of others in service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.
interpretation: This verse highlights that it is ultimately Allah who determines the sustenance and provisions of His creation in this world, as well as the varying degrees of status and elevation among people. Rather than becoming arrogant or using their advantages over others, individuals are encouraged to show mercy and kindness to one another, emphasizing that the mercy and blessings of Allah surpass any material wealth or status acquired through worldly means.
orig: أهم يقسمون رحمت ربك نحن قسمنا بينهم معيشتهم في الحياة الدنيا ورفعنا بعضهم فوق بعض درجات ليتخذ بعضهم بعضا سخريا ورحمت ربك خير مما يجمعون

translation: And had it not been that the people would become one community, We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful - for their houses - ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity among people. It highlights that if humans were not intended to be a unified community, there would have been extravagant rewards even for those who disbelieve. The verse encourages harmony, cooperation, and shared purpose among all human beings, stressing the value of coming together rather than being divided.
orig: ولولا أن يكون الناس أمة واحدة لجعلنا لمن يكفر بالرحمن لبيوتهم سقفا من فضة ومعارج عليها يظهرون

translation: And they will have couches [of fire] and [given to them will be] the carpets and cushions [of Hell]
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment of the disbelievers in the Hellfire, where they will have couches of fire as their resting place. The mention of carpets and cushions implies that even in their punishment, there will be no comfort for them, and they will experience torment and suffering for their rejection of the truth.
orig: ولبيوتهم أبوابا وسررا عليها يتكئون

translation: And adornment. But the enjoyment of worldly life is only [temporary]. And the Hereafter - with your Lord - is for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the beauty and adornments of this worldly life are temporary and fleeting. True and everlasting enjoyment is reserved for the Hereafter with the Lord for those who are righteous and God-conscious.
orig: وزخرفا وإن كل ذلك لما متاع الحياة الدنيا والآخرة عند ربك للمتقين

translation: And whoever is blinded from the remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of turning away from the remembrance of Allah. When a person neglects to remember the Most Merciful, they are susceptible to being influenced by the devil, who becomes a constant companion leading them astray. The verse emphasizes the importance of staying connected to the remembrance of Allah to safeguard oneself from the whispers and temptations of Satan.
orig: ومن يعش عن ذكر الرحمن نقيض له شيطانا فهو له قرين

translation: And indeed, they prevent them from the way [of Allah] while they think that they are [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people, while believing they are on the right path, are actually leading others away from the true path of Allah. It warns against the dangers of misguided actions and beliefs that can lead one astray despite their perception of being guided.
orig: وإنهم ليصدونهم عن السبيل ويحسبون أنهم مهتدون

translation: So when they come to Us, they will say, 'If only there were between us and them distance as far as the east and west!' So evil is the companion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, when the disbelievers see the consequences of their actions, they will wish to be far away from the believers. It highlights the regret and realization that will come too late for those who rejected faith and guidance. The reference to the 'companion' symbolizes the influence of bad company and evil actions that led them astray.
orig: حتى إذا جاءنا قال يا ليت بيني وبينك بعد المشرقين فبئس القرين

translation: And today, no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is your guardian, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse serves as a strong warning to those who have wronged themselves by disbelieving, emphasizing that no recompense or ransom will avail them on the Day of Judgment. It reiterates that the disbelievers and wrongdoers will share in the punishment of the Hellfire, indicating that their ultimate destination will be a miserable one. The verse highlights the seriousness of disbelief and its consequences, urging people to turn back to righteousness and seek refuge in God before it is too late.
orig: ولن ينفعكم اليوم إذ ظلمتم أنكم في العذاب مشتركون

translation: So will you make the deaf hear, or guide the blind or those who are clearly misguided?
interpretation: This verse highlights the inability of the disbelievers to understand the truth despite clear signs and guidance provided by Allah. It emphasizes that guidance ultimately comes from Allah alone, and it is not in the hands of a human being to guide those who are not willing to see and hear the truth.
orig: أفأنت تسمع الصم أو تهدي العمي ومن كان في ضلال مبين

translation: So either We will take you in death, or We will punish you.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the inevitability of death and the accountability that individuals will face for their actions. It serves as a reminder that death is a reality that no one can escape, and that ultimately everyone will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: فإما نذهبن بك فإنا منهم منتقمون

translation: Or shall We show you that which We have promised them? We surely have full power over them.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's complete authority and power over all creatures. It emphasizes that Allah has the ability to fulfill His promises and that nothing in the heavens or the earth can prevent Him from doing so. It serves as a reminder of the omnipotence and sovereignty of Allah over everything in existence.
orig: أو نرينك الذي وعدناهم فإنا عليهم مقتدرون

translation: So adhere to that which is revealed to you. Indeed, you are on a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following and holding onto the guidance and revelations given by Allah. It reminds the reader that by following this guidance, they will remain on the right path and will be guided towards righteousness and success.
orig: فاستمسك بالذي أوحي إليك إنك على صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, there is a reminder for you and your people, and you will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Quran is a reminder not only for the Prophet Muhammad and his people but for all mankind. It highlights the importance of reflecting on its teachings and using it as a guidance in all aspects of life. The verse also serves as a warning that everyone will be questioned about how they responded to this reminder, indicating the accountability before Allah for one's actions.
orig: وإنه لذكر لك ولقومك وسوف تسألون

translation: And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers; have We made besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?
interpretation: This verse urges the readers to seek the lessons and knowledge from the messengers who came before, questioning whether other gods have been appointed besides the Most Merciful. It highlights the concept of monotheism and warns against the worship of other deities besides Allah.
orig: واسأل من أرسلنا من قبلك من رسلنا أجعلنا من دون الرحمن آلهة يعبدون

translation: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, 'Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the mission of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) to Pharaoh and his people, where he delivers the signs and messages of Allah to them. It reflects the duty of prophets to convey the message of the One God to all people, regardless of their status, and the importance of recognizing the Lord of the worlds as the ultimate authority.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا إلى فرعون وملئه فقال إني رسول رب العالمين

translation: When Our verses came to them, they would laugh at them.
interpretation: This verse indicates the response of some disbelievers when they were presented with the signs and verses of Allah. Instead of taking them seriously and reflecting on the message, they mocked and laughed at them. It highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who fail to recognize the truth and guidance provided in the Quran and choose to ridicule it instead.
orig: فلما جاءهم بآياتنا إذا هم منها يضحكون

translation: And We show them no sign except that it is greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that the signs and teachings of Allah are presented in various forms and magnitudes, each holding its own significance and wisdom. The afflictions and trials faced by individuals serve as reminders and opportunities for reflection and repentance, ultimately guiding them towards returning to the path of righteousness and submission to Allah.
orig: وما نريهم من آية إلا هي أكبر من أختها وأخذناهم بالعذاب لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And they said, "O magician, invoke your Lord for us by what He has covenanted with you. Indeed, we will be guided."
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when disbelievers challenged Prophet Musa (Moses) by asking him to invoke Allah based on the promise Allah had made to him. The disbelievers were trying to test the authenticity of Prophet Musa's connection with Allah. The interpretation signifies the importance of faith and trust in the Prophets and the covenant they have with Allah. It also highlights the concept of seeking guidance from Allah through His chosen messengers.
orig: وقالوا يا أيه الساحر ادع لنا ربك بما عهد عندك إننا لمهتدون

translation: And when We removed the punishment from them, suddenly they broke their word.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of how some people, when saved from a difficulty or punishment, immediately revert to their old ways and break their promises or commitments. It highlights the ingratitude and lack of sincerity in individuals who fail to uphold their end of the bargain even after being shown mercy or forgiveness.
orig: فلما كشفنا عنهم العذاب إذا هم ينكثون

translation: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, 'O my people, does the kingdom of Egypt not belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; do you not see?'
interpretation: This verse illustrates Pharaoh's arrogance and delusion of grandeur as he claims ownership of Egypt and its resources. It serves as a warning against pride and the false sense of power, reminding us that true authority ultimately belongs to Allah.
orig: ونادى فرعون في قومه قال يا قوم أليس لي ملك مصر وهذه الأنهار تجري من تحتي أفلا تبصرون

translation: Am I better than this one who is contemptible and can scarcely express himself clearly?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the arrogance of a person who thinks they are better than others simply because of their eloquence or status. It serves as a reminder that true worth is not determined by outward appearances or speaking abilities, but rather by sincere faith, humility, and good deeds.
orig: أم أنا خير من هذا الذي هو مهين ولا يكاد يبين

translation: Why was there not sent down upon him a treasure or garden for consumption, as had those before him? And the evil-doers said, 'You follow none but a man bewitched.'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the disbelievers refused to accept the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a Messenger of God, demanding extraordinary signs or miracles be sent down to prove his prophethood. However, the true essence of Prophethood lies in the message being conveyed and the guidance brought by the Prophet, not in extraordinary displays of earthly treasures or miracles. The disbelievers' rejection was rooted in arrogance and denial, as they sought excuses to divert from the truth rather than opening their hearts to accept the clear signs and guidance provided by the Prophet.
orig: فلولا ألقي عليه أسورة من ذهب أو جاء معه الملائكة مقترنين

translation: So [Pharaoh] bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse talks about Pharaoh deceiving his people to gain their obedience. It highlights how he used manipulation and falsehood to maintain his power over them. The verse also emphasizes that the people were already inclined towards disobedience and corruption, making them vulnerable to manipulative leaders like Pharaoh.
orig: فاستخف قومه فأطاعوه إنهم كانوا قوما فاسقين

translation: So when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.
interpretation: This verse speaks about how those who provoked the anger of Allah faced the consequences of their actions, in this case, being drowned. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being mindful of one's behavior and the consequences of going against the will of Allah.
orig: فلما آسفونا انتقمنا منهم فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: So We made them precedents and examples for the later peoples.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the stories of the past nations mentioned in the Qur'an serve as precedents and examples for future generations. By reflecting on the consequences of their actions and the lessons learned from their experiences, people can derive guidance for their own lives and avoid repeating the mistakes of those who came before them.
orig: فجعلناهم سلفا ومثلا للآخرين

translation: And [mention] when the son of Mary was presented as an example; immediately your people laughed aloud.
interpretation: This verse refers to the mockery and ridicule that some people directed towards Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) when his miraculous abilities and his position as a Prophet were brought to their attention. It highlights the human tendency to react with skepticism and ridicule towards things that are beyond their understanding or beliefs.
orig: ولما ضرب ابن مريم مثلا إذا قومك منه يصدون

translation: And they say, "Are our gods better, or is he?" They did not present the comparison except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a contentious people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the flawed reasoning of those who compare their false gods with the true God. The verse emphasizes that such comparisons are based on weak arguments and do not hold any validity. It serves as a reminder that those who engage in such comparisons are merely being contentious and not seeking the truth.
orig: وقالوا أآلهتنا خير أم هو ما ضربوه لك إلا جدلا بل هم قوم خصمون

translation: He is but a servant whom We have favored, and We have made him an example for the Children of Israel.
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him), emphasizing that he is a servant of Allah who was bestowed with favor and chosen as an example for the Children of Israel. It highlights Jesus' status as a great prophet and role model for his people.
orig: إن هو إلا عبد أنعمنا عليه وجعلناه مثلا لبني إسرائيل

translation: And if We willed, We could have made among you angels in the earth succeeding [one another].
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of Allah, mentioning that if He wanted, He could have created humans as angels walking the earth in succession. It emphasizes the diverse capabilities and creations of Allah, confirming His authority and wisdom in His creations.
orig: ولو نشاء لجعلنا منكم ملائكة في الأرض يخلفون

translation: And indeed, it (the Qur'an) is a knowledge of the Hour, so do not doubt it, and follow Me. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an contains knowledge about the Day of Judgment, so believers should not doubt its truth and should follow the guidance it provides as it is the straight path leading towards righteousness and salvation.
orig: وإنه لعلم للساعة فلا تمترن بها واتبعون هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: And let not Satan turn you away. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers that Satan is their open enemy and that they should not let him distract or misguide them from the path of righteousness. It emphasizes the importance of remaining vigilant against the tricks and temptations of Satan in order to stay true to one's faith and beliefs.
orig: ولا يصدنكم الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, 'I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear Allah and obey me.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an demonstrates the role of Jesus (peace be upon him) as a messenger of God who brought clear evidence to his people. He emphasized the importance of wisdom in understanding differences and urged people to be mindful of Allah and follow his guidance.
orig: ولما جاء عيسى بالبينات قال قد جئتكم بالحكمة ولأبين لكم بعض الذي تختلفون فيه فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the Lord of all, calling for worship and submission solely to Him. It highlights the importance of following the straight path set by Allah, indicating the clear and righteous way to lead one's life in accordance with His commandments.
orig: إن الله هو ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: So the groups differed [among them] and woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day.
interpretation: This verse is warning those who have wronged and caused division among themselves that they will face a severe punishment on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder to avoid causing discord and injustice, as it will lead to a painful consequence in the Hereafter.
orig: فاختلف الأحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين ظلموا من عذاب يوم أليم

translation: Do they await but that the Hour should come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?
interpretation: This verse questions the mindset of those who are heedless and unaware of the signs and indications of the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the suddenness and unexpected nature of the Hour, calling upon individuals to be vigilant and conscious of their actions and the reality of this inevitable event.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: On that Day [of Judgement], close friends will become enemies to one another, except for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of the Day of Judgement, where the closest of friends will turn against each other due to the intensity of the situation. It emphasizes the power and significance of piety and righteousness, as those who have been mindful of their faith and actions will be spared from this discord and enmity.
orig: الأخلاء يومئذ بعضهم لبعض عدو إلا المتقين

translation: O my servants, there is no fear upon you this day, nor shall you grieve.
interpretation: This verse is a reassurance from Allah to His servants, telling them not to fear or grieve. It reminds believers that on the Day of Judgment, those who have faith and do good deeds will have nothing to fear or be saddened by, as Allah's mercy and forgiveness will prevail.
orig: يا عباد لا خوف عليكم اليوم ولا أنتم تحزنون

translation: Those who believe in Our verses and are Muslims.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of true believers who have faith in the signs of Allah and submit themselves completely to His will. They not only believe in Allah's revelations but also embody Islam in their actions and attitudes, demonstrating obedience and surrender to Allah.
orig: الذين آمنوا بآياتنا وكانوا مسلمين

translation: Enter Paradise, you and your spouses, delighted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reward and bliss of Paradise for the believers who will be reunited with their spouses in a state of joy and happiness. It highlights the importance of righteous companionship in the Hereafter and the fulfillment of their deepest desires and wishes in Paradise.
orig: ادخلوا الجنة أنتم وأزواجكم تحبرون

translation: Circulated among them will be plates and cups of gold. And there will be whatever the souls desire and the eyes delight in. And you will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse describes the luxurious and everlasting rewards awaiting the believers in Paradise. It paints a picture of abundance and pleasure, indicating that believers will have all their desires fulfilled and enjoy eternal delight in the afterlife.
orig: يطاف عليهم بصحاف من ذهب وأكواب وفيها ما تشتهيه الأنفس وتلذ الأعين وأنتم فيها خالدون

translation: And that is Paradise which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse is referring to Paradise and the rewards awaiting the believers in the afterlife. It emphasizes that Paradise is a place of inheritance for those who do good deeds in this world. It serves as a reminder that our actions in this life will shape the rewards or consequences we receive in the Hereafter.
orig: وتلك الجنة التي أورثتموها بما كنتم تعملون

translation: You have in them abundant fruits; from them you will eat.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the bountiful provision of fruits from the gardens as a gift from Allah to humankind. It signifies the generosity and mercy of Allah in providing sustenance and pleasure for His creation.
orig: لكم فيها فاكهة كثيرة منها تأكلون

translation: Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the destiny of the wrongdoers who will remain in eternal punishment in Hell. It serves as a warning and reminder for believers to follow the right path and avoid evil deeds to escape such a severe outcome.
orig: إن المجرمين في عذاب جهنم خالدون

translation: Do not turn away from them, while seeking the luxuries of this life.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder not to neglect or ignore those who are in need, even when facing challenges or difficulties in life. It encourages believers to continue supporting and helping others, showing compassion and kindness, even when faced with personal struggles or temptations.
orig: لا يفتر عنهم وهم فيه مبلسون

translation: And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah does not wrong anyone, rather it is the individuals themselves who commit wrongdoing and oppression. It serves as a reminder that each person is responsible for their own actions and that ultimately they will be accountable for their deeds.
orig: وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا هم الظالمين

translation: And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."
interpretation: This verse refers to a scene from the Day of Judgment where the disbelievers will cry out to the guardian of Hell, Malik, to ask Allah to end their suffering by destroying them completely. However, Malik will respond that they are destined to remain in Hell as a punishment for their sins, highlighting the eternal punishment that awaits those who reject faith and disobey Allah.
orig: ونادوا يا مالك ليقض علينا ربك قال إنكم ماكثون

translation: We have certainly brought you the truth, but most of you to the truth are averse.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the truth has been presented clearly and unequivocally, but many people still turn away from it. It highlights the idea that despite the clarity of the message, there will always be those who choose to reject it due to their own biases or preconceived notions.
orig: لقد جئناكم بالحق ولكن أكثركم للحق كارهون

translation: Or have they devised [some] affair? But indeed, We are devising [a scheme].
interpretation: This verse alludes to the futility of human plotting against the divine will. It serves as a reminder that all human schemes and plans are ultimately under the control of Allah, who is the ultimate planner and the best of planners. It conveys the message that all efforts that run counter to the will of Allah will ultimately fail, emphasizing the overarching power and wisdom of Allah over all things.
orig: أم أبرموا أمرا فإنا مبرمون

translation: Or do they think that We do not hear their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers are with them recording.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing and is fully aware of everything, including the secret conversations and hidden thoughts of people. It also highlights the concept of angels being present with humans to record their deeds and actions for accountability on the Day of Judgment.
orig: أم يحسبون أنا لا نسمع سرهم ونجواهم بلى ورسلنا لديهم يكتبون

translation: Say, "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I am the first of worshippers."
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the oneness of God and rejects the idea of God having a son. It emphasizes that worship should be directed solely to God, without associating any partners with Him.
orig: قل إن كان للرحمن ولد فأنا أول العابدين

translation: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the greatness and transcendence of Allah, who is the Lord of all creation, including the heavens, the earth, and the Throne. It highlights the perfection, holiness, and unblemished nature of Allah which is beyond human description or comprehension.
orig: سبحان رب السماوات والأرض رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: So leave them to indulge in vain talk and play until they meet their Day which they are promised.
interpretation: This verse advises believers to not engage with those who mock the teachings of the Qur'an and engage in unproductive activities. It reassures that those who mock will face the consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي يوعدون

translation: And He is the God in the heavens and the God on the earth, and He is the Wise, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the oneness of God, stating that He is the only true God both in the heavens and on the earth. Additionally, it highlights two of God's attributes: His wisdom and His knowledge. God is described as Wise, meaning He acts with perfect wisdom, and All-Knowing, signifying His complete knowledge of all things.
orig: وهو الذي في السماء إله وفي الأرض إله وهو الحكيم العليم

translation: And blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and with whom is knowledge of the Hour, and to whom you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute and ultimate sovereignty of Allah over all creation. It highlights that He is the All-Knowing and All-Powerful, holding the knowledge of the Day of Judgment. It reminds us that ultimately, all beings will return to Him for accountability and judgement.
orig: وتبارك الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وعنده علم الساعة وإليه ترجعون

translation: And those they invoke other than Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who are worshipped besides Allah do not have the power to intercede on behalf of individuals on the Day of Judgment. The only ones who will have the authority to intercede are those who testify to the truth and have knowledge about the reality of the situation.
orig: ولا يملك الذين يدعون من دونه الشفاعة إلا من شهد بالحق وهم يعلمون

translation: And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say, "Allah." So how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse reflects the undeniable belief within every individual that God is the Creator. Despite this innate knowledge, people can still be led astray due to their own desires, ignorance, or arrogance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of staying true to one's faith and not letting oneself be misguided by worldly distractions or false beliefs.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلقهم ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: And Nuh (Noah) was told, 'O Lord, these people do not believe.'
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Nuh (Noah) mentions to Allah that his people do not believe. This shows the concern and frustration of Prophet Nuh towards his people's rejection of the message he was delivering to them. It highlights the challenges and struggles faced by prophets in conveying the message of guidance to their communities.
orig: وقيله يا رب إن هؤلاء قوم لا يؤمنون

translation: So turn aside from them and say, 'Peace.' But they are going to know.
interpretation: This verse advises to respond to harm or hostility with forgiveness and peace, showing patience and restraint. It also indicates that eventually, those who have done wrong or shown enmity will come to realize their mistakes and understand the consequences of their actions.
orig: فاصفح عنهم وقل سلام فسوف يعلمون

translation: Ha Meem.
interpretation: This verse is known as the disjointed letters (Huroof Muqatta'at) and carries a hidden meaning that is known only to Allah. Some scholars suggest that these letters are a means of challenging the Arabs of that time, who prided themselves on their eloquence, to produce something similar to the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and the inability of mankind to replicate it.
orig: حم

translation: By the clear Book,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an itself, which is often referred to as the clear Book because of its clear guidance, teachings, and commandments. It emphasizes the importance of the Qur'an as a source of clear and unambiguous guidance for mankind.
orig: والكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We sent it [the Qur'an] down during a blessed night. Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance and significance of the night on which the Qur'an was revealed, known as Laylatul Qadr (the Night of Decree). It emphasizes that the revelation of the Qur'an was a blessing and a guidance for humankind. Additionally, it conveys the message that the purpose of the Qur'an is to warn and alert people to the consequences of their actions and choices, encouraging them to strive for righteousness and guidance.
orig: إنا أنزلناه في ليلة مباركة إنا كنا منذرين

translation: In it every wise command is made distinct.
interpretation: This verse highlights that within the Qur'an, every wise decree and command is clearly explained and differentiated, guiding believers on the right path and providing wisdom for their lives.
orig: فيها يفرق كل أمر حكيم

translation: It is a command from Us; indeed, We are messengers.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the commandments and guidance mentioned in the Qur'an are decreed by Allah and conveyed through His messengers. It serves as a reminder of the divine source of the Qur'anic message and the importance of following the guidance sent by Allah through His chosen messengers.
orig: أمرا من عندنا إنا كنا مرسلين

translation: It is a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the mercy we receive is a gift from Allah, our Lord, who is all-hearing and all-knowing. It serves as a reminder of Allah's compassion and grace towards His creation, and reinforces the importance of seeking His mercy and guidance in all aspects of life.
orig: رحمة من ربك إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, if you should be certain.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of Tawhid (the Oneness of Allah) by acknowledging Allah as the ultimate authority over all creation. It calls on believers to have certainty in their faith and belief in the power and sovereignty of Allah, who is the creator and sustainer of everything in the heavens and the earth. The verse encourages believers to have unwavering faith in Allah's existence and control over all aspects of the universe.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إن كنتم موقنين

translation: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the only deity that has the power to give life and cause death. It also mentions the connection between the Lord of the current generation and the Lord of the ancestors, highlighting the continuity and universal nature of Allah's dominion over all generations and creation.
orig: لا إله إلا هو يحيي ويميت ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: Nay, they are in doubt, sporting.
interpretation: This verse highlights the state of disbelief and doubt that some individuals may choose to live in. The word 'sporting' indicates that they are heedless and not taking the seriousness of their doubts and denial of the truth to heart. It serves as a reminder of the danger of neglecting or playing around with matters of faith and belief.
orig: بل هم في شك يلعبون

translation: So wait for the day when the sky will bring a visible smoke,
interpretation: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment, warning people to be prepared for the events that will take place. It symbolizes the Day of Resurrection, where there will be clear signs of the impending judgment and the consequences of one's actions.
orig: فارتقب يوم تأتي السماء بدخان مبين

translation: This punishment is agony overtaking the people.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the severity of the punishment that will befall the disbelievers. It portrays a scene where a painful punishment envelops the people, indicating the consequences of rejecting faith and righteousness.
orig: يغشى الناس هذا عذاب أليم

translation: Our Lord, remove from us the punishment. Indeed, we are believers.
interpretation: This verse reflects the believers' plea to Allah to remove any punishment or hardship from them. It shows the believers' trust and reliance on Allah, believing that He is all-powerful and merciful. By stating their faith along with their request, they demonstrate their humility and submission to Allah's will.
orig: ربنا اكشف عنا العذاب إنا مؤمنون

translation: How will they remember (admonition), when a clear Messenger has already come to them?
interpretation: This verse questions the inability of disbelievers to take heed and remember the guidance given to them despite the clarity of the message brought by the Prophet. It highlights the importance of reflecting upon the signs and messages sent by Allah through His messengers.
orig: أنى لهم الذكرى وقد جاءهم رسول مبين

translation: Then they turned away from him and said, 'He is a madman, possessed.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates a common reaction of those who rejected the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad. Rather than engaging with his message or considering its validity, they resorted to calling him names and dismissing him as insane. It serves as a reminder of the resistance and ridicule prophets often faced when conveying the message of Allah.
orig: ثم تولوا عنه وقالوا معلم مجنون

translation: We shall gradually reveal Our punishment; you shall [soon] return [to Us].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that divine punishment may come suddenly or gradually, and that ultimately, all beings will return to God. It serves as a reminder of the eventual accountability and the need for repentance and seeking forgiveness.
orig: إنا كاشفو العذاب قليلا إنكم عائدون

translation: On the Day when We will seize with the greatest seizure, indeed, We will take retribution.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when Allah will seize the disbelievers with a great seizure as a punishment for their wrongdoings. It emphasizes that Allah will ensure justice is served and retribution is taken against those who have transgressed His boundaries.
orig: يوم نبطش البطشة الكبرى إنا منتقمون

translation: And certainly We tested the people of Pharaoh before them, and there came to them a noble messenger.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the nations before the disbelievers of Quraysh were also tested, as was the case with the people of Pharaoh who were tested with various tribulations. Despite these trials, they received a noble and honorable messenger from Allah to guide them towards the truth. The verse serves as a reminder that trials and messengers have been sent to various nations throughout history as a means of guidance and testing.
orig: ولقد فتنا قبلهم قوم فرعون وجاءهم رسول كريم

translation: that you should give the slaves of Allah to me. Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of trusting and obeying the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a trustworthy messenger of Allah. It highlights the significance of following his guidance and teachings in order to fulfill one's obligations to Allah.
orig: أن أدوا إلي عباد الله إني لكم رسول أمين

translation: And do not assert superiority over Allah. Indeed, I have come to you with clear authority.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not claiming superiority or authority over Allah. It serves as a reminder that only Allah possesses ultimate power and authority, as evidenced by the clear proofs and signs that have been sent down. It warns against arrogance and urges humility and submission before the clear authority of Allah.
orig: وأن لا تعلوا على الله إني آتيكم بسلطان مبين

translation: And indeed, I have taken an oath by my Lord and your Lord not to stone the adulterers.
interpretation: The Prophet Muhammad is affirming the prohibition of stoning as a punishment for adultery. This verse emphasizes that he has sworn by his Lord and the Lord of his people not to carry out this punishment, indicating a shift towards mercy and forgiveness in dealing with such cases.
orig: وإني عذت بربي وربكم أن ترجمون

translation: And if you do not believe me, then leave me alone.
interpretation: This verse indicates that if someone refuses to believe in the message being conveyed to them, the speaker advises them to leave them be and not interfere with their mission. It emphasizes the importance of free will and choice in accepting or rejecting faith.
orig: وإن لم تؤمنوا لي فاعتزلون

translation: So he called upon his Lord, "Indeed, these are a criminal people."
interpretation: This verse describes a situation where a Prophet calls upon Allah to bear witness that the people he is dealing with are indeed committing sinful acts. It highlights the Prophet's concern for the moral and ethical behavior of his community and his call for justice and righteousness.
orig: فدعا ربه أن هؤلاء قوم مجرمون

translation: So set forth with My servants by night; indeed, you are to be pursued.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to His servant to travel with His followers at night to avoid being chased and pursued. It signifies the importance of stealth and caution in certain situations, as well as the divine protection that Allah provides to His obedient servants.
orig: فأسر بعبادي ليلا إنكم متبعون

translation: And leave the sea as calm, indeed they are an army to be drowned.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event of the crossing of the Red Sea by Prophet Moses and the Israelites as they fled from Pharaoh's army. Here, Allah is instructing Prophet Moses to strike the sea with his staff which will then split, allowing the Israelites to cross safely. The verse signifies the power and control of Allah over all things, including nature and the forces of the enemies. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of defiance against Allah, ultimately leading to the destruction of the oppressors.
orig: واترك البحر رهوا إنهم جند مغرقون

translation: How many gardens and springs they left behind.
interpretation: This verse draws attention to the nature and extent of the blessings that people may disregard or ignore while pursuing worldly desires. It serves as a reminder to reflect on the numerous blessings and provisions that people often take for granted or neglect in their pursuit of temporary pleasures.
orig: كم تركوا من جنات وعيون

translation: And [for] crops and [their] noble site.
interpretation: This verse highlights the favor of Allah on His creation by providing them with sustenance in the form of crops and dignified land for cultivation. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the blessings of sustenance and fertile land that enable livelihood and prosperity.
orig: وزروع ومقام كريم

translation: And they enjoyed therein [the pleasures] of a blessing.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the enjoyment and fulfillment experienced by certain individuals through the blessings bestowed upon them by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing and appreciating the many gifts and blessings we receive in our lives, and the gratitude we should express for these favors.
orig: ونعمة كانوا فيها فاكهين

translation: And thus We made it [the land of Palestine] a heritage for another people.
interpretation: This verse refers to the land of Palestine being bequeathed to another group of people. It carries the message that lands and properties are not permanent possessions and can be transferred to other individuals or groups based on the will and decree of Allah.
orig: كذلك وأورثناها قوما آخرين

translation: So the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they given respite.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of the punishment that those who deny and reject the truth will face. It highlights that at the time of their punishment, even the heavens and the earth do not mourn for them, indicating the magnitude of their wrongdoing and the lack of sympathy or respite that they will receive.
orig: فما بكت عليهم السماء والأرض وما كانوا منظرين

translation: And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's mercy and protection towards the Children of Israel. It serves as a reminder that no matter how difficult or humiliating the torment may be, Allah is always there to save and deliver those who seek His help. It emphasizes the importance of seeking refuge in Allah during times of distress and hardship.
orig: ولقد نجينا بني إسرائيل من العذاب المهين

translation: From the family of Pharaoh, indeed he was among the corrupt ones.
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh, the tyrannical ruler who oppressed and rejected the message of Prophet Moses. It highlights his arrogance, pride, and unjust behavior, which ultimately led to his downfall. The verse serves as a warning about the consequences of corruption and wrongdoing.
orig: من فرعون إنه كان عاليا من المسرفين

translation: And We have chosen them for knowledge above the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that certain individuals have been selected by Allah for knowledge which surpasses that of all beings in the universe. It highlights the importance and honor of seeking and spreading knowledge in Islam.
orig: ولقد اخترناهم على علم على العالمين

translation: And We have given them of signs that in which there is obvious trial.
interpretation: This verse indicates that God tests His people through clear signs and revelations. The signs mentioned in the verse are not only meant to guide and lead the believers, but also to test their faith and commitment. Believers are expected to recognize and follow the signs provided by God, demonstrating their devotion and obedience. The trials and tests in these signs serve as a means of purification and strengthening of faith for believers.
orig: وآتيناهم من الآيات ما فيه بلاء مبين

translation: Indeed, these [people] are only saying
interpretation: This verse indicates that the people being mentioned are only uttering words and making statements, without necessarily taking any action or showing true belief. It serves as a reminder to consider the actions and intentions behind what is being said.
orig: إن هؤلاء ليقولون

translation: Indeed, this is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
interpretation: This verse reflects the attitude of disbelievers who deny the concept of resurrection after death. They believe that death is the ultimate end and there is no afterlife. The verse portrays their denial of accountability and life after death, showing their limited understanding and lack of belief in the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن هي إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمنشرين

translation: So bring our forefathers back, if you should be truthful.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the arrogance and ignorance of those who reject the truth and demand miracles to prove the existence of God and the Resurrection. It points out the futile nature of their request, as even bringing back their forefathers would not convince them. The verse emphasizes the importance of faith and reflection on the signs of God rather than demanding extraordinary proofs.
orig: فأتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers mentioned are better than the people of Tubba' and those who came before them, who were destroyed by God due to their crimes and sins. It serves as a reminder of the consequences that befall those who choose to disobey God and commit sins.
orig: أهم خير أم قوم تبع والذين من قبلهم أهلكناهم إنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in play.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the creation of the heavens and the earth, along with everything between them, was not done in jest or as a form of idle play. It highlights the seriousness and purposefulness of the creation, pointing to the profound wisdom and divine intent behind the universe's existence. Everything in existence has a specific purpose and serves as a sign of Allah's power and wisdom, carrying deep meanings beyond mere amusement or triviality.
orig: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the creation of human beings is based on truth and wisdom. However, many people are ignorant of this reality. It serves as a reminder that despite the purposeful creation of humanity, many individuals fail to recognize or acknowledge the truth of their existence and their Creator.
orig: ما خلقناهما إلا بالحق ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgement and highlights that it is the set time when all will be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability before Allah for everything that has been done in this world.
orig: إن يوم الفصل ميقاتهم أجمعين

translation: The Day when a protector will not benefit the one he protected in anything, and they will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate Day of Judgment, when no one will be able to protect or benefit another person, and no one will be able to seek help from anyone else. It emphasizes the accountability and individual responsibility that every soul will face on that Day.
orig: يوم لا يغني مولى عن مولى شيئا ولا هم ينصرون

translation: Except for those upon whom Allah has mercy. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine mercy in Islam. It emphasizes that ultimately, it is through Allah's mercy that individuals can attain salvation and forgiveness. It also stresses the qualities of Allah as the All-Powerful (Al-Aziz) and the Most Merciful (Ar-Rahim), showcasing His infinite compassion towards His creations.
orig: إلا من رحم الله إنه هو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Indeed, the tree of zaqqum,
interpretation: This verse refers to the tree of zaqqum, a tree that is mentioned in the Qur'an as a food for the sinners in Hell. The tree of zaqqum is described as a bitter tree with fruits that resemble the heads of devils. This verse serves as a warning of the consequences of sin and disobedience, and highlights the torment that awaits those who reject the guidance of Allah.
orig: إن شجرت الزقوم

translation: The food of the sinners
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that the sinners will face in the afterlife, where they will be given food that is symbolically associated with their sinful actions and deeds in the world.
orig: طعام الأثيم

translation: like molten brass, it will boil in the bellies,
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment for the wrongdoers on the Day of Judgment, where their bellies will be filled with boiling molten brass. It depicts the intense torment and agony that they will face as a consequence of their actions in the worldly life.
orig: كالمهل يغلي في البطون

translation: Like boiling oil.
interpretation: This verse is describing the punishment of the disbelievers in the hereafter, likening it to boiling oil. The intensity of the punishment is emphasized by comparing it to the boiling of oil, indicating the severe torment that those who reject faith will face in the afterlife.
orig: كغلي الحميم

translation: Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse is describing the severe punishment awaiting those who have committed grave sins and wronged others. It warns of the consequences of one's actions and the inevitable accountability in the afterlife for those who have strayed from the path of righteousness.
orig: خذوه فاعتلوه إلى سواء الجحيم

translation: Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water.
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment where scalding water is poured over the head of the sinner in the Hereafter. It signifies the intense agony and suffering that the wrongdoers will face as a consequence of their actions.
orig: ثم صبوا فوق رأسه من عذاب الحميم

translation: Taste. Indeed, you are the Exalted in Might, the Generous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and generosity of Allah. It emphasizes that He is the Almighty, capable of all things, and His generosity knows no bounds. Through this, believers are reminded to trust in His power and seek His blessings and mercy.
orig: ذق إنك أنت العزيز الكريم

translation: Indeed, this is what you used to dispute.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Qur'an is confirming and emphasizing a specific point that the people were previously in disagreement or doubt about. It serves as a reminder and a clarifying statement that dismisses any uncertainties or inconsistencies that existed among them.
orig: إن هذا ما كنتم به تمترون

translation: Verily, the righteous will be in a secure place.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the status of the righteous individuals who are God-conscious and pious. It emphasizes that they will be in a secure and honorable position in the sight of Allah, where they will be protected from harm and their good deeds will be preserved. It serves as a reminder of the importance of piety and righteousness in Islam, and the promise of security and honor for those who adhere to these qualities.
orig: إن المتقين في مقام أمين

translation: In gardens and springs,
interpretation: This verse describes the lush and beautiful landscapes of paradise, portraying a serene and tranquil environment where believers will be rewarded after their struggles in the world. It symbolizes the ultimate reward and bliss awaiting those who lead a righteous life and follow the teachings of Islam.
orig: في جنات وعيون

translation: They will be adorned with garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and they will be seated face to face.
interpretation: This verse describes the reward for the believers in Paradise, where they will be dressed in luxurious garments and seated in a dignified manner. It signifies the honor, comfort, and beauty that await the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: يلبسون من سندس وإستبرق متقابلين

translation: Thus. And We paired them with companions with beautiful eyes.
interpretation: This verse discusses the reward of the righteous believers in Paradise. It indicates that they will be rewarded with spouses in Paradise who are pure and beautiful, emphasizing the fulfillment of their desires and happiness in the afterlife.
orig: كذلك وزوجناهم بحور عين

translation: They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit in peace and security,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where the inhabitants will have the freedom to call for any kind of fruit they desire, and they will receive it in a state of complete peace and security. It symbolizes the abundance, joy, and tranquility that believers will experience in paradise.
orig: يدعون فيها بكل فاكهة آمنين

translation: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who enter Jannah (Paradise) will not experience death as they did in the earthly life, except for the initial death. They will be protected from the torment of Hellfire, ensuring eternal peace and bliss in the Hereafter.
orig: لا يذوقون فيها الموت إلا الموتة الأولى ووقاهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: This is by the grace of your Lord, a great success.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that success comes from the grace of Allah. It reminds us that true success is achieved through the help and blessings of our Lord, and not just through our own efforts. It highlights the importance of recognizing and being grateful for the favors and blessings bestowed upon us by Allah, as they lead to ultimate success and achievement.
orig: فضلا من ربك ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: So We have made this Qur'an easy in your own language, so that with it you may give good news to those who are righteous and warn those who are argumentative.
interpretation: Allah has made the Qur'an easy to understand and recite in your own language, so that it may serve as a source of guidance and reminder for those who are willing to learn and reflect. It is a means of conveying glad tidings to the righteous and cautioning those who tend to argue and oppose the truth.
orig: فإنما يسرناه بلسانك لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: So watch, indeed, they are also watching.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that individuals should be vigilant and aware that they are being observed and judged by Allah. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and retribution, reminding believers to be mindful of their actions and intentions as they will ultimately face the consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: فارتقب إنهم مرتقبون

translation: Ha, Meem.
interpretation: This verse is a part of a set of Arabic letters that appear at the beginning of certain chapters in the Quran and their specific meaning is known only to God. These letters are a mystery that serves to show the miraculous nature of the Quran and the inability of humans to produce something similar. Muslims are encouraged to reflect on their presence and ponder over the divine wisdom behind their usage.
orig: حم

translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is not merely a book of human authorship but a divine revelation from Allah, the All-Powerful and All-Wise. It emphasizes the divine origin and wisdom contained within the Qur'an, inviting believers to reflect upon its teachings and guidance with humility and reverence.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's existence and power that are scattered throughout the universe, serving as reminders for those who believe. It encourages believers to ponder over the creation of the heavens and the earth as a means to strengthen their faith and deepen their connection with their Creator.
orig: إن في السماوات والأرض لآيات للمؤمنين

translation: And in your creation and all the creatures He has spread about there are signs for people of sure faith.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah present in the creation of human beings and all living creatures. It encourages people with true faith to reflect upon these signs as a means to strengthen their belief in the existence and greatness of Allah.
orig: وفي خلقكم وما يبث من دابة آيات لقوم يوقنون

translation: And [of] the alternation of the night and the day and what Allah sends down from the sky of provision and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and the ordering of the winds, are signs for a people who reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's greatness and power in the alternation of night and day, the provision that comes from the sky, the revival of the earth after it was lifeless, and the orderly movement of the winds. These are all clear signs of Allah's existence and capability, meant to be pondered upon by those who possess intellect.
orig: واختلاف الليل والنهار وما أنزل الله من السماء من رزق فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها وتصريف الرياح آيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the signs and verses of Allah that are recited to people truthfully. It questions the disbelief of people in these signs and asks what other message or proof they seek beyond Allah's words to believe.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق فبأي حديث بعد الله وآياته يؤمنون

translation: Woe to every sinful liar
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who engage in sinful behavior and falsehood. It emphasizes the consequences and the pain that will befall those who persist in deceptive actions and wrongdoing.
orig: ويل لكل أفاك أثيم

translation: He hears the verses of Allah recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns about the consequences of arrogance and pride when one hears the verses of Allah but refuses to heed them. It highlights the importance of humility and attentiveness when receiving divine messages, as the refusal to listen may lead to a severe punishment.
orig: يسمع آيات الله تتلى عليه ثم يصر مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against mocking or belittling the signs and verses of Allah. It emphasizes that those who do so will face a severe and degrading punishment. It highlights the importance of respecting and reflecting on the signs of Allah rather than treating them with contempt.
orig: وإذا علم من آياتنا شيئا اتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: Behind them is Hell, and what they have earned will not avail them at all, nor what they took as protectors instead of Allah. And they will have a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitable consequences of wrongdoing and turning away from the guidance of Allah. It warns that the deeds and false beliefs of disbelievers will not benefit them in the afterlife, and their chosen allies or protectors other than Allah will be of no assistance. As a result, they will face severe punishment in the Hereafter, particularly the torment of Hell.
orig: من ورائهم جهنم ولا يغني عنهم ما كسبوا شيئا ولا ما اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: This is guidance, but those who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord will have a painful punishment of foul nature.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a source of guidance for believers. However, it warns that those who reject the signs and verses of Allah will face a severe and agonizing punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and the importance of acknowledging and following the guidance provided in the Qur'an.
orig: هذا هدى والذين كفروا بآيات ربهم لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: It is Allah who subjected the sea to you so that ships may sail upon it by His command, and so that you may seek His bounties and be grateful.
interpretation: This verse underscores the power and authority of Allah in creating and controlling the sea for the benefit of mankind. It highlights the importance of gratitude towards Allah for His blessings and encourages seeking His bounties through the resources provided, such as the sea.
orig: الله الذي سخر لكم البحر لتجري الفلك فيه بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything in the heavens and the earth has been subjugated for the benefit of humanity by Allah. It serves as a reminder that everything in existence is under the control and dominion of Allah, and these signs point towards the greatness and wisdom of Allah for those who reflect and ponder over them.
orig: وسخر لكم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض جميعا منه إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Say to those who have believed to forgive those who do not expect the days of Allah so that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of forgiveness and mercy between believers, even towards those who may not have hope in the reward from Allah. By forgiving others and showing mercy, believers may receive recompense and rewards from Allah for their actions, ultimately leading to a better community and individual purification.
orig: قل للذين آمنوا يغفروا للذين لا يرجون أيام الله ليجزي قوما بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does so] against it. Then to your Lord you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse underscores the concept of individual accountability. It emphasizes that the consequences of one's actions – whether good or bad – ultimately affect oneself. It reminds believers that their deeds will determine their fate, and that accountability lies with each individual. The verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate return to God for judgment, where everyone will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: من عمل صالحا فلنفسه ومن أساء فعليها ثم إلى ربكم ترجعون

translation: And We certainly gave the Children of Israel the Scripture, the judgement, and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and favoured them over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights how Allah bestowed upon the Children of Israel various blessings and favors, such as giving them the Scripture, wisdom, prophethood, sustenance from good things, and raising them in status above all other nations of the world. It serves as a reminder of Allah's provision and special blessings towards those who follow His guidance and laws.
orig: ولقد آتينا بني إسرائيل الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على العالمين

translation: And We gave them clear proofs of the Command. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them, out of injustice among themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse highlights that differences and disputes often arise among people due to ignorance and injustice, despite the clear signs and guidance provided to them. It emphasizes that final judgment will be made by God on the Day of Resurrection regarding these differences, underscoring the importance of seeking knowledge and acting justly in resolving disputes.
orig: وآتيناهم بينات من الأمر فما اختلفوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم إن ربك يقضي بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Then We put you on a right course of command so follow it, and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to adhere to the straight path of guidance provided by Allah, as revealed through the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), and not to follow the whims and desires of those who lack knowledge and understanding of the divine guidance. It emphasizes the importance of following the teachings of Islam with sincerity and steadfastness, rather than being swayed by misguided opinions or worldly temptations.
orig: ثم جعلناك على شريعة من الأمر فاتبعها ولا تتبع أهواء الذين لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, they will never avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but Allah is the protector of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse conveys that no matter how much support or alliance the wrongdoers have among themselves, it will ultimately hold no power or benefit against the will of Allah. Those who unjustly oppress or harm others may find temporary support and comfort in each other's company, but their alliances will not prevail in the divine judgment. The verse emphasizes the ultimate protection and guardianship granted by Allah to the righteous and the pious, implying those who maintain a connection with God through righteousness will find true security and guidance through divine support.
orig: إنهم لن يغنوا عنك من الله شيئا وإن الظالمين بعضهم أولياء بعض والله ولي المتقين

translation: This is enlightenment for mankind and guidance and mercy for people who are certain [in faith].
