interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an serves as a source of guidance and mercy for those who have firm faith and certainty in their belief. It is a light that brings enlightenment to humanity and serves as a path to righteousness and compassion.
orig: هذا بصائر للناس وهدى ورحمة لقوم يوقنون

translation: Or do those who commit evils think We will make them like those who have believed and done righteous deeds - [make them] equal in their life and their death? Evil is that which they judge.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that those who commit evil deeds should not assume that their status will be the same as those who believe in God and do good deeds. The verse highlights that there will be consequences for one's actions, and individuals will be judged based on their deeds in this world and in the afterlife. It warns against the false assumption that one's bad deeds will have no repercussions or that they will be equal to the deeds of the righteous individuals. Ultimately, the verse emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous actions in determining one's fate.
orig: أم حسب الذين اجترحوا السيئات أن نجعلهم كالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سواء محياهم ومماتهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth, and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine justice of Allah, stating that He created the universe with truth and fairness. It also highlights the concept of accountability, suggesting that every individual will be rewarded or punished according to their own deeds on the Day of Judgment. Ultimately, it reaffirms the belief in a just and merciful God who does not wrong anyone.
orig: وخلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق ولتجزى كل نفس بما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and Allah has sent him astray due to knowledge and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after Allah? Then will you not be reminded?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the danger of following one's own desires instead of guidance from Allah. It warns against allowing one's desires to become a priority above the teachings and guidance of Allah. The verse highlights that such a person will be led astray by their own whims and desires, and will be deprived of true understanding and clarity. It is a call to reflect on the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and not letting personal desires cloud one's judgment and lead them away from the right path.
orig: أفرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه وأضله الله على علم وختم على سمعه وقلبه وجعل على بصره غشاوة فمن يهديه من بعد الله أفلا تذكرون

translation: And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have no knowledge of that; they are only assuming.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mindset of those who only focus on this worldly life and deny the Hereafter. They believe that life is limited to this world, where they are born, live, and die, attributing all events to time and luck. However, they lack true knowledge and understanding of the reality and purpose of life, being guided only by baseless assumptions and conjecture.
orig: وقالوا ما هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما يهلكنا إلا الدهر وما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يظنون

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, 'Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes how stubborn some people are in rejecting the truth. Even when clear signs and proofs are presented to them, they dismiss them by asking for the return of their forefathers, as a way to avoid accepting the message conveyed to them. It highlights the importance of recognizing and accepting the truth when it is presented, rather than making excuses and clinging to the ways of the past.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات ما كان حجتهم إلا أن قالوا ائتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "Allah gives you life, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most of the people do not know."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power of Allah over life and death. It reminds us that ultimately, we will all be gathered on the Day of Resurrection, without any doubt. However, the verse also highlights the ignorance of many people regarding the reality of the Hereafter and the Day of Judgment.
orig: قل الله يحييكم ثم يميتكم ثم يجمعكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and the Day the Hour appears - that Day will lose the falsifiers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate sovereignty and power of Allah over all creation, emphasizing that on the Day of Judgment, those who have been deceitful and have spread falsehood will face loss and disappointment. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and justice that will prevail on the Day of Judgment for those who indulge in dishonesty and deception.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يخسر المبطلون

translation: And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], 'Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, every individual and every nation will be called to account for their actions. It highlights the ultimate justice of God, as each person will be recompensed accordingly for their deeds, whether good or bad. It serves as a warning to humanity to be conscious of their actions and to strive towards righteousness in order to receive a positive outcome in the Hereafter.
orig: وترى كل أمة جاثية كل أمة تدعى إلى كتابها اليوم تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

translation: This is Our Book; it speaks with truth about you. We have been recording whatever you have been doing.”
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the Qu'ran as a book of truth which bears witness to the actions of individuals. It serves as a reminder that all deeds and actions are being recorded and accounted for, highlighting the belief in divine accountability and justice.
orig: هذا كتابنا ينطق عليكم بالحق إنا كنا نستنسخ ما كنتم تعملون

translation: So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the clear attainment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to admit those who have faith in Him and perform good deeds into His mercy. It emphasizes that the ultimate success lies in achieving the mercy of the Lord, which is the clearest form of attainment and the ultimate goal for a believer.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيدخلهم ربهم في رحمته ذلك هو الفوز المبين

translation: And as for those who disbelieved, did My signs not come to you? But you were arrogant and were a criminal people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of disbelief and arrogance towards the signs of Allah. It indicates that the disbelievers were shown clear signs from Allah but chose to ignore them due to their arrogance and wrongdoing, leading them towards a path of denial and transgression against the truth.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا أفلم تكن آياتي تتلى عليكم فاستكبرتم وكنتم قوما مجرمين

translation: And when it is said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour - there is no doubt about it,' you say, 'We do not know what the Hour is; we are only assuming and are not convinced.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of some people to doubt the Day of Judgment despite the clear promise of Allah. It emphasizes the importance of having faith in the unseen and the inevitability of the Hour. It serves as a reminder to believers to trust in Allah's promises and stay steadfast in their faith, rather than relying on mere assumptions.
orig: وإذا قيل إن وعد الله حق والساعة لا ريب فيها قلتم ما ندري ما الساعة إن نظن إلا ظنا وما نحن بمستيقنين

translation: And the evil consequences of what they did appeared to them, and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of consequences in Islam. It emphasizes that individuals will face the repercussions of their actions, even if they initially mocked or belittled the idea of being accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder that one's actions have real and tangible effects, and one must be aware of the consequences that may come as a result of their choices.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And it will be said, 'Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning that those who forget or neglect their meeting with Allah in this life will face abandonment in the Hereafter. It underscores the importance of remembering and being mindful of one's obligations towards Allah to avoid being abandoned and facing the consequences of being distanced from His mercy and assistance.
orig: وقيل اليوم ننساكم كما نسيتم لقاء يومكم هذا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: That is because you took the verses of Allah in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So today they will not be taken out of it, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who mock the signs of Allah and are deceived by the temporary pleasures of this world will eventually face consequences in the Hereafter. They will not be able to escape their fate and will not be given the opportunity to seek forgiveness.
orig: ذلكم بأنكم اتخذتم آيات الله هزوا وغرتكم الحياة الدنيا فاليوم لا يخرجون منها ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: So to Allah belongs [all] praise, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute praise and gratitude that are due to Allah, the Creator and Sustainer of all that exists. By acknowledging Him as the Lord of the heavens, the earth, and all the worlds, we are reminded of His ultimate power, authority, and dominion over everything in existence. It serves as a reminder for believers to worship and submit to Allah wholeheartedly, recognizing His unparalleled greatness and sovereignty.
orig: فلله الحمد رب السماوات ورب الأرض رب العالمين

translation: And to Him belongs grandeur in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms the greatness and supremacy of Allah in the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that Allah is the Most Powerful and the Most Wise, underscoring His unmatched authority and wisdom in all matters.
orig: وله الكبرياء في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: Ha-Mim.
interpretation: This is the abbreviation of two separated letters that appear at the beginning of some chapters in the Qur'an. The exact meaning or significance is not definitively known, but these letters serve as a reminder of the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and its divine origin. It is a mystery that invites reflection and contemplation, emphasizing the unique, precise, and powerful nature of the Qur'anic revelation.
orig: حم

translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that the Qur'an is a divine revelation from Allah, who is described as the Most Powerful and the Most Wise. It highlights the importance and authority of the Qur'an as a source of guidance and wisdom for humanity.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything between them except in truth and for an appointed term. But those who disbelieve turn away from what they have been warned about.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the purposeful creation of the heavens and the earth by Allah with truth and wisdom. It also highlights that there is a predetermined term for this existence, and those who reject the signs and warnings presented to them willfully turn away from the truth of the message.
orig: ما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى والذين كفروا عما أنذروا معرضون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered what you invoke apart from Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth; or do they have a partnership in the heavens? Bring me a scripture prior to this one, or some trace of knowledge, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse is a call to the polytheists to reflect upon the idols they worship instead of Allah. It challenges them to provide evidence of the power of these idols by showing any part in creation or knowledge they possess. The verse emphasizes the uniqueness of Allah as the sole creator and possessor of knowledge, questioning the legitimacy of associating partners with Him.
orig: قل أرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله أروني ماذا خلقوا من الأرض أم لهم شرك في السماوات ائتوني بكتاب من قبل هذا أو أثارة من علم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allah those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they, of their invocation, are unaware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the misguidance of those who call upon others besides Allah, such as idols or other false deities, who have no power to answer their prayers. It emphasizes the futility and ignorance of such actions, pointing out that only Allah has the ability to respond to prayers, and those who seek help from others are misguided and unaware of the truth.
orig: ومن أضل ممن يدعو من دون الله من لا يستجيب له إلى يوم القيامة وهم عن دعائهم غافلون

translation: And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were enemies] will be for them [as enemies], and they will be disbelievers in their worship.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene on the Day of Judgment when disbelievers will realize that those whom they took as enemies in the world will turn out to be their adversaries. It highlights the ultimate truth of the Day of Resurrection, where each individual's actions and relationships will be laid bare, and the disbelievers will regret their rejection of true faith and worship.
orig: وإذا حشر الناس كانوا لهم أعداء وكانوا بعبادتهم كافرين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to the truth when it has come to them, 'This is obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how even when clear signs and verses from the Qur'an are presented to the disbelievers, they choose to attribute it to magic or some form of trickery rather than acknowledging the truth and guidance within the verses.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم هذا سحر مبين

translation: Or do they say: 'He has invented it'? Say: 'If I have invented it, you will not possess for me the power to defend me against Allah. He knows best what you are divulging concerning this. Sufficient is He as a witness between me and you; and He is indeed the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the accusation of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) inventing the Qur'an. The verse asserts that even if the Prophet were to invent the Qur'an, those who accuse him would not have the power to protect him from Allah. It highlights that Allah is fully aware of what is being said and done by the disbelievers. The verse emphasizes that Allah alone is the ultimate witness between the Prophet and his accusers, and that Allah's forgiveness and mercy are vast and encompassing.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل إن افتريته فلا تملكون لي من الله شيئا هو أعلم بما تفيضون فيه كفى به شهيدا بيني وبينكم وهو الغفور الرحيم

translation: Say, 'I am not the first of the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I follow only what is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humility and obedience of the messenger of Allah (Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him). He acknowledges that he is not the first messenger and does not have knowledge of the unseen. He states that he only conveys the message revealed to him by Allah, and his role is solely to warn and guide people. This verse highlights the role of prophets and messengers as conveyors of divine guidance, acting in submission to the will of Allah.
orig: قل ما كنت بدعا من الرسل وما أدري ما يفعل بي ولا بكم إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي وما أنا إلا نذير مبين

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if the Qur'an was from Allah, and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar and believed while you were arrogant?' Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of humility and sincerity in accepting the truth. It questions the arrogance of those who reject the truth, even when others, like the Children of Israel, have recognized and believed in similar revelations. The verse emphasizes that arrogance and wrongdoing hinder guidance from Allah, emphasizing the significance of humility and openness to accepting the truth.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن كان من عند الله وكفرتم به وشهد شاهد من بني إسرائيل على مثله فآمن واستكبرتم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it.' And when they are not guided by it, they will say, 'This is an ancient falsehood.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and dismissiveness of the disbelievers towards the believers. They question the goodness of what the believers follow, claiming that if it were truly good, they would have followed it first. However, when they fail to find guidance in it, they dismiss it as an old fabrication out of stubbornness and ignorance.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا لو كان خيرا ما سبقونا إليه وإذ لم يهتدوا به فسيقولون هذا إفك قديم

translation: And before it was the Scripture of Moses as a guide and mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse speaks about how the Quran confirms the previous scriptures and reiterates the message of guidance and mercy for humanity. It is in clear Arabic language so that people can understand its warnings for those who commit wrongdoings and its glad tidings for those who do good deeds.
orig: ومن قبله كتاب موسى إماما ورحمة وهذا كتاب مصدق لسانا عربيا لينذر الذين ظلموا وبشرى للمحسنين

translation: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is Allah' and then remain steadfast - the angels will descend upon them [saying], 'Do not fear and do not grieve.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of both declaring faith in Allah and being steadfast in one's belief. It assures believers that when they maintain their faith and remain steadfast, they will receive divine support and protection from fear and sadness. It highlights the significance of perseverance in faith and trust in Allah's promise of guidance and support.
orig: إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse mentions the companions of Paradise, who will reside there forever as a reward for their righteous deeds in the worldly life. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and recompense based on one's actions and intentions. It serves as a reminder of the eternal bliss and reward that await those who strive for goodness and righteousness.
orig: أولئك أصحاب الجنة خالدين فيها جزاء بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to his parents. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. [He grows] until, when he reaches maturity and reaches [the age of] forty years, he says, 'My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to work righteousness of which You will approve and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing kindness and gratitude to parents, acknowledging the hardships they endured for our upbringing. It also highlights the significance of repentance, righteousness, and seeking guidance for oneself and future generations.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه إحسانا حملته أمه كرها ووضعته كرها وحمله وفصاله ثلاثون شهرا حتى إذا بلغ أشده وبلغ أربعين سنة قال رب أوزعني أن أشكر نعمتك التي أنعمت علي وعلى والدي وأن أعمل صالحا ترضاه وأصلح لي في ذريتي إني تبت إليك وإني من المسلمين

translation: Those will have their reward according to the best of what they have done, and We will add for them from their deeds of the worst of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that those who do good deeds will be rewarded according to the best of their actions, and God will forgive them for their bad deeds. It signifies the importance of performing good deeds and the mercy and forgiveness of God for those who sincerely repent and strive to improve themselves.
orig: أولئك الذين نتقبل عنهم أحسن ما عملوا ونتجاوز عن سيئاتهم في أصحاب الجنة وعد الصدق الذي كانوا يوعدون

translation: And [mention] the one who said to his parents, 'Fie upon you! Do you promise me that I will be resurrected, when generations have passed before me [without resurrection]' while they call for Allah's help [and say], 'Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth.' But he says, 'This is not but legends of the former people.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the arrogance and disbelief of a person who questioned the idea of resurrection, despite the signs and assurances of Allah's promise. This individual rejected the concept of being brought back to life after death, considering it to be nothing more than myths and tales of the past. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of belief in the promise of resurrection and the truth of Allah's words, even when faced with doubt or skepticism.
orig: والذي قال لوالديه أف لكما أتعدانني أن أخرج وقد خلت القرون من قبلي وهما يستغيثان الله ويلك آمن إن وعد الله حق فيقول ما هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: Those are the ones upon whom the word has come into effect, [who will be] nations of jinn and men that have passed away before them. Indeed, they [all] were losers.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the consequences that befell those who rejected the truth and chose to remain in disobedience. It emphasizes that they will be joined with earlier nations of jinn and men who also faced destruction due to their transgressions. The verse serves as a warning to those who choose to reject the guidance of Allah, ultimately leading to loss and ruin.
orig: أولئك الذين حق عليهم القول في أمم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والإنس إنهم كانوا خاسرين

translation: And for all [people] are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and He will fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that every individual will receive a just recompense for their actions, with varying degrees of rewards or punishments. It highlights the fairness and justice of Allah, who will ensure that everyone is fully compensated for their deeds without any form of injustice.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وليوفيهم أعمالهم وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And [mention] the Day when those who disbelieved will be presented to the Fire, [and it will be said], 'You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient.'
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when those who rejected the faith will face the consequences of their actions. They will be confronted with the reality that they indulged in worldly pleasures without acknowledging the truth and authority of God, leading to their arrogance and disobedience. Their punishment will be a result of their audacious behavior and defiance towards God's commands during their lives.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أذهبتم طيباتكم في حياتكم الدنيا واستمتعتم بها فاليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تستكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تفسقون

translation: And mention the brother of 'Aad, when he warned his people in the [region of] al-Ahqaf - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], 'Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of warning people and calling them to worship only Allah. The reference to the brother of 'Aad highlights the duty of believers to convey the message of monotheism and warn against idolatry. It reminds us of the consequences of rejecting this message, which may lead to severe punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: واذكر أخا عاد إذ أنذر قومه بالأحقاف وقد خلت النذر من بين يديه ومن خلفه ألا تعبدوا إلا الله إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: They said, 'Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers worshiping, so that you two may have greatness in the land? We will never believe in you.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the resistance and skepticism of those who were called to abandon the worship of false gods and turn to the one true God. It reflects a common reaction of people who are reluctant to change their beliefs and traditions, even when presented with clear evidence and honest intentions. It shows how some may prioritize worldly status and pride over the truth and submission to the teachings of Islam.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لتأفكنا عن آلهتنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said, 'Knowledge is only with Allah, but I will convey to you what I was sent with.' But I see you a people behaving ignorantly.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of knowledge being with Allah and that prophets are messengers sent to convey that knowledge to people. The verse also points out the ignorance and heedless attitude of some people towards the message of truth.
orig: قال إنما العلم عند الله وأبلغكم ما أرسلت به ولكني أراكم قوما تجهلون

translation: So when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, 'This is a cloud bringing us rain!' Rather, it is what you were impatient for: a wind in which is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an speaks about people mistaking a coming punishment for a blessing. It warns against the shortsightedness of individuals who fail to recognize divine signs and consequences, mistaking them for mere natural occurrences. The verse serves as a reminder to be mindful of our actions and intentions, as they may lead to unforeseen consequences and punishments.
orig: فلما رأوه عارضا مستقبل أوديتهم قالوا هذا عارض ممطرنا بل هو ما استعجلتم به ريح فيها عذاب أليم

translation: Everything is destroyed by the command of its Lord, so they became only [the ruins of] their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of God over all things. It serves as a warning and a reminder to those who commit crimes and wrongdoings, that ultimately they will face consequences for their actions. It emphasizes that nothing can withstand the will of God and that justice will prevail for those who transgress the limits set by Him.
orig: تدمر كل شيء بأمر ربها فأصبحوا لا يرى إلا مساكنهم كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: And We have certainly given them power such as We have not given you, and We have endowed them with hearing and vision and hearts. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not from anything [of the punishment] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of Allah; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse highlights that some people are given material power and abilities by Allah, such as hearing, vision, and understanding, yet these worldly skills are of no avail if they choose to reject the signs and guidance of Allah. Essentially, it emphasizes that true success lies in accepting and following the teachings of Allah, rather than relying solely on worldly abilities and achievements.
orig: ولقد مكناهم فيما إن مكناكم فيه وجعلنا لهم سمعا وأبصارا وأفئدة فما أغنى عنهم سمعهم ولا أبصارهم ولا أفئدتهم من شيء إذ كانوا يجحدون بآيات الله وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].
interpretation: This verse highlights the historical events of previous nations, emphasizing their destruction due to their disbelief. It also emphasizes that Allah has provided various signs and proofs to guide people back to the right path, highlighting the importance of reflection and repentance.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا ما حولكم من القرى وصرفنا الآيات لعلهم يرجعون

translation: So why have those they took besides Allah as deities not aided them? But they have strayed from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of worshipping false deities and idols instead of Allah. It questions why these false gods the disbelievers turned to for help did not come to their aid, emphasizing that they have deviated from the truth. The verse condemns the fabrications and falsehoods of those who substitute the worship of Allah with idols.
orig: فلولا نصرهم الذين اتخذوا من دون الله قربانا آلهة بل ضلوا عنهم وذلك إفكهم وما كانوا يفترون

translation: And [mention] when We directed toward you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, 'Listen attentively.' And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.
interpretation: This verse highlights the attentive and observant nature of some jinn towards the recitation of the Qur'an. It underscores the importance of listening to the Qur'an with focus and reflection. These jinn then returned to their kind as admonishers, conveying the message they heard to their community, showcasing the universality of the message of the Qur'an even reaching realms beyond the human world.
orig: وإذ صرفنا إليك نفرا من الجن يستمعون القرآن فلما حضروه قالوا أنصتوا فلما قضي ولوا إلى قومهم منذرين

translation: They said, 'O our people, indeed we have heard a Book revealed after Moses confirming what came before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the acceptance and recognition of the message brought by the new Scripture revealed after Prophet Moses. It signifies the importance of recognizing and following the guidance contained in divine revelations, as they lead towards truth and righteousness.
orig: قالوا يا قومنا إنا سمعنا كتابا أنزل من بعد موسى مصدقا لما بين يديه يهدي إلى الحق وإلى طريق مستقيم

translation: O our people, respond to the caller of Allah and believe in Him; He will forgive you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse urges people to heed the call of Allah and have faith in Him. By responding to this call and believing in Allah, individuals will be granted forgiveness for their sins and saved from a severe punishment in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of heeding the message of Allah and having faith in Him in order to attain mercy and protection from harm.
orig: يا قومنا أجيبوا داعي الله وآمنوا به يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويجركم من عذاب أليم

translation: And whoever does not respond to the caller of Allah will not cause failure upon the earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of responding to the call of Allah and following His guidance. It highlights that those who do not heed the call of Allah will not be able to harm Him in any way, and they will be left without any protectors or allies. Such individuals are described as being clearly misguided and in error for rejecting the guidance of Allah.
orig: ومن لا يجب داعي الله فليس بمعجز في الأرض وليس له من دونه أولياء أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and did not tire in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes, indeed, He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and capability of Allah. It highlights the greatness of the Creator and serves as a reminder to all that if Allah has the power to create the heavens and the earth with such intricacy and perfection, then surely He has the power to resurrect the dead. It reinforces the concept of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah) and affirms the belief in the Day of Judgment.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض ولم يعي بخلقهن بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى بلى إنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And [mention] the Day when those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire. [They will be asked], 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He will say, 'Then taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will be faced with the reality of the Fire. They will acknowledge the truth at that moment but it will be too late, and they will be made to taste the punishment due to their persistent disbelief.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: So be patient, as were those of determination among the messengers, and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and perseverance, highlighting the behavior of the determined messengers who remained steadfast despite difficulties. It cautions against hastiness and reminds that the promised reckoning will come suddenly, making the worldly life seem short in retrospect. It questions whether only the defiantly disobedient people will face destruction in the afterlife, underscoring the themes of patience, accountability, and consequences of one's actions.
orig: فاصبر كما صبر أولو العزم من الرسل ولا تستعجل لهم كأنهم يوم يرون ما يوعدون لم يلبثوا إلا ساعة من نهار بلاغ فهل يهلك إلا القوم الفاسقون

translation: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - He will waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who reject the truth and prevent others from following the path of Allah will find their righteous deeds rendered void. It underscores the importance of not only believing in the teachings of Islam but also actively encouraging and supporting others to uphold those principles. The verse serves as a warning against hypocrisy and the consequences of obstructing the guidance of Allah from reaching others.
orig: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله أضل أعمالهم

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been revealed to Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of true faith, righteous deeds, and belief in the revelation sent to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It assures believers that by following these principles, Allah will forgive their sins and improve their state of being.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وآمنوا بما نزل على محمد وهو الحق من ربهم كفر عنهم سيئاتهم وأصلح بالهم

translation: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus Allah presents to the people their comparisons.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the consequential contrast between those who choose to reject the truth and those who choose to embrace it. It signifies that those who turn away from faith and follow falsehood will be misguided, while those who believe and follow the truth from their Lord will be guided. Allah uses these examples to demonstrate to humanity the outcomes of their choices and actions.
orig: ذلك بأن الذين كفروا اتبعوا الباطل وأن الذين آمنوا اتبعوا الحق من ربهم كذلك يضرب الله للناس أمثالهم

translation: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allah - never will He waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the conduct in battle against disbelievers and the rules of engagement. It outlines the permissibility and regulations surrounding self-defense and warfare in Islam. It emphasizes the principle of restraint and mercy even in the midst of confrontation, and the purpose of these trials is to distinguish the believers and to test their faith and actions. Those who fight and die in defense of the truth will not lose their reward in the sight of Allah.
orig: فإذا لقيتم الذين كفروا فضرب الرقاب حتى إذا أثخنتموهم فشدوا الوثاق فإما منا بعد وإما فداء حتى تضع الحرب أوزارها ذلك ولو يشاء الله لانتصر منهم ولكن ليبلو بعضكم ببعض والذين قتلوا في سبيل الله فلن يضل أعمالهم

translation: He will guide them and improve their condition.
interpretation: This verse highlights that God is the ultimate guide and has the power to lead individuals onto the right path and rectify their affairs. It signifies that God's guidance is not only about spiritual enlightenment but also about improving one's overall state, whether it be physical, mental, or emotional. Believers can find solace in the fact that God is not only guiding them but also working to better their circumstances.
orig: سيهديهم ويصلح بالهم

translation: And He will admit them to Paradise which He has made known to them.
interpretation: This verse expresses the promise of Allah to admit the believers into Paradise, a place that Allah has made known to them through guidance and scriptures. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate reward and destination for those who believe, obey, and worship Allah sincerely.
orig: ويدخلهم الجنة عرفها لهم

translation: O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers that by standing up for the truth and supporting Allah's cause, they will not only earn Allah's support and assistance, but they will also find steadiness and stability in their own lives. It emphasizes the importance of remaining steadfast and unwavering in faith, knowing that Allah's help is always available to those who sincerely seek it.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تنصروا الله ينصركم ويثبت أقدامكم

translation: And those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who choose to reject the belief in God and His message. It describes how those who disbelieve will face misery and their good deeds will be in vain. The verse serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and the consequences of disbelief.
orig: والذين كفروا فتعسا لهم وأضل أعمالهم

translation: That is because they disliked what Allah revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of disliking or rejecting what Allah has revealed. It signifies that those who refuse to accept the guidance from Allah will find their deeds invalidated or made void. It serves as a reminder of the importance of following and accepting the divine guidance for the success and validity of one's actions.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كرهوا ما أنزل الله فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disbelievers is something similar.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder for people to reflect on the consequences of the actions of those who lived before them. By observing the outcomes of past communities who were destroyed due to their disregard for divine guidance, individuals are encouraged to learn from history and avoid repeating the same mistakes. The mention of the disbelievers facing a similar fate serves as a warning against arrogance, disobedience, and rejection of the message of Allah.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم دمر الله عليهم وللكافرين أمثالها

translation: That is because Allah is the protector of those who have believed, and that the disbelievers have no protector.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine protection and guardianship. It highlights that Allah safeguards and supports those who have faith and believe in Him, while emphasizing that the disbelievers have no such guardian or protector. It serves as a reminder that ultimate protection and support come from having faith in Allah.
orig: ذلك بأن الله مولى الذين آمنوا وأن الكافرين لا مولى لهم

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that those who believe in Allah and perform good deeds will be rewarded with entry into paradise, where they will enjoy its abundant blessings. In contrast, those who reject faith will be left to indulge themselves in the temporary pleasures of this world, similar to how animals graze, but they will ultimately end up in Hellfire as their final abode.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار والذين كفروا يتمتعون ويأكلون كما تأكل الأنعام والنار مثوى لهم

translation: And how many a community is there that is more powerful than your community which has driven you out? We destroyed them, and there was no helper for them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the potential for even the most powerful communities to be brought to ruin by divine intervention. It serves as a reminder that no matter how strong a community may be, it is ultimately God who holds all power and control, and He can bring about the downfall of any nation if they deviate from His guidance and commit injustices.
orig: وكأين من قرية هي أشد قوة من قريتك التي أخرجتك أهلكناهم فلا ناصر لهم

translation: Is then he who is on a clear proof from his Lord like the one to whom the evil of his deeds has been made fair-seeming, and they follow their own desires?
interpretation: This verse questions the comparison between those who have clear guidance and proof from their Lord and those who are swayed by their desires and have the evil of their deeds made attractive to them. It highlights the importance of following clear guidance and evidence from God rather than being led astray by one's own desires.
orig: أفمن كان على بينة من ربه كمن زين له سوء عمله واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.
interpretation: This verse describes the description of Paradise which has been promised to the righteous believers. It illustrates a beautiful and abundant paradise with flowing rivers, milk, wine, honey, and various types of fruits. It contrasts the reward of the righteous in Paradise with the punishment of the disbelievers in Hell. It serves as a motivation for believers to strive towards righteousness and piety to attain the ultimate reward of Paradise.
orig: مثل الجنة التي وعد المتقون فيها أنهار من ماء غير آسن وأنهار من لبن لم يتغير طعمه وأنهار من خمر لذة للشاربين وأنهار من عسل مصفى ولهم فيها من كل الثمرات ومغفرة من ربهم كمن هو خالد في النار وسقوا ماء حميما فقطع أمعاءهم

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but when they leave you, they say to those who were given knowledge, 'What did he say just now?' Those are the ones upon whose hearts Allah has sealed and who have followed their [own] desires.
interpretation: This verse describes a group of people who superficially appear to be attentive to the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) but in reality, they do not internalize or ponder over his teachings. After leaving his presence, they question others about what was said, showing their lack of true interest or commitment to the message. It also speaks to the danger of following one's desires over following the guidance of Allah, as their hearts are sealed due to their disregard for the truth.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك حتى إذا خرجوا من عندك قالوا للذين أوتوا العلم ماذا قال آنفا أولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: And those who are guided will be given more guidance and increase in their piety.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that those who are already guided and follow the right path will be granted even more guidance and strength in their piety. It illustrates the concept of spiritual growth and the importance of consistently seeking guidance in order to increase one's level of piety and righteousness.
orig: والذين اهتدوا زادهم هدى وآتاهم تقواهم

translation: Do they await but for the Hour, that it should come upon them suddenly? But its signs have already come. Then how will they be reminded when it has come upon them?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the heedlessness of disbelievers who are waiting for the Day of Judgment to come as if it will take them by surprise, while in reality, the signs of the approaching Hour are already evident. It questions how they will be reminded or benefit from the warning when the Day of Judgment comes upon them unexpectedly.
orig: فهل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة فقد جاء أشراطها فأنى لهم إذا جاءتهم ذكراهم

translation: So know [O Muhammad] that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows your movement and your resting place.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the belief in the Oneness of Allah, seeking forgiveness for one's sins, and praying for the forgiveness of all believers. It also highlights that Allah is fully aware of everything we do, our actions, and our final abode.
orig: فاعلم أنه لا إله إلا الله واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات والله يعلم متقلبكم ومثواكم

translation: And those who believe say, 'Why has a surah not been sent down?' But when a precise surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is hypocrisy looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them would have been [to say]
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an discusses hypocrites who question the revelation of specific Surahs or chapters that involve rulings related to fighting. When such Surahs are revealed, the hypocrites reveal their true nature, showing signs of fear and reluctance to engage in acts of faith. This verse highlights the importance of sincerity in faith and the necessity of adhering to all aspects of the teachings of the Qur'an, even those that may seem challenging or demanding.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا لولا نزلت سورة فإذا أنزلت سورة محكمة وذكر فيها القتال رأيت الذين في قلوبهم مرض ينظرون إليك نظر المغشي عليه من الموت فأولى لهم

translation: Obey [Allah] and speak good. And when the matter [is resolved], then if they had been true to Allah, it would have been better for them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of obedience to Allah and the importance of speaking kindly and truthfully. It emphasizes that when decisions are made, it is crucial to be truthful and sincere in one's intentions towards Allah. By doing so, it leads to better outcomes and blessings.
orig: طاعة وقول معروف فإذا عزم الأمر فلو صدقوا الله لكان خيرا لهم

translation: So do you think that if you turned away, you could cause corruption on earth and break your [ties of] relationship?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the consequences of turning away from the truth and committing sins. It implies a warning that indulging in corruption and severing family ties can lead to chaos and harm on earth. It serves as a reminder to maintain good conduct and relationships in order to preserve peace and harmony in society.
orig: فهل عسيتم إن توليتم أن تفسدوا في الأرض وتقطعوا أرحامكم

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.
interpretation: This verse describes the consequences of those who have earned Allah's curse. It alludes to how their hearts and minds have been sealed off from guidance and truth, leaving them spiritually deaf and blind. This serves as a warning to the believers about the serious consequences of straying from the right path and falling into disobedience.
orig: أولئك الذين لعنهم الله فأصمهم وأعمى أبصارهم

translation: Do they not then reflect on the Qur'an, or are there locks upon their hearts?
interpretation: This verse questions the lack of reflection on the Qur'an by some individuals. It suggests that the inability to contemplate its teachings might be due to a barrier over their hearts that prevents them from understanding and benefiting from its guidance.
orig: أفلا يتدبرون القرآن أم على قلوب أقفالها

translation: Indeed, those who have reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the warning against those who, after having been guided and understood the truth, deliberately turn away from it. It indicates how Satan tempts them, prolongs false hopes for them, and eventually leads them astray.
orig: إن الذين ارتدوا على أدبارهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى الشيطان سول لهم وأملى لهم

translation: This is because they said to those who disliked what Allah has revealed, 'We will obey you in some matters.' And Allah knows their secrets.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the fact that some individuals express obedience to those who oppose the revelations of Allah, promising compliance in certain matters. However, Allah is fully aware of their hidden intentions and secrets. It serves as a reminder that Allah's knowledge encompasses all aspects, including what is concealed within the hearts of people.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا للذين كرهوا ما نزل الله سنطيعكم في بعض الأمر والله يعلم إسرارهم

translation: So how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
interpretation: This verse describes the moment of death for the disbelievers, highlighting the intense fear and punishment they will experience when the angels of death seize their souls. The mention of striking their faces and backs signifies the severity and terror of this moment, as they will be overwhelmed by regret and dread for what awaits them in the afterlife due to their disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: فكيف إذا توفتهم الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم

translation: That is because they followed what angered Allah and disliked His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who choose to disobey Allah and actively go against His teachings. By following actions and attitudes that displease Allah and neglecting to seek His approval, their deeds hold no value and are ultimately futile. It serves as a reminder of the importance of following the righteous path and seeking the pleasure of Allah in all aspects of life.
orig: ذلك بأنهم اتبعوا ما أسخط الله وكرهوا رضوانه فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?
interpretation: This verse challenges those who harbor ill feelings or hatred in their hearts, reminding them that Allah knows what lies within their hearts and that nothing is hidden from Him. It serves as a warning to purify one's heart from negative emotions and to be sincere in their faith and actions, as Allah is aware of the true intentions of every individual.
orig: أم حسب الذين في قلوبهم مرض أن لن يخرج الله أضغانهم

translation: And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And Allah knows your deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that one's true identity and character are not merely based on their outward appearance or physical features, but rather on their speech and actions. Allah has placed significance on the importance of character and deeds over superficial traits. It serves as a reminder that true judgment of individuals should be based on their behavior and the way they communicate, rather than just their external appearances.
orig: ولو نشاء لأريناكهم فلعرفتهم بسيماهم ولتعرفنهم في لحن القول والله يعلم أعمالكم

translation: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of trials and tests in life. It emphasizes that humans will face challenges and adversities to distinguish between those who strive sincerely for the cause of Allah and exhibit patience in the face of difficulties, and those whose faith may waver. It also underscores the importance of being steadfast in faith and patience during trials as a means of proving one's dedication to Allah.
orig: ولنبلونكم حتى نعلم المجاهدين منكم والصابرين ونبلو أخباركم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them - never will they harm Allah at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who consciously choose to disbelieve in Allah, turn people away from the path of righteousness, and oppose the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) after having received clear guidance, will ultimately not be able to harm Allah in any way. Their actions and deeds will be in vain, as Allah is aware of their intentions and will render them fruitless.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله وشاقوا الرسول من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى لن يضروا الله شيئا وسيحبط أعمالهم

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of obedience to both Allah and His Messenger. It serves as a reminder to the believers to follow the guidance provided by Allah and His Messenger, as disobedience can nullify their good deeds. It highlights the significance of aligning one's actions with the teachings of Islam, both in terms of faith and practice.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول ولا تبطلوا أعمالكم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and then die while they are disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who reject the faith and actively prevent others from following the path of Allah. It emphasizes that those who die in a state of disbelief, despite opportunities for guidance, will not be forgiven by Allah. It highlights the severity of denying the truth and intentionally obstructing others from righteousness.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله ثم ماتوا وهم كفار فلن يغفر الله لهم

translation: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allah is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward for] your deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of standing firm and not showing weakness in situations of conflict. It highlights that seeking peace does not mean compromising one's principles or giving up one's advantage. It reassures believers that Allah is with them as long as they stay committed to their cause and deeds, and that their efforts will not be in vain.
orig: فلا تهنوا وتدعوا إلى السلم وأنتم الأعلون والله معكم ولن يتركم أعمالكم

translation: Indeed, the worldly life is nothing but play and amusement. But if you believe and fear God, He will reward you, and He will not ask you for your wealth.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that the possessions and pleasures of this world are transient and fleeting, and should not distract them from their faith and devotion to God. If one maintains faith and righteousness, their true reward will come from God in the Hereafter, and ultimately it is one's deeds and piety, not material wealth, that will be of importance.
orig: إنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وإن تؤمنوا وتتقوا يؤتكم أجوركم ولا يسألكم أموالكم

translation: If he asks you for it and presses you, you will become tight-fisted; and it will bring forth what is in your hearts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that when someone is asked to give in charity or contribute towards a noble cause, they may initially hesitate or be reluctant. However, if the request is persistent, it will reveal the true nature of their hearts and whether they are truly willing to give generously or not.
orig: إن يسألكموها فيحفكم تبخلوا ويخرج أضغانكم

translation: Here you are - those who are called upon to spend in the cause of Allah - but among you are some who withhold [stingily]. And whoever withholds only withholds from himself. But Allah is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that when believers are called upon to spend in the way of Allah, some may hold back and be stingy in giving. However, the act of withholding is ultimately to the detriment of the individual doing so, not diminishing anything from Allah's wealth. Allah is self-sufficient and does not benefit from our wealth. The verse emphasizes the importance of generosity and selflessness in giving for the sake of Allah, and warns that if one group of people fails to fulfill this duty, Allah can replace them with others who will be more deserving of His blessings and guidance.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء تدعون لتنفقوا في سبيل الله فمنكم من يبخل ومن يبخل فإنما يبخل عن نفسه والله الغني وأنتم الفقراء وإن تتولوا يستبدل قوما غيركم ثم لا يكونوا أمثالكم

translation: Verily, We have granted you a manifest victory.
interpretation: This verse reassures Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that a clear victory has been decreed for him. It signifies the conquest of Makkah, but also symbolizes the spread of Islam and the triumph of truth over falsehood. It serves as a reminder that ultimate success comes from Allah's support and guidance.
orig: إنا فتحنا لك فتحا مبينا

translation: May Allah forgive you for your past and future sins, complete His favor upon you, and guide you to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication asking Allah for forgiveness for all past and future sins, and for His blessings to be completed upon the believer. It also requests Allah to guide the believer on the right path, showing the importance of seeking forgiveness, seeking guidance, and asking for Allah's continuous blessings in one's life.
orig: ليغفر لك الله ما تقدم من ذنبك وما تأخر ويتم نعمته عليك ويهديك صراطا مستقيما

translation: And Allah will aid you with a mighty victory.
interpretation: This verse conveys a message of hope and encouragement to the believers, assuring them that Allah will provide them with powerful support and assistance, leading to a glorious triumph. It emphasizes that victory comes from Allah's decree, and believers should have faith in His help and remain steadfast in their beliefs and actions.
orig: وينصرك الله نصرا عزيزا

translation: It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers, that they may increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah is the one who grants serenity and peace to the hearts of the believers, enabling them to strengthen their faith. It also emphasizes that the entire creation and all the forces in the heavens and the earth belong to Allah, who is All-Knowing and Wise. The tranquility and assurance that Allah provides to the believers serve to increase their faith and trust in Him, enabling them to navigate life's challenges with composure and certainty.
orig: هو الذي أنزل السكينة في قلوب المؤمنين ليزدادوا إيمانا مع إيمانهم ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: So that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally and He will remove from them their misdeeds - and that is, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment -
interpretation: This verse describes the great reward that awaits the believing men and women in paradise. They will dwell in gardens with flowing rivers, where they will reside forever. Allah will forgive their sins and grant them a grand success. It highlights the mercy, forgiveness, and eternal bliss that Allah promises to those who believe and do righteous deeds.
orig: ليدخل المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ويكفر عنهم سيئاتهم وكان ذلك عند الله فوزا عظيما

translation: And [He will] punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allah an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature, and Allah has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who engage in hypocrisy and polytheism, and harbor negative assumptions about Allah, will face severe punishment. It highlights the seriousness of holding negative beliefs about Allah and the consequences of deviating from faith. Additionally, it serves as a warning against hypocrisy and polytheism, stressing that such actions will lead to a dreadful fate in Hell.
orig: ويعذب المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات الظانين بالله ظن السوء عليهم دائرة السوء وغضب الله عليهم ولعنهم وأعد لهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah, emphasizing that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him, and that He is all-powerful and all-wise. It serves as a reminder of the greatness and sovereignty of Allah over all creation.
orig: ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: Verily, We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of glad tidings, and a warner.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges the Prophet Muhammad's role as a witness to the message of Islam, someone who brings good news to those who follow the message, and also as a warner to those who reject it. It highlights the Prophet's crucial role in delivering the message of Islam and guiding people towards righteousness.
orig: إنا أرسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا

translation: So that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, support him, respect him, and exalt Him morning and evening.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having faith in Allah and His Messenger, supporting and honoring the Prophet Muhammad, and remembering and praising Allah regularly. It highlights the essential elements of faith, obedience, and reverence in Islam.
orig: لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتعزروه وتوقروه وتسبحوه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to his own detriment. But he who fulfills that which he has promised to Allah - He will give him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling promises and commitments made to Allah and His Messenger. It teaches that faithfulness and loyalty to the pledge made to Allah bring great rewards, while breaking such promises only harms oneself. It also highlights the concept of divine protection and guidance by stating that the hand of Allah is above their hands, indicating His support for those who are sincere and true in their commitments.
orig: إن الذين يبايعونك إنما يبايعون الله يد الله فوق أيديهم فمن نكث فإنما ينكث على نفسه ومن أوفى بما عاهد عليه الله فسيؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: Those who stayed behind will say when you set forth to take the spoils, 'Let us follow you,' desiring to change God's word. Say, 'You shall not follow us; God has said this beforehand.' So they will say, 'Nay, you are jealous of us.' In fact, they understand very little. Say, 'Whether you flee from death or from being killed, what difference will it make? In the end, you will receive contempt instead of respect.' Say, 'Who can protect you against God if He intends to harm you or intends to extend His mercy to you?' They will find no protector or helper besides God. God knows everything you do.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the hypocrites among the Arabs who made excuses to stay behind from participating in battles or expeditions but still wanted to gain benefits from the spoils of war. The verse refutes their false claims of loyalty and warns them that they cannot escape God's will, whether it brings harm or benefit. It emphasizes that ultimately, God is fully aware of their intentions and actions, and they will find no refuge or support outside of His decree.
orig: سيقول لك المخلفون من الأعراب شغلتنا أموالنا وأهلونا فاستغفر لنا يقولون بألسنتهم ما ليس في قلوبهم قل فمن يملك لكم من الله شيئا إن أراد بكم ضرا أو أراد بكم نفعا بل كان الله بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you thought an evil thought and you were a people doomed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of avoiding negative assumptions and suspicions about the Prophet and the believers. It warns against harboring ill thoughts and misconceptions in one's heart which can lead to negative consequences. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain trust and sincerity in relationships, and not to be quick to doubt the intentions of others.
orig: بل ظننتم أن لن ينقلب الرسول والمؤمنون إلى أهليهم أبدا وزين ذلك في قلوبكم وظننتم ظن السوء وكنتم قوما بورا

translation: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and rejection of Allah and His Messenger. It emphasizes that those who do not believe will face the punishment of Hell. The verse highlights the importance of faith and warns against the rejection of divine guidance.
orig: ومن لم يؤمن بالله ورسوله فإنا أعتدنا للكافرين سعيرا

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate control and authority of Allah over all creation. It emphasizes that Allah has the power to forgive or punish as He sees fit. It is a reminder of Allah's mercy and forgiveness, while also underscoring His justice and authority to hold His creation accountable for their actions.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The hypocrites will say, when you set out towards the spoils [of war] to take them, 'Let us follow you.' They want to change the words of Allah. Say, 'You will not follow us. Thus did Allah say before.' So they will say, 'Rather, you envy us.' But [in truth] they were not understanding except a little.
interpretation: This verse addresses the hypocrites who try to deceive by expressing willingness to join in battles for the spoils of war when in reality they have ulterior motives. The verse reminds believers that the hypocrites do not comprehend the deeper meaning of faith and guidance from Allah, and instead, they try to manipulate situations for their own selfish gains. It serves as a warning against deception and insincerity in matters of faith.
orig: سيقول المخلفون إذا انطلقتم إلى مغانم لتأخذوها ذرونا نتبعكم يريدون أن يبدلوا كلام الله قل لن تتبعونا كذلكم قال الله من قبل فسيقولون بل تحسدوننا بل كانوا لا يفقهون إلا قليلا

translation: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, 'You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them or they will submit. So, if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward, but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse reminds the Bedouins who did not join in the battle that they may be called to face a formidable enemy and they have the choice to either fight or seek peace. Obedience to the call will be rewarded by Allah, but turning away will result in severe punishment. The verse serves as a warning about the consequences of neglecting duty and the importance of following through with commitments.
orig: قل للمخلفين من الأعراب ستدعون إلى قوم أولي بأس شديد تقاتلونهم أو يسلمون فإن تطيعوا يؤتكم الله أجرا حسنا وإن تتولوا كما توليتم من قبل يعذبكم عذابا أليما

translation: There is no blame upon the blind, nor is there blame upon the lame, nor is there blame upon the sick. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the mercy and compassion of Islam towards those who might have physical disabilities or illnesses. It highlights that individuals will not be judged based on their physical limitations but on their obedience to Allah and His Messenger. Those who follow the guidance of Allah and His Messenger are promised paradise with flowing rivers, while those who reject it will face severe punishment.
orig: ليس على الأعمى حرج ولا على الأعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ومن يتول يعذبه عذابا أليما

translation: Allah was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree; He knew what was in their hearts and sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with a near conquest.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an describes the event of the Pledge of Ridwan (Bay'at al-Ridwan) during the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah where the companions of the Prophet Muhammad pledged their allegiance to him under a tree. Allah was pleased with their sincerity and rewarded them with tranquility and the promise of a soon-to-come victory. The verse emphasizes the importance of purity of intention and steadfastness in faith, as well as the concept of divine approval and support for the believers who demonstrate such qualities.
orig: لقد رضي الله عن المؤمنين إذ يبايعونك تحت الشجرة فعلم ما في قلوبهم فأنزل السكينة عليهم وأثابهم فتحا قريبا

translation: And they take many acquisitions, but Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights that people may acquire many material possessions and worldly gains, but ultimately it is Allah who possesses ultimate power and wisdom. It serves as a reminder that true strength and wisdom come from Allah, and all worldly acquisitions are temporary and fleeting compared to the might and wisdom of Allah.
orig: ومغانم كثيرة يأخذونها وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: Allah has promised you much booty that you will take and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of Allah's promise of abundant rewards and victories, and how He sometimes expedites these victories for them and protects them from harm. This protection and victory serve as a sign for the believers, reinforcing their faith and guiding them towards the path of righteousness and guidance.
orig: وعدكم الله مغانم كثيرة تأخذونها فعجل لكم هذه وكف أيدي الناس عنكم ولتكون آية للمؤمنين ويهديكم صراطا مستقيما

translation: And [He created] another thing of which you have no knowledge.
interpretation: This verse highlights the vastness of Allah's knowledge and power. It emphasizes that there are aspects of creation and existence that humans may not understand or comprehend fully, but Allah, with His infinite wisdom, encompasses all things and has power over everything.
orig: وأخرى لم تقدروا عليها قد أحاط الله بها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا

translation: And if those who disbelieve fight with you, they would certainly turn their backs, then they would find neither a protector nor a helper.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that if they face aggression from those who disbelieve, eventually the disbelievers will retreat and abandon their hostilities, leaving them without any form of support or assistance. It serves as a reassurance that standing firm in the face of adversity will ultimately bring about a sense of protection and aid from Allah.
orig: ولو قاتلكم الذين كفروا لولوا الأدبار ثم لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: This is the established way of Allah which has occurred before, and you will never find in the way of Allah any change.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consistency and immutability of the divine laws and decrees set by Allah. It highlights the unchanging nature of Allah's decrees throughout history, implying that the laws of Allah are constant and unwavering. The verse serves as a reminder of the eternal and unchanging nature of Allah's guidance and divine plan.
orig: سنة الله التي قد خلت من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

translation: And it is He who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Mecca after He had given you victory over them. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse refers to how during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), Allah protected the Muslims and the disbelievers from engaging in warfare within the sacred sanctuary of Mecca, even after the Muslims had achieved victory over their enemies. It highlights Allah's wisdom and awareness of all our actions, reminding believers of the sanctity of Mecca and the importance of upholding peace and justice, even in times of conflict.
orig: وهو الذي كف أيديهم عنكم وأيديكم عنهم ببطن مكة من بعد أن أظفركم عليهم وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا

translation: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the path of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people, equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severity of preventing others from reaching Al-Masjid al-Haram and hindering the performance of religious rites there, such as the offering of sacrifices. It underscores the significance of respecting religious sites and rituals and warns against causing a disruption. The verse also warns of a painful punishment for those who engage in such misconduct, emphasizing the importance of upholding religious sanctity and respecting the rights of others to practice their faith freely.
orig: هم الذين كفروا وصدوكم عن المسجد الحرام والهدي معكوفا أن يبلغ محله ولولا رجال مؤمنون ونساء مؤمنات لم تعلموهم أن تطئوهم فتصيبكم منهم معرة بغير علم ليدخل الله في رحمته من يشاء لو تزيلوا لعذبنا الذين كفروا منهم عذابا أليما

translation: When those who disbelieved harbored disdain in their hearts – the disdain of ignorance – then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and imposed on them the word of righteousness, for they were more deserving and worthy of it. And Allah is All-Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that when disbelievers in ignorance harbor negative feelings in their hearts, Allah bestows tranquility on His Messenger and the believers. It highlights the importance of righteousness and piety, with believers being described as more deserving of adhering to these virtues. The verse signifies that Allah's knowledge encompasses all things and situations.
orig: إذ جعل الذين كفروا في قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجاهلية فأنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وألزمهم كلمة التقوى وكانوا أحق بها وأهلها وكان الله بكل شيء عليما

translation: Indeed Allah has fulfilled the vision for His Messenger in truth. You will certainly enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and hair shortened, not fearing. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near at hand.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has fulfilled the vision of His Messenger accurately, indicating that there will be a safe entry into Al-Masjid Al-Haram after shaving the heads and shortening the hair, without fear. It suggests that Allah has knowledge beyond what humans know and that there will be a soon-to-come triumph or conquest.
orig: لقد صدق الله رسوله الرؤيا بالحق لتدخلن المسجد الحرام إن شاء الله آمنين محلقين رءوسكم ومقصرين لا تخافون فعلم ما لم تعلموا فجعل من دون ذلك فتحا قريبا

translation: He is the one who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah may dislike it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate purpose and mission of the Prophets and Messengers, which is to convey the message of guidance and truth to humanity. It emphasizes that the true religion brought by the Prophets will eventually prevail over all other beliefs, despite the opposition of those who worship others besides Allah. The verse calls for believers to have faith and trust in the ultimate victory of truth and righteousness.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and those with him are severe against the disbelievers and merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating in prayer, seeking bounty from Allah and His pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers, so that Allah may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who have believed and done righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.
