translation: Or does He only have daughters and you have sons?
interpretation: This verse questions the belief of the pre-Islamic Arabs who considered daughters as a sign of disgrace and humiliation. It challenges their perception by implying that having daughters is not a cause for shame, and questions why they preferred sons over daughters as a blessing from Allah. The verse challenges the unjust societal norms that devalued daughters and emphasizes equality in the eyes of God.
orig: أم له البنات ولكم البنون

translation: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened?
interpretation: This verse questions the motives of people who expect payment or reward for spreading the message of the Qur'an. It suggests that true believers should convey the message of Islam without expecting any material gain in return, as their primary intention should be to please Allah and guide others towards the right path.
orig: أم تسألهم أجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون

translation: Or do they have the unseen, so they write [it]?
interpretation: This verse questions whether people have knowledge of the unseen that they can write down. It highlights the limited knowledge and understanding humans have compared to the vast knowledge and wisdom of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate power and knowledge of Allah over all things, including the unseen.
orig: أم عندهم الغيب فهم يكتبون

translation: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve are the object of a plan.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futile efforts of the disbelievers to plot and scheme against the believers. It serves as a reminder that no matter what schemes they devise, it is ultimately in vain as they themselves will be the ones ensnared in their own plots and deceit.
orig: أم يريدون كيدا فالذين كفروا هم المكيدون

translation: Or have they a deity other than Allah? Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of monotheism in Islam, emphasizing that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah. It also emphasizes the transcendence and exalted nature of Allah, beyond any partners or associates that people may ascribe to Him.
orig: أم لهم إله غير الله سبحان الله عما يشركون

translation: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, '[It is merely] clouds heaped up.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people fail to recognize the signs from Allah even when they are clearly evident. It emphasizes how some individuals are so entrenched in their disbelief that they make excuses or dismiss miraculous occurrences as something ordinary or explainable by natural phenomena. It serves as a reminder to be attentive to the signs of Allah and to not let our disbelief or ignorance blind us to His power and existence.
orig: وإن يروا كسفا من السماء ساقطا يقولوا سحاب مركوم

translation: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -
interpretation: This verse advises believers to be patient and leave those who oppose the truth alone until the day of judgment when they will face the consequences of their actions and be rendered unconscious by the severity of the punishment awaiting them.
orig: فذرهم حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي فيه يصعقون

translation: On the Day when their scheming will avail them nothing, and they will receive no help.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when all the plots and schemes of the disbelievers and wrongdoers will be of no use to them. No one will come to their aid or support them, and they will face the consequences of their actions alone. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, one's deceitful tactics and evil intentions will not save them from the justice of Allah on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يوم لا يغني عنهم كيدهم شيئا ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And those who have wronged will have a punishment besides that, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who commit wrongdoings will face consequences and punishment in addition to what they can see in this worldly life. However, the verse emphasizes that many wrongdoers are oblivious or unaware of the repercussions of their actions. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate justice of Allah, even if it may not be evident immediately.
orig: وإن للذين ظلموا عذابا دون ذلك ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And be patient for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [ Allah ] with praise of your Lord when you arise.
interpretation: This verse advises believers to be patient and submissive to the decree of Allah, for He sees everything and knows what is best for His servants. It also emphasizes the importance of praising and exalting Allah in gratitude and worship, especially when standing up for prayers. Overall, the verse reminds believers of the importance of patience, submission to Allah's will, and gratitude in all circumstances.
orig: واصبر لحكم ربك فإنك بأعيننا وسبح بحمد ربك حين تقوم

translation: And [in] the night, give Him praise and after the stars have faded.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of praising and worshiping Allah during the night, as well as reflecting on the fading of the stars as a reminder of the passing of time and the impermanence of worldly things. It encourages believers to remember and glorify Allah even in the darkest hours and to contemplate the beauty and order of the universe, recognizing the power and majesty of the Creator.
orig: ومن الليل فسبحه وإدبار النجوم

translation: By the star as it descends,
interpretation: This verse is referring to a star as it sets or descends. It serves as a reminder of the power and grandeur of the cosmic order established by Allah, highlighting His control over the universe and all its phenomena.
orig: والنجم إذا هوى

translation: Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
interpretation: This verse is reassuring the followers of Prophet Muhammad that he is steadfast, guided by God, and free from error or misguidance in delivering the message of Islam. It establishes the trustworthiness and reliability of the Prophet as a guide and leader for the community.
orig: ما ضل صاحبكم وما غوى

translation: And he (the Prophet) does not speak from his own desire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Prophet Muhammad does not speak based on his own whims and desires, but rather conveys the message that is revealed to him by Allah. It highlights the divine nature of his message and serves as a reminder to follow the guidance that comes from Allah, rather than following one's own desires.
orig: وما ينطق عن الهوى

translation: It is not except a revelation revealed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an, stating that it is not a human creation but rather a message revealed by Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers of the Qur'an's sacredness and authenticity.
orig: إن هو إلا وحي يوحى

translation: His knowledge is vast and powerful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unlimited and formidable nature of Allah's knowledge. It highlights the fact that His knowledge is comprehensive, profound, and unmatched, signifying His supreme wisdom and ability to encompass all things.
orig: علمه شديد القوى

translation: He is the Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He has no wife? He created all things, and He is All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness and uniqueness of Allah as the Creator of the heavens and the earth. It refutes the idea of Allah having a son, highlighting that He is far beyond human attributes such as having offspring. It asserts Allah's complete knowledge and authority over all creation.
orig: ذو مرة فاستوى

translation: And He is the highest of the highest.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the ultimate greatness and exalted nature of Allah. It highlights His supreme position above all things and His unmatched status in the universe. It serves as a reminder of the incomparable power and majesty of God.
orig: وهو بالأفق الأعلى

translation: Then he approached and descended,
interpretation: This verse describes a moment of closeness and humility, suggesting a powerful image of someone drawing near and bowing down in submission. It highlights the act of coming closer to God with humility and reverence, acknowledging His greatness and authority.
orig: ثم دنا فتدلى

translation: So he was the distance of two bow lengths or nearer.
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment during the Isra and Mi'raj, the miraculous night journey of the Prophet Muhammad. It describes how close the Prophet was to Allah during this incredible journey, emphasizing the intimate connection between the Prophet and his Creator.
orig: فكان قاب قوسين أو أدنى

translation: So He revealed to His servant whatever He revealed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine act of revelation, where Allah inspires and communicates His message to His servant (Prophet Muhammad). It reflects the profound nature of communication between the Creator and His chosen messengers, highlighting the importance of revelation in guiding humanity towards righteousness and truth.
orig: فأوحى إلى عبده ما أوحى

translation: The heart did not lie about what it saw.
interpretation: This verse highlights the sincerity and truthfulness of the heart in perceiving and recognizing the signs of Allah. It emphasizes the purity of the heart as a vessel of faith and knowledge, acknowledging that the heart, when guided by faith, can provide true insight and understanding of the world around us.
orig: ما كذب الفؤاد ما رأى

translation: Do you dispute with him concerning what he saw?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the validity of disputing or challenging someone's direct experience with what they have seen or witnessed. It encourages believers to trust in the experiences of others and not question them unnecessarily.
orig: أفتمارونه على ما يرى

translation: And he certainly saw him in another descent,
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) saw the angel Jibreel (Gabriel) in his true form during one of the moments of revelation. It highlights the magnitude of the encounter and the significance of the message being delivered to the Prophet.
orig: ولقد رآه نزلة أخرى

translation: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary,
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific location in the heavens known as the Lote Tree, which marks the boundary beyond which even the angels, including the Archangel Gabriel, cannot pass. It signifies the limitation and distinction between the created beings and the essence of Allah. This verse emphasizes the incomparable and infinite nature of Allah's dominion and the distance between His creation and His ultimate existence.
orig: عند سدرة المنتهى

translation: He has the refuge of Paradise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believer who will be granted the refuge of Paradise by God as a reward for their faith and good deeds. Paradise is described in the Qur'an as a place of eternal bliss and happiness, where the believers will be rewarded for their patience and obedience in this world.
orig: عندها جنة المأوى

translation: When the Lote tree was covered with what covered it,
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the miraculous Night Journey of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) where he ascended to the heavens and reached a point where even the Archangel Gabriel couldn’t go further. It highlights the awe and mystery of that divine experience and signifies the limits of human knowledge and understanding when faced with the majesty of God's creations.
orig: إذ يغشى السدرة ما يغشى

translation: The sight did not swerve, nor did it transgress.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of controlling one's sight and not allowing it to be led astray or look at inappropriate things. It teaches about the significance of maintaining purity and righteousness in one's actions and thoughts, including what one chooses to look at. By maintaining control over one's sight and avoiding looking at sinful or immoral things, one can strive towards a more righteous and virtuous way of living.
orig: ما زاغ البصر وما طغى

translation: He has certainly seen of the greatest signs of his Lord.
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who has witnessed the magnificent signs of Allah's creation. It highlights the importance of reflecting on the signs of God in the natural world as a means to strengthen faith and recognize the greatness and power of the Creator.
orig: لقد رأى من آيات ربه الكبرى

translation: Have you seen Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza?
interpretation: This verse questions the pagans about their belief in Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza, two idols they worshipped during the pre-Islamic era. The verse challenges them to reflect on the absurdity of their idol worship and encourages them to turn towards the worship of the one true God.
orig: أفرأيتم اللات والعزى

translation: And the third, the other
interpretation: This verse refers to the third wife of the Prophet Muhammad, Aisha, who was known for her intelligence, wisdom, and knowledge. It emphasizes her unique position among the wives of the Prophet and highlights her importance in Islamic history.
orig: ومناة الثالثة الأخرى

translation: To you belongs [your] males and to Him belongs [your] females.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of creation and ownership by God. It emphasizes that both males and females are created by God and ultimately belong to Him. It serves as a reminder that all beings are the result of God's creation and should be respected and treated with equality and justice as decreed by Him.
orig: ألكم الذكر وله الأنثى

translation: That is indeed a very great division and judgement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the profound nature of the division and judgement being spoken about. It conveys the weightiness and seriousness of the events being described, highlighting the significance of the divine judgement that is to take place.
orig: تلك إذا قسمة ضيزى

translation: Indeed, they are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of blind adherence to traditions and customs that have no basis in divine scripture or guidance. It warns against following practices based solely on assumptions and personal desires, as true guidance comes from Allah alone. It calls for reflection on the source of beliefs and practices to ensure they are rooted in authentic divine teachings rather than conjecture or personal inclinations.
orig: إن هي إلا أسماء سميتموها أنتم وآباؤكم ما أنزل الله بها من سلطان إن يتبعون إلا الظن وما تهوى الأنفس ولقد جاءهم من ربهم الهدى

translation: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
interpretation: This verse questions the mindset of human beings who assume they will not be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder that every individual will ultimately face the consequences of their deeds, whether good or bad, in the Hereafter. It highlights the importance of being mindful of one's actions and constantly seeking forgiveness and guidance from Allah.
orig: أم للإنسان ما تمنى

translation: To Allah belongs the Finality and the Beginning.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that both the end and the beginning belong to Allah. It reminds us that Allah has complete control over all aspects of existence, both in this world and in the hereafter. It emphasizes Allah's power and authority over the entire timeline of creation, from its inception to its conclusion.
orig: فلله الآخرة والأولى

translation: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allah has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the ultimate power and control of Allah. It explains that even though there are angels in the heavens who may intercede on behalf of people, ultimately it is only with Allah's permission that their intercession will be effective. This highlights the importance of seeking Allah's pleasure and approval in all matters, as He is the ultimate decider and controller of all outcomes.
orig: وكم من ملك في السماوات لا تغني شفاعتهم شيئا إلا من بعد أن يأذن الله لمن يشاء ويرضى

translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,
interpretation: This verse highlights how the disbelievers, who deny the existence of the Hereafter, mockingly assign female names to the angels as a sign of their disrespect and disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the distorted perceptions and arrogance of those who reject the idea of life after death.
orig: إن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة ليسمون الملائكة تسمية الأنثى

translation: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and clarity, rather than relying on mere assumptions and guesswork. It teaches that truth cannot be replaced or stood against by baseless assumptions. It encourages seeking knowledge and understanding from reliable sources to avoid being misled by falsehood.
orig: وما لهم به من علم إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن الظن لا يغني من الحق شيئا

translation: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires nothing but the life of this world.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the remembrance of God and His guidance over worldly desires. It warns against those who knowingly ignore or reject the teachings of the Qur'an, seeking only material gains and pleasures in this temporary worldly life. It encourages believers to stay focused on their spiritual journey and not be swayed by the distractions and temptations of this world.
orig: فأعرض عن من تولى عن ذكرنا ولم يرد إلا الحياة الدنيا

translation: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of those who deviate from the right path and those who are on the right guidance. It reminds believers that Allah's knowledge is comprehensive and encompasses all, and that He is the ultimate judge of who is astray and who is rightly guided.
orig: ذلك مبلغهم من العلم إن ربك هو أعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بمن اهتدى

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, that He may recompense those who do evil [according to] what they have done and reward those who do good with the best [reward]
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of ultimate justice in Islam, emphasizing that everything in the heavens and on earth belongs to Allah. It stresses that on the Day of Judgment, everyone will be recompensed for their actions - those who do evil will face consequences for their deeds, while those who do good will be rewarded with the best reward. It serves as a reminder to believers to always strive to do good and act in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ليجزي الذين أساءوا بما عملوا ويجزي الذين أحسنوا بالحسنى

translation: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding major sins and immoral actions, while acknowledging that humans may still commit minor faults. It highlights the vast forgiveness of Allah for those who repent and seek His mercy. It also serves as a reminder of Allah's knowledge of every stage of human development, from creation to birth, and warns against arrogance and self-righteousness, emphasizing that true purity and righteousness come from sincere piety and fear of Allah.
orig: الذين يجتنبون كبائر الإثم والفواحش إلا اللمم إن ربك واسع المغفرة هو أعلم بكم إذ أنشأكم من الأرض وإذ أنتم أجنة في بطون أمهاتكم فلا تزكوا أنفسكم هو أعلم بمن اتقى

translation: Have you considered the one who turned away?
interpretation: This verse is calling attention to the one who has turned away from the guidance and teachings of the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder to reflect on the consequences of turning away from the truth and the potential loss that comes with neglecting the divine message.
orig: أفرأيت الذي تولى

translation: And He gives a little and increases [it].
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah provides for His servants in various amounts, sometimes giving just a little, and at other times increasing it manifold. It signifies that Allah's provision is not fixed but can vary, teaching believers to be content with what they have and trust in Allah's wisdom and timing.
orig: وأعطى قليلا وأكدى

translation: He has knowledge of the unseen, and He does not keep it to Himself.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has complete knowledge of the unseen, which includes all that is hidden and unknown to mankind. His knowledge is comprehensive and nothing is hidden from Him. Allah willingly shares some of this knowledge with His creation through revelation, guidance, and signs, demonstrating His mercy and wisdom towards His creation.
orig: أعنده علم الغيب فهو يرى

translation: Or did he not announce to them what was in the scriptures of Moses?
interpretation: This verse implies that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) had indeed informed the people about the contents of the scriptures revealed to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) and that the information aligns with what was already mentioned in those scriptures, emphasizing the continuity and connection between the prophetic messages throughout history.
orig: أم لم ينبأ بما في صحف موسى

translation: And [mention] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations]
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Abraham (Ibrahim in Arabic), highlighting his unwavering commitment and fulfillment of the duties and promises he made to Allah. It serves as a reminder for believers to be steadfast and faithful in fulfilling their obligations and responsibilities towards Allah and others.
orig: وإبراهيم الذي وفى

translation: No bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that every individual is responsible for their own actions and will be held accountable for their deeds in front of God. It emphasizes the concept of personal responsibility and the importance of seeking forgiveness and guidance for oneself, without relying on the deeds or faith of others to save oneself.
orig: ألا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى

translation: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of human effort and striving in achieving goodness and success. It signifies the concept that human beings will only achieve what they work for and put effort into. It serves as a reminder for individuals to strive for righteousness, success, and fulfillment in both worldly and spiritual matters.
orig: وأن ليس للإنسان إلا ما سعى

translation: And that his effort will be seen.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every individual's efforts and striving will be acknowledged and observed by Allah. It serves as a reminder that all actions are known and accounted for, and encourages believers to work diligently in obedience to God.
orig: وأن سعيه سوف يرى

translation: Then He will reward him the fullest reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine justice and reward in Islam. It indicates that God will reward each individual according to their deeds, and His recompense will be complete and fair. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and righteous actions, as they will be rewarded in the most perfect manner by God.
orig: ثم يجزاه الجزاء الأوفى

translation: And unto your Lord is the final destination.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that all beings will ultimately return to their Lord for judgement. It emphasizes the belief in the Day of Resurrection and the accountability of all individuals before God. It serves as a motivation to lead a righteous life and strive towards pleasing Allah, knowing that the ultimate destination is the Hereafter where one will be recompensed for their deeds.
orig: وأن إلى ربك المنتهى

translation: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and [one] weep,
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that it is Allah who grants both laughter and tears to human beings. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power over the emotions and experiences of individuals, highlighting His ability to bring about moments of joy as well as moments of sadness in our lives.
orig: وأنه هو أضحك وأبكى

translation: And that it is He who gives death and gives life;
interpretation: This verse affirms the belief in Allah's absolute power over life and death. It emphasizes that it is only Allah who has the authority and ability to give life and bring death. This serves as a reminder of Allah's dominance and control over all aspects of existence.
orig: وأنه هو أمات وأحيا

translation: And that He created the two mates, the male and female,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the complementary nature of males and females in creation. It highlights the balance and harmony in the creation of pairs in various aspects of life, including humans and other creatures. It also signifies the wisdom and perfect design in the creation of male and female genders as complementary partners in the scheme of creation.
orig: وأنه خلق الزوجين الذكر والأنثى

translation: From a sperm-drop when it is settled.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the miraculous creation of human beings from a tiny sperm-drop, which eventually grows and develops into a complete human being. It emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah in creating life and showcases the intricate process of human development from something so small and insignificant.
orig: من نطفة إذا تمنى

translation: And that upon Him [Allah] is the next existence.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah who holds the power over the future life, the afterlife. It highlights the belief in the Hereafter and the ultimate accountability before Allah in the afterlife. It signifies the importance of faith in the resurrection and the Day of Judgment, where every soul will be recompensed for its deeds. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate justice and the importance of leading a righteous life in preparation for the Hereafter.
orig: وأن عليه النشأة الأخرى

translation: And He is the richest and the most self-sufficient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute richness and self-sufficiency of Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah is not in need of anyone or anything, and He is independent of His creation. It reminds believers to rely on Allah for their needs and seek His guidance and blessings, knowing that He possesses unlimited wealth and completeness.
orig: وأنه هو أغنى وأقنى

translation: And that He is the Lord of Sirius.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah is the Lord of the star Sirius (the brightest star in the night sky), emphasizing the magnitude of His power and control over the entire universe, including the celestial bodies. It serves as a reminder of Allah's supreme authority over all creation.
orig: وأنه هو رب الشعرى

translation: And He destroyed 'Aad the first [people].
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment brought upon the people of 'Aad by God. The 'Aad were a nation known for their strength and power but were destroyed due to their arrogance and disbelief in God's signs. The mention of 'Aad serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting God's guidance and falling into arrogance and disobedience.
orig: وأنه أهلك عادا الأولى

translation: And Thamud, they were not left.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Thamud who were destroyed by Allah for their disobedience and disbelief. It emphasizes that none of the people of Thamud were spared from this destruction, highlighting the severity of their punishment as a warning to others about the consequences of rejecting the guidance of Allah.
orig: وثمود فما أبقى

translation: And the people of Noah before were certainly more unjust and oppressing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wrongdoing of the people of Noah who lived before and emphasizes that they were extremely unjust and oppressive in their actions. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of such behavior and the importance of upholding justice and righteousness.
orig: وقوم نوح من قبل إنهم كانوا هم أظلم وأطغى

translation: And the one who throws sparks [of fire],
interpretation: This verse describes the person who ignites conflicts, spreads discord, and fuels animosity. It warns against the dangers of provoking unrest and inciting disputes among people.
orig: والمؤتفكة أهوى

translation: So He overwhelmed her with affliction as none else,
interpretation: This verse speaks about a specific event where Allah overwhelmed a group of people with a punishment or downfall that was intense and unmatched by any other. It conveys a message about how Allah's power and wrath can manifest in ways that are beyond human comprehension, emphasizing His ultimate authority and might.
orig: فغشاها ما غشى

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse in the Qur'an challenges the readers to reflect on the countless blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon them, emphasizing the importance of recognizing and appreciating these blessings. It serves as a reminder to be grateful and to not be ungrateful or skeptical towards the blessings and bounties of God.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربك تتمارى

translation: This is a warner of the warners of old.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the message of warning and guidance that has been sent to people throughout history by various prophets and messengers. It serves as a reminder of the continuity of the message of monotheism and accountability before God for one's actions.
orig: هذا نذير من النذر الأولى

translation: The imminent event has come close,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the certainty and proximity of the Day of Judgment, suggesting that it is a reality that will inevitably occur. It serves as a reminder to believers of the importance of preparing for the Hereafter and living their lives in accordance with the teachings of Islam in order to attain success in the eternal life to come.
orig: أزفت الآزفة

translation: There is not for it any remover.
interpretation: This verse highlights that there is no one who can avert or remove a decree or fate determined by Allah. It emphasizes the ultimate power and control of Allah over all things, implying that no one can change what Allah has decreed.
orig: ليس لها من دون الله كاشفة

translation: So in which hadith after it will they believe?
interpretation: This verse questions the people who reject the teachings of the Qur'an, asking them what other source of guidance they find more appealing or worthy of belief than the Qur'an. It challenges them to consider the wisdom and guidance present in the Qur'an and to reflect on the truth it presents.
orig: أفمن هذا الحديث تعجبون

translation: And you laugh and do not weep.
interpretation: This verse is pointing out the attitude of some individuals who are engaged in frivolity and heedlessness, finding amusement and pleasure in worldly matters without reflecting on the deeper realities of life. It serves as a reminder to balance joy and enjoyment with awareness of one’s spiritual responsibilities and the consequences of one’s actions.
orig: وتضحكون ولا تبكون

translation: And you are looking on
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah is fully aware and knowledgeable of all our actions and intentions. It serves as a reassurance that nothing escapes His knowledge, even the smallest of deeds or thoughts.
orig: وأنتم سامدون

translation: So prostrate yourselves before Allah and worship Him.
interpretation: This verse is a clear command from Allah to prostrate and worship Him. It emphasizes the importance of submission and worship as fundamental aspects of being a Muslim. By prostrating to Allah, we acknowledge His power and greatness, and by worshipping Him, we show our devotion and gratitude. It also serves as a reminder that our ultimate purpose in life is to submit to Allah and worship Him with sincerity and humility.
orig: فاسجدوا لله واعبدوا

translation: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].
interpretation: This verse describes the signs of the Day of Judgment. It signifies the nearing of the end of the world and the occurrence of extraordinary events, such as the splitting of the moon, as a part of the signs leading up to the Hour. It serves as a reminder of the power and inevitability of the Day of Judgment.
orig: اقتربت الساعة وانشق القمر

translation: And if they see a sign, they turn away and say, 'This is but evident sorcery.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubborn refusal of disbelievers to accept the signs and miracles of Allah as evidence of His power and existence. Instead of acknowledging the truth, they dismiss these signs as mere magic or sorcery, thus further hardening their hearts and rejecting the guidance of Allah.
orig: وإن يروا آية يعرضوا ويقولوا سحر مستمر

translation: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But every matter is settled.
interpretation: This verse highlights the act of denying the truth and following one's desires, which leads people astray. Despite their denial and defiance, all matters will ultimately be judged and settled by the divine decree.
orig: وكذبوا واتبعوا أهواءهم وكل أمر مستقر

translation: And there has already come to them of the news that in which there is deterrence.
interpretation: This verse describes how the disbelievers have already received warnings and lessons from previous nations, but they choose to ignore these reminders. The message is clear and serves as a deterrent to their wrongdoings, yet they persist in their disbelief and defiance.
orig: ولقد جاءهم من الأنباء ما فيه مزدجر

translation: A word of wisdom, but it does not benefit at all.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of actions over mere words or promises. It signifies that a person's verbal declarations or pledges hold no value or benefit if they are not followed through with concrete actions. It serves as a reminder that actions speak louder than words, and true wisdom lies in the practical application of one's words and intentions.
orig: حكمة بالغة فما تغن النذر

translation: So turn away from them on the Day when the caller will call them to a severe affair.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the Day of Judgment when every individual will be called to account for their deeds. It serves as a warning to the disbelievers to turn away from their wrongful ways before the inevitable Day arrives.
orig: فتول عنهم يوم يدع الداع إلى شيء نكر

translation: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when people will be resurrected from their graves in a state of humility and submission. The imagery of emerging like locusts emphasizes the multitude and dispersal of people as they arise to face their reckoning before Allah.
orig: خشعا أبصارهم يخرجون من الأجداث كأنهم جراد منتشر

translation: rushing towards the caller; the disbelievers will say, 'This is a difficult day.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene of the disbelievers rushing towards the caller on the Day of Judgment and acknowledging it as a difficult and challenging day. It highlights the overwhelming nature of the Day of Judgment and the regret of those who rejected faith in this life.
orig: مهطعين إلى الداع يقول الكافرون هذا يوم عسر

translation: Before them, the people of Noah denied the truth, and so did the other disbelieving groups. They called Our servant a liar and said, 'He is possessed and gone astray.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the pattern of denial and ridicule that prophets often faced from their people. Even though the message of truth was conveyed to them, the disbelievers resorted to slander and mockery. The verse emphasizes the opposition faced by Prophet Noah and how he was falsely accused and belittled by his people, reflecting the challenges that prophets faced when spreading the message of Allah.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح فكذبوا عبدنا وقالوا مجنون وازدجر

translation: So he called upon his Lord: 'Indeed, I am overpowered, so help.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the example of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) when he was in a state of distress and sought help from Allah after feeling defeated. It teaches us that in times of hardship and when feeling overwhelmed, turning to Allah in sincere supplication can bring about victory and relief.
orig: فدعا ربه أني مغلوب فانتصر

translation: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in abundance.
interpretation: This verse portrays the abundant mercy and blessings of Allah, who provides rain from the sky to nourish the earth and sustain life. It signifies the power and generosity of Allah in sending down water from the heavens, symbolizing His ability to provide for all His creation.
orig: ففتحنا أبواب السماء بماء منهمر

translation: And We caused the earth to burst with springs, so the waters met for a matter already predestined.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous creation of springs and water sources on earth by the will of Allah. It emphasizes the divine decree and predestination, illustrating the perfection of Allah's planning and creation in sustaining life through the provision of water.
orig: وفجرنا الأرض عيونا فالتقى الماء على أمر قد قدر

translation: And We carried him on a [ship] made of planks and nails,
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah (Nuh) and the Ark. It highlights how Allah guided Noah in constructing the ark to save him and the believers from the flood. It symbolizes the importance of obedience to Allah's commands and trust in His guidance, even in the face of trials and challenges.
orig: وحملناه على ذات ألواح ودسر

translation: It flows beneath our eyes as a reward for whoever disbelieves.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting how the recompense for those who refuse to believe in the truth will be evident and flowing before their very eyes, underscoring the notion that the consequences of disbelief are apparent and unavoidable.
orig: تجري بأعيننا جزاء لمن كان كفر

translation: And We have certainly left it as a sign, so is there anyone who will remember?
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the signs of Allah are all around us, in the world and within ourselves. It calls on us to reflect on these signs and to contemplate the power and wisdom of Allah. It prompts us to be mindful and remember our Creator in all aspects of our lives.
orig: ولقد تركناها آية فهل من مدكر

translation: So how was My punishment and My warnings?
interpretation: This verse questions the listeners about the severity of the punishment and the warnings that were given. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of straying from the right path and emphasizes the importance of heeding the warnings and following the guidance provided to avoid facing the punishment mentioned.
orig: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر

translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there anyone who will remember?
interpretation: This verse highlights the ease with which the Qur'an has been presented for people to remember and reflect upon. It invites individuals to engage with the Qur'an, ponder its message, and take the opportunity to benefit from its guidance. The verse questions whether there will be those who will take the initiative to remember and understand the teachings of the Qur'an.
orig: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر

translation: The tribe of 'Aad rejected the truth. How awesome was My punishment and My warnings!
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an refers to the tribe of 'Aad who denied and opposed the message of the Prophet Hood. The verse highlights that despite being warned and given reminders, the people of 'Aad continued to reject the truth and faced the consequences of their actions in the form of a severe punishment. It serves as a reminder of the importance of accepting the guidance and warnings given by Allah and the Prophets, and the consequences of denying the truth.
orig: كذبت عاد فكيف كان عذابي ونذر

translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune.
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment inflicted upon a specific group of people by sending a destructive wind upon them during a day of misfortune. The wind mentioned is symbolic of a calamity that is relentless and devastating, emphasizing the significance of divine retribution for those who go against God's commandments.
orig: إنا أرسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا في يوم نحس مستمر

translation: People are like scattered palm leaves.
interpretation: This verse portrays the image of people being like scattered palm leaves, highlighting the transient and fragile nature of human life. Just as palm leaves can be easily scattered by the wind, people too are fragile and fleeting in this world. It serves as a reminder of the impermanence of life and the need for humility and reflection on the transient nature of human existence.
orig: تنزع الناس كأنهم أعجاز نخل منقعر

translation: So how was My punishment and My warnings?
interpretation: This verse is questioning how people can ignore the punishment and warnings of God despite being clearly stated in the Quran. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobeying God's commandments and serves as a warning for those who do not heed to it.
orig: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر

translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there anyone who will remember?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an has been made easy to understand and remember. It invites people to reflect on its teachings and to remember and ponder over its guidance. It challenges the reader to seize the opportunity to learn from the Qur'an and apply its lessons in their lives.
orig: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر

translation: Thamud denied [the truth] through their transgression.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Thamud who rejected the warnings and signs from Allah out of their arrogance and wrongdoing. It serves as a lesson on the consequences of denying the truth and disobeying Allah's commandments.
orig: كذبت ثمود بالنذر

translation: So they said, 'Should we follow one man among us? Indeed, then we would be in error and madness.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the resistance and disbelief of some people towards following a single messenger or prophet sent by God. They expressed skepticism and ridiculed the idea of following just one man, showing their arrogance and lack of understanding of the importance of heeding the guidance and message brought by the chosen messengers of God.
orig: فقالوا أبشرا منا واحدا نتبعه إنا إذا لفي ضلال وسعر

translation: Shall the Reminder be cast upon him from among us? In fact, he is an insolent liar!
interpretation: This verse reflects the disbelief and rejection of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by the disbelievers of Makkah. They accused him of lying and fabricating the Quranic revelation. The verse emphasizes their denial of the Prophet's message and their refusal to accept the truth, despite the clear signs and proofs presented to them.
orig: أألقي الذكر عليه من بيننا بل هو كذاب أشر

translation: They will know tomorrow who is the liar, the evildoer.
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that falsehood and wickedness will eventually be exposed and that the truth will prevail in the end. It serves as a reminder that no matter how convincing falsehood may seem in the present, its true nature will be revealed and justice will be served.
orig: سيعلمون غدا من الكذاب الأشر

translation: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as a trial for them, so watch them and be patient.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an illustrates the story of a she-camel sent by Allah as a test for a particular nation. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being vigilant, patient, and steadfast in the face of trials and challenges sent by Allah. The verse emphasizes the need to endure patiently and to have faith in Allah's wisdom and ultimate plan.
orig: إنا مرسلو الناقة فتنة لهم فارتقبهم واصطبر

translation: And inform them that the water is shared between them, each drink being preordained.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes divine intervention in determining the allocation of resources, such as water, among people. It highlights the significance of recognizing that sustenance and provisions come from Allah and are distributed according to His will. It serves as a reminder to appreciate and utilize resources responsibly, showing gratitude for the blessings bestowed upon us.
orig: ونبئهم أن الماء قسمة بينهم كل شرب محتضر

translation: So they called out to their companion, and he climbed up and overcame them.
interpretation: This verse describes a story of companions who faced a challenge together. When they called upon their companion for help, he rose to the occasion and overcame the challenge with determination and strength. It highlights the importance of unity, support, and courage in overcoming difficulties and obstacles in life.
orig: فنادوا صاحبهم فتعاطى فعقر

translation: So, how was My punishment and My warnings?
interpretation: This verse questions the non-believers about the severity of the punishment they faced despite the warnings that were given to them. It emphasizes the inevitability and seriousness of divine punishment for those who reject the truth and refuse to heed the guidance and signs from Allah.
orig: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر

translation: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of a fence builder.
interpretation: This verse describes how a single blast from the sky caused destruction and devastation upon a group of people, likening their destruction to the breaking and scattering of dry twig fragments. It serves as a reminder of the power and might of God, and how His punishment can swiftly and completely destroy those who disobey His commandments.
orig: إنا أرسلنا عليهم صيحة واحدة فكانوا كهشيم المحتظر

translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there anyone who will remember?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the simplicity and ease with which the Qur'an can be remembered and understood. It calls upon people to reflect upon its teachings and to take the opportunity to remember and contemplate its messages. It serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is accessible to all and that its guidance is for those who choose to take heed and reflect upon it.
orig: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر

translation: The people of Lot denied the warning.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Prophet Lot who rejected and denied the warnings and advice given to them. It highlights their disbelief and defiance towards the guidance and reminders from their prophet, leading to their ultimate punishment for their immoral behavior and refusal to heed the divine message.
orig: كذبت قوم لوط بالنذر

translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn
interpretation: This verse mentions how the people of a certain community were punished by a storm of stones, except the family of Prophet Lot. This can be seen as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience to God's commands and a lesson on the importance of following the right path to salvation.
orig: إنا أرسلنا عليهم حاصبا إلا آل لوط نجيناهم بسحر

translation: A bounty from Us. Thus do We reward the grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that blessings come from Allah, and those who show gratitude will be rewarded abundantly. It highlights the importance of being thankful for the blessings we receive and how expressing gratitude can lead to even more blessings from Allah.
orig: نعمة من عندنا كذلك نجزي من شكر

translation: And We had certainly warned them of Our punishment, but they disputed the warning.
interpretation: This verse refers to how the disbelievers were warned by the prophets about the consequences of their actions, but they ignored the warnings out of arrogance and continued in their disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the importance of heeding warnings and being conscious of the consequences of one's actions.
orig: ولقد أنذرهم بطشتنا فتماروا بالنذر

translation: And they had demanded from him his guest, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], 'Taste My punishment and warning.'
interpretation: This verse highlights a punishment inflicted by God on a group of people who attempted to harm or seek wrongdoing against a guest of Prophet Lot ('him' in the verse). The consequence of their ill intentions was that their eyes were obliterated as a form of divine punishment. This serves as a warning about the severity of transgressing against the rights of guests and the grave repercussions that can follow such actions.
orig: ولقد راودوه عن ضيفه فطمسنا أعينهم فذوقوا عذابي ونذر

translation: And the morning brought them a settled punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes how the disbelievers faced a sudden and lasting punishment in the morning, highlighting the swift and decisive nature of divine retribution against those who reject faith and disobey God's commandments.
orig: ولقد صبحهم بكرة عذاب مستقر

translation: So taste the punishment for what you forgot.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of forgetting or neglecting one's duties and responsibilities as prescribed by Allah. It warns of the punishment that awaits those who turn away from the teachings of the Qur'an and fail to remember their obligations towards their Creator.
orig: فذوقوا عذابي ونذر

translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
interpretation: This verse highlights the Quran's clarity and ease for those who seek to remember and comprehend its teachings. It is a call for reflection and remembrance, urging individuals to contemplate its messages and apply them in their daily lives.
orig: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر

translation: And the family of Pharaoh came with warning
interpretation: This verse describes how even among the family of Pharaoh, there were individuals who acknowledged the signs and warnings from God. It highlights that guidance and faith can be found in unexpected places, reminding us that belief is a matter of the heart and not solely based on external affiliations or positions.
orig: ولقد جاء آل فرعون النذر

translation: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of those who deny and reject the signs and revelations of Allah. It emphasizes that despite their denial, Allah's power and might are supreme, and He has the ability to hold them accountable for their rejection of His signs.
orig: كذبوا بآياتنا كلها فأخذناهم أخذ عزيز مقتدر

translation: Are your disbelievers better than those [believers] or do you have immunity [in the scripture]?
interpretation: This verse questions the superiority of the disbelievers over the believers by asking if they are really better, or if they have some kind of immunity or special status in the divine scripture that justifies their actions. It encourages reflection on the value of faith and adherence to divine guidance.
orig: أكفاركم خير من أولئكم أم لكم براءة في الزبر

translation: Do they say: 'We are all powerful and triumphant'?
interpretation: This verse questions if people claim to be all-powerful and triumphant on their own, emphasizing the arrogance and false sense of superiority that can lead individuals to believe they do not need to rely on a higher power or seek guidance.
orig: أم يقولون نحن جميع منتصر

translation: The company will be defeated, and will turn their backs [in retreat].
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who oppose truth and righteousness will ultimately face defeat and retreat. It serves as a reminder that justice will prevail and wrongdoers will not succeed in the long run.
orig: سيهزم الجمع ويولون الدبر

translation: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability and severity of the Hour (the Day of Judgment), stating that it is appointed for those who deny the truth. It serves as a warning of the dire consequences that await those who choose to reject belief and disobey the guidance of Allah, highlighting the seriousness and gravity of the Day of Judgment.
orig: بل الساعة موعدهم والساعة أدهى وأمر

translation: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.
interpretation: This verse refers to the fact that those who commit sins and wrongdoings are in a state of misguidance and foolishness. It highlights that deviating from the right path leads to a state of confusion and distortion of understanding.
orig: إن المجرمين في ضلال وسعر

translation: The day they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire, 'Taste the touch of Saqar.'
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they will be dragged on their faces into the Hellfire. The word 'Saqar' is used to refer to a specific level of Hell known for its intense heat. The verse serves as a reminder of the severe consequences of rejecting faith and disobeying Allah's commandments.
orig: يوم يسحبون في النار على وجوههم ذوقوا مس سقر

translation: Verily, We have created everything according to a fixed decree.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Divine decree and predestination in the creation of all things. It highlights the belief that everything in the universe is created and controlled by Allah according to His perfect plan and wisdom. It serves as a reminder for believers to trust in Allah's will and accept whatever comes their way, knowing that it is all part of His greater plan.
orig: إنا كل شيء خلقناه بقدر

translation: And our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ease and simplicity of Allah's commands. Just like a quick glance of the eye encompasses a single action, Allah's orders are straightforward and precise, reflecting His unparalleled wisdom and power.
orig: وما أمرنا إلا واحدة كلمح بالبصر

translation: And We have certainly destroyed your kinds. So is there any who will be reminded?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of past nations that were destroyed due to their disobedience to Allah. It urges the current generation to reflect on these past events and take heed from them, emphasizing the importance of turning to Allah and following His guidance.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا أشياعكم فهل من مدكر

translation: And everything they did is in the scriptures.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every action, good or bad, that people do is recorded and documented in the scriptures. It serves as a reminder that nothing goes unnoticed or unaccounted for in the sight of God, and that individuals will be held responsible for their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وكل شيء فعلوه في الزبر

translation: And every small and great [thing] is recorded.
interpretation: This verse affirms the belief in the meticulous recording and preservation of every single deed, no matter how insignificant or significant. It emphasizes that nothing escapes from the knowledge and record of God, highlighting His ultimate justice and accountability for all actions.
orig: وكل صغير وكبير مستطر

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs.
interpretation: This verse describes the ultimate reward for those who are pious and God-fearing. It emphasizes that the righteous believers will be in a place of eternal bliss in Paradise, surrounded by beautiful gardens and flowing streams, which are symbols of peace, beauty, and abundance. This is a promise and encouragement for believers to strive towards righteousness and to maintain God-consciousness in their lives.
orig: إن المتقين في جنات ونهر

translation: In a seat of honor, with a Most Powerful Sovereign.
interpretation: This verse describes a place of truth and righteousness, in the presence of the Almighty and All-Powerful King. It signifies a position of honor and integrity in the sight of God, who holds all power and sovereignty.
orig: في مقعد صدق عند مليك مقتدر

translation: The Most Merciful
interpretation: This verse refers to one of the 99 names of Allah in Islam, 'Ar-Rahman', which means The Most Merciful. It highlights one of the key attributes of Allah, emphasizing His limitless mercy and compassion towards His creation. This name serves as a reminder to believers of the boundless love and forgiveness that Allah offers to His servants, encouraging them to seek His mercy and strive to embody mercy in their own lives.
orig: الرحمن

translation: The knowledge of the Qur'an
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of acquiring knowledge about the Qur'an. It encourages Muslims to seek understanding and enhance their knowledge of the teachings and guidance present in the Qur'an. By learning and reflecting on the Qur'an, believers can strengthen their faith, gain insights into life's challenges, and grow closer to Allah.
orig: علم القرآن

translation: He created the human
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the magnificent act of creation by God, who created human beings with precision, purpose, and uniqueness. It serves as a reminder of the power and creativity of the divine being in designing and bringing forth mankind into existence.
orig: خلق الإنسان

translation: He taught him eloquent speech.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of divine knowledge and guidance in enabling a person to communicate effectively and eloquently. It highlights the significance of knowledge and understanding in conveying messages clearly to others.
orig: علمه البيان

translation: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the precise and orderly way in which the sun and the moon operate in the universe, following a predetermined course and an exact calculation. It serves as a reminder of the precise design and order in the creation of the universe by Allah.
orig: الشمس والقمر بحسبان

translation: By the star when it descends, Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred, Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
interpretation: This verse talks about the Prophet Muhammad and confirms his guidance and reliability in delivering the message from Allah. It emphasizes that the Prophet is dedicated to conveying the divine revelation faithfully without any personal inclinations or errors.
orig: والنجم والشجر يسجدان

translation: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
interpretation: This verse discusses the greatness of Allah's creation, highlighting the meticulous balance and precision in how He has created and structured the universe. It signifies the order and equilibrium that Allah has established in His creation, emphasizing the harmony and balance that exist in the heavens and throughout the universe.
orig: والسماء رفعها ووضع الميزان

translation: Do not commit excess in the balance.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to believers to be just and balanced in all aspects of their lives. It warns against cheating, lying, or manipulating in any way that would disrupt the balance and fairness that should exist in society. It encourages moderation and righteousness in dealings with others and in fulfilling one's responsibilities.
orig: ألا تطغوا في الميزان

translation: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining justice and fairness in all aspects of life. It teaches us to be just and honest in our dealings, ensuring that we do not cheat or deceive others. It urges us to uphold justice and equity, both in material transactions and in our moral conduct. By doing so, we ensure that our actions are in balance and in harmony with the values and principles of Islam.
orig: وأقيموا الوزن بالقسط ولا تخسروا الميزان

translation: And the earth He spread out for the creatures.
interpretation: This verse highlights the vastness and generosity of Allah's creation, emphasizing how the earth has been made spacious and habitable for all living beings. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power and care in providing for His creation, ensuring their sustenance and well-being.
orig: والأرض وضعها للأنام

translation: In them are fruit and palm trees with sheaths
interpretation: This verse is describing the gardens of paradise, highlighting the abundance of fruits and specifically mentioning the palm trees with sheaths. This depiction aims to emphasize the beauty, richness, and blessings of paradise that await the believers in the afterlife.
orig: فيها فاكهة والنخل ذات الأكمام

translation: By the fig and the olive
interpretation: This verse is a powerful oath in the Qur'an, emphasizing the importance of these two fruits - the fig and the olive. The fig and the olive hold great significance in the Islamic tradition as symbols of goodness, blessings, and sustenance. This verse can be seen as a metaphorical reminder of the Creator's bounties and the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings bestowed upon humanity.
orig: والحب ذو العصف والريحان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to reflect on the countless blessings and favors bestowed upon us by our Lord. It urges us to acknowledge these blessings and not be ungrateful or deny them, but rather be grateful and appreciative of the countless favors we receive.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: Man has been created from clay like that of pottery.
interpretation: This verse highlights the origin of mankind, emphasizing the humble beginnings of human creation from clay. It serves as a reminder of the power and creative ability of Allah, who created humanity from simple materials yet with the potential for great complexity and diversity.
orig: خلق الإنسان من صلصال كالفخار

translation: And [He created] the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
interpretation: This verse highlights the creation of the jinn from a unique substance, which is a smokeless flame of fire. It emphasizes the power and creativity of Allah in creating diverse beings with different natures and characteristics.
orig: وخلق الجان من مارج من نار

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question that emphasizes the numerous blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon humanity. It serves as a reminder for people to reflect on the countless blessings they have received from God and to be grateful for them rather than denying or unappreciative of these blessings.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: Lord of the East and Lord of the West.
interpretation: This verse affirms the complete and absolute sovereignty of Allah over all directions, symbolizing His encompassing power and authority over all aspects of creation. It serves as a reminder to believers of the omnipresence and omnipotence of Allah, who holds dominion over the entire universe from the Eastern horizon to the Western horizon.
orig: رب المشرقين ورب المغربين

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the countless blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon us, and invites us to reflect on them and be grateful. It serves as a rhetorical question, emphasizing the need for gratitude and acknowledgment of God's blessings in our lives.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: The meeting place of the two seas.
interpretation: This verse refers to a natural phenomenon where two bodies of water meet but do not mix. In a broader sense, it symbolizes the meeting of two different entities or worlds, yet they remain distinct and different from each other. It serves as a reminder of the boundaries and differences that exist in the world, emphasizing the importance of respecting diversity and maintaining harmony despite differences.
orig: مرج البحرين يلتقيان

translation: Between them is a barrier which they do not transgress.
interpretation: This verse refers to the barrier placed between the two bodies of water, referring to the separation of saltwater and freshwater. It emphasizes the decree of Allah and the boundaries set by Him, highlighting the unique and distinct nature of each creation and the importance of respecting these boundaries.
orig: بينهما برزخ لا يبغيان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse serves as a rhetorical question posing a challenge to people to reflect on the numerous blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon them. It calls for acknowledgment and gratitude towards these blessings rather than denying or taking them for granted. The verse prompts believers to constantly reflect on the blessings in their life and to be grateful to their Lord for them.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: Out of them [both], come out pearl and coral.
interpretation: This verse refers to the oceans or seas, highlighting the beauty and diversity within them. It serves as a reminder of the magnificent creations of Allah and his endless bounties, citing pearls and corals as examples of the precious and valuable treasures that emerge from these vast bodies of water.
orig: يخرج منهما اللؤلؤ والمرجان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, asking humans which of His countless blessings and favors are they going to deny or reject. It serves as a reminder for believers to reflect on and appreciate the numerous blessings they enjoy, ultimately leading them to gratitude and obedience to their Creator.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
interpretation: This verse highlights the might and power of Allah, as the ships sailing in the sea resemble great mountains when viewed from a distance. It serves as a reminder of Allah's control over all aspects of creation, even the vast and powerful structures in the sea.
orig: وله الجوار المنشآت في البحر كالأعلام

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to reflect on the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah, and to acknowledge and be grateful for these blessings. It highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the generosity of God in our lives, encouraging believers not to deny or overlook the countless favours granted to them by their Lord.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: Whatever is on it [the Earth] will perish.
interpretation: This verse highlights the impermanence of everything in this world. It serves as a reminder that all material possessions and creations are transient and will eventually come to an end. This concept encourages believers to focus on the eternal aspects of life and prepare for the Hereafter, rather than becoming attached to worldly possessions which ultimately have no lasting value.
orig: كل من عليها فان

translation: And the face of your Lord remains full of Majesty and Honor.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the eternal and everlasting nature of the Majesty and Honor of Allah. It highlights the magnificence and splendor of God’s presence, indicating that His greatness and dignity will always endure. It serves as a reminder of the unmatched power and greatness of Allah, encouraging believers to show reverence and respect towards Him in all aspects of their lives.
orig: ويبقى وجه ربك ذو الجلال والإكرام

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to the listener, inviting them to reflect on and acknowledge the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord. It serves as a reminder to be grateful and not deny or ignore the blessings and bounties that have been bestowed upon them.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: Everyone in the heavens and the earth asks Him. Every day He is bringing about a matter.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that all beings in the heavens and the earth continuously turn to Allah and seek from Him. It emphasizes the importance of constantly being in supplication and seeking guidance from Allah alone, as He is the ultimate provider and decision maker of all matters.
orig: يسأله من في السماوات والأرض كل يوم هو في شأن

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to remind and prompt people to reflect on the countless blessings and favors bestowed upon them by God. It serves as a reminder to be grateful and not deny the many blessings that a person receives in their life.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: We will pour on you a weighty Word.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance and weightiness of the Qur'an, indicating that it contains profound wisdom and guidance that will have a significant impact on the believers. The word of God is not to be taken lightly, as it carries immense value and significance, worthy of contemplation and reflection to benefit from its wisdom.
orig: سنفرغ لكم أيه الثقلان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question asking the disbelievers to reflect on the countless blessings and favors they have received from their Lord. It serves as a reminder for people to be grateful and not to deny the blessings bestowed upon them by Allah.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority.
interpretation: This verse highlights the extent of Allah's power and authority over all creation. It emphasizes that no one can surpass the limits set by Him except by His permission and authority. Allah's control over the heavens and the earth is absolute, and no one, whether from the jinn or mankind, can exceed the boundaries without His will. It serves as a reminder of the limits of human capability and the ultimate power and control of Allah in all matters.
orig: يا معشر الجن والإنس إن استطعتم أن تنفذوا من أقطار السماوات والأرض فانفذوا لا تنفذون إلا بسلطان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse challenges the listener to reflect upon the countless blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord, reminding them not to be ungrateful or deny these favors. It serves as a reminder to be thankful and appreciate the many blessings in our lives.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: There will be sent upon you both a flame of fire and smoke, and you shall not be able to defend yourselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of disobedience and wrong actions. It depicts a scene of punishment where individuals will be overwhelmed and unable to protect or save themselves from the divine retribution that will be sent upon them. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being mindful of one's actions and seeking forgiveness to avoid facing severe consequences.
orig: يرسل عليكما شواظ من نار ونحاس فلا تنتصران

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse serves as a rhetorical question emphasizing the numerous blessings and favors that Allah bestows upon His creation. It challenges the reader to reflect on and acknowledge these favors, highlighting the ingratitude of denying or rejecting them.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: When the sky splits apart and becomes rose-colored like paint.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the sky will split apart and take on a rose-colored appearance. The imagery conveys the awe-inspiring and transformative nature of the events that will unfold on that day, highlighting the power and majesty of Allah's creations and the inevitability of the final hour.
orig: فإذا انشقت السماء فكانت وردة كالدهان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question that invites reflection on the countless blessings and favors bestowed by Allah upon His creation. It serves as a reminder to acknowledge and be grateful for these blessings, and to question why anyone would deny or be unappreciative of the gifts provided by their Lord.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: On that Day, no human being will be asked about his sins, neither the jinni.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute justice of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that on that day, no one will be able to escape accountability for their deeds. The verse conveys the idea that every individual will be responsible for their own actions, and there will be no room for denial or evasion of one's sins. It serves as a powerful reminder for believers to be mindful of their actions and to seek repentance before facing the consequences on the Day of Judgment.
orig: فيومئذ لا يسأل عن ذنبه إنس ولا جان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers and reminds them of the numerous blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon them. It aims to make them reflect on these blessings and acknowledge the existence and greatness of their Creator.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the actions of the wrongdoers will eventually expose their true nature and they will face the consequences of their deeds. It emphasizes the idea that individuals will be judged based on their actions and their outward appearance may reflect their inner character.
orig: يعرف المجرمون بسيماهم فيؤخذ بالنواصي والأقدام

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse serves as a rhetorical question about the favors and blessings that Allah has bestowed upon humanity. It prompts reflection on the countless blessings we enjoy in our lives and calls for recognition and gratitude towards Allah for these favors.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: This is Hell which the criminals deny.
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the existence of Hell, which is a place of punishment for the wrongdoers and those who commit crimes against Allah and His creation. It serves as a reminder of the consequences for those who reject the truth and indulge in evil deeds.
orig: هذه جهنم التي يكذب بها المجرمون

translation: They will circulate between it and scalding water.
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment for the disbelievers in the afterlife where they will circulate between the blazing fire and scalding water, experiencing torment and suffering.
orig: يطوفون بينها وبين حميم آن

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse challenges the disbelievers to reflect on the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord. It is a rhetorical question aimed at making them realize the importance of gratitude and acknowledgment of these blessings, thereby inviting them to believe in and worship the Creator.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: And for he who fears the position of his Lord are two gardens.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward and blessings that await those who fear and are conscious of their Lord. It signifies that those who have a deep sense of awe and respect for Allah will be granted abundant blessings and prosperity in the Hereafter, symbolized here as 'two gardens'. The verse emphasizes the importance of piety and mindfulness of God's commandments as a means to attain the ultimate success and eternal happiness in the afterlife.
orig: ولمن خاف مقام ربه جنتان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question to make the listeners reflect on the various blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon them. It serves as a reminder to be grateful and not reject or deny the countless gifts and blessings that come from God.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: two considered ones.
interpretation: This verse refers to two women who were involved in a dispute or accusation. They are described as 'considered ones' which may imply that they were respected or known, highlighting the seriousness of the situation being discussed in the context of this verse.
orig: ذواتا أفنان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed in the Qur'an, reminding the reader of the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord. It serves as a prompt for reflection on gratitude and acknowledgment of the blessings in one's life, encouraging believers to appreciate and not deny the multitude of blessings they have been granted.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: In both of them are two springs flowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the distinction of the human being, created with two eyes as a means of perceiving the physical world. It symbolically signifies the dual nature of human perception - one that comprehends the external physical reality and the other that perceives the internal spiritual realm. It serves as a reminder of our complex existence encompassing both the material and the spiritual dimensions.
orig: فيهما عينان تجريان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse challenges the reader to reflect on the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord, asking which of these favors they are willing to deny or ignore. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for all the blessings in life and to recognize the continuous generosity of God.
orig: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان

translation: In both of them are fruits, palm trees, and pomegranates.
interpretation: This verse describes the gardens of paradise, emphasizing the abundance and diversity of fruits found in them. It symbolizes the rewards and pleasures that await the believers in the afterlife, highlighting the richness and beauty of paradise.
orig: فيهما من كل فاكهة زوجان

translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
