interpretation: This verse highlights the deceptive and divisive nature of Satan, indicating that his whispers and secret schemes are aimed at creating discord among the believers in order to cause sorrow to those who have faith. However, it reassures that ultimately Satan has no power to harm the believers except with the permission of God. Therefore, the believers are urged to place their trust in God as the ultimate protector and source of strength.
orig: إنما النجوى من الشيطان ليحزن الذين آمنوا وليس بضارهم شيئا إلا بإذن الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: O you who have believed, when you are told, 'Space yourselves' in assemblies, then make space; Allah will make space for you. And when you are told, 'Arise,' then arise; Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, in degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to be respectful and considerate in gatherings and meetings. They are urged to make space when asked to do so, and to stand up when required. By following these etiquettes, they not only demonstrate their obedience to Allah's command but also show respect to others. Those who are knowledgeable and believe will be exalted by Allah, who is aware of all their actions and intentions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا قيل لكم تفسحوا في المجالس فافسحوا يفسح الله لكم وإذا قيل انشزوا فانشزوا يرفع الله الذين آمنوا منكم والذين أوتوا العلم درجات والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers about the etiquette of approaching the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) for private consultation. It encourages them to give a charity (sadaqah) before such a private meeting, as a way of seeking blessings and purification. If for some reason they are unable to give charity, Allah is forgiving and merciful, showing His understanding and mercy towards His believers.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا ناجيتم الرسول فقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقة ذلك خير لكم وأطهر فإن لم تجدوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Do you fear to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allah has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of giving charity willingly and sincerely for the sake of Allah. It also highlights that if someone fails to give charity when they could have, they can make up for it by performing prayers, giving zakah, and obeying Allah and His Messenger. It reminds believers that Allah is aware of all their actions and intentions.
orig: أأشفقتم أن تقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقات فإذ لم تفعلوا وتاب الله عليكم فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأطيعوا الله ورسوله والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Have you not seen those who have taken as allies a people with whom Allah has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them. And they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of forming alliances with those who have earned the anger of Allah. It warns against joining forces with such people, as their dishonesty and betrayal will eventually become apparent. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain alliances with those who uphold truth and righteousness, rather than compromising one's values for temporary gains.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين تولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم ما هم منكم ولا منهم ويحلفون على الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; indeed, they were doing [wrong].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability in Islam, highlighting that those who commit wrongdoing will face severe consequences. It serves as a warning to individuals to be mindful of their actions and to reflect on the morality of their deeds, as they will be held accountable for them in the hereafter. It encourages believers to strive for righteousness and to avoid engaging in activities that transgress the boundaries set by Allah.
orig: أعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. So for them is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against those who use false oaths and deceit as a means to misguide people from the path of Allah. Such actions lead to a disgraceful punishment in the Hereafter for those who engage in them.
orig: اتخذوا أيمانهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله فلهم عذاب مهين

translation: Their wealth and their children will not avail them a thing against Allah. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate futility of relying on material possessions and family ties when it comes to standing before the judgment of Allah. It emphasizes that true success and protection come from faith and righteous deeds, and that those who rely solely on worldly matters and neglect their spiritual well-being will face consequences in the afterlife. It serves as a reminder to prioritize one's relationship with Allah over worldly distractions.
orig: لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are upon something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Resurrection when all beings will be brought back to life before Allah. People who used to challenge the truth and deny the existence of the divine will then realize their falsehood. They will swear falsely, just as they did in the world, thinking they had some power or authority. However, in reality, they will be exposed as liars and accountable for their falsehood.
orig: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فيحلفون له كما يحلفون لكم ويحسبون أنهم على شيء ألا إنهم هم الكاذبون

translation: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they are the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the danger of being influenced by Satan and forgetting the remembrance of Allah. It warns against being part of Satan's party, which leads to loss and destruction. It serves as a reminder to always be mindful of Allah's presence and guidance to avoid falling into the trap of Satan.
orig: استحوذ عليهم الشيطان فأنساهم ذكر الله أولئك حزب الشيطان ألا إن حزب الشيطان هم الخاسرون

translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are among the most humiliated.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who go against the guidance of Allah and His Messenger will face humiliation. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobeying Allah and His teachings, indicating that a person's defiance towards the divine commandments will only lead to degradation and loss.
orig: إن الذين يحادون الله ورسوله أولئك في الأذلين

translation: Allah has written: 'I will surely overcome, I and My messengers.' Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of the victory of Allah and His messengers over all adversaries. It highlights the strength and might of Allah, reassuring believers that ultimately, the truth will prevail. It also serves as a reminder that no matter the challenges faced, believers should trust in the power and supremacy of Allah.
orig: كتب الله لأغلبن أنا ورسلي إن الله قوي عزيز

translation: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. Those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of loyalty to Allah and His Messenger above all else. It emphasizes that true believers should not have affection or support for those who go against the teachings of Allah and the Prophet Muhammad, even if they are close relatives. Those who maintain faith in their hearts and stay loyal to Allah will be rewarded with paradise, where they will dwell eternally in pleasure. This verse serves as a reminder of the importance of staying steadfast in one's faith and loyalty to Allah.
orig: لا تجد قوما يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر يوادون من حاد الله ورسوله ولو كانوا آباءهم أو أبناءهم أو إخوانهم أو عشيرتهم أولئك كتب في قلوبهم الإيمان وأيدهم بروح منه ويدخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه أولئك حزب الله ألا إن حزب الله هم المفلحون

translation: Glorify Allah, whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth; and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omnipotence and wisdom of Allah, and commands the glorification of Him for all that exists in the heavens and the earth. It serves as a reminder of His power and wisdom as the Creator and Sustainer of all things in the universe.
orig: سبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He it is Who turned out those who disbelieved from among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah. But [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts so they destroyed their homes by their own hands and the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O you who have insight.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the power and authority of Allah in dealing with those who opposed and disbelieved. It shows how Allah can uproot the arrogant and rebellious from their positions of security and authority when they transgress the limits set by Him. The verse also emphasizes the importance of reflection and drawing lessons from the incidents mentioned, especially for those who possess insight and understanding.
orig: هو الذي أخرج الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب من ديارهم لأول الحشر ما ظننتم أن يخرجوا وظنوا أنهم مانعتهم حصونهم من الله فأتاهم الله من حيث لم يحتسبوا وقذف في قلوبهم الرعب يخربون بيوتهم بأيديهم وأيدي المؤمنين فاعتبروا يا أولي الأبصار

translation: And if it were not that Allah had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in this world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse illustrates that sometimes people may seemingly escape punishment in this world, but if it's not for God's divine decree of mercy or wisdom, they would face consequences in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder of divine justice and warn those who do wrong that they cannot evade accountability forever.
orig: ولولا أن كتب الله عليهم الجلاء لعذبهم في الدنيا ولهم في الآخرة عذاب النار

translation: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who go against the commands of Allah and His Messenger will face severe consequences. It serves as a warning to believers to stay obedient and not challenge the will of Allah, as He is strict in punishment for those who defy Him.
orig: ذلك بأنهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاق الله فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: Whatever you cut down of a palm tree or left standing on its roots, it was by permission of Allah and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything that happens, even the cutting down or leaving standing of a palm tree, occurs by the permission of Allah. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, all events are under the control of Allah, and He allows them to happen for a purpose. It also warns the wrongdoers that those who openly disobey Allah will ultimately be disgraced.
orig: ما قطعتم من لينة أو تركتموها قائمة على أصولها فبإذن الله وليخزي الفاسقين

translation: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allah and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying the commands of Allah and His Messenger. It highlights that everything given to the Messenger is under the control of Allah and is intended for specific recipients like the Messenger himself, his relatives, orphans, and travelers, rather than for the wealthy elite. The verse calls for following the guidance of the Messenger and refraining from what he forbids. It stresses the need to be mindful of Allah's authority and the consequences of disobedience.
orig: وما أفاء الله على رسوله منهم فما أوجفتم عليه من خيل ولا ركاب ولكن الله يسلط رسله على من يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Whatever Allah has restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns is for Allah, the Messenger, the near of kin, the orphans, the needy, and the wayfarer, so that it may not circulate solely among those of you who are rich. And whatever the Messenger gives you, take it; and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it. And fear Allah; surely, Allah is severe in retribution.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the distribution of wealth and resources in a just and equitable manner by outlining those who deserve a share including the Prophet, his kin, orphans, the needy, and travelers. It also instructs the believers to follow the guidance and prohibitions of the Messenger, and to be mindful of God's commandments, as God is just and strict in enforcing His laws.
orig: ما أفاء الله على رسوله من أهل القرى فلله وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل كي لا يكون دولة بين الأغنياء منكم وما آتاكم الرسول فخذوه وما نهاكم عنه فانتهوا واتقوا الله إن الله شديد العقاب

translation: To the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and properties, seeking bounty from Allah and approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger. Those are the truthful.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the sincere and truthful believers among the poor migrants who were forced out of their homes and lands, seeking the bounty and approval of Allah. They support and uphold Allah and His Messenger, showing their true dedication and faith.
orig: للفقراء المهاجرين الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم وأموالهم يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا وينصرون الله ورسوله أولئك هم الصادقون

translation: And [also for] those who were settled in al-Madinah and [adopted] the faith before them. They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the virtue of the Ansar (the Helpers) who welcomed and supported the Muhajirun (the Emigrants) in Al-Madinah. It emphasizes the generosity, selflessness, and love that the Ansar showed towards the Muhajirun, even though they themselves were not wealthy. The verse praises those who overcome their greed and prioritize the well-being of others over their own needs, stating that they are the ones who will achieve success.
orig: والذين تبوءوا الدار والإيمان من قبلهم يحبون من هاجر إليهم ولا يجدون في صدورهم حاجة مما أوتوا ويؤثرون على أنفسهم ولو كان بهم خصاصة ومن يوق شح نفسه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And those who came after them say, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts any resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity and compassion among believers. It teaches Muslims to seek forgiveness not only for themselves but also for their fellow believers who came before them. Additionally, it advises against harboring ill feelings or resentment towards other believers. The verse highlights the qualities of kindness and mercy as essential virtues in Islam.
orig: والذين جاءوا من بعدهم يقولون ربنا اغفر لنا ولإخواننا الذين سبقونا بالإيمان ولا تجعل في قلوبنا غلا للذين آمنوا ربنا إنك رءوف رحيم

translation: Have you not considered those who hypocritically say to their brothers who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, 'If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you.' But Allah testifies that they are liars.
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceitful nature of the hypocrites who claim allegiance to both sides but are actually deceptive in their intentions. They pretend to support the Muslims when in reality, they side with the disbelievers. It serves as a warning against hypocrisy and the importance of genuine intentions and loyalty.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين نافقوا يقولون لإخوانهم الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب لئن أخرجتم لنخرجن معكم ولا نطيع فيكم أحدا أبدا وإن قوتلتم لننصرنكم والله يشهد إنهم لكاذبون

translation: If they are driven out, they do not leave with them, and if they are fought, they do not help them. And if they help them, they will turn their backs; then [there will be] no help.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fickle and untrustworthy nature of some people who may claim to support and assist others, but when the time comes for them to fulfill their promises and offer help, they show their true colors by abandoning those in need. It warns against false alliances and insincere friendships, emphasizing the importance of choosing companions and allies wisely.
orig: لئن أخرجوا لا يخرجون معهم ولئن قوتلوا لا ينصرونهم ولئن نصروهم ليولن الأدبار ثم لا ينصرون

translation: For they fear you more than they fear Allah- but how little do they reflect!
interpretation: This verse highlights a warning about people who fear and respect worldly authority more than the authority of Allah. It emphasizes that such people lack understanding and fail to reflect on the real importance of fearing Allah above all else.
orig: لأنتم أشد رهبة في صدورهم من الله ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
interpretation: This verse describes the tactics of those who oppose believers, indicating that they are not likely to engage in open combat but rather resort to attacking from fortified positions or through deceitful means. It underscores the disunity and lack of coherence among such opponents, cautioning believers to be aware of the varying intentions within this group. The verse highlights the importance of critical thinking and understanding in dealing with adversaries.
orig: لا يقاتلونكم جميعا إلا في قرى محصنة أو من وراء جدر بأسهم بينهم شديد تحسبهم جميعا وقلوبهم شتى ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعقلون

translation: Like those before them shortly tasted the evil consequences of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability and justice of divine retribution for those who defy the guidance and warnings provided by God. It serves as a reminder that those who came before faced the consequences of their actions, and those who persist in wrongdoing will also experience the painful punishment awaiting them. It underlines the importance of heeding the lessons of the past and adhering to the teachings and commands of God to avoid similar consequences.
orig: كمثل الذين من قبلهم قريبا ذاقوا وبال أمرهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And the example of the devil, when he says to man, 'Disbelieve.' But when he disbelieves, he says, 'Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse serves as an example illustrating the deception of Satan. It highlights how Satan entices individuals to disbelief by whispering doubts and temptations, only to distance himself when his influence leads them astray. The verse emphasizes the cunning nature of Satan and warns believers to be vigilant against his deceitful tactics. It also underscores the importance of fearing Allah, the Lord of all creation, as a means of protection against falling into the traps set by Satan.
orig: كمثل الشيطان إذ قال للإنسان اكفر فلما كفر قال إني بريء منك إني أخاف الله رب العالمين

translation: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the consequence awaiting those who commit wrongdoing and fail to seek repentance. It serves as a warning about the punishment that awaits the unjust and unrepentant souls in the Hereafter, emphasizing that the Fire is the ultimate abode for those who persist in injustice and disobedience.
orig: فكان عاقبتهما أنهما في النار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء الظالمين

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to the believers to be mindful of their actions and their intentions. It emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah, being conscious of Him, and being aware of accountability for our deeds. It encourages self-reflection and urges individuals to consider the consequences of their actions, both in this life and in the hereafter, as Allah is fully aware of all that we do.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله ولتنظر نفس ما قدمت لغد واتقوا الله إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse warns against forgetting or neglecting Allah, the consequences of which are severe. Those who forget Allah end up losing touch with their own souls and ultimately become disobedient and deviate from the path of righteousness. It serves as a reminder to never lose sight of the importance of remembering Allah in all aspects of life in order to maintain spiritual well-being and righteousness.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين نسوا الله فأنساهم أنفسهم أولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: The dwellers of the Fire and the dwellers of Paradise are not equal; the dwellers of Paradise are the winners.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fundamental difference between the fate of those who will be in Hell and those who will be in Paradise. It clarifies that the two groups are not equal in their outcomes, with the people of Paradise being the triumphant ones. The verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate reward and punishment awaiting individuals based on their actions and faith in this life.
orig: لا يستوي أصحاب النار وأصحاب الجنة أصحاب الجنة هم الفائزون

translation: Had We sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from the fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and significance of the Qur'an by illustrating that if it were to be revealed on a mountain, the mountain would crumble out of awe and fear of Allah. The verse also highlights the importance of reflecting on the examples and teachings provided in the Qur'an, encouraging people to contemplate its messages and gain deeper understanding.
orig: لو أنزلنا هذا القرآن على جبل لرأيته خاشعا متصدعا من خشية الله وتلك الأمثال نضربها للناس لعلهم يتفكرون

translation: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the oneness of Allah, who is the All-Knowing of both the unseen and the witnessed. It emphasizes His attributes of mercy and compassion, being Most Gracious and Most Merciful towards His creation.
orig: هو الله الذي لا إله إلا هو عالم الغيب والشهادة هو الرحمن الرحيم

translation: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Source of Faith, the Preserver, the Mighty, the Compeller, the Supreme. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique and supreme qualities of Allah. It emphasizes the oneness of Allah as the only deity worthy of worship, and describes Him using powerful and majestic attributes such as Sovereign, Pure, Preserver, and Mighty. The verse also underscores the greatness and grandeur of Allah by stating that He is exalted above any partners or associations that people may attribute to Him.
orig: هو الله الذي لا إله إلا هو الملك القدوس السلام المؤمن المهيمن العزيز الجبار المتكبر سبحان الله عما يشركون

translation: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine attributes of Allah as the Creator, the Inventor, and the Fashioner, highlighting His uniqueness and power in shaping all existence. It also underscores the idea that everything in the heavens and the earth glorifies and praises Allah, emphasizing His supreme authority and wisdom.
orig: هو الله الخالق البارئ المصور له الأسماء الحسنى يسبح له ما في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [do] take them not as friends. You confide to them affection, but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against taking as allies those who are openly hostile to Islam and to them. It emphasizes the importance of staying true to one's faith and principles, even if it means facing hardship. The verse also highlights the importance of sincerity and honesty in one's actions, reminding believers that nothing is hidden from Allah, and those who compromise their faith for the sake of worldly gains have indeed deviated from the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا عدوي وعدوكم أولياء تلقون إليهم بالمودة وقد كفروا بما جاءكم من الحق يخرجون الرسول وإياكم أن تؤمنوا بالله ربكم إن كنتم خرجتم جهادا في سبيلي وابتغاء مرضاتي تسرون إليهم بالمودة وأنا أعلم بما أخفيتم وما أعلنتم ومن يفعله منكم فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers that if the disbelievers gain power over them, they will act as enemies and harm them through physical and verbal aggression, and they would desire for the believers to abandon their faith. It serves as a reminder to the believers to remain steadfast in their faith and not be swayed by the hostility of the disbelievers.
orig: إن يثقفوكم يكونوا لكم أعداء ويبسطوا إليكم أيديهم وألسنتهم بالسوء وودوا لو تكفرون

translation: Your kindred and your children will not avail you on the Day of Resurrection; He will decide between you. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Resurrection, no relationships or children will be of benefit to a person in front of Allah. Each person will be judged based on their own actions and deeds, without favoritism towards family ties. It serves as a reminder that ultimately, our actions and deeds are what will determine our fate in the Hereafter.
orig: لن تنفعكم أرحامكم ولا أولادكم يوم القيامة يفصل بينكم والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: Indeed, there has been an excellent example for you in Abraham and those with him when they said to their people, 'Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone - except for the saying of Abraham to his father, 'I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah.' Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.'''
interpretation: This verse highlights the exemplary behavior of Prophet Abraham and those who were with him in their unwavering belief in the oneness of Allah. They were willing to disassociate themselves from those who worshipped other than Allah, even if it meant facing animosity and hatred. The verse also emphasizes the importance of relying on Allah and returning to Him in all matters, as Abraham did when he prayed for forgiveness for his father while recognizing that only Allah has the power to grant forgiveness.
orig: قد كانت لكم أسوة حسنة في إبراهيم والذين معه إذ قالوا لقومهم إنا برآء منكم ومما تعبدون من دون الله كفرنا بكم وبدا بيننا وبينكم العداوة والبغضاء أبدا حتى تؤمنوا بالله وحده إلا قول إبراهيم لأبيه لأستغفرن لك وما أملك لك من الله من شيء ربنا عليك توكلنا وإليك أنبنا وإليك المصير

translation: Our Lord, do not make us a trial for those who have disbelieved and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him to protect the believers from becoming a source of trial or temptation for those who have chosen to disbelieve. The believers are asking for forgiveness and mercy from Allah, acknowledging His power and wisdom in handling all matters. It highlights the believers' reliance on Allah's strength and knowledge in seeking protection, guidance, and forgiveness.
orig: ربنا لا تجعلنا فتنة للذين كفروا واغفر لنا ربنا إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed in the Messenger of Allah you have a good example for those who look to Allah and the Last Day, and remember Allah often.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the example of the Messenger of Allah, Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), for those who believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment. It encourages believers to emulate the virtues and behaviors of the Prophet as a source of guidance in their lives. The verse also highlights that Allah is self-sufficient and worthy of all praise, reinforcing the idea that following the Prophet's example leads to spiritual growth and closeness to Allah.
orig: لقد كان لكم فيهم أسوة حسنة لمن كان يرجو الله واليوم الآخر ومن يتول فإن الله هو الغني الحميد

translation: Perhaps Allah will put between you and those whom you have enmity some friendship. And Allah is competent, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the hope that Allah may mend relationships and create love and understanding between individuals who were previously enemies. It highlights Allah's power to bring about reconciliation and His forgiving and merciful nature, encouraging believers to strive for forgiveness and peaceful resolutions in their relationships.
orig: عسى الله أن يجعل بينكم وبين الذين عاديتم منهم مودة والله قدير والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of maintaining justice and kindness towards those who do not pose a threat to you or your faith. It highlights the Islamic principle of treating others with fairness and kindness, regardless of their beliefs or backgrounds. The verse teaches Muslims to deal with non-Muslims in a just and respectful manner, as righteousness and fairness are qualities that are beloved by Allah.
orig: لا ينهاكم الله عن الذين لم يقاتلوكم في الدين ولم يخرجوكم من دياركم أن تبروهم وتقسطوا إليهم إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: Allah only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to the believers that Allah prohibits them from befriending or allying with those who have fought against them due to their faith, evicted them from their homes, and assisted in their expulsion. It serves as a warning to maintain loyalty with those who share a common faith and not to align with those who have shown enmity towards the believers and their beliefs.
orig: إنما ينهاكم الله عن الذين قاتلوكم في الدين وأخرجوكم من دياركم وظاهروا على إخراجكم أن تولوهم ومن يتولهم فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing of their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to test and verify the faith of women who seek refuge with them. If it is confirmed that these women are believers, then they should not be returned to those who reject faith, as such women are not permissible for disbelievers, nor are disbelievers permissible for them. However, believers are to return to disbelievers any wealth that was spent by them for these women. It further gives permission for believers to marry these women after giving them their rightful dowries. The verse also emphasizes that believers should not maintain marital relationships with disbelieving women, and should settle financial matters fairly. Ultimately, the judgment is in the hands of Allah, who is All-Knowing and Wise.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا جاءكم المؤمنات مهاجرات فامتحنوهن الله أعلم بإيمانهن فإن علمتموهن مؤمنات فلا ترجعوهن إلى الكفار لا هن حل لهم ولا هم يحلون لهن وآتوهم ما أنفقوا ولا جناح عليكم أن تنكحوهن إذا آتيتموهن أجورهن ولا تمسكوا بعصم الكوافر واسألوا ما أنفقتم وليسألوا ما أنفقوا ذلكم حكم الله يحكم بينكم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and then you retaliate, then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
interpretation: This verse addresses the situation where Muslim men who have lost their wives to non-believers seek to retaliate against them. The verse instructs to give a compensation to the men whose wives have left them, equal to the amount they had spent on their wives. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of maintaining consciousness of Allah in all actions, reminding the believers to be mindful of their faith in Allah even in difficult circumstances.
orig: وإن فاتكم شيء من أزواجكم إلى الكفار فعاقبتم فآتوا الذين ذهبت أزواجهم مثل ما أنفقوا واتقوا الله الذي أنتم به مؤمنون

translation: O Prophet, when believing women come to you pledging that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor steal, nor commit adultery, nor kill their children, nor bring forth slander falsely, nor disobey you in any matter of righteousness, then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) instructing him on how to deal with the pledges of allegiance that believing women make. The verse outlines the conditions for their purity and righteousness, emphasizing key aspects of faith and morality that they must uphold. It highlights the importance of belief in the Oneness of Allah, honesty, chastity, respect for life, truthfulness, and obedience to the Prophet. The verse encourages the Prophet to accept their pledges and seek forgiveness for them from Allah, emphasizing Allah's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: يا أيها النبي إذا جاءك المؤمنات يبايعنك على أن لا يشركن بالله شيئا ولا يسرقن ولا يزنين ولا يقتلن أولادهن ولا يأتين ببهتان يفترينه بين أيديهن وأرجلهن ولا يعصينك في معروف فبايعهن واستغفر لهن الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those who are the recipients of anger from Allah, for they have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against forming close relationships with people who have earned the anger of Allah, as these individuals have lost hope in the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have no hope of meeting those in the graves. It serves as a reminder to choose companions who are on the path of righteousness and who uphold faith to avoid being influenced negatively by those who have strayed from the path of God.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم قد يئسوا من الآخرة كما يئس الكفار من أصحاب القبور

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal and comprehensive nature of the glorification of Allah by everything in the heavens and on earth. It emphasizes that all aspects of creation declare the greatness and perfection of Allah through their existence and obedience to His divine will. Furthermore, it emphasizes two important attributes of Allah - His Might and His Wisdom - underscoring His power, authority, and infinite knowledge in all matters.
orig: سبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the believers to uphold their words with actions. It questions the inconsistency between one's declarations of faith and their actual behaviors. It emphasizes the importance of aligning one's words with their deeds, highlighting the significance of sincerity and integrity in one's faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لم تقولون ما لا تفعلون

translation: It is greatly hateful to Allah that you say what you do not do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of practicing what one preaches. It conveys that it is detestable in the sight of Allah for individuals to speak about good deeds or instructions without actually implementing them in their own lives. Hypocrisy is condemned, and sincerity and authenticity in actions and speech are highly valued in Islam.
orig: كبر مقتا عند الله أن تقولوا ما لا تفعلون

translation: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of unity and discipline in the struggle for the sake of God. It emphasizes the power and beauty of cohesion among believers who fight together for a righteous cause. Just as a well-built structure is strong and formidable, believers who are united in purpose and action are more likely to succeed and receive the love and support of Allah.
orig: إن الله يحب الذين يقاتلون في سبيله صفا كأنهم بنيان مرصوص

translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?' And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) addressing his people about their mistreatment towards him despite knowing his prophethood. When they persisted in their wrongdoing, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. This serves as a reminder that deviating from the truth leads to further deviation in one's heart, and Allah does not guide those who persist in disobedience.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم لم تؤذونني وقد تعلمون أني رسول الله إليكم فلما زاغوا أزاغ الله قلوبهم والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, 'O Children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad.' But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, 'This is obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an highlights the prophecy made by Jesus (peace be upon him) about the coming of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Jesus informed the Children of Israel that he was sent by Allah to confirm the teachings of the Torah and to bring the glad tidings of a final messenger to follow him, whose name would be Ahmad (one of the names of Prophet Muhammad). Even with clear signs and miracles, some people refused to believe and accused Jesus of performing magic.
orig: وإذ قال عيسى ابن مريم يا بني إسرائيل إني رسول الله إليكم مصدقا لما بين يدي من التوراة ومبشرا برسول يأتي من بعدي اسمه أحمد فلما جاءهم بالبينات قالوا هذا سحر مبين

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah while he is being invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the severe injustice committed by those who fabricate lies about Allah despite being called to the truth of Islam. It emphasizes that Allah does not guide those who do wrong and spread falsehood about Him.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله الكذب وهو يدعى إلى الإسلام والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will complete His light even if the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the futile attempts of disbelievers to extinguish the truth and guidance provided by Allah through their words and actions. However, the light of Allah's guidance and truth is complete and will prevail, regardless of the opposition from those who reject it. This verse serves as a reassurance for believers that the truth will ultimately prevail over falsehood.
orig: يريدون ليطفئوا نور الله بأفواههم والله متم نوره ولو كره الكافرون

translation: He it is who has sent His messenger with guidance and the religion of truth, that He may make it prevail over all religion, however much the idolaters may be averse.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has sent His messenger with guidance and the true religion in order to establish it as the dominant faith, regardless of the resistance and opposition from those who associate partners with Allah. It signifies the ultimate victory of truth over falsehood, even if disbelievers and idolaters may dislike it.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون

translation: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the believers and inviting them to a spiritual transaction or deal that will result in their protection from a severe punishment. The transaction referred to here is likely the act of obedience to Allah, which brings blessings, protection, and salvation from torment.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا هل أدلكم على تجارة تنجيكم من عذاب أليم

translation: You believe in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Allah and following the guidance of His Messenger. It also highlights the significance of making sacrifices in the path of Allah, whether it be through giving from one's wealth or through physical effort. The verse suggests that such commitment and dedication to the cause of Allah will bring about the best outcomes for individuals, if they truly understand the wisdom behind these actions.
orig: تؤمنون بالله ورسوله وتجاهدون في سبيل الله بأموالكم وأنفسكم ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to beautiful dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the immense mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards believers. It promises the forgiveness of sins, entrance into Paradise with flowing rivers and the most pleasant abodes in the eternal Gardens of Eden. It emphasizes that achieving this reward is the ultimate success and attainment for a believer.
orig: يغفر لكم ذنوبكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ومساكن طيبة في جنات عدن ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And another [favor] that you love - victory from Allah and an imminent conquest. And give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the promise of victory and triumph from Allah, which will soon be realized. It is a message of hope and encouragement for the believers, reminding them of the ultimate success that awaits those who remain steadfast in their faith and obedience to Allah.
orig: وأخرى تحبونها نصر من الله وفتح قريب وبشر المؤمنين

translation: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, 'Who are my supporters for Allah?' The disciples said, 'We are supporters of Allah.' And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.
interpretation: This verse calls upon the believers to be supporters of Allah, just as Jesus asked his disciples who among them would support the cause of Allah. It highlights the concept of believers being steadfast in their faith and standing up against any opposition or enemies they may face. It also demonstrates the definitive victory of the believers over the disbelievers when they have the support of Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا أنصار الله كما قال عيسى ابن مريم للحواريين من أنصاري إلى الله قال الحواريون نحن أنصار الله فآمنت طائفة من بني إسرائيل وكفرت طائفة فأيدنا الذين آمنوا على عدوهم فأصبحوا ظاهرين

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms that all beings in the heavens and the earth glorify and praise Allah, acknowledging His sovereignty, purity, might, and wisdom. It emphasizes the omnipotence and wisdom of Allah, indicating that everything in the universe is in submission to Him and recognizes His greatness.
orig: يسبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض الملك القدوس العزيز الحكيم

translation: He it is Who has sent among the unlettered ones a Messenger (Muhammad) from among themselves, reciting to them His Verses, purifying them, and teaching them the Book and the Wisdom, although they were before in manifest error.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger sent by Allah to the unlettered community, guiding them by reciting the divine verses, purifying their hearts, teaching them the scriptures and imparting wisdom. It emphasizes that despite being in clear error before, through the guidance of the Prophet, they were led to the right path and enlightenment.
orig: هو الذي بعث في الأميين رسولا منهم يتلو عليهم آياته ويزكيهم ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة وإن كانوا من قبل لفي ضلال مبين

translation: And others among them, when they join them, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights that there are others among the believers who will join the community of believers. It emphasizes that God is Mighty, with power beyond measure, and Wise, with profound wisdom in His actions and decisions. This serves as a reminder of God's attributes and an encouragement for believers to trust in His power and wisdom.
orig: وآخرين منهم لما يلحقوا بهم وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: That is the bounty of Allah, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the blessings and favors bestowed upon individuals are solely at the discretion of Allah. It highlights the concept of divine favor and generosity, reminding believers that all blessings come from Allah, the possessor of immense generosity and favor.
orig: ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of not just having knowledge or being entrusted with a message, but actually carrying it out and living by it. It criticizes those who neglect the teachings they were given, comparing them to a donkey carrying heavy burdens without benefitting from them. The verse warns against rejecting the signs of Allah and emphasizes that those who do wrong and deny the truth will not be guided by Allah.
orig: مثل الذين حملوا التوراة ثم لم يحملوها كمثل الحمار يحمل أسفارا بئس مثل القوم الذين كذبوا بآيات الله والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Say, 'O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah to the exclusion of [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the Jews who claimed to be the chosen people of Allah. It challenges them to wish for death if they truly believe that they are the only ones favored by Allah. The verse reminds them that true piety and closeness to Allah are not based on lineage or ethnicity, but on faith and good deeds.
orig: قل يا أيها الذين هادوا إن زعمتم أنكم أولياء لله من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And they will never wish for it, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the wrongdoers will not desire the punishment they receive, as they will be aware that it is a consequence of their own actions and choices in the world. It highlights how individuals will have full awareness and acknowledgment of their deeds and their implications, and that Allah is fully aware of the injustice committed by those who oppress others.
orig: ولا يتمنونه أبدا بما قدمت أيديهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that death is inevitable and cannot be escaped. It emphasizes that after death, individuals will stand before the Knower of all things, who will reveal and account for all their actions. It is a call to reflect on one's deeds and prepare for the accountability of the Hereafter.
orig: قل إن الموت الذي تفرون منه فإنه ملاقيكم ثم تردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an reminds the believers to prioritize attending the Friday prayer over their worldly affairs. It encourages them to leave behind their business transactions and engage in remembering Allah during the designated time for congregational prayer on Fridays. The verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing spiritual development and connecting with Allah's remembrance as a means of seeking goodness and blessings in their lives.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا نودي للصلاة من يوم الجمعة فاسعوا إلى ذكر الله وذروا البيع ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: So when you have finished the prayer, disperse in the land and seek the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking sustenance and livelihood after performing prayers, as well as frequent remembrance of Allah. It reminds believers that success in this life and the Hereafter is achieved through a balance of fulfilling worldly responsibilities and maintaining a strong connection with Allah through constant remembrance.
orig: فإذا قضيت الصلاة فانتشروا في الأرض وابتغوا من فضل الله واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And when they see trade or amusement, they break away to it and leave you standing. Say, 'What is with Allah is better than amusement and than trade, and Allah is the best of providers.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that their primary focus should always be on seeking the pleasure of Allah and striving in His worship. When distractions such as business or entertainment arise, believers are encouraged to remember that what Allah has in store for them is better than temporary worldly pursuits. It serves as a reminder to prioritize the spiritual over the material, as Allah is the best provider and sustainer.
orig: وإذا رأوا تجارة أو لهوا انفضوا إليها وتركوك قائما قل ما عند الله خير من اللهو ومن التجارة والله خير الرازقين

translation: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, 'We testify that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah.' Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
interpretation: This verse highlights the deceitful nature of hypocrites who pretend to believe in the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) outwardly, while internally harboring disbelief. It warns against false testimonies and insincerity in faith. The verse emphasizes that only Allah truly knows the hearts of people, distinguishing between the sincere believers and the hypocrites.
orig: إذا جاءك المنافقون قالوا نشهد إنك لرسول الله والله يعلم إنك لرسوله والله يشهد إن المنافقين لكاذبون

translation: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who use false oaths and deceit to mislead people and turn them away from the path of Allah. It highlights the hypocrisy and evil deeds of those who manipulate others for their own gain, emphasizing the wrongfulness of such actions in the sight of Allah.
orig: اتخذوا أيمانهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: That is because they believed, then they disbelieved, so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.
interpretation: This verse explains that the reason some people do not understand the message of faith is that they initially believed but then rejected faith. As a consequence of their disbelief, their hearts became sealed, making them unable to comprehend the truth and guidance of God.
orig: ذلك بأنهم آمنوا ثم كفروا فطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون

translation: And when you see them, their bodies please you; and if they speak, you listen to their words. They are as if they were pieces of wood propped up. They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse is warning the believers about hypocrites and their deceitful nature. Hypocrites may outwardly appear pleasant or agreeable, but their intentions are false and deceptive. They are described as being like pieces of wood propped up, meaning they lack depth and sincerity and are easily swayed by external influences. The verse encourages believers to be cautious of hypocrites who pretend to be allies but are actually enemies and to trust in Allah to expose their falsehood.
orig: وإذا رأيتهم تعجبك أجسامهم وإن يقولوا تسمع لقولهم كأنهم خشب مسندة يحسبون كل صيحة عليهم هم العدو فاحذرهم قاتلهم الله أنى يؤفكون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you,' they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and pride of certain people who, despite being offered the opportunity to seek forgiveness through the intercession of the Messenger of Allah, refuse to do so. They display their arrogance by physically turning away and avoiding the opportunity for forgiveness, emphasizing their unwillingness to humble themselves before Allah.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا يستغفر لكم رسول الله لووا رءوسهم ورأيتهم يصدون وهم مستكبرون

translation: Whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them, even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, Allah will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that seeking forgiveness for those who have knowingly rejected faith and have actively opposed God and His Messenger will not result in their forgiveness. It highlights the importance of sincere belief and obedience to Allah, and that forgiveness is only granted to those who are willing to repent and submit to His guidance.
orig: سواء عليهم أستغفرت لهم أم لم تستغفر لهم لن يغفر الله لهم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: They are the ones who say, 'Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband.' And to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of hypocrites who try to discourage spending on those who are with the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by spreading false excuses. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate provider of all resources and wealth, and criticizes the lack of understanding and faith among the hypocrites.
orig: هم الذين يقولون لا تنفقوا على من عند رسول الله حتى ينفضوا ولله خزائن السماوات والأرض ولكن المنافقين لا يفقهون

translation: They say, 'If we return to Al-Madinah, the most honorable [of people] will surely expel therefrom the most humble.' But honor belongs to Allah, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the theme of true honor and dignity being bestowed by Allah, His Messenger, and the believers, rather than being determined by societal status or outward appearances. Hypocrites fail to understand the true essence of honor and dignity which comes from faith and righteousness.
orig: يقولون لئن رجعنا إلى المدينة ليخرجن الأعز منها الأذل ولله العزة ولرسوله وللمؤمنين ولكن المنافقين لا يعلمون

translation: O you who have believed, let not your wealth or your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers not to let their wealth and children distract them from remembering Allah. It serves as a warning that those who are heedless of the remembrance of Allah due to their attachment to material possessions will ultimately be at a loss spiritually. The verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the remembrance of Allah over worldly distractions and highlights the detrimental consequences of neglecting this fundamental aspect of faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تلهكم أموالكم ولا أولادكم عن ذكر الله ومن يفعل ذلك فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And spend [in the way of Allah] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, 'My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to spend in the way of Allah from the wealth and provisions they have been given before it is too late. It warns against procrastination in doing good deeds and emphasizes the importance of charity and righteousness in securing a favorable outcome in the hereafter. It reminds us to prioritize acts of goodness and charity in our lives without delay, as death can come suddenly and there may not be a chance for repentance or righteous deeds once it arrives.
orig: وأنفقوا من ما رزقناكم من قبل أن يأتي أحدكم الموت فيقول رب لولا أخرتني إلى أجل قريب فأصدق وأكن من الصالحين

translation: And Allah does not delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that the appointed time of death for each individual is predetermined by Allah and cannot be delayed. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of all our actions and deeds, making it clear that we should strive to lead a righteous life and not be deceived by the illusion of postponing our fate, as the time of death is certain and cannot be altered.
orig: ولن يؤخر الله نفسا إذا جاء أجلها والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah. To Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs the praise, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universal glorification of Allah by all creations in the heavens and the earth. It highlights Allah's sovereignty and power over everything, with all praise belonging to Him. The verse serves to remind believers of Allah's supreme authority and capability over all aspects of existence.
orig: يسبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض له الملك وله الحمد وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: He it is Who created you, then some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers; and Allah is All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the diversity of belief among human beings, highlighting that even though all are created by Allah, some choose to believe in Him while others reject Him. It serves as a reminder that Allah sees and is aware of the actions and choices of each individual, whether they are believers or not.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم فمنكم كافر ومنكم مؤمن والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: He created the heavens and the earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate power and authority of Allah as the Creator of the heavens and the earth. It also emphasizes how Allah created humans with perfection and beauty, and that the ultimate destiny and return is to Him. It serves as a reminder of the purpose of creation and the belief in the divine wisdom and ultimate accountability before Allah.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق وصوركم فأحسن صوركم وإليه المصير

translation: He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse highlights the all-encompassing knowledge of Allah. He is fully aware of everything within the heavens and the earth, as well as all that is hidden and all that is made known by His creatures. The verse emphasizes that Allah is even aware of the secrets and intentions hidden in the hearts of people.
orig: يعلم ما في السماوات والأرض ويعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون والله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Has there not reached you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the consequences faced by the disbelievers who rejected the truth before, and warns the listeners to learn from their fate. It serves as a reminder of the severe punishment that awaits those who choose to persist in disbelief and disobedience to God.
orig: ألم يأتكم نبأ الذين كفروا من قبل فذاقوا وبال أمرهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, 'Shall mere mortals guide us?' So they disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed with them, and Allah is Free of need, Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences for those who rejected the messengers sent by Allah despite the clear signs and guidance they brought. The disbelievers arrogantly dismissed the messengers' guidance, thinking themselves above being led by human beings. As a result, they turned away from the truth and Allah's guidance towards disbelief. Ultimately, Allah has no need for anyone, as He is self-sufficient, and He is deserving of all praise and gratitude.
orig: ذلك بأنه كانت تأتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فقالوا أبشر يهدوننا فكفروا وتولوا واستغنى الله والله غني حميد

translation: Those who disbelieve claim that they will not be resurrected. Say, 'Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will be informed of what you did. And that is easy for Allah.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the arrogance and disbelief of those who reject the idea of resurrection after death. Despite their denial, the verse asserts that resurrection will indeed happen by the will of Allah. It emphasizes accountability for one's actions, as all deeds will be brought to light and every individual will be made aware of their deeds. The verse concludes by highlighting the ease with which Allah can bring about resurrection, underscoring His infinite power and control over the affairs of the hereafter.
orig: زعم الذين كفروا أن لن يبعثوا قل بلى وربي لتبعثن ثم لتنبؤن بما عملتم وذلك على الله يسير

translation: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Allah, belief in His Messenger, and following the guidance and revelations sent down. It also serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of all our actions and deeds, encouraging believers to adhere to righteousness as He is fully aware and knowledgeable of everything.
orig: فآمنوا بالله ورسوله والنور الذي أنزلنا والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: The day He will gather you for the Day of Assembly, that is the Day of Deception. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability before Allah on the Day of Judgment. Those who believe in Allah and perform good deeds will be forgiven for their sins and will be rewarded with entry into eternal gardens in Paradise, where they will reside forever. The verse highlights the ultimate success and achievement that awaits those who sincerely follow the path of faith and righteousness.
orig: يوم يجمعكم ليوم الجمع ذلك يوم التغابن ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يكفر عنه سيئاته ويدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally, and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of those who reject the signs of Allah and deny His revelations. They are destined to be the dwellers of Hell, where they will remain forever. The verse emphasizes the severity of their fate and underscores the terrible consequences of their disbelief.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب النار خالدين فيها وبئس المصير

translation: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse illustrates the belief in the concept of divine decree in Islam, affirming that no calamity or misfortune occurs unless it is permitted by Allah. It also highlights the importance of faith in Allah, stating that those who believe in Him will find guidance and comfort for their hearts. Ultimately, it emphasizes that Allah has complete knowledge and awareness of all things.
orig: ما أصاب من مصيبة إلا بإذن الله ومن يؤمن بالله يهد قلبه والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only the [duty of] clear notification.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying both Allah and the Messenger (Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him). It highlights that the responsibility of the Messenger is to clearly convey the message, and if people choose to turn away from it, the Messenger has fulfilled his duty by conveying the message to them.
orig: وأطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول فإن توليتم فإنما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين

translation: Allah! There is no deity except Him, and upon Allah let the believers rely.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of putting trust and reliance upon Allah for the believers. It serves as a reminder that true believers should have faith and confidence in Allah for all matters, and that He is the ultimate source of guidance, support, and protection.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers that there may be instances where one's own family members, like spouses or children, could potentially act as adversaries or obstacles in their faith journey. It urges caution and vigilance in such situations. However, it also emphasizes the virtues of forgiveness, pardon, and overlooking faults, for Allah is described as the Most Forgiving and Merciful. Ultimately, the verse encourages believers to maintain good relations with their family members while also practicing forgiveness and seeking Allah's mercy.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن من أزواجكم وأولادكم عدوا لكم فاحذروهم وإن تعفوا وتصفحوا وتغفروا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Your wealth and your children are only a trial, whereas Allah with Him is a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that worldly possessions and family are merely a test from Allah. True success and reward lie in the sight of Allah, not in material wealth or offspring. This serves as a reminder to believers to prioritize seeking the pleasure of Allah over worldly attachments.
orig: إنما أموالكم وأولادكم فتنة والله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allah]; it is better for your souls. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah, obeying His commands, and being charitable. It teaches that spending in the way of Allah is beneficial for oneself, and those who are able to overcome the greed and stinginess of their souls are the ones who will achieve success in the eyes of Allah.
orig: فاتقوا الله ما استطعتم واسمعوا وأطيعوا وأنفقوا خيرا لأنفسكم ومن يوق شح نفسه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Appreciative and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the concept of giving in charity or performing good deeds for the sake of Allah. It reassures the believers that any good they do in the way of Allah will not go unnoticed or unrewarded. By loaning a good loan to Allah through good deeds, believers can expect their reward to be multiplied and their sins forgiven. It also highlights Allah's qualities of being Appreciative of His servants' efforts and Forbearing with their mistakes.
orig: إن تقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعفه لكم ويغفر لكم والله شكور حليم

translation: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive knowledge and wisdom of Allah, Who is aware of everything that is hidden and everything that is apparent. It also emphasizes Allah's might and wisdom, indicating that His actions are purposeful and wise beyond human comprehension.
orig: عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الحكيم

translation: O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And these are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allah will bring about after that a [different] matter.
interpretation: This verse addresses the Prophet Muhammad, instructing him on the proper conduct during divorce proceedings. It stresses the importance of observing the waiting period (iddah) for women after divorce, not expelling them from their homes unjustly, and the importance of fearing Allah. It sets boundaries for the process of divorce and warns against transgressing these limits. The verse also highlights the uncertainty of future events and the importance of trusting in Allah's wisdom and guidance.
orig: يا أيها النبي إذا طلقتم النساء فطلقوهن لعدتهن وأحصوا العدة واتقوا الله ربكم لا تخرجوهن من بيوتهن ولا يخرجن إلا أن يأتين بفاحشة مبينة وتلك حدود الله ومن يتعد حدود الله فقد ظلم نفسه لا تدري لعل الله يحدث بعد ذلك أمرا

translation: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allah. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out
interpretation: This verse addresses the rules related to divorce in Islam. It emphasizes the importance of treating women who are to be divorced with kindness and fairness. It instructs the believers to either retain their wives with kindness or part with them amicably if the marriage cannot continue. It also highlights the significance of bearing witness truthfully in matters relating to divorce, and reminds believers that those who fear Allah will always find a way out of their difficulties with His help and guidance.
orig: فإذا بلغن أجلهن فأمسكوهن بمعروف أو فارقوهن بمعروف وأشهدوا ذوي عدل منكم وأقيموا الشهادة لله ذلكم يوعظ به من كان يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ومن يتق الله يجعل له مخرجا

translation: And He provides for him from sources he could never imagine. And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of reliance on Allah and trust in His provision. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate provider and sustainer, providing from sources that are beyond human comprehension. By placing trust in Allah, one will find sufficiency and fulfillment, for Allah is able to fulfill His decreed purpose and has set a limit to everything.
orig: ويرزقه من حيث لا يحتسب ومن يتوكل على الله فهو حسبه إن الله بالغ أمره قد جعل الله لكل شيء قدرا

translation: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of determining waiting periods for women who have reached menopause, those who have not yet menstruated (such as young girls), and those who are pregnant. It emphasizes that those who fear Allah and act in accordance with His commands will find ease in their affairs. Overall, this verse serves as a reminder of the importance of righteousness and trust in Allah's guidance.
orig: واللائي يئسن من المحيض من نسائكم إن ارتبتم فعدتهن ثلاثة أشهر واللائي لم يحضن وأولات الأحمال أجلهن أن يضعن حملهن ومن يتق الله يجعل له من أمره يسرا

translation: This is the command of Allah, He has sent it down to you. And whoever fears Allah - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and following His command. It assures believers that those who have piety and consciousness of Allah will have their sins forgiven and will be rewarded abundantly in the Hereafter. It serves as a motivation for believers to stay on the right path and be mindful of their actions.
orig: ذلك أمر الله أنزله إليكم ومن يتق الله يكفر عنه سيئاته ويعظم له أجرا

translation: And live with them in kindness. If you dislike them, it may be that you dislike something in which God has placed much good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of treating one's spouse with kindness and respect, even if there are differences or disagreements between them. It highlights the value of maintaining a harmonious relationship within marriage, and suggests that there is inherent goodness and blessings from God in the bond between spouses. It encourages couples to seek mutual understanding and to resolve conflicts amicably, with the ultimate goal of fostering a loving and supportive marital relationship.
orig: أسكنوهن من حيث سكنتم من وجدكم ولا تضاروهن لتضيقوا عليهن وإن كن أولات حمل فأنفقوا عليهن حتى يضعن حملهن فإن أرضعن لكم فآتوهن أجورهن وأتمروا بينكم بمعروف وإن تعاسرتم فسترضع له أخرى

translation: Let the rich person spend according to his income, and the one whose resources are restricted should spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah never burdens a soul beyond what He has given it. Allah will grant ease after hardship.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of fairness and justice in acts of charity and monetary spending. It encourages people to spend and give charity in accordance with their means and financial capabilities. It reassures that Allah does not burden anyone beyond their capacity and promises that ease will come after hardship. Overall, the verse promotes balance, moderation, and trust in Allah's wisdom and kindness.
orig: لينفق ذو سعة من سعته ومن قدر عليه رزقه فلينفق مما آتاه الله لا يكلف الله نفسا إلا ما آتاها سيجعل الله بعد عسر يسرا

translation: And how many a city which transgressed against the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences faced by cities or communities that defied the guidance of their Lord and the messengers sent to them. It serves as a warning about the severe accountability and punishment that awaits those who reject the message of God and His messengers, emphasizing the importance of obedience and adherence to divine commandments.
orig: وكأين من قرية عتت عن أمر ربها ورسله فحاسبناها حسابا شديدا وعذبناها عذابا نكرا
