translation: So she was saved from it, and they were granted insight into the matter. And the outcome of her affair was successful.
interpretation: This verse refers to a situation where a woman was wrongly accused but was saved from the false accusations. It highlights the importance of patience, perseverance, and seeking guidance from God, as ultimately the truth prevails and justice prevails in the end.
orig: فذاقت وبال أمرها وكان عاقبة أمرها خسرا

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an as a reminder.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to believers to be mindful of Allah, who has prepared a severe punishment for those who disobey Him. It encourages believers, especially those of understanding, to be conscious of Allah, to fear His punishment, and to reflect upon the Qur'an as a source of guidance and reminder in order to stay on the right path.
orig: أعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا فاتقوا الله يا أولي الألباب الذين آمنوا قد أنزل الله إليكم ذكرا

translation: A Messenger reciting unto you the revelations of Allah made plain, that He may bring forth those who believe and do good works from darkness unto light. And whosoever believeth in Allah and doeth right, He will bring him into Gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein to abide for ever. Allah hath made good provision for him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the role of the Messenger in conveying the clear signs and revelations of Allah to lead the believers from darkness towards light, symbolizing the journey from ignorance to enlightenment through faith and righteous deeds. It highlights that those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Gardens beneath which rivers flow, as Allah will ensure their well-being and sustain them abundantly.
orig: رسولا يتلو عليكم آيات الله مبينات ليخرج الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات من الظلمات إلى النور ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا قد أحسن الله له رزقا

translation: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and knowledge of Allah. It highlights the intricate design of the universe with its seven heavens and earth, all of which Allah has created. The verse also indicates that Allah's commands are implemented throughout the heavens and the earth, demonstrating His authority and capability over all things. It serves as a reminder of Allah's omnipotence and omniscience, encouraging believers to recognize His sovereignty and wisdom in all aspects of creation.
orig: الله الذي خلق سبع سماوات ومن الأرض مثلهن يتنزل الأمر بينهن لتعلموا أن الله على كل شيء قدير وأن الله قد أحاط بكل شيء علما

translation: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and questions why he prohibited something permissible for himself out of seeking the pleasure of his wives. It serves as a reminder that one should not go to extremes in pleasing others, even if they are loved ones, if it means going against what is permissible according to the laws set by Allah. It also emphasizes that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful, and his laws are meant to bring ease, not unnecessary hardship.
orig: يا أيها النبي لم تحرم ما أحل الله لك تبتغي مرضات أزواجك والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah has made lawful for you the oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that Allah has set rules concerning the making of oaths, highlighting the importance of being truthful and trustworthy in keeping one's promises. It also emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate protector of believers, all-knowing and wise, guiding them in their actions and choices.
orig: قد فرض الله لكم تحلة أيمانكم والله مولاكم وهو العليم الحكيم

translation: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, 'Who told you this?' He said, 'I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the story of Prophet Muhammad confiding in one of his wives about a certain matter, and when she shared it with another wife, Allah revealed the matter to the Prophet. Rather than revealing the entire information, Prophet Muhammad disclosed some of it and withheld a part. When the wife asked how he came to know about it, he attributed it to Allah, who knows all and is well acquainted with everything. This verse emphasizes the importance of honesty, trustworthiness, and confidentiality in relationships.
orig: وإذ أسر النبي إلى بعض أزواجه حديثا فلما نبأت به وأظهره الله عليه عرف بعضه وأعرض عن بعض فلما نبأها به قالت من أنبأك هذا قال نبأني العليم الخبير

translation: If you two [wives] repent to Allah, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.
interpretation: This verse is referring to a situation where two wives of a man conspire against him. The verse advises the wives to repent to God as their actions have harmed their own hearts due to deviation from the right path. It further asserts that God, along with the angel Gabriel, righteous believers, and angels, will support the husband who is being conspired against. The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking repentance from God and warns against working together in wrongdoing.
orig: إن تتوبا إلى الله فقد صغت قلوبكما وإن تظاهرا عليه فإن الله هو مولاه وجبريل وصالح المؤمنين والملائكة بعد ذلك ظهير

translation: It may be if he divorces you [all], that his Lord will give him in your place wives better than you: submissive [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, penitent, worshipping, fasting, previously married or virgins.
interpretation: This verse discusses the possibility of Allah replacing the wives of a man who divorces them with other women who are more devout and obedient. It highlights the qualities of these women as being submissive to Allah, believing, devoutly obedient, penitent, worshipping, fasting, and having either been married previously or being virgins, implying that Allah's wisdom surpasses human understanding.
orig: عسى ربه إن طلقكن أن يبدله أزواجا خيرا منكن مسلمات مؤمنات قانتات تائبات عابدات سائحات ثيبات وأبكارا

translation: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
interpretation: This verse is a call to action for believers to safeguard themselves and their families from the punishment of Hell. It emphasizes the seriousness of this matter by describing the intensity of Hellfire and the nature of the angels appointed over it. The verse serves as a reminder for believers to be obedient to Allah's commandments, acting in accordance with His guidance and staying away from what He has forbidden.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا قوا أنفسكم وأهليكم نارا وقودها الناس والحجارة عليها ملائكة غلاظ شداد لا يعصون الله ما أمرهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون

translation: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers that on the Day of Judgment, they will not be able to make excuses for their disbelief. They will be held accountable and rewarded or punished based on their actions in this world. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and good deeds in Islam.
orig: يا أيها الذين كفروا لا تعتذروا اليوم إنما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, 'Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincere repentance to Allah for the believers, with the hope that Allah will forgive their sins and reward them with entry into gardens of Paradise on the Day of Judgment. The believers are described as having light emanating from them, indicating their righteousness and guidance, and they pray for the perfection of this light and for forgiveness, acknowledging Allah's unlimited power and authority.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا توبوا إلى الله توبة نصوحا عسى ربكم أن يكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يوم لا يخزي الله النبي والذين آمنوا معه نورهم يسعى بين أيديهم وبأيمانهم يقولون ربنا أتمم لنا نورنا واغفر لنا إنك على كل شيء قدير

translation: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse is urging the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to actively oppose and combat the disbelievers and hypocrites who pose a threat to the Muslim community. It emphasizes the seriousness of the situation, warning of the consequences awaiting those who oppose the faith. It serves as a reminder of the Prophet's duty to protect the believers and uphold the teachings of Islam against those who seek to undermine it.
orig: يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم ومأواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those two did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, 'Enter the Fire with those who enter.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of betrayal and disbelief. Even being in the company of righteous individuals does not guarantee salvation if one's actions are not in accordance with faith. It serves as a warning against hypocrisy and the importance of sincerity and faithfulness in relationships with both people and with Allah.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا للذين كفروا امرأت نوح وامرأت لوط كانتا تحت عبدين من عبادنا صالحين فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيئا وقيل ادخلا النار مع الداخلين

translation: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, 'My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse illustrates the sincere and profound faith of the wife of Pharaoh, despite being in a position of immense power and surrounded by tyranny and oppression. It highlights the importance of turning to Allah in supplication and seeking refuge in Him, even in the face of the greatest trials and challenges. It serves as a reminder of the power of prayer, faith, and seeking salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا للذين آمنوا امرأت فرعون إذ قالت رب ابن لي عندك بيتا في الجنة ونجني من فرعون وعمله ونجني من القوم الظالمين

translation: And Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, and We breathed into her of Our spirit, and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and His books, and she was of the devoutly obedient.
interpretation: This verse is talking about Mary, the mother of Jesus, who is being praised for her chastity, her belief in the words of her Lord, and her devotion to Him. It highlights her purity, her faith, and her obedience to God.
orig: ومريم ابنت عمران التي أحصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيه من روحنا وصدقت بكلمات ربها وكتبه وكانت من القانتين

translation: Blessed is He in whose hand is the dominion, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty of Allah over all creation. It reminds us that He has full control over everything and is capable of doing whatever He wills. It serves as a proclamation of Allah's authority and power, highlighting His unmatched ability to manage and govern all affairs in the universe.
orig: تبارك الذي بيده الملك وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: He who created death and life to test you, [to see] which of you is best in deeds - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary nature of life and death in this world, both of which are created by Allah. The purpose of this creation is to test and evaluate human beings, as to who among them will perform the best deeds. Allah is described as 'the Exalted in Might' highlighting His supreme power, and 'the Forgiving' emphasizing His mercy and readiness to pardon the shortcomings of His servants.
orig: الذي خلق الموت والحياة ليبلوكم أيكم أحسن عملا وهو العزيز الغفور

translation: Who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see any imperfection in the creation of the Most Merciful. So look again. Do you see any rifts?
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous creation of the seven heavens by Allah, highlighting the perfection and harmony in His creation. It invites reflection on the flawless design of the universe as evidence of Allah's power and wisdom, prompting us to contemplate and appreciate the beauty and order in creation.
orig: الذي خلق سبع سماوات طباقا ما ترى في خلق الرحمن من تفاوت فارجع البصر هل ترى من فطور

translation: Then return the vision twice again; your vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of reflecting on one's beliefs and actions. It suggests that one should look at things from different perspectives and contemplate deeply in order to truly understand and gain wisdom. By doing so, one's vision will become clear and insightful, recognizing its limitations and weaknesses in contrast to the wisdom and mysteries of the Divine.
orig: ثم ارجع البصر كرتين ينقلب إليك البصر خاسئا وهو حسير

translation: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the beauty and purpose of the stars in the universe. The stars not only serve as a decoration in the sky but also act as missiles or projectiles thrown at the devils who try to eavesdrop on the heavenly conversation. It symbolizes the power and protection of the divine realm against evil forces. The mention of the punishment of the Blaze indicates the severe consequences for those who engage in such malicious activities.
orig: ولقد زينا السماء الدنيا بمصابيح وجعلناها رجوما للشياطين وأعتدنا لهم عذاب السعير

translation: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequences of disbelief in the Lord. Those who reject their Lord will face the torment of Hell, which is a dreadful and miserable destination. It serves as a reminder of the severity of the punishment for those who deny the truth and turn away from their Creator.
orig: وللذين كفروا بربهم عذاب جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.
interpretation: This verse paints a vivid image of the terror and punishment awaiting the wrongdoers in Hell. They will hear a terrifying sound emanating from the Hellfire, as it boils and rages with intensity. The verse serves as a warning to stay on the path of righteousness and avoid the consequences of straying away from it.
orig: إذا ألقوا فيها سمعوا لها شهيقا وهي تفور

translation: She seems almost ready to burst with fury: Every time a group is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them: 'Did no warner come to you?'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the severity of Hellfire, suggesting that it is almost bursting with anger and fury. The keepers of Hell question those who are thrown into it, asking if they had received any warnings or reminders about the consequences of their actions. The verse serves as a warning about the consequences of disbelief and disobedience.
orig: تكاد تميز من الغيظ كلما ألقي فيها فوج سألهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم نذير

translation: They will say, "Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything; you are not but in great error.'"
interpretation: This verse illustrates the attitude of arrogance and denial of those who rejected the message brought by the warners sent by Allah. Despite being warned and shown the truth, they chose to disbelieve and claim that nothing had been revealed by Allah. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the signs of Allah and persisting in disbelief despite being warned.
orig: قالوا بلى قد جاءنا نذير فكذبنا وقلنا ما نزل الله من شيء إن أنتم إلا في ضلال كبير

translation: And they will say, 'If we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret of disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they realize the consequences of their actions. They acknowledge that if they had used their intellect and listened to the guidance given to them, they would not have ended up among the dwellers of Hellfire. It emphasizes the importance of using reason and reflecting on the signs of Allah to avoid such a fate.
orig: وقالوا لو كنا نسمع أو نعقل ما كنا في أصحاب السعير

translation: So they will acknowledge their sins, but far removed they are from the companions of the Blaze.
interpretation: The verse conveys a warning to those who deny the truth and commit sins. It tells that ultimately they will have to acknowledge their sins and face the consequences, which will lead them far away from the torment of Hellfire.
orig: فاعترفوا بذنبهم فسحقا لأصحاب السعير

translation: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and being conscious of His presence even when no one else is watching. Those who maintain this fear and consciousness will be rewarded with forgiveness for their sins and a great reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب لهم مغفرة وأجر كبير

translation: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah is aware of all that is concealed or manifested by people, even the innermost thoughts and intentions within their hearts. They are advised to be mindful that nothing is hidden from Allah, hence it is important to be sincere in their actions and intentions.
orig: وأسروا قولكم أو اجهروا به إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?
interpretation: This verse highlights the omnipotence of Allah as the Creator who is fully aware and knowledgeable of all aspects of His creation. It emphasizes the divine attributes of subtlety and deep knowledge possessed by Allah. It serves as a reminder to believers that even though they might not understand certain aspects of the creation, Allah, being the most Subtle and Acquainted, knows everything in detail.
orig: ألا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير

translation: He it is Who has made the earth subservient to you, so traverse in its tracks and eat of His provision; to Him will you be resurrected.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of the earth being subjugated for human benefit by the will of Allah. It encourages people to travel throughout the earth, explore its vastness, and partake of the provisions provided by Allah for sustenance. The verse ends by reminding believers of the ultimate accountability and resurrection before Allah, emphasizing the importance of gratitude, reflection, and responsibility in one's actions while benefiting from the earth's resources.
orig: هو الذي جعل لكم الأرض ذلولا فامشوا في مناكبها وكلوا من رزقه وإليه النشور

translation: Do you feel secure that He who [holds authority] in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to the disbelievers who feel secure from the consequences of their actions. It highlights the power of Allah over all creation and reminds us of the unpredictability and suddenness with which disasters can strike. It emphasizes the importance of always being mindful of Allah's power and being prepared for any potential calamities.
orig: أأمنتم من في السماء أن يخسف بكم الأرض فإذا هي تمور

translation: Or do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven will not send against you a storm of stones? Then you will know how [severe] was My warning.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's power and ability to send down punishment upon those who transgress. It warns that no one is beyond the reach of Allah's punishment, and that people must heed the warnings sent by the prophets and messengers to ensure they do not face the consequences of their actions.
orig: أم أمنتم من في السماء أن يرسل عليكم حاصبا فستعلمون كيف نذير

translation: And indeed, those before them denied, so how [terrible] was My denial?
interpretation: This verse highlights the repeated pattern of disbelief and rejection of truth by previous nations, leading to their downfall and punishment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying God and His signs, emphasizing the severity of their denial and the inevitability of accountability for their actions.
orig: ولقد كذب الذين من قبلهم فكيف كان نكير

translation: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and folded in? None holds them except the Most Merciful. Surely He is All-Seeing of everything.
interpretation: This verse points to the power and control of Allah over all aspects of creation, such as the birds flying in the sky. It reminds believers to reflect on the signs of Allah's creation and to acknowledge His ultimate authority and mercy.
orig: أولم يروا إلى الطير فوقهم صافات ويقبضن ما يمسكهن إلا الرحمن إنه بكل شيء بصير

translation: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of turning to Allah in times of need and desperation, highlighting His power and mercy in responding to those who call upon Him. It reminds believers of Allah's ability to alleviate their difficulties, protect them from harm, and grant them success and prosperity. The verse also points out the folly of associating partners with Allah and urges people to reflect on the truth and the teachings of Islam.
orig: أمن هذا الذي هو جند لكم ينصركم من دون الرحمن إن الكافرون إلا في غرور

translation: Is He who provides for you, if He withholds His provision, who could provide for you? In fact, they persist in rebellion and aversion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute reliance on Allah for sustenance. It conveys the idea that if Allah chooses to withhold provision from anyone, no one else could provide for them. The verse highlights the ingratitude of those who persist in disobedience and turn away from Allah, despite His blessings and provisions.
orig: أمن هذا الذي يرزقكم إن أمسك رزقه بل لجوا في عتو ونفور

translation: Is he who walks bent on his face better guided, or he who walks evenly on a straight path?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an poses a rhetorical question comparing two different ways of living one's life: walking bent on one's face represents a person who strays far from the righteous path, while walking evenly on a straight path symbolizes a person who follows the guidance of God. The verse emphasizes the importance of staying on the straight path of righteousness and guidance rather than deviating from it.
orig: أفمن يمشي مكبا على وجهه أهدى أمن يمشي سويا على صراط مستقيم

translation: Say, 'It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how Allah is the Creator who has provided humans with the faculties of hearing, sight, and intellect. It serves as a reminder that despite these blessings, many people fail to show gratitude towards Allah for the countless gifts He has bestowed upon them.
orig: قل هو الذي أنشأكم وجعل لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: Say, 'It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fact that all blessings and abilities humans possess are from Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of being grateful to Allah for all that He has bestowed upon us, including the faculties of hearing, vision, and understanding. It warns against ingratitude and calls upon humans to reflect on their Creator and their eventual gathering before Him.
orig: قل هو الذي ذرأكم في الأرض وإليه تحشرون

translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
interpretation: This verse showcases the disbelievers expressing doubt and mockery towards the promise of the Day of Judgment, questioning its occurrence as a means to challenge the truthfulness of the believers. It serves as a reminder of the importance of patience and faith in the face of mockery and rejection of the beliefs.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "Knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all knowledge belongs solely to Allah, highlighting His superiority and omniscience. It also underlines the role of the Prophet as a clear warner, indicating that his duty is to convey the message clearly and warn people of the consequences of their actions.
orig: قل إنما العلم عند الله وإنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: So when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, 'This is a cloud bringing us rain!' No, rather it is what you were trying to hasten: a wind, containing a painful punishment!
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the arrogance and disbelief of the disbelievers who mockingly interpreted the signs from Allah as just a simple cloud that will bring them rain, not realizing that it was actually a punishment from Allah in the form of a destructive storm. It serves as a reminder that sometimes people fail to recognize the signs of Allah and interpret them incorrectly due to their own prejudices and lack of faith.
orig: فلما رأوه زلفة سيئت وجوه الذين كفروا وقيل هذا الذي كنتم به تدعون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if Allah should destroy me and those with me or have mercy upon us - who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?'
interpretation: This verse reflects the understanding that ultimately it is Allah who has control over everything, including the fate of individuals. It emphasizes the power and mercy of Allah, while also underscoring the consequences for those who reject faith. It reminds believers to trust in Allah's wisdom and justice, as well as the importance of seeking His protection from a painful punishment.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أهلكني الله ومن معي أو رحمنا فمن يجير الكافرين من عذاب أليم

translation: Say, 'He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error.'
interpretation: This verse conveys the message of putting complete trust and faith in the Most Merciful (Allah), as well as emphasizing the certainty that those who are misguided will eventually be clearly identified and distinguished from those who have true faith and reliance on Allah.
orig: قل هو الرحمن آمنا به وعليه توكلنا فستعلمون من هو في ضلال مبين

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?'
interpretation: This verse is posing a rhetorical question to make people reflect on the fact that even something as essential as water can suddenly disappear or become inaccessible. It highlights the importance of recognizing the blessings of Allah, including the provision of water, and the powerlessness of humans when faced with such deprivation unless Allah provides a solution.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أصبح ماؤكم غورا فمن يأتيكم بماء معين

translation: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the significance of writing and the knowledge that is imparted through it. It highlights the power and impact of the written word, indicating the importance of education, preservation of knowledge, and the responsibility of conveying information accurately.
orig: ن والقلم وما يسطرون

translation: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is addressing Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and assuring him that he is not insane or possessed as some of his contemporaries had falsely claimed. It highlights the divine favor bestowed upon the Prophet through prophethood and reassures him of his soundness of mind and his status as a true messenger of God.
orig: ما أنت بنعمة ربك بمجنون

translation: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of a continuous and abundant reward from Allah for those who engage in acts of righteousness and piety without expecting anything in return from others. It serves as a reminder for believers to strive towards good deeds with sincerity and to trust in Allah's infinite mercy and rewards.
orig: وإن لك لأجرا غير ممنون

translation: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the exceptional character and high moral standards of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It serves as a reminder of his admirable qualities and a testament to his exemplary conduct.
orig: وإنك لعلى خلق عظيم

translation: Then he will see and they will see.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that eventually each individual will have a clear and distinct understanding of their actions and the consequences thereof. It signifies that on the Day of Judgment, everyone will witness the consequences of their deeds and their true spiritual state will be revealed before all.
orig: فستبصر ويبصرون

translation: By which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers about which of the blessings and favors of their Lord they would deny. It challenges them to reflect on the countless blessings they have been given and to acknowledge the existence and greatness of Allah through His favors upon them.
orig: بأييكم المفتون

translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of those who have strayed from the right path and those who are rightly guided. It serves as a reminder that Allah's knowledge is perfect and comprehensive, and He is fully aware of the actions and intentions of all individuals.
orig: إن ربك هو أعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: So do not obey the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a commandment from Allah to not follow or obey those who deny the truth of the message of Islam. It teaches the believers to stay firm in their faith and not be led astray by those who reject or distort the teachings of Islam.
orig: فلا تطع المكذبين

translation: And they wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [towards you]
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of human interactions, where people often desire for others to be lenient or accommodating towards them first before they themselves are willing to soften their stance. It serves as a reminder to stay steadfast in our principles and not compromise them simply to please others, especially when they are not willing to show the same level of flexibility or respect in return.
orig: ودوا لو تدهن فيدهنون

translation: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer,
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to follow or obey those who are known for their deceitful, disrespectful, or empty promises. It cautions against blindly trusting individuals who frequently make false claims or pledges, reminding believers to be discerning and cautious in their interactions with others.
orig: ولا تطع كل حلاف مهين

translation: The malicious gossip who goes about slandering
interpretation: This verse describes a person who habitually spreads lies and malicious gossip about others, causing harm and discord in society. The verse serves as a warning against engaging in such behavior and emphasizes the importance of speaking truthfully and with kindness.
orig: هماز مشاء بنميم

translation: One who repels good, transgressing, sinful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of those who reject or oppose goodness, and instead indulge in transgression and sin. It warns against turning away from what is good and just, emphasizing the importance of avoiding sinful actions and behaviors.
orig: مناع للخير معتد أثيم

translation: Then do research, [O Muhammad], in this Qur'an, for you will not be questioned about what the people do.
interpretation: This verse encourages deep reflection and contemplation on the Qur'an. It emphasizes the importance of understanding and internalizing its teachings. It highlights the responsibility of the Prophet Muhammad to convey the message of the Qur'an without being held accountable for the actions and choices of the people.
orig: عتل بعد ذلك زنيم

translation: He had wealth and children.
interpretation: This verse describes a person who is wealthy and has children. The interpretation could be that material wealth and offspring are blessings from God, but they should not distract individuals from fulfilling their obligations towards God and others.
orig: أن كان ذا مال وبنين

translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, 'Legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the attitude of some disbelievers when they hear the Qur'anic verses – dismissing them as mere tales and myths. It shows how arrogance and ignorance can blind people from recognizing the truth and message of the Qur'an.
orig: إذا تتلى عليه آياتنا قال أساطير الأولين

translation: We will brand him upon the snout.
interpretation: This verse symbolizes the punishment or exposure of the wrongdoers and evildoers. It signifies that those who engage in oppression and arrogance will be identified by their deeds, as if marked on the face, exposing their true nature for others to see.
orig: سنسمه على الخرطوم

translation: Indeed, We tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting that Allah tests His creation, just like how He tested the people of the garden who had made a promise to harvest its fruits at daybreak. It serves as a reminder that trials and tests are a part of life and can serve as opportunities to demonstrate faith and patience.
orig: إنا بلوناهم كما بلونا أصحاب الجنة إذ أقسموا ليصرمنها مصبحين

translation: And they do not make exceptions.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of justice and fairness in Islam, stating that believers should not show favoritism or make exceptions when it comes to upholding justice and righteousness. It reminds individuals to treat everyone equally and fairly, without discrimination or bias, thus promoting a just and ethical society.
orig: ولا يستثنون

translation: Then a company of your Lord's angels passed by it while they were asleep.
interpretation: This verse describes an incident where a group of angels passed by a community while its inhabitants were asleep. It highlights the power and authority of Allah and how His angels carry out tasks in the unseen realms even when humans are unaware.
orig: فطاف عليها طائف من ربك وهم نائمون

translation: So she became like a hollow trunk of palm-tree
interpretation: This verse describes a woman who has lost her strength and vitality, becoming weak and frail like the dry trunk of a palm tree. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from faith and righteousness, leading to a state of spiritual emptiness and vulnerability.
orig: فأصبحت كالصريم

translation: So they called out to each other at daybreak,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where people are calling out to each other early in the morning. It can be interpreted as a reminder of the importance of communication and cooperation among people, especially at the beginning of the day when plans and tasks are usually set for the day ahead.
orig: فتنادوا مصبحين

translation: And go out to your crops in the morning, if you are so inclined.
interpretation: This verse is advising the believers to diligently tend to their crops and agriculture, highlighting the importance of hard work and dedication in one's livelihood. It emphasizes the value of being proactive and committed to one's responsibilities and tasks, urging believers to start their day early and engage in productive work to bring about sustenance and prosperity.
orig: أن اغدوا على حرثكم إن كنتم صارمين

translation: So set forth unabashedly and while they are in close ranks.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to advance confidently and courageously in the face of opposition or difficulty, while remaining united and steadfast. It emphasizes the importance of determination, unity, and bravery in the pursuit of righteousness and justice.
orig: فانطلقوا وهم يتخافتون

translation: That there shall not enter it the poor among you on the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, wealth and status will not be the criteria for entering paradise. It emphasizes the importance of helping the less fortunate and being charitable towards those in need, as this will be a critical factor for one's success in the afterlife.
orig: أن لا يدخلنها اليوم عليكم مسكين

translation: And set out during the early part of the night with a group, in order that you may find gain.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to undertake journeys during the early part of the night, possibly for the purpose of trade or seeking sustenance, emphasizing the importance of diligence and actively seeking provisions through effort and planning.
orig: وغدوا على حرد قادرين

translation: So when they saw it, they said, 'Indeed we are lost.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the moment when people realize their mistake and acknowledge that they are misguided. It serves as a reminder that admitting one's faults and seeking guidance is essential in finding the right path.
orig: فلما رأوها قالوا إنا لضالون

translation: But we are deprived.
interpretation: This verse conveys a sense of resignation and acceptance of a situation in which the speaker feels deprived or lacking. It may serve as a reminder that ultimately all matters are in the hands of Allah, and it is through acceptance and patience that one can find peace despite hardships or difficulties.
orig: بل نحن محرومون

translation: He said, 'Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience and perseverance in times of difficulty. It reminds us that hardships are to be expected in life, and it is essential to remain steadfast and patient, even when facing challenges. It serves as a lesson on the significance of trusting in Allah's plan and having faith that difficulties will ultimately lead to growth and blessings.
orig: قال أوسطهم ألم أقل لكم لولا تسبحون

translation: They said, 'Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse shows the repentance and humility of the believers when they realize their mistakes and sins. They acknowledge their wrongdoing and express their admiration and acknowledgement of the greatness of their Lord, seeking His forgiveness and mercy.
orig: قالوا سبحان ربنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: So they approached one another, questioning each other.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where people will be gathered on the Day of Judgment, and they will approach each other asking questions. It signifies the state of confusion, fear, and accountability that will prevail on that day when everyone will be concerned about their deeds and seeking answers to their actions.
orig: فأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتلاومون

translation: They will say, 'O woe to us; indeed we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse reflects the regret and remorse of the wrongdoers on the Day of Judgement when they realize the consequences of their oppressive and unjust actions during their lives. It highlights the importance of reflecting on our actions and seeking forgiveness before it's too late.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا طاغين

translation: It may be that our Lord will give us something better than this. Indeed, we are turning to our Lord with hope.
interpretation: This verse reminds us to have faith and trust in Allah that He will always provide us with what is best for us, even if we may not understand it at the moment. It urges us to remain optimistic and hopeful in the face of adversity, knowing that Allah's plans are always better than what we may desire or expect.
orig: عسى ربنا أن يبدلنا خيرا منها إنا إلى ربنا راغبون

translation: Such is the punishment. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity of the punishment in the Hereafter and highlights that it is far greater than any punishment in this worldly life. It serves as a reminder for the disbelievers to be aware of the consequences of their actions and to turn back to God before it's too late.
orig: كذلك العذاب ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the gardens of pleasure.
interpretation: This verse conveys the promise of paradise (Jannah) for the righteous believers who are mindful of God (Al-Muttaqeen). It emphasizes that those who live righteously and in piety will be rewarded with eternal bliss and delight in the hereafter, in the gardens of happiness. It serves as a motivation for believers to strive for righteousness and piety in their actions, with the ultimate reward being the attainment of paradise and the pleasure of Allah.
orig: إن للمتقين عند ربهم جنات النعيم

translation: Should We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the idea of treating the believers and the wrongdoers equally, emphasizing that it goes against the justice and mercy of Allah. It highlights the notion that believers who follow God's guidance and laws should not be equated with wrongdoers who disobey and transgress.
orig: أفنجعل المسلمين كالمجرمين

translation: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the judgment and decision-making abilities of the disbelievers who reject the truth and evidence presented to them. It highlights their lack of understanding and wisdom in rejecting the clear signs and messages of God.
orig: ما لكم كيف تحكمون

translation: Do you have a scripture in which you study?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the people being addressed have a scripture that they study and follow. It implies the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance from authorized and reliable sources such as scriptures.
orig: أم لكم كتاب فيه تدرسون

translation: Indeed, for you in it is what you choose.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the freedom of choice that humans possess. It highlights that individuals have the ability to make decisions and to choose their paths in life. Our choices have consequences and we are responsible for the decisions we make.
orig: إن لكم فيه لما تخيرون

translation: Or have you [O believers] a binding promise [with Us] that shall not be violated until the Day of Resurrection, that you shall have whatever you choose?
interpretation: This verse questions the believers about whether they have a special agreement or promise with Allah that guarantees them everything they desire until the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a reminder that ultimate judgment and decision-making are in the hands of Allah, and not subject to human wishes and desires.
orig: أم لكم أيمان علينا بالغة إلى يوم القيامة إن لكم لما تحكمون

translation: Ask them which of them will be responsible for that.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the notion of accountability and responsibility. It emphasizes the importance of assigning duties and roles clearly so that individuals can be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a reminder that in any situation, there should be clarity on who is in charge and responsible for particular tasks or decisions.
orig: سلهم أيهم بذلك زعيم

translation: Do they have partners (i.e., other deities) who have ordained for them a religion that Allah has not permitted? But if not for the decisive Word (that preceded from your Lord), the judgment would have been passed upon them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is questioning the belief of associating partners with Allah and worshiping other deities besides Him. It challenges those who do so to provide evidence or bring forth their supposed partners. The verse emphasizes the absolute authority of Allah and warns that those who engage in such false practices will face a severe punishment. It serves as a reminder to stay true to the monotheistic belief and to worship Allah alone.
orig: أم لهم شركاء فليأتوا بشركائهم إن كانوا صادقين

translation: The Day when the shin will be uncovered and they will be called to prostration but they will not be able,
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, when the shin will be exposed and people will be called to prostrate to God, but those who were arrogant and denied the truth in the worldly life will be unable to do so. This verse signifies the ultimate power and authority of God over all creation and highlights the consequences of those who disobey His commandments.
orig: يوم يكشف عن ساق ويدعون إلى السجود فلا يستطيعون

translation: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
interpretation: This verse highlights the state of those who arrogantly refuse to bow down in prostration to Allah. Their refusal will lead to humiliation and disgrace, contrasting with the peace and soundness they could have attained through submission to their Creator. Ultimately, it emphasizes the importance of humility and surrender to Allah's commands as a means to true peace and success.
orig: خاشعة أبصارهم ترهقهم ذلة وقد كانوا يدعون إلى السجود وهم سالمون

translation: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], and whoever denies this message. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
interpretation: This verse conveys a warning to those who reject the message of the Qur'an. It indicates that those who deny the truth revealed in the Qur'an will be led towards punishment gradually, in a way that they may not comprehend, as a consequence of their denial and rejection of the divine guidance.
orig: فذرني ومن يكذب بهذا الحديث سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون

translation: And I give them respite; surely, My plan is strong.
interpretation: This verse highlights the patience and mercy of Allah towards those who commit sins or reject faith. It indicates that despite the wrongdoings of people, Allah gives them time to repent and mend their ways. It also emphasizes the power and strength of Allah's plan, suggesting that no one can escape the consequences of their actions in the grand scheme of things.
orig: وأملي لهم إن كيدي متين

translation: Do you ask them for payment? But they are of the gift of your Lord, munificence.
interpretation: The verse refers to the idea that believers should engage in good deeds and acts of worship not with the expectation of material reward, but as a form of gratitude and devotion to God. It emphasizes that the rewards and blessings bestowed by God are far greater than any material compensation one could receive from others.
orig: أم تسألهم أجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون

translation: Is it that they have the unseen with them that they can write it down?
interpretation: This verse questions the claim of those who associate partners with Allah, asking if they have knowledge of the unseen so that they can document it. It highlights the limitation of human knowledge and the exclusive knowledge of the unseen that is attributed to Allah alone.
orig: أم عندهم الغيب فهم يكتبون

translation: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not be like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and submission to the will and decree of Allah. It draws a parallel to the story of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) who was in distress inside the belly of the fish, yet remained patient and turned to Allah for help. It teaches us to be steadfast in times of difficulty and not lose hope, knowing that relief will come from Allah at the appointed time.
orig: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تكن كصاحب الحوت إذ نادى وهو مكظوم

translation: If it were not for the favor of his Lord upon him, he would have been cast into the open bare land while he was censured.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine favor and protection. It emphasizes that God's blessings and protection are crucial in preventing a person from being subjected to hardship or criticism. It serves as a reminder to acknowledge and appreciate the blessings and favor that God bestows upon us, as they shield us from potentially negative consequences.
orig: لولا أن تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم

translation: So his Lord accepted his supplication and made him among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse speaks about how Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) made a supplication to Allah, and Allah accepted his prayer and granted him a righteous son, Prophet Yahya (John). It highlights the fact that Allah responds to the prayers of His righteous servants and bestows His blessings upon them.
orig: فاجتباه ربه فجعله من الصالحين

translation: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, 'Indeed, he is mad.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how the disbelievers were so adamant in their rejection of the message of the Quran that they would mock and ridicule the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), accusing him of being insane. It illustrates the challenges the Prophet faced in conveying the message of Allah to those who refused to believe, even when the truth was presented to them. The verse serves as a reminder of the patience and perseverance required by believers in the face of adversity and opposition.
orig: وإن يكاد الذين كفروا ليزلقونك بأبصارهم لما سمعوا الذكر ويقولون إنه لمجنون

translation: And it is not but a reminder to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an serves as a reminder and guidance not only for believers but for all mankind and all worlds. It emphasizes the universal message of the Qur'an that transcends boundaries of time, place, and people, aiming to guide and remind all creation of their purpose and the way to righteousness.
orig: وما هو إلا ذكر للعالمين

translation: The Inevitable
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the certainty and inevitability of the event. It serves as a reminder to believers that all will be held accountable for their actions and that they should strive to live a righteous life in preparation for the Hereafter.
orig: الحاقة

translation: What is the Inevitable?
interpretation: This verse raises a rhetorical question about the reality of the Inevitable, referring to the Day of Judgment when all will be held accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder of the certainty and gravity of the Hereafter, urging reflection on the ultimate truth and purpose of existence.
orig: ما الحاقة

translation: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
interpretation: This verse reflects the incomprehensible and profound nature of the Inevitable Reality, which is referring to the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the notion that human understanding is limited and incapable of fully grasping the true magnitude and reality of the Day of Judgment and its consequences.
orig: وما أدراك ما الحاقة

translation: Thamud denied [the truth] through their transgression,
interpretation: This verse refers to the rejection of the message of Allah by the people of Thamud due to their arrogance and transgression. It serves as a warning against the consequences of denying the truth and turning away from the guidance of God.
orig: كذبت ثمود وعاد بالقارعة

translation: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
interpretation: This verse refers to the destruction of the Thamud people by a severe punishment sent by Allah due to their defiance, arrogance, and rejection of the guidance of their prophet. It serves as a warning to those who choose to follow a path of oppression and disobedience, reminding them of the consequences of such actions.
orig: فأما ثمود فأهلكوا بالطاغية

translation: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a furious, roaring wind.
interpretation: This verse highlights the punishment that befell the people of 'Aad, a powerful ancient tribe. They were destroyed by a severe wind, as a consequence of their arrogance, rejection of the message of their prophet, and defiance of God's commandments. The mention of this punishment serves as a warning to future generations about the consequences of disbelief and disobedience.
orig: وأما عاد فأهلكوا بريح صرصر عاتية

translation: He made it subservient to them for seven nights and eight days easily. You see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the people of Thamud and how they were punished by Allah. The verse describes how these people were arrogant and disobedient, and as a result, Allah made the punishment easy to execute. The description of the people being like hollow trunks of palm trees signifies their utter defeat and destruction.
orig: سخرها عليهم سبع ليال وثمانية أيام حسوما فترى القوم فيها صرعى كأنهم أعجاز نخل خاوية

translation: So do you see for them any remaining benefit?
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether there is any lasting or enduring benefit for those who oppose the truth and persist in their disbelief. It highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and understanding in order to recognize the truth and not be misled by fleeting worldly gains that hold no lasting value.
orig: فهل ترى لهم من باقية

translation: And Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities committed sin.
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuity of disbelief and transgression among the people and rulers who came before Pharaoh. It shows that sin is not exclusive to one person or one time period, but rather a recurring pattern in history. The mention of 'overturned cities' serves as a reminder of the consequences of people's wrongdoing and disobedience to God's laws.
orig: وجاء فرعون ومن قبله والمؤتفكات بالخاطئة

translation: So they denied the Messenger of their Lord, and He seized them with a seizure of overwhelming power.
interpretation: This verse highlights the consequence of those who reject or disobey the Messenger of their Lord, as they face a severe punishment. It serves as a reminder of the importance of following and obeying the guidance brought by the messengers of Allah, and warns against the potential consequences of disobedience.
orig: فعصوا رسول ربهم فأخذهم أخذة رابية

translation: Truly, when the waters rose high, We carried you in the floating ark,
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah and the Ark, where Allah saved Noah and his followers from the great flood by carrying them in the ark. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and ability to protect His believers in times of adversity.
orig: إنا لما طغى الماء حملناكم في الجارية

translation: We will make it a reminder for you, so would you heed?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the purpose of the Qur'an as a reminder and a source of guidance. It questions whether the listener will truly pay attention to its teachings and act upon them. It serves as a reminder for believers to reflect on the Quranic teachings and act upon them with consciousness and understanding.
orig: لنجعلها لكم تذكرة وتعيها أذن واعية

translation: So when the Horn is blown with one blast,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the trumpet will be blown signaling the end of the world as we know it. It signifies a monumental event that will lead to the resurrection of all beings for judgment. The single powerful blast of the trumpet symbolizes the ultimate and irrevocable event that will be the beginning of the end of the earthly life and the start of the hereafter.
orig: فإذا نفخ في الصور نفخة واحدة

translation: And the earth and the mountains will be carried off and crushed; all together.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the earth and mountains will be lifted and crushed in one blow. It emphasizes the immense power of Allah and the absolute submission of all creation to His will on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وحملت الأرض والجبال فدكتا دكة واحدة

translation: On that day, the Event will occur.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, the inevitable Event will take place. This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment and serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability of all beings before Allah.
orig: فيومئذ وقعت الواقعة

translation: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is [fractured]
interpretation: This verse describes a moment of immense power and upheaval on the Day of Judgment, where the sky will be torn apart, representing the dramatic and unprecedented events that will unfold. It serves as a reminder of the absolute authority and control of Allah over all creation.
orig: وانشقت السماء فهي يومئذ واهية

translation: And the angels will be upon its edges. And Our Lord comes with the Throne bearing His essence, on that Day, eight angels will carry the Throne of your Lord above them.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the angels will be present at the edges of the Throne of Allah. It signifies the power and authority of Allah as He descends with His Throne, highlighting the grandeur and majesty of that Day when everything will be under His control and command.
orig: والملك على أرجائها ويحمل عرش ربك فوقهم يومئذ ثمانية

translation: On that Day, you will be presented; no secret of yours will remain hidden.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, every individual will be presented before Allah with all their deeds and intentions laid bare; nothing will remain hidden or secret from Him. This emphasizes the idea of accountability and the importance of being mindful of our actions in this world, as everything will be brought to light on that Day.
orig: يومئذ تعرضون لا تخفى منكم خافية

translation: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
interpretation: This verse is speaking about the Day of Judgment when the righteous believers will receive their book of deeds in their right hand. They will be eager to share and show their good deeds, feeling proud of their accomplishments and seeking acknowledgment for their efforts. It highlights the importance of striving for righteousness and good deeds in the present life to receive a favorable outcome in the Hereafter.
orig: فأما من أوتي كتابه بيمينه فيقول هاؤم اقرءوا كتابيه

translation: Verily, I thought that I would meet my account (my record with Allah).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in the Day of Judgment and the idea that every individual will be held accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder to believers to be mindful of their actions and to strive to do good, knowing that they will be answerable for their choices in the Hereafter.
orig: إني ظننت أني ملاق حسابيه

translation: So he will be in a pleasant life.
interpretation: This verse implies that those who have faith and obey God will be granted a content and satisfactory life in this world and in the Hereafter. It highlights the concept of inner peace and fulfillment that comes from living a life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: فهو في عيشة راضية

translation: In a lofty paradise.
interpretation: This verse describes the believers being in a high, elevated paradise, symbolizing the exalted status and blessings that await those who are righteous and obedient to Allah. It signifies a place of honor, beauty, and serenity where believers will experience eternal bliss and closeness to their Creator.
orig: في جنة عالية

translation: Its clusters will be hanging down,
interpretation: This verse describes the beauty and abundance of the clusters of fruits in paradise, hanging down in a pleasing and delightful manner. It signifies the richness and luxury of the rewards awaiting the believers in the afterlife.
orig: قطوفها دانية

translation: Eat and drink at ease for what you have sent before you in days past.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to people to enjoy the blessings of Allah and to partake in permitted food and drink without excess or wastefulness, while also being mindful of their actions and intentions in the past.
orig: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما أسلفتم في الأيام الخالية

translation: And as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, 'Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
interpretation: This verse describes the regret of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they receive their record in their left hand, indicating their bad deeds. They will wish they had never received their record and had not been held accountable for their actions, but it will be too late for regret or change.
orig: وأما من أوتي كتابه بشماله فيقول يا ليتني لم أوت كتابيه

translation: And I do not know what my account will be.
interpretation: This verse expresses the uncertainty and humility that humans feel towards the Day of Judgment when they will be held accountable for their deeds. It shows the acknowledgment of the limited knowledge of individuals regarding their own future and the importance of being mindful of one's actions in preparation for the afterlife.
orig: ولم أدر ما حسابيه

translation: Oh, how I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten.
interpretation: This verse expresses a deep lament and a desire for death, wishing to have not experienced the current situation and to be forgotten completely. It reflects the feeling of intense sorrow and despair that one may face in times of great difficulty or hardship.
orig: يا ليتها كانت القاضية

translation: My wealth has not availed me.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fleeting nature of worldly possessions and the realization that material wealth cannot provide true contentment or fulfill all needs. It serves as a reminder that one's wealth and possessions are ultimately transient and do not guarantee lasting happiness or success in the sight of Allah.
orig: ما أغنى عني ماليه

translation: My authority has been destroyed.
interpretation: This verse signifies the loss or destruction of power and control that someone had. It conveys the idea that ultimately all authority and power belongs to Allah, and any worldly authority is transient and subject to His will.
orig: هلك عني سلطانيه

translation: Capture him and chain him;
interpretation: This verse can be interpreted metaphorically, calling for controlling and overpowering one's desires, negative thoughts, or any harmful temptations that may lead to wrongdoing. It emphasizes the need for self-discipline and restraint in the face of challenges.
orig: خذوه فغلوه

translation: Then let him call his associates for help.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers that in the Hellfire, they will call upon other disbelievers or idols they worshipped for help, but they will find no assistance or relief. It emphasizes the accountability of each individual for their own actions and the consequences they will face in the afterlife.
orig: ثم الجحيم صلوه

translation: Then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits, insert him.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the seriousness and severity of the punishment awaiting the wrongdoers. It conveys the idea of being bound by one's misdeeds and the inevitability of facing the consequences of one's actions. The image of being tied up in a long chain serves as a powerful warning about the consequences of straying from righteousness.
orig: ثم في سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه

translation: Verily, he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who did not have faith in Allah, the Supreme Being. It highlights the importance of belief in Allah, emphasizing His greatness and the significance of having faith in Him.
orig: إنه كان لا يؤمن بالله العظيم

translation: And does not encourage feeding the poor.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers not only to refrain from refusing to help the poor and needy but also not to take it a step further and actively discourage or prevent others from providing assistance to those in need. It emphasizes the importance of promoting charity and kindness towards those less fortunate, rather than discouraging or obstructing such noble actions.
orig: ولا يحض على طعام المسكين

translation: He will have no intimate friend here today.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment, where every individual will be left alone without any close friend or supporter, highlighting the accountability and solitude of each soul before Allah. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate reality of standing before Allah with one's deeds and actions, devoid of any worldly attachments or relationships.
orig: فليس له اليوم هاهنا حميم

translation: and [forbidden to you] is [the consumption of] dead animals and blood and the flesh of swine
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an establishes dietary restrictions for Muslims, prohibiting the consumption of dead animals, blood, and the flesh of swine. The prohibition on such foods is meant to promote health, hygiene, and spiritual purity among believers.
orig: ولا طعام إلا من غسلين

translation: No one will eat it except the sinners.
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific food or substance that is prohibited for consumption, except for those who are sinners. It serves as a reminder that certain things may be lawful for some, but unlawful for others based on their actions and intentions.
orig: لا يأكله إلا الخاطئون

translation: So I swear by what you see,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of the signs and evidences visible in the universe as proofs of the existence and power of Allah. It implies that these visible signs should lead one to recognize and believe in the Creator.
orig: فلا أقسم بما تبصرون

translation: And that you do not see.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that there are aspects of the universe and creations of God that are beyond human perception and understanding. It serves as a reminder of the limitations of human knowledge and the importance of humility before the vastness and complexity of God's creation.
orig: وما لا تبصرون

translation: Verily, it is the word of a noble Messenger.
interpretation: This verse indicates the high status and noble character of the Messenger who delivers the message of Allah. It highlights the importance of paying attention to and respecting the words and teachings of the Prophet Muhammad, who conveys divine guidance to humanity.
orig: إنه لقول رسول كريم

translation: And it is not the word of a poet; little is it that you believe.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an is not the product of poetic expression, but rather a divine revelation. It challenges the people of that time, and all readers, to ponder its profound message and recognize its miraculous nature as a guidance from Allah.
orig: وما هو بقول شاعر قليلا ما تؤمنون

translation: And not [by] the saying of a soothsayer, little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the futility and emptiness of the words of soothsayers or fortune-tellers. It reminds the believers to not be swayed by the false promises or predictions of such individuals, as their words lack substance and truth. The verse serves as a warning to rely on the guidance and wisdom of Allah and to stay away from superstitions and practices that are not aligned with the teachings of Islam.
orig: ولا بقول كاهن قليلا ما تذكرون

translation: A revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an, stating that it is a revelation sent down by the Lord of all the worlds. It highlights the universal message of the Qur'an that is not limited to a specific group of people or a particular region, but is meant for all of humanity.
orig: تنزيل من رب العالمين

translation: And if he had forged and attributed any sayings to Us,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if the Prophet Muhammad had fabricated any of the revelations of the Qur'an, he would have been severely punished by Allah. It serves to reinforce the authenticity and divine origin of the Qur'an, highlighting that it is a revelation from Allah and not a creation of the Prophet's imagination.
orig: ولو تقول علينا بعض الأقاويل

translation: We will surely take from him with the right hand.
interpretation: This verse is indicating that on the Day of Judgment, individuals will be held accountable for their deeds, and those who have done righteous deeds will be given their record of deeds with their right hand, symbolizing honor and success. This gesture represents acceptance and reward for the good deeds they performed in this world.
orig: لأخذنا منه باليمين

translation: Then We will completely cut off the aorta.
interpretation: This verse is describing a punishment that will be inflicted on the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. The severing of the aorta symbolizes a severe and final punishment, highlighting the certainty and severity of the consequences for those who reject the truth and continue in disbelief.
orig: ثم لقطعنا منه الوتين

translation: So there is none among you who can prevent Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and authority of Allah, stating that no one can stop or resist His command or will. It serves as a reminder of the sovereignty and control that Allah possesses over all things, highlighting the concept of total submission to His decree.
orig: فما منكم من أحد عنه حاجزين

translation: And indeed, it is a reminder for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the Qur'an serves as a reminder for those who are righteous and God-conscious. It is a source of guidance and reflection for those who strive to uphold piety and righteousness in their lives.
orig: وإنه لتذكرة للمتقين

translation: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that God is fully aware of those who deny His signs and His message. It serves as a warning to those who refuse to believe, emphasizing that God knows their true intentions and actions, even if they try to conceal them. It also implies that denying the truth does not affect God's knowledge and authority, and those who choose to deny will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: وإنا لنعلم أن منكم مكذبين

translation: And indeed, it is a regret upon the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse signifies that disbelief in the truth and rejecting the message of Allah will lead to deep regret and sorrow in the Hereafter for those who disbelieved. It serves as a warning to those who choose to deny the signs of Allah and turn away from His guidance.
orig: وإنه لحسرة على الكافرين

translation: And indeed, the Hour (Day of Judgment) is the truth promised.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Day of Judgment is a certainty and a truth that will inevitably come to pass. It serves as a reminder of the importance of preparing for the Hereafter and living a righteous life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: وإنه لحق اليقين

translation: So exalt the name of your magnificent Lord.
interpretation: This verse is a call to acknowledge and praise the greatness of Allah, the Almighty and Magnificent Creator. It emphasizes the importance of glorifying and exalting the name of our Lord, recognizing His infinite power and majesty.
orig: فسبح باسم ربك العظيم

translation: A questioner asked about a punishment to befall.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inevitability of accountability and judgment in the Islamic faith. It signifies that individuals will be questioned about their deeds and will face the consequences, emphasizing the importance of leading a righteous life and being mindful of one's actions as they will ultimately determine one's fate in the Hereafter.
orig: سأل سائل بعذاب واقع

translation: For the disbelievers, there is no escape.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the fate of those who choose to disbelieve in God. It conveys the idea that there is no way for the disbelievers to escape the consequences of their disbelief, emphasizing the severity of their rejection of the truth.
orig: للكافرين ليس له دافع

translation: By the way of Ascent,
interpretation: This verse refers to the concept of the 'Ma'arij', which are the ascending levels or stages by which one approaches God. It signifies the paths of spiritual growth and enlightenment that lead a believer closer to Allah, thereby emphasizing the importance of striving towards self-improvement and spiritual elevation.
orig: من الله ذي المعارج

translation: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a Day the measure of which is fifty thousand years.
interpretation: This verse describes the magnitude and grandeur of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing that even the angels and the Spirit require a significant amount of time to ascend towards Allah during that momentous day. It illustrates the vastness of the divine realm and the reverence with which even the celestial beings approach Allah's presence on that Day.
orig: تعرج الملائكة والروح إليه في يوم كان مقداره خمسين ألف سنة

translation: So be patient with a beautiful patience.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing patience in difficult times, encouraging believers to exhibit patience with grace and beauty. It reminds us that enduring hardships with a positive attitude and resilience is a virtue in Islam.
orig: فاصبر صبرا جميلا

translation: Indeed, they see it [as] distant.
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of people who perceive the Day of Judgment as something far off and distant from their current reality. The interpretation suggests that some individuals may neglect or ignore the importance of preparing for the hereafter due to their perception that it is a distant event, while in reality, it is a certainty that should be taken seriously and prepared for.
orig: إنهم يرونه بعيدا

translation: And We see it near.
interpretation: This verse speaks about Allah's knowledge and awareness of everything; nothing is hidden from Him. It emphasizes that Allah is close to His creations, aware of their actions, and always present to witness everything happening in the world. This verse serves as a reminder to believers of Allah's omniscience and constant presence in their lives.
orig: ونراه قريبا

translation: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the sky will lose its brightness and clarity, becoming dark and gloomy like murky oil. It symbolizes the terrifying and catastrophic events that will occur on that Day, highlighting the severity and seriousness of the situation that will unfold during the end times.
orig: يوم تكون السماء كالمهل

translation: And the mountains will be like wool.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from the Day of Judgment when the mountains will be shattered and turned into scattered dust, appearing as light and delicate as carded wool. It illustrates the immense power of Allah to transform even the most solid and seemingly permanent structures into frail and fleeting forms. The verse serves as a reminder of the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah over all creation and emphasizes the temporary nature of worldly strength and stability in comparison to the eternal strength and might of God.
orig: وتكون الجبال كالعهن

translation: And no friend will ask another friend
interpretation: This verse signifies that on the Day of Judgment, even the closest friends will not inquire about one another's fate or well-being, due to the immense fear and concern each person will have for their own fate. It emphasizes the severity and individual accountability of the Day of Judgment, where even the closest bonds will not provide support or comfort in the face of divine judgment.
orig: ولا يسأل حميم حميما

translation: The criminal would wish to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children
interpretation: This verse describes how on the Day of Judgment, the wrongdoers will be so desperate to escape punishment that they would even wish to ransom themselves with their own children. It emphasizes the severity of the consequences of their actions and the regret they will feel for their deeds.
orig: يبصرونهم يود المجرم لو يفتدي من عذاب يومئذ ببنيه

translation: And his companion and his brother
interpretation: This verse refers to the advice and companionship of a person's close friend or sibling, emphasizing the importance of having good company and support in one's life journey and decision-making process.
orig: وصاحبته وأخيه

translation: And his kindred who shelter him
interpretation: This verse refers to the family and relatives of a person who provide support, protection, and comfort. It emphasizes the importance of family ties and the role they play in providing a sense of belonging and refuge.
orig: وفصيلته التي تؤويه

translation: And whoever is on the earth entirely will perish.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the transitory nature of life on earth and serves as a reminder of the inevitable end that all beings will face. It highlights the temporary nature of worldly existence and the ultimate reality that all shall perish except those whom God chooses to save. It calls on believers to reflect on the temporary nature of this life and to focus on their ultimate goal of seeking the pleasure of God and the eternal Hereafter.
orig: ومن في الأرض جميعا ثم ينجيه

translation: No! It is surely a blaze.
