interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty and severity of the punishment awaiting those who defy Allah and His message. It serves as a reminder to take heed of the consequences of one's actions and to strive towards righteousness to avoid such a fate.
orig: كلا إنها لظى

translation: A dispute for [burning] fuel.
interpretation: This verse metaphorically refers to the disputes and conflicts that arise among people over trivial and insignificant matters, akin to quarreling over burning fuel, which is of little value. The verse highlights the futility and pointlessness of engaging in such arguments and encourages seeking more meaningful and constructive discourse.
orig: نزاعة للشوى

translation: You invite those who turn back and turn away.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the idea that despite facing rejection and resistance from some people, believers are encouraged to continue calling others towards goodness and faith. It reminds believers to remain steadfast in delivering the message of Islam even if some reject it or show indifference.
orig: تدعو من أدبر وتولى

translation: And He shall gather [men] together.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when all people will be resurrected and gathered before God for judgment. It emphasizes the ultimate power and control of Allah over all of creation, reminding believers of the importance of accountability and the afterlife.
orig: وجمع فأوعى

translation: Verily, mankind was created anxious,
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of human beings, emphasizing that they are created inherently anxious and restless. It serves as a reminder of the struggles and challenges that human beings face in their lives, and calls on them to seek peace and tranquility through faith and connection with the divine.
orig: إن الإنسان خلق هلوعا

translation: When evil touches him, he is despairing,
interpretation: This verse describes the state of a person when they are afflicted by evil or harm, and they react with impatience and despair. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining patience and faith in times of hardship, as despairing and giving up hope is not the right response when facing difficulties.
orig: إذا مسه الشر جزوعا

translation: And when he is touched by good fortune, he is ever grudging.
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who becomes stingy and reluctant to share his good fortune with others when he experiences success or receives blessings. It warns against being ungrateful and selfish during times of ease and abundance.
orig: وإذا مسه الخير منوعا

translation: Except the ones who pray
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prayer in Islam, highlighting that only those who establish regular prayers will be successful. It signifies the essential role of prayer in maintaining a strong connection with Allah and seeking guidance and blessings in one's life.
orig: إلا المصلين

translation: Those who are constant in their prayer
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of being steadfast and regular in performing prayers. It emphasizes the value of consistency and commitment in maintaining a strong connection with Allah through prayer, indicating that true believers are those who are unwavering in their devotion and observance of their daily prayers.
orig: الذين هم على صلاتهم دائمون

translation: And those who are true to their trusts and their promises.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling trusts and promises. Believers are encouraged to honor their commitments and responsibilities, whether they involve material possessions or otherwise. It highlights the value of integrity and honesty in dealings with others.
orig: والذين في أموالهم حق معلوم

translation: For the petitioner and the deprived
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of helping those who ask for assistance, whether it is in the form of knowledge, guidance, support, or material aid. It emphasizes the duty of providing for the needy and offering help to those who are less fortunate, underscoring the significance of compassion, generosity, and empathy in the community. It reminds us of the virtue of being responsive to the needs of others and being mindful of those who may require help or support.
orig: للسائل والمحروم

translation: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the Day of Judgment, which is a fundamental aspect of Islamic faith. It is a reminder to believers to be conscious of their actions in this world because they will be held accountable for them on the Day of Judgment. Belief in the Day of Judgment serves as a motivation to do good deeds, seek forgiveness for wrongdoings, and strive to attain Paradise in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين يصدقون بيوم الدين

translation: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are conscious and mindful of the punishment that may come from God, motivating them to stay away from sins and do good deeds. It emphasizes the importance of fearing God's punishment as a way to seek His pleasure and protection.
orig: والذين هم من عذاب ربهم مشفقون

translation: Verily, the punishment of their Lord is not to be felt secure from.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no one should feel immune or safe from the punishment of their Lord. It serves as a reminder that God's punishment can reach anyone, regardless of their status or wealth, and should thus encourage believers to always be mindful of their actions and seek forgiveness.
orig: إن عذاب ربهم غير مأمون

translation: And those who guard their private parts,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of protecting one's chastity and controlling one's desires. It is a reminder to be mindful of one's actions and to strive for purity in behavior and intentions.
orig: والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون

translation: except with their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the permissible forms of intimacy and relationships in Islam, emphasizing that sexual relations are only allowed within the framework of marriage or with those whom one has taken as slaves (those their right hands possess). It sets clear boundaries for sexual conduct and discourages engaging in any form of sexual activity outside these permissible relationships. Additionally, it assures that those who abide by these boundaries will not face blame for their actions.
orig: إلا على أزواجهم أو ما ملكت أيمانهم فإنهم غير ملومين

translation: So whoever desires beyond that - then those are the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who seek anything beyond the limits set by Allah are considered transgressors. It serves as a reminder to stay within the boundaries prescribed by God and not to exceed them in pursuit of worldly desires or ambitions.
orig: فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فأولئك هم العادون

translation: And those who are keepers of their trusts and covenants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being trustworthy and fulfilling one's promises and commitments. It highlights the qualities of reliability, integrity, and honesty in dealings with others. It teaches believers to honor their responsibilities and obligations, whether they are personal commitments, agreements, or entrusted tasks, as it is considered a key aspect of faith and character in Islam.
orig: والذين هم لأماناتهم وعهدهم راعون

translation: And [they are] those who are observant of their testimonies.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of upholding and being sincere in one's testimony. It highlights the significance of being truthful and reliable when bearing witness and testifying in various matters, be it in legal proceedings, relationships, or interactions with others. It encourages honesty, integrity, and accountability in one's words and actions.
orig: والذين هم بشهاداتهم قائمون

translation: And those who are constant in their prayer.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being diligent and committed in one's prayers. It signifies the significance of maintaining regularity and devotion in prayer as a crucial aspect of one's faith, indicating that those who guard their prayers with care and constancy are on a path of righteousness and closeness to Allah.
orig: والذين هم على صلاتهم يحافظون

translation: They will be in gardens, honored.
interpretation: This verse describes the reward awaiting the righteous believers in the hereafter. It indicates that those who have lived a life of piety and virtue will be granted entry into the gardens of paradise where they will be honored and esteemed. It emphasizes the idea that the righteous will be rewarded with a place of eternal felicity and honor in the afterlife for their steadfastness and good deeds in the worldly life.
orig: أولئك في جنات مكرمون

translation: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you?
interpretation: This verse addresses the question of why some people who have rejected the message of the prophets before Muhammad (peace be upon him) are in such a rush to deny the truth and turn away from guidance. It highlights the irrational and hasty nature of disbelief, questioning the motives behind such behavior and implying that ultimately the truth will prevail despite their rush to disbelieve.
orig: فمال الذين كفروا قبلك مهطعين

translation: From the right and from the left, honored.
interpretation: This verse refers to how those who are righteous and obedient to Allah will be honored and distinguished, regardless of their position or status in society. It emphasizes that true honor comes from one's faith and actions, not worldly possessions or power.
orig: عن اليمين وعن الشمال عزين

translation: Does every man among them want to enter the Garden of Bliss?
interpretation: This verse questions the true intention and motivation of people who claim they want to enter Paradise. It challenges individuals to reflect if their actions and beliefs truly align with the pursuit of eternal happiness in Paradise, or if their desires are purely superficial or hypocritical.
orig: أيطمع كل امرئ منهم أن يدخل جنة نعيم

translation: Nay! We created them from what they know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that human beings were created from substances and elements that are within their knowledge and experience. It highlights the direct connection between human beings and the material world around them, emphasizing the intimate relationship between humans and their physical environment. This verse serves as a reminder of the humility and limitations of human knowledge and understanding in the face of the Creator's infinite wisdom and power.
orig: كلا إنا خلقناهم مما يعلمون

translation: So I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We are surely able
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and control of Allah as the Lord of all the directions, east and west. It serves as a reminder that Allah has full authority over all things and is capable of doing whatever He wills. It asserts His omnipotence and highlights that nothing is beyond His ability.
orig: فلا أقسم برب المشارق والمغارب إنا لقادرون

translation: We shall replace them by others better than them. And We are not to be outrun.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of God's continuous renewal and replacement of people with others who are better in faith and deeds. It reassures believers that God's plan always involves improvement and progression, and no one can escape or overcome God's decree.
orig: على أن نبدل خيرا منهم وما نحن بمسبوقين

translation: So leave them to plunge in vain discourse and play until they encounter their Day which they are promised.
interpretation: This verse warns those who follow falsehood and engage in idle talk and heedless activities to continue in their ways until they face the consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment, as a reminder of the accountability awaiting them.
orig: فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي يوعدون

translation: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, people will come out of their graves swiftly, as if they are racing towards a goal, reminiscent of how they used to compete in the worldly life, but this time it will be towards their final destination and accountability before God.
orig: يوم يخرجون من الأجداث سراعا كأنهم إلى نصب يوفضون

translation: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading around,
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when people will rise from their graves with humility and fear, akin to locusts swarming in various directions. It illustrates the overwhelming nature of that day and the feeling of vulnerability and submission that will encompass all beings before their Lord.
orig: خاشعة أبصارهم ترهقهم ذلة ذلك اليوم الذي كانوا يوعدون

translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], 'Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of warning and guiding people before they face the consequences of their actions. It highlights the role of prophets in conveying the message of guidance and reminding people to turn back to righteousness before facing the consequences of their wrongdoing.
orig: إنا أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه أن أنذر قومك من قبل أن يأتيهم عذاب أليم

translation: He said, 'O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner.'
interpretation: In this verse, the speaker is addressing their people and informing them that they have been sent as a clear warner to guide and advise them. The message is straightforward and meant to serve as a warning for the people to take heed and follow the right path.
orig: قال يا قوم إني لكم نذير مبين

translation: And worship Allah and fear Him and obey Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshiping and obeying Allah with fear and reverence. It reminds believers to be mindful of their actions and to submit to Allah's commandments. By worshiping Allah, fearing Him, and obeying Him, one can attain spiritual fulfillment and lead a righteous life.
orig: أن اعبدوا الله واتقوه وأطيعون

translation: He will forgive you your sins and defer you to a specified term. Allah's term, when it comes, cannot be deferred, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of forgiveness and patience. It assures believers that Allah will forgive their sins and grant them respite until an appointed time. It also serves as a reminder that Allah's decree is final and cannot be delayed once the appointed time arrives.
orig: يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم إلى أجل مسمى إن أجل الله إذا جاء لا يؤخر لو كنتم تعلمون

translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
interpretation: This verse reflects the Prophet's plea to God, informing Him that he fulfilled his duty by calling his people to the truth persistently. It emphasizes the Prophet's dedication and relentless effort in conveying the message of God, showing his commitment to guiding his community towards the right path.
orig: قال رب إني دعوت قومي ليلا ونهارا

translation: So my invitation increased them not except in flight.
interpretation: This verse highlights a response to the call of the Prophet Muhammad by the disbelievers of his time. Despite his sincere and persistent invitations to guidance, they did not respond positively but rather increased in their rejection and hostility towards him. This emphasizes the concept of free will and individual choice in accepting or rejecting the message of truth.
orig: فلم يزدهم دعائي إلا فرارا

translation: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
interpretation: This verse describes the resistance of disbelievers to accept the call to seek forgiveness and guidance. Despite being invited to seek forgiveness and mercy from God, they deliberately ignore and cover themselves metaphorically from the truth. Their arrogance and stubbornness lead them to reject the message and persist in their disbelief.
orig: وإني كلما دعوتهم لتغفر لهم جعلوا أصابعهم في آذانهم واستغشوا ثيابهم وأصروا واستكبروا استكبارا

translation: Then indeed, I invited them publicly.
interpretation: This verse signifies the unwavering commitment of the speaker to openly and confidently calling a specific group of people towards a certain belief or action. It reflects a sense of courage, determination, and a firm belief in the message being conveyed, regardless of any potential opposition or resistance.
orig: ثم إني دعوتهم جهارا

translation: Then I proclaimed to them and kept secret to them secrets.
interpretation: This verse may refer to the communication of divine messages and revelations from Allah to the people. It highlights the idea that certain aspects of the message are made public and proclaimed openly, while others are kept hidden and secret, possibly indicating the depth and complexity of divine wisdom and knowledge.
orig: ثم إني أعلنت لهم وأسررت لهم إسرارا

translation: So I said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord, indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah, as He is always ready to forgive His servants. It highlights the mercy and forgiveness of Allah towards those who sincerely repent and seek His forgiveness.
orig: فقلت استغفروا ربكم إنه كان غفارا

translation: He will send down upon you from the sky, rain in [due] measure.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the manifestations of Allah's mercy and provisions for His creation, as rain is sent down in the right amount at the right time to sustain life on earth. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power, control over nature, and His constant care for all living beings.
orig: يرسل السماء عليكم مدرارا

translation: And He will provide for you from His bounties; He will grant you children and develop you with wealth, and provide you with gardens and rivers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of sustenance and blessings from Allah. It highlights that everything we have, including wealth, children, gardens, and rivers, are all provisions and gifts from Allah. It serves as a reminder for gratitude towards the sustenance provided by our Creator.
orig: ويمددكم بأموال وبنين ويجعل لكم جنات ويجعل لكم أنهارا

translation: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur,
interpretation: This verse questions why people do not attribute the proper level of greatness and magnificence to Allah. It encourages believers to reflect on the glory and grandeur of Allah and to have a deep reverence for Him.
orig: ما لكم لا ترجون لله وقارا

translation: And He has created you in layers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the complex and intricate way in which Allah has created human beings. Each individual is unique in their composition, characteristics, and capabilities, reflecting the divine wisdom and creativity in the creation of mankind.
orig: وقد خلقكم أطوارا

translation: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens in layers?
interpretation: This verse highlights the intricate and profound creation of the heavens by Allah, emphasizing the perfect design and order in the universe. It encourages reflection on the marvels of creation and the power of Allah in creating such a complex and harmonious system of seven heavens.
orig: ألم تروا كيف خلق الله سبع سماوات طباقا

translation: And He placed the moon therein for light, and made the sun a burning lamp.
interpretation: This verse highlights the creation of the moon and the sun as sources of light and guidance in the universe. It signifies the wisdom and power of Allah in creating such celestial bodies to illuminate the darkness and provide warmth and light to the world. It also symbolizes the balance and harmony in the natural world orchestrated by Allah.
orig: وجعل القمر فيهن نورا وجعل الشمس سراجا

translation: And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and providence of Allah in creating and nurturing life on earth. It highlights the continuous growth and development of vegetation as a sign of Allah's mercy and care towards His creation. It serves as a reminder of the intricate and precise system of sustenance established by Allah for all living beings.
orig: والله أنبتكم من الأرض نباتا

translation: Then He will resurrect you therein, and bring you forth [again] in the manner of creation.
interpretation: This verse refers to the resurrection and recreation of individuals after their initial death. It emphasizes the concept of resurrection and the ultimate accountability before God for one's deeds. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment and the belief in life after death in Islam.
orig: ثم يعيدكم فيها ويخرجكم إخراجا

translation: And Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you,
interpretation: This verse highlights the vastness and the generosity of Allah in providing the earth as a place for humanity to dwell and fulfill their needs. It serves as a reminder of Allah's blessings and mercy upon His creation.
orig: والله جعل لكم الأرض بساطا

translation: so that you may make your way through its paths smooth
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of Allah in order to navigate through life with ease and without obstacles. By adhering to the teachings of the Qur'an and the Prophet Muhammad, believers can lead a life that is free from confusion and difficulties.
orig: لتسلكوا منها سبلا فجاجا

translation: Noah said, 'My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him in anything except loss.'
interpretation: Noah is expressing his distress to God about his people who have rejected his guidance and followed those whose material possessions and family connections do not add any value and will only lead them to ruin and loss.
orig: قال نوح رب إنهم عصوني واتبعوا من لم يزده ماله وولده إلا خسارا

translation: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that despite the schemes and deceptions of human beings, ultimately, it is Allah's plan that will prevail. It reminds believers that even when faced with difficulties and adversaries, they should trust in the divine plan and know that Allah's wisdom surpasses human understanding.
orig: ومكروا مكرا كبارا

translation: And they say, 'Do not leave your gods and do not leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the disbelievers who were worshipping multiple false gods. The verse highlights their concern about abandoning their idols, such as Wadd, Suwa', Yaghuth, Ya'uq, and Nasr. The interpretation emphasizes the folly of worshipping things that have no power or divinity, and the importance of turning to the one true God, Allah.
orig: وقالوا لا تذرن آلهتكم ولا تذرن ودا ولا سواعا ولا يغوث ويعوق ونسرا

translation: And they have certainly misled many, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who are unjust not only lead themselves astray but also lead others astray. It indicates that the path of wrongdoing is one of continuous error and misguidance, emphasizing the importance of staying away from unjust actions and individuals to remain on the right path.
orig: وقد أضلوا كثيرا ولا تزد الظالمين إلا ضلالا

translation: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that certain people faced as a result of their sins, leading them to be drowned and thrown into the Fire. It emphasizes the ultimate reality that there is no support or helper for anyone except from Allah, highlighting the importance of seeking guidance and assistance solely from Allah.
orig: مما خطيئاتهم أغرقوا فأدخلوا نارا فلم يجدوا لهم من دون الله أنصارا

translation: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant."
interpretation: This verse is from Surah Nuh in the Qur'an. Prophet Nuh (Noah) is pleading with Allah to not allow any of the disbelievers to remain on the earth, as they spread corruption and disbelief. The verse highlights the seriousness of disbelief and the importance of righteousness and belief in Allah. It also shows Nuh's concern for the purity and righteousness of the earth, seeking a world free from the influence of those who reject faith.
orig: وقال نوح رب لا تذر على الأرض من الكافرين ديارا

translation: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine justice, where leaving the wrongdoers unchecked can lead to corruption and misguidance among the people. It also indicates that those who persist in their disbelief and wrongdoing will only bring about more evil and disbelief. Thus, it highlights the importance of holding individuals accountable for their actions and ensuring that justice is maintained in society.
orig: إنك إن تذرهم يضلوا عبادك ولا يلدوا إلا فاجرا كفارا

translation: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication in which the speaker seeks forgiveness from God for themselves, their parents, all the believers who enter their house, as well as all believing men and women. The verse also includes a warning against increasing the wrongdoing individuals except in their own destruction, emphasizing the consequences of deviating from the path of righteousness and justice.
orig: رب اغفر لي ولوالدي ولمن دخل بيتي مؤمنا وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات ولا تزد الظالمين إلا تبارا

translation: Say, [O Muhammad], 'It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of jinn (creatures made of smokeless fire) who listened to the Qur'an and acknowledged its extraordinary nature. The jinn, like humans, have free will and the ability to believe in the message of the Qur'an, showcasing that the Qur'an's impact transcends the realms of humans and jinn.
orig: قل أوحي إلي أنه استمع نفر من الجن فقالوا إنا سمعنا قرآنا عجبا

translation: He guides to the right path, and we have believed in Him. And we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
interpretation: This verse expresses a profound declaration of faith and monotheism. It signifies the believers' unwavering commitment to following the guidance of God and their resolute belief in His Oneness. The believers affirm their devotion to God alone, without associating any partners or rivals with Him in worship, demonstrating their loyalty and submission solely to the Lord.
orig: يهدي إلى الرشد فآمنا به ولن نشرك بربنا أحدا

translation: And exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute oneness and uniqueness of God. It rejects the concept of God having offspring or a partner, asserting His independence and supremacy above any human limitations or associations. It highlights the pure monotheism in Islam and underscores the incomparable nature of God's divinity.
orig: وأنه تعالى جد ربنا ما اتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا

translation: And he used to say about Allah that which is unfounded falsehood.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of false claims and statements made about Allah without any basis or evidence. It serves as a warning against speaking about God in a foolish or ignorant manner, as it is a serious offense to attribute false things to Allah.
orig: وأنه كان يقول سفيهنا على الله شططا

translation: And I had thought that the jinn and mankind would never speak about Allah a lie.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief that both humans and jinn, as beings accountable to Allah, are not expected to lie about Him. It emphasizes the seriousness of falsehood when it comes to matters related to Allah, indicating the high standard of truthfulness expected from His creatures.
orig: وأنا ظننا أن لن تقول الإنس والجن على الله كذبا

translation: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.
interpretation: This verse highlights a misconception where some humans sought protection from the jinn (supernatural beings) who were believed to possess mystical powers. However, instead of finding refuge, their burdens and troubles increased. The verse serves as a warning against superstitions and misguided beliefs, urging people to seek protection and guidance only from Allah, the ultimate source of help and support.
orig: وأنه كان رجال من الإنس يعوذون برجال من الجن فزادوهم رهقا

translation: And they thought as you thought that Allah will not send anyone.
interpretation: This verse addresses the misguided belief of those who deny the resurrection and the Day of Judgment. The verse highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who think that God is not capable of resurrecting people and holding them accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder of the power and authority of Allah, who has the ability to bring all human beings back to life for judgment.
orig: وأنهم ظنوا كما ظننتم أن لن يبعث الله أحدا

translation: And when we have touched the heaven, we found it filled with strong guards and meteors.
interpretation: This verse describes a moment when the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) ascended to the heavens during the Isra and Mi'raj. It conveys the idea of the vastness and majesty of the heavens, as well as the presence of powerful guardians and meteors. It serves as a reminder of the grandeur and awe-inspiring nature of the celestial realms created by Allah.
orig: وأنا لمسنا السماء فوجدناها ملئت حرسا شديدا وشهبا

translation: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
interpretation: This verse speaks about a time when the angels used to sit in the heavens listening to messages from the heavens. But now, those who try to eavesdrop on the heavens will encounter flames waiting to strike them. The verse highlights the consequences for those who attempt to intercept or gain unauthorized access to the heavenly secrets, warning of severe punishment for such actions.
orig: وأنا كنا نقعد منها مقاعد للسمع فمن يستمع الآن يجد له شهابا رصدا

translation: And I do not know; perhaps it is a trial for those on earth or their Lord intends for them a right path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the uncertainty that human beings may face in understanding the reasons behind certain events or trials. It emphasizes the limited knowledge and perspective of human beings compared to the ultimate wisdom and guidance of their Lord. It serves as a reminder for believers to trust in Allah's ultimate plan and seek guidance and righteousness in times of ambiguity and confusion.
orig: وأنا لا ندري أشر أريد بمن في الأرض أم أراد بهم ربهم رشدا

translation: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the diversity among the jinn, stressing that like humans, they also have individuals who are righteous and others who are not. It suggests that differences and divisions exist among the jinn just as they do among humans.
orig: وأنا منا الصالحون ومنا دون ذلك كنا طرائق قددا

translation: And we thought that we would never be able to frustrate Allah in the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by flight.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that no one can escape or overpower the will of Allah. It emphasizes the ultimate power and sovereignty of Allah over all things, including the inability of humans to escape His control or punishment. It encourages believers to have faith in Allah's power and live their lives in accordance with His commands, knowing that ultimately, all affairs are in His hands.
orig: وأنا ظننا أن لن نعجز الله في الأرض ولن نعجزه هربا

translation: And when we have heard the guidance, we believe in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the guidance received from Allah and having faith in Him. It reassures believers that those who have faith in their Lord will not fear any loss or hardship, as Allah will always provide for and support them.
orig: وأنا لما سمعنا الهدى آمنا به فمن يؤمن بربه فلا يخاف بخسا ولا رهقا

translation: And among us are Muslims, and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity among people in terms of their beliefs and actions. It acknowledges that within communities, there are both Muslims who submit to God's will and follow the right path, as well as those who are unjust and deviate from the right course. It emphasizes the importance of choosing to embrace Islam as a way to seek guidance and righteousness.
orig: وأنا منا المسلمون ومنا القاسطون فمن أسلم فأولئك تحروا رشدا

translation: And as for the defiantly disobedient, they will be fuel for Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that those who persist in disobedience and rebellion against Allah will ultimately be the fuel for the Fire of Hell. It serves as a warning about the consequences of rejecting guidance and choosing a path of defiance and sin. The verse highlights the severity of the punishment awaiting those who continue to transgress the limits set by Allah.
orig: وأما القاسطون فكانوا لجهنم حطبا

translation: And if they had stood firm on the path, We would have provided them with abundant rainwater.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of divine support and blessings. It implies that if people remain steadfast on the right path and follow the guidance given to them by God, they will be rewarded abundantly. Just like rainwater nourishes and sustains life on earth, those who remain committed to righteousness and faith will receive spiritual blessings and support from God.
orig: وأن لو استقاموا على الطريقة لأسقيناهم ماء غدقا

translation: We will test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord - He will put him into the punishment of a burning fire.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that people will be tested in their lives, and those who choose to turn away from the guidance and remembrance of their Lord will face severe consequences and be subjected to the punishment of Hellfire. It emphasizes the importance of staying steadfast in one's faith and obedience to Allah, as turning away from His remembrance will lead one astray and ultimately to a painful punishment.
orig: لنفتنهم فيه ومن يعرض عن ذكر ربه يسلكه عذابا صعدا

translation: And that the mosques are for Allah (alone), so invoke not anyone along with Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the purity of worship in mosques, as they are dedicated solely to the worship of Allah. It warns against associating anyone or anything with Allah in worship, highlighting the importance of sincere and exclusive devotion to God in places of prayer.
orig: وأن المساجد لله فلا تدعوا مع الله أحدا

translation: And when the servant of Allah stood up invoking Him (in prayer) they (the jinn) almost swarmed all over him.
interpretation: This verse describes the reaction of the jinn (a type of supernatural beings) when a person, who is a servant of Allah, stands up to worship and pray to Allah. The jinn become close and attentive to the worshipper as if they were about to crowd around him and listen intently to his supplication.
orig: وأنه لما قام عبد الله يدعوه كادوا يكونون عليه لبدا

translation: Say, "Indeed, I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincere worship and devotion to Allah alone, without associating any partners with Him. It reaffirms the concept of Tawheed, the oneness of God, and highlights the rejection of polytheism and idolatry.
orig: قل إنما أدعو ربي ولا أشرك به أحدا

translation: Say: 'Verily, I possess no power to harm or benefit you.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the limited power of individuals over others, highlighting that ultimately it is Allah who has control over everything. It serves as a reminder that humans should not put their trust or fear in fellow humans, but rather in Allah alone, who controls all outcomes.
orig: قل إني لا أملك لكم ضرا ولا رشدا

translation: Say, 'Indeed, none can protect me from Allah at all, nor will I find a refuge apart from Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate protection and refuge in Allah alone. It highlights the belief that no one else has the power to protect or offer refuge to an individual besides Allah. It demonstrates the monotheistic principle and the importance of relying solely on Allah for all forms of help and support.
orig: قل إني لن يجيرني من الله أحد ولن أجد من دونه ملتحدا

translation: Except [when there is] a warning from Allah and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the consequences of disobeying Allah and His Messenger. It warns that those who go against the guidance and commands of Allah and His Messenger will face the punishment of the Hellfire, where they will dwell eternally.
orig: إلا بلاغا من الله ورسالاته ومن يعص الله ورسوله فإن له نار جهنم خالدين فيها أبدا

translation: Until when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.
interpretation: This verse highlights the idea that when those who deny the truth finally witness the consequences they were warned about, they will realize the weakness of their own support and the fewness of their numbers. It serves as a reminder that the truth will ultimately prevail and those who oppose it will see their own vulnerability and isolation.
orig: حتى إذا رأوا ما يوعدون فسيعلمون من أضعف ناصرا وأقل عددا

translation: Say, "Do you inform Allah of your vow or do you attribute to Him whatever is in your minds?"
interpretation: This verse questions the arrogance of those who believe they can outsmart or deceive Allah by making false promises or claims. It emphasizes that nothing is hidden from Allah, and he knows the intentions of our hearts. It serves as a reminder of the concept of God's infinite knowledge and power, urging humility and sincerity in our thoughts and actions.
orig: قل إن أدري أقريب ما توعدون أم يجعل له ربي أمدا

translation: Knower of the unseen, He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of Allah being the Knower of the unseen, emphasizing His ultimate knowledge and wisdom that surpass human understanding. It signifies that no one has access to the unseen except Allah, and this serves as a reminder for believers to trust in His wisdom and guidance.
orig: عالم الغيب فلا يظهر على غيبه أحدا

translation: Except for those [messenger angels] whom He has approved of [and others cannot intercede], and they, [in His presence], have the responsibility [of guarding] before Him and behind Him.
interpretation: This verse talks about special messenger angels that Allah has approved of, who are tasked with the responsibility of guarding before Him and behind Him. It highlights the unique position and role of these chosen angels in carrying out Allah's commands.
orig: إلا من ارتضى من رسول فإنه يسلك من بين يديه ومن خلفه رصدا

translation: So that they may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the messengers have fulfilled their duty by delivering the messages from their Lord. It also reflects the comprehensive knowledge and awareness of Allah, who knows everything that is with the messengers and has counted and measured all things accurately.
orig: ليعلم أن قد أبلغوا رسالات ربهم وأحاط بما لديهم وأحصى كل شيء عددا

translation: O you wrapped in a garment!
interpretation: This verse addresses the Prophet Muhammad, instructing him to prepare himself for the heavy responsibility of receiving and delivering the message of the Qur'an. It signifies a call to readiness, seriousness, and devotion to the task ahead, emphasizing the importance of being spiritually prepared and covered in the guidance of Allah before undertaking the mission of prophethood.
orig: يا أيها المزمل

translation: Stand [in prayer] at night, except for a little -
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to engage in the night prayer, known as Tahajjud or Qiyam-ul-Layl. It encourages them to dedicate a portion of the night to worship and reflection, showing devotion and seeking closeness to Allah. The verse also acknowledges human limitations by allowing for flexibility in the duration of the night prayer, understanding that not everyone may be able to pray extensively into the night.
orig: قم الليل إلا قليلا

translation: Take half of it or leave it a little.
interpretation: This verse is conveying a message about fairness and honesty in dealings among people. It is instructing to either give exactly what is owed, even if it is half, or to show leniency by leaving a small part unpaid. The emphasis here is on upholding justice and not taking more than what is rightfully due.
orig: نصفه أو انقص منه قليلا

translation: Or adduce a command even greater and recite the Qur'an in a measured way.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to recite the Qur'an with a measured and beautiful tone, emphasizing the importance of reciting the holy book with focus, reflection, and reverence. It serves as a reminder to recite the Qur'an carefully, not hastily, in order to fully comprehend and internalize its teachings.
orig: أو زد عليه ورتل القرآن ترتيلا

translation: We shall send down to you a weighty Word.
interpretation: This verse refers to the heavy responsibility and profound message that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was tasked with delivering to the people. It signifies the importance and gravity of the message of the Qur'an and the divine revelation that was revealed to him. It serves as a reminder of the weighty task of spreading the word of God and guiding humanity towards righteousness.
orig: إنا سنلقي عليك قولا ثقيلا

translation: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and importance of the night hours for prayers, reflections, and seeking nearness to Allah. The quiet and stillness of the night make it an ideal time for deep thoughts and sincere conversations with God. It suggests that the tranquility of the night creates a conducive environment for contemplation, self-reflection, and spiritual connectivity, making it a time when supplications are more likely to be granted.
orig: إن ناشئة الليل هي أشد وطئا وأقوم قيلا

translation: Verily, in the daytime you have a prolonged occupation.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers that they have great responsibilities and duties to fulfill during the daytime, indicating that they should engage in meaningful activities and productive endeavors throughout the day. It serves as a reminder to make the most of one's time and not waste it in idleness or unproductive pursuits.
orig: إن لك في النهار سبحا طويلا

translation: And mention the name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him with complete devotion.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of remembering and mentioning the name of Allah and dedicating oneself fully to Him with sincere devotion. It serves as a reminder to constantly be mindful of Allah and to prioritize Him in all aspects of life with complete sincerity and dedication.
orig: واذكر اسم ربك وتبتل إليه تبتيلا

translation: Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah, the Lord of all directions. It highlights that there is no deity worthy of worship except Him. Believers are encouraged to rely on Allah and entrust their affairs to Him, recognizing His control and authority over all matters.
orig: رب المشرق والمغرب لا إله إلا هو فاتخذه وكيلا

translation: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
interpretation: This verse advises believers to remain patient in the face of negative remarks or actions from others, and to distance themselves from those who are hostile in a dignified and graceful manner. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining composure and dealing with adversity with elegance and wisdom.
orig: واصبر على ما يقولون واهجرهم هجرا جميلا

translation: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah will deal with those who reject the truth and enjoy a life of ease in His own way and time. It emphasizes the concept of patience and trust in the divine judgement, as eventually, everyone will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: وذرني والمكذبين أولي النعمة ومهلهم قليلا

translation: Indeed, We have chains and a blazing fire.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that awaits those who reject the faith and commit sins. It serves as a reminder that the consequences of wrongdoing are severe and that there is a consequence for every action in the afterlife. The mention of chains and a blazing fire symbolize the intensity and severity of the punishment for those who disobey God’s commandments.
orig: إن لدينا أنكالا وجحيما

translation: and a painful punishment
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the consequences that await those who deny the truth and engage in wrongful behavior. It serves as a warning of the severe punishment that will be inflicted upon those who persist in their disobedience and rejection of guidance.
orig: وطعاما ذا غصة وعذابا أليما

translation: The Day the earth and the mountains will quake and the mountains will become like a heap of sand poured out.
interpretation: This verse describes the intense scene on the Day of Judgment when the earth and mountains will tremble in fear and awe before Allah's power. The mountains, which are usually depicted as stable and solid, will be reduced to scattered dust and will be as if they never existed. This event conveys the immense power of Allah and emphasizes the inevitability and magnitude of the Day of Judgment.
orig: يوم ترجف الأرض والجبال وكانت الجبال كثيبا مهيلا

translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that messengers have been sent by Allah to different nations throughout history to deliver His message and guide the people towards the right path. Here, it is emphasized that the Messenger sent to the people in question will bear witness to their deeds, just as the Messenger sent to Pharaoh bore witness to his actions. It highlights the importance of following the guidance brought by the messengers and being held accountable for one's actions.
orig: إنا أرسلنا إليكم رسولا شاهدا عليكم كما أرسلنا إلى فرعون رسولا

translation: So Pharaoh disobeyed the Messenger, and We seized him with a severe grip.
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh's defiant disobedience of the divine message brought by the Messenger (Moses), leading to his subsequent punishment and downfall. It exemplifies the consequences of arrogance, tyranny, and rejection of guidance, highlighting the importance of submission to God's commandments.
orig: فعصى فرعون الرسول فأخذناه أخذا وبيلا

translation: So how will you, if you disbelieve, protect yourselves on the Day which will turn the children gray-haired?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the powerlessness of disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. It paints a vivid picture of the overwhelming fright and panic that will grip the hearts of those who rejected faith when they witness the profound terrors and trials of that Day. The verse serves as a stark warning for people to take heed and turn to faith before it's too late.
orig: فكيف تتقون إن كفرتم يوما يجعل الولدان شيبا

translation: The sky will split asunder, for His promise is to be fulfilled.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the sky will split as a sign of the fulfillment of Allah's promise. It serves as a reminder of the inevitable Day of Judgment and the power of Allah to bring about the promised resurrection and accountability for all beings.
orig: السماء منفطر به كان وعده مفعولا

translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a powerful reminder for those who are willing to take a path towards their Lord. It highlights the free will of individuals to choose the path that leads them to Allah, encouraging them to seek closeness to Him through their own choices and actions.
orig: إن هذه تذكرة فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا

translation: Indeed, your Lord knows that you stand [in prayer] almost two-thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allah determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allah and others fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the flexibility in performing acts of worship, particularly the night prayer. It acknowledges that not everyone is capable of standing for prolonged periods in prayer during the night, thus allowing for different levels of commitment. It also highlights the necessity of seeking forgiveness from Allah, performing acts of charity, and striving in the path of Allah. The verse encourages consistency in worship, making efforts to do good deeds, and seeking the forgiveness of Allah due to His limitless mercy and forgiveness.
orig: إن ربك يعلم أنك تقوم أدنى من ثلثي الليل ونصفه وثلثه وطائفة من الذين معك والله يقدر الليل والنهار علم أن لن تحصوه فتاب عليكم فاقرءوا ما تيسر من القرآن علم أن سيكون منكم مرضى وآخرون يضربون في الأرض يبتغون من فضل الله وآخرون يقاتلون في سبيل الله فاقرءوا ما تيسر منه وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا وما تقدموا لأنفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله هو خيرا وأعظم أجرا واستغفروا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you enveloped in garments!
interpretation: This verse addresses Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and encourages him to convey the message of Islam to the people. The term 'Al-Mudathir' can be interpreted as 'the one enveloped' or 'cloaked', symbolizing the Prophet being tasked with the responsibility of delivering the divine message despite any challenges or obstacles he may face. It serves as a reminder for believers to also be steadfast in conveying the truth and spreading goodness, even in difficult circumstances.
orig: يا أيها المدثر

translation: Arise and warn,
interpretation: This verse is an instruction to the Prophet Muhammad to stand up and deliver a warning to the people. It emphasizes the duty of the Prophet to convey the message of Islam to all people, regardless of their acceptance or rejection of it.
orig: قم فأنذر

translation: And exalt your Lord.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to glorify and magnify the greatness of your Lord. It emphasizes the importance of praising and exalting Allah, acknowledging His supreme status and acknowledging His greatness in all aspects of life.
orig: وربك فكبر

translation: And purify your garments.
interpretation: This verse is a call to maintain cleanliness and purity in all aspects of life, including physical cleanliness and purity of the heart and intentions. It serves as a reminder to uphold moral values and integrity in all actions and behaviors.
orig: وثيابك فطهر

translation: And turn away from idolatry.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to avoid and distance themselves from all forms of idolatry, which includes worshiping anything or anyone other than Allah. It emphasizes the importance of staying away from all that is considered impure or blasphemous in the sight of God.
orig: والرجز فاهجر

translation: And do not extend favor to gain more.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers not to offer their kindness or favors to others with the intention of receiving something in return or gaining more benefits. It teaches them to be sincere in their actions and to do good deeds purely for the sake of pleasing Allah, without any expectations of worldly rewards or personal gain.
orig: ولا تمنن تستكثر

translation: So be patient with thy Lord
interpretation: This verse is advising to have patience and perseverance in facing challenges and difficulties with trust in God's plan, guidance, and help.
orig: ولربك فاصبر

translation: Then when the Horn is blown in it
interpretation: This verse refers to the blowing of the Horn (Soor) as a sign of the Day of Judgment. It signifies the terror and chaos that will ensue when the Day of Resurrection arrives. It serves as a reminder that all of creation will be gathered before their Lord for judgement and accountability.
orig: فإذا نقر في الناقور

translation: So that Day is a difficult Day.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the severity and difficulty of that day. It serves as a reminder to believers to always strive to do good deeds and seek forgiveness in order to prepare for the great challenges of that Day.
orig: فذلك يومئذ يوم عسير

translation: Upon the disbelievers is a burden that is heavy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that those who reject the truth and deny the message of Islam will bear a heavy burden as a consequence of their disbelief. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and responsibility each individual holds for their beliefs and actions, indicating that the rejection of faith comes with heavy consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: على الكافرين غير يسير

translation: Leave Me [alone] with [the one] whom I created [all by] Myself,
interpretation: This verse reflects the power and sovereignty of Allah, emphasizing His ability to create independently. It conveys the message that Allah is capable of creating all things by Himself without the need for help or partners. It highlights the unique and unmatched nature of the Creator, reaffirming His ultimate control and authority over all creation.
orig: ذرني ومن خلقت وحيدا

translation: And I have given him wealth abundant
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of provision and wealth being bestowed upon individuals by the will of Allah. It signifies that wealth is a blessing from Allah and is distributed according to His divine plan. It also serves as a reminder for individuals to be grateful for the provisions they have and to use their wealth in a manner that is pleasing to Allah.
orig: وجعلت له مالا ممدودا

translation: And sons as witnesses.
interpretation: This verse may be emphasizing the idea that having sons can serve as witnesses or bring strength to a family or community. Sons are seen as important witnesses in various aspects of life, such as inheritance, legal matters, or social affairs.
orig: وبنين شهودا

translation: And I prepared for him a way.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has facilitated and prepared a smooth and easy path for the person being mentioned, making their journey or task ahead simpler and free from obstacles. It signifies divine assistance and support in making things easier for the believer.
orig: ومهدت له تمهيدا

translation: Then he desires that I should add more.
interpretation: This verse refers to the attitude of a person who, despite being blessed by Allah, continues to desire more and more worldly possessions. It serves as a reminder that true contentment can only be found in being grateful for what one has, rather than constantly seeking to accumulate more wealth and possessions.
orig: ثم يطمع أن أزيد

translation: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection and stubbornness of those who refuse to believe in the signs and revelations of Allah. It signifies the arrogance and stubborn nature of individuals who, despite being presented with clear signs, choose to turn away and persist in their disbelief.
orig: كلا إنه كان لآياتنا عنيدا

translation: I will surely punish him.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that there will be consequences for those who go against the teachings of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and justice that exist in the divine plan, emphasizing the principle of retribution based on one's actions.
orig: سأرهقه صعودا

translation: He planned and determined.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of divine planning and determination. It highlights the belief that all things happen according to Allah's will and that He plans and decides all matters. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate control and wisdom of Allah over everything that occurs in the universe.
orig: إنه فكر وقدر

translation: So, slay not the innocent.
interpretation: This verse is urging against the killing of innocent lives. It is a reminder of the sanctity of life in Islam and emphasizes the importance of protecting and preserving the lives of those who are not engaged in any wrongdoing or harm.
orig: فقتل كيف قدر

translation: Then he (Moses) killed him (the Egyptian man), [but later regretted it].
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident in the story of Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) when he unintentionally killed an Egyptian man who was oppressing a fellow believer. The interpretation highlights that even though Moses acted in defense of the oppressed, he regretted taking a life and sought forgiveness from Allah. It serves as a lesson about the importance of seeking forgiveness for unintentional wrongdoings and showcases the humanity and humble nature of one of the great prophets.
orig: ثم قتل كيف قدر

translation: Then He turned to the heaven
interpretation: This verse illustrates the power and greatness of Allah, highlighting His ability to create and control the universe. It signifies that after creating the earth, Allah then turned His attention and power towards the heavens, emphasizing His control and dominion over all aspects of creation.
orig: ثم نظر

translation: Then he frowned and scowled.
interpretation: This verse refers to a specific incident where the Prophet Muhammad frowned at a blind man who came to him seeking guidance. It serves as a reminder of the importance of showing kindness, patience, and respect to everyone, regardless of their social status or physical abilities.
orig: ثم عبس وبسر

translation: Then he turned away arrogantly,
interpretation: This verse describes the behavior of a person who rejects the truth out of arrogance and pride. It highlights the negative consequences of turning away from guidance and being arrogant towards the teachings of Islam.
orig: ثم أدبر واستكبر

translation: So he said, 'These are only knowledgeable tricks.'
interpretation: In this verse, Pharaoh dismisses the miracles shown by Prophet Moses as mere magic tricks. His disbelief and arrogance blind him from recognizing the truth and deny the power and authority of Allah. It highlights the dangers of arrogance and stubbornness in preventing people from accepting the truth.
orig: فقال إن هذا إلا سحر يؤثر

translation: This is nothing but the word of a human being.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that the Qur'an is not the mere product of human invention or imagination, but a divine revelation. It emphasizes the stark contrast between the profound wisdom and guidance found in the Qur'an and the limitations of human speech and intellect. It serves as a reminder to acknowledge and appreciate the unique nature of the Qur'an as a miraculous message from God.
orig: إن هذا إلا قول البشر

translation: I will brand him on the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: This verse describes a severe punishment for those who reject and disobey Allah, indicating that they will be marked and branded in Hell on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a warning of the consequences of turning away from faith and choosing disbelief.
orig: سأصليه سقر

translation: And what can make you know what is Saqar?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severity and depth of the Hellfire by questioning the knowledge of the listener about its true nature. It conveys the incomprehensible horror and intensity of the punishment in Hell, indicating that it is beyond human understanding and imagination.
orig: وما أدراك ما سقر

translation: Do not leave anyone alive, nor do you spare anyone.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of not allowing any enemies to survive or escape in a situation of conflict. It is a call for total annihilation of the enemy and leaving no room for mercy or tolerance towards them. This could be understood in the context of war or battles where the enemies are considered a threat that must be completely eliminated.
orig: لا تبقي ولا تذر

translation: A reminder for mankind.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the Qur'an serves as a reminder for humanity, guiding them towards righteousness and urging them to reflect on the signs of Allah in the world. The Qur'an is a source of guidance and a reminder for people to follow the right path and avoid sins and heedlessness.
orig: لواحة للبشر

translation: Over it are nineteen.
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels who are guarding Hell. The number nineteen is significant and mysterious, possibly indicating the power and precision with which Hell is guarded and managed.
orig: عليها تسعة عشر

translation: And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt. And that those in whose hearts is hypocrisy and the disbelievers will say, 'What does Allah intend by this as an example?' Thus does Allah leave astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And the mention of the Qur'an is not but a reminder to human beings.
interpretation: This verse explains that the keepers of the Fire are angels appointed by Allah. Their number and presence are a test for disbelievers, with the intention of leading believers to have stronger faith and to remove doubts. This test also exposes the hypocrisy in the hearts of some disbelievers. It emphasizes that Allah guides whom He wills and leaves astray whom He wills, and that true knowledge of the unseen belongs only to Him. The Qur'an serves as a reminder to humanity of their purpose and guidance.
orig: وما جعلنا أصحاب النار إلا ملائكة وما جعلنا عدتهم إلا فتنة للذين كفروا ليستيقن الذين أوتوا الكتاب ويزداد الذين آمنوا إيمانا ولا يرتاب الذين أوتوا الكتاب والمؤمنون وليقول الذين في قلوبهم مرض والكافرون ماذا أراد الله بهذا مثلا كذلك يضل الله من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء وما يعلم جنود ربك إلا هو وما هي إلا ذكرى للبشر

translation: Nay! I swear by the moon,
interpretation: This verse begins with a strong denial followed by an oath by the moon. The use of such oaths in the Quran emphasizes the importance and seriousness of what is about to be said. This verse is meant to draw attention and affirm the truthfulness of the following statement, indicating that what comes next is of great significance and must be paid heed to.
orig: كلا والقمر

translation: By the night as it departs,
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance and power of the night as it fades away. The departure of night symbolizes a transition or change, reminding us of the continuous cycle of time and the transient nature of life. It also serves as a reminder of the signs of Allah's creation and the need to reflect on His greatness and wisdom in the changing phases of day and night.
orig: والليل إذ أدبر

translation: By the morning brightness,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of the beautiful morning light, which symbolizes a new beginning, hope, and renewal. It serves as a reminder of the blessings of a new day and the opportunity it represents to seek guidance and strive for righteousness.
orig: والصبح إذا أسفر

translation: Indeed, it is one of the great [signs].
interpretation: This verse refers to a great sign or miracle of Allah. It emphasizes the awe-inspiring nature of the phenomenon or event being described, highlighting the magnificence and power of Allah's creation.
orig: إنها لإحدى الكبر

translation: A warner to mankind.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the role of the Qur'an as a warning to all of humanity. It serves as a reminder and a caution against straying from the right path and the consequences of disobeying God's guidance. The Qur'an is a guidance for all people, inviting them to reflect, seek righteousness, and avoid wrongdoing.
orig: نذيرا للبشر

translation: To whoever of you desires to advance or stay behind.
interpretation: This verse highlights the freedom of choice that every individual has in deciding whether to take a step forward in pursuing the path of righteousness or to lag behind. It emphasizes that personal growth and progress in matters of faith are determined by individual choices and efforts.
orig: لمن شاء منكم أن يتقدم أو يتأخر

translation: Every soul is held captive by what it has earned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of individual accountability before God. It states that every person will be accountable for their own actions and decisions in this life. It serves as a reminder that each individual is responsible for their deeds, and they will face the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. Therefore, it encourages believers to be mindful of their actions and to strive to do good in order to earn the pleasure and mercy of God.
orig: كل نفس بما كسبت رهينة

translation: Except the companions of the right.
interpretation: This verse refers to a select group of people described as the 'companions of the right.' In Islamic theology, this group is believed to be the righteous and pious individuals who will be rewarded by Allah on the Day of Judgment. They are the ones who will receive their book of deeds in their right hand, a symbol of success and acceptance into Paradise. The verse signifies the importance of righteousness and faith in Islam, as well as the ultimate reward that awaits those who follow the true path.
orig: إلا أصحاب اليمين

translation: In gardens, they will question one another,
interpretation: In paradise, the believers will engage in friendly discussions and ask each other about their experiences and journey towards righteousness. It signifies the sense of community and companionship among the dwellers of paradise.
orig: في جنات يتساءلون

translation: From the criminals,
interpretation: This phrase is indicating a shift in focus onto the actions and characteristics of the guilty individuals or wrongdoers. It highlights that the subsequent discussion or context will be centered around the behavior and consequences related to those who commit crimes or immoral acts.
orig: عن المجرمين

translation: What has brought you to Saqar?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the wrongdoers about what led them to the punishment of Saqar (Hellfire). It serves as a reminder that individuals will be held accountable for their actions and choices, and that they will ultimately face the consequences of their deeds.
orig: ما سلككم في سقر

translation: They said, 'You are not of those who pray.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of disbelievers denying someone's status as a believer and questioning their commitment to prayer. It highlights the importance of sincerity and genuineness in one's faith and worship, as mere outward appearances may not always reflect one's true faith.
orig: قالوا لم نك من المصلين

translation: And we did not used to feed the poor.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the past behavior of disbelievers or those who neglect their duty towards the needy, stating that they did not used to feed the poor. It serves as a reminder to fulfill the obligation of helping those in need and caring for the less fortunate.
orig: ولم نك نطعم المسكين

translation: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it].
interpretation: This verse highlights the unproductive nature of engaging in meaningless conversations or arguments. It discourages individuals from wasting their time and efforts on futile discussions that do not bring any benefit, emphasizing the importance of engaging in meaningful and constructive dialogue.
orig: وكنا نخوض مع الخائضين

translation: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and ignorance of those who deny the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the belief in accountability for one's actions in the Hereafter, emphasizing the importance of faith in God's justice and the Day of Recompense.
orig: وكنا نكذب بيوم الدين

translation: Until there came to us the certainty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the eventual arrival of death, which is a certainty that every soul will face. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of life and the inevitability of the hereafter, urging believers to prepare for the Day of Judgment by living a righteous life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: حتى أتانا اليقين

translation: So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, no intercessors or intermediaries will be able to help or benefit anyone except with the permission of Allah. It highlights the absolute authority of Allah, who alone has the power to grant intercession and pardon on that day.
orig: فما تنفعهم شفاعة الشافعين

translation: So what is [the matter] with them that they are turning away from the advice?
interpretation: This verse questions the reason behind why people turn away from the reminders and advice given to them. It highlights the importance of reflecting on and heeding the guidance and admonition provided to them in order to benefit from it.
orig: فما لهم عن التذكرة معرضين

translation: Like they are frightened wild donkeys.
interpretation: This verse describes the disbelievers as being scattered and panicked, resembling frightened wild donkeys. The imagery conveys the sense of chaos and disorder among them due to their rejection of the truth and their lack of unity and guidance.
orig: كأنهم حمر مستنفرة

translation: I fled from Qaswarah.
interpretation: This verse seems to refer to a situation where the speaker had to flee or escape from a place called Qaswarah. It may represent a moment of fear, danger, or difficulty that led the speaker to leave that particular place in order to seek safety or protect themselves. The specific details and context surrounding this event may provide further insight into the significance of this verse.
orig: فرت من قسورة

translation: Rather, every one of them desires that he should be given scriptures spread out.
interpretation: This verse highlights the superficial desires of some individuals who seek to be seen as knowledgeable or pious by possessing and displaying scriptures, without truly internalizing their teachings or acting upon them sincerely. It serves as a reminder that the essence of faith lies not in outward appearances but in the genuine understanding and application of divine guidance.
orig: بل يريد كل امرئ منهم أن يؤتى صحفا منشرة

translation: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the misguided belief of some individuals who do not fear the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. It indicates that they do not have a sense of accountability in the afterlife, which leads them to commit wrongful deeds in this world without considering the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: كلا بل لا يخافون الآخرة

translation: Nay, indeed it is a reminder.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the Qur'an as a reminder for humanity. It serves as a source of guidance, wisdom, and reflection for believers, reminding them of their purpose in life and encouraging them to adhere to the teachings of Islam.
orig: كلا إنه تذكرة

translation: So whoever wills may remember it.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the act of remembering Allah and His teachings is a matter of personal choice and will. It emphasizes that the remembrance of Allah is open to all those who choose to do so, highlighting the importance of free will and personal commitment in spiritual matters.
orig: فمن شاء ذكره

translation: And they mention not except that Allah wills. He is the rightful owner of piety and forgiveness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything that is mentioned or occurs is by the will of Allah. He is the ultimate authority over piety and forgiveness, and it serves as a reminder of the importance of acknowledging and submitting to the will of Allah in all aspects of life.
orig: وما يذكرون إلا أن يشاء الله هو أهل التقوى وأهل المغفرة

translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance and significance of the Day of Resurrection by taking an oath upon it. It serves as a reminder to believers of the reality and certainty of the Day of Judgment, urging them to reflect on their actions and strive for righteousness in preparation for the Hereafter.
orig: لا أقسم بيوم القيامة

translation: And I swear by the reproaching soul,
interpretation: This verse is a solemn oath taken by Allah swearing by the self-reproaching soul. It highlights the significance of the soul's inherent nature to be constantly aware of its own faults and mistakes, and the internal struggle humans face when they go against their innate moral compass. It serves as a reminder for believers to be conscious of their actions and strive for self-improvement and righteousness.
orig: ولا أقسم بالنفس اللوامة

translation: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
interpretation: This verse challenges the arrogance and heedlessness of mankind, reminding them of the Day of Judgment when all will be resurrected and held accountable for their deeds. It serves as a reminder of the inevitability of death and the importance of living a righteous life in preparation for the Hereafter.
orig: أيحسب الإنسان ألن نجمع عظامه

translation: Yes, We are capable of reproducing his fingertips.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to recreate and resurrect people even to the finest detail such as the fingertips. It speaks to the belief in the afterlife and the Day of Judgment when every aspect of a person will be accounted for and brought back to life by Allah's will.
orig: بلى قادرين على أن نسوي بنانه

translation: Nay! But man desires to continue in sin.
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of humans to persist in committing sins and wrongdoing despite knowing what is right. It emphasizes the weakness of human nature and the struggle against sinful desires that many individuals face.
orig: بل يريد الإنسان ليفجر أمامه

translation: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
interpretation: This verse highlights the curiosity and concern of some disbelievers about the Day of Resurrection. The question posed demonstrates their lack of faith and understanding of the concept of the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder to believers about the certainty of the Day of Resurrection and the importance of preparing for it through faith and good deeds.
orig: يسأل أيان يوم القيامة

translation: So when the lightning lights up the sky,
interpretation: This verse describes a powerful scene where lightning brightens the dark sky, signifying a moment of brilliance and awe. It can be understood as a metaphor for sudden realizations or moments of clarity that can illuminate our lives and bring forth new understanding.
orig: فإذا برق البصر

translation: And the moon is eclipsed.
interpretation: This verse is describing a phenomenon where the moon is eclipsed. From an Islamic perspective, this may be seen as a sign of the power and majesty of Allah, as natural events such as eclipses are considered as signs of His creation and control over the universe.
orig: وخسف القمر

translation: And the sun and the moon are joined together.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah in controlling the celestial bodies in the universe. It showcases the harmony and balance in the universe, illustrating the perfect design and order created by Allah.
orig: وجمع الشمس والقمر

translation: Man will say on that day, 'Where is the [place of] escape?'
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, people will realize that there is no escape from facing the consequences of their actions. This verse highlights the accountability and inevitability of the Day of Judgment, where everyone will be called to account for their deeds.
orig: يقول الإنسان يومئذ أين المفر

translation: No! Not at all!
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every individual is responsible for their own actions and will bear the consequences, both good and bad, of their deeds. It reminds believers that no one can bear the burden of another's sins or deeds on the Day of Judgment, each soul will be held accountable for their own choices and actions.
orig: كلا لا وزر

translation: To your Lord that day is the destination.
interpretation: On that day, all beings will return to their Lord for judgement and accountability. It signifies the ultimate truth that every individual's final destination and ultimate goal is to return to their Creator and be held accountable for their deeds in this world.
orig: إلى ربك يومئذ المستقر

translation: On that Day, man will be informed of what he put forward and kept back.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the concept of accountability on the Day of Judgment, indicating that every individual will be made fully aware of their deeds, both the good and the bad, and will bear the consequences of their actions.
