It serves as a reminder of the importance of being mindful of our actions and intentions, as everything will be brought to light and judged accordingly in the Hereafter.
orig: ينبأ الإنسان يومئذ بما قدم وأخر

translation: Nay! [But] verily, man shall be well aware of himself,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that human beings have the capability to perceive and understand their own selves deeply. It points to the importance of self-awareness and introspection in order for individuals to recognize their own strengths, weaknesses, and moral responsibilities.
orig: بل الإنسان على نفسه بصيرة

translation: And even if he presents excuses.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no matter what excuses a person may present, they will not be sufficient to avoid the consequences of their actions. It serves as a reminder that one cannot escape accountability before God, and that sincerity and repentance are key in seeking forgiveness and mercy.
orig: ولو ألقى معاذيره

translation: Do not move your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with it.
interpretation: This verse is advising the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to be patient and composed in conveying the message of the Qur'an, not rushing or being quick in its recitation or delivery. It emphasizes the importance of measured speech and thoughtful communication in delivering the divine message.
orig: لا تحرك به لسانك لتعجل به

translation: Verily, it is upon Us to gather it and to recite it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the responsibility of preserving and reciting the Quran is upon Allah alone. It signifies the divine protection and preservation of the Quran from any alterations or corruption, ensuring that it remains in its original form for humanity to benefit from as a guide and source of wisdom.
orig: إن علينا جمعه وقرآنه

translation: So when We have recited it [through Jibril], then follow its recitation.
interpretation: This verse instructs us to not just listen to the Quran when it is recited, but also to follow its teachings and guidance in our lives. It emphasizes the importance of not only hearing the words of the Quran but also acting upon them.
orig: فإذا قرأناه فاتبع قرآنه

translation: Then upon Us is its clarification.
interpretation: This verse implies that it is the responsibility of Allah to explain and clarify the message of the Qur'an. It underscores the importance of seeking guidance and understanding from Allah to comprehend the deeper meanings of the Qur'anic verses.
orig: ثم إن علينا بيانه

translation: No! But you love the immediate [life].
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is highlighting the tendency of humans to focus on the immediate, temporary pleasures and gains of this worldly life over the everlasting rewards of the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder to prioritize actions that will lead to spiritual growth and success in the eternal life over temporary gratifications.
orig: كلا بل تحبون العاجلة

translation: And you leave the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse conveys the consequence of focusing solely on the material world and neglecting the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder to believers that they should not prioritize temporary worldly gains at the expense of the eternal life in the Hereafter, emphasizing the importance of balancing both aspects in a believer's life.
orig: وتذرون الآخرة

translation: Faces on that Day will be radiant,
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, some faces will be shining brightly with joy and happiness due to their good deeds and faith, while others will be gloomy and filled with despair due to their sins and disbelief.
orig: وجوه يومئذ ناضرة

translation: looking to their Lord
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of believers constantly turning their gaze, attention, and focus towards their Lord, seeking guidance, support, and mercy from Him. It conveys the idea of reliance on God and the importance of maintaining a connection with the Divine in all aspects of life.
orig: إلى ربها ناظرة

translation: And [some] faces, that Day, will be gloomy,
interpretation: On that Day, there will be faces filled with gloom and despair, reflecting the internal state of those who did not follow the guidance of Allah in their earthly lives. This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the importance of living a righteous life in accordance with the teachings of Islam, in order to attain success and happiness in the Hereafter.
orig: ووجوه يومئذ باسرة

translation: Do you think that He cannot bring them back to life?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the disbelievers about their lack of belief in the resurrection. It challenges them to consider if they truly believe that God, the All-Powerful, is incapable of bringing the dead back to life. It prompts reflection on the power and capabilities of God, emphasizing His authority over all things, including life and death.
orig: تظن أن يفعل بها فاقرة

translation: Nay! When the earth is pounded to powder,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the earth is trembled and shaken to its core, emphasizing the incredible power and might of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate reality and the Day of Reckoning when everything will be brought to an end and held accountable for their deeds.
orig: كلا إذا بلغت التراقي

translation: And it was said, 'Who will restore [life] to the bones?'
interpretation: This verse presents a question about the restoration of life to bones, highlighting the miraculous power of God to bring back life even to the most lifeless and decayed forms. It illustrates the concept of resurrection and the ultimate power of God over life and death.
orig: وقيل من راق

translation: And he thought it was [the time for] separation.
interpretation: This verse reflects a moment of uncertainty or fear in which an individual wrongly perceives a situation as the end or separation. It highlights the human tendency to misinterpret events or circumstances based on emotions or limited understanding, reminding believers to be patient and trust in the wisdom and decrees of Allah in times of difficulty.
orig: وظن أنه الفراق

translation: And the shin shall be uncovered
interpretation: This verse is a vivid description of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the horror and severity of the events that will occur. It symbolizes the stripping away of all pretense and protection, leaving individuals exposed and accountable for their deeds before Allah. The unveiling of the shin represents a moment of truth and transparency, where nothing can be hidden or concealed, and all actions and intentions will be laid bare for judgment.
orig: والتفت الساق بالساق

translation: To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
interpretation: On that Day, every individual will be presented before the Lord for judgment and will be assigned their eternal abode in either Paradise or Hell. It emphasizes the absolute authority of God as the final Judge who will determine the fate of all creation.
orig: إلى ربك يومئذ المساق

translation: So he did not believe, nor did he pray.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of both believing in Allah and fulfilling the act of prayer. It serves as a reminder that simply believing in the existence of Allah is not sufficient without following through with prayers. Both faith and rituals are essential components of a Muslim's life and are interconnected.
orig: فلا صدق ولا صلى

translation: But he denied and turned away.
interpretation: This verse highlights the response of those who rejected the message of truth, choosing instead to turn away from it and deny its validity. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from guidance and truth.
orig: ولكن كذب وتولى

translation: Then he came to his people, walking with pride.
interpretation: This verse describes a person returning to his community with arrogance and pride. It highlights the negative quality of arrogance and how it can affect relationships within a community.
orig: ثم ذهب إلى أهله يتمطى

translation: The nearer, the nearer.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the principle of priority and importance - that the closer or more immediate something is, the more priority it should have in one's attention and focus. It serves as a reminder to prioritize what is closer to us in various aspects of life, whether in terms of relationship, obligation, or importance.
orig: أولى لك فأولى

translation: Then more preferable to you is the first [life].
interpretation: This verse suggests that the life in the Hereafter is far better and more worthy of desiring than the life of this world. It emphasizes the importance of prioritizing actions that will benefit one in the afterlife, and encourages believers to focus on their eternal life rather than temporary pleasures in this world.
orig: ثم أولى لك فأولى

translation: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to humans that they should not presume they will be left unaccounted for or that their actions will not be considered. It conveys the message that God is fully aware of all that we do and will hold us accountable for our deeds in the Hereafter.
orig: أيحسب الإنسان أن يترك سدى

translation: Was he not a drop of ejaculated sperm?
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble origin of human beings, emphasizing that humans come from something as small and insignificant as a drop of sperm. It serves as a reminder of the power and creativity of Allah in creating life from such a tiny beginning, and it encourages humility and gratitude in recognizing the miraculous process of human creation.
orig: ألم يك نطفة من مني يمنى

translation: Then he was a clinging clot, and [ Allah ] created [his form] and proportioned [him].
interpretation: This verse describes the beginning of human creation, from a tiny clot of blood to a developed and proportioned human being. It highlights the miraculous transformation that occurs during the development of a human being and emphasizes the power and ability of Allah as the Creator.
orig: ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى

translation: So He made of it the two sexes, male and female.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the creative power of Allah by creating males and females as pairs, complementing each other in their differences and playing crucial roles in the continuity of life on earth.
orig: فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والأنثى

translation: Is not He who is capable of creating the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Indeed, He is the All-Knowing Creator.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to create anything, even to bring the dead back to life. It highlights the concept of resurrection and the ultimate power and knowledge of Allah as the Creator of everything.
orig: أليس ذلك بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى

translation: Has there come upon man a period of time when he was a thing unremembered?
interpretation: This verse questions whether there was a time when humans did not exist or were not recognized, pointing out the insignificance and transience of human existence in the grand scheme of creation. It highlights the humble origins of human beings and serves as a reminder of our mortality and dependence on the will of Allah.
orig: هل أتى على الإنسان حين من الدهر لم يكن شيئا مذكورا

translation: Verily, We created man from a drop of mixed fluid to test him, so We made him able to hear and see.
interpretation: This verse highlights the origin of mankind from a humble beginning, emphasizing the process of creation and the purpose of life being a test from Allah. The mention of hearing and sight indicates the importance of using these faculties to understand the signs of Allah and follow His guidance in this world.
orig: إنا خلقنا الإنسان من نطفة أمشاج نبتليه فجعلناه سميعا بصيرا

translation: Indeed, We guided him to the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that Allah guides people to the right path, giving them the choice to be either grateful or ungrateful for this guidance. It highlights the importance of gratitude and acknowledges that individuals have free will in accepting or rejecting the guidance offered to them.
orig: إنا هديناه السبيل إما شاكرا وإما كفورا

translation: Verily, We have prepared chains, yokes, and a blazing Fire for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the severe consequences awaiting those who choose to disbelieve. It describes the punishment as being bound in chains and yokes, and being cast into a blazing Fire. This serves as a warning to the disbelievers to remind them of the consequences of their rejection of faith.
orig: إنا أعتدنا للكافرين سلاسل وأغلالا وسعيرا

translation: Verily, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,
interpretation: This verse speaks of the reward and blessings that the righteous will receive in the hereafter. They will be given a unique and pure drink as a symbol of the ultimate pleasure and satisfaction awaiting them in paradise. The mention of Kafur, a substance known for its purity and fragrance, indicates the pure and exquisite nature of the blessings that the righteous will be granted in the afterlife.
orig: إن الأبرار يشربون من كأس كان مزاجها كافورا

translation: A spring from which the servants of Allah drink; they will make it gush forth in force.
interpretation: This verse portrays a scene of abundance and blessing provided by Allah to His servants. It signifies that believers will have access to abundant and refreshing water in Paradise, which will flow easily and abundantly for their pleasure and sustenance. It conveys the idea of eternal satisfaction and abundance in the Hereafter for those who faithfully serve Allah.
orig: عينا يشرب بها عباد الله يفجرونها تفجيرا

translation: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of fulfilling promises and commitments made to God. It emphasizes that those who keep their vows and obligations out of fear and reverence for Allah will be safeguarded from the widespread harm and evil that will prevail on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يوفون بالنذر ويخافون يوما كان شره مستطيرا

translation: And they give food, in spite of their love for it, to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of giving food and aid to those in need, even when the giver themselves may value the food greatly. It teaches about the act of selfless charity and kindness towards the less fortunate, highlighting the virtues of generosity and compassion in Islam.
orig: ويطعمون الطعام على حبه مسكينا ويتيما وأسيرا

translation: We feed you only for the countenance of Allah. We wish for no reward nor thanks from you.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of doing good deeds solely for the sake of Allah, without expecting any worldly gain or gratitude from others. It emphasizes the importance of sincerity in acts of charity and kindness, with the intention of seeking only the pleasure of Allah and not seeking validation or recognition from people.
orig: إنما نطعمكم لوجه الله لا نريد منكم جزاء ولا شكورا

translation: Indeed, we fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful.
interpretation: This verse expresses the deep fear and concern of believers regarding the Day of Judgment when they will stand before their Lord. It conveys the seriousness and gravity of that Day, emphasizing the importance of faith, righteousness, and accountability for one's actions in the sight of God.
orig: إنا نخاف من ربنا يوما عبوسا قمطريرا

translation: On that Day, Allah will protect them from the evil of that time and grant them brightness and joy.
interpretation: This verse describes a promise from Allah to protect and bless the believers on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that Allah will shield them from harm and distress, and instead, bestow upon them purity, beauty, and happiness. It highlights the idea of divine protection and reward for those who remain steadfast in their faith and righteousness.
orig: فوقاهم الله شر ذلك اليوم ولقاهم نضرة وسرورا

translation: And He will reward them for their patience with a garden and garments of silk.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the reward that Allah promises to those who demonstrate patience in the face of adversity. The believers who endure difficulties with patience will be rewarded with entry into paradise where they will enjoy luxuries like beautiful gardens and luxurious garments made of silk as a token of Allah's appreciation for their perseverance.
orig: وجزاهم بما صبروا جنة وحريرا

translation: Reclining therein on [raised] thrones, they will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the believers in Paradise, where they will be comfortably reclining on thrones, shielded from the extreme heat of the sun and the piercing cold. It highlights the luxurious and tranquil environment that awaits the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: متكئين فيها على الأرائك لا يرون فيها شمسا ولا زمهريرا

translation: Their shadows will cover them, and fruits will be brought low for them.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from paradise where the believers will be sheltered by the shadows of trees, and the fruits will be within easy reach, symbolizing the abundance and blessings that await the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: ودانية عليهم ظلالها وذللت قطوفها تذليلا

translation: And around them will circulate vessels of silver and glasses having been [made] clear as glass,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where people will be served with vessels made of silver and clear glasses, symbolizing the luxury and abundance of blessings in the afterlife. It signifies the fulfillment of desires and pleasures beyond imagination for those who have lived a righteous life and earned the reward of paradise.
orig: ويطاف عليهم بآنية من فضة وأكواب كانت قواريرا

translation: Vessels of silver, precise in measure.
interpretation: This verse highlights the precision and accuracy in the measurement of the vessels made of silver. It emphasizes the importance of being meticulous and detailed in our actions and transactions, as well as the value of precision in all aspects of life.
orig: قوارير من فضة قدروها تقديرا

translation: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
interpretation: This verse describes a reward in Paradise where the inhabitants will be given a pure and delightful drink, with a taste similar to that of ginger. It symbolizes the pleasures and comforts in the afterlife for those who have lived a righteous life on earth.
orig: ويسقون فيها كأسا كان مزاجها زنجبيلا

translation: A spring therein called Salsabil.
interpretation: This verse describes a spring in Paradise known as Salsabil. It symbolizes one of the many blessings and delights that inhabitants of paradise will enjoy. The mention of such beautiful and pure water conveys the idea of abundance, purity, and eternal contentment in the afterlife, emphasizing the serene and luxurious nature of paradise.
orig: عينا فيها تسمى سلسبيلا

translation: And immortal youths will be circling around them, when you see them, you would think them scattered pearls.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where immortal young companions will be attending to the believers. The description of them appearing like scattered pearls emphasizes their beauty, purity, and preciousness. It signifies the exquisite nature of the companionship and delights awaiting the faithful in the afterlife.
orig: ويطوف عليهم ولدان مخلدون إذا رأيتهم حسبتهم لؤلؤا منثورا

translation: And when you look, then look again; you will be dazzled and your sight will be amazed by the vastness [of the blessings and provisions in this world and the Hereafter].
interpretation: This verse suggests that when you reflect on the blessings bestowed upon you, both in this world and in the Hereafter, you will be astounded by their enormity and beauty. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of and grateful for the abundant provisions and favors that Allah has given us.
orig: وإذا رأيت ثم رأيت نعيما وملكا كبيرا

translation: Upon them will be garments of fine green silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
interpretation: This verse describes the luxurious attire and adornments that the righteous inhabitants of Paradise will be granted by Allah. The mention of fine green silk, brocade, silver bracelets, and purifying drinks paints a vivid picture of the rewards and pleasures awaiting those who enter Paradise. It showcases the immense beauty, comfort, and abundance that will be bestowed upon the believers in the Hereafter as a form of recognition and reward for their piety and good deeds in the world.
orig: عاليهم ثياب سندس خضر وإستبرق وحلوا أساور من فضة وسقاهم ربهم شرابا طهورا

translation: Indeed, this is a reward for you, and your effort has been appreciated.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the rewards promised by Allah are for the believers, and it acknowledges and appreciates their efforts in striving to do good deeds and follow the guidance of the Qur'an. It serves as an encouragement for believers to continue their efforts in worship and righteous deeds, with the assurance that their endeavors are recognized and valued by Allah.
orig: إن هذا كان لكم جزاء وكان سعيكم مشكورا

translation: Verily, We have sent down the Qur'an to you in stages.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the gradual revelation of the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) over a period of twenty-three years. It highlights the Divine wisdom in revealing the Qur'an gradually, taking into account the circumstances and needs of the Muslim community at each stage of revelation. This method allowed for the gradual implementation of Islamic rulings and teachings, facilitating an easier transition for the early Muslim community and ensuring a deeper understanding and reflection on the message of the Qur'an.
orig: إنا نحن نزلنا عليك القرآن تنزيلا

translation: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to have patience and perseverance in the face of challenges or difficulties, while also advising them not to follow those who are sinful or ungrateful towards God. It emphasizes the importance of staying steadfast and not compromising one's faith or values, even if others around them may be going astray.
orig: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تطع منهم آثما أو كفورا

translation: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and mentioning the name of Allah regularly, both in the morning and in the evening. It serves as a reminder for believers to maintain a strong connection with Allah throughout their day, starting and ending it with remembrance and gratitude.
orig: واذكر اسم ربك بكرة وأصيلا

translation: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worship during the night, specifically through prostration and glorification of Allah. It highlights the significance of dedicating a portion of the night to worship, demonstrating devotion and sincerity towards Allah.
orig: ومن الليل فاسجد له وسبحه ليلا طويلا

translation: Indeed, these [people] love the immediate and leave behind them a heavy Day.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that some people prioritize immediate, worldly pleasures over thinking about the consequences of their actions in the Hereafter. They are so focused on the present that they neglect the weight and importance of the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن هؤلاء يحبون العاجلة ويذرون وراءهم يوما ثقيلا

translation: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses completely.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the power and authority of Allah Almighty. It emphasizes that Allah has the ability to create and shape human beings as He wills, and at His will, He can change their physical appearances completely. It serves as a reminder of the limitless power and control that Allah has over His creation.
orig: نحن خلقناهم وشددنا أسرهم وإذا شئنا بدلنا أمثالهم تبديلا

translation: Verily, this is a reminder. So whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a reminder for humanity, showing the way to approach and connect with their Lord. It highlights that each person has the free will to choose whether to follow the path to their Lord or not.
orig: إن هذه تذكرة فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا

translation: And you do not will except that Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the ultimate power and authority of Allah. Our will and desires are subject to the will of Allah, and His knowledge and wisdom surpass all. It emphasizes the importance of submitting to the divine will and trusting in Allah’s wisdom in all matters.
orig: وما تشاءون إلا أن يشاء الله إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute authority and mercy of Allah, who chooses to admit whomever He wills into His mercy. However, those who persist in wrongdoing and oppression will face severe punishment, as they are the ones who have deliberately chosen to turn away from the path of righteousness.
orig: يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمين أعد لهم عذابا أليما

translation: By the winds sent forth one after another,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the powerful and purposeful nature of the winds, which are sent forth with precision and intention. It highlights the signs of Allah's creation and His control over the elements of nature.
orig: والمرسلات عرفا

translation: So the storm swept them away.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the power and severity of storms or calamities that can overcome people. It symbolizes the consequences of straying from the right path and the importance of staying steadfast and seeking guidance in the face of challenges.
orig: فالعاصفات عصفا

translation: And those who spread [the message]
interpretation: This verse refers to the people who actively spread and promote the message of Islam to others. It emphasizes the importance of sharing and propagating the teachings of the Quran and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to help guide and enlighten others. It highlights the duty of Muslims to convey the message of Islam to others and encourages them to actively engage in sharing the faith with those around them.
orig: والناشرات نشرا

translation: So I swear by the planets that recede
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power and significance of celestial bodies in the universe, highlighting their ability to move and recede. The oath taken by the receding planets draws attention to their awe-inspiring nature and their intricate motion, signifying the intricate design and system of the universe created by Allah.
orig: فالفارقات فرقا

translation: So proclaim (O Muhammad) what you are commanded,
interpretation: This verse is a command to the Prophet Muhammad to convey the message he has been given, without hesitation or alteration. It emphasizes the importance of delivering the message of Islam as it was revealed, without any changes or additions.
orig: فالملقيات ذكرا

translation: An excuse or a delay.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of fulfilling promises and commitments as well as the significance of keeping one's word in the sight of Allah. It serves as a reminder that one should not offer excuses or delays when it comes to honoring agreements and responsibilities.
orig: عذرا أو نذرا

translation: You are only promised the truth
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that the promises and prophecies mentioned in the Qur'an will undoubtedly come to pass. It serves as a reassurance that the truth of these promises will manifest, urging believers to have faith and patience in the face of adversities and trials.
orig: إنما توعدون لواقع

translation: So when the stars are obliterated,
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment, where the stars, which are considered to be a manifestation of the divine power and a sign of the greatness of God's creation, will be extinguished and disappear. It conveys the idea that on that Day, the very order of the universe will be overturned, emphasizing the power and control of God over all creation.
orig: فإذا النجوم طمست

translation: And when the sky is split open,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the sky will split open as a sign of the end of the world. It is a reminder of the immense power of Allah and the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection when all beings will be brought before Him for judgement.
orig: وإذا السماء فرجت

translation: And when the mountains are scattered,
interpretation: This verse alludes to a great catastrophic event that will occur in the future. It emphasizes the immense power of Allah, who can cause even the seemingly solid and immovable mountains to be obliterated. This serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when all creation will be destroyed and resurrected for the ultimate accountability before Allah.
orig: وإذا الجبال نسفت

translation: And when the messengers are made to stand
interpretation: This verse highlights a moment of reckoning where the messengers of God are called to stand before Him to testify to their fulfillment of their mission. It serves as a reminder of the accountability of all individuals, even the most honored and noble messengers, before God in the Hereafter.
orig: وإذا الرسل أقتت

translation: For what Day were [the disbelievers] postponed?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the reality of the Day of Judgment and questioning the disbelief of those who deny it. It serves as a reminder that there will come a day when everyone will be held accountable for their actions and beliefs, and those who rejected the truth will then realize the consequences of their denial.
orig: لأي يوم أجلت

translation: For the Day of Judgement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the day when all human beings will be judged and held accountable for their beliefs and actions. It serves as a reminder of the eventual accountability and justice that will be administered by Allah on that day. It underscores the importance of living a righteous life and fulfilling one's responsibilities towards Allah and fellow human beings.
orig: ليوم الفصل

translation: And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
interpretation: This verse highlights the incomprehensible nature of the Day of Judgement. It emphasizes the severity and significance of the Day of Judgement, which is a day when all individuals will be held accountable for their deeds and will receive their ultimate reward or punishment. It serves as a reminder to believers to remain steadfast in their faith and righteous deeds in preparation for that inevitable Day.
orig: وما أدراك ما يوم الفصل

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: On that Day of Judgment, there will be great misery and regret for those who denied the truth and rejected the messages of Allah. This verse serves as a warning to those who choose to disbelieve and turn away from the guidance of God, emphasizing the consequences they will face in the Hereafter for their disbelief.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
interpretation: This verse questions the listener about the destruction of the previous nations by God as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and wrongdoing. It serves as a warning to those who may be following a similar path, urging them to reflect on the lessons of history and turn back to God before facing a similar fate.
orig: ألم نهلك الأولين

translation: Then We will follow them with the others.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that individuals will be followed by others in their actions, whether good or bad. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and consequences of our deeds, as our actions can set examples for those who come after us.
orig: ثم نتبعهم الآخرين

translation: This is what We do to the criminals.
interpretation: This statement is a reminder of the consequences that await those who commit wrongdoings and sins. It serves as a warning that Allah will deal with the criminals justly and punish them accordingly. It emphasizes the concept of divine justice and accountability, reiterating that no one will escape the consequences of their actions.
orig: كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: On that Day, there will be great distress and regret for those who rejected the truth and denied the signs of Allah. They will face the consequences of their disbelief and rejection of the guidance that was offered to them.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the humble origin of human beings, created from a despised fluid, emphasizing the importance of humility and gratitude towards the Creator. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of human existence and the need for humility and gratitude in recognizing the origin of our creation.
orig: ألم نخلقكم من ماء مهين

translation: So We made him (Ibrahim) settled in a safe place
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) being settled in a secure and tranquil place chosen by Allah. It signifies Allah's protection and care for his believing servants, ensuring their safety and well-being in the world.
orig: فجعلناه في قرار مكين

translation: To a specified extent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that everything in this world is predetermined and measured by Allah. It signifies that the limits and boundaries of all things are known and set by Him, highlighting the concept of predestination and the divine knowledge and control over everything.
orig: إلى قدر معلوم

translation: We have determined, and excellent are the determiners.
interpretation: This verse signifies the power and authority of Allah, who has the ultimate ability to determine and decree all matters. It acknowledges the perfect control and ability of Allah over all things, highlighting His supreme power and wisdom in decreeing the fate of all creation.
orig: فقدرنا فنعم القادرون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the truth and reject the message of God. It foretells a day of great despair and regret for those who choose to disbelieve despite the clear signs and warnings provided to them.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Did We not make the earth a resting place?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, reminding mankind of His power and wisdom in creating the earth as a stable and secure place for all living creatures. It emphasizes the blessings and provisions that the earth offers to humans as a place of rest and sustenance, ultimately leading us to reflect on the greatness of Allah's creation and His mercy towards His creatures.
orig: ألم نجعل الأرض كفاتا

translation: The living and the dead.
interpretation: This verse refers to the ultimate power and knowledge of Allah, who is aware of every living being and every deceased soul. It signifies that Allah's knowledge encompasses all aspects of existence, whether alive or passed away, emphasizing the fact that no one can escape His awareness and judgment.
orig: أحياء وأمواتا

translation: And We made therein lofty mountains as pegs, and We gave you to drink sweet water.
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah has created mountains as stable anchors on the earth's surface and has provided water for sustenance to His creation. It signifies the power and wisdom of Allah in His creation and His abundant mercy in providing for the needs of His creatures.
orig: وجعلنا فيها رواسي شامخات وأسقيناكم ماء فراتا

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a warning about the impending doom and punishment that will befall those who deny the truth on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and rejection of the signs of Allah.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Set forth to that which you used to deny.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to embrace the truth and move towards accepting and following the guidance that they were previously rejecting or denying. It serves as a reminder to be open-minded and willing to change one's beliefs in order to align with the truth of Islam.
orig: انطلقوا إلى ما كنتم به تكذبون

translation: Proceed to the shadow of a cloud having three branches,
interpretation: This verse is urging believers to seek shade and protection under the guidance and teachings of Allah, which are vast and encompassing like the shade of a cloud with multiple branches. It symbolizes the importance of finding refuge and solace in the guidance of God during times of trial and difficulty.
orig: انطلقوا إلى ظل ذي ثلاث شعب

translation: No shade will there be that Day, nor will they need [any] sun.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, there will be no shade for the disbelievers, and they will not find any comfort or relief from the intense heat and torment of the Hellfire. This verse highlights the severity and inevitability of the punishment awaiting those who reject faith and commit evil deeds.
orig: لا ظليل ولا يغني من اللهب

translation: It throws sparks like palaces.
interpretation: This verse is describing a scene where something is throwing sparks that resemble the grandeur and size of palaces. It emphasizes the powerful image of sparks being thrown with great force and intensity.
orig: إنها ترمي بشرر كالقصر

translation: As if it were yellow camels.
interpretation: This verse is often interpreted as describing the color of yellow camels. However, scholars have differed on the exact meaning of this phrase, some suggesting that it may be symbolic or metaphorical, rather than describing the actual color of camels. It serves to remind believers of the bounties and blessings of Allah, which are vast and abundant, just like the beauty of a herd of yellow camels.
orig: كأنه جمالت صفر

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: On that Day, there will be great anguish and regret for those who denied and rejected the truth of Allah and His message. It emphasizes the severe consequences that those who disbelieved will face in the Hereafter.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: This is a Day when they will not speak.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment, a day when everyone will stand before Allah and no one will be able to speak in their defense or argue their case. It emphasizes the absolute authority and power of Allah on that Day, where all will be held accountable for their actions and deeds.
orig: هذا يوم لا ينطقون

translation: And they are not given permission to apologize.
interpretation: This verse indicates that there are situations in which some people are not allowed to seek forgiveness or make amends. It may suggest that certain actions or behaviors are so severe or unforgivable that they are beyond apology or redemption.
orig: ولا يؤذن لهم فيعتذرون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a warning about the severe consequences awaiting those who deny the truth on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the accountability and justice that will prevail in the hereafter, where the deniers will face regret and punishment for their disbelief.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: This is the Day of Judgement; We have gathered you and the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgement when all people, both past and present, will be gathered together for final judgement by God. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability of all individuals for their actions and beliefs.
orig: هذا يوم الفصل جمعناكم والأولين

translation: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that no matter how much we may plan or scheme, ultimately it is God who is the best of planners. It serves as a warning to those who may plot against God or His messengers, emphasizing that any plan against God will ultimately be in vain.
orig: فإن كان لكم كيد فكيدون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning of impending doom and misery on the Day of Judgment for those who deny the truth and refuse to believe. It conveys the severe consequences of rejecting faith and the accountability that awaits such individuals in the afterlife.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Verily, the righteous will be in shades and springs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward and status of the righteous individuals who are conscious of God in the hereafter. They will be provided with shades from the harsh heat and springs for refreshment, symbolizing the comfort and ease they will experience as a result of their piety and righteousness.
orig: إن المتقين في ظلال وعيون

translation: And [they will be given] fruits from whatever they desire,
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings and rewards that righteous believers will receive in paradise, emphasizing that they will be provided with all kinds of fruits and delights that they desire and wish for.
orig: وفواكه مما يشتهون

translation: Eat and drink at ease for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to the believers that they will be rewarded in Paradise for their good deeds in the worldly life. It is a source of reassurance that they will enjoy the blessings of Allah in the afterlife without any fear or worry. The verse encourages the believers to continue doing good deeds and to have faith in the promise of Allah's rewards.
orig: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Verily, thus do We reward the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah recognizes and rewards those who perform good deeds. It emphasizes the concept of divine justice and reassures believers that their efforts to do good will not go unnoticed or unrewarded.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Woe that day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse conveys a warning of severe punishment on the Day of Judgment for those who deny the truth and reject the signs of Allah. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and the accountability that awaits in the Hereafter.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while; surely, you are criminals.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to those who indulged in wrongdoing and sin, instructing them to enjoy the temporary pleasures of this world, but the underlying message is that ultimately they will face consequences for their actions. It emphasizes the transitory nature of worldly pleasures and warns against the arrogance and heedlessness that can arise from indulging in them without accountability. The verse serves as a caution to those who have deviated from the right path, urging them to reflect on their deeds and seek repentance before facing judgment in the Hereafter.
orig: كلوا وتمتعوا قليلا إنكم مجرمون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a warning about the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the inevitable punishment that will befall those who deny the truth of the religion. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and the importance of believing in God and following His guidance.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Bow down,' they do not bow down.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of those who refuse to submit to the commandments of Allah. It signifies the refusal of some individuals to humble themselves before their Creator and heed His guidance, despite being reminded and instructed to do so.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اركعوا لا يركعون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the truth and reject the guidance of Allah that they will face great distress and regret on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of failing to believe in the message of the Qur'an and the existence of a Day of Reckoning.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: So in what statement after this do they believe?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the disbelief of people despite the clear and powerful message of the Qur'an. It challenges the listeners to reflect on what other evidence or message they are waiting for in order to believe, as the message of the Qur'an is complete and sufficient for guidance.
orig: فبأي حديث بعده يؤمنون

translation: What are they questioning about?
interpretation: This verse highlights the questioning and doubtful nature of some individuals in regards to the teachings of the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder of the importance of seeking knowledge with sincerity and humility, rather than engaging in fruitless arguments and questioning for the sake of causing confusion or doubt.
orig: عم يتساءلون

translation: Concerning what are they asking one another?
interpretation: This verse refers to people asking one another about the great news or the momentous event that will take place. It suggests a sense of curiosity and wonder among people about a significant event or revelation that is to come.
orig: عن النبإ العظيم

translation: in which they differ.
interpretation: This verse refers to matters in which people hold different opinions or perspectives. It signifies that disagreements and differences will arise among people in various aspects of life. This can serve as a reminder to handle disagreements with patience, respect, and understanding, while seeking peaceful resolutions.
orig: الذي هم فيه مختلفون

translation: No! They will soon know.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that ultimately everyone will come to know the truth and the consequences of their actions. It emphasizes that no one can escape accountability for their deeds, and it is a call to reflect on one's choices and intentions in light of this inevitable knowledge that will be revealed.
orig: كلا سيعلمون

translation: Then indeed they will know.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that all people will eventually come to know and understand the truth. It highlights the inevitability of knowledge and awareness, suggesting that ignorance or denial will not last indefinitely. Ultimately, each individual will gain knowledge and recognition of the reality of their existence and their deeds.
orig: ثم كلا سيعلمون

translation: Have We not made the earth as a bed?
interpretation: This verse highlights the vastness and stability of the earth, which has been created by Allah as a resting place and a cradle for all its inhabitants. It serves as a reminder of the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the perfect environment for life to thrive.
orig: ألم نجعل الأرض مهادا

translation: And the mountains as stakes.
interpretation: This verse describes the mountains as pegs or stakes that firmly anchor the Earth. Mountains serve as stabilizers, ensuring the stability of the Earth's crust and preventing it from shaking or moving. The mention of mountains in this context highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the Earth with such precision and balance.
orig: والجبال أوتادا

translation: And We created you in pairs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of pairs and complementary relationships in the creation of human beings. It emphasizes the idea of balance, harmony, and mutual support between individuals, which is a fundamental aspect of human existence and the natural order of the universe according to Islamic belief.
orig: وخلقناكم أزواجا

translation: And We made your sleep [a means for] rest,
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessing of sleep as a form of rest and rejuvenation provided by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of sleep in maintaining physical and mental well-being, and serves as a reminder of the mercy of God in allowing humans to rest and recover through the act of sleeping.
orig: وجعلنا نومكم سباتا

translation: And We made the night as clothing,
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine wisdom in the creation of night, emphasizing its function as a covering. Night serves as a means of comfort, protection, and a time for rest and rejuvenation. Through this metaphorical comparison to clothing, the verse symbolizes the enveloping nature of night and its role in shaping the rhythm of life on earth.
orig: وجعلنا الليل لباسا

translation: And We made the day for livelihood.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the day as a time for earning a living and engaging in productive activities. It emphasizes the concept of time as a resource provided by Allah for sustenance and productivity in this world.
orig: وجعلنا النهار معاشا

translation: And We constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
interpretation: This verse describes the creation of the seven heavens by Allah above the Earth. The 'seven strong heavens' signify the layers of the sky and the cosmic system that exist above us. It reflects the vastness, order, and complexity of the universe created by Allah, emphasizing His power and wisdom in the design and organization of the heavens.
orig: وبنينا فوقكم سبعا شدادا

translation: And We made the sun a shining lamp.
interpretation: This verse refers to the magnificence and power of the sun, created by Allah as a radiant source of light and warmth for the Earth. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to provide sustenance and guidance to His creation, and highlights the importance of the sun as a vital element in the balance of the universe.
orig: وجعلنا سراجا وهاجا

translation: And We sent down from the clouds water pouring forth in abundance,
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessing of rainfall as a mercy from Allah, emphasizing the abundance and continuous flow of water that sustains life on Earth. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power and wisdom in providing for His creation, and calls on believers to reflect on and be grateful for this essential gift of water.
orig: وأنزلنا من المعصرات ماء ثجاجا

translation: We bring forth thereby grain and vegetation.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who creates and sustains life on Earth by causing grains and vegetation to sprout forth from the earth. It serves as a reminder of the cycles of life, growth, and sustenance provided by Allah for the well-being and nourishment of His creation.
orig: لنخرج به حبا ونباتا

translation: A garden of lofty heights.
interpretation: This verse describes the concept of paradise in Islam as a beautiful and elevated garden. It symbolizes a place of ultimate peace, happiness, and rewards for the believers who follow the teachings of Allah and lead a righteous life.
orig: وجنات ألفافا

translation: Verily, the Day of Judgment is the appointed time.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty and inevitability of the Day of Judgment, where all individuals will be judged based on their beliefs and deeds. It serves as a reminder of the importance of leading a righteous life and preparing for the accountability that awaits in the afterlife.
orig: إن يوم الفصل كان ميقاتا

translation: On the day when the horn will be blown, and you will come forth in multitudes.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when the trumpet will be blown, and all beings will be resurrected and gathered in groups before their Lord for judgment. It signifies the ultimate power and authority of Allah over all creation, and the day when each individual will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: يوم ينفخ في الصور فتأتون أفواجا

translation: And the heaven was opened and became gateways,
interpretation: This verse describes a profound and miraculous event where the sky is opened up, revealing gateways or passages. It signifies the power and greatness of Allah, the Creator, who has the ability to unveil the unseen and reveal the mysteries of the universe. It also serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment when the heavens will be opened up for the believers to enter Paradise, highlighting the ultimate justice and mercy of Allah towards those who have faith and do good deeds.
orig: وفتحت السماء فكانت أبوابا

translation: And the mountains will be as a mirage.
interpretation: This verse is describing the Day of Judgment when the mountains, which are often seen as symbols of strength and stability, will be reduced to nothing but an illusion, like a mirage. It highlights the overwhelming power and authority of Allah on that day, when even the most formidable creations of Allah will be insignificant before Him.
orig: وسيرت الجبال فكانت سرابا

translation: Indeed, Hell is lying in wait,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Hell is real and ready, awaiting those who disobey God's commands. It serves as a stark reminder of the consequences of wrongful actions and urges believers to stay on the path of righteousness to avoid the punishment of Hell.
orig: إن جهنم كانت مرصادا

translation: For the transgressors is a place of return
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who commit oppression and transgression will eventually have to face the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning to those who unjustly harm others, reminding them that there will be a reckoning in the Hereafter where they will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: للطاغين مآبا

translation: They will abide therein for ages.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the punishment of the disbelievers and wrongdoers in the Hellfire. It emphasizes the eternal nature of their punishment, indicating that they will dwell in it for a very long, seemingly endless period of time as a consequence of their sins and rejection of faith during their worldly lives.
orig: لابثين فيها أحقابا

translation: They will not taste therein coolness or drink.
interpretation: In this verse, Allah describes the punishment of the Hellfire, in which the inhabitants will not find any relief from its intense heat or any coolness to soothe their suffering. This emphasizes the severity and eternal nature of the punishment awaiting those who reject faith and commit evil deeds in their worldly life.
orig: لا يذوقون فيها بردا ولا شرابا

translation: No food will there be for them except from a boiling spring and a dirty wound.
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment in the afterlife for the wrongdoers, emphasizing that they will have no sustenance or relief other than scalding water and a festering wound. It conveys the severity and inevitability of divine justice for those who commit evil deeds.
orig: إلا حميما وغساقا

translation: Recompense proportioned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of fairness and balance in recompense. It signifies that the rewards and consequences for one's actions are given in perfect accordance with the deeds performed. It serves as a reminder that God's justice is precise and just, ensuring that everyone is fairly compensated for their actions.
orig: جزاء وفاقا

translation: Indeed, they never expected an account.
interpretation: This verse reflects on the disbelief and arrogance of those who reject the notion of accountability before God. It highlights their refusal to accept that there will be a Day of Judgment where they will be held responsible for their deeds and actions in this world. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of denying the reality of the Hereafter and the importance of living a righteous life with the awareness of being accountable to God.
orig: إنهم كانوا لا يرجون حسابا

translation: And they denied Our signs with [emphatic] denial.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that some people rejected the signs and verses of Allah with complete denial and disbelief. It highlights the stubbornness and arrogance of those who choose to reject the clear signs and guidance provided by Allah, despite their truth and wisdom.
orig: وكذبوا بآياتنا كذابا

translation: And We have enumerated everything in a register.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the comprehensive knowledge and power of Allah, who has recorded and accounted for everything in existence. It illustrates the perfect organization and control that Allah maintains over all aspects of creation, ensuring that nothing is overlooked or forgotten. It serves as a reminder of God's complete awareness and authority over the universe, highlighting the divine justice and wisdom that underpins all creation.
orig: وكل شيء أحصيناه كتابا

translation: So taste [punishment] because we will not increase you except in torment.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to those who reject the guidance and mercy of Allah, that they will only increase in torment and punishment for their disbelief and disobedience. It signifies the consequences of turning away from the truth and choosing to follow a path of disobedience.
orig: فذوقوا فلن نزيدكم إلا عذابا

translation: Indeed, for the righteous is success.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that success and victory are guaranteed for those who are mindful of God and adhere to His commandments. It serves as a reminder that true success in this life and the hereafter is reserved for those who fear God and strive to live a righteous life.
orig: إن للمتقين مفازا

translation: Gardens and grapevines.
interpretation: This verse alludes to the beauty and abundance of Paradise, where believers will be rewarded with lush gardens and fruitful grapevines as a symbol of the bountiful blessings in the afterlife.
orig: حدائق وأعنابا

translation: And youthful servants equal in age.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where there will be servants of equal age serving the inhabitants of paradise. It signifies equality and abundance in the blessings of paradise, where everyone will be youthful and ageless, serving each other with ease and grace.
orig: وكواعب أترابا

translation: And a cup [of wine] flowing with pleasure.
interpretation: This verse is describing one of the rewards for the believers in Paradise, where they will be given a cup of wine that is pure and delicious, symbolizing the pleasure and joy that they will experience in the afterlife. It signifies the ultimate reward and fulfillment that awaits the righteous in the hereafter.
orig: وكأسا دهاقا

translation: They will not hear therein any ill speech or falsehood.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the purity and righteousness of paradise, stating that its inhabitants will not be exposed to any indecency, lies, or falsehood. It highlights the ideal nature of the environment in paradise where only truth and goodness prevail, and there is no room for deceit or harm.
orig: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا كذابا

translation: The reward from your Lord is a gift for which an account is demanded
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of accountability and just recompense from Allah. It emphasizes that the rewards for one's actions are given by Allah as gifts, but every individual will be held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: جزاء من ربك عطاء حسابا

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate authority and power of Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that no one has the right to speak on His behalf or claim any share of His divine authority. It asserts the unique sovereignty and majesty of Allah in the entire universe.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما الرحمن لا يملكون منه خطابا

translation: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for the one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will speak what is correct.
interpretation: The verse describes a scene on the Day of Judgment where the Spirit and the angels will stand in orderly rows. Only those whom Allah grants permission will be allowed to speak, and what they say will be the truth. This signifies the ultimate authority and control that Allah possesses on that Day, where only truth will be spoken.
orig: يوم يقوم الروح والملائكة صفا لا يتكلمون إلا من أذن له الرحمن وقال صوابا

translation: That Day is the true reality. So whoever wills, let him take a way to his Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty and truth of the Day of Judgment. It explains that everyone has the free will to choose their path and relationship with God. It serves as a reminder that ultimately everyone will return to their Lord and face the consequences of their choices and actions.
orig: ذلك اليوم الحق فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه مآبا

translation: Indeed, We have warned you of a near punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth and the disbeliever will say, 'Oh, I wish I were dust!'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning of the impending punishment for those who reject the truth and indulge in wrongdoing. It describes the Day of Judgment when every action, whether good or bad, will be laid bare before everyone. The regret and despair of the disbelievers will be intense, to the extent that they will wish they were mere dust to avoid facing the consequences of their actions. It emphasizes the inevitable accountability that awaits every individual, urging them to reflect on their deeds before it's too late.
orig: إنا أنذرناكم عذابا قريبا يوم ينظر المرء ما قدمت يداه ويقول الكافر يا ليتني كنت ترابا

translation: And those who pull out gently,
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels who gently pull out the souls of the deceased, separating them from their bodies at the time of death. It signifies the peaceful and merciful nature of this act, as the angels handle the soul delicately and with care, guiding it towards the afterlife.
orig: والنازعات غرقا

translation: And the nāšitāt nāšitā.
interpretation: This verse is considered one of the most concise and enigmatic verses in the Qur'an, with various interpretations based on the context and the meaning of the root words. One interpretation is that it refers to active, diligent, and hardworking women who are dedicated and energetic in fulfilling their duties and responsibilities. It can be seen as an encouragement for women to be proactive and steadfast in their endeavors, whether in their personal development, family life, or contribution to society.
orig: والناشطات نشطا

translation: And the swimmers, swimming.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the creatures in the ocean that swim swiftly and smoothly through the water. It highlights the beauty and diversity of the creation of Allah, who has created countless creatures that swim gracefully in the depths of the oceans.
orig: والسابحات سبحا

translation: So [for] the previous [who run]
interpretation: This verse highlights the reward and priority given to those who race or compete in doing good deeds and seeking closeness to Allah. It emphasizes the importance of actively striving for excellence in one's faith and actions, indicating that those who excel in this strive will be rewarded accordingly.
orig: فالسابقات سبقا

translation: So I swear by the retreating stars -
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power and control of Allah by swearing by the retreating stars, highlighting the magnificence and precision of His creation. It serves as a reminder of the greatness of the Creator and His authority over the entire universe.
orig: فالمدبرات أمرا

translation: On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when a great blast will shake and convulse all of creation. It signifies the immense power and awe of that Day, when all will be gathered before Allah and held accountable for their deeds.
orig: يوم ترجف الراجفة

translation: Then comes the chasing one after him.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene where one is being pursued or followed closely by the one who is chasing him. It conveys the idea that people's actions and intentions are constantly being observed and followed, either by others or by angels recording their deeds for the Day of Judgment.
orig: تتبعها الرادفة

translation: On that Day, [some] faces will be bright (and radiant),
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, some people's faces will be shining with joy and happiness due to their good deeds and faith in Allah. This verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability and the reward for those who lived a righteous life according to the teachings of Islam.
orig: قلوب يومئذ واجفة

translation: Its sight humbled.
interpretation: This verse speaks about a profound state of humility and submission in the gaze of the entity being referred to. It signifies a deep sense of reverence and awe towards something greater, possibly indicating the natural world or the signs of the Creator's power and beauty.
orig: أبصارها خاشعة

translation: They say: 'Shall we really be restored to our former state?
interpretation: This verse highlights the skepticism and disbelief of some individuals regarding the concept of resurrection and being brought back to life after death. It reflects the doubts and questioning of those who find the idea of resurrection hard to comprehend or accept.
orig: يقولون أإنا لمردودون في الحافرة

translation: When we have become dust and decayed bones?
interpretation: This verse is reflecting on the transient nature of human existence and serves as a reminder of the ultimate reality of death and decay. It emphasizes the humbling fact that human beings will ultimately return to the earth as lifeless bones, highlighting the temporary nature of worldly life and the importance of introspection and spiritual growth in preparation for the afterlife.
orig: أإذا كنا عظاما نخرة

translation: They say, 'This is a losing struggle.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the mockery and skepticism of those who do not believe in the message of the Qur'an. Despite the truth and guidance it offers, they dismiss it as futile and hopeless. It emphasizes the importance of faith and perseverance in the face of doubt and ridicule.
orig: قالوا تلك إذا كرة خاسرة

translation: So it is only one shout.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the inevitability and suddenness of the Day of Judgment, where there will only be one single shout or blast that will signal the end and the beginning of the new eternal phase of existence. It serves as a reminder of the power and authority of Allah, and the decisive nature of the Day of Resurrection.
orig: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة

translation: And suddenly they find themselves in the open field.
interpretation: This verse paints a scene where people will find themselves standing in a plain, open field. It can symbolize a moment of clarity, realization, or reflection after being involved in activities or distractions that may have clouded their understanding or diverted them from their path.
orig: فإذا هم بالساهرة

translation: Has the story of Moses reached you?
interpretation: This verse is asking the listener whether they have heard about the story of Prophet Moses. It serves as a reminder to reflect and ponder upon the lessons and wisdom found in the story of Prophet Moses as mentioned in the Qur'an.
orig: هل أتاك حديث موسى

translation: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
interpretation: This verse refers to the moment when Allah called upon Prophet Musa (Moses) in the holy valley of Tuwa. It signifies a significant and sacred event in the life of Prophet Musa, where he received divine guidance and revelations from Allah. The mention of the 'sacred valley' indicates the importance of the location as a place of revelation and connection between the Prophet and his Lord.
orig: إذ ناداه ربه بالواد المقدس طوى

translation: Go to Pharaoh, indeed, he has transgressed.
interpretation: This verse is instructing the Prophet Moses to go to Pharaoh and deliver a message from God to him, warning him about his arrogance and tyranny. It highlights Pharaoh's wrongdoing and emphasizes the importance of standing up against oppression and injustice, regardless of the oppressor's position or power.
orig: اذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى

translation: So say, "Have you considered: if [this Qur'an] is from Allah and you disbelieve in it, who would be more astray than one who is in extreme dissension?"
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelief of those who reject the Qur'an despite its clear signs and guidance. It highlights the misguided nature of those who are in stubborn denial and refuse to purify themselves by accepting the truth revealed in the Qur'an. It emphasizes the seriousness of rejecting Allah's message and the consequences of being lost in deviation.
orig: فقل هل لك إلى أن تزكى

translation: And He will guide you to your Lord so you may fear Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance ultimately comes from God, and through guidance, one can develop a sense of reverence and fear of God. It signifies the importance of being guided to the right path in order to increase one's awareness and fear of God Almighty.
orig: وأهديك إلى ربك فتخشى

translation: So I showed him the greatest sign.
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when a significant and miraculous sign was shown to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), emphasizing the greatness and power of Allah. It highlights the importance of recognizing and appreciating the signs and miracles from Allah as a means of strengthening faith and belief.
orig: فأراه الآية الكبرى

translation: So he denied and disobeyed.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the actions of defiance and disobedience. It portrays the attitude of denial and rejection towards the truth and a deliberate choice to disobey the commands of Allah. It highlights the consequences of such behavior and serves as a reminder of the importance of faith and obedience in Islam.
orig: فكذب وعصى

translation: Then turned he towards them and sought to slay them.
interpretation: This verse describes a situation where someone turned away from the guidance of Allah and instead actively sought to harm or kill others. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of turning away from righteousness and the dangers of succumbing to negative impulses.
orig: ثم أدبر يسعى

translation: So he gathered and called out.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene where a person gathers or calls out to others. It can symbolize the concept of gathering people together for a specific purpose or calling out to them for a particular reason. It may also signify the importance of communication and unity in fulfilling a goal or objective.
orig: فحشر فنادى

translation: So He said, 'I am your most exalted Lord.'
interpretation: This verse signifies God declaring Himself as the supreme and exalted Lord of all. It emphasizes His ultimate authority, power, and superiority over everything, underlining the importance of recognizing and submitting to His sovereignty.
orig: فقال أنا ربكم الأعلى

translation: So Allah took him in exemplary punishment for both the Hereafter and the former life.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the punishment inflicted by Allah upon disbelievers can be seen as a warning to both those in this world and in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and going against the commandments of Allah, emphasizing the severity of the punishment that awaits in the Hereafter for those who persist in disbelief.
orig: فأخذه الله نكال الآخرة والأولى

translation: Indeed in that there is a lesson for whoever fears (Allah).
interpretation: This verse indicates that the events mentioned in the Qur'an serve as lessons for those who are conscious of Allah and fear His judgment. It highlights the importance of reflecting on the stories and guidance in the Qur'an to derive lessons and improve oneself in terms of faith and behavior.
orig: إن في ذلك لعبرة لمن يخشى

translation: Are you more difficult to create or is the heaven? He constructed it.
interpretation: This verse challenges the arrogance and lack of faith of those who doubt the resurrection after death. It questions the disdainful attitude of humans towards the concept of resurrection, asking them to consider which is more complex: their own creation or the construction of the vast heavens. It emphasizes the power of Allah to create and construct, and highlights the undeniable signs of His existence and ability found in the universe.
orig: أأنتم أشد خلقا أم السماء بناها

translation: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the immense power and knowledge of Allah, who created the heavens and the earth perfectly and in proportion. It indicates Allah's control over all creation and His ability to maintain balance and harmony in the universe.
orig: رفع سمكها فسواها

translation: And He covers the night with darkness and brings out the light of day.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and control over the alternation of night and day. It reflects the order and harmony in the universe that Allah has created and maintained. The darkness of night is contrasted with the light of day, symbolizing the cycles and balance in life. It also serves as a reminder of the importance of appreciating the blessings of light and time for different activities and reflections.
orig: وأغطش ليلها وأخرج ضحاها

translation: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the awe-inspiring power and creativity of Allah in shaping the earth with its majestic mountains and diverse forms of beauty. It highlights the precision and purpose in the creation of the earth, showcasing the magnificence of God's design and the balance and variety present in nature.
orig: والأرض بعد ذلك دحاها

translation: Its water and its pasturage will come out of it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of provision and sustenance that Allah provides to His creation. Just as water and pastures come out of the earth, Allah ensures the sustenance of His creatures as a part of His mercy and provision.
orig: أخرج منها ماءها ومرعاها

translation: And He placed firm mountains on the earth,
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah has created mountains as stable structures on the Earth, signifying His power and wisdom in establishing the earth's stability and balance. Mountains are symbolic of strength, permanence, and grandeur, serving as a reminder of Allah's creative abilities and His control over nature.
orig: والجبال أرساها

translation: as a provision for you and your grazing livestock.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the provision that has been provided by Allah for human beings and their livestock. It highlights the bounties and sustenance that have been made available for both humans and animals on the earth as a form of divine mercy.
orig: متاعا لكم ولأنعامكم

translation: So when the greatest disaster strikes,
interpretation: This verse refers to a catastrophic event that will come upon the disbelievers as a result of their denial of the truth and rejection of faith. It serves as a warning of the immense consequences that await those who persist in their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: فإذا جاءت الطامة الكبرى

translation: The Day when mankind will remember what they strove for.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, every individual will vividly recall and recognize all the effort, striving, and deeds they engaged in during their worldly life. This remembrance will serve as a moment of realization and accountability for one's actions and choices made in the earthly life.
orig: يوم يتذكر الإنسان ما سعى

translation: And Hellfire will be brought into view for those who see,
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when Hellfire will be made visible for all to see. It emphasizes the seriousness of the consequences for those who have turned away from God and done evil deeds, serving as a warning and a reminder of the accountability and judgment that awaits.
orig: وبرزت الجحيم لمن يرى

translation: So as for he who transgressed,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who exceed the limits set by Allah, behave unjustly or oppressively, and commit wrongdoings. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of transgressing and the importance of maintaining righteousness and justice.
orig: فأما من طغى

translation: And prefers the worldly life,
interpretation: This verse highlights the behavior of individuals who prioritize their worldly desires and concerns over their spiritual growth and connection with Allah. It serves as a reminder to give precedence to matters of the Hereafter and not to be consumed by the temporary and material aspects of this life.
orig: وآثر الحياة الدنيا

translation: So indeed, Hell is the promised place
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Hell is not just a possibility or a hypothetical concept, but a real and inevitable destination for those who reject faith and commit grave sins. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the importance of following the guidance of the Qur'an to avoid such a dreadful outcome.
orig: فإن الجحيم هي المأوى

translation: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having a sense of fear and consciousness of Allah, which leads a person to protect themselves from sinful desires and inclinations. It highlights the significance of self-discipline and self-control in adhering to what is pleasing to Allah and abstaining from what is displeasing.
orig: وأما من خاف مقام ربه ونهى النفس عن الهوى

translation: Indeed, Paradise is the [final] refuge.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Paradise is the ultimate and eternal abode for the believers. It serves as a reminder to strive for the Hereafter and to keep the focus on attaining the rewards of Paradise through righteous deeds and faith in Allah.
orig: فإن الجنة هي المأوى

translation: They ask you about the Hour, 'When is its arrival?'
interpretation: This verse is pointing out the curiosity and concern that people have regarding the Day of Judgment. It highlights the fact that the exact timing of the Hour is only known to Allah, emphasizing the importance of preparedness and faith in the face of the uncertainty of when it will occur.
orig: يسألونك عن الساعة أيان مرساها

translation: Where are you from the remembrance of it?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the listener about their attention and consideration towards the remembrance of Allah. It serves as a reminder to reflect on one's relationship with the remembrance of Allah and to seek to increase their mindfulness and awareness of Him in their lives.
orig: فيم أنت من ذكراها
