translation: To your Lord is its final destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fact that every individual will ultimately return to their Lord, and that the final destination, the ultimate accountability and judgment, belongs to Allah. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment and the importance of living a life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: إلى ربك منتهاها

translation: You are only a warner to he who fears it.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that the role of the Prophet (peace be upon him) was to warn those who fear the consequences of their actions and who are conscious of God. It emphasizes that the message is for those who are willing to listen and reform themselves, not for those who persist in arrogance and disobedience.
orig: إنما أنت منذر من يخشاها

translation: As if they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will feel as though their worldly life was only a short part of a day. It emphasizes the fleeting and temporary nature of this worldly life compared to the eternal life in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder for believers to focus on preparing for the Hereafter and not get overly attached to the transient world.
orig: كأنهم يوم يرونها لم يلبثوا إلا عشية أو ضحاها

translation: He frowned and turned away,
interpretation: This verse refers to a moment when the Prophet Muhammad frowned and turned away from a blind man who came to him seeking guidance. It serves as a reminder that one should not neglect any person seeking help or guidance, regardless of their status or appearance. It highlights the importance of treating all individuals with respect and kindness, as everyone deserves attention and compassion.
orig: عبس وتولى

translation: That the blind man came to him,
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident where a blind man came to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) seeking guidance and attention, highlighting the importance of showing kindness and compassion to all individuals regardless of their social status or physical abilities. It serves as a reminder of the Prophet's humble and inclusive nature, emphasizing the value of treating everyone with respect and dignity.
orig: أن جاءه الأعمى

translation: And what can make you know? Perhaps he may be purified,
interpretation: This verse reflects the uncertainty and limitation of human knowledge when it comes to the essence and intentions of individuals. It teaches us to refrain from making judgment about someone's purity or impurity, as only Allah truly knows what lies in the hearts of people. It reminds us that purification of the soul is a process known only to Allah and should not be assumed or judged by others.
orig: وما يدريك لعله يزكى

translation: Or he may take heed, and the remembrance may profit him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power of remembrance and reflection on the verses of the Qur'an. It suggests that by contemplating the lessons and guidance provided in the Qur'an, one can benefit and improve themselves spiritually and morally. The verse emphasizes the importance of paying attention to the reminders and teachings in the Qur'an in order to gain wisdom and guidance in life.
orig: أو يذكر فتنفعه الذكرى

translation: As for the one who is self-sufficient,
interpretation: This verse refers to someone who believes they are self-sufficient and do not need Allah. It serves as a reminder that all beings are in constant need of Allah's help and guidance, regardless of their material wealth or status.
orig: أما من استغنى

translation: So you are facing him.
interpretation: This verse can be understood as a reminder that all actions and choices are ultimately accountable to Allah, as if one is directly facing Him. It emphasizes the idea of being mindful of God's presence and conscious of one's responsibilities towards Him in all aspects of life.
orig: فأنت له تصدى

translation: And as for you, [O Muhammad], there is no duty upon you if he does not purify himself.
interpretation: This verse reassures Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he is not responsible for the purification of an individual's soul. It emphasizes personal responsibility and accountability, indicating that each person is accountable for their own actions and spiritual development.
orig: وما عليك ألا يزكى

translation: And as for the one who comes to you striving,
interpretation: This verse refers to someone who approaches you with eagerness, sincerity, and determination. It conveys the significance of putting effort and dedication into seeking knowledge, guidance, or any beneficial endeavor. It emphasizes the importance of actively and passionately pursuing one's goals and aspirations.
orig: وأما من جاءك يسعى

translation: And He fears
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the awe and reverence that Allah (God) has, highlighting His power and authority. It reminds believers of the importance of fearing and respecting God, as it is a sign of faith and humility.
orig: وهو يخشى

translation: So you are distracted from it.
interpretation: This verse highlights the warning against being distracted from the remembrance of Allah and the teachings of the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder to stay focused on what is truly important in life and not to be consumed by worldly distractions.
orig: فأنت عنه تلهى

translation: No! Indeed, it is a reminder.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Quran is not a fictional tale or a myth, but rather a solemn reminder for mankind. It serves as a wake-up call to reflect on one's actions, purpose in life, and ultimately to turn towards the guidance and teachings of Allah.
orig: كلا إنها تذكرة

translation: So whoever wills may remember it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the freedom of choice and will given to individuals. It suggests that the remembering and reflection upon the lessons and guidance of the Qur'an is ultimately up to the individual's own will and discretion. It highlights the importance of personal responsibility in seeking and benefiting from the teachings of the Qur'an.
orig: فمن شاء ذكره

translation: In honored sheets.
interpretation: This verse describes the Qur'an as being inscribed in honored sheets, indicating that the Qur'an is a noble and esteemed scripture. It highlights the value and sacredness of the Qur'an, emphasizing its significance and importance in Islam.
orig: في صحف مكرمة

translation: Elevated and purified.
interpretation: This phrase refers to something that is exalted or raised in status and purified or cleansed from impurities. It can be interpreted as something that is honored and purified, such as the teachings of the Qur'an or the character of a believer.
orig: مرفوعة مطهرة

translation: With power and skillful hands.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of working diligently and skillfully, using one's abilities and capacity in the best way possible. It highlights the significance of putting effort and dedication into one's work, and the rewards that come from doing so.
orig: بأيدي سفرة

translation: Honorable and Pure
interpretation: This verse describes the essence of human beings as noble and pure, highlighting the inherent dignity and integrity that each individual possesses. It serves as a reminder of the sacred nature of all human life and emphasizes the importance of treating others with respect and honor, regardless of differences or circumstances.
orig: كرام بررة

translation: Man is ever ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ungrateful nature of humans towards the blessings and favors they receive from Allah. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for everything we have been given, and to not let ingratitude lead us to denying the signs and bounties of Allah.
orig: قتل الإنسان ما أكفره

translation: from what did He create him?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an is highlighting the power and ability of Allah in creating the human being. It prompts reflection on the origins of human creation and serves as a reminder of the divine wisdom and capability behind our existence.
orig: من أي شيء خلقه

translation: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that all human beings are created by Allah from a humble origin, a small sperm-drop. It highlights the miraculous process of creation and how each individual's destiny and abilities are predetermined by Allah.
orig: من نطفة خلقه فقدره

translation: Then He smoothed the way for him,
interpretation: This verse conveys the idea that after a period of difficulty or hardship, Allah makes the path easier for the believer. It emphasizes the concept of Allah helping and facilitating the way for those who remain patient and steadfast in their faith.
orig: ثم السبيل يسره

translation: Then He causes him to die and put him in his grave.
interpretation: This verse describes the cycle of life, death, and burial that every human being goes through. It reminds us of the eventual end we all face, which is death, and the subsequent burial before the Day of Judgment.
orig: ثم أماته فأقبره

translation: Then when He wills, He resurrects him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and authority of Allah to resurrect people as He wills. It emphasizes the concept of resurrection and the ultimate control that Allah has over life and death, reminding believers of the Day of Judgment and the importance of preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: ثم إذا شاء أنشره

translation: No! When it (the soul) reaches the throat.
interpretation: This verse speaks about a critical moment in the process of death, emphasizing that when the soul reaches the throat, there is no turning back from the decree of Allah. It signifies a point of no return, highlighting the certainty and inevitability of death as per Allah's command.
orig: كلا لما يقض ما أمره

translation: So let mankind observe his food,
interpretation: This verse is reminding humans to reflect on and be grateful for the provision of food they have been given. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of the sustenance provided to us and recognizing the blessings we receive through food.
orig: فلينظر الإنسان إلى طعامه

translation: And We poured down rain in torrents.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power and abundance of Allah's blessings, particularly in the form of rainfall. It symbolizes how Allah bestows His mercy and sustenance abundantly upon the Earth, nurturing the land and all living beings. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to provide for His creation in ways that are vast and plentiful, highlighting His control over nature and His ability to bring life and growth through his blessings.
orig: أنا صببنا الماء صبا

translation: Then We split the earth in clefts.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the power and ability of Allah to create and shape the earth as He wills. It showcases His ultimate authority over all creation and emphasizes His ability to bring about immense changes in the natural world.
orig: ثم شققنا الأرض شقا

translation: So We grew {plants} therein well
interpretation: This verse expresses how Allah has created the earth suitable for the growth of plants and vegetation, emphasizing His power and wisdom in providing sustenance for all creatures.
orig: فأنبتنا فيها حبا

translation: And grapevines and olive trees,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon humans by mentioning specific fruits like grapevines and olive trees. It serves as a reminder to be grateful for the provisions we have been given and to reflect on the generosity and wisdom of the Creator in providing such diverse and beneficial resources for our nourishment and well-being.
orig: وعنبا وقضبا

translation: By the fig and the olive
interpretation: This verse is a continuation from the previous verses, where Allah is taking oaths by different creations to emphasize the truths being mentioned. The mention of the fig and the olive trees holds significance as they are believed to be trees of value and benefit, highlighting the wonders of Allah's creation and His power to create diverse and beneficial things.
orig: وزيتونا ونخلا

translation: And gardens of tall trees
interpretation: This verse describes the lush and beautiful gardens filled with towering trees that are found in paradise. It conveys the idea of abundance, beauty, and tranquility that await the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: وحدائق غلبا

translation: And fruit and palm trees.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the various provisions and blessings that God has provided for humanity, including fruits and palm trees. It serves as a reminder of God's generosity and the importance of being grateful for the sustenance He has bestowed upon us.
orig: وفاكهة وأبا

translation: a provision for you and your cattle
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of sustenance and provision from God, not only for humans but also for their cattle. It highlights the idea of God's abundant mercy and care for all living beings, ensuring that their needs for sustenance are met. It serves as a reminder of the importance of gratitude for the provisions provided by God for both humans and animals.
orig: متاعا لكم ولأنعامكم

translation: When the deafening blast comes,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the Trumpet will be blown, announcing the end of the world and the beginning of the Day of Resurrection. It signifies a moment of great terror and upheaval, when all creatures will be confronted with the reality of the Hereafter and held accountable for their deeds.
orig: فإذا جاءت الصاخة

translation: On the Day a man will flee from his brother
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when everyone will be preoccupied with their own fate and will distance themselves from even their closest relations. It indicates the severity and magnitude of that day, where individuals will be solely focused on their own deeds and salvation, leaving behind all worldly relationships and connections.
orig: يوم يفر المرء من أخيه

translation: And his mother and father
interpretation: This verse refers to the importance of honoring and respecting one's parents in Islam. It highlights the significance of maintaining good relations with one's mother and father and fulfilling their rights upon their children. It emphasizes the duty of kindness, respect, and obedience towards one's parents as a fundamental aspect of faith and a way to attain closeness to Allah.
orig: وأمه وأبيه

translation: and his wife and his children
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining good relationships with one's spouse and children. It highlights the significance of family ties and the responsibility of taking care of one's family members.
orig: وصاحبته وبنيه

translation: To each one of them on that Day will be a matter adequate for him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, each individual will be preoccupied with their own concerns and affairs. No one will be able to help another person or alleviate their burdens on that Day. It serves as a reminder to focus on one's own actions and deeds, as everyone will be held accountable for their own choices and be responsible for their own destiny.
orig: لكل امرئ منهم يومئذ شأن يغنيه

translation: Faces on that Day will be bright,
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, some faces will be radiant and shining with joy and happiness, reflecting the good deeds and righteousness of the individuals. This verse highlights the reward and bliss awaiting the righteous believers in the Hereafter.
orig: وجوه يومئذ مسفرة

translation: peaceful and happy
interpretation: This verse describes a state of being peaceful and happy. It may refer to the feeling of contentment and joy that comes from being in a state of tranquility and harmony with oneself and others. It emphasizes the importance of inner peace and joy as a source of comfort and fulfillment.
orig: ضاحكة مستبشرة

translation: And [some] faces, that Day, will be dust-stained,
interpretation: On that Day, some individuals will have darkened faces, symbolizing shame and remorse for their sins and disobedience to God. This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the importance of seeking forgiveness and guidance to avoid such a fate.
orig: ووجوه يومئذ عليها غبرة

translation: Nobody will be able to bear its burdens
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the gravity of the burdens and responsibilities that one may carry in life. It serves as a reminder that some burdens may be too heavy for an individual to bear alone, highlighting the importance of seeking help and support from others, and ultimately turning to Allah for guidance and strength in times of difficulty.
orig: ترهقها قترة

translation: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject faith and indulge in wickedness and immorality. It serves as a warning against such behavior and emphasizes the importance of faith and righteousness in Islam.
orig: أولئك هم الكفرة الفجرة

translation: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up,
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the Day of Judgment when the sun will lose its light and be folded up, signifying the end of the world and the beginning of the Day of Resurrection. It emphasizes the immense power and control of Allah over the entire universe, as everything will be subject to His command on that day.
orig: إذا الشمس كورت

translation: And when the stars fall, scattered.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from the Day of Judgment, where the stars will lose their light and fall from the sky. It is a powerful and awe-inspiring reminder of the Day of Resurrection and the ultimate power and control of Allah over the universe.
orig: وإذا النجوم انكدرت

translation: And when the mountains are removed
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the Day of Judgment when the seemingly immovable and unshakeable things in this world, like mountains, will be changed and removed with the power of Allah. It symbolizes the absolute power and control that Allah has over everything, emphasizing that all things will eventually perish except His eternal sovereignty.
orig: وإذا الجبال سيرت

translation: And when the ten nights are completed,
interpretation: This verse refers to the ten sacred nights in the month of Dhul-Hijjah, the last month of the Islamic lunar calendar. It highlights the importance of these specific nights and the significance of performing righteous deeds during this time, such as acts of worship, charity, and remembrance of Allah. Muslims are encouraged to increase their good deeds and devotion during this period to draw closer to Allah and seek His blessings and forgiveness.
orig: وإذا العشار عطلت

translation: And when the wild beasts are herded together,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when even the animals will be gathered and made to stand before Allah. It emphasizes the power and authority of Allah over all creation, showcasing a scene of fear and awe on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: وإذا الوحوش حشرت

translation: And when the seas are filled with flame,
interpretation: This verse describes a dramatic scene where the seas will be set ablaze. It signifies the Day of Judgment when the world will come to an end, and all living beings will face the consequences of their deeds. The image of the seas being set on fire conveys the magnitude and terror of that day, serving as a powerful reminder of the ultimate accountability awaiting every individual.
orig: وإذا البحار سجرت

translation: And when the souls are paired.
interpretation: This verse describes a profound concept in the Qur'an where it is mentioned that souls are created in pairs, emphasizing the idea that every soul has a destined partner. It often refers to the belief that humans are created in pairs, male and female, and that they complement each other in various aspects of life. This pairing is seen as a gift from Allah, who has created mates for each individual, and it is a reminder of the importance of relationships and companionship in the journey of life.
orig: وإذا النفوس زوجت

translation: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
interpretation: This verse refers to a time in pre-Islamic Arab society when female infants were often buried alive due to the societal preference for male children. It conveys the gravity of this crime and the severe questioning these perpetrators will face on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإذا الموءودة سئلت

translation: By what sin was she killed?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the innocence of the person who was killed, questioning the reason behind their unjust death. It highlights the sanctity of life in Islam and condemns the act of killing without just cause.
orig: بأي ذنب قتلت

translation: And when the pages are spread out,
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Day of Judgment when all deeds, good and bad, will be revealed and displayed for everyone to see. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of our actions and their consequences, as they will ultimately be laid bare for accountability and judgment.
orig: وإذا الصحف نشرت

translation: And when the sky is stripped away,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the sky will be torn apart and stripped away as a part of the apocalyptic events. It signifies the immense power of Allah and the inevitability of the Day of Judgment when the world as we know it will come to an end.
orig: وإذا السماء كشطت

translation: And when Hell is set ablaze,
interpretation: This verse describes the terrifying scene when Hell is ignited, indicating the severity and intensity of its punishment for the wrongdoers. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience to Allah and the importance of striving to avoid such a fate through righteous actions.
orig: وإذا الجحيم سعرت

translation: And when the Garden is brought near,
interpretation: This verse describes a scene from the Day of Judgment when Paradise will be brought near to the believers. It signifies the fulfillment of the promise of eternal bliss and reward for those who lived a righteous life. The mention of Paradise being brought close serves as a source of hope and inspiration for believers to strive towards attaining the pleasure of Allah and a place in Paradise.
orig: وإذا الجنة أزلفت

translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection. And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the significance of the Day of Resurrection and the accountability that comes with it. It highlights the concept that each soul knows and acknowledges its deeds and intentions, therefore indicating its own fate through its actions. The verse serves as a reminder of the ultimate truth and the consequences of one's choices and actions in this life.
orig: علمت نفس ما أحضرت

translation: So I swear by the setting of the stars,
interpretation: This verse is invoking the setting of the stars as a solemn oath, emphasizing the power and authority of the speaker.
orig: فلا أقسم بالخنس

translation: The neighboring kin and the needy traveler
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being kind and generous to one's neighbors, relatives, and travelers in need. It highlights the significance of maintaining strong bonds with family and community members, as well as showing compassion and hospitality towards strangers and travelers. The verse encourages believers to be mindful of those around them and to always extend a helping hand to those in need, promoting unity and care within society.
orig: الجوار الكنس

translation: By the night when it departs.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an acknowledges the significance of the night and how it quietly fades away. It serves as a reminder of the passing of time and the inevitability of change. It can also be interpreted as a symbol of hope, as even in the darkest of times, there is always the promise of a new day ahead.
orig: والليل إذا عسعس

translation: And [by] the morning when it breathes,
interpretation: This verse refers to the morning time when it 'breathes', symbolizing the start of a new day, full of life and opportunities. It highlights the beauty and significance of dawn as a time of renewal and awakening after the darkness of night, signifying the mercy and blessings of Allah upon His creation.
orig: والصبح إذا تنفس

translation: Indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an, stating that it is the word conveyed by a noble Messenger (Prophet Muhammad). It highlights the importance and sanctity of the message being delivered, urging the believers to heed and follow its guidance.
orig: إنه لقول رسول كريم

translation: Possessor of strength, established in the presence of the Throne.
interpretation: This verse describes Allah as being powerful and firmly established near His Throne, emphasizing His might and authority. It highlights the strength and stability of Allah's dominion and rule over all creation.
orig: ذي قوة عند ذي العرش مكين

translation: He is to be obeyed then trustworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of a leader to be someone who is to be obeyed due to their authority and then further emphasizes the importance of trustworthiness in carrying out that authority. It stresses the idea that a leader should not only have power but also be reliable and honorable, creating a sense of trust and security among their followers.
orig: مطاع ثم أمين

translation: And your companion is not [at all] mad.
interpretation: This verse is a reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he is not insane or possessed as the disbelievers accused him of being. It is a declaration of his sanity and the truthfulness of his message, emphasizing that he is a true messenger of Allah.
orig: وما صاحبكم بمجنون

translation: And he certainly saw him in the clear horizon.
interpretation: This verse refers to the experience of Prophet Musa (Moses) with Allah, where he saw a manifestation of Allah in a unique and clear way. It signifies the special relationship between the Prophet and his Lord, as well as the prophets' abilities to witness signs of Allah's existence and power.
orig: ولقد رآه بالأفق المبين

translation: And He is not stingy concerning the unseen.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah is not hesitant or reluctant to grant provisions or blessings beyond what is visible or known to us. It emphasizes the generosity, abundance, and limitless nature of Allah's provisions and blessings, even if they are not immediately apparent to us.
orig: وما هو على الغيب بضنين

translation: And it is not the word of a cursed devil.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and asserts that it is not the speech of a cursed devil. It serves as a reminder to readers of the purity and truthfulness of the message conveyed in the Qur'an.
orig: وما هو بقول شيطان رجيم

translation: So where are you going?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, questioning the disbelievers about their ultimate destination and the purpose of their actions. It serves as a powerful reminder for individuals to reflect on their intentions, decisions, and the consequences of their choices, ultimately emphasizing the importance of accountability in the Hereafter.
orig: فأين تذهبون

translation: This is nothing but a reminder for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the message of the Qur'an is a reminder for all mankind. It serves as a call to reflect on the guidance provided in the Quran and to draw lessons from it for their lives. The word 'worlds' here refers to all the different communities and individuals, highlighting the universal appeal and relevance of the message of the Qur'an.
orig: إن هو إلا ذكر للعالمين

translation: Whomever of you desires to walk straight.
interpretation: This verse signifies that guidance and righteousness are a matter of personal choice and will. It emphasizes the individual responsibility to strive towards the straight path, indicating that it is up to each person to choose righteousness and seek guidance. It highlights the notion of free will and personal accountability in matters of faith and moral conduct.
orig: لمن شاء منكم أن يستقيم

translation: And you do not will except that Allah wills, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate power and authority of Allah over everything. It teaches us that despite our desires and intentions, it is ultimately Allah's will that prevails. It reminds us to submit to the divine will and trust in God's wisdom and decree.
orig: وما تشاءون إلا أن يشاء الله رب العالمين

translation: When the sky splits apart,
interpretation: This verse depicts a powerful image of the Day of Judgment, where the sky will split open as a part of the signs of the impending hour. It emphasizes the immense power of Allah and the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection.
orig: إذا السماء انفطرت

translation: And when the stars are scattered,
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the Day of Judgment when the whole universe will be disrupted and the stars will lose their light and scatter, signifying the end of the world as we know it and the beginning of a new eternal life. It serves as a powerful reminder of the ultimate power and control of Allah over all creation.
orig: وإذا الكواكب انتثرت

translation: And when the seas are filled with flame,
interpretation: This verse is a depiction of the Day of Judgment when the seas will burst into flames, indicating the magnitude of the events that will occur at that time and the power of Allah over all creation.
orig: وإذا البحار فجرت

translation: And when the graves are scattered around
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when the dead will be resurrected, and the graves will be turned upside down as a sign of the power of Allah and the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the inevitability of resurrection and the accountability of every soul for their deeds.
orig: وإذا القبور بعثرت

translation: Every soul will know what it has brought with it and left behind.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of accountability and judgment in the afterlife. It highlights that every individual will be fully aware of their deeds, both good and bad, and will be held responsible for them. It serves as a reminder that one should strive to do good deeds in this life and be conscious of their actions, as they will have consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: علمت نفس ما قدمت وأخرت

translation: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to humanity to reflect on what may be distracting them from recognizing and honoring their Lord, who is kind and generous. It calls upon individuals to ponder over their actions, attitudes, and beliefs that may be causing them to overlook the abundant blessings and mercy of their Lord.
orig: يا أيها الإنسان ما غرك بربك الكريم

translation: Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and wisdom of Allah as the Creator who has fashioned human beings in the best possible way. It highlights the intricate design and balance in human creation, indicating that Allah has created humans with perfection and precision.
orig: الذي خلقك فسواك فعدلك

translation: In whatever form He wills, He puts you together.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has the power to create human beings in any way He desires. It highlights the unlimited creative power of Allah and serves as a reminder of His control over all aspects of creation.
orig: في أي صورة ما شاء ركبك

translation: No! But you deny the Recompense.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the disbelievers deny the Day of Judgment and the idea of being held accountable for their deeds. It serves as a warning to those who reject the concept of accountability and consequences that their denial will not change the reality of what is to come.
orig: كلا بل تكذبون بالدين

translation: And indeed, over you, [for] those who protect.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that there are guardians appointed to watch over and protect individuals. It conveys a sense of assurance that there are constant preservers and protectors assigned to ensure the well-being and safety of people.
orig: وإن عليكم لحافظين

translation: Honorable recorders.
interpretation: This verse refers to the noble and honorable angels who are tasked with recording human beings' deeds. They meticulously note down every action, word, and thought of individuals. The phrase reflects the importance of accountability in Islam and the belief that every individual's actions are closely monitored and recorded by Allah through his appointed angels.
orig: كراما كاتبين

translation: They know what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has full knowledge of all our actions. It serves as a reminder for Muslims to be mindful of their deeds, as nothing escapes the knowledge of Allah. It instills a sense of accountability and encourages believers to act with sincerity and righteousness at all times.
orig: يعلمون ما تفعلون

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure.
interpretation: This verse affirms that those who are righteous and obedient to Allah will be in a state of bliss and happiness in the hereafter. It emphasizes the reward and joy that awaits the pious believers for their dedication and good deeds in this life.
orig: إن الأبرار لفي نعيم

translation: And indeed, the wicked will be in Hell.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the fate of the wicked, stating that they will inevitably be in Hell. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of wrongdoing and the importance of striving to do good and follow the teachings of Islam to avoid such a severe punishment in the afterlife.
orig: وإن الفجار لفي جحيم

translation: They will bow down before it on the Day of Judgment.
interpretation: This verse is describing the humbling and awe-inspiring moment when all beings will prostrate before Allah on the Day of Judgment. It signifies the ultimate submission and acknowledgment of His absolute sovereignty and authority over all creation.
orig: يصلونها يوم الدين

translation: And they are not absent from it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no one will be able to escape or evade the consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment. It signifies the omnipresence and all-encompassing nature of Allah's knowledge and justice, highlighting the accountability of every individual for their deeds.
orig: وما هم عنها بغائبين

translation: And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
interpretation: This verse conveys the concept of the Day of Judgment, a fundamental belief in Islam. It emphasizes the enormity and magnitude of the Day of Recompense, highlighting the fact that human comprehension is limited and cannot fully grasp the reality of that day and the consequences of one's actions. It serves as a reminder to believers to reflect on the importance of preparing for the Hereafter and living a righteous life.
orig: وما أدراك ما يوم الدين

translation: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the unfathomable nature of the Day of Judgment, highlighting that it is beyond human comprehension and understanding. It serves as a reminder of the power, significance, and mystery of the Day of Recompense, which is a key belief in Islam where individuals are held accountable for their deeds. It prompts believers to reflect on the implications of that day and to maintain their faith and obedience to Allah.
orig: ثم ما أدراك ما يوم الدين

translation: On the Day when no soul will possess [any] power for another soul; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allah.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of the Day of Judgment when no one will be able to help or protect another, and all power and authority will rest solely with Allah. It emphasizes the ultimate justice and accountability that will prevail on that Day, where each individual will be judged based on their own deeds and merits.
orig: يوم لا تملك نفس لنفس شيئا والأمر يومئذ لله

translation: Woe to those who give less [than due],
interpretation: This verse warns and condemns those who cheat, deceive, or give less than what is rightfully due in their dealings with others, whether it be in trade, business, or any other interactions. It highlights the importance of honesty, fairness, and justice in all dealings and transactions.
orig: ويل للمطففين

translation: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who, when they are entrusted with measuring or weighing something for others, they do so with complete fairness and honesty. They ensure that they give full measure or weight, without cheating or deceiving others. This highlights the importance of integrity, honesty, and justice in all dealings with people.
orig: الذين إذا اكتالوا على الناس يستوفون

translation: And when they are weighed on the scale, it will be found wanting.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, people's deeds and actions will be evaluated meticulously. Those who have not lived righteously will find their scale of good deeds to be light, signifying their loss and failure to meet the standards set by God for entry into Paradise.
orig: وإذا كالوهم أو وزنوهم يخسرون

translation: Do those [who deny resurrection] not realize that they will be resurrected?
interpretation: This verse is asking those who deny resurrection to reflect on whether they truly believe that they will not be held accountable in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder of the inevitability of resurrection and judgment, urging people to consider the consequences of their actions in this life.
orig: ألا يظن أولئك أنهم مبعوثون

translation: For the Great Day.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the Day of Judgment, emphasizing the significance and magnitude of that day. It serves as a warning to believers to be conscious of their actions and to prepare for the accountability of their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ليوم عظيم

translation: The Day when people will stand before the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, all individuals will be brought before the Almighty Lord, the Creator and Sustainer of all worlds, to be held accountable for their actions and deeds. It signifies the ultimate justice and accountability that will prevail on that Day.
orig: يوم يقوم الناس لرب العالمين

translation: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjin.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the deeds of the wicked and sinful individuals are recorded and preserved meticulously. 'Sijjin' is often understood as a place or register where the actions of the unrighteous are documented, highlighting the accountability and justice that will be meted out in the afterlife based on these records.
orig: كلا إن كتاب الفجار لفي سجين

translation: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
interpretation: This verse challenges the listener to consider the severity and mystery of the punishment that awaits the disbelievers. It emphasizes the unfathomable nature of the suffering that awaits them, serving as a warning of the consequences of their actions and the power of Allah's judgment.
orig: وما أدراك ما سجين

translation: A Scripture inscribed.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the divine nature of the Qur'an, stating that it is a scripture that has been meticulously preserved and recorded. It highlights the sacredness and significance of the Qur'an as a written form of guidance and wisdom sent from Allah to humanity.
orig: كتاب مرقوم

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment and regret that will befall those who rejected and denied the truth on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the consequences of denying the message of God and the accountability that awaits in the Hereafter.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Those who deny the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject or deny the concept of the Day of Judgment or the Day of Recompense mentioned in the Qur'an. It addresses those who choose to disbelieve in the accountability of their actions in the Hereafter and the ultimate justice that will be served by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the importance of faith in the Day of Judgment as a cornerstone of the Islamic belief system.
orig: الذين يكذبون بيوم الدين

translation: And none reject Our revelations except the transgressors and wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that only those who are unjust and rebellious against God's commandments deny His signs and revelations. It highlights that those who are committing sins and transgressing the boundaries set by Allah are the ones who reject the truth and guidance found in the Qur'an.
orig: وما يكذب به إلا كل معتد أثيم

translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, 'Legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the attitude of some disbelievers who, upon hearing the Qur'anic verses and teachings, dismiss them as mere myths and legends from the past, rather than recognizing the truth and wisdom within them. It highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who refuse to acknowledge the guidance of Allah and dismiss it without understanding or reflection.
orig: إذا تتلى عليه آياتنا قال أساطير الأولين

translation: No! Rather, what they used to earn has rusted over their hearts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the corruption and wrongdoing that people engage in can permeate and affect their hearts, hardening them and obscuring their ability to recognize the truth. It serves as a warning against the consequences of indulging in sinful acts and the importance of maintaining a pure and upright character.
orig: كلا بل ران على قلوبهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: No! Indeed, they will be [branded] from their Lord that Day and then they will be deprived.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, those who turned away from the guidance of their Lord will be clearly identified and deprived of the rewards and blessings that come with obedience and faith. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of neglecting the commands and teachings of Allah.
orig: كلا إنهم عن ربهم يومئذ لمحجوبون

translation: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of those who have been mentioned earlier in the Qur'an, highlighting that they will be punished and suffer in the Hellfire for their actions and disbelief. It serves as a warning of the consequences of wrongdoing and emphasizes the concept of accountability and justice in the Hereafter.
orig: ثم إنهم لصالو الجحيم

translation: Then it will be said, 'This is what you used to deny.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that on the Day of Judgment, the truth will be revealed to all, and those who denied the message of God will come to realize the reality of their denials. It serves as a warning to heed the guidance and truth of God in this life, as denial will have consequences in the afterlife.
orig: ثم يقال هذا الذي كنتم به تكذبون

translation: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyin.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the deeds of the righteous are meticulously recorded and preserved in a high place (illiyyin) as a testament to their piety and devotion. It highlights the concept of accountability and the belief in a just and meticulous system of recording one's actions for the Day of Judgment.
orig: كلا إن كتاب الأبرار لفي عليين

translation: And what can make you know what is 'Aliyyun? (a high state)
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question emphasizing the incomprehensible and lofty nature of the state or rank referred to as 'Aliyyun. It signifies a state of elevated status or excellence that is beyond human understanding, highlighting the greatness and superiority of this exalted position.
orig: وما أدراك ما عليون

translation: A written Book.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an as a Book that is written down, preserved, and containing guidance for mankind. It emphasizes the importance and permanence of the Qur'an as a divine scripture that is meant to be recited, understood, and followed by believers.
orig: كتاب مرقوم

translation: The close angels bear witness.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the angels in close proximity to Allah bear witness to events or actions. It emphasizes the idea of divine awareness and observation over all matters, highlighting the concept of accountability and the presence of witnesses to one's deeds.
orig: يشهده المقربون

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure.
interpretation: This verse assures that those who are righteous and follow the guidance of Allah will experience joy and happiness in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the rewarding nature of righteousness and obedience to Allah's commandments.
orig: إن الأبرار لفي نعيم

translation: On thrones, looking.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where the believers will be seated on thrones, enjoying the blessings and rewards for their deeds in the world. It emphasizes the peace and luxury that awaits them in the afterlife.
orig: على الأرائك ينظرون

translation: You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
interpretation: This verse describes a state of bliss and contentment experienced by the believers in paradise. It suggests that their joy and happiness will be visibly apparent on their faces, reflecting the eternal happiness and blessings they are enjoying in the afterlife.
orig: تعرف في وجوههم نضرة النعيم

translation: They will be given to drink a mixture of water from a spring
interpretation: This verse describes the reward for the righteous in the afterlife, where they will be given pure and refreshing water to drink as a symbol of the ultimate satisfaction and fulfillment of their desires.
orig: يسقون من رحيق مختوم

translation: Its ending is perfumed (with musk). And in that let the competitors compete.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the beauty and excellence of the rewards awaiting the righteous in the afterlife by comparing it to the fragrant musk. It also calls upon believers to strive and compete in performing good deeds in order to attain these rewards, highlighting the importance of constant effort and dedication in one's faith and actions.
orig: ختامه مسك وفي ذلك فليتنافس المتنافسون

translation: And his [drinks] will be a mixture of Tasneem,
interpretation: The believers in paradise will enjoy an exquisite and refreshing drink from a spring in heaven called Tasneem. This verse describes the high quality and pleasurable experiences awaiting the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: ومزاجه من تسنيم

translation: A spring from which those brought near [to Allah] drink.
interpretation: This verse is describing a blessed spring in paradise from which the close companions of Allah will drink. It is a symbol of the rewards and blessings that the righteous will enjoy in the afterlife, where their thirst will be quenched from a source that symbolizes closeness to Allah.
orig: عينا يشرب بها المقربون

translation: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrast between those who commit sins and those who believe in God. It describes how the wrongdoers may mock and ridicule the believers, showing the mockery and ridicule of faith by the disbelievers and sinners.
orig: إن الذين أجرموا كانوا من الذين آمنوا يضحكون

translation: And when they pass by them, they pass by in a mocking manner.
interpretation: This verse is referring to people who mock or ridicule believers when they pass by them. It serves as a reminder to treat others with respect and kindness, and to avoid engaging in behaviors that may hurt or belittle others.
orig: وإذا مروا بهم يتغامزون

translation: And when they returned to their people, they returned jesting.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the behavior of some people upon returning to their families or communities after being away. It emphasizes how they approach the people close to them with jest and frivolity, perhaps not taking things seriously or not recognizing the importance of their relationships and interactions.
orig: وإذا انقلبوا إلى أهلهم انقلبوا فكهين

translation: And when they see them, they say, "Indeed, these are misguided."
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people, upon seeing those who follow the right path, will assume that they are misguided simply because they have a different belief or perspective. It serves as a reminder not to judge others based on appearances or preconceived notions, but rather to strive for understanding and tolerance.
orig: وإذا رأوهم قالوا إن هؤلاء لضالون

translation: And they were not assigned to guard over them.
interpretation: This verse underscores the fact that no one is appointed to protect individuals from making their own choices and facing the consequences of their actions. It emphasizes personal responsibility and accountability before God, as individuals are free to choose their paths and bear the results. It serves as a reminder that humans have been granted free will and are expected to use it wisely.
orig: وما أرسلوا عليهم حافظين

translation: So today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene on the Day of Judgment where the believers will be in a state of joy, contentment, and amusement while witnessing the fate of the disbelievers. It highlights the stark contrast between the believers who are rewarded with paradise and the disbelievers who are faced with loss and regret.
orig: فاليوم الذين آمنوا من الكفار يضحكون

translation: They will be looking on from thrones.
interpretation: This verse is describing a scene in the afterlife where the disbelievers will be watching the believers as they enjoy their rewards in Paradise from a place of privilege and comfort. The disbelievers will witness the bliss and blessings granted to the believers, which will serve as a form of punishment for their rejection of the truth and their misconduct in the worldly life.
orig: على الأرائك ينظرون

translation: Is the clothing of the disbelievers not that which they used to wear?
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the clothes the disbelievers wore in their worldly life will remain with them in the Hereafter. It signifies that their outward appearances or material possessions will not benefit them or accompany them in the afterlife. It serves as a reminder that spiritual purity and faith are what truly matter, not worldly possessions or appearances.
orig: هل ثوب الكفار ما كانوا يفعلون

translation: When the sky splits apart,
interpretation: This verse describes a great and awe-inspiring event where the sky will split apart. It signifies the Day of Judgment and the power of Allah to bring about incredible and unimaginable events. The splitting of the sky serves as a reminder of the inevitable Day of Resurrection and the ultimate power of Allah over all creation.
orig: إذا السماء انشقت

translation: And has given heed to her Lord and will be successful.
interpretation: This verse signifies the importance of obeying and submitting to Allah. It implies that those who listen to their Lord and follow His guidance will attain success in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: وأذنت لربها وحقت

translation: And when the earth is extended,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the earth will be stretched and spread out, symbolizing the end of the world as we know it. It is a reminder of the power and control of Allah over all of creation, emphasizing the inevitability of the hereafter and the accountability of all beings before their Creator.
orig: وإذا الأرض مدت

translation: And it throws out what is within it and becomes empty.
interpretation: This verse is describing the cataclysmic event of the Day of Judgment, where everything in the universe will be overturned and destroyed. It is a reminder of the transient nature of this worldly life, emphasizing that all material possessions and creations will be rendered insignificant in the face of the enormity of that day. It serves as a warning to humanity to prioritize their spiritual well-being and prepare for the Hereafter.
orig: وألقت ما فيها وتخلت

translation: And she sought to guard herself, and We sought to guard her.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Maryam (Mary) in the Qur'an, where she sought refuge with her Lord and her Lord protected and guarded her. It illustrates the concept of seeking protection and guidance from Allah, and highlights His role as the ultimate protector and guardian of those who turn to Him.
orig: وأذنت لربها وحقت

translation: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitable journey of every individual towards meeting their Lord. It highlights the continuous effort and striving that humans put in towards meeting their Creator, whether through their actions, worship, or deeds. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate meeting with Allah, where one will be held accountable for their efforts and deeds in this worldly life.
orig: يا أيها الإنسان إنك كادح إلى ربك كدحا فملاقيه

translation: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who will be handed their book of deeds in their right hands on the Day of Judgment, symbolizing their good deeds, faith, and obedience to Allah. It signifies their success and acceptance into Paradise, as the right hand is a symbol of honor and favor in Islamic tradition.
orig: فأما من أوتي كتابه بيمينه

translation: He will [soon] call you to account for a small issue.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah will bring every person to account, even for the smallest of deeds or sins. It conveys the idea that nothing will be overlooked on the Day of Judgment, and highlights the importance of being conscious of our actions and seeking forgiveness for any wrongdoings, no matter how insignificant they may seem.
orig: فسوف يحاسب حسابا يسيرا

translation: And he will return to his family joyous!
interpretation: This verse describes the individual who has successfully completed their journey of faith, returning to their family and community filled with joy and contentment. It signifies the happiness and satisfaction that comes from fulfilling one's obligations and responsibilities towards family and loved ones in the light of faith.
orig: وينقلب إلى أهله مسرورا

translation: And as for him who is given his record behind his back,
interpretation: This verse refers to the people who will receive their record of deeds behind their back on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that their sins and wrongdoings have overshadowed their good deeds, resulting in a negative outcome in the Hereafter.
orig: وأما من أوتي كتابه وراء ظهره

translation: So he will be plunged into destruction.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the consequences of one's actions. It indicates that those who engage in wrongful behaviors will ultimately face a fate of ruin and destruction. It serves as a warning to individuals to reflect on their actions and to follow the path of righteousness to avoid a similar fate.
orig: فسوف يدعو ثبورا

translation: And they will be exposed to the Scorching Fire.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment of those who have committed evil deeds and rejected the truth. They will be exposed to the intense heat and torment of the Hellfire as a consequence of their actions. It serves as a warning to those who choose to disobey Allah and follow a path of wrongdoing.
orig: ويصلى سعيرا

translation: He was indeed pleased with his people.
interpretation: This verse signifies the pleasure and contentment of the individual being referred to, who was pleased and happy with his people. It suggests a sense of fulfillment and satisfaction with his family or community.
orig: إنه كان في أهله مسرورا

translation: He thought that he would never return.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the erroneous belief of a person who thinks that they will never be brought back or held accountable after death. It serves as a reminder that everyone will eventually be brought back before their Lord for judgment and recompense for their deeds.
orig: إنه ظن أن لن يحور

translation: Indeed, his Lord was ever Aware of him.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah, the Lord of all, is constantly watchful and fully aware of all His creations. It serves as a reminder that our actions and intentions are always within His knowledge and that His awareness encompasses every detail of our existence. This verse emphasizes the concept of Divine omniscience, comforting believers with the assurance that Allah's knowledge is comprehensive and unwavering.
orig: بلى إن ربه كان به بصيرا

translation: So I swear by the twilight glow,
interpretation: This verse is a solemn oath made by Allah by the twilight glow. The twilight is a time of transition between light and darkness, symbolizing the transient nature of life and the certainty of a new dawn. By swearing upon this moment, Allah emphasizes the importance of reflecting on the fleeting nature of life and the inevitability of change.
orig: فلا أقسم بالشفق

translation: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance and blessings of the night, which provides a cover from the hustle and bustle of the day. It symbolizes calmness, reflection, and a time for rest and rejuvenation. The darkness of the night is a reminder of the unseen world that exists and the mysteries of the universe. It encourages believers to ponder on the signs of Allah and seek His guidance and protection during the night.
orig: والليل وما وسق

translation: And by the moon as it follows
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the precision and order in the universe, highlighting the regularity and consistency of the moon in its orbit. It serves as a reminder of the signs of Allah's creation and His power over all things.
orig: والقمر إذا اتسق

translation: You will surely ascend from one stage to another.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of continual growth and progress in one's spiritual journey. It encourages believers to strive for improvement, to ascend in their faith, knowledge, and good deeds gradually, and to continuously seek to better themselves in all aspects of life.
orig: لتركبن طبقا عن طبق

translation: So what is [the matter] with them that they do not believe?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the reason behind the disbelief of certain people. It implies a sense of wonder and confusion as to why they do not believe despite the clear signs and proofs presented to them. It highlights the importance of reflection and pondering over one's beliefs and the reasons behind them.
orig: فما لهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse highlights the unfortunate reality of some people who, even when the Qur'an is recited to them, do not humble themselves before Allah through prostration. It serves as a reminder to reflect on the importance of obedience and submission to the messages within the Qur'an.
orig: وإذا قرئ عليهم القرآن لا يسجدون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve are denying.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject the truth are actually denying it. It highlights the obstinate refusal of the disbelievers to accept the message of the Quran, even when presented with clear signs and evidence. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting faith and the importance of reflecting on one's beliefs.
orig: بل الذين كفروا يكذبون

translation: And Allah knows best about what they describe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah, the Most Knowledgeable, is fully aware of the true intentions and thoughts of people, even if they may try to hide them or portray a different image. It emphasizes the concept of God's comprehensive knowledge and awareness, underscoring that nothing is hidden from Him.
orig: والله أعلم بما يوعون

translation: So give them the good news of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is a warning issued to those who have strayed from the path of righteousness and committed sins. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of their actions and the punishment that awaits them if they do not seek repentance and change their ways. It emphasizes the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning back to Allah before it is too late.
orig: فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: Except those who believe and do righteous deeds; for them is a reward uninterrupted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds will be rewarded immensely without any reduction or interruption. It motivates believers to continue their good actions and have faith in the divine promise of a continuous reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم أجر غير ممنون

translation: By the heaven furnished with stars,
interpretation: This verse speaks about the beauty and magnificence of the heavens adorned with stars. It highlights the divine craftsmanship and order in the universe created by Allah. It serves as a reminder of the power and creativity of the Creator, and urges believers to contemplate the signs of God's existence and majesty in the celestial bodies.
orig: والسماء ذات البروج

translation: And the Promised Day.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment, when all human beings will be resurrected and brought before God for judgment. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability and justice that will take place on that day.
orig: واليوم الموعود

translation: And the witness and the one witnessed
interpretation: This verse refers to the concept of accountability on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that every action a person performs is being witnessed by Allah and will be presented as evidence on the Day of Judgment. Therefore, individuals are accountable for their deeds in front of Allah.
orig: وشاهد ومشهود

translation: The companions of the trench were killed,
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of a group of believers who were thrown into a trench and martyred for their faith. It serves as a reminder of the persecution and trials faced by early Muslims, highlighting the importance of standing firm in one's faith even in the face of adversity.
orig: قتل أصحاب الأخدود

translation: The Fire fueled with men and stones,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the intensity and severity of the Hellfire by describing it as a fire that is fueled with men and stones. It illustrates the unimaginable torment and punishment that awaits the disbelievers and wrongdoers in the afterlife. The imagery used here evokes fear and emphasizes the consequences of unbelief and sinful actions.
orig: النار ذات الوقود

translation: When they are on it (the fire)
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of people being made to sit on the fire, conveying the image of intense punishment and torment. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of one's actions and the justice of divine retribution.
orig: إذ هم عليها قعود

translation: And they are, over what the believers do, witnesses.
interpretation: This verse highlights how some individuals observe and bear witness to the actions and conduct of the believers. It serves as a reminder that our actions are not hidden and are being observed by others, and thus we should strive to maintain our integrity and righteousness in all aspects of our lives.
orig: وهم على ما يفعلون بالمؤمنين شهود

translation: And they did not resent them except [for] believing in Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights that the disbelievers' animosity towards the believers was solely because of the believers' faith in Allah, who is Powerful and Worthy of all Praise. The verse emphasizes that being steadfast in faith may lead to opposition, but believers should continue to trust in Allah's strength and glory.
orig: وما نقموا منهم إلا أن يؤمنوا بالله العزيز الحميد

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is, over all things, Witness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty and authority of Allah over the entire universe. It asserts that Allah is the ultimate Witness and Observer of all things, aware of every detail and every action that takes place. This serves as a reminder to believers of Allah's power and knowledge, urging them to live their lives in accordance with His commands and to seek His guidance in all matters.
orig: الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض والله على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Indeed, those who have tortured the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
interpretation: This verse serves as a stern warning against those who persecute and torment the believers, emphasizing that those who do not repent for their actions will face the severe punishment of Hellfire. It underscores the importance of seeking forgiveness and turning back to God after committing wrongs against others.
orig: إن الذين فتنوا المؤمنين والمؤمنات ثم لم يتوبوا فلهم عذاب جهنم ولهم عذاب الحريق

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the intertwined relationship between faith and good deeds in Islam. It highlights the concept that true believers who act righteously will be rewarded with paradise, symbolized by gardens with flowing rivers. The 'great attainment' refers to the ultimate success and felicity of those who maintain sincere faith and righteous actions in this world.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ذلك الفوز الكبير

translation: Indeed, the grip of your Lord is severe.
interpretation: This verse highlights the strength and power of God's hold over His creation. It emphasizes that God's grip is firm and severe, serving as a reminder of His authority and the consequences of disobedience. It instills awe and reverence for God's might and justice.
orig: إن بطش ربك لشديد

translation: He it is Who originates creation, then repeats it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to create and recreate. It highlights the concept of continuous creation and recreation in the universe, showcasing the cycle of life and the ultimate control that Allah has over it.
orig: إنه هو يبدئ ويعيد

translation: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes two qualities of Allah: His forgiveness and His affection. It highlights His mercy and love towards His creation, reminding believers that no matter how many mistakes they have made, Allah's forgiveness is always available to them. It also showcases His kindness and care for His servants, indicating that His love for them is unconditional and everlasting.
orig: وهو الغفور الودود

translation: Owner of the Majestic Throne.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges the grandeur and magnificence of Allah, the One who possesses the glorious throne. It emphasizes the sovereignty, power, and majesty of Allah as the supreme ruler and authority over all creation.
orig: ذو العرش المجيد

translation: He is able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unlimited power and ability of Allah to fulfill whatever He wills. It signifies that Allah has complete control over all matters and can make anything happen according to His divine plan.
orig: فعال لما يريد

translation: Has there reached you the story of the soldiers,
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the listener has heard about the account of the soldiers. It serves to draw attention to an important event or lesson that will be conveyed in the subsequent verses.
orig: هل أتاك حديث الجنود

translation: Pharaoh and Thamud
interpretation: This verse mentions two nations, Pharaoh and Thamud, who both were destroyed due to their arrogance, rejection of the truth, and oppression towards the prophets sent to guide them. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of defiance and disobedience to Allah's guidance.
orig: فرعون وثمود

translation: But those who disbelieve are in persistent denial.
interpretation: This verse highlights the state of the disbelievers who are stubbornly rejecting the truth despite the evidence and guidance provided to them. It emphasizes that their disbelief is a result of their deliberate choice to deny the message of God.
orig: بل الذين كفروا في تكذيب

translation: And Allah is encompassing them from behind.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing knowledge and presence of Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah is aware of everything that happens and is ever-watchful over His creation. It conveys a sense of comfort and reassurance that Allah's protection and guidance are always present, surrounding us from all sides.
orig: والله من ورائهم محيط

translation: But it is a noble Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exalted and majestic nature of the Qur'an. It highlights the profound beauty, dignity, and significance of the Qur'an as the central religious text in Islam. It serves as a reminder of the importance of revering and cherishing the teachings and guidance found within the Qur'an.
orig: بل هو قرآن مجيد

translation: On a preserved tablet.
interpretation: This verse refers to the concept of a preserved tablet in Islamic belief, which is a clear indication of Allah's perfect knowledge and wisdom. It is believed that everything that has occurred, is occurring, and will occur is already written on this tablet. This emphasizes the divine knowledge and control over all aspects of the universe.
orig: في لوح محفوظ

translation: By the sky and the night comer,
interpretation: This verse is a solemn oath taken by the sky and the bright star. It signifies the power and authority of the Creator in the universe. It serves to draw attention to the grandeur and magnificence of the heavens and the celestial bodies, emphasizing the importance of reflecting on the signs of creation and the existence of a supreme being.
orig: والسماء والطارق

translation: And what can make you know what is the Night-Comer?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the greatness and mystery of the Night-Comer, referring to a star (or a bright celestial body) that appears at night. It highlights the unknowable nature of certain aspects of the universe and encourages reflection on the signs of God's creation that are beyond human comprehension.
orig: وما أدراك ما الطارق

translation: By the star when it descends,
interpretation: This verse in the Qur'an refers to the star which is bright and clear. It highlights the divine power and significance of the stars as signs of guidance and knowledge. It serves as a reminder of the greatness of the Creator and His ability to guide and inspire through His creation.
orig: النجم الثاقب

translation: Every soul will be held in pledge for its deeds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief that every individual is responsible and accountable for their own actions and will be judged accordingly. It serves as a reminder of the concept of accountability in Islam, where each person is responsible for their intentions, actions, and the consequences of their deeds in this life and in the Hereafter.
orig: إن كل نفس لما عليها حافظ

translation: So let man observe from what he was created.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder for human beings to reflect upon their humble origins and the miraculous creation which brought them into existence. It encourages introspection and contemplation on the signs of Allah's power and wisdom evident in creation, leading to a deeper sense of humility and gratitude towards the Creator.
orig: فلينظر الإنسان مم خلق

translation: He is created from a fluid, ejected,
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of human beings from a fluid (sperm) that is ejected during sexual intercourse. It underscores the miraculous process of human creation and serves as a reminder of the power and creativity of Allah in bringing forth life from such humble beginnings.
orig: خلق من ماء دافق

translation: He emerges from between the backbone and the ribs.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous creation of human beings, noting that they are created from a fluid that comes from between the backbone and the ribs. This could be seen as a reference to the creation of human life and the intricate details of the human body, emphasizing the divine origin and sophistication of human beings.
orig: يخرج من بين الصلب والترائب

translation: Indeed, He is Able to return him [to life].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and ability of Allah to bring back the dead to life on the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate control and authority of Allah over all things, including the resurrection of the dead for accountability and judgment.
orig: إنه على رجعه لقادر

translation: On the Day when secrets will be exposed,
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when all hidden truths and secrets will be revealed. It emphasizes the ultimate justice of Allah, where every individual will be held accountable for their deeds, even those done in secrecy. This serves as a reminder for believers to be mindful of their actions and intentions, as everything will come to light on that Day.
orig: يوم تبلى السرائر

translation: So, he has neither power nor any helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ultimate powerlessness and lack of support of those who oppose the divine guidance. It emphasizes that without the help and support of Allah, no one can succeed or have any power.
orig: فما له من قوة ولا ناصر

translation: By the sky with its pathways,
interpretation: This verse refers to the sky and its various pathways and orbits. It highlights the vastness and intricate design of the sky, emphasizing the power and wisdom of the Creator. It serves as a reminder of the signs of Allah's creation that are present in the natural world for those who reflect and ponder.
orig: والسماء ذات الرجع

translation: And [by] the earth which cracks open,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power and ability of Allah by drawing attention to the earth and its ability to split open. It serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment and the immense power of Allah to cause the earth to split as a sign of the end times and resurrection.
orig: والأرض ذات الصدع

translation: Indeed, it is a decisive statement.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a clear and decisive statement, meaning that its message is clear, unambiguous, and not open to multiple interpretations. It serves as a reminder of the powerful, straightforward, and impactful nature of the Qur'anic verses, guiding believers to understand the message clearly and act upon it decisively.
orig: إنه لقول فصل

translation: And it is not a joke.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that the matters being discussed or conveyed in the Qur'an are of utmost seriousness and significance, and should not be taken lightly or as a trivial matter. It emphasizes the importance of paying attention to and reflecting upon the messages and guidance provided in the Qur'an.
orig: وما هو بالهزل

translation: Verily, they are planning a scheme.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who oppose the message of the Quran are actively plotting and scheming against it. It serves as a reminder for believers to be vigilant and aware of the challenges and opposition they may face in upholding their faith.
orig: إنهم يكيدون كيدا

translation: And they planned, but Allah is the best of planners.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that no matter how much human beings plan and plot, ultimately Allah's plan is the most superior and will prevail. It highlights the belief in divine decree and the ultimate power and control of Allah over all matters.
orig: وأكيد كيدا

translation: So grant respite to the disbelievers. Deal you gently with them for a while.
interpretation: This verse is advising patience towards those who deny the truth or disbelieve. It encourages a gentle and patient approach towards non-believers, allowing them time to reconsider their beliefs and giving them the opportunity to come to the right path at their own pace.
orig: فمهل الكافرين أمهلهم رويدا

translation: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,
interpretation: This verse is a call to praise and glorify Allah, the Most High. It reminds believers to exalt and honor the name of their Lord, recognizing His supremacy and greatness above all else.
orig: سبح اسم ربك الأعلى

translation: Who created and proportioned,
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah as the Creator who not only brings things into existence but also perfectly proportions and designs everything in the universe. It emphasizes that all creation is meticulously planned and structured by Allah with flawless precision.
orig: الذي خلق فسوى

translation: And He who has determined and [then] guided
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of predestination (qadr) and guidance from Allah. It emphasizes that Allah determines all things and also guides those who heed His guidance. It reminds believers that ultimately Allah is in control of all affairs, including providing guidance to those who seek it.
orig: والذي قدر فهدى

translation: And who brings out the pasture,
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and mercy of Allah, who brings forth sustenance from the earth for all living creatures. It signifies the generosity of Allah in providing for His creation and emphasizes the importance of recognizing His blessings and provisions in our lives.
orig: والذي أخرج المرعى

translation: So He made it as swallowed particles.
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah turns something into scattered particles, emphasizing His complete control over all aspects of creation and His power to transform things as He wills.
orig: فجعله غثاء أحوى

translation: We will make you recite, so you will not forget.
interpretation: This verse highlights the promise of Allah to support and aid the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in reciting the Qur'an, enabling him to deliver the message accurately and without error. It also serves as a reassurance to the Prophet that he will not forget the revelations given to him by Allah, emphasizing the preservation of the Qur'an as the divine scripture.
orig: سنقرئك فلا تنسى
