translation: Except for what Allah wills. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
interpretation: This verse highlights that everything happens according to the will of Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah is aware of everything, whether it is said aloud or kept hidden. It emphasizes the concept of divine knowledge and control over all aspects of existence.
orig: إلا ما شاء الله إنه يعلم الجهر وما يخفى

translation: And We will ease you toward ease.
interpretation: This verse reassures and promises the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that after every hardship there will be ease. It signifies that challenges are temporary, and with difficulty comes ease, granting believers reassurance and hope in times of trials.
orig: ونيسرك لليسرى

translation: So remind, if the reminder should benefit.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reminding others of the teachings of the Qur'an and the guidance of Allah. It encourages believers to continue reminding others with the hope that they will benefit from the reminder and be guided towards righteousness and truth.
orig: فذكر إن نفعت الذكرى

translation: He will remember whoever fears (Him).
interpretation: This verse implies that those who have a deep reverence and fear of God will be remembered by Him. It highlights the importance of piety, consciousness of God, and humility in one's actions as means to gain His attention and favor.
orig: سيذكر من يخشى

translation: And the wretched one will avoid it.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are in a state of misery, despair, or wretchedness. It emphasizes that those who are truly unfortunate will try to avoid the guidance and teachings of the Qur'an, despite its potential to bring them peace and salvation. It highlights the self-inflicted nature of their suffering, as they turn away from the path that could lead them to goodness and righteousness.
orig: ويتجنبها الأشقى

translation: The one who will [enter and] burn in the Great Fire.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment in the Hereafter for those who will be condemned to the Hellfire. It serves as a warning to remind people of the consequences of their actions in this world and the importance of seeking repentance and righteous deeds.
orig: الذي يصلى النار الكبرى

translation: Then he does not die therein, nor does he live.
interpretation: This verse refers to the state of punishment in the Hereafter, where the disbelievers will face a perpetual existence in torment without the release of death or the enjoyment of life. It illustrates the severity and eternity of the punishment for those who have rejected faith and righteousness.
orig: ثم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى

translation: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of moral purity and self-purification as a means to achieve success in the sight of Allah. It highlights that inner purification, both in actions and intentions, leads to true success in this life and in the hereafter.
orig: قد أفلح من تزكى

translation: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering and mentioning the name of Allah when praying or engaging in any act of worship. It highlights the significance of invoking the name of God as a means of strengthening one's connection with Him and seeking His blessings and guidance.
orig: وذكر اسم ربه فصلى

translation: Rather, you prefer the worldly life,
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of human beings to prioritize the transient and material aspects of the worldly life over the spiritual and eternal aspects. It serves as a reminder to focus on the hereafter and the values that will lead to eternal success, rather than being consumed by the temporary pleasures and distractions of this world.
orig: بل تؤثرون الحياة الدنيا

translation: And the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the superiority and everlasting nature of the Hereafter compared to this worldly life. It serves as a reminder to prioritize actions and deeds that lead to success in the Hereafter, rather than being solely focused on temporary worldly pleasures.
orig: والآخرة خير وأبقى

translation: Verily, this is in the former Scriptures.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that the message of the Qur'an is in line with the teachings of previous scriptures, such as the Torah and the Bible, emphasizing the continuity and consistency of the message across different revelations from Allah.
orig: إن هذا لفي الصحف الأولى

translation: The Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that prophets and messengers before Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) also received divine scriptures and guidance from Allah. It emphasizes the continuity and unity of the messages revealed to different prophets throughout history, including the messages given to Abraham and Moses. It serves as a reminder of the shared essence of these messages, promoting unity and understanding among the followers of various prophets.
orig: صحف إبراهيم وموسى

translation: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the listener about whether they have received news of the overwhelming event, referring to the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder of the gravity and certainty of the Day of Judgment, prompting reflection and contemplation on one's deeds and faith.
orig: هل أتاك حديث الغاشية

translation: Faces, that Day, will be humbled
interpretation: On that Day, some faces will show humility and submission, reflecting the recognition of the Day of Judgment and the accountability for one's deeds. This illustrates the power and majesty of the Day of Resurrection, when all will be in awe of the divine presence and authority.
orig: وجوه يومئذ خاشعة

translation: Worker in debt,
interpretation: This verse refers to a person who is burdened with debt and is struggling to repay it. It highlights the challenges and difficulties faced by individuals who are financially obligated, reminding believers to be compassionate and supportive towards those in debt.
orig: عاملة ناصبة

translation: You will be kindled with a fire, blazing and burning.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning about the consequences of disobedience and sin. It illustrates the severity and intensity of the punishment that awaits those who reject faith and commit evil deeds. It conveys the idea that those who consciously choose to go against the teachings of Islam will face a fierce and punishing fire in the Hereafter.
orig: تصلى نارا حامية

translation: You will surely drink from a vessel [of wrath] that is bitter.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the consequences of one's actions. It indicates that those who indulge in sinful or misguided behavior will ultimately face the bitterness and punishment of their deeds. It highlights the importance of being mindful of our actions and seeking righteousness and guidance from Allah to avoid such consequences.
orig: تسقى من عين آنية

translation: They will have no food except from a bitter, thorny plant,
interpretation: This verse is a warning about the consequences that the disbelievers will face in the Hereafter. It depicts a scene of deprivation and punishment, where the only food available to them will be from a bitter and thorny plant, symbolizing the harsh and miserable existence that awaits those who reject faith and righteousness.
orig: ليس لهم طعام إلا من ضريع

translation: It does not make one fat nor satisfy hunger.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that material possessions and wealth do not ultimately bring fulfillment or satisfaction to a person's needs. It emphasizes that true contentment and well-being come from a deeper source beyond physical wealth and luxury.
orig: لا يسمن ولا يغني من جوع

translation: Faces that day will be radiant.
interpretation: On that day, believers will have glowing, radiant faces due to their joy and happiness as they receive their rewards from Allah for their good deeds and devotion in this world.
orig: وجوه يومئذ ناعمة

translation: Her effort is satisfying.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that every individual will be rewarded based on their efforts and intentions, regardless of the outcome. It serves as a reminder that in the eyes of Allah, sincere effort and commitment are valued and will not go unrecognized.
orig: لسعيها راضية

translation: In a lofty Paradise.
interpretation: This verse describes the lush and elevated gardens of Paradise, highlighting the beauty, exaltation, and majesty of the reward and bliss awaiting the believers in the afterlife.
orig: في جنة عالية

translation: Do not hear in it any idle talk.
interpretation: This verse advises believers not to engage in or pay attention to any useless or empty talk. It reminds them to avoid gossip, slander, rumors, or any speech that serves no beneficial purpose. Instead, they should focus on meaningful and beneficial conversation that aligns with the teachings of Islam.
orig: لا تسمع فيها لاغية

translation: In it are flowing springs.
interpretation: This verse refers to the description of Paradise (Jannah) in the Qur'an, emphasizing the abundance of blessings and pleasures that it contains. The flowing springs symbolize eternal sources of refreshment and joy, highlighting the idea of endless prosperity and contentment for the believers in the afterlife.
orig: فيها عين جارية

translation: Therein are high thrones.
interpretation: This verse describes Paradise as a place where high thrones are set up for the righteous believers. The mention of thrones symbolizes honor, dignity, and authority that will be granted to the inhabitants of Paradise as a reward for their faith and good deeds in the worldly life.
orig: فيها سرر مرفوعة

translation: And cups [of wine] put forth.
interpretation: This verse refers to the luxurious and abundant provisions that await the righteous in Paradise. It symbolizes the blessings and pleasures that believers will enjoy in the afterlife, signifying contentment, joy, and reward for their good deeds.
orig: وأكواب موضوعة

translation: And [with] palm-leaf coverings spread [in rows]
interpretation: This verse describes a scene in paradise where people will be provided with luxurious comforts and decorations such as palm-leaf coverings spread out in rows. It signifies the abundance and beauty that awaits the believers in the afterlife as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: ونمارق مصفوفة

translation: And [gushing] waters pouring forth.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of abundant water bursting forth, symbolizing divine blessings and mercy flowing continuously and generously. It portrays a vivid image of divine generosity and grace, emphasizing the abundance and constant provision that God grants to those who seek His guidance and blessings.
orig: وزرابي مبثوثة

translation: Do they not look at how the camels were created?
interpretation: This verse is pointing to the creation of camels as a sign of the power and wisdom of Allah. It invites people to ponder and reflect upon the intricate design and functionality of camels as evidence of the existence and greatness of the Creator. It serves as a reminder to consider the signs of Allah's creation as a means to strengthen faith and increase gratitude.
orig: أفلا ينظرون إلى الإبل كيف خلقت

translation: And to the heaven, how it was raised?
interpretation: This verse refers to the wonder and greatness of the creation of the heavens. It prompts reflection on the incredible power and wisdom of Allah in raising and maintaining the vast expanse of the sky above us. It invites us to ponder the amazing design in the creation of the universe and to recognize the signs of Allah's existence and might.
orig: وإلى السماء كيف رفعت

translation: And [have We not] set the mountains as stakes?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the strength, stability, and immovability of mountains. It is a reflection on the power and wisdom of Allah, who has created these large structures as firm pillars on the earth, serving as a metaphorical anchor and support for the world. The mention of mountains in the Qur'an often serves as a reminder of God's omnipotence and the signs of His creation.
orig: وإلى الجبال كيف نصبت

translation: And to the earth - how it was spread out?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the greatness and marvel of the Earth, highlighting the perfect design and balance in its creation. It invites reflection on the vastness and intricacies of the Earth's surface, leading one to ponder over the skillful planning and organization of its features. It serves as a reminder of the power and wisdom of Allah in the creation of the Earth, urging believers to reflect on His intricate design.
orig: وإلى الأرض كيف سطحت

translation: So remind, you are only a reminder.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of his role as a messenger and a warner to the people. It emphasizes that his duty is solely to convey the message of Allah and remind people of their obligations, without the burden of ensuring that everyone follows it. It is a reassurance to the Prophet that he should not be disheartened if people do not heed his message, as his responsibility is only to deliver it.
orig: فذكر إنما أنت مذكر

translation: I have no power over you.
interpretation: This verse conveys the message that Allah is emphasizing His ultimate authority and power over all things, including humans. It serves as a reminder that no one has control or power over Allah, and that ultimately, everyone is subject to His will and decree.
orig: لست عليهم بمصيطر

translation: Except for those who turn away and disbelieve,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that those who choose to turn away from the guidance and teachings of Allah and disbelieve will have consequences. It serves as a reminder that faith requires active participation and adherence to the principles laid out in the Qur'an, and those who reject this guidance will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: إلا من تولى وكفر

translation: So Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who commit grave sins and transgress the boundaries set by Allah will face severe punishment in the Hereafter. It serves as a warning to individuals to avoid such sins and adhere to the teachings of Islam to avoid the severe consequences in the afterlife.
orig: فيعذبه الله العذاب الأكبر

translation: Indeed, to Us is their return.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that ultimately all beings will return to Allah, to be held accountable for their deeds. It emphasizes the belief in the Hereafter and the Day of Judgment, where everyone will face the consequences of their actions in this world.
orig: إن إلينا إيابهم

translation: Then upon Us is their account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that every individual will be held accountable for their actions on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder that God is just and no one will escape their reckoning, as He is the ultimate judge of all deeds.
orig: ثم إن علينا حسابهم

translation: By the dawn
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of dawn, a time of spiritual significance in Islam. It can also be seen as a reminder of the blessings of a new day and the opportunity it brings for renewal, reflection, and prayer.
orig: والفجر

translation: And the ten nights.
interpretation: This verse refers to the first ten days of the Islamic month of Dhul-Hijjah, which are considered very significant in Islam. These ten days include the Hajj pilgrimage and are regarded as particularly blessed and virtuous. Believers are encouraged to engage in acts of worship, good deeds, and seeking forgiveness during this period.
orig: وليال عشر

translation: And the Even and the Odd
interpretation: This verse refers to the concept of pairs and odd numbers, highlighting the balance and order in the universe. The Even represents pairs, symmetry, and balance, while the Odd represents uniqueness, individuality, and diversity. The mention of Even and Odd serves as a reminder of the harmonious structure of creation and the divine wisdom behind it.
orig: والشفع والوتر

translation: By the night as it covers
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the night and its peacefulness and cover, highlighting its significance and the symbolism of darkness providing tranquility. It serves as a reminder of the beauty and order in the creation of Allah, as well as a contemplation of the cycle and balance in nature.
orig: والليل إذا يسر

translation: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes that there are clear signs and indications in the world around us that should serve as more than enough evidence for those who possess intelligence and perception to acknowledge the existence of a divine power and a higher purpose. It calls upon people to ponder over the creation of the universe and the intricate details of nature as a means to appreciate and recognize the presence of the Almighty.
orig: هل في ذلك قسم لذي حجر

translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -
interpretation: This verse invites introspection on the consequences of the actions of the people of 'Aad, who were a nation mentioned in the Quran for their arrogance and transgression. It serves as a reminder of the power of God and the importance of reflecting on the fate of the nations before us as lessons for our own behavior and choices.
orig: ألم تر كيف فعل ربك بعاد

translation: The city of pillars
interpretation: This verse refers to the city of Iram, known for its grand structures and pillars. The mention of pillars may symbolize strength, stability, or grandeur, highlighting the importance of this city in history or as a lesson in the Qur'an.
orig: إرم ذات العماد

translation: which was not created in the land.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness of Allah's creation, highlighting that there is nothing like Him or His creation in the land. It emphasizes the unmatched beauty and perfection of Allah's creation, serving as a reminder of His greatness and power.
orig: التي لم يخلق مثلها في البلاد

translation: And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in their valleys,
interpretation: This verse introduces the people of Thamud who were known for their skill in carving rocks and constructing dwellings in the mountains. It highlights the arrogance and defiance of the people of Thamud towards the guidance and warnings from their Prophet, Saleh. Their disobedience and disbelief eventually led to their destruction as a punishment from Allah.
orig: وثمود الذين جابوا الصخر بالواد

translation: Pharaoh, owner of stakes -
interpretation: This verse is referring to Pharaoh, the ruler of Egypt during the time of Prophet Moses, describing him as the 'owner of stakes'. The term 'owner of stakes' could be a metaphorical reference to Pharaoh's power, authority, and tyranny, emphasizing his oppressive and tyrannical rule over his people.
orig: وفرعون ذي الأوتاد

translation: Those who committed excesses in the lands.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have committed injustice, transgression, and excess in the lands. It serves as a reminder to avoid such behavior and to uphold justice and righteousness in all aspects of life.
orig: الذين طغوا في البلاد

translation: So increase therein corruption.
interpretation: This verse warns against spreading corruption in the land and encourages people to uphold justice and righteousness in society. It serves as a reminder to avoid actions and behaviors that lead to chaos and harm within the community.
orig: فأكثروا فيها الفساد

translation: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that as a consequence of their wrongdoing and disobedience, Allah's punishment came down upon them. It signifies that those who persist in disobedience and transgression will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: فصب عليهم ربك سوط عذاب

translation: Surely, your Lord is ever watchful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the constant vigilance and watchful nature of Allah. It serves as a reminder that nothing escapes His knowledge and observation, and that He is always aware of everything that happens, both outwardly and inwardly. This attribute of Allah provides comfort to believers, knowing that He is always protecting and overseeing them, and it serves as a warning to wrongdoers that they cannot conceal their actions from Him.
orig: إن ربك لبالمرصاد

translation: So when the Lord tests them by giving them honor and blessings, they say, 'My Lord has honored me.'
interpretation: This verse highlights how some people may respond to blessings and favor from God by acknowledging and attributing it to His grace and generosity. It reminds us to be humble, grateful, and recognizing of God's blessings in our lives, attributing any honor or goodness received to His mercy and kindness.
orig: فأما الإنسان إذا ما ابتلاه ربه فأكرمه ونعمه فيقول ربي أكرمن

translation: And as for one whom He provides with resources, he is stingy, and thinks himself self-sufficient.
interpretation: This verse highlights how when Allah blesses someone with wealth and resources, they may become arrogant, stingy, and feel self-sufficient instead of being grateful and using their resources to help others. It serves as a reminder to reflect on how we perceive and utilize the blessings we have been given.
orig: وأما إذا ما ابتلاه فقدر عليه رزقه فيقول ربي أهانن

translation: No! But you do not honor the orphan.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance of caring for orphans and treating them with kindness and respect. It serves as a reminder to the believers to fulfill their duty towards orphans and to protect their rights, as neglecting them goes against the teachings of Islam which stress the care and compassion for the vulnerable members of society.
orig: كلا بل لا تكرمون اليتيم

translation: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor,
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to the community to not just focus on their own individual wealth and well-being, but also to actively participate in helping those less fortunate. It emphasizes the importance of caring for the poor and not neglecting their basic needs, urging believers to work together to ensure the proper feeding and sustenance of the impoverished members of society.
orig: ولا تحاضون على طعام المسكين

translation: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
interpretation: This verse is a warning against consuming the inheritance of the orphans unjustly and excessively. It reminds believers to be just and fair in their dealings, especially when it comes to the wealth and rights of orphans.
orig: وتأكلون التراث أكلا لما

translation: And you love wealth with immense love.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human tendency to have a strong attachment and love for material wealth. It serves as a reminder to be mindful of not letting this love for wealth overshadow our spiritual and moral values, and to not prioritize wealth above all else.
orig: وتحبون المال حبا جما

translation: No! When the earth is pounded to dust,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the power of Allah and the inevitability of the Day of Judgment. It conveys the idea that everything in this world will come to an end, and even the mighty earth will be crushed to dust when the final judgment arrives.
orig: كلا إذا دكت الأرض دكا دكا

translation: And your Lord has come, and the angels, rank upon rank.
interpretation: This verse describes the day of judgment when Allah will come with all His glory and majesty, accompanied by a vast array of angels in perfect order and discipline. It signifies the power and grandeur of Allah's ultimate authority and the organized nature of His creation.
orig: وجاء ربك والملك صفا صفا

translation: And Hellfire will be brought forth on that Day; on that Day man will remember, but how will the remembrance avail him?
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when Hellfire will be brought forth. On that day, people will remember all their deeds and actions, but for many, it will be too late to benefit from this remembrance. It emphasizes the importance of reflecting on one's actions and making amends before it's too late.
orig: وجيء يومئذ بجهنم يومئذ يتذكر الإنسان وأنى له الذكرى

translation: He says, "I wish I had put forth [some good deeds] for my life."
interpretation: This verse reflects a moment of regret, where the speaker wishes they had done more good deeds and been more proactive in living a life that is pleasing to Allah. It serves as a reminder to seize the opportunity to do good in this life and prepare for the Hereafter.
orig: يقول يا ليتني قدمت لحياتي

translation: On that Day, He will not punish with His punishment anyone.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when no one will be able to impose punishment on others except Allah. It reminds believers of the significance of the Day of Judgment and the absolute justice and power of Allah in executing His judgment. It serves as a warning to those who disobey Allah and a reassurance to the believers of the ultimate justice that will prevail on that Day.
orig: فيومئذ لا يعذب عذابه أحد

translation: And no one can bind with the same strength as Him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unmatched power and ability of Allah, emphasizing that no one can equal or rival Him in strength or might. It serves as a reminder of the sovereignty and greatness of Allah over all things.
orig: ولا يوثق وثاقه أحد

translation: O reassured soul,
interpretation: This verse addresses the tranquil soul, emphasizing peace, contentment, and tranquility. It serves as a reminder to the soul of its true nature and purpose, calling on it to find rest and comfort in the remembrance of God.
orig: يا أيتها النفس المطمئنة

translation: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him].
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to return to their Lord in a state of contentment and acceptance, demonstrating a sincere and pleasing attitude towards Him. It emphasizes the importance of seeking spiritual growth and fulfillment through being content with the will of God and striving to please Him in all aspects of life.
orig: ارجعي إلى ربك راضية مرضية

translation: Then enter among My servants.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah, inviting the believers to draw closer to Him by being in the company of His righteous servants. By being among the devout worshippers of God, a person can increase their faith, knowledge, and devotion, ultimately strengthening their relationship with their Creator.
orig: فادخلي في عبادي

translation: And enter My paradise.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to enter into His paradise. It signifies the ultimate reward and blessing for those who have submitted to Allah's will and lived a righteous life according to the teachings of the Qur'an. It serves as a reminder of the promised eternal bliss for those who have attained Allah's pleasure and forgiveness.
orig: وادخلي جنتي

translation: I do not swear by this city
interpretation: This verse highlights the seriousness and importance of the message being conveyed by the speaker. By swearing on something, the speaker emphasizes the truth and importance of their words. This verse signifies that the speaker considers the city mentioned to be significant enough that its mention alone should validate the message, calling attention to the gravity of the upcoming statement.
orig: لا أقسم بهذا البلد

translation: And you are free in this city.
interpretation: This verse highlights the Prophet Muhammad's freedom and protection given to him by Allah in the city of Mecca despite facing opposition and persecution from the Quraysh tribe. It signifies divine support and a reminder that with faith and patience, one can overcome challenges and fulfill their purpose.
orig: وأنت حل بهذا البلد

translation: And [by] the parent and that which they have borne,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the significance and responsibilities of both parents and children. It highlights the relationship between parents and their children, stressing the importance of recognizing and respecting the efforts and sacrifices made by parents in raising and nurturing their offspring. It also implies the reciprocal obligations of children to honor and care for their parents, acknowledging the bond and interconnectedness between generations.
orig: ووالد وما ولد

translation: We have certainly created man into hardship.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges the challenging nature of human existence. It implies that life for humans involves struggle, difficulties, and hardships. This can be viewed as a reminder that challenges are a natural part of life, and that resilience and patience are virtues to cultivate in facing these adversities.
orig: لقد خلقنا الإنسان في كبد

translation: Does he think that no one has power over him?
interpretation: This verse questions the arrogance of those who believe they are beyond accountability or cannot be held responsible for their actions. It serves as a reminder that ultimately all human beings are accountable to a higher power and will be judged accordingly for their deeds.
orig: أيحسب أن لن يقدر عليه أحد

translation: They say, 'We have destroyed wealth in abundance.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the misconception that some people may have about wealth being a measure of success and power. It warns against the arrogance and pride that can come from material wealth, reminding believers that true richness lies in faith, good deeds, and humility.
orig: يقول أهلكت مالا لبدا

translation: Does he think that no one has seen him?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the belief of certain individuals who think that their deeds, good or bad, go unnoticed and unseen by anyone. It serves as a reminder that Allah sees and knows everything that people do, and nothing can be hidden from Him. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and the belief that every action is recorded and will be brought to light on the Day of Judgment.
orig: أيحسب أن لم يره أحد

translation: Did We not make for him two eyes?
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating human beings with the ability to see through the gift of eyesight. It serves as a reminder of the blessings and capabilities granted by Allah to mankind, emphasizing the importance of utilizing these gifts for good and being grateful for them.
orig: ألم نجعل له عينين

translation: And a tongue and two lips.
interpretation: This verse describes the physical attributes of the human being, highlighting the significance and beauty of communication through speech. It serves as a reminder of the responsibility that comes with the gift of speech, encouraging believers to use their words wisely and truthfully.
orig: ولسانا وشفتين

translation: And We guided him to the two steep inclines.
interpretation: This verse refers to how Allah guided Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to the two clear paths of guidance - the path of righteousness and faith, and the path of falsehood and disbelief. It emphasizes the importance of discerning between the right path and the wrong path, and following the path that leads to righteousness and the pleasure of Allah.
orig: وهديناه النجدين

translation: So he did not enter the steep path.
interpretation: This verse describes a person who does not fulfill their responsibilities or face challenges with determination and effort. It emphasizes the importance of perseverance and dedication to overcome obstacles and achieve success in both worldly and spiritual matters.
orig: فلا اقتحم العقبة

translation: And what can make you know what is 'Al-'Aqabah?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the importance and gravity of the concept of 'Al-'Aqabah, a steep path or difficult ascent. It is emphasizing the unknown and challenging nature of what lies ahead, prompting reflection on the uncertainty and unpredictability of future events, and underscoring the need for trust in God in navigating through life's obstacles.
orig: وما أدراك ما العقبة

translation: So free a slave
interpretation: This verse is a command to free a slave as an act of atonement for certain sins or mistakes made by the believer. It emphasizes the importance of freeing slaves as a means of seeking forgiveness and redemption in the eyes of Allah.
orig: فك رقبة

translation: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of acts of charity, specifically feeding the hungry, during times of hardship and famine. It emphasizes the significance of helping those in need and easing their suffering, even when resources are limited.
orig: أو إطعام في يوم ذي مسغبة

translation: An orphan of near relationship.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of caring for orphans who are close relatives. It emphasizes the idea of showing compassion and providing support to those who are vulnerable and in need, especially when they are part of one's own family or community.
orig: يتيما ذا مقربة

translation: Or a poor person suffering in the dust.
interpretation: This verse highlights the condition of a poor person who is in a state of poverty and deprivation, emphasized by the imagery of being covered in dust. It emphasizes the importance of caring for and helping those who are less fortunate and in need, teaching compassion and empathy towards those who are struggling in society.
orig: أو مسكينا ذا متربة

translation: Then He will be among those who believe and advise one another to patience and advise one another to compassion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith and cooperation among believers. It highlights the qualities of patience and compassion as key virtues that should be practiced and encouraged within the Muslim community. By showing patience in times of trial and showing compassion towards others, one can strengthen their faith and contribute positively to the unity and harmony of the believers.
orig: ثم كان من الذين آمنوا وتواصوا بالصبر وتواصوا بالمرحمة

translation: Those are the companions of the right.
interpretation: This verse describes the honored position of those who will be granted entry to Paradise and receive their book of deeds in their right hand on the Day of Judgment, symbolizing success and acceptance by Allah. They are the righteous believers who will be in a state of bliss and joy for eternity.
orig: أولئك أصحاب الميمنة

translation: And those who disbelieve in Our verses - they are the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who reject the signs and revelations of Allah are the ones who will be held accountable and will face the consequences of their disbelief in the form of punishment in Hellfire. It serves as a reminder of the serious consequences of denying the truth and turning away from the guidance of Allah.
orig: والذين كفروا بآياتنا هم أصحاب المشأمة

translation: Upon them is a fire closed over.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of the disbelievers who will face a fire that is tightly sealed over them, indicating that they will be engulfed by a fierce and unescapable punishment in the hereafter.
orig: عليهم نار مؤصدة

translation: By the sun and its brightness,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and magnificence of the sun, which is a creation of Allah and a source of light and life on Earth. It serves as a reminder of Allah's greatness and the signs of His existence in the universe.
orig: والشمس وضحاها

translation: By the moon when it follows it,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the oath by the moon that follows a certain path. It illustrates the order and precision in the natural world as a sign of Allah's power and control over the universe.
orig: والقمر إذا تلاها

translation: And [by] the day when it displays it.
interpretation: This verse can be interpreted as a reference to the phenomenon of daylight when it manifests with all its brightness and clarity. It could also be highlighting the importance of the day and its role in illuminating the world and showcasing Allah's creations. It symbolizes the constant cycle of day and night as signs of Allah's power and control over the universe.
orig: والنهار إذا جلاها

translation: By the night as it covers
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of the night in the grand designs of Allah. It signifies the beauty and significance of the night as it envelops the world in darkness, signaling the end of the day and the beginning of a time for rest and introspection. The night is a reminder of the cycle of life, of the alternating phases of light and darkness, and a reminder of the power and wisdom of Allah in creating such harmony in the universe.
orig: والليل إذا يغشاها

translation: And the sky and He who built it,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the magnificence and power of Allah as the Creator of the sky and everything within it. It serves as a reminder of the divine origin and control over the universe, showcasing the beauty and precision of Allah's creation.
orig: والسماء وما بناها

translation: And the earth and Him who spread it
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of Allah in creating and spreading the earth. It serves as a reminder to acknowledge the greatness of Allah's creation and to reflect on His ability to create and shape the world around us.
orig: والأرض وما طحاها

translation: By the soul, and He who proportioned it,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance and sanctity of the human soul, emphasizing that it is created and perfectly balanced by Allah. It signifies the divine origin and essence of the human soul and reminds believers of their responsibility to honor and protect their own souls, as well as the souls of others.
orig: ونفس وما سواها

translation: So He inspired it (the soul) to its wickedness and its righteousness.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah instills in human souls the knowledge of good and evil, guiding them towards righteousness and urging them against wrongdoing. It signifies the innate understanding that humans possess regarding what is right and what is wrong, encouraging them to choose the path of righteousness over sin and corruption.
orig: فألهمها فجورها وتقواها

translation: Indeed whosoever purifies it (i.e., the soul) shall achieve success.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the importance of purifying one's soul. It signifies that success is attained by those who strive to cleanse and refine their inner selves from impurities such as sins, negative traits, and harmful desires. The purification of the soul leads to spiritual growth, inner peace, and ultimately success in the eyes of Allah.
orig: قد أفلح من زكاها

translation: And he has failed who instills it (with corruption).
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who try to corrupt or tamper with the teachings of the Qur'an will ultimately fail in their endeavors. It serves as a reminder of the Divine protection and preservation of the Qur'an from any form of distortion or manipulation.
orig: وقد خاب من دساها

translation: Thamud denied [the Prophet] because of their transgression.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that the people of Thamud rejected the message of the Prophet due to their arrogance and defiance. Despite being presented with clear signs and warnings, they chose to deviate from the right path and indulge in wrongdoing. Their denial was a result of their own transgression and refusal to submit to the truth.
orig: كذبت ثمود بطغواها

translation: When its most wretched shall be sent forth
interpretation: This verse is indicating a future event where the most wretched individuals will be resurrected or brought back to life for judgment. It serves as a reminder that everyone will be held accountable for their actions, even those who lived in disobedience and corruption. It highlights the concept of divine justice and the ultimate reckoning that awaits all souls.
orig: إذ انبعث أشقاها

translation: So the Messenger of Allah said to them, 'The she-camel of Allah and her drink.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a story in the Qur'an about a miraculous she-camel sent by Allah as a sign to the people. The Prophet was emphasizing the significance of the she-camel and its provision of water as signs of Allah's power and mercy. It serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing and appreciating the signs and blessings that Allah has provided.
orig: فقال لهم رسول الله ناقة الله وسقياها

translation: So they denied him and hamstrung her. So he decreed destruction upon them, and he made it equal.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment inflicted upon those who denied a messenger of God by rejecting his message and committing acts of aggression. The punishment is a direct consequence of their own sinful actions, bringing about their destruction and ruin to make it equal to the severity of their crimes.
orig: فكذبوه فعقروها فدمدم عليهم ربهم بذنبهم فسواها

translation: And he does not fear the consequences thereof.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of performing good deeds without expecting any worldly returns. It emphasizes that a true believer should not fear the consequences of their actions when they are done sincerely for the sake of pleasing Allah. It encourages trust in Allah's mercy and justice, teaching that those who do good deeds will be rewarded by Allah in the Hereafter, regardless of the challenges or obstacles they may face in this world.
orig: ولا يخاف عقباها

translation: By the night as it conceals (the light),
interpretation: This verse highlights the night, specifically when it envelops the world in darkness. The darkness of night symbolizes challenges, difficulties, and the unseen aspects of life. Just as night conceals the light, trials and hardships can obscure our path and make it harder to see clearly. Therefore, the verse may be reminding believers to seek guidance and comfort in Allah during times of darkness and uncertainty.
orig: والليل إذا يغشى

translation: By the morning brightness,
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the brightness and clarity that comes with the morning, symbolizing the light and guidance that one receives from God. It also serves as a reminder of the cycles of day and night, signifying the constant change and renewal in the world that reflects the power and majesty of the Creator.
orig: والنهار إذا تجلى

translation: He did not create the male and the female except that they believe and do righteous deeds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the purpose of creation and highlights that human beings, both male and female, are created to believe in God and do good deeds. It highlights the equality of men and women in terms of their spiritual obligations and the importance of faith and righteousness in the sight of God.
orig: وما خلق الذكر والأنثى

translation: Your effort is diverse.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept that human endeavors and efforts are varied and diverse. It suggests that people pursue different goals and engage in a wide range of activities. It conveys the idea that individuals have different strengths, talents, and areas of interest where they put their efforts, and this diversity adds richness to the human experience.
orig: إن سعيكم لشتى

translation: So as for he who gives and fears Allah,
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of a righteous person who not only gives in charity but also fears Allah, indicating the importance of both generosity and piety in Islam. It emphasizes the significance of combining good deeds towards others with a sincere intention to please Allah and a sense of consciousness of Him.
orig: فأما من أعطى واتقى

translation: And confirmed the truth with the best explanations.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of confirming the truth with the best and most beautiful explanations. It encourages believers to express the truth in a clear, eloquent, and convincing manner, reflecting the beauty and wisdom of the message of Islam.
orig: وصدق بالحسنى

translation: So We will ease him toward ease.
interpretation: This verse assures that Allah will make things easy for the one who chooses the right path and performs good deeds, providing comfort and ease in life's journey. It is a reminder of Allah's mercy, compassion, and assistance to those who remain steadfast on the righteous path.
orig: فسنيسره لليسرى

translation: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are miserly and stingy, thinking that they are self-sufficient and do not need to give in charity or help others. It warns against the attitude of selfishness and greed, highlighting the importance of generosity and humility in the path of righteousness.
orig: وأما من بخل واستغنى

translation: And denied the best.
interpretation: This verse indicates that some people reject or deny the best things that are offered to them, which could refer to the good teachings, guidance, or blessings from Allah. It serves as a reminder to appreciate and accept the goodness and beauty that is presented to us.
orig: وكذب بالحسنى

translation: So We will ease him toward ease.
interpretation: This verse is conveying the message that Allah will make things easier for the one going through difficulty, providing relief and comfort after hardship. It emphasizes the idea of patience and trust in Allah, as He is the one who can turn hardships into ease.
orig: فسنيسره للعسرى

translation: And his wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
interpretation: This verse highlights that no amount of wealth or material possessions will be of use to a person when they face the consequences of their actions or when they are in a state of vulnerability. It emphasizes the transient nature of worldly goods and the ultimate insignificance of material wealth in the face of the greater realities of life and the hereafter.
orig: وما يغني عنه ماله إذا تردى

translation: Indeed, upon Us is guidance.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the responsibility of providing guidance rests upon Allah alone. It signifies that true guidance and direction in life can only come from Allah, and it is a reminder of the importance of seeking guidance from Him through faith, prayer, and following the teachings of the Qur'an.
orig: إن علينا للهدى

translation: And indeed, for Us is the Hereafter and the first [life].
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the Islamic concept of the Hereafter (life after death) and the current worldly life. It emphasizes that both the Hereafter and the current life belong to Allah, and He has ultimate authority and control over both aspects of existence. Muslims are reminded to prioritize their actions and deeds in this life with their eternal life in the Hereafter in mind, focusing on striving for success in both worlds through obedience to Allah and righteous actions.
orig: وإن لنا للآخرة والأولى

translation: So I warn you of a Fire that is blazing.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning from Allah about the severe consequences that await those who stray from His path and engage in wrongdoing. It emphasizes the existence of a blazing Fire as a punishment for those who reject faith and commit sins, highlighting the importance of adhering to the teachings of Islam and avoiding actions that lead to spiritual destruction.
orig: فأنذرتكم نارا تلظى

translation: None touch it except the most wretched.
interpretation: This verse is describing the hellfire and emphasizing that only the most unfortunate and wretched individuals will come into contact with it. It serves as a warning about the severe consequences of evil deeds and the importance of avoiding actions that lead to such a cursed fate.
orig: لا يصلاها إلا الأشقى

translation: Who has denied and turned away.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have rejected the truth and turned away from it. It emphasizes the consequences of denying God's message and choosing to follow their own desires instead. It serves as a warning against the consequences of disbelief and the importance of staying on the right path.
orig: الذي كذب وتولى

translation: And the righteous will be kept away from it.
interpretation: This verse refers to how the righteous and God-fearing individuals will be protected and saved from the punishment of Hell. It emphasizes the concept that those who lead a righteous life, follow the teachings of Islam, and avoid sins will be rewarded with protection from the torment of Hellfire.
orig: وسيجنبها الأتقى

translation: Who gives his wealth in order to purify himself.
interpretation: This verse highlights the concept of purification through giving in charity. It emphasizes that giving wealth for the sake of purification is a noble act that not only benefits others but also cleanses and elevates the character and spirituality of the giver. Such acts of charity are considered as acts of worship that purify the soul and cultivate compassion and generosity in the heart.
orig: الذي يؤتي ماله يتزكى

translation: And no one has a favor [done to him] that will be rewarded.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept that no matter how much one may do for someone else, they can never fully repay the good done to them. It serves as a reminder of the infinite blessings and favors bestowed upon us by Allah that are impossible to fully reciprocate or repay.
orig: وما لأحد عنده من نعمة تجزى

translation: Seeking the countenance of their Lord, the Most High.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of sincerely seeking the pleasure and approval of Allah, the Most High, in all our actions. It encourages believers to strive for righteousness and excellence in worshipping and obeying Allah, seeking His acceptance above everything else.
orig: إلا ابتغاء وجه ربه الأعلى

translation: And soon will your Lord give you so that you will be pleased.
interpretation: This verse assures believers that Allah will provide them with what they need and grant them satisfaction, emphasizing the idea that contentment and fulfillment come from Allah's blessings. It serves as a reminder to have faith in Allah's plan and trust that He will grant what is best for His servants, ensuring their ultimate satisfaction and happiness.
orig: ولسوف يرضى

translation: By the morning brightness,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of the morning and the light it brings. It can be seen as a reminder of the blessings and opportunities that come with each new day. It also serves as a sign of hope and renewal, urging believers to be grateful for the gift of each day and to use it wisely to do good deeds and seek closeness to God.
orig: والضحى

translation: By the night as it envelops
interpretation: This verse is drawing attention to the night and its tranquil nature. It signifies the importance of the night as a time of rest and peace. It serves as a reminder of the beauty and serenity that can be found in the darkness of the night, highlighting the contrast with the brightness of the day. Overall, it emphasizes the divine nature of the night as a time for reflection and rejuvenation.
orig: والليل إذا سجى

translation: Your Lord has not forsaken you, nor does He hate you.
interpretation: This verse reassures and comforts the Prophet Muhammad, reminding him that his Lord has not abandoned him nor does He dislike him. It is a message of support and encouragement, emphasizing Allah's continuous care and protection over his Messenger.
orig: ما ودعك ربك وما قلى

translation: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the Hereafter over the worldly life. It serves as a reminder that the rewards and blessings in the Hereafter are far superior and everlasting compared to the transient pleasures of this life. Believers are encouraged to focus on preparing for the Hereafter and prioritizing their actions and choices based on their eternal consequences.
orig: وللآخرة خير لك من الأولى

translation: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
interpretation: This verse reassures the believers that their Lord will provide for them abundantly and fulfill their needs, leading to their contentment and satisfaction. It emphasizes trust in Allah's provision and the importance of being grateful and accepting what is given with contentment.
orig: ولسوف يعطيك ربك فترضى

translation: Did He not find you an orphan and give shelter?
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the care and protection provided by Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) when he was orphaned. It is a reminder of how Allah is constantly watching over His creations, especially those who are vulnerable and in need, and provides them with support and guidance.
orig: ألم يجدك يتيما فآوى

translation: And He found you lost and guided [you].
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine guidance provided by Allah to those who were once lost or astray. It serves as a reminder that even in moments of confusion or misguidance, Allah has the power to lead us to the right path and offer us guidance.
orig: ووجدك ضالا فهدى

translation: And He found you lost and guided [you].
interpretation: This verse conveys the concept of divine guidance and support. It highlights how Allah finds people in states of need or confusion and then leads them towards the right path, offering help and enrichment.
orig: ووجدك عائلا فأغنى

translation: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing kindness and compassion towards orphans and not taking advantage of their vulnerable situation. It is a reminder to treat them with respect, fairness, and support, rather than oppressing or neglecting them.
orig: فأما اليتيم فلا تقهر

translation: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of responding to those who ask for help or assistance, and commands the believers not to turn away those who come seeking help or support. It encourages kindness, generosity, and compassion towards those in need, reminding believers of their duty to help others and maintain good relations within the community.
orig: وأما السائل فلا تنهر

translation: And proclaim the bounty of your Lord.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to openly speak about and acknowledge the blessings and favors that God has bestowed upon them. It reminds them to express gratitude for the gifts and kindness they have received, and to share their appreciation for the abundant blessings from their Lord.
orig: وأما بنعمة ربك فحدث

translation: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?
interpretation: This verse is a reassurance and a source of comfort for the Prophet Muhammad, letting him know that Allah has eased his burdens and expanded his chest to make his mission easier to bear. It also serves as a reminder for all believers that Allah is there to provide support and relief during times of difficulty and stress.
orig: ألم نشرح لك صدرك

translation: And We have lifted from you your burden
interpretation: This verse refers to the forgiveness and mercy of Allah, who removes the burdens and sins from His servants when they sincerely turn to Him in repentance. It also serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to ease the difficulties and hardships faced by His believers.
orig: ووضعنا عنك وزرك

translation: The one who broke your back
interpretation: This verse describes a person who has caused harm or distress to another individual, to the extent that it feels as though they have broken their back metaphorically. It signifies the intensity of the hardship or the burden that the person has inflicted upon someone else.
orig: الذي أنقض ظهرك

translation: And We have raised high your repute.
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah has elevated the mention and reputation of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to the highest level, indicating his esteemed position and honor in the sight of Allah. It conveys the divine status and honor granted to the Prophet as a messenger and the leader of the Islamic community.
orig: ورفعنا لك ذكرك

translation: So verily, with the hardship, there is relief.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that ease always follows hardship. It teaches us to be patient during difficult times, knowing that Allah will bring us comfort and relief after every hardship we face.
orig: فإن مع العسر يسرا

translation: Verily, with hardship comes ease.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that with every difficulty or hardship they face, there will be ease and relief that follows. It serves as a source of comfort and reassurance, emphasizing that even in the darkest of times, there is always hope and light at the end of the tunnel.
orig: إن مع العسر يسرا

translation: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
interpretation: This verse is reminding believers to prioritize their worship and devotion to God once they have completed their worldly tasks or responsibilities. It serves as a call to action, urging believers to dedicate time and effort to prayer and obedience to God after fulfilling their worldly obligations.
orig: فإذا فرغت فانصب

translation: And to your Lord direct your longing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of turning to Allah wholeheartedly with hope and desire. It encourages believers to place their trust and hope in Allah alone, seeking His pleasure and mercy in all aspects of life.
orig: وإلى ربك فارغب

translation: By the fig and the olive
interpretation: This verse from Surah At-Tin (The Fig) emphasizes the importance and significance of the fig and olive trees. These trees are considered symbols of goodness and blessings in Islamic tradition. The mention of these fruits in the Qur'an is believed to signify the greatness of Allah's creation and serve as a reminder of His power and wisdom.
orig: والتين والزيتون

translation: And [by] Mount Sinai
interpretation: This verse refers to the holiness and significance of Mount Sinai as a place where Allah communicated with Prophet Moses. It serves as a reminder of the powerful and sacred nature of the revelation received by prophets.
orig: وطور سينين

translation: And this city of security
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance and sanctity of Mecca as a city of peace and security. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining peace, justice, and trust within a community, and serves as a reminder of the responsibility to safeguard the well-being and security of all inhabitants.
orig: وهذا البلد الأمين

translation: Verily, We created man in the best stature.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has created humans in the best possible form, with wisdom and perfection. It serves as a reminder of the beauty of human creation and the responsibility that comes with being created in the best manner, encouraging gratitude and reflection on the blessings bestowed upon humanity.
orig: لقد خلقنا الإنسان في أحسن تقويم

translation: Then We returned him to the lowest of the low,
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment of those who are arrogant or oppress others. It signifies that those who display arrogance or wrongdoing will be brought down to the lowest of the low in the Hereafter as a result of their actions.
orig: ثم رددناه أسفل سافلين

translation: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them is a reward uninterrupted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who have faith in God and engage in good deeds will be rewarded generously and continuously. Their reward will not be limited or restricted in any way, showing the abundant mercy and grace of God towards the believers.
orig: إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فلهم أجر غير ممنون

translation: So what could make you deny the Recompense?
interpretation: This verse is questioning why would anyone deny the concept of the Day of Judgment and the accountability for their actions. It emphasizes the importance of belief in the afterlife and the consequences of one's deeds.
orig: فما يكذبك بعد بالدين

translation: Is not Allah the most just of judges?
interpretation: This verse highlights the belief in the ultimate justice of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is the most fair and just judge, who will judge all matters with perfect justice on the Day of Judgment. It calls upon believers to trust in the divine wisdom and fairness of Allah's judgment, and to seek solace and guidance in His justice.
orig: أليس الله بأحكم الحاكمين

translation: Read in the name of your Lord who created.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and learning in the name of Allah, the Creator. It emphasizes the significance of education and encourages believers to seek knowledge as a way to connect with the divine and understand the world around them.
orig: اقرأ باسم ربك الذي خلق

translation: Man was created from a clinging substance.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humble origins of mankind, stating that human beings were created from a clinging organism. It highlights the miraculous nature of human creation and serves as a reminder of the power and creativity of Allah in shaping and bringing life into existence.
orig: خلق الإنسان من علق

translation: Read! In the Name of your Lord who has created.
interpretation: This verse is urging the reader to seek knowledge and enlightenment through reading, reminding them of the importance of knowledge in Islam. It emphasizes the idea that acquiring knowledge is a noble act and that through learning, one can come closer to recognizing the greatness of their Creator.
orig: اقرأ وربك الأكرم

translation: The One who taught by the pen,
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of knowledge and education. It emphasizes the importance of writing and documentation as tools for learning and spreading knowledge. It symbolizes the power and impact of education in enlightening individuals and societies.
orig: الذي علم بالقلم

translation: Man is taught that which he knew not.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of continuous learning and the acquisition of knowledge throughout one's life. It highlights the idea that human beings are capable of learning and growing beyond their current knowledge and understanding. The verse encourages seeking knowledge and emphasizes the importance of education as a means of personal and spiritual development.
orig: علم الإنسان ما لم يعلم

translation: No! Indeed, man transgresses,
interpretation: This verse highlights the tendency of human beings to go beyond the limits set by Allah, to transgress and commit sins. It serves as a reminder for individuals to be mindful of their actions and to strive to stay within the boundaries of righteousness and piety.
orig: كلا إن الإنسان ليطغى

translation: He saw it - the signs of God in nature - yet he refused to acknowledge God's existence.
interpretation: This verse from the Quran emphasizes the idea that even when people witness the clear signs and proofs of God's existence in the universe, some individuals still choose to deny or ignore Him. It highlights the ingratitude and arrogance of those who turn away from God despite His evident presence in every aspect of creation.
orig: أن رآه استغنى

translation: Surely, to your Lord is the return.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that ultimately, everyone will return to their Lord for accountability and judgment. It serves as a reminder to live a life in accordance with the teachings of Islam, as all actions will be brought before Allah in the Hereafter.
orig: إن إلى ربك الرجعى

translation: Have you seen him who forbids...
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question, asking the listener if they have observed or considered someone who prohibits or forbids certain actions or beliefs. The verse sets a tone of reflection and contemplation, urging the listener to think about the consequences and motivations behind such prohibitions. It encourages deep contemplation on the subject to understand the wisdom and reasons behind such actions.
orig: أرأيت الذي ينهى

translation: when the servant prays,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of prayer in Islam. It emphasizes the significance of worship and obedience to Allah through prayer, indicating that prayer is an essential part of a believer's life. By praying regularly, a servant demonstrates devotion, submission, and gratitude to Allah, and seeks His guidance and blessings.
orig: عبدا إذا صلى

translation: Have you considered: if [this Qur'an] is from guidance,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of reflecting on whether the Qur'an is truly a source of guidance. It prompts individuals to ponder and contemplate the message contained within the Qur'an, questioning its authenticity and relevance to their lives.
orig: أرأيت إن كان على الهدى

translation: or enjoin righteousness
interpretation: This verse is reminding believers that they should not only abstain from evil but also actively promote righteousness and piety in their lives and in the community. It emphasizes the importance of encouraging one another towards goodness and piety, as well as practicing it themselves.
orig: أو أمر بالتقوى

translation: Have you considered if he denies and turns away -
interpretation: This verse can be seen as a question posed to the reader to reflect on the consequences of denying the truth and turning away from it. It serves as a reminder of the accountability individuals will face if they choose to reject the teachings and guidance provided to them.
orig: أرأيت إن كذب وتولى

translation: Does he not know that Allah sees?
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah is all-seeing and all-knowing. It emphasizes that no one can hide their actions from Allah, as He is fully aware of everything that happens. This serves as a warning to encourage believers to always be mindful of their actions, knowing that they are constantly being observed by Allah.
orig: ألم يعلم بأن الله يرى

translation: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock -
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that if a wrongdoer persists in his ways and does not repent, he will face the consequences of his actions. It portrays the firm and just nature of God's judgment, indicating that there will be no escape from accountability for one's deeds.
orig: كلا لئن لم ينته لنسفعا بالناصية

translation: A lying sinful forehead.
interpretation: This verse refers to individuals who are dishonest and sinful in their actions. It emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and integrity, warning against falling into falsehood and deceit.
orig: ناصية كاذبة خاطئة

translation: So let him call upon his council.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of seeking advice and consultation before making important decisions. It is a reminder that individuals should seek the counsel of others, especially those who are knowledgeable and wise, in order to make well-informed choices and decisions. By encouraging consultation, the verse promotes the value of collective wisdom and highlights the importance of humility in seeking guidance from others.
orig: فليدع ناديه

translation: We will call the guards.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, people will be held accountable for their actions and will be summoned to stand before God's judgment. It serves as a reminder that everyone will have to face the consequences of their deeds, and that there is ultimate accountability for one's actions.
orig: سندع الزبانية

translation: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse instructs believers not to obey Satan and his temptations, but rather to prostrate in prayer and draw nearer to Allah through worship and submission. It emphasizes the importance of resisting evil influences and staying steadfast in devotion to God.
orig: كلا لا تطعه واسجد واقترب

translation: Indeed, We sent the Qur'an down during the Night of Decree.
interpretation: This verse refers to the night in which the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It highlights the significance and greatness of the Night of Decree, emphasizing the sacredness and importance of this night in the Islamic faith. Muslims are encouraged to seek out this night during the last ten nights of Ramadan for its immense blessings and spiritual significance.
orig: إنا أنزلناه في ليلة القدر

translation: And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the greatness and significance of the Night of Decree, emphasizing the incomprehensibility of its true significance to human beings. It invites believers to reflect on the immense importance and blessings of this special night, highlighting the need for deep contemplation and spiritual connection during this time.
orig: وما أدراك ما ليلة القدر

translation: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense significance and value of the Night of Decree (Laylat al-Qadr) in Islam. It emphasizes that worshipping on this night carries great rewards and blessings, exceeding the rewards of worshipping for a thousand months. It encourages believers to seek out this special night and devote themselves to acts of worship and supplication during it.
orig: ليلة القدر خير من ألف شهر

translation: Angels and the Spirit descend therein by the permission of their Lord for every matter.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of divine intervention and assistance in the earthly matters. It signifies that through the permission of Allah, angels and the Spirit descend to fulfill various purposes and tasks. It emphasizes the belief in the unseen world and the constant presence of divine support in the affairs of the believers.
orig: تنزل الملائكة والروح فيها بإذن ربهم من كل أمر

translation: Peace be upon this morning's daybreak
interpretation: This verse conveys a sense of peace and tranquility associated with the early hours of the morning, highlighting the serenity and beauty of dawn. It serves as a reminder of the blessings and opportunities that a new day brings, encouraging believers to start their day with a sense of calmness and gratitude.
orig: سلام هي حتى مطلع الفجر

translation: Those who disbelieve among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence.
interpretation: This verse indicates that disbelief is not easily removed from the hearts of those who reject the truth, whether they are from the People of the Scripture or are polytheists. It emphasizes that the persistence in their disbelief will remain until clear evidence reaches them, elucidating the truth and guiding them towards the right path.
orig: لم يكن الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب والمشركين منفكين حتى تأتيهم البينة

translation: A Messenger from Allah, who recites purified scriptures,
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) who is the Messenger of Allah and recites the pure and untainted revelations sent down to him by Allah. It highlights the importance and purity of the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad to guide humanity towards righteousness and truth.
orig: رسول من الله يتلو صحفا مطهرة

translation: In it are valuable books.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an as being full of valuable guidance and teachings for mankind. It emphasizes the importance of the Qur'an as a source of knowledge and wisdom that leads towards righteousness and guidance in life.
orig: فيها كتب قيمة

translation: And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity.
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who were given the Scripture (Jews and Christians) only differed amongst themselves after clear proofs and guidance had come to them. The reason for their disagreements and divisions was not due to the lack of knowledge or guidance, but rather stemmed from envy and rivalry among themselves.
orig: وما تفرق الذين أوتوا الكتاب إلا من بعد ما جاءتهم البينة

translation: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the essence of the religion of Islam, highlighting the core elements of worship, sincerity, devotion, prayer, and charity. Muslims are directed to worship Allah sincerely, in a state of purity and truthfulness, establishing the five daily prayers and giving alms to those in need. It emphasizes the importance of upholding these principles as the foundation of a righteous and upright way of life.
orig: وما أمروا إلا ليعبدوا الله مخلصين له الدين حنفاء ويقيموا الصلاة ويؤتوا الزكاة وذلك دين القيمة

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
interpretation: This verse from the Qur'an emphasizes the consequences of disbelief for the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) and the polytheists. It states that they will be punished by being eternally in Hellfire, describing them as the worst of creatures. The verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of rejecting the truth and the severe punishment that awaits those who consciously deny the message of God.
orig: إن الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب والمشركين في نار جهنم خالدين فيها أولئك هم شر البرية

translation: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - they are the best of creatures.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of faith and good deeds in Islam. It conveys that the best of all creations are those who not only believe in God but also consistently act in a manner that aligns with their faith by performing good deeds. It emphasizes the importance of both belief and action in shaping a righteous character and distinguishes those individuals as the most honorable and virtuous among all creation.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك هم خير البرية

translation: Their reward with their Lord is gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally, and Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
interpretation: This verse describes the ultimate reward for the believers in Paradise, where they will have eternal abode in gardens with rivers flowing beneath. They will be in a state of perpetual satisfaction as Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. This is a promise for those who have true reverence and fear of their Lord.
orig: جزاؤهم عند ربهم جنات عدن تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه ذلك لمن خشي ربه

translation: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of immense chaos and upheaval, symbolizing the Day of Judgment. It conveys the power and might of Allah, who holds the power to shake the foundations of the earth when He wills, as a sign of the impending Day of Resurrection and accountability for all beings.
orig: إذا زلزلت الأرض زلزالها

translation: And the earth casts forth its burdens,
interpretation: This verse speaks about the Day of Judgment when the earth will give up the burdens and secrets it holds within it, symbolizing the resurrection of all beings to stand before Allah for judgment. It represents the power and sovereignty of Allah, revealing that nothing will remain hidden or buried when the time comes for all to face accountability.
orig: وأخرجت الأرض أثقالها

translation: And man says, 'What is [wrong] with it?'
interpretation: This verse reflects on the questioning and skepticism of humans when faced with the signs and revelations of Allah. It highlights the tendency of humans to question the wisdom behind Allah's creations or commands without fully understanding the reasons and wisdom behind them. It serves as a reminder to have faith and trust in Allah's infinite wisdom and knowledge, even when we do not fully comprehend the reasons behind His decrees.
orig: وقال الإنسان ما لها

translation: On that Day it will report its news,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the earth will reveal all that has happened on it and report the deeds of all creatures. It signifies that everything we do on earth is being recorded and will be brought forth for accountability on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يومئذ تحدث أخبارها

translation: That your Lord inspired to the bee
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the divine guidance and inspiration from Allah to the bee in its innate ability and behavior. It serves as a reminder of the intricate designs and wisdom in the creation of each creature by Allah.
orig: بأن ربك أوحى لها

translation: On that Day, people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, individuals will be separated into different groups according to their deeds and actions during their lifetime. Each person will be shown the consequences of their actions, whether good or bad.
orig: يومئذ يصدر الناس أشتاتا ليروا أعمالهم

translation: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief that every small good deed a person does, no matter how insignificant it may seem, will be accounted for and rewarded by God. It serves as a reminder that even the tiniest acts of kindness or righteousness are significant and not overlooked in the eyes of God.
orig: فمن يعمل مثقال ذرة خيرا يره

translation: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that every action, no matter how small, has consequences. Even the tiniest of evil deeds will not go unnoticed, and every individual will be held accountable for their actions, whether good or bad, in the sight of God.
orig: ومن يعمل مثقال ذرة شرا يره

translation: By the racers, panting,
interpretation: This verse refers to the horses or other animals that are in a state of panting as they race fiercely. It symbolizes the intense power, speed, and determination with which these creatures move, drawing parallels to the relentless energy that believers should have in striving towards goodness and righteousness in their lives.
orig: والعاديات ضبحا

translation: So proclaim openly what you are commanded,
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of conveying the message and commands given by Allah without hesitation or fear. It encourages believers to proclaim and spread the teachings of Islam confidently and with conviction.
orig: فالموريات قدحا

translation: So by the morning brightness,
