interpretation: This verse is highlighting the oath taken by the morning brightness, emphasizing the power and significance of this time of the day in the natural world. It serves as a reminder of the beauty and vitality present in the universe, calling believers to reflect on the signs of Allah's creation and to be grateful for the blessings bestowed upon them.
orig: فالمغيرات صبحا

translation: So He made it (as) excessive rain
interpretation: This verse signifies that Allah caused abundant rain to fall as a sign of His power and mercy. It showcases Allah's ability to create and control the natural elements, emphasizing His dominion over all aspects of the universe.
orig: فأثرن به نقعا

translation: And dwell therein collectively.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the concept of unity and togetherness by encouraging people to live together in harmony and cooperation. It highlights the importance of creating a community that resides together and supports one another, fostering mutual respect and solidarity among the believers.
orig: فوسطن به جمعا

translation: Verily, mankind is very ungrateful to their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ungrateful nature of mankind towards their Creator. Despite the numerous blessings and favors bestowed upon them by their Lord, many people fail to recognize and acknowledge His greatness and constantly overlook His countless blessings. It serves as a reminder for humans to reflect on their conduct and continuously express gratitude towards their Lord for His mercy and kindness.
orig: إن الإنسان لربه لكنود

translation: And indeed, he is a witness to that.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that God is a witness to all that happens, nothing escapes His knowledge and insight. It serves as a reminder of God's omniscience and presence in every aspect of our lives, highlighting the importance of living in accordance with His guidance and commandments.
orig: وإنه على ذلك لشهيد

translation: And indeed, he is to the love of good intense.
interpretation: This verse highlights the intense love for goodness that is present within the individual being referred to. It emphasizes the strong inclination towards what is righteous, virtuous, and beneficial, indicating a deep-rooted desire to seek and promote goodness in all aspects of life.
orig: وإنه لحب الخير لشديد

translation: Does he not know when that which is in the graves will be scattered,
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the Day of Judgment, when everything that is hidden or buried will be brought to light and every individual will be held accountable for their actions. It emphasizes the certainty of resurrection and the need for conscious awareness of our deeds and their consequences.
orig: أفلا يعلم إذا بعثر ما في القبور

translation: And what is within the breasts will be known.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah knows the secrets and intentions that lie within the hearts of people. It serves as a reminder that even our innermost thoughts and feelings are not hidden from Allah, emphasizing the importance of sincerity and purity in our intentions and actions.
orig: وحصل ما في الصدور

translation: Indeed, their Lord is Knowing about them that Day.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware and knowledgeable about His creations, especially on the Day of Judgment. It signifies that every individual's actions and intentions are known to Allah, and He will judge them accordingly with justice and wisdom on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: إن ربهم بهم يومئذ لخبير

translation: The Striking Calamity
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when a calamity or a disaster will strike, shaking the entire universe. It serves as a reminder of the power and might of Allah and the importance of preparing for the Day of Judgment.
orig: القارعة

translation: The Striking Calamity
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the Day of Judgment when a great calamity will strike, shaking the foundations of the universe and causing fear and awe among all beings. It serves as a reminder of the power and sovereignty of Allah over all creation.
orig: ما القارعة

translation: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
interpretation: This verse indicates that no one fully comprehends the magnitude and seriousness of the Day of Resurrection except Allah, emphasizing the inevitability and significance of that Day. It serves as a reminder to believers to prepare for the Hereafter and to reflect upon the consequences of their actions in this life.
orig: وما أدراك ما القارعة

translation: On the Day when people will be like scattered moths,
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment when people will be in a state of chaos and confusion, just like scattered moths. It portrays the image of a disorganized and scattered humanity, overwhelmed by the enormity of the events unfolding on that day.
orig: يوم يكون الناس كالفراش المبثوث

translation: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
interpretation: This verse describes a scene of the Day of Judgment when the mountains will be scattered and disintegrated like wool, emphasizing the profound power of Allah to completely transform even the most solid and stable elements of the earth. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of this world and the ultimate power and control that Allah has over all creation.
orig: وتكون الجبال كالعهن المنفوش

translation: So as for he whose scales are heavy,
interpretation: This verse refers to those whose good deeds outweigh their bad deeds on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of performing good deeds and being righteous in one's actions as they will be a means of salvation and reward in the Hereafter.
orig: فأما من ثقلت موازينه

translation: So he will be in a pleasant life.
interpretation: This verse describes a person who has faith and righteousness, indicating that they will lead a content and peaceful life in this world and in the hereafter. It signifies that by living a life obedient to God's commandments and seeking His pleasure, one can attain a state of inner satisfaction and tranquility.
orig: فهو في عيشة راضية

translation: And as for those whose scales are light,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when their deeds will be weighed. Those whose scales are light will have done fewer good deeds compared to their bad deeds. It emphasizes the importance of performing good deeds in this world to achieve success in the hereafter.
orig: وأما من خفت موازينه

translation: So his mother bore him in weakness upon weakness.
interpretation: This verse refers to the physical and emotional struggles that a mother endures while carrying and giving birth to her child. It highlights the great sacrifices that mothers make for their children and the profound physical and emotional challenges that they face in the process.
orig: فأمه هاوية

translation: And what can make you know what that is?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the incomprehensible nature of a particular event or concept, highlighting the limitations of human understanding in grasping certain aspects of the divine knowledge and wisdom. It serves as a reminder of the vastness and profundity of the mysteries that exist beyond human perception and comprehension.
orig: وما أدراك ما هيه

translation: Blazing fire.
interpretation: This verse describes the intense and scorching nature of the Hellfire. It emphasizes the severity and intensity of the punishment that awaits those who have committed grave sins and failed to seek repentance and forgiveness.
orig: نار حامية

translation: The rivalry in worldly increase diverts you,
interpretation: This verse highlights how obsession with material possessions and competition in acquiring wealth can distract individuals from focusing on their spiritual growth and the true purpose of life. It serves as a reminder to prioritize spiritual development over worldly pursuits.
orig: ألهاكم التكاثر

translation: until you visit the graveyards.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder to reflect on the inevitability of death and the afterlife. The act of visiting graveyards is a humbling experience that prompts one to contemplate their own mortality, leading to introspection, gratitude for the blessings of this life, and a greater focus on preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: حتى زرتم المقابر

translation: No, you will surely know.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that ultimately, everyone will come to know the truth and face the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning that no one can escape accountability for their deeds, as God's justice will prevail.
orig: كلا سوف تعلمون

translation: Then indeed, you will surely know.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that eventually, everyone will come to know the truth and be held accountable for their actions. It serves as a powerful reminder of the Day of Judgment and the importance of leading a righteous life in accordance with Allah's guidance.
orig: ثم كلا سوف تعلمون

translation: No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty.
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the importance of seeking true knowledge and understanding with certainty. It emphasizes that superficial knowledge or assumptions are not sufficient; rather, one should strive to acquire deep understanding and unwavering conviction in matters of faith and knowledge.
orig: كلا لو تعلمون علم اليقين

translation: You will surely see Hell.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to the disbelievers and wrongdoers that they will definitely see the consequences of their actions in the form of Hellfire. It emphasizes the concept of accountability and the afterlife, reminding individuals to be mindful of their deeds and their ultimate destination.
orig: لترون الجحيم

translation: Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment, where every individual will witness the reality of their deeds and be held accountable for them. It conveys the idea that there will be no doubt or confusion on that day, and everyone will see the truth clearly with absolute certainty.
orig: ثم لترونها عين اليقين

translation: And you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that they will be held accountable for the blessings and pleasures they were given in this life. It indicates that a person will be asked by Allah about how they utilized the blessings and favors bestowed upon them in the worldly life on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a reminder to be grateful, humble, and responsible stewards of the blessings we have been granted.
orig: ثم لتسألن يومئذ عن النعيم

translation: By the time,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of time in the life of human beings. It serves as a reminder that time is a valuable and finite resource that should not be wasted. It encourages believers to make the most of their time by engaging in acts of worship, kindness, and productivity to fulfill their purpose on earth.
orig: والعصر

translation: Indeed, man is in loss.
interpretation: This verse highlights the inherent vulnerability and inadequacy of human beings. It serves as a reminder of the tendency of humans to deviate from the path of righteousness and the challenges they face in striving towards spiritual growth and guidance. It encourages self-reflection and a realization of the need for humility and seeking the guidance of Allah in order to overcome the losses and shortcomings in this worldly life.
orig: إن الإنسان لفي خسر

translation: Except those who believe and do righteous deeds and enjoin one another to truth and enjoin one another to patience.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who believe in God and follow His guidance, perform good deeds, encourage others to uphold the truth, and advise one another to be patient will be exceptions to facing the consequences of wrongdoing. It highlights the importance of faith, righteous actions, truth, and patience in the life of a believer.
orig: إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وتواصوا بالحق وتواصوا بالصبر

translation: Woe to every backbiter, slanderer,
interpretation: This verse warns against those who engage in backbiting and slander, emphasizing the severity of such actions. It serves as a reminder to avoid spreading harmful rumors or speaking ill of others behind their backs.
orig: ويل لكل همزة لمزة

translation: He who gathered wealth and counted it,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the behavior of individuals who accumulate wealth and continuously count and keep track of it. It serves as a reminder that focusing solely on amassing material possessions and being overly preoccupied with counting one's wealth can distract one from more meaningful aspects of life, such as spirituality and personal growth.
orig: الذي جمع مالا وعدده

translation: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mistaken belief of some individuals who amass wealth thinking that it will give them eternal life. It warns against the false sense of security that material possessions can provide, emphasizing that true immortality lies in righteous deeds and faith in the Almighty.
orig: يحسب أن ماله أخلده

translation: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of punishment for those who reject the truth and continue in their arrogance and disbelief. It serves as a warning of the consequences of turning away from guidance and choosing the path of disobedience.
orig: كلا لينبذن في الحطمة

translation: And what can make you know what is the Crushing Calamity?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the gravity and severity of the Day of Resurrection, highlighting the incomprehensible nature of the events that will unfold. It serves to make the reader ponder on the immense power and impact of that day, emphasizing the importance of being prepared for it through righteousness and good deeds.
orig: وما أدراك ما الحطمة

translation: The kindled fire of Allah
interpretation: This verse refers to the intense and fierce punishment that awaits those who oppose Allah and His guidance. It signifies the terrifying and relentless nature of divine retribution against those who transgress the boundaries set by God. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience in the Hereafter.
orig: نار الله الموقدة

translation: that which penetrates into the hearts.
interpretation: This verse describes the Qur'an as something that penetrates deep into the hearts of the believers, having a profound impact on their innermost thoughts and feelings. It suggests that the Qur'an has the power to touch the core of one's being and influence their beliefs, attitudes, and actions.
orig: التي تطلع على الأفئدة

translation: Indeed, it is they who are the closed,
interpretation: This verse highlights that those who reject the truth and continue in their disbelief are the ones who close themselves off from the guidance and mercy of Allah. Their hearts and minds become closed to understanding the signs of the universe and the messages of the Qur'an, leading to their own spiritual blindness and distance from the truth.
orig: إنها عليهم مؤصدة

translation: On extended columns.
interpretation: This verse is describing the beauty and grandeur of the pillars or columns in a majestic structure. The use of the word 'extended' conveys a sense of spaciousness and magnificence, highlighting the splendor of the architecture. This verse emphasizes the awe-inspiring nature of the structures mentioned in the Qur'an, portraying them as elaborate and impressive.
orig: في عمد ممددة

translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
interpretation: This verse from Surah Al-Fil draws attention to the power and might of Allah, who protected the sanctity of the Kaaba in Makkah from the attack of Abraha and his army, who came with an elephant to destroy it. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to intervene in the affairs of His creation and protect His sacred places.
orig: ألم تر كيف فعل ربك بأصحاب الفيل

translation: Did He not make their plan into misguidance?
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in thwarting the schemes and deceitful plots of those who go against His guidance. It emphasizes that no matter how elaborate or cunning the plans of the disbelievers may be, ultimately they will lead to nothing but misguidance and failure, as Allah's decree prevails over all.
orig: ألم يجعل كيدهم في تضليل

translation: And sent against them birds in flocks,
interpretation: This verse describes how God sent a punishment to the people by sending flocks of birds to attack them. It showcases God's power and the consequences of disobedience and wrongdoing.
orig: وأرسل عليهم طيرا أبابيل

translation: You will cast them with stones of clay,
interpretation: This verse describes a punishment where the disbelievers will be pelted with stones made of baked clay. The severity of the punishment implies the gravity of their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: ترميهم بحجارة من سجيل

translation: And made them like eaten straw.
interpretation: This verse is a metaphorical description of the fate of those who reject faith and turn away from guidance. They are likened to straw that has been eaten and destroyed, emphasizing the utter worthlessness and insignificance of their actions and choices in the eyes of God.
orig: فجعلهم كعصف مأكول

translation: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh -
interpretation: This verse highlights the divine protection and security provided to the Quraysh tribe by Allah. It signifies the importance of acknowledging and being grateful for the blessings and favor that Allah bestows upon His creation, even towards those who may not fully recognize or appreciate His grace.
orig: لإيلاف قريش

translation: Their journey in winter and summer.
interpretation: This verse may be referring to the natural cycles of life, indicating that human beings go through different phases and seasons, both metaphorically and literally. It could also imply the transient nature of life and the continuous journey that individuals undertake, facing different challenges and experiencing various seasons of life.
orig: إيلافهم رحلة الشتاء والصيف

translation: So let them worship the Lord of this House (the Kaaba in Mecca).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the worship and devotion to the Lord of the Kaaba in Mecca. It serves as a reminder to all believers that their ultimate focus should be on worshipping and submitting to Allah, who is the Lord of the sacred and revered House of Islam.
orig: فليعبدوا رب هذا البيت

translation: Who provided them with food against hunger, and secured them against fear.
interpretation: This verse highlights the provision and protection from Allah. It refers to how Allah provides sustenance in times of hunger and grants security in times of fear. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy, care, and protection for His believers.
orig: الذي أطعمهم من جوع وآمنهم من خوف

translation: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
interpretation: This verse questions the attitude of those who deny the Day of Judgment, asking the reader to contemplate the foolishness of rejecting the concept of accountability and the consequences of one's actions. It serves as a reminder of the importance of belief in the Hereafter and the ultimate justice of God.
orig: أرأيت الذي يكذب بالدين

translation: So woe to those who pray
interpretation: This verse is a warning to those who neglect the orphans, indicating that they will face severe consequences for their actions. It serves as a reminder to show kindness and compassion towards orphans and other vulnerable members of society.
orig: فذلك الذي يدع اليتيم

translation: And not encouraging the feeding of the poor.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of not mocking or discouraging the feeding or helping of those in need and specifically the poor. It serves as a reminder to treat the underprivileged with respect and dignity, and to promote acts of charity and kindness towards them rather than discouraging such acts.
orig: ولا يحض على طعام المسكين

translation: Woe to those who pray,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that simply performing the physical act of prayer is not enough; true prayer requires sincerity, devotion, and humility. It warns against praying just for the sake of appearance or social status, without genuine faith and submission to God. It serves as a reminder that the essence of prayer lies in the inner state and intention of the worshipper, rather than the outward performance.
orig: فويل للمصلين

translation: Those who are neglectful of their prayers,
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of prayers in Islam and warns against being negligent or heedless in performing them. It serves as a reminder to believers to be consistent and devoted in their prayers as a form of worship and connection with Allah.
orig: الذين هم عن صلاتهم ساهون

translation: Those who have insight
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have clear vision, understanding, and insight. It highlights the importance of having intellectual and spiritual perception to comprehend the deeper meanings of the Qur'an and to live a purposeful life guided by wisdom and understanding.
orig: الذين هم يراءون

translation: And they withhold [simple] help.
interpretation: This verse points to those who are miserly and refuse to provide even the smallest of assistance to those in need. It highlights the importance of generosity and helping others in Islam, emphasizing that withholding assistance goes against the teachings of the faith.
orig: ويمنعون الماعون

translation: Verily, We have granted you Al-Kawthar (a river in Paradise).
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he has been granted an abundance of blessings and goodness from Allah. The term 'Al-Kawthar' refers to a river in Paradise which symbolizes the endless blessings and bounties that Allah has bestowed upon the Prophet. It serves as a reassurance to the Prophet and a reminder of Allah's favor towards him.
orig: إنا أعطيناك الكوثر

translation: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prayer and the act of sacrifice in worshiping Allah. It is a reminder to be devoted to Allah, to offer prayers diligently, and to be willing to make sacrifices in His cause.
orig: فصل لربك وانحر

translation: Verily, your enemy is the one cut off (from all good).
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that those who oppose you or harbor ill feelings towards you will ultimately be unsuccessful in their endeavors and will face consequences for their actions. It provides reassurance to the believers that their enemies will not succeed in causing harm and will be deprived of goodness and blessings.
orig: إن شانئك هو الأبتر

translation: Say, "O disbelievers,"
interpretation: This verse is a command to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to address the disbelievers and inform them that their beliefs are contrary to the Islamic message. It highlights the rejection of polytheism and idolatry, emphasizing the importance of monotheism in Islam.
orig: قل يا أيها الكافرون

translation: I do not worship what you worship.
interpretation: This verse reveals a clear statement of rejection towards the false idols and objects of worship that people adhere to instead of the one true God. It emphasizes the difference in beliefs and practices, asserting a firm stance on monotheism and refusing to associate any partners with Allah.
orig: لا أعبد ما تعبدون

translation: And not [even] you worship what I worship.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the distinction between the beliefs and practices of the disbelievers and the believers. It points to the uniqueness of faith and worship, emphasizing that true believers do not worship the same false gods or idols as the disbelievers. It also highlights the idea of monotheism and the exclusivity of worshiping the One true God.
orig: ولا أنتم عابدون ما أعبد

translation: Nor am I a worshipper of what you worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights the rejection of the false beliefs and practices of the polytheists by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and emphasizes the distinct monotheistic faith in Allah that he preached. It signifies the unwavering commitment of the Prophet to the worship of the One true God, Allah, and his refusal to associate any partners with Him.
orig: ولا أنا عابد ما عبدتم

translation: And you do not worship what I worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights the distinction between the beliefs of the disbelievers and the believers. It emphasizes the fundamental difference in faith and worship between those who believe in Allah and those who associate partners with Him. The verse underscores the concept of monotheism and the rejection of polytheism.
orig: ولا أنتم عابدون ما أعبد

translation: To you be your religion, and to me my religion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of religious freedom and tolerance. It teaches that each individual has the right to practice their own religion without interference or compulsion from others. It emphasizes the importance of respecting the beliefs and practices of others, even if they are different from our own.
orig: لكم دينكم ولي دين

translation: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,
interpretation: This verse describes a time when Allah's support and victory are imminent, indicating that believers should remain steadfast in their faith and continue to strive for righteousness and justice as they await the inevitable triumph that comes with following the path of Allah.
orig: إذا جاء نصر الله والفتح

translation: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the widespread acceptance and embrace of the religion of Allah by diverse groups of people. It emphasizes the inclusive and universal nature of Islam, as people from different backgrounds and walks of life come together in submitting to and following the teachings of Allah.
orig: ورأيت الناس يدخلون في دين الله أفواجا

translation: So exalt [ Allah ] with praise of your Lord and ask His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to continuously praise and glorify Allah, and seek His forgiveness with sincerity and consistency. It reminds us that Allah is always ready to accept our repentance and forgive us when we turn back to Him with sincere intentions.
orig: فسبح بحمد ربك واستغفره إنه كان توابا

translation: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!
interpretation: This verse is a declaration of the destruction and damnation of Abu Lahab, an uncle of the Prophet Muhammad who was one of his fierce opponents. The verse emphasizes the severe consequences of his opposition to the Prophet and the message of Islam, portraying his ultimate fate as one of punishment and abandonment by God.
orig: تبت يدا أبي لهب وتب

translation: His wealth and gains will not avail him.
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the ultimate worthlessness of someone's wealth and earnings in the Hereafter if they were obtained through dishonest or forbidden means, or if they were not used in the way that pleases Allah. Material possessions and worldly gains will not be of any benefit to an individual in the sight of Allah if they are not accompanied by righteousness and sincerity.
orig: ما أغنى عنه ماله وما كسب

translation: It will [then] roast him in a blaze.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment awaiting those who engage in wrongdoing and crimes. It illustrates the severe consequences and torment that will befall such individuals, emphasizing the intensity and severity of their punishment in the afterlife.
orig: سيصلى نارا ذات لهب

translation: And his wife [as well] who carries firewood.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment of one of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment, where he and his wife will be dragged towards Hell by the angels. The mention of the wife carrying firewood signifies the severity of punishment and the burdens that each soul will carry for their deeds.
orig: وامرأته حمالة الحطب

translation: In her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
interpretation: This verse is a warning of the consequences of arrogance and disobedience to God. The metaphor of a rope around the neck signifies the binding consequences of one's own actions and the burden that arrogance and sin bring upon oneself.
orig: في جيدها حبل من مسد

translation: Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of the oneness of Allah, highlighting His uniqueness, indivisibility, and incomparable nature. It affirms the belief in the absolute unity of God in His essence, attributes, and actions, conveying the message that there is no one like Allah, and He stands alone in His sovereignty and divinity.
orig: قل هو الله أحد

translation: Allah, the Eternal Refuge.
interpretation: This verse highlights one of the attributes of Allah, which is As-Samad, the Eternal Refuge. Allah is the self-sufficient, the one who all creatures depend on but who depends on none. He is the ultimate and perfect refuge for all beings and the one who is sought after for all needs. This attribute emphasizes the completeness and perfection of Allah and signifies His unchanging nature, His immutability, and His eternal existence. One can find peace, comfort, and security in turning to Allah, the Eternal Refuge, in times of need.
orig: الله الصمد

translation: He neither begets nor is born.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and incomparability of God. It asserts that Allah does not have a son, nor was He born from anyone or anything. It reinforces the concept of tawhid (oneness of God), highlighting that God is not born like humans or animals, nor does He father children in the way humans do.
orig: لم يلد ولم يولد

translation: And there is none comparable unto Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness and incomparability of Allah. It signifies that there is nothing and no one that can be likened or equated to Him in any way. This serves as a reminder of the greatness and superiority of Allah, highlighting His perfect attributes and the impossibility of finding any equal to Him.
orig: ولم يكن له كفوا أحد

translation: Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
interpretation: This verse is a call to seek protection and refuge in Allah, the Lord of daybreak. It implores the believer to rely on Allah's strength and power in times of vulnerability and need.
orig: قل أعوذ برب الفلق

translation: From the evil of that which He created,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes seeking protection from the harms and evils that exist in the world, acknowledging that everything, both good and bad, is created by Allah. It serves as a reminder to seek refuge in Allah from all forms of evil and harm that may come our way, whether physical or spiritual.
orig: من شر ما خلق

translation: And from the evil of the darkness when it settles,
interpretation: This verse highlights seeking refuge in Allah from the harm and malevolence of the darkness and night when it envelops everything in its shadow. It serves as a reminder to seek protection from the potential dangers and uncertainties that may lurk in the darkness, both physically and metaphorically. It encourages believers to seek Allah's guidance and protection in times of darkness and difficulty.
orig: ومن شر غاسق إذا وقب

translation: And from the evil of those who blow on knots.
interpretation: This verse is seeking refuge in Allah from the harm caused by those who practice witchcraft or sorcery by blowing on knots or using other methods to cause harm to others. It warns against the actions of such individuals and emphasizes the need for protection and seeking refuge in Allah from their evil deeds.
orig: ومن شر النفاثات في العقد

translation: And from the evil of the envious when he envies.
interpretation: This verse highlights the harm that can be caused by envy and jealousy. It warns against the negative consequences that stem from feeling envious of others and emphasizes the negative energy that is created when one harbors feelings of jealousy towards someone else. Envy can lead to ill intentions and actions that may harm both the envier and the one who is envied. It serves as a reminder to avoid envy and jealousy, and instead strive for contentment and gratitude for what one has.
orig: ومن شر حاسد إذا حسد

translation: Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind
interpretation: This verse is a declaration seeking refuge in Allah, the Lord of humanity, from all the evil and harm that comes from the whispers of the devils and evil beings. It emphasizes the recognition of Allah as the ultimate source of protection and safety, highlighting the importance of seeking His guidance and help in times of need.
orig: قل أعوذ برب الناس

translation: Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes seeking protection and refuge in Allah, the Lord and Sovereign of all human beings. It serves as a reminder of Allah's power, authority, and protection over all mankind, encouraging believers to seek His help in times of need and to put their trust in Him alone.
orig: ملك الناس

translation: The God of mankind.
interpretation: This verse highlights the oneness of God and His connection to all of humanity. It emphasizes that God is the deity of all people, regardless of their backgrounds, cultures, or beliefs. This verse serves as a reminder that we are all ultimately under the authority and care of the same God, uniting us in our worship and submission to Him.
orig: إله الناس

translation: From the evil of the retreating whisperer,
interpretation: This verse from Surah Al-Nas seeks refuge in Allah from the harm caused by the whisperings of Shaytan, who tries to lead people astray by planting doubts and desires in their hearts. The retreating whisperer refers to Shaytan who retreats when the name of Allah is mentioned, as his whispers lose power in the face of the remembrance of God.
orig: من شر الوسواس الخناس

translation: Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind,
interpretation: This verse refers to Shaytan (Satan) who whispers evil thoughts and temptations into the hearts of people, trying to lead them astray from the path of righteousness. It serves as a reminder for believers to be cautious and seek protection from such whisperings by staying close to Allah and seeking His guidance.
orig: الذي يوسوس في صدور الناس

translation: From among the jinn and mankind.
interpretation: This verse refers to the diverse creation of Allah, mentioning the two main categories of beings with free will - jinn and humans. It acknowledges the different types of creatures that exist and highlights the vastness of Allah's creation.
orig: من الجنة والناس
